reviews.review: Learn to cook in a traditional Bali house . Cleanliness was 100%. We made 10 dishes including 2 deserts. Presentation was beautiful, instructions clear, and we had a good laugh. Recipe options were given for ingredients hard to find in local country eg banana leaf. I now have a good understanding of the basic flavours of Bali dishes and am confident I can reproduce at home. So the real highlight of course was the tasting and eating at the end. Delicious because all the ingredients were fresh and made from scratch. Highly recommended.
Cooking class. Was really nice with just three persons. The explaining was good sometimes a bit to fast!! The food we cooked was amazing!!

Good experience!. Me and my husband really enjoyed cooking class. We were picked up from our hotel and went straight to the market where they buy all their ingredients which was nice to see. Then we went where they make coffee and tried different types of coffee and tea. The cooking class was with group of people in local house. We have learned to cook few delicious dishes the best think was to eat them in the end yameeee :) We have also received recipe of the all dishes we have cooked which was great.We really enjoyed this cooking class everybody was very friendly.

They made me feel home . I want thanks Putu and his family for the wonderful experience the cooking class was! they walk us thru every ingredient and made the cooking fun and delicious ! we cooked 4 course meal and enjoy every meal! great way to try traditional balinese cousine !

Cooking class. It was my second time to the cooking class, my first was back in May when I was travelling on my own. I enjoyed the whole evening and it was very comfortable as a solo traveller. It was also nice being in Made home and meeting his family. So when I return in August with my husband, we went again this time during the day so we got to go to the markets and as a special request we got to cook Nasi Goreng which we have since replicated back in Oz with great success !Unfortunately our trip with short and we never got to go on Balimanggang other trip, next time very keen to do the Volcano hike and mountain bikingWe also use Balimanggang for all our transfers and they were very affordable and reliable. They spoke very good English and were able, to answer all our question and fill us in on all the history and culture of the area.Great experience thank you

Intresting and fun. Liked this cooking class. We were with a small group and learned to make several dishes. The pick up from the hotel came earlier than expected, so we needed to hurry. But it was nice to take a look at the market. The day before we already visited a plantage, so that part was not very intresting for us, but cooking was great! Fresh ingredients, great taste and you'll get the recipes afterwards.

A great cultural and culinary experience!. We started our day with an early morning pick up, then off the local market.The market, where activity usually starts around 4 am, was quiet by the time we arrived. But that made it perfect for our walk-around. Our host and guide Made Larte’s took us on a show-and-tell around the market and pointed out items we would use in our class. We didn’t buy anything at the market, because Made had shopped and prepped for our class ahead of time. The market is a lot different from what you would see at any of the Ubud tourist markets and at most markets at home, so it was worth the visit. During the drive and during the class Made shared tons of information about food and culture, answering our millions of questions about cooking and life in Bali.Next stop – the Luwak Coffee plantation. We saw the Asian Civets that are key to the production of this unique coffee. After the quick tour, we enjoyed some complimentary tea samples – delicious!… and shared a small coffee sample @ $5USD. They bring communal tea sampling glasses, but we asked for individual glasses and they obliged. The coffee tour ended at the Gift shop. We were anxious to get to our cooking class and hastily bought some gifts for home… Buyer Beware – Luwak Coffee is noted as the most expensive coffee in the word! A 200 gram package @ $7.600 converts to approx. $76USD NOT $7.60. We bought 2 packages and had an unpleasant surprise when we got home to a higher than expected credit card charge. The cooking class was held in our chef's private home. Chef Made, his family and kitchen support staff were all knowledgeable and very hospitable. The class was in English and everyone was easy to understand. The whole morning so much fun, and it was a real authentic “hands-on” cooking class. Everyone got their own apron and then with knives and mortar and pestle in hand we started… For two hours plus, we cut, peeled, diced, ground, sautéed, steamed, and barbequed. The menu included a chicken soup with fish balls, tomato sembal, peanut sauce, steamed rice, a vegetable dish, steamed banana leaf wraps, 2-3 traditional Balinese barbeque meat dishes, dessert and more. We even made our own offerings. My favourite was the ground Tuna sticks. When cooking was done we all settled down to a family style buffet with tons of food. We left with a full stomach and take home recipes for everything we made. It was a very fun day, great value and an overall wonderful experience.

Delicous food - cooked by ourselves!. We did the afternoon tour and started at a coffee plantation. It was nice, but we have been to a plantation the day before. But you don´t need to buy anything there and the tasting is for free.The cooking itself was very nice. We were 9 people and the chef explained everything well, although not in perfect English. I liked his humour and we had a lot of fun! The place was kept clean and the ingredients were fresh. We cooked soup, curry, vegetables, sate, different kinds of sauces, meat and a dessert. Each two persons were cooking by themselves and at the end we mixed everything together. So you could really cook by your own and taste what you have done. At the end the food is prepared nicely like you can see on the photos. I have the feeling that I learned a lot - there are typical ingredients that you use for everything. I feel prepared to try it out at home :) For that we got the recipes of what we cooked.

Great experience had. My aunt and I took part in this class, the transportation was prompt and the guide Made was very kind. He took us into a market that we wouldn't have originally been brave enough to walk into. Then visited a plantation and tried the famous civit coffee. There were 5 others and we were all made sure to be included in the preparation of all the dishes. We were educated on the base herbs and spices required to make our own Balinese meals and were sent home with a recipe book to ensure we wouldn't forget all the tasty dishes we as a group cooked together. As a whole it was an enjoyable experience, very hands on and one that I'm very glad we took part in whilst staying in Ubud.

Cooking Class. A really enjoyable afternoon learning new skills and all about balanesian food and teqniques then getting to eat the lovely food, lovely location and a visit to the coffee plantation as well. Very knowledgable and helpful chef teaching the class.

Too expensive for what it is. We didn't had a good experience with the cooking class.Early in the morning, they picked us up to go the market. We had to wait 45 minutes until we finally got our tour on the market. The guide was very rushed, so the market tour was only for five minutes.Then we went to a coffee farm, where they selled overpriced coffee. We didn't ask for such a tour and we just wanted to learn how to cook.For the cooking class itself, our group was to large and we didn't had the feeling we actually learned something.The receipe we got a the end was nice, and the food was good.After we paid (way to much) for our class, the owner asked extra money because we drank a beer. They did not mentioned it that i was not included and expensive.We made a big mistake to come here.

Great cooking experience. The cooking class with Made was great. We were only with 2 couples which was perfect. We first stopped at the local market and then went directly to Made's family home. We skipped the coffee plantation because the four of us already did the tasting before. It was very nice to see a real Balinese family home and learned some things about the Balinese culture. Next: the cooking! It was really well organized. We made a whole buffet of typical Indonesian dishes (from starters up to dessert) and because we were a small group there was lots of cooking to do :) And finally we could taste and eat the result of our hard work, it was a delicious meal and we were all stuffed at the end. Thank you Made for this nice experience and the recipes. We will sure try to make them at home!

Wonderful Experience at Cooking Class. I had a GREAT experience with this cooking class in Ubud, which I did in August 2016. The day consisted first of a stop at the local food market in Ubud, where our guide showed us many of the typical local ingredients, and those we would be cooking with later that day. Next, we stopped at a small plantation where they grow many herbs, spices, coffees and teas. We had a tea & coffee tasting here of about 12 different types, which was included in the overall cost. We also had the experience to try to the famous "luwak coffee" produced onsite for an additional 50K rupiah (under 3 GBP). All of the teas & coffees were delicious and it was an informative session. Next we had the main event - the cooking class. It was a small group - we were one small group of 4 (of which I was one) and a family of 4 alongside us, with 2 main instructors for the class, plus some additional helpers. Over the course of the time we made about 11 different dishes. It was a family-style approach where different people handled different steps (i.e. one person chopping certain ingredients, the next person using the mortar & pestle to mix them, etc.) and taking turns with different steps on different dishes. I think this would be suitable to anyone with an interest in cooking and food, and you would not need any specific cooking skills beyond the very basics- suitable for cooking novices or more advanced home cooks who want some exposure to Indonesian cuisine. There were children in the family who was in the same session as me (guessing about 7-10 years old) and they were able to participate fully, with the instructors making sure to assign them the tasks they would be best suited for and would be safest for them. The highlight was our shared lunch at the end in which we ate everything we had made. The food was delicious and we received copies of all the recipes. The instructors were friendly, gracious, helpful, and easy to understand. This included pick-up/drop-off from my hotel in the centre of Ubud and the full time of transport and all activities was about 08:30am-1:30pm.

Great cooking class. Great! We booked the cooking class directly. Quick response via email. Pick up at hotel in Ubud was on time and short drive to the market and Balinese house where class takes place. Class was small, which was a big plus because of attention to detail per person. Detailed information about ingredients and recipes. In short: awesome experience, nice host and good food. Perfect morning activity!

Nice cookingworkshop. Just attended this Balinese cookingworkshop today. It was a nice experience. I got picked up at the guesthouse on time. We went to a local market first, which was interesting to see. The cooking experience was fun. The cook keept us pretty busy. No time to sit down and relax. The recipes were traditionally Balinese and the food tasted great! Also proper hygiene is taken into account.At the end of the workshop the cook gave us the recipes in a small booklet (print-out). It's a pitty that these recipes are not really clear (no measurements) and that they seem to differ from the workshop. I won't be able to reproduce all of them at home. Overall it was a great cooking experience in a local Balinese residence. It was fun and I had a great meal for only 350.000. Good value for money. Five stars!

Wonderful way to spend an evening!. Great small group size and delicious food - a definite highlight of our trip! The cooking process was thorough with a wide range of dishes made, each explained regarding method and ingredients, Beautiful setting in Ubud too - got to prepare the food as the sun set. Gorgeous. Would definitely recommend to those looking for an exciting balinese experience.

Fabulous Bali cooking experience. We were able to book an afternoon class directly for the same afternoon without issue. Came and collected us from our hotel and took us to an authentic Balinese homely kitchen, which had a wonderful atmosphere, to do the class. we also stopped via a coffee growing site where we could see the whole coffee production process. learned so much from this class and also have all the recipes to take away. couldn't recommend highly enough!

Fantastic, authentic and delicious cooking experience. Our morning spend at Manggang Cooking Class was an absolute delight. Our instructor was very patient, kind and informative and was genuinely interested in us and making sure we had the most positive experience possible. The kitchen was large, clean and well appointed, all the ingredients were wonderful and fresh and the staff were more than happy to accommodate us with a vegetarian menu. Made welcomed us graciously into his home and every second we spent there was full of smiles.

Good Class. We booked our class with our hotel in Ubud so glad we did , we visited the local market then onto the cooking class very relaxed , we were made very welcome and everything was explained step by step enjoyed this experience and would recommend to everyone
Great experience . Highly recommend doing this cooking class when in Ubud. Learnt how to make wonderful Indonesian food from scratch. Great experience for kids and adults

Delicious Balinese food, our new favourite kitchen. The cooking class was at the home of our host, Mr Made; only a few minutes by car from center Ubud. Hotel pickup at the correct time.
Beautiful kitchen with great views at the lush tropical surroundings. Cooking was excellent, hospitality was excellent too.
This is 100% recommendation.

Good class. Me and my partner were recommended to do a cooking class, and due to availability chose this one. We got picked up from our hotel and taken to the local market for a walk round then back to Made's house for the cooking class. He was very friendly, helpful and generous. The only downside was the small language barrier, but still his English is mostly very good. The class was quite long for what we learnt, but what we did learn was good and very tasty.

Excellent course and lots of fun. My girlfriend and I did this during our stay in Ubud and had a brilliant time. We were lucky enough to be the only 2 in the class so essentially had a private course! The instructor spoke excellent English, was very knowledgeable insightful and had a great sense of humor.The kitchen is on a covered roof outside and has a beautiful view of the surrounding countrysideThe meal we made was delicious and there was an enormous amount of food so skip whatever meal you have before the course!Couldn't recommend this higher!

Wonderful experience. Me and my boyfriend visited Bali Manggang cooking class today. We had the best time!Not only were the host (cook Made) and hostess very nice and welcoming, we also left with new cooking skills.The Balinese home, where the cooking takes place is really nice and clean, with a stunning view at sunset. We got a lot of personal attention and learned something about Balinese culture and the language as well. Made was also honest about the food we created. He thought our spiced, minched chicken rolled in banana leafs were excellent, the peanut sauce not so much ;)Overall, a wonderful experience that we would recommend to every one.Terima kasih dan selemat jumpa lagi!

Amazing authentic cooking class!. This was an amazing experience. We were picked up from our hotel and taken to a traditional Balinese compound with a beautiful view overlooking a plantation. The cooking instructor has years of experience working on a cruise line ship and was an amazing teacher! Definitely recommend!

EXCELLENT & GREAT FUN Bali Manggang Cooking Class. The Balinese Cooking Class with Bali Manggang is a must do on your trip to Bali. It was a lot of fun. We were picked up from our hotel on time and dropped off at the end of the class, full of great food and enjoyment. We made around 6-7 dishes, also all the spice pastes. It was very interactive and the tutors were very knowledgeable and attentive and the kitchen was extremely clean and well stocked. We also made all the, condiments and sauces, including peanut sauce for the Sates sticks, Sambal, Soup, Main courses and even a desert. We were treated very well by the chef "Made" and his English was very good as was his wife's who also helped considerably with assisting us to make the yummy Balinese dishes. We learnt heaps about the food preparation and the price and event very worthwhile. Absolutely recommend to anyone who likes Indonesian food and a good dose of fun and hands on activities. The price was very good for the event and being able to eat the food we prepared at the end made in extremely good value. The trip to the Coffee Plantation which was included was also very interesting and we got to taste 16 different coffees and teas, including the Labac coffee. We recommend this Cooking class you will enjoy it.

Cooking class at local home. We had a cooking class at Bali manggan. Made organised everything really well. In the afternoon we went to a herb farm were they explained all the local herbs which we would going to use. The market was already closed in the afternoon so we couldn't go there. Together with 2 other people so 4 in total we had the cooking class. We made different dishes which took us arround 2 hours. Saté Ayam, nasi goreng, saté tuna, bananas, sambal (which I will certainly make at home), chicken broth soup. After cooking and BBQing we had a very nice rijsttafel.Would reccomend the Manggan cooking class certainly.

Absolutely incredible. A must do if in Ubud area. . My boyfriend and I could not recommend this cooking class enough. It was so incredible. The teacher and his wife are very knowledgable and extremely friendly. The food that you make is so delicious. You get to make many Balinese dishes including my favourite fish and chicken satay with peanut sauce. If you want to do this class, and I highly recommend you do, email or call directly as booking companies will take a 50% cut. The cooking class is in a balinese village and home which makes the experience very authentic you can even stay at their hotel. If we ever return to Bali we will definitely take the course again. We left full and very satisfied. Thank you for an incredible and authentic experience here in Bali ♡

Must do!! Excellent Food and Nice teacher. On my stay in Bali I wantend to learn more of the traditional coocking. Spending this day with cook Made was very pleasant and learning. First we went to a local market, than to very nice Plantage. All very relaxing . And than preparing this delicious food. I hope I will find all the ingredients at home so I can astonish my family and friendsEls

A real taste of Bali. Family run cookery class in the heart of Bali.. I was travelling in Bali with a small group and on a free day I decided to pick up this half day cookery course near Ubud. So pleased I did. This is a small family run class, about 30 minutes drive from Ubud centre, but he comes wherever and picks you up. There are two classes and in the morning, I'm told he takes you to the market to buy the ingredients although he grows the rice himself. I went to the afternoon class and the fresh ingredients where already waiting. In the four hour class we where introduced to 11 Bali recipes, with hints and tips, along with friendly banter. After you cook you can relax and eat in the open rooftop kitchen. The food will be excellent and you will have tasted something special.

Amazing food- Nice teachers. The cooking course not only included cooking. We were picked up directly at our hotel, then drove to a coffee plantation where we got heaps of information about a variety of plants- very interesting! There was a nice tasting of different coffees and teas included as well, BUT don't buy anything in the shop! The coffee we bought there was ways too expensive and not the same taste like in the tasting before- not worth your money!After this, we drove to the family cooking house, with a great view and terrace. We cooked a menu of 8 different meals- the teachers were very kind and caring about us, they explained a lot and made us feel very comfortable. In the end we had so much amazing food, for the two of us this afternoon it was more than enough, it's absolutely worth its price!

Definite priority on 'to do' list in UBUD. Mardi x 2 and Ketut... Amazing personalised experience. True traditional Balinese culinary delight.. If in doubt just do it! You fetch, cook and eat.. The food is sooo tasty. Dishes are done and Bintangs were fetched.. Just a fantastic afternoon.. Morning tours you will get to see the market, but afternoon coffee plantation.

Cooking class, BBQ and a wedding party with perfect prices!. I was very late for this review as it is very special to me . First: regarding the class it was very informative, it gave us a basic tricks for cooking as well as giving us a passion for cooking. The whole experience was amazing from Cooking to grilling to chopping. We also wanted to know how to cook the fried rice and the fried bananas (which was not on the cooking list) and Made (the chef) was very happy to teach us how to do it. Although I didn't like most of the food as its different than ours in Egypt but will still go again. Second: the management was extremely smooth, I kept in contact with Made (the owner of the place which is having the same name like the chief) through the email, I booked and had the car pick us up without any drama. Everything was through email and was credible. Third: prices are really good in comparison to other cooking classes. It's affordable. I contacted many classes but most of them where vet pricy and others didn't want to help me doing a surprise cake for my husband as its out of schedule. Fourth: it was a tour with a lot of information about the Hindu life. It was very exciting to see their houses and to know about their religion and see the temple. That was another highlight of the day. They have very rich culture. Fifth and the most important : I hade a numerous emails back and forth between me and Made to try to make a surprise for my husband in the honey moon. I didn't want to make the traditional candle dinner. Made (the owner) was extremely helpful and flexible. I asked him if he can makes us a cake and a slow dance as we didn't have a wedding. He welcomed the idea and after some emails it ended up by planning a demo Balinese wedding . He got us the weeding costumes, cake, dancer and musicians. The best thing about it was his whole family celebrating with us. OH MY GOD. It was an amazing night and we kept laughing till we went to sleep. Tips: -wear something comfortable. -The cooking class takes some time so relax and be ready to spend have of the day cooking but in as exciting experience. -Expect not to like the food as the taste buds might be different but personally I'll do that in every single city that I will go to. -If want to customize anything don't hesitate to tell Made, that's what made him different than the other people that I take to. Thank you Made and enjoy your time there.

World class experience. We chose to do the afternoon class as we are not morning people. That meant we did not visit the market, but we knew that before we went. Picked up from our hotel by Komang, he turned out to be not just the driver but a mine of information and helped with the ingredients, the cooking, took photos for us and was generally a wonderful host. Started with a trip to a herb and coffee plantation, here we were given loads of information and 12 different drinks to taste. Then off to the cooking class location a few kms away. It is in the home of the owner and has probably enough facilities for 12 or 14 people. We were the only 2 on this course, presumably most people do not have the aversion to morning that I have (and it was not main season). Komang and the lady who owns the house (their cooking school) showed us how to prepare and cook the seven courses. The whole thing was a wonderful experience in beautiful surroundings. And the food was brilliant - the soup I helped prepare was amazing. We have done a number of cooking classes in different parts of SE Asia and this was definitely the best, would heartily recommend. Thanks for a wonderful experience.

Best cooking class and local experience . Well organised, hotel pick up and return - local market tour with explanation of local ingredients. Personalised service, demonstration and hands on cooking experience of local traditional Balinese food. My 14 year old daughter and I had the best time - so friendly to welcome us into their home - guide excellent and so knowledgeable - well worth the experience - you then get to eat the fruits of your labours as well as taking the recipe home. Best tour ever - thank you

Cooking class awesome . Fantastic experience. A small group of 6 (they cater for up to 20 which would be very crowded). Very hands on and got to participate in all parts of preparation and cooking. Best bit eating after. Plenty of food. Did not really enjoy trip to market and plantation before, would've preferred to go direct to class (this is only for morning classes)

Great and fun cooking experience . We had a lot of fun with our 2 daughters learning how to cook Balinese food, our host is great fun and makes you feel welcome in his home. You start at the market and then proceed on with cooking in his family home, dishes are not particularly hard to cook and are great fun for children mine are aged 7 and 8

Great way to spend an afternoon. We enjoyed our cooking class the day we were scheduled to fly back to Aus. As it was a night flight, the afternoon spent cooking with Made and his team was a perfect way to spend the time. The food was authentic local flavours and there was plenty for us to eat. We made 8 dishes in all and were lucky to be the only people doing the afternoon class that day. The location is in the family home and it has great views of local plantations and jungle. The pick up and short drive there was also very enjoyable as it felt like we had left the main drag and were going into the 'real' Ubud. The staff are very helpful and friendly and knowledgable and this was a great Bali experience.

Fantastic day!. Started the day on a tour around a local market. Wonderful! Then got to try making about 15 dishes. Very hands on and such friendly staff. They were able to tailor food to health needs/food preferences. I highly recommend coming!!! The food was delicious!

Bali cooking class. Great class! We started by going through the local market and seeing how most locals start their day. After that we learned to cook a variety of Indonesian cuisine. It was all delicious!

Great morning. Bit of a trial trying to sort out which groups to go with, but these guys were really good. We were taken to the markets(their markets) and shown where the food was purchased and what each ingredient was. We then went to the family compound and spent a pleasant couple of hours preparing and then eating the food. Our guide and driver (the owner) were really nice and helpful and I presume it was the wife was lovely as well. You will not regret booking with. This company.

Fun class! . This was such a good way to spend my afternoon in Bali. Made, the chef, was informative and kind, and as I was the only one to attend the class that day, the whole meal was easily made vegetarian for me. I loved all the dishes we made (I was surprised how hands on it was) and appreciated the instructions were thorough and dishes were easy. Everything from the peanut sauce to the veggie curry, potato dumplings and banana fritters were delicious and I felt that I could recreate them at home (especially now that I have the recipes). Definitely a great choice for solo travelers!

Great Fun. This is an excellent cooking experience. We did it in early November 2015. They picked us up from the hotel in Ubud, and took us to the local market, which was fascinating. The guide, Made, was really interesting and humorous. We also visited a herb and coffee plantation and tried 12 different coffee and teas. The cooking class itself was great, in their semi-open second storey kitchen, overlooking the tops of palm trees. Afterwards we had a fantastic lunch.

Great!. The cooking experience was amazing, very friendly instructors. We got to make everything from scratch, everything went fast. But we got a cooy of the recepies, which was great so that I can practice cooking everything at home. The food was delicious and we where eating more than ever before.One of the best things we've done this vacation! Really recommended!!Only thing I can complain about is the fact that it was constantly pointed out where the woman and the mans place was in the kitchen... that annoyed me. It's 2015. Equality!

Amazing culinary experience!. We started at a local market where we got information about the Balinese ingredients. On our way to the cooking class we stopped at a rice field to get some information about rice. The cooking class itself is really nice. We made all kinds of typical Indonesian dishes which we got to eat in the end. It was deliciously of course! Best of all: we got all the recipes so that we can practice the cooking at home! The staff is really friendly and everything was well explained. We are happy that we took this class, definitely would recommend it if you're staying in or around Ubud!
Great time at the cooking class !. The class was a great time ! The Chef is really nice and fun, the food was amazing and the discovery very instructive !

Delicious vegetarian & non vegetarian food. Because I was alone and vegetarian, i didn't expect to find a good class. My homestay recommended this one. Made, a very funny man, came to pick me up on his motorbike to go to the local market in Laplapan. We were only 3 to attend the class, which was very nice. All the ingredients were ready on the table and we could all chop and grind the spices and cook everything. I was very happy that they arranged vegetarian dishes for me but also fish and meat for the other couple. They were very considerate leaving the shrimppaste out for me aswell. We had a great buffet with soup, saté, porc or corn in bananaleaf, tempehcurry, vegetables with grated coconut, lemongrass salad, peanutsauce and as a dessert bananadumplings. It was delicious!The setting in the open bambookitchen overlooking the jungle is wonderfull!
Excellent. Excellent experience, perfect moment in the ! Food was excellent and staff was fun. Totally recommend this place!!!!!

Best cooking experience!. Our honestly recommend this course out of the many available, this because it is a family run business. And the main chef has worked on cruise ships and knows our western standards of hygiene. It was a great experience. After a tour of the market and the coffee plantation we got to cooking, we were with 8 people from different countries, the staff tries to make sure everybody is in contact and they ask you to leave your camera on the table so they can make pictures while you're cooking. We paid 350.000 IDR per person. A must do in Ubud!
Great time . We really had a great day. Not sure what to expect but our host made us feel at home and taught us the finer art of balinese preparation and cooking. Great fun had by all.

It's a great experience even if you are no 'foody'!. I really didn't fancy 'cooking class' because I'm a really fussy eater but my husband did so I relented and went. Firstly we were given a tour of the market, this was great but our guide spoke very quickly and the market was noisy that I missed much of what he was saying.Later we went back to his amazing Balinese house tucked away in a street in Ubud. He gave us a tour which I found very interesting. He told us that the whole family live there - 4 families however they all had their own dwelling.Next we went to 'cooking class'. Four of us cooked up a Balinese storm. Now as I said I am a fussy eater and although I didn't eat all of what we cooked, the whole experience for me was about understanding how the Balinese cook and their main ingredients so that I can take what I've learnt home and tailor it to my family's tastes. At the end of the class we got to sample our delights and I must say, I did try most of the food and it was ok. My husband is a real 'foody' and loves trying food and new tastes; he adored all of the cusine. A great morning out and I would definitely do it again!

Amazing experience. Accidentally I was the only participant during this morning. But nevertheless Made performed the whole programm for me. Visit at the local market, explanation about the family structure as well as the religous settings. Cool to know all these things. Then we started cooking. I was busy with preparing, cutting, cooking for two hours. A really good experience. The instructions were professional, the food was extremly tasty and we laughted a lot. Made has a unique sense of humor and it was a pleasure to cook with him. If somebody want to know how to cook Balinese food that is the best address to get it. Due to the receipts, you will get, you also can do the cooking at home. Suprise your guests with a unique experience.Thanks a lot MadeEnrico

Sambal. These guys where great!The morning started with a tour to the local market ( not ubud market, an actual local market ) and a trip to the Luwak coffee plantations. The cooking class was a fun experience and our tour guides made sure we had a great time. They teach you to make the food, everything is clean and well prepared. They had drinking water handy and we got all the recipes at the end of our stay. Had a great day!

Fun experience. It was more of a cooking experience rather than a cooking class, although you get the recipies. It is a fun and diverse half day experience. The food was delicious and fun to make, although it is hard to really grasp what you are doing. Visiting the coffee tasting was nice, as you get to taste 13 kinds of coffees and teas. But don't buy any of the product as the prices are between 2 and 4 times what you pay in the centre of Ubud. Especially the famous Luwak coffee, priced at around 1 million, can be bought for 250k elsewhere. It would have been professional if the chefs would warn you for this, as it is a genuine rip-off.

Great fun, good food. We did the morning class which included a trip to the local market which was great. Enjoyed the coffee plantation as it was informative but not drawn out and there was no pressure to buy.I liked the traditional setup of the cooking class. We were a group of five so got plenty of hands on cooking.It was a lot of fun, I enjoyed the experience and the staff were lovely. Great thing to do while in Ubud, very much recommended!

Great experience in Balinese cooking. We choose the afternoon class and it was only the two of us. We didn't go to the market which is only in the morning but it was ok for us.We went to the coffee/spices plantation which was quite nice with the free tasting.For the cooking class, it was great, just the two of us, with the "teachers", we touch to everything, it was special because of the atmosphere.Also there were taking picture of us, assisting when we needed, good English from them.And of course amazing romantic dinner with great tasty food !!Amazing people

Wawa wewe. Wawa wewe means so so or comme ci comme ca, I say this because although i did not really enjoy my day it was as tourism goes in Bali ok,some experiences can leave you angry and frustrated this did not,. I wanted to lean the basics of Balinese food, and this class covered it. The chef or guy that took me had limited English, he certainly spoke well but understood little of what i said back, He asked many of the same question again and forgot my occupation which is a chef surprisingly,or again he just did not understand, I had thought that he would have been interested in this fact being a chef or working in the industry, he did not work for the company full time and was called in to take me in the class (i was the only person that afternoon). He adhered to the cooking side of the program with military precision, almost robotic, which for me took away from a personal experience and we were joined by another chef/cook but not the advertised cruise ship chef, i liked the second guy, he had better english but he stayed only long enough to complete he tasks and left again.. The first part of the day was to take me to a coffee plantation. I had been a few days before already to another one, i indicated this to my tutor, but he took me anyway.. I dont like the style of the coffee plantations, after/ during tasting they tend to want to sell the cat poo cino for 50000 rp which there is no way of trusting that is actually the real mccoy, and generally its a why not i try it once, then they take you generally to the shop which the make out or present the idea that they have grown and processed the over priced products on site, not just the coffee but the spices and teas can be well over priced, To me its just a scam and not authentic you see no evidence of coffee, tea or spice production, but you do get to see as you go in various spices growing in a large jungle/ garden setting, but no actual plantation,And the coffee plantation cost the cooking class nothing,I suspect they may even get a hand back for bringing customers as many people are trying to drag you to plantations, that's how we got to one the first time. I was never taken to a local market, which is on the brochure and i do love to see them the real local markets in asia can be eye openers, exciting, horrific and interesting, so i was disappointed not seeing a market. After cooking the food and displaying it i asked that i could take the food away as i really was not feeling well or hungry my coach insisted a taste a little which I did and offered a bintang which was slightly more expensive than a restaurant 25000 small 50000 lg As i really couldnt eat a meal ( had had a late lunch and i think the heat was getting to me, and i had picked up a flu or cold the week before, anyway kindly he let me return with some leftovers for my partner and the guest house staff.As for my partner, she chose to go to the tourist market shopping which worked out well as 350000rp each if the both of us had gone it would have been an expensive day by Bali travel standards.However I think I gained what i went for the basic sauce or spice paste, which if my tutor is correct is the base for almost every Balinese dish, but sourcing the ingredients may be difficult.In all i feel if you find a guest house and get along well with your host you would have a better experience going to the market with them and learning the base dishes that every Balinese would probably know at their home, if you can wrangle it.

Fun day. Started with a tour of a local market, this was very interesting and informative. Next a visit to coffee, tea and spice garden for sampling of Luwak coffee and other flavoured coffee and teas. Then off to the family compound for the cooking class to begin. The class was very hands on with everyone getting involved in the chopping and mixing and cooking of the food. This is in contrast to previous cooking classes taken which were more demonstration than actual preparation. Very enjoyable day topped off with a banquet of all our efforts, which were so delicious by the way that we over did it and had to cancel our dinner reservations!

so full!. I really enjoyed this cooking school, it was recommended by a person staying at our hotel. we were taken to a local food market which was great, then to a coffee plantation where we tried many coffees and teas (there are heaps of these, and I'd been to one the day before and it was great, but happy to try the teas all over again). Then we went to the family compound were they had built a cooking school out the back. The cooking was great, the only down side being that instead of learning a number of dishes from start to finish, the five of us worked on various parts of dishes to make about 8 dishes, so I didn't feel like I had a grasp on all the dishes cooked (I gather this is a similar experience to other cooking schools here, I'm just comparing to an excellent school I went to in Thailand). The husband and wife who ran the place were very welcoming, their limited English made up for by the guy who guided us the whole morning. The food was awesome, traditionally cooked, and we were so stuffed at the end. The only real downfall was the written recipes, with incomplete recipe lists and odd instructions, and a spice paste referred to by three different names which was very confusing. I had hoped to find time to write them out in better English, but I'm sorry, it's been too long and I can't remember the steps well enough...hopefully someone will offer to do this for them as this really was the only problem.

Insight into Balinese culture and food. We elected to do the morning class. We were picked up from our hotel and taken to the local market and given an overview. Next we stopped at a plantation growing a variety of crops and producing a variety of teas, coffee (including Balinese Luwak), spices and chocolate. Pricey to buy but good quality. Made 1 and Made 2 then took us to the Balinese compound for the cooking class. We then began learning the fundamentals of Balinese cooking, preparing ingredients and then cooking a variety of dishes. There were only 4 people in our class and we did work virtually non stop but it was terrific. The food was just delicious and more than we could eat! They even packaged up what was left for us to take home - which was much appreciated. We left around 8.15 and were back at our hotel by 1.30 pm - so 4 hours all up. v=This is a terrific experience, great value and highly recommended. Made 1 & 2 and the other staff are lovely people.

Very Enjoyable!. Very enjoyable day! Picked up from accommodation at the arranged time. First a look around a small market learning about the variety of local foods then a stop for tea & coffee tasting. The cooking class was held at the chefs home - very interesting to get a glimpse of how a Balinese family live. The class was relaxed, fun & informative. As for the cooking be prepared to roll up your sleeves & get to work! This is a hands on experience. After we finished we got to eat everything ...delicious!! I would definitely recommend this class, great value! Thank you to the chefs Made 1, Made 2 & the ladies who helped in the kitchens, we had a great time

Absolutly amazing experience, great hosts -Made and Made plus the team-. If you want to get to know typical Balinese food prep go and join Made in one their cooking classes. Been picked up from the place we stayed for now extra costs (one organic cooking school was going to charge an exta 100 tsd for a 10 min ride), Made takes you took a small local market (you don thave tobe there by 7am) and to a (yeah!)typical coffee farm where you can try teas and coffee. Ok if you have been dragged to one before that might not make much of a differ nce but if not, then it s ineresting. At least atthe one we went the poor Luwak life in a bigger cage with some tree stumps and a sign "breeding" (2 Luwaks in the cage) instead I'm fa box cagelike at other places. If you don t agree with the method of making Poo Coffee .... this is Asia at the end of the day and I m sure there are "things" Asians don t like about Europe. Back to the cooking class: Made 2 has explained all ingredients and preparation before you start getting you hands on experience, they assist and explain while you are preparing pastes, sauces, and other parts ofthe menue. Very relaxed atmospaehre, no Master Chef attitude, very down to earth easy going. We enjoyed every minute and highlight was lunch: Yummy is the only word to discribe! Well worth the money and a great experience with Balinese locals.
Great cooking experience. Thanks to Made, really good chef! Food was delicious and the location really typical. Highly recommended. Total cost 300.000 roupies per person.

Highlight of our trip. We were lucky to only have a group of 4 people in our evening class. The experience was so personal and it is really hands on. Made x2 helped us make sooo many dishes and it was the best food we ate all holiday. We were in a family home and that only added to the experience as we watched the sunset while chopping ingredients. Made gives you a list of recipes so you can make the dishes when you get back home. This was definitely the highlight of our holiday. If you are looking for a hands on cooking class (not a demonstration) in a family home/compound with amazing people and small groups look no further!!

A Top Balinese Food Experience . For 314,000 IRD incl the food you couldn't fault it. Mardi speaks from 8 years experience working on cruise ships around the world cooking Indonesian food. And it shows as this was the best Indonesia food I ate throughout my entire 10 day holiday. The best part was the whole 'food experience'. Going to the very local market where the food you are going to cook with was purchased. Then heading to the plantation to see how they harvest all the chillies, spices, garlics, gingers etc. this also doubles as a local coffee your and includes a nice tea and coffee tasting free of charge. Then it's into Mardi's house and he does a great job firstly explaining they layout of the traditional Bali home and what each aspect of it represents. The its onto the cooking. Very clean, you cook everything from scratch and you really take plenty of lessons away from it. They're constantly stopping for drinks and to explain the more important steps in detail. The variety of traditional Balinese food is vast and really gives you and all round Balinese chef and taste experience (curries, open grill, salads, satays, soups, deserts... etc) Bus pickup and drop off to the door of your hotel tops it off. Awesome experience, best food on tour.

Amazing. I have done a cooking class in Bali before which turned out to be more like a demo so I didn't hold high expectations for this one. I was pleasantly surprised and excited. The class is run by a lovely family and held at their home. It was is really nice to hear about their home, family and culture. We cooked lots of dishes and ate like Kings and Queens at the end. We were involved and hands on the whole time. I can not recommend this class enough. Very clean, great price, good English.

Amazing Experience!. We participated in this cooking class after cancelling a rafting trip due to the weather and after taking it I'm so happy the weather turned on us because this was an absolutely amazing experience! First I'll say that our hotel offered a cooking class similar to this one for $110 per couple. We paid much much less with Bali Manggang. As is mentioned, this is held in a private kitchen in a local village where you do everything from chopping to grilling all of your own dishes and then you get to eat it all from the family recipes. This is a must do if you are every in Ubud! Everything tasted delicious & fresh!

Great cooking class, awesome chefs!. A great way to learn Bali cuisine. The very friendly chefs pick you up at your hotel, show you the fresh ingredients on a local market and take you to a small plantation nearby where you learn about different plants and have the chance to taste different coffees. (For 50k rhp also a cup of coffee luwak) After that you go to the house of the chef to cook in a traditional style kitchen on a rooftop. You'll definitely make more delicious dishes than you will be able to eat. And if you're lucky maybe the owner takes you to a tradional rooster fight in the village Temple!

Everything we wanted in a Cooking Class!This is NOT a demonstration class.. Our morning tour started at 8.20 am with our driver being on time. We were a family of 5 and it was it was only us in the class!! We went to the local Balinese market, not the Tourist Ubud market and were shown the various ingredients and spices. We ended up buying some of the traditional sweets to try later. Then we went to the organic spice farm where they serve tea and coffee for you to try. We tried about 12 different ones and then some Arak( Balinese spirit) and then some organic chocolate( milk, vanilla and orange). You have the opportunity to buy the products afterwards, which people have said is expensive but the place is educational and we thoroughly enjoyed their products. The chocolate doesn't have dairy so my daughter loved it. We stopped in at a rice field and it was explained how the rice grows and is harvested.Next was the cooking class in an actual village and is at someones house, not a hotel! However, the kitchen area is a large open area perfectly set up to prepare and cook your food. We each had a cooking space and they had about 8-9 stoves to utilise. We each had something to do, some chopping, some cooking vegetable curry, some cooking chicken meatball soup, some making the bean vegetable dishes or the spicy sauces, Lemongrass, BBQ and satay sauce( my fav) And we got to BBQ the satays, the pork satay's and the chicken.We all contributed to making 3-4 dishes each. It was full on cooking for each person. This is not a demonstration class!Our food feast was plentiful! We couldnt eat it all and we eat a lot! The final dessert was banana fritters that were boiled, kind of like sweet dumplings!! And then they were coated in fresh coconut. They were delicious! I will be making these back home! So easy but just yum, not too sweet!They also catered for us as we don't eat wheat, and everything is very fresh.The staff were wonderful, very happy and nothing was too much effort, the class was not rushed and we were able to really enjoy our meal. We were also allowed to adjust the spice level to suit our taste, and we like really spicy!! If you want a hands on class, where you participate fully for 2-2.5 hours just cooking, and then having a relaxing time eating then you must do this class!! We also have recipes to take home. Highly recommend!!

Great, tasty and interesting expirience!. It was great adventure - from visiting market in the morning, then visitig plantations, degustaion ~15 varaites of tea and coffee, with detailed explnations. After we moved to chief's house where we cooked about 10 types of dishes - bbq pork and tuna, pork in banana leaves, vegetables, 3 types of souses, soup and dessert. Everything was clear and interesting. After it we ate all these delicious food, it is great luck we got exactly this classes!

great value cooking for all levels of experience. Had a wonderful experience at the cookery school. Our lesson was preceded by visit to local market and then coffee plantation. My sister is an experienced cook while I am less so
But I Was able to keep up quite easily with help from chef and his wife.Lovely to see traditional Balinese family and compound
Would definitely recommend.

Fantastic!. Where to start! Well I definitely highly reccomend this class! The food was delicious, and simple enough that I feel comfortable that I'll be able to re-create back home. The tour started out with a local market tour and then plantation tour to give an idea of the local produce and it did add a nice little touch to the day. We were lucky as my friend and I were the only ones who had booked the class so we had the class to ourself; although I still believe we would have enjoyed it just as much if we had to share. The chefs were able to adjust the recipes to cater to my dietary needs, so I didnt miss out on much. Everything was made from scratch and the fact that we got the recipes at the end made it even better. Only thing I would suggest; would be for the recipes to come to with measurements as they only provide the ingredient list and method; but no measurements for ingredients.
Traditional cooking. I had a great time! When you want to lern how to cook traditional food you have to go there! The lunch was perfect en the people are realy friendly.

Great cooking class!. Had an amazing day at the manggang cooking class with delicious food and interesting visits at the food market and the coffee/tea plantation! The chef and assistants were very friendly and helpful! Recommend this class if you want to learn how to cook Balinese food and more about the Balinese food culture!

Great cooking class :). This was a great experience - The cook was very helpful and his assistants were very friendly - we had a lot of fun although the food was a little too spicy for us. We would recommend it to everyone :)

Brilliant class with lovely hosts. The class was just what we wanted as food lovers, to get to understand Balinese cooking! The market visit was excellent, as was the cooking! Lovely fresh ingredients in a big, open, Clean kitchen. Definate value for money, as we didn't eat for the rest of the day!

Amazing!. I did this cooking workshop with Bali Manggang for the second time after a year and both times were unforgetable. Made and the other teachers provide a real insight into Balinese life. They pick you up and drive you around. Visiting the market and the garden with herbs was very special and a lot was explained about the use of the ingredients. We were lucky to be with the two of us which made cooking the food a really good experience so we could do most of it ourselves. There was plenty of time, the kitchen was spacious and clean and the food was cooked with a lot of care. The peanut sauce is the best I've ever tasted! Made knows exactly what he is doing and everything tasted and smelled delicious! Would definately recommend this cooking class out of all the companies. One of my best experiences in Bali!

Brilliant cooking class and guide. Imade Astawa picked us up bright and early to begin our journey at the local food market, then onto the plantation to see of the ingredients we would be cooking with. We tasted every type of coffee and tea including the infamous luwak tea. We then went to the manggang house to start cooking. My friend and I were lucky to be tutored by Imade astawa alone and he let us really get involved and we ended up cooking a huge delicious feast! He was a brilliant teacher, patient, funny and kind and I would really recommend his class to anyone fortunate to be in ubud or the surrounds.

Great experience. Lots of fun and well worth the time. You cook in a lovely cool, open, clean kitchen with lots of fresh ingredients and great teachers. We were lucky that this morning there were only the two of us cooking. We made a huge number of dishes, all of them delicious (soup, tofu curry, fish and pork skewers, bean/coconut salad, grilled chicken, pork steamed in bananna leaves, sambal, satay and fresh lemongrass sauces and a banana dessert). Glad to take the recipes home because we would love to try making them again. Book directly with Manggang because hotels and booking agencies take a large commission from the people that run the class. Lots of fun!

Amazing. Had a great time, very rural Bali experience. The market was local, coffee and tea plantation was really good also. Then into local residence where the 6 of us chopped, cooked and the ate some delicious Balinese dishes would highly recommend this adventure. Thanks so much

Excellent authentic cooking experience!. I'm so glad we chose this company out of the many options available. We were very lucky as they were able to modify all the dishes for our vegetarian requirements. We felt comfortable and really enjoyed learning the local dishes. I was so surprised at how easy it was to make amazing food. Even my girlfriend did it. Thank you so much for a fun and educational experience!

Friendly approach, good teaching and great food. There were 5 of us in total in this class and it was a perfect number, I have to say. The guide took us to a local market, not the one for tourists and overpriced ingredients. We sampled there a few sweets that we bought ourselves from locals and then headed to a coffee plantation to have a coffee which is the only reason I will not put a 5 star rating here. I would skip this visit to see poor animals in the cages and see the business they do with them there.The visit to a rice field was fine, pity we had to rush for the cooking already. The chef and his team are friendly and made us all organized while preparing more dishes at the same time. Luckily you get recipes of all meals you do there so you can prepare it yourself at home. We cooked maybe too much for five of us, but the class was definitely worth as the guide and chef can give you a nice background of Balinese cuisine.

We had a fun day with our Chefs and excellent Food!. Started with a visit to a local market (sort of behind the scenes) and learned a lot about the balinese culture. The class takes place in a Family residence. We were only 7 so everybody hat his share of work to do and got intense supervision by the Cooks - great experience!

best experience ever. We wanted to do a cooking class and came across this one which was excellent value for money. This class was better than others as it was actually at the owner/chef's house. We did the morning class which was worth getting up for as we got to go to the local market. The guide was friendly and very knowledgeable. Oh and the food was incredible! We will definitely try to recreate it. Thank you for a fabulous opportunity. Fiona and Phil xx

Great Cooking Class. Great experience. Started off at a traditional market, went to a rice paddie then to a Balinese family compound. The group was kept small which is great and everyone did something different. The food was delicious.

Amazing!. We had a great experience at Bali Manggang. They are very friendly and helpfull. The cooking class was very nice and the dishes we cooked were delicious. I would recomment this cooking course to everybody!

Amazing cooking skills for life. We recently partook in this cooking course...it was absolutely fantastic and the staff involved are really enthusiastic and passionate about explaining balanese traditions and cooking to you. We all felt like we would definitely use all our new cooking skills at home and just found the whole process fascinating. Everything we prepared from scratch was so healthy and on par with dishes we had sampled in the local restaurants. It was such a good way to spend a morning here in Ubud.I would highly recommend this particular cooking school as their warm nature, patience and enthusiasm was very endearing.
Balinese cooking. Super day out..The balinese people are so lovely and friendly. We had great fun cooking and also learned a lot about their culture..so interesting. ..

Great morning.. Really enjoyed the cookery course, we learned so much and got to eat everything after....was delicious!! The staff was so nice and friendly and explained things very well. I would definitely recommend this day...excellent value!

Just join in!. Wonderful experience with a lovely kitchenteam.Visiting the local market was very interesting und well explained, many informations during our way to where cooking class took place. Here again very well done explanations about family life in Bali, different houses and their meanings on the compound ground. Very well prepared and nicely decorated ingrediences we needed for cooking, made courious to start. The buffet we made offert all from fishsoup to grilled chicken, fishsatay, fish and meat in bananaleafs etc,. We loved it and recommended it to friends!!! Thanx again!

Great class!. Great class and so easy to organise. We messaged the place in the morning and had a response within the hour. A driver picked us up and dropped us off so didn't have to worry about finding the place. We did the afternoon class and it was really fun. Have some great easy recipes to try when we get home. The class was so organised and perfectly timed! Would absolutely recommend. It was a really great price as well. Also, you end up eating dinner with an amazing view!

Amazing Cooking Class. We had so much fun and made all the meals when we got back to Canada. Super easy to find all the ingredients back at home as they informed us of alternatives. Also it was an absolutely beautiful view.

Funny And Yummy Cooking Class. I had a great time here. The entire event is orchestrated to perfection. It's more like a dance than a cooking class. 4-5hrs of perfect entertainment and engagement. Go here above every other place. Not a single complaint...it was really something else and the people I shared the experience with were amazingly inclusive as well.

Making Memories . Experienced this cooking class today with my daughter Johanna, who had attended once before. What a fabulous experience!Puspa and Wayan are warm,welcoming and humorous hosts and all staff are helpful and happy to answer any questions. It was a hands on cooking experience and the food was prepared communally giving it an authentic family feel. The food itself was amazing and the instructions good enough to want to attempt this at home. Thanks honey!

Highlight of our trip!. I love this cooking class so much - I did it last year and this year I brought my Mum back. It's so much fun and extremely good value. The 350k includes transfers in Ubud, market tour, getting to taste traditional fruit at the market, tea and coffee and water, all the cooking class, a gigantic buffet lunch with dessert plus a recipe book for you to take home. It is really one of my favourite things to do in Bali and I can't wait to come back next time with my fiancé.

Great experience . We went on the 4/11/16 was great felt very welcomed when we came in the welcome drink was great! Yes the lady your owns it does move around but it's still good to get community with everyone else and the food was amazing! And I loved the idea of having the menu so we can take it home! Overall my mum and I loved it

Authentic Experience - Great Value and Fun - A Must do in Ubud!. I am about to write a lengthy review so for the lazy (I am guilty too). All I can say is do this cooking school (as long as you don't have crazy dietary requirements or are a super fussy eater/hard to please)..... It's well worth the money and time.- Firstly we were picked up from our Resort (and dropped off at the end of the day) and driven to the markets (morning class only). This was a really nice touch. We tried some fruit and asked question about the food. Then we were driven to the family home.- When we arrived, we were given refreshing lemon drinks and our host talked about Balinese culture. All done with enthusiasm and humour. - The class room was super clean with great facilities. The lesson was structured well but was also fun. - We chopped, swapping jobs at times and then cooked in pairs. I am glad we weren't able to "put our own stance on the cooking" as it would have made the dishes less authentic. Plus there were 12 of us in the class so that could have been a disaster! I feel like I can cook these dishes at home now with the recipes we have been given and we were encouraged to cook for our families. - All the while we could help ourselves to cold bottled water. We were offered tea or coffee at the start and at the end of the class with dessert.- Puspa was not there for all of the class but this was not a problem at all. The other staff were super friendly and fun to be with. (I think it's fine to hold two classes at the same time, they were staggered, especially since we were well looked after and were there to cook food).- Puspa and her staff did a great job of explaining the ingredients and explained how we could use other ingredients that might not be available in our countries. This is as authentic as it can get (we are tourists after all). We were invited into someones home to cook in a well organised kitchen. Learning from someone who has set up a great business. Thank you Puspa and everyone at the school for a great day. If I am ever in Ubud, I will be back. This is a must if you are a food lover. It's great value for money and a fun day out... I can't wait to cook for my friends and family.

A fabulous experience - just amazing! . Just back from our cookery course, which will be an experience we will remember forever. We are a family with 2 young children, travelling for the year and therefore on a limited budget. We wanted to go in a course which welcomed children, gave us an introduction into Balinese cooking and was good value for money. This absolutely did not disappoint in anyway. We left totally delighted at the wonderful experience and could not see any room for improvement.I emailed in the morning and after a few quick exchanges, we were booked on the afternoon course on the same day. The transport arranged was perfect, and the driver was really very welcoming and informative about our general Bali chit-chat. On arrival we were provided with a lovely welcome drink, which we had overlooking the lovely surrounding countryside. We were looked after as a party of 8, which included our 2 children age 5 and 8. The staff could not have been more welcoming, and let the children do everything the adults did. It meant it was a fully interactive trip for all of us, and our children were fully engaged and enthused throughout. We could not believe the amount of different dishes we prepared! All very different, totally authentic and giving a really good insight into Balinese cooking. It was really nicely paced, you get to prepare, cook a bit, eat starter, cook main, eat main, prepare pudding etc. This meant there was a really nice pace to the class. The food was absolutely delicious, and there was more food than the 8 of us could eat. However, we weren't too full to have seconds! I logged onto trip advisor to see another review posted for 4 Nov which only scored the class 2 out of 5. I am really astounded with these comments as this was NOT our experience of the day at all. There are lots of staff to help, but only 2 real guides, which is actually quite nice as you get a bit of variety in the instruction.As well as a totally authentic Bali 3 course meal, with about 8 different recipes, you get tea/coffee/water included, a welcome drink, free pick up service and a recipe book. To me, it was an exceptionally well thought out course with friendly helpful and welcoming staff. The quality was top class, and the experience and value for money therefore outstanding. As we left I said to my husband that they could not improve on this course. Don't miss this great experience! You won't be disappointed.
Great fun!. A highly enjoyable and entertaining experience! You get to make and taste some fabulous food and the hosts are just hilarious. Well worth a try!

Lacks authenticity and real cooking. This cookery course may have an authentic origin, but it over commercialised and lost any authentic feel.The cooking is basic - you will chop, stir and crush - and then everyone's 'cooking' is combined so any personal flavours you have added are gone. There is limited opportunity to put your own stance on the cooking. Also the veggie options are limiting - how many different ways can you at tofu?!The course overall feels over orchestrated, Puspa has multiple classes on the go and is splitting herself between them, which means it lacks a personal touch. Instead you leave feeling pressured to write a good review as Puspa refers to TripAdvisor as her 'god mother' and like you've been ripped off any real Balinese cooking. It's a shame really. I feel like all Puspa could see was dollar signs in all her guests and experience or sharing knowledge wasn't on the agenda.
Great time in Ubud. Great food, and great company! Highly recommended! Food was easy enough to cook, and tasted great. Also some good coffee and BINTAAAANNNNG!!!

Paon cooking class. I recently went to the Paon cooking class with my partner, my sister and her partner. Hosted by Puspa and Wayan it was a great morning. The trip to the Ubud market was an eye opener followed by a very warm greeting in their home and kitchen by Wayan and Puspa.The kitchen team led by Nyoman made everything simple and the fresh ingredients and their tutelage resulted in some tasty dishes. Our party thoroughly enjoyed the morning and I absolutely recommend the experience. Thankyou very much

Cooking with love. The entire afternoon was so nice and lovely. The organization of the cooking was just perfect and the staff really kind. The food we made was delicious and we are looking forward to try it at home.:-)

What an amazing time!!!!. I can only recommend this cooking class, it was amazing! It started with a guided tour of ubud market, followed by a quick trip to a rice paddy. Our guide explained both very well and answered all of our questions. Then we went to the owners house, which is,very nice, and we cooked 8 dishes! The flavours were fantastic and the staff very friendly and relaxed. It was a wonderful experience!!! A must!!

Great Event. We had an amazing evening there. Everything was perfect organized. Stunning Location with the Dschungle View and the openkitchen. All the people there were so kind and helpful. We had the luck that the class was pretty small only 5 instead of 13 upto. So it was pretty private and cosy.Thanks for a great Event!!

Amazing cooking class, highly entertaining head chef. Chef 'Honey' and her team give a superb class. we cooked a 7 course meal together as a class, which was delicious. She provides an explanation to Indonesian ingredients and methods. If you are in Bali, i highly recommend doing this cooking class.

Fun experience, delicious food!. We have so many things to rave about, from the funny driver who picked us up from the hotel, feeling welcomed in the instructor's own home, the many memorable phrases that we picked up from the instructor (you have to be there to find out!), to some of the most delicious food we had in Ubud. The cooking class exceeded our expectations!

Great dishes and some of the best food we had in Ubud!. We had trouble finding great Indonesian food in Ubud so we were thrilled to do this cooking class and really learn about Balinese cooking. Everyone was really friendly and helpful and we cooked up a feast. Thank you!

Must do when in Ubud just perfect cooking class! . Just perfect way to learn about Balinese food and style of cooking. The class is well organized and a lot of preparation of food and cooking is done by participants in class. The boss and owner is a truly a queen! She is funny and you really feel welcome and all the other employees are thoughtful and really nice. I was really happy to have this experience while in Ubud.

No surprise they are #1. Probably the most interactive activity with other travelers in all of Ubud. Super funny and sweet hosts, really fun dishes, great edu, yummy food and really great price. Made friends and shared experiences.

Outstanding hosts and cooking class. Paspa & Wayan really welcome you into their home and make you feel so welcome! Even with a 22 month old they even bought out a bed to help our daughter sleep. Food was amazing and the venue was incredible overlooking the forest. With a free pick up and drop off from our hotel it was educational as well thoroughly enjoyable and the highlight of our trip to Ubud. We would thoroughly recommend Paon Bali Cooking Course

Great cooking class. This cooking class exceeded my expectations. Authentic Balinese cooking using traditional methods. We prepared and cooked everything. It was a delicious feast with all the recipes available to take home.I highly recommend this class to everyone.

The best experience . We booked this class based on the reviews on TripAdvisor & it really really did not disappoint.We were collected & dropped to & from our guesthouse included in the cost. Welcomed by a wonderful family & an ice cold lemon water. The husband was so welcoming, telling us about his home, his married dogs & what today would entail. We had free tea, coffee & water and an amazing view where we would be cooking. We prepped, learnt & cooked all 8 courses of the most amazing food with the most wonderful host (the wife, I am terrible with names sorry) a cookbook to take home & a life time of memories. You really really should go.

Very recommendable!. We had a wonderful experience, participating in this cooking class. From the visit to the market, the welcome at the home, the explanations and information, the class itself and the resulting food: It was all amazing! I highly recommend this cooking class to anyone!

AMAZING DAY!. We are Bali regulars who come every year and try to dedicate at least one day of our holiday to learning about Balinese cooking and cuisine. Always before we had a chef come to our villa and show us how to make a few dishes! This year we went strictlyon the advise of TRIP ADVISOR and booked the Paon Bali Cooking Class... and WOW! This was the highlight of our trip! The booking process is super easy and they will pick you up and take you to where the tour begins... the local market in Ubud... then on to the rice paddy where you have great photo ops and they explain the rice harvest. Next to the home of AMAZING Puspa and Wayan who take it from there. You are actually a guest in their home and they make you feel so welcome! You become a part of the family and meet so many different people in a very comfortable setting! They have the day orchestrated to the second and it is so well organized! And you get to eat the delicious meals you prepared at the end! This will be one we will repeat every year! I recommend it and guarantee you will never ever forget this experience!

This is a MUST in Ubud. One of the best experiences we had in Bali. The cooking class runs smoothly, you prep food, cook food, learn about food, eat food and drink (free water and beer) The family are the nicest people and so welcoming into their home. The views from the cooking class are breathtaking. Free pick up and drop off shuttles are provided. Auntie Pusba is a legend! We will return!
Great time!!. Excellent cooking class! Such a delight! We will definitely go again. We got a ride to the facility and a quick tour of the house before heading into the kitchen.

DISSAPPOINTED & UNHAPPY. Emailed them several times to find out what time they would pick us up from our hotel - they never responded! Then they just turned up in the middle of the afternoon and expected us to go - I was in the shower & hubby in the pool!!! Not good enough - still waiting for our refund 5 weeks later!

Great!. We booked the afternoon class, from 4-8 pm.We were picked up from our hotel on time and had a 10 in drive to the place. We were a group of approximately 20 people. They offered coffee tea water and then it started.puspa and her team are really nice and professional! They show and explain all the ingredients and tell you exactly what to do.it is so much fun and you meet so many nice people.the food at the end was delicious!!they also give you all the recipes! We highly recommend this class!

Fun and interesting cooking experience . The couple who run this are hilarious and make it a really fun experience! The class includes collection and dropoff from your hotel. You learn to make about 6 dishes, a really variety of items. And eat it all of course! It was delicious! Expect there to be a lot of people there, we had 22 in our class, and there was about another big group who had split off into another group. But they organise if well so everyone is taking part all the time, you try making all the diff bits, the class passes really quickly. Their home is beautiful, a really lovely setting for the experience.

Great cooking class. My family, including two boys ages 11&14 thoroughly enjoyed our time at Paon Cooking Class. Very clear directions, entertaining host/hostess and lovely setting made for a relaxed and fun evening. The menu included delicious Balinese foods and recipes to take away. Definitely recommend!

Definitely worth it!. We visited a few days ago and found this class to be totally worth the trip to Ubud from the Seminyak area. We coordinated our own taxi ride to the class as we decided to spend the entire day in Ubud after the class. I emailed Paon cooking class via their website and coordinated to meet in front of the Ubud Palace at 8am. We were greeted by a staff member right on time and took a brief tour of the market where we were told about the different fruits and veggies available there. Our guide even gave us extra time to make a few purchases along the way:)Next was the rice paddy field "tour." This was more of an explanation of the history and importance of rice while standing in front of one of the fields. It was beautiful but my group and I found this to be a little longer than necessary. Although the guide was sweet and funny. We then went to Puspa's home. This was amazing and so clean! She and her husband were very funny and welcoming! The cooking class was informative, memorable and a great time! The food was yummy and they were very accommodating to those with allergies or vegan or vegetarian. I would definitely recommend this class! Just FYI... Allow at least 5 hours total if doing the morning tour. Our taxi for the entire day was about ($65 US plus tip)Thank you, Puspa! (Aka "honey")

Delicious and accommodating! . I was really looking forward to this cooking class since I booked my trip to Bali. Puspa and her team were very accommodating and great about confirming my booking and coordinating pickup. The day started with a quick stop at the local market and a rice field before we headed to start cooking. There was a large group of people there, but there was enough for everyone to do. Puspa was really accommodating to my food restrictions. I was the only vegetarian (and gluten free at that) and I was able to enjoy lots of delicious foods. My meal at the end of the class was the only thing I ate all day! The price is fair for the food/pickup/tour and for the experience. I would definitely come back!
Great experience and fantastic value for money. Highly recommended - the market and rice field visit were very interesting but the cooking class with Puspa definitely the highlight, great fun.

Just a great day out. We actually did this in 2012 but still talk about it. Great day which starts at the market in Ubud. Following a visit to the rice fields, you end up at the family home. Entertaining from start to finish. A great way to learn about local spices and cooking techniques.I have since cooked the full menu at home on several occasions & it has always been a success. I'm not a big cook but definitely a great thing to do on hols.

perfect for the non cook!. Professional, funny, and super tasty!Great time with Puspa and her team.Market tour to see Balinese fruit and veg and spices.Learn things about the bali family compound design.Great food, transport and also receive a recipe book from the day!
