Fine and heartwarming cooking class!. The married couple welcomes you on a charming and funny way. You learn to cook Balinese food with a bunch of other people who become for a few hours "your cooking family". Pedagogic and with humor.

No Show - Ruined Final Day in Bali. I booked this course around a week in advance for my final day in Indonesia. Based on the reviews, I was very much looking forward to the experience. Communication up until the day of the course was prompt and friendly. However, when it came to the morning that I was supposed to be picked up, I waited at my hotel for over an hour. No one showed. I left my contact details with them when signing up (both personal and hotel numbers) and no one had called. Only when I later emailed did I get a response claiming that they couldn't find the hotel! Absolute nonsense. They didn't even have the decency to call. This ruined my last day in Bali as I was then left with having to change my plans at the last minute.

Must Do!. This class was fantastic. Puspa is well-organized, funny, and a fabulous cook. I couldn't believe how much food we ended up making! She was also very accommodating to me being gluten free AND vegetarian. Thanks for a fun afternoon!

Delicious and Entertaining. Wayan and Pusapa have their routine well rehearsed - and it's an energetic morning of market tours, food education, local culture and cooking, cooking, cooking and eating. We really enjoyed being able to learn about and sample fruit and spices at the markets before cooking with them. There's a cheeky sense of humour in the cooking instructions, mixed in with vigilant food safety and hygiene, so we felt relaxed the whole time. The recipes were briefly explained beforehand, with all the ingredients. Everyone took turns chopping, slicing, grinding and frying - and then we had an amazing banquet for lunch. Most of us went back for seconds. And then there were bananas with coconut cream for dessert! Returned to hotel full of good food and good memories.

Best cooking class ever!. We had read that this was the best and we certainly weren't disappointed. An entertaining anilkumar@rubycargouae.com informative day, and the food was to die for! Can thoroughly recommend it!

Fun, educational, and yummy. What a great experience. We did this class today and both really enjoyed it. The trip to the market and rice paddies was educational and the class was so much fun. The program runs smoothly, the outdoor kitchen has a cool breeze and all the food was easy to cook and delicious. I've taken a lot of cooking classes and this was one of my favorites.

Super Fun cooking class. The best cooking class ever. We actually chopped, sliced, diced and mortar the food we consumed. We were with our group only, it was nice...and even the hubbies were encouraged to participate, which they enjoyed. Puspa, the host was humorous and educated us on the different herbs and vegetables used and told us what to use if we weren't able to find in our produce at home. Lots of laughing and good eating was had by all. One of the most delicious healthy meals we had while staying nearby in Ubud.

Fun class with great range of dishes. I really enjoyed this cooking class. You get the chance to cook a range of dishes with a group, so you get to mix it up & do some frying, chopping etc. The best bit is you get to eat all the dishes you've made at the end. The staff were very friendly. They also offer a drop off & collection service to your hotel. Would recommend!

Deliciously friendly and efficient. Very well organised cooking school. From pick up to drop off. Good hands on class with great opportunity to share with everyone in the class. Lots of honey bunnies. Food we prepared and cooked and ate. Would recommend. Good value for money too.

Great cooking class. Pick up, welcome drink all very smooth, staff have good interaction with class, they keep it fun while still moving the preparation and cooking procedures along well. The morning class is definitely a better option as the trip to the market and explanation of some of the fruits and spices is helpful and interesting. Puspa obviously interacts with each class and this is also very good. Thank you for a lovely experience.

Fun First Time at Cooking Class. My husband and I chose to go to Paon cooking class on the recommendation of our Airbnb host. We were picked up from our accommodation and we're first taken to the local market where we were told about Indonesian spices and then given various fruit to sample. After that we were taken to see rice paddies close to where the lessons were held. The four and half hours was an enjoyable experience. We cooked in pairs, and then everyone combined their cooking into one dish. The pace was just right and results delicious. We made seven or so dishes and are now waiting to get home and try out the recipes on our own. I would highly recommend going to Paon.
AUTHENTIC LOCAL. Very authentic local cooking class. Gets you down to the roots and essence of balinese cooking. Thumbs up! Try it you will love the class!

Amazing cooking class with Wayan and Puspa. Felt very welcome by Wayan (Husband) who greeted us at the entrance of his home with a refreshing lime juice drink that helped to beat the heat. As well as 2 tiny chihuahuas. Before we started the cooking class proper, he gave a very interesting short intro to Balinese Hindu culture with regards to family, home layouts, and placentas. The couple were very entertaining and welcoming to all guests. The class then started off with an introduction to the raw ingredients to make all the EIGHT dishes you will have for lunch/dinner (depending on the slot of your class). It's conducted in a huge kitchen in the back of their home that is clean and well lit and breezy. Everything was well organised and proceeded like clockwork. Puspa and her crew are professionals.

Good experience with some minor transportation issues. First, they know what they are doing. As a German I was impressed by the logistics and the time planing while cooking and preparing the food. We did not feel any breaks or question marks what the next steps would be. Everyone was always involved and in action. The hosts are extremely welcoming, and focused on the needs of their cooking classes. This is a professional and well though through cooking school that I can highly recommend. If you are not from the area of Ubud, you may have to rely on a driver service that the cooking school offers. Right now, this driving service is quite expensive, since the driver stays at the place the whole day. This can be improved, and will also be improved as promised by the owners. Alternatively you can always organize the transport yourself. The cooking school is worth it.
Slick Operation . Great class. Well organised, streamlined delivery. Extremely flavoursome food but not much heat to it. If you like chilli you need to add to your food when eating.

Fun and Delicious Cooking. While in Bali, I didn't realize how much I would fall in love with the food. I researched this class on TripAdvisor and immediately booked a class. This was the most organized activity I did while in Bali. We started out at a market, tasted some of the local fruits and veggies, headed to the rice fields adjacent to the Puspa's class and then to cooking class. I enjoyed preparing, cooking, learning about the Bali food history and most of all LOVED everything I cooked. I love the hospitality that the Balinese people give and Puspa was not only welcoming but quite the comedian. The class was fun, it was great to meet so many people from other countries and eat family style. This class is well worth your time if you love Balinese food!

Must do!. We originally wanted an "in villa" personal cooking class, but our villa owner said that this class was a must do! She was right! We had no clue what to expect; glad they booked here!!! Puspa and Wayan took us in as if we were family!!! Great "how to" regarding AUTHENTIC Balinese dishes, with ideas for substitution ingredients if needed! Had a blast meeting others from around the world and learning to cook Puspa's dishes with them!

Great people and great food. This cooking class was very well organised and very good value for money.After a tour of the local food market and a visit to local rice paddies, we arrived at the home of our hosts where we were made to feel very welcome. The cooking class was super well-organised and very hands on, with all participants involved in making all the dishes.The resulting feast was fantastic and shared with our new friends from around the world.I would definitely recommend this cooking class and will be going back on my next visit to Bali.

Love the cooking class. Love the cooking class, well organised, offer hands-on experience. The trainer Puspa is very humorous. The people attending the class are very international, a good place to make new friends :)

Loved Puspa!. First off, I hate cooking. I live in NYC and I just don't do it. I was in Bali with my cousin, her boyfriend, and our aunt, and they all outvoted me on taking a cooking class. But it was great and I couldn't recommend it more! We started out seeing some rice fields and heading over to Puspa's house/school/restaurant. Her husband entertained us for a bit (also mentioning how they had to have a village meeting about when Pokemon Go was appropriate) and then we all went in to an open air kitchen. It was super fun and the food was so amazing and not as complicated as I thought - I even think I may be up for recreating it now that I'm at home. I even made sure that I didn't completely destroy our little cookbook on the ensuing 3 week backpacking trip. And Puspa herself was so adorable. When she found out that my cousin had brought along her "honey bunny" for the trip, she offered to be my honey bunny for the day, which was just delightful. We posed for a picture after under what appeared to be a solo wedding photo of herself. The whole day was weird and beautiful and hilarious.

Great cookery class. We attended the cookery school on the 7th October after our daughter had recommended it having been last year. We were not disappointed, booking the class was easy and was done online, any queries we had were quickly responded too.On arrival at the school we were warmly greeted and were part of a group of 10. All instructions were clear, hygiene standards were very high and there were plenty of helpers on hand to help. Everyone was given a job to do and clear instructions were given as well as giving alternatives for some of the ingredients if your not able to source them once you are back home. The class was fun and it was good to meet and talk to the other members of the group from other countries. The food we cooked was amazing and was very tasty.All in all this is a very well run school, with pick from hotel and drop if back again included ( as long as you are in the Ubud area).Only one minor point - it would have been nice to have had a beer with the meal.

Amazing cooking experience. We had a great time, from a timely pick up, to a very interactive class, where both of us cooked all dishes under simple and easy to follow instructions. The food was delicious. Staff was super friendly and attentive, always with a big and welcoming smile. Highly recommended!

Good quality for money. I really enjoyed for Paon Bali food course.Course started morning tour on the market. Days end at 2 pm. Pick up from Ubud hotel including in price.We made eight different food for our lounch.I learned many new things for cooking and foods."Teachers" was very good and everything works well. We had very fun day with cooking.

Fantastic day out!. We are rather partial to a food tour or cooking class and Ma spending two weeks in Ubud was the perfect opportunity to partake in another one. We chose Paon Bali due to their ranking and reviews on trip advisor and were not disappointed. The 350,000 IDR (about £20GBP) included pick up and drop off from our accommodation and a brief tour of Ubud Market, as well as the cooking and eating of eight dishes. Yes you read that correctly EIGHT, all of which were delicious. But back to the beginning…We were collected a little late, which is par for the course in a country as relaxed as Bali, by a very smiley Wayan who dropped us at Ubud Market where the rest of our group was gathering. We walked around the narrow stall lined passageways while another Wayan (It's one of only four Balinese unisex names) and one of the owners of Paon Bali, introduced us to the local fruits. Sappadillo, snake fruit and mangosteen were new ones to most of the group but having been on a lot of food tours and eaten a lot of fruit over the last months we’re familiar with them all and big fans of mangosteen in particular. We were also offered smooth orange passion fruits, far from the wrinkled aubergine coloured ones we get back home. (Over the last few days we have eaten fresh ones, still yellow, picked straight from the vines that form part of one of the roofs at Bata Bata our favourite local warung (eatery) as an appetizer to their delicious meals.) The cobwebs crowding the grubby ceilings above the market stalls sent shivers down my spine thinking about the spiders who must have made them but I managed to keep my focus on the goodies we were passing through and kept panic at bay After our quick market stroll we were split into groups and taxied to Wayan’s house in the hills overlooking Ubud where we regrouped and gained some more making a total of twenty four budding chefs. On arrival we were offered wonderfully refreshing Balinese lemon juice. They do not have yellow lemons on Bali so people assume they are limes but they also have limes and green lemons which have a taste somewhere between western lemon and lime. You find it served most places blended with a little sugar and ice and it’s really the most refreshing drink. While we were drinking and after an amusing introduction to his home and the cooking school by the very charming Wayan we met Puspa, his wife, the boss, and our cooking teacher for the day.After a quick chat from the very lovely Puspa we were led back into the cooking area, a large covered space with two permanent cooking areas, three long worktops with hidden hot plates and three seating areas around a central courtyard.Throughout the day we were split into pairs and all given the opportunity to slice, cut, mush, make, stir and cook at least one stage of each dish making for a really fun and interactive experience. I was teamed up with South Korean Sujee while JHubz and Ma made the perfect comedy duo We began by making Bumbu Kuning; a traditional yellow sauce that was used in several of the dishes and that included some twenty different ingredients ranging from familiar turmeric to galangal and candle nuts. The ingredients were placed in a big stone mortar and required some pretty impressive grinding with a four foot wooden pestle. Once suitably mushed (technical term) we started preparing the ingredients for all the other dishes and when everything had been sliced, diced and chopped to perfection our workstations were magically transformed into cooking areas.The first of our dishes was Sup Jamur; a clear mushroom and vegetable soup that was easy and quick to make and delicious to taste, which we did as soon as it had been made.Then it was on to cooking the rest with the ingredients we had prepared earlier:Kare Ayam; Chicken and coconut currySate lilit Ayam; Minced chicken grilled on bamboo sticksGado Gado; Vegetables in peanut sauceJukut Urab; coconut and snake bean saladPepes Ikan; Steamed fish in banana leafTempe kering, deep fried tempe in sweet soy sauceI won’t bore you with the details of each, suffice it to say we fried, steamed and grilled until a real feast had been created. Everything was downright delicious; I was so full after my heaped plate that I couldn’t go back for more even though I wanted to, badly, never have I been more disappointed in myself.My chilli allergy was easily and painlessly accommodated into the process and they clearly have experience dealing with people with allergies. Despite my telling previous places we’ve attended in advance, I have either been treated like a pariah or expected to forgo most of the dishes. Here everything was tailored so that in my partner pair we made a chili free version of everything, really first class service.The class was rounded out by Puspa making Kolak pisang; Banana in palm sugar syrup for us all as a final treat before we headed off on our separate ways. It was a great class, one I would highly recommend, interactive, fun and even with twenty four of us, we were all equally involved. Canadian David and Stephanie who were on their honeymoon, Sujee and the three very nice young multi lingual Scandinavian (we think) girls who shared our table were great company and made the experience even more memorable, a really great day out. It was so good in fact we may even go back again while we are here Xx

Best Experience and Food. Just the best afternoon, fun and professional. The hostess with the mostest was funny and so knowledgeable. Great hands on experience up high in the misty mountains with the aromas of the beautiful ingredients wafting on the mountain breeze. My husband who does not cook ( maybe a BBQ once a year if I am lucky) got right into the spirit and sliced and diced, fried and stirred to his heart content. We got to try all that we had prepared and cooked and it was simply an abundant amazing feast. The best food we had enjoyed in our many trips to Bali. Highly recommended.

Great Class for Couples. We visited yesterday in the afternoon class. We had a very large class! We probably has 20 people in our class and there was also a second class going on upstairs. There is a lot of staff and they have a very good plan for how to handle all of the attendees and keep it fun and interesting. We cooked 7 different recipes and you do get to have a hand in cooking at least a piece of everything. You have a little downtime while they do the final preparations for the food which is a great opportunity to talk with the other people in class and hear where everyone is from; they get a lot of folks from all over here. Only thought to make it even more awesome is to add some adult beverages. :) Logistics wise - they did pick us up from and drop us off at our vila. We left around 3:45 and returned around 8.
Fantastic. A great experience all round! Tasty food, fantastic hosts, stress free and Thoroughly enjoyed. (It's also a good chance to meet fellow travellers.)

To easy honey!!. It is very clear that this I a business with every single little detail planned.Even the hosts jokes and gestures was rehearsed in this play.After a tour to the market we had to make 8 courses in 4 hrs. After an hour with preparation we were paired up to do the cooking. The cooking was so fool proof that even a small child could do it with flying colors.After preparation all food was collected and finished by the staff that prepared it as a buffet.I would have liked to have spent less time at the marked and more time in the kitchen with more guidance. And I'd also would have liked to eat that I produced myself.To be honest in think the level of difficulty was to low for my expectations.We were told to rate and review the experience on TripAdvisor. Now I have done so!
Amazing course. This cooking course was simply excellent. So very well run and organized. The food we cooked was lovely and the entire session couldn't be faulted

Great half day activity. Owner and chef Made is very friendly. Pick up right on time. First to the local market and then off to cook at a nice location next to a rice field. Great food, great people, great half day activity.

A well organised cooking class to spend half a day!. Me and my hubby were on our honeymoon Trip and decided to learn some Bali cooking as both of us have interest in cooking :) I must say we both enjoyed the experience. After the driver picked us up from our hotel at 8.30, we were gathered in a local market, where we were introduced to many local spices and fruits. Then we were brought to the class, where our teacher was waiting for us. We cooked, laughed, ate together in the midst of nature .. Must do activity when you are in Ubud, Bali!
Impossible to fault.. The day was run seamlessly by Aunty Puspa and her team. I honestly struggle to see how the day could be any better. Thank you for teaching us some wonderful dishes.

Excellent experience!. We just did this class in September 2016 and had a wonderful time.We will always remember this experience with Puspa. They really do a great job of getting you involved in all the aspects of cooking. She is a very funny lady who has much knowledge in culinary concepts.Beer, water, coffee, tea is included. We met wonderful people in our class, and had really enjoyed ourselves in the beautiful setting in which you cook in here.Food was awesome, come hungry!Do the morning session as the class takes time to do. Great activity to do as a couple!Loved the trip through the market, really shows you a lot about the Balinese culture.

Brilliant Balinese cookery course. Wayan, Puspa and their team make you feel instantly welcome, they take great care to ensure that anyone with allergies is identified and hand hygiene is strongly reinforced. The trip to market is interesting and you are given the chance to try some local fruits if you want, you also stop at some rice paddy fields and the process of planting, harvesting and how the rice is prepared is explained there. The food preparation is shared amongst the group and then you get cooking. The menu is great, there's tons of food and you leave with a recipe book so it can all be recreated at home.Definitely worth the money and a lovely way to spend a morning.

Perfect. My husband and I went to the cooking class on our honeymoon in Bali. We loved every minute of this friendly, clean beautiful cooking class. If you go to a morning class you will go round the market in Ubud too. The day is very well organised, caters for all dietary requirements and is held in a beautiful location. Transportation to and from the cooking class is included. All the staff and owners are wonderful, this is well worth a visit if you're in Ubud. Amazing morning!

5 stars for Puspa . One of our favourite activities in Bali. Paon is a great environment to get immersed in the culture and cuisine of Bali. The kitchen and dining area is located in a picturesque area of Ubud. Whilst cooking and eating you get to enjoy the beautiful scenery and company of other travelers. Puspa leads you through a Balinese menu allowing you and your partner/family to equally contribute to the meal. Lots of laughs, spices and good food!

Fantastic, yummy food!!. My husband and I took part in the morning cooking class with a trip to the market first, then a stop off at some beautiful rice fields to take some photos, lastly onto the owners family home. We were greeted with a refreshing lemon drink. Then helped prep the ingredients and cook some delicious food. Would highly recommend this cooking class we had a brilliant time. Thank you

Definitely recommend. Great cooking class. We prepared the food and it was put in a big pot altogether to cool properly before serving (it wouldn't be feasible cooking each course completely yourself due to the time each course takes). We went to the morning class so we could go to the food market which was worthwhile. It was situated in a lovely area with great views. The food was delicious and they accommodated for me without any hassle being a vegetarian. They give you recipes to take home at the end of the day. Definitely recommend.

A Class Act. A wonderful experience on this my first visit to BaliGood hands on experience in immaculate cooking area with very friendly hosts , the food and ingredients were so fresh and expertly explained to us resulting in first class Indonesian food in about 5 different courses. We were given a booklet then with all the recipes - water, tea and coffee all available throughout the sessionI am sorry for those that rate this as low as three - they need perhaps to learn some basic skills as I cannot imagine they are in this class to be so negative. Do not let them put you off - it was amazing in a fabulous country and very reasonable in priceWell done - Puspa, family and staff

Nice friendly host showing how to cook indonesian food.. If you start in the morning you get to see the market, then we headed to rice fields and got a quick lecture on how to grow rice. The cooking class in really good and the food is a well thougt out mix of different foods which will satisfy most peoples palates.

Excellent morning out. The day starts with a market tour explaining different ingredients and tasting some fruits. We then headed to see some rice fields and had the rice harvest process explained before going to the cooking school which is in a traditional Balinese family compound which has had a large cooking school attached. The cooking process is a well oiled machine which allows everyone a chance to try preparing and cooking each dish. The food was deli shush, the staff were fantastic, the kitchen very clean.Yes it was a large group and some reviewers criticised that. I felt that the way they organised it meant that it didn't feel too big. It's definitely not an intimate group in a family kitchen so if that's what you're expecting perhaps it's not the class for you.

Helloooo Honeeeys!. We took our lads with us and we all enjoyed this wonderful evening. We made a day of it with a private driver to Ubud catching all the sites on the way. Finishing at this unique dinner spot. Fantastic sunset views and such a professionally run event. A must regardless of where you are based.
Extraordinary!. Don't read anything about it. Just go and enjoy every surprising minute. If they keep the program and the fair price, it will always be worthy.

Lots of laughs. We had the best time at this cooking class with lots of laughs. You go to the owners home and him and his wife are both hilarious and warm and soooo welcoming! They really do treat you like it's your home too.We cooked many delicious dishes. They accommodated my peanut allergy and others who were vegetarian. MUST DO IF IN UBUD!

A must to do when in Ubud. The food was the best i had of any place in Bali. Puspa, Wayan and all other staff were fantastic. They were friendly, knowledgeable, welcoming and funny. To experience true Bali culture and food this one you have to do. Better than five star.

wow so yummy!. We are so glad we arranged this. We booked in advance and the communication was great, picked up on time and all went to plan. We visited the local market which was an eye opener then went to the house and met the owner.He is a funny guy and really welcoming. There were around 10 of us cooking. It was really clean, well organised and good fun. The food we made was delish and some of the best in Bali! Cant wait to attempt them at home!!book it you wont regret it.

5 stars doesn't come close. This is a must do if you visit Ubud. Traditional cuisine prepared with the help of some very experienced chefs. Services are amazing from the transport to the market this is top notch

good fun. I really enjoyed and had fun at this cooking class. The house is lovely and the owners are extremely nice and friendly, I really felt welcomed. I was particularly pleased because they veganised some of the recipes for me, the others were already vegan. My group was small and we cooked in pairs. There were a lot of things that we did not cook, but I learned a lot. All the ingredients were very fresh and the food turned out amazing, really delicious. They gave us a booklet with the recipes and the lady offer to give us more recipes by email.

Best cooking class ever. If you go to Bali (near Ubud) you can not miss this cooking class. Loved every part of it. Very well arranged, the most friendly staff and hosts. You go to the market first where you can taste some of the local fruits and the owner/host tells you about some herbs, fruits and vegetable. After that you go to his beautiful house with jungle view where his wife hosts the cooking class. She is super friendly and funny. And nice to meet some other travelers in the cooking class. The food is amazing and the best thing is, you make it yourself !! So I would definetely recommand this as a (half) daytrip!!

What an experience 👌🏽. Awesome from start to finish... So enjoyable! The owner and her husband were so extremely lovely and treated us like family, offering delights and space/teddy for my daughter to go to sleep too.You have to try this experience, it is one of a kind and one you will always cherish. So worth the money and the distance!

Good but not too much cooking yourself. It was good fun and all ingredients were very fresh with great recipes but you didnt really get to cook yourself...at start you just chop all ingredients randomly (not for specific recipe) with everyone (about 20 in our class) then add stuff to pans later but dont really get to individually make stuff as all just gets added together for one big buffet at end (which tasted great)! We had already done a class a few weeks early in hoi an and you got your own personal station and made your own individual dish for 4 courses - so probably not able to due to huge class sizes here.

Amazing!! Such a special class and birthday for me!. I loved this cooking class, we were recommend it by looking online and were so impressed start to finish. We were picked up and returned to our hotel with ease. Staff were so friendly, especially the host! Selection of food was incredible and so interesting to learn! So good!!! I am vegetarian and their selection for me was amazing. It is one of the best things I've done in Bali. Plus, it was my birthday and they presented me with birthday wishes as well as a cake!An amazing experience with amazing food!!! Would definitely recommend!

Nice and friendly, but very touristy . We attended an afternoon course and was picked up at our hotel. They were very welcoming and warm and everything was nice and clean. However, the classes are of 20+ persons and you don't really feel like home. It felt like we were pushed along the assembly line and did not learn much about Indonesian cooking at all. They even advertised for a good rating on tripadvisor at the end of the session, which may explain the excellent rating they have. The course is fairly priced and you will not be leaving hungry. All in all 3/5..

Our best experience in Bali!. What an experience! All the best that Bali has to offer in a fun-filled half day of culture, cuisine, hospitality and laughs! Our group of 5 felt like we had a true glimpse into Balinese family life starting with a quick tour of the Ubud market where locals actually shop for fresh produce and spices, and a visit to the paddy fields, the source of a staple so central to Balinese cuisine. The cooking classes are actually held in the beautiful home of Ibu Puspa and Pak Wayan in Laplapan, and we felt immediately welcomed to their family. It was a totally hands-on class covering the produce, implements, utensils and techniques of traditional Balinese cooking while being entertained by Ibu Puspa’s warmth and humour. AND we got to eat the results for lunch and the food was DELICIOUS!We left that afternoon – tummies satisfied, armed with new skills and amazing recipes to wow our friends and family back home, and memories of the humour, generosity and hospitality of the best Balinese ambassadors!Thanks honey!

Honey, what a wonderful cooking class. Number on Trip Advisor and well worth the votes. My husband and I attended the Paon Bali cooking class and were treated to a fabulous day of cooking, fun and laughter. We spent the morning at the Ubud market and rice paddy field before being welcomed by Puspa and her husband into their home. Puspa and her team were fantastic and shared their skills and experience with us. The cooking class is very interactive with all of us assisting in preparing the meals. We cooked about 7 dishes and Puspa shared her vast wealth of knowledgable with us. Great experience in a beautiful environment. We sat down to an absolutely delicious and tasty shared lunch at the end of the day. I love cooking and this class was a highlight of my holiday. I'm looking forward to making all the wonderful dishes at home.

Awesome experience . We had a group of about 14 people amd they accommodated us perfectly. They food was amazing and they were really easy to follow directions. "Auntie Puspa" and Wayan's chemistry and love for each other is evident in they way they run their class. You should definitely check this out when you visit Ubud!

What a treat!. This was by far the best cooking class I've ever attended. I was traveling solo in Bali and wanted an authentic and high quality, educational cooking class that I could do near Ubud. Paon Bali was PERFECT! We went to the market and the rice fields to learn a bit about Balinese culture and food, and then we headed to the gorgeous home/test kitchen where we cooked 7 delicious and fresh Balinese dishes. The staff were very accommodating, providing us with a welcome drink, unlimited water, tea and coffee. They also had all of the food cleaned and prepped to make the cooking experience seamless, and no cleanup was required! Puspa and her husband were a very cute pair and treated everyone in our group like family. I walked out with seven delicious recipes, knowledge about Balinese food, and new friends, which I'm so excited about! Thank you Paon Bali for the fantastic experience!
Absolutely fantastic class!. Best thing we could have done! Pick up/Drop off, Market tour, great class, great food and new friends! Love!

It's No. 1 for a reason!. What a great experience this was. After a walk around the markets, and a look at some rice fields, we were welcomed into the family home to start our cooking class.The hosts were very friendly and engaging.I thought the set up was really good, plenty of staff to assist. It was hands on, chopping, grinding and cooking.At the end we all got to enjoy the food around tables.Exceptional value for money, and a fantastic way to spend a morning.

Wonderful Experience; Great Taste of Bali. My wife and I enjoyed a private cooking class at Paon, as part of our honeymoon vacation. It was arranged by our agency (Black Tomato) and we are so happy they recommended this experience as part of our trip. Aside from eating, we don't know our way around the kitchen so well, but we aspire to. This class was a great way to learn some basics from scratch and put some good recipes in our portfolio. And it was great fun as well. Wyan was an engaging, clear and pleasant teacher/hostess. She was very helpful with imparting proper technique and we found the practice of suggesting alternative ingredients and equipment to use back home to be extremely valuable. She also said she'd be happy to skype with us if we needed a refresher. The owners came by to say hello and check up on us. They were welcoming and curious to know what we thought about the experience. Although we did this as a couple, it's clear that this would be a fun group activity as well. Perhaps most importantly, the food was excellent and the plating was stunning. Overall, this was an excellent experience that helped us get further in touch with our Balinese surroundings and we definitely learned something we hope to implement in our home in the near future.

Brief introduction to Balinese cuisine. The class was very well organised and professionally held. We received a booklet of recipes of the dishes we cooked and the staff were funny and efficient in preparing everything behind the scenes so we had a pleasant experience. It was a good introduction into Balinese/Indonesian cuisine and the food we cooked was delicious. However, if you're looking for a more in-depth learning experience you're probably not going to be 100% satisfied, the class was quite large with around 15-20 people and while they had more than enough room and could deal with the amount of people without any problem, the "learning to cook" part came a bit short. The food we cooked was great but it could've been a bit more so that everyone gets a second serving. Nevertheless I can definitely recommend this class if you're looking for a fun evening with good food!

Must do cooking class!. Pushpa was an excellent host for this must-do cooking class. She made it fun and innovative with a good mix of traditional cooking techniques. We even got to try the old Balinese blender...! Haha!I would highly recommend this class - we learnt to make a good variety of dishes from scratch and it was so well organised - perfect couples activity!

Amazing cooking class! . My boyfriend and I took part in this cooking class last week. It was a brilliant experience and far surpassed our expectations. You get to participate in all aspects of the cooking. The hosts are so friendly and funny. The class is very well organised and relaxed. At the end you eat what you have cooked and the food is delicious. You also get copies of the recipes to take home. The price is 350k per person which is just under £20. The experience is well worth this plus you get a three course meal on top. If you are staying in Ubud they provide transport to and from your hotel for free. We loved this cooking class and definitely recommend to try it!

What an amazing experience? soo much fun!!. Hi, I joined Paon´s cooking class last wednesday alone and I had such an amazing time. I was picked up from my hotel with the rest of the people, went to the market and then to the family home. Wayan and Puspa´s charisma and personality takes this tour from good to great. They are funny and so passionate aboiut their culture. Their happiness is contagious. Everything is organised perfectly well with the rest of the family/staff and the food is delicious. As well a great way to meet other people travelling in Bali. Don´t miss it!! and congratulations to the family for a fantastic experience!!

Very creative and efficiently run!. My wife was interested in taking a cooking class and we found this a very creative and efficiently run cooking class through Trip Advisor. They hosted about 20+ of us and we each shared preparing the ingredients and had a hand in cooking everything in smaller groups. The owner had great energy, was funny, and taught us how to cook each meal, step by step. She even offered alternative ingredients in case we could not find traditional Balinese ingredients back home. We made over 5 dishes and each tasted so fresh and delicious, I was surprised we cooked it all! The cooking class takes place in her home and we were able to enjoy our dinner in her beautiful backyard forest view. They also offered free rides from Ubud.

Holiday. My husband and I visited Ubud in September 2016 and during the course of our holiday we attended this cookery class run by a fabulous couple Wayan and Puspa. The whole experience was second to none they were entertaining and knowledgeable The food was delicious and we both learned a great deal about Balinese cuisine. Hopefully I will master rolling the chicken onto the satay stick!!!!We highly recommend this course, a fun day was had by all.

Excellent Instruction, Delicious Food, and Wonderful Company. I was a solo traveler and emailed the day before. Pupusa was so accommodating and emailed me back right away. When I arrived there were welcome drinks for us! I loved meeting my fellow chefs and getting to know people from across the globe. The cooking program was extremely well organized and we felt like we were really interacting. I loved it! I would recommend it to anyone.

Bested My Expectations Honey!!. Travelers and Foodies. I picked this cooking class for me and my partner based on TripAdvisor Ratings and I was pleasantly surprised. Although we were picked up 20minutes late without warning we were on our way to the traditional house with lovely couples in our minivan. We met a lovely Getman couple from Munich and another German lady on her own. The vibe started off nice. It wasn't before long that we were in the traditional house where you will be welcomed with a drink and explanation by the owner of the traditional house setting.Once that was done we go inside for some tea and coffee and the explanations on cooking begin ! The ingredients are all fresh and the host is just the loveliest cutest woman you could ever imagine. With a smile as big as the sun and a personality larger than life she really made the cooking class fun and exciting!!Be prepared to be called "honey" a hell of a lot by her! The food was second to none (starter, main and desert) and all easily replicable if you try at home.I don't want to give too much away from the experience but it is one of the best things to do if you want to constructively kill 3 or more hours in the evening. The price is worth it as it's the cost of a posh meal in Ubud but you get the interaction here. All in all, there's so many pros but the only con would be timeliness of driver coming to collect us. 5 stars all round. This is a MUST people! Don't forget payment is in cash and is paid at the end of the class! Enjoy !

5 star experience! AMAZING!. A great tour to the market, welcome drinks on arrival, amazing hosts and SO MUCH FOOD. I did this as a solo traveller, I met some amazing people, it was very engaging and the food was just out of this world. I also requested a Vegan option and didn't feel like I was missing out at all, they provided so much for me!100% you have to this on your visit to Ubud.

Laughter and cooking - the perfect combination. This was the first attempt at a cooking class for our group, and if this experience was an indicator of how much fun it can be, I know this won't be our last.Our tour started with a trip to a local market where we could get a sense of what ingredients were available in Indonesia outside of what we found at Circle K. I would have liked actually do the shopping for our class there, but I understand that isn't to everyone's taste and would extend the course by several hours.Both Puspa and her husband were more than gracious, welcoming all of us to their home. Both had a great sense of humor.When we got to our "kitchen," all of the prep work had been completed, which afforded us more time to learn about the dishes we were making rather than doing all of the grunt work."Class rooms" seemed to be about 10 - 12 people, so not everyone got to do everything, but everyone in our group seemed to have fun and no one felt left out.Teams of two were assigned to the cooking, so everyone got a chance to have a hand in preparation.All dishes were finished by the staff.After doing all of the cooking, we got to sit down and enjoy our banquet - all of which was excellent. I think we all felt bad that we left food behind, but there was must too much to eat.I can't speak for people from other areas, but as residents of the San Francisco Bay Area, the recipes provided used ingredients that are readily available locally.Highly recommended.
'Start your engines... Honey'. A great night! Great recipes, well explained, great location. Would give it a 6 out 5 if they served a bin tang with dinner! :)

Too many people. We heard great things about the class, everything was great. Pushpa and her husband were great hosts, they had a large set of cheerful workers constantly cleaning pans and getting ingredients out. But we did not realize how many people were taking the class.First- Pushpa does not conduct the demonstrations for the entire duration of the class, it is her assistants do. We had 3 large tables, with about 10-12 people working on each table. All of us would have to gather around a cook top for a demonstration, and a short person like myself could hardly get a peep. We expected the experience to be a bit more involved and intimate, but with so many people in the class all we go to do is stir the vegetables in the pan a few times and chop a few vegetables. If you are doing this just for fun its great. if you are hoping to get something out of it, then I would not recommend the class.
Great, delicious, hilarious and super friendly staff. Great, delicious, hilarious and super friendly staff!The owner, is so welcoming and funny!!A must do in Bali

Fun activity, easy-going but educational on the cooking. Auntie Puspa puts on a great show. A vibrant personality and a smile which makes even most Balinese pale. Because they were running two courses at the same time, auntie Puspa had to split her time. That's fine, but I think she should be careful not to stretch herself thinner since she really is the star of the show.Pricing was very reasonable especially given all the food you get to eat.Cooking was interesting but very easy-going. Staff were helping out a lot, which makes for a relaxed experience.

The higlight of my Bali holiday. Myself, my 13 year old and 11 year old undertook a cooking class with Paon Bali, I wasn't sure what to expect but, right from the beginning they were professional, accommodating and friendly. You are picked up from your accommodation, I chose a morning cooking class and we started with a tour of the local market in Ubud, the guide explains a lot of the produce that is local to Bali, really insightful. The class itself was conducted in such a way that everyone was involved in the preparation, then the cooking of the various meals and sharing the meals with your group at the end. Lots of explanation and demonstration that my kids were able to follow. Highly recommend as must do in Bali, this was the highlight of my trip, it was fantastic and have told everyone about it.
WOW HONEY. What an amazing cooking class. Would strongly recommend you do this. A great time learning and cooking, followed by the delicious meal you've just prepared.Don't miss this.

A delicious experience, great value for money!. This is a must-do experience for foodies. Aunty Puspa's kitchen is spotless and so well-run. The cooking experience was expertly managed by her team of ladies and the food was so, so good. Amazing value for money, including transport, welcome drinks, a feast for dinner, water and tea and coffee.

Excellent Experience! Best time EVER!. I LOVED this experience ... it was a show and a cooking class in one ... The hostess/teacher is phenomenal, gorgeous and has a vivacious personality. I highly recommend this little course should you consider a cooking class. It takes place in a private home and they accommodate EVERY palate. Vegetarian, Meat-a-tarian, Pesce-tarian, No-Tofu-a-tarian. Just a beautiful way to share in the culture of Bali while cooking in a private residence! LOVE-LOVE-LOVE IT!

Amazing experience with great hosts and incredible food!!. This was one of the highlights of my recent trip to bali and hands down the best food I ate during my 3 week trip. The staff were so helpful and friendly and Puspa was a lively and entertaining host! The afternoon was so well organised and offered a great insight into Balinese cooking techniques as well as lots and lots of amazing food to eat!! It was great value for money and a great laugh along the way! Thanks to Puspa (honey) and her husband Wayan for making it such an enjoyable experience!! A must do in ubud!!!

Incredible experience!!! Must do!. This was a wonderful experience and my husband and I were shocked that so much was included in the price. We got to go to the market and try new fruits and learn about the spices and ingredients and it was wild to get an insider view of the traditional busy market place. Then we toured a rice field before heading to the cooking class. The school and owners are amazing and made you feel at home. They were very funny and personable. The ingredients were top quality and the food was the best meal we had in Bali!! We were so full and had the best time. I highly recommend this experience for everyone who comes here.
Great. One perfect day, which was well organized and a perfect combination of entertainment and learning new skills. Had a great time and a delicious lunch

Fantastic cooking experience. We tend to try a cooking class wherever we travel as it tends to give a good introduction to basic culture and history... Also we like to cook... And eat... Mostly eat.All of the chefs were great and attentive hosts, giving great tips and alternative ingredients of the originals are not available in our home countries.Highly recommend this!

A Must do Experience when staying in Ubud an enjoyable and entertaining cooking class.. We attended the morning cooking class which included a very informative tour around the food market.Then we went too Wayan's and Puispa's home they were extremley welcoming and very entertaining ,the cooking class was excellent we prepared all the ingredients (yes 99% of the time you do have to chop food to cook it believe it or not) then cooked them making various Indonesian meals which we then ate,the food was ace and we had a great time.We would recommend the cooking class to anyone you can learn such a lot in a short space of time enabling you to be able too follow the receipes when your back home and craving the tasty Indonesian food.

A must do in Ubud. Fantastic people and a delight to do. Collected from hotel and the adventure began. Into the markets for an education on spices and local fruit / veges. Up to rice paddy for discussion on local rice economy and then to house where the magic begins. Taken through full preparation of traditional Bali cooking and full involvement. Chopping, cooking and eating. Beautiful hosts in a gorgeous setting make for a delightful morning. Great value for money and a must do. Treated like royalty by the queen herself and a lot of laughs along the way. Do it!

One of the best meals of our holiday.. There were about 20 of us in the group. Under expert supervision of our hosts, who spoke very good English, we prepared and cooked most of the food. The ingredients were very fresh and the meal was excellent.

Nice way to spend the afternoon!! . Lovely people easily engaged, English language very good!!! We had the best food we've ever prepared easy to follow instructors!! Friendly and funny!! Hey Hunny Bunny!'

So glad I did. I'm a foodie and love cooking. TripAdvisor reviews were not wrong. This was a great way to up skill my knowledge of Balinese cooking along with other like minded travelers, then to sit and share our dishes together. Thank you Puspa and Wayan for a very enjoyable morning.

Excellent service & value for money. We were picked up from our villas and shuttled to the Ubud market which was a eye opener but our guide was very informative and helpful!
The cooking class was very well organised and lunch was amazing !!!!
I would defiantly recommend this to anyone wanting to learn the art of Balinese cooking !!
Thank you very much Honey !

Paon Bali. The food was 100% Balinese but the ingredients were sourced from suppliers who provided, safe to eat standards for westerners. So well organised, everything flowed. Somehow I ripped my dress on the way and exposed my undies. Puspa quickly arranged for a sarong to wear around my waste, and it almost matched the top of my dress. Amazing attention to detail.

Cooking School. We were collected on time and taken to the cooking school located outside of Ubud in a village. The program was very well planned and organised. We prepared a good variety of meals with lots of direction ensuring things were done correctly. After a delicious meal our day finished with a beautiful chocolate birthday cake for one of our group. We can highly recommend this as an experience when staying in the area.

Dinner for One!. I always enjoying learning about local cuisine so I make a habit of taking cooking classes when I travel. I found Puspa on Trip Advisor and signed up. It was a five star experience. I sent in my request to book and quickly got confirmation. They sent a follow up email the day of confirming my pick up time. The driver was on time and very friendly. Upon arrival, we were greeted by Puspa's husband. He made sure we all felt at home. The staff provided a welcome drink and we headed for the "kitchen". I was a solo traveler and felt totally comfortable not being in a couple. The couples assisted me any time I needed more than two hands. Each couple gets to prepare part of each dish. When the dish is complete, they are all combined to feed the group. I thought the food was fantastic. The ingredients looked like high quality compared to what I had been buying at the local grocery store. It should be noted that only the morning group goes to the market. I took the afternoon/evening class and was disappointed that we didn't get to go to the market. I hadn't been able to find it so I was looking forward to going with Puspa. She is really funny and happy to provide alternate ingredients for items that you can't get at home. I even sent her an email a few days after the class asking about the drink that they served and she responded right back same day. I would definitely do this class again. All dishes were Balinese and fantastic. You won't regret taking this class.

Fun and informative even for a cooking novice . My culinary talent ends at beans on toast so I thought this was going to be a long few hours to keep the Mrs happy but I was so wrong. We decided to do the morning class which included a trip first of all to the local Ubud market which before 9am is a food market. Here we learnt about the local foods and ingredients we would be using.Next onto a rice padi near the cooking school, here we were told about the rice growing process etc.Now onto the cooking class which is held at the home of the organisers family. They have a wonderful huge open kitchen. The group was a fairly large one, maybe 18 people but we all felt included and had the perfect balance of watching, cooking and eating. The food was all amazing and this is coming from someone who rarely ventures further than eating pizza and chips. There was salad, local dressings, sauces made from scratch, tuna steak, chicken satay Skewers and more. We were then dropped off back at our hotel.All in all a very enjoyable day. Would definitely recommend especially for the price. (Roughly £20 which includes all the food you've cooked plus the recipies to take home)

Delicious, friendly and a lot of fun. We can highly recommend this cooking class! Everything was well organised.As we arrived (after the market) her husband greeted us and let us feel like family. Each dish was cooked by everyone. Afterwards we ate the delicious meals together.We learned a lot and met interesting people from all over the world. Thanks for this great experience!

Afternoon class! Couldn't have been better. Had such a fantastic time at this class. We were picked up promptly by a super friendly driver, taken through Ubud and warmly welcomed into the beautiful cooking school. The class was so well organised and led by the most charming teacher. Learnt lots of new skills and had a delicious meal at the end! We forgot to bring cash but they were happy to take us to an ATM on the way back to our hotel. Great value for money- I would do it again happily!
A must do !!. Absolutely fabulous! Good food, fun and informative. Definitely a must do and would do it again. The market visit was also a big plus.

Brilliant Class. We went to with two adults and two children 10 and 12. It was a brilliant afternoon- we were there about 4 hours and made many delicious dishes! Auntie V was so great with the kids, she has a brilliant sense of humour and as well as giving the recipes to bring home, the lesson was fun and the meal we made delightful! Totally recommend this and great value for money!

Brilliant! !. Well run course with wonderful hosts. Funny, informative, clean.. all the good stuff. Had a 15 year old and and a 12 year old with us and they loved it too! Highly recommend as a great trip

Yum yum!!!. Myself and 4 friends spent 10 days in Bali, and Puspa and her assistants were one of the highlights! Paon Cooking Class was so much fun and so delicious. We were promptly picked up from our accommodation, chatted to on the way, stopped at some beautiful rice paddies and told a little about the processes, and then arrived at the cooking class. We were greeted with a cool drink, treated like family and then started cooking. We all tried our hands at different things, cooked and then ate the most amazing Balinese delights (I've found a love of tempe - who'da thought!). Puspa was funny and knowledgeable, and wanted to make sure we were all having a wonderful time...which we were. The outlook to cook and then have dinner was beautiful. This was such an enjoyable experience - I would recommend it to young and old.

Good but falls a bit short. We went the Paon Bali cooking class after the rave reviews on TripAdvisor and although it’s well organised and fun it fell a bit short of a proper cooking experience. The main issue is the group size and personal touch. We went for an afternoon (4pm) class so you eat in the evening rather than at lunch and they were 20+ people. Although the main lady (Pushpa) does the intro and has a great personality the class was run by various helpers for most of the time (I think Pushpa had another class upstairs)The set up feels very much like you’re a ‘line cook’ in a large kitchen and ingredients you were making were mixed with 5/6 other groups who were all doing the same thing at the end so there was no real connection with the food (level of spice etc), and little opportunity to have dialogue with the teacher whilst in the process. The final meal prepared to share was delicious and hygiene throughout was of a very high standard but obviously due to Pushpa’s success dare I say it the enjoyment of the experience may be lost. I’ve done a couple of 5* cooking classes before in Thailand and Barcelona with groups of 8-10 and a personal touch with a single lead teacher. I’m sure this was how Paon Bali started and if you manage to get a small group with Pusha it’d be 5* (morning class may be better). As it is though it didn’t offer much for a cooking enthusiast.Also as a note to management by all mean at the end ask people to rate on TripAdvisor but don’t try and push people to give 5 star or speak up if you didn’t think it was – no one is going to do this in front of over 20 strangers as it’s not appropriate! Just ask politely to ‘rate if you get the chance and if there’s any issues just speak to me personally about how things could be improved…’

Cooking, Comedy and authentic Cuisine. The family that run this cooking school are a joy to meet and the day ran like clockwork. SO organised and the food was fantastic - set in Laplapan village away from the busy centre. We would highly recommed!

Absolutely fabulous, I can cook Balinese now!. We bumped on this cooking class almost by accident doing a small research on Internet, somehow it was meant to be.I am not an active cook myself, nevertheless we wanted to share a moment discovering ingredients and new meals. I don't like spicy, so that a huge challenge. We were received with a bright smile and welcome drink, until everybody arrived and we were 8 for the class. The host told everything we needed in forehand, in case there was any doubt on who did what and that we would eat everything we prepared. Yummi!Beautifully fresh and well presented ingredients in an impeccable clean wide kitchen. Each of them was explained in detail and how we could eventually find or replace them by similar ones back home. We were also given the possibility to cook standard or vegetarian, nice detail for some in the group. Spicy, medium or none. The preparation of the dishes and yellow sauce was split into smaller groups, but in a way that everyone did take part of the same meal. I was amazed how well organized it all was and how much pleasure we took in seeing things advancing. No previous cooking experience is required, the host is there to explain and help out at any time.The first meal to be ready was a soup, which we are as "amuse bouche" before we went to more serious stuff. Grinding ingredients with a stone and another bigger stone / wood grinder was a great experience, and using woks also great to use. Once we finished preparing our mains, I couldn't believe WE just did all that!!! I just wanted to start eating and taste it. Overall the class doesn't seem long as you are most of the time busy cutting, preparing, grinding, mixing, cooking and eating. By far it was the best Balinese dinner we have had in two weeks, and a true local experience worth living. 350.000 IDR seems a fair price for this.

Great food, lovely family. A lovely activity to do with friends and family. You are shown step by step how to cook authentic Indonesian dishes from start to finish, which you all can enjoy when you're done! They even pick you up and take you home, it couldn't be easier!

We got so much more out of this course than we could have imagined! . The day started with an insightful visit to the market, although the hotel pick up was about 30 minutes later than agreed. In small groups, we were given a tour of the market, taught about the key ingredients and even got to taste some fruit which I had never seen before. From there, we went to the beautiful rice fields, which offered some wonderful photo opportunities and taught a little about the fields and farmers themselves. Next we went into the hosts' actual home, and we greeted with a refreshing glass of coconut and lime ice drink. The host or "King" of the home, was funny and charming, he told us about Bali culture and families, even showing us the various parts of his house, including the family temple and what each part symbolised. From here we went into the gorgeous open air kitchen, the views are breathtaking. The Queen of the House, Papsa, had us all laughing with her jokes and introduction, and gave us exceptionally good coffee. We all prepared the food together and cooked in pairs or singles. Everyone seemed to be in a good mood, open minded and chatty. We tried a lot of new ingredients and had a go at traditional methods, such as the Bali "blender". The menus were smoothly adapted for pescatarians, vegetarians and vegans. Papsa's assistants were also a pleasure to be around me and the course ran like clockwork, ingredients were always given to us on a little plate right on time and the whole event was very smooth and graceful. The food was wonderful, and the atmosphere fantastic. I would really recommend this to anyone interested in uncovering a little piece of Balinese culture first hand in a fun, informal setting. I would also say that this course is fantastic value for money, you get a private market tour, rice field tour, understanding of the culture, new experiences, new cooking skills, unlimited (beautiful) coffee, tea and water, new friends and a very delicious and satisfying meal. Just do it! The food is only half the fun!

Cooking school. Fantastic experience provided by Ibu Pushpa and her husband. The class ran like a well oiled machine. Much was covered in a short space of time. Exceptional value. Amazing setting. Food was awesome!Hilt recommended. Do yourself a favour and read up a little on Balinese culture and cooking practices- this will give you an opportunity to ask questions. Terima kasi banyuk!
Fantastic! . The class was well organised, fun and tasty!! The hosts were so welcoming and friendly and we had a great time! Highly recommend!

AMAZING 😍. Thankyou so much for the most amazing experience!
I'm a vegan and they tailored everything to my diet!
They are so lovely and it was a great way to try Balinese food!
They are beautiful people and will recommend to all my friends and family!
💜

Super well organised!. Excellent day and totally recommend doing the morning class, as it takes in the visit to the markets. Great service - pick up and drop off from our accommodation, interesting visit to the rice fields and the class was incredibly well organized and good fun. The hosts were lovely and very funny and the lunch we prepared was probably the best meal we had while on holiday.

Great fun and great food!. Our whole family had so much fun at this cooking class! We took the evening class so it would serve as dinner, thus we didn't get to do the market tour. No matter -- Puspa and her husband were welcoming and so much fun. You really get a taste of the culture through the food and the traditional Balinese home. It was one of the favorite things we did during our vacation, even for our teenagers. The food was fantastic and I've even made the coconut chicken curry since coming home. Puspa was also very helpful -- our plane was delayed by 1 day and we had to reschedule; Puspa took good care of us. Even if you don't like to cook, you'll learn a lot about Balinese culture and food at this fun dinner.

Excellent cooking class. This cooking class was excellent. It was interactive, fun, and we actually learned how to make Balinese food. We made friends with the other people in the group, because you all work together to make the meal. The teachers, esp. Pushpa, are pretty awesome, very funny and very accommodating. They also did a great job working with the vegetarian people in the group to make veggie options for us. I now know how to make tofu and tempe. Would definitely recommend this to anyone who likes cooking!
Brilliant. Really great cooking class. Great hosts (who were quite funny!) and we made some really tasty food. Was nice and communal in a fabulous setting
Great!. Easy to follow, fun class, with amazing food! I would recommend to anyone in Ubud. Great funny hosts that were very accommodating.

Very fun and educational!. This was one of the most exciting activities I’ve participated in during my stay in Bali as I am a foodie! It started off with a morning market tour – which was quite nice as we saw the various fruits/vegetables that we wouldn’t normally get in north America. The guide allowed us to taste some of these exotic fruits – which was quite nice as well. We also saw some of the key ingredients that are used in Balinese cooking and learned a little bit about their culture. The most interesting part was when we stopped at a rice field on our way to the class and the guide was giving us a quick crash course on the Balinese culture, farm life and their naming convention. It was definitely an eye opening experience. The cooking class was very organized. Its not like other places I’ve been to where we made our own individual dishes. This was more of a group effort. The food turned out delicious and the entire process was quick and fun! Pushpa was super friendly and funny which made the experience even better. The only feedback I would have is to have more vegetarian options and to use vegetable stock instead of chicken stock.

Fantastic!. I had a great time and learned a lot! This was one of my favourite cooking classes. You really work as a group during the class and the teacher's explain everything really good. And the food we made was amazing and so tasteful! If you are vegetarian than they replace the meat and fish with tofu and tempe, which is also amazing!

Amazing!!!!!!. Myself and 2 of my friends went to Puspa's class today and it was amazing!!! We started with a visit to the Ubud markets then off to a beautiful rice Padi up in the village which had Mt Agung in the background We then went to Wayan and Puspa's home where we started our day Highly highly recommend to do the class, it was so enjoyable and I will definitely be back! Always remember (according to Wayan) 'happy wife, happy life' Thank you Puspa and her wonderful team!!!

Wonderful and charming. My friend and I were only in Ubud for two days. When she saw the positive reviews she booked us onto this class. I was so glad she did. The host Pusba and Wayan were completely charming. So were the instructors’. They are willing to go the extra mile to make sure you feel looked after. They also give you lots of helpful tips along the way, the best of which being alternative ingredients for things you might not find at home. We also learnt a bit about Balinese traditions and customs. This half day class was more than I could have expected. I learnt about food, tradition, laughed and left fuller than I think I have ever been. When I come back to Bali I might have to go again :)
Best experience cooking Balinese food. Best experience ever! Hosts were fantastic! 5 star experience and a definite when you visit Ubud. Thank you Tavel Counsellors and EXO for referring us.

A fantastic day out. A great day out , met some fantastic people , this is a must for your holiday.Starts with the markets , then onto the beautiful balinese house, beautiful food great tutorials , amazing food

Nice social activity. It's possible to make online reservations and they reply quickly. Experienced some Bali time and due to misunderstandings between the family and the driver I missed half of the market tour. They apologized for that. After the market tour they took us to the rice fields (prettier than many others in Ubud) and explained how they grow it. It was nice to meet the family and hear about life in Bali. Cooking class went very smoothly - Puspa made sure that everybody had something to do. I wouldn't say that I'm confident to cook these dishes by myself but this wasn't the main goal for me anyway. I took it as a social activity with some good food as the end result. Also good for learning about Balinese cuisine in general.

A really lovely way to spend a day. We thoroughly enjoyed the cooking course during our recent honeymoon trip to Bali. The trip to the market was very informative and the structure of the cooking class was perfect- we each contributed to a variety of dishes, enjoying each over lunch at the end. Would very much recommend.

Cook, laugh, eat. We took the class on the recommendation of our granddaughter who had done it with some school friends and it was a great experience. Having fallen in love with Balinese cuisine, we were keen to learn more and this class offered everything we could have wished for. Starting with a visit to the Ubud Market to learn about ingredients, a welcome drink, we joined 9 others on a fun experience. Sharing the food preparation and then once cooked, having it for our lunch was memorable. Puspa runs a tight ship which works - her staff are helpful and keep up with running two classes at the same time. We were given the recipes to take home.

Amazing. We spent an amazing morning. Very expensive class 350.000 idr but was definitely worth it. Puspa was always smiling and laughing. We learned how to cook many dishes. Be prepared to spend a half a day there!And the best part was that Puspa had misread my email and booked two spots for me a month later. We called her that morning after having waited for them to come pick us up and she just asked one of her drivers to come get us ASAP! Very great class. Would do it again if I came back!

Cooking . Thank you so much for the cookery class last night! Myself and three friends went and we enjoyed every last bit of it.The food was delicious. Everyone was involved and nobody Was left idle hanging around doing nothing which was a huge plus. We all sat down together and ate. The guy who worked there offered to get us bintang as we were unsure as to whether we could bring wine into the class or not. Recipe books were taken home and we will remake these dishes again in Ireland.Thank you!!

Good fun. We had a fun afternoon learning how to cook some Balinese classics. Attention to hygiene was great. Food was really tasty and so lovely to share the cooking and eating with our fellow travellers. Instructors were nice and also suggested substitute ingredients. The take away recipes were useful too.We were based in the upstairs kitchen which made it feel nice and cosy. Great views too!

I do not understand the negative reviews. This class was fantastic!. Balinese food is pretty amazing & this is the sure fire way to learn how to cook it! Puspa and Wayan are a hilarious & delightful couple who runs these cooking classes in Ubud, Bali which takes place in their traditional Balinese family home. A visit to the Ubud traditional market kick starts the morning class. Everyone gets a chance to chop, cut, and grind. Their helpers help to take care of some of the more intensive aspects of the meal prep while you do get a chance to get your hands in the mix & work various facets of the open kitchen. When you sit down to enjoy the delicious meal you've prepared, you'll feel well rewarded. A great way to spend a couple of hours in Ubud when you're on holiday! Oh & they also pick you up & drop you off to your hotel in Ubud. They were also super prompt in their replies to my emails!

Really fun . Great thing to do if you're a foodie. However, you don't really know how to cook the dishes once you're done. The classes are quite big, and you don't really get know know what you're doing well enough to replicate it. Fun and delicious none the less
Jenny. Awesome class! The dishes were so delicious and it was a very fun way to spend half of our day. I would recommend this to everyone!

Just great!. Originally booked a morning class, but there happened to be a cremation that morning, so we rescheduled to the afternoon class. Organisation is first class, dishes great. Had cooking class in Thailand one time where we went to a local market to buy ingredients which was a great experience, don't know if that is the case here with morning classes. All in all a very nice activity for those who like to know more about local dishes and cooking.

Touristy...But Still Great!. My wife and I took a morning class on our recent honeymoon. And while I can see what some people mean when they say the class is large and showy, I also found that it was too much fun to care about that!We met some great people from all over the world while we cooked some delicious food and learnt the basics of Balinese cooking.

I am not sure why this class is so popular... I signed up for this cooking class way in advance, and was mega excited as all the reviews seem to be extremely positive. Frankly, I have no idea why this class is so popular. My reason being...1) After the class begins, they ask you to grab your place at chopping, grinding, or leave-picking stations. You will be pushed around with people trying to find their place to work on smth (with class size being up to 20ppl), and their pushy staffs (they have like 7 staffs helping around) aren't too helpful either. They just take veggies that were sitting at other stations, and tell you to chop it. But not in a friendly or wanting to help way at all. Pretty hostile in fact.2) You don't really get to eat what you cooked. They give you a little station with stove, and tell you to stir this stir that etc, but food that everyone made gets COMBINED into one big bowl and gets mixed. When class was done, I couldn't eat mine all the way since it was way too salty. I understand people have different sodium level preference- but I think the way class has been laid out is bit poor.3) They won't give you basic understanding of how each ingredients are used. Yes, they tell you what each ingredients are called- but you won't get any explanation over how each can be used and incorporated. So, if you are just looking for an experience of cooking Balinese food itself- then this class would be good for you. However, if you are like myself, who is looking to learn how to utilize spices, then I'd say look for some other classes.4) Unfriendly staff and environmentMs. Paspu has helpers around her moving things around and placing ingredients for participants. As I mentioned earlier, they are not friendly at all. They are always in rush, and when I tried to grab my plate to put into heated pan, (I guess they made a mistake and placed a wrong one?) they just grabbed it out of my hand without saying anything, and just placed a different plate saying "Use this". Just the whole environment felt pretty unfriendly, even though Ms. Paspu is up there smiling and keeping on calling you "honey".At the end, I felt like I didn't get much out of the class. It felt more like a factory with random chopping, and grinding ingredients without really knowing what they are supposed to be used for. My boyfriend and I I even left without having dessert because we were so tired of being there...I honestly think you can find smth better with the same class fee, which is IDR 350,000 per person.

great experience. we have this cooking class in the afternoon, we cooked around 8 dish. this is my first time and totally fun experience. we cooked Bali traditional food such as : Sate Lilit, Tempe Goreng, Urap and many more.

Just get a good Indonesian meal and a cook book instead. My wife and I went here to understand Indonesian cooking; what are the absolute basic flavours, how core ingredients are matched, how we can replace ingredients that are hard to find where we live but instead we got an orchestrated and scripted routine of chopping, grinding and watching. If a normal cooking show on TV is like watching a movie, this is like watching the same in 3D or maybe 5D if I add aroma and taste.If you have NEVER cooked, you will still find the chopping and grinding of novelty but if you are into even putting together a basic meal for yourself, you may feel you could have got this by looking up the recipe online.The only two things I will give then is that you end up eating a good meal and they run a well planned course.

Excellent half day class, amazing food. After having read all the reviews on tripadvisor we were hoping the class would live up to our expectations, which it most definitely did! The market visit in the morning was interesting but not necessarily an essential part of the experience. The class itself was informative, very well organised, ran at a perfect pace and was great for those who are both inexperienced and experienced at cooking. The team were really friendly and gave lots of helpful examples for substitutes should the ingredients not be available in your home country. Needless to say the food itself was amazing, some of the tastiest food we had in Indonesia. The free pick up and drop off service to Ubud is great and is only 15/20 minutes away from the centre (Ubud traffic dependent!). One thing to mention is that we only got a response via tripadvisor not via the contact and booking form on the direct website. Would highly recommend this class.

Fun and delicious!. My husband and I had a great time at this class! You work together with a table of 6-8 people to create each dish. There is a ton of chopping, grinding, and prep required so working as a team made it easier. The location is open air and very clean. They had us washing our hands many times throughout the process. The food you make is delicious and there is loads of it! You won't go home hungry! The head cook is funny, and calls everyone 'honey'. She checks regularly to make sure everyone is enjoying themselves. There were 24 people in our class, but since you work in smaller groups and eat at tables of 6-8 as well, it didn't feel crowded. Thanks for a delicious time!

Highlight of Ubud!. Had an amazing evening at the cooking class, definitely the highlight of my time in Ubud. The food we made was fantastic, and you get to keep all the recipes to try at home. The staff were amazing, very helpful and funny made you feel like you were part of their family. You have to go to this class whilst in Ubud!
