One word. Excellent!. One of the best parts of our trip! Puspa, her staff and family are just lovely. Highly recommend this cooking class, looking forward to making all the yummy dishes at home. Thank you Puspa & Wayan for sharing your home, knowledge and culture with us.

Good for men too.... I was hesitant but my wife dragged me to this cooking class (a quid pro quo after Mt Batur;) and to my surprise, I quite enjoyed it. It wasnt that painful after all, great surroundings, good organization, good humour of the host, some easy cooking and a very decent self-prepared lunch. There are worse ways to spend the morning, and keep your better half happy.

Absolute must do in Ubud!! . Just returned from this fantastic experience!! Everything was wonderful and the hosts were incredible. Really hands on and a fantastic lunch banquet to enjoy! This is a definite not to be missed experience...our children absolutely loved it. Thank you Wayan and Puspa!!

The best cooking experience :). If you are a vegan or vegetarian and interested in traditional Balinese cooking, then look no further. Paon Bali has the best instructor 'Puspa' in whole of Ubud and possibly in whole of Bali. The location is a 2 storey cooking school cum house and the entire staff is extremely welcoming. All ingredients were professionally organized, really fresh and proper hygiene maintained at all times. Partcipants were served with tea and coffee. Puspa was really entertaining and her instructions were really easy to follow. This is a must to do experience if you are in Ubud, Bali.
Fun cooking. Had great fun with the family in this cooking class. Very well organised. Puspa is a very funny lady. Will try out my recipes at home soon!

Amazing experience! . We were made to feel welcome from the second we arrived with a welcome drink and introduction from our host. As a group we cooked a wide variety of traditional Balinese recipes which all tasted incredible! I would definitely recommend this to anyone with an interest in cooking!!!
Sensational day. Thank you Puspa, what a remarkable day we had, so friendly and welcoming and beautiful food our group of 8 people thoroughly enjoyed our day with the very best and fresh food

Expensive but super pro and comprehensive. Great facilities, good recipes (8 dishes in total !) which you will leave with a printed version of, qualified and fast staff although English is not always easy to understand, family-like meal time and opportunity to exchange with other participants. We had a great time, the 2-3 hours flew by ... and of course the food was DELICIOUS !

Great fun. We arranged to be picked up in town for the afternoon class. For some unknown reason we drove past the location and taken to a local rice field to kill about 10-15 minutes before returning to Paon Bali. The class (group of 10) was very interesting, informative and hands on. Puspa and Wayan our hosts were friendly and hospitable. A most enjoyable and delicious evening had by all.

Highly recommend . We thoroughly enjoyed the cooking class. It was done with much humour whilst learning about Balinese cooking. Would definitely recommend for the cooking, the eating and the overall experience.

Wonderful Activity on Honeymoon. This was easily the highlight event of my recent honeymoon to Bali. We participated in the afternoon class as we didn't want to sacrifice our morning, but looking back I would have loved going around the markets. The staff are fantastic and professional, attention to cleanliness is apparent and they always gave everyone a task. You join in on all the stages from the preparation to the cooking - and definitely the eating. We were also given recipes to take away which is great because I can't wait to make the dishes again. It was just so much fun, a great way to spend the evening, and something I would even do again if I could. Everyone who goes to Bali must take this class!

Fun cooking class. The class was great, the food was outstanding and the staff were friendly and knowledgeable. I am vegetarian and had no problem, was able to cook separate dishes depending on dietary requirements.

Cooking up traditional Balinese ain't so hard!. I signed up for the morning class, which started with them picking me up from my hostel, followed by a tour of the locals morning market (which becomes the tourist souvenir market later in the day), with explanations about local fruits, veggies and spices. We then drove to a rice terrace on the way to the kitchen and were taught about the farming process of rice. At Paon itself, we were given a welcome drink, and had a funny intro by the husband and wife duo who run the company. The cooking class began with an explanation of the 8 dishes we would cook, then we all (18 of us)set out to do the prep, with each person doing something different (which made the prep time super quick). For the cooking, we paired up and took turns with one person cooking and one person adding the food to the pan, then switched off throughout the morning. Overall the food was absolutely amazing, and it was so much fun! There were even leftovers! I totally recommend this class!

Terrific fun and great food!. Cooking classes are tricky. Some may be quite in depth, others may be very superficial without giving much feel for the actual preparation of the food. Despite a large group of 16, Puspa made everyone feel at home and gave everyone a chance to participate meaningfully in the preparation of an 8 course Balinese feast. The dishes prepared were delicious and helpful instruction was provided in the creation of each dish. Written recipes were provided at the end of the night and email/web contacts provided in case we had questions. Puspa is a generous, cheerful and hilarious host who maintains a constant rapport with the group and ably leads a team of assistants who work with the participants in the meal preparation. This was one of the most enjoyable cooking classes we've participated in and would highly recommend!

Awesome Balinese Eats. Puspa and Wayan run a fun filled and informative class on traditional Balinese cooking set amongst sprawling Ubud vistas.Everything is easy to follow and all the staff VERY helpful.Our extended family has been enjoying the fruits of this course since our return a few weeks ago. Thoroughly recommend this course to anyone with even the slightest interest in Balinese food it will certainly enhance your culinary skills and leave you inspired. Asha & Brad
Awesome!!!. Really good cooking class. Staff were great with the kids and the food we cooked was delicious. Host was funny and more than happy to share her house and stories. Thoroughly recommend!

Cooking class . Had a great time today cooking up a Balinese feast for lunch at Paon Bali Cooking Class. First stop is a trip to Ubud market where you get an intro to the amazing array of fruits and spices. The class is a held a small trip away into the jungle and at a traditional Balinese home. You're made to feel like part of the family. No risk of Bali belly here as all the meat is kept refrigerated (they also buy direct from a halal supplier) until ready to use & everything is kept very clean. Great service being picked up from our hotel & dropped back off on the afternoon. Our hosts went out of their way to make sure we had a great time & that the class met our expectations.

Amazing experience!!. For this cooking class you are taken to the home of the brilliant Puspa and Wayan, who have converted half of their compound into a fully featured Balinese version of the Masterchef kitchen, complete with several helpful assistants to help things run smoothly. They were at great pains to emphasise the hygiene side of things, using bottled water for drinks, explaining the meat source, and avoiding the dreaded BB (Bali belly)! As someone who is paranoid about food I must say the setup was excellent and I had no qualms about eating the food we made. We were in a group of around 20, but predominantly worked in couples, and all the pot washing and cleaning was taken care of for us. The host was an amazing lady, very funny, and a real character. It certainly opened my eyes to Balinese cuisine, especially the vegetarian options, which were full of flavour. Book now!

Brilliant activity, best meal I've had in Bali. I chose to do this cooking class after seeing it on TripAdvisor. I wasn't disappointed! Puspa was very entertaining and it was a really fun, educational class. The food was incredible and there was a lot of it! Definitely value for money.

5 stars - Incredible!. Absolutely amazing...both the teaching methods and food! Would highly recommend anyone to do this course if you want to learn how to cook traditional food in a beautiful location!

Clean and easy. Puspa and Wayan are very friendly, funny and proficient. The class is well thought of and conducted, very clean and professional, and the food was very good too! Puspa also takes the time to answer emails for other recipes!

Well worth doing and very enjoyable. On our trip to Ubud we spent an evening doing this particular cooking class and it was one of the highlights of our trip, we found the class reasonably priced and throughly enjoyed learning new things and tasting all of the yummy Indonesian food. The class was run so well and timely and I felt that we got the very most out of the class.
Complete and wonderful. Just a great experience from start to finish. Even though we are large groups, the hosts keep it nice and personal. I would recommend this activity to people of all ages.

Clean, fun and easy to follow.. I will strongly recommend this cooking class to anyone. Puspa and her team are great at giving instruction and have a good sense of humour. The team were conscious of food safety and dietary requirements.If you like food and you are in Bali this is a must! We were staying in Legian and Puspa arranged for a driver (for a reasonable fee) to pick us up and drop us back.

Great food, great instruction, great facility. This was one of the most well-organized, guest-friendly cooking classes of the dozens I've taken around the world. The food was the best I've had in the 5 days since I arrived in Bali.

Delicious! . Took quite a number of cooking classes while visiting Bali and this was by far my favorite. It's very hands-on, but still guided the entire time with main cooking done by staff. Would love to take another class here in the future. The best part was that the food was delicious!!!

Wow, lovely, delicious, fun. From the pick up service to the lovely setting to the highly organized instruction and delicious creations we can't say enough good praise. Thank you Trip Advisor for the tip.
Great clsss. Took the class as a solo traveler, was fun and warm atmosphere .. Puspa and staff were friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Learned a lot and had a great meal.
So worth it!!!!. Clean, fun, friendly, social, educational, memorable and delicious!! A definite highlight from our 3 amazing weeks in Bali! Highly recommend doing a cooking class with this family!

Must do in Ubud. We had the pleasure of attending the Paon Bali Cooking class today. We picked them as they were No1 on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed. They picked us up on time at our hotel. We were taken into the Ubud markets for an explaination of there temple offerings and the different ingredients/spices we would use in our cooking. Next we went to the local rice fields where they explained about growing rice. Off to the local house where the kitchen is located. The owner and cooking teacher explained why things were laid out in a specific way in the house. We then got cleaned up and the dishes were explained. We all prepared the dishes and got to cook each dish as a pair. The best part was smelling the spices and flavours cooking and then eating the dishes. Everything looks and tasted very fresh. We absolutely loved your cooking class and would recommend it to anyone coming to Ubud.

Great time with wayan n wife. Altho we only booked 3 slots, Wayan allowed another one as walk in. He picked us from villa n took us to the market.Very informative time n we learnt a lot. Particularly loved the basic sauce recipe n its multiple uses.What made it so different from other cooking schools was tht it was held in a family kitchenMy first time in a Balinese household (always had been curious as to what lies behind the narrow doorway) n it was v interesting. Wayan explained the various rooms/ halls in the compound, so it was more than just a cooking class. We had a tour to rice fields also.Thank you wayan n Wife!

Definitely worth it!!. Fantastic cooking class that is worth the trip up to Ubud!!Very friendly and informative staff/family!Enjoyed the market side of it and the cooking is fun. The end result food is delicious!

Brilliant day!. We booked the morning tour as you get taken around Bali market first. The whole morning was brilliant and I highly recommend this for a must do in Ubud. We were picked up in the morning, shown around the markets, then taken to the families rice paddy and given a talk about that. We then arrived at the house for the class and were greeted and given a welcome drink, we were then in the kitchen for a few hours learning 8 different dishes. It was great fun and my partner who agreed it wouldn't usually be his thing, loved it too. Thanks for a great cooking class!

Amazing food and so well organised. Wow. I went along with a friend as cooking isn't really my thing, however the whole experience was very Informative and entertaining with an amazing lunch to top it all off. So we'll organised, well except they told us to be at the front of palace at 8am and we waited 45 mins before a lovely lady arrived to take us over to the market where we met up with the rest of the morning group. It was a great experience that I'd highly recommend to others.

Great activity for anyone. My husband and I did this cooking class for something different and it was recommended by a friend. We thoroughly enjoyed the class, well organised and staff were very friendly as also was the Owner. We were picked up from our hotel in Ubud. Best of all the food was delicious and easy to cook and we were given the recipes to take home. Would highly recommend.

Fun informative and delicious . From start to finish this is all class !!! Puspa and Wayan are an absolutely delightful couple who clearly love their "jobs" and are born teachers and entertainers. From the trip around the market and then the visit to the rice paddy to the friendly welcome and refreshing drink on arrival at their home this warm and happy couple are the true stars of this class! I learned more about the Balinese way of life and Family home layout than in all my previous trips to this beautiful country. This is a very well run business all the staff are happy and helpful and I cannot imagine how many people there are out the back constantly washing the dishes that are whisked away every time you finish and magically appear for the next step. Everyone assists with the prep and the actual cooking the recipes are simple and easy to recreate at home and the flavours are divine. They cater for all tastes allergies and palates and the feast at the end is a delight to behold. Do yourself a favour and book your day out in Ubud it truly is fun tasty and informative the highlight this trip for sure and will return again thanks for sharing your home and your passion!

Fun fun fun. I had a blast here! The hosts were amazing, organized, friendly and fun. Met lots of people, awesome variety of food and techniques. Great way to spend the day, especially for couples or families. There’s a reason these guys are #1 on tripdavisor. It’s that well put together.

Amazing Cooking Class. What a great day! The class was super well organized, Puspa was very affectionate and a joy to be around, her husband was also super sweet and really helped coordinate everything. The class was fun, social, simple enough to learn, with a wide variety of foods and techniques. Beautiful home and sunset view from their patio. Great way to spend the evening.

Great Time. This is a great night. Entertained by the hostess who is so funny, learning and participating in the preparation and cooking of wonderful Indonesian dishes then sitting down to a feast. Do not miss out on this!!!!

Very enjoyable and tasty!. We loved our cooking class and delicious meal at Puspa and Wayan's cooking school. They are both very friendly, hospitable and professional hosts. Wayan picked us up and shared information about their village and life. Puspa is a fabulous teacher and has a great team working with her. She soon had us all joining in with chopping and cooking and having lots of fun in the process. The facilities were spotless, the food fresh, and our meal at the end was the most delicious food we had in Ubud. Some of our group had food allegies and Puspa easily took this on board and found substitutes so that everyone was included and well fed. Highly recommended!

Become enthralled by Balinese cuisine and kindness. What a lovely experience ! Wayan and Puspa were such wonderful hosts and welcomed us into their home with open arms. Wayan is so friendly and full of information - he brings you around the market explaining the ingredients that you will be using later in the day. Wayan and ps home is absolutely stunning ! And an amazing place to learn to cook. The class begins with an explanation of what you will be cooking and the ingredients then the group begins prepping the ingredients - you will get to take turns doing different preparations (chopping, grinding, slicing etc). After that you and a partner will cook six dishes and two sauces together and sit down to a delicious traditional Balinese feast ending with a simple and delicious dessert. Overall it was an amazing experience and I highly recommend it. You will leave with a happy belly and a book of recipes to recreate the delicious creations at home. Note the morning class gets you back to your accommodation around 2pm and they only accept cash but are very accommodating and will bring you to an atm if necessary.

Delicious, Informative and Entertaining!. This husband and wife duo make a great team. After an eye opening trio to the local market we were greeted by the hubby (sorry I have forgotten their names) with a refreshing drink and some lovely stories both personal and cultural. Once the wife had us in her kitchen we were treated as part of the family as we prepared food and laughed together. She is an unforgetable character and the setting was beautiful.

Definitely recommended . We were picked up from our villa and taken on a magical journey. Wayan and Puspa were fabulous hosts, amusing and very informative. They gave us a special taste of Bali life. Their home was beautiful and Wayan explained the lifestyle of the Balinese family in their compound and gave us a special insight into their way of life. The food preparation was fun and interesting and we met friendly people from around the world. Lunch was awesome and plenty to eat. This is a must do activity. Will come again. Thanks so much

Great! . We loved our cooking class. Friendly staff, very clean facilities, and really delicious food! Highly recommend! Everyone in our group booked ahead, we were lucky to get in the morning of by calling. I think they had a cancellation.

A good chance to learn Balinese food.. I was very exciting to learn traditional Balinese food. It was a big group, helping each other cooking. A good asmosphere, humorous staffs and delicious food. And we had a copy of recipe which we can follow at home. Thank you for the present and good memory. Definitely a place to recommend!!!

Wonderful Cooking Class with Puspah and Wayan. Our group was greeted with a fresh lemon squash and given a tour of Wayans family home complete with cultural information. The cooking class is well organised, the staff helpful and friendly and the food fantastic. Puspah and her team make it so much fun and have great communication skills. An evening of fun and fab food. Not to be missed

Cooking was never so much Fun!!. I was quite reluctant to engage in a cooking class - being domestically challenged in most arenas and having some food allergies (chilli). I was concerned I would be a 'downer' on the whole party- as the cooking class was a part of a tour. I had no reason to be concerned this was the best cooking adventure I have experienced. The hosts (Wayan) and his boss (wife, Puspa) full of character, local knowledge and culinary talents; facilitated a class that one could not fail, but could learn and best of all create a delicious multi-dish meal from local, traditional ingredients and methods; in the beautiful serene surrounds. The entire cooking team were fluent in their English and so efficient, talented (& forgiving). For those that have specific dietary needs Puspa had numerous creative substitutes- which tasted as fabulous as the other meals. Trust me you will get so much more from this unique class than you anticipate. Ps: you will also take home a recipe book.

Amazing Afternoon and Evening. This was an inspiring afternoon. We were looked after so tenderly and beautifully. We learned to make many dishes from the beginning. Lots of humour and a depth of knowledge imparted. This woman has a passion for cooking

Delicious and interesting. Puspa and Wayan from Paon Bali Cooking School, welcomed us into their home and compound to give us an authentic experience of Balinese life in the village, and their delicious traditional cooking. The setting was truly magnificent, immaculately clean and set up for a fabulous cooking experience and feast. I've done this class every time I've visited Bali and always learn something new and refresh my cooking skills to bring home. Couldn't recommend them more highly. Puspa and Wayan's warmth and personality and beauty are magnetic. Highly recommend for a wonderful experience of Balinese life and food. It is always a highlight of my visit to Bali. Thank you both so much.

Amazing venue/facility. Food sensitivities graciously considered. Thanks to Wayan and Pushpa and staff for top class attention to all details of our visit. Warm heartfelt hosts who dream big as you will see at this amazing venue. christine w Honey.

Awesome Experience, Great Company!. First of all, Auntie Puspa or Mommy Puspa, as I called her later in the night, was such an interesting and lively character. She really made the whole experience an enjoyable one. Each step of the process was beautifully explained and we actually learned the different traditional Thai styles of cooking. Mommy Puspa was even considerate enough to add a last-minute dish of Mee Goreng, which I had earlier mentioned was a dish that I loved. Because of the light and fun environment that was set by Mommy Puspa and her team, we were able to interact easily with new people from different walks of life. Such a great first day experience! I would recommend this to anyone :)

Recommended!. Our large group attended an afternoon class. Wonderful welcome and introductory talk about Balinese family living and domicile. Excellent facilities. Charming and experienced hosts and instructors. Just a delightful experience to identify, taste, prepare, cook & eat in this atmosphere.

Extraordinary Bali food experience. Wayan, a driver pick-us up at our hotel in the morning. He drove us to the market visit, then to the cooking class. We were very well welcomed and then had a wonderfull cooking class. Balinese cooking is tasty and easy. The lunch we prepared all together was excellent.Thanks for all

Fun, easy going cooking class. My boyfriend and I attended the evening cooking class at Paon Bali. We were picked up very punctually by their driver and the venue is actually not very far away at all. Maybe only a 15 minute drive from Monkey Forest Street. We were warmly greeted by Wayan and Puspa and had a lovely refreshing lime welcome drink before being told about the building. We were then taken upstairs to start the class. Puspa is hilarious and incredibly welcoming. The chef who took our class was very thorough and helpful with any queries. We got a chance to learn how to chop, slice, crush and blend the Indonesian way and the aromas throughout were great! We cooked a total of 8 different dishes and the operation was so smooth. The members of staff who cleaned and transformed the kitchen after every dish were brilliant. We had a lovely group and all the food we cooked was simple but tasty. We also got the recipes to take home after. A great experience to have in Ubud and well worth the money.

FUNtastic Class!. The class was such a package: fun, informative and the food was great! Went there with my girlfriends but I'm sure any sort of group: couples, family, business or even solo will have a great time with this class! :) Thank you so much, Auntie Puspa! :)

Great chance to meet people. We really enjoyed the class today, the course organiser was a character who put everyone at ease. We met some really nice people and made some tasty food. Some dishes were more to my taste than others but as an experience I would definitely recommend that you go.

Gluten free & vegetarian. As I am gluten intolerance and a vegetarian, I thought it would be difficult for them to alter the menu, but this turned out to be no problem at all. In stead of meat I used tofu and tempeh and as a replacer of soy sauce I used liquid palm sugar in my dishes. It was a very nice evening and the dishes we made were all very good

Great fun, informative, delicious!. The class was such a great learning experience and very fun for us while on honeymoon in Bali. Pick-up from our hotel was great, market tour very fun, and it was amazing to visit a local home, even if with other tourists! :) "Auntie Puspa" is incredibly talented and funny to boot, and we were very impressed with the organization of their business (we saw other groups coming/going but were never interrupted as they have several kitchens and the knowledgeable staff managed to rotate just in time). Wow! So glad we did it.

Lots of fun. They were really organised, very friendly and the group we were with was small and heaps of fun. The food is a bit spicy, which we loved but not everyone will (maybe mention if you don't like it as spicy, i'm sure they'd accommodate). Highly recommend...

Great honeymoon activity - amazing food! . We had a blast at Paon. We came here for our last day in Ubud and are thrilled we did. Puspa and the whole team are fantastic - from being picked up right on time, to the market tour, to the amazing explanations of everything we were making, and what you can substitute if you don't have certain things, such as palm or banana leaves.This was one of the highlights of our trip, and we highly recommend it for anyone - solo, couple, honeymooners, etc.Thank you Puspa and team!
Awesome. Loved every minute of this day! Was fun, beautiful food and the hosts were hilarious. Very well organised...would do it again tomorrow if I could

100% Balinese but big class!. We were picked up from our hotel on time for our morning class and taken to the Ubud market to join a group of 12 people. The group felt a bit large but we enjoyed the tour and found it informative. After the market we were taken out to country to see the rice fields. We waited for 20-30 minutes for another 12 people to join us before we were told about the area and growing process. We got back into our respect vans and continued on to the Subawa family home in Laplapan village. We were given a refreshing drink and a brief introduction in their courtyard from Mr. Subawa and then waited (again) for his wife to start the class as there were two classes being held at the same time in different parts of the house which she went back and forth between.We prepared the ingredients in two large groups and cooked in pairs in an immaculate kitchen. We created and tasted 8 different dishes. Dietary requirements were addressed. Recipes were received at the end of the class and only cash was accepted for payment.Mr and Mrs Subawa are great hosts but it felt like we were attending a cooking school factory. I wish their website was more informative and included the size of the cooking classes with a detailed itinerary. We would have preferred a smaller, more personalised approach, with less waiting around.

Great for us beginners!!. Aunty Pusa is well organized, fun and a great cook. I don't do any cooking at home but the instructions were clear and the food was delicious! Who knew I could cook!?! Although you cook in pairs all good is combined to make for a great lunch!!

So memorable and joy-filled. Our hosts were so accommodating about my vegetarianism and simply one of the happiest couples I've met. Don't miss this experience! So easy to book, to get to, and to enjoy.

Holiday. Great way to start a holiday! Class was a hoot and the hostess and staff were great. Very professional and fun. We cooked as a group as well as visiting the market and rice paddies. Really interesting and helpful in understanding Indonesian culture and food. Loved it and loved eating our delicious food. I truly recommend you do this while you're in Bali .

Cooking Up Fun. I had a wonderful time with the Paon Bali cooking class today. The trip to the traditional market was eye-opening by itself, but the cooking class was exceptional. The facility was homely, clean and well-staffed. The recipes were tasty, beautifully executed and the end result (lunch) was exquisite! For a real taste of Bali let Paon Bali cooking class take you there!

Great fun!. Me and my friend, both 22 years old, went on this cooking course in July 2016. Considering I felt extremely ill, I had a fabulous time.We cooked about six dishes and then all sat down to eat together.The staff were very accommodating to dietary needs- I can not eat gluten and they had delicious gluten free alternatives.I would highly recommend this cooking course to anyone in Ubud, a bit pricer than some cooking courses offered but I would say worth it.

Charmed. I was planning our trip in Bali and was looking for things to do around Ubud, our first stop on the Island. Then it occurred to me: why not a cooking class? What better way to get introduced to the local food? Well, little did we know how incredible that idea would turn out to be. Hotel pickup, local market visit and stop in the rice fields. Everything accompanied with brief but very educating expainations. Of course the cooking in itself is the higlight, but you just don't expect it to be so much fun. Especially how the owners are so charming and funny. And it doesn't keep the class to be impressively well organized. At the end you get to eat the food prepared, with quit a bit of help of course, and it's amazing ! And they give you the recipes for everything. It was an amazing experience!

Delicious Experience. We were met by punctual smiling drivers...and our morning went from there. Through to the maze of the colourful busy markets, the lush rice paddies and to the cooking school itself. An informative, hands on and tantalising gourmet experience! Puspa (with a joking Wayan at her side) was funny, informative and very knowledgeable about Indonesian cuisine. Not to mention the other Paon Bali chefs and cooking guides who were also informative and gently encouraging as we chopped, pounded and stirred. The end product was a banquet to remember. Each mouthful an explosion of the spices and flavours that we had helped to create. On the business side of things, the cooking school is excellently run. Messed is swept away in the blink of an eye, dishes magically appear and there is plenty of room to prepare the dishes and take in the lovely surroundings. Thankyou Paon Bali Cooking Class for sharing your talents with us. We had a memorable time:)

Five stars, what else?. For our last day in Indonesia, we wanted to go back home with some recipes and cooking secrets of the great food over there. We joined a group of ten people (mostly Australians) and prepared a lunch of eight dishes that we ate after the class. After a hotel pickup, the class started by a visit of Ubud's food market to discover the products we would use later. Then we headed to the owners' home where we were welcome by Wayan, the owner. Such a sweet character! He entertained us with funny stories for a couple of minutes, explaining how Balinese homes were organized. Then we were handled by his wife Puspa and her team, to prepare our dishes. A lot of the tedious tasks (like peeling garlic or turmeric, mincing the chicken) were already done, so we could concentrate on mixing the ingredients and cooking them. Everybody tried everything as we were constantly rotating so we could discover different aspects of the cooking process, including preparing the famous yellow sauce in the Balinese blender. The atmosphere was super friendly and the organization and timing super professional. We left the place with the recipes and a promise to Puspa to rate our experience five stars.. what else?

Curry-licious in Ubud. If you are looking for a one on one cooking experience, this is NOT the class for you. If you're a little more advanced, again probably not the class for you. But if you want a fun cooking experience with a friendly host and friendly staff and to fill your belly with great tasting food, then I can not recommend this enough.The day we attended was quite the downpour and the amazing drivers went out of their way holding umbrellas over us to ensure we did not get too wet.They cater for dietary requirements and will adjust a menu item for your simple food dislikes. You get a hands on experience in aspects of Indonesian flavours starting with a tour of the Ubud food market and explanations of the more exotic fruits and vegetables.To finish the class you get the recipes for everything you've made, and Puspa is even willing to email you through different recipes after completion.To find out what happens in the middle, you will just have to attend.The high rating is definitely earned and very well deserved.....5 out of 5

A 'Honey' of a Visit! . This is one of the better cooking class experiences I've had in Bali. The Paon staff were highly organised, friendly and accommodating (all diet types were catered to). Of course, the real stars of the show are Aunty Puspa and her husband Wayan. So much personality in such a wee package. The class was fun and entertaining and the food delicious. I took along a 'non-cooking' friend who soon found herself manning a wok and slicing garlic. Very good value for money. I will recommend to friends.

Fantastic cooking class and meal!!. Paon cooking class was a fantastic way to have some fun, understand more about Balinese culture and food, and eat a superb meal! My friend and I found this class through Trip Advisor. We were picked up at our hotel and taken for a tour of the local market and nearby rice fields before class. The actually cooking class ran incredibly smoothly and was well paced. The kitchen is gorgeous and the staff friendly. We all contributed to cooking our meal, which consisted of 8 courses. Our hosts were knowledgeable, funny, and gracious. I would highly recommend this class to anyone thinking of taking a cooking class in Bali! Everyone in our class seemed to have a great time and the food was fantastic! You will not be disappointed!

A great foodie experience. Our travel agent recommended this authentic Bali cooking class and we're so glad he did. From start to finish we were made to feel very welcome in the home of this lovely family. They knew we were vegetarian and had planned accordingly, which was really appreciated. We learned a great deal about the local cuisine and very much enjoyed the process. The result was a spread of very tasty dishes which we devoured with enthusiasm. We came away with printed copies of the recipes and a very warm glow.

5 star experience! . Found out about this course through reading the trip advisor reviews and it did not disappoint! Fantastic variety of ingredients and brilliant opportunity to learn some new recipes. Would absolutely recommend this trip - transport provided, trip to market and authentic cooking in a wonderful home setting. All fantastic - thank you so much!

Great host . Aunty Papusa was a great host with a funny personality and great charisma. The cooking class itself was also very entertaining. We got to cook quite a few dishes and then we ate everything afterwards.

Cooking in Bali. A fantastic opportunity to learn how to cook traditional Balinese cuisine. Professionally run with great staff. The food was amazing, the best we had in Bali, and the setting is picturesque. All of the staff are very friendly and knowledgeable about the food we were cooking. Would recommend to anyone thinking of doing a cooking class in Ubud.

Best cooking class ever. This is a great cooking class, really nice family, great location and great healthy food. They catered for all food allergies and made sure everyone had enough to eat. This is a must it you are in Ubud.

Fabulous thing to do - kids loved it too!. We were recommended this by our driver and it did not disappoint. Smoothly run class, great recipe notes, delicious food and accommodated our daughters nut allergy and a vegetarian in our group very easily. They picked us up from our out of the way villa and dropped us back afterwards. Easy and fun!

Great Night 🍴. Thanks Aunty Puspa and team for a wonderful night. You have given me recipes and techniques that I can now use in my future cooking. I would definitely recommend this experience to anyone looking to learn about Indonesian food and the ingredients used. Wish we could of made mie goreng! Nevertheless, we had so much fun!

Best food of our trip & learned a ton! . My best friend and I did this cooking class at the recommendation of a friend who had done it a few months back and loved it. It did not disappoint! The price of 350,000 for the several hours experience (including beer and transportation!) was worth every rupiah! We learned how to cook 7+ different dishes and the treat of getting to taste it all was amazing. Puspa and her husband are a dynamic duo, with charming humor. Their space is incredibly clean and all of the staff is super friendly. The whole experience was seamless. By far the best food of our three week trip, and so fun to have a hand in making it!
Beat cooking class. We thoroughly enjoyed this class, very interactive, the staff are so friendly and organized it was so much fun and of course the food was delicious!! Highly recommend!

Fantastic . Highly recommend the morning cooking session. It includes a market and rice field visit with explanations before a home visit cooking experience. Absolutely lovely, humorous hosts who welcome you to their home and provide a memorable time. Food is to die for! An absolute must if visiting Ubud.

Amazing experience!!. Thanks so much for the authentic, fun filled and tasty experience! They picked us up directly from our village and delivered us just on time. Puspa was amazing, friendly and full of jokes. Her team was welcoming and well experienced in traditional Balinese cooking! She also took the time to teach us about Balinese culture. A must do when in Ubud! Thanks again

Amazing. Absolutely amazing experience. My friend and I wanted to cook and try authentic Indonesian food and that's exactly what we got. The host and her team were lovely and entertaining also. 10/10 recommend if you're going to do a cooking class in the Ubud area.

Fun cooking class. Pickup time is definitely jam karat ( rubber time ) so expect some delays in getting picked up.Once at the market you will meet everyone else , as they use several drivers for the pickups.Once there Wayan will be cracking cheesy one liners all through the market tour.Puspa isn't short of jokes either.After the market tour there will be a brief stop in the rice paddy while Wayan explains a bit about the rice. Then you go to the compound and get a lemon ginger welcome drink and the cooking class ( Puspa's domain ) starts.You will probably do bits of everything as the activities are shared around, then you get to eat the results.Most of the prep work is already done for youAnd the food tastes great.They also cater for vegetarians.

An Absolute Must Do!!!! . Just completed the morning course with my friend and can honestly say it was the best part of our trip so far, we loved it from start to finish! Our taxi was running late but they were so accommodating and waited for us before an entertaining market tour. We were then introduced to Puspa and her husband an incredible, genuine and fun loving couple. After that the food!! Huge array of high quality ingredients, very clean, amazing informative teaching and huge quantities! Couldn't have asked for anymore, would highly recommend to anyone. The fact you get a menu booklet at the end means we can at least try and replicate how delicious it was when we get home!

"Hands On" Chop, Learn, Laugh and Eat!!! YUM!. As a family of four (two boys ages 12 and 10) we were seeking a cooking experience where we got to learn about the ingredients, chop and prepare them all and then enjoy eating the finished product in a fun traditional environment. Puspa (master chef) was funny and informative, yet, with the help of her very helpful staff kept you on task throughout the cook without making you feel uneasy. Our two boys thoroughly enjoyed being able to get hands on chopping and cutting under great guidance and even though this was not something that they were looking forward to totally soaked it up and is a holiday highlight for them. Intitially we were planning to do the morning class which includes the local food market, we couldnt make it so we did the afternoon which on reflection was a better choice as the food you prepare becomes your dinner and it is a cooler time.Thanks Puspa and family for welcoming my family into your home and teaching us a little about your culture.

a great time! fun way to meet people from around the world and we made excellent food together!. We were placed in a group of 12 and met folks from Ireland, China, Germany, New York and the Netherlands. It was a fun experience to cook together. Puspa and her staff were great and the class was well organized. We received recipes to take home and alternatives if we couldn't find the exact ingredients in our home countries.

Balinese cooking at it's best. Visited with 2 friends on recommendations from others and they were not wrong! Puspa is lovely and a real character, she made the whole morning a lot of fun and her staff are all knowledgable and helpful. We visited the market in the morning, which eludes to the fact you buy your ingredients here, but it is actually just a tour. Which was still enjoyable. The group's are quite large but then you are split up onto smaller tables to firstly prepare all of the ingredients - herbs, spices and veg. Everyone rotates and get a chance to try everything - definitely need one of those large knives!!!I'm Gluten Free and Puspa knew exactly what needed to come out of which recipe and separated some ingredients for me and knew exactly what was what the entire way through. Within your smaller group you then cook all the ingredients and this involves lots of new ingredients and skills which was so much fun.Of course the best bit is eating the food later on, the chicken curry and the satay was absolutely delicious. I will definitely be giving them a go at home - and Puspa has now sent me further recipes which I can't wait to tryWould DEFINITELY recommend for a real taste of Balinese cooking.

A MUST DO ACTIVITY. Amazing day at Paon Bali with Puspa and Wayan! From the warm welcome on arrival to all the jokes, the cleanliness of the facilities, the quality of the ingredients and the instruction all the way through to the tasting (amazing), the Paon Bali Cooking Class is an absolute must do activity. You won't be disappointed!Wayan and Puspa are so funny and on top of that it was so nice to 1) learn how to cook Balinese food and 2) to understand the resourcefulness of how they cook.Plenty of options for veggies and meat-eaters and Wayan and Puspa's house was incredible; we were welcomed like family members!

Great fun!. Wonderful experience. The prompt pickup from our hotel was followed by a delicious welcome drink, a tour of Auntie Puspa's beautiful home (the views!) and meeting her adorable dogs. The setting above the river is really spectacular, and there is real charm in cooking in Puspa's own home. Her husband and her assistants are all delightful. Seamless transition between preparing the ingredients, cooking the food and making sure everyone feels involved and sure of themselves. Great opportunity to meet people too, if you are traveling solo or as a couple. Making good friends and sharing laughs with them was such a bonus. Can't wait to cook some of the recipes for my family. Thanks, honey! ;)

Do it!. This what a truly great experince. Even though har group was big (20 pax) everything was petfectly arranged and organised. And mrs. Puspa is a clever and fun teacher. We will never forget our Balinese cooking class

Cooking with Class . What a great cooking class. The staff are fabulous. The facilities are excellent and hygiene is very high.The group all work together to prep the ingredients then with a partner every pair make the dishes that are shared with th2 group.The owner is so calm, knowledgeable and friendly. 'Honey turn on your engines' will be a phrase that makes you smile. Well worth the time and money. Very reasonable price.

Deliciously entertaining!. A friend and I travelled to Ubud for a day and we're delighted to finish up the day with a delicious array of traditional Balinese dishes and sauces. To top it off this kitchen in situated at Puspa and Wayan's home, with a beautiful view. We had allergies, gluten free and vegetarians in our group all of which the staff had alternative options for which tasted just as great! We all participated in the cooking process and it was very hands on. The staff ensured we all moved to different preparation areas and tried the traditional ways of making the basic Balinese sauces. We cooked in pairs, swapping with each other for every dish. Would absolutely recommend to anyone travelling to Bali wanting to experience a true Balinese meal, in a traditional home with lovely hosts. Will absolutely be returning here on our next trip to Bali!!

AMAZING. Not strictly with teenagers - more like a 21yo daughter and mum combo but we had a fantastic time with this cooking school. A great introduction to our short stay in Ubud on our first morning there. Everything was super organised, well set up, beautiful, thoughtfully done, and the food was fantastic. It really set us up to appreciate and understand Balinese food and the culture around it. Puspa is a real character - very welcoming, funny and chatty. We did a morning class so got a tour of the Ubud markets with Puspa. This was a real hit to the senses and again set us up for the rest of our stay in Ubud with her explaining bartering and the different ingredients and even cooking utensils we came across. The cooking class was run on a balcony (one of three or four classrooms we thought) that overlooked lush forest and had a welcome breeze coming in. Hygiene was flawless, we always had cold water, and everyone enjoyed a really hands on experience with us doing some prep work as well as using the stove top burners and even shaping our own sate kebabs. Be prepared to eat yourself silly and make some friends. If you're vegetarian or have any other requirements this isn't a problem for this course, they're very accommodating and make everyone feel at ease in a Balinese kitchen.

great experience. these guys know what they're doing, really enjoyable and engaging. from picking us up at our hotel, to the market and rice paddie visit before returning to their cooking school. many dishes cooked and enjoyed. we had a great group and all stayed behind and had beers and shared other great experiences to do while in Ubud and Bali. you will not regret going.

Bali cooking class. This cooking class is highly recommended if you are looking for learning how to make a traditional meal the Balinese way. They also offer a pick up service which will take you to their local food market to show you the different type of spices and fruit. Then we were taken to the owner's house where the cooking class is held. They speak good English and one can easily understand their methods of cooking.I can say it was a very pleasant experience and we also made friends with other members.P.S. the food was also amazing and very delicious

Smoothly and efficiently done.. Very good. Well worth going. It was fun, lots of hands on cooking and the food was so delicious. It was well presented and we all ate together. The lesson was polished, informative & well organized. Well done guys

Great Cooking Class! . I decided to book this activity after reading so many good reviews on trip advisor. The reviews didn't lie! This was such a polished well organised class! Puspa and her husband are so welcoming and friendly. You get to cook a great amount and variety of dishes, with all diets and allergies well catered for. Everything is hands on from the prep to the actual cooking and the food is delicious with a menu to take away at the end! Totally worth it, highly recommended and it was even worth the hour and half trip from Kuta!

Fantastic Experience!. A must do when in Ubud! The Chef was charismatic and very easy to listen to. She also accommodated a plethora of food allergies in our class with ease.
Couldn't have asked for a better experience!

Highly recommended. They have two sessions, the morning one consists of the Ubud market tour. If you've done the market scene, you may as well just go for the afternoon session. The school provides pick up and drop off, provided you're in Ubud itself. Puspa, the chef, is the main highlight; she made the whole process fun and informative. Although there were about 20 people, everyone had something to do and had time to sit down, relax and enjoy what we made after every few dishes. It was a morning very well spent for me and I'd definitely recommend this place if you want to experience Balinese style cooking. We cooked in a well equipped outdoor kitchen and dinedoutdoors as well, overlooking the lush greenery Ubud offers. And at the end of it, you get to take home all the recipes of the dishes you make!

An epic culinary experience! . Puspa is a force to be reckoned with! This amazing woman welcomes you into her home for the class, greeting you with lemonade. Then you are whisked up to the class in a private room overlooking the lush Ubud greenery. The staff is fun and jovial, making sure every detail is attendee to. I couldn't believe how many dishes we made (7!) And it was such a unique cultural experience to understand the local flavors/ingredients like keffir lime leaves, palm sugar, white pepper, aromatic ginger, lemongrass and more. I would recommend this class in a heartbeat!

Fantastic. We prepared 8 meals, guided by very friendly Balinese women. Very nice setting with fantastic view on the jungle. I would highly recommend this to everyone interested in cooking and tasting local specialties.

Amazing-an absolute must!. Me and partner went to this cooking class and absolutely loved it! You are made to feel a part of the family and get to cook some fantastic fresh local food! The class is conducted in a smooth and professional manner! Would highly recommend, it will make your trip.

Fun group cooking class.. I really enjoyed my morning at this cooking class, but have to admit it was not quite what I was expecting. I naively believed that we would all be preparing and cooking individual dishes from scratch, instead we were assigned different food preparation tasks before taking turns with a partner to cook the different dishes. There were a lot of people in our morning class and many were already experienced cooks, for a novice like myself I would have learned more in a smaller class.I also felt that the morning trip to the market was really not necessary, no ingredients were purchased and the information we received there was duplicated in the class. If you want to see the morning market in action get there at 6am when the locals are doing their food shopping.That said it was a fun class, Puspa was fabulously entertaining and the group (those that I did get to talk to) were a fantastic bunch of people. At the end of the class you take home with you a booklet of the recipes, which also gives great tips on alternative ingredients to use back home.

Excellent Experience Professionally Run. Paon Bali offers those interested in Balinese cooking an excellent professionally run experience, a delicious meal and a chance to meet other food lovers from around the world. We went for the evening meal, so missed the market and rice field visit, but this did not at all detract from the experience for us. We were picked up and returned to our Villa in Ubud as part of the service. In between we had a lot of fun making nine different Balinese dishes. Importantly you learn to make staples such as a yellow curry sauce and peanut sauce that then are key ingredients in to a wide array of dishes. As someone who regularly cooks Asian food at home I learned a lot about the ingredients, how much to use, and how to prepare them. The whole evening is incredibly well organised. There is a very big focus on hygiene and all the ingredients are pure and clean. We have one daughter with food allergies and the other is a vegetarian and Paon catered for their needs with ease and without fuss. It was especially nice that our vegetarian daughter got to cook all the vegetarian versions of the dishes she was to eat. This is our fifth trip to Ubud, so we have pretty much seen and done everything around here, but this was our first cooking class and certainly well worth doing - and at Rp.350,000 per person it is incredibly good value. Finally we met a nice Belgian family and got to get to know them and share a lovely Balinese banquet.

Must Do in Ubud. We started the morning in the Ubud market - not for the faint hearted. Cooking class in the private home was well set up and very clean. Small class meant you could have a conversation with other travellers.Good value for money and an absolute must in Bali.

Great fun and learnt a lot. This was one if the highlights of our trip to Bali. A trip around the markets in the morning to show you the raw ingredients, and then a quick drive up into the countryside to Puspa and Wayan's home. We didn't get the explanation about the countryside or the house that others appear to have had, but that was fine as we were there for the cooking.We prepared soup, curry, satay, steamed fish, and a variety of salads and side dishes. Most of the ingredients were semi-preprepared, so the group just had to do the final chopping and blending (by hand!) before being able to start chucking things together in a pan to create these delicious meals that you can then eat for lunch.I'm not sure how much I learnt, but it was great fun and we came away with a copy of the recipes so no excuse not to try out at home!

Love love love!!!!! Do not miss out on this amazing cooking class!!. Where to begin?! Just amazing! If you want to try out traditional balinese food and cook it yourself, this is the place!Amazing staff, amazing family, laughing all through the class with great people and great atmosphere. Food preparation, demonstartion, cooking and eating! Also suggested replacement for any ingredient which are difficult to find in your county. A recipe book is also handed out to you at the end of the class.I just loved it! Worth every penny! They also offered free shuttle from and to my hotek !

Cooking class. Australian standard in cleanliness.We do not rate anyone a 5 as that means there is no room for approvement. We would recommend this to everyone. Value vof money and once cooked all eaten, met some lovely people and only small groups.

Great Day. I highly recommend this cooking school, from the morning market tour, right through to eating your fantastic creations at the end. The staff are very welcoming and make your day very enoyable

Cooking class. This was an awesome experience! Well worth doing for a half day trip. Hands on cooking and preperation in a small village with a huge open air kitchen.the food was fresh and delicious! Well explained cooking ingredients and recipes too. Fantastic day 😆

Raw vegan perfect. Filling and inspiring. Arifs class was with my friend,myself and another. We were firm friends by the end of it. Loved all the ways arif made simple ingredients into gourmet delights. We had to take most of our hand made food home as we stuffed ourselves with the food arif made us as examples. Very good for begginners and people experimenting. Food amazing and burdting with flavour. Worth every penny.

Ubud 2016-cooking class. This is one of the best tours we have taken... The program started with a tour of the ubud market and education on various types of spices, fruits and vegetables available in Bali. Next they showed us around a padi field. Puspa and her husband are a joy, we got to learn about the Balinese home and to cook in their home kitchen. The lesson is such a joy! We got to learn to cook 8 different dishes and they all turned up yummy, probably tastier than some we had at restaurants.I want to commend myself for choosing Paon Bali cooking class but it was a friend who recommended it. Love it!!

Very good cooking class. I did the Paon Bali cooking class in Ubud with friends. It was a very good class and the meals we cooked were very tasty. My only complaint is that the morning market stop didn't really serve a purpose because we didn't buy any ingredients there (all the ingredients had already been purchased). I feel like this takes away from the authenticity because it's always nice choosing the meats and produce you want to cook with beforehand just like the locals. Maybe I'm just spoiled because the cooking class I did in Vietnam included the market stop and we bought everything at the market we would use to cook with and the teacher there did a very good job explaining to us how to tell if something is fresh or old at the market etc which was very interesting to learn. Just gives it a more authentic feeling purchasing food like the locals at the market which this class doesn't do. I also think the class is a little big and perhaps offering smaller more intimate classes would be better. But besides those two issues it was a very pleasant day cooking with friends.

An Entertaining Day - Lots of Food and Laughs!!. Very well organised and plenty of food to eat at the end of the cooking. Clean and the setting was lovely. Our other would-be-chefs were from Europe and the US. Nothing was too much trouble for our hosts.We were staying at Seminyak and the drive took longer than I thought due to traffic so it took up most of the day.

Ranked no.1 with a certificate of excellence. " They deserve it".. It is obvious why they have such a great rating.We wanted to do the morning class starting at 8.30 where you do a market tour then go to their house / cooking school, it was booked out during our 5 night stay in Ubud & there was only 2 dates available for the night classes 4pm to 8 pm.The night we went it was full, 20 people. The hosts / owners are very welcoming & friendly, on arrival you are given a refreshing drink & advised about the course & there property.Then entering the outside kitchen where the vegetable ingredients ( all extremely fresh mostly from there own organic garden are on display, you are then served ginger & lemongrass tea. They tell you what the nights 8 course meal which you will be cooking ,includes 2 sauces and the process also going through the ingredients & yes any special eating requirements is catered for eg vegetarians.To start everyone gets involved with preparing the vegetables & pastes, when it comes to cooking, you pair off in couples & alternatively prepare & cook dishes.Very simple instructions, easy to follow.The food was delishes, not one complaint, even if you can not cook, give it a go for 350,000 ($35 aud) it is excellent value, great fun & did I say DELICIOUS food.You also get picked up and returned to your hotel in Ubud.The bonus, you even get the recipies to take home and an email address of the head chef for future communication if you desire or loose your recipes.

Great, authentic Balinese food. We made the trip into Ubud from Jimbaran bay and it was definitely worth it! Great, easy cooking experience learning to make authentic Balinese food that would be easy enough to make at home. They give you a copy of all the recipes you made to take home, and it is all delicious! So full!

Worthwhile One-off Experience. I didnt realise until attending this course how powerful Trip Advisor ratings were. Our class had attendees from 5 different countries who all booked off Trip Advisor feedback and at the end of the class i felt pressured to give not less than a 5 star rating so the success of the business could continue. To be fair, I just need to say that i don't think i have ever rated a 5 to any business before.There was also another class running at the same time, so there was alot going on. The class was well organised and methodically structured like an orchestra. The staff were very nice and helpful and i have to give special mention to the husband whom i thought was so lovely and genuine. Throughout the class there was consistent referral to food safety to prevent Bali Belly. The location appeared clean and tidy.I noted some attendees felt uncomfortable leaving their belongings in a place which was accessible to others and not in view which was fair. We were provided handouts of recipes and given an option to email to receive others. Transport was efficient and organised. Market visit was interesting and worthwhile attending.

Best food I ate in Bali...and I made it!!. The below reviews give a good outline of what takes place during the cooking class so I won't repeat it. All I can say is DO THIS CLASS! It was one of the highlights of my time in Bali and the food is delicious! Wayan and Puspa are entertaining characters and you get a handout of all the recipes at the end. I'd recommend this to anyone travelling to Bali.

Fab cooking class. Myself and my husband attended the Paon Bali cooking class on the morning session. We enjoyed looking round the market prior to the class. We loved the cookery class itself and initially I was miffed to be selected to prepare cauliflower and broccoli as I always use these at home in the UK. However , once the preparations have been done you all get to cook all of the dishes in your couple and it was actually quite nice seeing the bits I had prepared turn up for various recipes. So don't be upset if you have to cut the broccoli haha. The food was brilliant and our hosts were so friendly and charismatic, not to mention excellent at time management in organising such a large group. We would both highly recommend this cookery class experience.

Fun, friendly & delicious. I can't say enough about what a wonderful experience this was, from beginning to end.From the moment we were picked up at our hotel in Ubud, everything was simply perfect. Puspa and her staff are incredibly friendly, even by Balinese standards, and we were made to feel welcome immediately. After drinks and a short introduction to our host, to Bali, the cuisine and the ingredients, we plunged in. Step by step, we prepared a lavish and delicious meal, with advice and assistance from the staff.They manage a pretty astonishing balancing act during the class. On the one hand, we all became a well-oiled machine, grinding and slicing and chopping, mixing, frying, sauteeing, etc etc. On the other hand, it felt completely relaxed, and everyone was having fun.As impressive as that is, of course, it doesn't make a difference if the product isn't satisfying. It was. Soup, curry, sate, gado gado, snake bean salad, pepes ikan, tempeh kereng and for dessert, boiled banana with palm syrup. All delicious. All spicy and layered, the way Balinese food should be.If you like to eat, have fun and make friends, this one is a no-brainer. You won't find a better way to spend an afternoon.
Fun cooking class . This was by far my favorite thing we did in Bali highly recommend it! E wry one was so friendly and they teach you some great recipes!

Wow what a class!!! . Paon was an amazing experience that I would highly recommend!! Everyone was made useful and the atmosphere was light and cheerful. The food was explained really well and tasted amazing! I have learnt so many new skills and recipes I will use forever.

2nd choice but best experience. We wanted to go to an other class, but it did not do anything that night. We were advised but our driver to go here. BEST ADVISE EVER!We did the evening course so we didn't go to the market. for us it was fine because we already know all the ingredients.The class is very efficient and everybody gets to do every dish.when the moment comes you feel like taking break, you are already done and they overlook the final stage of waiting by the "engine" :).The queen of this kitchen is an awesome lady called Puspa, her husband is an amazing guy with the best sense of humor.Thank you for an amazing night!

Cooking has never been so easy!. I visited Bali as a travel tourist for 20 days and I liked the food so much that I decided to take a cooking class to learn it. I choose Paon Cooking Class and had a beautiful experience. The staff is particular nice and kind. They show you trough every step and you can follow them really easy. You make a lot of dishes for everyone to enjoy afterwards. I loved that they use traditional Bali kitchen tools and that the instructors give you a solution how to do it at home if you don't possess them. The fun you have during the cooking makes you feel very confident and made me feel as it isn't that difficult. I enjoyed it and recommend it to all Balinesian Food lovers!!! :)

You won't want to miss this. This was a tremendous experience. You start in the market learning about the foods and spices of Bali and then to the family villa to learn how to cook Balinese essentials, all the while learning important elements of Balinese culture. After cooking a traditional Balinese meal, you eat the fruits of your labors. The recipes are spectacular. The quality of teaching is top tier. It is well organized and they anticipate your questions. They inquire about dietary restrictions and make accommodations (one of our group had allergies). The cooking experts and the novices in our group adored the program equally. I'm excited to try what I learned. The view is gorgeous too.

Yes, you can cook. Booked this class as we have always wanted to get the taste of Bali back home. Collected from our hotel in Seminyak and driven to Ubud where we met up with our fellow budding chefs where we had a tour of the Ubud Market, then off to the Rice Paddies for a lesson on how rice gets to the table!!A short drive later we were greeted by Wayan with a refreshing Lemon Juice and then we hit the kitchen... Puspa showed us how to chop, dice, and blend. We were underway and cooking.Our class was a mix of young and old and from all corners of the world, 15 in total and everyone had a great time. Laughing and chatting while we took turns preparing or cooking. We made 8 courses in total and at the end all sat down together to enjoy the fruits of our labours. The food was great and the company and surrounds even more so.This would have to be one of the most fun things you can do in Bali and great value for money. Much cheaper than some of the others but not cheap and nasty. Do your self a favour and give this place a go, you will not regret it.

Fantastic service!. Really well organised and friendly team. We learned a lot about the different ingredients used in traditional Balinese cooking. We got to participate in the preparation and cooking of most dishes followed by a generous and delicious lunch. We were given copies of the recipes to take home and we can't wait to cook them. Puspa the host even offered us email support for any questions when cooking at home. Fantastic service!

Amazing and funny cooking class. It wa just perfect, our host was funny and very professional with very nice products. The food was just so good !! We cooked 8 meals, all of them typical Balinese !! It was a very nice afternoon with all the group. We enjoyed a lot to learn some new recipes. Thank you for your welcome. We will recommend this class !!!

A GREAT day out.. We thought the review may have been too good...but they were accurate. It was a really fun day and learned so much. The market visit was great. The staff were incredibly efficient and worked very hard to make us all look proficient. Great food, fabulous day.. Highly recommended.

Great fun and lovely food!. Me and my wife went to the class today. Picked up on time by our driver and taken to the market. It was nice to walk through the market and learn about everything without being hassled. When we got the house we were greeted by a very friendly chat and then upstairs to the cooking! The staff were very helpful and spoke really good English! The food was lovely and we left well and truly stuffed! They also provide you with a recipe book so you can continue to cook this great food at home! Thanks Puspa! Ben and Emma!

A must do when in Bali. This is just not a cookin class it is a morning immersing yourself in Bali culture. Starting off with a tour of the markets fruit, vegetables, spices and meat, you are then heading off to the local rice paddies to be entertained with humor and a lovely view, then we head off to the beautiful home of our hosts, where the cooking is relaxed, and fun, and the tastiest I've ever eaten. I was a solo participant and had a wonderful time meeting other like minded travellers. I would recommend this to all travellers and you even get to take home a recipe book so you can recreate the delicious meals for your family back at home.

Great fun. I loved the day and have cooked some of the recipes already when I got home. They taste just as great and all ingredients found at your local Asian grocer. The only thing I did not enjoy was the market tour, the smell was really terrible where the meat was...especially after a night of cocktails. There is an afternoon class that does not include the markets. I think the markets is just for morning class. All good prep was done in excellent sanitary conditions- no need to worry about Bali belly here. They even have a halal kitchen.

A must go for those who like to cook.. I am indeed fascinated by the efficiency and speed Makcik Puspa and her team. They taught us how to cook authentic Balinese dish and were friendly and polite to everyone of us. Furthermore, the atmosphere is great as the location was a Kampong (village and rural setting) setting which makes the whole class a relaxing one.

Excellent Experience. I do not particularly enjoy cooking in general, but I had a great time at this class. Everything was well timed and well organized, but more importantly, fun. Prompt pick-up at our hotel, a lovely welcome from the family when we arrived, and then we got down to cooking. We rotated through jobs in order to try everything. Clear directions were given and they made sure to accommodate those with food allergies. All the instructors/helpers were warm and friendly and it felt like we were at a fun dinner party. Would definitely recommend this class.

Evening Cooking Class. Puspa and her husband are wonderful hosts. It was an enjoyable evening with fabulous authentic indonesian food. Recommend to all who wants to try making and savouring a delicious meal.

Excellent Cooking Class in a Magical Setting! . A great way to spend a morning while in Ubud! The tour starts with a market visit, then a rice field visit, before you arrive at the house in a village near Ubud where the class is conducted. The class is fun, informative, hands-on, very well organised and everything is super clean! And the meal is delish! Everyone is friendly, and it's a great way to meet fellow foodie travellers. Highly recommended!

Best cooking class ever. This has been one of the highlights of my trip to Bali. After touring the market for an hour and visiting a rice padi, we came to our hosts home. The husband was incredibly funny, welcoming and just an overall happy guy. His wife, our cooking guide or "food friend" as they said was also hilarious, sweet and a wonderful teacher. Right when we arrived we got welcome drinks. The cooking was fun, relaxed and interesting. There was probably 15 of us in total, but they split us up into smaller groups which was nice. The food was the best food I've had yet in Bali (and we made it! #score). The ambiance and setting is beautiful, the facilities are clean and they offer lots of tea, coffee, beer, soda and water. But the hosts and their staff made the experience go from 5 starts to 10 stars. I would recommend this for couples, friends and even solo travelers. Can't wait to take our little recipe books and make some of these dishes! I would say this is a must-do if you come to Ubud.

Really Excellent Experience. We loved our time at Paon cooking class! We came here after our friend recommended it to us, and couldn't have been happier. The staff is incredibly friendly, the class is super fun, and the food is great! 10/10 would recommend!

Great local experience!. On time pickup, good driver, long way to Ubud from Seminyak area and visit to a local market, introduction to local fruits and vegetables in decent English with happy guide as well as local market temple. Short drive to a rice field, rice production presentation and short way to the house. Fun presentation by the owner, new meaning of MBA and placenta story. It's very interesting to get inside of a real house you always see partly because of walls.Clean, spacious, spotless. Well, well organized , fun, relaxing , involving. Good English, happy people. High level sanitary. A must to visit . Reasonable prices.
Fun cooking show.. It was really good fun but they definitely pile in the punters! We really enjoyed it and the food we made was delicious not sure that we well be able to recreate it though

Thoroughly recommend . Did the afternoon class, had a fantastic time. Lovely host (Puspa) and staff. Very well organised and run (everything went like clockwork).I was a bit dubious as all previous cooking classes I have done have been 2-3 people max and this was about 18 people but there was plenty of space and plenty of help on hand! Made some delicious dishes and get a chance to try different cooking/preparation techniques (and can enjoy a beer whilst doing so!)

Top Cooking Experience. Had a fantastic morning at Paon cooking school. Picked up from hotel and taken to Ubud markets which were an experience in the early morning. Then taken to cooking school compound in the countryside where we were given a hands on cooking lesson. Even though 16 in class we were all involved in preparation.Then we ate what we prepared! Wow!!!Can thoroughly recommend.

Great fun and good activity in the evening. I did this evening cooking class with my mum. It was a good evening activity to do and included a delicious dinner. The class had 20 or so people which was a bit much for my liking; however it was well organised and catered for this amount of people. It is a great way to meet new people and have a laugh. The staff were lovely and the pick up and drop off service was great.

Easy, fun and great value cooking course in ubud. My wife and i picked this course due to the positive reviews. Our group of 11 was the perfect size and from around the world. We all participated in the preparation and cooking, having fun and chatting along the way. The pick up and hotel drop off was convenient. The food at the end was the highlight of an enjoyable few hours.

Highly recommended . Had a great time at this lovely house just outside Ubud. We got to cook some local foods with excellent and funny tuition and then shared the meals we prepared with some travellers from all around the world.Highly recommend it and Puspa and Wayan make it great fun.Don't miss out on this experience.Paul & Mary (Ireland)

Do it! It's awesome 😊. Myself and my partner spent the day here and it was fantastic. The staff are friendly and welcoming and the food was delicious, can't wait to see if I can manage to recreate it at home. Everything was described so well and it is excellent value for money, not only do you get to learn to cook some awesome food but the lunch you prepare as a group is so good, couldn't quite believe we cooked it! It is such good value for money, would highly recommend.

Puspa and Wayan are a hidden treasure. . Paon Cooking Class in Ubud, Bali is the best!!Puspa & Wayan welcome you to their home, with an amazing, professional set up dedicated to teaching the art of Indonesian cuisine. This was our 2nd time at Paon, and we will absolutely come back again. Very welcoming & very enjoyable.

Great morning!. We loved the Paon Bali cooking class. We were picked up at our place on time and taken to the market and given a great overview of Balinese fresh foods then onto the cooking school. The staff and owners are very entertaining and go out of their way to make your visit fun and a wonderful learning experience. We all participated in the cooking of our large lunch and then sat down together to enjoy our lovely spread. I'd highly recommend this experience!

An absolutely fabulous class. We attended the Paon cooking class in Ubud recently and it was excellent. Puspa and her team were very professional, friendly and efficient. The class was quite large however this added to the experience. It was very hands on and cleverly designed. At the end we enjoyed a yummy banquet. We came away with a copy of all of the recipes and the confidence to prepare many delicious dishes. Thanks again Puspa! Cheers Ray and Maz

So much fun, honey! . My boyfriend and I heard about this class from our taxi driver - turns out it was a great recommendation! At 35,000 rupiah (about £15) each, it's a complete bargain. To put things into perspective, our hotel was running one for more than a million rupiah pp! We wanted the early morning class with market visit, but as we were booking the day before it was sold out. Luckily we got a space on the 4pm class. Pickup was smooth and included in the price (drop off is also included afterwards). After arriving at Wayan and Puspa's home, we were greeted with a cool welcome drink and treated to Wayan's little comedy routine - hilarious! Next up we met Puspa, who enjoys calling everyone honey and is an excellent teacher. Their couples standup routine is just brilliant and obviously well rehearsed! Prep and chopping gets everyone involved, we all had several tasks to carry out. When it came to cooking we were all doing the same thing, with our individual efforts then combined to form the large to dish for everyone to share and eat at the end. A genius and smooth way of teaching 20+ people at once. The food at the end was delicious and it was a sociable evening, eating and chatting to our fellow travellers.
