Vegetarians need not worry - there are alternatives available. My boyfriend and I are so pleased we gave this class a go and can't wait to try the recipes at home. Highly, highly recommend.

Great morning activity. The program was organized and delivery was both educational and amusing. The early morning market and rice paddy tours introduce you to the ingredients with which you will be working and give you a small look into everyday life in Ubud. It was great to then be welcomed into Puspa and Wayan's home to learn to prepare the food and enjoy a terrific lunch. Teaching was in English and easy to follow.

Great morning out with my "honey bun". A great morning of entertainment, the results of which you get to eat! Doesn't get much better. My husband and I really enjoyed the food and the company. It was very good value - the morning includes a visit to the market (which we didn't know existed), trip to the paddy fields, and of course, the cooking lesson and lunch. My only comment is that if you want an intimate cooking lesson in a small group, then this may not be the trip for you. For me, I really enjoyed the community feel of working with about 20 people, and found this experience was more of a taster - forgive the pun- than anything.We were given the recipes which I am going to enjoy trying out when I get home.
Bree. Fantastic, loved it, great fun, loads of cooking tips and local information and many laughs along the way! Food

Great. We went to Paon bali yesterday.Had a great time. If you're vegetarian or have food allergies you needn't worry as they provide excellent alternatives. And the love and care shown by pushpa and wayan are out of this world. The experience was one of a kind and I don't think I and my wife will stop talking about it for years.Thank you!! I could have given you 6 stars if I could!

Masterchef training . This lived up to all my expectations, the pick up from the hotel, the market visit and the cooking class in Puspa and Wayan's home, it was very well arranged and extremely professional.Oh and the food was just sensational, probably the best meal in Bali

Great class and cooking team, too bad about the +30 min pickup wait. Informative and fun day with a nice visit and explanation about rice farming. Cooking material and ingredients were fresh and new. 7 recipes were followed, easy to understand and distributed to all. The afternoon class we booked took around 4 hours.Why not 5 stars? Due to ceremony day and busy traffic the company was not able to pick up many people on time. Result was a wait of 30-60 minutes by many. Improvement necessary on customer communication when schedule is (expected to be) off.

Mum&3Daughters. We had the wonderful experience of attending the cooking class at Paon.We were collected from our hotel in Kuta and driven to the markets were the vegetables come from.Then onto the beautiful home of the owner and his wife and were welcomed with a cooling drink .The ancestral home is beautiful and the grounds are in keeping with the old world charm.Then we were escorted to the cooking class area which was quite lovely.The chef is his wife and we were all made very welcome.This class was friendly and fun the 4 of us are Australian in addition there were 2 people from Canada, 2 girls from the U.K and a couple from the U.K who were from my birth place The Isle if Wight.Everyone participates in the preparation of the meals which started with a mushroom soup like you have never tasted before ,yum.The cooked meals are actually cooked by the chef and her helpers and then we are seated to eat all we have prepared.This has to be one of the best class I have attended and can recommend it to everyone ,at a cost of $35.00 Australian dollars it is value for money.After the wonderful meal we were returned by coach to our hotel.I would give Paon Bali Cooking Class a five star rating.

Evening class wonderful . My family and I attended the evening class we all had a wonderful time, all the staff were so friendly and the food was amazing. I would definitely recommend putting this on your to do list

nice experience. We first visited the local market, then the rice field and finally their house. The owner first gave us a quite entertaining introduction about local family culture, then his wife offered us a nice cooking workshop. We have learned a lot about Indonesian kitchen. Instead of just dining in different restaurants, by cooking with local people we have a better understanding about the local food. The dishes are delicious and people are friendly. The only thing can be improved maybe is that the market visiting for me is not necessary at all.
Did the morning class with the market visit. My wife and i did the morning class with the market visit. One of the best thing we did during our tree week trip to Bali. A must-do activity.

Amazing . Just did this workshop and it was amazing! The hostess is one of a kind: so funny! The food we prepared is nice and we learned a lot about the traditional ways of preparing and making balinese food. I can really recommend this one, especially if you want a good laugh!

Excellent experience 5*. Had an amazing time at this cooking class. We visited the market to sample some Balinese delicacies before taking a look at the rice fields where we were informed of how the process of making the various rice works. The guide had excellent English and gave us a real insight into the Balinese culture. We were them taken to the kitchen where we joined a group of 20 to prepare around six local dishes including satay chicken. From chopping, to grinding (motar and pestle) to cooking, we were involved in the cooking for, start to finish. What was also extremely positive was that the instructor gave us substitutes to use if we can't access certain ingredients back home. We then sat down and tasted the food, which was amazing and departed with a smile on our faces along with a copy of the recipes for our return to the UK. Extremely enjoyable experience.

Fantastic day. We loved every minute of this class. All the staff were friendly and informative. We were very involved in the preparation of the food which ended up delicious. Would not hesitate to recommend to anyone visiting Ubud.

Loved it!. My girlfriend and I headed out today to learn some authentic balinese cooking and we weren't disappointed. Puspa and Wayan were lovely, classes were well organized and best of all, the food was delicious. I would definately recommend it to anyone coming to Ubud.

Best tour we have done!. The package included them picking us up from the hotel which was convenient, the host and his wife (the boss) were wonderful people! He introduced us to his home beforehand and it was more like a show he made us laugh and feel loved. The house itself is incredible very clean bathrooms and kitchen/dining area. The cooking portion pretty much took up the whole day but we learned traditional cooking methods and the staff were very helpful and patient with us! We got a chance to eat overlooking a wonderful view and made some great friends at the same time, if you're in the area highly recommended!

Amazing! So much fun! A must do in Ubud!. This was so much fun!!! We have never done a cooking class before and so we didn't know what to expect. Upon arrival we got drinks and met A lovely chihuahua called Katerine. We soon got chopping, mushing, peeling and blending before we "started our engines"The cooking was really interesting and eating it all at the end was great! The host was fantastic and so funny! All the staff were really nice! We loved it hunniiiiiiiiiii, don't be jealous ;).A must do when your in Ubud! A real nice treat!

A Slice Of Balinese Life. TL; DR Do it. No regrets. Scenic cooking class, satisfaction guaranteed. Before I start this review, I'd like to give a quick shout out to the wonderful people of Bali and the stunning place that it is. Anyone planning a trip there will never regret it. On with the review now.•What is Paon Bali? What can I expect?•-Paon Bali, roughly translating to Kitchen in Bali, is one of the numerous cooking classes in Bali, promising to teach authentic cuisine. There are two sessions, one each in the morning and afternoon starting at 8:30 AM and about 4 PM respectively. However the difference would be that the morning session includes a market tour while the latter does not. -The market in Ubud is quite interesting and you're shown around and given a sample of various local fruits (In addition to spices, knives, wood carvings, face masks, meat, dried fish).You could also buy some of the wares if you wish. (Negotiation, it goes without saying, is a must). After about half an hour like this, you'll be taken to the beautiful rice terrace village of Laplapan for a quick view and tour before proceeding to the actual class.•What can I expect at the class? How is the scene?-The class itself is at the beautiful home of Wayan and Puspa, who are possibly the best hosts in the world. You're graciously welcomed into their gorgeous house with a tall glass of particularly refreshing lemonade. Here, Wayan regales you with his humorous and witty take on the world today and makes you feel like one of his family members coming home to roost. All this while you're sitting around in the courtyard, with a bunch of strangers who begin to feel like family already. The coming together of flavors, so to say, has already begun. -Wayan then leads you to the kitchen where the class takes place. Here, after a cup of tea or coffee, you finally meet Puspa, who can absolutely be called the Nigella Lawson of the East. She explains beautifully and the dishes seem to throw themselves together. -You will be taught about 8 dishes including a dessert.•What is so special about this class?You suspect that you're being made to cut dummy veggies, crush prop spices, which will be stealthily disposed and perfect dishes be replaced in their stead. There's nothing of that sort, no. All the food is cooked by YOU, 100% and still is completely authentic. Herein lies the magic; You could go in completely inexperienced, and still be proud of the fact that you made something so beautiful. That is one heck of a feeling and that alone makes this class worthwhile!•Is it crowded? No, expect about 30-40 people or fewer in a batch. It does not feel uncomfortable at all.• Price350,000 IDR (Indonesian Rupiah) ie $26 per person.•How to get thereThey offer free pick up anywhere in Ubud. Else, you may take a hotel taxi. However, be sure to set out early if you're at a considerable distance from the place, and make sure your driver actually knows where the place is.•What about food allergies? I'm a vegetarian, can I attend? I do not eat beef or pork, how can I attend?-You will be asked about any known allergies beforehand, therefore there is no need to fret.-Vegetarians will be taught appropriate dishes, and there is no dearth of delicious Balinese veggie options-Chicken and fish are the only meats used, with none of the sauces being of animal origin. Any other meats are suggested as alternatives but not actually used.

Hunnniiiii... Awesome cooking experience. A wonderful experience in a welcoming and traditional home. Perfectly priced for the experience and a great introduction to all of those things you have looked at on menus but not been keen enough to order. A funny experience and a great way to meet new people! Take your insect repellent and make sure you are ready to enjoy! Have fun hhuuunnniiiii (this will make more sense after you attend!!)

Amazing food. The day started early at the Ubud markets which was a great introduction into Balinese cooking. From there we were talked to there family home via the rice fields. We were greeted by their beautiful family who made us feel so welcomeThe cooking class was awesome the food was amazingA great morning a must in Bali

An amazing experience . From beginning to end, the whole cooking class experience was amazing. It started with getting picked up at our hotel, and being driven to the cooking house where we were greeted with warm smiles and a cold drink. From that moment we felt so welcome and accepted into their home. I would definitely recommend this experience!

Nice environment and lovely lunch.. My daughter and I were picked up from our hotel and dropped back afterwards. I loved how they stopped to show us how the rice grows in the fields. I loved the class but thought it went on a little too long, was a bit boring waiting to be taken back to hotel..Overall though, I would recommend it! The husband is very amusing

Great day. We did this cooking class with friends of ours and had a great time. The food was amazing and the hands on experience was superb.Their attention to hygiene was excellent. The information on family life etc. was really interesting and our hosts made our day with lots of laughter.Even the non cooks amongst us had a great time and learned a lot,I would definitely recommend this cooking school to everyone and it deserves it's TripAdvisor rating.

Best Day In Bali. We decided that we would like to try a cooking class so asked Gus our wonderful tour organiser and driver. He booked us in and we headed off to Ubud we met and went to the markets to learn about the spices and vegetables and fruit we would be using. We then went to the rice fields to learn about them, and then off to their home which was just beautiful. They had the school set up at the back overlooking the most beautiful scenery. We cooked 8 different dishes the class was fun friendly and very informative. We all then got to eat what we cooked wow it was delicious. And then we got given copies of all the recipes and contact details if we needed help when we got home and wanted to cook them. A highly recommended day out

A delight. Excellant evening with wayan, pupsa and co. They're 5 star rating is well deserved. They're witty, humorous hosts who make you feel very much at home on the house. The food and teaching is excellent. A far better experience than some of the cooking classes in ubud town from what we heard

Delicious Traditional Balinese Food. This was the only cooking class we did in Ubud and it was a great experience. The day starts off with a pickup from your hotel followed by a tour of the local market. Afterwards, they take you to a BEAUTIFUL Balinese home approximately 10 minutes from the market. The father of the family greeted us and welcomed us to his home and explained a bit about Balinese culture, Ubud and his family. Next was the cooking. They started off asking if anybody had dietary restrictions (eg vegetarian, allergies, etc) which was very thoughtful. They even have a second kitchen to prepare food for certain religious restrictions (e.g. Muslim or otherwise). They had us prepare and cook all of the food and explained what substitutes could be used if we couldn't find some of the ingredients. This was appreciated as it would definitely be difficult to find certain items back home. I cannot thank them enough for welcoming us into their home and showing us how to cook such delicious and authentic Balinese food. They even provide you with the recipes to take home.My only comment was I thought this could have been done without a trip to the market (30-40 minutes). The reason is because, in my opinion, the market wasn't that out of the ordinary. Also, for the cooking class, most of the foods are sourced elsewhere (higher quality) to ensure tourists don't feel sick if they are not used to some of the more local qualities (this is a positive in my opinion). That being said, it seemed others enjoyed the market so please take this with a grain of salt. Overall, it was a GREAT way to spend a morning and I would highly recommend this to anybody who loves eating and/or cooking!

Fantastic. One of the highlights of our holiday. We were picked up and returned to our hotel which was a 15 minute drive out of town before visiting the early morning markets and rice paddies. I can't recommend this experience enough. Our hosts were funny, gracious and generous. Loved it

Nice experience and dinner. My boyfriend and I attended one of the afternoon classes, and as soon as we got there, we were served a fresh lemonade juice and then Puspa and her husband started explaining about the traditional balinese houses, and then took us to the kitchen, then we had an option of lemongrass tea or coffee before starting the cooking. There was also mineral cold water available the whole time.We had so much fun doing all the prep and getting to know new people and their different stories...Then we had a really nice dinner, a feast. All for 35$ including pickup, drinks, a nice and relaxing experience and amazing food! Would be recommending Paon Bali to all my friends x

Great experience in Ubud!. We went for the dinner option and were picked up right at our hotel lobby which was very convenient. Staff was fantastic and efficient throughout the whole evening. They are very organized and professional. We all had the opportunity to prepare and cook while learning about the ingredients, the culture, and each other. There was a fantastic group of students and we ended up even making friends with people from all paths of life that headed out for drinks and a night of fun after! But back to Paon Bali... We made everything from scratch and saw the whole process from start to finish for all of the dishes. Puspa is a hoot- a great host who is clearly well versed in her craft and knows how to engage a crowd. Would definitely recommend for couples and friends to enjoy an evening together.

Awesome! Would go again.. This cooking class was such a great time and the food was amazing! Everything about this event was well thought out and executed perfectly. Starting with the transportation to the house. They were on time and very nice! Upon entering the house, we were greeted by the husband and fresh lemonade. During the cooking class the staff was very efficient with prepping the cooking tools and setting up the kitchen and the ingredients were fresh! The cooking was fun and very engaging. Fun time! And the food was absolutely delicious! Definitely a must go during your time in ubud

Such a wonderful family business and you feel like family when you are there . There is no doubt that if you want to do a cooking class that you should do this. It was fun, extremely well organised and hands on. You learn to cook and get to eat AMAZING Balinese food and leave with the collection of recipes to impress everyone at home. Definitely book with this company, you will not be disappointed!

Amazing experience. It's a day later and I'm still thinking about the amazing experience I had yesterday in the morning session of the Paon Bali Cooking class. Everything from beginning to end was simply wonderful. You're picked up at your local Ubud hotel and transported to the market for the first part of the class. You gave an opportunity to see and learn about some of the local foods and customs in preparation for the class. Next stop is a quick stop to the rice fields to have that process explained. Last stop is to the Paon family home for the actual cooking class. We were greeted with a wonderful welcome drink into the most amazing open air setting. Not sure if this is what all typical Balinese homes are like but this was just stunning. Next we are taken to the open kitchen prep area where all of the ingredients we'll be using to prepare our meal are displayed beautifully. Pupsa, who is is so endearing and calls everyone "Honey" explains all of the ingredients and what we'll be making then it's time to get down to work. Everything runs like a well oiled machine, even with a class of at least 20 people. Everyone has an opportunity to slice, dice, and participate in the prep of the ingredients we'll be using for the meal. Then when it's time to cook, each person has an opportunity to do that as well. They are great about switching up so that everyone has an opportunity to do everything. Even though neither situation applied to me, they were especially concorned about people that were vegetarians and/or had food allergies to ensure that their food was prepared separate or with appropriate modifications from everyone else. The end result was the most amazing meal!!!! And when you leave you are given copies of each recipe to take home with you to prepare at home. I have already posted about my experience on Facebook advising anyone I know to take this class when they visit Bali and if/when I return, I will surely do it again myself. Thanks again for the amazing experience.

Good food Great Experience. Six friends from Australia visited Pasba &Wayan this week. The experience was nothing short of amazing!. From the welcome into their beautiful home right through the afternoon, preparing and cooking a wonderful menu, lots of laughing, they made us feel as if we were treasured guests and we loved them. We will be back on our next trip to experience it all again

Return after 4 1/2 years - just as good as I remembered!. I first experienced Paon in 2012 with my two teenage kids, it was really a highlight of our trip. I just returned some 4 1/2 years later with my partner and it was just as good as I remembered. Both my partner and I really enjoyed it with the perfect balance of detail and simplicity. I would thoroughly recommend Paon to general and intermediate lovers of food and cooking. Thank you so much to Puspa and Wayan.

Second time here, second time awsome. We had taken with my husband this class last year and since we loved it, we decided to take another class. The class takes about 4 hours, the morning class has Ubud Market added. Oter than than, the morning and afternoon classes are the same. We were picked on time(the real one,not the Balinese one) in our Ubud hotel (if you are not in Ubud,they will pick you up for a fee). The class is in Puspa and Wayan home. It is split usually into two smaller groups. Puspa is really amazing teacher and she really cares about everyone's comfort. After the class, you will get the recipes back home, so you can try it back home (if you will be able to buy all the things). After the class, we were drop back to our hotel. I hope we will be back someday again.

We promised Puspa 5 stars... Therefore that's what she gets! We had so much fun, this place runs like a well-oiled machine. While you don't cook one dish start to finish (with the Amount of food you'd never have time!) but work as a team doing lots of prep and cooking together, it makes the whole process fun and efficient. You cook multiple dishes that are all completely different using almost all the same ingredients. Accommodations were made with ease for dietary restrictions (here's looking at you, vegetarians. Or me.) and the whole Paon team is lovely. Not related to cooking, this husband-wife team are both gracious hosts and possess wonderful wit and humour, making the whole day entertaining.The BEST food we ate on Bali.
Absolutely amazing!. My husband and I attended this class and had a great time. Great food, in the most beautiful location! Will definitely do again next time we are in Ubud!

Great class!. We were picked up from our hotel right on time, and had lots of fun. The hosts had everyone involved at all times - we all had a job to do and were able to try doing a bit of everything. Each step was explained clearly, and all our questions were answered :)The food was all very fresh and the area was clean, and the food we cooked was just delicious! Very authentic Balinese food! Thanks to the girls we joined for the class - it was lovely meeting and cooking with you all! :)

My Wonderful Balinese Cooking Experience. my experience with paon bali was nothing short of AMAZING!! and they accommodate different dietary restrictions and VEGANS! the entire program was extremely well organized and prepared with attention to detail. i took the morning class because it includes a stop at the local market. the class includes pick up/drop off service from your hotel and begins with an educational overview of different balinese foods and spices at the local market. the tour guide explained different fruits and vegetables and offered samples of some to try. after the market visit, we stopped at a local rice field and received education on how different types of rice are grown and produced in bali. this was the first hour of the program. we were then taken to the paon bali cooking studio, which is held on the family property of the owners. the property and studio are lovely and we were warmly welcomed with freshly prepared icey lemon drinks (made with filtered water) and smiles. paon bali is a family operation and we were greeted by the husband, who chatted with us briefly about his family and their property. the entire family welcomed all of us with love. the cooking experience begin shortly after that and included two hours and prepping and cooking time. again, this program gave such detail to presentation and proper cleanliness throughout the entire cooking experience. many sinks are available on the property for hand washing and they provide you with clean aprons and towels. the main chef/teacher was the wife of the property and she was perfect! she explained the extensive menu that we would be preparing and every single ingredient that we used for each dish. a total of 8 food items/dishes were prepared during this program. there were many assistant staff on site to help with the smooth flow of the program. the class that i attended had approx. 30 participants in it and the space was large enough to accommodate all of us. everyone was able to take part in the different cooking and prepping tasks. all of the items that we collectively prepared are presented beautifully at the end. the photo opportunities are endless! we are then invited to prepare our plates and enjoy the wonderful mask that we've prepared. the amount of food is crazy! there is more than enough for second servings (if you like) and you won't leave hungry. (i might suggest not eating breakfast that day also.) this experience was truly the highlight of that day and one of the main highlights to my entire experience in bali. i really can't say enough to express how pleased i was with paon bali. absolutely worth the $350,000 rupiah (approx. $35 USD) that i paid. my only suggestion would be to extend the program a little to include 15-20 minutes of shopping time, after the market presentation (i found myself wanting to purchase some fruit and spices afterward, but didn't have time to.)even still, I GIVE THIS EXPERIENCE **10 STARS!!!**thank you for a beautiful, memorable experience!!!amber s.
Awesome experience! . The class was held at a lovely house with amazing hosts.The dishes were delicious and despite a big group, everyone got a chance to get involved with cooking.Highly recommended!

Brilliant. This family is amazing, from pick up to drop off everything was brilliant, the couple running it are a hoot, very funny but also very professional food was amazing, learnt a lot and can't wait to put it into practice at home highly recommend

Sensational experience . My husband and I attended this class , along with a few of our adult children and their friends and we all had a wonderful experience . Wayan and Puspa are remarkably warm and welcoming and clearly have hearts filled with incredible love and gratitude . I loved listening to Wayans stories of every day life in their village and his tour through the market and Puspa is one of the most naturally humorous and entertaining cooks I have ever seen . All of this plus we learnt to cook in a very hands on way nine remarkable dishes which we ate with incredible enthusiasm and joy. This is a must do experience ...and we so look forward to demonstrating our new found skills when we get home ... Thank you Wayan and Puspa and your beautiful staff ❤️❤️
Great class in Ubud!. Delicious food, wonderful atmosphere, friendly and engaging teachers. They also pick you up right from your hotel, which is a great plus. Not to be missed!

Best part of our trip so far. We were travelling from Ubud down to Legian so while we had time between check out and check in we decided to try this. I would like to start by saying all three of us were glad we did. Pick up time was on real not Bali time that was nice but it's vacation so what's a few minutes if they were. They dropped us off at the market where our guide taught us of local ingredients and just being in and seeing the market was really neat. From there we went out to a rice field and another guide gave us a very informative "tour"( we just stood there but lecture sounds boring). From there it was on to cooking. When we arrived at a beautiful house we were greeted with a most delicious lime drink which was a great start. Names have escaped me but the husband entertained us while things were being prepped in the back. He did an amazing job of being funny and entertaining but also quite informative of they layout Balinese houses and how family life works. Once he finished it was off to the kitchen where we were greeted by his wife and a layout of gorgeous ingredients. I wish I could remember names but the wife who was teaching us to cook the dishes was equally as amazing at mixing entertainment and humour but still kept it informative. The cooking part was fun and there only being 20 or so of us we all got to cook everything with the odd hand off of duties. I should also mention they handled my seafood allergy very well. The food we made was amazing and I'm so glad we got to bring the recipes home with us. Once we paid there was zero wait we walked out and straight into a car and were taken back to our hotel. The best way to describe the over all experience is don't leave Bali without trying this it would be a serious mistake.

Fabulous hosts, fun experience!. Our group of four all really enjoyed this authentic experience! As guests in the hosts home, you get a very personal experience, with the use of a full-grade kitchen that can accommodate a large group - very cool setting. The food was perfect, we prepared 8 traditional Balinese dishes that we had been eating at restaurants the days before so it was great to learn how to make everything. All food was fresh, facilities were clean, everyone washed their hands constantly. We were given a copy of the recipes and told to keep in touch with the owners if we have questions in the kitchen! Great value for cost! Enjoy!

Authentic. Delicious. So friendly.. Originally the school we wanted closer to us in Nusa Dua was full so I came to ye 'ol TripAdvisor to help me out. #1 is deservedly Paon Bali and reassured me that #1 really is #1. We arranged transfers (WHICH TAKE FOREVER FROM NUSA DUA) so plan to add an extra 1.5hr each way for the journey but hey, if you're in Bali you should be on Bali time right? Was actually nice to get out and see a bit more of the land. Do the morning tour which includes the market tour as well - afternoon tour = no market tour. From the markets you head back into the crazy traffic to the homestead of the lovely couple who run the tours. A brief explanation of the house and we're up to start chopping. There's enough to do and share without being overly involved or uninvolved. It's sounds like a lot of dishes but they are pros and it all gets eaten by everyone. They have multiple classes running at once and we were up the stairs which was excellent to see into the valley right before us. Fell asleep in the car on the way back to the hotel. Excellent day and the recipes have all had a work out since coming home. Food is incredible and incredibly easy. Yes to this all over again.

Fun and eye opening!. We travelled from our hotel at Denpasar super early in the morning to meet Puspa's assistant outside Ubud palace at 8:30am. We were given a 30 min wet(?) market tour which was nice, it included fruits, spices, utensils, etc. 10 of us (all couples) were transported via their company van to Puspa's place. The cooking area overlooks the beautiful Ubud scenary. Ingredients were peeled and cleaned for us, we only need to do the cutting and cooking. Everyone had a shot at cutting ingredients, cooking, etc. Puspa and her assistants made sure everyone was doing something. Everything from start to end was very smooth and organized. Loved it.

Fun for Foodies. Well organized, fun hosts, good food ... do recommend this for foodies. In an open-air kitchen, we cut, chop, peeled and ground ingredients. Liked that we changed so each of us tried every station. Paired up to cook and swapped around every other dish so you and your partner had lots of cooking time. Food eaten after was delicious.

Authentic Balinese cooking in Ubud. If you love food and you love culture then this is a MUST DO in Ubud! Puspa and her husband Wayan's cooking class is fun, light hearted and authentic! They use halal chicken for their food and avoid pork and beef dishes. They were really accommodating with any food intolerances or allergies. Highly recommended!

Absolutely Loved It. This was such a great evening. We chose to join the cooking class for the evening session, but it is great you have the option for a morning session that also includes a market experience. Puspa and her family were so fun and made the experience a wonderful time. Upon arrival you get a delicious welcome drink, and then the fun begins. It is set up very well with lots of room for everyone in a great outdoor kitchen atmosphere. The variety of dishes that you get to prepare and enjoy afterwards are so tasty. From start to finish everything was perfect. We was an authentic experience and loved learning more about the cultural meaning behind a Balinese Home. We loved this cooking class and would highly recommend it to any traveler! A must do while in Ubud

What a great day, learned a lot too. This is a top notch cooking school. Very polished. Highly organized. Beautiful outdoor kitchen in a tropical setting in the home of an award winning chef of a chi chi hotel. Husband and wife team, both very funny and down to earth.There were two simultaneous classes in separate areas, each had about 8 participants. Very hands on. We received printed recipes for the 8 dishes we made. We were picked up at 8:15am and dropped off around 1:30pm. 350,000rupiah included our transportation in nice vehicles, trip to the local produce market, class, and of course eating the lunch we prepared. Great experience. Fun for husbands too, but they opted out. Too bad. They would have loved it. Highly recommend.

Satay Sauce :) . Really good set up, delicious lunch, easy to make things and everything is step by step. You are given the recipes to take away. Vegetarians are perfectly catered for as is other dietary requirements such as gluten free etc. The day starts with a market tour and is very informative, explaining fruits and vegetables, photos can be taken without issue.
A sensational opportunity to experience the Real Bali. A fab time at Paon Cooking School & making new friends from around the world-fresh produce & flavour

Very nice and good cooking class. A lot of fun, a lot of jokes, very good food and a nice group of people.Our group was in total around 20 people, but still a good amount of personal attention. The food was the best traditional food we ate in our holiday on Bali.

Balinese Cooking class . This cooking class was amazing - highly recommend. Both Wayan and Puspa were so welcoming and friendly. The set up was amazing and the food delicious. You learn how to cook traditional Balinese food and you get a recipe book to take home so you don't forget. Definitely a highlight of our trip!

Fabulous experience. We had an amazing time with Puspa and her family. They were incredible hosts and we had so much fun. The food was amazing. So yum! We only had one night in Ubud and decided to do this and couldn't have been happier! Would highly recommend this to anyone travelling to Ubud. Thank you honeys!

Cooking in Ubud. This was so fantastic !! Even my husband who is not interested in cooking enjoyed this wonderful insight into Bali family life . It was such good value for money and a really unforgettable experience . I shall take " Honey's" recipes with me for life . What a great team she has filled with humor , generosity and gratitude ..just go !!!

The perfect experience. My mum, sister and I thoroughly enjoyed this cooking class. IT was great to start at the markets and then continue on to he beautiful location of the cooking class. Everything as made from scratch and we were given the recipes to take home. Everyone was very friendly and made us feel very welcome. It was my birthday and they even bought a surprise birthday cake and sung happy birthday to me. A great experience that we will treasure always.

Great cooking class!!! . Owners are amazing - they take the time to explain some cultural aspects of the balinese culture. The setup for the class is great and the receipes are easy to follow... Food we created was simply amazing!!! Theses people speak and teach with their hearts !!! Lovely!!

Brilliant! . Great fun and very passionate people . Highly recommended!! Happiest married couple in Bali teaching the class and who own the facility . Authentic bali food . Don't eat breakfast before going .

What an amazing experience!. This was even more than just a cooking class! A tour around the local food market, a wonderful warm welcome to Puspa's home with a refreshing drink & an insight into the culture & her wonderful home! The cooking class itself was great & it was so nice to cook dishes that I can also make once I get home! The food was absolutely delicious & I can highly recommend booking onto this class!

Cooking and so much more . Pick up from hotel was great. The driver was so knowledgable and really friendly. We visited the market and learnt about the raw ingredients we would be using that day, we had the added benefit of trying some yummy Balinese fruit. I fell in love. We stopped at the rice fields, took some photos and learnt about how they produce it all. At the house we were greeted with a refreshing lemon drink, it was well needed. We learnt about the owners compound. I love these two..... Married for 17 years I believe and they bounce off each other. They are so funny and very caring. The kitchens are large and you all get to have a try of smashing, chopping, frying etc. A fridge full of cool water was free and you could drink as much as you needed. Toilets clean and tidy. The food was beautiful and the scenery is like a picture. We loved it. Thank you. X

Great food and friendly people. . The lady who runs this class is great. You will be called honey multiple times during your time. We learned many dishes and went home with our own cookbooks and an invite to email her with any questions or just to keep in touch.

No questions... DO THIS CLASS!. Cannot recommend this enough. I told my tour guide I wanted to do a cooking class and he arranged it with Paon Bali. They were VERY gracious hosts. Hilarious, knowledgeable, happy to answer any and all questions. The food was FANTASTIC! We received a recipe booklet at the end of the class with a print-out of all the recipes we had cooked that day. Have already tried making some at home and the directions are easy to follow. Also, we brought our five-year-old daughter with us and they arranged a lovely babysitter for her while we cooked. If you have time to do just one tour while in bali, make sure it includes this cooking school. Do the morning tour, if you have time, as the walk-through of the local market is really interesting.

Unbelievable experience. This was my first time in a cooking class. Mainly as they had not previously interested me and I always thought that they were too expensive. Having read other reviews about Paon I thought I had to check it out.We went for a morning class as I had wanted to see the markets. We were picked up punctually and taken to the market where - Wayan I believe? Showed us around. We got to try different fruits and had an explanation on various ingredients we would be using. Her english was awesome, she was very informative and the markets were sensory overload. An awesome start!It was back to Laplapan to have a brief lesson on an paddy field. This was very informative and the guide was a local who's family had farmed rice for generations, his knowledge came through very well and I learnt lots that day.Next stop was to the house for a refreshing welcome drink, introduction and to be taken around the family home. I must confess I can't remember his name - we did the class a week ago and it has been very busy but all the same MR was very funny and friendly welcoming us all.We cooked 8 different dishes and were given the opportunity and encouraged to have a go at every part. Before any section we would have a talk about the meal we were doing and it was all very interesting. There were 2 people to each stove and we were in different sections o it was all very social. Bottled water was available throughout which was handy as it was thirsty work!We used a traditional balinese mortar and pestle and cooked on a barbecue with coconut coal. Honestly a very unique experience and totally tasty!Finally we all sat down to enjoy our food and chat about the morning. An unbelievable experience from start to finish. Everyone involved was friendly, knowledgeable and were people people.I would recommend to everyone and anyone.p.s almost forgot the settting which is a spectacular open plan kitchen with views over rice fields - immense.

Most wonderful day you could spend in Ubud. We booked into this class not knowing what to expect, well what an amazing day. We were taken to the local market to source the ingredients and were then taken to our amazing Balinese house to spend the next 4 hours cooking. We made everything from scratch, had great fun with the giant mortar and pestle grinding our spices. We cooked a beautiful basic yellow curry, then chicken in coconut curry, mushroom and vegetable soup, vegetables in peanut source and a wonderful boiled banana in palm sugar syrup. We then sat together as a group and ate our beautiful food. The staff were so good and helpful. Thanks for our exciting day.
A Taste of Bali. My daughter and I had a wonderful day! I loved the added bonus of doing the market tour in the morning. We learnt so much and loved how hands on it was.

More than a cooking class: a culture class !. So i went with 3 friends, aged 25yrs old average.Spend the few days in Ubud and decided to take the famous paon Bali cooking class.In the morning, pick up on time at the hotel then off to the market ! A rather large groupe (around 30 pax, don't go there for intimate class), we discovered the market, local product, fruits, vegetables, spices...all the ingredients we would come to play with later.After the market, a littel drive accros Ubud and we stop in the rice field, where the guide explain us everything about rice in Bali and general balinese way of life. Reached the house/kitchen a bit alter in the morning, where all of us were greeted by rather funny introduction and fresh drinks.Cooking class went well, we prepared 8 dishes, from scratch. Everything was perfectly well orchestred and clean, each team preparing the same recipe before sharing the lunch all together.A really nice moment, wouldn't mind going back!

Excellent!. Really nice people learning you how to cook signature Balinese food! You will cook seven dishes, and all are really nice. Go to this place to meet wonderful people and learn about Balinese cuisine. Highly recommended!!

Sensational Cooking Class that should not be missed. This was an amazing cooking class, my friends wanted to go and I am not much of a cook but this class was full of information. It began with being collected at our hotel and taken to the local markets where all the ingredients that we would be using in the cooking class were explained to us then we were taken into the rice paddies and advised how rice was grown and harvested then we were welcomed with a cool citrus spritzer and some laughs from the owner who explained the process for the day's cooking class. We chopped, grinded and cooked some truly tasty meals - 8 courses, I did not think I was capable of making such wonderful meals. I would recommend this class to all for an amazing professional day of cooking. Don't miss it!!

Cooking classes . What a wonderful experience I had here .From the pick up at my hotel ..the drive to the village ...and then to be greeted by the beautiful people who are .. Paon Bali Cooking. . Very organized and professional. The recipes are delicious. I will be coming back again .

Fantastic time! . A friend and I came to the Paon Bali cooking school and absolutely loved it! The instructors were fantastic, and so helpful and instructional. We had a blast making traditional Balinese food!

Book it! Such a fun day!. Paon cooking class was the highlight of my trip! Puspa and her husband Wayan are hilarious and such good hosts! They took care of everything! I did the morning class and enjoyed everything about the whole experience. Attending the local markets and learning about all the produce was great. The class itself was well paced and very social throughout. The icing on the cake was how tasty the food was even though we had technically made it ourselves! Who knew! From start to finish this is a very professional operation and I would highly recommend!

Perfect morning session, great cooking class. I spent 2 weeks on Bali, and every day was a delight, but Paon Bali's cooking class was definitely a highlight even though. It's a great fun even for those who don't cook on a daily basis. Highly recommended!

Morning cooking class. Really had a wonderful time at Paon Bali Cooking Class this morning. Very welcoming and friendly family (funny, too). It was a larger group than I had expected, but they were so well organized with plenty of space that I never really felt it was too much. I'd do it again.

Excellent cooking class & hosts . What an excellent morning. We started with a complimentary hotel pick up. Local market tour and stop at a rice paddy field and information session. Once we got to Paon Bali we received homemade lemonade and a welcome from Wayan who was hilarious. The cooking class was great we all got involved and shared tasks and made about 8 differeny dishes. The feast at the end was incredible i nearly rolled out of there. A great day out.
Amazing cooking class . Wonderful host, beautiful home, well planned cooking class& so full at the end, I could roll home!! Thank you Aunty Puspa & all your staff. Shireen x

Ubud cooking class. Paon really made my first cooking class experience unforgettable and I'll definitely keep trying cooking classes wherever I travel thanks to it. The owner, Gusfa is an excellent host and she made the whole time enjoyable. You will see what I'm talking about if you try it. ;-)The class menu was well prepared including the dessert and the staffs are well organised. I want to come back when I'm back in Bali!

Perfect family or individual cooking course . Well worth the money - highly recommended!We rocked up without a booking and we're invited to join a class that was just starting! This suited us perfectly.I was a bit concerned about class sizes after reading some reviews but am very glad this didn't put us off. The lady who runs this business has a team of very able and diligent staff who make the whole thing a very pleasant and enjoyable experience. Together they offer a very well organised and relaxed environment to learn to cook many balineese dishes. We rocked up with a toddler too (she's neslr 2yrs) and they accommodated us all with ease. Everyone alternated jobs throughout the course so we all got to do a bit of everything and our baby had a chair pulled up so she could join in too. It couldn't have been a better family (or indovidual) cooking experience!We did a different cooking course before in Samatra which was very personable because there was only the two of us, however even though there were 9 people on our course in Ubud, I feel we got a lot more out of it. Absolutely do it!

Excellent Balinese cooking class. If you are in ubud please make sure that you go to this cooking class. The staff were really friendly and funny too. Learning to cook the Balinese way was so much fun and the food tasted divine! Thanks so much for a lovely morning and teaching us to cook Balinese style!

Beautiful bali experience. From the quick market tour to the refreshing welcome drinks to the explanation of a traditional bali house, this cooking class is a lot more than just food. Time is really well managed so you get a lot out of your four hour experience. I will definitely come back, and recommend to all.

Just wonderful!. Loved the staff, very clear and professional, whilst charismatic and a lot of fun. The whole set up was spot on and they accomadated a man with nut and fish allergies with ease and without complaint. Food was fresh clean and incredible to taste. Very impressed with overall experience.

Trip Highlight but I almost missed it!. Wasn't overly excited about a cooking class so almost skipped it. Thankful I went as it definitely was a trip highlight. Our hosts were knowledgeable, professional, friendly, patient and in addition to teaching us about food and customs they had us laughing as we chopped away. Our meal was excellent! The cooking facility is very organized, clean and a beautiful layout. Definitely needs to be on everyones list if they are in Ubud. All members of our group had a great time. I would rarely give top ratings but everything was perfect & I don't think they could have done anything to make it more enjoyable.

Just go and do it. Loved every moment of this class, a lovely driver picked me up from the hotel, he then took us to the rice fields to explain how the rice is grown and how often it is planted EtcWe then were greeted at their beautiful house with a refreshing drink.Then the magic of creating the most incredible dishes begun, everything ran like clockwork, the food was so do good, a fantastic night all round

Cooking the bali way. The funniest most lovely cooking experience i ever had. The owners were so lovely and funny as well they really know how to entertain us i enjoyed everything and also improved my cooking so its a great thing loved it

Amazing! . Best cooking class I have been to. Puspa was very informative with recipes and gave lots of substitutes if you could not find certain foods back home. The food was to die for, best Indonesian food I have tasted. Highly recommend going if you are in Ubud.

Highlight of Ubud Trip . Everything about this class is entirely worthwhile-- the food was delicious, the class was very hands on, and Puspa and Wayan made sure we had an incredible experience from start to finish. Great hospitality and overall a highlight of our visit to Bali.

Outstanding experience from start to finish. All of the staff were extremely friendly and professional. Hygiene was obviously a priority and quite frankly, standards of hygiene were higher that what I would expect in my own home. There was a great balance of fun and learning. And at the end of it all, our group agreed that it was the tastiest meal that we experienced on our entire 12 day trip, which included many high-end restaurants. I would return in a heart-beat!

Excellent cooking class. My wife and I were recommended this cooking class by one of our friends. The people teaching us was fun, knowledge and make us very comfortable. The venue is v nice, and they pick you up and drop you off from your hotel. we would recommend doing the morning class, as they take you to the market and explain all the ingredients you will be using. Overall A must when staying in Ubud.
Wonderful experience from market to class. Hosts were terrific, welcome was relaxed and warm. Classes were fun as couples paired off to create a great meal.

A great experience and so welcoming. We were welcomed into a traditional Indonesian home and had a great lesson where everything was explained well. We had fun discovering new ingredients. All the dishes were lovely, I particularly enjoyed The Mushroom soup and the Snake bean salad. I would highly recommend as this was and amazing experience.

Great place with lots of laughs as well as learning traditional cooking. Loved every minute of the class, food, people and hosts. A must do when in Bali. Can't wait to try the techniques at home in Aus.

Friendly host but average food. We were greeted with enthusiasm from the couple who showed us how to cook Indonesian food. I expected the classes to be more hands on, cooking a full dish per couple instead of everyone cooking their portion and combining it together to make one dish. Overall it was a pleasant evening and if you're new in the kitchen, this would suit you. If you're more experience in cooking, especially with Asian cuisine, this cooking class may be a tad simple for you.

Absolutely a must visit!. Wonderful experience from our hotel pickup to our our last bite. The class was well organized and the staff were wonderful. Puspa and Wayan were very warm and welcoming hosts. All members of our group of 10 thoroughly enjoyed themselves. Who knew we were such good cooks.

Lovely experience. My adult daughter was keen so really only attended to keep her company however was so surprised what an enjoyable experience it was. To visit an Indonesian village home and learn something about their culture was an added plus. The cooking class was excellent, well organised and all participated rather than just stand and watch and then do a food tasting. We enjoyed a full delicious meal with people from all over the world. Wayan and "Auntie Pusbah" you do a great job honey!!

Fantastic cooking class. I loved this cooking class experience, the best in Bali so far. We did the 4pm class, were picked up and dropped off which was great. The class was extremely well organised, fun and the food was delicious. I have cooked some of the recipes since returning home and have been very pleased with the taste, I would recommend Paon to anyone looking for a very pleasant experience in a beautiful setting with wonderful hosts.

Great activity in Ubud!. My husband and I enjoy taking cooking classes in different countries we visit, and this was one of the best organized.Prior to arrival, email communication with Puspa was prompt and easy. Explanation of all the ingredients and each person getting to cook each menu item (there were 8) were excellent. Instead of dividing the group to put 2-3 people in charge of each dish, everyone participated in cooking every dish in small portions, then combined in a single pot/pan for final heating and serving.The setting was also very nice -- at Puspa and Wayan's home with 2-story open kitchen. Overall a wonderful experience, and totally worth it just for the delicious food you get to eat!

The best cooking class in Bali!!!. This cooking class is definitely the best in Bali. The organization was so perfect (including pick-up and bringing you home) and Puspa was the best host. She was so sweet and warm and patient and the food we made was the best food we had during our entire stay at Bali. The group is quite large, but there is enough room for everyone to cook and enough attention for all. It did not feel like a touristy place at all. We got to take home the recipes as well. Really great food and a great experience!

A great family experience. What a well organised and fulfilling experience. We have dined at the local warungs and now can see where all of the flavours come from. We took our 10 yr old son with us and learnt so much and have taken a lot out of the lesson / experience. I was worried about the class size at first, however this was quickly removed as the group all works together as a team in a very well structured and fun environment.Great atmosphere, great location, great transport, fantastic people and sensational Balinese food (cannot fault this experience at all)

Highly recommended!. Beautiful people, beautiful food and beautiful class. Would highly recommend. Go the earlier class so you can be a part of the market tour. Puspa and her husband are so lovely and welcoming. ❤️❤️

유쾌하고 즐거웠던 요리 수업과 맛있는 음식 :). 너무너무 유쾌한 사람들과 즐겁게 요리할 수 있었던 곳:) 제대로 된 레시피와 체계화된 수업으로 유익하면서도 즐거운 경험이었습니다. 수업 장소도 너무 시원하고 아름다운 경치가 같이 있어서 더운 날씨에 지치지 않고 즐길 수 있었습니다. 물론, 음식도 맛있구요!Beautiful place and delicious food in foll of happiness :) the greatest experience in bali, more than perfect!

Wonderful Balinese Experience. This was one of the top two attractions we did during our week long stay in Bali. This class is professionally organized and just a wonderful experience learning various cooking techniques and sampling a wide variety of Balinese cooking. The instructor was very friendly and truly made it feel like we were one of the family. Very hands on and comes complete with a recipe book of the dishes you made. A+++++++++

Well Planned Class. The cooking class is really well-planned introducing visitors to Balinese culinary heritage. However, I found the food coming out of the class to be too catered for overseas tastes. Then again, overseas visitors may not get used to Balinese 'spice-ness' yet.

FANTASTIC EXPERIENCE. We were staying in Seminyak and arranged for a pick up through the cooking class. Our driver was friendly and on time. We arrived at the market to meet the rest of the group. The market was interesting and we got to sample some unusual fruits. We then as group travelled to the rice fields in our vehicles and given some history about the area & rice fields - stunning scenery. We then headed to class where we were welcomed by Wayan's dog which gave us a bit of a fright, Wayan was there quick smart with an apology and a huge smile ushering us in & making sure we were ok and then provided us with a refreshing cool lemon drink. Wayan gave us a bit of history about their culture and family. He has an infectious humour as does his lovely wife Puspa. Loved the class, the food, the atmosphere. Highly recommend it, will go back

Highlight of the trip. From the time we entered the family home and met our hosts we knew we were in for a great day, as well as being beautiful people, they were entertaining, funny, informative and professional, one lady in our group was there for her 4th time. Great day out,great value for money, really great food.

Amazing class with an incredible view!!. The class is in Wayan and Puspa's home overlooking stunning scenery! They are incredibly welcoming and their team is amazing too! The class was great, one of the highlights of the trip!! Highly recommend !!!

Wow!!. From the time we got picked up from our hotel to the end of cooking class, i was blown away by the organization and enjoyment of paon bali cooking class. The food provided for the class was fresh and well cleaned. The wife and husband who welcomed us into there home/class spoke excellent english and provided amazing food. Everything cooked tasted amazing and the take home recipes will certainly be used when i return home to cook them all again. Must do this while it bali ☺

great cooking experience and amazing food!. Puspa was amazing and so was her staff. They were attentive and organized; everything flowed really smoothly. The recipes were varied and tasty, and the instruction was great. She let us keep the recipes are the end, and I would absolutely make them all again! The sauces were versatile, and we got to eat everything we made. Her set up was great; everything you needed was at your fingertips. 100% recommend.

LEARN TRUE BALI HOSPITALITY. we looked for something pre cruise that took in quite a lot of things and this cooking class covered it all...we covered the market the rice field and learnt all about how families live in Bali. Took my husband under sufferance and he thoroughly enjoyed. unfortunately I got sick at the beginning of the class and we had to leave half way through again the family couldn't do enough even providing food for my husband and son to eat on the 90 min journey back....would highly recommend

Great cooking experience. This was a great half day outing. I have attended other cooking classes & this was different to others, neither good or bad different, just different. Here was more of a group effort in preparing dishes, rather than start to finish make your own dishes. The food did come out tasting great, unfortunately as vegetarian most of it tasted the same, all very peanut tasting because of peanut sauces or lots of tempe in dishes. Looking forward to trying out recipes at home.

Incredible, would definitely do it again!. This was so well organised and ran so smoothly, we were shocked by how much we got for how cheap it was. My friend and I had an amazing time and the food was even better. The staff were very friendly and made the whole experience very relaxing and enjoyable. I would highly recommend the morning class to beat the heat in the afternoon.

Fun cooking experience. Great service. Picks you up up from your hotel/ villa takes you to the markets and rice padi where you learn about everything from herbs and spices to the history and growing of the rice. Then the fun bit of cooking. Great couple. Very welcoming and a great set up. No matter what your cooking skills are it is definitely worth a go.

Highlight of the trip. Very lovely cooking lesson. The hosts made you feel very welcome and had spoke great English. Morning class included market tour which was pretty good-if there was the option to do the morning class but skip the market tour I would have done this. Thank you for the great hospitality and experience.

A super feast. From the beginning until the end, you feel apart of the family and home. It works like clock work to ensure that the full experience is had. One of the best things we did while in Bali!

Best cooking-class experience. Great experience.Great service with pick-up etc. Great valueThe lady was super friendly, carismatic and funny.The class was very well organized and 4h in the kitchen felt like 5 min because we had a great time.The food tasted great !5 stars!
Delicious. Great class, well organised, easy to follow, lots of variety incredible edible experience.Thanks Puspa and Way an for having us in your beautiful home

Super cooking class!. We absolutely loved our experience and recommend you book this class! The whole thing is wonderful, from pick up to drop off. I definitely recommend the morning class as the market tour was a fab addition to the day. The knowledge of the staff was A*. On arrival we met Puspa's husband who was a perfect host and should be a comedian - so funny! Lovely welcome drink too which is a delightful touch. Their home is divine and we felt honoured to be welcomed in and learn of their family heritage and traditions. Then the cooking of course: the whole process is so slick and organised! It runs like clockwork. You learn the basics of some utterly delicious Balinese dishes and even get the recipe books to take home. We'll definitely be trying them! We learned lots and also had so much fun in this relaxed environment. This day does not feel too 'touristy' or cliche, it's just a wonderful addition to your holiday. Book it for sure, it's a bargain at twice the price! :-)

Excellent experience . Everything was great from start to finish. It was an amazing day out and the food you get to make and eat is absolutely outstanding. If you are lucky you might get to meet the gorgeous chiwawa. She was precious. I have done cooking classes abroad and this stands up to the best. Thank you for making our wedding anniversary one to remember.

Review of Paon Bali Cooking Class. This was my favorite part of my trip to Bali and I hate to cook. The hosts were wonderful and made cooking fun! I would highly recommend it and the food was delicious. They also gave you the recipes so that you could make it on your own in the US with substitutions for things you may not be able to get here. It was an amazing experience which I would do again. This should be part of every visit to Bali!!!

I may go once more, for luck! . Pick up from our villa in Ubud was just before 8.30am and we were taken to the market for a tour and explanation of the local produce. After our tour we then went to a rice paddy and finally onto Puspa's house to begin the cooking class. We worked at a small station of 3 couples cooking about 8 dishes together. You are given simple directions which are easy to follow and the class is very hands on. The food was amazing and you leave with a recipe book containing all the dishes you make on the day. A must do while in Bali. TIP: Take the morning class as the afternoon one does not include a tour of the local produce market.

Had a ball!. Picked up on time, then straight off to the market where we got to taste fruits and see the local foods before eventually heading to the cooking class. The whole family were very welcoming and as someone who has grown up around a big family and food, this cooking class was wonderful and made me think of home! We learned step by step how to make every course, then eventually sat down to lunch with everything we'd learned to cook! Best part is getting to keep a little recipe book, so I can't wait to try it out when we get home!!

Amazing class! Must do in Ubud!. This cooking class is run by the most beautiful people you'll ever meet. Delicious food, you get to cook so much and the value for money is unbelievable. I would have paid twice as much for what we got! Very traditional and a fun and enjoyable experience. Would recommend to anyone.

Awesome experience. So we picked the right activities, it was amazing class, everyone was really enjoying it, the hosts were great, the food was great, we had a blast. Will totally recommend it to anyone who is visiting Bali.

Fun, Delicious, Great views!!. The best thing we did in Ubud! Incredible hosts, authentic cooking experience, very social and the huge outside kitchen over looks the jungle- it is stunning! Fab sun sets too- 10 out of 10 experience. I'm 24 and my friend is 27 and we had the best day... There were people from 18- 65 in our group and everyone seemed to love it. Plus the food was the tastiest I had in all of Indonesia.

A must do in Ubud. Wonderful in everything, we visited Ubud market in morning, we tried different kind of fruits and the friendly guide explained us everything. Then we stopped to see the stunning rice terraces. Arrived at their house, they offered us a welcome drink and we spoke with the hilarious husband! The cooking lesson was held by the wife and everything was perfect! We ate the food that we cooked (8 different kind), simply delicious and in big portions! After that they gave us all the recipes. Wonderful experience!

A very social cooking class. My husband found this cooking class here on Trip Advisor. And, this was the only activity we had booked prior to arriving in Bali. That says a lot, thank you to all the 5 star reviews!Let me tell you. What is included in the price: Free pick-up from & drop-off to your hotel in Ubud, a nice stop at the Ubud Market to learn about exotic fruits, flowers, and vegetables, a pit stop at the rice terraces to learn about how they work, a nice refreshing drink waiting at the class host's home, and a delicious feast of 8 dishes. What great value! I highly recommend the morning class, so that you still have the rest of your day to enjoy. It's a great class for groups, couples, and even solo travelers- there was about 15-20 people in our class from different parts of the world, and I enjoyed meeting them. Oh and I'd like to say the mushroom soup was my favorite!Puspa, you are amazing! You, your husband, and your team have put together such a nice program. We will certainly take your class again when we visit Bali next year!

Great way to spend a half day. This class ran smoothly from start to finish (pick up at hotel, trip to the market, go to house to cook) and we had a great time. Our group had 10 people so was a good size. The food was delicious, it was great to take away the recipe book, excellent spoken English made it easy to follow and the hosts were fantastic.We had a really enjoyable experience and would recommend it to others. Thanks Puspa and everyone else involved for such a nice day :).

A lecture class more than hands on. A good thing about this Paon Bali is their will pick u up in any Ubud hotel or resortsPick up 8.30amGo to Ubud Market till 9.30amBack to Paon school 10amStarts lecture and cooking 12pmFinish 1-1.30pmBe prepare to finish half a day there.Payment by Cash only and come with their recipe book - 350,000 k per person.Paon Bali should set in a small scale instead of 20 people. Around 10 people is good. We get to prepare our own food - not mixing with other people cook food.Nothing great to whoa about.If you guys want to cook, look around Ubud Town - such as Cafe Wayan.

Fabulous cooking experience in Ubud. My mom and I did a Thursday morning cooking class with Paon that included the market tour and we absolutely loved it. The organization was seamless and stellar. Pickups happend on time. The guides were friendly, professional, informative, and spoke very good English. We enjoyed the market tour and tasting the various locally grown fruits, smelling the local spices, and walking through the colourful chaos that characterizes the site. After we drove maybe 10 minutes to a house in a nearby village where the actual cooking class took place. The place was spotless and had an incredible view from the second floor open kitchen over the jungle. Again, the organization was fantastic. The food was prepped so that we got to do all the fun stuff and none of the tedious work. The staff was all so friendly and helpful and extremely conscientious of cleanliness and sanitation. They washed their hands frequently, had us do the same, and used hand sanitizer to show us before touching any food. Our class size was small (8 people), which was fantastic for getting hands on and we had a really nice group. There were two other classes running simultaneously in different kitchens throughout the house, but the setup was so thoughtfully considered that we hardly even knew they were there. I've heard the menu is pretty similar from school to school but I can't complain one bit because every dish was delicious! We made 8 things in total: Balinese salad, yellow sauce (the key ingredient in 70% of Indo dishes we learned), peanut sauce, gado-gado, satay lilit, chicken curry, fried tempeh, and boiled bananas and jackfruit for dessert. We left with full bellies, a booklet full of recipes, and smiles on our faces from the wonderful staff and the hilarious jokes from Puspa, the matron of the house and the mastermind behind the Paon school.We'd definitely recommend this to anyone looking to do a cooking class in Ubud. It was a great experience.

A refreshing taste of Bali in Ubud, excellent cooking class. We booked the cooking class after reading reviews on TripAdvisor, the class was a fraction of the cost of booking a cookery class with our hotel at 350,000pp (£20)We were picked up at 8.15am from our hotel in a people carrier (this was included in the price), and collected another couple en route. We visited Ubud Market and had a tour guide who spoke English very well. He described importance of temples and offerings in Hinduism culture prior to touring the market. In the market we tried various fruits from Bali and he showed us stalls relating to our cookery class (spices, meats, utensils to buy..) From here we drove to a local paddy field and had an opportunity to take photos. From here we could see other people carriers who were also on the tour. Each car arrived at the cookery class and we were greeted with an iced glass of lemon drink. One of the hosts spent 5-10 mins giving a talk about Balianise culture and their home (I won't give any spoilers!) it was really insightful and each person who was hosting the class was friendly and kind.  the class, (which had about 20 people take part) was well organised. All the food was weighed with veggies peeled ready. We were given tea and coffee before starting and each an apron and cloth. Excellent hygiene throughout. We each chopped various elements to each dish, the host described each dish we were going to make and kept reminding us of how the elements came together. We split into pairs and used a burner between us to make dishes, contents were combined before being served. The food was amazing, we were each given a recipe book with the indonesian name of dishes in addition to English titles. We emailed the class for the chicken stock recipe after we left and we're given the recipe within a day! The class was fantastic, lots of opportunities to experience traditional Balianise Cooking - totally recommend this experience for anyone in the area.
Best cooking class in Bali. Great teacher, great food, great people and great class. Very friendly environment and the freshness of food is amazing. You learn to prepare the food, cook it and eat it
Wonderful morning. Amazing food, beautiful people. We had a great time. We will definitely be taking these recipes home and making them part of our repertoire.

Take this class!!!. We took this class as couple and had a ton of fun. We begun are day meeting in the market where we were met by our guide and given a tour of the market to see what the ingredients we would be using later looked like. We were driven to the class site, which is a large private home in the midst of rice fields, just outside of the main city. We learned more about the ingredients and how we could source or substitute them if unavailable back home. We were divided into small groups where we were instructed in a step-by-step process to prepare and then cook the dishes. Once the cooking was complete, we enjoyed the fruits of our labor, a delicious multiple course Balinese meal.

Cool cooking class. It starts with a tour at the local market and a short stop at the rice fields of Ubud. The cooking class itself was good. 30 people in total. It seemed to be a little too much of a show but nevertheless it was yummy and much fun.

Very good activity!!!. It was great from start to finish. They come pick you up at your hotel (drop you off after as well), visit of The Ubud market (just if you do morning class) and arrival at cooking class. The owner Puspa is really nice, funny and A great teacher! Her team of employees are really well trained and super Nice. The kitchen is big, outdoor, clean!!! So much food! Sooooooo good! And you leave with the recipes so you can cook at home! One of my Best meal and definitely The Best 350k spent in Bali!Strongly recommended!

One more for the good luck, Honey.. was a great morning and early afternoon, nice atmosphere, learnt actually a lot and had a great meal afterwards. I can only reccomend this cooking class. Great price-value ratio!

Ok, Honey!? What a Fabulous Time.. Met many new people and enjoyed the communal and social nature of the activity. Food preferences/needs are accommodated and kids around 10 and up could easily participate. You get to attempt every component of each meal prepared (about 7 from memory).Much fun and highly recommended.
Yummy food. Great day out going through marketplace of the locals and then back to the house to cook. Nice size of 8 in group and made 8n dishes all super tasty.

Cooking class between friends. We went there with a friends and we had sone very good times at paon bali cooking. Hosts were very terrific! The place is also very nice with a view on a jungle valley. Everything has been said already about the cooking itself. I highly recommend it.

Vegan-friendly Food Treat. The two owners are so fantastically friendly. The entire way through they were so helpful and kind, making sure we were asked whether we ate various foods, or whether we needed food cooked separately. Their menu is (according to them) 70% vegetarian anyway.But the most important part is that the food is delicious. I mean REALLY delicious. Getting to cook it (and do no dishes!) and then feast upon the beautiful food (lots of food, too, so you can properly feast). So much better than any restaurant. Very very happy with this class and would definitely recommend it to anyway - vegetarian or meat-eater alike.

Nice food but classes too big. Picked this course from tripadvisor recommendations. For me, it was not what I expected. The market tour involved standing around being spoken to about fruits etc rather than focusing on and buying the ingredients for the dishes we were to cook. There were way too many of us in the group (26). The cooking class itself was more of a chopping experience. I didn't get to make a dish from start to finish and even when we did cook ingredients off, they were just added to a big dish with everyone else's so I didn't get to taste how I cooked it. Pros:-Pick up and collection from accommodation-lovely, tasty food-nice hostsCons:-class size WAY too big, you get lost in the group.-don't really get to cook anything from start to finish- a lot of waiting around during the day (in the market, waiting for others to chop etc)

Best way to experience great Balinese cooking. This cooking class is run by a husband and wife duo who are inviting students into their home to enjoy and learn to prepare an authentic Balinese dinner. Honestly, I wasn't expecting much but this family is a pro both in their presentation, student involvement and final results. Set in their home on the side of a mountain. (the view itself was a trip in itself) I was one of 19 other students and one minute you can be chopping vegetable or spices, then simmering sauces and then rolling tuna in banana leaves. Everything just ran so well. Great cooking class.

Cooking class a must!. This cooking class was exceptional. They picked us up from the hotel, took is to the markets and then back to their home for the class. The whole family was friendly and helpful and funny. We had such an amazing meal that we cooked!

Fusion of Balinese culture and cuisine. We were picked up from our accommodation and taken to the Ubud markets. While essential for those not familiar with Asian foods, a smaller village style market would have been a more personal experience. The hosts were welcoming, knowledgeable, and entertaining. We loved the cultural explanation of family life in Bali and. were made to feel at home. The cooking experience was well-organised, efficient, instructive and highly enjoyable. This activity is highly recommended for any traveller wishing to have a hands on experience of Balinese culture anc cuisine.

Cooking class in Ubud. Initially I was a little concerned with the number of people enrolled in the class. The shopping at the market was informative for those new to Far East Asia, however if you've travelled in Asia, it's not too interesting. Once we got to the home of Wayan and Puspa, the real fun begins. The kitchen was very well organized, it didn't feel crowded, and the staff was knowledgeable and spoke good English to answer any of your culinary questions. We cooked 7 dishes and one dessert. The food was delicious and plentiful. Wayan and Puspa are lovely and I'm happy to have spent half a day with them.

Very well organized cooking class. As promised we were picked up from our villa outside Ubud and brought to the market for a quick walk through & introduction to the local fruits (including free tasting), herbs & spices on sale as well as a cooking utensils stall. The market was very dirty & unpleasant to walk through but it was full of color and vibrancy.
