Then a stop by some rice terraces with our driver guide who gives us some idea of how rice is grown and harvested and also a little bit about the composition and families which make up the villages around Ubud.Finally we make it to Paon's house. With our welcome nice cold drink we sit around the courtyard whilst Paon welcomes us to his courtyard and explains a little about the layout of Bali houses and their compounds.Then we are introduced to his lovely wife and the cooking lesson begins in her lovely wide open kitchen - well thought out layout - work tables - burners (switch on your engines), a wonderful team of assistants getting all our cooking utensils and ingredients ready for us to cook. We are all given opportunities to cut, dice, crush, grind, mash up ingredients using traditional Bali utensils - lots of action and fun and of course cooking our own lunch and eating it. Great fun and great way to spend a day.....
Wonderful Experience. Great 1/2 day in Ubud - starting at the hotel - they pick you up. Then visiting the market; cooking, eating, meeting people from all over. Highly recommended!!
Enjoyable!!. It was an excellent experience to learn Balinese cuisine, the instructor has a sense of humor and it's great attending a class with different nationalities.
Great host . Very fun experience cooking 8 dishes Indonesian food. The class is very well organized and the food is great! The host is very friendly and lovely too :)

Cooking Class Paon Bali. Better experience than I expected. Very well organised, Easy to participate and understand. Lovely hosts. Vegetarian alternatives and allergies accommodated. Well worth doing!

Wondeful Cooking Class in Ubud. This class was one of the best activities I had in Bali, and I absolutely loved it! The class was very hands on and I got to truly experience Balinese food. We made lots of delicious food and stunning green view while laughing and enjoying other wonderful people's company.

Fantastic!!!. We had a blast at Paon Bali Cooking Class learning to make authentic and delicious Balinese dishes. It was a fun activity to do as a family. Puspa and her team made it such an enjoyable evening. I would highly recommend this cooking school.
Cooking up a feast. What a great experience. This is a great course for all levels of cooking as there is so much to learn. The food, location and hosts are a winning combination.

Great cooking class in Ubud. This has fantastic reviews on Trip Advisor and it is easy to see why. The family were extremely welcoming and gave us an insight into Balinese culture as well as cuisine. It was great as a soloTraveller as there was a large group who all mixed well. The setting was beautiful and as I took the afternoon class saw a beautiful sunset.

Joanie Winter. This was the second time I've experienced this amazing Balinese Cooking Class. I brought my friends, and they were blown away with the day. As you prepare the food, your senses are titillated with the aromas. A must to do when you first come to Ubud, as you gain so much knowledge of Balinese cooking and food. It helps in ordering food in Ubud. The location in a village home near padi fields is an experience you'll never get with other cooking classes. An affordable and well prepared day, with the hospitality that only the Balinese can extend.Highly recommended.

Worth every cent and more. This was one of our favourite days in Indo, learnt a lot about the region, how to prepare some delicious new meals and laughed non-stop!Highly recommended, suitable for any level of cooking and everyone gets a chance to participate as much/little as they like.The market was very interesting and our guide extremely knowledgeable and friendly (thank you!). Our chef/owner had a lovely sense of humour and planned the day perfectly - we wouldn't change a thing.Well done on such a perfectly executed day and thank you for all the fun!

Amazing food with a big smile!. Such a great experience we had learning about Balinese cuisine and cooking hands on our own tasty (8) recipes with Pushpa, who is the most charismatic host we could ask for.10/10 cleanliness and 10/10 taste.

Nice to Learn Cooking with Ibu Puspa. The best day I ever spent with my father inlaw. We learn cooking from Sate, Base Gede,tempe manis, soup dan sayur urabThe owner Ibu Puspa is very great welcoming and best cook teacherEvery guest should try here when you want to learn cooking.We will back again.
Fabulous. The cooking class was amazing, the food was delicious. And you could watch the Sunset as you ate dinner. Everyone was so welcoming. Great price and one of my favorites in Bali.

Fantastic day . I found this cooking school as number 1 on TripAdvisor so thought I'd give it a go even though it was slightly more pricey than others after speaking to other backpackers in ubud. The day is 350,000 rs. However, I had such a great time! They picked me up at 8.25 and we walked to ubud market where we were told about the local fruits, vegetables and spices on offer. We even got to try local fruits such as snake fruit, mangosteen and hairy fruit. Next we got in the taxi and they dropped us off at a local rice paddy to take some pictures (stunning!) before driving to the cooking school. Our cooking host is the most adorable lady, you just want to take her home!! We were greeted on arrival with a cold refreshing lime squash as she introduced herself and the history of the house. Next we went inside and another welcome drink was waiting for us, either local coffee or lemongrass and ginger tea. Our group was about 20 but the room was plenty big enough that it didn't feel like a big group at all, it still felt very personal. We all got involved in the prep and then paired up for the cooking. Once everything was made we sat together and ate our delicious local dishes! Another hot drink and dessert finished the day off perfectly and we were presented with a booklet of her recipes to take home and a request to keep in touch. A perfect day with the most lovely people.

Great afternoon with our host and hostess!. Great afternoon with Pushpa ( the most beautiful wife in Bali as described by her husband) and all the lovely people who helped to give us a fantastic cooking experience.8 courses of food...company and atmosphere on our table was awesome; 2 lads from Netherlands and 2 female doctors from Australia.PBM will never be the same for us again, thanks to Pushpa. If you want to know the meaning, check out Paon on your next trip to Bali.We totally recommend!!
Charismatic family teaching tasty food . This was a really well organised cooking class. If you're in Bali you should learn how to make yellow curry, and this is the place to do it.

Exquisite experience. What a great way to spend a day in Bali. Visiting the markets in Ubud, seeing the rice fields then onto the cooking extravaganza. All fresh ingredients and brilliant cooking teachings from their staff. Overall a great recommendation for anyone visiting Bali.

Tasty & frienmdky. Puspa runs the school with a twinkling sense of humour but also a determination to be outstanding. Her variety of dishes is impressive - 6 prepared over three hours - and then we ate, well! Super fresh (and clean), this is an outstanding way to dive head first in Balinese cooking.

Revived my interest in cooking. Just finished a cooking class with my husband and a great bunch of people we never knew. The class was so well organized, presented with humor and delight, and a complete delight to be part of. We tried foods that were new to us and learnt new skills in making pastes using the balinese"blender". Finally we shared a meal had some great laughs and shared some travel tips with some lovely young people who it was a pleasure to meet. Well done Puspa, happy wife- happy life. Many thanks.

Highlight of the Holiday!. The traditional Balinese cooking experience with Wayan and Puspa was outstanding!! This was definitely one of the highlights of our trip to Bali and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a traditional, but highly entertaining evening.Thank you for hosting us with such warmth!

Amazing Experience!!!. Wonderful experience for a intermediate cooker for myself! Both husband and wife were very entertaining the whole time. I among my 5 other friends were welcomed with "welcome drinks." Very refreshing for such a hot day! The presentation of the food before it was prepped was key to the instruction. We when through a series of preps for the several different dishes and were served our appetizer of soup half way through. Every thing was thorough and explained perfectly throughout the learning experience. Our instructor was extremely accommodating to one of our friends who was unfortunately experiencing stomach and headache issues before and throughout our day. My friend was feeling so bad that our instructor offered her very own bed and at the end, did not charge my friend for the experience because she was not able to participate during most of the lessons! How amazing and generous these people were! If I could give all 30 stars on behalf of my friends, I would. Truly an unforgettable experience. I felt like an adopted daughter in a new home. :)

Great class, funny hosts, learned a lot about Balinese culture. This is the first cooking class I've taken here, and wasn't disappointed. I took it with Husband, and we spent several hours learning about the food, the culture, even the architecture of a traditional Hindu home. Both Husband and I are very happy that we went.The class started with a trip to the local outdoor food market. Wow. Talk about a very eye-opening experience. Our host for this part of the trip was one of the assistants in the kitchen. He knew the vendors in the market and used their products for us to taste and touch. Being from a very sterile, Western culture, I found some of the food handling and storage shocking to say the least. Fascinating. Sometimes downright gross, but always interesting.Then we drove out to the rice paddies outside the hosts' village and had a mini lesson there about how this grain is cultivated and how big a part it plays in their lives and diet.And then we went to the home of the hosts, Puspa and Wayan. We were welcomed with a fresh limeaide drink (using bottled water so as to avoid getting "Bali Belly") and a speech from Wayan. He's really funny and charming. ("Happy wife, happy life!") He said many times that we should consider his home our home.Then off to the kitchens we went and started prepping food. We chopped, we sliced, we diced, pestled, sauteed and fried. Eight dishes later, we sat down for a delicious traditional Balinese meal that we had created with Puspa's guidance. She is also very funny and charming. "Honeyyyy!" she'd yell after almost every sentence. Haha. I can still hear her voice in my head. It has the same tonal quality as the actress in That Seventies Show who plays the mother, married to Red. Hilarious.If you're looking for a class that has not only traditional Balinese food at its core but also the added bonuses of a Balinese cultural education, by all means check this class out. You'll meet and share time with some other very enthusiastic tourists from around the world and feel like part of a special family by the time you leave.Of note: Puspa asked all of us to come to her if we had any problems whatsoever so she could fix things for us and for future classes. She only wants 5 stars on Trip Advisor reviews because this is how they make their living. They are very focused on ensuring their guests are happy and satisfied. I was happy to give 5 stars because they earned it. Also, our driver we paid separately, although he was arranged to pick us up by the cooking class. You could probably get one cheaper if you arrange it outside of their class on your own. We paid 650,000 rupiah for the day (because we went to another different workshop after before going back to Seminyak), and our other driver only charges us 450,000 for a full day of driving. I'm sure you can get it even cheaper if you wish, but we're happy to pay a fair price for a day's work. 650 seemed expensive for this area.

Good experience. The market experience to start with is great, so you do understand where everything is coming from. The cooking class was really good, in the palace that this lady has built to herself and her family, good for her! The ingredients used and the ladies helping the "boss" where just perfect, and this is the only down side of this business, that the boss is wondering around like a queen and even telling us how we should rate her cooking class on tripadvisor. I think she should stay with only one group of people, do the introductions to everybody and then maybe the ending part, and thats it! Let your amazing staff do their job!

Perfect cooking class. I had SO much fun. I feel like everything has already been said here. So just to add- yes, it is a big group- but no, it doesn't influence the quality of the experience. The class was perfect in timing, the food was outstanding.. The staff is pleasant, welcoming and funny. You learn a whole lot about culture in Bali. Fantastic experience, for foodies especially ;)

Best cooking class in Ubud. We wanted to do something different for our second trip to Bali, therefore my husband and I signed up for a cooking class. Read from tripadvisor about Paon cooking class and has very high review on the lesson, we decided to sign up the class! Indeed, we never regretted it and it was one of the best experience we ever have. The class is fruitful and interesting that we can taste and learn the different ingredient in Balinese cuisine.

Awesome day awesome experience!. Lovely and familiar host! You get treated like a family member and it is an awesome feeling.The dishes are traditional, even the way of blending and preparing of the food. Definitely worth and a experience for a lifetime.You arrive with a simile and leave with a bigger one... and you are not hungry for the rest of the day!

Fantastic experience!. Starts with a tour of the market, then the local village where the course is located. The course itself was fantastic - located in a traditional homestead with stunning views. And the food - best food we have had on our trip so far. Highly, highly recommended!

Th best Cooking School in Bali ❤️😍😎💋👠💄👗💃💃💃💃💃💃💃. This cooking class is th best, we had so much fun and learnt to cook authentic Balinese food which will really delight and impress our family and friends back home.The food was to die for and so so much of it !!!We went to th afternoon one, which was amazing, th took us to a,rice field and we were able to take the most wonderful photos of us all, th th cooking school.I have been to many all over Thailand, Bali and Malaysia and this one I's THE Best !!!!

Fun and informative day!. We did the Paon Cooking class on our 2nd day in Bali after finding it on trip advisor. Was great to learn about the local cuisine at the beginning of our holiday. Visit to markets was really cool especially to learn about the local produce. Wayan and Puspas home was well presented, clean and had lots of fun! would definitely recommend to others!

Most memorable experience in Bali. My bf does not enjoy cooking that much, and if someone like him can leave raving about this cooking class then take it from me, this is something worth doing in Ubud! The staff were warm, funny, well organized and very engaging. Beautiful experience overall. Can't recommend this enough!

Best cooking class - and catered perfectly for vegetarians!!. Puspa and her husband were so welcoming - I particularly appreciated them catering for not only vegetarian but also my no onion or garlic diet!! Made a completely separate yellow sauce (the base of a lot of Balinese flavour) and everything - just for me! We were made comfortable the whole time we were there and actually covered a lot of things - market tour, traditional house, rice fields and even a music lesson on their bamboo xylophone! Amazing and really recommend the day!!!

Agree with Number 1 rating, Great way to learn Basic Bali cooking. I great way to spend 5-6 hours in Ubud. From start (picked up on time) to finish, the class was well done. You can tell they have done this many times. We were a group of 20+ tourists, which concerned me, how do you do a hands on cooking class with that many? Not to worry, they have it all figured out.Quick stop on the way at the Ubud food market. Not really impressive, and winding down by 9AM when we got there. Then a quick stop at some rice fields, great photo ops. Also got a better idea of the ups and downs of the Ubud geography. Arrive at the private home of Puspa And Wayan, great hosts.We then cooked an 8 course meal. Chopped up all the mis-en-place in teams, (it's amazing what 25 pairs of hands can get done.) Then one by one we sauted, stir fried, or poached our way to lunch. It was delicious.And a very affordable 350,000 Rupee, or about $29 US per person.Don't miss it.

Best cooking class!. My friend and I took this class and it was AMAZING! The hosts (husband and wife) are VERY good at showing you a good time and show you how to make the BEST food! Such a great time!!!! Would definitely recommend!
Fantastic food experience. Great value for money! Charismatic hosts and a great location in which to spend 4 hrs cooking and eating traditional food. Highly recommend

Well worth a visit. We had great evening at the cookery class. The ingredients were all well explained- including what to use if we can't source then at home. Wayan was just brilliant. Thanks for a great experience!

True Authentic Balinese Cooking. Puspa and Wayan deliver what they promise. The cooking class was one of the highlights of our trip. We started with an Ubud market tour at 8:30am and spent the next 5 hours being thoroughly entertained by Puspa and her team of cooks and kitchen hands. Our class of seven prepared and cooked our lunch (with the help of Puspa's team doing the dishes and cleaning up after us). Was an awesome experience and would thoroughly recommend the Paon Bali Cooking Class.

Fun, professional yet traditional, and so tasty!. We loved our afternoon cooking class and dinner with Puspa and Wayan. We were in a group of 9 people of all ages and nationalities, and we all had an opportunity to learn and try different preparation and cooking techniques in a fun atmosphere and beautiful setting, and also to socialise. It was a great insight into the Balinese lifestyle, and Puspa was an excellent teacher, whilst also being very entertaining. I was also very impressed with her careful attention to hygiene and safety. By 6.45pm we were sitting down to the eight course dinner which we had prepared and cooked. An excellent experience, and very well priced!

Utterly amazing!. My friends and I had an utterly amazing cooking experience. A driver was sent to our villa to pick us up in the morning and we were taken on a small tour of the markets. After the markets we were taken to a home, where the cooking class is held. Puspa and her family were very welcoming and accommodating. We were shown a multitude of dishes, all in which we were very hands on with. After the class we sat down to a very lovely and filling meal (the fruits of our labour). Everyone was given a recipe book, with easy step by step instructions, allowing us to recreate these wonderful dishes at home.

Excellent hosts and amazing food!!. Absolutely loved this cooking class. The main host was friendly and informative. Recipes were provided for us to take home! Food was delicious!!! Great day, great value for money!! Would go again!!

Great, friendly Balinese cooking. It's hard to imagine better hosts as you're taken into their home and entertained with their great humour and friendliness. This course is suitable for all ages and a great introduction to balinese cuisine, the 8 dishes you learn to make are delicious and easy to prepare.

Great value, lovely people, our food tasted great!. Startes with tour of market to learn about fruits and spices, stopped off at a rice paddy, then the cooking. All up about 5 hours - lots of fun, hands on. Only reason why i give it 4 stars and not 5 stars is that a lot of the food prep was done for us - however, it would have taken a full day otherwise! Everything was clean, the food tasted great, the hosts were awesome. We paid 350k idr.

Second time just as good!!!. Did this class a few years back and thoroughly enjoyed it so when a friend came with me to Bali I knew it was an essential thing to do The owners are funny, warm ,very knowledgable and most importantly concerned about food safety and that is a plus It was slightly different than my previous class as we didn't stop in the rice fields to learn about rice production and harvest which was very interestingI think that the flow of the class is better thoughAnd I think we made more dishes I was lucky to be in a class with only 7 other people , although the earlier class was still enjoyable with quite a few more people We communally did the prep and then in groups of two cooked our food. I appreciated the fact that Puspa gave alternatives to ingredients that might be hard to find All in all we made a soup , 6 mains and a dessert .All incredibly yummy
Great experience. Was a great experience. The booking was same morning and they sent immediately the direver to my hotel, nice people and good food.

World class experience!. Paon Bali cooking class is a world class experience. If you do anything in Ubud I highly recommend it be this cooking class. Host were friendly, funny, and highly personable. The class normally last the first half of the day and price includes transportation.

highlight of my short stay in Ubud. Unlike most visitors to Bali, I came for work and so was not overly interested in the typical tourist attractions. Taking a cooking class however helps you to understand the local culture, its food and customs - and introduces you to some fun people - very nice perk for solo travelers like me. Together the 7 of us chopped and mashed and stirred and cooked following the instructions of our charming hostess. We made a soup and about 6 main course dishes and a dessert. Everything was well organized and explained - top notch hygienic conditions were followed and we had a lot of fun. We consumed our tasty fixings and I'm pleased to say I was able to take home a doggie bag so I can enjoy it again tomorrow (thanks to the frig in my apartment). I especially appreciated the pick up and drop off service and the 4 hour event is such a good value at only $26. I highly recommend Paon Bali Cooking class. Bonnie

Paon cooking Classes ! ! !. This is a 'must-thing-to-do-in-Bali'.The staff are very friendly & helpfull. They really know how to treat people well and their home is very clean. Most other classes charge around $50 !, but this class is only $35 each. Overall I give this a solid 10/10. Well Done !!!! Also check-out the local attractions around Ubud.

Very inspriring day. This cookery school was recommended to me. The day was very well organised and I received quick repsonses to my emails prior to the day itself. We started with a look around the market and heard about the local fruits and spices (Ubud market isn't the prettiest, but it was interesting to learn about the products). Then we briefly visited the rice paddies to learn about rice growing. Then onto the house of Puspa and Wayan where we cooked. It was a lovely setting overlooking the jungle and the kitchen was outdoors yet covered. I was surprised that our group was large (17 people) but there was plenty of space for everyone. Puspa was a great teacher and kept everyone working throughout the morning. We cooked 7 different dishes and they were all incredibly tasty. You eat everything that you cook. Being given the recipes to take home is a great way to finish the day. The only negative for me was the pick up from my hotel - They were 25 minutes late and then a girl turned up on a motorbike and took me down the road to the market to meet the rest of the group - I didn't mind this too much, but it was less professional than the rest of the day.

Amazing people, amazing food, amazing value . This was one of the highlights of our trip to Bali. Puspar, Made and their family go all out to make this a fulfilling experience as well as making some really tasty food. Can't fault it. Thank you!!

Amazing Experience. The owners emphasized several times that we should think of their home as our second home. They were warm and welcoming and fun and funny. And the food was incredible! They fully accommodated for the vegetarians and took extra precautions to make sure the food/water/ice would not make any non-accustomed stomachs sick. I was picked up at 0815 and dropped off at my hotel by 1400 so it is a long day but I highly recommend this experience!!

Great experience. We found this class on TripAdvisor and was so glad we tried it. I emailed several other classes as my husband and I are vegans and I have several allergies, these guys had a really good menu and they were also reasonably priced. We were picked up from our hotel for the afternoon class. Both wayan and his wife are funny and entertaining, his wife guiding us in the kitchen. Taking note of our dietary requirements we were well looked after. Everyone got to experience chopping, preparing, making, cooking each dish, and it was all very well explained. The ladies assisting the process were funny and helpful as well. The food at the end was delicious! Highly recommended!

Great way to spend time in Ubud, Bali!. We loved everything about Paon Bali, you feel just like visiting great friends :) The food is very delicious and the preparation is easy and enjoyable. I will definitely suggest Paon Bali to my friends and hope to be back soon :)

For someone that doesn't really cook I found this class really enjoyable and learnt so much.. Really well organised class and for half a day we made so much. Super friendly and informative guidance and gorgeous cooking surrounds in a Balanese courtyard setting. One of the highlights of my trip and has inspired me to do more cooking classes in other places I visit.

Must-do!. This a must do while in Ubud. A morning very well spent. Could've skipped the traditional market though.
Very well organized and it certainly qualifies as a class. You walk away feeling confident you can cook the dishes taught and this is coming from a dude who doesn't cook.

So many reasons why it's number 1!. The location is gorgeous, the staff are fantastic and the whole day was inspiring! Warung and his family are so thoughtful to let us share their home for the day and learn and cook so many delicious meals.There is a reason why this is the number one cooking school! Its a must do, even if you're staying in Seminyak and have to make the trip up there! Sooo affordable and great communication via their website.10 stars!

Great experience & amazing recipes to take home!. We had such a fantastic time at the Paon Bali cooking class. The market was so informative and our guide was really knowledgable, showing us the spices, fruits and veg we'd be cooking that day. We then headed to Pusba's beautiful house, where her husband took us through the history and rituals of their home and family. They are a great team, very entertaining together.The food we cooked was delicious. 8 different meals, very hands-on and fun for the whole group. Two members had children and they were very well looked after by the family too, and we all sat around eating together. It was very sociable and interactive. The food was so delicious and very easy to make at home. Would definitely recommend.

Best cooking school ever!. I have done this class twice and each time it has been fantastic. I took my mother the first time and my son for his 16th birthday and they both loved it. The morning session includes the market and rice paddy tour as well as the cooking class... it is amazing value for money and the food is out of this world. Puspa and Wayan welcome you to their home and you really feel like part of the family, Wayan is an absolute hoot and his ex girlfriend (his now wife lol) is just beautiful. Can not recommend this place any more!!! Do it!!

AMAZING!!! She needs her own cooking show! *wink*wink. Just like what all the other reviewers have said previously. This is THE Best cooking class out there. Such a beautiful home. Great experience! I can not wait to get home to recreate this experience. She also sends you home with all the recipes of everything you cooked in the class. Worth every penny!! Thank you

Amazing class and experience!. We are so happy that we took this cooking class! They picked us up from our hotel and we first went to the market in town and then to rice fields where we learned about the ingredients we would be cooking with before arriving at their home for the class. Everything was very well organized and Puspa and her team were amazing! We had an amazing time and not only got to learn how to cook traditional Balinese dishes, but we also learned a lot about their culture. The best part was that the food prepared was delicious! Would definitely recommend this class, its absolutely fantastic!

Fantastic class, amazing experience!. Puspa and Wayan are lovely people who have created an out of world experience with this class.We loved every bit of this class... from the ingredients to the stories to the utensils and the lighthearted banter!I recommend this class to all!

Great value and Amazon experience. . Definitely worth every penny. From the market visit to the rice fields and then the cooking lessons...everything was well-organized and executed. Had an amazing time and the food we made was delicious! Can't wait to try the recipes at home in Canada!

Amazing class and not just cooking. I strongly recommend the morning class, because besides the cooking we also went to morning traditional market and rice fields. There are different guide to explain everything. Puspa was our teacher and she was so nice and funny. The other staff are also proffesional and kind. We really enjoy cooking in that peaceful place.
Great course!. Learnt so much, had a great meal, and enjoyed the company - all for less than the price of a decent Balinese meal in Melbourne!

Well organized class!. What I have learned is that using just one basic curry sauce can help to create Balinese salad, appetizer and main dishes!The course first started off with visiting the local market, which was an interesting tour. The class size is just about right as we had nine people. The instructor explained each ingredient in detail and the preparation flow was well organized. All the final products were delicious with different flavors. The environment is nice and clean and it was definitely an enjoyable lesson.
Best cooking class ever . Best experience ever! Must do!!! Lots of laughs and food was the best! Great cultural experience do not miss out when in Ubud!

A highlight of our Bali Holiday. We selected this cooking class purely based on TripAdvisor reviews & it certainly did not disappoint! We participated in the afternoon class & were picked up from our accommodation in Ubud. First we visited the rice fields nearby to the class & we were given an explanation of the growing of rice which was great.Puspa was our host & she was simply amazing offering such warm Balinese hospitality. The class is hands on & we are offered alternative ways to making the dishes/different ingredients in case we were unable to obtain them back home. Once all of the dishes were complete we were able to enjoy the final product. There was plenty of food to go around our class of 10 and it was simply delicious, some of the best food that we had tried in Bali during our holiday.I would highly recommend this tour if you have time while staying in Ubud.
Very nice experience. Very nice experience and great food. Everything was organised well and the venue was perfect for cooking outside.

Signed up for a cooking class, got a standup comedy + cooking class in one. Auntie Puspa and her staff knows how to run a cooking class, and provide you standup comedy at the same time.We were taken on a tour of the local market in the morning and were shown spices, fruits and other ingredients. The market was bustling and colourful. Not for cleanliness freaks, this is a wet market, get over it.Over at Auntie Puspa's house we did the cooking class. In total our class had 9 people, which I think was just right. There were enough "stations" and equipment set up such that everyone could rotate among various different tasks such as chopping/slicing/pounding/frying, etc. If you had any problems, the staff would be there to make sure everything is alright.We got introduced to the ingredients and their alternatives (in case you couldn't find those ingredients locally). The staff were very experienced and managed time very well. There was a good balance of explanation, demonstration and practical hands-on time with the cooking. The instructions were peppered with jokes in between for great entertainment. At the end we got to eat the meals that we cooked, which was absolutely delicious and too much for our group to finish. You get to bring back a set of the recipes of the meal you cooked. Puspa also offered to answer any questions you might have about other dishes, over email.This activity is also great for family bonding.I am so glad that I signed up our entire family for Auntie Puspa's cooking class. You should do the same. You will have no regrets. Expect to be entertained. Expect to learn cooking. Expect an awesome lunch.
Lunch. We went to cooking class today was the best class we have been to yet not to mention the best food we have eaten in Bali this trip round. Can't wait to go again

A wonderful and relaxing experience!. This was definitely one of my favorite experiences in Bali. After a little tour of the Ubud market getting schooled on the many varieties of fruits, spices, meat, etc, we made our way to the private residence of Puspa. Once greeted by her entertaining hubby with a delicious, refreshing drink and given an introduction of what to expect for the afternoon, we were ushered into our kitchen, complete with gorgeous views! Our group was upstairs with an open air kitchen and intimate eating area. The cooking class flowed extremely well at all times. Unfortunately, the exuberant Puspa was working with the class downstairs but her staff that assisted us were extremely helpful and very friendly! We made 8 different dishes ~ all very flavorful and fresh! The best part was the recipe book given each participant at the end. I'm still working hard to find tempeh in Korea to make my favorite dish. Thanks so much!

Very relaxing but efficient. Our family went to the class together. We had so much fun working together to cook a delicious lunch. The pace of the class was great. We always had something to do or eat but never felt rushed or bored. The teacher and her husband were so humorous. I loved how she called everybody 'honey'! My 12 year old daughter especially loved it!

Excellent cooking class with entertaining host. This was our second time taking Paon cooking class. We enjoyed it so much 2 years ago and weren't disappointed this time. The class is a bit large but the quality of food we cooked was great. I must say that if you are a professional cook or really serious about cooking, you might be disappointed as the class if for general public who wants to spice up their cooking. The class is designed as much entertainment as a cooking class.

Balinese Food. Great fun experience. Pupa is not only entertaining but an excellent teacher. Wonderful ways with natural fresh ingredients. What you cook you eat-delicious. Very good value-would highly recommend this visit

Lovely cooking class in spacious home setting. My boyfriend and I really enjoyed this group cooking class at the home of Puspa and Wayan. They have a great rhythm that allows everyone to participate in each dish and results in a delicious feast! Met some other friendly travelers and had a great time :) highly recommended. Can't wait to try out the recipe book that we brought home!

Will come again. . Great service great food and great hospitality. My partner and my friends went to the morning session. Started off with a kind driver who picked us up. Went to the market which he explained and let us taste some fruits. Than off to the cooking place which was also the owners home. Very beautiful house. We were welcomed with a refreshment and welcomed and greeted by the owner. She was very kind, funny and helpful. We cooked 7 courses and it was all delicious. The price was also very reasonable. 350000idr. Would recommend and come her again. My friends also couldn't stop talking about the great experience.

Interesting Local cooking experience. The cooking class is a great experience in Ubud. Great class structure- a short trip to Ubud marketing -> rice field -> welcome drink/ short-break-> cooking!The host (sorry I forget her name) gives very clear and precise instruction yet keeping the class at a very relax and enjoyable experience. The staff are all very helpful.The class is easy to follow and no heavy duties are involved. Recommend for all people (couples/ family/ friends) and for all cooking ability (new/ experience).
k9labrador. Fantastic day, and one of the feature tours when visiting Ubud. They make it a lot of fun, which is what the holiday should be.

Had the best time! . Great beginners class! I'm not a good cook at all so this was great to do a little bit but not to much so I didn't ruin the food lol! If your wanting something more advance or one on one ask if they can provide. This was a big class but lots of fun! Suggest to do the morning class the market experience was great!
Interesting class for Balinese cuisine. Pick-up service is good and convenient. Class is interesting, food is delicious. However, it will be better to learn more if it's smaller group.

Fantastic Balinese cooking class in Ubud. Not much more that I can say that hasn't already been said! My husband and I attended a morning class which included a short tour of the local market. The class is held at the hosts' house and we had a beautiful view from the kitchen. There were 10 of us in total in my class, the instructors were all very friendly and helpful and the food delicious.We were picked up from our accommodation and dropped back. Would highly recommend Paon Cooking Class!

Fun and delicious . Loved this. Excellent market tour early in the morning, quick look at the rice fields then a visit to the owner's home with a welcome drink and kitchen to prepare delicious Balinese food. So so friendly and welcoming, great humour (had us laughing together all the way - a lot of fun) and the food is surprisingly simple to recreate at home, thanks to the recipe pamphlets you take away. Great for food enthusiasts and cooking amateurs alike.

I'm inspired to cook! . Me and my friend really wanted to do a cooking class during our Bali stay. Paon Cooking class caught our attention with the amazing reviews. And let me tell you, we were not disappointed! The food we made together was amazing, the class really inspiring (even for a person like me who's favourite dish is cereals) and our host made us feel like home in her kitchen (which btw has a great location with a nice view). If you want to take a cooking class while staying in Ubud, I find it hard to believe there's a better place then at Paon's!

Learned a lot and had fun. My husband and I enjoyed our Cooking Class in Ubud Bali. We enjoyed visiting the market and learning about the variety of fruit and vegetables Bali has along with the many spices. We learned to cook a variety of dishes that were delicious. At the end of the class, we received a booklet with all of the recipes we cooked. The class was very organized and we enjoyed meeting new people from all over the world.

Fantastic food and host! . This class was well executed and efficient. Everyone is engaged and moving all the time. The pace is fast but not at all confusing as there are enough instructors there to guide. The hosts themselves are energetic and personable and make even the most amateur cook feel like a pro.The end result is delicious - you won't even believe you cooked it!
Brilliant!. This was definitely a highlight of the time spent in Ubud. Everything was perfect and seamless. Loved it and definitely recommend.

best real balinese food during our holiday!. So glad I found this through tripadvisor! It was everything I hoped for! The trip to the market was fun and educational. Learned a few new things and got to taste some good and bad fruits hehe :P I forgot to buy a knife though... damn...The menu was delicious! Everybody made everything so you can't miss anything. And the info we got during cooking was perfect. How long can you save your food in the fridge for instance, that's always good to know. And there was enough for everybody to eat at the end. Evrybody was fully satisfied.The ony thing I didnt like was the dessert but who cares when the food has been this good!! Keep doing like you do! Loved it!

Wonderful cooking experience. From the moment I received a very speedy email reply from Puspa (The Owner of the cookery school) I knew it was going to be great. After the pick up at our Villa, arranged the day before, we went to the Ubud market to get acquainted with local produces..especially spices. A quick drive later we stopped momentarily to hear about how rice is cultivated before another very short drive to Puspa's house.We were welcomed into Puspa's home with a refreshing drink, and entertained by Puspa's husband, Wyan for a few minutes (he's a very funny guy) until it was time to get cooking. They are very friendly & hospitable people and make you feel very welcome.The class is very professional, slick, well organised and easy to take part in. Its great fun too. There were about 20 in our group from all over the world. A couple of family groups of 4, with children, some couples and a lady on her own. Everyone cooks at stations and there is always one of the many helpers on hand should you need them.You'll read a lot of good things on trip advisor about this class....and its all true. Thats how we found it and we are very glad we did. Highly recommended.

Loved, loved, loved... Just delicious. We did this cooking school, me as a very good cook and daughter and hubbie as rookies. We all enjoyed the day, the family compound is sooooo lovely and gives you a whole family history of their living. The markets and rice paddies are also of interest but it is the fresh ingredients, easy recipes, fun cooking and of course...it's all in the eating. Just a wonderful day with this lovely family and very affordable. Just do it!

An experience not to be missed . We had such a great evening at this cooking class. It was quite a big group but it was great to meet other people. The venue is up in the hills of ubud at their home and it is such a beautiful scenic space to do the class and have a meal. The staff were incredibly helpful, funny and so welcoming in their home. We got a great insight into more traditional Balinese life and how to cook some traditional Indonesian food which is often hard to find in the tourist spots of Bali. The owners clearly just love what they do and they are very successful at doing it, striving to make the class as best it can be and take on feedback from guests. A few of us even had a good gossip with puspa with some coffee after the class, showing how genuine she is about making the class an all round fantastic experience. We have done several no.1 rated cooking classes and this is certainly up there with the best. Don't leave ubud without doing this if you're interested in Indonesian food.

BEST EXPERIENCE AND COOKING CLASS IN BALI!!. This was the best thing I've done in 8 Years of travelling to Bali. 350,000 IDR (BARGAIN!) and just an unbelievably great day. We learnt so much and got to cook everything from scratch. It was Fun, Informative and SUPER TASTY!!!!! The kitchen was beautiful, immaculate and the Husband and Wife Team that run it were AMAZING!!!! We got to leave with a copy of the recipes and very happy stomachs! Learning to cook traditional Indonesian food was something i had always wanted to do and this was SO PERFECT!!

An Unmissable Experience!. Go ahead and book!!!!This full day experience is so much fun. The amount of food is astounding and the flavours are delicious!You won't be disappointed or hungry.Puspa and Wayan are so hospitable, knowledgable and friendly!I would highly recommend this fun day outing!

Amazing. Great experience! You go and cook authentic Indonesian and Balinese food with an amazing hostess. Very good food. They pick you up, you arrive at the home where you get an introduction to Balinese culture.

Awesome cooking experience!. Book it! We had a great day, started at the market, where local fruits, vegetables and spices were explained. Afterwards we cooked delicious bali meals in a small group. Everybody had something to do the whole time and we had enough time to enjoy our cooked meals without getting bored. Really friendly and funny owners and staff! Perfect experience and great recipes!

A Must !!. This cooking school exceeds all reviews -- incredible! The trip to the market if you are doing a morning session is a must and the extra insight given by going to the paddy fields really makes the experience stand out. Being welcomed into their home is such a privilege. The cooking is fun and plentiful with quality delicious food - thank you for a day to remember :)

Fantastic Traditional Cooking Class. We booked the morning/lunch class with a first up visit to the local market to view meat, fruit and spices commonly used in Balinese cooking. Then off to a local village and farming area to see rice paddies. Wayan provide an explaination of farming and local village customs as well as throwing in a joke or two. We then visited the family compound where further information on the layout and use of rooms and other family customs. Cooking class is held in a large area specifically designed and our class contained about 15 people. Thorough explanation of methods and ingredients used - with all preparation completed by yourself. Food was fantastic and recipes given to take home - even a few Balinese secrets. Vegeterians where in the class and they were well catered for as well. If you do any cooking class in Bali, i would suggest you do Wayan and Puspa's value for money class - A thoroughly enjoyable day with Wayan, Puspa and staff.

Bali's best!. If you are looking for a cooking class, this is definitely the one you should choose. It cost 350t and is definitely worth every single cent! The course is about 4 hours long, but the time fly away fast when you're having fun. I must say this was above all expectations and I would definitely do it again, no questions asked. If you really want to experience the Balinese culture, this is the way to go. Everything is authentic, tasty and fun! It's appropriate for all age groups, so people, bring both your kids and grandparents! I will assure you that you all will enjoy it.

Wonderful experience you shouldn't miss. We had the most wonderful day at the cooking class and would recommend it to everybody. When we were booking the class, we were a bit worried that it's a too touristy thing but we were pleasantly surprised. Of course, the concept is for tourists and yes, there are other guests (there were 20 people in total) but it was really like cooking with a family. A huge thank you to Wayan, his lovely wife and to the team!

Wonderful cooking class. Was in Ubud last week and booked into the wonderful cooking class held by Paon Bali Cooking Class. I arranged this before leaving Australia and received emails to confirm booking details. Pickup was on time and delivered me to the local markets where we started the day ahead. Time spent learning about and tasting some of the foods at the markets before heading to our cooking school at Laplapan Village. It was a large group of about 30 people from different parts of the world and the class was fabulous. We diced and sliced, ground and cooked our various 8 dishes for the day including desert, although the group was large it ran like clock work. Everything was very well organised, clean and lots of fun. We had the opportunity to ask questions along the way and our hosts were funny, friendly and fabulous. Lunch was enjoyed by all and located in a beautiful setting in Ubud, thank you for a wonderful class, great value and I will certainly be back next time when visiting and would recommend highly for others to enjoy.

Best cooking class I have been to. . Thank you for the most amazing morning of cooking. The food was fantastic and the hosts were super friendly and very professional. We started the day with a trip to the local market where we got to sample fruits. Then we visited the rice fields and learnt about how rice is grown. Then back to the house for cooking. Everything was super clean and well organised. Would definitely do it again.

Awesome cooking class with super fun host!. This cooking class was a highlight of our trip to Ubud. We were picked from our hotel and and dropped off afterwards. The class was extremely well organized and the host Puspa was so welcoming and knowledgable but most of all very very entertaining. We cooked a large variety of foods and then all ate together at the end of the class. Recipe books were given out for us to take home and I have cooked many recipes since returning home. Highly recommended

a wonderful surprise. I found a brochure for this cooking class at my hotel (Hibiscus Cottages) and was delighted with the experience that included a stop at the local market where we were invited to sample local fruit in season and/or purchase spices. We had a brief introduction to the life in the village and rice cultivation. in class we prepared and ate eight delicious dishes and received the written recipes (and ingredient alternatives). I look forward to attending other classes here.

Fantastic experience. Great service with pick up from our requested area! Staff were very hospitable and helpful! Great way to experience Balinese culture and cuisines! Great interaction and fantastic way to meet people around the world. Highly recommend tour/class for everyone! Cooking was really fun, enjoyable and engaging for all participants. No one was left out. Staff was very efficient in preparations. Thank you for the enjoyable experience. Will definitely be back!

Such a great experience. I went to this cooking class with my sister, and we both loved it. It was fun to see the traditional market before the class, and the staff were very interested in explaining Bali culture. The class took place in Wayan and Puspa's home, and they were so friendly and welcoming. The cooking was fun, and the food turned out great.

Fantastic experience. I did this one evening with my adult daughter and it was the best experience we had in Ubud. The family who run this are absolutely lovely, very helpful and great at communicating what to do. Truly the nicest place to cook: a large, clean well organised kitchen overlooking the veranda and balcony with the tropical valley below. We cooked as the sun went down and then enjoyed our feast together in the nicest possible surroundings. A must do.

What an awsome day.. Had a terrific day learning about Balinese cuisine. The staff were welcoming and friendly. The activities were well organised and interesting. My 11 year old son had a great time and my wife loved it. cant say enough good things about this experience.

Well organise from A to Z. Driver came to pick us up spot on the time planned. Brought to the market to introduce the ingredients that we will be cooking and about a 5mins drive to the actual cooking place. Instruction for cooking was clear and instructor was well verse in her english. We even got a visit from Aunty Puspa the owner herself guides us through some of the process. Ingredients was fresh. We took turns to prepare the dishes and mostly importantly everyrging is very hygenic. We left with a full tummy and the biggest smile. Must come if you enjoy cooking!

Friendliest and Best Cooking Course. Absolutely outstanding. The family that ran it were the cutest, providing laughter and also great insight to the balinese culture. Food was so simple but delicious. Some of the best I've had since staying here.

New found love for Indonesian food . Had so much fun at this cooking class! Very funny and sweet family, we really enjoyed visiting their home. Learned how to make 7 traditional Indonesian dishes, and it was well organized so that we each had a small part in making all of them. At the end, they set all of the dishes out -buffet style, and I loaded a little bit of everything on to my plate. It was absolutely delicious !! She even sends you home with a copy of the recipes, in case you forget.

Must do cooking class!!. Amasing location, amasing people!! After spending 5 days in Bali, dining out everyday, I can still say the most tasteful dishes we ate in the cooking school. The mushroom soup was amasing! and everything else. We went for afternoon course for 4pm, and were watching the sunset there. Beautiful!

Best cooking class ever!. Puspa and her team really know what they are doing! The class was inspiring - the food tasted superb, everything was super clean and super organized! And you learn - besides the cooking - a lot about Bali. I'll go again.

A Remarkable Experience. I have never ever been to a cooking class anywhere in the world and I am a travel writer, always on the go and always writing about amazing experiences as I go. My family persuaded me to attend Paon Bali's cooking class in Ubud while visiting Bali.I have to tell you that from the word go... it was a wonderful experience. From the preparing and cooking and then to the eating experience, received an A+ ranking from my entire party. My family and I loved the whole experience and highly recommend the class to anyone wanting a different experience. Plus we all came away from the class with new cooking skills to hopefully use back home.

Wonderful day. A great experience. The class is extremely well organized, very hygienic and you eat a wonderful meal. Beyond the actual cooking, you are in a real home and learn much about the Balinese culture.

A great morning cooking. We had a great morning visiting the market and then cooking back at Wayan's house. Puspa and Wayan's are really good fun and we really enjoyed our morning with them - learning more about Balinese culture. The food we cooked was really good and we learnt how to cook several different dishes and were given recipes to take away. I would definitely recommend if you are in Ubud and looking to do a cooking course.

Spectacular Views, Food and Hosts!. This was one of the best things I've ever done on vacation. The hosts at Paon are very warm and welcoming. The organization is very well thought out and it is fun to cook collectively with the group. The food is amazing, fresh and fragrant.The kitchen views are peaceful and perfect. Worth every penny!

So good we went twice!. We booked on to the morning cooking class session, and were picked up on time by the driver from our accommodation. We were then taken on an insightful tour of Ubud market. We had been before but not this early in the morning, when the main food sellers are active. The guide was instructive and knowledgable about local food and ingredients that would be used in the cooking class. Thankfully, food for the cooking class is provided by a supplier, not from the market which is quite unsanitary. On the way to the cooking class we also stopped at a rice paddy to learn about the cultivation of rice - again, very insightful.Upon arrival at the class we were greeted with a cold drink, which was very welcome and made to feel extremely welcome by the family! The class itself had the perfect mix between doing relatively uninteresting prep and having the feeling like we made the food, and the guests do the cooking, not the staff. In that sense it was very hands-on, no one left with nothing to do and at all times very engaging. The facilities allow everyone to participate regardless of the class size (ours was around 18). The menu is varied and flexible depending on dietary requirements e.g. Vegetarian or allergies. The speed of the class was just right, not too fast and not too slow. It was also super efficient, dirty pans being whisked away in the blink of an eye! The food itself was delicious - there was more than enough to leave feeling very full and satisfied. The family and team of helpers really made the morning- so friendly, happy, funny, helpful, and passionate about their food. We enjoyed so much we came again for an afternoon the next day. The menu we made was largely the same - a few small substitutions for several of the dishes (e.g. swapping mushrooms for tuna), one brand new dish (nasi goreng) and a brand new dessert. To some extent, the second day felt like a repetition of the previous day - however the flip-side is that we learnt so much more the second time, as the methods and ingredients sink into our memories more. And of course we got to eat the excellent food again!

Fabulous fun filled class. My friend & I did the morning cooking class. It was very organised, lots of fun and most importantly we learned to make lots of yummy Indonesian dishes. I am vegetarian and there was no issue at all catering for me. The kitchen facilities were amazingly clean, the produce was fresh and the whole day was great value for money!

Fresh and delicious.. This is the first cooking class I have done in Bali and I enjoyed it a lot. Everything was extremely organised and although personally you don't get to do a lot it is still worthwhile and the end product was a delicious meal. Staff all very friendly.
Amazing experience. The food was amazing, hosts were very warm and welcoming, and the experience was one I will not forget. Highly reccommend! :)

Excellent class. I did the morning session with Paon Cooking Class (includes market tour, highly recommended). The session was fantastic and great value. Strong emphasis on food safety & cleanliness which I appreciated. They can also cater to vegetarians or pescatarians if you request. The class was ~18 people but was extremely well organized and never felt crowded. Everyone was involved in every aspect of the preparation & cooking. Most importantly, the food was delicious.Highly recommended.

An excellent cooking class indeed. We enjoyed this cooking class a lot. The personnel, including the driver, was happy and very friendly. We were in a group of 19 people, of which 5 were vegetarian and had for a large part a separate cooking class. Upon arrival we were immediately offered drinks. The owner gave a quick tour of the compound. We have been to a few Balinese compounds, this one was the nicest and cleanest to see. Then we started cooking. Before every dish, the wife of the owner would explain how the dish was made, and what other ingredients to use if you can't find the same ingredients at home. Then tasks were divided and we started cooking. As mentioned in other reviews, don't expect to do everything yourself: a lot of food has been prepared already, and for example dessert was made by the personnel, but still, you get to do a fair amount of hands-on work. In the middle we had a break to enjoy the mushroom soup, then we continued with the rest. In the end we enjoyed our delicious, self-made dinner with a lovely view over a small valley, and had a nice chat with other guests. We thought it was over too soon!If you would like to do a cooking class in the Ubud area to prepare some Balinese food, we would recommend this one!

Amazing Experience. My partner and I did this on our last day in Ubud and are so happy that we did. The entire thing was just perfect. Puspa is beautiful, as is her home! It was such a wonderful atmosphere, everyone was so relaxed. The food was also incredible! Highly recommend it, it's so much more than a cooking class. It was truly a special experience that both my partner and I will cherish forever.

A Different Travel Experience. My friend and I love to travel and this time, since we both love to cook and eat, we've decided to include attending a cooking class. We chose the Paon Bali cooking class because of the excellent reviews. What can I say, my friend and I thoroughly enjoyed the experience. After booking with them, they contacted the guest house where we were staying so they could pick us up the next day. The driver took us to the local market and a guide was already waiting for us there. The market tour was interesting as we learned about foodstuff and tools typically used in Balinese kitchen. On the way to Paon Bali, we stopped by the rice fields for a brief talk on rice farming. It was informative, but we weren't really interested. We were then taken to Puspa's place. The welcome drinks were already waiting for us and Puspa gave us a brief introduction to Balinese cuisine and the Paon Bali cooking class. We were then ushered to the huge outdoor kitchen. Participants took turns preparing the dishes. It was very hands-on. Everyone had a lot of fun as we tried our hands preparing the ingredients using traditional Balinese kitchen tools. The best part was eating the dishes we prepared. There was enough of each and we got our bellies filled. We had to leave earlier than other guests, but Puspa was still able to make arrangements to drop us off at our next destination. I highly recommend this to those going to Bali. One thing to note, though, is that it could easily eat up half a day's worth (or more) of your trip, so be sure to include this in the itinerary.

Cooking with a Balinese family. What a great experience. It was my fav thing to do in Bali. Organized, friendly staff, great food and value was fantastic. It was the best food I had in Ubud. Thanks again to the family for their attention to detail and their care in what they do. Our group had 6 people! Felt very personal. View from their 2nd floor kitchen was beautiful. Would do it again!

Definitely lives up to the 5 star rating. . There's not really a huge amount to add to previous reviews, except to say that this really lives up to it's five star rating. Not just because the food is delicious, but also because the hosts are warm, friendly and funny; guaranteeing a fun and relaxed way to learn about Balinese food and culture.

Afternoon session. Nice experience , we opted not to do the morning session so not to go the market. The afternoon session took us to a rice paddy and gave a bit of info on rice growing. Nice welcome drink, big group so we were split into 2 , very good facilities and clean kitchens, delicious food. Lovely setting.

Definitely worth doing! . This cooking class in Ubud is amazing. We took our 9, 12, 16 and 21yr old children and everyone thoroughly enjoyed it! The driver picked us up from our hotel in kuta which i organised with puspa via email. ($40 for the day, about 1.5hrs one way ) we were taken to the markets first but a few of us had weak stomach's so we didn't stay long as the smell was a little overbearing. (Don't let that put you off at all!!) Next we were taken to the rice fields which were lovely to see then back to puspas for the class. Her husband was lovely and explained about there house and culture while we sipped a really refreshing drink they made. Then it was down to it. I liked the fact that even though there where about 25 in the class we had our own prep table and all cooked together. There was plenty of food and all tasted amazing. We were all given recipes to take home and puspa even gave us some left overs before we left as our 15yr old daughter woke up sick and had to miss the class. Since being home we invited friends over and cooked a few of the dishes for them which they also thoroughly enjoyed. No bali belly here! And for $35 an adult and half for children it's definitely worth the money and experience.

Much more than a cooking class. Not only is the cooking class exceptionally well done, with great dishes, ingredients, and instructions, the owners really welcome you in their home and share a great bit of their cultural knowledge. We can recommend the morning class as it starts with a tour of the market in Ubud. This was a great introduction to Balinese food and produce.The couple who runs it are really entertaining and will do everything in their power to make sure everyone has a great time.And the food...... ....was awesome!

Best cooking class BALI. We experienced an absolutely fun day with Wayan and Puspa.Our day began with a pick up from our hotel and a visit to the market.We then visited a rice field.We arrived at the family home by 10am and didn't leave until 2. The whole time was spent preparing ingredients, cooking and eating. I took our 12 year old son and 15 year old daughter who enjoyed it as much as I did.Well priced and an experience I would highly recommend.

I can only agree with the others- I highlight in Bali!. For me, this was a highlight of my time in Ubud. Puspa is a wonderful hostess-funny, engaging and, or course, a great cook. Our meal was delicious, the presentation was fabulous and we met travelers young and old from around the world- it was the perfect outing. My daughter and I are vegetarians and they easily modified the recipes for us. In our group, there was also someone who couldn't eat spices and so the recipes were modified for her too. I imagine they can work with all dietary restrictions. Highly recommended!

Authentic cooking with a great people. After reading the reviews I chose to go with Paon as so many have shared their experiences - and for good reason. I was picked up my hotel at 8:20 promptly and whizzed off to pick up another 4 cooking 'apprentices'. Once everyone was in, we scooted off to Ubud market (downstairs is fruit, spices and meat) where our very smiley and friendly guide, Wayan, explained about Balinese traditional fruits and veg and we also tried many items such as hairy fruit, snake fruit and Balinese oranges. Myself and a few others had assumed we would help to pick the produce but as this ended up being a big group (our car met up with two others so in total around 15 of us) perhaps it would be too difficult to do so. After this we ventured off to the Rice paddies where another guide explained the family traditions of rice farming, which was very interesting. Once everyone had taken pictures etc. we head for the cooking class and were welcomed with an icy cold refreshing drink and another Wayan (owner of the business). Wayan also made us feel welcome in his home (which is huge!) and shared funny stories about their village traditions and gossip. We went into the kitchens around 10:25am where we were greeted by the host and queen B, Puspa. Before you start, Puspa goes through the menu clearly - in total 9 dishes were prepared and cooked. If you have allergies, they can tailor the menu for you (you just cook something slightly different). The meal prep was very enjoyable and a great opportunity to talk and get to know the other guests whilst you chop onions, garlic, chill or mash peanuts. Note that you also have Paon kitchen helpers to assist you and point out quantities etc. The dishes are very easy to master once you realise that the base for many dishes in Bali uses the same herbs etc. good to know for when you are making back home so you can make a batch of the yellow sauce paste! The food was SO good, probably the best Indonesian food I have eaten during my trip and situated in a large kitchens that overlook the forest. What more could you ask for? A hands-on activity with a great host and friendly family. Thanks for a great day!

Worth Every Bite. Best cooking class. You get plenty of hands on time and the class moves along fluidly. The hosts are wonderful and you learn a lot about Balinese culture while cooking. The food is outstanding and you walk away with a good knowledge of how to prepare it at home, and even a cookbook! I even lost my cookbook and the hosts were kind enough to send me a pdf version. This was my favorite thing I did in Bali this past trip.

Amazing Cooking Experience. I highly recommend Paon Bali Cooking School for anyone interested in learning the culinary delights of Balinese food. It is incredible value at AUD$35 and we gained so much knowledge and had a memorable experience. The day begins with a walk through the central market to be educated and have a taste of the local fruits and vegetables. This is particularly valuable if this is your first SE Asian experience. We then went up to Puspa's village where her cooking school is located. We stopped at the rice paddys and learnt about the propagation through to the harvesting of this grain. It was very informed. Once we arrived at Puspa's home we were given information regarding the importance of building and temple placement by Wayan, Puspa's hilarious husband. On to the food....the jungle view from our work station was amazing and both the organisation and the dishes we prepared and cooked were outstanding. It is very hands on and we all prepared and cooked our feast which was devoured with enthusiasm. This is a must do experience whilst in Ubud.
Excellent cooking class. Must do! Good value for money, excellent food, extremely well organised, clean. Puspa and Wayan are a class act and very personable. Highly recommended.

Very happy we did this!. Every time my husband and I travel we always talk about a cooking class but never find the time to do it. This time we made it a point to reserve in advance and im glad we did!! It was a total of 6 of us at the owner's home. The kitchen was HUGE and the scenery was gorgeous. I'm a germophobe so I was pleased with how clean and well-prepared everything was. She was extremely conscious of our hands being clean and us not reusing utensils that have been soiled. There were to helpers that did a lot of the preparation so we could focus on the end product...cooking!The food we prepared was delightful and we were veryyyy full when we left. The other great part about this was the other guests we shared this experience with. We had great conversations as though it was a family dinner. We are very thrilled we did this and we highly recommend this!

Well Oiled Machine. The experience was beautifully crafted, everything was well organised and efficient with little waiting time. From the initial pick up to the market visit, a short tour/introduction to the rice fields and to the kitchen, everything was well planned and timed perfectly.While we didn't have to do much preparatory work, the instructions were clear and entertaining. We had a great time learning how to make the all important yellow sauce in Balinese cuisine, which was really tasty and useful. The lunch and dessert were so filling that I fell asleep on the ride back after the class. Would recommend this to friends who want to learn more about the local culture.

Great experience and delicious food. My husband, daughter (16 year old) and I attended the morning cooking session. It was very interesting to learn about the local produce at the market and a little about Balinese culture throughout the experience. The family made the experience a lot of fun and informative for everyone. Everyone helped in various aspects of preparation and then we all paired up to cook about 7 dishes and two sauces. Everyone was very friendly and helpful, always asking if we had questions and if we were enjoying ourselves. I would definitely recommend to others.

OMG WOW!!!. Been here today and what an absolute treat it was.Firstly we went to the market and saw all of the spices, knives, vegetable and fruit. We even tried some. We then went on a nice little drive to the rice fields and learnt the process and had a hard time opening one of the ricicles. We then went to the cooking class where we were greeted by the owners who were just the cutest and friendliest people ever. Nothing was too much at all. They go out of their way to please you and help you. The group was quite big but that was nice as you make so much, you get to try everything in the process and when you get tired of one thing someone else can take over hahaha. We were allowed to take photos as well and everything was clear. What was also great was that you could try different things before added and after before everything was combined. The food was incredible especially the chicken curry. Puspa and her team were fantastic. I cannot speak highly enough of her. Everything was so clean and organised unlike some I've seen. A definite must if you are Bali! Thanks to Puspa, Family and team. HAPPY LIFE HAPPY WIFE AND NO BB!!!

Great Food, and a lot of Fun. I loved this cooking class in Ubud. You start the day at the market, and then go to the family compound to prepare several dishes. This class is very hands on, every one chips in to chop and prepare, and you get a chance to participate in every dish.

Amazing cultural food experience. Awesome value for money, friendly staff who make sure you have a great experience, food was amazing & really fresh, if you can't finish all your food you can take away.

Must Do in Ubud. My teenage daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed the cooking class and market tour. Our hosts Wayan and Puspa were delightful. Facilities were first class and the food we prepared was by far the best we have eaten since arriving in Bali a week ago.If you are thinking of taking a cooking class, look no further. A highlight of our trip so far!

Fantastic experience . What a great day had at the school. You get a walk through the market in the morning, lots of a great info around Indonesian cuisine. Food was absolutely amazing. Service you cannot fault as they pick you up and drop you off at your door and are friendly and relaxed the entire time. They really do strive to make you experience a lasting one. Highly recommended any age to take part. Thanks guys

Balinese Cooking . Had an amazing time! Truly lovely people and I actually learned how to cook Bali style!! Peanut sauce was my favorite! The home is beautiful and the dishes are easy and delicious!!!
Great. Great cooking class - not too long or short. Mushroom soup was the highlight for me along with the bean salad & chicken curry.

Paon Cooking Fun. Such a great day of Balinese cooking set amongst traditional Balinese homestead with a well organised hostess. The directions were clear and found myself involved in the whole process of preparing a seven meal banquet. Such Fun and yummy meals I now know how to cook. Would recommend if you are in the Ubud area to learn more about the Balinese way. Clean and beautiful setting. :)

Totally enjoyed it. We made a booking but my friend was sick so I ventured on myself. There is a taxi that picks you up from your hotel and drops you back in which it's all included. On arrival you are welcomed by Puspa and her lovely staff. We did the preparation of the food and each ingredient was explained. We all made it a team effort with preparation, cooking food and preparing it. Their was a great bunch of people in the class and it was very enjoyable and a great experience. We made approx 8 dishes and at the end we got to eat as much as you want. For anyone that wants an outing or an experience or to improve their cooking ability then this is a mustPuspa is such a beautiful warm person that even extends her help for any other recipes via emailHoney bunny xo The pic is of some of the dishes we cooked

Amazing cooking class . The best cooking class that I've been. They will take you from the market and explain you about the the tools and product that you will use till the rice fields and back to the kitchen.

Impressed with everything. Thank you Paon team for such excellent plan out of cooking programme and seamless execution.My partner and I enjoyed everything from the beginning till the end.Market visit is a must unless you are an hygiene freak. The home/school is located slightly away from the centre so you have beautiful mountain view and rice paddy scenery. The school is amazingly built, our group is lucky and got the top floor, more breeze, better view and more private as compared to the other classes.Cooked 7 dishes and a pairing system which was perfect as then everyone got to participated and stayed interested. (This could have been an issue for someone looking for an intermediate class for a more hands on experience, but was perfect for us)Thanks again for the warm welcoming, well prepared programme, paying attention to details and hygeine, and all the fun jokes and humour. We wish you all the best!

Christmas lunch with a twist.. My partner and I attended the cooking class on Christmas day and it was loads of fun. I've done a few cooking classes in Bali and most tend to cook pretty much the same menu but I'd definitely recommend anyone interested in cooking to give this a go. We did the market and the rice paddies tour and it was very informative. The food tasted great and the staff made it very easy and enjoyable.

Okey but could have been better. Good: the visit in the local market, good food, nice staffCons: felt like a cooking class factory, the food made by the course was combined together so we couldnt eat what we made ourselves

Commertial Mass Tourism.... If you're looking for an intimate cooking experience...this is not the place.....they pack people in like sardines to make the maximum money....The food is tasty though...tried some dishes I hadn't tasted before...Bottom line: Good Food, but mass tourism experience...

Highly recommended!. What an unique experience to learn to cook Balinese food in a traditional Balinese house/kitchen!! The class is very well organized and the chef Puspa & her assistants have made the cooking lesson extremely fun and enjoyable. Our group of 5 (age 20+ to 60+) have all enjoyed ourselves very much in the class. Hint: as it is a minimum 90-minute drive from Seminyak, we have opted for an afternoon class and organized a couple sight-seeing activities before the class. We loved the refreshing iced welcome drink which was perfect after spending hours in the heat!
First class evening . From the moment we were picked up the team looked after us and gave us a very enjoyable night. Heaps of food and they really get you involved.

Feel at home . The hosts at Paon really make you feel welcome in their typical balinese house (which is really gorgeous). The cooking class is really pleasant as the chef is a dynamic and funny woman. After participating at the elaboration of 8 dishes, Each participant receive the recipes and can enjoy the tasty lunch made together. Teaching method is ok and food is really good. Recommended

Great food, great people!. 10 out of 10! It started out with a trip on the market where it was very interesting to see all the spices and vegetables that are common in Bali. Then we drove down to Laplapan village near Ubud town with Bali family home / cooking lessons. The owner is Wayan Subawa - very nice family. The staff was amazing - very kind, a good teacher, with good humor and good english. . After making the 7 dishes, there was so much food - no way I could eat it all (we wanted to!). As a group, we took turns preparing many vegetables and ingredients garlic, ginger, asparagus, broccoli and the horn of plenty, rice, onions, peas, tomatoes, carrots, cauliflower and plenty more. We are Bali chefs, now graduated. Wok on!
