Fun and Delicious. Held on a family compound just outside of Ubud. We were picked up from our villa for a visit to the market and then on for the cooking class. The market is interesting though very 3rd world and a bit fragrant. (Don't visit the meat section as it is un-refrigerated and has lots of flies.) There were 10 of us for the cooking class which is held on the compound of a Balinese family. It was very well organized with a lot of attention to hygiene. Together we cut and prepared several dishes for our lunch. The teacher explained all of the ingredients and how to cut and prepare each dish. Though there were many common elements each had its own distinct flavor. The food was some of the best we've had in Bali. The facilities are modern with a nice toilet and sinks. The staff were polite and helpful and everything was clean. The price was very reasonable and she asked for feedback after we were finished. That is rare here and a good sign. We'll return on a future visit.

Good Class. I booked this class when I arrived in Bali, it was a great class, however I wouldn't call it brilliant - I've been to the Baipai Cooking Class in Bangkok that is similar to this one and found the Bangkok one to be much better. With the Bali school, you don't get to make the whole dish, it is a group effort, which was a bit of a shame. Also the group that we had was huge (22), so that was hard to navigate. It would have been better if everyone got their own cooking station and you cooked dishes from scratch, but it isn't that type of class. I stayed in Seminyak and it was 400k for transport through the cooking school, which I'd recommend doing rather than booking your own taxi, as the school and markets can be difficult to find, so it is worth spending the extra on having them collect you.

Paon Bali - Start your engine! It's 5 stars for me!. We have a fantastic day at the Paon Bali cooking classs. We travelled from Seminyak to Ubud where the class was held but the journey was worth it. It is not only cooking but other aspects of Balinese culture were also taught by Pushpa and her team. Everyone is hands on and the camaradie is excellent. Make new friends. Puspa, and her team are so efficient and makes everyone relax and felt so at home with BB and MBA jokes. Join the class and you will know what BB and MBA meant! I have been to other cooking classes but this one is exceptional. Start your engine! The Basic yellow sauce is the key to most of the dishes! We get to eat what we prepared and the end product was really good with quality control from Puspa and her team. Well done! I strongly recommend having fun at this class. Thank you Puspa and team! Terima Kaseh!

Great day. Wayan,Pupsa and team deserve number one! They welcome you into their family home in a very genuine way! The morning tour kicks off with a trip to the food markets which is an experience, if not one just for your nose :)! You will get to sample the local fruits which are great and not something you would likely do if you weren't offered! The cooking class is great, hands on, everyone helps out and then sits down to eat 8 courses which is absolutely delicious! They cater to vegetarians as well as we had two in our group! My husband and I enjoyed our class and they were even okay with bringing our 3 yr old ( we brought a nanny too so we could join in and not chase him) they feed him let him explore their home, play with their chickens and their children! They even feed our nanny too! They are truly lovely people!Do this class, you get the receipts to take home too!!

Nice Experience. We went to this cooking class as a part of our honeymoon trip to Bali, the overall experience was nice my husband enjoyed the class a lot and we made new friends that day, the food is yummy and you get to take a printed recipe with you by the end of the class, the only downside was that Puspa didn't host our class herself, she just welcomed us to her house and left us with her team and went down to host another class, the team was friendly and fun but I would've preferred if Puspa herself held the cooking class, overall I would advice attending this class as it's a nice experience.

Brilliant day and delicious food!. I had a brilliant day at this cooking class - the staff are so efficient and make everything seem so easy. We cooked a delicious feast and I've already bought ingredients to try and make some of it myself! I was travelling alone and so glad I did this, met some lovely people. Would highly recommend this for solo travellers, couples, group of friends and anyone who likes eating or cooking!

Great learning experience on Balinese cooking style!. It was a great experience right from the start. A driver picked us up at our hotel lobby right on time and took us to a rice field where he explained about fields, different types of rices, importance of rice in balinese way of life etc. We were then taken to the class which is actually the teacher's house. Its a typical traditional balinese house with a temple inhouse. Beautiful house. We were then escorted to the cooking room, spacious, with a good view of nature. We were shown all the ingredients (arranged very nicely) and were explained about a typical tradiational balinese kitchen and its steam cooker for cooking rice. We were then explained about all the 7 courses we were going to prepare (from Soup to Dessert :)...). It was very well guided and the owner was hilarious and informative and always helpful. It was fun learning about the ingredients and cooking style followed here. And then we eat :). We were also explained about the house and met their family members.All in all a great experience.

Delightful cooking class. An excellent tour of the market and rice fields before receiving a warm welcome into the family home. A great atmosphere was created with jokes and handy cooking tips. The food was good and you sent home with all the recipes to try at home. Would recommend to anyone visiting Ubud.

Best experience we've had in Bali . What a fabulous day at Paon Bali. Even though my husband and daughter had their doubts before we left, they had a fantastic time going through the market, seeing the rice fields, finding out about a traditional Balinese home and then cutting and preparing the dishes. Eating the food and having wonderful conversations with people from around the world was the icing on the cake. (Apologies for the bad food pun). Time just flies and there is a lot of gentle humour. This really was the best part of our trip and I would recommend it without hesitation - you don't have to be a cook, you'll have a ball anyway.

Such a fantastic experience! . We booked the Paon Bali cooking class as it was top on trip advisor. I'm so glad we it as it was an amazing experience from start to finish. It's almost like 3 or 4 trips in one. You get picked up from your hotel and taken to the market near the royal palace. You are given a guided tour and told what the different fruit and vegetables are and get to taste. Then you move on to a rice paddy in beautiful countryside, and finally on to a beautiful and traditional balanese house. The owner gives you an informative and hilarious welcome and given delicious welcome drinks.Then more importantly you get to prepare and eat a wide range of balanese dishes. It's so well organised and great fun. Whether you're on your own or as a couple or group. I couldn't recommended Paon Bali cooking class more highly. It was a highlight of our trip!
BEST COOKING CLASS. My sister and I loved this cooking class! It was run very well and the food was delicious. I would recommend this cooking class to anyone.

What an amazing experience!. I feel truly blessed that I was recommended this cooking class on Ubud! The couple who run it are amazing and so welcoming! It felt like a second home! Would recommend to friends and family!

Spectacular cooking class. The great reviews here don't lie. I wanted to learn how to cook tempeh as well as some other popular dishes as well as learn a bit more about the local culture. We were warmly welcomed upon arrival with a cold drink and a nice history lesson. The food prep was great and there was just enough of being able to experience everything without having to do all the unpleasant work. The instructors were a hoot and kept things lively for us. Cooking was delegated into stations and I was sad to miss the tempeh even though I mentioned that was the primary reason I took the class. I still picked up a few pointers to use at home but it's not quite the same The best part was meeting some people to connect with there and eating the food of course!

Awesome food, super fun. Highly recommend this for anyone! I was traveling solo but there were families, couples, groups, and other solo travelers there. It's a perfect introduction to Balinese food and everything tastes delicious. Do it at the start of your trip! I ended up meeting some solid buds to spend my remaining time in Ubud with.

Best Cultural Cooking School in Bali. What a find!!!, its a shame that this tour is not bookable or promoted by travel agents in Australia. I own a Travel Business and I recently discovered this tour on a google search whilst in Bali. I was looking at Casa Luna but didn't feel that it would give me the cultural experience that I was looking for. After emailing Puspa, she responded immediately and advised that The tour included a Traditional market Visit, before moving on to the family owned Rice paddy with tour and then finishing with full 8 course cooking class in Puspa's house!!Puspa and her husband were fantastic hosts, The tour really gave a insight into culture and the traditional Balinese family and way of living. Very informative. The cooking class couldn't be faulted, A fantastic variety of dishes and not hard at all, even catering to vegetarian if needed. Very hands on and we didn't just watch, we created all the meals ourselves. The kitchen was set up perfectly for a group of 20 people and the lessons were very easy to understand. The best part was sitting down afterwards to eat all of our creations buffet style. We even received a recipe book to take home!! Please give this tour a go if you are feeling the urge to be creative and cook whilst in Bali Its traditional and informative, A fantastic day tour. Located in Ubud. 5 Stars from me and would definitely do it again. Thank you Puspa for a fantastic and memorable experience.

Fun, yet thorough balinese cooking class. I booked the morning Paon cooking class while I was in Ubud as a fun activity for me and my family to take part in, but also as a way to see a bit more of Ubud and eat at the same time! Once you have a date booked in, a driver comes to pick you up from your hotel (if staying in Ubud) and takes you to the first stop, Ubud market. A guide walks you through the different local foods and spices used in balinese cooking, and provides an opportunity for you to make any purchases from the market. You are then taken to the rices paddy fields to learn all there is to know about rice and it's importance in the balinese diet. After that you are taken to the paon cooking school to meet your teacher (Pushpa) and get going with some actual cooking. There is a community feel about the class, with different people doing different jobs (some people are chopping, some are blending, some frying, etc), with rotations actively encourage by Pushpa and her helpers so everyone gets an opportunity. The whole class literally makes a balinese feast, complete with starters, mains and dessert. Ingredients and tools are explained, as well as an interactive demonstration of a balinese blender! Once the meal is cooked, everyone sits down together to enjoy the fruits of their labour and at the end of the class, a booklet of the recipes cooked that day are given out to everyone. Tea, coffee and bottled water are provided throughout the whole day. Overall this was one of the favourite activities of the trip for my family because you get to make and eat super fresh, simple., tasty food, but also Pushpa's energy is just wonderful. She brings the whole group together so you don't feel like everyone is separate in their own groups, but working together for one common goal....filling our bellies!

Very nice Balinese cooking course. Did a cooking course with my girlfriend at Paon. After a nice welcoming drink we started prepping everything for the various dishes we were going to make. Everything was really well organised and went very smoothly. Afterwards we received the recipes and for more recipes we could send an email. We really enjoyed the whole experience!!

Was recommended and did not disappoint!. A friend of my wife recommended we do this cooking class in Ubud, and we're glad we did! Our hotel driver suggested it actually, picked us up a couple of minutes late, but that was due to another couple cancelling on his pickup route.First we were taken around the Ubud markets to learn about the fruit and spices they use, before being taken to a rice padi to learn how they grow and harvest the rice before heading off to the kitchen only a few minutes away. The host was lovely, we got welcome drinks, and as much water and bali coffee as you can drink for free. She then took us through step by step, explaining the dishes we would cook, demonstrating and then allowing us to cook also.The class was fun and informative, and the food was delicious! We highly recommend anyone who visits Ubud to go along! Also great value for money!

No allergies? No worries!. Paon Bali Cooking Class is run by a local Balinese family that graciously welcome you into their home. After being picked up from your hotel lobby, you are taken for a quick tour of the rice fields. After this, you're welcomed into Aunty Puspa's house where she greats you with a lemon ice drink and then your choice of lemongrass and ginger tea (delicious) or Balinese coffee (strong and black). The session begins with meeting the other groups (mostly couples) and the reveal of the ingredients and what you'll be cooking. You're all then given a task (chopping, dicing or blending [which is using a mortar and pessel])After this, you're given a pan to fry a small portion of what the group has cooked. Kicked off with the term 'start your engines', you light the grill and tip in your prepared ingredients. After this, you sit down with the group you've been cooking with and enjoy the food you've created. Upon coming into this session, Aunty Puspa took careful consideration into checking food allergies and if there were any vegetarians. However, despite said precautions, some shrimp paste slipped into my partner's food and he was violently ill that night. I, however, had a great time. I went for the food but ended up making some international friends while there.

Highly recommend. My husband and i had a fantastic experience. We loved going to the market, the class was very interactive and the food we made was incredible. The staff were so friendly and we look forward to trying the recipes at home. Thank you so much.

Best in the business!. This is a fantastic day out. A great market tour, followed by a visit to the rice terraces. The families hospitality was outstanding. Puspa was so knowledgable about all the dishes made and more. Will definitely be recreating these dishes at home. Would highly recommend this to all friends and family.

Great food. We did this cooking class in November and it was excellent. Lots of fun .. Learnt to cook authentic Food with great flavour... Will be making it once we get home...the cooking class is an education as well as cooking and really good value for your money as you get to have a feast after you have cooked all the yummy food ... Great day out

Put it in your "must do" list in Ubud. What a great way to spend your day in Ubud! The group cooking class started early in the morning at the local market (they pick you up at your hotel), where one of the Paon Bi team members showed us all the different ingredients of Balinese food and explained what is what (everything is bought from the reliable suppliers, including Halal chicken).We were then taken to the rice paddy and were told all about rice, which also provided a great opportunity to take nice pictures of the terraces.After that the driver took us to the Wayan' s and Puspa's house for the cooking class itself. This family are uber cool and are full of humour (my husband will definitely remember the phase "Happy wife, happy life"). Not only they taught us many things about Balinese food, but also about local culture and traditions. The group class included cooking 8 dishes and the organisers ensured that everyone participated in all the "activities" by taking terms. They are also great when it comes to allergies, diet etc so that everyone can participate and learn to cook! After all the cooking was done, everyone got together to enjoy the lunch, which was absolutely delicious (which is always the case, when you cook food by yourself).Thank you again Paon Bali and the team!

Excellent introduction to Balinese cooking!. The half day cooking class at Paon Bali was terrific. I suggest the early class which includes a brief trip to the market, where one can see and identify different ingredients, such as fruits and spices. The course included preparation for about seven dishes, including dessert, along with a recipe book to take home. I really enjoyed this class, my group, especially the staff, and feel like I left a little bit smarter. ;) Strongly recommended! Thanks Puspa!
Surprisingly fun. Good way to try all of balis signature dishes with a bit of info behind them. Getting recipes to take home is great as well.

Great way to learn about Bali culture. I took the morning class, about 5 hours in duration. There was 19 of us. It started at the market where we learned about the fruits, vegetables, and spices used for Balinese cuisine. Then we were brought to a rice field where we learned about the system of growing rice. Afterwards, we were brought to the home of Ms. Puspa where we learned about the structure of Balinese homes and families. Then we got to cooking 8 dishes in stations that we rotated around. The hosts were hilarious. It was a great experience. Don't expect to learn how to cook 8 Balinese dishes in less than 5 hours. It was more a cultural lesson and introductory course in Balinese food. I loved that all the dishes were healthy. I learned alternatives to cooking healthy. Two things I really liked: 1) it was sanitary, complete with hand washing stations and sanitizers. No Bali belly for me. 2) my boyfriend was sick, started coughing when he smelled the bbq smoke. Instead of kicking us out, Ms. Puspa took care of him, gave him ginger-lemongrass tea. She was like a mother hen to him. I'll never forget her kindness. Thank you!

A n Ubud must!. This is a really fantastic way to spend your time in Bali. The whole day and everyone we met, whether people involved with the class or tourists like ourselves were so lovely.The visit to the market in the morning was really great as it wouldn't have been something we would have found and seen ourselves. We tasted so many new and delicious fruits! The visit to the rice terraces was really informative too.We loved learning all about the different dishes, ingredients and techniques. The food we made in the class was probably the most delicious Balinese food we had on our entire trip!! Will definitely be making Tempe Manis in the future :)

Great experience & easy to follow teaching. Thank you Puspa, your family & helpers for the kind hospitality.It was fun trying to pound the peanut paste for Gado Gado and making the sauces in Balinese style. The satay was my favourite. It's tender & delicious!Very clean & cosy environment to cook in. I enjoyed it! :)

Lives up to all the reviews . This place lives up to it's hype. It was great, been to Bali many times and still learning.. had a blast. Food great, explained lots about Balinese culture and day to day life. If you only have a short time in Bali, this is a must do!

A very special day. All the good things people say in the reviews are correct. Puspa and Wayan are truley grateful to all of us who attend their class. From the convenience of a taksi (taxi) service to and from. All the information they give you about everything is perfectly done.They are also quite humorous about each other. Baby in the belly Puspa. Coming from a chef it is a perfect definition of your beginnings.I really can not say enough wonderful things about this entire day. Thankyou for the recipes, your hospitality and a full stomach. No BB, Bali belly.... loved it, loved them.

Very well organised class. Puspa is amazing! She and her team are extremely professional, the class was busy but they managed to flow from one dish to another with speed and poise...and everything was absolutely spotless....food tasted great and it was a fantastic insight into Indonesian cuisine...cannot fault it. Thanks! Judi

One of the top experiences in Bali. Paon Bali provided us with one of the best experiences in the Island. Everything is professionally organized surrounded by a very friendly atmosphere from begging to end. We felt like part of a family & friends group while learning the secrets of the Balinese cuisine. The visit to the market and to the rice fields is fun and helpful to connect with other participants before the class.Do not expect hard work with the preparations (no slicing onions involved), as the team will make everything to easy your work and make sure you have fun. You will feel like a chef! I highly recommend it, including for those who are more into to eating than cooking!

Fantastic cooking class!. Learnt a lot in this half day class! Made lots of delicious food, under fantastic instruction. They cater for all dietary requirements. The little added extras of the market, visit to rice fields and chatting with the owner about Balinese life beforehand were a nice touch. Would definitely recommend! Thanks Paon Bali!

Highlight of our Bali Trip! Truly an awesome experience!. Paon Bali really lives up to its reviews! Definitely a must-try for those who loves to cook and experience local life. We went two weeks ago, and our morning class was full even if it was off-peak season and it was a weekday! there were 24 of us total but everyone got a chance to cook. The hospitality they show you is so heartwarming, sharing their house, their home, their cultural traditions. It's quite interesting that when they asked us how we heard about Paon Bali, everyone in unison answered "Tripadvisor". :D You won't regret it!

Amazing. Brilliant leader, and you learn loads. We had so much fun on this! The course leader is brilliant - warm, funny, full of joy. And she has a great team of relaxed and friendly people helping out, all with excellent English, that keep this highly organised but really fun.We learnt 8 dishes in total, and they keep a nice relaxed atmosphere, so you can share food and travel stories with everyone.Great view and tables to enjoy the afternoon/evening too!

The best hands on cooking class in Ubud. Puspa is an amazing lady! She is funny, articulate, wise and most importantly is sheer joy to cook with. You will learn heaps about local foods and sourcing them if you do ihe morning class as it includes slso a tour of Ubud traditional market.You then will be taking yo Paon, just outsixe the centre. On the way they stop at a stunning rice field for a brief overview of the rice and its importance to Balinese families and culture. You are shown how rice is grown and the life cycle and harvesting of rice is explained.You then go to Puspas home and are given a lovely welcome drink while she explains the buildings in their traditional Balinese home compound.Now you proceed to the custom built cooking class area, this kitchen within her her compound. The kitchen space is huge...it's airy, light, breezy and spotless.This is where you get to work with her, learning to make the sauces and pastes that are the building blocks for all Balinese dishes you will prepare. You will assist in cutting, frying and construction of everything you will eat. The meat is fresh and ready to go. There are many options for vegetarian cookers here. She can cater for your needs easilyin the class.The hands on time is extensive but you wont feel overtaxed, you are laughing snd learning and its very easy to pick up the knowledge and participate in the preparation. Paon cooking school is a very hands on experience. You will make a beautiful meal of many varied dishes to enjoy at the end of your time in the kitchen you will enjoy eating a sumptuous feast of what you and your cooking class colleagues prepared. Paon is definitely of the best cooking schools I have ever been to becuase it is so much more than the kitchen. Its the market, rice terraces, the balinese home compound and hands on experiences. You will get to know Puspa as I did. She is in fact a most generous and wonderfully knowledgeable guide to understanding and preparing Authentic Balinese food.I have done this class 3 times over 5 years and I always enjoy my day out with her.5 smiles for Puspa and her Team! ☺☺☺☺☺

Great day. Nice, welcoming, funny and entertaining hosts. Everything was well planned and organized. No delays whatsoever, welcome drinks, interesting information about the local food. The house is very good, it has a nice view from the second floor. The food was absolutely amazing. I would recommend that place to everyone that is into cooking or just wants to see the local culture from this angle.

Great cooking class. Did cooking class yesterday wth my family and thoroughly enjoyed it from start to finish. Enjoyed the Ubud markets tour, stopping at the rice paddy fields and learning about the process of growing rice and also learning about the family culture.We were welcomed into their family home whilst we prepared and cooked eight different dishes. Small class size with friendly people made it that much nicer. We will be back, thank you! Dawn Leslie Sydney Australia

Great day out . Awesome morning out. Visited marketplace with a very attentive and entertaining guide. A quick visit to rice paddock then off to the kitchen for action stations. Fabulous hosts and staff are brilliant. Amazing food prepared so quickly and easily, with great instructions even my hubby kept up! The desert dish of banana was to kill for. Can't recommend highly enough for a day away from the water sports and shops.

"Exceptional". This was the best cooking class I have ever experienced! We were a large group of 18 and yet everyone had continual, "hands-on" participation throughout the morning. The dishes were fabulous and Puspa, while very professional, kept everything light and lively with her tremendous sense of humour..."Start your engines, ladies..." I highly recommend this class - you will not be disappointed!

Amazing Food and Lots of Fun. I attended the school as part of a ladies travel group and we had a great morning preparing authentic Balinese dishes and then enjoyed it all for lunch. Puspa and Wayan and so welcoming to their beautiful cooking studio and will share lots of great information regarding Balinese life, beliefts and culture. The class was very hands on and you leave with recipes that can be made when you return home. Wonderful!

Great experience. Excellent cooking class, everyone had the chance to be involved in the preparation and cooking of the food. I would recommend the morning class as it includes a trip to the market which was very interesting. Lunch was the food we had prepared and it was all very tasty. Everyone received a recipe book to take home.

Outstanding !!. It took so long to decide what cooking class to attend, but we could't have chosen better. We had an exceptional morning at the market, rice fields and then on to their home. The class was great fun and vey informative, we sat down to a very special meal, prepaired by our class after we were finished prepairing and cooking. Everything was perfect and we would highly recommend joining this great value for money cooking experience.

An absolute highlight of my Ubud trip. Wasn't expecting much but ended up having loads of fun at the cooking class. The day started with tour at the market, being introduced to local food ingredients and spices and fruits. Then we were taken to the rice field and explained how rice is planted then we were driven to the house of Puspa and Wayan where Puspa gave us a very funny and informative orientation with a glass of welcoming drinks on our hand. The cooking class was extremely well organized and orchestrated. Nobody was left aside with nothing to do. And the food we made together was absolutely delicious. One of the best meals I have ever had in Bali.

Loved it. Tasty tasty food, friendly staff, great taxi driver, market visit was great - glad we went in the morning and really loved how hands-on and organised the class was, not to mention the warm welcome we received from the funny husband. They were also very conscious of dietary requirements and allergies.

Double Thumb Thumb. It was a great adventure... I have learned to make a few dishes... I still have to tried to make it at home, but I would like to advise people who like to cook, than is cooking course at Paon Bali Cooking Class a MUST!Believe me... You will learn more than cooking... Such as Balinese culture, religion, Balinese MBA and more...

Great cultural experience . Such a great night meeting new people and experiencing Balinese culture. Staff were fantastic, welcoming and helpful from start to finish. And of course, food was amazing. Highly recommend

Excellent!. We did the morning cooking class as it includes a trip to Ubud market (very interesting!). The experience was excellent, we cooked 8 different dishes and learnt about Balinese food and culture during the class. The family are so friendly and welcoming and it was very professionally run - there were quite a few of us at the class but it all ran seamlessly and everyone got a chance to take part at all stages. Enjoying all the dishes you have cooked overlooking a lovely scenery was a perfect end :-) highly recommended! Thank you for a great day!

Great experience with Puspa and Wayan . This is my fourth cooking class in Bali. The school is in Puspa and Wayan's family compound. The morning begins with a early morning visit to the various sections of the Ubud food market, followed by a stop at a local rice padi to see how rice is grown. Then it's off to class! The entire time is spent watching, listening, prepping, cooking and eating the lovely food we have made. Our group was about 15-18 people. Everyone had a job at all times. The class is very professionally conducted by Puspa, assisted by her team. Puspa speaks fluent English and is an expert teacher. Drinks are available at all times. Food handling is hygienic and the big covered outdoor kitchen is well equipped and very comfortable. You are collected from, and dropped back to your hotel. It's a wonderful way to get into Balinese culture. Highly recommended. Thank you Puspa and Wayan, also you lovely staff.

Learning to cook delicious food in a family home. We asked our hotel to book a cooking class for us, and completely trusting their judgment without asking any questions, we ended up having the loveliest experience at the Paon Bali Cooking Class. The school picked us up at our hotel, took us to Ubud Center to meet up with the larger group where they took us on a tour of the market, then we drove out to rice fields to learn more about the local crop, and from there we headed to the family home where we were welcomed by the head of the household and greeted with refreshing beverages. From there, we moved to the spacious kitchen with a view at the back of the property where we had a hands on experience cooking several Balinese dishes. The cooking classes were led by the woman of the house and she was a delightfully entertaining person to spend a couple hours learning from. All the staff were very helpful (and impressively efficient), and our meal at the end was delicious. The class had about 20 students, and didn't feel crowded at all and everyone had the opportunity for a hands on experience every step of the way. At Rp350,000, this 5 hour experience was very reasonably priced and well worth the value.
Amazing cooking class. My boyfriend and I had a really great time. The food was delicious and Puspa was really friendly. :) If you visit Ubud this is definitly a must do.

Amazing!! . We did the afternoon tour since morning tour was unfortunately booked out already. Yet, we also loved every bit of the afternoon cooking as we were able to enjoy anazi get sunset overseeing the great backyard and open kitchen. The family made us feel like home immediately, everything unbelievably organized and just simply amazing experience!! Definitely must do!!

What a great cookery course!. The day started when our driver picked us up and took us to the market where other people were waiting for us. We then did a tour of the market learning about about different fruits (which we tasted), veg and spices. Then it was off to puspa and wayan's where we were met with a great refreshing lime drink and a warm welcome from wayan who explained to us about his home and community. After that we started cooking, we cooked a combined total of 7 dishes I think. And desert was demonstrated by puspa. All of the food was excellent. And you get to keep a recipe book so you can cook at home!! Only negative I did have but wouldn't take a star away was that the website and leaflet said there would be a tour of a rice padi, but there wasn't. Not make or break but a little disappointed. But none the less an amazing morning cooking and eating good home cooked food!!

Extremely well run cooking class in Ubud . Very nice time spent with Puspa and her team - informative, fun and delicious! I phoned at 7pm the night before to arrange - very friendly on the phone and we got picked up exactly on time. Tour round the food stalls at the market before heading to the rice paddies and then to the kitchen.

" MASTER CHEF ". We looked at a few places to try something different while on holiday as we both loved cooking. Having read a few review about other places and people were a bit disappointed as they only got to chop up the ingredients and it was wisked away and miraculously reappeared ready to eat! Not here! You have all the ingredients explained to you and also an alternative which you can get back home. Then you chop, slice and grind your way through every dish. And yes you actually cook every dish yourself, and move from station to station so you get to know how to do it all. At the end you are given a copy of the receipt's you have created, all in English of coarse. It was really fun to do something different while on holiday and would highly recommend it even just for the people you meet all enjoying the experience.

Best day in Bali. This was a stunning day out exploring the food and lives of the local Balinese people. The market experience was fantastic (albeit crazy!) but you're perfectly safe with your tour guide. You even get a chance to buy some fruit or spices here if you'd so inclined. Then it's up to see the local rice paddies before heading to the cooking class itself. You're shown the traditional preparation techniques for all the favourite Balinese dishes then get to prepare them yourself (and then eat the finished buffet, of course!) All the while you are introduced to family life in the village and get a real slice of local Balinese life. This was my best day in Bali and I couldn't recommend attending this class any higher. Brilliant!

I would rate this 7 Stars if I could!. Puspa and her team have put together a cooking class which is second to none! This is a great experience from the market walk-through talk-through, to the rice padi, to the kitchen for preparation and cooking (all ingredients were very high quality), and ultimately to the table for eating ... this course is great value for money and something I would happily recommend to anyone visiting Bali

learn together. Arriving for dinner was a new opportunity to learn more about the daily lives of traditional balinese family kitchens. From a handful of ingredients, learn the bases of all flavours and plates which are created daily in many families homes. The format to learn was fun and informative, practical,comfortable and gives a good background to how to create the flavours and dishes. Don't skip this activity it is lots of fun!!! be surprised, honeys

Paon Bali Cookery class. Our family group had an excellent time. Everything was very well prepared in advance for us, and we were well taught and encouraged by people whose English was proficient and who were friendly and informative. Very enjoyable meal at the end. Thank you, Puspa and your team!

Really worth it !. The trip starts with a view of the rice terrasses just outside Ubud, and a good explaination of how rice is made.You will make 3 starters, 4 main courses and a dessert.All of which you will gets to eat, while watching a beautifull sunset with nice scenery.You will also get a complentary welcome lemonade and tea/coffee/mineral water as much as you like.The trip includes pick-up and drop-off at your hotel when you stay in Ubud.So at 350.000 rupia p.p. you will get a nice learning experience and a (really) full stomach.

Just awesome and you need to try . The overall experience was just wonderful! After being picked up from our hotel we went to a rice field to learn a little about rice. Then we went to a real Balinese home, to which we got a very pleasant introduction from the owner. After that we started to cook a Balinese dinner with eight different dishes. Of course with some help from the friendly staff, who explained a lot in English. The taste was just awesome and we really enjoyed the experience. The location of the house is just fantastic and you will be overlooking a jungle valley. Puspa, her husband and the staff is just great and you will receive the recipies in the end.

Absolutely by far BEST experience !. This cooking class was recommended by friends of ours.We went to the market learned about the ingredients and went back to Paons own home whereShe holds her group cooking classes. We made over 7 dishes from scratch and got to eat what we made over looking beautiful scenery. Her ingredients and chef help were of high quality. We learned so much we can't wait to have an Indonesian cook off with our couple friends that took this class when they visited Bali. I would highly recommend this cooking class she was amazing.Facilities were clean instructions were clear and it was sooooo yummy thank you for an amazing experience we ll never forget

Fantastic Cooking Course!. Just back from a brilliant morning with Puspa and her team. Tour of market was fun and interesting despite being a bit smelly from the overnight rain! All the food we cooked was delicious and there was plenty to go around. Puspa even cooked some mie goreng for us which was not on the typical menu. A must if in Ubud!

Great fun. It was one of the most memorable tours we have done whilst in Bali. We got picked up from our hotel in Kuta and got driven to the Ubud markets. We walked around and tried some of the local fruits and our guide taught us about all the different foods and spices they have to offer. We then saw the rice terraces and then went to the home to start cooking. It was a fantastic experience and would do it over again.

Private Tour of the Markets. This was such an amazing experience. We were really struggling to see Bali at its deepest roots with all the tourism around. The Husband of the Wife running this cooking class was kind enough to take me and my other half around the extremely rural and local markets near Ubud which were truly spectacular. He bought us all sorts of fruits and bits to try and we learnt so much in one day. When we went on to their beautiful traditional Bali house his wife gave us all a lovely drink while the they taught us the weird and wonderful ways of the Balinese. We were then lead on to the kitchen cook some insanely tasty food.

Fantastic! Highlight of my trip!. I did the cooking class and market tour on Wednesday and will be recommending to all friends and family visiting Bali. It was so much fun and every step along the way was filled with humour and information. The cooking experience was very hands on and we participated in every aspect of making the meal (8 dishes), and we got a booklet if all the recipes we made. As for the food... it was honestly the best, freshest, tastiest Indonesian food I habe tasted since being in Bali. Best class ever, and Puspa is a darling!

Perfectly organised cooking class. Paon Bali Cooking Class was an amazing experience. Puspa has put a great program together, including a walking tour of the Ubud market before you are taken to her house for a fun morning of Balinese cooking.20 people in the class was not a problem as everything is extremely well organised and executed by Puspa and her staff. A few things were pre-prepared (e.g. we didn't cook the rice), but all the essential was chopped, blended or cooked by us participants - mostly in teams of two - after a quick demo of what to do.And the final result was incredible. We cooked around 8 different dishes, and they made up one of the best lunches we had in Bali.We highly recommend Paon Bali Cooking Class.

I wish I could give this 10 stars..... I wish I could give this 10 stars....that is how incredible the experience was!!! Baspa (sorry if I spelled that incorrectly) was an amazing hostess, both informative and very funny!!!! The school is inside her family's beautiful home overlooking the jungle and the set up and staff were all Amazing! The class itself was very informative and the food was EVEN better!!!! There were 6 total in our class and it was such fun getting to chat with everyone If you're staying close to Ubud they offer free pick up and drop off

Wonderful experience! Highly Recommend!. My brother and I had such a great time learning about traditional balinese cuisine at this cooking experience. This family is so incredibly nice and hospitable! From the moment were handed delicious drinks when we arrived, to the detailed cooking instructions, to even the demonstration of traditional methods such as the Balinese mortar and pestle, we had a wonderful time.Also, the food was so incredibly delicious, it was difficult to not stuff yourself! The trip to the market was also a nice touch. Our tour guide was very knowledgable and let us sample a number of common fruits consumed in Bali.

Start your engines please...... What an amazing experience. From the moment we were picked up from our hotel in an air conditioned vehicle, until the moment we were dropped back, we were made to feel welcome. Our guide, Wayan was friendly and helpful especially explaining the different fruits, vegetables and spices at the Ubud Markets. Once we'd finished at the markets, the real fun began, as we were taken to the rice fields and then off to the families home for the cooking class to begin. Wayan and Puspa, the King and Queen welcomed us into their home and we were taken through the preparation processes and the cooking process for 8 dishes, which were beyond being just tasty. Puspa was the perfect hostess and she has a great sense of humour. Anyone who does this cooking class will not only walk away full, but with the skills and knowledge to recreate these tasty dishes at home.

One of my best days in Bali. Immersion in Balinese culture. Invaluable. And fun and delicious. And beautiful. I loved cooking in coconut shell coals and the 'Balinese food processor.' There was kind accommodation made for different dietary needs. Do not miss this class! The chef is awesome!

Amazing!. My family had the pleasure of doing this for a morning cook. We were taken through the market and got to try some fruit and see the types of herbs they use. Cooking class was absolutely amazing and the best experience!! Very friendly staff and very easy to understand. Very very highly recommended for families, couples, solo and friends but probably not too good for young children. Worth the money and the area is beautiful, especially for sight seeing. Would do it again!! 10/10

Suprised - but in a very nice way. We were expecting a small Balinese kitchen but this was a professional set up, with a well thought out kitchen and preparation and dining area, with a great setting.Puspa and her team had everything spot on - and organised everyone with uber efficiency, humour and very tasty food. You basically prepared, cooked and ate the groups evening meal.Would certainly recommend, and my 'honey bun' (thanks Pupsa) now has no excuses not to get a meal ready.

Absolutely amazing . Wayan, Puspa and their family welcomed us to their beautiful home in ubud.They were so welcoming and friendly.Started off with a market tour and returned to their home to start the class. Food was absolutely amazing and fresh. Their assistants were so friendly and cleaned all the benches plates and bowls and utensils as we went along. She often mentioned about the risks of Bali belly so she ensured everything was of 1st class standard. The classes were so much fun and the food we cooked tastes awesome.I would highly recommend this to everyone going to Bali.Thank you to wayan and Puspa for making our visit an amazing experience

Excellent Cooking Class. Had a wonderful time at Paon Cooking class. I had attended a class a few years ago but enjoyed this class thoroughly. Classes are run on the grounds of the home of the owners, in beautiful surroundings. The premises are immaculate and the staff were welcoming and helpful. We were picked up from our hotel in Ubud and started our class with a visit to a beautiful rice field. When we arrived at Paon, we met the owners and whilst we sipped on a delicious welcome drink, she introduced herself and shared some details about herself and her home. This was an interesting way to meet the rest of the class and get everyone chatting. Basically, everyone is involved in the cooking which was a lot fun. The owner and staff are efficient but manage the class with a great deal of humour. We produced a wide range of traditional dishes and then sat down to a wonderful feast. At the end of the evening everyone received a copy of the recipes. We were also encouraged to contact the owner if, when we got home, we could not access all the ingredients, so she could provide alternatives. Once again I had a wonderful evening and definitely recommend this class to anyone who wants to learn how to produce delicious Balinese dishes.

Great Laugh and Really Practical . We were a group of 4 girlfriends and we all really enjoyed it. Very informative, really enjoyed the market tour and then the background behind Balinese family life. Then you get straight into the cooking, and learn about the main elements of satay and curry. Loved it, nice group of people and the staff were excellent. Would highly recommend it, much better to be in a traditional Balinese home.

Great experience!. We did the course with the market included and it was very interesting to discover all the exotic fruit & veggis of Indonesia. After that we went to the family's rice field and got to know how rice is grown.Then we went to the cooking course (around 20 persons in total). That's a big group, but they oganised it very well, so everyone could try out everything and we cooked in teams.The location is beautiful, in the middle of the rice fields with view over the rainforest. The food was very good quality and delicious. Everything was easy to understand and for 350 000 Rupiah it was a great value! Thanks :-) See you next time.

best organized cooking class. I have taken cooking classes over the years in many places, but few were as well organized as this one. The trip to the market was great fun. In the class we made 8 dishes plus a demonstration of dessert- the class size was perfect at 8 and everyone had hands on experience. Best was the teaching of two basic sauces - peanut and curry that can be applied broadly. Would recommend to anyone interested in a Bali Cooking class. (also loved the fact it was in a home and we learned about the traditions of architectural home layout in Bali culture).

Best meal in Bali!. We took this class upon a recommendation from my cousin and it was amazing. We loved the stories we heard before the cooking began and my husband and I had a great time cooking together. You are in a large group but it still feels intimate. Great to have the recipes as a take home and they can email it to you as well. Our best meal in Bali and can't wait to cook when we get home!

Great class, tasty food!. We did the morning cooking class that included an informative tour around the market. The staff were all friendly and spoke English really well. The class takes place about 10 minutes outside of Ubud but you get picked up and dropped off, and welcomed with a lovely cold drink. Coffee, tea and water are unlimited throughout the class, and the views were amazing over the forest. The food was delicious, and everyone got the chance to help prepare and cook a wide range of traditional dishes. Would definitely recommend doing this class, a really fun way to spend the morning!

Highly recommended!. Paon Cooking class is amazing! We had a lot of fun cooking. From the drivers to the cooks, very warm, kind and funny people to be around! Puspa, Wayan and the others are very skilled in teaching you how to cook these delicious dishes (still can't believe we made those). We did the afternoon version without the market visit, and it was just fine. In return we had this beautiful sunset view over the lush Ubud hills from the open kitchen and dining room! Thanks for one of the best experiences in our Indonesia trip!

Fun, interesting, and a unique experience!. This was a wonderful experience, and SO much more than just a cooking class. We were picked up at our hotel, and our tour of the market was fun and informative. We then arrived at Puspa's home, where her husband gave a fun little talk about his home, his traditions, his history, and his life in general. He had a WONDERFUL sense of humor, and very entertaining stories. Our entire group was smiling, laughing, and learning.The cooking class was so enjoyable. While Puspa has a very organized and structured process, the class is still laid back, easy, and fun. It's the perfect combination.And best of all - you get to eat all of the delicious food, and take home the recipes! I recommend contacting them directly on their website, and making the reservation quite far in advance. It takes some time to hear back from them, and our class was fully booked! At this time (October 2015) we did NOT need to pay ahead of time.

Well recommended . Myself my mum and 24 year old son went to this class on the recommendation of the hotel. Hotel pick up at 8am, trip to Ubud market with tour of the food and spices then out to the rice fields and on to the class. 20 of us in the class but didn't feel too many. Infomative class presented with humour and knowlege by Wayan and Pushpa in their traditional home with purpose built kitchen/classroom. involved in chopping, mixing, preparing and cooking the 8 dishes. Then a sit down amazing lunch and back to the hotel by 2. Thank you Wayan and Pushpa for a great day

A fun cooking experience in Bali. Puspa and her husband is very polite, humble and welcoming. Since the moment they picked me up from my villa, showed us around in Ubud market and got us to taste local fruits to the entire session of the class is a wonderful experience. I do not cook often back home so I was a little worried when I signed up for the cooking class but it was pretty easy and we all followed the instructor step by step so nothing was too hard. The kitchen/their house is very clean and the open kitchen offers a good view when we are making the cuisine.Food was very tasty, couldn't believe we made them ourselves, the ingredients they used seems pretty fresh. They provide recipes for the cuisines of the day, so for someone is enthusiastic about cooking, can follow the recipes and make them back home. Recommend to those who looking to do something different in Bali, I personally will go back again next time I am in Bali

Happy wife, happy life!. This cooking class was so much fun! Staring off with a tour of the local market, our tour lady was super informative and it really felt like an educational tour. She took us through the market the locals use to buy their fruit and vegetables and many more items, explaining the different foods we came across, what they are used for and how they differ from European equivalents. After the tour we headed to our cooking class. Upon arrival we were greeted with a refreshing drink and given an interesting and funny introduction to the place we would be cooking in. The course is family run and the husband was a great entertainer, telling us about Balinese home traditions, family traditions and what each area of the home symbolises. He also made sure to drill home the saying 'happy wife, happy life', which being a newly wed along with another couple at the course, made us laugh :-)The cooking course was introduced by his lovely wife, where apart from being so friendly and inviting, really took us through our ingredients and the different courses we would be making and when each course is typically had in Balinese life. The cooking course itself I would say relied on the teamwork of your group, where together you take different responsibilities of the preparation. This was a great way to meet people and have a good chat as you chopped, grounded and sliced your ingredients. Each step of the course was well instructed and any ingredients that may be harder to find in your home country were given examples of substitutions. Fun and laughter was encouraged and all the courses felt like something you could roughly replicate at home. The surroundings to the location were beautiful and once everything was prepared and cooked, as a group you were able to enjoy your team effort meal.If you are in Bali this cooking class is well worth the book! You will not be disappointed.

Excellent cooking class!. It was really excellent experience. As I work in gastronomy, very interesting for me. We started at local Ubud food market with great guide. Then we moved to rice fields and later to Puspa´s house. Having a warm welcome by Puspa´s husband :-). The cooking was very simple and we enjoyed a lot of fun. Puspa is really fantastic women! Very friendly, very warm! You must fall in love with her! Thanks again for the great time!

complimentary birthday cake made by Puspa herself!. I do not need to repeat the view reviews made by the other reviewers. awesome experience.what surprised me was the cake made by Puspa herself, it had rum infused inside. kudos!

Fun, informative and delicious!. We had an amazing time at this cooking class! Staff was friendly and approachable and both the owner and her husband were very kind and humorous. The cost per person is $350,000 rupiah and you pay at the end of your class. As we lived in kuta and had a driver, we met our guide in front of ubud palace (note they also do pick up at kuta but it's around $400,000 return). At first it was a little confusing as our guide didn't have a sign so we didn't know who we were looking for. But they found us at the end so it was all good. We were taken to the ubud market to show what produce we will be using, which was quite interesting. The market itself is not really the cleanest and is quite busy. So if you're not a fan of 'asian markets' I suggest you take the afternoon class which bypasses the market. Our guide then took us to a beautiful rice field and explained how they grow rice. We were each given a welcome cold drink when arrived at poan's house and her husband gave us a welcome intro - he was very nice and humorous! We were given unlimited tea, coffee and water during the class. They really took great care of us, making sure we weren't thirsty and that we understood everything. The whole cooking process was fun and well structured. I won't reveal too much here other wise I will spoil the fun! They will let you know alternatives to ingredients you might not have in your country. All in all, the food was super delicious and we will definitely recommend people to take this class. We will come back again Poan!

Excellent cooling class!. Not one bad word about this cooking class. Great atmosphere, delicious recipes, perfect timing, understandable explanation. We would highly recommend this to anyone interested in de Balinese kitchen!

Perfect. A cooking class in Bali was not on the agenda for my short stay.Sitting in the lobby of my hotel, a lovely lady said, that she had hdone this amazing cooking class and it was a must.Our driver took us to Ubud, where we were met by a darling man and 6 others. We had a wonderful tour of the markets, a rice paddy, and then taken to a beautiful home. The darling owner told us about his home and life, given fresh lemonade and then the cooking began.The wife guided us through and explained everything perfectly, in a gorgeous setting and open kitchen, where we were all given the chance to cut, slice and blend... Then put it altogether, before sitting down to a fantastic, scrumptious feast.What a treat to meet these wonderful people and to cook in their home. Tasting the authentic flavours of Bali. A must!

Highly recommended. Very organised and hospitable. Cooked a great variety of dishes and learned about Balinese culture at the same time. One of the highlights of my trip. I would recommend this to anyone.

Great Day in Paradise!. We loved this experience. Lovely people and wonderful food. You can't go wrong here. Wayan taught us the meaning and beauty of the Hindu family in Bali. His humor and genuiness is wonderfully unique. Coming from the west my husband and I feel deeply inspired. Truely a culture of love, hapiness and beauty. Puspa also has a wonderful sense of humor and along with her staff seamlessly worked with 20+ of us.  Somehow they managed to give us all individual attention and include everyone equally.It was an easy fun day in their beautiful family compound eating and meeting new friends from around the globe. Thank You! Wayan and Puspa

The only cooking class you need in Bali.... Puspa runs a wonderful cooking class. She caters for different food allergies and ensures you have everything you need for a great class. Puspa has many people helping through the cooking class, the day we went there was roughly 30 people in the class with 6 or more staff helping out. The class is hands on so you walk away knowing how to best prepare the food and everyone gets a turn preparing for each dish. There are about 10 different dishes! Your receive a recipe for each dish as well as tips for replacing certain foods based on the availability back home.The food market tour before hand was an eye opener and the tour of the rice field was also an education!You are picked up from your hotel and dropped back at the end of the class/tour.The food is delicious and an amazing way to spend a half day.Book in advance as best you can, the classes are very popular!

Very nice!. Nice people, great vegetables and meat, good lessons, delicious food! We've got the recepies to try at home.Went to the ricefields and they explaned the daily living of the Balinees in a nice way.

Great morning. Lovely hosts and fantastic food. Started with a trip around the market with explanations of herbs and spice before driving past rice field to the hosts house. The host family were really welcoming. Talked to us about Balinese living before taking us to the kitchen to cook. The lesson was really well organised and explained. The food was delicious and we came away with the recipes. Highly recommended.

A must do in Bali. Balinese food is cooked with tradition and love which is reflected in the class at Paon. The tour through the market highlights many of the fresh fruits and vegetables that are used in everyday cooking. Puspa is a hoot and we enjoyed her zest for life. She has a culinary teaching background from working in the hotel industry and now runs her own class with the help of some very sweet cooking assistants at her home. The setup is very clean, the equipment is in great condition and the ingredients are very fresh. You prep and then cook about 8 different dishes that are later shared family style with members of your cooking class. We each got a takehome recipe list and were told ingredients that you could substitute if they were not available back home. I have a passion for food and really enjoyed this class, but its a fun day for anyone who interested in learning how to cook some of the fun foods in Balinese cuisine.
Fun Time. I decided to do this course with my friend after seeing many positive reviews on here. Highly recommended even for people who don't like cooking like myself. You'll enjoy this one!

What a great way to spend an evening!. The food in Bali is so good that we decided to take a cooking class to learn how to make it! This class was one of the top rated, so we went for it. The ratings definitely do not disappoint. The entire experience was phenomenal! We were guided through making several dishes, served a welcome drink and tea throughout, and ate our delicious dinner while watching the sunset over the jungle. I might even do this every time I go to Bali!

Amazing. We decided to do this class because of its reviews and w ere not disappointed , absolutely loved the interaction with all the staff and other people doing the class , the food and market visit was great as well .

Amazing!. Amazing cooking class - the food is delicious (get around the tempeh)! The morning class takes you to the markets where you get to try some local produce, and to a stunning rice terrace where you learn about the harvest process as well as what life is like in the Village. The class is held at the home of the cooking teacher (where she lives with her husband and two kids). Upon arrival you get a nice cold lemon drink and her husband provides some on-point laughs and stories about living in Bali. The class itself is VERY well organised and everyone gets to do lots of different things. And best of all the teacher told us to email her whenever we wanted for other recipes and tips!

Flawless day. We visited this class in the morning of 7th October and from start to finish it was incredibly well organised and fun. The market tour, rice field visit and description of their Balinese house was incredibly informative and the class itself was brilliant. They made sure to spend time talking to all participants and swapped jobs so everyone got a full experience. The food was great too! Would highly recommend.

You are Family. First off, there are lots of cooking classes to choose from in Bali and in Ubud.None of them are as good as the Paon Bali Cooking Class.You feel like family here. They are kind, funny and attend to any of your needs. They are happy to answer any and all questions. With a group you get to cook many different dishes and share them all together at the end.You will chop and prep all the ingredients and you will cook them all as well. You get a lesson in Balinese cooking and in their culture.The morning class you go to the Ubud market and learn about the ingredients and spices you will be using. It's a mini tour before you go cook.You can book private classes or be part of a large group. I have to say cooking with a group of strangers, who become your friends, is priceless.Food and cooking really does break down boarders.If you are staying in Ubud, they will come pick you up at your hotel, and return you there once class is done.I highly recommend this class, and if I had time, I would go back again.

Great fun and fantastic food.. We chose this class as a result of recommendations copying from trip advisor reviews. It was a great choice! After being collected from out hotel we started the morning with a short visit to a small local market. The cooking class was held in an attractive garden setting which was well equipt and very clean. There was a lot of attention placed on hygiene. The group size of 10 was perfect.The food was very fresh and the instructions easy to follow. The hostess was delightful and very engaging. It was a great "hands on" experience and whole set up was very professional. There was a good selection of recipes which could easily repeated at home. Most importantly, the food we prepared was absolutely DELICIOUS. A most enjoyable experience.

Excellent cooking school. Spent a lovely day with Puspa, Wayan and their assistants learning to make traditional Indonesian sauces and dishes. First we went to the traditional food market to have a look at the local ingredients, then travelled to Puspa's beautiful home where we made and ate lots of dishes. E erythema is very, very clean. Puspa has hand washing basins there and we were sent to wash hands repeatedly, and she uses aqueous gel on her own hands. Very well run and informative. Thank you Puspa!

Great learning experience for authentic local food. Puspa and her husband do a great job at making you feel like part of their family as they guide you through the experience of preparing your own Balinese meal. Felt like I was learning how to cook from my grandma all over again! Was the perfect date night for me and my partner in Bali.

A must-do in Ubud!. The most wonderful evening!! The hosts were so funny and not only explained about cooking but we also got a lesson on how the compounds (family houses) work in Bali and a visit to the rice fields. All the food we cooked was beautiful and it was lovely to sit down to the big group meals. The entire process is organised so well - from the free pick-up in Ubud to the welcome drink, food preparation and cooking.

Balinese cooking class. I would highly recommend the Paon cooking tour. The day starts relatively early with a pick up from Kuta @ 7.30am driving out to the markets in Ubud to see where the fresh product is purchased from. Onto terraced rice fields and then through to the location for the class. It's extremely well organized and Puspa with her husband are friendly, professional and efficient hosts. A truly great experience with hands on chopping, grinding, cooking and finally enjoying the amazing food you've just cooked. Along with recipes to come home with and impress your friends and family with your newly acquired Indonesian culinary skills.

Best cultural cooking class in Ubud, Bali. Wayan and Puspa responded to us very fast and arranged to pick us at our hotel on time. We went to market and head to their kitchen for cooking lesson. They gave us warm welcome with cold drink and tea and told us some cultural story there. Note: their house is located in the center of Ubud and it is in the middle of a village. That is why we chose them.We had a lot of fun there and we came back to write a journal with photos to show our friends. They organized class very well and explain to us in the easiest way to understand. The environment is clean.If we came back to Bali, we will visit Wayan family again.

Do not miss this class!. This was an amazing experience. First and foremost, the food was delicious, the organization of the class was unbelievable, and it was incredibly clean. But I have to say that the highlight of the class was Puspa. It is worth taking the class just to meet this amazing, hilarious woman and to see her beautiful home. I chose this class because of the reviews it had on Trip Advisor, and I was not disappointed. One of the highlights of my trip to Bali.

Surprising, delectable, perfect. My wife and I attended the Paon Cooking Class, and while rated highly on TripAdvisor, wasn't sure what to expect. We were picked up at our hotel in a comfortable van. When we got to the property, I thought, oh no... is this going to be dodgy. But no, as we got to the kitchen, my fears were alleviated, as a modern and clean kitchen was displayed to us. We had an amazing time. The host and her helpers were so friendly, and knowledgeable. We got in and assisted with the preparation and the cooking. Just perfect. We met a lovely couple from Germany, and we shared dinner with them at our table. The food was excellent. And the bathrooms were modern and clean, a surprise for Indonesia. This is something everyone should experience during their visit to Ubud.

Brilliant fun and amazing hosts. Had an absolute splendid time here this morning and couldn't recommend it more. Group was around 25 people, very well organised so that everyone is always included. Very social atmosphere and the hosts explained everything so well. #1 for a reason!

Amazing experience . I wish I could give this more stars...it deserves an uber rating..so good..from the moment you arrive and are greeted with a cold drink through to hands on cooking and then eating your meal this is an amazing experience. You are given very clear instructions and recipes to take home. Puspa runs this cooking school and she is a star in her own right. At rp 350,000 this was a good price for an afternoon to remember.

Great meal, even better experience. We spent two weeks in Bali and this was unquestionably one of the top highlights. We couldn't stop raving about how friendly everyone on the Island was and Wayan and Puspa we're the best example of this. It was great to learn about their home and lifestyle and to tour the market and rice field. And that's to say nothing of the class itself- which was so much fun, so educational and most of all, so delicious! You can't leave Bali without learning to cook Balinese cuisine and this is the place to do it!

Fantastic Experience. This cooking class is so deserving of all the fantastic reviews. A taxi is arranged to pick you up which means you don't have to worry about getting there or finding the place. When you arrive you are welcomed with a cocktail and warm introduction. The setting couldn't be more perfect, open air with a jungle backdrop sets really sets the scene for the experience. The class is taught in English and a group of about 12 - which is just the right size, and great fun when you all sit down to eat together. There is something to be learnt by a first time cook or a chef who wants to expand there knowledge and the food turned out fantastic! Anyone should try this on their visit to Bali. The value of the class is unbelievable - booking in advance is a must!

More event than cooking course. The team is really friendly and funny, you learn about Bali culture and their life.Also the food tastes really good.However, it terms of "cooking class" I was a bit disappointed. We were more than 20 people and i had the feeling of being in a factory. You get assigned to cutting certain veggies and do not prepare the whole meal for yourself. You get the parts needed ready on a plate and put it in the pan. Then all the pans will again be put in one and the dish finished by them. All in all I did not have the feeling of cooking my own meal.

Amazing!. We had a lovely time here at the evening class. The hosts were a couple of comedians and the whole experience was interesting and a great laugh. Food was delicious and views great! Would recommend this to anyone!

A fantastic day for everyone. I went to this cooking class with my daughters- 11 and 13 and it was fantastic. The staff were so friendly and well organised and the food we produced was so yummy. Highly recommend this day out

Fun and Educational. A very relaxing way for a group to learn how to cook Balinese food. Staff was friendly, knowledgeable and accommodating. The food, prepared from scratch, delicious. One of the highlights of out trip.
Best authentic food. Very good experience. The days was well planned and very fun. The food was the best ever!! Thank you for a great experience in Bali.

Fabulous food education at a beautiful setting. A fantastic evening learning how to cook Indonesian and Balinese food in a great setting. The staff was friendly, the pace just right and the kids (12 and 15) could handle it and enjoyed it. The food was amazing and a great insight into some of the food we had eaten at restaurants. Our hostess was warm and funny so made us feel we were in a family home not a commercial cooking course.

A perfect experience!. Puspa should have her own TV show since she is a great entertainer and very talented chef. Wayan, Puspa and their team are excellent and we enjoyed the evening with her and the Go Eat Give group led by Sucheta Rawal.Puspa - when will you start your own TV cooking show??ZM

Professional & Fun. We had a lovely day visiting Ubud Market, the rice fields and then joining the cooking class where we prepared our lunch. The welcome we received to the family home was great and very funny. Everything was very well organised as we produced very tasty dishes for lunch. We sat at a table with a few of our fellow tourist cooks with a fabulous view sampling what we had made. Only comment I would make is that the class size was alot bigger than I expected it to be so if you are looking for something a little more one on one, this might not be for you - however, it was well organised and the kitchen was big enough to accommodate everyone.

Couldn't get any better!. We were picked up from our hotel and driven to the Ubud Markets where we were guided through by a lovely Balinese girl who was very informative and spoke english well. Then off to Wayan's & Puspa's house. We were greeted with a lovely cold drink, and told of some of the Bali ways of life. Then off to the cooking class. It's situated on the balcony of their beautiful house with fantastic views. We all were able to participate in the preparation and cooking of the different dishes. Great fun, great hosts, great food and a good laugh. Cleanliness is very high on their menu for those of you worried about Bali Belly! Then we sat down to feast on the dishes we had made. Would do this every time we visit Bali. Excellent.

Fantastic experience. Went here based on hotel recommendation. Great experience with visit to market, then rice fields and kitchen is in family compound. Very very organised and clean and entertaining and great exposition. We ate our own creations and we got to keep the recipes. We cooked many dishes together with about 18 others. They arrange pick up and drop off. Fab experience!

Some of the Best food in Bali. What an Experience! This was everything i wanted in a cooking class and more. We were taken to the markets, shown the rice paddies and then taken into the beautiful home of the family who ran the class. The surroundings were breathing and the food was honestly some of the best i had eaten in bali. Such a beautiful caring and fun family with a sense of humor too. Absolutely fantastic!!!

Perfect from start to finish.. Cannot speak highly enough of this class. They take you to and from your accomodation. The trip starts with a look around the local market so that us as foriegners become aware of the ingredients are used. You are taken to visit a rice paddy before finally ending up at their luxurious cooking area in a town high up in the hills.Great ingredients. Great service. Smiley faces all around.The dessert was especially delicious. Dont miss out!

A fun experience with lovely hosts. A really enjoyable and educational experience. The hosts were excellent and really explained everything well including some nice stories about Balinese culture.The cooking experience was interactive and hands on however the class was a little large. I would recommend to anyone wanting to learn true Balinese food!

Great food, awesome staff, enjoyable . Good way to spend half a day.We started at the market where someone explained us the different kinds of fruit and veg there are in Bali. We were even invited to try some of the different fruits. The guy who explained everything was speaking English very clearly and had a good sense of humour which made the market visit more enjoyable. After the market we went up to the rice fields where he had some interesting information for us. Then we got to the cooking class, where we got a welcoming drink and where able to get a rest. The host of the class was inviting us to learn something about his culture and family. It gave us such a warm feeling of being welcome. The class and the cooking was perfect structured, everyone was able to help. The female host of the class was clear in her commands and had everything under control, that's why we didn't get the feeling of being not useful. The menu which we cooked had a soup in it. Which I didn't prefer. I have been in Bali several times, I can't count anymore, but soup was never on my plate. It would be interesting to see if the menu differs from year to year. In that case, I would definitely come back.

Groups are too large. There were 26 people in our class which gave us the opportunity to merely chop/cut/dice a few foods whilst others in the class worked on other ingredients. After cooking everything up, it was then combined in a big pot so we couldn't eat what we personally made nor adjust to our liking. Because of this, we found that most of the dishes were nice but bland and lacked the real spicy Indonesian flavours were hoping to discover. The hosts were nice but it ran more like a production line then an intimate cooking experience in a Balinese home. I wouldn't recommend this to others, look around for something that offers smaller class sizes.

Good. Had a really enjoyable time and have learned at least one recipe I can see myself using when I get home. Ideally I'd have been offered the opportunity to buy a beer or a wine with the dinner I made.

Most enjoyable experience and most delicious meal in Bali!. This experience at Paon in Bali (Ubud) was recommended by a Balinese friend who loves to cook. My fiancé and I have previously also done excellent cooking classes in Thailand, Laos and Vietnam and this was just as enjoyable and informative. We were invited into the home and kitchens with warmth and a high regard for hygiene, welcomed with some lime juice and then had the owners share the story of their traditional home. If you have allergies/intolerances, this cooking school checks to accommodate. We cooked 8 dishes and then shared lunch. All are dishes I could imagine recreating at home. I highly recommend it!

A really great experience. In my opinion the must do to get a cultural feel of family,religion,food.It could be cheaper but I don't mind since it includes the delicious meal we made.Highly recommended.

A must do. I was glad to assist to a little lesson about rice farming/plotting, to get recipes at the end.Probably one of the testiest diner we had in Bali.Taxi to pick you up and driving you back to the hotel.All must have already been said before. Just do it and enjoy ! Gold medal ! A++

Greatest cooking class ever. Just another great comment about this place! The class is great! The hosts are lovely and the place is beautiful! One of the things to do in Bali! Would recommend every time!

Underwhelmed. I agree with odo5435 view that perhaps Paon is a victim of its own success. At the start, the host were very charming, introducing us to their home and Balinese culture. What's more, they never fail to make all of us laugh with their jokes.
