However I felt that the class was rather commercialize with 30+ student at the same time, when it was obvious that the facilities there wasn't able to handle so many people at a go. Although we got to "cook" 8 dishes, it didn't really felt like you learn much from it.You start out with preparing the ingredient by going to any available stations (there wasn't even enough stations and they had to create a new one just for me). Each stations prepared different ingredients, you could be grinding or chopping any ingredients. Once everyone is done with preparing the ingredients, you are paired up to start "cooking", one person will be in-charge of working on the pan, while the other is in-charge of putting in the ingredients and condiments. Everything was done in a rush, you only get about 3-5mins cooking each dish, simply because even before the food is ready they will rush you to combine everyone dished into one big pan. Where the cook, will continue cooking it. So there is no individual taste to the cooking because everyones cooking get combine and the cook will make further changes to enhance the taste. Hence, because everyone preps a different ingredients and rushed to cook the food. You really have no idea what you are cooking because each dish wasn't made step by step, which i guess was more time efficient for the company. So at the end of a day you get a recipe book, but is clueless about how to go about with it back home.I would have hope that it was a more cosy setting with much fewer participants, considering your not paying a bulk/lower cost for it and a more detailed cooking class.

Wonderful Cooking Class!. We had a lovely morning- and learned so much! (And I cook regularly at home) The grounds are set in the beautiful rice terraces, and you are able to enter one of the local compounds to get to the cooking class, and get off of the main streets of Ubud. The class was very informative, the teachers were wonderful, and the food was absolutely delicious!

Victims of Their Own Success?. Wayan and 'Auntie' Puspa are entertaining hosts and their home is very beautiful. The 'but' is that there were too many participants in our class - almost 30. This was our third cooking class in different venues over several visits to Ubud. The Paon (=Balinese for kitchen) is well designed for approximately 16 participants but individual experience is limited once that number is exceeded. Instead of following the cooking process through from start to finish all tasks are shared.This means that we did not get to follow the flow of ingredients from start to finish.Some chopped, some sliced. some fried and some of the basic processes such as blanching vegetables or extracting coconut milk/cream were bypassed completely. When it came to desserts there was no 'hands on' whatsover - it was simply done in front of us all.The menu was most definitely traditional Balinese and the eventual eating of the meal was delicious but we had no idea of who had had what input into any of the courses.Unfortunately, the class I would highly recommend is closed for 'renovations' at the moment. It had far fewer participants, the instruction was much more personal and we all got to eat the exact meals that we had prepared. For a slightly cheaper price.If you are more interested in cooking than in being entertained, I would very much recommend that you search around for less popular classes. You will more likely get the full experience of Balinese cooking.

Traditional Balinese cooking. Fantastic experience , first they picked us up at our hotel and took us to the market to show us where the locals shop and then to a private house for the cooking class , it was excellent our host told us of Balanese traditional family life and then we chopped and ground spices and vegetables and made soup , yellow paste , vegetable curry , salads tofu , satay desert etc etc it was fun and very informative not to mention delicious.

Fantastic first day in Ubud!. We did this on our first day in Ubud and it was a brilliant start to our stay. We were picked up from our hotel and driven to Ubud market where we met our host. She showed us around the market and we were amazed by all of the different fruit and vegetables we saw there. Then we were driven to the family's home, which overlooked a lush valley. The family were friendly and our host was brilliant- funny, knowledgeable and engaging. There were 10 of us in the class and we all helped to prepare different Balinese food which we ate together at the end of the morning. It was a fantastic way to learn more about and sample different regional food.

Best cooking class in Bali. The best cooking class in Bali. We went there from Kuta beach on scooters. That's about a 1-1,5 hour trip and went back in the evening. That was quite the adventure so I would recommend you going there while you stay in Ubud. You'll be most handsomely welcomed with some Es Djeruk (which really is a nice refreshment when it's hot outside). The building in which the cooking class is given is absolutely beautiful and the view during the evening is stunning (that's why i'd recommend you to do the evening class). The different kinds of food you make are one of the best Indonesian foods i've ever tasted (and i'm quite used to really good Indonesian food). The hosts are lovely and I would definitely recommend you doing this course with your honey(bunny).

Fantastic way to learn about Balinese food. The people who gave us the cooking class are really fun and good people. They provide a free pick-up from the hotel. We started the day on a tour through a local market, away from the touristic Bali. It was very nice to see Bali in that way. After that we went to see the coffee Luwak plantation, wich was very interesten! They had an extra guide that tell us about the Luwak production and Madi (guide from the cooking class) told us about all the different herbs and spices that they grow in the Luwak plantation. We had a cup of coffee and tea afterwards. Then the cooking class. The two chefs gave us just enough information that it was still fun to learn and the flavours they cobined were excellent! All was done with a lot of humor and it was a great way to spend a morning like this in Ubud. If you are ever in Ubud you should really check this out!

Fun and a lot of new knowledge. The family that runs the cooking classes is super nice! After introducing the fruits and spices on the local market they shown us rice paddies and how the rice is grown. They talked about balinese culture and shown as their traditional bali house with explanations what certain building means. This was really nice. Cooking was very well organized, staff was great! A lot of new knowledge about the food and bali traditional cooking. Definitely recommend!

Brilliant way to spend a morning in Ubud . On Time and Friendly pickup from our hotel in Ubud! Exciting and informative tour of the morning markets. Passionate explanation of each ingredient and enthusiastic cooks at hand to show the class the Balinese style of cooking.

Charming. A wonderful morning with a truly genuinely charming Balinese family.Hilarious and educational - a great way to spend time here and learn about Balinese culture (I had been dubious about it at first, but loved it!)
Had a fantastic time. Lots of tasty food, very relaxing but also informative. Puspa was a fantastic teacher and kept us all entertained! Highly recommended.

An amazing Bali Experience. The Paon Bali cooking class was an amazing experience and well worth the 350,000 rupiah. We did the morning class so we could visit a local market. The class started at 830. We were staying in Sanur so we did not do the free car pickup in Ubud area. We met at Ubud Palace. We saw the cars luckily otherwise I'm not sure we would have know where to meet since we didn't see anyone with signs. We spent probably 30-45 minutes learning about the different items at the market. We tried different fruits and bought some spices since they were cheap and we knew we weren't getting ripped off. After the market visit you head out to some rice terraces and learn about how to harvest rice and a bit about Bali culture. Our class had 24 people (which at first I was like oh this isn't going to be very personal) but everyone rotated different jobs and got to have their hand in everything. We learned how to make 8 different items then had a big feast. Make sure you have rupiah or dollars (60 dollars so not a great exchange rate) since there is not a credit card machine since it is at a home. After you finish (about 2) they will drop you off back at your hotel or somewhere in Ubud.

Nice and relaxed cooking. The cooking site is very comfy as we were cooking in an open kitchen. Group size of 10 people was perfect and the ambience is very relaxed and friendly. As we are cooking several dishes in only short time it is difficult to follow the food processing steps: eg. one second you are cutting something, the next time you use it it has already been fried without you noticing it. But I would recommend this course, it was fun and I'm already excited about cooking the food at home.
So much fun . What a great experience, loved it so much I'm going back again in October. Lovely home beautiful hosts and delicious food
Foods with stories. Professional cooking class, tasty foods with nice stories:)One of our best experiences in Bali:))))))))))))))))))))))))))

Awesome Cooking Experience. The food from this class was the best food I ate while in Ubud. We cooked more dishes than I expected. There was a nice flow to the class and I was very impressed how organized it was. The only critique I have is that we were the last group to be dropped off by our drive so we had a welcome drink and coffee shoved at us and we were expected to drink them within a few minutes before the class started. I would have liked to have 15 minutes to enjoy the drinks and take a few pictures of the facilities.

Superb Experience!. Was so lucky enough for taking this class! I called Paon Cooking class 4days prior to my trip in Bali, Yes I'm a solo traveller and my first time in Bali. Puspa was so accommodating to confirmed my booking thru phone though I'm not really sure if they will really come to my hotel in Ubud to pick me up for that class since it's just verbal. To my surprised they did and on time!! When i met Puspa in the school she was even worried if I'm ok as i arrived to my hotel in Bali at 1am and my pick up time was 8:30am! { yah I just want to spend much of my time during my short vacation }It's one of my bucket list to learn the Balinese dishes and Puspa and Wayan did a great job in explaining everything to us! It was so organized from Pick up to going to the market, the cooking class itself and drop to our hotel. The best part of it was we even cooked it by ourselves and it's sooo yummy!! :) it was a truly great experience!!! Thank you Puspa's team!! You really cook from the heart!!

Great experience.. We enjoyed Puspa's cooking class during our staying in Ubud and we loved it.The day started in the early morning, when we have been picked up from our hotel and brought to the food market where the guide showed us most of the ingredients that we would have used lately during the class.Afterwards we have been introduce to Puspas's house by her funny husband who explained us the fundamentals of a Balinese family.Then we moved to the open.air kitchen where we had all the ingredients to be used to cook; the group has been divided in smaller ones, each with a different task.At the end we enjoyed a pleasant lunch and we were provided with different receipts to bring back home.

Number 1 for a reason - the best of the best. What an incredible experience. Wayan and Puspa invite you to their home to learn the techniques and traditions of Balinese cuisine. After a tour of the market and learning about local fruits and vegetables and a tour of the rice terraces we began our class. The food and ingredients were fresh and locally grown. The class wasn't intimidating, but fun, great for everyone! Getting to enjoy the meal at the end was great and taking home the recipes was a bonus!

Good way to spend an afternoon. Took the afternoon class with my cousin, which took about 4 hours from start to finish.Price is good for what you get: pick up and drop off at hotel, quick visit of rice fields, cooking class and dinner.The place was neat and with high hygiene standard; we only used fresh ingredients and nothing ready made.Our hosts were friendly and welcoming, we got a number of drinks on the house (juices, tea, coffee, water and beer), as well.It's not the traditional cooking class where everyone has an individual station facing the main chef. It was a collective effort under the direction of our host, and - quite frankly - given the context it is well worth the money (just 16£). You get to taste as you go, eat everything you cook, which was delicious and filling, plus the social environment gives you a chance to make friends with the other participants.We made soup, 2 salads, 2 mains, 2 sauces and dessert. Everyone then gets the recipes on paperback.Overall an enjoyable experience.

Really Amazing Class. Just got back from the cooking class and my husband and I enjoyed it immensely! The market tour was awesome because the guide was telling us all about their local ingredients. The class itself was super efficiently run and everyone got to take part in every aspect, even with a group of 20, which we were worried about. The food was amazing and we were so full by the end of it. Wayan and Puspa, the hosts, were hilarious and so sweet. Had no problems booking through their website...received an email confirming within 30 mins. Overall, absolutely loved it!

Great fun, food and wonderful hosts. We attended and evening class and were lucky enough to have only our five family members in our class. It was wonderful from the start. The staff was very welcoming and helpful. We felt very much at ease and our chef made us all feel very welcome and eager to join in. All of our "children" are now in their twenties and this was a favorite evening for everyone. I highly recommend spending an evening here. It is well worth the time and money. What a fun and filling evening.

Fantastic, highly recommend! . Such an excellent evening! I did the afternoon course on Monday and was picked up at 3.45 from my hotel started at 4-8.We took a trip to the rice fields where we learned about how rice was produced, took a few snaps and headed back to their home.As a group we cooked 8 dishes and sat down to eat a starter of soup, various dishes for main course and then dessert.It was so organised and was run like clockwork. The food delicious and we all had great fun preparing the dishes. The hosts were super friendly and made the experience even more enjoyable.The course cost 350,000 and was well worth it for a fantastic evening out and each came away with a recipes of everything we cooked.

Very well organized cooking class. My husband and i went for the afternoon session on a Sunday. Whole course was about 4 hours from 4pm-8pm for 350,000 rupiah per person. Driver picks u up at your accommodation and drives u home after as well.Course was well organized as many have mentioned, efficient, well prepared with all the ingredients and necessary utensils. Food was great and more than enough, clear instructions. Best to go in pairs! Well worth the money but one thing would have been great if there could be an option of doing without the driver and having a lower price (since we have our own bike)
Fantastic cooking class!. Amazing experience, staff were so friendly and really got you involved. The recipes were delicious and the cooking we'll coordinated. I recommend it highly!

Fantastic Day. We attended a morning class with our 3 kids, and we were all made very welcome. The trip to the Markets was informative, but hard as we had a large group. It was interesting hearing about the rice paddies, before heading to the school. You are separated into groups and walked through the process of making lunch. It was delicious. You receive a cookbook with all the recipes.

A highlight of our honeymoon!. We took part in a private cooking class here on our honeymoon and would definitely recommend it. We were greeted by Puspa who gave us a very refreshing drink and then we were taken upstairs to our private kitchen for the afternoon/evening! They also do a group class but I would really recommend booking in for the private class. It was so relaxed and we got to do everything! Puspa left to run the class downstairs and we started prep with our teacher Wayan (not the owner Wayan- who we also met later on) Wayan was a great teacher who guided us through all of the preparation and cooking processes. We made so much food - satay, yellow curry, mushroom soup, steamed tuna, long bean salad and much more. They also catered for me as I do not eat meat and allowed my husband to make chicken satay/chicken curry and for me to make tofu satay/curry. The pace of the lesson was perfect and we were able to use traditional equipment, which was really well explained to us. We then sat down to eat it all and Puspa came in to see how it was going and gave us a beer. We were then left to eat and enjoy all of our creations. Before leaving we were given all of the recipes and I cannot wait to try these out and have friends over. Definitely a highlight of our honeymoon! Thank you Wayan, Puspa & Wayan!
Awesome hands on traditional Balinese cooking . Only our first, however this class is absolutely fantastic. Very well organized, clear instruction, very friendly, great recipes and awesome food!

One of the Best Experiences that We had on our Holiday. We were booked into this class by our tour operator, so we didn't really have any idea what to expect. Our tour guide took us to the door of the house where we were greeted with a delicious lemon drink and taken upstairs to the cooking area. The views from the dining room were amazing and we enjoyed looking out of the windows whilst waiting for the other group to arrive. Before the cooking class started they gave us the recipes and asked if anybody was allergic to any of the ingredients. I am mildly allergic to peanuts and there were no issues with that. I was always informed about what I could and couldn't eat and where other people in the class had allergies to ingredients that only played a minor role in the recipes they removed them altogether for us.The kitchen, despite there being many dishes worked on at one time, was always very organised and there was always something for our 8 and 13 year olds to be doing too. The food was all delicious and I would strongly recommend this class to anyone coming near to it.

Great class and excellent food!. My wife and I attended the afternoon class on August 5th. As the large majority of the reviewers, we were not disappointed.We were first welcomed by Wayan, who briefly explained us the life in a traditional Balinese family compound.After this short introduction, we got the cooking class with Puspa (Wayan's wife) in a very friendly atmosphere. Everything was well organized, the instructions were clear and the food easy to prepare.The food (8 dishes) was delicious!

Disappointing. If you have any a cooking class read our review of payuk BaliWe have done both and there are as no comparisonPaon was disorganised, the chef regularly interrupted the class to take phone calls and you didn't get much hands on cooking experience. It was far from bad but it was a poor second. The class was 20 which was too big as chef wanted to do everything. The food was very good though and like all Balinese everyone was friendly.

Fantastic cookery class witty such welcoming hosts. I honestly can't praise this enough. Everything was so efficient and smooth, we were impressed from the moment they picked us up to the moment we got dropped back at our hotel. The hosts welcome you into their home with welcome drinks and lovely anecdotes of their lives in Bali, they are also very amusing which helps add a sense of fun to the experience.The setting is stunning, the kitchen is sparkly clean and everything is beautifully presented. You get to prepare and cook so many dishes, which all taste delicious. We are vegetarian and they adapted the menu for us without making any fuss at all, likewise they did so for one person with an allergy. They have lots of staff around helping out and doing all the clearing up, who are also wonderfully friendly. I really couldn't recommend this course enough, it was incredibly good value for money, especially as that's your dinner well and truly covered!

Great day. I was recommended to take this class. By two different people and was not disappointed! Had a great morning touring the market, the cooking class was well run, very helpful and friendly, amazing recipes, plenty of space and a great kitchen.

#1 for good reason. When you first step foot in the Ubud home where the class is held, it's clear why Wayan and Puspa have the #1 cooking class in Bali. The traditional setting makes you feel like you are cooking in your own home; the kitchen is spotless and ingredients fresh; the dishes you make are absolutely delicious. You even get a recipe booklet to take home! This was a highlight of my Bali trip, and I cannot recommend it more! And make sure you have your camera, because everything from the house to the view to the food (even the raw ingredients) is beautiful presented! Don't be shy; they encourage photos! Book directly through the website, not through Expedia.

Lovely food and great class!. We had a great time. We went to the market first. Real nice to get information about all the food and we could ask all our question about all the goods, vegetables and food we did not know. Then to the cooking school. At first we thought there were many people, but they aranged that our group of 7 could cook and eat at one side and the other group at the other side. And the other group was very nice too, so we had a great time. We learned to cook different dishes and of course the yellow sauce. It tasted great! Puspa also gives all the recepies and you can always mail here if you have any question later when you are at home. Also Puspa was real nice on another question. We saw in bali all those oil candles in water. She had them as well. When ewe asked here where we could buy them, she got us some. And when she found out she didn t have the wicks she had them delivered to our hotel the next day. Wonderful Puspa. Many thanks and you made Balinese cooking much more accesible. I definitly am going to try this at home.

Awesome experience. The cooking class was awesome, the experience as a whole even better. We started by going to the market where we had explanations on all the Balienes ingredients, spices, cooking tools etc. Then we visited the family's rice field in their little town, and finally we arrived to their house where we cooked with a stunning view on the Balinese nature.The cooking class was very well organized and super simple to follow. They gave us tips to find ingredients back in our countries and what to replace some ingredients with if we couldn't find them. And they gave us the recipes of everything we cooked.I took the class with my family and my two little brothers (5 and 10) were treated liked kings, they had fruits, peanuts, they installed a matress in front of a TV just for them...All in all, I just lack words to describe how awesome this experience was !!!

clean and efficient workshop. The paon Bali cooking class takes place in the home of the hostess, who will tell you about the place during your welcome cocktail. In the kitchen she tells you the menu and shows the ingredients. Everyone gets busy grinding, chopping and slicing all of that. After making and eating a clear mushroom soup, all the other dishes are cooked in pairs at the stations. Everything is very hygienic and clean, the hostess really does not want any of her guests to be left with a Bali Belly after class which is great. The food is delicious and you get the recipes in a little folder. I would have liked to make everything myself from scratch, but with 7 dishes and a group of 18 people that's probably undoable. But if that's what you expect in a cooking class, then you know this is not the one for you. If you have good basic knowledge of cooking it will be no problem to recreate the dishes in your own kitchen.

Awesome day !!. The Paon Bali cooking class was one of our highlights in Ubud. We had a lot of fun from shopping at the market, visiting their own rise fields to cooking in the class with people from all over the world. The kitchen was very clean and the food was excellent! Wayan and Puspa were so friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed this day

One of the best things we did in Bali. From picking us up at the hotel, to the visits to a market and a rice paddy, and the actual class, this was my favorite activity in Bali. We got hands on experience making 8 different dishes, and our host/teacher was so sweet, funny and helpful. The food itself was also some of the best food we had on our whole trip and I cannot wait to make it all again for my friends and family back home.

Authentic Balinese cooking. Well organised and reasonably priced cooking class.Went to the afternoon class because the morning class was fully booked.Nevertheless it was very nice! They teach you to cook some of the essentials of Balinese cooking.As an experienced Indonesian amateur cook of Indonesian disches I found it very informative and learned a few new recipes!Location just outside Ubud is also very nice!Would recommend it!

Wonderful time!. We thoroughly enjoyed the cooking class. What was really insightful for us, was seeing the interior of a Balinese home compound for the first time. Wayan did a lovely job of explaining it all to us over our refreshing welcome drink. His wife is in charge of the cooking! It was really very professionally organised, clean and well managed. It all went by like clockwork. We had our recipes to take home and the chance to enjoy what we had cooked over a stunning jungle view.

A MUST VISIT!. After making the decision to try a cooking class in every country I visit - this was the one I picked for Bali - and what a great choice! After researching the other local cooking classes on offer, this one stuck out the most through it's great reviews! We were not disappointed one bit. As soon as we were in their hands, they welcomed us and greeted us with the most friendliest reception. We chose to attend the afternoon session and I loved the trip to the rice fields on route! Such a beautiful location! The group size was reasonably large (apprx 15/ mixed age & gender) but made it even more enjoyable as we all got on well and had a chance to recommend various Bali visits to each other. The cook is superb! She was so lovely and funny, and took us step by step through each cooking process clearly and why we were using certain flavours etc.We all took part throughout the whole experience and made all the dishes together. The food was all displayed as a buffet at the end of the day but there was more than enough for all of us. The setting was perfect with sun set views and rice fields. We had drinks available to us throughout the entire time and snacks here and there. The locations was spotless - VERY CLEAN! which is always a must with me!On returning home, we were all given a recipe booklet which I still have with me now and use.Definitely worth every penny! An amazing experience that I could not fault!

Must Go Place. I'm so glad I chance upon this place through Tripadvisor.It is indeed a must go place if you visit Ubud.I managed to contact Puspa directly via email and her response was pretty fast too. She arranged a free pick up service from my villa, even though it was a last minute request.I'll definitely suggest to go for the morning class as the market tour was interesting and you got to understand more about local stuff. The guide was really friendly and nice. At the end of market tour, we even had a brief tour of a paddy field on our way down to the kitchen. The whole cooking lesson was very organized and structured. Never mind about you not being a good cook or whatsoever, the teachers there are able to guide you throughout. It's a really fun session and everyone is so kind and friendly too.I absolutely love this place and will recommend it to groups of friends or couples to mark this as part of your itinerary. :)Thanks Puspa for the wondrous experience.

An amazing experience!!. We did the morning session, where they took us to the market and explained the various ingredients we'd be using for our lunch. When we arrived at the cooking site, it turned out to be a very nice traditional Balinese house with a great view. Everything was extremely well organized so that there was no wasted time, and we were able to make about eight delicious dishes in one morning! The instructors and staff were also really friendly and helpful.Note: Book the cooking class directly through their website, NOT through a third party like Expedia.

What a HOOT HOOT - 'Start your engines definitely #1 tourist attraction!'. I had a wonderful time cooking, there is so much effort that goes into a tradition Balinese meal it really takes a community and we met some of the loveliest Balinese people there. Thank you Wayan and Puspa my friend and I had lots of fun and great memories will last for ever. ***** * thats 6 stars from this traveller

Fantastic cooking. This cooking class is fantastic and so much fun. It is extremely well organised, lovely environment and amazing, delicious food that caters for vegetarians too. Highly recommend.
Look forward to trying the recipes at home.

Fun experience - great food, great instructor. We booked this excursion online not knowing what to expect. The class picked us up and dropped us off at the resort when we were done. First stop was the market which was dirty and crazy and complete madness - but a great experience. Second stop was at a rice paddy (kind of useless) and the last stop was the house where we cooked. Their initial intro was like a standup routine, absolutely hilarious. Following that was prep work and then cooking. My wife and I had a great time, learned a lot, and left full. It was a great start to our day!

GOOD VALUE AND FUN. Well organised and fun outing for all ages. Wayan picked us up at our hotel and onroute to the class stopped by his village to explain the production of rice within the village community, I found this informative and an interesting part of Bali culture. Onto the family compound to begin our cooking class which was conducted in a clean and hygenic environment. I loved Puspa's commentary and directions on how to cook her recipes. Start you engine people, I'm not surprised by the No 1 rating, this class is good value. Well Done.

A highlight of our travels. We were hesitant about doing this class as we thought it was quite expensive however a friend told us it was a MUST DO and she was right. The class was worth every penny.Tip - book in advance as gets booked up! It started with us being collected from our homestay in Ubud. We then stopped at some rice fields in a local village where we were told about the process of growing rice etc. we were then taken to Wayan and Puspa's gone and greeted with a welcome drink. Wayan told us all about traditional family life in Bali and about their home - he was entertaining and very kind.Puspa's then led the class where we learnt to cook 8 Balinese dishes. The class was run excellently and was very entertaining. After cooking the dishes we then got to enjoy a sit down dinner in their relaxing garden. Worth every penny!

Excellent food and great experience. Terrific location and views, beautiful home, excellent food and a great experience that was both fun and informative.The classes are incredibly well organised, with options for vegetarian and other dietary requirements handled really well. The staff were all amazing and lovely. There are a lot of courses to choose from in Ubud and we chose this becomes they were quick and helpful to respond to queries, offered vegetarian classes had afternoon classes. We were looking forward to it, but actually enjoyed it even more than expected. Would highly recommend this to anyone interested in eating a big feast after following some easy to follow, fun and interactive cooking instructions.

Rip Off Alert: Watch Out. I booked a cooking class through Expedia for Monday July 20. As indicated I called the BaliKU Tours (+62 81 139 9350) to coordinate the pick up from my hotel. They barely speak any English so they told me they were going to send me a confirmation text message. What I got was a "Sorry, the class for Monday is Fully Booked" What? I have already MADE a reservation and PAID for it!!!! I complained and told me they couldn't do anything but they were going to inform Expedia about my refund. Of course they never did. Until today ( Aug 6) I already have made 4 calls to Expedia where I have been told that the vendor BaliKU Tours does not answer the phone to confirm my claim. Most likely I will never be able to collect the money I spent on this.

Great course . This course was great! We discovered the Balinese gastronomy with Puspa. We had some explanations about the Balinese life and house. At the end, we received the receipts and Puspa explained by what replace the ingredients which doesn't exist in our country. Great! Thank you!

What a fantastic evening. My wife and I had a marvellous experience with Puspa and Wayan. Great teaching method and lots of fun. We prepared and cooked 8 dishes after which we dined communally. Will be telling all our friends to go.

Amazing experience. My husband and I booked this class after reading the previous reviews here and we weren't dissapointed. The previous reviews detail what happens on the day so I will just summarise and say the class was easy to access (hotel pick up/drop off), the staff (especially Puspa and the young guy who did our market tour) were very friendly, the instruction was very clear, we were all kept busy despite being a big group (about 20), there were good facilities (clean, free drink on arrival, free bottle water) and finally the food was amazing. The class is very good value for money at less than £20 each for a 5.5 hours experience and a 8 course meal.

Why not learn Balinese cuisine for yourself?. As part of a Bali get-away with two other friends, I enroled us in this cooking class I had heard about on a previous visit. We were not disappointed. We were picked up at our hotel by the smilling Wayan who drove us to Ubud market for a morning tour with other participants. We were then driven through the countryside surrounding Ubud to the village in which the cooking school is located, in a family compound. Puspa was their to greet us with her wonderful sense of humour and we all got stuck in to a very hands on lesson in several typically Balinese dishes. We also took turns at giving it a go with the traditional motars and pestals. We were lucky to have a very friendly group, and the food was delicious. Very well organised and a memorable experience.

highlight of our trip to Ubud. we had a family cooking lesson with Puspa and her wonderfully friendly team. Great fun learning to cook the most delicious menu which can easily transfer to your kitchen at home. Patient explanations, even the boys could follow what they had to do and they dont cook!
Then the joy of eating our banquet overlooking the valley. A grastonomic delight.

Best day in Bali. Brilliant hosts, so informative with a tour through the market then we were invited into Puspa & Wayan's beautiful home. Was very professional and a great setup. Cooked and the ate some amazing food and then dropped off to our door. They thoroughly deserve the top spot on TA and we highly recommended.

Amazing Authentic Experience. We were lucky enough to enjoy the hospitality of Puspa and her family in their home on Tuesday 28th July and it was the most incredible authentic experience I have he in Bali. The food we cooked was delicious and loved the touch whereby they gave us recipe books to take home so we could try the fishes out back in Australia. Would highly recommend this activity!! Thank you so much Puspa ☺️

Cooking instruction, cultural information and a really good multi course dinner. All good!. The coordination was amazing. Everyone got little chores. And staff finished up dishes so the meal all got completed at once and well. We cooked local dishes including basic sauces and broths that form the basis of the cuisine. The hostess was fun and added personal stories to keep the instruction light and interesting. We got recipes to take home. There were about 24 students, Dutch, Brits, French, Americans, Indians. We were chauffeured to and from class with a short stop at a rice paddy. All well done.

Perfect! . Thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience and couldn't fault it! Started the day with a tour of the food market with explanations and realistic prices to pay. Transported in air conditioned people carriers to the family compound. Greeted with a refreshing drink and a brief explanation of Balinese culture. Extremely clean with stunning views. Made 10 dishes collectively. Plenty of drinks served throughout the day. Food was phenomenal! Pace of the day was ideal. I highly recommend.

Fun and educational day!!!. This was an outstanding experience and definitely appeals to the kinesthetic learner. We chopped, sliced, sautéed, stired and ate multiple dishes. The owner of the Villa we stayed at recommended this class and it really was worth the time and money. Don't hesitate to book it!!! Already planning our cooking back home.

Excellent cooking class!. My husband & I have taken cooking classes across the globe. This was one of the best! They were catering to both vegetarian & non-vegetarian. Everyone got to participate the entire time. It was a true immersion in Bali culture - beyond just food. I'm somewhat of a germaphobe and they had everyone wash their hands before cooking & use plastic gloves when directly handling the food. I would highly recommend - a very good value that will provide many great memories to take home with you!

Great day out good fun. The moment you walk into Puspa home you are made to feel like family and very welcome , it was great fun from start to the finish very clean and exceptionally well run . Puspa is a gem a lovely lady with a true passion for what she does and we got to sit down in a beautiful setting and enjoy a banquet fit for a King Thank you Puspa for a fantastic day and recipes have already tried the clear mushroom and vegetable soup

Professional, Authentic and Fun. Everything is great with Paon Bali. Perfectly organized for the visitor to be comfortable and enjoy the time there. Everyone involved has a perfect smile and the class is made so those interested on cooking can learn and those who are just company can have a fun time. It's a great way to discover Bali's traditional meals.

We got cheated. We booked a cooking class through the online service provided in Tripadvisor and were billed for the full amount + transportation fees. After receiving no further information we called them only to be told that the class was "fully booked" and that the next available date was after 4 days when we had already left Ubud.After multiple phone calls and emails we received only apologies and no help whatsoever in recovering our lost money. They have now stopped answering our emails and we have been instructed by the credit card company to contact the police.

Best introduction to Balinese food and culture. We booked the class a month in advance but it wasn't too crowded, only 4 couples in total. We were so glad we chose to do this on our first day in Bali as it was an ideal introduction to the food and culture. Hotel pickup and drop off was included. We were first taken to the food market in Ubud and had about a one-hour tour. We tasted some exotic fruits such as snakeskin fruit that we weren't familiar with. The young man who was our guide was great, as were all Balinese people we met. We also saw the temple next to the market. The cooking school is held in the couple's own beautiful family compound. The owners are Puspa and Wayan who were amazing hosts. They both have a great sense of humour and made us feel completely welcome. All the raw ingredients were laid out and everything was very organized and well run. We took turns chopping and mixing and learned to make 7 different dishes. The best part of the day was eating the fantastic food! We were given printouts of the recipes to take home. Even if you're not a cook, we highly recommend this class!

Great fun cooking morning. We loved our cooking trip - we started with an interesting and informative trip to the market with Wayan our guide. This was followed by a brief stop at a rice padi field where we learned about rice growing. We then went to Puspa's kitchen where we met the extremely charismatic cook and her helpers. We had great fun cooking all of the dishes, with helpful explanations throughout. We then sat overlooking a stunning view to eat the many delicious dishes we had prepared. Would highly recommend for a fun, family day out.

Great cooking class Balinese style. Our travelagent advised us to do this cooking class. It was great. We were received in the family home. Everything was explained very clearly but also friendly and enthousiastic. The kitchen is very clean. The food we prepared was delicious and even better than we tasted in restaurants. The staff is absolutely dedicated.

Beautiful Food & Atmosphere. Very well run, got to try lots of different dishes and a copy of the recipes to take home. I couldn't get my wifi to work to book online I decided to go there to enquire instead and turned up just as a class were staring and then welcomed me to join and I had a very pleasant experience.

Cultural excellence!. What a fantastic insight into Balinese cuisine! With clear hands on lessons and great warmth and humour- this was the highlight of our Bali visit. Chef Puspa entertained and explained with care. All meals we had after our lesson were compared to this day- but not all stood up to our trained efforts! Highly recommended.

A taste of Bali's culture. I really enjoyed the class, it is very dynamic and interesting, they even take you to a rice field where the explain the importance of the rice as part of the Balinese food and some other interesting facts. The teach(s) is amazing, it is a great and unique experience, the food at the end was delicious, you should really try it!

Great cooking course. Teenager daughter and mother. East email. Pick up on time, market ok and then 10 min drive to house. We had 8 in our group upstairs. Very happy with effort for vegetarian and gluten free. Well organised and recipes given . Lovely happy family with great intro to Indonesian food. Would recommend for fun morning for the average cook

Must do !. Brilliant evening meeting new people, learning to cook authentic bali food and eating an incredible meal we cooked ourselves. Professional, well organised, informative, hands on yet relaxed and ideal way to spend an evening. All for a bargain price.

Fabulous!. Fantastic day spent with Wayan and Puspa and rest of the team cooking amazing dishes in the friendliest atmosphere. High level of hygiene and very caring about dietary requirements and allergies. We felt we walked away with great knowledge and eager to cook these dishes for our friends and family. Also worth booking the morning tour as you get to go to the traditional market. Lovely location as well for the class as you get to cook in a typical balinese compound with the most stunning views. One if the highlight of our stay here.

A fun and enriching experience!. My mother and I took part in the afternoon class on 8th July, and it was a truly enjoyable and enriching experience, more than just a typical cooking class! Before the class started, we were taken to the family's rice paddy field where we learnt more about traditional rice farming and harvesting in Bali. Upon arriving at the cooking class, we were greeted by the lovely and humourous couple Puspa and Wayan, given a welcome drink and a brief introduction about a typical Balinese home. The cooking class itself was extremely well organised and easy to follow, with a number of helpers besides the main teacher Puspa, to guide us along during the cooking. It was also great that Puspa was extremely vigilant about hand hygiene, reminding us to wash our hands before and after preparing food. I also liked that the recipes for the dishes made during the class were compiled neatly into a booklet and given to us at the end, which makes for easy reference in the future. We were able to enjoy the fruits of our labour at the end of the class, and all the balinese dishes made were very tasty and made an extremely satisfying dinner! I would highly recommend Paon Bali Cooking Class to anyone visiting Bali, it is an experience not to be missed!

Best cooking class you can do!. Second visit to this awesome cooking class. We decided to bring a large group back as part of our wedding week in Bali. Everyone enjoyed the whole day from the markets to the rice fields tour to the amazing feast we learnt how to make. Thanks Paon for your hospitality once again we will be back again :) Mirsada & Daniel

Fabulous Fun and superb meal!. My husband and I recently enjoyed a cooking class with Puspa and loved every minute. We were collected from our hotel; given a most interesting tour round the fresh food market; taken to see the paddy fields and then given an explanation of their home layout; followed by the interactive cooking class and finally got to enjoy the delicious many course meal we had helped prepare. Everything was hands-on in terms preparation and cooking of Balinese food but what impressed us greatly was the cleanliness and focus on ensuring food was always covered and plastic gloves were used with food requiring "fingerwork". This protects one from the effects of colours and spices but also from transfer of germs - most impressive as was the consideration and flexibility applied for people with allergies. Puspa's explanations were entertaining and clear and provided a great understanding and superb experience. Would recommend the morning class to enjoy the market and different fruits and vegetables offered there. Incredible value for money and highly recommended.

Family cooking adventure. We all loved this, Miss 13 and Miss 10 rated this as their best Bali experience. We were very lucky to be the only ones booked in (probably because of all of the cancelled flights due to volcanic ash) so had market tour, hosts and kitchen to ourselves. We all chopped, mixed, sauteed and garnished every one of the 8 dishes. We felt very honoured to see their family compound, temple and home. The food was magnificent- can't wait to do another one next time we visit. $Aud35 per adult and$Aud25 for the girls, plus $Aud40 for pickup from Seminyak and return via a really good and by far the cheapest market - can't remember the name but was recommended by hosts - lots of original art works, crafts, t-shirts etc

Wonderful experience!. Had a superb cooking and socialising experience with Puspa and Wayan. It was informative, inclusive, delicious in such a gorgeous setting. Puspa was a gracious hostess with so much knowledge to share and the warmest smile.. Loved it!

Fantastic experience! . Wayan, Puspa and staff were absolutely lovely. Hilarious and good people. Super professional, beautiful home, explanations were clear and food was over the top amazing. I couldn't stop shoving my face with food. Recommend taking the morning class so you start at the local market! Thank you so much throughly had an amazing! experience. All the best x
Super nice hosts. Thanks to people in there i had great time in there. Lovely people, well organized course, beautiful view, good food!

Delicious & Delightful!. My whole family had a wonderful morning and afternoon at Paon Bali. The hosts are hilarious and welcoming mixing jokes with great cooking techniques. The class is very hands on and the eight dishes prepared are flavorful and delicious. We can't wait to try out the recipes at home! One thing worth mentioning was that we were a group of 8 and had a private class. We were upstairs and not mixed with any other groups. This worked out very nicely for us.

Worth booking in advance!. I was really keen to attend a cooking class whilst in Bali. I looked on Trip Advisor and saw that Paon was number one in Ubud - I would definitely agree!Initially I was keen to do the full day class but this was booked up so we booked the half day class which I think is actually more than enough. They collect you from your hotel in Ubud and take you to the market (if doing the morning class) this is a great experience as you get to see the produce first hand - spices, vegetables, metre long cinnamon! You have an opportunity to buy stuff to take home, no need to buy for cooking as they have already arranged ingredients for the class. The driver speaks great English which is handy as he takes you round the market. We also stopped at some beautiful paddy fields. Puspa's husband did a lovely intro to the class when we arrived. He's warm, open and welcoming. The class is well set up and facilities fantastic. We learnt to make around 5-6 dishes and are given the recipes to take home. We ate what we cooked for lunch with a beautiful view! Well worth the money! Puspa and her team are really lovely!

Great class and food.. Set in UBud and a visit to the market on the way, all the ingredients is portioned for you and the cooking and preparation instruction is easy and fun. The food is amazing a the end. The staff are lovely and friendly.

Good experience. We really enjoyed the cooking class at Paon Bali. It was very nice to see a Balinese home and cook with a gorgeous view in the background. The number of people is what brings the review from 5 to 4 stars. In the market, it was difficult at times to hear because of the number of people. When cooking, due to the number of people, we did not get to be part of food prep for all the dishes. Overall, though, the food was delicious and we are happy to come home with recipes.

Awesome cooking class / meal. We were picked up from our villa, toured the local market with Wayan and learned a lot about the different spices, vegetables, and fruit that are used as ingredients in Balinese cooking. Afterwards, as a group of 11, we chopped, minced, and sliced to prepare all the different ingredients in our meal. After having some spicy & sour mushroom soup to start, we cooked about 6 different dishes for our main meal, which all turned out amazing! Lunch was spectacular, and by the end of it we were all pretty exhausted, which Puspa knew, so she prepared dessert while we watched and had cups of tea or coffee. The class was a great balance of enjoying the process of cooking as well as eating and interacting with people. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

A great experience, well worth the money. We were promptly picked up from our accommodation and taken by our driver to rice fields near the house where we would later be cooking. It was a great introduction to Balinese cooking and I asked lots of questions which were answered well. We were welcomed into the family home with a welcome drink and then got an introduction on what we would be cooking and how. We were all assigned jobs chopping and bashing etc. And then got to cook all the dishes, with supervision on what to add next etc.It was all very seamless and there were many people on hand to help move things along (although not in a pushy way!).There were around 15-20 of us there, but there was plenty of space and the cooking area is set with a beautiful jungle backdrop.After all the prep, we sat down for the 1st course and then continued to cook our mains after we were finished.The food was absolutely delicious and I wish I could have eat more (which you could if you wanted to!)After the main dinner we made two kinds of desert and were given a recipe booklet each to take home.There was beer and water available.Our hosts were very friendly and accommodating to any dietary requirements also.We had a lovely time, and understand why Paon Bali is #1 on TA!Thank you!!

Fun... . My partner and I attended today. We had an amazing day: lots of fun and ate yummy food. I personally had hoped for a more intense/hands on cooking experience but for a novice it was great.The market excursion was fine - a little long but interesting enough. The rice field visit was a pleasure.We made 8 dishes - all with phenomenonal flavour and quality ingredients. As a couple we had fun. I dont feel I learnt a lot but it was a good half day.We cooked as a group and my constructive feedback would be:- separate classes for children. We paid a decent fee and as 2 full paying adults had to share a cooking station while young children had one to themselves- beginners and intense classes for those with varying skill sets- opportunity to make your own meal in full. I personally was uncomfortable eating food others had prepared - given I watched them lick fingers and pick noseLovely hosts and fun day - not entirely what had hoped for but good nevertheless.

Great, amazing hospitality. I can only agree with the raving reviews given here. We had a very nice cooking class were everything ran very smoothly and we all got to try some prep and cooking of 8 different typical Indonesian dishes. The host couple were extremely natural and friendly hosts and created a very enjoyable visit for us all I think. I really liked making the food, and it was all also delicious to eat afterwards. There were plenty of food for all. The groups can be big, up to 30 people per class, but they can handle this many participant well. The only time I felt we were a bit many were when we visited the morning market, even after we split up in three groups. It's just so crowded there. Pickup and return from our hotel went very well.

A truly authentic balinese experience...... We had booked this class based on trip advisor reviews. Well worth every dollar. We were picked up from the hotel in Ubud on time at 8 15 am and taken to central fruit and vegetable market. Over there the ever helpful and smiling Wayan explained all the local produce and it was very informative. We could also buy spices and herbs. Then Wayan took us to the rice fields and gave us a quick talk on rice harvest. Then the best part of the class. Welcomed to Pushpas home with a chilled refreshing lemonade. It is a traditional Balinese home with a family temple and living quarters. The kitchen is open style and quite spacious to accommodate 18 of us. It overlooks the green lush forests. I have to say Pushpa and her team work in total unity and all through out kitchen is very clean and tidy. Special focus on hygiene. We had to keep washing our hands and use gloves while cooking meat and fish. We cooked 7 dishes and Pushpa is a very good teacher. She's got a good sense of humour and makes the class delightful and informative. We learned to makes curry paste using a traditional mortar n pestle and also peanut sauce. Then we took turns and cooked. It was a pleasure eating all the food we had cooked. We met people from all over the world and meal times were really enjoyable. Paon Bali classes are a truly authentic Balinese experience. So START YOUR ENGINES...if you have attended Pushpas class you will know what I mean!!!!

Unbelievably good.. Just returned from a morning at the Paon Cooking class and couldn't wait to submit a review. Puspa and Wayan are the genuine article, warm and welcoming and their English was excellent. They both have a brilliant sense of humour to boot.I was very impressed by the very high standard of cleanliness/ hygiene. The ingredients are organic and so fresh and the resulting dishes so delicious. Everyone gets to cook too, no waiting and watching its a full hands on experience. The food was yummy, the company outstanding. I cannot recommend this class enough. Whatever else you do in Ubud do not miss doing this class.
A must do. A great experience and highly recommended. .. Puspa and her husband are hilarious and the 8 dishes you make are delicious...

Great class with some humor!. Great class with some excellent fundamentals to Balinese style cooking. We did the afternoon/evening group and the family that runs the class were very welcoming and instruction was excellent with some good value humor thrown in throughout. A must do while in Ubud. One minor negative was our pick-up driver falling asleep on the way to the class (this was fixed for the drive home by PBC).
Fantastic. Absolutely worth all of the high acclaim this place has. Fantastic activity and fantastic organisers. 100% recommend!
Good. Big group cooking class. No doubt they will make you feel like VIPs doing the cooking. 3 weeks on... Don't think I can whip up the same dishes back home.

marvelous and unforgettable cooking class where you don't just cook. I would agree with other reviews on how awesome this cooking class is, but it did not wow me the way i expected it to so I am not giving 5 stars. You guys need to know that I'm will be very truthful and not lenient in this review. The morning tour begins in Ubud fruit market where we were mixed with a few other people and guided around the market. The guide lead us and went around explaining about Balinese spices, fruits and vegetables and culture. It was informative and somewhat interesting but if you are not a cooking and foodie enthusiast, you will find this boring. We headed to the rice paddy and literally took a few steps out of the car before listening to the guide for a while and getting back in to the car. It was disappointing. We had no chance to explore the gorgeous paddy field (why you no include this paon??D:) Plus this guy has been doing this talk twice everyday, so expect little enthusiasm and a monotonous classroom-teacher-like talk. Their house was gorgeously traditional and had jaw-dropping infrastructure: Massive resting area, open air kitchen and dining area overlooking rooftop views of very lovely greenery of the hillside. The class was structured, relaxed and enjoyable. Paon, the humorous and cheeky house wife was all smiles throughout and very informative. She did not pressure us one bit like other cooking class instructors I know - she made everything seem easy peasy. All you need to know is how to hold a knife, spoon and fork. Her helpers actually did more work than us. Not to mention, the result was delicious!!! However, I did not like it when she spent the last 15 minutes pushing good reviews into us on Tripadvisor, it kind of spoiled the experience a little bit. Well, at least she got what she wanted. Budget wise, it's one of, if not the cheapest in Bali so it's definitely great value and worth your time. However you sure don't get a intimate experience as it is very popular and therefore not very engaging. But honestly, for me - meeting 20 people from all around the world was part of the fun. Next time, I would try the green cooking class in Sidemen.... If you have also been to Paon's class, do you agree with my review? Let me know if you do and also things you disagree with me !

Brilliant day of culture and food. Paon cooking course fulfilled everything I wanted out of cooking course and more. The family that run the course are lovely and the menu and range of dishes cooked were by far the best compared to other schools I looked up. Can't recommend this place enough!

Very entertaining and interactive class. The family that runs Paon Bali has a well oiled machine with their classes. After the morning market tour we returned to their family compound for a very interactive cooking class. We had a great deal of fun and learned about both Balinese cooking and culture. We ate the meal we prepared and it was delicious! The only problem is that it was SO delicious that many restaurants we visited afterward for Balinese food seemed lackluster. We will definitely be making these recipes at home!

Wonderful cooking class in a beautiful setting. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our cooking class with Wayan, Puspa and their family. We began with a trip to the morning market and then stopped by the village rice field before going to the family home for our class. Puspa, the matriarch of the family is the energy and driving spirit of the well-run operation. The class was very hands-on with each group having and expert to help them with preparation. The resulting food was delicious and we went home with recipes. The school will happily accommodate vegetarians and food allergies. It was a wonderful morning, big lunch with enough time for those coming from outside Ubud to enjoy the shopping in town for the afternoon.

My 3 time and still excellent. this was my 3rd time doing the Paon cooking course. It has become very popular though still keeps some of its personal charm, of course Puspa is beautiful, friendly and funny. The experience is excellent and the half day goes really quick. The course is quiet basic and very educational, you tour the rice fields, and learn about their house and they way they live, differences between spices and difference between rice and cooking methods. Might not suit an advanced cook but still a great experience. I would do it again! Great value. They pick you up and drop you of in Ubud at the Palace, but we are always late so meet them in the Ubud market opposite.

best cooking class ever. We enjoyed everything about this class. We were picked up at our villa and driven to the class in a lovely hillside setting above Ubud. The open kitchen was large and set on a hill overlooking a river. Staff was helpful and friendly. The chef was charismatic and entertaining. Food was delicious.

A super fun evening!. We took a cooking class at Paon Bali and had a complete blast. I am not a cook by any means and wasn't sure how it will be but both Puspa and Wayan did a great job of welcoming us (a group of nearly 20) into their home, give an overview of how they live and then take us through the process of cooking authentic Balinese cuisine! The best part of the evening was that we got to cook some part of all our dishes while having extremely interesting conversations with people from all over the world. We ended up making friends there that we hung out with the next day. This is a really nice experience and one I would highly recommend.

Sensational Operation and excellent experience. Such a wonderful experience being introduced to a beautiful family and their traditional recipies.Paon cooking class collected us from our accommodation and directly to the Ubud Market to be introduced to the range od herbs, spices, vegetables and tofus being used in balinese cooking. They make a point that they do not purchase from the market but direct from suppliers to maintain hygenine standards.We had a seafood allergy in ourgroup and they understaood and had systems in place to keep his food fish sauce free, even using a seperate steamer for his food.This class involves a hands on approach and gives all attendees a printed copy of all recipies cooked on the day.So great we were so genuinley impressed and grateful for the expeience.Thank you Paon

Fantastic delicious evening. Brilliant night, fantastic food and excellent hosts - an evening enjoyed by all the family and lots of tips to go home and make stunning dishes. Highly recommended for an Ubud trip.

Great fun. Great morning / 5 hrs. Funny morning, our hosts were most generous and the class very interactive. I was part of the smaller group which I believe may have been a bonus. Well worth the visit, and produced some lovely food, ++

Authentic Balinese experience in a home-kitchen setting. Puspa, family and their team run an incredible cooking class here - it's informative, interactive and entertaining. Instead of sitting around watching someone cook, you're there in the large outdoor kitchen bashing away at spices and herbs to make base sauces, kebabs, noodle dishes and salads.Everything is executed with precision, it's clean and the team are really careful with hygiene (perfect for those who get a little panicky about bali belly) and its a great opportunity to meet people from around the world in a fun and interesting environment.Would recommend to families, couples, business groups and friends - it is something that appeals to the Masterchef in all of us!

AMAZING & GOOD HOSPITALITY. The teacher is so nice and funny and the food is so good. My boyfriend and I both really enjoyed the class as this is our first time doing "real cooking".This is definitely a must do in Bali!!

Delicious food & so much fun!. This review is long overdue! My brother and I spent a few weeks in Bali last December and decided to take a cooking class in Ubud. I found Pupsa's class on Trip Advisor and emailed to sign up for the course. Booking was super quick and easy. Everything was done via email and her driver was there to pick us up right on time at our hotel in Ubud. Pupsa is a great host and teacher. From the moment we arrived to her home, we were greeted with welcome drinks and open arms. Pupsa is funny, engaging and very knowledgeable about Balinese cuisine. Everything we made was so delicious and fresh. The class was very organized and remains the highlight of my time in Ubud.The class was worth way more than we paid. I would definitely recommend signing up if you're up for a fun day of cooking and eating!

Fabulous. Highly recommend it!. The most delicious Indonesian/Balinese food we had on our trip. And Paon was charm personified. The setting is lovely too. And you get a little tour of how families live in Bali.

A highlight of our stay in Ubud. Have just come back from an exceptional morning spent with Puspa and her wonderful staff. One of our party was sick the day of our scheduled class. Even with very late notice, Puspa was so kind and accommodating and rebooked us into a later day. You really will learn how to prepare Balinese food (as well as get to enjoy the fruits of your labours). Thank you Puspa!

Great traditional cooking class. I found this cooking class on Trip Advisor and booked it as soon as I landed in the airport at Denpasar, This class starts around 8:15am with a pick up included if you are staying in the surrounding Ubud area. You are then taken to the local market for around an hour and our guide explained what we would be using in the cooking class, showed us herbs and spices, the different vegetables, even showing us where the 'offerings' are made this is a mainly Hindu area. After the market you are taken to the Rice Paddy field in the village and then go to the family home. The husband and wife team are lovely and a put everyone at ease, explaining everything as we go along. We had a refreshing drink before starting the chopping of the vegetables to start our basic sauces etc. I would highly recommend this class, there were around 20 of us in the group and everyone chatted to everyone and groups were mixed around. We ended the afternoon by eating the food we had cooked and even had room for a little desert. The best thing is that the recipe book is included and I cant wait to get back home and try to make the dishes for myself.

What an delectable experience!. Paon our host was charming and the cooking school ran like clock work. The focus on traditional Balinese food preparation was wonderful and the meals we created were delicious. I have come home armed with a range of recipes that will become family favourites I am sure. It was a morning filled with laughter and was a lot of fun!

Enjoyable evening . My friend and I enjoyed the hospitality of this lovely balinese family in their beautiful home. Prepared 8 dishes for dinner during the evening class which took about 3 hrs including dinner. Easy to follow despite my lack of cooking abilities. Appreciated the local balinese flavour and humour as well as the introduction at the rice padi field before starting the class.

A very well organised, clean and recommended cooking class!. Well organised transport from accommodation to villa where cooking class is held.Well set up industrial kitchen, enough space for bigger groups.Cleanliness is at high standards here. Washing hands is encouraged during length of course, toilets available, sinks with soap, clean aprons and towels.Food is partly prepared by staff on long wooden tables.A variety of dishes, 7 in totall, were prepared by a group of 11 guests and beautifully presented on the wooden table with lit candles.A social experience with delicious food to share after cooking with breathtaking views into the tropical landscape.Puspa is an experienced cook who is in charge during the course and makes sure everything goes to plan and is open to questions. Wayan talked about his culture and spices used in Balinese dishes.A well prepared handout with all the recipes was supplied for all guests.A big thank you to Puspa, Wayan and all the staff that made this cooking class so enjoyable, Angela

Best Cooking Class ever. Very well organized. Everyone gets a chance to do everything. Varied variety, a nice look into the Balinese Compound, and you the bonus is that you get to eat and enjoy what you collectively cooked.

Come away with an authentic taste of Bali. Being foodies, my son and I always look for cooking classes when we travel to exotic places. This one lives up to all the positive reviews it has received on Trip Advisor. We came away having experienced the tastes of Bali we were looking for but hadn't really gotten in restaurants. This is home cooking, with clear explanations and demonstrations of techniques that are reproducible in your own home. The visit to the market is an inspired idea... giving you a chance to see and taste tropical fruits that might be new to you. We felt this was a day well-spent and memorable.

A thoroughly enjoyable experience. We booked this after reading the TripAdvisor reviews and we weren't disappointed. Although they did forget to pick us up initially the day turned out to be informative and fun. There was a large group but it was managed well with us split into 2 groups for the cooking. To start the day we went to the market and tasted fruit and were shown various spices. Then we went to the rice fields and this was explained to us. Back to the family compound for an introduction about family life in a Bali compound. The cooking was excellent - clear instructions and we all participated in the preparation of the food. It's a great way to spend a morning or afternoon. Thank you - really enjoyable.

Cooking class Bali Style. We saw great reviews for this cooking class so expectations were high. Fantastic day from the market to the rice paddy to a traditional Balinese house. We learnt about food, culture, Balinese families, rice production and more. And all that before we even cooked!! Well structured class that was easy to follow and not too difficult. We were involved in every part of cooking. And the food was just delicious!! Wayan and Pusan were fantastic hosts and their staff were attentive and friendly. Highly recommend. Great day out in beautiful Ubud

Informative and Entertaining. We enjoyed this class very much. There was a refreshing welcome beverage and a nice explaination of the family compound before the cooking began. We were made to feel very welcome and "part of the family" . The class was well organized and the food was great. Can't wait to try to recreate some of the recipes at home.

Great learning experience. We wanted to learn about Balinese food and found this Paon cooking class by accident. We were picked up from our resort and taken to the market for an interesting walk amongst the vegetables, the salted dry fish and the many exotic herbs and spices to be found, escorted by Wayan, who was very informative and funny. We then went by car to this house where we were going to learn how to cook Balinese food and were greeted by Puspa who also has a great sense of humour. The set up is well planned, very clean and very well organised. Busy operation as we must have been around 20 people attending the class. We learned a lot in a fun way, and meet some lovely people as we interact throughout the course of the morning and we ended up having a great lunch, cooked by all and topped up with a few Bintang. We started with a mushroom soup, followed by yellow curry chicken, steam fish in banana leaves, peanut sauce for satays and gadogado, chicken satays, coconut and snake beans salad and finished with stew banana with coconut and palm sugar. A definitive highlight of our time in Ubud and I highly recommend it to anyone that want to learn some basic but tasty Balinese food, in good spirit and with fun!

FANTASTIC!! Do not book anywhere else!. This is a fantastic classWe were picked up from Dedari Villas in Ubud on time and taken to the Market where we were shown local produce and allowed to taste some items which were paid for by the guide. The market is busy and the locals will still try and get you to buy things. We were then taken in convoy to rice paddy fields on the outskirts of Ubud where our knowlegeable guide told us about rice, harvest, the local families and information about the water. There are two ladies selling sarongs for $1 there.From here we went to the home of Puspa and Wayan. After a welcome drink and a very funny talk from Wayan about his home and his lovely wife we were invited behind their home which has stunning views to cook 7 dishes - Everyone gets stuck in chopping, slicing and using the Balinese blender as well as cooking the dishes.This is NOT to be missed, more for adults than children. Do not be sucked into the cooking tours in Ubud centre, Paon is fantastic and a credit to the family!

Excellent day of cooking and eating!. I had an amazing day at this cooking class. It all started with our amazingly friendly driver Nyoman Arjana (mobile phone +62 85 237 002 003). He was so nice and helpful! He also offered to drive me to the airport the next day at a discounted rate because I was a part of the cooking class the day before, great guy. The family that runs this cooking class were all so lovely and friendly. The dishes we cooked were absolutely delicious, and the setting very professional. The tables you eat at have a lovely view of the countryside. The market visit before the class is interesting as well. Well worth the time and money.
"Amazing". This cooking class was definitely a highlight for us we met some fabulous people and cooked amazing food...it's a must do in Bali

SENSEational. Spoil your senses with this amazing experience in Ubud. Having been to Bali many times, we were looking for a point of difference, a deeper understanding of the culture beyond beaches, bars and Bintang and we were not disappointed. From our initial foray through the Ubud markets with the charming, warm and funny Wayan, to our cooking class in his home high in the rice fields shared by his effervescent wife Puspa, our talented Bali chef, we were enchanted. The day was an assault on the senses, starting with the noise, bustle and controlled commotion of the Ubud markets, the smells of spices, exotic fruits, vegetables, fishes and meats, and the opportunity to sample some unknown varieties. Wayan was gracious to a fault, offering food and cold spring water, at his expense, throughout the morning.Our trip then to the open, fresh air and tranquility of the paddy fields was a welcome contrast as Wayan explained how the village families worked the land. And then it was off to class..What a wonderful, fun, informative morning! We were greeted with a cool lemon, welcome drink, and ushered to pristine-clean toilets to freshen up before we entered the main kitchen which held about 20 new apprentice Bali cooks from all over the world at their own station. Puspa somehow managed to supervise and coordinate us all, chopping, slicing, mixing, blending, stirring and cooking with exact precision disguised with charming humour and patience.For those who are concerned, the hygiene was first class. We were all compelled to wash our hands at various intervals, plastic gloves were provided for handling fresh meat, and there was always a supply of handwash nearby.In the midst of an explosion of smells and flavours and sights, there was never a dull moment, all culminating in a lunch of 8 dishes prepared by ourselves - with Puspa's help So if you want a taste of Bali, in Puspa's own words as she urged us to switch on the gas cooker...'Start your engines'....Book it now!

Best food we had in Bali!. 6 of us booked in for the morning class so that we could visit the market and rice paddy fields. Wayan and Pushpa were fantastic hosts - they have a great sense of humour! We made 8 different dishes and each was a flavour sensation! It was some of the best food we had while in Bali. So glad I have the recipes so I can recreate the dishes at home and keep my Bali trip alive. Thank you for a wonderful day!

Ubud trip highlight - don't miss!. This class is an absolute must when visiting Ubud. The class gave me a great insight into Balinese cuisine and Balinese culture in general.Our hosts were fantastic from the moment we were picked up and taken to see the rice fields right to the very end of the evening when we all shared a meal consisting of the many dishes we'd cooked during the class.The food was top notch and the setting was amazing, with a really nice view to watch the sunset.If you're in Ubud, don't miss this class!

A foodie's delights. Amazing location, host, facilities and, of course, food.We loved learning about the ingredients on the market tour and the drive through the rice paddy fields before the class. The class had the right balance of learning, cooking and eating, with all of the attendees trying all of the jobs, then sitting down together to laugh, chat and enjoy the delicious food.Our hostess was charming, insightful and ran the show with clockwork precision. The supporting staff were friendly and attentive. We left the class with our minds and our bellies full. Would definitely recommend.

Great hosts and amazing food!. We chose Paon Bali after reading the great reviews - we were not disappointed!We were picked up from our accommodation by a very friendly driver, along with one other couple, and taken to Ubud Market to meet up with the rest of our small group. At the market we were greeted by Wayan, who is super smiley and enthusiastic. He took us on a tour of the food market, explaining all about local farming and the ingredients we would be using during the class... cracking jokes as we went! We were able to sample a range of fruit in the market, which was paid for and offered around by Wayan. The cooking class takes place at the home of Wayan and his wife Puspa, which was beautiful. Puspa taught the class with the assistance of a team of super efficient staff. She was very knowledgable about all of the dishes and ingredients and she worked hard to make sure everyone got involved in each stage of preparation and cooking.We ended up with an amazing three course lunch, which was tastier than most restaurants we had been to so far on our trip. We loved the recipe book to take home too - a great touch. Highly recommend Paon Bali!
