Excellent private group class. Excellent well run class in traditional balinese home. Delicious and achievable recipes. Lot's of laughs and good pace of direction. We were a private group of 8, picked up from resort, guided tour of market and then welcomed into beautiful home and worked upstairs. Gorgeous cultural day.

Late pickup, minimal cooking, large groups. I booked two days before my class and they confirmed that they would pick me up between 8:15-8:25. At 8:30, I had my hotel call them and they said they were on their way but didn't arrive until 8:55. When I asked the driver why he was late, he said, "no problem, no problem." We then spent another ten minutes driving around trying to find another girl who they couldn't find so I didn't meet up with the group until 9:15, even though the class was supposed to start at 8:30. The husband (never got his name!) said that his wife would take me to the market after the cooking class to see what I had missed earlier. There was a nod to "Bali time" which shouldn't be the case when you're paying this much money for a professional service. The cooking class was quite large - split into two groups for the market part which was a good idea. I've done quite a few cooking classes but didn't feel like I cooked as much here. I mostly just chopped some vegetables and poured things into a pan. We combined all of our plates into one so you really didn't get to "taste your own dish."That said, the food was really amazing. Everything tastes really good and the program is a well-oiled machine. Water, lemonade, tea and coffee are included and they will drop you off anywhere in Ubud after. The setting is really nice. The class ended with the wife saying "if you are happy, please tell TripAdvisor. If you are not, please be quiet" which I always think is poor taste. Before leaving, I went to ask the wife why they were so late in the morning. With a smile on her face, she said that the driver was waiting the whole time at a different hotel for me, even though I double-checked my email and I had written the right one. She also said that I didn't miss anything which was not true and not the point. They gave me a 50.000 IDR refund which was appreciated.

Best experience . It's a must do in bali. This experience was mine and my husbands favourite in Bali. The service was perfect. The food we cooked was better then the restaurants we had been to and we got intake the recipies home with us. Now we can take some of valid culture home with us to share with friends and family. There were so hygienic and welcoming I couldn't brag enough thanks for an amazing night and out wonderfull dinner xxoo

This is an absolute must!!. A very shout out to Puspa and Wayan and all your wonderful staff who made our time with you so much fun!My partner and I had such a wonderful time with you, from starting early at the markets, to visiting the rice paddy, to learning how to cook your wonderful cuisine the traditional way.I appreciate the recipe book so I can cook this delicious food at home in Australia.This is with no doubt a five-star experience - both professional and informal and best of all, we got to eat all food at the end - sensational!Thank you to you both, and I'll spread the word over here .... If only I could fly you here so you can cook for me everyday! Hahaha!We will be book to further our skills.Cheers, John & Eglis

Great experience!. Got picked around 8.30 from hotel by wayan, who has very good english, and is very informative.Our frist stop was the market, tried diferent fruits and learnt about numerous spices.Next stop was the rice fields near his home, stayed there only a short time.Then we went to their beautiful home, where we were greeted with fresh lime juice, whilst wayan explained his culture and homelife.Then we were of to the kitchen, wayans wife was very informative and everyone was given a job.We made several dishes, learning diferent techniques along the way.The food was excellent! would recomend for everyone to do, at only $35 AUD P/P, it is well worth it!!

Wonderful day - a must see/do!!!. Fabulous experience and was everything and more we had hoped for. We were picked up promptly and efficiently from our hotel in the morning and taken to the local market in Ubud. Our friendly, informative and very good English speaking guide Wayan explained Balinese food and ingredients and we were able to try various fruit that we don't get in Australia. We then drove out to a terraced rice paddy field for photos and an explanation of how rice is grown. Then we went to the family home of Puspa and Wayan where we were made feel very welcome while indulging with a refreshing lemon juice and a Bali coffee while Puspa told us about the family home. Then the best part. The kitchen was very professionally set up with everyone able to participate with the preparation and cooking of the food. We made several delicious courses of food that I can't wait to try at home. The ladies were very friendly and informative and the flavours of the food were delicious. It is very clean and hygienic. We had a really good group and had good conversation and laughs! A thoroughly enjoyable day and very good value for money. When we decided to do this tour it was because we wanted to experience and learn a little of Balinese culture (we felt we could not do this from a hotel) and we were not disappointed.
Beautiful. Amazing food, amazing host, overall a great experience. Thanks a lot!P.S.: The review must be at least 100 characters long, so I'm adding this ;-)

A bit disappointing. The overall experience is quite on avarage. The day starts with a visit t the market, where Wayang (Puspa's husband) tries to explain something about spices and fruits but he's not that good at saying something interesting. You just spend about one hour there, but the overall experience is quite poor. Then they drive you at a compound, and here is where the show starts: Wayan explains the guests that here is where his family lives, which is totally untrue. That is just not a house, but a sort of restaurant with a great view on a tropical forest. Again, he spends about half an hour trying to tell something interesting about their balinese familiar life, but the explanation is really poor and lot of things are just fake. That is NOT a balinese house, it's just a well organized place where they pretend to live in to make the overall experience feels like authentic. The group was made of about 20 persons, which is a bit too big to enjoy a real cooking class. The whole thing is a real money machine, I would say quite well organized. Nothing really usefull, neither intimate or relaxing. Puspa is a kind of "robotic" boss who does not involve you in the cooking process and makes you part just of an assembly line where things as spontaneity, intimacy, improvisation, that are what makes me love cooking, are not at all in place.

A fantastic Family Day. I have been wanting to do a cooking school every time I travel to Bali. This time we found the cooking school through Trip Adviser and it was just as amazing as the reviews. The Husband and Wife team are lovely and have a wonderful sense of humour. The tour of the market was great, I only wish I had more time to wander on my own. I did the cooking school with my Husband and two children aged 9 and 11. I thought my son would be bored, but he thoroughly enjoyed the day cooking each meal and learning techniques on chopping, pounding and rolling. The food was delicious, the venue, a traditional Bali home was welcoming and the family just beautiful. If you would like a wonderful day out, great food and an experience to remember, then you must put this one on the list.

Awesome experience!. A group of about 20 of us did this cooking class on our visit to Ubud in May 2015. What an amazing experience! I highly recommend this class. Before you class we were taken to the markets to learn about where they get their produce, spices etc. Tasted different fruits that we don't have in Australia. We also got to see the rice fields and take pictures. At the class itself we were shown how to make beautiful Balinese dishes and the best part of it is you get to eat all the food you made and take recepies home with you! Thank you Puspa and Wayan for welcoming us to your home. :)

4.5 stars. Wasn't exactly what I thought it would be like but still awesome. Class included a market tour and a rice field visit. The guide is really knowledgeable and speaks good English so we learnt heaps and there's lots of opportunity to ask questions. Also time at the markets to buy things if you want too. (Note if you are New Zealander or Australian, we had no problem bringing peanut sauce and vanilla back home so stock up large while you can - its SO cheap in Bali!). You can also try some of the fruits while you are there. Welcome drink was really yummy, we enjoyed while listening to Wayan's welcome to his home and talk more about Balinese culture, it was really interesting and we weren't expecting that and it was a really nice insight, hes funny too! Wonderful hospitality and lovely hosts. After that it was into the kitchen. They are very professional and run to a strict time frame and schedule. It felt a bit over practiced for me, being in Bali I imagined it would be much more relaxed but it was like being in primary school, all lined up and told what to do and when. Great for my husband and the less skill chefs but I was a little bored. There's lots of staff who do all the running around, setting up equipment and stations and do dishes and prep for you. We made 7 dishes that included yellow curry paste which we used in Sate Chicken, Curry, Peanut Sauce and a few other things. We made Gado Gado (my now fav salad ever), tempe stir-fry a round bean salad, fish in banana leafs and a soup. We got to take away all recipes and all throughout we were told ingredients we could use if we could get hold of something in our home countries. It was served as a buffet lunch and was delicious. I'll defiantly be making these meals at home, they were wonderful. Theres lots of sugar in almost every dish so watch out if you are conscious of that, I was slightly alarmed but tried to forget about it being that I was on holiday! For dessert Puspa made a banana dish and we all watched and sampled at the end (more sugar!). Everything is of a high standard and very clean. Its obvious they know what they are doing, have been doing for a long time as its very structured. There were roughly 25 people on the day we were there so great money to be making in Bali. I think it would be worth while for them to have an advance course as well for the more advance cooks or those looking to learn a little more. I really enjoyed it, and my husband who I dragged along enjoyed it even more than me!! There was lots of solo visitors there and everyone was friendly and interacted so don't feel like you can't come alone. Hotel transfers were fantastic, on time and reliable. I found it hard to find finishing times when I was booking so if you are wondering its about 1.30-2pm in the kitchen so don't expect to be back at your hotel until around 2.30pm. Such an honour to be invited into their home and experience such wonderful hospitality.
Absolutely brilliant! You will never forget this cooking class! . Go for it! You will never forget this fantastic "cooking" experience! We would love to give it more stars if we could! Loved it!

Amazing cooking class. If you want to taste and try to cook local cuisine, don't hesitate to visit this cooking class. We have enjoyed it very much, program was very rich and teacher is amaizing with her approach and positive funny mood. Really recommanded.
Fabulous. We thoroughly enjoyed our time at Paon Cooking school - the atmosphere, the food, the people - we have been cooking Balinese ever since we got home and loving it!!!

Fun cookery. I was unenthusiastic about going for a cooking class, apron and all but would have regretted if I had missed it.It's much more than a cooking class. Wayan and Puspa deliver their lessons on Balinese culture with much humour in the 'courtyard' of their very beautiful home. Learned as much about Balinese culture as about cooking from them.Everyone in the class participates in cooking which makes it seem so easy. The outcome was very delicious, shame we couldn't stay for the dessert as we had to make our way to Legian the same afternoon.Met some very lovely people in the class too. I would highly recommend this class.

Friendly and Accomodating Hosts. As a solo traveller, I signed up on a day where they were hosting another group. The first evening my travel was delayed from Gili Air and I missed my booking, but Paon Bali was super understanding and ready to have me participate the following evening instead.Great food, entertaining hosts, and I am really excited to bring my recipes home and try them out! Their cooking school is clean, beautiful, and a must-do in Bali!

What a laugh! . We had such a great experience learning to make some great dishes, which were amazing to eat. We arrived late at our hotel from Seminyak, and the pickup (luckily they were just picking the two of us up) waited 20 minutes for us. We were extremely apologetic, but it was clearly no problem for the driver and we were made to feel at ease and take our time.We still got to see the Paddy fields, and made it in time for the introductory talk with the rest of our group.The owner Pupsa, made us all feel very welcome. His wife led the course and was a barrel of laughs! She made the cooking class even more entertaining and enjoyable.I would definitely recommend this course for anyone in Ubud who is looking to learn to cook and taste some great food!

10/10!!!!!. One of the best days I had in Bali! Puspa and her family are so lovely and make you feel at home. The cooking class is run like clock work and everything works so well. Even in a large group, everyone gets involved and helps out which is amazing! The kitchen is spotless and everything is done with the highest hygiene levels and the food is fantastic!!! I would go back again and again if I had time! At the end, you get the recipes and they're well written and easy to follow :) at the end, because we were in a bit of a rush, Puspa kindly arranged for us to be dropped off at our hostel to get our bags and then taken straight to our bus stop which we were so grateful for! This really is an amazing class!!!

Best part of my Bali visit. Puspa and Wayan are quite the team. The Paon experience is far more than just a cooking class. Your day starts with a tour of the local market, with wonderful color and explanation around how the locals shop and sell at the market. The market is followed by a visit to the rice paddies, which are beautiful. The cooking class takes place in Puspa and Wayan's lovely home, where we also learn about the orchestration and placement of the traditional Balinese home. Then, we cook! The meal was delicious. I would recommend Paon to anyone visiting Bali and would absolutely return.
Wonderful experience. Cooking the Balinese dishes is amazing.Cooking your own lunch and host are nice. Strong recommend to join it.We will back and have more fun again

A wonderful experience. The Paon Bali cooking class is a wonderful experience. The class is well prepared and paced creating a lesson that is easy to understand. The interactive aspect creates excitement about the dishes you prepare. At the end you marvel in the food that you've created. The class notes you are given at the end of the lesson are very easy to follow. I would recommend a visit to Paon Bali cooking to everyone.

Lots of fun!! . Had a great time at the cooking class. Was very well organized and ran smoothly with everyone involved in the cooking and preparation. Always a smile on puspa's face and lovely friendly staff.

Great insight into Balinese family and food. My husband and I did this cooking class together. I normally cook - he doesn't. We were collected from our villa then taken to the central market and shown local produce at food stalls there. After going to a rice paddy we were taken to the family compound where the layout was explained together with information about family life and traditions. We then started the cooking class. This involved all of us helping to chop ingredients, crush them into a paste in the Balinese equivalent of a large mortar and pestle and fry elements of our meal in a wok. Puspa was an enthusiastic and informative teacher with a great sense of humour. She made the whole thing fun. After helping to prepare our meal we all sat down together to eat. Overall it was a great experience that could be enjoyed by anyone - including those with no cooking experience. It was fun to do as a couple. However, if you are looking for more of a cooking masterclass there are other cooking schools that offer this.
Heartwarming cooking class!!!. I loved the way they treat you like a family member and make you feel very welcome! Everything was so good organized!! Perfect cooking class, the food was yummy❤️

Great Morning. This cooking class had everything!! The hosts were funny, very informative and also very careful and respectful of their clients as well as market stall owners (my partner has peanut allergies) They explained in detail about the different fruits and vegetables and then gave a detail explanation about the rice paddies and village and family life in Bali. Their kitchens have heaps of space and the view is amazing, with the cooking being very interactive and hands on. And the food, wow!! I would recommend this class to anyone who likes cooking, eating, or just enjoys a bit of fun.

Highlight of the Trip. This cooking class was by far the highlight of our entire trip. We chose to do the afternoon class so we didn't go to the Balinese market, but after being picked up from our hotel in Ubud we were taken to rice paddies where we learned about the tradition of growing rice and how a paddy is passed down from generation to generation. The class itself was wonderful; you get to take part in the preparation of each dish. I was especially happy because I have a nut allergy and before we started preparing anything Puspa made sure to ask about any allergies which I really appreciated. At the end of the class we were given a print out booklet of the recipes we made so that we can make them at home! Absolutely wonderful experience! I would recommend it to anyone looking for a unique experience in Bali.

Fantastic - a must do in Bali. Our group of 10 were first visited a local market and then onto their home where we were made very welcome. A refreshing welcome drink on arrival then into our aprons and ready to start. We were first shown how to begin the preparation then everyone got an opportunity to chop veggies, use the 'Bali blender' and bit by bit prepare some of the most delicious food I have had in a very long time. The vegetarians in our group were also catered for as well. One of the highlights of our trip and most certainly recommended as an interesting and informative activity while visiting Bali.

Great experience. We were greeted by a very welcoming family that gave a wholistic experience from visiting the market to explain key ingredients to hands on cooking of some typical Balinese dishes. Would definately recommended!

A must try !. Yes lot of people (around 20 pax). It is very popular due to TA ranking. Pick up and drop off taken care off. Pick up can be long when you wait for people. Overall very welcoming people, very friendly. Visit of the market quite straight forward. Then go to their house where you are divided in two group. Even though the group is big you can still "cook" a bit. You cut, you mix and you listen to Puspa ;) Good meal but quite simple.

Start your engines!!. The class begins with a pick up from your hotel and a tour of the local markets in Ubud to learn about the local ingredients. It is then off to a rice field to learn a bit about the rice growing process from planting through to harvest and processing. Not far from there is Puspa's house where her husband (Wayan) will do an entertaining and informative introduction to Balinese homes and the cooking school. There were eight different dishes that we prepared and it was reasonably hands on as we were engaged in doing something most of the time. The dishes turned out well and instructions / recipes were provided. To begin with I was a bit taken aback by the class size which must have been 25+ but this was well managed by dividing into smaller groups. Puspa is a great hostess, very funny and a bit cheeky in a fun way.

A wonderful experience. A friend had recommended that we do this class. This was our first holiday to bali. I emailed Puspa from Australia and she was very prompt with her replies and accomodating of our children whom were allowed to come along. She arranged for us to be collected from our hotel and returned also. The class itself was a lot of fun and the food was amazing! We participated in the preparation but the very talented staff would finish off each course and serve us at our large dining table. We had 4 children with us aged 5, 4, 2 & 1 - Wayan was so lovely with all the kids I just wanted to take him home!

A must do and so much fun. We were picked up from our hotel in Ubud and taken to a rice paddy In the countryside overlooking Mt Agung where we were met by the other people who we would be doing the class with. Wayan explained about how they grow the rice and encouraged us to take photo's of the beautiful scenery . From there we were taken to Wayan & Puspa's home where Wayan9Puspa' husband not our driver) talked to us about traditional family life and Balinese customs. He was a delight and had a great sense of humour. Then on the kitchen that is open air and has a great view overlooking a valley.We made soup and 5 main courses working in pairs, so everyone gets a chance to cook. We then sat down in this beautiful spot and enjoyed our meal.Pusapa then made us a banana dish for dessert Pusapa also has a great sense of humour and is very entertaining. She is very fussy in regard to hygiene making sure you remember to wash your hands and providing disposable gloves when handling the meat. We did the afternoon class so we didn't go to the market but you can do that if you do the morning class. Book early because these classes book out very quickly. The cost of the class was $35 including transfers to and from our hotel in Ubud.

Wonderful cooking class!. If you are hesitating to book this class, don't! It's fantastic. We couldnt make our original date we booked as we fell ill, but Puspa was happy to accommodate another class for us for another day with no cancellation fees. We took the afternoon class from 4pm - 8pm. Picked up from our hotel and taken to a rice terrace where the lovely driver spoke about how rice was grown and processed, which was great to learn & the view was beautiful. Then to Puspa & Wayan's family home, where we were welcomed with a refreshing drink and a comedic explanation of how the traditional balinese family home operates. We continued on to cook a handful of beautiful traditional indonesian dishes using fresh local produce in a great kitchen overlooking a huge valley as the sun went down. As a vegetarian or vegan, this class is extremely accomodating! At the end we were able to sit down and enjoy all the food we created with a cold Bintang. It was truly delicious and we learned so much! Highlight of the trip. Thanks Wayan & Puspa.

Amazing.. Absolutely perfect in execution, organization, food, pace, etc. Excellent hospitality, and delicious. A lot of surprise treats like the tour of the market, pick up, cultural references, and just a nice feeling of connection.I would absolutely recommend this if you are looking for a fun activity!

Lovely time spent in Ubud. Our driver picked us at the hotel on time and drive us to Ubud. Then we start a trip on morning market, which was really interesting to see and taste some local products. After market trip we went to rice field,where we were told how the rice is grown. After the rice field visit, we finally get to Puspa's home, where we were welcomed by her husband, who told us about culture and life on Bali. Then after we split to two groups and go to the kitchen. The class itself is in friendly atmosphere and is really super easy. If you are looking for some sophisticated class, try something else. This class is really a casual overall on cooking on Bali. I have to say I really enjoyed this cooking class.

Unforgettable experience... . This is something you must do! From the comical introductory chat, to the detailed explanation of a typical Balinese style home, and then onto the cooking class!100% hands on approach, sharing the cooking/ingredients prep with your partner, plenty to do and get involved with! Can't recommend this experience highly enough, it was perfect and a great addition to an already wonderful holiday!

Fabulous Cooking Class Adventure. Todays booking for PAON Cooking Bali was much more than we expected. Initially we were met by Made at the Ubud Palace. We met up with Wayan inside Ubud Market, he explained the traditional temples and offerings to the gods and spirits, we sampled local produce and met Puspa who walked us through the market explaining other produce and spices. We then took a brief tour of a local rice field whilst Puspa and Wayan went to prepare our welcome drinks. After a very informative tour of the rice field we were welcomed to Puspa & Wayan home with a delicious lemon drink. After some explanation of the family culture the cooking class began. Puspa, Wayan and their team of staff were amazing, the food was delicious, the instructions and methods were simple producing some amazing food that we all shared. There were approximately 20 people in our class however it was like we were having personal lessons.I thoroughly recommend this as a "Must Do" experience in Bali.Puspa & Wayan are very entertaining and extremely warm and welcoming.Thank you so much Puspa, Wayan & Team :-*

Fantastic Cooking Adventures with Puspa!. This cooking class is worth every penny. My partner and I did the afternoon class. It was easy to book online and the pick up/drop off was great as well. You will learn about Balinese culture and family life. The cooking is done in a very efficient manner. Everything is clean and spotless! A word of advice: Dont eat lunch that day or you'll be stuffed! Highly recommend this to anyone visiting Ubud!

Excellent class, yummy food!. We were a big group travelling from Aus who did the morning cooking class. We all got picked up from our hotels, taken to the market in Ubud and given a tour of all the exotic fruits and veges, we also learned alot about the culture. After the tour we were taken to the rice fields where the tour guide gave us insight on how the rice was harvested. We were than taken to Paon's cooking class in her own home. What a welcoming family and full of humour! They were well organised and hygenic and we got to participate in making all the different dishes. Food was delicious, real authentic Balianese dishes. Fun day was had by everyone! Highly recommend if your in Ubud and you have 5 hours to spare :)

Deserves 10 stars - the best ever!. This was not only the highlight of my trip in Bali, but perhaps one of the best excursions I've ever done on any trip. The class/tour starts with a trip to the market where fruits are explained and sampled. Then onto a rice field with a brief educational history. Then you arrive at one of the most gorgeous homes in Ubud. The instructors husband introduces you to the home, explains the property and offered a brief history to home life in Bali. Finally, the cooking. The Chef, Ms. Puspa, is absolutely amazing! Funny, charming, informative. The food she thought us to make was phenomenal. I really cannot rave enough. If I could give it 10 stars I would. Do NOT miss the opportunity to do this when you are in Bali. Seriously, if I had not left the following day I would have done it a second time!

Learn Authentic Balinese Cooking - Delicious!. my wife and I love to immerse ourselves with the local culture on our trips and cooking courses are our favorite way. Paon was amazing for so many great reasons, a big one was the host who was so witty when imparting the skills and how-to for authentic Balinese food, and getting everyone involved and hands on to make 8 dishes was really fun. They collected us from our Ubud hotel and at the end of the night, with the recipes printed out, we were driven home to our hotel. Wonderful people, wonderful course, delicious food and a great way to spend 5 hours. Highly recommended, great for couples and single travelers.

A great time with Aunty Puspa. My wife and I’s travel agent booked us onto a half day Balinese cookery course. We started early at the Ubud markets, where you are guided through the various sections (flowers, meat, spices, vegetables and fruit). En-route to Laplapan village, we stopped to have a brief talk about padi fields and their history, which was an interesting little interlude. When we arrived in Laplapan, we were introduced to “Aunty Puspa”, who was our teacher for the cooker course and in whose home the course took place. The course was designed to allow you to cook a full lunchtime meal from start to finish and then eat the meal you’d cooked at the end. The whole course was very well organised, easy to follow and created some delicious food. I would certainly recommend it to anyone of any level of cooking ability, as there is something for everyone. It’s also worth mentioning, that vegetarians are well catered for also.

Start Your Engines, Hunny Bunny !!!!. Not just a cooking school.....a cultural and culinary adventure!The day started with a visit to the local markets with Wayan to check out where the produced is purchased from. Then a visit to a rice paddie to learn how rice is grown and harvested. Next...the main event....off to Wayan and Aunty Puspa's home for a fun, funny and educational hands on in the art of Balinese cooking.Aunty Puspa and her team are the consummate hosts, teaching us not only how to prepare and cook some classic Balinese dishes, but also about the Balinese way of life. The facilities at the school are top notch and the dishes prepared are amazing....what a feast!!! At the end of the morning, we left having made life long friends in Aunty Puspa and Wayan. Every time I pull out my cookbook, I smile and think of them....."Hunny Bunny....start your engine!!!"

Excellent experience. Even if u are a solo traveller like me I am sure u will enjoy it!! U will get to visit market places, rice terrace and finally back to her house for the class. U will get involve in the cooking as it is a hands on class then get to eat in a very nice scenery !

Highlight of my trip!. Having never done a cooking class before I signed up to Paon Bali after reading all the wonderful reviews on trip advisor! And it didn't disappoint! From being collected at my hotel to an incredibly detailed and friendly tour of the local food market, I received far more than just an insight into Balinese/Indonesian cooking. Wayan's friendly & humerous introduction paved the way for a wonderful mornings cooking in their home with his bubbly wife Pupsa. The food was delicious and the whole morning was thoroughly enjoyable. Excellent value for money and an experience I would highly recommend to anyone travelling to Ubud!

Best cooking class ever!. The cooking class at Paon will be remembered for a very long time. It was extremely well organized and the hosts have a fantastic sense of humor. The food is very authentic and we truly enjoyed it. Besides learning a lot about cooking we got a great tour of a real Balinese house and a lot of background. We felt very welcome and enjoyed ourselves a lot!
Heaps good!!!. Fantastic day in Ubud. Guided tour of the market, then the warm up man Wayan, followed by the main attraction, his wife Puspa. Thoroughly entertaining and interesting cooking class.

5 stars isn't enough. What an amazing experience. Wayan & Puspa are an amazing team and will have you cracking up laughing when sharing their life story. The driver, Noyman, was also amazing and such a grateful & humble person. If you go to cooking class and don't enjoy it there is something seriously wrong with you. Even though we had 25 people in the class, everyone is made to cook & there is no getting out of it - I tried as I just wanted to eat :) The food we cooked was out of this world so there is hope for me yet. Unlimited bottled water is supplied too. A must do!!!!!

The champion!. Paon Bali reigns as champion of market tour / rice padi view / cooking schools. I was initially apprehensive that this might be "too touristy" - there were about 20-30 people in our class - but we found it was actually a nice opportunity to meet and get to know other travelers while sharing notes about other places to visit in Indonesia. They have clearly invested the time and energy in making sure the whole experience was seamless and engaging. Well done.

Fun Cooking Class. Would definitely recommend Paon cooking class, what a fun way to learn more about Balinese food & culture. Puspa and her husband are passionate in what they do & were wonderful hosts along with the staff helping out. Also providing some humour along the way. Morning starts with trip to market learning about ingredients used & also the families rice paddies. Very hands on with everyone helping to prepare & cook the dishes. Sitting down to eat our food was the the highlight as food was delicious & probably the best I've eaten so far in Bali.

One of the best experiences in Ubud. Found the start of the day just the tiniest bit boring, as I'd already been to the market and seen the rice fields, but as soon as we got to the cooking class's location, in the owner's lovely home, I was in heaven. The couple who run the class are delightful. Very personable, fun and funny. The woman in charge is super organized, so that the class flows perfectly, with just enough hands on work to be entertaining, but not so much as to be slavery. Learned a lot. Met great people. Enjoyed the environment and the food we cooked was then our lunch and it was delicious. Highly recommend!!

Must Visit. The best hands on, hospitable, authentic cooking class you will do. Puspa and Wayan offer a warm, cultured experience in their home which they have adapted to accomodate visitors from all over the world, from small groups to weddings. They cater for all dietary requirements , allergies and preferences without any fuss and use fresh, amazing ingredients that you will easily be able to replicate. Their jokes are funny too, but the food... The food is the best you will eat in Bali hands down. Because you will have made it fresh from scratch - Sublime!!!!! I did this class with my teenagers five years ago and it was one of their highlights of Bali and still talk about it. Every time any of our friends go to Bali, they go to see Puspa. You know it's going to be of a high standard the minute you enter their home, from the beauty, to the streamlining of the whole program, to the love, humour and appreciation they show their guests. Everyone gets to take a recipe booklet and we all cook a large array of authentic dishes under the guidance of the team. Hygiene is first class, so Thank you Puspa and Wayan and to the team for such a professional, yet relaxed, genuine experience much love Cherry and Dora (Melbourne, Australia)- I would love to welcome you to my home one day

Fun, informative, charming, and delicious cooking class. From start to finish, my significant other and I, along with 15 other people, had a wonderful time learning about and taking part in preparing Balinese food. Puspa is a wonderful instructor, full of energy and clear excitement/love for what she does. You take part in preparing many delicious dishes and imbues the class with so much fun. The food was delicious and her husband was a wonderful opening act for the class itself.

Fantastic cooking school!. We had a really great time with Puspa teaching us to cook local dishes... Fresh ingredients, wonderful teachers with a great sense of humour and beautiful setting... Some of the best food we have had in Bali! Definitely recommend a visit.

Best cooking school in Bali. If you want to learn about the way the Balinese live in Ubud this is the cooking class to head to. I chose the morning class which included the market tour which was amazing. I leant so much. Aunty Puspa was the highlight of the cooking experience and her charm and friendly disposition made my experience in Bali one to remember.

Paon Cooking Class. Great value!! Visited Ubud markets first, rice paddies then into the well appointed establishment. Puspa and her staff were wonderful, well organised and very attentive. The end result was absolutely delicious!!

A nice place to learn cooking and taught by the best.. Very reasonably charged to attend the cooking lesson. It is in Ubud so my advice is to give extra time to get there. I stayed in jimbaran and due to the jam i arrived later that the appointed time eventhough i put aside 2 hours traveling time. U will learn a variety of dishes and the whole place is very beautiful. You will be guided along each step. Im very happy to have had this experience. You leave the place feeling full !

SO MUCH FUN, BEST MEAL WE HAD IN BALI. This was our favorite Bali adventure. I wasn't too sure about taking a cooking class, but it was so much fun! The garden kitchen is beautiful and the husband and wife duo are hilarious! The food you cook is amazing and you get to take the recipes home with you! It is fun for all ages and I would recommend this to all! I wish we could go back just to spend time with them and eat more great food. I have been home for 2 weeks and have already made some of the dishes back home because we liked the food so much!

Fantastic time, learned heaps cooked great food, wonderful hosts. I really enjoyed my time at the Paon Cooking Class. It was way more than a cooking class, we learnt all about their family life their food and spices and visited the Market and the rice fields. It's extremely well run, the food is amazing and we all got to cook and prepare every facet of the meal. Highly recommend this is a must do in Ubud.

Materclass not Masterchef. Simple to make, great flavours. Adequate cooking facilities. Our Chef Puspa was interactive, polite and her class is easy to understand. The afternoon is well priced compared to others and well worth the money (transferred included). The only two drawbacks are; - there is a wafting smell when sitting down to eat, which is usual for Indonesia, however can be solved with more incense. - you don't cook in order of the food. ie - you never make one full meal at a time. I understand this is probably to reduce time and have good flow however from a participation perceptive, it lacks engagement.A good old fashioned cooking class however if you go thinking it's Master Chef, you'll be disappointed.

Amazing food , wonderful location!!. We had such a great time cooking at Paon, the class is run very professionally and the staff are wonderful. I thoroughly recommend it ! I was so surprised at how tasty and deiscious the food was and certainly cant wait to try it out at home.

Fabulous day out cooking Balinese food.. Puspah was a wonderful teacher, she explained everything well and what we could substitute certain foods that are difficult to find in supermarkets at home. Her facilities are fantastic, all clean, and the view from the kitchen is an added bonus.. Sitting down after to eat the feast we'd cooked.. awesome. Extremely good value for money.

A must must do do!!. This has definitely been one of the most enriching experiences I have been through ever.The dishes that we made were amazing and definitely the best food I have have had in Bali. Puspa and her team were brilliant and a trip to Bali is incomplete without this experience.

Amazing!!! Such a great experience a must when in ubud!. Went here on our last day in ubud. Was a great experience. Very well organised and food so tasty. Pushpa and her team are amazing. The class also includes a trip to the local market where you try all the exotic fruits and a visit to the paddy fields.

Very enjoyable morning. Interactive, personable and fun, cooking experience! Owner pushpa welcomes you to her home for an authentic Balinese experience. Visit to the market (mornings only) is also a great plus. Includes pick-up and drop.

Great day!. This class is such good value for money! We got picked up from our hotel, went on a tour of the market and tried different fruits and learnt about the different foods, then we went to the rice fields- stunning view. When we arrived at the cooking school we were welcomed with delicious drinks and then cooked 7 different dishes. The instructors were funny, friendly and easy to understand and the food was delicious- and you get to cook it/eat it in the front of the most amazing view. +free water. It only came to $35 AUD- BARGAIN!

An entertaining class. Wajan and Puspa are both true entertainers, so the class is a lot of fun to start with. Based on previous cooking classes I expected that the market visit would include buying the ingredients, but this was not the case. The market visit is quite short with good explanation about different fruits and spices though. If you're familiar with them, I would take the afternoon class. Everything at the cooking class itself is superb arranged, with attention for allergies/diets/hygiene. In hindsight, the group was too large for me, as someone who loves to cook I would have liked to really cook from scratch and do everything myself. The food we ate was amazing and gives you a perfect impression on Indonesian kitchen. Great fun for families I can imagine as well and good way to meet other people. Big thank you to Puspa and Wayan and their team!

Great cooking class. I absolutely loved this class until the last20 mins where the Auntie was pushing a 5 star rating on trip advisor. For me
It was too much pushing for good ratings. Otherwise the class is awesome and beautiful the food is delicious !

Nice chef, tasty food!. the chef was so good! She is funny and polite. Also, she taught us patiently.
In her class, you will never feel boring~ There were plenty of opportunities for you to cook every dishes.
If you want to attend cooking class in Bali, this is the one i recommended.

Best cooking adventure ever!. I had a wonderful day at the Pain Bali Cooking Class. From the driver sent to pick me up from my resort in Nusa Dua, to the great food experience. Wayan and Puspa were genuine and so likeable. Cooking with a group of 20 people from all over the world was also very special. This is a must do while in Bali!!

Fantastic day out and incredible meal. This day was so worth while. The operation is very slick. As a cookery teacher myself I was really looking forward to this day and attended with my mum, also a cookery teacher and my sister. The Hygiene standards were very high. The quality of the food was fresh and incredible. The teaching was fast paced and well organised and fun" we all had chance to participate and even with a full group it was fantastically well organised. The presentation and teaching was charismatic informative and pitched just right to include everyone. The visit yo the market and paddy fields were informative and interesting. We were given fantastic cookery notes with adaptations for food we can access at home. The transfer organised by the company was high quality, safe, and well worth the expense. What is more the communication with the company was fantastic both in the uk and in Bali, despite me making so some mistakes with my dates. My advice is .... Book in advance, if you want to do a cookery course in Bali, and I highly recommend that you do...Do it with these people.

A lot of fun!. This class was such an enjoyable activity in Ubud and a great way to have your dinner also. The cost includes return transport in the Ubud area which is worth the price of admission! We did the afternoon class as we didn't want the market tour (avid home cooks, we are familiar with the ingredients). This paid off as our class was smaller than the morning ones. 9 people including my husband and I. There is a good balance between explanation, prep and hands on cooking so that it is fun and relaxing. The food was great, the recipes not too simple but ok for all levels. They make sure people switch roles and you get to try everything. They also accommodated gluten free - which was awesome! Would highly recommend it to anyone.

Such lovely people . Wayan and Puspa were so so lovely. Our one year old son came with us and Wayan took him and my dad over to a local celebration and gave them full attire to wear whilst we cooked! The cooking was great but if you are after one on one then this is not for you... There was about 25 people in the class but 6 teachers for the group plus your driver to and from villa and to market and rice paddy! Great experience!

Fantastic family day out. Puspa is a gem, she made everyone feel so welcome and put our teenage daughters at ease immediately.Such a gorgeous setting and so well organised. We all thoroughly enjoyed our day and the food we cooked was fantastic. Loved that we got all the recipes to take home and Puspa explained what ingredients we could substitute at home so it would still taste just as amazing.Never thought my husband and daughters would want to do a cooking class while on holiday but it was a highlight of our trip and I would recommend to all. This was money VERY well spent and I would definitely go back again. Thanks "Aunty" Puspa xx

Great day!. This was an enriching day! Everything was really well prepared, the food tasted good, and the hygiene was high. It was amazing to cook, talk and have fun at the same time! This family is really friendly and they offer the perfect setting for this course. They did everything right and we are glad that we went to this course!Thank you for a great day!

Marvelous experience..... My wife and I decided last minute to join the cooking class. Considering limited research and online reviews we decided to go with Paon... Needless to say Tripadvisor unbias reviews were great. Pushpa, Wayan and their crew are honest, generous, open and loving people. They open their hearts, house and food secrets with us. They made us and the other 15 people feel at home, welcomed and genuinely made helped us understand the meaning and work put into each and every Indonesian grain consumed..... A must do class for couples, singles and food loving people. Basically covers everyone. Would recommend to everyone....

We Loved It!. We experiened the Paon cooking class Friday 10 April. Where do I start ... We were picked up at 7.30am by excellent driver Dewa. We met Puspa at the markets in Ubud & we taken on tour. We then met at a rice field & given a very informative explanation of rice production & demand. Then to Paon which is located in Puspa & Wayan's home. We were given a welcome drink on arrival, intro meeting then headed to the kitchen where we were offered tea & coffee. Puspa & Wayan are just gorgeous, both friendly, funny & accommodating. Puspa explained the outline for the afternoon & then we got into it. We were all given jobs to do for the preparation of the meal & it was so much fun. As a family of four we thoroughly enjoyed every minute of it and together we all shared and experienced awesome tasting food - the bonus is we now know how to cook it & are very excited to try the recipes at home. We would highly recommend this class to anybody & it is suitable for all ages. Puspa also goes out of her way to check for food allergies & dietry requirements. On another note: the house is immaculate & the toilets very clean! Thank you Puspa & Wayan!

What a delight!. Having experienced other Balinese cooking classes this was by far the best. So well organised with lovely and funny hosts, so warm and welcoming! Clean lovely kitchen, fresh food to die for. By far the highlight of our trip and will be recommending to anyone who asks us! Next time ice cream with the bananas Puswah 😉! Loved it.

Highlight of my trip!. Very organized and delicious.
They took care of every detail and made us feel so welcome in their home.
Hands down the best cooking class I've ever taken.

AMAZING- 10/10 would reccomend!. Today we visited Paon cooking school and it was an unforgettable experience! We were picked up by our driver in Seminyak and driven to the local fresh markets in Ubud! We were greeted by Puspa who showed us around the markets and gave us local fruits to try! We were then driven out to the rice fields in Ubud and taught how the rice is grown and harvested! Then we were driven to Puspa and Wayan's lovely home in ubud where the cooking class was held! The kitchen was very large accomodating for around 20-30 people! We each had many jobs of chopping the ingredients, cooking the sauces in the multiple fry-pans and even preparing all the food for cooking! The food that we all prepared was AMAZING and so tasty! It was so good to learn about the balienese cooking and we were even given the recipes! Nothing was too hard, the complimentary drinks were flowing from the moment we walked in, the hygiene was impecable and Puspa was VERY aware of illness that may be caused by eating baliense food. The toilets were some of the cleanest toilets we have seen in bali, and we have visited over 6 times! Would reccomend this cooking class to ANYONE, even vegetarians, vegans, young and old!

Interesting cooking class and GREAT food. We have been taking cooking classes in our many recent trips, to Thailand, Italy, etc. We chose Paon Bali based on the great reviews online and the fact that we could choose between am and pm classes. Responses to my emails were quickly answered.The course itself was interesting though I find a little crowded. I think if each station was individual it would be more interesting and personalized, though we probably wouldn't have enough time for all the meals we prepared. Puspa is very kind and dynamic, she handles the class well with her assistants. Their home is fabulous.In resume, we must admit we simply LOVED eating what we cooked!!!

Excellent Experience - loved it!. If you are looking for some authentic Bali experience, join Paon Bali for some hours of excellent cooking & dining. Puspa, Wayan and Nyoman were super nice and tried to show everyone a great time. Enjoy the beautiful setting and probably the best tasting local food i have had in Indonesia. Do it! :)

A highlight of our trip. Just brilliant.. I have "done" cookery classes before, but this one is an absolute stand out. We were picked up from our lodgings, taken on a very interesting trip to the produce market,followed by a brief visit to the village rice paddies and on to the cookery experience. There simply cannot be a better organised, cookery lesson. We all were made to feel like special guests and we produced, with the help of super efficient staff, a wonderful Balinese meal. I will be back, next time with whole family. A TOP experience.

A great class with a fantastic host. We were very impressed with the morning class, which takes in a tour of the market and rice fields before moving onto the kitchen. The class is slightly bigger than some that I have been on before, so the preparation is split into work stations that you rotate around to get a feel for everything. The actual cooking is done in pairs and is led by Puspa, who is a great host and made us feel very welcome in her home. Overall, a fantastic morning that I would recommend to anybody interested in Balinese food.

Relaxed cooking class if you're feeling lazy. This is a good class for those who are struggling with Bali heat and humidity because you don't have to do much. Well organised tour where all ingredients are washed and prepared so you just have to chop or fry a little. We had 25 in our class so if you prefer a more hands on and intimate class, this is not the right one for you. I found it a bit boring but lovely food.

Entertaining and educational. A hands-on and educational experience with a spectacular view. There were three of us visiting Bali and two of us had a cooking class on our bucket list. We attended the afternoon class held by Puspa, or Aunty Puspa as she referred to herself. We arrived early and met the very entertaining Wayan and had a sneak preview of the area where we would be preparing and cooking the food. Before starting we were taken away to hear about rice cultivation, a fascinating and informative part of the tour. There were 16 in our group, but we were promised that all would have the opportunity to prepare and cook the eight recipes in the booklet we could take away with us. Wow!! the food was fabulous, Puspa and her staff were right there at all times to assist, and we had a table full of delightful dinner companions that had all worked alongside us.Our group of three organised our own driver so we could do our own thing in the morning before starting the class at 4pm, so missing out on the market visit the morning class does was not an issue. It is totally understandable why this class gets rave reviews - it is fun, informative and yummy.

We loved it!. We had a fantastic time with the team at Paon cooking class in Ubud. The market tour was great and we even got to see the rice fields! We them headed to the family compound which was lovely and got to work, everyone got their share of prep and hands on cooking. The day was great and we definitely took something away from the class. We booked through Expedia and organised a lift from Seminyak for the day - it takes around 1:15 to drive from Seminyak. Definitely worth going to this class!

A wonderful experience with delightful hosts. held near Ubud the half day class included a market visit, local orientation and is hosted in a private home. A brilliantly set up instruction kitchen, careful instructions, a high level of interaction and take away recipes. A lovely lunch to finish it all off. Highly recommended

Second time and we'll be back!. Thanks Puspa for another fantastic experience in your kitchen! This time we booked the morning market tour which was both colourful and educational - and the food we made was once again full of the rich flavours and aromas we were introduced to last time at the evening class.As visitors to your family home we always feel welcome and catered for - especially as we are vegetarians. Your new kitchen is spacious and cool to work in and as expected, spotlessly clean - hygiene being such an important factor when cooking with novice chefs!I can highly recommend both your morning and evening classes to anybody with an interest in the preparation and flavours of traditional Balinese dishes - where you are actually 'involved' in the preparation yourself rather than a mere onlooker. The recipes you gave us to take home have been tried and tested a number of times since our visit - we even found a traditional Balinese blender!We love the fact that your classes are as much a social event as a cooking experience - and have enjoyed the company of new friends and conversation over the meal on both occasions. We are coming back for another visit soon and hope to bring our fellow travellers along with us to our 3rd cooking class! Transport, educational information at the market and rice fields, cooking 'hands-on' experience, entertainment and a delicious 'all you can eat' meal including delightful conversation with new friends from all around the world - where else can you do this for such a reasonable price? Wonderful!!

Absolutely fantastic!. We came in a group of 8 with 4 boys ranging from 8-11 years old. We weren't sure what to expect or how interested the boys would be at cooking, but the warm welcome with smiles, drinks, and a quick introduction to the way all family temples are set up was a great way to reel all of us in! We were captivated by the colors and smells of the fresh produce and the beauty of the kitchen. The food we prepared was far better than we expected and it was nice to have a better understanding of traditional Balinese food. I have already suggested the Paon Bali Cooking class to my friends that are coming to Bali next week. Collectively we agree, this was our favorite family outting so far! We highly recommend it!

Super yummy!. Our teacher (Puspa) was great! She was really funny and charismatic. We cooked a LOT of food and all tasted really authentic. Her house was so clean and all her assistants were really kind, perfect for tourists. It was an awesome experience!

Great experience and great food!. We did the morning cooking class and were picked up from our hotel in Ubud. The day started with a tour of a market and then a short trip to the rice paddies after which we were taken to Puspa's home. There were between 20 and 30 people on the course but everything ran smoothly and everyone was fully involved. Puspa and her husband were a comedy duo who kept us entertained. The food was delicious and it was lovely to meet so many people from all over the world. I would definitely recommend this if you are staying in Ubud.

Amazing experience! Loved everything about it!. Paon Bali Cooking Class was one the highlights for our entire time in Bali! We started off our morning tour at the market which was really informative and from there everything continued to exceed our expectations. The hosts Puspa and Made really made the experience. They were extremely knowledgeable, funny and welcoming into their home. We were able to make a lot of dishes, trying so many new foods and having a lot of fun with it. As someone else stated, it really was more than just a cooking class, but an overall wonderful experience (with some excellent food)! I highly HIGHLY recommend it!

A Must Do!. This is a must do experience for anyone visiting Bali. A great way to see Ubud, and to learn and try Balinese food. Very interactive with excellent service from the hosts. They catered for us (vegeteranians) and met our every requirement. A day well spent indeed!
Amazing experience!. Truly amazing and educational experience. Great way to learn about the Balinese families and there way of living! Food tastes amazing!

Amazing!! What a fun day!!. I can see why Auntie Puspa gets the ratings she does. Her cooking class is run like a well oiled machine. We started with the shopping tour in the Ubud Market, where we learned about traditional pastries, fruits, vegetables, spices, cooking tools, meats, etc. We had the option to buy things if we wanted. Then we stopped by a rice paddy where we learned a little about how rice is grown. Finally, we were taken to Auntie Puspa's home where the class began. The day is a combination of a culture, comedy and cooking. It is entertaining and fun. The day we went there were almost 20 people. While at first, we thought that may be too many, it turned out to be lots of fun! We met so many interesting people from around the world. The day is run perfectly with transitions from section to section happening seamlessly. We made about eight dishes that we then ate for lunch. Everything was fantastic. And I left feeling that i could replicate what we made in class. I would highly recommend this class. I would actually take it again myself!!

Amazing!! A must do for everyone. Wow what can I say. This cooking class well exceeded my expectations. Mumma Puspa was entertaining and so informative. Made was also a great host. Loved the tour of the rice fields as well. Having just returned, my belly is full, and I am smiling at the enjoyable time we had. Thank you Puspa and Made for the great experience :)
Great service. This is a must visit while you are in Ubud, Great hospitality, great food and great fun!!!!!! The food was delicious and service outstanding. My 10 year old can cook now

Best time!. We had such a great time! The host was hilarious - great entertainment and really got the group enthusiastic about cooking. The food was just delicious and the menu catered to all vegetarians, and gluten free! Overall a 10 out of 10!

Incredibly professional and friendly/allergies are no problem. We booked a cooking class there the day before and they send us a drive to pick us up. The driver was friendly and very punctual. We then went to the market where we were met by a fluent English speaking woman who explained all the different kind of fruits and vegetables for us and let us try a bunch of them. After that they drove us to a rice padi and explained the whole process of making rice and so on. The cooking class itself was held in a beautiful open kitchen with a lot of space. Everything was explained in perfect English and we cooked a lot of different dishes. As I am allergic to fish I was quit worried about the class but they took incredible care of me and everything I cooked was strictly separated from the dishes who had seafood in them. Puspa (the lady who teaches you) is very friendly and incredibly funny and the whole class is incredibly professional but it still feels really personal. It was a great experience and totally worth the money (350.000 rp)! I would recommend it to absolutely everyone! Lena (&konstantin) from Germany.

Had a great time lovely hostess. I had a great time and the hostess was very charming and informative. The food we cooked was delicious and lesson entertaining and educational! The only drawback for us was that as we were staying in Legian which was a two hour drive to get to this location and the transportation cost as much as the cooking lesson. Having said that it was still worth it!

Miss Kelly. A fantastic experience fantastic food and fantastic hosts a beautiful environment and an amazing place to learn and cook to dish and about the food with traditional Bali family. I have been home three weeks and every weekend I've found myself repeating the recipes are Belin and still love the food thank you so much for the experience and the growth in my cooking

Phenomenal! Highlight of our trip!. This was a definite highlight of our 2+ weeks in Indonesia. We heard about Puspa and Wayan's classes through friends and their rave reviews were well deserved. It was so special to be in their actual home, to learn a little bit about family and tradition and Bali and visit the rice fields and the market before we got down to business. This is more than a cooking class, it is an amazing experience that you will not soon forget. AND they will pick you up at your hotel and take you back!Puspa and Wayan are delightful, funny and very knowledgeable as well as sincere. We had fun and we made and ate an amazing meal. We cannot wait to use our new found knowledge and recipes at home. I would recommend this to anyone visiting Bali.

A Tasty Learning Experience!. Our class began at the local market in Ubud where we were introduced to many of the fresh vegetables and spices we would be using in our dishes. Then we were transported to a rice paddy where the growing of rice and it's importance in Balinese culture was explained to us. Finally it was time to get down to work. There were 22 of us in a spacious kitchen. The instructions were clear and there were people to assist us if problems popped up. The facilities were clean and well organized. The food was delicious. It was a wonderful day and gave me an appreciation of the cuisine and culture of this beautiful country.

A pleasant few hours. We're picked up at 8 from our ubud retreat and after meeting others taken through the markets to have all the ingredients explained. Would loved to have bought some buy unsure about bringing them back through customs. Next was off to the paddy fields for a lesson on how they are farmed which was great. The cooking came after that and all the food was great. Puspa and her husband do a bit of a comedy routine to start which was nice. Had a great meal and met some nice people.

A fun cooking class - just watch out for aggressive hagglers. My husband and I had a really fun day learning to cook some Indonesian food. Everything we made would be easy enough to make again at home. We really enjoyed the staff as they were entertaining and welcoming. The home where you cook is peaceful and is a relaxing place to have your lunch. I would highly recommend the cooking class. The only recommendation I would have is to make sure your customers are not physically pulled and scratched by hagglers when you are trying to listen to the information being given by the tour guide. The woman even tried to get into the drivers car when we were leaving, despite me ignoring her the whole time she began throwing her items at me. The driver and tour guide offered no help and my husband had to push the woman out and lock the car door. Please make sure your paying customers are looked after by your drivers.

Love The Food. Cooking is not my favourite thing but this may have changed my mind. The staff here made it easy & fun. And I loved the experience of making the yellow sauce for the curry the traditional way. Recommend Paon Bali to all for an awesome experience.

Fun and very well-run. This class runs like clockwork. Puspa has perfected the balance between instruction, cooking and relaxation, making this activity enjoyable for everyone regardless of cooking experience. "Now we are all family for one night!" she told our group, and that's what it felt like. This was hands down the best activity during our 2-week stay in Bali.

Great Bali cooking school and fantastic experience. From the time when Wyan picked us up until he dropped us back to our villa we had a fantastic time. The fresh ingredients, with the hands on chopping, blending of spices, both original and modern methods and various cooking processes. From the welcome fresh lemon drink to eating our efforts every thing was highly organized by Puspa , Norman and the other staff. Well done Puspa for making our day one of our most memorable events in Bali.

The best of Ubud!. The entire day was amazing from the traditional markets to the kitchen and beautiful home of Puspa. I had sometime in Bali on my own and this was the best decision I made. Met a lot of other lovely travelers and learnt traditional recipes that I can take home with me. Puspa is quite the host and I love her sense of humour :)

Fabulous Day, Great people, Yummy food!. Highly recommend Paon Bali Cooking School, had the best day!Started out at 8am with free pick up from our Ubud hotel, then after collecting a couple others, we headed to the Ubud markets where our guide showed us the local produce - the markets were a bit of a shock to the system, so gratefully we didnt spend a great deal of time there, but we did pick up some great bargains on spices ($2 for a huge bag of saffron, $2 for a large bunch of vanilla pods). we then headed to Laplapan village where we learned about village life and how the locals farm the different varieties of rice. Then we drove to the cooking school where we were welcomed by Wayan & 'Aunty' Pushpa,who are just the most hilarious and adorable couple. Wayan spoke to us further about Balinese family life which was really interesting. THEN .... we started cooking! We had the best group, and had a ball getting to know other people in the class from all over the world. Cooking is communal, we all pitched in and had turns at doing all the steps in the recipe. it almost felt like we were workers in a Balinese kitchen - but in a good way. We cooked, chatted, drank bintang, laughed and ate great food all day!Everyone was catered for - vegetarian, allergies, sugar free etcWe cooked 8 dishes in total, and all were yummy! My faves were the Tempe Me Goreng & the Kolak Biu (the banana dessert). We were all given a booklet of recipes to take home and told to contact Aunty Pushpa via email if we needed any help when making the dishes at home.Fabulous day, great people, yummy food! You will not regret doing this.

Paon Bali cooking school. I don't enjoy cooking, but i accompanied a friend, and i loved the experience. The instructor was terrific and entertaining, the activity was done in a way that doesn't make you feel totally useless, and the food at the end was delicious. (Did I really cook that?!). One of the highlights of our stay in Ubud.

An experience. this has to be one of the most hands on I've come too in bali. I have to say for the price it beats casa Luna hands down. The only downfall was the pick up service. Being picked up was okay but the driver cong back dropped me off in town with the mutual agreement he would contact my resort to pick me up, well this did not happen, very disappointing indeed.

Money and Time Well Spent. Despite some initial confusion that was NOT the fault of the cooking school, but that of the intermediary travel agency, the school graciously accommodated us the next day. In fact, we were initially supposed to do the class in the morning, but ended up doing the evening class, which my wife and I agreed was likely better. We were picked up from our hotel, given a brief show at and tell at a rice paddy and then taken to the school. The facilities were clean and bright and overlooked a beautiful valley, which only added to the ambiance.The class itself was great and delicious all along. The final meal resulted in many great dishes and we only wish we'd had more space to eat more! Finally, we were given the recipes to take home with us and very much look forward to trying them again at home.I don't hesitate to wholeheartedly recommend this as a great Ubud experience.PS - great bathrooms.

Entertaining and educational cooking class. An easy outing from Ubud. We were picked up at our hotel and brought to the Ubud market, where we met Puspa. She is very extroverted and enjoys her work. She showed us many of the herbs, spices and produce in the market, explaining their uses and answering questions. Then we saw a rice paddy and talked about the importance of rice in the Balinese diet and culture. Then we went to her school and cooked. Puspa was very good at keeping everyone involved in the tasks, and answering questions. She recommended substitute ingredients for some that may be hard to find at home. Most importantly, she and her staff kept the pace going and the discussion entertaining, while teaching us several very good recipes. Each person got a recipe book to take home, and these dishes are easy to reproduce at home.
Very Fun and interesting. i went here with my partner, and it was so fun to cook the traditional bali food. the class is very good and also Ms.Puspa very helping.

Most gracious hosts . If love culture if you love great hospitality if you love great food and you love eating!!!! Do not miss this!! Wayan's tour of Ubud market's was just the start to our culinary adventure. Don't miss the opportunity.

Loved this. . This is a great way to spend a day in Ubud even though we travelled from Seminyak to attend. Great value for money.
The class is very professional, yet friendly, authentic and relaxed.
The food was amazing and so were the facilities.
Highly recommend.

Great experience!. Researched a lot of activities in Bali/Ubud and this cooking class seemed to have a lot of great ratings. I can tell you that it exceeded even these high expectations and it was A LOT of fun!Why was this so great? Here are a few reasons...1. Pickup and dropoff transportation was included if you are staying in Ubud. Starts around 9am and ended about 1:30-2pm. I would also recommend this activity for a day trip from Kuta/Seminyak/Legian.2. Refreshing and tasty welcome drinks, with a clean and beautiful outdoor setting for cooking. Lots of cooking stations in the cool shade, and had spectacular view of the jungle valley. The entire class was professionally orchestrated by friendly staff.3. Puspa (the host and main cooking teacher) was extremely charismatic and had a great sense of humor. My fiancé and I were "newly engaged," and we secretly enjoyed being called "honey bunny" by her :)4. Tours of the market and rice paddy beforehand were informative and lasted just the right amount of time (not too long and not too short). Their English was easy to understand.5. Prep work and cooking was not overly strenuous or intense, yet still was enough that made you feel fully involved (first-hand) in the authentic cooking techniques and ingredients of native Balinese culture. Quick poll at the end of the class, everyone (20-somethings to 60-somethings) participating were all smiles and very proud of the final result. 6. Despite being somewhat of a picky American eater, the food was absolutely delicious! I especially appreciated that they took great care to avoid risk of "Bali Belly" by carefully procuring ingredients and lots of hand washing/sanitation. 24 hours later and I still feel great! Those who were vegetarian or allergic to things like nuts were catered to as well.6 out of 5 stars for a great time! It takes a lot to impress me, and I was very pleased with the whole experience. Will be recommending Paon Bali Cooking Class to all of my friends and family. One of the main highlights of our first trip to Bali. Thank you Puspa and the rest of the staff!

Fantastic way to spend a day in Ubud. went here with two friends and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The staff led the proceedings superbly and the market tour was informative and interactive unlike some I have been to previously which tend to drag a bit. We cooked some brilliant dishes in beautiful surroundings. I am not vegetarian in any way but they were very well catered for. If you are visiting Ubud make sure that you spend a day at Paon cooking school.
Very informative and thorough day, wonderful experience!. We loved our day here. We felt so welcomed and learned so much! Really can't recommend this class highly enough.

Favourite cooking class in Bali so far!. I live in Bali so I have done a couple of cooking classes, when my sister in law said she wanted to do one I came to trip advisor to find one in Ubud so we could spend a day out, after seeing the reviews we booked in and were not disappointed!The day started at the local markets for a quick tour of the products and produce and some tasting of local fruit which is pretty standard at most classes. We then hopped in cars and headed out to some rice paddies which were beautiful and we got to learn more about the bali lifestyle.On arrival at the Villa for the class we were greeted by Wayan with some delicious frozen lemon drinks (need the recipie for these) Wayan and Puspa are so lovely and friendly with a great sense of humour! Being around them just made me smile! The class itself was fantastic! We got to chop, grind, saute, fry and cook our way through the morning and most of the dishes were actually pretty easy to make (if you have all the ingredients).The food - OMG let me tell you it was all delicious! For days after anything I ate was a disappointment. Everything was so full of flavour and simply mouthwatering, I would book in just to have lunch haha.Since coming home I have actually made the hot and sour soup which was just as good as the one we made on the day, if not better (I added more chilli) which is a first for me as I havent attempted anything from the other classes.I will defiantly try to make the fish, satay, dessert and tempe again as they were my favourites! I just need to get the ingredients when I have time!Must do in Ubud! Highly recommended and I will be back!

Best tour in bali. Had the best experience today cooking with puspa and the paon team. Highly recommended!!! Great food And eating it knowing you created it all was amazing. Can't wait to try my new skills at home
Fantastic. Great value for money and very hands on. You get to cook up a feast, with about 6 dishes. The hosts are easy to understand and you receive a copy of the recipes at the end.

I love this place!. Hosts Wayan and Puspa are so amazing and accommodating. They were so funny and entertaining. Before I arrived at Paon for the cooking class, I had eaten out and wasn't feeling right. Turns out I had a bout of food poisoning and reacted while I was on their compound. Aunty Puspa took such amazing care of me - she had me drinking her DIVINE ginger tea with honey and allowed me to sit down and watch the cooking and participate when I felt ok. She even brought a mattress out for me to lay on if I was feeling too bad!! I eventually started to feel much better, with the tea and wonderful soup our group had made with her guidance. I was able to enjoy all the meals she showed us how to prepare. I cannot get over how hospitable they were to me... I can't reccomend any better place. If you want to see an amazing home in the beautiful rice paddies of Bali, this is the place!

Delightful!!. This class was one of the most fun, friendly, informational and delectable experience I've had in Ubud. The staff and Puspa and her husband were genuinely funny and welcoming. The food and work the staff do to make the class flow so well is impressive. They are also very attentive to any dietary needs and ensure that each and every person is taken care of personally. I would recommend this class (the morning class with a trip to the market) to anyone interested in any of the local food and what makes them so good.
Yum!. Staff were friendly, food was tasty and the place was very clean. Our group was quite large (about 20) however we were all catered for well.

Amazing cooking class. My family and I did this cooking class last week and had an absolutely wonderful time! Puspa and Wayan are the most accommodating hosts. Having the experience of going out to the Ubud markets in the morning was one I won't forget – you get to see where the Balinese people buy their Fruits, Veggies and Meat and sample some of the local fruits also. Wayan and Puspa are full of personality and make you feel very welcome in their home – they were even trying to set up my younger cousin with their daughter! I have done many cooking classes back home in Australia and none of them even compare to this one. It was very hands on, with everyone chopping, blending, peeling and everyone getting a chance to use the traditional 'Bali Blender'. We cooked a huge selection of food, and all got to sample it afterwards, with everyone going back for second and third helpings (there was still food left over!) I would happily pay more than USD$35 for this. All in all, it was a fantastic experience, and I won't hesitate to do it again! Thanks so much Wayan and Puspa!

An excellent experience.. We had a wonderful time at the Paon cooking class. The hosts Puspa and Wayan are funny, friendly and very welcoming. The class is held at the family home compound which is beautifully set up to allow a group to cook together. The class and the transfers were well organised and excellent value. We cooked several courses for lunch - and it was absolutely delicious. Thoroughly recommended!
Awesome experience! Highly recommended!. It was a real pleasure to be part of the family, cook together and eat just perfect food. Well planned and organized cooking class. Thank you a lot!

Excellent!. From the moment you arrive, you're made to feel very welcome into Puspa's home. Based in Ubud, it's a collection of family buildings with the cooking school in a sheltered open air area at the back.We were staying in Seminyak and they organised a round trip by car for Rp. 400k.
