While they are big enough to cater for 25+ students in a session (and had done that morning), my partner and I were joined by just one other couple which gave us a really personalised experience.Having had our Welcome drinks, we prepared and cooked 8 dishes - all of which tasted great and were fully instructed. Always checking for questions, Puspa was happy to explain what local alternatives we could use to substitute ingredients we otherwise can't get.I would highly recommend for anyone with a spare morning/afternoon who wants to learn the basics of Balinese cooking. We all left with a recipe book and full stomachs.

Paon Cooking Class Ubud, Bali. What a fabulous day we had taking this Authentic Bali Cooking class. Pupa and Wayan are charming and energetic and so organized. When I realized that there were 25 people taking this class, I was a little suspicious. But it's all managed and arranged so effectively that everyone gets to participate in preparing and cooking all the ingredients of an eight course Balinese meal. And then, of course we got to eat it all. All ingredients were fresh and so aromatic. Thank you for inviting us into your beautiful home and sharing so much with us about Balinese culture and food. This certainly was a highlight of our two weeks in Bali! We would do it again in a flash!

Highlight. Today again I did the cooking class with Puspa and Wayan. I had done it 5 mths ago and was so impressed I had to take my daughter to come and enjoy the experience. We both loved it! Thank you for a wonderful and informative day
Great, a bit different experience!. Never been to an exotic cooking class before, but I enjoyed this one very much! Good food, nice hosts. Definitely worth the money.
Had a great time. Truly a wonderful experience, lovely people, great food, they have toilets and everything is spotless (this is something I am always worried about). You must give this a go :)

Highlight of our Trip - February 2015. We attended the cooking school in February 2015. The chef is charismatic, great at instruction, well-organized, and just a delight. We made eight dishes, received the recipe for each, and ate to our heart's content. To cook inside someone's beautiful balinese home is a very special event. I recommend this for expert cookers and novices like me. Thank you for a wonderful morning!

A truly unique Balinese cooking experience!. I love cooking and this was perfect. Another cuisine to add to my dinner party recipe book. The day starts off with a small market tour in Ubud center and then you are driven to the home of Wayan and Puspua where you are given a small introduction about Balinese home culture. We were taught over 6 different dishes! And they were all so yummy! Vegetarian options are available and meat can be substituted for those who dont want to cook with meat. A truly fun experience and a wonderful meal. Best cooking class i've had!

Back again. We did this tour back in 2013, had so much we've come back for more. We did the morning class which includes a market visit & rice fields visit & then back to the family home of Wayan & Puspa, we were welcomed back like old friends. They've renovated since our last visit & it's looking good. Food was fab, fresh ingredients, amazing flavours, now to recreate this at home

Perfect. Group cooking class. Very good food, very entertaining, good vibe, good people, learned a lot about the culture as well, they will answer all your questions! It was also very clean, everyone got to cook and leave with a full stomack! Definitly worth the time and money!

Highlight of my trip. I thoroughly recommend doing this class while you are in Ubud. It is heaps of fun and not too intense. The teacher and her team are great fun throughout the class and you will get to cook and taste some really tasty yet simple dishes. The setting is stunning and the kitchen and its surroundings are extremely clean!!

Well organized and loads of fun. Great early morning activity. Very informative. From the morning market visit to the rice paddy visit and finally back to the home for a very well organized cooking class. Easy, simple, and delicious. Bonus, they couple that run the activity are super entertaining! Well done!
Fun and delicious!. We had such a great time! Very well organized and entertaining. They accommodate any diet restrictions. Family run. Really the sweetest people! Highly recommended!
Awesome experience. If you are a foodie then I recommend this cooking class! Food was amazing, people lovely and great location

Must do this. If you want find out how the Balinese people cook and live there awesome way of life of family and tradition. This one is for you. We come out of the paon family home Having learnt how to cook 8 popular Balinese dishes in a 5 star kitchen overlooking the ubud jungle. And also leaving with a full stomach and a clear understanding of how the people of bali live. All for the same price as you would pay for lunch in a café. Very interesting and quite a laugh too..Thanks so much.Myles

Amazing food and hands-on experience. Puspa does an amazing job with this program. You start with a trip through the market in Ubud to learn about the ingredients used in traditional cooking. A quick stop at the rice paddies for an explanation of the growing process and different types of rice was interesting as well.Upon arrival at Puspa and Wayan's home, you instantly feel welcome and comfortable. The kitchens are very well thought out to involve everyone in the cooking process from chopping/slicing/blending preparation and through the whole cooking process. The dishes prepared were excellent. The spice level is toned down for those of us that can't handle much but there are chili sauces available for those to spice it up. Puspa also has modifications that can be made to the recipes for diet restrictions and hands out the recipes with recommendations of substitues for what can readily be found in your home country.This was a great experience and one we would definitely do again!

Taste of Bali. We were picked up from Villa, and met up with others at local Ubud market. We got a good explanation of some of the herbs and foods used in Balinese cooking. A quick run to some rice paddies and an explanation on how rice is grown and propogated, then off to cooking. A welcome, a nice cold drink and introductions to the hostess. A really well appointed outdoor but undercover kitchen, extremely clean, with a number of experienced cooks to help us and explain "how to do it" The basic balinese bases were covered, so that you get that authentic flavour. Traditional preparation methods were explored, with western alternatives given. Most of the tedious preparation work was done, such as de seeding, peeling etc. Once cooked, all of the dirty dishes and waste was cleaned away quickly for the next part of the "lesson"About 20 people were in the group, and wer comfortably accommodated. A great meal ensued, that we all cooked.Perhaps just a little rushed, but all in all excellently set up, clean, fresh and fun. Lovely host and hostess, and very happy to share. 350,000 ind rp or around $35 Oz. The meal alone is worth that. Great value for a fun, and feastful day

Mouthwatering good food and perfect organisation. The organisation is like an oiled machine. It was such a perfect day. The group was really nice, the food was mouthwatering good. I don't think I like eating in warungs anymore in Bali after having had this lovely food ;) The chef was really talented, enthusiastic and was open for suggestions. The staff was really helpful and the guide on the market and rice field really informative. We came with a smile and left with a bigger smile (and a full and happy tummy). Location is stunning and the big kitchen is very well equipped.This is great to do with kids, families, groups, on your own or like us as a couple.

Great day to experience Balinese food. This was an excellent way to get up close and personal with some traditional Balinese meals, in both the preparing and tasting of them! Puspa and Wayan were excellent hosts and did the best they could to give us all the greatest opportunity to create some amazing dishes. Wayan first took us to the traditional Ubud market to learn how it all runs and we got to try some common Balinese fruits. Then we were welcomed into their home (compound) where the cooking took place, and the class was very well run by Puspa and her staff. We all had plenty of opportunities to prepare the dishes we would eventually share for lunch, and it was well organised. My partner is gluten and dairy free and Puspa was very accommodating for it, always remembering her and making a very slight variation of each dish that she couldn't normally eat, which was fantastic. She also wasn't feeling very well on the day, and Puspa went out of her way to make sure she was as comfortable as possible while being able to still participate in small parts. It was a very enjoyable day and we were able to meet some great fellow tourists from around the world which made the experience even better. Highly recommended!
Amazing!!. Everything about this experience was absolutely wonderful! The class was well organized and the food we made was delicious! Highly recommend!

Excellent. Attended this cooking class in January and it was fanastic. The staff were very professional and friendly, the kitchen was clean, the variety of food was excellent, and the setting was beautiful. We learnt lots of recipes and love the recipe book we got to take home. Highly recommended.

Fantastic - Great Fun. We knew we would enjoy this - but we didn't realise it would be one of the biggest highlights of our honeymoon. Everyone was so friendly from the moment we were collected until we left. I learned so much about rice and traditional balinese life from the whole family. The food was fabulous also - definitely arrive hungry!

Delicious Experience. We intended to do the morning class with market visit butPain was booked out however we were not disappointed by our evening class. The location is beautiful and we enjoyed our dinner overlooking the valley by sunset. The class was informative and at a good pace. The standards of preparation and hygiene were very high and the ingredients excellent. The meal we are on the terrace Was the best meal we have eaten on our trip. Thankyou Puspah and helpers for sharing your kitchen with us.

A wonderful, memorable experience I would recommend it to all visitors to Bali.. An exciting experience from the time we entered the traditional Bali home to the food and hospitality until a sweet handshake when we left.

Excellent day out in Ubud!. My girlfriends and I went to Paon to learn some Balinese cooking for the day and we came home feeling delighted and refreshed (and full). Like other reviews, we found that the experience was thoroughly enjoyable, from learning about Balinese family home traditions to actually cooking and eating their traditional food. It's certainly something we would never get anywhere else!Puspa was very good in terms of teaching the cooking, she was easy to understand and very entertaining. We didn't get confused at any point and forgot that we were actually starving! She made cooking look easy and enjoyable. The most important aspect of this day for me was how well organised it was, it was extremely clean, very systematic and well planned. We cooked eight dishes (and ate them) in space of approx. 1.5 hours. It was an awesome day and will certainly be back!

Fabulous experience!. Today my family and I went to this cooking class it was amazing! We learnt about the Balinese cooking cultures and got to visit a wonderful place with the most beautiful people! Thank you so much! Will be recommending everyone!

Best thing to do in Ubud. What a wonderful and tasty experience. Puspa and her staff invited us to an exciting day to explore the Balinese cuisine. I was picked up at my hotel and went on a market tour in Ubud before we arrived at Puspas house. She explained how a Balinese family lives and how there houses are set up, very interesting. The we got to learn and cook some delicious food. We also got a tour of the rice fields. It was a wonderful actvity and I would recommend it to everybody.  My friend injured her foot and could not taken part in the day so Puspa send a whole plate of food with me back to the hotel. What a sweet gesture.

Cooking class. Exceptional value for money, the hosts are incredible and very accomodating. Food is sensational and all the staff were so lovely and willing to help. Very clear instructions and thorough education.

Fabulous day!. We attended the cooking class during our stay in Ubud in February......best ever day out! Not only wonderful setting but also just a brilliant well oiled machine as far as how they run the actual cooking session with so many people attending. Extremely clean and impressive teaching methods mixed in with just a whole lot of fun. The family are welcoming and have a lovely communication style with the travellers from all over the world. Absolutely beautiful kitchen open view to rice fields and jungle, great visit to market to start off the day, and a delicious lunch, can't recommend highly enough!

Brilliant day. This was a great way to spend a morning and lunchtime. We were collected from our hotel and went to the market and got an insight to Bali fruits, veg and spices that you couldn't get without a guide. Then a quick look at paddy fields and rice farming before arriving at Puspa and Wayan's traditional home. The location and setting is to die for and they present it in such a welcoming, amusing and friendly way. I've just looked at our photo's and the smiles say it all. We had great fun preping and cooking the dishes, you really don't have to be a foody, the experience is great. Also we met some fellow travellers from all over the world and shared our experiences while cooking and eating which was so easy. You must do this trip (and it is the best value). Special hi to our new friends, the young nursing couple from HK, Andy x
Excellent experience. The nicer bali cooking class. Not spoiling the fun, but highly reccomend it. Scenic cooking experience, clean with frienly staffs. Professional. Food was good, easy to make.

Amazing experience!. Yesterday we had the cooking class and it was amazing! There so nice over there and explain everything very well! We also went to the market,the rice fields and the family explained some things about the hindoeism culture. the woman is so funny; "start your engines" when you had to put on the gas. The most important thing; they explaibed everything very well,we got all the recipies and it tasted delicious!!!

Excellent cooking class, a must when you are in Ubud. I went to Paon Bali for the second time this year. Last time I was there in October 2013 with a friend, now I have taken my boyfriend.Both times it was so lovely there! It's an absolute good experience. If you take the class in the morning they also take you to the local market. For the afternoon class they won't, as there is just souvenirs at the market then and no ingredients for the cooking. They also take you to a rice field and explain you about how they grow rice.Puspa and her family and team are very nice and will welcome you with their big hearts. All is very organised and you will be cooking a few of the local dishes, like a chicken curry, mushroom and vegetable soup, gado gado, fried tempe, satay, tuna in a leaf and so on. And not to forget a freaking good dessert :-)All the time you can have water, coffee and an amazing ginger tea for free. After you cooked the dishes you will obviously eat what you have created together with your group and it is absolutely delicious.At the end, you get all tje recipes and they also tell you what you can use to replace some of the ingredients which you might not be able to buy back home.All I can say is that it is an absolutely good experience also for families. Highly recommended and I would definitely go there again anf again and again!They will pick you up at your hotel if you stay around ubud and of course bring you back there afterwards.

Must do this if in Ubud. My wife and I have started to enjoy going to cooking classes both at home and abroad. So far I would have to rate this class the best! Great cooking facilities with many stoves and big benches for large groups (our group was 16 people and it was excellent). The hosts are lovely. We got a good tour of the markets and rice field with the main highlight set in there very comfortable traditional Bali home (with some nice modern alterations). We should not have eaten breakfast because we are quite a lot of food during the class. All very tasty and clean dishes using traditional cooking methods. You leave with a little recipe pamphlet so you don't have to remember everything. Usually I find a lot of places don't do this one simple thing! Over all, we got a little tired of temples and the shops so this was a fantastic way to spend half a day. I would recommend this to anyone.... You will not be disappointed!

Amazing Experience. After several trips to Bali and never doing a cooking class, this was organised by one of the girls we were holidaying with, what an amazing day this was, we were invited into a traditional balinese home and before you know it we were all participating in an amazing cooking experience. Would highly recommend this to anyone who wishes to have a hands on experience with a truly amazing host.

"Best Day in Bali". A fantastic day, something the whole family enjoyed together, from being collected from our door, a tour of a local market-sampling tropical fruits, visiting a rice paddy with a comprehensive explanation on the growing cycle. It was a true hands on cooking experience and then enjoying the feast 'we' had cooked. Experiencing compound environment and of course washed down with Bingtang!! Will go back thank-you Puspa & Wayan xx

Time well spent followed by a fantastic meal!. We had an opportunity to learn about local produce and spices in the Ubud market before heading to Wayan and Puspa's lovely home to put it all into practice! This is fun for everyone - families, couples, friends etc and one of the best meals you will eat in Bali.

The best cooking class in Bali.. Having been to Bali about 10-12 times, I still try to make it back to Paon to enjoy the cooking class. The family that runs this class are beautiful, kind and hospitable people. They go out of their way to ensure you feel comfortable and that the cooking area is immaculately clean and always prepared for the next dish. The class begins with a tour of the markets, which is always interesting for people who haven't experienced the sights, smells, the hustle and bustle of the market. It then proceeds to a rice field where the process of the rice is explained. Then to the class inside this beautiful family's home. You are welcomed with a refreshing beverage, tea and coffee if you wish and a huge smile and friendly introduction to how a balinese house is run. Then to the kitchen to start the course, prep is divided between the members of the class, it's a fun way to start and get involved. Everyone is made to feel comfortable in this friendly environment. Over the course of the class, you go through several different dishes in which the responsibilities are divided between the members. I was (this year) in a class of around 15, and everybody had a good turn at each and every preparation and cooking activity. Some reviews have complained that the tasks were too simple, however, compared to other balinese cooking classes I know that you are not able to take such a hands on approach. First an entree is made and consumed, a delicious hearty clear soup that fills one's stomach just enough to last through the second bout of cooking. For lunch the class prepares 7-8 dishes in traditional balinese style, mortar and pestling your own curry pastes etc. It's one of the best and most traditional lunches I've had in bali. The food is seriously sensational. After lunch everyone is pretty knackered so the hostess prepares dessert in just a few minutes with a demonstration. Everybody receives a cookbook of the recipes learnt in the class, and a very thankful and warm farewell. I highly recommend this class to anyone who would like an introduction into balinese cuisine and the flavours of this incredible culture. 5/5

Absolute must do in Bali!!!. Paon Bali Cooking Class was an incredible experience in every way. From walking through the local food market and a stop by the edge of a rice field, we were then introduced to the lovely Puspa and Wayan. This great couple welcomed us to their traditional family compound and explained a little of how the Balinese live. After a gorgeous refreshing drink we were led to a special outdoor/indoor kitchen where the magic of Balinese cooking was revealed. The day was full of fun and information and it ended with us eating the delicious meal we had prepared. The flavours are absolutely amazing and I think, with the recipes which we were given, I'm sure I can reproduce the 8 or so various dishes at home.Thank you so so much Puspa and Wayan and the whole Paon Bali team for a truly Balinese experience which I will always remember. Wonderful, totally wonderful!!!Ten stars out of Five!!!

Paon Bali cooking was awesome!. We totally enjoyed this class, starting off at the Ubud markets; learning about the fruit, vegetables, rice growing, spices and utensils used for cooking Balinese cuisine.Puspa and her husband are hilarious and very welcoming. They pick you up from your hotel and take you inside their home and let you loose in their kitchen, helping you whip-up super delicious Balinese fare that caters for everyone (gluten free, vegetarian, allergy aware).After cooking, eating and enjoying a cold beer followed by desert and Balinese coffee - everyone was stoked and very full! It was a perfect morning! We really recommend this cooking class to get an authentic and warm Balinese experience. You get to learn something real about Bali and Ubud with a personal touch.Food is fantastic! Hosts are great!

Incredibly welcoming family!. Puspa and Wayan welcomed us into their home, hearts and culture. What a great way to learn how to cook Balinese recipes, savor them and also get a glimpse into the Balinese way of life in living the sacred on a daily basis.

Paon Bali 5 star Exellent.. We booked this as a fun way to interact with Balinese locals, and learn some cooking skills. We got so much more. Puspa runs a very professional, fun filled kitchen. Clean facilities and a beautiful home. All staff give so much, and we were sad to say goodbye. Our fellow students were great fun and we were all amazed at the dishes we made. A fantastic day, spent with gentle genuine Balinese people. 5 stars, excellent.

Great fun. It was great fun, the owner is very bubbly, great personality - very clean and well coordinated. Learnt a lot, enjoyed the cooking and the eating. Push a is very clear in her instructions, the staff are always wearing gloves and asking us to wash hands. Would highly recommend to anyone interested in learning Indonesian traditional cooking, we did 8 dishes.Worth every penny..Sincerely thanks to the Paon team for a great day.
Great fun. Excellent activities. Wonderful hosts, friendly people, amazing food, all in one easy day. Simply relaxing.

Great day out for everyone - Food Amazing. Highly recommended. I'm a super foodie and this is the best of the best. The whole day is great as you get up and go to the local market where you learn about all of the local food's, coffee and spices. It goes from one extreme from being in the busy colourful markets in the centre of the town to to being in the beautiful countryside in the heart of the Paddy Fields. Our guides were so hospitable and friendly with great English. The main house where you cook is beautiful and you feel like a guest in their home.Last but not least the food is AM -AZ-ING!!! Super healthy, quick, and defiantly worth it. It is something to bring home from the holiday and to conjurer up for friends and family and tell them all about your adventure :)

Beautiful food, beautiful teacher. I attended the evening class with two friends. We had such an incredible time cooking with Puspa, who is the most warm, friendly person. Puspa gave really detailed instructions as we were preparing and then cooking the dishes. She made sure that everyone got involved with each stage of the cooking and she made everyone feel welcome at her family compound. The seven dishes we made tasted amazing! They were also surprisingly easy to make. As Puspa explained each of the ingredients she suggested substitutes for some of the more exotic Indonesian ingredients so that everyone would be able to make the dishes easily at home. After we all enjoyed the meal we cooked together, Puspa generously insisted that we take home the remaining food to enjoy the next day (which we did, immensely).My friend and I are going to recreate the meal we made at the class for friends in Melbourne this weekend, we enjoyed it so much. I will definitely be attending this class again when I return to Ubud in April.

Excellent Class!. Presentation of food, materials and hospitality is outstanding. Very open, inviting and friendly. Amazing Balinese food! Favorite was the Tempe Goreng amd the Mushroom Soup. We asked to learn how to make a sambal, and the they have kindly added the Sambal Matah to the list! Yumm! Most certainly would recommend.

Fantastic day!. Highly recommend doing this!!We were collected from our hotel, taken around the market where we got to taste some local produce, then driven into the hills where we were shown and told about rice paddy fields and how they are managed. The cooking class was next and the venue was fanastic! So much thought has been put into the way it is run and it was a brillant experience. The kitchen is open and looks into a beautiful forested valley. Our host/chef spoke great english and was hilarious!This is a fantastic addition to any trip to Ubud and a really reasonable price too.

Traditional Indonesian cooking with market and rice patty tour. Spent six hours in this wonderful immersion experience of Indonesian cooking. Host and hostess were most gracious in welcoming all participants as well as asking about food allergies and any special dietary restrictions.
Food was prepared by participants, and enjoyed by all. I highly recommend this as a DO NOT MISS experience while in BALI.

It does not get any better then this. My wife and i wanted to pick up some indonesian cooking lessons while in Ubud.We had done our homework beforehand and with the help of trip advisor weeded out the places that did not seem inviting or Professional .We ended up at Paon indonesian cooking class. Everyhting about this attraction is excellent. The family house / temple where the cooking takes place is incredibly sapcious ,clean and beautyful. There is plenty of room and equipment so everybody can perticipate. Everything from the welcome drinks and Made`s historical presantation to Puspa `s cooking lesson is perfect. All is well runed -in ,efficient and enjoyable.If you have a half day to spare, try it out, you will not regret it !!

Very enjoyable experience. Our family of five (2 adults and 3 children) attended an afternoon/evening class and we all left with a great experience, and an enjoyable evening and meal. Our session commenced with a visit to a local rice paddy field to look at the harvesting activity and then we were taken to Puspa and Wayan's family compound. We were greeted with a very friendly smiles and a lovely fresh, cold drink. Puspa and her assistance guided us through the preparation and cooking of 6-7 Balinese dishes over the course of several hours. I was impressed with the facilities and structure of the course. The class size was about 12-13 and allowed us share and change tasks at various times. At the end we sat down to a beautiful meal. This was one of the highlights of of trip to Bali.

Interesting, informative & lots of fun!. First, the market tour was great with introductions and tastings of local fruits as well as descriptions of vegetables, herbs and spices used in Balinese cooking. Then we went to the rice patty fields where we learnt about how rice was produced. And finally we went back to the cooking class. Puspa, the main teach is lovely and lots of fun. She gave us little tips and pointers along the way and even told us what ingredients could be subsituted if we couldn't get it at home. They gave us a little insight into the Balinese culture and how a family in Bali lives. The food we ate once we finished cooking was excellent and any left overs could be taken home with those who wanted it. At the end of the day we went home with full tummys, happy faces, a wealth of knowledge on balinese cooking and the all important recipes under our arms. Recommend to anyone with a little bit of cooking interest. THANK YOU PUSPA!

Fantastic!. Had such a fun morning (definitely book the morning class). Meet in ubud market at 8ish and then shown around the food stalls - veg, fruit and spices. Getting a good explanation of everything. Then taken to the rice paddies where the farming system is explained, then on to puspa's house. She is something else! Very fun and lively. Explains all about ingredients and recipies then gets you cooking. Amongst meeting all the other people in the class, tea/coffee and water provided all day and then you get to eat the delicious food! Highly recommend!

Enjoyable and unique experience!. We attended the morning class on January 2, and loved it! I really enjoyed the format of the class where there is an explanation about the ingredients to be used, and then everyone helps out by preparing the vegetables, tofu, spices and meat before the actual cooking begins. Puspa and her assistants were very helpful throughout the process by answering questions and providing assistance when needed. I really enjoyed the informal nature of the class as well as Puspa's humour and the way that she taught the class. The class was extremely organized and I also liked the spacious layout of the kitchen. All food allergies and other dietary preferences were accommodated and I really appreciated that. The time goes by very quickly when preparing and cooking the food. The speed of the class was good for me, not too rushed and not too leisurely. The end result was delicious! I didn't eat dinner until 9 pm as I was so full! I really appreciate that Puspa was able to accommodate my late request to join this class. Although I was a late arrival I was still able to have a brief tour of the market before the class. My husband also really enjoyed this class. This was definitely one of the highlights of our trip to Bali -- a very unique experience!

Just amazing. The cooking class starts from 8 in the morning. We brought our baby girl with us and they even could provide baby sitting service, though we didn't use it. My wife enjoyed all, and my one and half year old baby girl spent a great day at Paon as well. They even provide a large doll for my daughter when she fell to sleep, very considerable. Everything is delicious, it's a great way to know local people, no wonder it's the highest rated cooking class in bali.

Terrific cooking and cultural experience. Aunty Puspa and her husband run a very polished tour. Starting at Ubud's market with explanations and sampling of local fruit etc, the tour then goes to the rice paddies of Laplapan Village. Next stop is Puspa's family home with explanation of the Balinese family unit and household customs. Finally it is time to cook. The prep tasks are allocated and you get to do most aspects of the prep after a few rotations. Next, "start your engines" is the signal to fire up the burners and begin the preparation of an 8 course feast. Vegetarians are catered for, as are those with food allergies. My daughter, aged 6, was able to participate in all aspects of the tour and enjoyed it thoroughly, as did I.

Fantastic experience, deliscious food!. My wife and I did this class 2 years ago and it was a highlight of that trip, so upon our return to Ubud with my parents I knew it was a must do again. The 4 of us enjoyed the class very much. The recipes were deliscious and easy to follow. Plus, we are vegetarian and we didn't have to omit any dishes from the program, appropriate substitutuons were made.Highly recommend.

Wonderful activity and must to go. We really enjoyed it.. I went with my family mother and a teenager and 10 years old brothers with my 5 years old son and all of us really enjoyed cooking and had lots of fun , the chef was a grate teacher funny and very helpful and patient.. All of the staff was happy and helpful to, we felt like home with our family and we didn't want to finish. We went from 4pm to 8pm and still want to stay more.The food was so delicious and the chef gave us the recipe of every thing.Strongly recommend this tour to any one come to Ubud.

wonderful lesson and lunch. teacher is nice! a smooth lesson to learn how to prepare food and step by strp teaching. easy understanding. it's really a good chance to learn more on cooking! we all had a great lunch afterward.

Amazing experience!!. What an awesome thing to do in Bali! Aunty Puspa and her husband were excellent hosts, they were kind and friendly and extremely welcoming! They were patient and the cooking was manageable even for children. We got to experience traditional balinese cooking, amd best of all have a feast on some of the best food I have ever tasted once it's cooked. It really is an awesome way to spend a day in Bali!

Great intro to balinese cooking. Hosts were very friendly and knowledgeable, both during the market tour and class itself. The family home was very clean and well setup for the class. Staff were well trained and attentive. We were able to make a variety of dishes including sate, gado gado and curry. Good pace even for my dad who never cooks.

Absolutely delicious!!!!. What an amazing class. I've done a couple before, but this has been the best by far!! The guide, Puspa, does an amazing job of explaining everything (also to adapt recipes back in our country). It's also extremely clean- no chance of BB. The food would have to be the best food I've tasted in Bali (and we had a hand in cooking it- yay!) & the experience is so authentic! Do this, you wouldn't want to miss out!

Excellent food, beautiful setting, great friends. The Paon Cooking class was a highlight of my trip to Bali. This is a family owned and operated cooking experience, and you really get a feeling of companionship from all of the instructors/hosts. The food was fantastic, and I learned a great deal from the instructors. I'd never really used a mortar and pestle for food preparation (typically opting for food processors when called for in a recipe). While it certainly provides a workout, I do think it helps marry the flavors better. I certainly won't shy away from it in the future.I also had the good fortune of meeting some really friendly people to cook with. The owners were very friendly, and they essentially required mingling of the guests/students, by moving us from one preparation station to another. This provided a natural opportunity to converse and get to know the other in attendance. It allowed for rich conversation during the dinner.Finally, the setting was gorgeous. I don't have the words to properly describe the beauty. So, just trust that you will enjoy the setting.

Happiness on a Plate. Puspa, the owner, is a happy person and just loves to share her amazing cooking skills and beautiful home with her guests. The cooking class is peppered with good will and much laughter. Everything is well organised and laid out, the ingredients were of an excellent quality and the meals prepared by all were simply delicious.

What a fabulous day !!. This cooking class is educational, delicious and fun. This class starts with a tour of the country side, a stop off at rice fields and an explanation on how the rice fields are owned and worked by the families, and a visit to the local market to shop for ingredients.The hosts are funny welcoming people that make you feel right at home with a nice cold drink to settle you in and a talk about their family and traditions. Easy instructions that result in the most delicious lunch. I would recommend this family business to anyone looking for a great experience.

Very Enjoyable Day. We experienced just a variety of cultural activities from wondering the local food market to the rice fields that cover the Ubud surroundings and of course, the cooking at a beautiful Balinese home. Our hosts were very welcoming and the cooking class went exceptionally smooth. Everyone got a hand in all elements of cooking all the dishes and by the end of the day we made some new friends and our bellies were more than stuffed. I would recommend this to my friends and family. You cannot beat the value offered by Paon Bali Cooking Class.
Best food experience ever!. You can't miss this if you are in Ubud, Bali. Excellent hospitality, many laughs and good Balinese food.

Perfect experience. We had an amazing time at this cooking class - the driver, who was really nice, picked us up at our hotel and took us to check out rice fields before the class. Puspa, the owner, was so warm and welcoming, and the place is gorgeous, with great sunset views of terraced rice fields. Everything was pretty perfect, from the actual food to the organization and timing, which was on point. She made it social, interactive, and gave us a recipe book to take home. Do this while you're in Ubud.

Location,people and food-great combination. What a great way to spend a day in the Bali country side from the local markets,rice fields to the cooking location in the small communities compound there was nothing left out. Our hosts took us into the local markets and showed us the daily shopping that is the life in the country side and we tried lots of local fruits. The rice field info was interesting and made me realise how important rice is to the people who live in these areas.The cooking was the focal of the day and there was nothing that can be critisised except I could have stayed for the evening meal. The photos of the food are exact and if you had smell a vision it would make you want to fly there today. Fantastic people,host and location for a fantastic day away from the bustle and rush of Kuta. Will go back!

A must do. If you are not familiar with Balinese dishes I would suggest you book this for early in your trip as not only do you cook everything but you also get to taste everything so it is a great way of finding out what you like and don't like for the rest of your holiday.We were collected from our accommodation and taken to join a group of about 10 at the market in Ubud first. We were taken around the market and shown all the vegetables, fruit, herbs and spices that are used. We were then taken to the rice paddies by car and the way rice is grown was explained to us, its always very scenic for photos.We were then taken by car to Puspa's home where the classes take place. Puspa has a beautiful home with a huge open air kitchen and dining area at the back looking over the valley. The views are gorgeous. We were given fresh juice drinks firstly and shown the family temples. We then went through to the kitchen and were given aprons and tea and coffee and shown where the fridge was which is stocked with water bottles you can help yourself to. There were about twenty of us on the course and we all got involved in preparing the vegetables, fruit, fish, herbs and spices that were to be used in the 7 courses which we were to cook. It was very well organised and clean. There are banks of gas burners and you work across from your partner, one stirring and cooking, the other adding the ingredients. Everything is then transferred to large bowls and everyone sits down to eat together.It was great fun and really good value, about £18, and from pickup to drop off was about 6 hours. You also come away with all the recipes for the dishes you have made to try out at home. We would highly recommend doing this.

Just brilliant!. I did this course during the week I stayed in Ubud, and it was just great! Market trip, rice fields and insight into Balinese family life before you even start to learn to cook the amazing dishes. Superb facilities and great fun. Really well organised people! Cannot recommend enough.

A must do activity whilst in Bali. Me and my husband did this cooking course whilst we were staying in Ubud and would highly recommend it. Puspa and her husband were very entertaining throughout and were a wealth of information, not just on cooking but on Balinese traditions and lifestyle as well. We were taken around the food market in Ubud to start with (picked up from our hotel), where we were told about the types of fruit, veg, herbs and spices that are used in many Balinese dishes. We were then taken briefly to the rice fields before heading on to their lovely home to carry out the class. There were around 25-30 people in the class and we all assisted in the preparation and helped with cooking certain parts of the meal. I think for the money we paid it was extremely good value as we feel we learnt a lot and we also got to eat the meal afterwards, and it's some of the best food we ate whilst we were in Bali. They also give you the receipes for all the courses that we assisted in preparing. All this set in an amazing location with a beautiful view. You'll be missing out if you don't take part in this activity!

Absolutely fantastic. Worth every cent!! Puspa and Made made us very welcome and the experience of the cooking class was very enjoyable. Extremely clean, efficient and best of all fresh ingredients that had your taste buds in a spin. From the fresh markets to the rice padi demonstration to the kitchen to the table - WOW.We had 7 courses all of which were authentic and amazing. The cooking "classroom" and the environment were second to none and the view beautiful. Everyone pitched in and did something different from chopping to "blending the Balinese way", cutting, dicing, stirring and combining. We actually came away with so much extra knowledge about Indonesian food it was amazing.This cooking class was the best I have done and will definitely come back again and recommend it to anyone who wants to experience "real and authentic" cooking in Ubud.

Great cooking class - a must do in Bali! (Ubud). You will not leave disappointed (or hungry!) after this class. The hosts are great, the food is amazing. fresh ingredients, lots of fun to cook and fun to eat and chat to the other cooks. Definitely fun for friends or a great way to meet friends. I can't way to try the recipes at home!

Perfection. From the service to the hygiene to the indescribable food. It was simply perfect. The tours were informative, interactive and most of all just enjoyable (which for me to say is a very big thing, i get board easy). The staff will go out of there way for you to assure your experience is perfect. The food, words cannot describe the food... I must say the best Balinese food i have tasted! I have already recommended to so many friends and its been 2 hours since the class finished! YOU MUST GO!

Great fun. Really lovely family. The classroom is really well set up and you get to have a try at doing pretty much everything. Food was tasty and fresh. This was probably my favourite activity in my week in Ubud.

Best fun, so interesting!. Such a well organised, fun and informative day! A market tour, then to some rice fields and then to a most charming balinese family home: the hosts and family are such fun and made the day easy and exciting...I cant believe the amount of food we made and prepared. We came away with recipes and skills that I can actually apply! We all shared chopping, stirring, churning, tasting, laughing and soon we were sitting down to a banquet of Balinese foods including sate, curry, urab, fish parcels and more, we learned how to make the basic Bumbu Kuning which is essential to most dishes. Puspa herself is a character full of life and personality. So generous with help yourself to water tea and coffee, so generous in sharing knowledge and spirit. Loved it!

What a nice host 😊. The first thing to say is that staff are extremely nice and welcoming. You learn a bit about rice farming before you start which is informative then you get stuck into some simple cooking. Chopping, blending (balinese blender),marinading, frying etc etc instructed by puspa your host "mmmm, yum". Everyone gets a turn to cook and you make a couple of cracking dishes the tuna in banana leaves and chicken curry are definately going on the menu back home. A really good cooking class, i would recommend this highly. Mark

Cooking made fun. For anyone interested in learning about the food and culture of Bali, I highly recommend this cooking class. We got taken through the Ubud markets, to a rice field, and then to the family house. At each location we were told stories about what we were looking at.The cooking class came next and it was suitable for all skill levels. We were instructed what to do and didn't have to follow a recipe. The food was excellent and the bathrooms were very clean and modern.A very good experience.

wonderful day. We had a wonderful day- visiting the markets, rice fields and making the most amazing lunch in the clean and professional kitchen in the family's compound. Thank you so much for a very memorable experience. Great value for money.

Great cooking class, beautiful location and wonderful hosts. My 12 year old son and I took one of Puspa's Balinese cooking classes this morning at Paon Bali following all the wonderful Tripadvisor reviews. We weren't disappointed. We were picked up at our accommodation and enjoyed the market visit, followed by meeting Puspa and her team at her family compound. The cooking class was very professional, Puspa is a born teacher and highly engaging and we didn't feel crowded at all. The food was delicious, instructions clear and as a vegetarian myself, I was still able to enjoy and experience all the recipes, slightly tweaked to my dietary needs. Puspa and her team were warm and friendly. It was a great experience and I highly recommend it as a must-do activity while you're in Ubud.

Fantastic and enjoyable day!. My hubby and I really enjoyed the class! Loved the talk at the beginning about Bali family life and traditions. My husband loved the relaxed way it was ran and the fact he could have a few beers while cooking. A really great day

Delicious food in stunning location. This cooking class couldn't be any better: perfectly orchestrated, lovely and great instructors and heaps of tasty food - for everyone (i'm vegetarian and can't eat dairy which wasn't an issue at all and i got provided with alternative dishes). Don't miss out on this!

Wonderful joyous time. Being a SE Asian and widely exposed to Asian cooking, spices and methods of cooking. We decided to still do something very Zen and equip ourselves further with Balinese cooking, and it was a fantastic decision.The cooking class is a very enjoyable experience. Everyone of the facilitators pays extra attention to the curiosity of the class. Everyone gets to try everything, from grounding the nuts with a mortar, to seasoning and cooking. This is a half day experience that starts from a morning trip to Ubud market to explain on the ingredients/spices used.I accidentally cut my finger with the knife and immediately they tended to me without me even sounding the slightest 'ouch'. Tell me that is being pampered or what? The food prepared was also not too spicy and would suit everyone's taste for sure. Every facilitator have a great sense of humor and I love that they made sure everyone was comfortable and taken care of. Every utensil is clean, the area of cooking is very comfortable and airy as well complimented witha fantastic padi field as a backdrop. The toilet facility is very clean as well!

Fresh and fabulous. The morning trip to the market was a great start to the day. Our guide was informative and gave us an overview of all the fruits, vegetables and spices we would be using later in the kitchen. We stopped by a rice paddy before arriving at the kitchen. Puspa and her staff were delightful & everything was very well organised. She catered to everyone who had allergies or were vegetarian ect. The food was absolutely delicious and the menu had a good variety. It was great to cook in a relaxed and fun environment and I would highly recommend Aunty Puspa and her group!
Enjoyable. We both enjoyed this experience. Learnt a lot And laughed a lot too.Highly recommend.Delicious Balinese food cooked together and shared.

Brilliant!. I heard this was the best cooking class in Ubud and it's not hard to see why. The host Pupsa was an excellent cook and host! She also had a great sense of humour! Excellent value for money.

Family cooking experience. We enjoyed our cooking class with Paon and her staff. We were able to cook together as there was 8 of us, but we found the classes are way too big and found it very impersonal. We went to another cooking class whilst in Bali and for the same price we had a private class.

CANT BE MISSED!!! 5+ *s. My mother and I did this cooking class last night. We are staying in seminyak and it took us 4 hours to get to Ubud in (new year)traffic- Puspa waited and had a whole room set up for us as we were late and could not apologise enough for the traffic (it couldn't be helped) Our course was not rushed and the staff did not make us feel as if we were unconvincing them- which I'm sure we were a but by being so late.The food was outstanding.. The best I've eaten in Bali.You can't help but feel like part of the family here. All the recipes are easy to follow and there is always someone there to give you a helping hand. All the staff are really friendly and funny. This programme is so cheap you get a MASSIVE feed at the end. Definitely well worth it! I will be back!!
Great fun and experience!. My girfriend and I just finished our cooking class one hour ago.Great experience! Very well organized... A different way of getting to know the local traditions...

Cooking with heart. I got a tripadvisor account just so I could write this review. I have been traveling through Indonesia for 10 days now and this has been one of the top experiences of my trip. This cooking class will give you insight into the hearts and lifestyle of Balinese people. You will be welcomed with open arms and wide smiles into a traditional home, and have the opportunity to interact with the welcoming natives as you explore local ingredients and cooking techniques. We laughed for hours with our instructor and his assistants as we chopped, ground, and cooked the most delicious Indonesian food we have ever had. DO NOT MISS OUT ON THIS EXPERIENCE.

Single best experience of our 2+ week vacation. There were so many wonderful things about this experience that I don't know where to begin. Puspa, Ngyoman, Made, and Wayan are such wonderful teachers, but more importantly wonderful human beings. The recipes and techniques we learned are definitely things I will take home with me. The food we ate was absolutely delicious, and they make the cooking and prep experience so much fun. Many if not all of their ingredients are grown in their own garden just steps away. The kitchen is beautiful and has a lovely view of a rice paddy field where you get to watch the sun set as you cook and eat your delicious dinner. Everybody there was so professional, warm, considerate, and accommodating. Ngyoman, our teacher, had a wonderful attitude, a great sense of humor, and was a joy to be around. Throughout the process, I realized that I was not only learning new cooking skills, but I felt like I was truly making new friends. It was an informative and heartwarming experience that I will never forget. We have been in Indonesia for 2 weeks and this is the first review I have written. Not coincidentally, this is easily the most enjoyable experience we have had on this trip. This is more than just a cooking class, it is a glimpse into authentic Balinese culture. I will never forget this experience and the lovely people at Paon.

Don't miss this. Absolutely one of the high points of our trip to Indonesia. Puspa makes certain everything is perfect. Nyoman was an excellent chef and teacher. Beautiful setting and everything was squeaky clean. We felt like we were dining with family.

Great value, food and experience. Would highly recommended!! Extremely good value for money and very well organised. Everyone is friendly and you really learn about the food as well as how to cook the recipes. A must do!
A great activity!. The place is ultra-clean, the staff wonderful, and the food delicious. Everything is explained carefully and they accomodate for all taste levels.

Fun cooking. This coking school is the BEST, great fun good experience in cooking local food. The best part of the day was eating the results. Pupa was great fun and a fantastic cook. We tried all different foods. "Start you engines", was said a few times which added to the fun of the day. The welcomes were lovely and COLD on a hot...... day.

Delicious. We had such a good time with Paon Bali, the markets were really interesting and we got to try a lot of different fruits. The cooking class was incredibly organised and well laid out, everyone got a chance to try/cook everything and the ingredients were amazingly fresh. The final product(s) were even better. Would definitely recommend it.

Great value . Fun . Educational. Puspa and her husband are so friendly and welcoming and have great humour and knowledge. We cooked 5 courses and then ate òur creations at the end and got the recipies to take home. A different thing to do in Bali in a great location.
Delicious. Can't say anything more than what the previous people wrote. Very well organized, the whole family is helping. Lovely people.

Tasty & fun. I would recommend this cooking class, a lovely learning experience held in Lalapun Village just outside of Ubud. The day starts with a free pick up & a friendly smile. We were then taken to the markets where we were guided throughout with plenty of photo & shopping opportunities. We then drove to the village of our host via quick stop at a rice field where we were given the opportunity to learn about generations of Balinese rice families rice harvesting and farming. At arrival we received a complimentary refreshing iced lime tea. The husband of our host, Wayan, amused us with anecdotes of his family & home. Free bottled water was available throughout the class along with fresh ginger and lemon tea with honey and Bali coffee.The class is led by the lovely and very enthusiastic Puspa who is engaging and amusing as she teaches us about the Balinese style of cooking. The lesson was well supported by friendly staff so you get to do enough of the fun part of cooking & none of the boring stuff despite actively engaging in the preparation and cooking of the food enabling a delightful and educational experience we all enjoyed. You get to eat a course between cooking - yummy soup. Then 4 dishes that you have created collectively which left us all with full stomachs and happy hearts. My teenage daughters, husband & myself all think the classes was our favourite thing to do in Bali & the food amazingly surprisingly delicious. We shared our class with a couple who we really enjoyed meeting and 5 über cool Uni students a mixed bag handled well by the vivascious PuspaThank you Puspa & WayanThank you for returning my sports water bottle to me after I accidently left it at your school. Very kind & thoughtful which reflects your honesty & kindness.

Fun & enjoyable cooking class. We were glad to have chosen Paon Bali cooking class. The morning visit to the market to learn about the various ingredients was very educational. As the cooking school was near to the paddy fields, we also get to learn about the different types of rice grains. The kitchen was clean. The teacher and also the owner was humorous. We had good laughs and a lot of fun while learning to cook the 7 course lunch. Overall, we enjoyed the class and the delicious food we cooked.

Paon is a great cooker and teaches really well. It was an agreable afternoon learning and preparing a great variety of local food. If you go in the morning they will take you to the Market for buying the ingredients, what I understand, will make it even better experience. I just loved it, and have the recipes to try it at home... but of course, being at home I need to be creative to replace some ingredients that I cannot find in Brazil.

Puspa and Wayan nail it. Honestly, this was the best thing myself and my girlfriend did in Ubud, and it's cheaper than most of the other classes which is a bonus. We did the morning class, which included a market tour and explanation of the system used in Bali in the rice paddies. Both of these were great, and the class itself is exceptional. You get involved in all the process of preparation and cooking, and you are given copies of all the recipes to take away. 10/10 would recommend to anyone, not just "foodies".

Balinese cooking class. Me and my partner, we did a cooking class today and we absolutely enjoyed it. Everybody spoke perfect English. The kitchen itself was very clean. The dishes were tasty and unusual. After preparing the meal we ate with a beautiful view of the jungle. Each dish was explained thoroughly and in a fun way. There was a lot of food and we only ate half of what we cooked. We had a ride from and back to the hotel which was very thoughtful. We also got a tour of the house. A must do activity in Bali:)

Amazing experience, amazing host, amazing food. We found this tour off a Google search and were like "hey, why not?". Completely glad we did. My friends and I were shown are the markets, a rice field and most excitingly - food! We helped with the prep, had some good laughs and had a fantastic time. I was nervous to try "new food" I don't usually eat at home but I ate everything! So delicious and Puspa and staff were amazing. I always laughed when they said "start your engines!" to get the gas burners going. A good mixture of preparation, cooking and eating. If you have the time, do it.

A must-do in Ubud. We did the morning class with tour in Ubud market during early morning. The entire 4-5 hours tour are well organized and w are completely satisfied with our experience (including our 3-year old daughter). We had the opportunity to prepare a 7-course lunch under supervision and some help. For our session, there's a total of ~25 people, which is a bit too many and of course lacks some personal touch. But the hosts tried all they can to make our experience a good one. Do not expect coming back knowing how to cook Indonesian food on your own. This is more a culture experience not a real class per se. In my view, a must do in Ubud.

enjoyed this so much. My wife set us up last minute for this class. At first, I was a bit skeptical of going to a cooking class, but I was extremely surprised... The setting is beautiful, the class is fun, and the teachers are wonderful. Auntie Pushpa really makes you laugh and teaches you a lot of the basics. You meet a bunch of great people, and feel immersed for a moment into Balinese culture. Go for it. You will be happy.

Beautiful Puspa. The reviews before mine say it all. Puspa, Wayan and their fabulous staff made our morning interesting and fun. From the spotless cooking areas, fresh ingredients and Puspa making us all laugh, I would do this course again. The course is held in our hosts' home, in a cool, green village just out of Ubud.

VERY ENJOYABLE - DELICIOUS FOOD - GREAT EXPERIENCE. I really love it. The class was very well organized. The pace of tbe class was perfect. Puspa and her cooking team are very friendly. She is a great cook and a great teacher. We learned a lot (7 dishes). We ate the food we cooked and everything was delicious, so flavorful. I am so happy I went to the class. I am capable now to cook a nice Indonesian meal for my family and friends. I highly recommend it to anyone.

AMAZING AND FUN DAY. Lots of research went into our choice before my friend and I did a morning class the Puspa and Wayan, they are both hilarious, warm and very welcoming. The day started with a pickup from our accommodation in Ubud and taken to the traditional market for a tour and description of various fruits, vegetables, spices and utensils, then we drove into the hills to see and learn about rice paddies before arriving at Puspa and Wayans lovely home. I work for a cooking school in Far North Queensland, Australia where the maximum number of places is 8 per class so on arrival I was a bit concerned to find 19 students, however Puspa has planned everything so well and is so professional that the day went really smoothly and we all learnt how to do every dish. I particularly liked the tempe and chicken curry with yellow sauce, and enjoyed learning how to make the sate lilit - there is certainly a knack to twisting them around the skewers. We had an excellent day and highly recommend it. In fact some other friends did the class 2 days after us and loved it too. I took some great ideas away with me for our new kitchen and look forward to enjoying some delicious balinese food.

Great way to enrich yourself and your time in Ubud. Paon Bali is a cooking class and tour in Ubud. It is run by Puspa and her husband Wayan. Puspa primarily does the teaching for the cooking portion while other members of her family will provide you with a tour of the markets and rice paddy fields. Throughout the program, you feel welcomed as a member of their family. You learn how traditional ingredients are procured from the early morning markets and you also will visit the rice paddy fields where you get an explaination of how that business is managed and handed down through the generations. I found the content of the program to be very interesting and well organized.After visiting the markets and rice fields, you are greeted by Puspa herself in their traditional Balinese compound. You learn about the way of life in this traditional setting. All of this builds up your understanding and interest in the preparation of food, which is the heart of this program. The food we prepared was delicious and flavorful.Puspa is a great teacher with a wonderful personality and a good sense of humor. You will instantly feel like a member of the family. The teaching format is well done. You start with learning all the ingredients necessary for the dishes you'll prepare. During preparation, you have the opportunity to participate in all aspects of the cooking. You won't use any kitchen power tools, but instead you'll use the traditional grinders and mixing will be done by hand.Finally, all guests will sit at a communal table and eat the meal that you've all prepared. This was the most rewarding part of the program and the food we made was delicious! Swapping stories with other travelers and having great conversations while eating the amazing food that you've prepared together is sure to leave you with a lasting memory. The dining area overlooks a valley and has a gorgeous view.All in all, I felt it was money well-spent. I had a great experience. Thanks Puspa!

Had a great time!! Excelent!!. Had a great time!! I travel to Bali from Puerto Rico with friends and we wanted to take coocking classes to experience the traditional Balinese food. Wayan was a really great teacher, everybody was very nice. They tolds the instruction and we made the dishes with their help. It was fun.

Great Way to Spend the Day!. My husband and I took this cooking class and were extremely impressed. We started the morning with a pick-up from our AirBnb and went to the local market to learn more about the foods/spices/culture. From there, we went to the rice fields and learned about harvesting rice. Our hosts were amazing! They were extremely friendly, welcoming and informative. We had a special beverage upon arrival and from there it just kept getting better! Lots of delicious food and a great way to spend the day. Highly recommended for couples/families/friends/everyone!

A must do - AMAZING!!!!. My fiancé and I did a cooking class together and it was absolutely fabtastic. From the pick up to the drop off everything was perfect. Lovely English speaking guides to take you through the Ubud market to look at fruits, vegetables and spices. Before heading to the kitchen we had a look at the rice paddies. It was great to have a look where the rice from and learn a little bit about rice farming in Ubud. We arrived at Wayan and his beautiful wife's house to a welcome drink which was delicious. Then we went in to the kitchen and began the cooking lesson. I can not compliment Wayan and his family and the staff enough for how welcome they made us feel. They treated us just like family and made us feel at home. It was great to learn how to make traditional Balinese dishes and then take a recipe book home with us at the end of the day. Overall a fantastic day filled with lots of laughter and yummy food. Would highly recommend to everyone to go and visit Wayan and his family at Paon Bali Cooking classes.

Great food, great day!. Great cooking class in a beautiful traditional Balinese home. We made 7 delicious and easy to follow recipes that I will definitely be trying at home. The host was lovely and hilarious we had a really great day. We also started the day with a tour of the Ubud markets and the rice patty fields which, along with a tour of the home was a great insight to Balinese life. Highly recommend!

Great food - cooked by me!. Educational cooking lesson with traditional methods. The tour of the rice paddy is a nice start. Loved using the Balinese "blender". Had lots of great food as well as desert.

Fun activity. The food we cooked were amazing. We got to visit the market and learnt about the local produce. Then they drove us to a rice field and explained to us how the grains were processed. Then the cooking fun began. Everything was well organized. Even though there was a big group, it wasn't chaotic. Most surprisingly, the food we cooked was super delicious. I would say it's even better than the ones we had in the restaurants, which we didn't really expect. It's a great experience overall.

Must do in Ubud !. Found this cooking class on trip adviser and was not disappointed!We were picked up from our hotel and driven to the nearby local food market where different available foods including fruits and spices were explained. From there we were taken up to the rice fields were harvesting was explained. Next we went to the house - wow was it amazing. The kitchen area was amazingly kit out, clean, lots of space and shade and available tea and coffee. The class itself was well run. She had a number of other helpers who kept us busy with different jobs and made it go seamlessly from one activity to the next. I would highly recommend to any one and everyone. The end result is a buffet of different Indonesian food that you have cooked. Super tasty.

Absolute Must!. Being a Foodie, but having never done a cooking class before, I wasn't quite sure what to expect. Took Hubby and 19 year old daughter as well - and we all thought it was absolutely fabulous. Booking was easy, pickup was on time and everything went smoothly from then! Puspa was gorgeous and the food we made was divine. Being Westerners and worried about 'bali belly' the stand out for me was the huge open-air kitchen that was immaculately clean and food safety was not an issue. There was 20 in our group and we all helped prepare the food, and then cook it and sat down together to eat. My daughter is quite fussy with food, but after this class, and seeing the different ingredients that went into the dishes she was far more adventurous in trying things for the rest of our holiday. Money well spent - an absolute must to do in Ubud.

Would recommend to anyone!. Had such a great time taking part in the Paon Bali cooking class. Puspa, her husband and her staff were very friendly, knowledgable and made it an overall unforgettable experience. We learnt about the produce in the market, the rice paddys and cooked some delicious food!

You will not be disappointed!. This was one of the highlights of my trip to Bali. I couldn't believe how well-organized, fun, and delicious this was, starting with a tour of the Ubud market. I've taken many cooking classes in the U.S. and this was better than any of them. It was also one of the best meals I had while in Bali. Great value for the money as well. Btw, you don't have to want to learn how to cook to have a ton of fun!

Brilliant a must do class!. I went to this class with a group of people from my hostel after being recommended it by another traveller. It was fantastic and we were all very impressed. All the staff are friendly, funny and make you feel very welcome. It was all extremely clean and well prepared. The location is simply beautiful! Thank you for a great morning.

Soooooooo gooood!. Had an amazing day with Puspa and her team. We were picked up from our hostel and taken around the markets and rice fields. Puspa was very welcoming and funny! She has a beautiful home And an incredible view from the tables. Food was easy and delicious! Must do in ubud!!

MUST DO IN BALI!. One of the best things we did in Bali. Auntie Puspa was great!We did the morning course, so we were picked up in our hotel in Ubud at around 845am. You get a detour in the rice fields, with our driver explaining how rice is planted in Bali. Then you are brought to the main cooking "school" which is really a family compound where you will meet Auntie Puspa. After a couple of welcome drinks (lime drink and lemongrass tea) and an introduction to Balinese culture (I will never forget the placenta in the yard and the Balinese MBA!) we were brought to the open area kitchen in the back of the property.The dishes we learned were: Gado-Gado (Blanched vegetables with peanut sauce), Green Been Salad (Urab), Chicken Curry, Chicken Satay, Sour Mushroom and Vegetable Soup, Tempe, plus Sweetened Bananas with coconut sauce for dessert.The students all had to do some light prep work, mainly chopping/slicing vegetables — the men assigned to initially work on the “Bali Blender”, but we all rotated so everyone got to experience it. The class was well coordinated and gave easy instructions! You get to enjoy the fruits of your labor, such delicious meal! We were dropped off at our hotel afterwards! MUST DO IN BALI if you are a foodie and like to fiddle your way in the kitchen! Tip: The dishes used in the course are wonderful. Ask Auntie Puspa if you are interested in buying a few ceramic items to bring back home (She will tell you where you can buy them without having to lose a limb or donate a kidney - LOL). Bali is known for its beautiful ceramics but priced ridiculously high for foreigners. I didn’t go to the famous “J” ceramic dealer - I went to where she recommended. I bought a gorgeous teapot with matching 4 cups/saucers for a reasonable price. Hand carried all the way back to California by a cranky but willing hubby — what a trooper, haha! Drinking my lemongrass and ginger tea from it right now!
Two thumbs up!. Had an amazing time learning about Balinese culture and gastronomy with Puspa. It was fun, enjoyable and thoroughly delicious - highly recommended for anyone of any age.

Clean & Organized Cooking Class with a Warm & Welcoming Instructor. Very clean, streamlined, organized and hygienic. Puspa is an impressive lady, having built this business from scratch, through her experience in the hotel industry. She is humorous, warm, friendly and always with a smile on her face.Open air cooking - you're under shelter (in case it starts raining) but the view from the cooking area is quite scenic. As the dishes are prepared, we have our turn to chop things, or grind things with the "Balinese blender" ;) A lot of simple finishing touches make our dishes look amazing - the way the food we cooked is presented look great in photos (and taste delicious as well).Wonderful lunch. I would not hesitate to recommend this experience - it was worth the 1.5 hour drive here from our hotel.

Great teaching kitchen with delicious recipes. The Paon cooking class starts with a pick up at your hotel then a tour of the local market. The class can be large or small but everyone gets to participate in all of the cooking. They are attentive to allergies and vegetarian needs. The ingredients and recipes were all fantastic. We made many dishes and then sat and enjoyed them before being driven back to our hotels. A must do while in Ubud.

Best place to eat...and you made it yourself. Super friendly, knowledgeable, and good representative of Balinese culture. I would come here as soon as you get into town because you:#1 meet new people who you can swap vacation tips and experiences with#2 Pupsa is super nice, and gets you in the mood for vacation!Pros:-Super friendly (my boyfriend got sick the nice before, and she gladly accepted our cancellation the morning of, and packed him a box lunch for when he got better-You get to go to the market, and a good cultural experience-VERY clean, they take cleanliness very seriously.-Lots of Bintain and water to wash the delicious meal down-Cook book to take home to share these meals with your family and friends back home withCons:-Absolutely none. Any negative reviews are from people who take vacation to seriously. -My boyfriend was sick and couldn't experience this with me, but pro, we want to go back!Suggestion for class:-Make the food a little spicier...but that might be catered to the western crowd...

Fun time. Me and my brother had a fun time cooking some indonesian (balinese) food here. They showed us around the local market, rice fields and instructed us how to prepare and cook the food. In total very good service. The lady in charge even hooked us up with a good taxi driver afterwards (normally transport from and back to Ubud is included, but we were going north to Pemuteran)!

Excellent cooking class. I really enjoy taking a local cooking class when I travel, and this was up there in terms of my cooking class experiences. Puspa (the owner) was very responsive over email, and it was so easy to book. The market tour was great--just enough--as was the rice paddy tour. Our driver and guide, Made, was great, and answered all of our questions including those on Balinese culture. The class itself is run so smoothly--everyone gets a try and making the various dishes (I think we did 7) and the great staff keeps things moving along smoothly. Puspa explains everything very well and cares very much that you are learning, and can apply things back home (ex. if you don't have X ingredient, you can use Y). The set up of the outdoor kitchen is great--it's brand new and so clean. My boyfriend and I really enjoyed this experience and would highly recommend this class to those wanting to get an authentic experience. The price is also very reasonable (just over $30 US pp)

Delicious, clean and beautiful!. Highly recommend this cooking class. The family is very welcoming and helpful to people of all cooking abilities. We made several dishes, all delicious!I was impressed with the overall perfect planning. Everything was so smooth. I look forward to making some of these dishes when I get home!

Highly recommend. This class was fun, educational and very satisfying at the end! We loved spending our afternoon/ evening at this welcoming home with a great bunch of other travellers preparing an incredible 8 course dinner. The hosts were fantastic and we loved every minute. Thanks again!!!!
Feed me! . A fun activity, with lots of variety - the visit to the market was really interesting and the different prep techniques kept everyone involved.

Enjoyable Day at the Paon Cooking Class. Really enjoyed our day at Paon Cooking Class. Our hostess was SO entertaining and did an excellent job guiding us through the cooking. This is a don't miss while in Bali !!!

My daughters had a blast! highly recommended!. I took my two daughters (13 and 8 years old) for an afternoon cooking class last Thursday in Ubud. Puspa and her husband Wayan gave us great memories to take back home!Our hosts were really kind, spoke really good English, and they obviously love children. Puspa has a lovely home and she welcome us like dear friends or relatives. The kitchen and all facilities are extremely clean, we had a great dinner after cooking, every thing was delicious ...and we even made new friends!"Auntie" Puspa is the best teacher, and if we go back to Bali, I promised my daughters we will go back for an other class (you can let them know when you book it's you second class, so they make sure you try other recipes). We left with little booklets of the recipes we cooked to cook it back at home. Thank's Puspa and Wayan for a wonderful time!

Good fun with amazing food!. We really enjoyed our cooking class, walking round the markets seeing the rice fields then back to their beautiful house to cook. This was a big group activity, chopping, stirring and frying, the food we produced was amazing - a really good fun morning, I would definitely recommend this trip.
Great way to spend half the day.. Loved how they showcased to us the morning traditional market and the rice fields. Their home is really beautiful too.

Very polished experience. 5 dishes to cook and ear. This cooking school is very polished. From the instructions to the 5 dishes we prepared and cooked, the whole evening moved along at a nice pace. The level of instruction was just right and the meals were very enjoyable.

the most fun and enjoyable experience in Ubud. I booked at 6pm the day before, and the driver come to pick us up on time. He took us to Ubud local market to introduce Balinese vegetable and fruit, then he took us to the rice filed to told us the process to grow rice in Bali. The real cooking class start around 10:30am...OMG, Pupsma is so funny and nice. She asked anyone have any food allergy before the class, so I got special prepared food for my lunch as I got allergy to prawn. It was the most fun and enjoyable experience in Bali, we really like it. The food is pretty local and nice. Will highly recommend if you go to Ubud. Must do it.

A delightful host, great people and food and so much else of interest. We thoroughly enjoyed our day at the Paon Bali Cooking class even though none of us are passionate about cooking and food. Four of our family went - two of us in our fifties and our two young adults (18 and 20). Apart from the actual cooking instruction and the meal in Wayan and Puspa's beautiful traditional Balinese home and garden there were many other highlights for us. The people. Wayan is one of the most charming people I have ever met - he had everyone 'eating out of the palm of his hand' within a very short space of time. We really liked Puspa - she's a great organiser - and Nyoman (who also works as a driver and drove us north later on our trip) who took us to the market in the morning. Extra insights. Going to the market, learning about the food there, visiting Wayan's family rice field, learning about rice growing and the family rice paddy succession issues, learning about traditional Balinese extended family life - this was all so informative and interesting.
