And to top it all, we felt really honoured to have shared a little of Wayan and Puspa's home life - this enriched the whole cooking school experience - much better for us than if it had been somewhere more commercial.

Best Cookery Experience!! . The format and the way it is conducted speak volumes of the professionalism and the quality of what we learnt from the class. From the Ubud market tour to a short appreciation of Balinese home culture to concise preparation and individual participation in the cooking experience guarantees a full understanding of the local cuisine. The hostess was funny and helpful in making sure everyone is comfortable and following the class well. This is probably the best class I have attended in several countries. And it's absolutely value for $. Much recommended!!

Here's one I prepared earlier.... This cooking class was recommended by our tour operator & made for a very enjoyable evening. We prepared about 8 traditional Balinese dishes with the assistance of Puspa & her team. The class was very well organised with the main ingredients already laid out available (wish my meals at home could be this organised). As this was organised as a private tour we were allocated our own private table to consume our concoctions, however another couple who joined us during the preparation stages were also on their own table, so we all asked to be put together which Puspa happy arranged & we all had a lovely evening.

Fun and easy. I booked after sending an email enquiry. The response was fast and organised easily. We were collected from our villa and had a lovely day. I've done several other cooking courses around the world...but Pupsma is funny and thoroughly prepared for all nationalities. She gave options for being able to cook at home using our mod cons. I would absolutely recommend this to anyone.

bali experience. we have been to Bali too many times to mention but this was the first time we did a cooking class, wow what have we been missing. The day started at the UBUD markets and all the spices etc explained to us by a very knowledgable lady, from there we had a talk and demonstration on how rice is planted and grown, from there to Puspa and Wayan family home. Puspa really makes you feel like a family member all the ingredients are there waiting fir you, there were 26 of us this day, the chopping, slicing, pounding of all the spices etc are shown to you and then its your turn, Puspa explains everything so well that when it is your turn to follow she has made it easy. You are helped every step of the way by Puspa and her helpers and when all cooked we wer asked to sit banquet style and enjoy the fruits of our labor, a wonderful day, if you haven't already done this its a must on your next trip to this wonderful island.

Brilliant cooking school. Great value cultural learning experience. Wonderfully entertaining Puspa and her lovely husband Wayan welcome you into their home, and the show begins. A hands on cooking class which runs like clockwork, assisted by Puspa's very able staff. You learn to prepare eight traditional Balinese dishes, and then sit down to consume your handiwork. A fabulous day! I have since prepared the dishes at my home, the recipes are accurate, although nothing can beat eating in the open air restaurant in the rice fields.

Fantastic - must do for ubud. Hey; I am a coeliac so require a gluten free food and they couldn't have been more helpful!!! We had a fantastic day going to local markets, visiting rice paddy fields, being collected and visiting the hosts house. you work together in preparing 7 or 8 dishes which was fantastic. I met some fab people and genuinely believe that it was brilliant value for money we were well looked after with water and tea throughout the day too! Thanks ever so much

factual, fun and filling. Experiential fun cooking experience. Discovered interesting things about local village life as well as how to cook fantastic food. Clean well presented. A large group well managaged. Very responsive to food allergies and vegeterians. No worries about getting there or home. Finished with a fantastic feast to share with new friends.

Delicious food, delightful people, great experience. I cannot speak highly enough about the Paon-Bali cooking school. It is extremely well organised so that everyone in a group is able to learn the techniques and participate in cooking an extensive range of dishes which you then enjoy. You also have the opportunity to take a trip to the market and drive through the rice paddies to a small village where Puspa and Wayang welcome you to their home and tell you about their lives and Balinese culture. This is the 2nd time I have been to one of their classes. When I visited 3 or 4 years ago it was a tiny operation with Puspa and Wayan doing all the tour and cooking. It was the highlight of my holiday. Now the groups are larger and they have a small team of drivers and cooking staff to assist, but have managed to expand their house to create a lovely large open air kitchen with multiple burners to ensure everyone's participation and created a comfortable lunch area with a view of rice paddies. Everything was spotless and they catered for people with different dietary needs, creating alternative versions of dishes to ensure the safety and tastes of everyone. A memorable experience that will stay with you long after you leave (with recipes to try at home).

Whatever you do, don't miss out on this!. We booked this online while we were in Bali, Puspa quickly responded to our emails and arranged a driver to collect us from Sanur.We were picked up, taken to a local market in Ubud where we got to taste lovely fruits and learn about ingredients. Then a quick stop at padi fields to learn about the process of growing rice and is importance.Then we were driven to the home of Wayan and Puspa where we were greeted with a beautiful ice cold drink which we drank while Wayan explained how Balinese homes were laid out out and how people are named.Then we met the wonderful Puspa! As a group we prepared lunch with everyone getting to do plenty of stages. It was really fun and educational and then as a bonus you get to sit down to eat everything with all the lovely new friends you've made. Spotlessy clean, fun, educational - can't recommend it highly enough!

Awesome Experience!. Simply awesome! The cooking class is very well organised. Beside learning how to cook nice traditional balinese food through Puspa, I also got to learn about Balinese culture at her lovely home. Great host and would definitely recommend it to all my friends
Good organization. Everything is well organized, fun teaching, tidy place, good value , it was a good experience , recommend it

Extraordinary experience!!. This class was such an amazing experience! We loved how warm and welcoming the family was. Everything was so incredibly organized and informative... in addition to being the best food we had in Bali!! This is exactly the experience we were looking for. They were even able to meet our gluten-free needs without any issues. They give you all of the recipes of the dishes you made so you can try them again at home. I would recommend this class to anyone looking for a taste of the local Balinese cuisine, and a chance to spend time with an inviting family for an all-around amazing cultural experience!!

Outstanding cooking class. This cooking class was the highlight of my recent trip to Indonesia. I went mainly because my daughter wanted to do it but I couldn't have enjoyed it more. It was organised so well from the minute we were collected from our hotel until we were dropped back off in the afternoon. Everyone was so friendly and helpful. The cooking was fun and easy. Wayan and Puspa were such great hosts and so funny. I enjoyed Wayans explanation of village life. Puspa was fantastic at explaining the techniques. I am looking forward to trying some of them myself especially the Tempe. That was delicious. I would recommend this class to anyone even people who don't usually cook.

Absolutely Fantastic!!. A delightful surprise! We had a wonderful time. Learnt HEAPS and laughed till we cried! Very impressed with all facets of the adventure - from the market tour, to the rice paddy visit, and finally to the cooking centre where we participated in ALL stages of the cooking experience. We produced EIGHT delicious dishes, and then enjoyed a happy meal together. Wayan and Puspa are wonderful hosts, and the other members of their team were happy to help and share their information. We also received printed copies of the recipes and hints on how to replicate the dishes back home (ie, alternative ingredients we could use). Just brilliant! Even hubbie enjoyed it, and he NEVER cooks at all!

best food in all of Bali and best cooking teacher too!. Pushpa is an incredible personality -- she and her team graciously welcomed us into her home and we proceeded to create a multi course meal, which she modified slightly for me (i'm vegetarian). the whole day was perfectly timed, seamless, organized and informative. It was the perfect taste of Balinese culture, I learned a ton and enjoyed every moment. Pushpa, I'm ready for your cooking show!!
Awesome experience!. I would recommend a class to anyone - the instructors are fun and easy to understand. The food is fantastic.r

Yum yum and fun!. What a fun day! a walk around the markets, visit the rice fields, then an explanation about a Bali home and their homelife. Then the cooking! Great fun, very simply, and simply delicious. Everyone gets involved preparing the food, then everyone cooks. The banquet at the end of the day was a treat. Good humour, great people. If you're into cooking, this is a 'must do' when you visit Ubud. Even if you're not a cook, its great fun and a taste of Bali.

Great experience. Paon Cooking class was a wonderful experience. For the price of 350000 Rupiah ($35) We were picked up from our hotel and taken to Ubud markets where we learnt about Balinese fruit, veggies and spices. Then off to the rice fields to learn about the families and their rice paddies. We were then driven to the owners home where we were given a welcome drink and Wayan told us about his family and Balinese traditions. Then off to the kitchens we went to learn to cook Gado Gado, Sate chicken, curry chicken, Balinese salads and a few more. We finished off with sharing the meal amongst the class of about 20. Would recommend for avid cooks and honeymooning couples.
Great day. Great day with friendly and knowledgable staff - free water and tea and coffee all day - cheap beer. Food good

Puspa is always amazing - just do it!. This was my 3rd time at Puspa and Wayan's cooking school. I bring all of my friends there to share the experience.
The food is delicious, the hosts are fun, happy, engaging, informative, professional and very welcoming.
It's a fabulous experience.
Thank you Puspa - my sister from another mister xxx

So much more than a cooking class. My friend and I were collected from our hotel by a driver we arranged through the Paon Bali website and taken to the Ubud Market to learn about the indgredients and cooking tools we were about to use. We were allowed to make purchaces during the tour if we wanted to and we were fed samples of delicious fresh fruits. All the materials for the traditional Hindu offerings to the gods were in the market and our tour guide explained their significance in Hindu culture. After the market, we had a talk about the cultivation of rice, and many more bits of information about Balinese culture, while overlooking a gorgeous rice paddy. We were welcomed into a spacious and artful traditional home where our hosts conducted the cooking course with a iced lime "welcome drink" to sip while we were educated on the importance of community and good communication in a Balinese village. The cooking class was well orchestrated, clean and entertaining from beginning to end. We prepared 8 dishes and a dessert. There was complementary water, herbal tea and Bali coffee available throughout the class. We had an amazing experience getting to prepare the food using traditional tools and cooking methods. This was an extremley memorable and worthwile thing to do in Bali!

Do yourself a favour and book this class!. What a wonderful day we had with this very warm, funny and welcoming family from pickup to drop off . Tour of the food market, to the rice paddy, learning a little of the culture on the way, then to the family home for the start of our amazing food experience. A very clean, organised, well run class in outdoor kitchen with amazing views. We learnt about all the ingredients, how to prepare and then cooked some amazing dishes, finally shared with other travellers in the class. We cooked and ate the best meal I had in my time in Ubud. I would highly recommend Paon to all. just to note I do not like cooking at all. all the other reviews say it all, excellent!

Fantastic Experience. Fantastic experience that encapsulates all that goes into preparing a Balinese feast. The day started with a visit to the local market where we learnt about the ingredients and tools that make up a Balinese kitchen. We were then driven to the family home with a quick stop along the way at at a rice paddy to learn the about the varieties of rice, it’s cultivation and it’s importance in the Balinese diet.Once we arrived at the family home we were offered a refreshing drink and given a warm greeting by our hosts. With a quick explanation of the importance of family in Balinese culture, we where whisked away to the large kitchen to begin our cooking lesson.We were part of a large group but the kitchen had more than enough room for all off us to listen, watch and practice. The entire experience in the kitchen was laid out concisely giving us ample opportunity to have a hands on experience. The best part was enjoying all the wonderful food we helped create while enjoying a refreshing beer and sharing stories with other travellers.What truly made this a fantastic experience were our gracious hosts who kept us entertained through out. It is also worth noting that their English was excellent.

Best meal in Bali...and we all cooked it. We were picked up at the hotel in Sanur by a driver..Nyoman (means third born) and he was soooo funny. My husband and Nyoman kept me in hysterics all the way to Ubud so off to a great start. The market was the first stop and this was definitely a new experience! We then went to the rice fields to understand a little about how the families plant and distribute the rice and then onto Puspa and Warung's (sp) home where we all received a welcome cold drink.Inside and Puspa and her team were waiting for us. To cut this short I have to say that this cooking class is a winner. Very well run and everyone gets in and does their bit. And as others have said....definitely the best meal we ate over our 16 day visit to Bali. I also have to mention that gloves are worn when preparing the food and everything is hygenic and the place is spotless. Put it on your 'must do' list.

A must in Ubud. they picked us up at our hotel which was nice. We received a tour of the local open food market and then a rice paddy that has been in their family for three generations. When we arrived we received not one but two welcome drinks. The host was lively and had a great sense of humor, we learned to make lots of sauces that are the bases for many local dishes. The food was delicious and plentiful, i was stuffed. If your in Ubud this is the number one activity not the monkey forest, seriously.
Awesome class. People was so warm, everything running like a clock yet you feel relax and the Balinese spirit.Without a question the best experience in Bali.

Wow! Great Class. No matter how you slice it and dice it (and we did lots of that), this is a terrific experience that easily tops the list for fun and learning in a great environment. The morning class starts with a very informative visit to the market with show and tell comments on local products. A visit to a rice field follows -- again, learned a lot. The cooking class is at Puspa and Wayan's house with a clean, inviting environment. Demonstrations of preparation techniques follow and include hands-on practice with instructions by a very helpful staff. Cooking takes place at individual burner stations set up around the room. Finally it's time to sit down to a fantastic meal prepared by you and your new friends. Refreshing drinks are available throughout. You leave class with an English recipe book. The staff speaks good English. Transportation is provided to central Ubud. A fantastic experience and great value for $35 USd.

All in all a splendid spread. Me and my partner had a great experience with Paon Bali Cooking Class. We were picked up from one hotel and then dropped off to our next hotel as we were moving about which was very convenient and they handled our luggage too!The course was very informative as well as great fun! all the staff were great and we met some really awesome travelers too so the whole experience was just amazing!We started on the paddy fields and an explanation and history of the places and how its all done which was cool, we were showed around her place and given a drink before starting. The kitchen / dining are boasts extraordinary views and the whole place has this great feeling of tranquility which was just so pleasant and all the things we were shown how to prepare and cook were just delicious!! you then can take the recipes of all the things you've got to make and i was extremely happy as i had always wanted to know properly how to make my own Satay Sauce from scratch and now i do!!I defiantly recommend this to anyone visiting, Top experience!

Paon Bali Cooking Class - Fantastic Day!. We attended the Paon Bali Cooking class late Oct 2014. We had a fantastic day! Highly recommend it. We were picked up on time, taken to the Ubud market to explore and taste the fruits grown in Bali. Then onto the rice paddy fields where the guide was very informative then onto the cooking class. What can I say. We were greeted with a most welcoming smile and cool lemon drink. The venue is beautiful. Very clean! We enjoyed ourselves so much that the time just went by. We got to eat all the dishes that we created and were given the recipe of each dish to take home. Our host Wayan was absolutely lovely. "Start your engines" she would say when we had to ignite the flame to cook on. Most enjoyable. And at the end of the day we were driven back to our Villa's front door. Treat yourselves if you enjoy cooking.

Five star. My G/f and I did the cooking class yesterday. We were pick up at the desinated time. Pick up a couple of people on the way to market. Interesting! Then off to the rice paddy fields and the growing and harvesting of rice was explained. Greeted at school with a beautiful cold lime juice. The area was very clean as were the rest rooms. Hand washing insisted on at all time! Cooking facilities were very good and our own personnel assistant was lovely. We ate what was cooked and it all was delicious! Recipes given out and then transported back to our hotel. A great way to spend a day and very reasonably priced. You could purchase a beer if you wanted to add to your meal

Recommendable cooking!. During our third visit to Bali we took a cooking class at Paon in Ubud. We have attended another cooking class in Ubud before and was ready for more challenges in Balinese cooking. And our expectations were met completely. We had good guidance at the market and a warm welcome at home, where Puspa met us with her pleasant smile. What really impressed us was the well organised setup and involvement of each and every attendant. Along with the excellent ingredients and the super guidance we had a day we will never forget. Thanks to all at Paon!

Fantastic class. Went to the Paon cooking class today. Fantastic and informative tour of the markets and rice paddy fields before starting the cooking school. What a great set up the school has. Very clean and orgainised. Learned heaps, enjoyed the company and ate the most terrific food. What more can you ask for. Highly recommend this class

Best cooking class ever. As we drove up to the beautiful Ubud, we were very warmly greeted by Aunty Buspa to her gorgeous home. Everything was freshly prepared, ready to go. We learned 7 dishes and the teaching was very hands on, which helped us understand how all the ingredients work together. I loved the cooks and Buspa's sense of humour which kept us giggling all night long. We ate our dinner overlooking the beautiful jungle, which is the back of their home and cooking school. I will highly recommend this to all of my friends and family. Do yourself a favour and experience a Paon Bali cooking class :)

Great food, fun experience. We had an excellent time at this cooking class. Puspa is a lot of fun and we really liked the chance to participate but also share in the cooking responsibilities with the other participants. The food is wonderful and makes for a nice evening. The stop at the rice fields to learn about the rice growing process was also interesting. Definitely a fun opportunity if you have the time while in Ubud. Authentic food and you get to enjoy the process as much as the taste!
Great food, great people. Loved it! Thanks so much for an excellent day. Great people (wayan was a great driver) and the cooking school was perfect. Even for me, I don't cook. Thanks.

Yellow sauce is the best thing ever!!!. Was looking for a good cooking class as an introduction to Indonesian cooking whilst in Bali for 6 days and stumbled across Paon Bali Cooking Class on TripAdvisor and sounded pretty good from other reviews I'd spotted. Well... after attending on Tuesday afternoon I can officially say that this was one of best (if not THE best) cooking class that I have ever had the luxury to be part of. Puspa & her husband Wayan were so friendly and made us feel very welcome as a guest in their home. The cooking class was above & beyond anything that we could have asked for. Firstly, We were taken to the local market in Ubud in which we got a very detailed tour from Wayan about all the different produce that you can get which is locally grown and the more general (imported) varieties also. Tasting things like Snake fruit (nom nom) and watching whilst rouge chickens run around randomly between stalls. After this, Wayan then drove us to his families rice paddies and explained to us the importance of rice produce in the region, the history and production process from seed to harvesting the rice once ready (very interesting).(And all this before the cooking class even begins!! Amazing)Finally, once we arrive at the lovely home we are greeted by Puspa who has a very happy and big smile on her face giving us a warm (and hilarious) welcome to her home and cooking class. With a delicious lime drink as a welcome treat - yum yum!The cooking class itself is exceptional with clear instructions, guidance and an amazing array of ingredients to use. We all get assigned tasks to do and take it in turns to use the large 'Bali Processor'. With around 7/8 difference dishes to make the class goes by very quickly but is a good pace and keeps you on your toes. Such good fun! And the food at the end is probably the best I have ever tasted. We also met some lovely people on the course with us from Oz and by the end of the evening we were all chatting like long lost friends over a Bintang or 2. This was on of the best experiences that I had whilst I stayed in Ubud and if I ever return I would be very happy to attend this class again. Highly recommend!!Thanks again Puspa & Wayan - we had a lovely time!!

Fantastic Introduction To The Secrets Of Authentic Balinese Cooking. Back in August I visited Bali for 10 days. On Day 6 I had the absolute pleasure of joining the morning class (there is also an afternoon class) at Wayan and Puspa's 'Paon Bali Cooking Class'. One of the drivers from Paon, a lovely young man called Jack I believe, came to my hotel to pick me up and take me to the Ubud Market, where the other class participants congregated and we met Jack our host. We spent a fair bit of time exploring the market and trying some of the many exotic fruits and sweets. Jack explained many things that were being sold at the market stalls and frequently updated us on how much longer it would be before we departed for his house, where the cooking class is actually held.Back in the mini van once again, our next stop was one of the rice padis near Jack and Puspa's village of Laplapan. Interesting facts were shared about the various types of rice grown, how it is grown for domestic consumption only (not for int'l export) and how important it is in the Bali diet.Next stop was Wayan and Puspa's compound. We were welcomed with a refreshing drink and introduced to Puspa for the first time. What a lovely couple they make!!! Warm, friendly, outgoing and extremely hospitable. They have a great sense of humour and share their family story with people they have only just met!!! I see another reviewer has mentioned the story about their MBA daughter...as in Made By Accident!!!I just want to assure you that every precaution is taken to ensure hygiene levels throughout the whole process are taken very seriously. So if you are worried about 'Bali Belly', you need have no concerns. You are in the best of hands with Wayan and Puspa.W & P use top notch suppliers for all their fresh food supplies. The Ubud Market is too risky to buy any supplies for the tourists and so no chances are taken.The cookery class was very well organized. Participants are each given tasks to prepare ingredients to be used...so it is very hands on. Aprons and hand towels are provided. Hand washing with soap is done religiously :)Nine separate dishes are prepared by everyone. By the time everything is cooked it is a veritable feast...with little in the way of leftovers.I loved how the Paon drivers took on the task of cooking the Minced Chicken Grilled on bamboo sticks over a charcoal BBQ. As a reward for their efforts, they too were included in the feast.Attentive staff clear plates throughout and chilled Bintang beer is available for a nominal price.By the time we had finished lunch, the staff had washed all the cooking untensils, plates, glasses and cutlery. So no clearing up has to be done!!It was an exciting activity and you learn a new skill...well worth the effort. For a cost of Rp 350,000 per person, it is phenomenal value for money. And you meet some new friends from other places.I would highly recommend you try Paon Bali Cooking Class. Wayan and Puspa put their heart and soul into making it a memorable time.

Amazing food and great fun!. We booked this based on trip advisor and it did not disappoint! My friend and I have done several cooking classes in SE Asia but this one here was definitely the best we've done yet. Loved that she said what you can substitute things for if you don't have some of the exotic ingredients back home. Very organised, clean as professional as well as delicious food at the end. Highly recommend.

Satay and yellow curry sauce.. Perfectly organised half day cooking class with compulsory participation results in smorgasbord of dishes you know you will be able to recreate offshore. Also handy to realise which ingredients are in common Balinese dishes, demystifying a unique cuisine, but enhancing understanding and appreciation.
Loved it. Best cooking class! Loved it. Food was amazing and enjoyed the trip to the rice paddi. Value for money for only au$35

amazing cooking experience. I just can't say enough good things about this place. It was such a great day. We were a group of twenty and Puspa and Wayan made us feel so welcome. Honestly they could go on tour they were so funny and so professional - what a team you are! After the market visit and the rice field we arrived at Laplapan and were warmly greeted. I had two tired young children with me from a late night before and in typical Indonesian style Puspa, Wayan and their staff took them under their wing and kept them entertained. They also made sure they were included in the cooking activities which they loved. The cooking instructions were clear and the staff made sure no-one was left standing with nothing to do. We had a young man in our group who had never cooked before and he had a great time. We ate the food that we cooked and it tasted amazing! This was a real highlight on our trip. My husband and I have been travelling to Indonesia for the last couple of decades and Paon was a real stand out for us. I would definitely do this again in Bali and I would DEFINiTELY recommend this to anyone.

Super fun and delicious. We had an amazing time at our Paon Bali cooking class. We really appreciated the quick tour of the rice paddies and lesson on rice production. The cooking menu was long and I was initially worried that we wouldn't have time to make it all, but the course is really well organized and coordinated and we were sitting down to dinner before we knew it. We each had equal opportunity to try each task and the dinner we produced was so delicious!The hosts were warm and funny. I highly recommend this activity!

Great introduction to the Balinese kitchen. From the morning trip to the madkets through to the class itself and the meal of several dishes you have helped prepare, this would have to be the best half-day introduction to Balinese cuisine I could imagine. The hosts are very friendly and highly skilled. The course is run with much enthusiasm and efficiency. You will learn authentic techniques and key recipes in a beautiful setting. Unreserved recommendation for keen foodies like me.

Lovely People and Great Food. The title say's it all, my wife and I are foodies and we were really looking forward to learning more about Balinese cooking. The trip included market visit, and rice paddy fields which helped complete the overall experience. The people were lovely and the class is held in their home, which is beautiful. Overall couldn't fault it.
Supervised Cooking Clas. Fabulous, brilliant, great healthy locally sourced foods, you get to cook and eat, all in a beautiful location.

So good we'll be going back.. The trip to the local market gave you an excellent overview of both the ingredients and the equipment used by the Balinese when cooking. The information about the growing of the rice gave us an appreciation of how important rice is to each family.Puspa explained the program for cooking and how we'd all get to take part in the different activities. She is a delghtful woman who knows her stuff. Her staff were excellent and we all enjoyed the products of our cooking. We had a lovely group of people and Wayan organised a birthday cake for the 2 birthdays being celebrated. Thank you to Puspa, Wayan and their great team, we'll be back.

A Window into a Balinese Stomach. A one hour journey from Nusa Dua, thanks for the new super highway. We arrived at Ubud, and joined our group - the 8.30am is popular, but worth it. Broken up into smaller groups you get a first hand education in the Ubud market. Ample time to sample, shop and shoot photos, it was a great start to the day. An unexpected surprise was an education in the local rice paddy and how rice is produced and how important a staple it is in the Balinese culture.Puspa kept saying we would become a family in one day, and she wasn't misleading. There was a myriad of travellers from all edges of the globe, sharing a common activity. There was eightteen of us in total; and the cooking was broken up into stations. First we learnt about the items we would cook. Second was the yellow and peanut sauce, staples in the cuisine for seasoning. Course-by-course we got through cooking the menu, and enjoying it - with a cool Bintang. I would not miss out on this experience. I would also take the time to travel to Ubud to do it. I realise there are other cooking classes around but it was awesome! More value for money (seeing as I can be a frugal travellers at times).The host and hostess were funny, and well spoken - it was such a delight that I would do it again, I would show off and take friends to it, just to continue to brag about how awesome it was.

An Ubud "Must Do"!!. A great way to spend a few hours. Pushpa and her husband really extend a warm Balinese welcome to their home, village and culture. Didn't meet their MBA (Made By Accident) daughter but learned how to prepare some basic Balinese dishes with a great bunch of people I had never met before after first visiting the Ubud markets and learning about growing and harvesting rice. For $NZD40 this was simply a great foodie experience punctuated by delicious food. Will repeat the experience next time we are here just to enjoy the best Balinese food!! Geoff Nairn, NZ.

A must do activity. I did this class last year and loved it so much I took 2 friends with me to repeat the experience. It is not just the cooking class itself but the whole range of activities that make it such a worthwhile experience. The market tour highlights the range of foods relevant to Balinese life. The visit to the rice fields informs about this very staple ingredient - we take for granted just how we get this food item back at home! The tour then arrives back at Wayan and Puspa's beautiful home and explanations follow about the structure of Balinese families and how they live. All of this happens with great hilarity as Wayan and Puspa's personalities shine through. We had such fun and my friend's agree it was the highlight of their week in Bali.

Great food and lovely people!. The lady and her husband are so friendly and welcoming, they brought us to the market, to the rice fields and then they welcomed us into their home which has the cookery school. The food was soooo good! We ate so much! And you get all the recipes to bring home. She gives you alternative options for ingredients, knowing that we're from all over the world and when we get home we may not have access to exotic ingredients from Bali.

Delicious food, but you don't do much yourseld. The food prepared was the best we had in Indonesia. Unfortunately, this wasn't because of our cooking skilss. The course is rather an introduction to Indonesian food and some ingredienta, you don't learn much cooking yourself.

Laughs all round. This was one of the funnest afternoons I had on my health and fitness retreat with balance for life! Puspa and wayan are incredibly funny! And the good we made was so good. Definately a must in ubud!

Without Doubt Best Cooking Class (for value & fun). This is the third time I have attended a cooking class in Ubud/Bali and without doubt, this is the best. A comedy show (of all things!) starts the day by way of an intro by Wayan. Then "Aunty" Puspa takes the reins. We had a large group but it was no problem, a totally seamless, flowing, absolutely enjoyable way to spend our day. I recommend it as a bonding session for a large group, in fact. Appetiser made then eat, main course, eat, then fortunately after our hard work Puspa cooks us dessert. Then eat of course...what else?? Also complimentary water, tea and Bali coffee. The rest rooms are very clean, and there is a wonderful outlook over the eating area. If you are looking to do a cooking class, you seriously must choose this one!! They are passionate about what they do. Terrific value at AUS$35. Thanks to everyone at Paon Cooking Class!!

The best day ever!!! Amazing couple!. thank you so much Puspa and Wayan! I had the best day ever and probably the highlight of my bali trip! I enjoyed it so much ! The welcome, the tour of the market and rice fields, Wayans friendly ways and sweetness was so humbling. The cooking class was so phenomenal and I understood everything and cannot wait to hold a dinner party for my loved ones back home with the recipes you gave us! Again, thank you from the bottom of my heart! Much love and light ..from Alessia from Dubai! Xxxxx if you want to go to a cooking class in Bali ..THiS is the one to go to!

value for money. if my family or friend visit Bali, I will strongly recommend them to Paon Bali Cooking Class, Me and my girl friends never get bored from the begining till end, enjoyed the every moments. You will experience what the Balinese food is and eat the delicious Balinese food that you have cooked from the fresh ingredients. I still miss those food that I had eaten in the cooking class.

Super fun class, highlight of my trip!. I can only say great things about this cooking class! The market tour and rice paddies tour is just long enough where it's informative but not boring. The class itself is wonderful, Puspa is hilarious and the food we made was simple enough to replicate at home but interesting enough where you actually learn new things. She also does a great job at recommending you alternatives during the class, so you can replicate this at home if you can't find exactly the same ingredients, which I thought was incredibly helpful.You make 8 dishes, including 1 dessert - which is more than plenty of food! The class cooks all the recipes together, then her staff puts plates it all so the food can be eaten buffet style. There ends up being more than enough so you can easily get a 2nd or 3rd helping (so go to the class hungry!) At the end she also gives you typed up copies of all the recipes you make in the class and encourages you to email her if you have any questions when you get home.I would HIGHLY recommend this class to anyone going to Ubud/Bali - it was definitely a highlight of my entire trip!

Thank you Puspa. WOW what a day we had!!! It was amazing Thank you Puspa and staff for a day of cooking that was just Fantastic.We had a great tour of the local markets, then we went to the Family Home and the facilities were amazing everything was of the highest standard, friendly help full staff, wonderful views. We would have gladly gone back again to do all over again.Puspa keep that red scooter safe for my ride when I return!!!And thank you for giving us a day we will remember.

Bali at its finest. If you can only do one thing while in Bali, this should be it. An informative walk though the market and a chance to taste a few fruits not available to us, as well as see the vegetables send spices. Then off to the rice field to see first hand the rice plants and growing process. We were then welcomed into their home where we chopped, diced, and became human food processors ( the balaniese work out). The class was well run, the facilities clean and the final product was delicious! A wonderful experience that was affordable priced. I highly recommend. No experience required, just have fun and enjoy the food.

Fun, enriching and yummie cooking lesson!. During our honeymoon, we've enjoyed following a Balinese cooking class in Ubud in Laplapan with a very friendly family. We were transferred from our hotel to the morning market where the driver (and head of the family) guided us through the small streets.Next stop were the family's rice fields in Laplapan before visiting their home. Besides an amazing view, we enjoyed listening to his explanation on growing and harvesting rice.Afterwards, we were welcomed in his house by his wife (the 'queen'!) with a refreshing lime juice.The cooking lesson was given by his wife and was perfectly organised and perfectly timed.The explanation about the ingredients and cooking methods were very clear als well.Most importantly, the food was delicious, the family was superfriendly and it was fun!!And remember: a happy wife is a happy life! ;)

Flawless. I can't speak too highly of this cookery class from the pick up to the drop off was efficient yet done with panache. Lucked out with the other guests who were a really lovely bunch. The food was wonderful- challenging enough to be interesting to an experienced cook like myself but easy enough to replicate back home with a couple of ingredient adjustments. Thanks Puspa and staff for a great afternoon!
Brilliant cooking class. My friend and I attended a class at Paon this week Puspa and Wayan were lovely, the food was amazing, and I learnt a lot! I would highly reccomend it to anyone!

Fun and delicious. A group of us did the afternoon cooking class which was great fun. The tour started in a rice paddy which some explanation about how it is grown and the varieties. We then went to the house where the cooking class is run and had a refreshing lime drink while other groups were arriving. The whole thing was efficiently run and very professional. Most things were partially prepared and we helped with chopping and preparing. We then were split into pairs to cook the different dishes which then were combined together into one big pot.The spread at the end was fantastic and there was plenty to go around without much being wasted. Taking away the recipes at the end is great, I will certainly be cooking some of the recipes back at home.

Excellent Value. From start to finish I thoroughly enjoyed this course and the food was amazing. The friendly and inviting owner is obviously passionate and takes pride in her business. The course itself is extremely well organised, is very hands on and the friendly staff are always there to help. I would highly recommend this cooking course to anyone.

Great fun with lovely people.. We went for the cookery class as a couple which meant that we had a very personal experience. We prepared several dishes which we the ate. All the staff were very friendly and we thoroughly enjoyed the experience. I would recommend this as a great way to see a local family and learn about Balinese food.

Great warm experience. We went to Paon's cooking class one day in September and had a great time, would fully recommend it to anyone visiting the island. Clear instructions and good company, great fresh food. Bliss

A must do whilst in Bali!. We were so pleased we booked with Paon Bali! The package included a tour of the local Balinese market, which enabled you to understand the ingredients you were going to be using later as well as interesting insight into the day to day life of a Balinese family, for example the vast amounts of rice that is needed per day to feed one family! Our hosts were incredibly charming and welcoming and made the cooking lesson a truly great experience - not to mention the food was delicious!

One of the best things I did in Bali. We all love food, we all love a fun time, most of us like some education, we all enjoy being entertained - this cooking class does it all.I recommend the morning class, starts at the markets, taught me all my confidence to barter and walk through it again by myself, also got to try fruits I had not had before and get owned by an old lady at the herb stall with my novice attempts at bartering. Went out to rice paddies for a discussion on the history of rice and then spent the rest of the day at the superb house of Auntie Puspa. The entire day is worth it for this lady alone - she is bloody hysterical and so knowledgeable and friendly and made you so welcome as did all the staff, there was lots of laughs and fun to be had.They asked me to meet them at The Palace as my place was not easily accessible - told it was close to me - it was not - and just so you know - The Palace is not really a Palace, it is not signposted - it is a roof and "amphitheatre" in centre of town - got sooooo lost and arrived ten minutes late frantic I would miss it - they were there patiently waiting. The food was outstanding, and the ease of making it and cleanliness used was remarkable. And the best thing, meeting so many people of different nationalities. Most of the people there were in couples and I was a solo students - absolutely no worries at all - they also organised different things for veggos and while no one had allergies she did ask at the beginning so would definitely make alternates for those people - I will never forget Auntie's "blender" and will giggle every time I use it :)

Fantastic with my food allergies. We did the afternoon class. We had about 14 People at our lesson and we were split into 2 smaller groups. Our group had 7 so it was a nice sized group. I have an allergy to shell fish and with a lot of what we were making contained shrimp paste I was a little worried. Our teacher was aware and very helpful I had my own special prep area and all the food I cooked was kept seperate from everyone else's. I was amazed with how aware and help full they were. We had lots of laughs and cooked some yummy food.

Great value & fun. We attended this class on 9 Sept 2014 on the recommendation of a friend & we weren't disappointed. Puspa helped us create a traditional Balinese meal that tasted as good as it looked! She was an engaging & entertaining host! We made soup for entree, the traditional yellow sauce which is a base for many main meals & a number of mains & finished up being shown a simple but delicious dessert. Great value for money!

What a great experience!. I would highly recommend this cooking class to anyone. The day started with a pickup at our hotel by Made who then took us on a tour of the Ubud markets learning about and tasting local produce. This was very informative and gave us a good insight into the ingredients we would be using in our cooking class. This was followed by a tour of the rice fields and an explanation of the rice farming techniques in Bali. We then went on to the home of Aunty Puspa (the owner) to start our cooking class. We were welcomed by a cold drink and a brief outline of the day. We had a light morning tea and then into the cooking. There was a large group of people who were all involved in the preparation and cooking of our beautiful 3 course lunch but all of the steps were explained very well and was very hands on. Even our 16 year old son really enjoyed this class and I am hopeful now he might cook a meal or two for the family. I cannot recommend this class enough to anybody that would like an insight into the food and culture of Bali. Great food, great staff and met some lovely people on the day! Also thanks to Nyoman for transporting us back to Legian and passing on further insights into the Balinese culture and lifestyle.

Great hands on experience. My partner and I did the afternoon class, starting at 4pm. We were picked up from our hotel and felt very welcome and comfortable from the beginning. The chef explained all the ingredients and the menu really clearly. Everyone had the opportunity to prepare a part of each dish and it was lots of fun seeing a group of people standing at their own chopping board busy working to prepare an amazing meal. After all the prep was done, we each had a cooking station (in pairs) and we cooked a bit of each dish, which we then combined. When all the cooking was done, we all sat at the dining tables and watched the sunset, as the staff put all the food out on the serving table.The 7 different dishes we made were delicious and there was plenty for us to go back for seconds. I highly recommend this cooking class, as it is very well run and lots of fun.

Awesome cooking class. Booked a class on the last minute and good thing they still have an availability. This activity is highly recommended when in Bali. Auntie Puspa (the owner) was very much enthusiastic while explaining things to us. She is a good teacher. Learned Balinese cooking techniques and preparations.

Wonderful fun cooking experience at Paon Bali Cooking Class. I get to travel to Europe with artists and when I travel I love to take a cooking class and how to cook at least one and if I am lucky two local dishes when I get back home. Max the owner of the Villa we were staying at (Infinity Villa) recommended Paon Bali Cooking Class and we booked it. We were collected at our villa promptly at 8:30 and driven to Ibud for a guided tour of the Market. We were told about the many offerings that are made daily and how they are created, the spices and local fruits used in the cooking, the type of knives that are used daily, meat and fish counters. Then we were driven to the village and shows the different stages of harvesting the rice and why here are so many geese or were they ducks in the rice fields .... Next time to get to the home of Puspa and her husband Wayan... it was lovely. we were greeted with Ginger & Lemon grass lemon drink, the layout of the home was explained to us, and what is the structure in a typical Balinese household... Both Puspa and Wayan have great sense of homour and so our day in their kitchen began. We were escorted into the open kitchen/dining area. the fresh ingredients were all laid out on the counter (all covered) each ingredient was explained and how we would use it. The class was large and each one of us got a task... chopping, mashing, blending and frying. I got to do a bit of every step ... I loved it and my husband whom has never cooked a meal in his life really enjoyed himself... Maybe I will get that romantic meal after all. The food was delicious, the attendees at the class were wonderful and from all over the world. the whole experience was fantastic and I as I said earlier I do attend quite a few cooking classes but this was one of the best organized kitchen/cooking experiences that I have had in a long time. I would return to Paon Bali cooking class again if I ever get back to Ubud. So much fun.

Class of 20 : Great time but not a cooking lesson. Large group of people (20) so we learnt nothing and it felt like being in a industrial process with small tasks to do and not cooking. It is a well oiled mechanism that works smoothly. From a cooking perspective it was not at all worth the money, but from other reviews I guess that it must be different when there are less people.That said, it was a great opportunity to meet other lovely people during the class and the owners are great guys. They are very entertaining and we learnt a lot about Balinese home arrangements and family, daily life in Bali, etc.So all in all, disappointed for the cooking but we had a GREAT time.

Awesome cooking class. Really enjoyed myself at this cooking class.. Aunty Puspa was very kind and a good teacher as well.. It was interesting to learn the Balinese style of cooking.. A very hands on class.. Highly recommended activity if u go to Ubud..

Fantastic cooking class!. We booked this a couple of days before through their website and had excellent communication about the booking and the transfers. The cooking class itself was fantastic - great value and highly enthusiastic staff! Also, the food was great - probably the best Indonesian fod that we tasted in Bali. Would definitely recommend and do again.

Fantastic experience. We started in the markets where Wayan talked about the foods available and we tasted lots of fruits, he is a real character with his funny stories and jokes, he had everyone laughing! Then on the way to his home we stopped at the rice fields and he told us about how it's done in Bali, his beautiful house was only two minutes away so it didn't take long to get there where a refreshing drink awaited us. I am not going to spoil it by telling you what you will be cooking just make sure you bring an empty tummy with you, 3 courses, 7 dishes we were stuffed all day, it was great fun and I would recommend it to anyone.Thank you for welcoming us into your home!

What a blast!. I've enrolled in a number of cooking classes around the globe and Paon was unique. After visiting the market, we stopped by the rice paddy fields to learn how the rice is brought from paddy to table. Then we were welcomed into Puspa and Wayan's home, learning about the design of a traditional Balinese home. Our group was large but the number of students didn't degrade the quality. We chopped, stirred, and sauteed 7 different delicious meals, which were enjoyed on their terrace overlooking the beautiful green backdrop. The hotel pickup and dropoff was much appreciated as well. The cost for a 6 hour event was extremely fair. All the success to Puspa and Wayan!

Great evening out. Wow what a jam packed experience. We saw rice paddies, had a talk on village life, visited their traditional Balinese house, as well as, cooking and eating 6 yummy dishes. Great fun - lovely location. Really good value.

Can't keep us away. I bring my PT clients to Bali for Fitness Adventures and the first stop is always the Paon Bali Cooking Class. It sets us up for a great week of healthy eating and feeling great. From the market visit to the rice paddies and then into their home, Puspa and Wayan go to great lengths to make you feel welcome and enjoy the experience. We have now been four times and the food was delicious every time, and we will be back again twice in 2015. A great school, very hands on and a lot of fun. A must do on your trip to Bali!

Amazing Experience. This cooking class was so much fun and an absolutely memorable experience. The warm welcome in Puspa's house was followed by a introduction of all the different ingredients (a lot of ginger, chili and garlic were involved :) the cooking itself was so interesting and we produced seven local balinese dishes in total. They all tasted delicious. We will surely try and cook some of them at home (you will get the recipes as a handout). We can really recommend this place!

Great course!. We did this cooking course this afternoon and were not disappointed. A lovely fun relaxed atmosphere. You get talked through the ingredients, prepare them then cook them in couples. The good is all then pooled so everyone's we're mixed. Very good at accommodating dietary requirements and gave us some history and info about family life in Bali. Would highly recommend. Our class size was 10 which I would say is perfect, some of the negative comments on here have been when the class size is 20 or so, therefore my tip would be check when booking how big the class is and make sure you don't book on a very busy day!
Don't miss out. Definitely worth it, you learn a lot about the culture and rice fields and they teach you how to cook the best dish, of satay chicken. Amazing you have to do it!!

A must do in Ubud!. The cooking class was a highlight of our trip to Bali. It was perfect from the hotel pick up to the tour of the markets and the rice fields to the class and the fabulous lunch. Puspa and Wayan were great presenters and every detail was attended to from participant dietary preferences to cleanliness and safety to catering for differing levels of culinary ability. It was thoroughly enjoyable because of both the teaching style of the staff as well as the diverse international group of attendees. The morning was well paced, involved everyone, had plenty of variety and was interspersed with fun activities such as using the large mortar and pestle. The atmosphere was very relaxed and encouraging to novices and experienced chefs alike. We have come back inspired and will be hosting a Balinese dinner for friends based on Puspa's recipes. We look forward to seeing Puspa on her own TV show!

Good experience . I suggest to everyone who is visiting Bali to attend a cooking class, it is very interesting to discover the local dishes. The session was divided in 3 parts, visit to the market with an explanation of vegetables, fruits and spices, visit to rice crops and finally cooking class in the beautiful house of the organizers. Good humour and good organization from the couple holding the class. We really had spent some good hours.

Authentic and AWESOME!!. If your looking for authentic Balinese food and entertaining hosts, then this is the class for you! Puspa, Wayan and their helpers are just fantastic! They share their home and culture with you, with such a warm and welcoming feeling to put you at ease and get you cooking delicious food! Totally worth it!

Definitely a highlight. Was my first cooking school and I enjoyed it. Definitely go for the morning class, as you get a more holistic insight into the culture, with a local market visit, trip to the rice paddies and then time in the kitchen. The hosts, Paspa and Wayan are full of personality and help to make the day special. The groups can be large, there were 20 people in ours, but they handle this really well, taking turns at cooking or assisting. In fact, I felt it was a benefit as when playing 'assistant', you get to chat with the other assistants, rather than focusing on the cooking (and not letting things burn!).

Not to be missed. A beautiful insight into the local cuisine and culture. Puspa and Wayan bring you into their home and also tell you about local rice growing. The food was delicious and I have already been re-enacting the recipes in my home city. Try to do the morning session to get the market tour.
absolutely great!. Puspa is great! :) amazing cooking lesson with a wonderful view from her house... great food! a must if you are in Ubud :)

Best Cooking Class/tour in Bali!!. Aunty Puspa and her husband made us feel so welcome! This is by far the best cooking class in Bali. Well worth the travel time if coming from Kuta or surrounds! So informative & very hands on, they make sure you get to experience each step in making the balinese food, the traditional way! Such a lovely day! Thank you Puspa & everyone else involved! We will be back!

Paon cooking Class. Excellent. We were picked up from our hotel in Legian and travelled up to Ubud. Arrived at the food markets where we met up with other travellers. Our guide then took us through explaining about all the local foods and spices we would be using during our cooking.Then off to the Rice Fields for explanation of different rices grown. Next stop to the family home to begin our classes.The whole experience was magnificent. We learned 7 different dishes which was then served buffet style. All up the group was around 20. Sounds a lot but great chatting to everyone from all over the world.Would definitely recommend this class to anyone visiting Bali. A great day!

Fun time. Great food. We had a morning to kill before transit to Kuta so we did a cooking school. My brother found this on trip advisor and the reviews did the course justice. Had a great time, very well run and clean. The tuition was excellent. We finished and were back in Ubud by 2.30. We'll worth the money. And the the food was great.
Wonderful experience. Well worth the AUD 55. Including transport & 5 hours spent with lovely people. Very fresh food, clean, hands on. Highly recommend. CM

Great food excellent instruction. Well organized. Well worth it. We learned so much about the Hindu culture and traditional cooking. Several of the students were there as repeat customers. They were very accommodating and wanted our feed back. I would definitely re -commend it.

Best meal all trip. Picked up from Ubud hotel 3:30, drive to meet others in mid rice fields where chefs husband gave us chat about life in the paddys, rice cropping family ownership which was interesting.Then to the family home in Laplapan village where Puspa talked about family life in their world, the home structure before taking us to the 'kitchen'. First thing, an apron, t towell and wash hands, very reassuring !Table spread with all ingredients for our lesson and 8 course banquet. Discussion on all ingredients. We were then set to prep all for the various dishes, everyone was rotated to ensure we all had an opportunity to get hands on with each step. After each hands on food we were directed to wash hands, very reassuring !After prep, table set with little butane burners so each pair of cooks could work on each dish.In our group we had couple from Australia ( us ), Germany, Sweden, England and a bloke from Port Melbourne.Cooking the peanut sauce, each group had a portion from the prep then added the extra bits and so learned the process, then all pans combined. Same for other processes.Final banquet was best meal we had in Bali, dropped back to Hotel with recipes and we have cooked same at home successfully.This was the best activity we did in Bali, when we return we will do it again

Hassle-Free Cooking Class. The class was very systematic and we didn't really get our hands dirty since there were a couple of assistants who will do the rest of the cooking. It's like you will just be given the knowledge on the ingredients and how to cook it, and you will leave all the hard and messy parts to the cooks there. It was so much fun! Not only did we meet people but you will thoroughly learn the Balinese culture and most especially the food.

No. 1 highlight of Bali trip. The whole morning shared with Puspa, her husband and staff was totally a unique experience. The food amazing, the humour infectious and the courtesy outstanding. I rely on Trip Advisor for travel and I could not recommend a better whole experience. Five star. Unreal value for money. The best in Bali and beautiful Ubud.

Bali highlight. This was the best outing we have had in bali. The staff were great all with personality. We enjoyed the market as it made for some excellent photos. The cooking was great fun and although we had a little help from the staff the feast we made was one of the best meals we have had here. 5 stars.

Brilliant Balinese Cookery Class (BBCC). This is a great way to embrace the local culture and be part of it. We were collected from our hotel by the very likeable and knowledgeable Madi who first took us to the rice fields where he explained in detail whilst keeping us all engaged ( Ages 13/ 17/ 21 plus us ) the rice farming and harvesting process and then drove us to the class. We were made welcome from the moment we arrived and under our celebrity like characterful hostess Auntie Puspa and her charming colleague Njormann we were taken on a seven course cookery course adventure learning all the tricks of the trade. The attention to detail was faultless and the drinks and food plentiful and delicious - If you want to live the cooking experience then this is the only place!

Thank You Auntie Puspa. Great morning learning about Balinese life and culture. Food was delicious. Easy pickup from the hotel. The morning starts at the wet market with Puspas husband who is a funny character. Then to their home for an intro to Balinese home culture followed by about three hours of cooking, conversation and a delicious lunch of 13 courses.

Excellent!!. This is a MUST-DO when you visit Bali! My boyfriend I were picked up at our homestay right on time. We were worried they would be able to find the place because it was a bit hidden but sure enough, they were there to take us to see their rice fields. I actually live in Japan in the middle of rice fields so I wasn't expecting to see anything new there, but the view was incredible and the driver told us a lot interesting facts about rice fields in Ubud. Once we got to the home, Wayan (the man of the house) told greeted us with welcome drinks and a great story about how him and his wife got together. He also explained how traditional Balinese houses are built. Wayan has such a great smile and he is very happy.Right after his story, we went to the back to meet Puspa- his wife and kitchen master. She also has a great smile and humor. We enjoyed every second of the cooking class. I would give details of the actual cooking class, but I don't want to ruin the fun for the readers! Go and enjoy, you won't regret it.

Wonderful Balinese cooking experience. We started off by visiting the markets where we could see the different types of fruit,veg,herbs and spices which bali has to offer. Wayan, our guide was great and explained in detail what different ingredients are used for when cooking a balinese dish. The markets were a great experience and very smelly! After this we visited the rice fields which was also interesting and informative. We then arrived at Puspa's house and were welcomed with a lemon ice drink and Puspa and her husband gave us a tour of their wonderful home. The cooking then began and we all had a different job to do, chopping, grinding etc. The group was a nice size and a great way to interact with others and get to know people from all over the world. We cooked nine dishes including the famous yellow sauce which appears in most balinese dishes and a delicious desert. We split into two groups and sat to eat our feast whilst enjoying the lush jungle view behind us. At the end we were also given all the recipes for todays dishes. Overall this was an amazing experience and since I have arrived home I have stayed in touch with Puspa for more recipes! I will be cooking my own balinese feast this weekend so my family and friends can enjoy the same experience. Thanks Puspa, Wayan and all the staff at Peon Bali! We cant wait to come back and cook some more with you!!xxx

Wonderful experience. My husband and I took the cooking class with Aunty Puspa. What a great day! From the tour through the markets with Wayan and the other drivers, through the rice fields and a stop there to learn about them, then on to Puspa and Wayan's family compound. They were wonderful hosts who made it a fantastic experience (along with their other helpers). Unlike some of the other classes, this one is hands on so you really feel you've been a part of it. Fun, relaxing and a great way to meet other travellers and listen to their experiences. For my money, this is a must!

Unreal afternoon. Def would recommend this tour went there with my partner and was joined up with another couple.family so friendly and nice.explain everything in great deal and have great patients.def worth the 350.000rup.you make everything from scratch and get to sit down after to enjoy.10/10

Amazing cooking class. We took part in the afternoon cooking class and it was just awesome. At first we gathered next to a rice field and were told everything about growing rice which was very interesting. I guess if you take part in the morning class you will actually go to the market as promised on their website but this class might be more crowded.We then went to their house and were greated warmly by Puspa, a lovely lady! The cooking was great fun. It was always clear what to do and the staff were very friendly and helpful. To be honest, I thought the food contained way too much ginger and lemon grass but apart from that it was good. And as everyone else seemed to love it this is just my personal taste. Anyway, i can totally recommend this cooking class to everyone.

Very nice expérience try it. We booking paon cooking class and really had a good Time .The booking via internet was perfectWe have a free pick up at the hotel : on Time perfect We Visited the market : very interesting we tasted fruits, discovered vegetables and spices. Good moment Them we went to Rice fields for a short explanation on the Rice culture . Interesting.Them we were welcomed to Puspa home very nice and we have started cooking around 10:30.We cookies mans typical balinese dishes like chicken yellow curry , gado gado - tuna in banana leaf - peanuts sauce , chicken sate and si on..,The chief Puspa and her team are very nice and helpful.The place is clean and nice Do not hesitate try it

Fantastic experience. Highly recommend.. Can't recommend this cooking class experience enough. You get a ton for your money, a full day from 830 am to 2 pm filled with market visits, rice field, and wonderful food. The staff is friendly, facilities are very clean, everyone is knowledgable and there ate very good English skills from all the staff. Perfect experience. So authentic.

Good fun and tasty food. We booked this through Audley Travel for four of us, and we had a great afternoon preparing and cooking food. We made about 8 dishes and all were very tasty. The hosts are great and it was good to see inside a traditional Balinese house. We've even used the recipes since we've been home, after finding a local Asian supermarket. Would highly recommend it.

Fun night, not for someone who actually wants to learn about the cooking style.. We went with a party of 6. It was a really fun night, the atmosphere of the family was fun and lighthearted. All of the food was really tasty. Like other reviewers, I agree in that this was not really a cooking class as it was more of a socialization. There were 12 of us in total and therefore were never sure what we were chopping was for what dish and how the dishes were actually made. Many flavors and sauces were repeated in many dishes. We were treated like fresh students that came with no cooking skills. Despite all of this we had an extremely fun night. Tip: I recommend not booking through a travel agent as we paid an extra $10USD each (pamphlet said $35USD with free pickup in Ubud and we paid $45USD each).

Had to take turns of actual cooking. Class size was big too.. After an excellent cooking class on Chang Mai, Thailand, I was looking forward to my second cooking class. How different they were.1) the class sizero was 25!! My last class was 10. 2) As a result, we had to be in pairs to do the cooking. My last school, we all had our own cooking station. 3) The first part of the cooking class is simply chopping ingredients. Not actually learning anything.4) we got photo copies of recipes. My last school gave us an actual cookbook, which won't get ruined in my bag as I travel. I know the cooking class a business, but this class was not very personable.

Cooking as a formality. Paon is a lovely lady who built an exceptional business. She is smart, well spoken, and yet she can not avoid to leave the "students" with the uncomfortable feeling of having learned too little. Recipes are done quickly and just partially, as they are substantially completed by the hyper efficient team that surrounds Paon. Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed the time I spent there, especially because it was my first encounter with the Balinese food. Everything was new for me. Full of great smells and interesting notions around rice and its harvesting techniques. But from a cooking class I expect to learn how to cook one or two recipes, go in depth, see every angle and detail of what I am doing so to get it right and repeat it once back home. Paon instead provides you with a generous amount of recipes, around 8, all to be done in 1h. Despite the ingredients are quite repetitive, I left confused about what I cooked and sure that I could not repeat the performance if alone at home.

Great night . My partner and I went to the evening class and thoroughly enjoyed it. Our hosts were welcoming, knowledgable and helpful and the cooking itself was a really fun experience. Everything flows smoothly and the way one dish transitioned to another was so quick it seemed like magic. If you turned around to look at something, when you turned back the table would be full of clean pots and pans and new ingredients to cook. The attention to cleanliness and food health and safety was outstanding and receiving a book of recipes to take home was a really nice touch. The food itself was great and the balance between socialising and cooking was perfect. If you're someone who fancies themself as the next master chef, this class may not be for you as we did not really go into huge detail about specific techniques or flavour combinations etc. However, if you're someone who wants to learn about Balinese life whilst learning the basics of making delicious food with a bunch of great people, I would definitely recommend this class.

Authentic Balinese cooking.. After a very late pick up from our villa! We were thoroughly engaged. Loved the overall experience.. After many visits to Bali we finally did this tour, amazing, very well organised, spotless facility. Ended with a beautiful lunch with a splendid view. Will return and would recommend.

A delicious experience!. It was great to get an insight into the balinese hindu culture...seeing the market and the rice paddy was great and then the cooking was amazing, the colours and aromas were divine. The instructors were fantastic and taught at a good pace and with some humour thrown in and the end result was so tasty.

Fun insight into Balinese cooking and lifestyle. Wayan and Pusba were very welcoming. We were picked up from our hotel and taken to the rice fields to see where it was grown and told all about how they harvest it. When we arrived at their home we were told about the 4 buildings that a Balinese home has and taught a bit about the Balinese lifestyle.We were talked through the ingredients and then we tried various jobs including chopping, grinding, frying etc using Balinese methods. Veggies and allergies were catered for with various options and Pusba who delivered the cooking was very funny and accommodating. The balance between cooking, chatting with others and eating was perfect and we even got given the recipes to try at home - with alternatives for Balinese ingredients we probably won't find in the UK. Thanks Wayan and Pusba, all our family and friends are waiting for Balinese food when we get home at the end of August!

Amazing experience . Wayan and Puspa are absolutely amazing people. They invited us into their home and taught us the secrets to Balinese cooking. A well rounded experience that not only covered off on how to cook Classic Balinese dishes but have insights into the workings of the local market place, how rice is grown and the Balinese family life and culture. Would 100% recommend. Come with an empty stomach

One of the highlights of our trip!. My husband and I had a wonderful time at the morning cooking class. We learned so much during our market tour, and stuffed our faces silly with all of the delicious food we made. I can't recommend this wonderful family enough! The facilities were clean and kept so throughout the class, and everyone was given a chance to try at least one of each stage of cooking. It was such fun!

Fantastic experience and fantastic people. Have recommended to others. A must do in Bali.. We were welcomed into puspa and wayans home and everything went so smoothly and nothing was too hard for them. Really clean bathrooms and cooking facilities. Met some great people from different countries and the food, which we cooked, was amazing. After 11 trips to Bali I can't believe I haven't done it sooner. My sister and aunty now going next week too. Thanks!

You won't regret it!. This cooking class was probably the most fun i've had in Bali. They are lovely people and treat their customers with utmost respect. Very funny and entertaining, also accommodating. It was my girlfriends birthday and they surprised her with a cake, with lettering, candles and all. Thank you Puspa for your hospitality, and great recipes!

Fantastic experience. Today I attended my first ever international cooking class. The experience was delightful, from shopping at the local market, visiting rice paddy field to visiting the Balinese family home. Everyone was very welcoming, happy smiling faces, lots of laughs and above all learning some tasty recipes and cooking our delicious lunch.Would definitely recommend this experience to everyone. Great day shared with great people.

Super funny day!. We enjoyed this experience so much as Puspa and his husband are so funny and nice people. Their home is beautifull and equipped with all the materials for the cooking class and very clean. In half a day you will prepare a lot of dishes and this will give you a flavour of the real balinese cuisine. The lunch was great as we ate what we cooked and was one of the best meal we had in bali. Very good also the pick up service. Highly reccomended!

Balinese Adventure. Half of the reason I travel is to literally taste the culture. I fell in love with Balinese cuisine from the moment I landed. One of my favorite things to do while traveling is to take a cooking class. Without question, this was the most delightful class I have ever attended. Puspa was a wonderful guide through the eduction of ingredients, techniques and final product. I was able to recreate a magnificent feast upon my return home that brought my guest an authentic piece of Bali and brought me back to the beautiful courtyard where we ground spices. I highly recommend adding this a part of your journey through Bali!

Best experience in Bali!!. Great cooking class. Owners of the house taught us balinese cultures besides the cooking class. They were very entertaining and definitely make the class very cheerful! Will recommend to anyone who plan to visit Bali!

5 out of 5. Fantastic. Door to door transportation, great food, even went through the market with a guided tour so you know exactly where the ingredients came from. Puspa, the main lady, is an absolute gem. Speaks English well and is very positive and fun. Highly recommend this. It went from about 8:30am to 2:30pm. Well worth it for $35. Just great tasting food that you make yourself. Do it.

Best cooking class, well worth it for the experience!. Set out in a village not far from Ubud this cooking class experience is one I'll be doing again. Lovely hosts, beautiful food - too much food! Great instruction on how to prepare traditional Balinese dishes with complimentary recipe book. A comfortable, relaxing night with new friends.

Too many people, you will learn nothing. Positives:The owners are kind people and welcome you to their house. You will laugh, and meet other nice travellers.Negatives:Your cooking experience is limited to cutting vegetables and stirring a pot. I can do this in my own home. I did not learn about flavours / spices / what combination works well / how the food should taste and so on. About 10 of us worked on the same dish, we combined all our food into one big pot, so there was no chance to taste what you had personally made. The final result tasted good, but compared to other classes I have attended in Asia, this was really a dummied down cooking class.I really felt that this was a factory style cooking course - get 20 or more people in - make them smile - take their money and beg them to leave good reviews on trip advisor. Not recommended.

a little bit commercial. great cooking class but a little bit commercial now due to all the tripadvisor reviews. market and ricefiels trip was excellent. cooking was easy and took home some nice recipes

Even our fussy 6 year old made and ate the food.. Fantastic experience for the whole family. Loved every minute of it. Showed us the steps and processes were in our reach. We are keen to try the recipes when we get home.Thank you.

Highlight of Ubud!. Tour in market was interesting, good intro to the market, rice field tour informative, loved learning about Hindu homes when we got to the house where we would cook. I was able to get some of my questions answered about Hindu beliefs. Finally the cooking was well organized, fun, and VERY delicious. I would recommend to everyone this experience!

You must do this!! Incredible cultural and culinary experience.. We were two couples staying in Seminyak. Arrangements were made for us to be picked up from our villa and driven to Ubud. We were met by Made who took us on a meandering walk through the markets where he described the meaning behind the offering baskets and all the various fruit, vegetables and spices. It was a wonderful assault on the senses!After a stop at the family's rice plantation and an explanation of rice farming, we proceeded to the home of Wayan and Puspa who welcomed us like long lost family members. They host the Paon Bali Cooking School from their home compound. Having the layout of the traditional home explained was really fascinating!This was my second visit to Paon - I first came here three years ago.
