For this trip we wanted to do a cooking class and none on TripAdvisor could compare to the great memories I'd had of Paon. Thrilled to say that it was as fabulous as I remembered! Wayan and Puspa have almost finished doing some building renovations which I understand will be a new outdoor kitchen area and dining space that will beautifully compliment the cultural charm and take advantage of the stunning views. We were shown the beautiful fresh ingredients we would be cooking with and had our menu explained to us. We were provided with an apron and assigned a task of chopping, slicing, grinding and pounding. Then we were led to the kitchen and our own individual cooking area where we cooked one amazing dish after another. This was quite possibly the best meal we had in our entire holiday and we cooked it ourselves!Wayan and (Aunty) Puspa are an absolute delight. It is impossible not to fall in love with them. The setup they have is clean, professional and chock full of Balinese friendliness and charm. This cooking class should be at the top of your list of things to do!- Carolyn, Mark, Shane & Rhonda xx

Amazing People, Amazing Experience. I was on a research trip but our professor made time for us to experience this awesome cooking class. The people treat you like family and the cooking was fun and delicious, a must-do if you're visiting Bali.

Excellent introduction to Bali!. My 2 kids, husband and I all took this class on our first morning ever in Bali. We went to the market in Ubud, to the rice fields, and to their private home where the cooking class is held. Not only was the food incredible and fun to make, but we talked for days about what an excellent introduction the class was to Bali in general. We understood the food (helpful to be able to choose from a menu thereafter!), the culture, and what goes on behind all of the walls that you see in Bali. I would heartily recommend this to everyone on your first morning--you will get so much more out of it than just a cooking class! We adored every minute.

Paon Cooking School, wonderful even on a second visit. In July I took a friend to enjoy the delights of Puspa and Wayan. What a fantastic day even for my second visit, they remembered me and my husband from last visit. We were taken through the market, then the local area with an explanation of a new government subsidized organic rice program. A lovely informative discourse on community life followed at their compound and then such wonderful cooking! The instruction and explanation and offers of alternatives was excellent. Enjoyed the company while we devoured what we prepared. Definitely going again, Thank you to Puspa and Wayan.

Amazing cultural experience!. We were picked up at our hotel and driven to the market. At the market we were given a tour/talk about the local customs and foods. From there we were driven to the rice paddies, where we met the owner of the home we were to cook at. He gave us some basic information about growing rice and the local rice paddy (including his own). We were then taken to the home and introduced to his wife, "Auntie Puspa". We made an entire meal from appetizer to desert, using traditional preparation methods, including a "Balinese mixer". The instructions and introductions to the foods were excellent and it was very fun. Eating/enjoying the food we had prepared was the icing on the cake!
Great experience. Learning to cook Lawar Bali is my really best experience when i did cooking class at this company. So complicated ingredient and unique method of cooking. So great experience.
Awesome. Food was great. Learned lots. It is not just about the cooking but culture and source of the food.  They were festidious about cleanliness!!! Definitely a must do in Ebud.

A day to remember. What a fantastic day! Our hosts were gracious, and very entertaining. The class was held at their home and we were made to feel so welcome. The visit to the market and rice fields that proceeded the class was very interesting and informative. We all participated in the preparation and cooking of the meal, then sat together for the most delicious meal. The company was great, altogether a great day. Big thank you to our hosts.

Too many people and didn't learn much. There were around 30 people doing the cookery class which was far too many. Their house is beautiful and we were made to feel very welcome. The market trip was really good and we were told about different ingredients. I felt like it was a lot of talking and not much cooking. I have to say I didn't learn much at all. I left feeling a bit underwhelmed especially compared to other cookery classes we have done in Asia but the food was very good. I just don't feel it was very personalized and that I had really cooked anything myself.

Fantastic Paon bali cooking class. This was a wonderful day out and the best cooking class I have ever been toWe were picked up from our hotel in Ubud then joined a small group visiting the early spice markets were we were shown different spices and fruits with detailed explanation on how to use these in Balinese cookingAt the family compound the group increased to 20 and I thought there was too many for everyone to participate in a hands on workshopThe class was so well organized that everyone chopped cut and cooked not just now and again but each of us doing everything from start to finish Wyan and Puspa were lovely and made the whole day funEverything was cooked from scratch especially the sate sauce at other classes we made this with a prepared paste but here we really learned how to make authentic balinese sate sauce from beginning to end starting with grinding the nutsSitting down to a meal we had prepared and made ourselves was exciting and it was deliciousOn returning home I made meals from the recipes we were given they turned out fantastic thanks to Puspa sharing her knowledge and method of teaching so anyone can cook authentic Balinese meals

A taste of authentic Balinese food. Last week my firends and I have taken a class with Paon Bali and the super Puspa. She took us to the market to see all the different types of local foods and spices. A great experience. After that her husband took us to a paddy field where he explained us everything about the rise. And then we moved to their houses where the cooking class was held. Puspa and her husband are a great couple, they always smile and transfer this positive feeling to all the guests. Puspa is super passionate about her job and make everyone love and enjoy the class. Everything was clean and each one of us had the opportunity to cook and eat. Much better than having a more formal class in a resort. I would strongly recommend it as you will have the chance to touch the real Balinese cuisine. Thanks Puspa and husband.

Great experience, a must in Ubud!. The cooking course was really well organised. Got picked up from the hotel and went to the market. The guide through was interesting and the guide was knowledgeable, with very good English. The house where the class was taught was very nice, and homely. They run you through everything very well and keep it quite entertaining! Aunty Puspa is very bubbly! Definitely worth a visit to learn about Balinese cooking and culture!

Highlight of our bali trip. We came here as recommended by my co-worker and it was definitely the highlight of our bali trip. the market visit is a must! This cooking school is super authentic and they gave you a nice recipe at the end of the session. Thanks so much to Wayan and Puspa for making it such a special experience for me and my boyfriend!

Father and 8 yr old Son fun day. Awesome experience, have been to several cooking schools and this was fantastically authentic. Thanks so much to Wayan and Puspa for making it such a special experience for my son.

One of the highlights of our trip!. I came to this class with my 11 year old boy who loves to cook and wants to be a chef. We enjoyed every single thing about this program. The husband and wife team were awesome. They were funny and really nice. We learned more than just cooking, but also learned a lot about the culture which I think is a plus! The welcome drink was like this organic lemon lime juice and it awesome. My son said it was the best drink he's ever had in Bali! We can't wait to make our Balinese dinner and serve it to our Hawaii family!

BEST FOOD IN BALI, BEST TIME, BEST COMPANY. A MUST DO!. We made our own way up to Ubud for this cooking class but for a small fee could have been picked up by and returned to our hotel afterwards by Paon Bali. On arrival in Ubud, we were greeted by Wayan, the husband of the show. Wayan is incredibly welcoming and funny. Wayan then took the group of about 14 up to see his family rice paddy where he proceeded to tell us all about rice. Once back at his home, Wayan introduced us to his Lovely wife Puspa, also very welcoming and funny. After telling us how she and Wayan ended up together as well as a background on her home, we were taken to the outdoor kitchen where for the next 3.5 hours we prepared and ate the best food we had whilst in Bali. The company we shared our experience with and the scenery just made the night so special. We were also given all recipes to take home with us. So if you like to eat or cook or both, this is a fantastic day to include in your itinerary. No experience necessary but be ready to do some chopping and cooking. Great fun experience, brilliant host and group. Loved it.

Relaxed and informative - more than just a cookery class. We went on a morning tour which started at the food market, which was amazing. We were given an insight into daily shopping for the Balinese, from buying the elements of offerings to their native fruits and vegetables. Next, it was off to the family’s rice plantation where we were given an overview of what rice farming is like. Then we were taken back to Wayan and Puspar’s home where we were served a lovely cool drink and were introduced to the jovial Wayan, King of the house, who explained some of their traditions. Then it was off to the kitchen with Puspar where we chopped and prepared all of the ingredients before cooking a delicious meal. Dietary requirements are catered for and you make quite a spread – you definitely won’t go away hungry. All in all, this is more than a cookery course as you get an insight into Balinese life in a home environment (albeit, a more industrial kitchen but you would expect that). We took advantage of their free transfers in the Ubud area. A highly recommended experience.

The best meal I had in Bali by a Country Mile. I wanted to do a cooking class while in Ubud and this surpassed my expectations and was so amazing.The total experience by Wayan and Puspa was outstanding. We were welcomed into their home, entertained( they are both very funny) and shown how to cook the most mouthwatering dishes.The course was very professionally run and I had a ball. I was on my own and made to feel very welcome.We had an incredible bunch of wonderful people on the course as well and I had many interesting conversations throughout the time I was there. I didn't want to leave. Thank you so much Wayan and Puspa and you should be NUMBER ONE in the ratings.

Cooking is an Art and Joy @ Paon. This review is long overdue. We had a magical time at Paon. I tell everyone it is my only must due in Ubud. Everyone associated with the company is so kind and funny. They welcome you into their home with open arms and alluring smells. Be sure to come hungry and ready to start chopping. There are a variety of takes to complete, unlimited tea and it all takes place with a beautiful backdrop. Perfect activity for an evening in Ubud.

FUN, FUN, FUN, YUM, YUM, YUM!!!. My husband and I have a FABULOUS time cooking here!!Started with a beautiful and knowledgeable market tour by the husband Wayan. Followed by a tour of the couples home and explanations of a typical Balinese family compound setup- very interesting. We then joined our group of travelers from all over the world! Our chef, Puspa has a huge smile and fun loving attitude! She made cooking so much fun!We are vegetarians and they made sure the entire course that our food was correct. There were also food allergies within the group that she easily accommodated. The class is held outdoors in their backyard open to all the beautiful vegetation and surrounding area. We prepared so many dishes I lost track but one thing is for sure- they were all DELICIOUS!! We were absolutely stuffed by the end but of course wanted to keep eating as it was so good! I would recommend this for singles, couples, families, friends- anyone who wants to have fun and eat authentic Balinese food that you can take credit for making!!

Awesome time!. Had an amazing day with Puspa and her team. It was the best cooking class I've ever attended. Very efficient and professional. Absolutely loved the food and ate til I couldn't eat any more. I'm vegetarian and was very well catered for. Highly recommend this day as a fun and explorative day with some great recipes to bring home. Thanks to Puspa and the team! Moni

Authentic Balinese Cooking Class. Our experience began with a visit to a rice paddy where we learnt how rice was grown and harvested. Puspa and Wayan greeted us warmly at their home with a welcome drink while showing us their typical Balinese home. Puspa and her very efficient helpers talked us through the preparation and cooking (very hands on) of at least eight delicious dishes which we proceeded to enjoy with Bintang beer. The transportation there and back to Ayung Resort was provided. All in all a wonderful, worthwhile experience which I highly recommend.

Pain Cooking Class. Picked up on time from accommodation . Visited rice paddy and onto the class. Puspa greeted us warmly and we cooked a feast of eight dishes from very fresh ingredients. Each course was prepared from the beginning by the small group. Loved the aromas and tastes. Highly recommend this course.

Great experience. Day started out well, we were picked up right on time from a very lovely man. We then made our way to ubud where we were greeted by wayan at the market - this was interesting and we got to taste and see a lot! We then made our way to some rice paddies in wayan's village this was beautiful to see! Our group then made our way to wayan's house where we were greeted by wayan's beautiful wife puspa. The day then started with a lot of involvement in prepping and cooking the food. All in all a fantastic day out. Left feeling very full with such a yummy lunch and memories including a recipe book. Do yourself a favour and book this!

What a great cooking class!. We absolutely loved this cooking class. From the pick up to the end, everything was so well organized. The owners are lovely and the staff as well. It was nice to be hands on throughout the whole cooking class, and the food was delicious! Overall we had a lovely time to learn about Balinese food and traditions. It was also nice to meet people from other countries and get to chat about Bali! Thank you again to the owners and the staff who did an amazing job!!

Simply Superb!. Gracious and entertaining hosts, excellent guidance, hands-on cooking, wonderful food, and no cleaning up! - It's simply impossible to find fault!Vegetarians, vegans, and allergies are easily accommodated.Learn in a beautiful Balinese home, discover the culture, and be entertained with good humour and a sincere heart. It's a truly wonderful experience!

We loved it!. Hotel pick-up, visit to Ubud market, stop at the rice terraces and great staff ! There are enough places for everyone to work in the kitchen. Wayan and Puspa are great hosts and made the class fun and worthwhile! Thank you!

2nd Time 'round and still my favourite!. I did this activity in July 2013 with a friend. I decided to take my whole family this past Sunday, 20th July 2014 and I'll say that one year later it was STILL my highlight of things to do in Ubud. And next year I'll return again. Thank you Puspa, Wayang and all their wonderful kitchen helpers.

Amazing owners!. I attended this class alone and was a little nervous because I'm the only one who joined this alone in the morning class. However, the owner tried to make me laugh to relax and taught all participants about food or Balinese history or everything about Bali. You can learn lots of things not only Balinese food. I'd like to bring my daughter to cook together next time!

A delicious cooking class not to be missed!. My wife and I did the afternoon cooking class with Puspa and Wayan while one our honeymoon in Bali, and both agree that this was one of the absolute highlights of the trip. Though the market tour is only for the morning, our trip started (after a pickup at our hotel) with an overview of the rice growing process at a local field, conducted all in English by Wayan (who is full of charm, great humor, and kindness - all of which put us completely at ease and set the tone for a great night!). We then traveled back with the full group to the (beautiful) family home, for a welcome drink and overview of the evening and a bit of description of family life in Bali (plus an assurance, jokingly yet true, that we would not get 'Bali Belly' from this cooking class!).There were ~15 of us in the class, and throughout the course of the night we cooked a full buffet dinner. Puspa and team were very helpful throughout the night with the right level of teaching versus allowing us to do things on our own, and we felt like we picked up a solid beginners level understanding of Balinese cooking. We also were provided with all the recipes for the night to recreate for our friends! Throughout the cooking and dinner we enjoyed the opportunity to mingle with other internationals By the end of the night we were stuffed and happy. The price was 350K IDR per person, plus round trip transportation of about 350K. This truly was a fantastic way to spend the afternoon, and we'd recommend this to any couple or friends traveling through Bali.

The highlight of our trip to Bali. Thank you Puspa and Wayan - what a fantastic class! Very informative, interactive and by far, our best meal of the whole trip! Thanks for the recipes - Will definitely try recreate the meals at home.. All 5 of us really loved it and will hopefully be back again!

Cooking class where you get to cook a delicious lunch no less. This is one cooking class where you get to cook and learn about local culture and way of life. The class starts with a tour of the local market and introduction to Balinese family life. There is plenty of help where you might need during the cooking class and the timing is perfect: Puspa (the chef) has got the organization down pad so that everyone gets to cook and nobody spoils the dish! Lunch was definitely yummy! Wayan and Puspa were wonderful hosts who went out of their way to make everyone feel comfortable.

Sadly we were disappointed . Having read so many great reviews I was really looking forward to this class in the afternoon. The owners are really nice and there home is lovely. The highlight for us was mixing with the others on tour and exchanging Bali stories. Having done cooking classes in Asia before I expected this one to be top class. Sadly I have to say I learned nothing and felt the class of 12 was too big and lost any personal touch. Maybe my expectations where too high but the class is a nice way to spend an afternoon.

An Amazing Culinary Adventure!. What a wonderful way to truly experience the culture of Bali! We had a wonderful day visiting the market, rice fields and our host's home to learn about the amazing foods of Bali! Our hosts Pupsa and Wayan were so welcoming and funny and taught us so much about the culture and traditions of Bali. I had a shrimp allergy and they were so careful to ensure dishes were prepared safely for me without shrimp paste without sacrificing the amazing flavours of Balinese food. We met so many locals and travellers and felt like it was one of our favourite things to do in Ubud! Do not miss this amazing opportunity! You will take home a recipe book full of dishes to try at home and memories to last a lifetime!
New Skills. Thanks Paon Bali for my cooking class. I learnt so many new skills and can't wait to try them by myself.
Excellent evening! . We had a fantastic evening at the Paon Bali Cookingclass! We did not only cook, but we also saw the ricefields and the family's house! Very nice :)
Best cooking class in Bali. This was the best thing we did in ubud. Great cooking class. We learned a lot and still full 6 hours later! Free pick up and drop off and a lovely market tour.

How do you say Aloha in Balinese?. Wow..from the moment Wayan picked us up at our hotel on time I was impressed. My daughter and I signed up for the class before we arrived in Ubud. There were 3 other people in the van at pick up and we went straight to the Ubud Market and hooked up with the other part of the gang (20 total). We met wonderful people from all over the world in the class so that was a treat in itself! Gede navigated us through the market and we learned about the local fruit and spices. Then we headed up to Paon's village and stopped at a beautiful rice paddies to learn some basics about the cultivation process of rice. Next stop Pupsa and Wayan's home. The minute we arrived we were greeted with such graciousness it was impressive. Fresh juice was served and a little introduction to Balinese life by Wayan. We then were asked to wash our hands and all given aprons and towels. The cooking class was beyond my expectations. Amazingly well organized, very efficient, super clean and hygenic. We wore plastic gloves and also were asked to wash our hands alot. That was a good sign for me. The chopping, dicing, Bali blender, cooking experience was a blast! Pupsa was knowledgeable, very professional and a delight! The food..O.M.G.The best part just being apart of such good energy and meeting lovely people with good karma.

Best Day spent in Ubud. We almost thought about cancelling this class just to have another day at our Villa....so glad we didn't!! Puspa and Wayan are such a lovely and funny couple. They totally entertained our group of 20 on the day, their hospitality and friendly nature made us feel so special and the end result was a fantastic feast of traditional, mouth watering, balinese meals. The behind the scene's market tour was certainly an eye opener and a real treat to experience. I thoroughly recommed this cooking class, and will never forget this gorgeous couple, and the fantastic day we had inside their beautiful compound.

Great cooking :). Brilliant cooking class, friendly staff with plenty of demonstrations and opportunities to participate in preparation and cooking of traditional Balinese food. Very enjoyable end result when we all got to enjoy a buffet of the foods we prepared. The tour of the food market at the beginning of the tour was also a highlight.

Five star authentic Balinese food experience. The tour begins with prompt service in an air conditioned car from our hotel lobby. An informative market tour in central ubud and then transport to the home of Puspa and Wayan, our hosts. The attention to detail in all areas, including accomodation of allergies and vegetarians was most appreciated and handled with calm efficiency. The cooking experience was very informative and lots of fun and we were amazed at the quality of the feast we had created as a group. Definitely put Paon Bali cooking school in ubud on your must do list for Bali.

Exceeded expectations. My wife and I were looking for a quality cooking class to take during our time in Ubud and Paon Bali completely blew us away. Not only did we receive excellent guidance and learn a great deal but we also enjoyed hilarious commentary from the hosts and fantastic facilities in a traditional Balinese setting.If you're looking for an authentic and social atmosphere with lovely people, this is the course for you.

Excellent experience for everyone. My wife and I attended the class on 14 June 2014. It was excellent. Pick-up from the hotel, market visit, rice paddies visit provided interesting background to the cooking experience. Everything was prepared perfectly. Introduction to the ingredients followed by very well organised cooking where each participant could have a hand in all activities. Results exceeded our expectations. Initially we had some doubts whether we would enjoy the day and now we can say it was our best day on Bali. You should not miss it. Puspa and Wayan are great people building the team of participants in great friendly atmosphere. Just do it and you will have an experience to share with your friends. Thank you Puspa and Wayan.

Cooking class . Have been 2 Bali many times , this was the first time we have had a cooking lesson , we learnt so much & had a really fun time ! Puspa & Wayan made us all feel so welcome in2 their home , they even made a beautiful birthday cake for one of our friends in the group , as we r over in Bali celebrating his 50th . I can highly recommend this cooking class 2 anyone .

Don't Miss this Bali Experience!!!. This is something that should not be missed in Ubud, plain and simple. The hospitality was amazing, the food was fresh and probably the best meal we had in Ubud (better than the fanciest restaurants.) It is a truly interactive experience. You learn and laugh the whole time.It starts with a tour an explanation of the rice fields (a must when you are surrounded by them and it is a staple of every meal). Not only is the tour informative, but the scenery is breathtaking. Then you go on to your hosts' home where they explain a bit about a Hindu family unit and housing structure--something you would never know about if you just spent your days roaming the Sacred Monkey Forest and Ubud's streets. The couple brings vibrancy, charm, and lots of corny (but appreciated) jokes to the session. Then the cooking begins...explanation of ingredients, what you'll make and you're off to the races making about 9 different typical dishes. The end result is a top-notch meal you won't forget.Puspa says TripAdvisor is her fairy godmother, so take this review to heart and don't miss paying her a visit! Our Ubud vaction would have been incomplete without it.Fee was 350,000 IDR per person (~$30USD) + 15,000 per Bintang (a must!)

Delicious family fun. This was a very well organised, highly informative and enjoyable day. Starting with the sights, sounds and smells of the Ubud food market, followed by a rice paddy edge tutorial on rice farming, it culminated in the course itself, held at the family compound of the charming and hospitable Puspa and Wayan. The course was well organised and "hands on", catering to a broad range of abilities and interests, from our family of five (managing to hold the interest of boys aged 11,14 & 17), to the professional chef amongst the others in the group for the day. The facilities were scrupulously clean and, most importantly, the food delicious. I would highly recommend Paon Bali Cooking class to anyone staying in Ubud/Bali with even the slightest interest in food/cooking.

Excellent activity. We did this cooking class on our honeymoon and it was one of the highlights of our trip! A very warm welcome, great fun and the resulting food was the best we had in Indonesia. So glad that we got the recipes so that we can try to recreate it at home. Thank you!

Amazing Experience. We booked the morning cooking class thru Expedia (Bali Ku)but they didn't come to pick us up from the hotel! So then we called Paon directly n found out Expedia never followed up our booking with Paon after taking our payment. We were very angry n felt ripped off, but Pupas the owner was extremely helpful. She arranged us to attend the afternoon class n requested Bali Ku to come to her house and speak to us about the situation. We would like to thank Pupas for sorting us out and let us have a wonderful evening at her home. Food was yummy and it was so much fun(apart from the booking agent)!
bagus. such good food and such good fun they take you to ubud markets at first which is a good expeirence, then show the rice farm and then make the food w you. very welcoming and enjoyable.

Great Bali experience. Puspa and Wayan were great hosts; their house and garden (where the cooking class is set) is simply wonderful, and they make you feel at ease at once. Our day started off at the market, where we were taught about the local fruits, spices and treats. We were then whisked off to the rice paddies, where Wayan told us more about the daily farming life. Finally, we went to their house where welcome drinks and tea were waiting. We cooked 9 dishes all in all; everyone had their own contribution to the greater dish (you could be in the dicing station at one time, and at the cooking station at the next). Everyone shared the feast in the end. There were good vibes all around, and it was nice to share the experience with everyone else who were eager to learn and experience a slice of the Balinese life.

Bonding experience with Teenagers/Special needs. My husband and I took our 3 surly teens,one with an intellectual disability,on this memorable day.I booked it direct via cooking school email and paid in rph on the day.Paid driver direct at end of day.He was happy to take us anywhere on way back to extend day as cooking finished about 130pm.Pouspa organised a comfortable minivan from our Nusa Dua hotel lobby at 715am and even with crazy motorbikes everywhere carrying families of 3 plus a dog,we arrived at the bustling,colourful market in Ubud at 830am.New North-South tollway helped.Local guide Nyoman, was waiting with about 12 fellow 'students'and welcomed us in perfect English.We were with a french family which didnt bother Nyoman as he spoke french too.He was so informative and answered questions from our kids about native fruits(cut it up and let us taste it) contents of Hindu basket offerings and temple custom of wearing a waist sash.He allowed a little time for teens to try out their bartering skills when they spied things they wanted(although we had to say no to the wood caved knives,firewx and BB guns!).About 10am we went to the traditional villa that is home to Pouspa and her husband.I wont repeat what everyone has already said-just that I agree they are delightful hosts.After a refreshing drink it was into the cooking and EVERYONE is expected to participate.So great to watch the teen 'tudes' melt away as they tied on their aprons, washed their hands and took up a work station in the open garden kitchen,Amazing that.when someone else asks them to dice shallots finely,knead a spicy paste with a gloved hand and take a giant pestle and grind fresh vegies in a stone mortar they hop to it!My disabled teen had a ball-Pouspa and her team of helpers finding tasks within his capabilities and generally empowering him without one question to me about 'whats wrong with him'..The lunch was truly delicious-you could sit wherever- teens chose to sit with us- another first for the trip-and we took away the joys of a joint experience and our booklet of receipes.I cant wait to hit the Asian grocer at home and prepare essential yellow sauce from scratch together!

Highlight of the trip. Pouspa and her husband could not be more delightful. The school is operated from her beautiful home which is in itself a treat. The class was held outside and was exquisitly organized, not a small feat since on the day we were there there were about 17 of us. Nevertheless we had a short demonstration for each preparation and then we all chopped, diced, or cooked over the fire at individual stations. There were many lovely assistants. We learned 6 or 7 dishes and of course had a wonderful meal overlooking a rice field. It was so fun to chat with people from all over the world with a common love for food. I wouldn't miss this experience with these charming, generous, warm family.

AMAZING!!!. My family at home is Indonesian and I thought nothing could compare to my mother's and aunts' cooking... but Aunt Pouspa put them to shame. She was extremely friendly, laughed a lot, and was super informative.Learning about her passion for the culture, family and cooking kept everyone engaged and leaving their home with recipes in hand made me pumped to go back home and cook the items she had taught us.Thanks Aunt Pouspa! ONE MORE FOR GOOD LUCK!

Couldn't be better!. Plain Bali is worth every penny. We were picked up at our hotel door, shown the rice fields where our rice for dinner was grown and learned how rice is grown. We were greeted with refreshing drinks, shown a traditional Balinese home and then introduced to the ingredients we would be using. Puspa was knowledgeable, welcoming and humorous! She walked us through each step efficiently, allowing enough hands on experience but also making the process move swiftly. This is a must do in Bali! Thank you Puspa for making us family!

Best half day in Bali(Ubud). + great hosts "happy wife=happy life"+ amazing food unrivalled by any other restaurant we've been to in Ubud+ nice intro into traditional Balinese family life in a household- tried very very hard to find a negative point, but gave up without one :)

laplapan paradise. I have done the day class and the evening class at Paon. Pouspa an Wayan are the best. They are wonderful sharing and passionate about food their village and culture. I have been to other cooking schools and none compare to these lovely people.Laplapang is a lovely clean beautiful village with beautiful rice paddis. I will go againfor my 3rd visit not to learn to cook but to enjoy their company their knowledge and sense of humour.In my eyes they are the best cooking school in Bali run by 2 of the most lovely Balinese I have met in my numerous visits to my 2nd home in Ubud.Please go ! You will not be dissappointed.xxx Pouspa and Wayan from Playboy duck and Honeybunny. Lol

What fun!. My wife and I were treated to an exclusive cooking course at the Paon Balinese cooking school. We were met at the hotel by a driver, who turned out to be one of the school helpers. Taken to a paddy field and had the process of growing rice explained .... there is actually a lot to it!Then we went to the School,to be met by the proprietor's husband and then taken to the school area. The ingredients were laid out beautifully and we were off. We were shown how to make all the sauces and then we cooked the 9 dishes . this was very hot work but good fun. We sat down and were served the food that we had cooked. We can thoroughly recommend this school.

Excellent experience. A great coooking course. We were picked up at our hotel and taken to the market where we were told all about the different fruit, vegetables and spices used in Balinese cooking - really enlightening. Then we visited the rice field on the way to the compound where Wayan and his family live. Wayan told us about family life and then introduced his wife who did the cooking class. Everything was very well organised with everyone able to experience the preparation of the dishes - very hands on experience. The dishes were then eaten by everyone. This was the best food that we had in Indonesia - everything had so much taste. Don't hesitate to do this class - everything was done perfectly and you will love it.

Balinese cooking class. We started off in the morning with a tour of the markets, trying a few different items that we had not tried before. We then went to the paddy fields where we were told a little about rice growing, then off to Puspas house, where we found out a little about life in a Balinese house and then off to the kitchen.We followed instructions, chopped, added, stirred, fried, mixed and ended up with a very nice multi course Balinese meal. And the best thing, we took the recipes home! I haven't had a chance to cook them yet, so I hope they turn out at home as well!Everything appeared clean and all the meals were very tasty. Highly recommended!

Fun day out. We thoroughly enjoyed ourselves at Paon Bali. From on time pick up at our hotel, the trip to the market and rice field and then the class itself, everything was very well organised, informative and lots of fun. Wayan and Puspa are wonderful hosts and teachers, and the other members of our group of around 20 were excellent company. The amount of hands on cooking was just about right to make it enjoyable without being a chore, and the feast at the end was delicious. I highly recommend this to foodies and novices alike.

Paon Bali Cooking Class. The owner of Paon Bali Cooking Class, Puspa, was fun, entertaining and knowledgeable. The class was very well organized. We were picked up from our villa by the a tour guide. A quick informational tour of the essential rice fields started the class. Then we were taken to the traditional home of Wayan and Puspa. Everyone in a group of 16 was able to participate in all steps of cooking 6 different dishes. We had fun working with traditional Balinese cooking tools. Our vegetarian friends' needs were happily accommodated. The ingredients were fresh and varied. The final result was delicious.

Fun Educational and Inspiring. This cookery course was the highlight of our trip to Bali in April and was delivered with humour as well as being highly organised throughout. The visit to the market introduced us to spices herbs and fruit which I would never have tasted otherwise and was very informatitive as well as being pretty informal. The banter was well polished and fun. The tour of the rice field was a little brief but again we learnt abut the different types of rice and how it is harvested. The highlight was of course the cookery course and the while thing was delivered professionally and was so well organised. Basically we cooked in a group in pairs and it was very hands-on. The instructions were clear and my only regret was that because of the style of cooking in Indonesia it was over so quickly! That is a positive though as you realise that with a little preparation you can cook a feast in a very short space of time. The food we prepared was amazing - an explosion of flavours and a variety to tempt all but the most conservative of tastes. At the end we were given a "booklet" of recipes we had cooked which in itself is a very valuable tool I have cooked several of the dishes now I am back in the UK, having to adapt some slightly due to missing ingredients but the principle elements are there and the recipes really do work! A great morning and delicious food - not to be missed.
Great Value!. Went here December 2013, was interesting to learn about the culture and food of Indonesia.Highly recommend to anyone travelling to Bali, the food is awesome!

We loved this.... Everything about our experience with Paon Cooking class was fab! Loved the hosts (Mr + Mrs Team = hilarious), and all other staff (friendly, fun and great English). We learnt alot, the high hygiene standard was brilliant, and this class had the perfect balance of teaching and doing (and eating!) At the end of it all we had a delicious and authentic Indonesian meal…the best of our trip! A must for all foodies, even the blokes loved it!

A charming experience. I had a great time at this cooking class. It was very well organised, and all those involved were very welcoming. The cooking itself was run in a very efficient manner, and hence there was little that could go wrong. We were conducted by the effervescent Puspa, giving all members of our party separate tasks to complete in the kitchen, simultaneously being taught about the ingredients and the methodologies involved in Balinese cuisine. This made for an easy, fun afternoon, with a thoroughly enjoyable meal at the end of the day. The only downside was that I came away without the keenest insight into prepping a meal by oneself but an otherwise highly recommended activity for most ages.

Excellent, highly recommend!. Whilst organised through our travel agent this really was the highlight of our visit to Ubud. We stayed for 3 weeks in Bali for our honeymoon. Puspar and Wayan (sorry if spelt incorrectly) really did welcome us into their home, explaining all about their home, religion and culture before working with us to cook up an 8 course feast - yes just for the two of us! They were also great at not making it too spicy and ensuring everything was clean, explained thoroughly and very tasty. The courses ranged from mushroom soup (more exciting than it sounds), chicken sate, tofu, tuna and bananas. Great peanut sauce and basic yellow paste - yummy! Don't hesitate, book now !

Brilliant if a bit hands off. I went here with a group of 9 friends (all guys in our 20s). They had a big laugh at so many young fellas showing up for a cooking class! Very well run and friendly staff. We were picked up from out hostel right on time, given a tour of padi fields and it was explained how they work. The cooking itself was OK, we did all the prep of veg but we didn't really have much handling of meat or anything like that. It was kind of cooking by numbers, we were really spoon fed every step of the way which didn't suit me, but some of the guys who don't cook probably needed that. The food we ate at the end was fantastic, all ingredients were fresh and the bintang out there was cheap. Overall a deserved 5 stars but be warned that the cooking is a bit hands off if you're experienced.

Thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Every part of this trip was planned in a professional but fun way. Ubud market that our guide brought us to was big and full of interesting details. Although it is in the middle of a very touristy part of Ubud, many locals go there for their daily shopping. In one single place we saw many kinds of things that a Balinese family will need in its daily living. Our guide was knowledgeable and made all the difference to understanding the things we saw.Home cooking and a harmonious happy family go hand in hand. I thoroughly enjoyed what Puspa's husband shared in his courtyard about family life.We had a great time in Puspa's kitchen. Jobs like cutting, grinding and cooking were split into small and systematic way. My husband (at first a reluctant participant) and daughter (an apprehensive 13-year-old) were absolute beginners in cooking but because the process was so well-planned, they managed to do everything themselves and thoroughly enjoyed the programme. (Thank you Puspa for being especially encouraging to my daughter and giving her enough attention when needed.)Did we learn real food preparation and cooking? Of course! And learning it in an entertaining way was a bonus. Lunch was our best meal in this trip with a group of friendly people from various countries. Amazing experience.

Fantastic!. This was a great way to be introduced to preparation of Balinese cuisine. The facilities were clean, the staff made it fun and there was no pressure to do anything on your own. Well planned and supportive class. Had a blast and would recommend to anyone with an interest in food. Also gave some cultural insight into family life and the market place.

Must do!!. From start to finish this experience was fantastic and worth every penny (and then some). The market and rice field tour prior to the class was informative and provided a unique view of Bali. The actual cooking class was completely hands on and finished with one of the best meals we had while in Bali. This is not something to miss!!

A bit too much of a show. To be honest I don't understand why this cooking class gets such a high rating on tripadvisor. Don't get me wrong: the staff was very friendly, professional and hospitable and the food we cooked was delicious. The setting was quite charming and the ingredients of high quality and fresh. The kitchen equipment was very good as well.However: the visit to the local market was not so local (it was the morning market on the ubud tourist market location), they ENDLESSLY talked about random things not related to cooking before we actually started cooking (it was a bit of a stand up comedian show at one point) and the group was huge(14 people). If you're looking for a fun day activity and don't care much about the cooking itself but just want to be entertained, I highly recommend this course. However, if you really want to learn to cook in a small group and do everything yourself, you may be better off at another course that's a bit more serious and a bit less of a hype / an entertainment show. I've attended better courses for lower prices.Nevertheless I had fun and it's still worth 4 stars in my opinion. Thanks!P.s. if you're going to attend the morning course, make sure you have some breakfast beforehand. I was expecting to eat throughout the course but we ate nearly everything at lunchtime so I was hungry all morning ;)

Highlight!. My husband and I actually found Paon Bali cooking class here on tripAdvisor. We booked by email and Puspa replied very promptly. We did the morning class and we're picked up from our hotel in ubud at 830am. First we did the market tour with the driver and other guests, who were great ppl. The driver's English was great as he explained all the fruits, veggies and spices that we were to be using during the cooking class. Then we went to the rice fields just outside of ubud and were taught about how the rice grows, is harvested and used. After that we we're talk en to Puspa and Wayans home where we were greeted with a welcome drink and a very inspirational story of traditional Balinese life and culture by mr. Wayan (puspa's husband) the couple are very funny and engaging. Next was the cooking class taught by Puspa. Our whole group was able to do and try everything! We made soooo much food and were all given the recipes to take home. I was even able to have a take away box of left overs. The sanitary protocols were top notch! Something very refreshing to see in an Asian country. My husband and I were very impressed and left totally stuffed by the time we left. This day comes highly recommended for all ages!

Wow!!! . This is by far my favorite experience so far in Bali, out of many enjoyable experiences. Puspa and Wayan welcomed us into their beautiful family compound. Not only did we learn about Balinese food, but also the culture. I have a shellfish allergy and they took complete care of me, and never forgot about my need for something different. We left full and happy. Worth every penny! We can't wait to attempt some of the dishes from our new cookbook!

Full of culture and great food!. Our driver Gede Dedi suggested we try a cooking course. I convinced my husband to do a cooking course with Puspa and Wayan. We were collected at exactly 8.25 as arranged and everything went like clockwork. We visited the Ubud food market, local paddy fields before we arrived Puspa and Wayan's beautiful home.Wayan welcomed us and gave us some insight into Bali culture, the importance of family and food. There were at least 16 of us doing the course. There is a small army of workers making sure that ingredients and cooking equipment is ready to use. We were instructed, entertained and encouraged over the whole morning. The amount of energy, enthusiasm and cheer that was given to the group was infectious. In the end we all sat down to a delicious meal and a group of strangers had a very convivial time.The insight into the local culture was wonderful.Really shouldn't be missed.My husband and I were delighted out driver suggested it.

Great Hands on Cooking Experience. From the moment we were picked up until we were dropped off it was an exceptional experience. Everyone involved made us feel welcome.Everyone participates in the preparation and cooking just like a big family. The food is delicious and plenty of it. We would highly recommend this if you want to learn how to cook real Balinese food. You are given the recipes when you leave, so you can try at home.Stu and Jan, Christchurch, New Zealand

A "must do" on your trip to Bali. We were staying nowhere near Ubud but decided to take a trip up there just for this cooking class and I am SO glad we did! It was much better than a class in a restaurant, our friends did one of those and said they hardly got to participate. Puspa and Wayan welcome you into their home and make the entire experience fun and enjoyable, with delicious food!! It's a cultural experience that you'll remember forever and is also quite a reasonable price!

Food and Cultural trip. This is not only a cooking class, but also learn some Balinese culture. With a class size of 18, and each with different reqirement/restriction, it not easy for the team to remember all of them, but they did. The whole lesson was very well organised. And the final product, our "cooking" were some of the best food we had during our 4 days stay in Ubud.

Fun & enjoyable!. We went as a group of four and altogether the class was a group of 16! At 1st I thought "oh no" but Wayan, Puspa & their team made the experience fun & the food was was more than enough for all! I would recommend to anyone wanting to do a cooking class in Ubud.

Michelle Robinson. Our day started at 830am being picked up from our hotel and headed to the Ubud Markets. We were show how the local shop for their produce. We were introduced to their spices, vegetables and fruits. We headed to their home to start the cooking class where we were greeted with a cold lemon drink and treated like family. We all worked as a team to chop, slice and cook the diverse menu. Catering for vegetarians.Later we had the opportunity to eat the smorgasbord of delightful meals.Offer bintangs and other refreshments. A great day meeting any people from other countries and receiving a recipe booklet to reverse at home which we have done.Great memories and so glad we did this.Totalling recommend...

Quality experience. Puspa made us feel right at home and made the cooking class very enjoyable and easy to follow. The food was delicious, and the cooking was made simple thanks to the quality assistance of Puspa and the staff. The whole evening was a great experience and definitely one of the highlights of our stay in Ubud.

Excellent!. Very accomodating and flexible for us. Clean, hygienic and very well explained cooking. A great trip round the Ubud market and run by excellent people. The standard of the food was superb and what you end up cooking may be the best Balinese food of your trip
What an experience!. This was the highlight of our trip! the meals that we prepared were delicious and just such a fun experience!

amazing cooking experience. Puspah , Wayan and their team made the day a wonderful experience. They were all very welcoming and spoke very good English.The day started with Wayan taking us around the food market explaining all the foods and spices used in Balinese cooking. He was very informative and answered any questions we had. from here we were driven to Wayan's village where firstly we visitd the rice paddies to see how the rice was grown. Then we were taken baxk to Puspah and Wayan's home where we were welcomed with cold and hot drinks. Wayan then explained all about family life.We then commenced the cooking demonstration which was fantastic especially as everyong took part in the preperation and cooking of the food. We then got to eat all the food we had prepared and it was the best Balinese food we have had.We had a wonderful day and met some very friendly travellers from around the world.We cannot recommend this cooking experience highly enough. MUST DO when in Ubud.Thanks for the pick up and drop off from Nefatari Villas - really appreciated.

Must Do Experience. This day was amazing , from our tour of the markets in Ubud to hearing about the growing and harvest of rice . Wayan and Puspi are great hosts and it was also interesting to hear about Bali home life. The cooking was fun as we all prepared and then cooked, and after we all sat down to eat some fantastic food. Best day in Bali yet!

Best Ever Experience. The whole day, from the visit to the Ubud market, interesting and funny tips and facts, the rice paddis and of course the amazing cooking class, was just fantastic...highly recommend this activity
Excellent. Everything we made was delicious and all cooking techniques were explained properly. I particularly enjoyed learning about the layout of traditional Balinese homes.

A memorable experience. We attended the Paon Cooking class last Sunday and it was truly a most memorable experience.The welcoming owners attention to detail ensuring that all participants were happy and active participants during the evening was phenomenal. We asked about sambal mata and they even included that condiment in the presentation The recipes were distributed at the end of the evening and we have already made the delicious dessert! Thank you for your professional care!

Great experience and wonderful food. Really enjoyed our day with the team at Paon Bali. We began with the market tour where we were introduced to the range of ingredients to be used throughout the class. From there we travelled to the location where we would do our cooking - which turned out to be the home of our hosts. We were met with a delicious welcome drink and our host Wayan gave us an introduction to Balinese life. From there we began our course. Dishes were introduced and then task shared amongst participants. It was a friendly, cooperative group and we shared a table with a lovely Dutch couple and a really interesting Mexican guy who had spent the last 6 months travelling in Asia - so we spent most of our non cooking time swapping travel and food stories. The food we cooked was delicious. All complex enough to be interesting (in flavour) but simple enough that, with some planning and effort, could be replicated at home. Content was delivered with humour and an obvious love for sharing Indonesian culture through food. Would absolutely recommend this course for anyone interested in learning about the role of food in Indonesian families - or if you just like to make and eat delicious food. Better than most of the restaurant food we've eaten here.

The best evening ever. we went last Thursday , a group of 7 of us.We did the evening class which was great as we ate such a full meal we would never have enjoyed it as much in the heat of the day.The welcome we were given , the fiid we ate, the insights to Bali and its people!!What more can I say we loved it

Great day out and fabulous food. Puspah and Wayan made the day very interesting and the food we cooked was exceptionally good. Being able to take the recipes home after having engaged in every part of the preparation and cooking will make it easy to replicate in my own kitchen - I had a very enjoyable time, met interesting people and cannot recommend this enough to others.

Great Bali cooking class. From pre class visits to the local market and rice fields, to a brief and humorous introduction to Balinese homes, to an amazing cooking class culminating in the best Balinese meal we had on the trip - a first class experience. Do your kitchen talents and taste buds a favor and go.

Amazing experience!. Amazing time with travelers from all around the world! Enjoy cooking with a really warm and welcoming Balinese family, then share your meal all together! Also visit of market is quiet interesting on the morning with lots of info about local fruits & vegetables. Definitely an activity to recommend!

The highlight of my time in Bali. I have nothing but great things to say about this class. it is very well organized and informative. Puspa and Wayan are both very warm and friendly and speak English very very well - they were able to answer any question anyone asked, including all sorts of questions about substitutions. I went with a friend who is gluten-free and they were able to accommodate her easily by making a small batch of GF versions of all the recipes that contained gluten - and it wasn't even a big deal, as soon as they knew about the GF restriction they knew immediately how to accommodate. We made 8 different dishes and we got to try all of them - everyone ate until they were full and there was still food leftover. I highly recommend this class to anyone visiting Ubud.

Fantastic experience. Just finished the afternoon class at the Paon Bali Cooking Class. What an incredible experience. We're a group of 9 fellas in our early 20s and it has been the highlight of our holiday in Bali so far. We started with a visit to a paddy rice field and detailed explanation of the cultivation and harvesting of various types of rice. We then continued to the family home where we were greeted with a delicious lime juice drink. The introduction to the various ingredients and explanation of them was very thorough and informative. We were helped through the prep and cooking of 8 different dishes. The food which became our meal was enjoyed in front of stunning views over the nearby forest. Puspas was incredible, funny and very helpful and the meal as a whole was the best meal I've had in a long time. On leaving we were given a booklet with the recipes for all that we cooked and can't wait to get home and put them into practice. Could not recommend this course any more!

Amazing day with beautiful people!. Me and my boyfriend stayed in Bali for a week and this was one of my favourite days! The market visit was fascinating and it was where Eat Pray Love was filmed so I was extremely happy! An amazing couple make you feel very welcome in their beautiful home and you cook beautiful food. We both had the best meal we'd had in Bali and we'd cooked it all ourselves!! I'm a veggie and there was plenty of food for me. There is a veggie option for every meal cooked. Amazing day!!

Great day. Great day. We skipped the market trip as was too early for us coming from Seminyak. We were taken to a rural rice padi where the growing, processing and the use of rice was explained. Then taken to the home of Wayan and Puspa with 14 others from around the globe. We learned to prepare and cook Balinese dishes.My group was comprised of a Vegetarian and a couple with food allergies. We were meticulously catered for. the home and kitchen are very clean and water was freely available.After the cooking, to which everyone contributed, the group sat down to the biggest and best Bailnese feast of our visit. Delicious.

Excellent class. Well run, organized, great food. The market tour was great to see how Balinese get the ingredients, and the brief explanation on rice farming was, too. The class was constant cooking and eating, with the staff always offering to help or accommodate.

Masterclass Ubud. What a wonderful day learning from the experts how to prepare and cook a Balinese Feast. Wayan and Puspa welcomed us warmly into their lovely home and along with their dedicated team taught us how to prepare a number of authentic dishes with ease and fun. Once the cooking was finished everyone in the class sat down to enjoy great conviviality and amazing food. Thank you Puspa for a fantastic day.Chris and Phil

Amazing!!. I was so glad to have snuck into the class due to Puspa's confirmation going to my junk folder. She is so welcoming and a great teacher. The day started at the market where we were shown what the offerings were made if and where to buy fresh produce, spices and meat in the market. The team at Paon works hard and it's a great experience making all the food by hand without the use of electric kitchen gadgets. I would highly recommend that you book. The class will not disappoint. Puspa even taught us to make Sembal, my favorite.

Food Glorious Food. If you'd like an insight into how food is purchased, prepared and enjoyed Balinese style, then this is your class! Puspa and her husband have created a gourmet experience that provides fun and education for tourists, and employment opportunities for their community. The success of the day is largely about the input of the Paon team. Everybody from drivers to kitchen hands takes pride in their contribution to the success of the day. I did this class with my 14 year old daughter. We both enjoyed learning the cooking techniques and sharing the glorious feast with other travellers who appreciate traditional food. I was thoroughly impressed by the quality of this enterprise. Do it!

Cooking and culture combined - highly recommended. What a great day. We were collected from our accommodation in private transport at 8:30am and taken to the local market where we met up with the others in our class. In the tour of the market, Made showed us a selection of local foods, spices and materials for Hindu offerings (a big thing in Bali) and explained their uses. We were then taken to a rural rice padi (Bali is covered in them) where the growing, processing and the use of rice were explained.After the market and rice padi visits, we were taken to the home of Wayan and Puspa where, aided by a gang of friendly and competent local people, we learned (hands-on) not only how to prepare 8 Balinese dishes, but about the intricacies of Balinese family life and living.The group comprised about 16 people, mostly couples, of all ages and several nationalities. Vegetarians, vegans and those with allergies were meticulously catered for and their experience was not diminished in any way. We availed ourselves of the cold Bintang, available at an additional but reasonable cost.After the cooking, to which everyone contributed, the group sat down to the biggest and best Bailnese feast of our visit.All in all, the day exceeded our expectations significantly. Highly recommended.

A cultural experience. This was a great day that involved the option of attending a local market and seeing rice paddy fields and then making our way to a local home where we were warmly welcomed with refreshing drinks and lots of interesting stories and information about Balinese family life and culture. We then cooked together as a team to produce 8 amazing meals with the expert guidance of the staff members. We left with full bellies and eagerness to cook the same meals for our friends and family back home! Over all an awesome experience! Highly recommend.
Amazing time!. This was such a great day filled with culture, humour, friendships and AMAZING food! The best day out in in Bali- totally recommend. :D :D :D

Great look into Culture & Real Bali. This was a great day. We attended with ouyr mother, and we all enjopyed it immensly. It is an excellent way to see Ubud, and get away from the tourist Bali. The market tour was excellent, and taught us alot about the way they cook, cooking in their daily lives and how villiages live. The rice paddy visit was worthwhile, as it again gave us a look into the real Bali, and how the people live and work. The cooking class itself was excellent, and as hands on as one can expect from a tourist class like this. Although you dont get to cook the whole meal youself (As this was be way too time consuming) we got to cook enough to understand the ingredients, and cooking culture in this beautiful country. Wayan and Puspa were so welcoming, and also taught us how Balinese families coexist within the one home. It is also a great way to meet people from other countries and hear their experience of Bali. A great, value for money day- highly recommended to all.

FANTASTIC!!!!!. My friend and I visited Wayan and Puspas home whilst in Ubud. We were immediately made feel part of their family. They are the funniest couple. I am not a fantastic cook, however my friend is. The class was amazing. Very well organised and run. Very hands on. The visit to the market and rice field prior to the class was terrific. This was my 20th trip to Bali and first cooking class and I am so glad I did it. I have even cooked the food since being home and it was yummo.... Fantastic day cooking, learning about the daily lives of the locals and also meeting lovely people from all over the globe. A must do and a bargain at $35... Once the class was done we were ready to leave so Wayan grabbed his car keys and dropped us back to hotel. Nothing worse than having to wait around for agers to get home. Thanks Wayan and Puspa for a memorable day in Ubud. Loved it. xx

Delightful discovery in Ubud. Puspa and her husband, Wayan,together with their team of ever helpful and knowledgeable staff, organised a well thought-out, thoroughly enjoyable programme. Coming from Singapore and making our 5th visit to Bali, we at first thought the programme would most benefit people living outside Southeast Asia. We booked the programme to introduce our friends from Seattle to Balinese cuisine. We came away very impressed with the knowledge that was shared within the grounds of Puspa's and Wayan's beautiful family compound and treasured the opportunity to participate in hands-on food preparation and cooking. We also met many participants from various countries with whom we had great fun learning and prepping our Balinese feast. We cannot recommend this programme enough. Thank you to Puspa and Wayan for your hospitality.

Memorable experience in Ubud . This is definitely a must-do activity in Bali. Delicious food, great hosts, Balinese tradition & great authentic surroundings. I'm super impressed with the great hospitality and you have to simply embrace the friendly way of mr Wayan and mrs Puspa. Not only includes this offer convenient pick up and drop off, the driver also shows you the rice fields on the way to the Paon Bali location. Thank you for this wonderful afternoon.

a cultural experience. Enjoy a trip into a small village near to Ubud. We chose the afternoon session, as we didn't want to do the morning market tour. You will be welcomed as friends. The dishes you cook are so do-able once back home. I've done other classes in Bali, but this one is actually held in a beautiful family compound. Wonderful. A great thing to do in Bali.

Great Introduction to Balinese Cuisine. We booked the class based on a friend's recommendation and we were not disappointed! The class was so well organized from the pickup from our hotel (which located in Seminyak at 1 hour drive away) to the morning market tour, the paddy field tour by Puspa's husband Wayan and finally to Puspa's home where all the action happen. Puspa walk with us explaining each dishes that was to be cooked and the traditional method in making certain dishes. I love how the traditional method of preparing food are being preserved in the Balinese kitchen till this day. The kitchen are well kept and the ingredients are so fresh. There were a group of 13 of us and each of us were given a job to do, be it chopping or slicing or frying, no one was left without a task which is good as I would want to be able to hands on rather than watch a demo. The lunch was absolutely delicious! Each dishes gives you a different taste of spices used and it's not too spicy either for those who cannot take spicy food. Thank you Puspa & Wayan and your lovely team for the great experience. Definitely come back again!

Informative day. Great learning to cook "raw" .
Buying the fresh produce
The hosts were on the ball
Clean and efficient

Best part of our trip!. My fiance and I booked a day to do the Paon Cooking Class and It was the best thing we could have chosen to do. Highly recommended. The food was absolutely delicious and it was great to be a part of every process, every step of the way.
MUST do in Ubud!!! We absolutely loved every minute of it :)

Must do while in Ubud!!. It is easy to concur with the other five star raters... Wow!! SO GLAD we did this class and what an experience, great learning, great company (shout out to Colin and Jen and happy birthday Colin!) awesome food and a brilliant night! If deciding what to do while in Ubud or anywhere within driving distance, you must do this course. It seemed like we fit so much into the time and what an amazing loving couple to learn Balinese cooking from.. Go and experience it for yourself, you will not be disappointed! A brilliant experience as part of our honeymoon!

Amazing food, cooking made easy!. I am the first to admit my culinary skills are not the best but the way the cooks teach you makes things a lot less daunting! It was very interesting to use traditional methods to cook a hearty meal, the ingredients are fresh (we picked the herbs there and then from the garden!) and the end result (the meal) was fabulous!

All that you would want it to be!. Surprise, surprise but for my 'BIG' birthday i asked to go on a Balinese cooking course. Jen dutifully obliged with a session with Wayan and, of course, Puspa at Paon Bali. The reviews looked too good to be true but, do you know, it was everything that I could have wished for. The arrangements to pick us up were easy and Wayan (not Puspa's husband) brought his vehicle. One other couple in our vehicle, Pippa and Tama, and we were off. Not, as we thought, straight to the course, but to stop at the side of the road for a lesson on rice and life in a Balinese village by Wayan (Puspa's husband)Then to Paon with a bunch of others and a welcome by Puspa and her girls. More Details of Balinese village life and we begin. Demonstrate and let us do it was the order of the day. It worked, we started our engines, swapped places with our 'honies' and cooked each part of each course. I need say no more than every morsel was delicious and to think we had done it all. Bintang was available for those who wanted it and a full recipe set was provided. Puspa and Wayan could not have been more helpful, entertaining or hospitable. Everyone came away full and enthused. I certainly will be following the simple recipes to prepare a Balinese feast from starter to dessert. Do not miss this, even if cooking is not your thing. It is a must!

Do yourself a flavor and check this out.... What a great night. We really wanted to do the day trip and have the market experience but it was booked out so we learned another thing, when an attraction is as good as this, book early. We did get to do the evening cooking class and I can't imagine that we really missed out on anything. We had a fantastic evening. Wayan and Puspa put on a great night. I thought that we were going to educated on Bali Cooking, and we did, we also got educated on how to have a happy life and the Balinese way of having a happy home.I observed the ingredients, preparation and cooking from the perspective of someone who really likes to cook authentic food and I feel really enlightened on how to make Balinese food the easy way with ingredients I can get from an asian food market, or even the local supermarket.The way that Paon have set up the hands on cooking was so impressive. Their very friendly staff were so well trained and skilled in what they did, everything was run like clock work in a completely Bali time relaxed way. This is well worth every cent and more, we met cool people, helped cook and eat fantastic food, and I feel closer to Bali than I ever did sitting on a beach, eating at a bar or scootering through stacked up traffic. This evening has been the best Bali bang for buck.

Fun, informative and tasty!!. Me and my partner decided to do the paon cooking class after hearing some great reviews. It was our last day in Bali and we are so glad we went! Not only did we learn about Balinese food and culture we had such a fun time, puspa and wayan were great hosts and extremely welcoming into their home. For such a cheap price you get so much! Transport to and from class, Market tour, informative trip to the rice fields, class and feast! Food was amazing! Only thing I could say would be to reduce the class sizes, we had 17 but lucky we had such a good bunch of people :)

Great fun. The best way to enjoy traditional food is by joining this cooking class. We went for the afternoon session starting at 4pm, it is such a great service that they send a driver to collect you from your hotel. Aunty Puspa and her husband are real comedians and keep you entertained during the class. It is very proactive and you get a chance to have a go at making several different dishes which you can enjoy at dinner time. The whole experience was with strangers but by the time we sat down to eat we felt like a family. A must-do when visiting Ubud, you will have lots of fun and enjoy some delicious traditional food.

Perfect way to experience local food. The day was all very well organised. We were picked up from our hotel and taken into the local market for a short tour. We then visited the rice paddies where they explained to us how the farming works. It was then on to the chefs home where you learn all about the ingredients and how to cook them before getting to eat your creations.All very interesting and informative.

Great experience. This is my second trip to Ubud and have decided to join a cooking class. Paon Bali Cooking class is just what I thought it should be, great fun and learnt some cooking tips that I can't wait to put into practice once I get home. Puspa is full of fun and showed us the ease on how to cook Balinese food. We enjoyed a 3 course meal (the food we cooked) and I must say that it is comparable to any first rate Balinese restaurant, so yummy!

great way to experience balinese cuisine. This is my second time doing this class and the second time was even better then the first . Would recommend to anyone wanting to experience balinese cooking .

Clean, fresh and cheap. This was an awesome experience, our hosts were so funny but very knowledgable. Everyone had a turn at doing the prep. In the end, the food was amazing. Can't wait to try this at home

Wayan and Puspa, great ppl to meet. This is belated, but paon bali deserves praise for not only providing us with he best cooking class we have experienced on our travels, but the hosts were also characters to meet. Wayan and Puspa were most sincere and fun loving and that made the cooking class so much more enjoyable. Do not expect just a class, but expect to have fun with these 2 ppl. We mentioned in a note at registration that our trip was to celebrate my gf's birthday, and to our surprise, paon bali prepared a birthday cake and the staff came out to sing a birthday song for her. Having already eaten so much good food after the cooking class, we were not able to stomach more cake, but wayan and puspa's hospitality totally made our visit a great experience.

Best cooking class. My partner and I are from NZ. We were lucky to be referred here by a fellow hotel member, who had already been earlier in the week. The price is small in comparrison to the variety of experiences gained. Enjoy new experiences at the local market and stunning views at rice fields. Wayan and Puspa were most accommodating and welcoming in their home, the laughs shared and the techniques taught are gifts I'll always rremember. The food was plentiful and delicious we highly recommend this activity. Thank you Puspa you were such a lovely host.

Great day!!!!. Loved every bit of this class!! From the informative market tour to the cooking itself!! Everything was professional, easy to understand, clean and the food was delicious!!! Highly recommended!!!

Great way to spend half a day. My wife and I went to Paon Bali after a friend had recommended it. We found it to be excellent. The hosts were friendly and knowledgable, transport on time and the cooking component fun. Reading the lower rated reviews on here, several had commented that 'it is not a real cooking class'.We had about 15 people in our group and everyone got to do a reasonable amount of cooking/prep. The recipe for the base yellow sauce and peanut sauce will be invaluable…the yellow sauce forms the base for a lot of Balinese cuisine. For a half day, group booking, for $35 I am not sure what these other people expected. The trip to the market and rice fields were interesting and I did not find them too long…about half an hour in each. We were never made to feel like we had to purchase anything extra. If you're in Ubud and enjoy cooking, you must do this.
Best cooking class!!. You absolutely must do this cooking class!!!!…the food is unbelievably delicious!! Now we have the secret Balinese recipes to take back home with us!!

Wonderful experience with lovers of food!. Puspa was a fantastic host and teacher. The market tour to begin the day was quite the experience and I loved every moment. Tasting the different fruits and being looked after by Made was fantastic. Everyone was lovely and friendly. Holding the classes at the family's home was also beautiful and getting to know our hosts was very welcoming.Everyone had a go at different chopping and cooking styles and we got the recipes to come home with. I will definitely be giving them a go. A beautiful experience

HEARTFELT EXPERIENCE. The family that runs the class is AWESOME. They speak from their hearts and truly make you feel like a part of their family. Delicious food- the best we've had in Bali. So much fun. The best thing we've done on the 5 days we've been here so far. Highly recommended.

Great experience. I joined this class alone, and as mostly australian and others who can speak English fluently, I felt like I am taking a cooking class and English class at the same time, which was great experience for me.Everyone was so friendly and I felt like i was at home. As i was pregnant, they cared about me a lot, so i wasn't feel any uncomfortable. I could learn not only Balinese traditional cousin but also culture.Even if you are not interested in cooking, you probably can enjoy it as long as you like eating!!
Excellent experience!!. Loved this afternoon with Auntie Puspa!! This was the most hands on class and the food was all delicious! I would do this class again if we return to Bali!

A must do while in Bali - couldn't recommend more highly !!. What can I say, we had such an awesome morning with Aunty Puspa and along with the laughs and meeting some wonderful people, we both learnt how to prepare and cook authentic Balinese.The morning started with a complimentary pick up from our Ubud hotel for a quick tour of the markets, as this is done late in the morning all the locals have been and gone and don't be put off by the meat you see .. Paon use their own local suppliers .. a quick visit to a rice field then it's off to meet Aunty Puspa in her family compound.What a character, we had so many laughs while learning about how a traditional family compound is set up and operates before all getting stuck into learning about the various ingredients and spices (including what replacements can be used if you can't find the ingredients locally) and then each playing an active role in preparing and cooking our meals.This was a fantastic morning, everyone should try and do this while in Bali.

Loved every minute of it. This was a great day, with great food and company. You don't have to be a good cook to do this class. It's a very social day. Auntie puspa is a great teacher as well as all the staff that are there. Next year we will be booking a private class with 30 of our friends and family to give them a taste of the real Bali.

Best spent $35 in Ubud, Worth every penny!. Reading the raving reviews, we had to try it out. We were picked up at out resort at no extra cost, and they were punctual, arriving 8:15 on the dot. We had a market your which was a bit of a culture shock, but our guide was excellent. We arrived at the house of puspa, our host, and I honestly don't know where the time went. She was an excellent host, friendly, entertaining, knowledgable, and sweet. The cooking class was very hands on, and there were 20-25 people joining in on the activity.
