Despite the number, not once did I think the group was too large, and everyone received individual attention. We met and got to know some great people, and the atmosphere was friendly. The food at the end was sensational, and I can't wait to go back home and try it myself. When it was time to pay, we realised we didn't have any bali rupees. Not one to be so disorganised, but it was honest miscalculation. We asked Puspa if we could pay in Australian dollars, and all was fine. We left an extra tip because we were genuinely grateful. If you are considering trying this out, just do it! You won't regret it. There is a reason for all the great reviews. Thank you for a great experience.

Absolutely fantastic !!! We Highly recommend... I have done a cooking class before but this was truly fantastic. We were taken to the local markets and rice fields and then to their house where we all prepared and cooked in the outdoor kitchen. Everything was truly amazing and they were so welcoming.

Fabulous! Fantastic!. This was a wonderful experience, from the minute I was picked up from my hotel until the end of the day. We were taken through the market by a very knowledgeable guide, then to the rice fields for an explanation of the different kids of rice and finally to Puspa and Wayan's home in Laplaplan Village. We were met by beautifully dressed girls serving icy cold lemon juice which we drank while Wayan and Puspa explained things to us. Then it was on with the cooking - and although there were 18 in my group, we all got to do everything. Then we ate the food - heavenly!!! I am vegetarian and was the only one in the group, but Puspa adapted all the recipes for me. We left at the end of the day with our cookbooks. This is the very best cooking school in Bali - I've been to Bali 15 times now so I have heaps of experience. Don't miss it.

Cooking class?u sure?. Me and my girlfriend took the morning class a few days ago.what can I say about it.We started our day with almost an hour wait on the street waiting for somebody to pick us up. Seeing the market was quite interesting and also the rice fields later on.But when we arrived to the house to start our cooking class things started to speed up. We had a brief explanation of the ingridiants and than we started to cook.or so i thought we would. Since there was more than 15 of us we had to take turns making the preparations and than cooking. You were not able to see or try all of the things ,procedure etc.Than we ate what we cooked and the host quickly made the dessert.We were given complimentary drinks that we had to finish in the car because we were told to leave.probablly because of the afternoon class they also have.This class is nothing more than a money making machine. And to mention that we both got sick like an hour later and that really ruined our stay in ubud for the next two days.Please dont be fouled in taking this class because it feals more like playing around the kitchen.Save your money and pick something else.

Highly recommend. Really enjoyed my day - wayan and puspa are very nice hosts who are friendly and down to earth. It was all very well run - excellent hands on, and a great variety of dishes. The food cooked was so delicious and relatively easy to make. It wasn't just all about cooking - it was nice to be invited to their family home to learn a little bit about Balinese culture and life. They made everything so easy even with special requests for recipes. No wonder there were people in the group who were returning and also bringing their friends. I will too in the future. Thank you for a lovely time - you and your team are deserving of all the great praise for your hardwork in letting us in on same great dishes! Well done.

Wonderful day. My wife, daughter and myself all agreed this is a must do when you visit Bali. The tour of the local market gave us an indication of the marvelous fruits and vegetables available in Balinese cooking. On the way to the cooking class we were given an informative explanation of the workings of a ricefield and how this fits into village life. When we arrived for our cooking class we were made welcomed and felt at ease from the start. The cooking class was expertly carried out by Puspa and her helpers. We cooked eight dishes and they were all fantastic. Loved the tips Puspa provided for alternative ingredients that may not have been available in Australia. The recipe book we were given at the end was easy to follow and I have made two of these dishes since returning home with rave reviews from family and friends. Highly recommend .

Great experience. If you think about doing it, just do it. Great market and ricefield tour. After this we arrived in the house an prepared lot of dishes on ower own. The personal gave us some instructions but we did the whole work in pairs of 2 people. After the preparation, the food was put together to gain a large buffet. Was the best Indonesian food I ate until now. Thanks for the great hospitality and the introduction in Indonesian cusin.

Fantastic Family. Recently attended my first ever cooking class in Bali - and I absolutely loved it.Keeping true to the Balinese culture, by letting us into their village, their home and their gorgeous nature - to highlighting the delicious cuisine.Highly recommend this to any "i burn toast" type of person, to a qualified chef. Puspa presents effortlessly and with a smile.So welcoming!

Lives up to the hype. flawless experience, great food, Wayan and Puspaw are amazing hosts/instructors, make you feel so welcome in their home- such beautiful, friendly people! Will definitely recommend for friends and go again next trip. A must do experience folks!

just as good as everyone says!. easily followed recipes - including all the basicsjoin in as much as you want - no-one is left out and everyone has funall food restrictions seem catered for and the final meal is amazing - first the table groaning with food, and then us! Printed recipes, extra tips, and introduction into Balinese life and all the bintangs you need- what an evening ( I hear the lunch class is even better with visit to the markets first)A big thank you to Puspa and Wayan

Hospitality at it's finest. They run a tight ship, and what a relief that they do. No time was wasted, and everything and everyone had a purpose. I really liked that they picked up everyone from their location in small groups, so we could tour the market in an intimate setting and get 1:1 time with the guide. Stopping off in the rice patties also was a real treat, it was our first time seeing them close up and also enabled us to tick it off our list so we didn't have to make a separate trip. Puspa and her husband were adorable, and the information they offered about families in Bali is one that stuck with both me and my friend - don't go to bed with problems, talk about them before going to sleep so you wake up worry free. Also, the variety of food we made was a treat! The menu was so varied everyone can find something that they like, they cater for allergies and the free water throughout was so appreciated. Even $15K Bintangs were cheaper than the grocery store!

Paon is definitely the best cooking class. Have now tried a few in Bali and Paon is the best. Have been there 4 times now and each time it's been great, learn something new each time. It's clean, they offer great value ($35) and not just cooking. Market tour, then rice paddy, then home to get an overview of Bali family life and finally cooking. Wayan is great his explanation of the home, the temples etc is very good and puspa is fantastic in the kitchen. Best food I ate this trip, well worth the money. Would go again for sure.

Paon Cooking Classes. There were 7 of us on this tour ages ranging from 12 to 72. We all thoroughly enjoyed every part of this day.Extremely clean and well organised .Not to mention the yummy food we prepared.We left our hotel in Legian about 7.30am and returned about 3.00pmA big thank you to all involved, Well worth every cent we paid.

Must do !. It was absolutely amazing, loved every minute of it! It's so easy and so much fun.highly recommend it even if you normally don't cook or a bit unsure , you will be surprised how easy it is to crate those amazing dishes with a little bit of help also in fluent English which amassed us.It was one of my highlights on our bali trip !

Absolutely fantastic!. We booked on the strength of the trip advisor reviews, and we were not disappointed.From the moment you are picked up, you are treated like family. It was a fairly large class, but at no point did you feel forgotten or left out, all the staff are there to make your day perfect, and they don't fail.The food was amazing, and there is almost too much food, so you won't leave hungry. Plenty of dishes for vegetarians and meat eaters.The couple who run the show are first class comedy gold, and it really matters that they receive any positive or negative feedback, as you can sense the passion they have for the course.It will be very hard to find a better cooking class anywhere. Go for it!

Tempe Me Goreng. Following a recommendation from a family friend, my partner and I recently participated in Paon Bali's Cooking Class. Our hosts were extremely charismatic, spoke fluent english and highly informative. It was interesting to gain insight into Balinese culture and Hinduism. The produce was fresh and the communal cooking experience ensured that we each got to taste a variety of dishes. Our highlight dishes were the Clear Mushroom and Vegetable Soup and the Tempe Me Goreng, delicious! Thank you Wayan and Puspa for welcoming us into your home.

Just came back from Paon Bali Cooking Class. Amazing!. This is a must in your "to do" list when visiting Ubud. Our teacher and hostess Ibu (Mrs.) Puspa was welcoming and proud to teach my wife and I about each ingredient we will use fresh from her own garden. We cooked 8 different dishes. After we ate our food Ibu Puspa was very kind to explain the meaning of each building in her house. One of the highlights of our Honeymoon!

Good value and delicious food. For the price, you definitely can't beat it! All of the food was really delicious. The only downside is that sometimes, the class seemed to drag on a bit, but given the value, I didn't really mind too much!

A fantastic insight into Balinese Culture and Cuisine!. This is a must-do!!! We were staying in Ubud, only a few minutes from the cooking class. Although I would travel a lot further to have this experience!!! I learnt so much about traditional Balinese culture that was very interesting. The husband and wife that own the cooking class were extremely friendly, welcoming and hilarious!! All of the guests were welcomed into their home and we learnt a lot about the meaning of all of the buildings in a Balinese home and different aspects of their culture. There was a fantastic and delicious variety of Indonesian dishes that we cooked together. It was a lot of fun and great value for money... I'm so glad we got to do it whilst we were in Ubud! :)

A must do attraction, friendly guides and amazing food!!. A wonderful must do experience which is amazing value for money. I recently attended a morning cooking class which exceeded my expectations! Learnt so much about Balinese culture and life through the market tour and seeing the rice paddys before heading to the family home for cooking! Food was traditional and delicious! Catered to any allergies that participants may have had. This is a must experience for anyone, a thoroughly enjoyable day out!! Aunty is a friendly and entertaining character which made the experience all the better!!

I do love this cooking class!. It was so awesome. I and my husband had a great experience at Paon. Puspa, the instructor is a perfect hostess and teacher at the same time. Market tour was a very detailed and informative.

Fantastic experience!. We took part in the cooking class as part of our honeymoon trip. We were staying in Nusa Dua, which is about a 45 min drive away, but for an additional cost they sent a car to pick us up and take us back after. It was great to see the traditional market with the wide array of colourful fruits and vegetables. Back at their house, we received a warm welcome with a much needed ice cold drink! We all got to prepare the ingredients for the 8 courses we would cook and then eat. There were about 20 people in our group and we all got involved in all the processes. Once cooked, we sat down together to eat the delicious traditional Balinese food. Everyone gets a booklet of the recipes to take away, and we will definitely be attempting to make the dishes back home! We can't recommend it highly enough!

Excellent way to enjoy Balinese culture. We participated in this cooking class from chopping vegetables to blending ingredients in a large mortar with pestel to sautéing the ingredients add adding the sauces that make the delicious end product. Paon Bali was great for accommodating dietary restrictions and when I began to feel unwell, I even received a traditional aromatic foot rub. I highly recommend this to anyone visiting Bali. If your kitchen skills are lacking, no need to worry as the cooking is easy and able staff are ready to instruct and assist!

A truly amazing Balinese culinary and cultural experience. The day started off with a visit to the bright and bustling food markets and some rice paddy fields, the guide explaining the Balinese culture and offerings and the way the rice is harvested. We then began preparations, cooking from scratch and learning the traditional methods of grinding ingredients to make a sauce or paste. The result - absolutely beautiful food! The freshness and quality of flavour in the food was fantastic. Overall it was a truly amazing Balinese culinary and cultural experience. (Make sure you bring your camera so you can take pictures of the delicious food!)

Fantastic family feasting.. A fantastic experience. The market tour through to the final self-made feast was well organised, fun and informative. There was lots to do and the whole family from grandparents to our ten year old had a great time. We will definitely pass on the recommendation given to us on this gem of an activity/class.

Very well organized. Very well organized, entertaining hosts, great food! The hands-on part was in our opinion completely adequate, considering that this is a relatively short course. Despite having 20 people in our class, we all got to try each task. Hygiene and food safety was clearly a priority, a good thing to know. You get a copy of the recipes; will definitely try the 'tempe me goreng' at home.

Great cooking fantastic food. Paswa and her husband are great hosts Have done this cooking class twice once with my friends enjoyed it so much had to take my Daughter and family to do it every think is so clean could not fault a thing the food is amazing and Paswa was so easy to understand as i had done the class before Paswa changed part of the menu for me even though i told her it was fine i was happy to do the same menu will be doing it again in August with some moor friends think everyone should try this cooking class thank you for a great day

Great Cooking, Great Fun.. While staying at Samara Villas, they recommended this Cookery School. It was one of the most fun and interesting days out while in Ubud. From start to finish you are learning about culture, ingredients and the Balinese style of cooking. Everything is cooked by the class and enjoyed by all over a few beers at the end. The owners are so much fun and while I attended the class on my own, I soon made friends with people from all over the world. This is a very well run and organized cooking experience and I would strongly recommend it to anyone from beginner to experienced cook.

Great cooking experience. My husband and I did this class as we have always wanted to do one. Puswa and her husband were so warm and welcoming. We thoroughly enjoyed our cooking experience with them. We learnt how to make the food from scratch and it tasted delicious. We will definitely be back again one day. Thank you Puswa and team on a great day.

Cooking class with soul and Balinese charm.. We were picked up at our hotel and driven to the morning market in Ubud where we saw the various Balinese fruits and other specialties.Wayan welcomed us in the rice fields where he with great knowledge told about rice and how rice is grown.In Paon Bali we were welcomed by Wayan wife Puspa who with just as much knowledge and pasion led us into the Balinese cuisine.In approximately 4 hours (plus the time on the market) we made an 8 course Balinese dinner it was fun and cozy.We can only give our best recommendations and hope that others will want to try out in the Balinese cuisine.Lisbeth & Ronnie

Personal, fun and really interesting. My boyfriend and I did this course whilst staying a few days in Ubud. A friend had recommended it to us and I'm so glad they did! It started with an 8:15am pick up at our accommodation in Ubud. The driver was friendly and took us to the local market in Ubud where we met Puspa. She took us on an interesting tour of the food market explains things like the local fruit, veg etc. it was great to learn a little more about the ingredients we would be using (we got to try some delicious fruit too). We then drove to the rice paddies where her husband, Wayan, explained about the rice production. Then we headed to their house for the cooking. Firstly she explained about the Balinese household and it was good to get an understanding of this culture at home. We then had an intro into the cooking - we were going to cook eight courses! We all got involved in the cooking - not just watching someone do this.... There were 13 of us on the course but it didn't feel over crowded and we all had jobs to do and felt part of it. The food was all authentic Balinese and it was satisfying to eat lunch knowing we'd cooked this ourselves! Our hosts were really lovely, explained everything well and spoke great English. It was very clean and hygienic too. They provided free water and a welcome drink as well as tea and coffee. You could also buy beer to have with lunch. We finished around 2pm feeling very full after so much food!Highly recommended - just do it!

Great cooking class. We booked this cooking class last minute and we are so happy that we did! The couple is really really nice and she is great cook and teacher! The guided walk through the market was defenitly a plus point and the food that we cooked was absolutely delicious! Great overall experience! This is the place to go if you want to learn how to cook balinese dishes :)

Great program!. We had a great experience, cooked the signature balinese dishes, wonderful hands on learning. Very pleasant staff, great family and explanation of a Balinese traditional house. Good demonstrations of traditional methods of "blending", steaming, and grilling. We had a late pickup but not the end of the world. Highly recommend!
Excellent program. Every steps and stage are perfectly planned and executed. Definately it is worthy to join.

Culinary and cultural experience. Lovely combination of a culinary and cultural experience. Visit to the fresh market was very interesting. Our market guide (Wayan?) taught us a lot about the tradition of offerings as well as local produce. Wayan of the cooking school welcomed us at the rice fields to tell us about the local tradition of rice harvesting and the importance of the community. The cooking course itself was in the private home of Wayan and his wife Puspa, the chef. Learned so much about family traditions and "Balinese family homes". The cooking course itself was great. 8 different dishes, all easy to replicate at home. Simple, yet delicious. Puspa is great as a teacher and has a lovely bubbling personality. Unlike other cooking courses we all worked together creating the dishes, instead of everyone preparing their own dish and plate. Got insight in the traditional ways of cooking (eg. fire stove, and "blender"). Afterwards we enjoyed all the dishes together at lunchtime. Friendly welcoming staff, clean kitchen/amenities, cultural aspect and delicious food. Highly recommended.
Excellent day. We learned a ton of stuff, and ate like Balines kings! The hosts are amazing, and the activities fun. paon is a well-oiled machine, and they are very good at what they are doing

Good class :). It was great, we met wayan at ubud palace right in time. The market tour was very interesting. It was neat to visit a Balinese home as well. The cooking class itself was fun, not too intense. They gave the recipes so that we could try at home. There were about ten people which was perfect!

Best thing we did in Ubud. Wife and I took this class on our honeymoon and loved it. Puspa and Wayan, the couple who run the class are great, funny and warm people. they take you to their family home in a small village called Laplapan just outside of Ubud. But first to the Ubud market and the rice paddy outside their home to explain the ingredients, and Balinese culture. It's really a window into traditional Balinese family cooking more so than just a class about preparing food. The end product is a meal that was probably the very best we had in all of Bali. We were also very impressed with how professional this small family run operation is. Everything ran right on time, and is very well organized. You may not get to participate in every aspect of the meals preparation - there were about 12 in our group - but if you pay attention you'll learn how everything is made and they give a recipe book at the end of class for you to take home. I will say that if you can skip the trip to the market, you should. It smells rank with trash and most of the ingredients you see there are not used in the class. If your interested in the market better to go on your own for a quick walk through. I've traveled around the world and seen many local markets and this was probably the least impressive and worst smelling one I've seen.

Entertaining and Delicious!. A truly entertaining and delicious cooking adventure in Ubud! We started the tour at 8:30AM with a group of 7 people exploring the open market of Ubud, learning about the different spices and tasting the various fruits used in Balinese cooking. Our guide and owner, Puspa, was charming and entertaining which made the tour even more special. Along the way, my wife purchased some cute beaded purses for her friends ;)We met up with the rest of group at the rice fields in Ubud for a quick lesson on the rice growing process, and retreated to Puspa's villa thereafter where the real fun began. We were greeted with a ice cold refreshment of lime juice, and given a little background on the typical Balinese home. All hands on in the cooking class! We learned to make the traditional peanut sauce used in many Balinese dishes including chicken satay, curry, tempeh, goda goda to name a few. Please do not hesitate to request a dish or item you want to make. I wanted to learn to make sambal matah which is a spicy sauce seen on many Balinese tables. Puspa was kind enough to give me the recipe at the end of the cooking class.The best part of the class was tasting the finished dishes in an awesome setting overlooking the valleys of Ubud! Amazingly delicious! Don't be afraid to ask for a Bintang or two which was offered during the class! Puspa's Paon Bali cooking class is a must try when visiting Bali!

Excellent!. What a great outing! We enjoyed everything they had to offer. The market tour, the rice field tour, and the cooking class all come together very nicely. The hosts are very good at what they do, and everything happens very smoothly! Two thumbs way waaay up!

Absolutly Awesome. The day was great we had a group 15 people picked up from our hotel and taken to the markets the guide was very good ,Wayan and Puspa were great they welcomed us into there home with a beautiful and refreshing drink, Puspa and her team made everything easy and enjoyable .The food was awesome and there was plenty of it . Looking forward d to trying all the meals at home

Wonderful people, wonderful food and skills to take home.. Our day could not have been better. Wayan and Puspa were warm and engaging hosts who made everyone feel at home and relaxed. The market visit was very informative and the ongoing conversations about family life and culture were fascinating. The hands on nature of the cooking class really made you feel as if these skills could easily be applied at home. Puspa was conscious ofthe fact that certain ingredients may not always be available and always provided suggestions for substitution. All in all a great day.

Fabulous cooking class. Great day with Wayan and Pupsa. Food just delicious, very interactive session that soon had everyone from a very diverse group joining in. Can't wait to go home with my recipe book and cook the banana and jackfruit dessert!

A wonderful day full of flavour and a little spice. One of the best days and experiences in Bali. Humorous, educational and a meal worthy of the reputation. We were recommended by friends and today's cooking class and cultural experience was outstanding. Hosts made it fun and easy to understand. They generously took us into their Ubud home and made us feel very welcome We feel well equipped to do a dinner party at home and will enjoy sharing our experience with friends. A 10/10.

Amazing, well organised, friendly experience!. What an amazing day! I went with 3 friends and the markets were really interesting and our guide was lovely and funny. Explanations and information about the markets and rice paddy fields were great. Wayan and Puspa are such lovely, warm, welcoming and funny people and made us feel very welcome in their home. The class was lots of fun, really easy and the food was delicious! Would definitely recommend this class to anyone looking for a fun, authentic Balinese cooking experience.

Definitely an awesome experience. After reading other reviews on TA, we decided to book the Paon Cooking Class - we have done other classes in Bali, and so happy that we chose to do the Paon. Wayan & Puspa welcomed us into their home - and kept us entertained throughout the morning. We were collected from our hotel and arrived at the Ubud markets, where we shown the ingredients used in the cooking. From here we were taken to the rice paddies, not far from their home and then the fun started! Besides the fact that the cooking you do is simply delicious, the whole experience was fun and informative. We have already returned home and cooked some of the wonderful food that we experienced in your home. I would definitely rate this as a "must do" if you are in Ubud. Thank you again to Wayan & Puspa!

Amazing , food lover don't miss. amazing time today at paon cooking , learn a lot on how to cook traditional food , you cook it yourself and then eat everything , really nice people who make you feel really welcome and for the experience this is really cheap .Thank you again aunte Puspa wish you all the best.Steeve and weena

Id recommend this to anyone. Great class and fantastic food. The hostess is warm and engaging and full of tips for producing delicious Balinese food. The whole thing is well organised and informative and great value.

Fantastic Experience. Without a doubt, this was the best cooking class I have ever been a part of. They took us to the market to see and taste the fresh produce we would be using then shuttled us up to rice fields near their home. The warm and welcoming hosts were very courteous and were great teachers. The whole day was very well organized; probably the best organized activity in 8 months traveling SE Asia. The drivers were on time, the staff had everything prepared, and all was cleaned up by the time we all left. It was quite impressive. I cant wait to get back home to try to make all of these dishes on my own.
great class. it was a great day with some yummy food that we made, there was a few people in the class but we all managed to give everything a go i'd recommend this class to anyone

Brilliant day with amazing hosts! . Paon Bali is a wonderful experience for thosr wanting to learn more about Balinese food and life. Puspa and Wayan are warm and funny hosts, and the added touches like explanations of the rice fields and family home make the day more special. The food we helped prepare was the best I've eaten in Bali! I've done several cooking classes whilst travelling SE Asia and this has been a favourite. Only thing worth noting, it is less 'hands on' than other classes, the group share tasks rather than complete them. Its not a negative, by any means! Thank you Wayan and Puspa!!

A mesmerizing experience!!!. Being a food-consultant (www.cookingwithsj.com) for long years, this was the best gift I can ever expect! Hubby surprised me with this booking on Valentine's Day and never knew it was going to be one of the most memorable day... This absolutely wonderful couple made it a fun-filled cooking session! Explaining their culture-food-family, taking us on a trip to local market, giving insights of rice fields & yearly crop... Everything was just so perfect!!! Can't thank them enough for that experience to remember for life... :)

My Birthday Treat. Aunty Puspa invited us into her home and made us feel like we were really part of her family. Delicious menu, a good variety of dishes to cook. As it was my birthday, they bought me a cake and the whole team sang happy birthday to me. it was such a great day! Get involved!

An experience to remember. I can't say enough good things about Paon Bali and the wonderful couple (and their extended family) who make it happen. If you want to gain an understanding of Balinese cuisine in an inviting environment, and to have an exquisite lunch to cap off the whole experience, you must take this class. You'll leave full, happy, and wishing you could stay.

Fantastic experience and delicious food. My girlfriends and I absolutely loved spending the day with wayan, Puspa and their family. Gaining an understanding of the local food, culture, environment and family life, and of course the cooking and eating the most delicious food! Highly recommend.

Exactly what the reviews are saying. After reading all the reviews, my expectations were high. I wouldn't call it a cooking class, it's an experience that definitely leaves you satisfied, entertained and full with delicious food. The most valuable part for me was an opportunity to step inside a Balinese house, to hear some stories of their daily life, to see how they grow rice, spices, make coconut oils and try to use the Balinese blender :) not sure how Puspa and Wayan manage to maintain this level of energy and enthusiasm every day, and also give the vibe to you. I was impressed with the number of kitchen supplies and space they have. The pots were constantly changed and cleaned, the ingredients were fresh and prepared to each of us for every dish. Not to mention the hand cloves and all the hand washing.You can do a cooking course in a lot of places in Ubud. I'm happy I chose Paon Bali. If you decide to join, make sure you make a reservation, they are often fully booked. People are coming from different parts of the island.

One of the best esperiences we had in Indonesia!. As you can read here, so many positive reviews. We agree with all of them:Guided visit at the market: 10/10 - Bring your camera!Rice field: 10/10 Cleanliness: 10/10 - Extremely well set up! Like you would do at home.Instructions: 10/10 - Well delivered! You even get printed recipes to take home! Options are also provided for alternate spices/vegetables if Indonesian products cannot be sourced when you get back home.Hospitality: 10/10 - You will learn about Bali culture and traditions.Caring: 10/10 - One of the participants arrived at the site not feeling so well, and they were treated like a family member, provided with a resting place.Fun factor: 10/10 - Great sense of humour!Taste: 10/10 - SSsssssssssssssssso good!A must do if you enjoy great food and want to do something you will remember forever.

great culinary adventure. I really recommended it. It was great experience for all of my family (children also). The atmosphere was so nice, the food delicious and we can see all the products, coconut -oil processing, culture, make the dishes and taste it. The laesson was very good organized and the cooker was so familiar for us.
Awesome class. Well worth the visit. Food was amazing. Cant wait to try it all at home. Teaching was fabulous and made very easy to understand. Would recommend to everyone
Wonderful cooking class. Great atmosphere, great people, great food, I really enjoyed it! Interesting visit at the market in the morning and on rice fields.
Wonderful experience. A highlight of our trip. It was so much fun and absolutely yummy food that we actually made. I would highly recommend a visit next time your in Bali

Excellent class. Really well organized and you got to learn a lot in a morning. The market visit for me was the highlight, learning about the ingredients and seeing parts of Ubud market that are tucked away.The food we learnt to cook was delicious, even better shared with fellow travelers after our hard work. Have practiced a few since I've returned and found them easy to replicate. Very enthusiastic teacher and professionally run school.
Wonderful!. The food was excellent, the teaching was excellent, the atmosphere was excellent. Definitely worth the money.

Friendly and delicious. "Auntie Puspa" delivers what you want in a cooking teacher...entertaining, well organized, friendly, and warm. The market visit is nice, their home is well laid out for a class of 15 or so, and the whole experience seamless and fun. The food is lovely - gado gado, yellow sauce curry, etc. Everyone there enjoyed themselves. And cheap at IDR 350k including two way transport.

Great experience. I have been to Bali many times and always ran out of time to organise a cooking school. I pre booked this one over the internet so that it was locked in much to my fiancé horror. He was very apprehensive as he doesn't love cooking like I do, although he does love the cooking I do, but he enjoyed going through the markets and was awed by the rice fields. Being a vegetarian he was worried about the impact this would have on what he could eat and prepare, but they catered to both him and another person in our group who had nut allergies so well that he was far more comfortable and dare I say, even enjoyed himself?? For me the class was a little basic however I loved the flavours and learning about their ingredients, and actually how similar they are to what I can find and use at home. The food was amazing and the communal dinning experience was really great to meet our fellow travellers. Overall a fantastic day.
Best food on Bali. Best cooking clas ever. Delicious food, wonderfull experience with great people. They'll even pick you up in your hotel.

Couldn't have been better!. Fantastic experience that made Balinese cooking seem like a breeze! Detailed explanation and it was pure fun! Highly recommended. Much as though my villa was quite out of place, I was picked up by Paon's transport. And being able to have a great dinner on what we had all prepared was all the fun!

Paon Bali Cooking Class. What a wonderful experience. Husband & Wife team who are the nicest funniest Balinese couple I've met. I was picked up at my hotel, taken to the market then back to the families home. There were 18 of us and we all loved the cooking class. What a great way to meet other people as I was travelling on my own. There were other singles like me and also couples. Even the husbands thoroughly enjoyed the day! The traditional balinese home and surroundings were beautiful (stunning)!. We learnt so much about Balinese cooking, talked and laughed. I highly recommend this class and from what I was told by the others who have done other cooking classes in Bali, this is the best one. Gotta check it out!

very well done. Hard to believe how much is packed into this half-day class: a market tour with fruit samples, a lesson in rice growing and balanise family life, a hands-on cooking lesson and a great meal. Everything is very entertaining, and like a great theatre performance, while you know all the lines were delivered 100s of time before, it has the energy as if it was the first time and done just for you. Although hands-on, we've been to classes that were more hands-on. Still really learned a lot, enjoyed the food and look forward to replicating many of the dishes at home.

fantastic way to see a bit of Balinese life. This is a superbly put together half day. Just enough time is spent in the market, the rice field and then in the kitchen. The staff are friendly and the food is really good! It's difficult to see how the day could be improved, heartily recommended. My girlfriend has a nut allergy but the chef was happy to create a substitute.

A remarkable day. Firstly, I would like to mention the great communication when booking the class. We had an early start from Seminyak with a cooking school arranged driver but it was a pleasant drive to Ubud markets where we met the other participants.A lot of thought has gone into planning the day which led to a seamless experience. I was interested in visiting the markets, the explanation of rice cultivation, cool and hot drinks were offered prior to the start of the class. The location is in a family compound on the outskirts of Ubud was simply amazing. The views into the forested valley from the cooking area were impressive. However, not to be out done the Balinese food was the highlight. Our teacher Puspa and her team were able to cater for the range of food issues and diets of our small group. A feat in itself from a person who didn't realize what needed to be catered for. I was impressed with the hygiene protocols and we were forever washing our hands.After cooking the seven dishes, meals were served in two large communal eating areas. For a small extra charge you could buy a Bintang beer to accompany the authentic, Balinese dishes cooked. I would say the food we cooked on the day was better than restaurant quality. Highly recommended for those who prefer a 'hands on' cooking experience rather than just watching. I have participated in many cooking classes within Asia and this ranks up to the top ones.

Must do in Ubud. I was really excited about this cooking class and it really met all my expectations and more. We are taken to traditional food markets and we were explained about all their herbs and spices etc. Then to their house to cook traditional indonesian cuisine. Very hands on and enjoyable day. A must do when you are in ubud. Very hospitable and warm people felt like I was right at home

Best meal ever. The information about balanese culture, our entertaining hosts, learning new ways to prepare food the traditional way was a wonderful experience and the food was absolutely delicious. Hope to do it again one day.

Absolute best part of our trip. We went as a group of 4 and had a blast! We had done some research and heard great things, but it far surpassed our expectations. The staff was friendly and fun. They had a sense of humor and kept us smiling. Before we knew it, it was dark and we had been gone for nearly 6 hours! Don't worry, it wasn't necessary to stay/participate that long (I would say , we just got carried away having a good time and enjoying delicious food. I will highly recommend this to everybody. They were also considerate of special dietary needs (vegetarian, food allergies, etc.). We didn't try those options out, but they also gave us suggestions for alternatives to some of the ingredients that might be harder to come by outside of Indonesia.

enak sekali or very delicious. This is a must do when in Bali. From the food market tour in Ubud to the rice fields, then to the cooking classes, this is a 5 star experience. The hosts are amazing and the whole cooking experience is authentic. They sharing the mysteries of Balinese cookery including giving copies of all the recipies cooked. Once you have cooked the food you get to eat it, the whole experience was excellent It takes about five hours and represents excellent value for money.

Fantastic! I was very impressed. . I was hesitant because this was my first cooking class but I was completely own over by the warmth of the couple that ran the school. The school was professionally run and the setting was in a beautiful Bali house. Someone in our group was sick (even before she got here) but they took great care of her. They even brought out a mattress and a fan for her to rest and made sure she was comfortable. Thank you for the wonderful day. It was indeed one of the highlights of our week in Bali.

Fantastic cooking and informative experience. Would recommend for everyone who enjoys great food.. Truely unforgetable great experience. Welcoming into a traditional family home. Really enjoyed the whole experience. Cooking, tours and 3 course meal. Would recommend to everyone when coming to Bali. Lovely hosts, good understanding of english. Loved it!

Great time. Had an absolutely great day at the cooking class. Wayan and Puspa are fantastic hosts. Food was so yummy. I was a bit hesitant at first about the whole idea but turned out to be the highlight of our trip. 10 out of 10

Beautiful cooking tour. Paon cooking class was a very enjoyable experience, from the moment we arrived the comedy, hospitality and professionalism was outstanding.We were educated and welcomed into their family home, introduced to traditional ways of cooking even the garden in which the ingredients were grown.Cooking the meal and sitting to eat with the class had a rewarding, relaxing feel to the whole day.I would recommend it to all.

Must experience!!. This cooking class was more than I could've ever imagined! The hosts were so friendly, and they made cooking and a course meal simple, fun, and delicious! My first trip to Bali was a very memorable one and I hope to make it a yearly tradition, and I will definitely be back to visit my new friends Who made me feel very welcome:)

The highlight of my Bali trip. Definitely put this on your itinerary. Wayan and Puspa are an absolutely gorgeous couple and go out of their way to make sure everyone has a wonderful experience. They took us to a market, showed us how rice is cultivated then took us to their home to tell us about them and about life in a Balinese family. Their home was so lovely.Making the meal was fun and probably the best meal I ate during my trip.Thank you aunty Puspa and Wayan!

Wonderful experience, would (And have) recommend to anyone. My boyfriend and I had the most wonderful time doing this cooking class. Pupsa and Wayan treated us all as family and were the perfect hosts and teachers. From the moment we were picked up we felt completely welcomed into their world. The market tour was fantastic and very educational, as was the cooking class itself. Our group was a mixture of couples and single travellers but by the end of the day we felt like one big, happy family. The food we made was some of the best I ate in Bali (if I do say so myself!) and I will definitely be making these recipes countless more times. I cannot recommend this class highly enough, it will be the best $35 you ever spend. Thank you Pupsa and Wayan for one of my favourite experiences in Bali.

FABULOUS FABULOUS FABULOUS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. THIS IS THE WORLDS BEST COOKING CLASS!!! If you visit Puspa and Wayan of Paon Cooking Class you will have a great experience. They are caring and funny and overall THE BEST COOKS!If you go to Ubud in Bali make sure to check out this amazing cooking class as you will learn the secrets of Balinese cooking. Please go and check them out because they have so much to offer, to start they take you to the Ubud Market and you try the food and learn about the market, then you travel to their nearby rice padis and Wayan informs you about the surrounding scenery and rice growing. Wayan and Puspa share their home, then you cook than eat delicious Balinese .When you walk out you feel absolutely great, filled to the top with the freshest local ingredients and produce from the market.I have been to 3 different cooking schools in Bali and this one definitely stands out.

Lovely family, well organized class.. This was a great introduction to Balinese cooking. The family is sweet and have a great sense of humor. The class is very well organized and informative. Can't wait to get home to start cookingnBslinese food myself.

Caring cooking instructor and feel like home. One of the best cooking class that I have attended so far. The cook was great and knowledgeable. The staff were very friendly and caring. Nice food and relaxing ambience.

yellow curry sauce!!!!!!. What an amazing 4 hours of fun, and fantastic recipes to prepare, cook and eat in the beautiful balanese village of Ubud. We were picked up from Legian by a driver and returned later that night. The afternoon class was lovely, and we could enjoy our amazing meal at sunset, with a drink, and great conversation with Puspa, Wayan and staff as well as our other classmates. The food was fantastic, easy to prepare, and we got to bring home the recipes. They are very conscious of food preparation and hygiene as well. I have been able to find all of the ingredients in my small country town in Australia, and I am cooking some Indonesian this weekend.

Fantasic & authentic cooking experience in Bali. Paon Bali was recommended to us by a friend and it was a great day out in Ubud. We were collected from our hotel in Seminyak & driven in a private car to Ubud (about an hour away). We then got a tour of a Balinese food market - that's an eye opening experience! We were then taken to the home of Wayan and Puspa (stopping on the way to learn about the rice fields in their village). Wayan and Puspa were so accommodating and friendly (and funny!), welcoming us into their home. Out the back they have a fantastic outdoor kitchen set up for the cooking class which they run twice a day. In a group of about 16 participants We cooked 8 Balinese dishes and then got to enjoy eating them too, Everything about the entire day ran so smoothly - they were always one step ahead of us so there was never a delay or a hitch. It was fantastic. The best bit was that afterwards we even got a recipe book to take home. Whilst Wayan & Puspa took great precautions to ensure everything was hygienic and safe, unfortunately my partner got very ill afterwards with Bali belly which put him out of action for the next couple days. It could have been even the smallest piece of bacteria on a piece of food - these things happen so easily to foreigners over there. Would still highly recommend the class :)

Perfect place to get closer to the balinese culture. This place is really amazing and the people are great! The are so welcoming, so open and nice. We went to the class with two our kids, that were a bit tired after the hot day. Wayan and Puspa have made everything to help us and our kids to feel comfortable in their house. They even organized a place for kids to sleep and kept an eye after them while we were having dinner. Everything is very well organized and well prepared. If you want to see the balinese culture (balinese home, life) from the inside - that is the place for you!

made some delicious food & had fun!. My friend and I attended the afternoon cooking course during our stay in Ubud and had a lovely time. The class was small - 8 of us in total, so we had ample opportunity to prepare and cook the meals on the menu. Puspa, her husband and the other staff were very friendly and welcoming and attentive to our group and the food that we made was delicious! Print outs of all the recipes were provided and Puspa made some recommendations to use as substitutes if particular Asian ingredients couldn't be found in Western supermarkets! I would recommend this cooking class to anyone visiting Ubud!

Best of all worlds. I've been coming to Bali for 18 years, and I just discovered Paon Cooking class last year. I just took the class for the second time, and it was awesome. The best combination that includes a morning tour of the market, a stop at the rice paddies, and when you arrive at their home, Wayan gives you a great introduction to the Balinese home. Then it's time to cook! His wife Puspa makes sure everyone has a task, and she is so warm and welcoming. The class is very well organized, and before you know it, your done and it's time to eat all the amazing food you've just prepared. 5 stars. I'll be there again next year!

An immersion in Balinese culture. Participate in the preparation of a traditional Balinese meal, learning about the ingredients, the food preparation process, the culture. Share the chopping, mixing, and cooking with others in a convivial atmosphere. Set inside a Balinese home so you can see the beauty from inside the outer walls. Hear from Wayan and Puspa about some aspects of Balinese life that you wouldn't ordinarily learn about. And finally, with some aid from Balinese helpers, savor the results of your cooking endeavors in gorgeous dining pavilions overlooking natural scenery. An absolutely fun, friendly, delicious experience! Added pluses are their providing transportation from and to your hotel and their giving you a recipe booklet so you can try some of the recipes on your own once you get home, complete with suggestions of substitutions for ingredients not readily available away from Bali!

An Absolute Must!!. 5 stars is nowhere near enough for this amazing experience! If you are in Ubud you are doing yourself a disservice if you do not book with Wayan and his lovely wife, Puspa.. They are a hilarious husband and wife team that welcome you into their home for a magical evening of cooking organic, delicious food! Would definitely do this again.. and could not recommend highly enough. It was the highlight of our entire bali trip!

A great day out cooking and learning!. It started by being picked up from our hotel then taken to the market and that was fascinating! We were told about the spices the fruits some of which we tasted and the vegetables! Then the owner took us and there two other cars as we were a dozen to his rice field and explain and demonstrated all the different stages if rice growing!Then and that was great and very special we went to his home and his wife welcomed us with a lime drink which was served to us then explained about Balinese home and customs/culture! Then we went to the table after she had checked allergies vegetarians etc....she showed us her herb garden where all the spices and herbs incl vanilla pods grow and are used for the preparation of all eight courses we do get involved and cook in pairs - good explanations clear keeping preferences and allergies separate and we were surgical gloves when handling some food etc....Then we all sat and ate together lots of staff around helping and guiding! Well organized and a wonderful day out as well as a delicious lunch one had helped cooking! I very strongly recommend to go there and try for yourself!

Amazing cooking experience. Everything was so delightful about this tour.Market visit, rice paddies, welcome drink on arrival, beautiful house, modern and clean kitchen and dining areas, fabulous food and a recipe book to take home.Thank you aunty puspa!

Paon Bali Cooking Class. I loved my time at Paon Bali cooking school! From the Ubud market tour to the rice fields and then an introduction to a Balinese home, everything was very interesting and informative. The cooking was superbly organised and coordinated and we all felt that we had contributed to a wonderful tasty meal. I'm planning to make a batch of yellow sauce as soon as possible!

Fantastic, fun, informative, great value for money and tasty!!!!!. What an experience!!! Its a must...... I was returning for the second time with my parents. They just loved it, a real highlight of their trip.Thanks for your hospitality Puspa and hubby!!!

Lots of laughs and food. 4 Friends enjoyed a fun filled 1/2 day. Picked up from our hotel, first visiting the local food markets and trying exotic fruits before heading to a rice field to hear about growing rice in its different stages, interesting and funny. An ice cold home made lemonade to welcome us, this husband and wife team has these classes down to a fine art. We had about 15 in our class, I have to say we didn't do much cooking, some chopping and stirring but it was still a great day, lots of interesting foods and they can accommodate anyone with allergies. Set in their home is has a nice fun, relaxed atmosphere and everyone enjoyed the day.

Great time!. My wife and I attended this class on our honeymoon. We had a wonderful time! Aunty Pushpa (as she addresses herself) and her husband are a great team and keep the class very engaging. The class also includes a visit to the local market (which turned out to be more interesting than we had thought) and the rice fields.A great way to understand the local culture and have a great time!

Awesome food and even better people!. Myself and my partner attended the Paon Bali cooking class today and it was fantastic! It's not just about the cooking, the guide picks you up from your hotel and takes you to the local market where he lets you sample fruits and talks a lot about the culture and food of the Balinese people. Afterwards they take you to a rice padi and explain how the fields are cultivated and how the families of that village have passed down the plantations through the generations.After this you go to the house where the cooking class takes place. This is a beautiful family home, the husband and wife are welcoming, loving and have a great sense of humour! On arrival you are greeted with a lovely ice cold fresh lemon drink whilst the husband (my apologies, I've forgotten his name) talks you through the meanings behind the buildings in each Balinese home and give you an incite into the way of life on a day to day basis.Afterwards you are gifted with a ginger tea or coffee before commencing cooking. This is all hands on, everyone in the class has a job to do and will swap and change. There are many different dishes to learn, but the organisation of this class is fantastic! 'Aunty Puspa'; the lady of the house, is a brilliant teacher and host. The dishes tasted amazing, the table was laid and we all sat down to eat what we had created afterwards.All in all this was so much more than just a cooking class and exceeded my expectations! I think this is a wonderful experience for friends, families or solo! If you get the opportunity go for it!

Great way to get to know the food and culture of Bali. My husband and I went to Bali on our belated honeymoon and really wanted to take a cooking class while we were there. We looked at a variety of different options as there were many, but settled on Paon Bali because it was a cooking class held in a traditional Balinese home and had great reviews. We were picked up at our hotel and taken to the market in Ubud to learn about everything that was sold there. Our guides was extremely informative and pleasant. After leaving the market we headed towards Aunty Paon's house with a stop along the rice paddies for an explanation on how rice is grown and harvested. At the house we met Aunty Paon and got an introduction on how a typical Balinese home is laid out and then we got to cooking. I have to say that the course was done wonderfully and it was a several hour affair taking the time to do everything just right. We had a great time with the group of people we were there with and probably ended up cooking the best meal we had while in Bali! What a great time! Would do it again without a doubt.My husband says- YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED, AUNTY PAON IS THE BEST!!! GO NOW, STOP READING THIS AND GO NOW!!!

Amazing Balinese culinary experience! A must!!!. I will start by saying that if you are in Ubud, Bali, if you like to try new food and if you like to have a lot of fun whilst doing so, then Paon Bali Cooking class needs to be high on your list of must dos in Ubud! Such friendly and informative hosts, Pusba and her husband were an absolute delight, they took us around the famous Ubud Market where we learnt about the different foods, we were then taken to a gorgeous rice paddy and then to their home where the magic happens. My mom and I were with a group of about 18 people from around the world, we cooked together, laughed together, ate together and had an all round fantastic day!I would do it again in a heartbeat on my next visit!

Informative and enjoyable. It was a fun method of learning about the Balinese culture. A good way to meet new friends. Their staff was very cordial. Miss Puspa was such a delight, and the food was great! My mother-in-law, husband and I, all agree that it was quite an enjoyable experience.

More than just a cooking class!. My boyfriend and I took the Paon Bali cooking class while in Ubud and looking for something to experience other than yoga and shopping. Transport from our guesthouse was arranged and timely. On our way to the cooking class, we were given a tour of the food market, rice fields and given a look into balinese customs. The cooking class, at our hosts' home, was in a quiet and clean outdoor courtyard kitchen, overlooking rice fields. Our hosts were friendly and welcoming, reminding us frequently that "our home is your home". The class is very hands on, we got to pair up with each other and cook together as well as with other members of the cooking class, and we learned how to make many not-so-common delicious dishes (not your everyday Mie Goreng, etc.)...probably some of the best food we ate in our 2-week stay in Bali. Don't leave Ubud without doing this cooking class!

Perfect for beginners. We were recommended this class by the hotel after our first two choices were unavailable. We were picked up early in the morning and taken to the Ubud market where we were given a tour of local produce. Our guide was helpful and informative. We were then driven out to the rice paddy fields and then onto the location of the cooking class. It is a beautiful setting for a cooking class and the owners were very hospitable. The owners and staff run a very well organised and executed class. We were involved in the preparation of a variety of dishes and although you don't create each dish from start to finish, it was a wonderful introduction to Balinese cooking. All of the food we made was delicious and the owners were conscientious of dietary requirements within the group. Water and beer were offered for free throughout the day which was great. It is a long day but we didn't feel rushed and were able to fully enjoy the experience!

Exceptional..... I attended the Paon Bali cooking class with my 9 year old daughter. I had previously attended a cooking school in Ubud, which left much to be desired from both a hygiene and teaching perspective. This time we certainly chose wisely. Transport was arranged (for a reasonable extra fee) from Seminyak. We enjoyed the tour of the market and the explanation of the rice paddies. Then it was on to business at the cooking school. The school itself is particularly impressive in terms of functionality. The food preparation areas, traditional cooking areas, ablutions and dining areas are all immaculately clean and modern. We had a relatiely large group of 20 in total and although my initial thoughts were that there wouldn't be much practical involvement were soon dismissed. My daughter was delegated as much responsibility as the adults - which was pleasing as she actually had to apply herself to the task. All participants had to blend, chop, cut, mix ingredients culminating in cooking them; and there was plenty to do. The result was a fantastic full lunch of all the food we had prepared with local teas, coffees and a beer. In all, a great day and one that is ideal for children to participate under the guidance of an adult.

An absolute must while in Ubud!. Went to the cooking class tonight and I must say this was the best thing we have done on our trip yet! We were picked up at our hotel and our night just got better and better from there! The service is impeccable! We asked about the rice fields casually as we were driving in and he took the time to stop and explain how they grow the rice and point it out the different stages along the way. The actual kitchen where you cook was immaculate and the view is just stunning out over the jungle. They explain all the ingredients you will be using and help you prepare 8 dishes and you get to eat family style at a large table as the sun is setting. Simply spectacular! The food was the best we've had in Bali and the care and mindfulness in creating the menu (vegetarian options available!) and preparing the ingredients and presenting the finished dishes was on par with any 5 star restaurant back home. These people really want you to have the best experience possible and we truly did! They even give you the recipes all done up in a booklet to take home with you! Fantastic night and I just can't at enough about this experience! Stop looking and book it now!

Fantastic people and fabulous food!!!. I have been to Bali many times and until now had never done a cooking class. I am pleased to say I was glad to wait and find this beautiful class to do. I learnt a lot about Balinese cooking and tradition. The markets first thing in the morning was eye opening and refreshing and then the class itself was very special. I was able to learnt cutting techniques, blending techniques and how to creat Balinese dishes from scratch. I found it lovely that Puspa told us the traditional way to do things but also what we could use to get similar results at home too. The food was amazing and you get a booklet at the end to take home and make the food yourself. Overall it was a great day out and I would definitely recommend people do it.

Don't think, just book! . My friends and I had originally signed up to do another course at Lobong cookery school, but unfortunately the class was not able to go ahead and so we were advised to go to Paon Bali. What a fantastic recommendation! We were picked up on time by their very lovely driver and taken for a walk around the market, where he indulged every curious enquiry about the fruit by buying some and letting us try it. We were then taken out to a rice paddy and he told us some very interesting bits and bobs (none of which I can actually remember). Once back in the school, we were greeted by the man of the house, his gorgeous dog and a very delicious lime drink. He told us about traditional Balinese style houses and family values, which was fascinating. Following this, the cooking kicked off. It was an absolute dream of a spread, and as we were only in a small group, it was really hands on. They made a great effort to remember our names and we really felt at home. The lady of the house and her staff were extremely professional yet welcoming and friendly, and also incredibly informative. The food was wonderful-I'm getting a bit dreamy thinking of it now-and we had the feeling that we could give it a go at home ourselves, as it was simple but packed full of flavour. In summary, I haven't a single negative point. It was absolutely brilliant. Thank you!
Must do. Absolutely fabulous day. Market tour was well worth it then smooth operation from start to finish. Very entertaining and caring hosts. Looking forward to using the recipes at home.

Awesome Hands on Experience. The class was exactly the type of experience we had hoped for. The class was very organized and extremely hands on. The class was very well organized to first introduce everything to us, the ingredients and the process. We then worked in pairs at cooking stations where everyone had hands on experience to make all of the dishes. We enjoyed our day amidst a beautiful Balinese villa in the countryside. I would highly recommend the class to anyone looking for a hands on, traditional experience.

Cultural experience and food not to be missed!. We just returned from an evening with Puspa, Wayan and Nyoman where we enjoyed incredible insight into Balinese culture and it's delicious cuisines. The food was bar none the best we've had in Bali! The hosts were beyond welcoming and gracious from the second we pulled up to the house until the moment we left...even being so kind as to "valet" our scooter to the front door and gave us a send off akin to being family. My fiancé and I were lucky enough to have a private, two person class, which made the evening that much more enjoyable and we will never forget this awesome experience. We were heavily involved in the preparation and cooking and we learned a lot. We would recommend this class to everyone!

Must do!. As per previous reviews this is a great day from start to finish including the food we cooked - the best of our meals in Bali! Great personalities make this a truly memorable experience! Lovely '5 minute' story;) PJBD

Our best day in Bali!. Spending the day with Puspa, her husband and her staff yesterday was the highlight of our time in Bali. We first visited the little local market near Ubud, where we learned about the exotic vegetables, fruits and spices that are less familiar to us, then a quick visit to the rice fields where Puspa`s husband showed us how they grow and harvest rice in Bali. Finally, at Puspa`s family compound, we were treated as royalty with a refreshing lime drink, then learned how to cook indonesian food while having fun with other tourists just like us. Fresh, clean, organised and so welcoming. Even if you are not crazy about cooking, it is worth spending a day with Puspa just to experience the food and to learn more about the Balinese culture. Our best day in Bali!

Must do! even if you are not a master chef, so much fun. Spent 4 days in Bali on vacation and also doing research for my clients, I am a Travel agent from the USA. We had so much fun with Aunty at Paon, everything is super clean, very organized and really a very entertaining and informative evening.Using traditional ingredients and methods, the "Balinese Blender" for example, really does not matter if you are a big foodie or not, either will have fun with this evening.

Great local food experience and wonderful way to celebrate my 40th birthday!!!. Fantastic genuine local food experience. Well organized by the team which is headed by the lovely Puspa. It was one of my 40th birthday presents to attend this class with my partner and best friend and it was one of the highlights of the trip! And the lovely gesture to share a birthday cake brought by my partner with the other cooking class members and Puspa's team was 'the icing on the cake'. Very impressed with the food, explanations and lovely hospitality with great sense of humor. Would recommend this activity to everyone visiting Ubud!

Excellent, Knowledgable, Food Amazing You keep the recipes. Puspa and her team are so welcoming into their gorgeous home ( looked like a villa) The drivers, the tour guides are just lovely. So Clean !!!! I am a travel agent from Melbourne Australia and I went with my daughter, we had a ball. You learn how cook, prepare your food, see the fresh different spices growing in the garden. You actually cook with your partner, You are the CHEF! Once all prepared we all dine outside eating the amazing food amongst new friends from all around the world. I would recommend Puspa to all my clients and friends, for sure. PS Puspa gives you the recipes to take home.Thank you for a wonderful day my friends.

Amazing food, amazing cooking class, loved it!. We booked only the night before via email and the process was really easy. From then on everything was perfectly organised, from the hotel pick up, to the market tour, to the rice paddy visit, the lovely greeting into the family home, and then of course the cooking class itself. The facility is beautiful, well set up and spotless. Our hosts were funny, warm and vey good instructors. The lunch we helped to prepare was the best food we have had in Bali. No matter what your level of confidence or skill is in the kitchen, this course is perfect. Highly recommended!

Still dreaming about the food.. Puspa was such a wonderful host and teacher. We made reservations the morning of and luckily Puspa allowed us to join the class that same evening. We were even late because our bike tour lasted longer than we expected but she was still so gracious and was accommodated us. I would highly suggest taking this cooking class. We meet such wonderful people and the food was delicious. Everything was so well organized and being at Puspa's house made it feel so cozy.

Unforgettable cooking adventure!. Our 6 day vacation in Bali was mostly spent in and around Ubud. We did the cooking class on our third day. The dishes we made were the best-tasting version that we've ever tried in that trip! After doing the cooking class and eating what we cooked for lunch, it was quite hard to appreciate Balinese dishes we order for meals in various restaurants for our succeeding days there.

Exquisite Experience. After staying in Bali for about ten days, stuffing ourselves with a variety of dishes up and down, left to right, our taste buds kept going back to the set of meals we made in this cooking class. For me, there was something about the crunchy bits of fried tempeh glazed with the sweet, savory, soy sauce that I could not shake my head off. While the light and mild taste of the chicken curry remained in my brother-in-law's mind. As for my husband, the wholesomeness of the entire meal, the fragrant spices (raw and after they got cooked) just blew his mind. And as I typed this, the mushroom soup we made as an appetizer got me excited just thinking about it again. Mind you all the meals we learned in the class are simple enough to replicate at home (and yes, the class provide you with recipes to take home). But there was something magical in the class (in the place, the people, the air, whatever you wanna feel it) that turns all the simple meals into a memorable taste. Perhaps the charming, wonderful, comical instructors/hosts, Puspa and Wayan that immediately make everyone feels welcomed (and at home)? Could it be the younger Wayan, who went extra miles to pick us, a group of four, and started cracking some jokes a minute after we all got to know each other? Or maybe the fun, informative trip to the local market and the rice paddy field that adds dynamic to our learning process? And yes, we did got some spices at the market where my sister did most of the bargaining while Puspa navigated us throughout the market. How about the icy, lime-lemongrass drink that greeted us, as we arrive at the authentic Balinese home, where the class took place? Well, my friend, you may have to find out for yourself!All I can say is the cooking class was one of the culinary highlights of our family trip to Bali. As a culinary professional in NYC, I am deeply impressed to see how the whole operation is done, from the structure of the class to the professional quality of the food handling (sanitary/hygiene of the space, the freshness of all ingredients-- raw fish had no smell, coconut milk was made from scratch, etc). And on the personal note, growing up in Indonesia, Balinese cooking is almost like a genre that had always been foreign to try but this experience helped me crack the code. Not only I am proud and excited to see such an educational establishment exists but also huge props to Puspa, Wayan and their team for the great work they have done!

Fantastic Must Do!. My partner and I attended the Paon Bali Cooking Class today. We were greeted by Wayang and Puspa and welcomed to their beautiful home and cooking class business. They have a lovely way of making you feel at home and have great humour which they love to share. We learnt a lot about cooking today and also met some very nice people with common interests. The Paon Bali Cooking team showed us how to make eight courses which we all consumed during class. This is a 'Must Do' whilst in Bali.
Cooking at its best.. This was a really fun, informative cooking lesson. Its relaxed environment and great hosts help you get the most out of the experience. The food is delicious!!!!

Had a fantastic time. After a few days of not feeling productive and having someone else do all the cooking for me I was really looking forward to getting hands on in the kitchen. We made some lovely food with lovely hosts in a lovely environment. I will be highly recommending a course at Paon to my friends back home in Australia. Thanks for the great day :)

Amazing - Must do!. My fiance and I enjoyed a morning class with Puspa and Wayan in early January. We consider ourselves to be good cooks and this class was the perfect balance of learning, cooking and eating.For 350,000 rp the price is very reasonable. We were collected on time and taken to Ubud market for around half an hour. To be honest if you have seen south east asian markets before then Ubud market is no different. However, it certainly didn't detract from the experience.We were then taken to Wayan and Puspa's home. They made everyone feel so welcome and it was a pleasure to be there.We cooked an excellent variety of food and had a reasonable amount of hands on experience. The best bit was sampling everything that we helped to cook at lunch. These people deserve all of their success. The school was one of our favourite experiences from all of our trips to Bali.

Highlight of our trip!. As someone who has been to culinary school, I was so impressed with their program. We loved going to their compound and learning about how they live, eat, and a bit of culture. They are super organized and everything was very clean. It was a lot of fun! What my husband and i didn't care for was the trip to the market. I typically love local markets, but this one wasn't enjoyable - dirty and crowded. We could have done without it. Highly recommend them!

The BEST!!!. If you are looking for a fantastic experience you must visit Paon Cooking. We were a class of three. Just perfect. Set amongst the most amazing backdrop in Ubud and hosted by the gracious and lovely chef and owner you can't go anywhere else. A cheap fantastic and entertaining afternoon. It was all so very clean, no mossies, friendly and the food, where do I start? Easy to make, recipes provided to take home and SO tasty. I can't wait to make them at home. Please, do yourself a favour and book. I will definitely be going back and Pasaya would customize a new menu for us for something new. Thank you once again guys. Julie & Allen

a must do while in Bali. We booked the cooking class 2 days before and we loved it. As a chef I wanted to learn about balinese food and I wasn't disappointed. It's organized, well explained, very clean, we had fun and the food we made was great. You can choose to cook vegetarian or "normal" food.The tour at the market is fun too. You'll also go home with recipe booklet.

Fun and useful. I might not have been a fan of Wayan`s sense of humour (especially at 8am) but I surely enjoyed what we were there for - to see how real Balinese dishes are made.Because Bali is not unfamiliar to me, the market and ricefields parts were my least favourite parts but most people in our group enjoyed it and I can understand it.The cooking class was perfectly organised, entertaining and fun. We both learned a lot and enjoyed the process.I must emphasize that we especcially enjoyed that Puspa always mentioned how particular products can be replaced with ingredients available in Western part of the world.Thanks for your hospitality and we are having Three of the dishes tonight for dinner :)

Not just a cooking class. Sign up for the morning market visit in Ubud with Paon and Wayan! You not only learn basic Balinese recipes that you can easily try at home, you get to spend time at their home and learn about traditional Balinese life and culture. Paon and Wayan are hilarious lovely hosts and make everyone feel comfortable and at home in their home. Loved the food (8 dishes!) we made and the tips given. I am excited to take what I learned home and impress my next dinner party. The value is great for the food and the whole experience. They provide the pick up and drop off and mini market tour. Really cool to be introduced to the market vendors.

Not just a cooking school, a cultural experience. An excellent day - we were picked up from our hotel by a friendly driver and taken to the markets in Ubud to learn about the fruit, vegetables and spices used in Indonesian Cooking. From there we were taken to Laplapan Village just outside of Ubud. There Pak Wayan met us and spoke to us about rice harvesting for the villagers. Then we went to Pak Wayan's house where the cooking school itself happens. A welcome drink (icy and refreshing - and no concerns of Bali Belly!!) Here we were guided by "Auntie" Puspa (Wayan's wife) and learned about Balinese food and all had a go at chopping, slicing and of course Bali Blending. We made a variety of foods, with peoples dietary requirements considered. Very tasty food - nothing like eating the results of your labour!Everything was very clean, well ordered, all staff were friendly and accommodating. A great price and went for about 6 hours - a cultural experience, not just a cooking school!

Excellent. An excellent day, great market tour and rice paddy visit. Really enjoyed the cooking class, learnt heaps of tips and tricks and met some lovely people including our guests. A definite must for Bali holiday!

Best Bali activity we've ever done. Yesterday my husband, twenty-one year old daughter and I did a cooking course with Paon Bali Cooking School. We were collected from our Kuta hotel at 7.30am and driven to the Ubud market. There we were met by our guide and teamed up with two other people who were in our class for the day. We were introduced to Balinese fruit, vegetables and spices. There was plenty of opportunity to sample and buy if you wished.Next we were transported to the cooking school, which is also in Ubud. It is set on the side of a picturesque valley at the back of the family home. The kitchen and dining areas are covered but outdoors and there was a pleasant breeze all day.Paon explained each ingredient and technique clearly, gave us a demonstration then set us to work. As the morning progressed we swapped stations so we all had a go at each step. We made soup, salad, gado gado, curry, satay, fish in banana leaves ....etc.Once we had finished cooking, the food was beautifully laid out on a buffet table and we were encouraged to try everything and to go back for seconds and thirds.After the soup and main course were finished, we were taught how to make banana and jack fruit in coconut milk for dessert.Throughout the morning we were given fresh cold water and ginger and lemongrass tea. Coffee was also offered. Bintang beer was available for purchase. One member of our class was vegetarian and she was catered for with every dish.We finished up at about 2.00pm and were returned to Kuta just after 3.00pm.The day cost us $35 Australian dollars each and another $35 for the round trip from Kuta to Ubud.The whole day was well organized, the staff pleasant and helpful and the venue clean and well-maintained. Paon was the perfect host - she cracked jokes, kept us all working and answered our numerous questions without missing a beat.
