She even offers a follow-up email service to all her clients when they get back home and cook their Balinese banquet on their own.Like I said in my heading, this is the best activity we've ever done in Bali.

wow! great family adventure. My daughter and her husband, my husband and I participated in this cooking class. It was so much fun, and the food we made (along with about 10 others) was delicious. They gave us recipes to take home, and this coming weekend, we are cooking for our friends, some of the recipes we learned at Paon Bali. It was so well organized, from the trip to the outdoor food market, to the rice paddies, to their lovely home....We would heartily recommend this experience for any families going to Ubud. Susan and Larry Kennedy

Exceptional. The hosts were really friendly and very professional. We made about 10 different dishes from Satay, over Tempe to Yellow Sauce. What i liked the most is that we did every thing from scratch using all local products. Just fantastic. Would recommend every body to visit it.The only thing i didnt like so much was the Market visit as we just walked through with some explanation, a bit boring for my liking. However, i think most of the participants enjoyed it.

Great class and delicious food!. Wayan and "Auntie Puspa" do a great job organizing this cooking class out of their home. The class cost 350.000 IDR per person. We were staying in Seminyak, so they arranged round-trip transportation for my husband and I for an additional 350.000 IDR. The day started at Ubud Market. We had a guided tour, showing us the fresh fruits, vegetables, spices, and temple offerings. After the market, our group was taken to a rice paddy field to learn how rice is grown and cultivated. Although this part was interesting, my husband and I had already been to Ubud Market and had learned about rice cultivation. Had I known that the day started like this, I would have requested to be picked up later and join the class when cooking began.The cooking class is held at the owner's compound. We were welcome with a delicious frozen lemon drink - very refreshing. Wayan went on to explain the specifics of a Balinese house/compound. That was really interesting. I wanted to ask some questions, but we didn't have an opportunity and I didn't want to take away from the group's cooking time.Our class was rather large, but there were plenty of ingredients and time for everyone to cook. We made 8 different dishes and got to keep the recipes for all of them. It was a lot of fun and Auntie Puspa made sure that we were all on the same page. The explanation was very clear and you could tell that they love what they do. Lunch at the end was delicious! I barely had room for dessert.Overall this was a very unique and fun experience for my husband and I. Paon Bali Cooking School was fantastic and we highly recommend it. Puspa was very quick to respond to emails and it was easy to book online.

A well-oiled Balinese cooking machine. Part cooking class, part performance, part cultural education session, "Aunty Puspa" and Wayan have run enough of these classes to really know what they're doing. The class cost 350,000 Rupiah per person and we booked online the night before (receiving very quick responses to our questions). We were picked up from our hotel in Ubud at 8:25am and the morning class concluded at 2pm.As a group of six, we began with a market tour. The small group sizes at this stage are excellent because they enable you to move around the market and hear your guide more easily. We were introduced to interesting fruits and vegetables; however when Puspa took over for the 'spices' section it became less informative and more of a sales pitch. It's completely unnecessary to take a cooking class into the clothing section of the market, but fortunately that didn't last long. Next we drove out to Laplapan village and had a brief lesson on the rice paddies, which I really enjoyed. It was fascinating seeing the different stages of rice production and getting to ask questions about the day to day lives of the villagers.After that, we joined a much larger group at Puspa's house. There were about 17 of us in total. Everyone was treated to a refreshing "welcome drink" and Wayan spoke to us for about half an hour about Balinese life and traditions. We then moved to the cooking area for our SECOND welcome drink (coffee or ginger tea), while Puspa explained the ingredients and dishes we would be cooking (roughly eight in total). She also showed us how coconut oil is made. Hygiene is a huge priority, with hand-cleaning and sanitising being constantly promoted, and fresh aprons worn by everyone. Then comes the chopping, with everyone chopping all the ingredients at once. There's never any standing around and you get to move stations when you're done.The kitchen is really well-managed, with individual cooking stations and heaps of staff to pass around ingredients and do the cleaning up. Free icy cold drinking water is provided throughout. Vegetarians are carefully catered for and you're able to work in groups with friends to cook each course. The dishes you make include things like a basic yellow sauce, which you end up using in a lot of meals, and a yummy peanut satay. You end up cooking each dish in pairs and then combining your mixture with the group, so you feel like you have a hand in everything and can be confident when trying it at home.The meals you make are mind-bogglingly delicious. Written copies of each recipe are provided in a nice booklet and Puspa always recommends what ingredients you can use at home to replace the more exotic ones that you may not have access to (e.g. jackfruit). This class was a fun, educational and enjoyable way to spend the morning - I was entertained the whole time and feel equipped to make these incredibly tasty meals on my own at home.

Just do it.. Excellent in cultural insights, organisation, menu, hygiene, staff patience & value for money. We loved the opportunity to get a glimpse beyond tourist Bali. The food we prepared & ate was delicious and we will highly recommend this to anyone coming to Bali. To be collected and dropped off at our accommodation in Jimabaran at no extra cost was an added bonus. Thankyou Wayan, Puspa & staff.

Try a few. This was my 2nd cooking course experience in Ubud. It was good fun and really well organised. Pumps and Wayan are very friendly and you can tell that they enjoy teaching tourists to cook Balinese dishes. I found this class a little less challenging than a previous one, though perhaps that's because there were more participants on this course so less to do. A great day out with a feast fit for a healthy appetite at the end. Good value for money.

All the Recommendations fulfilled!. What a great experience. My husband, a dedicated NONcooker, enjoyed himself and to my surprise cooked under Puspa's wonderful friendly encouragement. Such a lovely day, we were picked up on time, in a comfortable vehicle, visited the local food market with a well spoken guide, had a little lesson on village/rice farming life, were greeted at the family compound with cool drinks and some more interesting information about family hierarchy and then cooking and eating, all in a small friendly outdoor environment!Could not recommend this day highly enough from start to finish.

Best bali cooking experience. Me and my daughter love cooking so we thought this would be an exciting experience. We started off the day by getting picked up from our hotel in Sanur and were taken to Ubud's markets. We looked around and tasted some of the traditional fruits and spices.then we were taken to the rice paddy fields and learned how to harvest rice.after that we went to the house of puspa and wayan where we started our cooking lessons. At lunch time we got to eat the food we cooked. Then we were taken back to our hotel. We had a truly amazing day!!!!!

Excellent authentic, great fun cooking and eating the meal in dramatic valley setting. Best cooking class of many we have tried in Bali, authentic cooking and real family vibe and setting. We'll definitely recommend this cooking class as this is very authentic Balinise food and the staff are excellent service.

Put this on your "Must Do" list for Bali!. It would be a shame for anyone to leave the island without doing at least one cooking class, and Paon offers a top notch experience. I don't want to spoil all the suprises, but from the prompt hotel pick-up, fantastic market tour, visit to the rice fileds, adorable hosts, amazing ingredients, great recipies and lovely setting, this experience offers HUGE value for the money. Easy booking online. You won't regret it.

Highlight of my 2 weeks in Bali!. Paon cooking class is amazing! I spent 2 weeks in Bali and this was only of my favorite days. Puspa and her husband were wonderful hosts and teachers. Plus they have great senses of humor and keep everyone laughing! They made us all feel really welcome in their home, as if it was ours. The class was structured really well, the efficiency and instruction were great. We learned a ton of dishes and all delicious. The class even included a trip to the local market and a stop at the local rice patties. All for $35. I couldn't recommend this higher, definitely go and you won't regret it!

Absolute must do!. My husband I are both keen foodies and so were looking forward to this cooking class which our travel agent recommended. What a wonderful day we had! Pick up and drop off from our hotel in Nusa Dua, first stop the markets at Ubud where we were greeted by the very charming Puspa and Waya. Despite the rain we still had a very full day as we were lead through selection, preparation and cooking of a variety of traditional balinese dishes we we got to enjoy eating at the end. Our hosts were knowledgeable and gracious hosts. Absolutely wonderful day.

Fabulous Bali experience. My wife, son (15) and I did the Paon Bali cooking class yesterday and had a wonderful time. We're not "into cooking" per se and just wanted an opportunity to experience some more Balinese culture in an unusual way (for us). What a fabulous day it was! After being picked up at the Palace in Ubud, we visited the market nearby and Puspa took us through the different areas (flowers, dry spices, vegetables, meat). We then all jumped in the cars and were taken to the village rice paddy fields near Puspa's home where her husband explained the traditions and processes for growing rice. Back in the cars and down into the village to Puspa's family compound where were warmly welcomed into Puspa and her husband - who offered a great explanation of Balinese family traditions centring around the family compound and village life. We then got into the cooking course and between the group prepared soup, several mains, followed by a simple but delicious banana and jack fruit desert. We were then driven back to the palace where we were picked up but had the option to be dropped off anywhere we chose in Ubud. We all had a wonderful time and this will certainly stand as one of the highlights of our Balinese holiday. Our 15yr old son who came somewhat reluctantly (err a cooking course with your parents - must be boring!) even commented that he had so much more fun than he'd imagined he would. One other thing of particular note was the attention paid to carefully ensuring that nobody risked leaving with bali-belly - always a risk with fresh meat preparation in the humid Bali climate - Puspa regularly asked everyone to wash their hands and we wore gloves for all the "hands on" parts of the preparation. If I could give six stars I'd do it - highly recommended!

What a fun way to spend a day!. Travelling with my partner and both our mums we thought this would be an activity that suited all ages...can't see either of our mothers (us 30s and 40s, mums 60s and late 70s) tearing down a mountain on push bikes, being thrown around a raft white water rafting or hiking up to the top of the volcano in the dark to watch the sunrise....It was great! From the Ubud food market tour at the beginning, to the rice paddy talk with our instructors lovely funny husband to the cooking instruction, to meet people from all over the world (me picking brains for hot travel tips being my first trip to Ubud) culminating in the spectacular feast at the end :)The welcome drink of icy lemonade and ginger tea or coffee was lovely and much needed in the heat - thankyou!The day was well priced ...I think less than US$35 from 8:30am until 2:30pm, lunch and refrershments included (you could purchase an icy cold beer with lunch at a reasonable price).We left with a print out of all the recipes at the end which is great, our friends having seen our photos can't wait for us to get into the kitchen!The day is well paced...everyone is involved and contributes to the cooking...from chopping, to grinding to frying to stirring, to wrapping etc.The hygeine is terrific...handwashing basin is close, antibacterial gel is supplied as are disposable food handling gloves when handling meat.It was great to see/find out how coconut oil/cream is made.I particularly like that there was a small team of helper staff who cleaned all the pots/pans etc whilst we were cooking...there was quite a lot as we learnt 7 dishes!! Imagine all the dishes! Awesome we just had to take them over to the sink :)I now know how to make delicious satay sauce and the "yellow sauce" which forms the base of at least 3 of the dishes we prepared (chicken curry and tuna fish steamed in banana leaf) and bonus it lasts 2-3 weeks in the fridge!At the end of all the cooking there was of course the eating...what a feast! Great to meet and talk with fellow travellers from around the globe also. Our host/instructor and her husband (sorry I forgot your names) were professional, funny, and very likable. I would reccommend this to anyone and will be back next visit to Ubud.

A cooking and cultural experience. Fantastic from start to finish, wonderful setup in family home close to Ubud. Cooked a great meal in the family home, visited the family rice plantation and had fun!

Great food, great people!. We were picked up at our hotel by a very nice gentleman and brought to the class. As you walk in to Puspa's home, you are immediately greeted with delicious welcome drinks. The instructor, "Auntie Puspa" is incredibly charismatic and hilarious. It's great to watch her interaction with her husband. It is evident that cooking is their passion. The class is perfectly paced as helpers go around to all the stations ensuring that you have a job to do. Everything is explained thoroughly and you learn so many Balinese traditions along the way. It was amazing being able to cook and meet new friends in such a great environment. Even though it rained, it was still so beautiful as the mist rose up from the valleys. We were offered cold beer while we enjoyed an appetizer of mushroom soup (that we all put effort into). We then started to work on our main dishes, including chicken satay and yellow curry. Puspa made sure that despite a big group, you still got to work solely with your partner, so this can definitely be a romantic date night if you want it to be. Overall, the class was done so well. The pace was perfect; we learned a ton! The people were amazing and the food to die for. Can't wait to try out the new recipes at home!

Forget the rest! The Original is the best!!. Found out that this was the first cooking school in Ubud so thought we would give it a go (my husband and I traveling with my parents). It was amazing!!! You go into the family home which is both beautiful and imaculatley clean and cook with a group of people. The family picked us up from our hotel and took us to their village and spoke to us about the rice fields and took us for a tour where they were harvesting the rice, was so great to see. Then we went to the home to start the cooking school. Where the whole group cooked the set meals, which included a large variety of both vegetarian and meat dishes. We sat down family style which was nice to chat with some other travelers. It was by far the BEST meal we had in Ubud and in Bali!! This is a MUST do in Ubud! The best part is that you weren't in a hotel kitchen doing the class you cooking it Bali style!! At the end we got a cook book to remember and share the delicious meals!

Highlight of my Bali trip: dream veg cooking class. This Balinese cooking class was truly the highlight of my 2-week trip to Bali. When planning my trip to Ubud, I thought a cooking class would be a good way to learn more about Indonesian cuisine especially since I am vegan and wanted a way to navigate a type of food I little exposure to in the U.S. I had heard that Balinese food in particular is very vegetarian and vegan friendly, so I was thrilled to see that this Paon Bali Cooking Class would tailor the class to any dietary restrictions of its students.I was truly "wowed" by this food market tour and home cooking class and consider it the best and most memorable activity I experienced in Bali. The husband and wife team are excellent instructors and make everyone feel welcome in their home and kitchen. I was the only vegetarian/vegan in the class and have some food allergies, so I was very impressed by how Puspa tailored the ingredients of every recipe for me so I was never left out. The result was an amazing lunch that our group prepared and a recipe book to take home filled with everything we made in the class.Since returning home, I have made all of the recipes I learned in the class including the mushroom soup, tempeh goreng, steamed tofu in banana leaves, veggie curry and banana in coconut dessert. This was the best investment I made during my trip and love that I can now cook delicious Indonesian food at home for my family and friends.

Fantastic class and rich cultural experience. A must-do! My girl friends and I took this cooking class in mid November 2013 and we had a fantastic time. Auntie Puspa and her husband are hilarious and incredibly genuine hosts. The dishes we made were the best tasting from my trip even though we went to lots of great restaurants. The class is hands on, so you actually get to cook, and Puspa will also show you how they make fresh coconut oil, and use other traditional Balinese utensils to blend and chop ingredients. We made about 8 dishes in 3 hours total. We were about 20 people total and it was fun to meet new folks. The class also includes a trip to the ubud farmers market and a stop at the rice patties for a richer cultural immersion. This was by far one of my favorite activities in Bali. Because we were welcomed into Puspa's home and she and her husband share some of their Balinese values, you come away with a greater appreciation and understanding for this paradise island and wonderful people.

Excellent Cooking Experience. In 2013 I led 36 students and teachers to Bali for an educational tour. I booked a cooking experience with Paon Cooking. I have never done this before, and have never thought it would be my thing. Our whole group thought that the activity was excellent. We were greeted at and led through Ubud markets, then we went on to the rice terraces for more food instruction and then to Puspa's compound, which is magnificent. We were welcomed with cool drinks and then began the actual cooking. The staff were amazing and dealt with the adults and kids professionally. Puspa herself was a delight. We prepared and cooked our way through an amazing smorgasboard. At the end we were even given copies of the recipes. It was tremendous and the groups responded warmly to the activity.

Brilliant and a must do!. Seriously one of the best things I did in all of Bali… the hosts take you on the most fun adventure of shopping and cooking. From the time you meet them until you leave, they make you feel like a VIP. They work so well together as a team each with their own stories to tell and activities to do. You have fun while cooking tons of regional food and then get to enjoy it while sitting on their terrace enjoying a most magnificent view. I can't recommend this enough to foodies and gourmands. Certainly a long day but never a dull moment and well worth the time and money.

Well paced first timer cooking class. This was our third cooking class in Bali and was in a different format to others we have attended. The hands on cooking was limited to dicing vegetable ingredients and basic assembly whereas other classes have been smaller (2-6) students. This class had approx. 20 people. Good information but details such as Balinese specialties were not hands on.All up a good first timers experience and was definitely good value for money but if this is not your first time, look for a smaller more hands on class.

Experiencing Balinese Food, Culture & more. An excellent way to experience Balinese Culture & Tradition while Learning. Paon is more than just a cooking class - they just don't teach you their recipes but also Balinese way of living. We have learned a lot from this class. We could not have chosen a better way to celebrate on our Anniversary day. The food is excellent- best chicken satay. Kudos to Paon Cooking Class.

Great FOOD, and Excellent Staff!. Anti Paon is amazing, she runs this excellent cooking experience in her beautiful home overlooking one of Ubud's many rivers. She and her staff are friendly, speak excellent English and are fluent in several other languages. They provide insight into alternative ingredients for the no-tropical dwellers (tourists) to make recipes easy and delicious!Recommended as a MUST DO!:)

More than a cooking class. I'm not excellent at writing reviews but here's what I can tell you:- Your driver who picks you up from the hotel is lovely. We had Wayan who was still in a bit of a honeymoon phase as a newly wed :)- Before the cooking class you have an insight into fresh food from the Ubud Market- After the market you go to Wayan and Puspa's house and they explain how and why Balinese build homes the way they do- Their little garden is paradise of spices and herbs- kitchen preparation and food is beautifully displayed, they really look after you. The food is amazing and you get to take the recipes home. Everyone is smiling and happy all the time, I'd be surprised if anyone had a bad day here.

Great experience. I took the cooking class while in Ubud,
It was one of the highlights of my stay in the area. The teacher was amazing, the staff to.
I recommend it
Claudia

The Best Balinese food we have eaten and we helped cook it!. What a amazing day not only did we learn hands on how to cook Traditional Balinese food we obtained knowledge re the food we were cooking, rice paddies and Balinese family life. I was unsure how my 18 and 23yr old sons would be and only told them on the way, there was no need as they had a fantastic time. We also enjoyed meeting and chatting to people in our group from different parts of the world, I would highly encourage you to do if your a solo traveller.This is a must do while in Bali especially if you are staying in or near Ubud.Thank you Wayan and Puspa for welcoming myself and 3 children into your home, we all can't wait to get home and make everything from your recipe sheets.You should be no 1 on the MUST DO IN UBUD list.

awesome.... even i need wake up early in the morning and drive along to ubud ... but absolutely Worth it !!! u should try it... its more than cooking class...cause through Mr. Wayan and Mrs. Puspa share the balinese culture it. it's quite interesting statement " act like at your own home" and "there always meaning of something ". They also so happy when they met me, cause they told me so rarely met Indonesian people in this program ;)During cooking class it was so fun,delicious recipes,clean, warmly and helpful staffs and efficient time management. ( so we got our lunch in a right time ). I will absolutely recommend this class to anyone who loves food,personal experience and is looking outside of 'mainstream' ( specially for Indonesian people, - u know what i mean right? ) hahahaha

Excellent. Went here as a group of 9 with two young children and cannot rate it high enough. A true Balinese cooking experience delivered by a Balinese woman, in an original Balinese home.Every one of the 8 dishes we cooked (yes 8!) were absolutely delicious! I made the Base Gede as soon as we returned to Australia to keep in my fridge and it is just as good as in Bali (well nearly)My son made friends with the blokes cooking the satay anf we enjoyed playing a part in preparing and cooking the great lunch we all shared.Definitely do this class. Even if you have one day in Bali, this will allow you to take more away with you than any other activity. The cook booklet you receive at the end is a nice reminder of the experience too.

Not only food. How many good reviews can you get? Well, at least one more excellent review from my side. This is a place well worth spending half a day. From the trip to the market, the rice field and to be welcomed in to their home.It was high quality, and extremely friendly, and now - three hours later - I am still questioning if I will be able to eat anything more today.It is more than cooking, it is a piece of Bali in an home environment and you have a good laugh together with other travelers.

Awesome Experience. Our experience at Paon Bali was just amazing. I can not say enough good things about this class. We emailed the morning of and they were so accommodating for our group of 4. The driver picked us up at 330 from our hotel in Ubud and he drove us out to Puspa and Wayan's beautiful home. We were greeted with refreshing lemonade drinks and a cute two month old puppy. Wayan entertained us and told us about his family and their home. He was so kind and genuine, he made us feel extremely welcome. We were then Shown back to the large kitchen as introduced to the star of the show, Auntie Puspa. This woman is amazing. Her hospitality is wonderful. Their garden is in their yard, where they grow many of the ingredients we used; kafir lime leaves, galangal, tamarind and lemongrass..among many many other things. We had a smallish group, consisting of some vegetarians, some who didn't like chili, some omnivores and some pescatarians. Auntie and her staff were so organiZed and prepared for each type of diet. We all had a chance to grind, "Bali Blend" and chop to prepare our meal. The result of our efforts was an absolutely incredible meal..I can honestly say that this was the best meal I have had in Bali. It was all homemade, it was neat to see where all of our ingredients were coming from and Auntie's humor and light spirit all added to the experience and the final product. I loved this experience and was lucky to share it with three girlfriends. This would be a wonderful way to spend girls night. Or a great night with your "honey bunny" (as auntie says). I will absolutely recommend this class to anyone who loves food and is looking for a high quality and personal experience. I truly cannot say enough good things. it was a highlight of our trip.

So glad I did this!. I booked in last minute to do this class and I am so glad that I did! A driver came to my hotel promptly at 8.15 and drive me to the local markets where we not only got a tour of how the locals shop and some interesting ingredients (which we got to try) but also some cultural education on local customs. Then a trip to the rice paddys to learn about how each family harvests it's own rice, the processes involved etc. all very interesting. Then to Wyans lovely home where his wife (ex girlfriend) took us through the ingredients we would be using and 8 (!) receipes we would be making. Unlike other reviewers, and despite our class of 11, I really feel we all got a chance to do almost everything involved in every recepie, and that I learnt enough to make these dishes at home. We were given the receipes to take home too. The lunch we made was delicious and there was sooooo much food. Really glad I saved room for the dessert though! A fantastic way to spend half a day in ubud!

Best meal in Bali !. We were collected from our place of stay by a friendly gentleman who drove us to the local market,We were given an informative tour of the stalls that were selling the types of produce we would be using later that day. We arrived at our Host's villa after we were shown the villages rice fields and local irrigation system . The people we met within our group were from all corners of the world which only added to the rich & colorful day of creation, flavours & aroma's , I highly recommend the cooking class even for souls like me that generally do not cook ! Enak.

Bali cooking awesome. Great experience, informative, hygienic and well structured. Went with 8 adults, a small child and baby. The children were welcomed and encouraged to help out too. Staff are very friendly and helpful recipes supplied, tour of food markets, endless supply bottled water. Cooking with Balinese people the real deal. Great value for money $35 au
Great cooking class, well worth doing. The cooking class was awesome! Very informative, friendly, hygienic and lots of fun. Definitely recommend going to this one.

Balinese cooking adventure - MUST DO!. Prompt pickup by our very informative and helpful driver from our hotel Kayumanis in Ubud. We shared introductions with the other members of our group then off to market. Going to the early market - the traditional food market for locals - before the tourist market opens was a fantastic experience especially with our helpful guide. Then a quick stop in the rice fields then on to Puspa and Wayan's beautiful home. Puspa is the consummate host - the Bali Nigella Lawson - excellent guidance through the class menu. Cooking at this class was fun and we got to eat our beautiful food in the company of the other couples in the group sharing travel stories and of course - Bintang! A real MUST DO ! Now we'll be eating all of our food back home with Puspa's "basic yellow sauce"
Great experience. Perfect day and wonderful food. The owners are very friendly and made everyone feel welcome. Highly recommend.

Warmed the cockles of my heart.... Not one to dabble in 'touristy' activities - admittedly I was a little apprehensive before booking this cooking class. How wrong was I! From the moment we were picked up, Aunty Puspa and her team took us on an unforgettable journey. Loved learning about the different foods in the market and at the rice fields - our guide Nuoman was so informative, without the 'production line' style of spiels. Upon arriving at Puspa's house, we chopped, fried, pounded and even moulded various foods and spices to create a smorgasbord of treats! Loved every minute!

Best cooking class. We just finished this cooking class and had to rush back to write a review, letting everyone know how fantastic it was. Puspa and staff were very professional and made the whole experience a complete enjoyment. Not only was it informative, but it was so much fun. Getting to cook Balinese food with strangers, who turned out to be family by the end of it was a delight. I can't recommend this enough.

The best experience in Ubud!. We attended this cooking class last night and it was a spectacular experience. Auntie made us and the other guests very welcome in her home above the Ayung River, and she and the others were all delights. The food was delicious, and the class itself so well organized and friendly. Everyone got to participate, ask questions, etc… The dishes and their history were explained, and it was just such a memorable evening I would recommend to anyone visiting the Ubud area (Price very reasonable, and the pickup/dropoff in central Ubud were simple too). I've taken some cooking classes back in Los Angeles, and this one was hands down the best. If you enjoy cooking, or just want to learn some Balinese culture, go to Paon Bali!

Best experience in Bali..... Wayan and Puspa at Paon cooking class make this a fantastic and special experience. They are such lovely and funny characters. They are very professional and organised in their cooking classes. From being picked up on time and being taken through the Ubud market to visiting some rice fields and then Wayan explaining about his family compound and family life to Puspa taking the cooking class everything was done with humour and was thoroughly enjoyed by myself and 4 friends. The cooking class was very hands on and we made about 10 dishes and every dish was delicious and fun to make and eat. I can highly recommend this class as a must do in Bali.

Paon-a-riffic. Such a top day out. From the moment u r picked up u r given top notch service. This is matched with puspa's skills as a cook and as a teacher. The day was well organized and the food I would describe as classy indonesian. Paspa explained the dishes delicious and made them feel 'easy' to re create!

Really well run cooking class!. Was a fantastic experience. Not only was it a great cooking class with amazing food, it was a fabulous introduction to the Balinese culture and traditions too. Being able to visit the locals markets and rice fields just added to the experience. Carve out 6 hours in your stay and ubud and do this class! Worth every penny!

Do yourself a favour. A fellow guest at the hotel I was staying at in Ubud raved about the Paon cooking class so I booked and had a ball. It is quite simply a must do experience. The owners Puspa and Wayan are not only interesting but also very entertaining. We gained a really solid introduction to Balinese cooking. Excellent value for money too. Do your self a favour and book this class, you won't regret it.

Highlight of our trip!!! Must do!!. This tour start with me emailing and booking from Australia. I always got a prompt reply and they were very understanding when I had to change dates.My two daughters and I were picked up from out hotel and driven to the market to meet Wayan. He is the funniest most lovely man and he definitely entertained us all day. He showed us around the market, explaining all the foods and spices to us. Then we went out to the Rice fields where he explained the process to us. I leant a lot about Balinese culture from Wayan, which gave me a new respect for the people there. We then went to his home and met his "ex girlfriend, now wife" Puspa. She is Devine . And very funny too. She showed us around her home and explained all the different rooms and areas. It was very interesting. We hadn't even started cooking yet!Once we had our aprons on it was straight to work. We cooked up a storm. There were approximately 30 people in the class but everything was so organised, it went like clock work. I am very critical of how things are organised and the process but this class could not be faulted.Once cooked we sat down to an amazing lunch. My daughters talk of this day being the highlight of our trip. It was definitely a day I will always remember. On our departure we were given a print out of all the dishes we had made, so we can make them at home.Thank you so much Wayan and Puspa. We thank you both and wish you all the happiness in the world. Michelle, Jessica and Stacey. Xxx

Perfectly lovely introduction to Balinese cookery. I'm an anthropologist and ethnographic food blogger, so taking a cooking class while in Bali was a must. This one lived up to expectations . The market tour was great, as it's a space that is harder to wander into as a tourist, as was the trip to the rice fields (though if you're in Ubud, you've done that already, so it was a tad redundant). "Pushpa Aunty" was really adept at managing our crew of 12 (I'd not advise taking this class if it's larger than 12 people though), and the morning went like clockwork. I can't say that we really did much cooking -- a little chopping, a little frying, a little rolling and so on. Just a little taste of everything, but nothing too involved or intense. In general, it was a really nice introduction to Balinese cookery from market to processing your own oil to making your own yellow sauce to preparing a pretty elaborate meal. In that sense, it felt complete. The setting was gorgeous, too: in Wayan and Pushpa's home, where the back garden is set up to accommodate the needs of the class, and you get to see the herb garden that provides (presumably) many ingredients for the course. Pushpa Aunty was also kind enough to send me home with a little food for the family (well, she would have, but I had to dash out when others were still finishing dessert), and some galangal and pandang for my own kitchen garden--sweet of her. I did feel like the initial parts of the day, once we'd arrived at the class site, had a bit more talking than necessary--starting at 830am or so, when you get through the market and ricefields and have rested a bit with your (lovely) welcome drink, you really are ready to stop talking/joking and start cooking! But our hosts were gracious, funny, accommodating, and kind, and the class was as much a space to socialize with others as to learn about Balinese cookery. It’s a good intro, especially if one follows up and actually starts to cook the dishes we’re introduced to—something I certainly intend to do.

Would give it a 6!!!. It starts with the booking process where all my emails were responded short notice and managed to find a place for the next day.I went from semyak to ubud with a pick up 2.30pm/drop off 8pm to the 4pm class. Taxi was 350.000 but worth this short trip to learn about bali food. Our group was not as big as I heard in previous reviews. 11 of us. 1.,we went to the rice fields for a short introdution of the importance of rice in balinese families.- this was a key point as I had no idea...2. we were welcomed at the hosts house - Puspa and Wayan, the best hosts I have found in any activity done. You must understand this is not just a Cooking Class. This is "an experience".So yes they talk about themselves, they explain the housing, tradition of Balinese people.It makes you understand it much better than reading or seeing temples and cerimonies.Then, YEs cooking!I think Puspa organized very well the class, introducing you to the spices, food, cooking process. Also she tells you what to do and swap with your partner,so everybody gets to cook. Obviously, this is not a private cooking lesson otherwise it would take ages to come up with the 5 dishes menu ready. It's a team work or "family work" as she called us-family.But at the end, I left their house very full,food was great, specially learning to do the sauces- the basic magic of Bali food.Puspa even organized for me to bring home some food for my boyfriend who missed the class.Thank you Puspa and Wayan.Maria xPortugal

A must do for visitors wanting to understand Bali food and culture. I gained much more from this class than expected. I endorse everything the other reviewers have said. It gave me a broad introduction and understanding of the meats, vegetables and spices used in Balinese cooking, as well as the preparation and cooking techniques.Totally unexpected and appreciated was the additional explanation of a typical Balinese family compound and the significance of the different dwellings and customs. For our cooking efforts over several hours to culminate in a fabulous feast was a perfect end to the experience. Oh yes, and there was even a fridge with beer and soft drinks available (for an additional cost) for those who enjoyed a 'coldie' with their meal. I took photos of all the individual dishes but didn't make a note of their names.Finally we were given easy to understand recipe pages so we could try to make some of the lovely meals when we returned to our home countries.It was a extremely good 'value for money' class, only about $35 AUD for approx 6 hours, including pick up and drop off to our accommodations.

Great fun for first timers.. Me and my girlfriend are to the best cooks and have little experience the cooking class was good fun and the food was nice. The hosts are both lovely and are very funny which made the trip enjoyable. If your an experienced cook maybe look for a more advanced course as you don't cook your own dish.Only thing I would say that could be better is the afternoon course should be a little cheaper than the morning one because you miss out on the market tour and the rice fields which we would have liked to see but couldn't due to having to leave Ubud.
Fantastic. Great fun. Very delicious. Informative. Friendly hosts. A joyous experience and a meal not to be forgotten.We were also shown rice fields, local markets, and the family home.

Wonderful Introduction to Balinese Cooking. We thought it would be a good idea to do this our first day in Bali. This was our first trip to Bali and we thought it would be a good introduction to the food and customs. This was way better than we expected. After touring the traditional food market in Ubud we went into the countryside and learned more about rice is farmed in Bali. We then went to their house and began cooking. We made 8 courses and then sat down to eat. We used what we learned throughout the rest of our vacation. If you are going to be in the Ubud area, this is something not to be missed.

Comprehensive introduction into Balinese Cooking. Our host Puspa provided us with ann almost full day's education into Balinese Food and culture with her class which culminates in the lunchtime meal at her family compound just outside of Ubud Central. A market visit and Rice Paddy tour preface the actual cooking but once at her compound you are treated with incredible warmth and humour - it is a well oiled machine and runs seamlessly- the vegetarians are catered for in cooking and eating , and our feast was amazing - I cant recall tasting a nicer Satay Sauce !!!

Must do... Now!. Amazing experience, the lady was charming and a great teacher, we learned so much. Her husband was funny and open to give us answer to any question we had. Our taxi driver picked us up at our hotel on time and we went to the market with him. Got to try so many fruits :) really should do while you are there

Number 1 for a reason. We settled on the afternoon course as I had heard that the classes are smaller and organised with Puspa transport from Seminyak up to Ubud. Our taxi driver was waiting on time. On the drive up to Ubud the drivers face would light up when talking about his 'bosses' Puspa and Wayan. We arrived at the the rice paddy field to be warmly greeted by Wayan who explained about the process of growing rice. We then jumped back into the taxi and headed to Wayan and Puspa's house. On entering the compound and seeing Puspa waiting to greet us I was overcome with emotion. A beautiful genuine smile on someone welcoming me into their home. We were given cool drinks and Wayan explained a lot about his family and life. It was very interesting and entertaining. We commenced cooking and all 5 of us got involved in grinding pastes and chopping vegetables. We made so many dishes and all sat down to an enjoyable feast afterwards. The course itself was very informative and hands on and the food was delicious. But what makes this course so special is the friendliness and entertainment provided by Wayan and Puspa. This isn't a commercial environment but a couple welcoming you into their home as if you were old friends and cooking and sharing a meal together. What a beautiful family. Thank you Wayan Puspa and staff

Awesome experience - fun, cultural, delicious!. We thoroughly enjoyed this experience. The tour of the Ubud Food Markets with Wayan was really good, and then we loved the drive to their home in the village while Wayan shared with us stories about life in the villages of Bali. Puspa and Wayan made the day fun and educational - while making sure that everything ran very smoothly and everyone was included. The surroundings were beautifully clean and well appointed. The food was totally delicious, and Puspa & Wayan are wonderful hosts. A fantastic experience and really recommended.

Best cooking class and food ever!. This was one of our best experiences in Bali. The staff is amazing, they teach you about Balinese compound and culture, they have amazing vegetarian options. It was the best food on the island. It is a must-do thing!

Fabulous culinary experience & enlightening cultural exposure. This experience was recommended and did not disappoint.The total package from market to rice field to cooking experience and tasting was just great....and great value.Thank-you Puspa - the menu was so delicious and I am looking forward to trying out several of the dishes at home. A labour of love..... Wayan provided an insight into local culture and family life; the very spiritual essence of Balinese life; the respect within the larger family groups for one another as they work and live together. It was a privilege to be a part of this environment for one day.

Enjoyed by all, great mouthwatering fun. The other reviews say it all, we were so impressed, on our return to the UK we have purchased ingredients listed on the the 5 course menu you are given from a Chinese supermarket and I hope we have as much fun and success as we had at the cooking class.We stayed at Nusa Dua and there are closer classes but Paon Bali came highly recommended and we phoned them and they organised a taxi to collect us from the hotel, the driver will visit sites of interest should you wish to on your return journey.To summarise, it was great fun, lots of humour but also very interesting, wonderful people, great value and delicious results.

Can't say enough great things!. Absolutely loved this cooking class. It was a perfect mix of culture and cooking. It starts with an informative market tour and stop at the rice terraces. One of my favorite touches with a short rest at the family's home when Wayan explained the way Balinese families live. The course teaches both the traditional methods for cooking as well as more modern short cuts and substitutions. Puspa is an enthusiastic instructor who clearly has a passion for sharing her culture and food. Of the many dishes we made, 3 were outstanding and all were very good. The logistics of the class itself were very well managed allowing participants to do a lot of the cooking without being bogged down with a lot of prep and clean up. Highly recommend this course!!
very professional. Had a great time cooking the food! Definitely worthwhile doing when in Bali. Was a great experience, would definetely recommend it!

Entertaining, fun and delicious food!. I participated in the Paon Bali Cooking Class this last Sunday... I really enjoy cooking but this was a completely different experience... Waman and Puspa are such a great team and a couple of interesting characters... not only you learn to cook true balinese food (8 different dishes!) but also they teach you about balinese culture and their traditions... I really enjoyed the quick visit to the amazing rice paddies and the explanation on the way they organize their life around the house... the market visit is not a highlight but the cooking is so much fun and the food truly delicious... I recommend this activity to everyone, groups, couples, solo travellers and from all different age groups... at least during my visit we all seemed to have an amazing time and laughed so much...

Fun and Tasty. The cooking class was very enjoyable and ran like a well oiled machine. I did the morning class, which began with a market tour and learning about the fruit, vegetables, meat and spices used in Balinese cooking. It was then followed by a stop at a rice paddy and finally the cooking school where the magic happened. Puspa and Wayan were very entertaining during meal preparation and cooking. The feast following the cooking was absolutely delicious and it was great to enjoy it with the other travellers.

You cant miss this, the food and hospitality is amazing!. I attended this today and had the best day.... Wayan and Puspa are so welcoming and hilariously funny and make you feel completely at home. The cooking experience is hands on and the food you make is delicious! Wayan provides the background about the balinese life which is absolutely fascinating, a trip to the markets and a rice field and Puspa is the cooking goddess, along with her amazing staff of helpers. Wayan talks a lot about happy wife and happy life. They are so accommodating, one of the people in my group had been before and Puspa said that if the come again to let her know and she would change the menu for the day.All of this for $35.... You wont find better hosts or value anywhere ! Thanks Puspa and Wayan.

One of the best cooking schools you can do. It takes a lot to motivate me to write a review, but having just completed with my partner this wonderful 'hands-on' cooking school in a village just outside Ubud, I feel compelled to let you all know how good it was!!Puspa & Wayan (MBA), invite you into their family compound to learn how to cook local style in a very interactive, enjoyable way with fresh ingredients often proving how easy it is to cook, although the Bali blender can be hard work indeed.And you get to enjoy the food you helped create, always a huge bonus!!Do yourself a favour if you go to Bali, book in and enjoy this truly friendly, well run and highly enjoyable experience.....you won't be disappointed!!

Brilliant. Pushpa and her husband Wayan introduced us to their home and made us feel right at home. Lots of insights into the traditional way of life in Ubud, great class and delicious food. As Wayan says "happy wife, happy life!"

If you want to learn Balanise cooking this is very good. This was a good experience To be up front and many that read my reviews on food and beverage outlets soon realise Im in the Hospitality business So this was an opportunity for my wife and I to experience another cookery dimension we were not dissapointedPuspa was a fantastic host, great personality, well organised, with an emphasis on hygiene The kitchen of course is under a lean to arrangement is well set out and copes well with 14/18 in a class as everybody is gainfully contributing to the dish We prepared 8 dishes all of which were unique to Bali and had very good flavours I was suprised how quickly the time passed and the banter amongst the paticipants grew as every body was having a fun timewe started the day at 8.30 am and finished about 2pm so In my eyes good value ,good entertainment and added value to a new upcoming menu Thanks to Puspa her husband and her team of helpers that made for a very memorable day

An experience you should not miss!. It was a combination of things that made this cooking class so outstanding, The attitude of Puspa and her husband who host this experience in their Balinese home overlooking breathtaking , lush jungle like scenery. You get to see a traditional Balinese home with their own temple, an assortment of individual rooms surrounding the outdoor kitchen and dinning area. The food was amazing, the cooking was easy but you still got the feel of how to cook Balinese style. An absolute must. Thank you and I will be back.

Delicious!. Delicious food, well organized and a fun day. Highly recommend. Hotel pick up around 8:30 am and then visited local markets and local rice farm before arriving at cooking school. Everyone was involved in chopping and cooking around 8 dishes which we then feasted on. Be prepared to be very full! Day ends around 2pm. Well worth it. Not recommended if you have little kids as you are working with knives and hot stoves. Perfect if you are single, couples or groups of friends.

One of the best cookery courses Ive done in Asia. My friend and I did this cookery course which starts off in the Ubud Market, then you are brought to a rice field which was very informative and finally you end up in the family compound where you are greeted with an ice cold drink and two very welcoming hosts. While you drink your drink the couple who run the school introduce themselves. They are hilarious and make you feel at home straight away. While the group was large the kitchen is set up in a way that allows members of the group to interact really well together. The menu is well thought out and the day flows effortlessly. About half way through you stop and eat the mains which you have prepared. Then its onto desert and you get dropped back to hotel after. All in all a very very enjoyable experience!

A must for all. I decided before we left home that learning to cook traditional Balinese food would be my treat so after much research I came across the Paon Bali cooking class and boy am I glad I did!! I took my 11year daughter with me & we had an afternoon/evening of amazing food & company.We were welcomed at the entrance to their home with a refreshing lime drink & then welcomed in & introduced to the other guests.The experience was amazing & it will be something that my daughter & I will treasure. The food we cooked was divine. We were all given the recipes at the end & I can not wait to cook them at home (still trying to find a couple of the ingredients).Many thanks for the wonderful time

Fantastic Bali Experience. What a day ,we met at the local community centre to go to the local markets a guided tour of all things spice and foods, then from the market we were transported to the rice Fields at the top of a hill and met by Wayan who gave us a humorous welcome and information about the family's rice fields and growing etc, then to his family house what a lovely place , then more information re Bali Family's with his wife Puspas, what a lovely funny welcoming couple.the Cooking then started, with much emphasis on hygine, plastic gloves , and much washing of hands, and lots of team effortsthe foods were unbelievable, we all ate in their beautifully set up gardens and had a receipe book to take home with all we had cooked , do this Cooking School it is an entertaining and educational day with a lovely family highly recommended!!!!So glad we did this tour

A great way to learn about Bali cuisine. My sister signed us up for Paon cooking class, and we were very impressed! We had to change the dates a few times, but Ibu Puspa was very helpful, no hassle and very easy to communicate with. Because my sister didn't stay in Ubud, we decided to skip the market trip.They picked us up from the place I stayed in Ubud, and drove us to the venue. Puspa and Wayan were amazing hosts, you could tell they love sharing their stories, and very passionate about what they do. They explained a little bit about Balinese culture, and how traditional balinese houses set up. We had so much fun, and we learn a lot about balinese cooking. The class was very hands on, we were involved in most of the cooking process, so the 4 hours just went really quick. We ended up with big beautiful plates of food for lunch, and a dessert, what a great feast! It was by far the best spent money when we were in Bali, and the best meal we had. Will definitely recommend this to everyone visiting Bali.

best food in Bali. We found out about this cooking class trough our hotel. They picked us up at the hotel, drove us to the rice fields near their house where we'd be later to show us a bit about the rice. Then we were introduced to the family's tipical Balinese home while we enjoyed our freshly squeezed welcome drink. We went trough the small garden where we were introduced to different kinds of ginger. Than we startet cooking. A lot of amazing pastes, sauces, grilled stuff, etc, etc. Me and my husband commented that nothing else in a 3 week trip in Indonesia was so well organized and planned as this cooking class. The food was a-ma-zing! Top experience. Go there!

An absolute highlight.. This was one of the best things we did on our whole trip to Bali. Puspa and Wayan were amazing. Such wonderful hosts and the food we managed to make was brilliant. Wayan told us plenty about his family and we were made to feel like honorary members of his family for the evening. The night class only had 6 people in it, so it felt like much more of a intimate experience than the really busy morning classes. Would recommend this to EVERYONE.

A fun way to lean about Bali cuisine!. As a professional chef I was not expecting to be impressed but what a wonderful way to spend a day in Ubud! I signed up because I wanted to get a feel for the market and the ingredients and techniques they use in Bali. I found the entire day totally exceeded my expectations. The market tour was great, even though we got to there a bit late and the market in Ubud is quite small. I still felt like the guides gave a great overview of the most common ingredients used in a traditional home kitchen. The cooking instruction was informative and they gave many alternatives to ingredients you may not be able to find in the US. The class was fun and Puspa & Wayan have a great sense of humor!

best food in bali - delicious banquet made by my own fair hands!!. My bf and I were keen to do a cooking class in Bali and our taxi driver advised us on this one. We were not disappointed. It was probably one of our highlights of our whole week and for only $35 AU it was completely worth the money and prob one of the best meals I'd eaten in a long time.It was wonderfully set up. We did the afternoon class and were not too bothered about visiting the market in the morning class so it worked well for us. When we arrived we were greeted with a perfect lime slushy drink - just what the dr ordered! In our group there was only 5 of us and to be honest it worked well in that size. I have read previous reviews regarding bigger groups and couldn't think of anything worse than a group bigger than 8 to do this class, anymore would just be not as much fun, and not feel so personal.They took us up to the rice fields which were great to see and explained how rice was made. Then it was back to the house. The lady explained the set up of a Balinese house which was very interesting. It was great being at her house and not in some hotel restaurant doing it. Amazing views of the valley to see while cooking. A big emphasis on hand hygiene was made which was great as no one wants 'bb' (bali belly) as the lady put it!!We were all given little tasks, turns to cook. The food was definitely not a disappointment. Everything was so fresh, even the oil was made right in front of us - coconut oil - the smell was amazing as was all the pastes. So when we sat down to eat our food there was sooooo much. Fill your stomach to your hearts content. The flavours were all there, so fresh. Now for someone who is not keen on tofu I can certainly say this was the best I've had and I would make it again. Time flew by and before we knew it time was gone, the exp was about 4 hours long. We have decided to re-enact our Balinese cooking class as we just loved all the dishes that we ate.The hosts were just lovely and no question was too stupid. Highly recommend this class and will never forget this experience.

Best experience most beautiful setting. We booked in to do this last minute and ended up having the most beautiful experience . The hosts are welcoming and educate you on a few Bali traditions and are extremely organised. Best activity most delicious food

Loved the cooking class!. We opted to do the afternoon cooking class which I hear is less crowded. There were only 4 people total in our class so we had a lot of attention. They picked us up from our hotel in Ubud and drove us to a neighboring village (Laplapan) where we got to view the rice paddies. The village was a lot more quaint and peaceful than Ubud itself. We got to make 5 or 6 dishes from scratch, and they were all delicious! They were very organized and helped us prep just enough to keep the class moving. I would highly recommend this class to anybody visiting Ubud. Also, the cooking class is in a family compound, with a nice view of the forest. From what I saw the other cooking classes available in Ubud are in the back of a restaurant.

Great afternoon class. We had a great time doing this cooking class in Ubud. It was more of a help preparation rather than doing all of the cooking yourself but still i really enjoyed the afternoon, meeting lovely new people and learning about the traditional way of cooking in Bali. The food was superb, we were made very welcome and i would recommend people to do this class.Plus you get a delicious meal at the end of it ! A must do in Bali.

cultural family home experience. I have been to many cooking classes around the word from Laos, Vietnam, Thailand and Australia. This one is very unique and refreshing. The experience is not just about the cooking and how to cook in an up market traditional family village kitchen. Its about experience culture, family values, as the family take the client on a journey. The family invite clients (participants) in as special guests for the day. The facilities are very clean and the presentation is professional. The experience commences with a tour of the local produce market. Much care is taken to ensure clients’ needs are met, and it was nice to see tour guide considering participants levels of tolerance in the busy market place. Requesting feedback from the client was done eloquently throughout the experience. From the market our journey continued to a family farm and rice field. We were provided with an overview of the local farm and a short history lesson of the area. Shortly after this we arrive at the family home and village and met with cool refreshing lime drink. The cooking lesson is completed with demonstration and team participation. Elements are broken down and shared. Our journey commenced in the morning from Sanur with a 7.30 am pick arriving back to the hotel early afternoon. The tour was safe well presented and clean.Thanks so much, the experience was great and well worth the effort for the early start. Also good for families with children from 9 +.

Well Worthwhile - Great Experience!. Hands on preparation, 8 different dishes, and then we had the pleasure of eating the best food I have ever tasted on my numerous visits to Bali. I did the morning class yesterday, I was picked up from Bali Ginger Suites in Seminyak who recommended this class, what a fantastic recommendation, I have done a cooking class in Thailand which was most enjoyable but this was more comprehensive with a visit to the markets, the rice padi's, and then a warm welcome to our hosts home with a lovely cool refreshing drink, then the actual cooking, the whole thing was very well organised, informative and fun with great insights into life in Bali. I would recommend this class to anyone no matter what their previous cooking experience is. Thank you for a most enjoyable day!

PAON Cooking class UBUD. We have just come back from Bali and did a cooking class in Ubud, this was fantastic great people so friendly and cooked 6 meals from scratch highly recommend doing this, if you do the morning class includes a trip to the market.5 Stars. Class is about 20 people

Entertaining & delicious!. I did the afternoon class and was collected from my accommodation with 2 others picked up along the way. There was no trip to the market this time (as I have previously done with another company) which was fine, but I believe the morning class includes this trip. Our group was small - 6, but perhaps typical of the afternoon class? Maybe I was lucky, but it was a particularly cohesive group of strangers who were all lovely and we got along well. The meal was delicious and a lot of fun to make. Puspa and Wayan are very entertaining and learning about their life firsthand is so interesting. The cooking notes provided have been used since my return, as I love the flavours of Balinese cooking. The kuah wong - clear mushroom & vegetable soup is a family favourite. A wonderful experience & highly recommended!

Wonderful experience! A must do in Ubud.. This was a wonderful experience which I would happily do again and recommend others to do for a unique cooking experience. Auntie Puspa knows her cooking and is more than generous sharing her knowledge as well as her home where the cooking class takes place. It was interesting to see inside baliese home as well as visit markets and rice fields. The food was delicious and certainly adaptable to cook back home in Australia!

Great fun!. We LOVED this experience! While it's not really a cooking class, rather a demonstration with some participation, we really learnt a lot about Balinese cuisine. We participated in the morning session. The market tour is really interesting, the rice field stop is a little long, but still nice. I would suggest that a toilet break before or after the market could be offered, especially for those of us not staying in Ubud. It is a long time before you eat, so perhaps a good idea to have a light breakfast before you leave your accommodation.Puspa really knows how to make the group work well together, I really enjoyed the company of the diverse group (including the poster below me). The atmosphere was really positive and heaps of fun.While Bali itself did not delight me or my husband at all (we'll never be back) this course was one of our favourite holiday experiences to date! Puspa, please come to Australia and run some classes! You will get booked out very fast!

An Ubud must-do (for men too). I've done cooking classes in Bali, Fiji, Vietnam and Cambodia, and this is hands down the best value for money. It abit different in that the classes are quite large (about 16 I think) and you all help to make all the dishes to serve communal style, but it means you get to make and try several different dishes with a larger number of participants (maybe 8 or 9 from what I can remember), and they're all delicious. Its a full 3/4 day, not finishing till about 3pm and includes a market tour and rice paddy field tour with Wayan (Puspa's husband), then the cooking class with Auntie Puspa herself. Wayan and Puspa introduce you to their home at the beginning in a funny welcome speech and the tone of the day is set. The custom build cooking school set in their home compound is fabulous, and the staff are great. We were picked up from town, but if you aren't staying in the Ubud area and want to do an authentic cooking class they can arrange for you to be picked-up from other areas, e.g. Kuta, Seminyak (at an extra cost). We loved it, don't miss it!

One of our favorite experiences. I'm sure there isn't much more I can say about this wonderful cooking class that has not already been said. I'll simply highlight some of the important info.-We were picked up at our villa in the morning and taken to the Ubud market for a walking tour. We got to see local ingredients and products as well as learn about important information about Balinese culture (e.g., making their daily offerings).-After the market we were driven to rice paddies to learn about the importance of rice.-We arrived at the cooking class in a traditional Balinese compound where we were greeted with a cold welcome drink. Puspa (our class instructor) then taught us about the different elements of a traditional family compound.-The actual cooking class included the entire group doing the prep work, the mixing, the frying, etc. We made a soup which we ate first, but then all other parts of the meal were eaten later at the same time.-The food is served buffet style, so you can take as much or as little as you'd like.-We were given free tea, coffee, and water, and you could purchase a cheap Bintang if you wanted one.-Puspa and the staff took care of making the dessert for us.-You are given a copy of all of the recipes at the end.I really thought this cooking class was great. You are given easy instructions (e.g., chop the string beans so that they're this long, put one teaspoon of salt in the pan) so that you can't really mess up. Yet you also have enough independence during the class so that you don't feel like you are being monitored. I thought the size of the group (15 people) was also appropriate. We were divided into two groups during the market tour so that we could move around easily, and there was enough space during the cooking class for everyone to have a place to comfortably work. It was enjoyable to meet and talk to the other group members, especially because we all came from different parts of the world. Of course, the best part of it all was the food. My husband and I decided it was our favorite meal that we had in Bali, and we had some pretty amazing food on our trip. We really enjoy the flavors of Indonesia (hope you like lemongrass and ginger!), so this may not be a favorite meal to someone with different tastes. Finally, I really just have to commend the Paon cooking class on the quality of their class. All of the employees we encountered throughout the day were so kind, helpful, and informative. The ingredients were fresh and the recipes were wonderful choices. They had every detail planned out for us and it helped make us feel like we were in good hands. I was so pleased with this experience and I really could not have asked for more, especially for such a reasonable price. I highly recommend this activity and this cooking class in particular if you are venturing to Bali.

An absolute must. My 8 year old daughter and I attended this cooking class yesterday morning and absolutely loved it. If you are contemplating an Indonesian Cooking class in Bali, Paon Bali Cooking Class is an absolute must. A trip to the market to purchase fresh produce and an insight into ingredients used in everyday Indonesian cooking, a visit to a rice field to learn how rice is grown and harvested and then on to Puspa's family compound for the cooking class. This was a very hands on class with plenty of opportunity to chop, grind and cook the most divine recipes. You fwr ro cook approx 8 - 10 recipes and then eat everything you've made. And the added bonus - we got to take the recipes home. Puspa is so passionate about Indonesian cooking and by the end of the class you feel as though you are part of her family.

Such fun and a great learning experience!. My husband, myself and another couple had the pleasure of doing "Auntie Puspa's" cooking course last week. We have done a few cooking courses through Asia and this would rate as our top experience. Auntie Puspa is a charismatic, fun teacher with a great sense of humour. She runs an extremely slick operation. We did the course with 4 couples in total and this was a great number of people. We learnt to make some fantastic dishes that were easy enough even if you aren't particularly good in the kitchen. The setting for the class is lovely and we thoroughly enjoyed eating the meal we had cooked (6 dishes) in this quaint garden kitchen. At $35 AUD per person this course is not cheap by Asian standards and we have done far cheaper and very good ones in Vietnam and Thailand; but as it was the best one we have done, we didn't feel ripped off.

Excellent in every way!. My partner and a friend and I thoroughly enjoyed this class, and so did all 16 participants in our class. We learned a great deal about Balinese culture, picked up some wonderful recipes and kitchen techniques, met engaging people from several continents, and had lots of fun in the process. Everything was beautifully organized, paced, and staffed.

We LOVE auntie Puspa. Wow this was a last minute decision and boy were we glad we did it . From beggining to end we were made to feel so welcome . The morning class was full so we were lucky to be able to do the afternoon one instead . The trip on the way to the rice paddies was so interesting and insightfull and the class was run like a well oiled machine . Even the most begginer of cooks would be able to enjoy . Im not going to lie making the food was good but eating it was even better . You will hardly be able to believe you actually made the food its so deliscous and the best bit is you get to take home the recipies . We even bought a bali blender to take home to australia . Auntie puspa is the most charismatic warm and funny host imaginable . You HAVE TO try this if your in Ubud you wont regret it :D

Efficient but also warm. My partner, myself and our 11 year old son were part of a group of 15. It was a great experience, made more enjoyable by actually being in a Balinese home, with the extras of a big working kitchen. Very well organised from start to finish, a great communal experience. Staff and Pruspa ran the kitchen like clockwork and the jobs of helping to prepare our meal meant that we had the added enjoyment of savouring the finished product. Although going to the market and stopping by the paddy fields make it a long session, I think it adds value to the overall experience. Would thoroughly recommend it.

This is à must do!!!. We just had the most lovely evening.. There is now beter place to learn about Balinese cooking. We just felt at home from the first moments we were welcomed in their home. Give all our love to this lovely family, when you visite them and that you must;)

Great food, Great staff, great overall experience!!!!. This was by far one of our favorite activities in Ubud!!!The program is run so smoothly and really allows the tourists to enjoy the food and culture. We started out at the Market to learn about the ingredients, then went to the rice field, then ended up at a true Balinese compound where the class began. We then all got to help prepare the food as well as see/use the Balinese cooking tools.Auntie Puspa is a great instructor and pretty darn entertaining. She is very welcoming. Multiple staff to keep it organized and flowing smoothly.The ingredients are all fresh and the food was delicious. Recipe book included. A must do in Bali if you are visiting Ubud. Good Bang for your Buck!!!!Also nice time to enjoy interacting with other tourists.

highlight of Bali vacation. My husband and I had the most fun on this day trip. We did this day trip as part of our Bali honeymoon.The women who led us through the market in the morning was such a joy, funny and friendly. Then touring the rice fields was very unique and interesting. The highlight was the actual cooking aspect of the cooking course. I like how everyone had a chance to cook and participate! The host and hostess of the home were so warm and welcoming. This is a great experience for groups, couples and people traveling solo. You're going to meet new people from all over the world and learn how to cook some amazing Bali dishes.It's a great day adventure!!Highly, highly recommend this cooking class.

NOT JUST COOKING, IT IS A CULTURAL EXPERIENCE. The whole experience is remarkable, from the Market and Rice Paddy Tour with explanations about different fruits and the growing of the rice and village life, right down to the explanations of the Balinese Household and then the beautiful outdoor kitchen. The wonderful experience of having all the ingredients explained to you and comparisons made by Puspa to ingredients found in South Africa, as well as being included in the actual making of each dish was awesome ..... and no washing up to do afterwards. The lunch that we had made was served to us afterwards and it was delicious. Such simple, easy to make dishes that you can easily make at home. This is such a wonderful cultural experience and something that no one should ever miss. They collected us promptly from our hotel and their driver was extremely helpful too in helping me locate a sim card for my cellphone. Would definitely recommend the professional approach that Puspa and Wayan take with this wonderful cookery course

Delicious meals prepared by us. Booked this course online. Correspondence with Puspa was quick and easy. Attended the course on 24 September afternoon batch. We were 7 of us.as the only man I was asked to grind the peanuts to make the satay sauce which was a good experience using mortar & pestle. My partner & other ladies did the cutting chopping veggies and frying tempe etc. We took turns while cooking 7 dishes which were delicious. Puspa and her staff were very skilled & helpful. The best part I liked about this course was the house was kept very clean and tidy. The kitchen/paon was clean too. Nyomang explained us about rice paddy fields. The kitchen hands were prompt in cleaning stuff and organising pans for us to cook one dish after other. Overall I can recommend this course. Good fun activity for couples who wish to learn and appreciate Balinese cooking. Price was IDR 350,000 which is dearer. But good value for money!

Great experience. Puspa and staff where amazing. Great market and rice paddy tour. The traditional house tour and cooking was a interesting experience. My wife and I really enjoyed it. Only snag a long drive back to Nusa Dua. Try and sleep over close to Ubud. Stan and Zahn Cape Town. SA

Too many people in a group!. If you do not like participating actively in cooking then this class is for you, but if you do want to be be involved in a process of cooking then this class is not for you. The class is too full, 20 people + helpers and there is simply not enough space for everyone! I only got to cut garlic and stirred a pan 2 times, but I had to fight the crowd to stir the pan. In the end I do not know how to cook the dishes at home. Of course the class is entertaining and the food was delicious but I was overwhelmed by the amount of people they put in their groups. I urge the owner to decreese group sizes.

Best meal we had in Bali and we cooked it!. Our group of 13 were all enchanted with Puspa, our charming and knowledgeable host. I could not fault this experience. Starting with a visit to the markets, then the rice paddies and then our cooking class. Very well organised with attention to detail and cleanliness we loved every dish we cooked and had the best lunch ever. Thank you Puspa for sharing your knowledge, hoping I can re-create these dishes at home.

Great Balinese experience. I booked the course from the uk as a surprise for my husbands birthday. Correspondence was fast and professional. The course itself was really well organised and was great value for money. Our host Puspa and her colleagues were friendly and welcoming. We started with a trip to the market and then were taken to the rice fields before being welcomed into Puspa's home to start cooking. We made 7 dishes in total and were guided through cooking each dish. The food we created was some of the best traditional Indonesian food we ate during our trip and we can't wait to recreate it at home with the recipe book given.

Family Fun and Food. My sister, my daughter, my daughter's boyfriend, my nephew, my nephew's girlfriend and I took this class while visiting Ubud in August 2013. The class is taught in a beautiful, typical Balinese home where the owners explain the Balinese customs as well as teaching the class. It was an honor to be in their home. The class was extremely organized and informative. Everyone participated in cooking the evening meal, and dinner was served in an outdoor dining area with a beautiful view. It was especially fun for us because we were all together. There were 4 other people in the class, but everyone had a great time. My nephew lives in South Korea and we don't get to see him very often. It was a wonderful atmosphere and dinner was delicious!!!!

Great day out. This is a great activity in Ubud! The staff are friendly and hilarious. The market tour and rice paddy terraces are an added bonus. The day is very well organised and everyone gets involved. The ingredients were fresh and the food amazing. Great value! Thanks :-)

Perfect experience!. We had an unparalleled experience at Paon! The staff were friendly, helpful, professional and fun!
