We are vegetarian and they were extremely conscious and accommodating to our needs. The food was amazing, truly fabulous flavors and ample amounts of everything! This was one of our most memorable experiences, thank you!

An experience not to miss. From the start it was very informative and i learnt so much. We got to make at least 8 dishes, and they tasted amazing. A very organised day with a fabulous host, so welcomed into their world/ culture. I did a lot of research into cooking classes and was extremely happy I went with paon.Will highly recommended to anyone that has passion about food.

Awesome cooking class. We booked the Paon cooking class and so glad we did. it was one of the highlights of our trip. the staff were great - helpful, fun and was well organized. The ingredients were fresh and the food was amazing. Great value :)

A must do. Fabulous day with a fabulous host. This is what Bali is all about to me its food. This course was a great way to learn the basics of Balanese cooking and it was a very well organized day. The best thing is you get to sit down after and eat what the class has prepared. Its also a great way to meet other people.

One of the best experieces in Bali!. Wish all the food available in Bali for tourists tasted as good as this! What a great time we had, the experience is not to be missed, even if you aren't a cook - go for the food. Our hosts we extraordinarily fun and took care of us from the moment we were retrieved at our hotel, through the market and rice fields, and then into their personal residence. The spices and aromas are not to be missed. Lunch is included - Enjoy!

A fun day with a delicious ending!. We were collected by a driver and taken to the markets for a look at some of the fresh produce. Then driven to the rice paddies for a small tour. Then straight to the family compound where we were welcomed with an ice cold lime drink. (Delicious!) I had lost my voice, so was also made a special ginger tea to soothe my throat. The family is very funny and tell you a lot about their culture. There are clean toilet facilities and a nice outdoor kitchen area. You can have as much cold bottled water as you like, or purchase a Bintang beer. We were involved in all the preparation work - chopping, mixing, crushing. Then guided through all the cooking processes. It doesn't matter if you are not an experienced cook - they help you the whole time. Everyone gets involved. At the end, you get to eat all the meals you helped prepare - soup, gado gado, sates etc etc. It was fantastic. You are given the recipes to take home. It cost $35 and went from about 9am to 2:30pm. I would recommend it to everyone. The level of hygiene is extremely high.

A great Chef to teach us the art of Thai cooking. a wonderful experience and a must if traveling to Ubud. First to the markets to see what produce was available, then to Rice Paddies where the procedure of growing rice was explained, very interesting. Then to her home where surroundings were very Thai, the kitchen was outdoors under cover, and after chopping, cooking etc we sat down to a delicious lunch and came away with delicious recipes, and I would say one of the best meals I had in Bali. Lots of fun and met people from around the world. A great day.

Super organised yummy food. Paon was a really well organised class with delicious food to make and eat. Would highly recommend as a great way to have a big lunch. Good to know some of the tricks behind the Balinese food I love so much.
Great Informative comprehensive valuable!. Was great would go back and do it all over again totally worth it!! Only downer I was the only single there full of newly weds.

A class worth attending. Having a considerable background in professional cooking I got nominated to do the course but thought it would be another boring Asian cooking class- but not to be. From the time we were picked up and taken on a tour of the Ubud markets to the end of the cooking class and sitting down to lunch it was a great experience and I learnt to cook Balinese style and walked away with another notch in the apron. Cooking with fresh ingredients makes so much difference rather than most in powder or dried form. Our class was conducted professionally and our hosts were just great.

3rd time and just as good!. Visited the Paon Bali class once more and although this is the third time PusPar and the wonderful team came up trumps for a delicious lunch! A visit to the market starts the day and onward to the rice terraces, then its off for a very warm welcome with Puspar and Wayan and the team to cook within their home compound! We had wonderful people cooking with us of all nationalities and all in all had a fantastic time once again. I cant imagine ever coming to Bali and not cooking with the team! And a special thanks to the great english speaking driver who was so helpful to us locating goods on the way back to our hotel Thank you all so much!Puspar deserves ten stars plus plus plus * * * * * * * * * * +++

Learn the secrets to exotic Balinese cooking….. I don’t know what more I can say about the time we spent here, as everything has been said by other reviewers. From the time we were picked up to the time we were dropped off, we not only learned about Balinese food, but also the life of a Balinese family in the village of Ubud and how they interact with their natural surroundings. The sweet lady Wayan took us for a fabulous tour of the market. Being a Hindu from Malaysia, where our cultures and practices have so many similarities, there was still always that little bit more that we could learn and discover from the market tour itself. Did you know that there is a “greater galangal” and a “lesser galangal”? Well, if you don’t, then this is the thing to do.Next was Wayan and his jokes. Despite the lengthy and amusing jokes, we learnt a lot about padi, beras and nasi and its varieties. Soon, we were introduced to the marvelous lady boss, Puspa, who humored us to no end. We learnt the secrets of Balinese cooking and ate the sumptuous food we all made ourselves. I must say, we also had guests from other countries that all made up a very happy “family” for six hours or so. Sure, you can pick up a recipe book at a bookstore or Google the specific recipes for cooking, but none of that can replace our experience here. The experience at this cooking class is one of a kind and a must do in Ubud.

A great class to learn cooking and culture. We were welcomed to the family home and made to feel so welcome- my husband did not do the course but was invited back to eat with us that evening. Explanation of Bali culture and what the buildings are for in the home and why.Very hands on cooking class and copy of recipes and they were Devine!!! This couple should have a cooking show they were so uplifting!

The Best Food in Bali. My husband and I took the class on our honeymoon. We had a Blast! We adored Puspa & Wayan. From the beginning of our tour, they made us feel welcome and like family. The recipes we learned to make were so good, and they can easily be recreated. Using the recipe packet Puspa gave us, my husband and I have tried and successfully recreated the recipes. We loved the class, and we will take the class again or next trip to Bali. GREAT!

Looking for the Best Cooking Class in Ubud. Well then you don't have to look any further ..Been to Bali many times best cooking classTotally enjoyed the morning markets great experience ..and can't wait to try our recipes at homeThanks Wayan

INFORMATIVE ABOUT VILLAGE LIFE AND FARMING. Enjoyed the cultural lesson as much as the cooking class. Gained insights into how the irrigation system works, the Dutch designers and rice yields. The cooking class moved at a steady pace with everyone being more involved with what a mixed group who were well cared and catered to. Astute and insightful whilst being fun and light hearted. Would recommend.

If you only do one tourist thing you won't be disappointed. We loved the friendly family atmosphere. You will laugh and smile for the full 4 hours. Cooking is so seamless, entertaining and fun. Recipes to take home. Best of all it's not expat owned. Highly recommend.

Fabulous hosts, beautiful environment, and great food :). I'd love this. The 'school' is in Wayan and Puspa's family compound which is stunning. They are wonderful hosts. We did the morning class so headed to the markets to learn about Balinese food and then to the rice fields to learn about how rice is grown. The cooking was fun - "start your engines" - the food we made was delish! It was an experience more than a pure cooking class. The group was pretty big but you still get to be hands on. We made, then ate, 8 dishes. Yummo! Thanks for a great day :)

Best cooking course in ubud. A great cooking course. Wayan collected us from our villa in a local village and took us first to the rice fields to explain the process and then to the family house. We were greated with a lovely lemon/ lime juice and then introduced to Puska. She was fantastic so funny and really interesting to listen to. All the staff were great and so friendly. We cooked around 8 dishes which were lovely and then we sat down and enjoyed all of the amazing food. They even provide free beer and water all evening. The evening was finished with Wayan and Puska driving us home. They were so welcoming and we were so pleased that we chose their cooking course. Thank you.

Great Hands On Experience and Accomodated Allergies. If you are heading to Ubud, book this now! Both my wife and I have different allergies (nuts for me and gluten for her) and Puspa was incredibly accomodating. Other places in Ubud told me that since the main Indonesian sauce has macadamia nuts there would be little for me to eat. The nuts are just one minor ingredient of many so Puspa made the sauce without the nuts for our class nd even made a few replacement dishes for my wife who cannot eat soy sauce. Even with about 18 people in attendance, everyone was involved with just about every part of the cooking process.

Paon Bali Cooking Class. This was a really fantastic experience, and one of the best things we did during our visit to Bali. The husband and wife team running the business are larger than life characters who really bring the class to life. You start at the food market, learning something about the different types of food and spices, go to a padi field to learn about how rice is produced and it's importance to the economy. Then it's off to the cooking class which is held at the owners house. There were 12 in the group and we were all kept busy all the time. The meal we produced was really good, due in no small measure to the patience and organisation skills of Puspa who is clearly a fantastic cook!

A must do in Ubud!. Paon is one of the best activities that you can do in Ubud. They are efficient and highly organised. I emailed them and received a reply from Puspa on the same night.More than a simple cooking class, the experience included a tour to the markets with introduction to the local vegetables, fruit and spices. Puspa's husband Wayan gave detailed and humorous explanation of farming rice, as well as the Balinese home and the spiritual and cultural reasons behind the architecture. Puspa also shared in detail the traditional cooking tools and methods. The cooking class did not feel crowded, Puspa ensured that everyone had good view of the demonstration and rotated the tasks. This meant that we all had a go but also time to relax and observe others. Otherwise cooking all 8 dishes yourself would be too much. Puspa and Wayan are a great couple with excellent humour. We really loved our time today and highly recommend them to everyone.

Unforgettable experience. This was one of the best things we did in Bali for sure. Wayan and his wife Puspa are both fantastic hosts, and although there were 18 of us cooking they kept everyone occupied at all times. I would definitely recommend the morning class - trip to the market and rice paddies was definitely worth it. Everything was very well organized - nice happy people, fresh ingredients and delicious food in the end. Loved every minute of it.

Perfect evening. Have just left the Paon Bali cooking school after a wonderful evening. We were picked up from our hotel and on the way to the family compound, were taken to the rice fields and given an explanation of rice farming. When we arrived we were greeted with friendliness and welcoming smiles as well as a welcome drink. We helped prepare the food for 8 courses and although we didn't do all of it, the entire experience was wonderful. I didn't expect to learn everything about Balinese cuisine in one lesson (so if you are expecting masterchef, you may be disappointed - I wasn't) but we cooked beautiful food and had fun with the rest of the group members (we were 15). We were made feel really welcome and were given an insight into Balinese family life in a compound. The setting is also beautiful. Could have stayed all night!

A highlight from our Bali trip and dishes we will be trying at home!. This has been one of the highlights of our honeymoon in Bali. First a great tour around the market walking around areas we had not seen on our own and with a great insight into local food and traditions, then a ride to the beautiful rice fields where all the process was explained and then a welcoming insight into a Balinese home and traditions... And then there is the cooking!!!8 yummy dishes, a really well organized explanation and a day we will never forget!!Thank you Puspa and Wayan for such a wonderful experience!! We read a couple of reviews that said that you don't get the chance to do much and I must say that is NOT TRUE! We did loads and we were in a group of 14...This is a MUST if you are in Bali and for us was the number one activity we tried.

A human and culinary wonderful experience. I was very happy to discover a traditionnal bilinear cooking class, which was recommended also by my guide in Bali. I suggest you to go to the evening class which is less crowded.We were 9 in this group: 2 Latvian, 2 Australian very funny and an American couple. Wayan and Puspa and all their colegues are so nice. For 4 hours, their house is our house. I won't tell you in details what you will do to keep the surprise. I juste discovered nice people and generous. They explain you their culture, their art of living, their food. After cooking, you're eating what you have cooked and you're talking with the others. At the end, it's like a dinner with friends. It costs 350.000 rupees and it's 4 hours op happiness. I will remember this for a long time. Wayan and Puspa, thank you very much again for this wonderful experience. Bruno, Paris, France

Fantastic Cooking Class. This was one of the best things we did in Ubud! From the moment we arrived we knew it was going to be fun. Puspa is the perfect hostess along with her husband Wayan. The class started with a trip to the rice fields then back to their beautiful home. It was a beautiful setting. Delicious recipes, fresh ingredients and lots of laughter. Would do this again!

Hands down the best!. Well, what can I say about Paon Bali apart from what an incredible experience! From the moment we were picked up we knew we had made the right choice. Wayun and Puspa welcomed us into their beautiful home, the drinks started flowing and so too did the laughter. We instantly felt relaxed and excited for the cooking to commence. With 12 of us in the class it was a perfect number for it to feel intimate but also gave us the opportunity to meet like-minded people and have a bit of fun with the whole thing. Puspa was extremely informative as she explained all of the ingredients and traditional cooking methods and then let us get our hand dirty and start cooking! Following that we tucked into a huge 8 course feast which was not only delicious but gave us a real sense of achievement, having cooked it all ourselves! Overall, it was a fabulous experience, fun and also delicious. Would recommend to anyone looking to do something a bit different whilst in Ubud. Thanks Paon Bali!

Number 1 in Ubud. What a great evening of learning, laughing and sharing! We loved everything; learning about the ingredients and recipes, chopping, cooking and eating amazing food. Wayan is the friendiest guy! Puspa and Wayan has the perfect recipe.... For success. Everyone working there seems to be totally happy. Thank you so much. It has been amazing. Lots of fun!

Even better the second visit. Having enjoyed my visit to Paon Bali so much on my first visit 2 years ago- I really wanted to bring my Husband and son along. Puspa, her husband Wayan, and their staff are warm and welcoming and very sharing - like a big family. This is MORE than a cooking class- it is a cultural education- which would not be easy to find any other way as we are welcomed into the owners home. I feel that the organisation and presentation of the class has improved since my last visit and I was offered a change in the menu as I had cooked the other dishes previously.The kitchen and surrounds are very very clean and comfortable.Puspa manages to cater to those with special dietary needs in a way that actually makes them feel special and she is very aware of allergies to foods and is particularly careful not to mix the dishes up. Apart from all of this they are happy, entertaining and funny. My son and husband also had a great day and now want to have a go at cooking the recipes at home (a booklet is provided to take home) .....Delicious fun !

Unforgettable Experience!. This is more than your typical cooking class! It started with a tour at the local market, showing us, teaching us and letting us taste all these different exotic ingredients. Teaching us all the medicinal benefits of spices and herbs, it was so interesting. After we went to the rice paddies and were taught all about the different types of rice and the history of the fields. Then we are welcomed into the beautiful home of Wayan and Puspa who are the funniest, nicest and warmest people ever! The class was conducted by Puspa and her staff who were all amazing! We got to touch pretty much all the recipes being made and learned even more about the ingredients being used. We made a whole spread of delicious food and then sat down with the group to enjoy every bite. Served with Cold beer and shared with people from around the world, it can't get any better!

Great fun!. My wife and I were getting bored and so signed up for the afternoon class and we thoroughly enjoyed it. There were 4 other couples on the class and we all bonded very quickly and had great craic. The men did a lot of the chopping and slicing which was perfect for my level.The hostess was very charismatic and made you feel very welcome from the start. The facilities were great and the long table meant that we could all sit down together and enjoy the finished food (with Bintang of course!) and chat about our holiday experiences.A great activity even for the men!

Best cooking experience with the kindest hosts. After spending time traveling around Indonesia on our Honeymoon, we decided to embark on a cookery course...and WOW it was a wonderful experience! We were met by a wonderful driver who took us on a free transfer to the village and stopped to meet Wayan (the father and host) at the paddy fields. It was explained in great detail as to how the rice was harvested and he was genuinely happy to answer any questions we had about the village. We were made to feel so welcome. After that we were taken to his home and had a delicious welcome drink as well as an explanation to the set up of Balinese homes. Again, we felt so welcome and felt like we knew Wayan for longer!We were then introduced to his lovely wife and two family friends who took us through the process of making a delicious 3 course meal (as well as a tour of the kitchen) and enjoyed the culinary delights of our success in the dining area. The menu was detailed and we were given a printout of all the recipes and methods so we could try it at home. We got a lot out of this experience and is simply a 'must do' in Ubud. There are a lot of cookery classes, but this is the most intimate and authentic experience you could have.Thank you for making this our best Honeymoon experience so far.Selina

Fantastic experience - a must do!. We have had an amazing afternoon and evening cooking and eating traditional Balinese food. We were lucky enough to book a private class so it was just my husband and I which meant we were very much part of cooking and preparing our entire meal. Wayan and Puspa welcomed us warmly into their home and clearly enjoyed sharing the traditions of family life and showing us around their home. The class was really well organised and everything was very clean. Everybody helping spoke very good English and clearly enjoyed what they did, the explanation about all the ingredients was fascinating and we now know how many more spices grow! Thank you all for a very special experience particularly for the musical ' Happy Anniversary '! We would highly recommend this as a must do on your stay in Ubud

absolutely amazing!. we loved the way the class was conducted, our hosts Wayan and Puspa are the most welcoming hosts who puts everyone at ease immediately. loved the market visit where everything is being immaculately explained to us and the class size, activities and how it was conducted was top class. wld definitely recommend to anyone who is out for some fun and good food in bali!

A must do for every traveller to Ubud. I wasn't intending on doing a cooking class in Ubud, but I am so glad I did. This was one of the highlights of my trip. The class was so well organized from beginning to end, and it was set in the garden of Puspa and Wayan's home. There were quite a few of us, but Puspa and her helpers organized everything so that everyone had a turn at doing everything. She was funny, welcoming, and open to lots of questions. The ingredients were so colorful and fresh - you forget at home how much flavor just adding one spice or herb can add to the dish, but not after this class! We cooked all the dishes and then sat down to enjoy them together at the dinner table. A fantastic experience that I would recommend to everyone who goes to Ubud!

disappointment. We saw all the very good critics and without hesitation we joined this cooking class. But what a disappointment. The group was too big, more than twenty people. Some had to cut mushrooms, some to cut garlic and some just stared at other people cutting an onion or a mushroom, because there was not enough room for people cutting the onion themselves, In the end I had no idea nor clue how a certain dish was made, because I did not participate actively from the beginning till the end in making the dish. , My sad conclusion was that I did not learn a thing about Balinese cooking, The food we ate was tasty and nice, but it felt more like eating in a restaurant...It would be a good idea to maximize the groups till twelve people and to give people a more active role in making a certain dish from the beginning till the end of the recipee. Only then you can enjoy learning how to cook Balinese food. . .

Happy Bali cooking with Happy hosts. A good day spent with great hosts. A educational and practical traditional bali cooking experience . I was pleasantly surprised at the easy going flow of touring the vegetable market learning about local produce. Wayan is a delightful dude passionate in educating and entertaining as well. Then to the house where I thoroughly enjoyed learning about the traditional techniques of cooking by a happy Puspa (Wayans wife) made several delicious courses with ease and enjoyment. Great day highly recommend it.

Good times. Very warm welcome and very educative. These people know what they are doing. Great typical recepies and a good explenation. Their English is good and they are happy to answer all your questions. Altough the things you do are somewhat limited you end up knowing how its done. At dinner there was some live music and pickup and drop off in Ubud are included. I liked this very much! Thanks for the good laughs and great food.

A wonderful experience. From the moment we met the charismatic and entertaining Wyan for our market visit to the time he welcomed us into his home, explaining many cultural aspects of Balinese life while we sipped on an ice cold lime juice drink, I was fascinated. He and his lovely wife, Puspa, run this wonderful cooking school from their traditional family home, inviting guests to not only prepare and cook food in the traditional Balinese way but they have gone out of their way to prepare their home, conscious of our customs and requirements. Spotlessly clean facilities and superior organisational skills delivered with lots of laughs and delicious fresh food, this is a must do activity for everyone.

Highlight of our Bali trip!. Great organisation, friendly staff, excellent instruction and a great meal at the end of it all, that is what you can expect from Paon Bali. Pupsa your hostess has charisma and entertains as well as instructs. The setting is beautiful. All facilities are clean and functional and the staff cannot do enough for you. We created numerous dishes ranging from the basic yellow spice paste to and tasty yellow chicken curry. Vegetarians are catered for with a number of options available. All the hard work of preparation is done for you so you can concentrate on the finer points of the dish. The pace of the day is relaxed with the starter followed by a bit more cooking, then the main. Throughout the day you have plenty of time to chat with other budding chefs at the table or in the kitchen. You even get to have a bintang beer once the major cooking is organised. The day flew by and the meal was authentic Balinese food of a very high standard. All the ingredients were fresh and of high quality. This family run business takes your enjoyment seriously, but with a humorous twist as Pupsa and her husband (he calls himself her boyfriend) clearly love what they do. I have done cooking courses in a number of countries and this was the best by far. Thank you Pupsa and all your people. 10 out of 10. thanks Rick and Marianne, Australia

No real learning experience. Paon cooking seems to go for big groups that make it rather difficult to have a real learning experience on Balinese cooking. In our group we were with more than 20 people. Although the recipes were nice this meant that the cooking part you did yourself was limited to some basic chopping and some stirring in a pan. There was not one recipe you completly prepared by yourself and that's a pity... The hosts do a great offer to make you feel welcome but at the end i did feel like it was all a bit of a show that is do 7 days a week. Overall I would not reccomend this cookingclass, there are better more intimate options to really learn Balinese cooking.

Cooking class experience Ubud. A great day. Very traditional cooking methods used,excellent hosts with market visit, lots of cultural information about Balinese family life, food etc.The hands on experience of the cooking class was made fun by our hosts, we got to meet other people of all nationalities. The setting for the class was beautiful, well organised so that everyone in the group was able to prepare and cook ingredients. Once finished the dishes were really lovely and the only authentic Balinese food we have eaten so far. To take away we were given the recipes and the skills to try these dishes for ourselves. Would strongly recommend the day !

Absolute must do!. One of the best days we had, visited Puspa and Wayan on the 16th July.We took our 17 year old twins as well and thoroughly enjoyed every moment. Your are so welcomed into their home and will experience a hugely informative day about everything local such as the origin and cultivation of local produce and culture.

Huge amount of fun. Our party of five joined 13 other guests to cook an 8 course lunch. Puspa and her husband (who delightfully often referred to her as his ex girlfriend) made the whole experience a lot of fun. Everyone was expected to assist with the preparation and the delicious food was prepared with a lot of laughter. A great way to spend a few hours and I am sure I will be preparing my own feast very soon.

Great food and happy to cater for vegetarians. A small local business run really well. I would highly recommend this cooking school. It's very "hands on", with clear recipes to take home that give me the confidence to try the recipes by myself. I'm a vegetarian and they happily adapted the recipes. All in all a delicious experience.

Best experience this visit to Bali...... Decided on the Paon cooking class after researching on trip advisor for myself and 4 girlfriends. Wow it was excellent value. We each enjoyed the day thoroughly. The food was delicious! I was very happy to hear the menu was chicken and tuna for the day as I dont eat red meat. Every dish was fantastic and I have printed out my photos of each dish to put with my recipes to try to replicate one each week. The market visit was so educational even after being to the Ubud markets many times this visit was excellent. The rice fields visit also very interesting. Our driver was lovely too. Wayan gave a wonderfully interesting and funny explanation of the family compound and of course his story of being adopted was very interesting. Puspa was the best part I must say she is adorable and so funny. Calling us all "hunny bunnies" and had such great control and organisational skills. We were a large group of people from all countries and she managed us perfectly. We all helped and got along together it was such fun. A nice cold bintang was given to us at one stage and was gratefully received. I cannot fault this class my only suggestion would be to put the recipes into some sort of plastic cover to keep in better condition when bringing them home. I will be back next time with my next travelling companions for sure.

10/10. Absolute "must do" in Ubud. Had a fantastic day at Paon cooking class today!The program is exceptionally well run, there were virtually no down time or boring moments. The market tour was very interesting, a true Balinese experience.Our host Auntie Puspa is warm, has a great sense of humor and made the program extra special.The cooking class venue was also the hosts' home, it was such a privilege to be welcomed into a real Balinese village.The ingredients used in class were fresh from the garden and were unique to Bali/ Asia. Cooking demonstrations were easy to follow. The end products were oh so yummy, we all had a feast!Booking and hotel pickup were a breeze, no trouble at all. I highly recommend the Paon cooking class.
Really good moment !. It's really interesting and good. People are very nice. We spent a really good moment with a great atmosphere. It's one of thing to do in Ubud !!

It's a real Balinese experience. I wish I had done this cooking class earlier. It's a pity I got to know about this only on my 4th visit. Well, it's of great value. The hosts are hospital and genuinely warm. The premise of the cooking school is a sight on its own. The lesson is well- organized, injected with great fun and introduction to the Balinese way of life. So get off kuta beach and go for this class. You will have the real Balinese experience.

First rate organisation, interesting, delicious & fun. Must agree with everyone on here - Paon Bali Cooking Class is a great thing to do in Bali. Puspa & Wayan run a very well organised activity that delivers in spades. Sitting out in their lovely home overlooking a verdant valley, eating gorgeous Balinese food that I'd help make (along with 10 others), accompanied by an ice cold Bintang I couldn't help thinking that I'd happily pay to come & eat such lovely food in this beautiful environment even if it was only a restaurant...but this is so much more. Brill tour of Ubud food market led by the charming Ni Wayan who was able to tell us so much about the medicinal & health qualities of the food we were going to prepare & eat. Then a very funny exposition of family & village life from Wayan, the co-owner of PBCC, all wrapped up in a fascinating explanation of rice growing in Bali. After a delicious welcoming cold lime juice Puspa & her great team took over. I really didn't see how we were going to cook 8 dishes & all get a fair go. I reckoned without Puspa's powers of organisation & orchestration - she is amazing! And very funny. It all flew by so too soon we had to say goodbye to each other (Canada, HK, Singapore, London, Bundaberg & Melbourne). My favourites were the Tempe (who would have thought!!) Me Goreng & the Gado Gado, others were going for the Ckicken Coconut Curry, the Snake Bean Salad or Sate. Truth is, it was all delicious. Last word for the totally yum Kolak Biu, Boiled Banana (who knew!) in Palm Sugar Syrup with an excellent cup of Bali Coffee. I did this with my sister who has been to many cooking schools around the world - she says this is up there with the best. Don't miss this great day - two young lads in our group were having a great time so it's good for all.

Absolutely fantastic, traditional and authentic. Puspa and her staff exceeded out expectations. The whole experience was entertaining, informative and we learnt a whole lot about food and the Balanise culture. Set in true Balanise surroundings and we got to eat what we cooked. Fantastic . You won't be disappointed . A truly magical experience . Thanks Allison From Perth WA

Paon Cooking class in Ubud. Imagine my surprise when my friend suggested we attend a cooking class, happen to find Paon on TripAdvisor, happen to find a last-minute-spot (book early!!!) and it turned out to be the BEST part of my week in Bali. Nothing comes close to the professionalism and enthusiasm of Wayung and Puspa and their staff. Thank you for opening your home to us and sharing so much more than just cooking Balinese food in the Balinese style. I will return and bring many friends. And I say it again - I have more respect for a cup of rice now than I ever had before. The (literally) back-breaking work that goes into it is amazing. I salute you for giving us rice!
ubud. The Paon Bali Cooking Class was fantastic, from the free pick-up to the return everything was very professionally done. Would recommend this class to all ages and all skills. A must do.

Wonderful slice of Bali life experience - highly recommended. We were recommended this by friends as one the best experiences they had in many visits to Bali. And so it was … from the smiling and prompt pick-up at our villa to the end of a satisfying day of cooking and eating the best of Balinese cuisine. Puspa and Wayan have created a wonderful experience centred around food at the same time allowing visitors an insight into traditional Bali family life. The setting in their home is beautiful and tranquil and the food was exceptional - some of the best we had in our entire stay in Bali. We will definitely be trying out the recipes when we get home. A must do on anyone's itinerary who wants to go beyond the ordinary in Bali.

Do not miss this!. This was hands down one of my favourite Bali experiences. Puspa and Wayan are fantastic hosts and a pleasure to be around. The class was very well organised, informative and Puspa took the time to answer all our questions and make sure everyone was taking part and at ease.We were also taken to the local market, rice fields, and had a great (and humorous!) explanation by Wayan about Balinese homes and families whilst he made us feel completely at home.Definitely a must-do!

Must do activity when in Ubud. Our tour commenced with a very interesting tour of the local food market before continuing onto a brief ricefield lesson and the family compound in Laplapan. I've been on a few tours that explain Balinese family life and this is the most informative one yet. Wayan and Puspa deliver it in an engaging and humorous manner. The lovely Puspa then guides you on a well organised and clean cooking class for eight dishes. I must confess to consulting my watch and wondering if we had sufficient time. I was to be pleasantly surprised. Students prepare and cook each dish before handing over to her staff to simmer and plate-up. The students then move onto the next dish or pause to eat the previously cooked meals. Very slick. I assumed that we would cover the usual meals - beef rendang and satay sticks. Again I was to be pleasantly surprised. The eight dishes are an excellent variety that would suit most palates. Students are given the eight recipes at the end. A great experience for all ages.

Freshest of ingredients at this 'hands-on' cooking class. For the morning class I had pre-arranged a pick-up from my hotel in Ubud and this was very efficient. My husband doesn't like to cook so I went on my own and had an amazing day. The tour of the markets, especially the spice market, was great. Also I learnt things I didn't know about the rice growing in Bali from the rice field visit. When we arrived at the cooking class we were met by Puspa at the doorway to her and Wayan's beautiful family compound. After a brief chat by her regarding traditional Balinese culture & the architecture of their compound, we walked to the back garden where the cooking classes are held. Everything was spotlessly clean and well laid out. There were 16 of us on that day in June (including 2 beautiful children). We all had plenty of 'hands-on' time grinding spices, making satays, and everything necessary to prepare the many dishes.. There was a vegetarian couple amongst us and Puspa, without any fuss, just adjusted their ingredients to suit their needs. We all sat down after the cooking and enjoyed the fabulous food. Anybody with a big appetite will not be left wanting here!!. It was an absolutely fabulous class, full of laughter and great food. Recipes given before you leave. You won't be disappointed if you choose Paon.

Delicious. The driver was on time, the market tour was nice, Wayan and rice paddies where amazing, the home was beautiful and the food we cooked with Puspa and her team was the best we had during our stay in Bali.Just go here for an unique Bali experience, you won't regret..

Unbelievable. This experience was fantastic. The best cooking class I've been a part of. Great explanation of some cultural things and the food dishes. One of the groups showed up with 6 extra people and Wayan and Puspa did a fantastic job of accommodating the larger group without sacrificing the experience for others. Wow! What an experience.

Cooking from the heart. Just returned from a cooking class this evening and we absolutely loved it. Gorgeous couple have put a huge amount of energy and love into this small business. We felt privileged to be in their home. The trip to the rice fields first was very interesting and beautiful scenery. The food was the best we have had in Bali yet & even our 2yr old boy had a great time. Not just a cooking class though - it was much more. You must go if in Ubud.

delightful, informative cooking class. What a great experience this was..Wayan and Puspa delightful hosts and very funnyWell organised class with great amenities and delicious food to eat during class

A serious MUST DO!. Probably my favourite activity during our 10 day trip in Bali :) Puspa and Wayan are such great people sharing their home and way of life with us! I was also very thankful that Puspa fitted me into a class on such short notice. The cooking class itself was fun and easy to follow! The dishes we made were traditional and definitely something that we could try and make at home by ourselves later on. Wayan's rice paddy and house tour was just as enjoyable (MUST DO!!) He is down to earth and VERY entertaining!

Fantastic experience. I had read the reviews here on trip advisor and really wanted to experience a cooking course with a Balinese family. My hotel was based in Kuta and i had various tour booking agencies try to steer me towards other cooking schools in Kuta or Sanur. Despite the early morning start from Kuta, I am happy I stuck to my original choice, the Paon Bali Cooking class turned out to be a fantastic experience.The hosts for this course were a wonderful family, very friendly, patient and helpful. We had a market tour in Ubud and a talk at the Rice fields prior to the cooking course at their home. A group of 15 of us were guided through the preparation and cooking of 6 meals , adjusting menus for people with dietary requirements (vegetarian) and food allergies. It was an organised class, conducted in a fun interactive way and in a lovely environment. The banquet of food we prepared at the end was just incredible, some of the best Indonesian food I’ve had.

Cooking is fun!!. Even if you are not into cooking, you will love this experience. Wayan and Puspa are hilarious and it was a chance to find out so much about the Balinese way of life. Their home is gorgeous and the food was amazing. Can't wait to give it a try at home ....and I am not that great a cook! A very worthwhile and value for money experience.

A big must to do on your Bali trip. This was something we had heard about to do while in Bali, and definitely the best thing we ever did. An unforgettable day full of culture, cooking and flavours that will blow your mind. You will walk away rewarded with confidence on how to cook authentic Balinese food. The hosts were so friendly and helpful and opened arms to welcome us into there home. You would be silly if you didn't pencil in this experience while on your Bali trip.

Equal parts food and fun!. Everything about the class -- from the schedule to the recipes -- was so impeccably planned that there was never a dull moment! I had my reservations about attending a cooking class, but am glad that I finally went ahead with it. The day started with a trip to the local Ubud market where Wayan introduced to us the array of Balinese spices, fruits and foodstuffs on sale. This was followed by a trip to the paddy fields where we were given an informative explanation on the subak system, then the house compound of Wayan and Puspa where we were served ice-cold lime juice as our lovely hosts explained the layout and symbolism of the compound. The mise-en-scene of the class was great -- and while this may seem like an unimportant detail, it truly set an unforgettable backdrop to the class. The entire thing was very Balinese, from the soft gamelan music in the background, Puspa's elegant batik kebaya to the lush jungle backdrop. It felt like a true blue Balinese experience!I was a little downbeat during the start of the class as my camera battery had unexpectedly died on me, but Puspa's infectious optimism cheered me up in no time. Wayan and Puspa were superb hosts and kept things breezy with their jokes and laughter. It was especially delightful to see them jokingly chide one another, which tickled me to no end. Before long, everyone had already warmed up to Puspa as we segued from dish to dish.On the day I visited, we cooked a total of ten dishes (including dessert), all of which I thoroughly enjoyed. The pace was nice and breezy but not slow, and everyone was kept busy throughout the class -- even the kids were involved! We were all, at some point in time, chopping or grinding or stir-frying and no one was left out of the action! The class similarly caters to all, be it novice wannabes or experienced cooks. Despite being a beginner, I found myself being engaged and involved throughout and the procedures were simple enough to follow. The final dishes were superb, too. I'm unsure as to whether the menu changes daily, but I particularly enjoyed the sate lilit and fried tempeh we cooked on that day. It took all the self restraint in me to stop myself from taking a third helping! The dessert -- an uncomplicated dish of bananas and jackfruit cooked in palm sugar -- also left me wanting more, and I thoroughly enjoyed it despite not being a fan of jackfruit. A recipe, thoughtfully compiled together, was provided after the class and I'll be sure to try out the dishes at home!The day ended with a flat camera battery, a full tummy and a satisfied smile. I'll definitely recommend this class to all travellers to Bali, especially those based in Ubud. You simply can't miss it!

A highlight of our trip. We couldn't fault a thing- the day was so well planned,informative and loads of fun. The morning market tour to explain the Balinese fruit, veges and spices was terrific ( bought some gorgeous Balinese aromatic oil that is sooooo refeshing, Wayan gave a background at the rice paddies about the importance of rice in Balinese culture, then a (hilarious) chat about the layout of Balinese family homes while we sipped our welcome drink. Aunty Puspa made all feel welcome, great cooking teacher and full of humour. The group size was fine- there as plenty of room and plenty to do - liked that we recieved a recipe book at the end so we can replicate it at home. We cooked and ate some of the best food of our trip...so much so that we tried to book to go back next day for the evening class, but was booked out....oh well, a good reason to return to Ubud!
Great Experience. We had a great time at the cooking course and learned a lot. Definitely worth doing if you're in Ubud, the hosts are great and you end up with a delicious lunch at the end of it.

Best cooking class and all day authentic Balinese experience!. Professional, well organized, fun and informative. A must of you are visiting Bali! The food was fantastic and the staff couldn't have been nicer.

Great day. Wonderful day learning about Bali family life and cooking. Mixed bunch of people but all fun to cook and learn with. Well run and very enjoyable. The food was great and all the staff very professional even when the group managed to break 2 pots of coffee! Felt very welcome, money well spent.

Fun day with Wayan and Puspa, what a hoot. Wont bore people repeating the itinerary just want to say its a great day, well worth it and I have already made some of the dishes at home. This is a very professionally run outfit and it is not a bludge, you will be working but you also meet some great fellow travellers. So nice to get some insight in the real Bali lifestyle.

Honeymoon Highlight. A huge Thank You to Puspa, Wayan and the team for a wonderful afternoon/evening. It was wonderful to be invited into a real Balinese home and make some wonderful dishes (with a little help). Everyone was so friendly and funny, delighting us with tales and sayings. It was wonderful for us to have the place to ourselves but I imagine it is also a great activity to do with a group or to use as a place to meet other people travelling. The food that we made was some of the best we had in Bali and we hope to recreate the dishes now that we are home. Would highly recommend!

Great day out - definitely recommend!. Thank you Puspa and Wayan and all people at Paon Cooking Class for an excellent day out. The trip started with an interesting and non rushed trip to the markets. so colourful and interesting! We then proceeded to the beautiful rice fields just as you see in a travel brochure. Wayan was very comical and interesting explaining the history and harvesting of the rice. We then went on to the family compound, again a very interesting and sometimes funny explanation of life and families in Bali. Already we felt so welcome and part of the family. Then we started cooking, it was so interesting , everything explained , so much help yet extremely hands on (no slacking allowed). Loved Puspa and her family. The food was out of this world...our final 8 dishes were fabulous...so much so that we had no room for dinner that night, unheard of! The price was so reasonable I think every tourist to Ubud should try to pre book this experience. 5 stars !! All i have to do now is try to recreate these amazing dishes !

I couldn't speak more highly, if I tried!!. I had such a wonderful time at this cooking school, that I was recommending it, while still in Bali!!You have free collections in Ubud, and they can arrange transfers from around the rest of Bali. We were firstly escorted around the markets, which was a nice start. Getting to see local produce was fun, especially for fruits and spices we were not used to.We then came back and listened to the husband and wife tag team explain all about their school. They were funny and warm and very welcoming and we had an amazing time. We were hands on in everything from preparing to cooking. We had a wonderful group of travellers from all over the world, which was good too. We made many dishes, from yellow curry, tuna in banana leaves, The course went from 8.30am to about 2pm. We all took our time and no one was in a hurry to leave.Thanks guys, for such a wonderful time.Sitting down at the end, was fantastic and we were all so proud of achievements.

Great insight into Balinese culture. I loved this cooking class, it was one of my favourite things that I did in Bali. The hosts are extremely friendly, welcoming and funny and it's a great opportunity to meet other travellers and get to know them in a casual setting. I really enjoyed the market tour, particularly as the guide explained how Balinese offerings worked as I had been wondering this since I arrived and saw them all over the streets. The rice fields were beautiful and it was very interesting to hear how the rice is produced to feed huge families all year round. To be honest I was actually dreading the actual cooking part because I know nothing and I mean NOTHING about food, ingredients and cooking. However it turned out I had nothing to worry about because the jobs we were given were very simple and well explained so that even I could handle it. The flip side of this I would imagine is that for an experienced cook or someone who is very interested in learning how to prepare a full Balinese meal, you don't really get that experience. The day is more about a cultural insight and a casual lesson, but this suited me perfectly and was exactly what I wanted. I would have hated to feel under pressure to prepare a meal by myself which others would be eating. Instead, we all contributed to making a number of dishes which we could choose from in a buffet style. The location of the house is beautiful and it was a really really wonderful day, I am very glad I took this class.

Have recommended to all my friends. Loved loved loved this course, the family is so warm and welcoming you can feel the spiritual energy coming from them and their home. Setting is Amazing in the hills - just gorgeous. Have made the recipes many time for dinner parties with success. This was the highlight if everyone's trip, my whole group agrees

Feel the real Bali life. You will find all excellent comments on paon cooking class. I just want to had that you will live during a half day Balinese life. After traditional Balinese market, you will go to rice fields where wayan will explain you rice story and important place that rice have in Balinese families. Then you will enter in real Balinese house where you will understand role of every buildings and temple in Balinese life. Next you will see, taste, touch every ingredients use to cook. You will work together, Balinese family and other countries students of the cooking class to prepare the best lunch that you will eat in Bali. You will never forget this human experience.

Great Class - Even My Non-Cooking Husband Enjoyed. Everyone's positive reviews basically sums it all up. Great husband and wife team and they speak great English. They know what to do to keep everything moving and everyone in the class had plenty of hands on time. I think our class was ~15 people?Also, they are very accomodating to gluten free/vegetarian. They ask beforehand so they can accomodate those people.We ate about 1PM i think and we got back to our hotel at 2PM.Highly recommend. We were recommending it to other people we met during the rest of our trip.

Awesome and Delicious Cooking Class in Bali!. My wife and I are on a three month journey through Southeast Asia. We have been to six countries and are now in Bali at the end of our trip. Our travel agent planned this cooking class and we didn't know what to expect. We did another cooking class at a restaurant in Vietnam that was lots of fun. Well, Paon was just as awesome! The really cool part (besides the best meal we have had in two and a half months) is that you go to the owner's actual home and get to see a traditional Balinese home before you cook. The owner, Puspa, is so funny and endearing and really makes you feel at home. She is an excellent chef and has great people helping her and ultimately the client cooks. It was just the right amount of hands-on without being too intense. They explained all of the dishes to us very well and the cooking moved very smoothly with the dishes coming together superbly. It was the best meal we have eaten in six countries. Also, there beautiful garden is a great setting to cook and then enjoy. If you are looking for an authentic Balinese experience, this is a great choice!

An amazing experience in Ubud. What a great day. Pickup from hotel, market ingredient tour, rice paddy explanation from husband Wayan (very charming), then on to his and wife Puspa's family home. A home tour (explaining the different buildings) then on to the outdoor kitchen where the equally charming Puspa awaits. A morning of chatting, learning, cooking and feasting. The host family want you to feel welcome, as evidenced by the help yourself to drinks (Bingtang costs a little more, but you fix it all up at the end so transactions don't taint the family atmosphere). A lot of fun, all hygienic (gloves and hand sanitizer throughout). And at the end you all sit to eat the delicious meal you've prepared (two starters, a salad, two mains, a dessert). Best tip... Have a small breakfast. At the end, we had to go shopping for a hammock, and the helpful driver dropped us at just such a shop. A memorable experience.

Great Day. We enjoyed the morning cooking class. It was so clean and well organised with everyone helping to prepare the final meals. Everyone was assigned different jobs and rotated often to ensure no one missed out. I would recommend this class to any traveller or resident of Bali. Fantastic. From the pickup and market visit, rice paddy tour (Wayan is so much fun) and the class right through to drop off. Nothing was too much trouble and everything was about smiles.

Highly Recommended!!. What a great day out in Ubud, highly recommended! A group of 17 ladies traveled out to Ubud from Seminyak for a hens day of cooking and we all had the most amazing day!! Puspa and her staff are very entertaining and educational about Balinese culture and cooking.The feast at the end was delicious!!! The best food we had in Bali.

Highlight of our honeymoon. We had an excellent time at paon cooking school and it was a highlight of our honeymoon. It was amazing to have the place to ourselves. All of the team were extremely friendly and the facilities were excellent. The location is amazing and the food we produced (with a little help!!!!) was fantastic. I would highly recommend.

Best food we ate in Bali!. We had gone to several restaurants in the Ubud area and the food we cooked was by far the best and most delicious. I am very familiar with Indonesian cuisine and this experience and food was fantastic and authentic. One of the members in our group is vegetarian and they were very accommodating. Overall, great experience and fantastic food!

Cheryl & Amanda, Australia. This class was recommended by friends. Myself and my daughter decided we would like to do this on our first trip to Bali. So glad we did. It was a great experience. The host were such lovely people. The group was small but very friendly. Wayan explained the farming of rice, and the set up of their home and family. The welcoming drink was very much appreciated. Puspa was very patient and good fun. Loved the way she came over to the table with one of the dishes balanced on her head. Sharing our cooked dishes with a drink in a beautiful setting at the end of the class was an experience that I would recommend to everyone.

One of the most enjoyable days in Ubud. We have just completed our first cooking class hosted by Puspa who is the principal of this cooking school. We had a great day and met some very interesting people. The class itself was relaxed and fun and at the same time we learned some key aspects of cooking Balinese food. We would recommend this experience in a heart beat. As a beginner in cooking I now have more of an interest in trying my hand at Balinese cusine because Puspa made cooking so much fun.Puspa was friendly and was prepared to help us with our other activities in Ubud, she is truly a lovely lady. Her husband Wayan was also chirpy and taught us about the rice crops and harvesting.

fabulous!. This is a beautiful way to spend your day. From a tour of the market, to the lovely rice fields outside of Ubud, then their lovely home. From explaining the importance and planting of the rice to the layout and family life in a Balanese home. Wayan is informative and entertaining. You are greeted with a welcoming drink by his lovely wife Puspa then on to the open air kitchen next to their organic garden. The group is not too large and we met wonderful people. We made a surprisingly large variety of delicious food. My friend is a vegetarian and was able to make a vegi version no problem. The curry sauce is delicious and can be used at home in a variety of dishes. I plan on making it soon as my jet lag is over. Please don't hesitate to sign up I don't see how any other class could compete. Fun for men as well.

A Must! What a great experience. I have been to Bali many times, this time my husband and I thought we would do something different and learn about Balinese Cooking. This was such a fantastic day!! Picked up at 8:30 taken to the local market shown local produce before a trip out to the rice paddies and shown how they grow and harvest rice.Then taken to a traditional Balinese village..then served with a fresh and cold lemon drink , then shown how they live in thier village before Puspa gets us involved in cooking all sorts of culinary delights. We all sit down and share our days work eating this amazing food and drinking home made ginger/lemon tea or fresh coffee..beer etc finishing off with the yummiest desert .try it you will not regret it.

Amazing experience!. This cooking experience was a fantastic package and was a memorable part of our honeymoon experience. We learnt about and used fresh local ingredients and the main balinese cooking styles and recipes. Wyan and Puspa were fantastic hosts and we learnt so much about balinese life and got to see their beautiful compound. To top it off we enjoyed eating all the dishes we had been part of making in a stunning setting as the sun set. An experience not to be missed. Thank you!

A wonderful experience. To put it simply, the cooking class was a complete and rewarding experience. We went to the markets for ingredients, visited rice fields and had the lesson in a beautiful Balinese home, all the while being given thoughtful cultural insights by our guides. What I liked were the small things; welcome drinks, ginger tea, toast for those who missed breakfast, gamelan music, attention to hygiene and genuinely warm hosts. Furthermore, the whole outing was conducted in the most professional manner. But of course, the piece de resistance was the lesson and the food. I know now how to cook delicious traditional food and eat it as well!!

Fantastic day with wonderful people cooking marvellous food.. The total experience was fantastic. From the markets to the rice fields and then taking you into their home like your part of the family. The food was amazing and the way the class was taught meant everyone had a chance to try without being over whelmed. If your thinking of doing the course don't think twice. Book !!

Too much FUN!. What a great time! Very prompt and courteous, pickup was right on time. The food was very tasty, and the lady running the class (Puspa), was very funny and charming. This attraction is well worth attending.

Great food, great people!. My husband and I selected this class because of the great reviews on Trip Advisor, and the class didn't disappoint. The owners were very conscientious of clean cooking standards and their well-planned program kept the group moving through the activities, such as a visit to the market, neighborhood rice paddies, and tour of their Balinese compound, but without being rushed. The food was excellent and there was great attention to allergies and dietary needs (nut allergies, vegetarian, etc.) I highly recommend this class if you have a day available in Ubud.

Brilliant!. Pain cooking school was educational, fun, great value for money, delicious and overall really well run. We not only learnt about Balinese cooking but about this lovely culture too. Set in their lovely home amongst the rice fields my mum and I thoroughly enjoyed it. Thank you!!

Great Experience. We did the cooking class with 3 adults and 1 eight year old child and all loved it. We enjoyed being involved in the food preparation and eating the gourmet dishes at the end. Highly recommended.
Best Cooking Class in Ubud. We thoroughly enjoyed a fabulous day of authentic cooking following by a magificent feast of delictible fine Indonesian Cuisine

A must do in Bali/Ubud. We loved this day out in the Ubud area of Bali. It was fun, yummy to eat and filling, you met a variety of other travellers and you appreciated the steps/preparation that goes into these meals!We highly recommend it to anyone who wants to learn Balinese cooking in a genuine Bali setting (not in a touristy hotel) and enjoy other people's company at the same time.Our drive out from Legian showed off the gorgeous countryside and the villages while fascinating also remind me how lucky I am to live in Australia!I can't really cook yet my partner can. We both enjoyed the day from the eye opening markets with a tour guide that could answer any question about anything in and around the markets that we saw to the informative stop at the Padi fields before our cooking started. Our arrival at Puspa's home was warm and friendly and refreshing with a welcome drink and an interesting explanation of how the traditional family home/compound layout works in Bali.Our cooking instructions were detailed, simple and clear to follow for a novice like me and if you had more technical questions then our trainer could answer those too.It is a team cooking format so each person is given tasks but you receive all the recipes so you can easily practice at home and the trainer ensures everyone has equal opportunities to cook.It is professionally run, very high standards of hygiene and you leave feeling full of your yummy food and happy about life!Go do it!

Excellent! Excellent!. We had an amazing time during this class. We did it in the evening, so there was no market visit (if you want to do that, do a morning class). Some people here have an issue with the number of people in the class. That didn't bother me, as there was a great group when I was there. But I can see their point. The only downside to the number of people for me was the time you got to spend with Wayan and Puspa. This couple, who operate Paon Bali, are such personable people that you want them all to yourself for the entire time.I highly recommend this event. Even if, like me, you get so used to counting your Rupian and think Rp.350,000 is a lot. It is, but it's worth it!

Learn about Balinese family life. An amazing experience to learn about the family life of the Balinese people. Got to learn how to make delicious dishes with a cookbook to bring home! Wayan and family were very hospitable and friendly. Highly recommend going!

Fabulous!. I booked this on recommendation from a guy that I met travelling and am very grateful for the recommendation! I thought this was fabulous. Everyone was lovely and the food, oooh lordy, the food! (I waddled back to my guest house with a serious food-baby and a massive grin).We started off in the market where Ms Wayan showed us the different types of fruit (got to try mangosteen and snake fruit), as well as explaining the different spices that are used.Next we hopped back into the car to go to visit the rice fields (lovely photo op!). Mr Wayan explained the process for making rice.Then we went on to the family compound where the class took place. Everything was super well organised, and ran very smoothly. We all even got to have a go on the "Bali Blender". :)When the cooking was finished we all got to tuck in, and it was *delicious* (not to mention *heaps* of food - they kept asking if we wanted seconds but we were all so full we had to decline. All in all, I really enjoyed myself and would like to say a huge THANK YOU! to Puspa and her team. 10/10

Excellent. Had an excellent evening. Very well looked after, very 'hands-on' and so much food to eat when we'd finished! Pupa and everyone else looked after us brilliantly. We would recommend this to anyone.

Getting our Bali on!. From the first contact I had with "Aunty Puspa" via email this cooking class was one if a kind. We where given a tour of the local rice fields and given the full run down of how things where harvested and locally produced. Puspa and her husband where fun and interactive and made you feel welcome in their beautiful home. The food was step by step and really interactive, everyone had numerous opportunities to get there hands dirty and cook Balinese in the traditional way. The food was AMAZING and Puspa have us lots of alternative options for ingredients so we can try and replicate it at home. We had a great time and would record this to anyone who wants to taste and experience some local culture.

If you love to cook and eat !. This is a great thing to do if you like to cook and eat , hands on prep and cooking ,ingredients well explained class moved along well venue very clean . Great afternoon Thanks Paon

Great food..... I attended a morning cooking class with my mother in October 2012 and we loved the food but there were just too many people. Then add to that the several people who 'had to do everything' and quite a few of us were left sitting back watching (unless we got the elbows out and pushed the others out of the way!)

Great class!. I loved this class, which we did in the afternoon. My impression is that class sizes are smaller in the afternoon -you don't go to the markets but you do get a visit to a rice paddy for explanation. The explanation of rice growing and Balinese family life were better than any others we had on our visit. With only 6 in our group, we go to do lots of cooking (though there was clearly a lot more going on behind the scenes!). Atmosphere and food were both great. The class was well organised and run very efficiently and professionally including all the timings. Definitely a great one!

Great food, wonderful place, but too many participants. This is a classing cooking class structure with market visit, rice paddies explanations and half a day spend in the compound of a Balinese family. You will feel sincerely welcomed and at ease. Time is spend to explain local cultures and family structure.The food is wonderful and a total of 8 dishes are prepared.It is my second cooking class in Ubud, last year I went to the other one (in the top 2 of TRip Adv. ranking). Just be aware that the facilities have been prepared to have up to 20 participants and really, this is way too much. The day I took the class we were 19! Everything take more time and you can not have much contact with the owners mor the other participants. With so many participants, the price should be half of what it is, because it is a complete different dynamic compared to 4 to 6 people classes.I strongly recommend the other one, more time is spend to visit the family compound, more hands on during cooking preparation and much more interaction is possible with the family.

Fantastic cooking class!. Wayan and Puspa's cooking class is great! My sister and I cooked a variety of authentic dishes Balinese style. Wayan and Puspa's English is exceptional, they are very welcoming hosts! The level of hygiene was top quality and it was a great evening activity! Am going back to Ubud and will be sure to pay them another visit as my best friend wants to cook too! Thank you Wayan and Puspa - see you soon!

Best thing to do in Ubud!!!. Paon cooking class is simply the best thing to do in Ubud - and that's why:+ The stunning number of eight delicious dishes+ The serene ambiente in the compound between rice paddies+ The high level of hygiene+ A lot of participation (you really cook yourself!)+ And last but not least the friendliest and funniest hosts ever!

A "Must Do" experience while in Ubud!. The class is well designed to expand participants knowledge of Bali culture, food, and family compounds. We were picked up at our Guest House and driven to the central market in Ubud were we met the other students before our guided tour of the market. In the market, we learned about local produce, fruit, fish, meats, and spices. Then we were off to the rice fields were we met up with Wayan and learned about the rice fields, how each family removed the jungle to claim the land for rice, and the ongoing planting cycle for white, red, and black rice that is still used in 2013. Next we went to the beautiful family compound where Puspa greeted us with cold drinks and explained how each family compound is designed and laid out. After drinking our refreshing fruit drink, it was time to wash up and begin cooking eight different courses. What a treat! Puspa is a master at leading students through the learning process, dividing up the work while ensuring each student has a chance to participate in creating the different dishes. The class was FUN and the participants enjoyed working together to cook amazing food. We had a delightful time and LOVED the food we made. Now we plan on holding a cooking class here at home to share our experience with our family. Puspa offered to answer any questions that may surface once we are on our own. DELIGHTFUL way to spend a day and well worth the price.

Our best day in Ubud. This was definietly the best experience we had in Ubud. Puspa and Wayan are so knowledgeable, welcoming and at the same time funny and relaxed - their home is beautiful and a great place to spend the day. I guess the main highlight of this cooking class is their level of organization and the fact that all students get "hands-on", with employees cleaning up our dishes etc. as soon as they have been used. We came with our 2-year old boy who ended up playing gamelan (local instrument) with Wayan, playing with the fish & dogs, so the entire family had a great time. I definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Ubud and who is after a "true Bali" experience.

A Balinese culinary journey your mind and stomach will devour!. A wonderful way to spend the day! The hosts were so welcoming, knowledgable about the food, and provided us with wonderful insight into the local culture. The food was beautiful and the pace of the class perfect so that you could sit and chat with the other "students" At only 350k person it was great value, including: an icy refreshing free welcome drink of lime juice, about 6 different dishes, a free Bintang, free water and the recipes printed to take home and recreate!! Would definitely recommend!

More then just a cooking class.. We did the morning tour that starts at 08:15 with a pick up at your location of choice and end at around 14:30 with a drop of. First they take you to the local market in Ubud town and explain about local habits and products. After this a short stop at the local rice fields that are just breathtaking, and then it's of to the private home of Wayan. Your welcomed with a nice cold drink and short explanation of the Balinese house and some of it's customs. Then it's of to the kitchen learning and cooking up to 8 different dishes and eating it later, that will taste great even when your not a good chef. During cooking you will learn about Balinese traditions and ingredients that are right their in the garden. People are amazingly friendly, very professional and super clean. No risks what so ever for your sensitive western stomach as they only use non "risky" products. Free drinks included and all this for a measly 30 dollars pp! I would definitely go again when given the opportunity!

Paon was a wonderful experience - highly recommended. Starting with a nice journey to the outskirts of Ubud and beautiful rice paddies, we were led through the experience of being Balinese, growing and cooking your own food, and living and sharing life's bounties with your family and village. It is difficult to appreciate life in Bali without such an open family experience and what better way to do it than over the centre of life - food. I can only highly recommend this professional, warm and filling experience to anyone, young, old, couples and groups. It will enrich your life beyond simply new cooking skills.

Excellent activity and food. The tour starts at the Balinese market area, where they show you the different vegetables and fruits they have, and the flowers they use as offerings to the temple. Next they show you the rice fields and tell you how the plant rice and what are the different stages of the planting. Finally we go to Puspa and Wayan's home, they show you their home which is built according to the Balinese tradition, explain you a bit about the culture, then starts the cooking. You cook 8 different dishes, and get to do a bit of all the steps of the preparation. You eat your 8 course meal and then they offer you the ride back. Everyone was very nice and accommodating, and this is not only about food, but also of the Balinese culture and traditions, which we wouldn't know elsewhere. I recommend it to everyone, it's also suitable for kids.

Home Style Cooking In Bali. If you want to experience a Traditional Balinese Cooking School in a Traditional Balinese Home don't go past Paon Bali Cooking Class. Your culinary adventure starts by unlocking some of the key ingredients that makes cooking Balinese dishes seem so easy once you know the secrets. Wayan will take you on a tour of some rice fields which only takes 5 Bali minutes lol. You will then be taken to the home of Puspa & Wayan and be warmly greeted, you will then begin your class in a very clean, hygienic environment, you will cook a variety of different dishes, Peanut Sauce, Yellow Chicken Curry, Satay Sticks, Clear Mushroom Soup, Bean Curd, and the list goes on. You will eat what you cook WOW great food. You will also be given Recipes and notes of what you cook to take home. DONT MISS THIS COOKING CLASS it is the best in Ubud as I and my wife have been to two others. The cost is 350.000RP about $33.00 AUS Dollars, Bintang laid on for free but at $1 AUS each it is polite to give a tip at the end to help pay for the Bintang.

Excellent yet again!. I have just returned from my second cooking outing at Paon Bali Cooking Class and feel compelled to share my experience. This excursion is fabulous. Pupsa and Wayan are consummate hosts exuding friendless and a desire to share their love of Bali and its food. The food preparation is fun and informative, and paced very well. Nothing is hurried and when one sits down to eat it is somewhat of a shock to realize how much the group has cooked. The food and the menu choices (all nine of them) are wonderful. Highly recommended, even for those who are no 'foodies'! Great value all round.

Great Food. What a great day!! We were picked up from our hotel, driven to Ubud to meet up with others in our group and headed off to the markets to check out the fresh produce. From there it was off to the rice fields to meet Wayan and get an understanding of the history of the fields and their sizes handed down through the generations. Next it was off to Wayan and Aunties home, a wonderful welcome drink and Wayan explained the layout of the compound, the homes, temples and meeting rooms. Next it was Aunties turn to take the reins and lead us off to the cooknig area. All the wonderful fresh ingredients!! We all did our share of prep and cooking under watchful guidance, the smells were fabulous! The food excellent! the hosts amazing! A definate must if you love cooking and enjoy Balinese food. Certainly value for money. Will do it again next visit!
Great Bali hospitality. Had the best day again second time around will tell everyone to go if you don't go you will regret it

stuart and Alinta Ubud cooking 2013. An unmissable experience if you want to meet 2 exceptionally dedicated Balinese, wayan and puspa who run the day. you will come away well informed on the market produce, the rice paddy system, the balinese house compound layout and of course an 8 course cooking class and lunch or dinner all so well managed, we could not recommend it more highly as a great experience.

Fantastic highlight of Bali trip. I visited the Paon Cooking school recently with 3 other friends, It was a fantastic day and excellent value for money. The venue was beautiful, facilities excellent, hospitality evident and a fabulous, interesting day was had by all. I recommend this 1 day cooking school to anyone who is interested in cooking and Balinese culture.

Best experience before heading home!. Thank you Pupsa and Wayan for such an entertaining and fulfilling day. We cooked and ate the best meal that I believe I will ever eat. Fresh ingredients combine with humour and good company to make a plate of flavour never to be matched. Market tour was also welcomed information to add another view from local knowledge. We will be back as were some of the people there today making their second trip back.
Awesome!. Such a wonderful experience. Puspa and Wayan have thought of everything. They are a delight to spend time with. And the food is truly beautiful.

Very informative class!!. My husband and I had a great time in Wayan and Puspa's cooking school. Wayan picked us up and was so kind and full of information! The class began with a tour of the market, then onto the family's rice paddies to learn about the rice harvesting process, and lastly we went to Wayan and Puspa's beautiful home where we spent the day fully emerged in the Balinese culture (Both from a culinary standpoint as well as life within the balinese home)... The family went above and beyond in their inclusion of everyone in the kitchen and home... We learned how to cook about 8 dishes.... At the end of class They even handed us packets with step by step instructions on how to cook each and everyone of the dishes.... My husband and I will absolutely be making some of these dishes at home... The meals was delicious and the hosts were incredible, they truly went above and beyond... In fact, Wayan even offered to take the guests on a tour of their village after the class was over... This was truly a unique and unforgettable experience.

Lots of fun, highly recommended. Wayan and his gorgeous wife Puspa go out of their way to make you feel welcome in their home. They start by giving you a bit of history about their family and cultural beliefs which I found very interesting.The cooking class is both fun and informative and the best bit about it is you get to devour the buffet feast at the end. The food is delicious.A must do when in Ubud.
