Authentic balinese food with organic materials. No wonder this class is popular amongst the healthy freaks and vegetarians. The menu really caters for this kind of dieters, they're also tasty. Class was practical and both Wayan & Puspa are very hospitable, makes you feel welcome at their home.What really impressed me was they made their own coconut oil. They also showed how they extracting the oil from the coconut fruit. Love it, I wish I could bring the oil back to Australia.

Definitely number 1. After regretting not doing the Paon Bali cooking class on my previous visit to Ubud 2 years previously I returned so that this time I could and I'm so glad I did!Puspa and Wayan are gracious hosts who are informative and have great sense of humours.All the cooking is done within the confines of their beautiful home with fantastic views of the surrounding countryside and all ingredients are lovely and fresh. We cooked 8 Balinese dishes which were all flavoursome and delicious.Every aspect of the programme is fine tuned, Puspa ensures that each individual is given an equal amount of tasks and this creates a great rapport as everyone gets stuck in. If you love food and want to learn more about Balinese culture you will thoroughly enjoy this and I highly recommend it.

The most unforgettable cooking class :). "Start the engine!!!!" Aunty Puspa cracks me up! Haha...Everything about Paon Cooking class experience was unforgetable. I have been to Ubud several times , but it was my first time with my girlfriends to experience with a local guide going to the traditional market of Bali, rice paddies and went into a traditional Balinese house where the cooking class took place. They are a group of proffesionals and friendly people. We cooked more than 6 dishes in 6hours which was pretty surprising because time flew when we really enjoy. I have to say my favourite would be the welcoming ice lime juice, the curry chicken and the balinese satay. Seriously, this cooking class is fully recommended for all ages! Mr. Wayan and Aunty Puspa take cooking to the next level, they bring laughters and joy. Thank you very much Aunty Puspa & Mr. wayan! :)

Warm hospitality and great food. What a wonderful day - one of the best I had in Bali. The highlights include a trip to a local market, a visit to the rice paddies and cooking eight yummy dishes in very pretty surroundings. The hosts are a husband and wife team who are welcoming, funny and knowledgeable. One thing I felt was truly excellent was the way the school worked to include those with specific dietary needs. I have an allergy as did one other member of the class and our hosts went out of their way to adjust the dishes so we wouldn't miss out. They also created some less spicy dishes for the children in the group too. This is a great class for all, and a really enjoyable experience that not only teaches you about Balinese cooking, but also about the culture of this wonderful place.

Excellent day, great food.. Visited Paon as part of hen's day in Bali and had such a lovely time. Wayan and Puspa were hilarious, the food was fabulous and their home was beautiful. We did lots of chopping and cooking and I learnt a few things. Not sure if I'd enjoy it so much with a group of strangers, but for us it was perfect. Highly recommended. Now I've got to finish cooking my tempeh. Yum.

Can't fault the hospitality, wonderful warm people. Not much actual cooking. We (gf and I) went to the afternoon cooking class based on other tripadvisor reviews. The hosts are fantastic, very welcoming and a pleasure to be around.I have been to a couple of cooking classes before - Morocco and the UK and on these courses the class size was 6-7 people. At the Paon Bali class there were around 20 or so people making things pretty cramped. It was a fun afternoon/evening with bottled water and beer in endless supply. For me I would have preferred to have had a smaller class and learnt more about the spices, cooking teachnique so I could take these skills home. Overall Pros: great hosts, lovely home, you eat your own cooking, bottled water and beer includedCons: Class far too big which (call me a cynic) leaves it feeling like a bit of a money spinner

Lovely experience and great food!. Loved it. What satisfied us immensely is the fact that overall, looking back at the experience it did not feel like a touristy experience, one of those commercial “got the t-shirt” activities you do on holiday and this pleased us a lot since we are not really into those.The morning market tour was quite interesting providing us a small window into the Balinese life. At the rice field we met Wayan who explained the way rice is planted and picked. Wayan and Puspa then warmly welcomed us into their charming home and made sure we were all involved in the whole process. About 20 of us in total, we all had something to do and it was a delightful experience with lots of laughter and interesting people. The dishes we cooked (8 in total) came out gorgeous thanks to Puspa’s clear instructions. She made sure to give us some tips on how to substitute some ingredients we might not find in our Countries. We then sat down with the whole group and enjoyed what we cooked, surrounded by nature in this amazing Balinese home. We were given all the recipes we cooked upon departure. Absolutely recommended.

Just amazing!. We booked the tour before we left Sydney for our first day in Ubud. We were picked up from our hotel and taken to the markets where we met with the rest of the group we'd be cooking with for the day. A very thorough tour of the Ubud food markets provided us with great insight, and a few eye opening experiences, into the balinese way of food.We were then taken to a traditional balinese rice padi field where we met up with the very charming Wayan who spoke about the process of planting and harvesting the rice. A good opportunity for some impressive photos!We were then taken to Wayan's home, the setting for the cooking class, and introduced to his wife Puspa, our guide throughout the cooking experience.The rest of the day was spent preparing, cooking and being educated about the traditional ingredients and cooking methods of the balinese. A very hands on experience. We then sat down as a group and were able to taste all of our cooking from the day, and may I add this was the best meal we had in Bali throughout our whole stay. Just so fresh, simple and extremely tasty!For our first day in Ubud, this was a great way to kickstart our holiday. We left feeling very humble to be able to enter a traditional balinese home having spent the day with such warm and welcoming people. Definitely recommend Paon cooking class whether your a fellow foodie or just interested!

Something to write home about.... It was our first morning in Bali. Twenty four hours of traveling and there we were bright and early at the Ubud market waiting for our cooking adventure to begin as the roosters called-in the morning. It was the beginning of a day I'll never forget. Wayan and Puspa are two of the loveliest individuals anyone could ever come across. Wayan with his cheeky humor and brilliant smile, and Puspa with her graceful hospitality and love for food. This was so obviously their calling; an experience that will continue to bring happiness and fond memories to every person who is wise enough to step foot into their lovely home. Don't leave Bali without this experience.

Fun day!!. Eight of us just spent the day at Paon Bali cooking class and even though my husband does Notcook, we all were blown away with how entertaining, informative, beautiful and delicious theexperience was. We were invited into a traditional Balinese family home and taught their traditions, culture and how to prepare their outstanding food. Our hosts were a delightful husbandand wife team and the school was clean, informative and entertaining. We highly recommend anyone coming to Bali to book this experience for a day..you will gain valuable insight intothe Balinese way and grow to these gentle, humble people.

Absolutely enchanting !!!. Its an amazing experience being welcomed into someone's home in Bali. Their compound is a beautiful example of Balinese lifestyle, and Wayan's explanation of the compound layout and Balinese family structure and culture, was a revelation. The cooking class was fantastic. Amazing fresh ingredients, the colours, the smell, the texture all coming together for a cultural taste sensation, and the best part is, YOU made it !!! Although is misheard one of the instructions, and put a little too much salt into one of the dishes, everything was perfect, and mashing the ingredients for the yellow sauce with a large pole is very therapeutic, lol. Wayan and Puspa are gracious and accommodating hosts, and Wayan's explanation of the rice, from farming to the way it forms an integral part of Balinese lifestyle and culture was informative. And the Bintang's were reasonably dingin too ;-)

Great fun, highlight of our holidays. Do not miss the cooking class with Paon Bali if you're staying in the Ubud area. It is fun, you learn, you cook, you eat great food and have lots of laughs and a great half day.

Eleven Lovelies loved this class. This was one of the highlights of our 6 days away together as as a group of eleven girlfriends. The whole experience from beginning to end was wonderful. Fantastic organization in a superb location. Puspa was an excellent facilitator. The food was fresh and delicious. We all highly recommend this class to you and our friends

Magic. My husband daughter son in law baby grandson and myself went to the Paon Bali cooking class in Ubud on Monday the 1st of April. I can not praise this class enough. The class was at an authentic Balinese home up in the hills of Ubud. The scenery from the Bali garden kitchen was magic. The lady chef was excellent and the food she taught us to cook was amazing!! Mushroom and Vegetable Soup, Basic Yellow Sauce, Chicken in Coconut Curry the list goes on and best of all we all got to sit and eat it. What a taste sensation!!! Everything was to the highest possible standard, hygiene, fresh food, friendless and fun. We all came away with the recipes. If I could rate this cooking class a 10 star I would. :)

Fantastic day!. We have done a number of cooking classes on our travels and this was by far the best! Puspa responded quickly to my email and arranged a pick up for us at our accommodation in Benoa. We then took part in the market tour and then had a great chat with Wayan at his rice paddy before going to Wayan and Puspa's home. They were wonderful, entertaining, welcoming hosts with a lot of information an stories about their home. The cooking experience then started and was hands on with everything clearly explained and very hygienic. We had fun from the minute we arrived until it was time to leave. The food we actually cooked was the best food we ate in Bali and the 8 course feast that we sat down to was unforgettable. My two teenage sons loved this experience as much as we did. A must do for everyone that visits Bali!

Fabulous Experience. Highly Recommended!. I recently got married in Bali in March 2013 and wanted to have a Hens Day where everyone could participate. We loaded 17 woman on a bus to Ubud for the cooking class. We all had the most amazing experience with Puspa and her staff. The couple were a comedy act that also taught us about bali customs, their home and a culinary experience we won't forget. Although we had a large group, everyone was included and particpated in the cooking of our 8 dishes. The feast at the end was worth every cents let alone the wonderful day we had.I highly recommend Paon Cooking Class. I will cherish the memory of the day as one of the best we had in Bali.

Highly recommended!. I would highly recommend this cookery course. My husband, son and I had a fabulous afternoon/evening, we could not have been made to feel more welcome at the home (compound)of Pupsa and Wayan. We were fortunate to be the only three guests on this particular afternoon so perhaps were a little spoilt, but reading other positive reviews I imagine that the experience is not necessarily spoilt by being part of a larger group. My son exclaimed that it was his favourite activity during our holiday - a great compliment from a demanding 12 yr old!

Good fun and great food. We loved this 3 hour experience. First the market tour in Ubud, then to the rice paddy where we met Wayan and then to thei compound for the cooking class. Puspa teaches well and the best bit is the whole class tastes the food that it cooks. Highly recommended. x Jenny and Ray

Fantastic Cooking Class!. We were picked up from our accommodation at 8:15am and driven to the centre of Ubud. A guide met the tour group of around 18 people and took us through the local market. The guide explained the different fruits, meats and cooking utensils on offer. We were invited to try a selection of fruits which were great.After the market we were driven to a rice paddy owned by Wayan and Puspa the owners of the cooking class. Wayan provided some comedy moments along with great insight into how rice is grown and the way Bali people live. He was friendly and very funny - a star!"Auntie" Puspa greeted the party at her home and we were all equally involved in the cooking process. The food was amazing with a wide array of ingredients grown within their own organic garden. Overall one of the best cooking classes we have taken. At the end of the day we all sat down for lunch along with a cold beer, perfect end to a perfect class.A must do while in Ubud.

A great day. We would highly recommend this cooking class when staying in Ubud (or it would be worth travelling from further). Puspa, Wayan and staff provide a wonderful opportunity to learn about Balinese food and culture and are very welcoming to their home. The food we cooked (albeit with lots of help) and then enjoyed was fresh, tasty and appealing. A great experience.

More than just a cooking class. It was a truly wonderful experience to get an insight to the customs and practices of Balinese culture. The hosts were friendly, funny and helpful. We were picked up and dropped off to our hotel, given a tour of the markets and rice paddies and cooked an 8 course meal in a very clean kitchen. Glad I made the time to experience this in Bali.
A pleasant surprise!. I had a great experience, exceeded my expectations, the owners and family members are all terrific, came away with some new techniques and ability to cook Balinese food...Rick

Best experience yet. Wayan and puspa made the whole cooking experience amazing not only did we get a tour of the local markets but we also got an understanding of living in such an amazing compound,Wayan and his wife explained the nature of bali and the Balinese people, it became not only a cooking experience but a social gathering, we all cooked together then sat and ate together, Wayan explained on our arrival all of the different areas of their home one area was the meeting area, if their was a problem in their home they would always meet in the afternoon to settle it and talk about it, maybe we should all do this !!! Best experience of our whole trip, I've been to bali 6 times this was a great cooking class and you must go, you will not be disappointed

Fantastic experience hands on cooking class with market visit and rice fields. We had the best time lovely family beautiful home made us feel very welcome. We booked morning class had the best day of our holiday .Wayan and Puspa made this cooking class so good lovely kind honest people . We learnt heaps and such a memorable day . Very helpful and so so clean and very hygenic always washing our hands ingredients were top were explained so many different foods in markets that we had never set eyes on before and enjoyed tasting the fruits at the markets so yummy .we all sat down and ate what we cooked together over a Bintang lovely atmosphere thanks for an awesome fantastic day that we will never forget and tell all our friends that are visiting Bali ..we went last Thursday .

Amazing Food. Great value for money. Wayan and Puspa are really beautiful people. Picking us up from our accomodation in Ubud was all part of the price. It was great to get a local to guide us through the food markets and taste some of the local produce.After the market we went back to their family home to cook up about 8 tradtional meals and then sat down together to the feast.Highly recomended.

Worth the trip to Ubud for a sunset cooking class!. We booked into a 4pm class & on arrival there was one other couple so it was almost a private class! The hosts were a delight & such happy humorous people! Food was pretty complicated to cook (I have done many cooking classes & unfortantly I won't be making these at home) so many spices & ingredients , don't get me wrong the food was amazing but I'm into more practical cooking I would have loved to have learnt how to make a traditional nasi goring or something that you could whip up at home. If highly recommend this course as a great night out & to see what goes into making those amazing Bali flavours!

Best experience in Bali. Wayan and Puspa are what make this cooking class so memorable. They welcome you into their home, and make you feel like family. They explained more to us about Balinese culture in the half-day we spent with them than a licensed tour guide did during a full day. They took us to the market and taught us about all the foods, kitchen tools, and spices we would be using in the class. Next they brought us to their village rice fields and taught us all about the growing and harvesting of this Balinese staple. Finally, we went to their home, and prepared a delicious 8-course meal. The course was extremely professional with outstanding explanations on every detail. Walan and Puspa are so friendly, cheerful, and the two of them are quite hilarious. I will miss them when I leave Bali, because they really did make me feel like a part of their family.

A must do when visiting Ubud!. Okay this was one of the most enjoyable events I did while visiting Ubud.The family of Wayan and Papuspa are so funny, kind and gave our group a wonderful day. This is more than a cooking class. We learned about shopping in the market for food, flowers and cooking supplies. We then went to a rice field to learn about rice from planting to harvest and then off to their beautiful house. We were taught a little history about their culture and living arrangements of the Balinese while we sipped a beautiful and delicious beverage.Puspa, a very beautiful and knowledgeable chef, took over and taught us how to cook 7 traditional dishes. Her home is beautiful and the menu she chose was amazing. She gave us so much information about ingredients and how to make many traditional Balinese dishes.Add this to your list!

Real Balinese Cooking. What a great night we had. We met a lovely group of people who, also like to experience local culture. Hi all from Tuesday 5th March. Wayan and Puspa ensured we had plenty to eat (after all our hard work in the kitchen!). I think Malcolm added extra palm syrup whenever it was his turn!!! It was so interesting learning about their culture and day to day life. As well as traditional cooking. Thank you for welcoming us into your home.

Highlight of our Southeast Asia trip! Best cooking class in Bali.. This review is long, long overdue as my new fiance and I were in Ubud in August of last year. This cooking class was the most memorable experience of the entire trip. After a private tour of the family rice fields by Wayan, we were warmly welcomed to Puspa and Wayan's family compound to create a 10 course meal, which we then ate over looking the jungle to the tune of the neighboring geckos. Puspa and Wayan (and the rest of the staff) made us feel like family. They were so charming, and we felt so welcome in the beautiful compound. The food was arguably the best food we ate in Indonesia, and we were sent home with a recipe book, which we managed to recreate in Oxford, England last weekend. Would highly recommend this experience and the number 1 most memorable and romantic thing to do in Bali. Best cooking class and authentic Balinese cooking experience in Bali.

A LITTLE SLICE OF PARADISE. Puspa & Wayan thank you so much for inviting us into your home and making us feel like part of your family.. what a wonderful way to learn how to cook local dishes and learn the Bali way of life. My self and my guests who I brought with me all had a very enjoyable day... Especially the day that the film crew were there with Para Quinn.....doing a segment of here show at your home.I enjoyed the day so much that I went back with my sisters-in-law the next week..

Cooking class and market / rice tour. Great cooking class very hands on and loads of information on the Bali way of life and cooking .The market and rice visit was informative and also a nice drive.The wonderful host puspa spoke good English and had no issues repeating her self or explaining something if you did not understand.They also will cater for people that have food issues and or vegetarian this is the first thing at the school that they ask. Loos are all western clean and cooking areas are all clean and kept clean through out your class

Great Day. This is the first cooking course I have ever done. I am a fan of eating but not normally a fan of cooking. I went with a friend who loves to cook. I really enjoyed this day and must say that Wayan and Puspa are just lovely (as are the other staff). It is so well organised and gives you a great introduction into Balinese culture, from the markets, the rice paddies, their village and day to day life. Both Wayan and Puspa are so welcoming and make you feel like part of a big family. The food we cooked was lovely and it was great to try food that I normally wouldn't try eg, tempe. I would recommend this course and who knows, I may even try to cook something at home myself.

Second visit... and I'll be back!. My first opportunity to meet Wayan and Puspa was last year in March, when my best friend an I decided to try our hand at playing chef for the day. We had such an amazing experience, I convinced my husband to join me for my second time round.Wayan himself – Paon Cooking School owner – collected us from our Ubud hotel and jumped out the car to greet us with a big welcoming hug. He knew I had come last year and was so pleased I had chosen them once again. A short drive to Ubud Place, where we meet up with our new found friends for the day and the gorgeous Made (our tour guide and assistant from last year) leads us to the morning Market, but not before she gets a big hug from me. The Market is exactly what I remembered from last year and Made doesn’t leave out a single explanation. This time Made helps me make some purchases that I was sorry I didn't get last year.We finish our Market tour and the group splits into two cars to make our way to Laplapan Village for Wayan’s explanation of his village’s rice fields. There are some children playing in the rice fields with long sticks in the close distance and Wayan tells us they are trying to catch dragonflies with the sticky substance (from fruit) on the end of the stick to use like glue. I wander away from the group and approach the children; I ask to take their photo and offer them a sweet each. They eagerly come to me with their hands out and thank me many times. As I rejoin the group, Wayan asks where his sweet is.We jump back in the cars and take another quick drive to Wayan and Puspa’s village, where we play in their kitchen for the day. As we enter their compound, Puspa is right there to greet us giving me a kiss on each cheek. A lemon welcome drink given to each guest, we relax on their “meeting room” platform and find out more about Wayan and Puspa’s life story before being taken into their kitchen, their home, their family.I was pleased to see that the profits made from their business obviously went straight back into the family compound and improving the area used for the cooking class. Since last year they had built a new toilet facility and put a brand new roof over the kitchen area. They were very proud to share this with me.Straight to it, Aprons on, knife in hand we chop; pestle in hand, we grind – mixing and creating so many flavours and aromas that will result in our amazing menu for the day. Together, all participants take on a role in the kitchen to contribute in some way to each and every dish we will later share for lunch. The menu includes: Clear Mushroom and Vegetable Soup (Sup Jamur), Base Gede – Basic Yellow Sauce (Bumbu Kuning), Be Siap Mesanten – Chicken in Coconut Curry (Kare Ayam), Sate Siap – Minced Chicken Grilled on Bamboo Sticks ( Sate Lilit Ayam), Kacang Me Santok – Vegetable in Peanut Sauce (Gado Gado), Coconut and Snake Bean Salad (Jukut Urab), Pepesan Be Pasih – Steamed Fish in Banana Leaves (Pepes Ikan), Tempe Me Goreng – Deep Fried Tempe in Sweet Soy Sauce (Tempe Kering), Kolak Bui – Boiled Banana in Palm Sugar Syrup (Kolak Pisang).This was the exact same menu I tried last year, but just as good and what made it even better, is that Puspa helped me make some minor variations to my dishes so that I could try something different. Of course she checked for any allergies prior and one of the participants was allergic to banana, so the dessert dish had Balinese Sweet Potato substituted for the banana, which I also tried for something different – YUM!The group separates (in no particular order) to two tables and we enjoy our first course – the soup. Some idle chit chat and getting to know one another, we learn in our group there are three people from Estonia, one from Finland, two from West Germany, two from Singapore and us two Aussies... and that was just our table. There were another five people on the other table.Every single person’s soup bowl bone dry, Puspa ushers us back into the kitchen to continue our cooking. What seems like only a few moments later, we are told to take our seats and a feast is quickly delivered to our table. There is SO...MUCH...FOOD! We pass the platters around and fill our plates with a little bit of everything. Hardly any room left for seconds, but feeling bad that we have left so much food, the platters do the rounds again for just a little more. We share stories with each other about our own countries and experiences and before you know it, the time has ticked away into the late afternoon.Puspa knows we are bursting at the seams, but who could resist that delicious and simple dessert – it literally takes minutes to whip up. A drink of coffee or tea to go with it, our day together winds down and the group prepares to go their separate ways. Puspa tells us their driver will take us back to our hotel in Kuta, but “no worry, no hurry”. Nyoman drives us all the way back to Kuta, with our suitcase safely still in the back of Wayan’s car.Although this was my second visit, it was just as special if not more as the first. Wayan and Puspa were so happy for me to be there and mentioned this many times throughout the day, that they made me feel like I was, in fact, their special guest. They both treated me and hubby like family, and I can confidently say that if you show genuine care and respect for their family and business, you will be well looked after.Hubby had his reservations (pardon the pun) about this day and really only agreed to come along to keep me happy. However, he did more work in the kitchen than me – I used the excuse that I’ve done it before and needed to take the photos – and he got to meet and chat with many really friendly people. Wayan took an instant liking to hubby, which immediately put him at ease. He tells me he would definitely do it again. I would definitely do it again... maybe my mum will join me next time?If you're considering doing a cooking class, you really must choose this one!

Good introduction to Balinese cuisine. We were referred to this activity by the manager of our Ubud hotel and we thank him for suggesting such an engaging excursion.The Paon Bali Cooking Class is available in mornings to prepare lunch or in late afternoons to prepare dinner. If you go to the morning session, as we did, a trip to the local food market is included.We were collected from the hotel but had to wait a long time hanging around in a temple in the city for other participants to arrive. Once we set off for the market, the excitement began to build. The guide was very pleasant and spoke clearly, but the smells and sounds (and flies) at the maket were oppressive and I felt we spent a bit long there, even though I enjoyed his descriptions of all the various fruits and spices. It was great being able to taste a few things and see the knives and other kitchen utensils on display. Time was allowed for people to buy a few things as we went around but some opted just to take in the layout and come back later to get some souvenirs.Next, we visited a rice paddy and listened to a presentation by the husband of the cooking class lady (by the side of the road). It was well organised and authoritative ad he established an easy rapport with the group in that situation.Finally we were taken to the location of the cooking class and while we sipped on a welcome drink the hosts explained the structure of a Balinese family compound before escorting us to the open verandah beside the garden where the class was conducted.There were up-front presentations by the hostess to begin with but soon a older, gentler fellow was our teacher and he was assisted by another couple of people helping keep an eye on us and whisking off what we had chopped to keep everything very efficiently organised.A touch I particularly enjoyed was the inclusion of quiet gamelan music being played live near the dining area. A very special detail for enhancing the cultural experience.Eight items were prepared and tasted. The class was pacy but there was always the opportunity to go to take water or beer whenever you wished. Beers were charged at the end of the day but water, tea and coffee was included.I won't spoil the surprise by listing the details of the dishes but I will say it was value for money. I was surprised that a receipt was not provided though.Another thing that disappointed me was that we did not get to eat our own portions as it all got put in one big pot at the end then you served yourself from the centre of the table.I would recommend this activity to others. Everyone in our session seemed well satisfied both with their education and the lunch.

Great cooking school. This was a perfect way to spend some time in Bali. The morning starts with a visit to the Ubud food market & then on to the rice paddies. The lovely hosts explain how Balinese families live while you visit their beautiful home where the cooking school is set up. The food was delightful, and you take the recipes home. I can't recommend this tour highly enough. Fun and informative, and a cultural highlight.

Wonderful Cooking Experience. Fabulous husband and wife team. Wayan's tour and explanation of the rice paddies and his detailed insight into Balinese family life was brilliant. Puspa's cooking lesson was a joy to be involved in. She is very articulate and patient with everyone, even with people like me who are not used to chopping and grinding but more used to electric blenders and grinders. There were 10 in our class and we all had a hand in all facets of the preparation. We would recommend this school to everyone and especially to those who love Balanise food

Do not miss this opportunity!. After reading reviews on Tripadvisor my expectations were high - and they were surpassed! I have just returned from the Paon Bali cooking class and HAD to post this review immediately. Wayan and Puspa are outstanding hosts and provided an entertaining, warm and educational morning, taking in the Ubud market, terraced rice paddies and inviting us into their home to cook authentic Balinese food. Free water, ginger/lemongrass tea, coffee and Bintang were supplied - as were all ingredients. The setting is serene and beautiful with lofty views and cool mountain breezes.This is day one of my first Bali visit and it could not have gotten off to a better start. Thank you Puspa for helping me source the volcanic stone mortar and pestle. I will make sure it continues to be well used. I appreciate your kindness and generosity.Do yourself a favour - if you like cooking and want to experience Balinese hospitality at its finest - this is the cooking class for you!

Highly recommended. My husband and I did the class in February. Puspa and Wayan are the perfect hosts. We started the day with a tour of the food markets, we actually found this part boring but the others in our group liked it. We then headed to the rice fields where Wayan told os all about the process of cultivating rice, from planting it to the irrigation system needed. Wayan is such a lovely man, with a great sense of humour. We met Puspa at the family home. The cooking area out the back is very professional and very clean. It was a very entertaining class with Puspa who is very good at keeping everyone on task and also entertained with her jokes. Puspa loves to be in photo's and always gives the camera a big beautiful smile. After cooking a variety of dishes we sat down around a large table and endulged in some delicious food. The day ended with us receiving a recipe book of all of the meals we created. I have no hesitation in recommending Paon Cooking Class. Thank you Puspa and Wayan. From Samantha and Graham x

My best experience in Ubud. I did this cooking class with a group of friends. We had the BEST time. Paon and his wife are the most entertaining, caring people I met in my whole 5 weeks in Ubud. I was even tempted to do the class a second time. They picked us all up, took us to the market and explained heaps of things, we cooked, we laughed, and we ATE!!! You simply must do this if you are in Ubud. Over all, it was about 5 hours, so great value for money.

Yum!. Exceeded my expectations! The cooking class also included an introduction to the Ubud market and rice paddies. The class itself was run very well and the food was delicious. And as everyone else has said already, Wayan and Pupsa were a delight.

We had the best time at Paon Cooking class. So happy I did my research on trip advisor as this was one of the best days in Bali. I went with my mother in law, sister in law and niece. Fabulous instructions, food, tour and a very home like feeling. Would do this tour again..

The best cooking class in Ubud. It was a great day, Puspa is really nice and so funny! We made a lot of food, we had such a great time in a beautifull environment in a beautifull villa. The meals were delicious and we got the recipes to cook at home.

Best experience by far!. Far, far better than the other cooking classes I have done in Ubud, such as Casa Luna ( and more entertaining!) Wayan and Puspa are so much fun and put everyone at ease.There were 9 in our class, from all walks of life and from all over the world.Afer being picked up from our individual accom, we enjoyed a tour of the Ubud market, including an explaination of Indonesian cooking ingredients.Wayan then took charge showing us the rice crop rotation, explaining the Balinese way of life in their family compound and then handed over the reins to wife Puspa to conduct our cooking class in their outdoor kitchen.It was all hands on then, with clear instructions by Puspa and her assistants. . All tastes - vegetarians, etc were catered for and we sat down to the eight dishes we had created.So delicious and enjoyable .Would definitely reccomend this to anyone who wants an entertaining day out- the cooking is a bonus.Total cost for five and a half hours of fun, plus a meal $35 ! Bon appetite!!

yummy!. This has been one of my favourite tourist attractions in Bali. We learnt to cook some fabulous food. Ibu Puspua and her husband Made made it a fun and entertaining morning.Would recommend this to anyone who enjoys good good and/or loves to cook. Will definitely be taking friends and family there when they visit me in Bali.

One of my best ever travel experiences. If you do nothing else in Ubud, I seriously suggest you attend Wayan and Puspa's cooking school. It was a fanatsic experience from beginning to end. Wayan and Puspas are two of the most delightful people I have ever come across and to be invited into their home and treated like family was a privelege. And as for the food, sensational!! The best meal I had during my stay in Ubud.

A taste of Bali. What a wonderful experience is to be had at Wayan and Puspa's cookery course. I was not sure what to expect as I had not read anything about it. Firstly, we visited the food market in Ubud and then were driven to the village to see rice growing. The main part of the day was spent in the lovely home of our hosts cooking an amazing meal. The group of would-be cooks was made up of people from Finland, Holland, Egypt, Mexico, Australia, France, Ireland and UK. We all mixed well because of the approach taken by Puspa who ensured we all got hands on. The hosts catered for everyone's taste and preference in foods. Some were total vegetarians, other's ate no meat but took fish and one has an allergy to seafood. Nothing fased our hosts. We made nine dishes in total covering starter, main courses and salads and dessert. I learnt a great deal about ingredients I had seen before as well as ones new to me. Working and eating in the lovely incense-scented garden was sheer joy, as was the fun way that Puspa dealt with us. I will definately source the ingredients at home and make some of the dishes. Brilliant.

Third Visit. This was our third visit and we took two friends to experience this wonderful insight into traditional Bali life.Puspa and Wayan are fantastic and make you feel extremely welcome in their home.The setup is fantastic and very clean.You can be as hands on as you want and it's best to get involved to get the whole experience.Don't eat before you go because there is so much to eat at the end.Would highly recommend this experience. My friends loved it !!

Great way to spend a day in Bali. What a lovely day we've just had! So much more than just cooking. Market visit, rice field stop-off, family home setting, slick set-up, gorgeous funny and warm hosts...then we get onto the fabulous food and great mix of fellow 'students'. I can't recommend this highly enough.

Number 1 for a reason. This is a great course with amazing hosts. Great to cook in a family compound and the tour of market and rice fields are worthwhile. We cooked and ate amazing food and laughed a lot during the class due to the first class hosts, who are both very hospitable and funny. Dont waste time researching just pick Paon,

Great cooking school!. Fantastic cooking school experience! We picked this one after reading reviews online and because we wanted to see the market and the rice fields. We started with an interesting tour of the market, and then met Wayan and the rest of our group of 10 students at the rice fields. Wayan's wife Puspa runs the cooking school and he explained to us how rice farming works before we went to their home. Wayan and Puspa make you feel like family, sharing the story of their family and showing you their home. Then it was on to the cooking. Puspa is fun and engaging and makes sure everyone is doing something. We learned a ton about Balinese cooking and then ate some incredible food. The class was very hands on which was nice since some classes are just demos. I also really liked that at the end, Puspa asked us for honest feedback. She is so passionate about her business and it is nice to see that. No one had any improvements though as it was a fantastic day!

Magic experience!. We did the evening cooking class last night after arranging it (via emails) that morning. We were picked up at our villa in Seminyak by a taxi (only $30 return) and taken to Ubud - a 90 minute drive. After a visit to nearby padi fields we went to the class venue and were met by the owner "Auntie" Puspa and her staff who made us (4 in total) very welcome with cool drinks waiting. She explained the setup of her home then we were ushered to the cooking area. A very pretty venue with views of the fields, and a kitchen garden. As it was a small group we all had plenty of opportunity to chop, pound and cook taking turns at the various tasks. Auntie explained all the ingredients and encouraged us to taste (and take photos) as we went along. Bottled water was available at no cost whenever required - a necessity in the humidity here :-)We made a total of 8 dishes over the next 3 hours or so and were made to feel 'at home' at all times. The food was all delicious and the staff were all very friendly and accommodating. Auntie made sure everything was kept clean and hygienic and the place was spotless. A really magical experience the whole way through. We consider ourselves 'foodies' and we thoroughly enjoyed every minute. You can't beat the freshness of the ingredients used and the resultant dishes were truly authentic. For A$35 each you could have a drink and entrée at KuDeTa or you could have a Balinese experience that you'll treasure forever!

Traditional food. Great day out ! From the moment we where picked up until we where droped off. The team was very friendly and intreasting. Had a good command of english. Great way to learn how to prepare local food. Great setting.

Very special. I chose this class while in Ubud because it was rated No1. I was not disappointed. I had Bali belly the day of the class and Wayan and Pushpa were so caring. It was interesting to go on the market tour and also see the rice being harvested. When we arrived at their house I had to lie down on the verandah, as I was not feeling well, while they were explaining about their traditional houses. Wayan gave me some ice in a towel to put on my neck. He also made up a bed for me to lie down if I felt bad during the class. I managed to watch the class and also have a few mouthfuls of each dish just to taste. Pushpa also tried to give me some money back as I had not eaten very much.The class was made a lot of fun due to the banter between Pushpa and Wayan. I can hardly wait to try the dishes now that I am back home.

Best cookery class!. I specifically chose this cookery class out of the many that are available in Bali as it was held in their house and not in a hotel or in some 'kitchen' in town and I definately wasn't disappointed!Was so nice to see our hosts in their home and learn lots about their way of life & family.The class started with a trip to the local market.....walking through all the areas, fruit, meat, fish, vegetables, spices and our hosts explaining about all the different key ingredients to BAlinese cooking. Next stop their rice paddies.....and an explanation about ownership, irrigation systems and growing rice. Finally to their home and preparing and cooking lunch together. There was about 15 of us and together we made the most wonderful wonderful food......which we then got to eat! yummy!! Our hosts Puspa and Wayne were pure joy to be with....great hosts and 'teachers', funny, warm and friendly....what more can I say apart from a GREAT BIG THANK YOU! We were so inspired that since coming home we've bought a couple of BAlinese cookery books, sourced some of the more unknown ingredients and now prepare Balinese food at home!Puspa & Wayne are an absolute delight!

A wonderful Balinese experience. From the moment the driver picked the 7 of us up at 8:15 am till we returned to the Hotel at 2:15 pm it was an exceptionally good experience. Our group included a family of 4 20 something year olds, 2 50-60year olds and an 85 yr old grandmother. All had a good time. The market trip was interesting though nothing particularly new; a visit to rice paddies to see a harvest and trying our hand at threshing then to Laplapan village where Pushpa runs a cheerfully vigorous and authentic cooking program in her home which includes a tour of the compound and her vegetable garden. We were 15 all told and there was plenty of hands on experience cutting, pounding and cooking 5 magnificent dishes. The vegetarian member of our party was catered for. Some of the best food we have enjoyed so far and in a beautiful traditional Balinese house compound hosted by genuinely friendly people who are very good at their job. And very good value for money.

Paon Cooking Class was an extremely enjoyable experience!. A fantastic experience! They picked us up at our hotel, took us to the food market, then showed us their rice patty plantation, then took us into their family compounds to educated us on Balinese families & culture, & then took us to the kitchen to teach us how to cook traditional balinese food. The cooking was fun, food was good, and the Subawa family are such happy & warm people...extremely pleasant to be around. The Kitchen was clean & we used gloves to chop and cook, so we were able to eat our food with little fear of Bali-Belly (which is not something i can say about every place we went to during our Bali trip!). We really enjoyed this experience and we would definitely recommend it to all of our friends who are travelling to the area.

Can it really be that good..... I often wonder with trip advisor reviews when so many are good, can it really be true? Well, I can save you a few minutes of reading and say absolutely. Wonderful hosts invite you into their home and village to prepare, cook, eat and be merry in beautiful settings. Their food is all fresh and conscious of western people avoiding bali belly so very good hygiene. Mixed class of males and females and everyone gets a go, even your "honey bunnies". Worth the half day experience for sure.

Best meal of my trip!. This was recommended on TA and by someone who had taken the class . It was very informative and really like the format , with guys and girls all taking turns cooking. There was another vegetarian in the group besides myself and our meal was just as good as the others , if not better!Highly recommend!

Wonderful cooking and eating in Ubud. Six of us signed up for this class and we all loved the hands on experience and fabulous food. Fabulous teacher/owner and staff. Will do it again if we ever return.

Fun social event but not really a cooking class!. I think we were pretty lucky in our class as we were only 4 people. Like many reviews said you dont really cook that much more look at other people cooking. Many ingredients you will not find in our country so a substitute should be given as I would obviously like to cook it home aswell. We got to stir a bit and then eat;) I did appreciate the little history about Bali and the explanations about the balinese families once we arrived. The place is very professional and the helpers are great!The other two people at our class were great fun and we ended up in the bar after the class continuing the night!

Highly recommend. What a super afternoon/evening....Pusan & Wayan are wonderful hosts. They showed us how to to cook beautiful Balinese cuisine in a fun environment. Also great value.. Would highly recommend.... thanks :)

Scrumptious learning!. Wonderful! I cannot rate this highly enough! My husband and I joined ten others for this magical class, which may sound like a lot, but actually worked really well! In a group, we were each given tasks, chopping, grinding and most importantly, laughing and learning!The trip included a guided visit to the local food market, and a trip to a family rice field to fill up on background information, before arriving at 'auntys' house to learn a little about the Balinese family compound... Then onto the cooking!!A wonderful learning experience, I would highly recommend this to anyone who enjoys cooking, regardless of skill level. And the best thing? You get to eat the deliciousness at the end - jaan!!

OUR balinese food!. We are 4- a Dutch family with adult children- and we enjoyed a wonderful and tasty cooking class in January 2013 at PAON Bali Cooking Class. First of all we went for a visit to the Ubud market in the morning- very interesting- explaining all 'OUR balinese fruits, knifes' etc. Very well organised cooking class. We made the clear mushroom soup yesterday at home again....recipe still very nice and spicy;-)! Thanks everyone from PAON, wish you lots of success!

The best cooking class in Bali!. We lucked out and had someone tell us about this cooking class and how hands on it was. Well see from pics that we got to make everything from scratch and then best of all eat it with some bingtang beer! They make you feel right at home and if you are a solo traveller this is a great way to meet some great people having fun! Thanks:)

The highlight of our trip. Well arn tee (puspa)what can I say awesome and the way you all looked after my partner who was not well on the day I can only say thank you for the best time in bali and the true humanity that the Balinese people have. We will be back to do it all again and we are spreading the word back here in oz and Are using our recipe book to show off what you and your team so lovingly taught us in such a short time. Thank you

Terima kasih baniak. Even it is so hot today in Ubud, I make my finger working :) to tell people reading the trip advisor comments not to miss your cooking class : it's 5 hours of happiness, learning, smiling and laughing. You both drivers, helpers, Master cooker are a great team. You are the why I love Bali so much : generosity, simplicity, and sense of humor. If one day you wish to come to Pemuteran/Menjangan, I will be very pleased to welcome you. Anyway, one day or another I will be back to attend the 2nd class.

Paon Bali Cooking Class is a Must Do. This was our second visit to Paon Bali. The first was outstanding. The second was fabulous. We brought the whole clan for a Christmas Eve day celebration. Puspa's class was the Bali trip's highlight for both generations. This class is a Must Do if you care at all about having a Balinese cultural experience during your trip.

Highlight of my trip to Ubud. Taking the cooking class was the highlight of my trip to Ubud / Bali!My friend recommended to take Puspa's class when she learned that I'm going to visit Ubud. I was not disappointed and it exceeded my expectations.Wayan, Puspa and their staff were very welcoming, friendly and helpful! :)The class starts off with a market and rice paddy tours. When we arrived at their house, Wayan gave us a very entertaining and informative explanations on Balinese family history and culture before proceeding with the cooking class.The class was simply amazing. Puspa explained everything: from the ingredients to how food is cooked in Bali. All 10 of us in the class were given a chance to participate and to cook. Their house is also a delight to be in as it was homey and very open. After cooking, we all sat down to enjoy everything that we prepared. The food consisting of 8 dishes and dessert were very sumptuous and tasty. It was worth it as it was not anything like the food I've tried in the restaurants in Ubud/Nusa Dua. I'm glad I went all the way to Ubud from Nusa Dua to take this class!

A great cooking and cultural experience. Have done a number of cooking classes across SE Asia and Paon Bali was the best all round experience that we have had. The class commences with a tour of the Ubud markets and then you are driven to a local village where you are given a great insight to the life of traditional Bali family life. You visit the village rice fields a and then the cooking class is conducted in a well set-up family home. You get involved with the cooking of soup through to dessert and then enjoy your creations. Cold drinks and tea are provided on arrival and cold Bintang is available to purchase during the class. The class from pick- up to drop- off in Ubud was 6.5 hours and cost was 350,000 rupiah - well worth it - highly recommended.

Wonderful. Highly recommend this cooking class...hands on lesson...fabulous lunch with subtle fresh flavours ....and most of all it's a wonderful insight into daily life for the Balinese. It's great to see, taste and smell the true Bali.

Highlight of our family trip tp Bali!. Our day with 'Aunty' Puspa & her gracious husband Wayan was fun-filled & absolutely fabulous! Paon cooking school gives you an authentic Balinese experience & I must say we cooked & ate some of the best Balinese cuisine I have eaten in my entire life! My 2 children aged 9 & 12 loved it so much & I couldn't keep my daughter away from the wok! Their comments sum it up - "Mum, that was awesome..sooo cool!"...."that's the best thing we have done in Bali so far" ... Thank you Puspa for a truly enchanting day x

Paon Bali is a must do. Puspa n Wayan took tutoring to another level. We hear of group management. It was playing out beautifully. I was part of a sizable group and there were denizens from more than three nationalities ... We all , irrespective of age, got down to enjoy Balinese cooking, the way of life n access to small details which Nat Geo may miss .... In short it was a day well spent and I'd you have time for just one thing.... Paon Bali must top your list

Insight to Balinese life!. We were picked up from our villa and went straight to the wet market to understand the day to day life of a Balinese. We were then brought to Puspa house and welcomed with a cooling iced drink. She gave us a house tour to understand the 3 levels of beings. Cooking class the began and it was so interesting! All ingredients were mainly from the garden. The whole process was very hygienic, clean and organized. Auntie Puspa is really humorous! Most importantly , the food was so yummy and the portions were so generous! We had hard copies of the recipes to bring back! Suggest Puspa should just give us soft copies through email! :)

Superb. What a day! Just finished cooking with Puspa and had a fabulous time.Wayan picked me up from my villa and drove me in to Ubud. Met with the rest of the group and first had a tour of the market. Sampled the fruit and then back in the car for a short trip to a rice paddy where we had a very interesting and informative lesson in rice growing.On to Wayan and Puspa's house for a refreshing drink and an introduction to Balinese family life and ceremony.At the back of their beautiful home they have the most fantastic set up - spotlessly clean prep and cooking areas out in the open, a traditional Balinese kitchen and some extremely efficient and friendly staff.Puspa takes you through everything very quickly and at first I thought it was going to be difficult to understand how all the prep would be formed into any of the dishes. This concern was unfounded though, Puspa really knows her stuff and suddenly it all comes together, all the chopping and mixing begins to form amazing, aromatic perfumes, beautiful, vibrant colours and wonderful flavours.By the time you sit down to eat with the others the ice cold Bintang is very welcome and then you can't believe that the food you cooked can taste so amazing.This was the highlight of my trip and a surprise at the end was a couple of boxes of the dishes to share with my wife in the evening.Puspa and Wayan are fantastic hosts - warm, friendly, happy, professional, funny and very knowledgable. It's no wonder they are rated so highly, I learnt so much to take home, happy memories, a great deal of cooking knowledge and a little of Puspa and Wayan's infectious happiness.

AMAZING and a must-do class!!. Might have been the most fun and informative experience in Bali. The food was so fresh and tasty. We learned so much about food and life in Bali! Sign up as soon as you can!

For the whole family. I booked the whole family (husband and 10 and 12 year old boys) into the Paon Bali morning class. What a fun day we all had! We were picked up from our villa and taken to the markets in Ubud (an eye opening experience - especially the meat section....). It was interesting to learn about all the herbs, spices, fruits etc used in Balinese cooking and this was a great start to the day.On to the rice paddies and a stunning volcano backdrop, to learn about rice production, then to Wayan and Puspa's family compound to start the cooking. What entertaining hosts! We all prepared a delicious lunch - the ingredients were all so fresh, and everything was really clean and hygienic.A hands on experience, and the kids were included in everything. We all had a fantastic day..
Not to be missed. Couldn't agree more. A magical afternoon/evening exploring Balinese culture and cooking. Prepared 8 dishes and then ate them as evening fell and music played.

Excellent.. I had a great time. Wayan and Puspa are wonderful hosts and fantastic teachers. You will definitely not regret doing this course! I look forward to trying out the delicious recipes when I get home. Thanks!

Do yourself a favour!!. If you are ever in Bali make sure you experience the Paon Bali Cooking class. What a beautiful experience of the people, culture and food of Bali. We were picked up from our hotel by Wayan who could not have been more generous and caring of us. After driving us to his home we were welcomed by his wife Puspa, who showed us how to cook eight amazing traditional Balinese dishes. She kept us busy the whole time slicing, dicing, stiiring, boiling and entertaining us with her wicked humour and ever present personality. There was not a boring moment. The other participants in the class became very quick friends and we laughed for hours. My friend and I enjoyed it so much that we returned to visit Wayan and Puspa the very next day. The world is a better place because of people like them!!

Worth every penny!!!. I have done my fair share of cooking classes around Asia and this is by far the best one. Please DO NOT leave bali without doing this class; even if its just for some great company and many laughs. Thanks Wayan and Puspa!!

A great day!. We had a wonderful time learning all about Indonesian and Balinese cooking. Wayan and Puspa are adorable and very welcoming. There staff are helpful and patient as they explain and teach you all about how to prepare the dishes. We learned a lot and ate A LOT! The only suggestion or minor disappointment is that we wish we could have learned or been able to do more. We know how to chop and fry, but fanning the satay, arranging all the food on the plates etc I wish we could have been a little more hands on. Otherwise, all-in-all a great afternoon, very informative and incredibly tasty-- the best Indonesian food I've ever had!

A true taste of Bali. While honeymooning in Bali, one of our favorite days was spent with the Paon Cooking School. We started our morning with a tour of the open air market, where we learned about local produce and spices. Next we were taken to the rice fields and learned about the process of growing and harvesting this important crop. That afternoon, we spent several wonderful hours at our guides, Wayan and Puspa's home. They were so kind to explain traditional Hindu homes and allowed us to see their family temple. Puspa and her charming chefs showed us how to separate coconut milk from coconut oil before diving into our cooking class. It was such a feast! We made six or seven delicious dishes in the outdoor kitchen before dining with our classmates. We all enjoyed our Bin Tangs, the nice breeze and the amazing view while eating our lunch. My husband and I have a tradition of going to local cooking classes in every place we visit. This was one of the very best! Puspa was not only a great instructor but she was also a fabulous host. I highly recommend spending a day with Paon cooking school.

Amazing. A must do in Bali!!!. This class was excellent. The class started with visiting the local markets, learning about all the different herbs, spices, fruit and vegetables. Next was the rice paddies which was not only beautiful but interesting. Upon arrival at puspa and wayans home, you are greeted with a refreshing drink and an informative insight to the culture of the locals home. Cooking was fabulous and delicious. They make you feel like family. The views whilst eating lunch are gorgeous. Thank you so much for such a great experience. By far the highlight of our holiday.

Cooking from the heart!. The minute we walked into Puspa & Wayan's home we could sense their passion for cooking and communicating that to their guests. We always felt so welcome. Everyone had a job to do and it was wondeful to see the detail that ensured that the flavour of each dish was perfectly balanced. The freshness and taste of the food was just fantastic! I was so impressed with the cleanliness of the whole process - all guests were required to wash and sanitise their hands regularly. At some stages we wore gloves to make sure our hands didn't get stained from the tumeric etc. The highlight of our Bali experience so far!

The highlight of my Bali experience.... Made a booking for Paon Bali after reading reviews on Tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. They picked us up early in the morning from our Ubud hotel. We did an incredible tour through Ubud Market and some rice paddies learning about different ingredients and the harvesting of rice.The cooking class that followed was an amazing experience. The hosts were funny and very knowledgeable and the food was exceptional. All ingredients were extremely fresh and tasty plus the hosts made sure everyone got involved in the cooking!This was the highlight of my Bali trip and I would definitely highly recommend this to anyone visiting Bali

Absolutely amazing!. This was such a fantastic cooking class! Not only did we get a tour of the rice paddies, the class is held at Puspa & Wayan's home so they give you a cultural lesson as well! We met great people, had amazing food (that we cooked ourselves), and Puspa and Wayan were hilarious! I would recommend this class to everyone!

Amazing Experience. It was a full day experience not just cooking but also we learned about balinese culture, customs, food..etc. Very well conducted, very professional..i enjoyed every minute beginning with hotel pick up..market tour, our hosts lovely typical balinese house, cooking and finally enjoying an exquisite meal while conversing with newly acquired friends. Puspa is such a lovely lady she's full of energy and fun..i recommend this activity its even a must do when you visit bali.

Ever entertaining. There are some fabulous personalities behind the class - most notably the wife and husband team - which keep a light entertainment theme running throughout the class. At various points in the afternoon/evening I felt we were both the audience and actors involved in a skit dialogue - most memorable. The class is very comprehensive, involving a chance to smell/taste and feel the essential Balinese ingredients, exploring how these are grown (in the cooking school garden) and learning how to assemble a degustation menu of sorts. It was here I discovered Tempe (a tofu alternative) and how to make it's delicious tasting sauce accompaniment. The hands-on class is incredible value for money and a unique way to get to know the country, it's people and it's culture. I highly recommend it!

Best day spent in Ubud. Signed up for Paon Bali cooking class after great reviews on tripadvisor.co.uk and it was the best decision ever. :) After been picked up from guest house by Wayan (Paon's husband) in the morning, we went to Ubud market - to explore balinese veg, spices, herbs, fruits and more. Wayan did explain many things about balinese cooking and even their traditions. And it was an amazing experience The Market - forget the European standards. :) Then we went to Laplapan village to rice fields. Wayan did explain about rice growing, it's importance in balinese life. Shortly we arrived at his lovely house, welcomed by Paon (his wife and main cook) and refreshing drinks. Before start cooking we got a tour around their garden where they grow vegetables. And then lots of fun with chopping, mixing, frying, peeling, boiling, stiring, steaming, crushing, tasting and so on.... And in the end we made so much food. I was very full with yummy balinese food. So tasty and made by me and others in cooking class. We aso got little book with all recepies in the end. It was 7 yummy spent hours. Very friendly atmosphere ( all day long u get cold or hot drinks too). And to add- it is peaceful because house is in the village ( nice view when u have the lunch). Recommended 100% and more. ;)

Well-deserved #1. Absolute amazing experience learning about Balinese culture and cooking. Auntie Puspa is not only fluent in English, but absolutely pleasant and funny! There were in total 17 people for the cooking class, and her and her family managed it so that every one of us got a chance to cook. The result was possibly the best lunch I've had in Bali. Yummm! They also made their own coconut oil, and I asked and was given two bottles to take home.Highly recommended, fun experience!

Great day, even for singles. I was travelling alone and was recommended this course. Great recommendation as tey get you from your hotel, welcome you into their home (with beautiful view of sunset), welcomed by people, group... Cooking is shared, bits of food tasted as you cook and then a real feast of dishes are enjoyed as you sit around a big table. Met interesting prople, took home recipies and memories and good not to eat alone too! Thanks fr the recommendation and great hosts!!!

Girls trip. This is a fantastic class to do. Wayan and Puspa are Very professional, very friendly and also have a delightful sense of humour. From the moment we were picked up, by a young Wayan, from our hotel, taken to the market, then the picturesque drive to the lovely village a talk about life in the village and the rice paddies, we had fun and lots of conversation. We were invited in to their lovely home/ outside kitchen and dining area. The herbs and spices are grown here and smell beautiful. The menu was very authentic. This is hands on with all participants preparing and cooking food. The kitchen is very clean. We were all in need of a Bintang ( hot day) and we really enjoyed eating what we had created. We arrived back to the hotel very full , with a booklet containing recipes for us to try at home! Great value, great fun, it's a must do.

Great Fun. We booked on the basis of the great reviews on Tripadvisor and thoroughly enjoyed our day thanks to the friendliness and humour of our hosts - Puspa & Wayan. The day started with a tour of the local market which was very interesting and offered some great photographic opportunities and we were then taken to the rice fields to meet Wayan who explained about the growing process. We then went to his family compound where the cooking took place. It was amazing to cook in such beautiful surroundings and learn about how Balinese families live. We had expected the class to be more hands on as we experienced in Thailand but that said, it was very interesting and the warmth of Puspa & Wayan together made it a very memorable experience which we would highly recommend. The food we helped cook was delicious and we are planning to cook some of the dishes when back in the UK!

A must do in Ubud!. This was by far the best experience we had in Ubud. Authentic Balinese cuisine. The hosts were funny, warm and great teachers. The kitchen set up is big, you share the duties with everyone and have an opportunity to try different tasks throughtout. We met so many lovely people from all over the world who genuinely had an interest in the food of this country. This was great value for money not to mention the beautiful view from there house and organic herb garden. You won't regret coming !

Nothing Special. A bit of a let down really. Very drawn out. Cannot fault the owners for their positive energy but it was probably one of my least favourite activities in Ubud. The lunch itself is tasty & plentiful but if I had a choice to do the class all over again I probably would pass.

Best cooking class ever!!!!. Booked this cooking class before going to Bali at the beginning of Dec and not being sure if I was doing the right thing or not. Should not of worried at all, it was FANTASTIC!!!! As usual in Bali it was a fantastic experience. Puspa and Wayan are a delight and fantastic hosts. They make you feel very welcome just by telling a few jokes and learning about the family life is very interesting. The food was amazing and sooooo tasty. I would highly recommend anyone thinking of doing a cooking class in Bali to do this one.. Great, Great, Great!!!! PS: The food market was unbelievable.Thankyou Puspa and Wayan,from Kerry and Kate from Australia.

Best by a country cooking class. after looking at some of the options in Ubud and then reading a review in one of theAussie papers i was confident this would be worth the 350r . they are all about the same price but Paon offers a home kitchen experience in their family commune just outside Ubud.. After pick up from our Hotel, Maya Fusion, we were taken to the fruit & vege markets in Ubud at 830 am, kept in small groups whilst we were given the introduction to local produce, spices, and fruit. After that we were taken out to a small village maybe 5 minutes from Ubud, where we met our host, Wayan and Puspa, .Wayan then explains the way the family lives, ,, their religious beliefs, all mixed in with great humour.. then the cooking preparation begins for the 9 dishes we are to prepare and consume later.Everyone of the 16 of us got to work on each dish, and as we had the nite before eaten at a very tradional Indonesian Restaurant, Miro,s, we were now creating the dishes we had enjoyed the night before.Our friends had done another cooking class in Ubud as had a few of the others and they all heaped praise on Paon.as the best experience by far.We had to forego the rice paddy visit as it was raining for most of the day, but that did little to dampen our enthusiasm.After an amazing feast of 9 courses, with a few Bintangs (extra cost) we were delivered back to our property by about 230pm..Book in advance this is a must for those who like to get involved in local culture and cuisine.

Best Cooking class!. If you are thinking of doing a cooking class in Ubud or even Bali for that matter you must must do it with Paon! This family run cooking class is awesome. From their high standards of cleanliness and keeping all guests from getting BB to their spectacular view this is the cooking class to do! The husband and wife are super funny and well educated. I would highly recommend it to anyone, families, friends and even honeymooners. My husband and I were on our honeymoon and we had a blast.There was another 3 couples on their honeymoon in our class and we were given our own "honeymoon" table as a little extra. The food you end up making is to die for and we all left feeling very full and extremely satisfied! Can't wait to go back and do it all again!

Great cooking class in Ubud. We attended the afternoon class on 27 Dec. Wayan and Puspa are such characters. Wayan is soft and gently spoken and Puspa, an extrovert. We enjoyed the class especially eating what we made. We compared the food cooked here with Made Warung in Seminyak and our output was more refined and tastier. The only negative was the (taxi) driver who picked us up and dropped us back to our hotel in Seminyak asked us for 300,000 INR for the fare which was already included & we were not advised of.

Paon Perfect!. Paon Bali cooking class is in its rightful place at the top of the list of activities in Ubud. Wayan and (Auntie) Puspa are the most wonderful hosts and teachers. Funny, warm and welcoming. We were lucky enough to be in a group of only 6 in the morning class and it was fantastic. The market tour was interesting and a great chance to stock up on some goodies to bring home. The class itself was interesting, entertaining and the food was delicious! Even my non cooking husband enjoyed himself...... Maybe helped by the constant supply of Bintangs! Thanks Puspa and Wayan we hope to see you again one day.

Best cooking class experience....if I could only forget the markets experience we had to endure.... Wayan and Puspa must be the most welcoming, wonderful people ever to grace this world! Once you arrive at their compound, you are guaranteed to have a truly enlightening experience filled with amazingly delicious food and plenty of Bintang (beer is 15,000RPH) each. The beginning of the tour is a hands-on look through the local food market. I have travelled extensively through many third world countries (including my own heritage) and am certainly not a travel snob. HOWEVER! These markets were absolutely awful and had no business being part of this experience. It is only for this reason I simply could not give the full five stars that the rest of the tour deserves.

No wonder this is ranked number 1 on trip advisor for activities in ubud!!. Oh my goodness! What a day! Puspa and Wayan made this an incredible experience that's much more than just a cooking class. It's an introduction into their life in bali and their local community. Amazing!

Yummylicious Experience!!. If there is one thing you have to do when you are in Ubud, you can't go wrong with this one! We had a class size of 11 and we made 8 delicious dishes. We were picked up at our hotel and had a market tour, and a quick paddy field tour with Wayan. After which we were warmly welcomed into their humble home. Puspa has amazing skills and she is such a good teacher. Thank you so much Wayan and Puspa for the excellent hospitality and the great session!

Wonderful, worth even if you do not like cooking :). I was picked up at my hotel in Ubud, we went to the market early, had the chance to know the vegetables, spices, etc. We did not go to the market to buy the food to be cooked. Then they drove us to a rice plantation and explained how do they grow it. Then went to Paon house where in the back has a quite big space for cooking. We were quite a big group in the morning, around 15-20 people and I was personally concerned that I wont be able to do any cooking, but far from reality, they know what they are doing, there is space for everyone and the couple are wonderful hosts. Just a piece of advise, if you'd like to cook in petit commitee, you may want to join the afternoon classes. Finally, the setting for the lunch has amaizing views to Ubud nature, so all in all one of the best experiences that I take from my trip.

The sight, smell and taste of food. The morning class begins with a guided tour of the Ubud market, which gives you a crash course on the ingredients that you will use in the class. Wayan and Puspa were excellent hosts, making you feel very comfortable in their home. Their English is excellent and Puspa is patient and gives clear instructions in the kitchen. They don't just teach you about food but also their culture. The class is well paced and great value given you will learn as well as enjoy an 8 course lunch. Great way to spend a day if you want to know more about Balinese culture, and you cannot find better hosts than wayan and Puspa!

Fantastic cooking class, lovely hosts, highly recommended.. We had an amazing day at the Paon Cooking Class, starting with a visit at 8:30 to the fruit/vege/meat market where we were able to sample some of the local fruits such as mangosteens and rambutan. This was followed by a visit to the rice padi fields and then we were welcomed into the home of Wayan and Puspa who run the cooking school. They have a great setup - the cooking school is outdoors in their compound in a beautiful green tranquil garden and everything is so clean and very professional. Hygiene is of a very high standard. We saw how coconut oil was made then used some in our cooking. The recipes (which you get to take home) were so yum and included satay, gado gado, curry. The group was small (about 11-12) and the best thing was that Puspa doesn't just show you how to to cook - you get to do everything yourself. After the cooking we sat down to relax and enjoy the food with a bintang and its was such a nice lunch, a great group of people and our hosts were just so welcoming and lovely. You absolutely get your moneys worth and more. Highly recommend this for anyone. I took my 13 year old daughter (who wasnt really looking forward to going) and she thought it was great too. Thank you so much Puspa and Wayan for your hospitality.

Best cooking class ever!. We enjoyed a wonderful time on the local market and in the balinese home.
We loved the warm atmosphere within the family and of course we loved the great food we cooked together!
We learned a lot about cooking, the balinese culture and way of life!
Must do when in ubud!

The Best Ubud experience!. There is a reason this is #1 on Trip Advisor for Ubud - it is an amazing day out. To call this a Cooking Class is to do it a disservice;First up, if you are staying within the Ubud area they will pick you up from your hotel, you then head to the Ubud Market for a walk through and explanation of many of the foods you will be working with later on. Your guide will show you through the fruit and vegetable section explaining many of the exotic foods you had always been too scared to try.Next up you will head out to the rice fields near Wayan and Puspa's home compound - Wayan will explain the process of growing the rice, and his infectious smile and laugh will put you in a great mood for the day.You will then head to the family compound where "Aunty" Puspa takes you on a tour of their family compound and shows you the amazing spice and food garden they maintain.Now its onto the cooking - I won't spoil it for you but you will basically be preparring a banquet feast for yourself and your fellow classmates. All up we made 8 different meals and also a dessert item.You get to prepare all the food items, then cook them all - Puspa has her army of helpers to make sure nothing goes too badly. You might worry that you can't cook, but the key you will learn with most of these Balinese dishes is that they are very hard to muck up, it is mostly stirring and frying. They are simple meals that make the food the star rather than fancy cooking techniques.This is not a quick experience - all up with were with them for about 7 hours from early morning to early afternoon; so when you think about the experience you are getting for such a small price it is a definate must do.Please book early though - Puspa has been known to be booked out months in advance.

A taste of Bali - recommended!. Very informative class - from touring the local market, to a quick visit at the paddy fields - the guides were very friendly, spoke good english and could answer all our questions easily. Gave me some insight to the lifestyle in Ubud. We then proceeded to the house and Auntie Puspa patiently explained the layout of the house, how they make offerings everyday in their family temple. The cooking class was also very fun as we took turns to prepare the dishes. Had about 6 dishes and all very delicious! It's amazing how the ingredients are mostly grown by the family and they were very aware of hygience! Very fun and clean environment to whip up good dishes. Very friendly host, amazing recipes and food, good insight to a typical day of the Balinese. Recommended!

Lives up to reviews - a must!. It isn't hard to see why this cookery school is rated the number one activity in Ubud. I was picked up by a lovely driver before meeting the rest of the group and doing a tour of the markets.
