The guide was very knowledgeable and let us smell an taste lots of different fruits and herbs on the market. The torrential rain stopped our rice field tour but he still explained to us how rice is harvested and answered all questions easily. The owners Puspa and Wayan were fab, very funny and informative. They really welcomed us into their home and it felt very friendly and genuine and not money grabbing like you often get on the streets of Bali. After a welcome drink overlooking the valley from the garden, we got cooking. Everyone had a go at all types of cooking and Puspa and her staff were on hand to ensure all was done properly. Their command of the English language was excellent and they were very funny. The food was fantastic, we cooked nine dishes in total and were stuffed after lunch! Fantastic value and a great cookery school. We were also given the recipes to take home and Puspa was great at telling us alternative ingredients to use if things weren't available at home. Also very aware of hygiene issues. A must-do in Ubud.

Absolutely fabulous - more than meets the eye. We absolutely loved our day, such a beautiful welcoming family, good reviews are well deserved. Great value even when coming from leigan. Lunch was delicious and it wasn't too hard. We got the recipes to take away which is great as its so hard to remember. Very entertaining and a fantastic look at a Balinese family. Won't be disappointed.

Cook, laugh and learn.. Five of us just spent the day at Paon Bali cooking class. Picked up by a very charming driver who was full of great information and who at the market, handled the many questions we fired at him about curious vegetables ect ect with a huge smile and great English. Eventually we arrived at the home of Wayan and Puspa to be greeted with a long cool lemon drink and an introduction to thier house and the class. As a group we laughed a lot , learned a lot, cooked a lot, (9 dishes in total) ate a lot and enjoyed very much the complete experience. . Ten out of ten for a wonderful and memorable "Bali " day. Great value for money and a great insight to the culture, cuisine and family life of Bali. Two of us live here and this will be high on the list to do again with friends who come to visit .

Top value. Great day and fabulous lunch. Wayan & Puspa & staff do a great job of communicating in simplified english to all comers. The preparation time is well worth the effort when you sit down to eat lunch which was delicious organic food.

Don't miss this!. This is so much more than just a cooking class. Puspa and Wayan have successfully made this into a wonderful half day experience of local life, customs, traditions and of course local cuisine! The food is delicious, the company was great and Puspa and Wayan are wonderful teachers. We thouroughly enjoyed it and will be back again when we next visit Ubud. I am even confident enough to try out the recipes at home - I think they will be a hit! Thanks again Paon Bali!

More Than A Cooking Class. Congratulations Puspa and Wayan for creating an excellent and extremely enjoyable food and cultural experience. Visiting the Ubud fruit & vegetable market, visiting the rice fields, learning about rice cultivation and then having the cooking class and dining in your traditional Balinesehouse was perfect. It was a very relaxed, educational and fun experience. There were 14 people from various countries and we all had plenty of 'hands on' re: preparing and cooking thehuge range of traditional dishes. The food was so yummy and delicious. Plus, Puspa's and Wayan's sense of humour and one liners were very entertaining.

Art in the kitchen. Is an experience in a Balinese house making it amazing and very authentic.They were all very friendly, at first the driver pick us at the hotel and took us to Ubud market, interesting experience, great for pictures... after they welcome us in to there home, and start to cook, we loved it because we were cooking all the time, the recipes were delicious, and it was easy to understand all the steps to prepare the food, excellent presentation at all times and very clean. We really recommend it, was a great experience and very delicious.

A great Day Out. I'm an eater not a cooker, but I decided to accompany my wife on her second time to Paon Cooking Class. I had a great day, got right into the cooking. Puspa and staff were fantastic, (Wayan unfortunatley had to atteend a ceremony that day). Because my wife had attended last May, they changed the menu for her. Overall great day, great fun, good learning and great company from staff and other participants. Oh yeah great food produced from a good mentor.

inspirational day. Gracious hosts, Puspa and Wayan welcomed us into their home and shared secrets of their local cuisine.Well orchestrated and expertly organised we all worked seamlessly together preparing a feast.Excellent value for money and have already cooked many of the recipes from the notes back here in Sydney to rave reviews.

Awesome!!. Thank you Puspa and Wayan. What an experience! Puspa is an absolute delight, so funny and an amazing teacher and cook. The food was all fresh and the beautiful tastes of Bali were wonderful. We learnt so much in a short time. Would recommend to everyone.

It's obvious why this is the #1 activity in Bali.... When we decided to travel to Bali this November (2012), doing a cooking class was at the top of our list. After looking around a bit we decided to try Paon Bali, based on the reviews we read on TripAdvisor. Although it was a 2 hour drive from our villa in Jimbaran Hills, it was most certainly worth it.We did the afternoon class, which starts at 4pm. Upon arriving at Paon Bali we were taken for a quick ride to the local rice fields and given a good explanation of the rice growing process and the local ownership structure of the land. Beyond the educational value, the views were simply stunning.We then returned to the house of Wayan and Puspa and Wayan took us for a tour of the compound, beginning with a thorough explanation of the family temple, which was enlightening. We then moved on to an explanation of the other structures and the way the compound was set up.Things really got interesting when we started to prepare our dishes and work with the various ingredients - some known to us, some not. We first saw how to harvest coconut oil, then got a walkthrough of the garden, and then started chopping and prepping. Our group had nine people so it was a great size to do some work, learn some things, cook a bit, but also socialise and relax with other couples in the group.The food was amazing and the process was good fun. But the highlight of the evening had to be our cooking host, Puspa. She was an absolute crack-up! Friendly, funny, smart, experienced - she made the day for us. We read another review here about her comment at the end of the night about recommending the class to our friends as she needs to pay her mortgage - clearly, this person didn't get her sense of humour. She was self deprecating and was just a great part of our day.Oh, and by the way, they have great facilities and very modern and clean bathrooms.If you can get to Ubud, we highly recommend this class. For $35/person (well, $45 for us after all our Bintangs!) you couldn't even eat our in Ubud for the amount and quality of food you get at Paon Bali.

Excellent!. We did the afternoon class that begins at 4pm. Although we didn't go to the market, we still had a look at the rice paddy fields and found that the amount of time was perfect. The food was delicious and the hosts were so friendly and funny. We had thoroughly enjoyed the class and couldn't believe the quality if food we produced. Well worth a visit!

Brilliant!. Being a lover of both cooking and asian food I was really looking forward to doing a cooking class in Bali and Paon came so highly regarded. I was not disappointed! The hosts Wayan and Puspa are fantastic, full of character and humour they really made the day.We started in the morning with a visit to the Ubud market followed by a visit to one of the rice paddies in the village before being taken to Wayan and Puspa's home where we proceeded to learn to cook around 8 different dishes. The group was only around 11 of us so a good size and everyone had the opportunity to do different jobs for each of the different dishes. It culminated in the enjoyment of what we had made for lunch and I can't wait now to make some of these dishes at home!Definitely recommened participating in this class, a fantastic day out, good value for money and lots of fun.

Great way to spend a few hours. We were looking to learn more about the Indonesian culture and saw this class offered. Wayan and Puspa took us into their home and offered a great taste of Bali, not only showing us a memorable time in the kitchen, but also providing an education on Hindu Family Temples, and the Balinese way a family life. The food was fantastic, the group we were with was great fun, and the general atmosphere was very welcoming and informative. I would highly recommend this outing to all and sundryMartinMelbourne Australia

EXCELLENT. My husband and I have just been for the second time to the Paon Bali Cooking Class! The first time we cooked wonderful vegetarian food earlier this year and this time the meat eater variety!Superb day led by warm and wonderful hosts Puspa and Wayan and their team of staff!Anyone thinking of doing this is in for a treat and without needing to be a great cook yourself you will be guided through a daunting menu with such ease and will turn out an incredible feast !Our thanks to all involved for another wonderful day.

Fantastic Experience!!. You HAVE to do this!!! If you love food (honestly! Who doesn't?!), then you will love this! I went with a group of about 15 and it was so much fun! I shall not give too much away but all you need to know is that the family are the sweetest you'll ever meet. The food was AMAZING and that's considering that WE prepared and cooked it! Everybody got involved and after a couple beers, the banter started flowing as well! This place is great value for money and I would recommend it to everyone!! P.S. I've already cooked the soup at home and it was a HIT!! :D

Fun and delicious day in bali!. This cooking class was fantastic. Puspa and Wayan are warm, welcoming, hilarious and a lot of fun. The group was a nice size and everyone had a great time together. Puspa is very good about moving everyone around to try cooking different foods with different techniques so you not only learn a lot, but have the opportunity to chat with lots of different people. I am a vegetarian and they were incredibly accommodating. If you like cooking even just a little, you will have a great time with Puspa and crew. This was also by far the best food I ate in bali. Awesome :)In addition to the cooking, you also take a tour of the local food market and rice paddies where Wayan (who is absolutely adorable) shares great stories and information about the local ways. Truly a great day.

Lots of fun!. Had a great evening with my partner doing this cooking class. Everyone gets involved from the ground up. Can't believe we cooked such a great meal. The family compound and scenery is amazing. Met some great people from all over the world too! Puspa and Wayan were both very warm and welcoming. Highly recommend.

Way too much fun. This class is such an incredible thing to take part of, everyone is so friendly and the class is surprisingly hands on! We were lucky enough to have a small class of just 3, since it was rain season and tourists are fewer. Aunty Puspa was tonnes of fun and a great guide to cooking, and ensured everyone was involved in all the dishes. They allow plenty of flexibility with meals, concerning food dislikes and allergies, which was wonderful and meant you could come away with more of a learning experience. Aunty Puspa also explains some good substitutes since it can be hard to find some ingredients.The guides through the rice fields and the market are buckets of fun, and it was a good way to learn a little about the culture and the area. If you do any one thing in Ubud, do this!Thank you, Wayan and Puspa and everyone at Paon Bali Cooking Class!!

Do yourself a favour. If you love cooking, or even if you are just curious, do yourself a favour and take the time to do this cooking class. From the visit to the Ubud markets, the informative talk about the ricefields, then on to a nice refreshing welcoming drink and chat before getting down to business and learning to cook and sample some authentic Balinese food, you will not be disappointed.Your hosts Puspa and Wayan will certainly make sure they are some of the best few hours your have ever spent in Bali.

Great experience!. We had an amazing time at the cooking school. It was great to meet the others in the class and cook some really amazing food! The food was some of the best we've had in Bali so far. Highly recommended.

A must to do.... Tour starts with an early (for morning class) visit to Ubud Palace market and fallows by a short rice fields information. Cooking class definetelly very enjoyable and entertaining. Ingredients very colourful and with full of life. Receipies mostly easy and I can surely try some of them at home. Techniques which chef teaches is in general impossible for anybody from western world, but I really appreciate the effort chef and staff shows how authentic it can be. Environment so nice and lovely, very clean, very originated. They make sure that everybody cooks and listens. Very engegament.

Darwin girls love cooking. My friends first visit to Bali and this was the highlight of the trip for her. I have been to Bali many times and had never done a cooking class but now I am so glad I went and will recommend this to all my friends. Very well organised, entertaining, and the food was fantastic. Can't wait to try some of the recipes now I'm back home.

Absolutely Sensational. This cooking course is brilliant. The staff speak perfect English, the ingredients are so fresh, some are even from their garden which you can walk around. They make it very fun and deserve their 5 star rating for sure.

Beyond expectations and disability friendly. I only learned about this cooking class from other traveler reviews on trip advisor. At the time I came across this opportunity on trip advisor, there were 496 excellent reviews, so I figured it must be good. When you register for this class, the staff arrange to pick you up at your hotel, take you on a market tour of the Ubud market, take you on a brief tour of a rice field that the family owns part of, then on to the cooking class, then they drop you off again when its all over. I was picked up from my hotel in central Ubud at 8:15am and dropped off again about 2:30pm. Do not plan to go shopping at the market on your tour as prices are inflated "tourist price" and there is not time for bartering. If you are in a wheelchair, this probably won't work for you. I myself was recovering from knee-surgery so walked with a brace and crutch and found the whole tour/class disability friendly. The market can be difficult to navigate as the food stalls are on the lower floor which require going up and down at least 1 flight of steps. The brief rice field tour was flat and on pavement. Wayan and Puspa and their assistants were wonderful hosts; the class takes place in their family compound which they give you a brief tour of upon arrival, there are a few steps at the front door and going into the kitchen. The open-air but well shaded kitchen area was very clean and they made use of traditional equipment for cooking but joked that when participants would get home, we would use food processors instead of hand grinders...which I probably will. During the class, all participants (my class had about 15 students) get an opportunity to prepare and cook all aspects of the meal. While I took this trip to Bali with my husband, he and I went our separate ways on the day of the class. Other students were friendly and this was a great way to meet people from Australia, Netherlands, Austria, USA. The food was the best Balinese food I ate in the 12 days I was in Bali and by far the best presentation...and believe me I ate Balinese food at every meal. Unlimited supply of bottled water is provided inclusive of price, bintang beer is also offered at a modest price. No regrets and worth the price!

Ooow my goodnes...:-) for cooking class experience!. Totally awesome! One must try activities in Ubud. Very beautifully arranged, greeted, coached...served..you name it, you have it! Simply enjoy, relax (cook and eat!) <--that was so true...

Paon Bali Cooking Class = #1. An amazing experience!! I have travelled to Bali 7 times and done many of the tours on offer, but this has to be my favourite one so far. I felt that the cooking classes ran by Wayan & Puspa are a great way to learn about the Balinese way of life whilst also being fun and of course DELICIOUS! My husband and I are on our honeymoon and I had to bribe him to come along....he LOVED it and can't wait to make some of the recipes once we are back home. I would definitely recommend Wayan & Puspa's cooking classes to anyone!!! Hope to come back one day and learn some more recipes!!!!

Cultural and Cooking Experience. Would recommend this activity if travelling to this region of Bali and certainly a highlight of our first trip to Bali.Gracious Puspa and her very humorous husband Wayan were wonderful.The day started with a guided visit to the local market and learn about and sample fruits native to Bali. A short drive to the family rice fields for a briefing on the local plantations and it's workings followed. We were then welcomed at Puspa and Wayan's house and touched on their traditions and culture which we found very educational. The class was organised, the venue clean and run in a most professional fashion. The group for the day was made up of 15 people from all corners of the world and of various age groupls, everyone participated in the preparation and cooking of the 8 dishes, so delicious, so much food!!! Extremely enjoyable.

Yum!. This would have to be one of the best times we had in Bali. Cooking Balinese style with traditional methods and kitchen. Teacher was very easy to understand and both her husband and her are very humorous!

Group Cooking Class. Puspa and Wayan have had so many wonderful reviews and deservedly so. We just wish to concur with all the wonderful experiences that everyone has experienced. If I could rate this higher I would.A little different, we had a larger business group than they normally cater for, over 30, but they graciously organised more cooking stations and gazebo and it was a perfect day. Everyone to the last, novice or not, were involved with the cooking process and all raved about their experience and the food.How amazing to be welcomed into their home and treated with so much respect and friendship, truly a Bali highlight for everyone.As I organised this for the larger group I was concerned at the level of involvement by the individual but to a person everyone said they had an amazing day.

a fantastic experience. This cooking class was a great experience, we went to the afternoon session so missed out on the morning markets however the class was smaller only 4 of us which made it very personal. The venue is outstanding probably the cleanest and best maintained compound I have ever seen in Bali. Our hosts were professional, friendly and funny. We had a great afternoon and the sunset was beautiful. Their vege garden was envious!!!

Deliciously fun. I have a habit that every place I visit I have to find a cooking and food something to ghetto know the local cuisine and culture around sharing a table. This was a great experience in the heart of ubud. Early in the morning the group met st the market and we were shown how the locals prepare their offerings, the local utensils, the spice market (make sure to buy a packet of vanilla) and fruit market (best mangosteens).They then took us to see the terraced rice feilds just 10 minutes up the road from central ubud. Then it was off to Puspa's place. Puspa is a warm, generous and vivacious lady who wholeheartedly welcomes you into her home. The cooking methods are easy and everyone gets involved. The best bit is the feast at the end. FYI don't bother with dinner if you do the lunch session, you'll be stuffed for hours.

Great Day Cooking. Wayan and Puspa provide a great day of activities to give you a good flavor of Bal life and food.The day started with a tour of the Ubud market where you get an introduction to all of the spices and fruits etc. Our fruit stall happened to be next to the local waste area that was being emptied at the time - smell was very bad. Only downside, but there has to be a better spot to do this.Visit to the rice fields was good and very informative - especially how the irrigation and cropping is organized.Cooking school was well organized and a great split between explanation, cooking and eating. Lots cooked so no shortage at lunchtime. Had 10 on the tour -good size and everybody had a good time - especially over a few Bintangs at lunch. All of this conducted at the family home in a village on the outskirts of Ubud.Have done a few schools in SE Asia and this one ranks highly.

Great cooking tour. The session was enriching and enjoyable. We had an insightful tour of ubud market, the Padi fields and then went to a Balinese home to cook. We had good guides and the cooking area was clean and welcoming. As a first time cook, this was great!

Great Cultural Experience - Delicious Food!. We loved everything about this cooking class. From beginning to end, we couldn't of asked for a better experience. I can't rave about Paon Bali enough- and I would be repeating all of the wonderful comments said before, so I'll keep this short and sweet. Thank you Puspa & Wayan!

"Fantastic! Authentic experience of Bali home and food". A fun day! Wayan and Puspa are delightful hosts and couldn't have been more welcoming. The cooking experience was fantastic - the end result mouthwatering and it would have been easy to while away the rest of the day in such beautiful surroundings. For the record, the kitchen facilities are well set up, everything scrupulously clean, and ingredients all fresh as can be! I am still cooking heaps of basic yellow sauce and practically live on the chicken curry. Friends are clamouring for more! Thanks Wayan and Puspa for a memorable experience - I will be back! Mim F-D

Paon Bali Cooking. I would highly recommend attending Paon Bali Cooking class if you have a passion for food or just want to learn more about Bali & it's culture.Absolutley wonderful experience Wayan & Puspa provided a very warm & welcoming experience, sharing their home and stories. The food was AMAZING and you get the recipes to take home. I have cooked from these recipes 3 times already for my family and friends.I would Definitely attend this class again, the whole experience was extremly satisfying, well worth the time & money. Thank you To Wayan, Puspa and all their wonderful staff. I will see you agin in April 2013 for some more yummy recipes.

Aunty help hunny bunny <3. Amazing day, amazing food and amazing experience. I just loved honey bunny aunty, she made the whole experience so friendly, personal and authentic. I would have no hesitations in recommending this place to any person - old, young or middle age and regardless of cooking skills! It catered to all. Fantastic. Love you Auntie! x
Fun experience of traditional Balinese cooking. My 7 year old daughter and I enjoyed our cooking class enormously. Lovely clean kitchen, great food, authentic Balinese experience.

Fabulous! Fantastic! Wonderful!!. I took my 70 year old mum along to Paon cooking class on our last day in Bali. We had such an AMAZING day, and it was a highlight of our trip!! Wayan and Puspa are fabulous hosts, and the food was delicious. From beginning to end, it was a great day, and something I would highly recommend.

Another great Bali experience. We have been to Bali many times, but this was our first stay in Ubud. We thought it would be fun to do a cooking school and decided on Paon after reading many good reviews on Trip Advisor.It really was a great day - picked up from our hotel and taken to the Ubud market (an experience in itself!) and then on to the rice paddies and finally to Wayan and Puspa's home to start cooking.We had a large group but Puspa made sure everyone was involved. We made 8 different dishes and then enjoyed eating them with a cold Bintang at the end.We were also given copies of all the recipes to take home and I have to say we have made a few things already - the recipes are really easy to follow!Wayan and Puspa made it a fun day, but we also learnt a lot about Balinese history and culture.I would highly recommend Paon cooking school.

Incredible educational experience!. I had the pleasure of attending a morning cooking class & Ubud market tour with Wayan & Puspa along with 5 family members/friends and it was one of the highlights of our recent trip to Bali.Wayan & Puspa are the most gracious hosts who open up their home to you and run a first class operation! It was informative, enjoyable and just plain fun. We were taught so much about the Balinese culture & cuisine & enjoyed the "fruits of our labour" for lunch.I would HIGHLY recommend this to anyone interested in taking a cooking class while in Bali!

Paon "home cooking" beats any restaurant food!. We had a wonderful experience at Paon Bali Cooking Class. The friendly service was outstanding from the very start when we went on the market tour, to the rice paddy talk and finally into their family, home kitchen. It was a relaxed environment in which everyone participated in cooking without pressure. Facilities are clean and care is taken to ensure cleanliness by all participants. Two clean toilets are in the home. Ingredients are fresh and of high quality. We stayed two more weeks in Bali and can attest the food we cooked and then enjoyed eating at Paon was better than any restaurant food we found throughout our stay. I attribute this to the fact that there is no substitute for “home cooking” which is what Puspa and Wayan offer with this attraction

Wonderful cooking class. My boyfriend loves cooking so we were excited to find and read the reviews of Paon Bali cooking class - we were not disapointed. It was a morning of cooking and the tour of the market gave us a better idea of prices so was able to grab a few bargains. They really welcomed us into their home and made us feel like part of the family. Lovely food and now the BF is cooking indoneasian food - yum!.. If you only do one cooking class in Bali, make sure its this one! Brilliant, thanks for a great day

Wonderful class instruction with even better food!. Puspur and Wayan are such wonderful host for this activity. My sister and I wanted to attend the cooking class but we did not want to attend the market or the rice paddy tour whcih is prior to the cooking and eating, Instead, we joined the class when they all arrived back at Wayan and Puspar's house for the morning session (around 10:30AM). We were welcomed with a cool refreshing drink and aprons. Then we listened as Puspar explained the different Balinese ingredients for the dishes that we would be cooking. Her English is fantastic, no one had any trouble understanding her. Since the class was on the larger side (15 people), we were all given different prepping tasks since there were not enough cutting or cooking stations. However, this is not an issue because anyone who is standing around is asked to add a quarter spoon of salt, peppers, etc. We all had the opportunity to participate in cooking several dishes such as chicken satay, mushroom soup, stir-fried tofu, and tuna wraps - all were delicious. Then the main event of eating our dishes was eagerly awaited by all. We stuffed ourselves silly and my sister even asked for more rice. Wayan played musical instrument for our listening pleasure whilst eating. This is a must-do in Ubud!

Gracious and Professional. A friend and I attended the Paon cooking class in October 2012 and it was one of the highlights of a fantastic first visit to Bali. Puspar and Paon are incredibly gracious hosts who run a highly organised, professional, and fun-filled business. From the rice field visit, the deliciously cool welcoming lemon juice on arrival, to the top notch toilets, this experience scored 10/10. They even provide mosquito repellent. Their traditional village home is beautifully decorated; stunnning stone walls and floors! Paon showed me a wall light fitting he'd carved - what talent! I will be trying out the recipes at home soon. Terima kasih for a wonderful afternoon and evening and best wishes for your continued success.

So much food!. I attended an afternoon cooking class at Paon.I was picked up at 3.30pm and taken to a rice field for an explanation of rice farming and to meet up with the others in my class. We were then taken back to the family home to begin cooking. We started with an explanation of the ingredients, and dishes we would be preparing and then got right down to cooking. We did all of the hands on prep along side Puspa and her helpers, and were guided step by step through each of the dishes. It was a fantastic experience and I really enjoyed it. We made so much food and it was all delicious. I am a vegetarian and although there were only 3 of us in the class it had been organized that I could make a vegetarian version of all of the dishes. So thoughtful and delicious!I would absolutely recommend this class, and will be back to visit next time I am in Ubud.

Fantastically Fun & Yummy Experience!. I booked this class for my sister, 20-something son and myself based on the strength of the Tripadvisor reviews: AND THEY'RE ALL TRUE! The hosts Wayan and Puspa are delightful. They have set up a well organized event that keeps everyone actively and cheerfully involved through the prep and cooking process and the resulting meal was delicious and beautifully presented. Their inclusion of visits to the food market, rice paddies and their home is a real bonus and gives much insight into traditional Balinese life. I can't stress how much fun it was! This event was one of the two highlights of our trip (the other being the downhill bike ride).

utterly brilliant!!. we had the best time ever!!! Puspar is genius! she really knows how to cook! we had so much fun, learnt a lot and mainly ate a lot! met great people there and everybody who is in Ubud MUST go and have a cooling class with them! very smiley people, her husband came to pick us up, very nice man too! we didn't go to the market with them because it was evening class and i think that day there wasn't market but we didn't mind at all. their house is overlooking jungle and she grows a lot of stuff herself. you also can see how Bali people are living. the best money ever spent!!! thank you guys!

A wonderful experience. We looked at several reviews and nearly booked another course, until I saw the great reviews on this one, and we were not disappointed. The couple who run the course are friendly and good fun, the day is informative with the market visit, the rice field talk and then a very hands on time of cooking, chatting and eating. As someone else said, you don't cook one thing from start to finish - we had 15 in our group but it was fine as all of us were preparing/chopping initially, then there were five cooking stations so they asked for five volunteers at a time to cook, others added drops of this or sprinkles of spice while the five were cooking and then it kept rotating throughout the different dishes we were preparing. Lots of hands on time, noone was fighting for time and overall very good. Lovely to be in their own traditional Bali home while you do you this too, rather than in a hotel. Lovely couple, lovely course!

It's all true. Our group of six senior Australians booked this activity based on Trip Advisor reviews we had read.We heartily agree that this is the best cooking and cultural activity in Bali. Yes, it's our number one, and we have said this to all our Australian contacts who may visit Bali in the future.As hosts and educators, Puspar and Wayan are the best. We learned much of Balinese culture we had no former knowledge of. Don't miss it. The best $35 you could spend on a tourism activity.

Outstanding Experience!. I found out about this cooking class through TripAdvisor, so emailed and made a booking weeks before we arrived in Bali. Wayan and Puspar responded immediately and confirmed dates, prices and organised transport (with two excellent drivers) to and from Legian. They even had us picked up early so we could spend the morning discovering Ubud, before attending the class. For those who think cooking classes are for the elderly and retired, revise these thoughts....most of the attendees in our class were young couples. This has to be one of the best experiences I have had in Bali for the following reasons: the entire experience is so well organised, it's great fun, the hosts are just wonderful, the food was delicious AND it's 100% Balinese - not a European take on Balinese cooking. The facilities are excellent and Wayan and Puspar's home and garden are beautiful. This is not an experience that one should miss. Then you too will understand what a "Bali blender" and an "MBA" are!

If you pass by Ubud you must take this class. Amazing activity. Funny, entertaining and interesting. We do not only learnt how to prepare traditional Balinase dishes but we also learnt about culture, rice cultivation etc. Food was delicious. Strongly recommended.

Top class authentic experience!. So wonderful to get away from the well trodden tourist path and to have an authentic Balinese experience. Wayan & Puspar are warm and welcoming hosts, and their team is friendly and attentive. The whole experience is convenient, interactive and thoroughly enjoyable. Right from the ease of being picked up at our hotel, having an informative visit to some rice fields, through to being welcomed into their home, and fabulous garden kitchen, through to the preparation, cooking, presentation and dining on 7 wonderful authentic Balinese dishes - everything has been thought of. The ingredients are all really fresh and the facilities and utensils are very clean. There are many thoughtful touches, and everyone gets involved in the food preparation, to having live accompanying music, to being shown how to separate the oil from the fresh coconut water. Even the herbs are picked straight from the garden. It is interactive, informative, and entertaining.This is an authentic experience that is well worth having. Thanks Wayan, Puspar and team!

Highly recommended. This was one of the first things I did on my stay in Ubud and I'm so glad I did. Wayan and Puspar are hilarious, entertaining, informative and generous. This is money well spent and the food was delicious. Puspar should write a cookbook!

One of the highlights of our Bali honeymoon!. I have been meaning to write this review for ages, but have only just got round to it (we visited in June 2012). Wayan and Puspar are amazing hosts and learning to cook at their family home is really something special. The location is fantastic, the food delicious, and the company makes it so much fun! Enjoying a couple of beers to accompany the food we'd just cooked and getting to sit on the special 'honeymoon' table with a view of the surrounding countryside as the sun went down is something we'll never forget. Thank you also to Puspa for returning our camera which we left behind, so so kind of you. Highly recommended!

I wish cooking was always this much fun!. Wayan and Puspar made this one of our highlights of our trip to Bali. Cooking has never been so much fun. After an informative visit to a rice field we went back to Wayan and Puspar's house where we were warmly welcomed. We all got stuck in to the preparation and cooking of some fabulous Balinese dishes which we then got to eat for dinner. It was all extremely organised and hygiene standards were very high. I would highly recommend this class.

BOOK THIS NOW - you will not be disappointed. this is a must do. Best food I ate in Bali the entire time I was there. excellent experience. Puspa and Wayan invited us into their home and it was such a lovely experience. hygene is excellent! you WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED!

Amazing... personalised yet professional!. My friend and I were fortunate to book into Paon Bali morning cooking class in March 2012, which we arranged ourselves over the phone once we had arrived. We had done some research beforehand and the website and reviews provided information suggesting to us that it would be the most likely educational, personalised, fun and cultural experience in comparison to the others (which were mainly restaurant based) - it was all that and so much more! The pickup from our hotel, to the Ubud Market Tour (where we were able to purchase ingredients to take home), the cultural explanations of foods, dress and offerings and the information about village life, only to finish up with cooking, eating and sharing the day with some fantastic people! Puspar is a beautiful woman and Wayan is a wonderful gentleman; proud of their culture and honest in sharing their life story. They invited us into their home and world and showered us with so much hospitality and gratitude, I felt like I was a part of their family. The lovely assistants, including Made, were so warm and friendly making the experience even more pleasurable. The group of participants were very different, but we all got along so well, learning from and about each other - by the end of the day it was like we had known each other for such a long time. The benefits of this day far outweighed the skills we learnt in cooking traditional foods and tasting the yummy dishes we created! Not to mention, the cost was unbelievably outstanding value for money - far cheaper than others and you could not put a $ value on what I gained during this day. I would participate in this experience, over and over again. In fact, we are planning another trip Feb 2013 and I have convinced my husband to come with me this time... CAN'T WAIT!

A must do experience in Ubud. Puspa & Wayan are a great team. They are funny, speak English very well and seem to enjoy their work despite cooking the same meal 7-days a week for the past 3-years...twice a day!! They'll arrange a pickup from your hotel, take you to the market and show you around and explain various things you'll find at the market..making sure you can taste the various fruits and advising you not to taste some others (like the boiled sardines) due to "Bali Belly" risk. After visiting the market we drove to a local rice paddy and were told all about the process of growing and harvesting rice in Bali. Very interesting. We then were driven a short distance to Puspa & Wayan's home and welcomed warmly into their (large) home and the family life and house architecture was explained. Finally we moved to the kitchen and began cooking...this is where it got really good.Having done many cooking classes in different countries, I've seen different ways of doing it. In this way Puspa explained how to do certain aspects of the preparation and then had enough stations setup for about 1/2 to 3/4 of our group (we were ~20) to work diligently on the same task...then all the food from the stations were combined together and we moved to a different part of the (outdoor) kitchen where the same process was repeated (with a different item to prepare).After several hours preparing, we sit at tables of 10 people or so and enjoy our hard cooked meal that consisted of many, many typical (and delicious) Indonesian meals.If you have an allergy, intolerance or food preference (e.g. vegetarian) that's no problem. Just be prepared to be asked in front of the whole group "who has allergies" or "who is vegetarian".Return transfer to hotel (or spa for us) also included.We were picked up at 8:40am (supposed to have been 8:15) and returned at 3:00pm.

Great experience. My boyfriend and I went on the morning cooking school on 26th September and it was really good fun. The trip around the markets was a great chance to try different types of fruit and to get to know a little more about the Balinese lifestyle. We then met Wayan at the rice paddies, who gave us a bit of history about the rice paddies and the pivotal role they play in the eating habits of the Balinese.Then over to Paon Bali, where we met Wayan's wife, Puspa, who was a fantastic host and very charismatic and approachable. The whole team at Paon Bali were fantastic, everything was organised perfectly and the food we cooked was delicious (naturally!). The menu we made up consisted of clear mushroom soup, gado-gado, sate, chicken curry and fried tempe, amongst other things. I would definitely recommend this course.

fun and delicious. Hosts Puspar and Wayan provide an entertaining, educational, fun filled and delicious cooking experience. Puspar radiates hospitality, warmth and humour and her informative discussion on Balinese life, culture and cooking is enthralling. The cooking is set up to allow participation at all levels and gives an insight into the basics of Indonesian food. Participation is fun, with jokes and humour spread throughout the informative commentary. And a delicious meal awaits at the end. I'm looking forward to trying the recipes at home. Highly recommended for anyone with even a slight interest in food.

An experience of both food and culture. We had done a cooking class last time we came to Bali and hadn't actually done any of the cooking, more just watched.This was a completely different experience. We booked the class via the website where Puspa was very reliable and easy to deal with. It was $35 per person and they also arranged for us to be picked up from our hotel in Legian. The car only cost $30 return for the 3 of us and they also let us spend the afternoon in Ubud and return at our convenience.Once we arrived in Ubud, Puspa met us at the market and took us through the food section pointing out some different spices and fruits and allowing us to tast them. We were then taken to look at the village where Puspa and Wayan live and we were shown the beautiful rice paddies. Once taken to Paon cooking class, which is actually where Wayan & Puspa's family live we were given a very detailed description of a typical Balinese house. It was very interesting and Wayan is quite a character.All the staff were very polite and spoke excellent english so If anyone had any allergies or were vegetarian they were well cared for.It was really great fun as we were shown all the ingredients and then took part in all the processes of the cooking under guidance. The food was amazing and needless to say we left in a very happy food coma. We finished the class at about 2pm.Wayan and Puspa were amazing hosts and this course was a phenomenal experience.

Best Balinese cooking!!. My 2 friends and I impulsively booked ourselves in to a Balinese cooking class at the very last minute. We called up Paon who advised us that they were fully booked for the rest of the week and the only availabilities were that morning. We agreed to this anyway and Puspa was kind enough to organise transport for us (since we were staying in Seminyak). We got there a bit late but was taken to the markets and the rice fields where we met Wayan and everybody else in the class. Wayan was just too cute and funny. Afterwards, we were taken to his house and introduced to his wife Puspa who was the teacher. She was ever so friendly and knew her food. The cooking class was pretty hands on and everybody participated in the cooking. We then all sat down to eat the food we made. It was the most delicious Balinese food we have ever had. And to think we made it ourselves with organic and locally grown products?!! I would definitely recommend this for a true Balinese cultural experience :-)

Great experience in a Traditional Balinese home. From start to finish an amazing time! Convenient and onetime pick-up at our hotel we then drove up to the village for our afternoon cooking class. We have been warmly welcomed in the family home of the chef and his wife.The kitchen is open air and we are helped by the owners as well as professional staff. Cleanliness of the house and hygien of the place is remarkable. With 9 participants we cooked 8 traditional dishes using wood fire, traditional techniques etc...We left after 4h and a great meal, with a printout of the recipes we prepared as well as great memories. Definitly recommend to anyone!

Highlight of Ubud. Believe the TA hype - Auntie Puspa and King Wayan are the best!! After a visit to the market, they welcome you into their home with so much warmth and laughter, and provide information on many aspects of Balinese culture, from rice paddies to family life. Participants cook as little or as much as they like while learning about the food, and the preparation process is extremely well-organized. The meal at the end was fantastic, and I especially loved the emphasis on using healthy, pesticide-free produce and rice. This class was easily the highlight of my Bali trip. Many thanks to Puspa and Wayan and everyone on their team for a wonderful day!

Not to be missed!. This cooking class was one of our favorite outings during our two week stay in Bali. The food was incredible and the hosts were extremely welcoming and knowledgeable! We can't wait to make some of the recipes now that we are back home in the states. Do not miss an opportunity to take this tour! You will not be disappointed!

So Much Fun!. This is a MUST do when you are in Bali! there are a lot of people/business/hotels who are giving cooking classes, the paon cooking class is not the cheapest but it is worth it absolutely!!You are be picked up at your hotel, and half way wayan is waiting for you at the rice terrasses, he explaines you everything about the rice. Then they bring you to the house of puspa and wayan, a real balinese complex. We got an explanation about a balinese house, we felt really welcome! Puspa explained everything about the ingredients and the balinese kitchen. Then we went cooking by ourselves, it became a great afternoon, we learned a lot, we laughed a lot, eat a lot, beautifull experience!We chose paon from all the reviews from tripadvisor and you were right!!! You have to do this cooking class, really so much fun, great memories!!

Best thing I did in Bali!. I was so pleased that I found Paon Bali Cooking Class via TripAdvisor's 'Things to Do' - it was the highlight of our trip. Puspa and Wayan are absolutely beautiful and they open their lovely home with such generosity and warmth that it truly is a humbling experience. So affordable and accessible, just do it.

Fantastic experience - highly recommended. We were blessed to have found this cooking class in Ubud. From the minute we were picked up (from our hotel that was 25 minutes out of ubud) a fantastic journey began. We were taken to the families compound where we were given an overview of family life in Bali and how the "pecking order" worked for families and given a lovely refreshment on arrival. The best part however was to come next, we made (I think) more than 7 dishes. There were about 14 participants on the day we went and every one of us had the opportunity to chop, cook and most definitely "eat". After we had prepared out dishes (using traditional cooking equipment) we all sat down for a beautiful dinner. We started at 4pm and finished at 9pm. It was wonderful doing it in the evening as it was cooler and we got to take in the atmosphere of the compound and surrounding area at night. We were given our recipes to take home and I will certainly be giving them a go. Lovely family, great experience...highly recommended!!

Excellent Cooking Class with Gracious Hosts!. I won't comment on how great this cooking class in Bali is. The other reviews are probably can write better than me. What you need to know is that the hosts Puspa and her husband are EXTREMELY gracious and accommodating! Me and my friends were late for the starting time by an hour and instead of leaving us behind, Puspa HERSELF came down to give us the market tour! We did miss the Rice Padi tour but we still managed to make the cooking class! This Cooking Class in Bali is a MUST GO!disclaimer: Just doing my bit for SEO!

Great day!. Had a lovely day and learned a lot about bali culture and food. The food is Amazing as are the hosts. Would highly recommend and looking forward to trying some of the dishes back home. Thanks

Cooking with Aunty Puspa - brilliant!. We thoroughly enjoyed our cooking class in a real Balinese house and kitchen, with a real Balinese family as our teachers. We learned about Balinese culture and had a lot of fun making the delicious food which we consumed when the class was finished. It was nice to be in a small group and get to meet some new people (other "students") from around the world with a love for good food too!

Great experience and authentic cooking. Paon is well worth the price ($35 pp) and you can participate as much or as least as you like in the cooking. Paon is set in a small village in a family compound which is run by a Balinese couple who were very delightful. It felt authentic, and rustic, like you were invited to their house for food and drink. We cooked and prepared about 7 dishes in all and they all tasted great. The peanut/satay sauce and the versatile yellow sauce will be reproduced back home! Overall a great experience as you not only learn about cooking great dishes but also learn about the culture and how important rice is in Balinese life.

Cooking, eating and culture. We were picked up from our accommodation and wended our way into the paddi fields where we waited for two other couples who were joining us for our class. Wayan gave us a good background about rice-growing in the area and took us to their family compound where, with good humour and generosity, he shared the religious and cultural beliefs that shape their lives. Then onto the cooking. Very slick operation (in a good way) with everything flowing and lots of energy by our fabulous hosts. The food was superb and, now home, the recipes sit on the bench begging me to get onto it! Soon ...

Great value and great food. Enjoyed this cooking class very much.. The presenters were entertaining and gave us a good insight into traditional Bali..Food we cooked was delicious and the house was spotless. Cleanliness was 10/10Food we cooked was all organic grown from their local garden. I'll definately do it again next trip.

Unbelievably fantastic. This was one of the best ways to spend an afternoon in Bali. Wayan and Puspa are so welcoming and friendly. They have an absolutely wonderful home and the food is second to none. Will definitely be taking friends and family every time I go to Bali (which is quite a bit). Well worth the drive from Sanur

Fantastic. We where a group of 5 ladies and we did the afternoon cooking class. It was great, we where picked up from Kuta and taken to Ubud. We joined the class with another 10 others. Everyone got involved in the preparation and cooking then we got to eat it and the end. We where taken back by transport arranged by Wayan and Puspa. I would highly recommend this and will take my husband when he goes with me next.

This is NOT a tourist attraction.... This is a priceless experience of a lifetime with Wayan and Puspa. They share the Balinese way of life through cooking in their home for 5 hours with a bunch of strangers!With such warmth and hospitality we are welcomed into their delighful outdoor kitchen to build our Balinese cooking skills. To explain the detail of the experience will spoil the surprises. So all I will say is that you will have a load of laughs, learn heaps, have a gigantic meal and not want to go back to your hotel! You will treasure Puspa’s recipes and cook with these memories forever…. At home now I always have a pot of white rice in the fridge, just so I can relive my cooking class anytime!Best wishes Wayan and Puspa - we will be back next time.

Fantastic and entertaining. If you are looking for a cooking school then this will not satisfy your needs. If, however, you are looking for a cooking class designed to provide a great day out that is fun, entertaining, informative and has a high level of participation then this is definitely the one. You can participate as much or as little as you feel you need to.Great variety of food; the day flows really well and there is plenty of food at the end of the cooking to sit down and enjoy. I found the team participation far better than individual cooking tables as it allows the day to progress at the same pace as some of us are not as good at cooking as others; all while you are enjoying a Bintang or 2- can’t beat that! I think I would struggle standing at a table preparing and cooking all my own food.Great location, the cleanliness and hygiene is second to none- critical in a place like Bali. And the value for money is amazing!Thanks to Puspa, Wayan and the team- an excellent day out.

great day!! lovely people!!. one of the best days of our trip. You learn sooo much, it's fun, they have beers, they are lovely people, there is music, family atmosphere, great feast, plus you get to take your recipes home with you. I very much recommend this to everybody!

Culture and Cookery in Ubud. We really enjoyed our visit to Wayan and Puspa's house where we learnt a great deal about the Balinese culture, and also really enjoyed the cookery class.We chose the afternoon class, as this meant we had a short tour of the padi fields, and then onto their compound where we had our cookery lesson, and finished by eating the food which was a great feast!I can't think of a better way to spend an evening in Ubud and Puspa and Wayan's hospitality is second to none.

Best authentic experience in Bali so far. After spending the first few days relaxing by the pool I was bored stupid. I finally convinced my boyfriend to come and do this cooking class with me as I was sick to death of all the western food on offer. I was hanging for some authentic Indonesian food!It was an hour from where we were staying (seminyak) but well worth the trip. This class was awesome and even my boyfriend who doesn't know how to boil water loved it! The food was great and not only do you get plenty of it but you get a great variety also. What I loved about this though was the that it was about more than just food. Wayan drove us past the rice paddies and explained a lot about Balinese culture which was really insightful. We got to see the beautiful countryside and eat authentic food. If you want an authentic Balinese experience then you must do this class.

Entertaining & and informative.. Top Marks to Puspa & Wayan These guys have a pretty slick act as a humourus duo. This is not just a very good hands on cooking class, but also a real look in the Balanese lifestyle and nature. We were told many interesting facts about the Rice fields and the family compound. Both these two are super friendly and good English speakers. Cooking wise, you will not be disappointed, as the only 100% vegetarian, I was catered for and the meal was excellent.... Highly recommended for serious foodies and general tourists.

An authentic Ubud experience not to be missed. My husband and I truly enjoyed this experience. Wayan and Puspa are truly wonderful people that make you feel at home. They are proud of their culture and family which adds so much warmth and authenticity to this class. The market visit, the rice paddy stop and being serenaded by Wayan while we were cooking are simply wonderful memories that we took away from that day. In addition to the recipes which I can not wait to try at home! The class logistics were well put together, very organized and you get to participate as much or as little as you like. And in the end, you get to taste the fruit of your labour which is absolutely delicious. You will not be disappointed!!!

One of the highlights of our trip to Ubud. Thankyou Puspa and Wayan for a day to remember.We loved our experience at this fabulous cooking school. For $35 per head my husband and I were picked up from our hotel at 8.30 , visited the local food market , to learn about the vegetables and fruit we would be preparing . I was able to buy bags of the freshest vanilla beans to bring back home for myself and my foodie friends . We were then amen to the families rice padi to learn about rice production , embarrassingly I wasn't aware how rice was grown , my husband loved this part as an engineer , he enjoyed seeing the irrigation , pumping operation. We were then taken to the family's beautiful home where we learnt a small insight into traditional Balinese family life structure.The cooking experience followed , which was very hands on , lots of chopping , stirring , pounding , mixing , all in all we covered 7 dishes ,which were printed in a recipe book to bring home. Puspa is a delightful teacher , personality plus , patient and clear in her instructions.We're cooking 3 of the dishes this weekend for friends and can't wait!Following the prep and cooking we all sat down at beautifully set tables looking out to glorious country views to eat the wonderful lunch we had all prepared , delicious! We were then driven back to our hotel 7 hours later , price wise this cookery class is indeed a bargain.Have no hesitation in encouraging any visitor to Ubud to attend Paon Cooking SchoolThank you Puspa and Wayan John and Jane

Fabulous day. A professional set up from the moment we were picked up from our villa, the tour of the market, the visit to the paddy field, the introduction to the Hindu home and then the hands on cookery lesson. A great day with the informative and funny hosts Puspa and Wayan. A must do for food lovers!Don,t book anywhere for dinner - you won't need it!
Excellent. Had a thoroughly enjoyable day, looked after from start to finish, learning about Balinese cooking in a informal and fun way.

Amazing!. One of the best things I did in Bali. It was by far the best meal I had, they were super nice and extremely welcoming and accommodating. We did the afternoon tour. They showed and explained the Balinese rice fields system. And then told us all about the structure of their home and and how it fits in with Balinese culture. They give you notes to take home with you. A must do in Ubud!

Great Experience. A Must Do.. Had a great time at this cooking class. Puspa and her husband Wayan are a lovely couple and made us all feel at home in their beautiful traditional Balinese home. The cooking lesson was wonderful and very easy to follow, lots of hands on. Then we got to eat our wonderful lunch. I should have mentioned that before the cooking clas s begins you are meet down in Ubud where you are escorted through the local market to familiarize you of the local ingredients you will use in the cooking class, then you are driven up to their village in Laplapsan where you learn about the rice paddy. It's very interesting, then you start your lesson. A nice way to mix with the locals and help support village life. Thanks for a fun day.

Best Introduction to Balinese Cooking and Home Culture. This is an excellent opportunity to see something of Balinese life and also learn something about local cooking techniques. The first part of the class was a not very instructive tour of the food section of the local market; not the highlight of the day. Then a short drive to paddy fields outside the small village of Laplapan, about ten minutes out of Ubud. There we met Wayan who gave us a short presentation about the land use system used by the villagers. It was obvious he enjoyed what he was doing and made us feel very welcome in this beautiful setting.The off to home of Wayan and, his wife, Puspa. The home is a traditional Balinese family compound and whist we enjoyed a welcome drink Wayan and Puspa talked to us about the way a Balinese family compound is laid out and how it works. Very interesting.Off to the lower level of the compound where the cooking facilities are located; a clean and lovely setting.Puspa and her staff showed us how to prepare the ingredients that were going to be used to make the nine (or was it ten) dishes we were going to cook. After much slicing, chopping and pulverizing, the ingredients were ready and we started to cook.There were about twelve people in the class and we all had plenty of opportunity to be involved in all aspects of preparing the dishes. Very hands on and lots of fun.Once the cooking was done we settled down to eat a wonderful lunch in a delightful setting overlooking the forest.Wayan and Puspa are both lovely people who do all they can to make this a truly wonderful experience that is much more than just a cooking class.

incredible experience. We were picked up by a driver, taken to the Ubud market for a tour of fruits, vegetables and spices. We were then taken to the rice paddies for a welcome and introduction into the village culture and rice cultivation. We were taken to the home of the owners where we were introduced to Hindu home life. Then we were escorted into the courtyard/outdoor kitchen for an amazing experience. We cooked a number of Indonesian dishes which we then enjoyed eatig in the outdoor dining area. The couple who run the school were very warm and personable, with a great sense of humor. Their assistants were highly capable and very friendly. This day started at 8:30 a.m. and went through about 3:00 p.m. We were given the recipes to take home with us. I highly recommend this experience! It is second to none.

A Must Do in Ubud. Paom Bali cooking class is an exceptionally well organised activity. Go in the morning if you can to include the market tour. Paon and Wayon are superb hosts and make sure you have a delightful time. The food - which you help prepare and cook - is wonderful. They help you all through the morning and provide recipes to take away. If you are 6 or 60 you will enjoy yourself!

Cooking Class Bali Ubud. Fantastic experience would recommend activity to all. Picked up at hotel on time and we went to morning market and rice fields. Both Puspa and Wayan (hosts) gave us a lot of information about the traditions in Ubud and their family. The cooking was wonderful and the recipes that were given out mean that they can be reproduced at home. Would recommend for all however young children could be bored.

Wonderful expeience. I have been to Bali four times now and Paon Bali Cooking Class is one of the best activities I have done in Bali.Puspa and Wayan, the hosts are just delightful. You are picked up from your accommodation and taken to the Ubud Market and meet up with Puspa and the rest of the group. Puspa gives you a guided tour of the market where you see all the ingredients you will be using later for sale. You also see all the general merchandise and clothing that the locals buy. You are not hassled by stall holders as Puspa commands great respect in the market.You are then taken to Wayan and Puspa's village about 10 minutes out of Ubud where Wayan shows you the rice paddies and explains the Balinese rice growing and harvesting cycles, very informative and interesting. From there it's on to Wayan & Puspa's family compound where you are given a lovely welcome drink and the layout of the home and family traditions are explained. After this it is the actual preparation of the food and cooking. There are a number of staff who help with the preparation, instruction and cleaning up.At the end, you get to eat all the wonderful dishes you have helped to create.Complimentary water is provided throughout the tour and class and various teas (the ginger tea with honey is great) and Bali Kopi is also provided. Bintang is available for purchase to have with your culinary masterpieces at the end!The recipes of all the dishes you helped prepare are given out at the conclusion of the class so you can practice your new-found cooking skills at home.The class is suitable for all ages from teenagers upwards, our group included my 17 y/o nephew and his girlfriend and they loved it, not bored at all! The tour/class is fabulous and well worth the 350,000 Rupiah (under $40 AUD), the meal alone is worth that!It is a good idea to book ahead to avoid disappointment as class sizes are limited due to the size of the facilities. Our group size was 12 which is pretty much the maximum; we had a friend who wanted to join us at the last minute but they could not accommodate him. I recommend the morning class as it includes the Ubud Market tour.There may be other more intense, smaller Balinese cooking classes better suited to the hard core foodie out there but Paon Bali is a great all round fun culinary and cultural experience.I can't recommend it highly enough!Enjoy!

More than a Cooking Class. Three of us, two foodies and one not, totally enjoyed the very special hospitality of Wayan, Puspa and their wonderful helpers. "Paon Bali Cooking Class" is not the standard cooking class visitors might expect. We began with a morning trip to the Ubud Market and learned much more about its produce, how it operates and its role in the life of Ubud and the surrounding villages, than we had in all of our own earlier visits. We then proceeded to Laplaplan. Wayan's talk about the rice paddies, how they are managed and their centrality to the life and culture of the village was really interesting, as was his information about the steps now taken to ensure the sustainability of Bali's rice paddies into the future. Our next stop was Wayan's home where we were served icy lemon drinks and met his lovely wife and chef extraordinaire, Puspa. Wayan and Puspa shared the story of their own lives together and of how the families in the village live and try to work as one for the good of all. We had walked and driven past so many family compounds and now we were beginning to understand what Balinese family life was all about. And then there was the cooking class. What a fantastic experience. The food handling standards and general cleanliness were extremely high. (Puspa: No one gets BB in my home!") We learned heaps about the local ingredients and all made a hands on contribution to the most amazing Balinese feast. Puspa made suggestions for substitutions for ingredients that some might find hard to get in their home countries and we received copies of all the meals we cooked to take home. It was almost a full day - 8.15am to around 3.00pm and we were superbly looked after for every minute of it. It was the stand out day of our holiday. Our only suggestion would be that Wayan and Puspa keep the numbers down to around 10 per group, even if this means slightly increasing the cost. There were 9 in our group. That was a good size. The three of us agreed that with a bigger group some of the "essence" of the experience might have been lost.

Fantastic class. A Must!. We completed the cooking class with Puspa and found her and her husband Wayan to be extremely welcoming and gracious hosts. The class was very interesting and allowed participants to gain a lot of hands on experience. Puspa was also able to cater to several allergies. It was lovely to see into a traditional Balinese home and gain understanding of their way of life. Wayan drove us back to our Villa and he was absolutely delightful to talk to. We would strongly recommend this class to anyone looking for a friendly and traditional cooking class.

Fab!. Funny, informative and great food! A great way to have an insight into local balinese methods - both old and new. Puspa (owner) and her husband take care of you personally and are warm and friendly. This was recommended to us, and I can only now do the same. Get yourself booked on to this as a must do!

Best cooking school in Bali!. Wow! I have done Balinese cooking class before but Paon far exceeds any previous experience. From the moment we were picked up from our Honeymoon Guesthouse we were welcomed so warmly and spent the rest of the day in awe of Wayan and his wife Puspa as they graciously welcomed us into their beautiful home and village, taught us many things aboutnBalnese culture, the market tour,growing rice in the rice paddies and cooking authentic Balinese dishes that were extraordinary!! Every dish delicious. Wayan and Puspa have such fun and encourage us to take everything slow. Their sense of humor, care & expertise made this experience a memorable one & we would certainly do it again. When I left my scarf behind, Wayan kindly called on the mobile to offer to drop it off to our Guesthouse, amazing people! This is a must do event.

If you want a cooking class, do this one!. Great day spent With Paon cooking class in Ubud. First at the local market, followed by the rice paddy field, the Balinese family compound and then cooking! Pusa, our cooking teacher, isso understanding and patient. She takes all likes and dislikes into account. Everyone is hands on with the cooking with wonderful results. Great meals as well as a recipe book to take home. Special treatment for you if on a honeymoon.

Champions of Bali cooking. Excellent day visiting these cooks home to share a day and do some cooking. Great market visit, great food and good learning and recipes that we will take hone. Also some good laughs.

A fabulous experience. We attended this class today and it was an experience that we would highly recommend . The hosts are warm and welcoming and very entertaining. We were collected from our hotel and driven and hour and a half to Ubud. We met the hostess at a food market and then met her very funny and informative husband at the Rice Fields. They then invited us to their home , where we enjoyed a wonderful afternoon of cooking and eating. This took a whole day, but it is definitely worth doing while in Bali.

Fabulous!. A group of us attended Puspa and Wayan's home to learn about the cultural significance of Bali alongside its exquisite flavours. I have tried the recipes learnt in the class at home now, with great success and not too much trouble. The classes were not just about cooking, we learnt about the heart of Bali too, through this lovely, enterprising and open hearted family.It was so good that I am about to book another on my next visit!

"Simply the Best"!. If you love Bali you must try this cooking class. It was a treat and one of the highlights of my trip. The host's (Puspa and Wayan) are so entertaining, they are lovely people. The cooking was fun and we ate what we cooked at the end which was delicious. We enjoyed learning about their way of life. It was an experience I'll never forget.

One of the highlights of my trip. Paon's cooking class was a great experience on many levels, I really enjoyed the visit to the market (who can resist tasting exotic fruits!!), the stop at the rice paddies was instructive and fun. The class itself is carried in a fun and relaxed manner, that allows the participants to learn at a reasonable pace - not too slow, not too fast. The food we prepared was absolutely delicious. We were given the recipes to take home. Thank you to Paon's friendly staff for such a wonderful day

Fantastic evening never to be forgot.. This evening was one to remember. Lots of fun had whilst making many different local dishes was had with Wayan and his wife. Couldn't thank them enough for inviting us into their lovely home and teaching us something about the.local cuisine. Great speed of learning and very hands on. Food was the best Indonesian we had whilst on our 3 week trip around the Islands. We hope one day to come back and visit again to possibly take them up on their offer to cook for a wedding!love Ashley and 'Baby Fish' x x x

A "Must Do While in Bali". Have just returned from a morning cooking class with this delightful couple and their friendly staff. The experience was fantastic, the food so delicious, recipes to take home, all carried out in an authentic Balinese village. We would highly recommend to anyone who loves Bali, it's food and it's people.

Great experience!. The cooking class was great! I was there with my 2 kids (15 & 19 yr olds). They loved it! It was easy enough for a novice to learn how to make a few great dishes. I find it a relaxing and comfortable atmosphere while we were making our dishes. I was able to chat with other people in the group. Auntie P is very organized and has the kitchen running smoothly. There were plenty of things to do since there were 20 of us. Everyone had a chance to prep and cook. At the end we ate our creation (8 dishes). Price was fair compare to the other cooking classes. Also went to the rice field and market. We did the morning tour.

Great food and Great People!. We had a blast at this course, the couple who run it are very funny and keep things going at a nice pace. We did the evening course so we started our class with a visit to a rice field to learn about how the balinese people grow rice. Next, we went to the class which takes place at Wayan and Puspa's home. You learn about balinese homes and start the class by viewing all the beautiful ingredients. The class was fun with lots of hands-on cooking and information. Puspa offers alternatives to ingredients that you might have difficulty procuring in your home country. The feast at the end was awesome and they were able to accommodate my vegetarianism without any problems. We all had take-home recipe books with a ton of options. Would definitely recommend this to anyone.

The best of the best. I have done 7 cooking classes but this out ranks them all and value value!!! what a fantastic joyful experience. great SAFE food no BB and a wonderfully presented class. Do your self a favour. I travelled from Seminyak well worth it.
Fun in the sun. A great way to learn about Balinese cooking and their way of life. Wayan and Puspa are lovely hosts and entertained us all evening with their cheeky sense of humour :-)
Yummy fun. One of the best thing we did on trip, afternoon class was great, drinking beers and cooking with great group of travelers, would do it again

Food that you can cook.. We booked into the afternoon cooking school. Firstly, we met Wayan in the rice fields, his bit was a mixture of stand up comedian and education. A very funny man. We were then driven to the school just down the road where we met Wayan's wife Puspa. They then ran through a little history and outline of Balinese living. Very funny and entertaining. The cooking was hands on, well thoughtout and very well explained. We loved it and have since used the recipes at home. I have never cooked Balinese food before and even I could do it!!! I highly recommend this school.

Afternoon Class, too long but great food. We signed up for an afternoon class and were told it would end at 8 p.m. However it finished at around 9:20 p.m., which means - don't plan anything after that. The whole program took approx. 5,5 hours and was way too long for someone staying only 6 days in Bali. At the end it got a bit boring. We were cooking eight dishes and I think five would do. The afternoon class does not include market shopping. Our group was rather big, 14 people. On the other hand the food was delicious and the family very nice people. We really enjoyed the view from our table.

An Amazing Experience. All of it was completely amazing and I loved getting taken to the markets and rice paddy fields before cooking and learning a lot about what I didn't know before. Everyone was included and got given jobs that were suitable for our cooking levels. Paon and Puspa were so friendly and funny and so were the other staff. All of them were full of information to help us out. The food was wonderful and really gave you an insight into the life a true Balinese family and we were treated with a delicious meal. The spot was amazing and everyone else that did it with us enjoyed it just as much.

A Fantastic Experience. Believe all the reviews ! This is a very professional operation which gives you a great introduction into the Balinese way of life. Wayan and Puspa are great hosts and it is a great activity which can be enjoyed by the whole family.

Highlight of my entire trip!. This was not just a cooking class but an insight into the Balinese everyday lifestyle.First we met 'Aunty' Puspa in the market where we learnt about where people do their everyday shopping. We also had the opportunity to try fruits that we have never had the opportunity (or the guts) to try before, with Aunty Puspa showing us which part is actually edible and warning us before we bit into something sour -thankfully! Then we were taken to the rice fields where we learnt about the rice paddy tradition from Wayan and the life cycle of rice. I found it such an eye opener to learn about where rice comes from (I'm so used to seeing only the end product in a plastic packet) and how much work actually goes into producing such a basic food staple. I now realise how much I take rice for granted!After that, we were taken to Wayan and Puspa's home. We were given delicious welcome drinks and further explanation of the Balinese housing arangments/ family traditions -which was made all the more enjoyable by Wayan's and Puspa's sense of humour. Then the cooking began!Firstly, I have to say that the facilities there were immaculately clean, with the staff clearing dishes and preparing ingredients with clockwork precision -so much so, that it was effortless and effective in ensuring that the more tedious aspects of cooking (ie- clean up) did not spoil guests' experience. Everyone was encouraged to get involved and before you know it, we had a banquet!! Oh and most importantly, Aunty Puspa was able to cater for allergies/food intolerances within an instant! No really, there's not many programs that can easily cater for someone who is gluten free, dairy free, nut free and vegetarian, but Aunty Puspa did without batting an eyelid! My mother and myself did not feel at all on the outer or any less involved in the experience. We were given tofu and tempeh alternatives and the food we produced was sooooo delicious!!!!!!!! It was an amazing experience! Anyone wanting to get out of the tourist bubble and learn about how the Balinese actually live, as well as eat delicious food, regardless of how many dietary exceptions you have, DO THIS PROGRAM!

A must do in Ubud!. A group of us had a wonderful time with Puspa and her family. The class was the perfect way to learn the basics of Balinese cooking: very professional and also fun and entertaining, nice and clean setting, great recipes, authentic and delicious food. And it was more than just cooking as the class provided unique access to a Balinese home and the opportunity to learn more about their culture. A must do in Ubud!

Don't hesitate, do it!!!!!. Everyone on the course came because of the tripadvisor reviews and no one was disappointed. You get it all, the rice paddies, wet market, visit to village temple, fantastic food and unbelievably entertaining and knowledgable hosts. All this in an authentic local village. If you do nothing else in Bali, do this!

Cooking splendor. A group of us did the Paon Cooking Class in Ubud in June 2012.. Loved every minute of it from the market tour, then onto a visit to the Rice Fields and then to the home of our hosts, Wayan and Puspa. Lovely couple and quite the comedy act.
