The cooking session was fantastic, interesting, fun and informative. The food we cooked was the freshest and tastiest we have had and we felt quite the 'Masterchefs'. Everything made from scratch (no packets like we use at home) and the whole cooking experience was a hands on one. Highly recommend this cooking day. One of the most enjoyable things we did in Bali. Wayan and Puspa were the perfect hosts.

great day of cooking, culture and fun. My sister, husband and I had a wonderful day with Puspa and Wayan. It is informative , hands on and one of the best meals we had in Bali. Puspa and Wayan are very warm and have a great sense of fun too. Their home is immaculate and perfectly set up for the cooking school. We had a lovely group and very much enjoyed sitting down to the feast we prepared. I learnt a lot and we take home the recipes so I can't wait to try them at home. It is amazing value and I would highly recommend it to not only people who love to cook but anyone who likes to eat! Thanks Wayan and Puspa for your wonderful hospitality and generosity. We really enjoyed our day with you.

Fantastic experience and food!. This was one of the highlights of our stay in Bali. Wonderful trip to the Ubud markets followed by a quick informative trip to the rice fields. Then to the hosts home where we all participated in the preparing of the food. Wayan and Puspa were wonderful hosts and they provide a a real insight into Balinese culture and food. The food itself was up with the best we ate in Bali. Also loved the welcome drink! Very highly recommended.

A must do in Bali. A fantastic half day tour! I can't recommend enough so much more than simply cooking. A rare insight into Balinese family life (as you go inside the family compound) local ubud market and rice growing techniques in village. Then there is the cooking of probably one of the best meals we had in Bali. Using Balinese techniques we cooked an incredible feast. Thankyou soooo much Puspa and Wayan probably the highlight of my holiday!

Delicious. A must do for your Bali trip. First rate. Very friendly husband and wife team. Not just cooking, but market trip, rice paddy visit, welcome drink, chat about Bainese family life, and then a cooking experience not to miss. Then the the sit down dinner to taste the Balinese delights. Very good value. I will now try the recipes at home.

A 'must-do' experience!!. This was definitely a highlight of our trip and a great chance to get away for a quieter afternoon. Wayan and Puspa were extremely welcoming and provided an amazing afternoon of cooking, culture and good humour. I have been to Bali several times and found this a lovely insight into the local food and lifestyle. I would recommend this experience to all ages. Just remember to have an empty stomach - the food is delicious!!

A wonderful cooking experience. We chose to do dinner with our group which meant we missed the market shopping in the morning, but it was worth it. The sunset and atmosphere were wonderful. Our group was only 9 which was perfect! We all took turns at the pans and chopping stations and then were able to sit at one large table for dinner to enjoy what local menu selections we had prepared that were fabulous! Puspa and her husband were entertaining, educational and gracious. We left with printed recipes in hand and a video to help recreate the wonderful experience. I would recommend it again to anyone and suggest to be in any class less than 10 :) A definate must!

Don't hesitate, book today!!!. My friends and I recently attended a cooking class at Paon Bali in Ubud. The entire experience was wonderful – definitely one of the highlights of our trip!! Wayan and Puspa are such lovely people, very friendly, welcoming, funny and really just lovely!!! Believe the positive reviews on here – this family is so sweet and you will have a great time. We had a fantastic time preparing, cooking and learning about different traditional dishes, all of which turned out delicious. Definitely a must do if you are in Bali (we were staying in Seminyak but made the trip to Ubud just for this class!!). We can’t stop telling family and friends about the tasty food we cooked and about our lovely hosts. We will definitely return on our next trip to Bali and can’t wait to try recipes from our books soon!! YUMFor $35AUD this cooking class is a bargain!!

Fill your mind and fill your senses at the same time.....Home cooking. I was very pleasantly surprised to find out my cooking class, arranged by my driver was in a village home kitchen not in a restaurant. My delight was magnified as the day progressed. Firstly: 8.15 pick up from my accomodation, just after breakfast. Then an opportunity to puruse the market with someone who knew what was what and her way around.Showing us new and not so new ingredients we would be using throughout our cooking experience. A big plus for any tourist. Yes I am a tourist, but one who loves to cook, shop and eat, so this was my idea of a dream day.Then we left and our delightful driver told us of many wonderous things along the journey, which was a few miles out of Ubud.Next: stopped beside a rice paddy with a couple of other cars with tourists/cooking companions.This is where my journey took on new meaning. We were not just shown & told how a rice paddy operates but the impact of pesticides (now they are almost organically grown) on the soil, but the loss of such a valuable commodity (rice paddies) to the Balinese people, when hotels are built in the food bowl area.(This has now been corrected by UNESCO and is no longer to continue) Wayan was a funny, passionate host who realises that people can make a difference albeit one at a time. He is intelligent man who understands progress but not at the expense of his culture. (I really believe we could learn a great deal from the Balinese people). This was a true learning experience in the field. But the learning continued throughout the day. Not contrived or pushy, infact downright interesting and a real joy to be a part of. Do I sound like I fell in love with Bali on my first visit? Sure I did, what wasn't to love except what tourists have created in Kuta?I digresse, Next: Meeting the amazing team in a most beautiful setting,the family home. we started with a cool drink then a hot drink and both were equally delicious. Then we progressed to learning about the compounds for the entire families. A wonderful introduction to family life in Bali and how it happens. Interesting and a good insight to how life looks in a Bali home.Next: Cooking with Puspa.....wow, 8 courses, I am good but did we have the time and skills to achieve such an extensive menu...sure did...we all cooked, co-operated, laughed, chopped, stirred and learned the basics of Balinese food and cooking. Of course Puspa made it simple, no dishes and the Balinese blender....you will have to see that for yourself.......Next we...all 18 tourists sat down and ate what we had prepared.......Sate, fish, gao gado, yellow curry, salad, Banana and Jackfruit dessert......yummmmmm. The food was amazing if I do say so myself (loved the yellow chicken curry). The company equally amazing and the experience priceless. The entire day was less than $35 AUS, fantastic value in any country. Also a trip back to my acommodation with the delightful Wayan, along the scenic route of course with an informative and interesting commentary. Wow what a day....!!!!!I believe that such warmth and hospitality exists, because the family is passionate about their culture. Well done to each and everyone who attended, spread the word as it is one experience that will stay with me and my family (through my cooking) for many years to come. Thank you in particular to Wayan and Puspa. You and your family and home are not a tourist attraction, you are life in Bali........giving, happy and blessed, I will return thankyou....Lizz

Wonderful experience. This was our second time to Paon Bali Cooking Class. The second time I learn't so much more than the first (so I would throughly recommended if you return to bali to attend the same course), its amazing how much you miss the first time.The food is fantastic and even if you just went for lunch and no cooking its still excellent value for money.I also like supporting a local balinese family and community. I will definitely returning again on my next trip.

THE BEST DINNER IN BALI!!!!. The house is BEAUTIFUL!!! The cooking class setting is wonderful and she is, hands down, the best cooking teacher ever!!GRACIAS!!! For the wonderful experience and the best dinner in Bali!

Amazing company and an all round amazing experience. I cant rave enough about this lovely couple, their life story and the amazing knowledge they are passing on to everyone that is lucky enough to be welcomed in to their home. From the moment you arrive you feel like family. We shared an amazing night cooking with fresh ingredients from their beautiful garden, laughing, telling stories and preparing the most wonderful feast for us all to share. This is a must do on your bucket list when travelling to Bali. We will be back some time and look forward to being bleissed with meeting you both again soon.

Cooking and culture. The class involved going to the market to see the kinds of ingredients we would use, then a little education about rice growing and paddies and local communities in Ubud, and then going to the family home for the class. The class was very educational, fun and a very slick operation. Food was delicious and the teaching and staff were great. I recommend Paon if you want t get out of town and visit a local home for your class. They explain a lot about Balinese homes too, which makes it a well-rounded experience.

Amazing. We were picked up by Wayan from our hotel in Sanur, taken to the UBUD markets to learn about ingredients used in Balinese cooking, then onto the rice paddy. We then arrived at the home of Puspa and Wayan to be greeted and introduced to the traditions of family life. Then we started cooking!! Amazing ingredients, fresh, clean and excellently organised. All the staff were attentive and looked after us all. We have been to Bali many times but this was our first time experiencing a cooking lesson. It was a full day of learning about Balinese culture and food, sharing and meeting other great people along the way and then to sit down and enjoy the food...just amazing! :-)Highly recommend it!!

More than just cooking. This cooking class gave us an insight into Balinese culture from the town market, to the rice fields and then finally about a Balinese house compound and finally plenty of fun cooking and some amazing food. The cooking is done in an outdoor kitchen within Puspa and Wayan's family home and it is spotlessly clean. The food is shown from raw ingredients (also growing beside you in the family garden) to being sliced and cooked and then eaten. You get a chance to have a go at everything and also the final feast is huge. What a wonderful way to learn about true Balinese life.

Professional, enjoyable, personal. Puspa and Wayan provide a wonderful personal insight into Balinese village life. So much more than a cooking class, it was a rich excursion into the market , rice growing, family life and traditions. Highly recommended.

Best Experience. Great day spent with my 70+ mother. Historical & Cultural review of Balinese Tradition and way of life and hospitality. Pak Wayang and Ibu Puspa are the hosts with the 'mostest' catering to our every need. The demonstration of traditional Balinese cuisine and way of cooking are compared to none. Value for money for the awesome experience. Makasih Pak Wayang dan Ibu Puspa!

Good cooking course - but........ Hubby and I recently did this cooking course and found it quite good - there were 12 in our group (we did the afternoon class so didn't get to do the market tour). We assisted with cooking a number of dishes and were given the recipes afterwards.Then came the disappointing bit - the lady who runs the class (Puspa) had quite a bit to say about the fact that she needs everyone's support to pay her bills and mortgage etc.Now, I realise that this is Bali and that this kind of thing is not unusual and it generally doesn't bother me as the majority of Balinese do need our assistance. But if anyone does the math - the owners of this business are most definately NOT in this category and to be honest we found it offensive. The class is held twice a day and some reviewers have said there were 20 or more in their groups. At 350,000rp (approx AU$35) per person - this works out to be a hell of a lot of money coming in - and very little outlay except for the ingredients and a couple of staff who assist. And to equate this even further, the average wage in Bali is about AU$140 PER MONTH. I am the first one to give credit to people who start businesses and make a go of it - good for them - but please, don't then plead poor.I'm sorry, but I wouldn't recommend this class for the pure fact that the owners are downright greedy - all I can hope is that they are spreading their wealth around with others less fortunate than themselves.

What an amazing cooking and cultural experience.... My daughter and I recently attended a cooking class at Paon Bali in Ubud. Wayan and Puspa invited us into their home in the village and treated us to a wonderful experience learning about Balinese culture as well as learning to cook some amazing Indonesian dishes. My eighteen year old daughter really enjoyed herself as well!!!I can highly recommend their cooking school and it is great value at approx. AU$35 per person. Puspa was kind enough to arrange transport for us from Kuta where we were staying and we found our driver very courteous and efficient.Thanks once again Puspa and Wayan...we won't forget our experience. I have already cooked some of your wonderful dishes for family and friends and they were most impressed.

Authentic Bali Experience. We went to Paon Bali Cooking School on the recommendation of friends who have travelled to Bali several times. I'm very interested in food and have done a few cooking schools - this one was great. You won't learn highly technical chef-iness here, but I did learn about the flavours and methods used in traditional Balinese cooking. It was definitely the best Balinese food I've had in Bali. The highlight for me was getting to see a traditional Balinese home and to learn about Balinese culture. Wayan and Puspa were so warm and friendly and good fun. It was definitely worth the 60 minute taxi ride from Jimbaran Bay.

Paon Bali Cooking School June 2012. A must do if only doing one cooking class in Bali - great hosts. Great food. Leant a little about bali life and culture as well as cooking. They cater for vegetarians no problems/ hassle free - so no one will be disappointed or hungry. Do it!

Excellent excursion and cooking class in Ubud, Bali. My husband and I joined 14 others with Wayan and Puspa for this wonderful day celebrating traditional cooking in Bali. Starting in the market, it was great to learn about local fruit and vegetables, then Wayan gave us a terrific insight into the year round process of rice farming. Back in the family kitchen we all took part in preparing a wonderful feast, which became our lunch - with Puspa making sure we all learned the correct method for all preparation. A highlight of our holiday.

Great cooking class. All the positive reviews say it all. It is a hands-on course. Learned a lot, and the food was the best we had in Bali. A highlight of our holiday. Great that they offer an afternoon class.

Unbelievable Value!!. We had lots more than a cooking lesson! Absolutely loved the whole experience from 8:30am to 2:30pm, and the recipes worked perfectly when I tried them back home in Perth. Thank you again Puspa and Wayan from Soulla and Bryan

Great class. This was such a fun thing to do! Wayan and Puspa(sp?) were great. They are so entertaining! I know some people complained about the size of the class but we personally liked it. If you are looking for a class with just a few people this might not be for you. There were about 15 people in our class and I felt like we had plenty of hands on time! We did the afternoon class which started at 4 and ended around 9. We did lots of frying/ mixing / chopping. The afternoon class does not take a trip to the market so if you want to go to the market definitely do the morning class and I would book as far in advance as you can so you get the day you want. They run a good operation and it was fun being in their home cooking.

A must do in Bali. Being an experienced cook, I am always looking forward to learning new recipes & techniques.Having lived in Bali for many years, I felt my skills of Indonesian cooking lacking and therefore looked forward to the experience at Paon Bali Cooking Class in Ubud.Puspa our teacher & her husband Wayan, were the most generous and friendly people you could ever meet. Along with their helful and friendly staff myself and the other students enrolled for the day all had a great time, lots of laughs and lots of yummy food at the end of our lessons for the various recipes we were there to master.I highly recommend this Class for anyone from total beginner to the experienced as it was amazing at how easy Puspa made everything we learned on the day.Never too old or young to learn, and the cultural experience which was all part of the lessons, was wonderful.Well Done Ibu Puspa

A great experience. A wonderful morning learning about Balinese culture and home life. Great cooking class and delicious food. Wayan and Puspa are very warm welcoming and impart everything with a big smiles. Great fun!

Highly recommended. I can genuinely recommend this cooking class as a very worthwhile experience. Wayan and Puspa are exceptionally friendly and speak very good English. We went to the markets, then to the village and learned about the rice fields etc. After that we went to their home, where Wayan explained about Hindu home life. He is delightful and very funny. The cooking was informative and fun and great to eat afterwards. Everything about this experience was memorable and enjoyable.

Fabulous. If you are in Ubud please please do this.Puspa is amazing. So warm, gentle and funny. The class is an excellent way to experience Balinese culture.We took the afternoon class which was wonderful. We were giving a delicious welcome drink, free water and beer (for less than £1 a bottle) and ended up having a fantastic evening meal with new friends.Having the course in Puspa's home was wonderful - a true insight into Baliense living. Also, both Puspa and her husband gave us informative talks on village life, culture and religion which was so interesting. This is excellent value and an unforgettable experience.

Amazing and Puspa what a Chef !!!!!!!!. My husband and I took this class on 27 May. They pick up at the hotel, didn't, get to do the market tour because of the rain., Then they took us to there home to start cooking.home we were learn to cook at 10 different courses. with all the fresh herbs and food.Puspa and Wayan real gave us insight into the Balinese culture. I would really recommend this cooking school, it was fun and the food excellent. Hope to be back.l

Highlight of our holiday!!. What a phenomenal experience! We have been to Bali many times but this was our first authentic Balinese cooking extravaganza!!! Wayan and Puspa the King and Queen of their beautiful castle were incredible hosts and welcomed us not only into their kitchen but in to their home. They are such a sweet family, all of them including their 3 spoilt dogs!!! The only thing sweeter is the receipies and amazing food you prepare and cook together. I would recommend this activity to anyone and I can't wait to cook the delicious food for our friends and family.

Loved this experience!!. We just loved this whole experience which took us from local Ubud market to the community meeting place surrounded by rice patties through to the family compound of Wayan, Puspa & their gorgeous family. A really incredible insight into Balinese culture, traditions & family life. Then on top of all that the freshest ingredients, great outdoor kitchen to all get our cook on in & then of course the outcome... Delicious Balinese meals shared with other travelers overlooking lush tropical splendor! Approx $35 p/p which includes pick up & drop off from your hotel in Ubud. I can not recommend this experience enough.

Best thing we did in Bali. There is not even a close second to how kind and generous Wayan and his wife were. To call it a cooking class is truly to not give the full sense of the experience as you are instructed about rice growing, Balinese family structure, and of course cooking. And it is all done in the most welcoming of environments as you listen to them instruct and inform while also talking about their own lives; it is truly amazing that such a thing exists that allows a visitor to feel at home with a family like this. As Wayan drive us back to our hotel and I asked where to find a certain cooking instrument, he insisted he would try to find one for me so that I wasn't ripped off in the market. If you are in Bali and wild like a truly authentic couple of hours and a delicious meal, you can do no better than this.

Cooking and Eating, Bali Style. What to do with a dozen culturally interested college students after a day's sightseeing in Bali? Puspa and Wayan's Paon Bali Cooking Class is hands-down the best choice. From the moment we were invited into our host's home, it was an immersion into Balinese culture and hospitality the likes of which I would have never expected from a tourist concern. Puspa took charge, a great idea when it comes to dealing with students, distributed a welcome drink, told stories, explained facts, and got everyone into a cooking mood. I believe the team at Paon Bali have an instinctive way of matching their personalities to that of the group. The cooking proceeded well, with many photos taken and many instances of laughter. The cooling downpour was welcome, after which we were able to sample the fruits of our labors. I think for myself, someone who has led student trips to many parts of the globe, this was probably the most satisfying experience of all the cultural experiences one can book. The students, initially somewhat skeptical of the idea, ended up loving it and describing it as one of their favorite experiences on the trip. Highly, highly recommended.
EXCELLENT. Best experience in Bali. Hosts are very welcoming and very beautiful couple. It was a great day and the food was amazing!!!! Can't wait to try it at home

This is a 'not to be missed' experience in Ubud!. I was a little sceptical about going on a cooking class, but I was wrong. Best thing we did - and when we go back to Ubud, we'd definately do this again. Absolutely amazing day!!While the format is probably similar to other classes, what sets this one apart is the atmosphere, the friendly, relaxed, warm welcome and the ability of the hosts to bring the group together.The day starts with pickup from your hotel, and you are dropped at the market for a detailed tour, talking about spices and vegetables that you will be working with later.A short drive in air-conditioned cars and you are taken up through the countryside to the village - with a short stop to talk about the rice paddies which was very interesting.Greeted with a delicious refreshing drink at the family compound, Wayan and Puspa are delightful hosts, breaking the ice with stories about how they met, the layout of the compound, and their culture.The cooking class was great fun - everyone was given different jobs to do and the group worked really well together. We all had turns at cooking different dishes. Everything was clean and hygenic.Needless to say, the food was delicious - and we were all given copies of the recipes to take home with us.I would definately do this class again, it is great value for money and an amazing insight into Balinese culture. If you are not sure if you really want to do this, go ahead and book - because you won't regret it!

REAL FUN COOKERY CLASS. Puspa and Wayan make this course such fun with their sense of humour and interesting antedotes about culture and life in a Balinese home. This is far more than just a cookery course, from the moment you step into the market, then to the rice paddies to learn first hand about the fields and the interaction between the villagers, their crops and their neighbours and then to their home where you are welcomed with a 'Welcome drink'. This course is definitely a great experience for both men and women and is a really fun interactive day and good value for money. The meal that you eat at the end of it is really awesome. This is the 3rd time I have done this course with different friends and everytime we have all loved the experience. Well done Puspa and Wayan.... this course is really 'a course with a difference'. I wish you great success with your venture.

Cooking class was sizzling!!. We were met at our hotel and dropped off at Ubud market, where the day started. Tour of the market, then back in the car and a tour of a rice paddy. We then were welcomed at the home of Puspa and her husband, who gave us a informative insight into the traditions of Balinese culture and Hinduism, Once the cooking started, it was all hands to the pumps, with everyone being gainfully employed chopping, slicing and cutting. We were a large group, about 20 in total, but it still felt personal. Every task was overseen with a smile by Puspa and her team. Together, we rustled up soups, salads, mains and desserts (about 9 in total) which we then devoured round a couple of tables in the kitchen / garden of their house. The food was gorgeous and the instruction was superb. Puspas and her husband are real characters and their warmth and enthusiasm is as plentiful as the dishes we created. As with all other reviews here, I would highly recommend the Paon cooking class.

Nicer than I expected. To cook in the family's home makes this cooking class very special. The lady of the house makes sure that everyone gets enough practice in making all the dishes. In the morning we had a tour in the local market, which was also very nice. also, the price is very reasonable. Maybe one negative point: the group was rather big, but that did not bother us.

Foodie paradise. Puspa and her husband deserve all the success and praise they receive through these reviews. I am happy to write a review as I would 100% recommend this Ubud cooking class to anyone considering taking a class from the many available. The food is the best I tasted in Bali, and now we know how to make it! I went as a group of 6 and we all had a fabulous time learning about Balinese cuisine and the ingredients themselves. Amazing backdrop of rice paddies with great company. No complaints. The experience is not to be missed.

Funny, interesting, interactive & yummy. I would do it again! The couple were so welcoming and lovely. They explained their home and then we went down to the kitchen and started cooking. There was at least 7 dishes prepared and everyone got to help out all the time. We were kept very busy and then when dinner was served it was fantastic meeting people and interacting with them. There was free water the whole time or beer (15,000rp). Also tea & coffee. The dessert was amazing, loved it - boiled bananas. 350,000 rp well spent, went from 4pm - 8:30pm and we hired a nanny to look after our kids who I would also highly recommend. She did a great job. They pick you up from your hotel and drop you home. Loved both of them, they were so funny and enjoyable. We didn't book, rang that afternoon for the next day which was fully booked so did it the same day. There was maybe 20 people, but the kitchen is large enough for everyone.Oh and the bathroom facilities are in great order too. :)

Best thing iv ever done in Bali!. I have been to Bali now 14 times and this is by by far the best thing I have done. Highly recommend to anyone that has been to Bali before or first time. Excellent value for money and beautiful hosts. Also located in very pristine location and get the experience to enjoy Balinese cooking in a real Balinese home.

the food is great...but puspa is the real attraction!. i took this course on the recommendation of friends, and realize that the morning class probably fits better with some people's schedules but if possible, try the evening session. you get a pickup from ubud lodging, a quick paddy tour and then an invite into puspa's home. she and her husband not only introduce you to popular balinese recipes, but they also weave in cultural tid bits and explain the balinese lifestyle. the day i went, it was just another couple and me-- and with the small group we had a very hands-on, instructional experience. 7 dishes and a dessert, plus sunset over the hills. puspa is a local treasure--and cooking taskmaster! she had us slicing, dicing, stir-frying, working the "bali blender" and washing our hands every time we so much as touched a pepper. she is a wonderful teacher and an entertaining host-- she clearly cared that we were having a good time, but also wanted to make sure that we were learning! she had us laughing and working hard...and then she allowed us to enjoy all of the food! the value, i thought, was incredible. and, she never rushed us out of the house, so my new friends and i were able to drink a few beers after dinner and continue talking. was a great last night in ubud and a nice change of pace from all of the spas! i'd highly recommend the experience.

High light of our time in Ubud. What a fantastic experience for our family group of seven. Market tour was wonderful and then to learn from Wayan the balance of the rice fields. Puspa is the star of the day with her wonderful cooking staff. We learnt so much and the hands on cooking was such fun. The meal at the end of our class was amazing. Loved receiving all the recipe sheets.

Great experience. After reading about this on Trip Advisor decided this was the one I and a very reluctant hubby wanted to do and it didn’t disappoint. Didn’t book until we arrived in Bali and as this course is gaining in popularity it would be advisable to book before leaving home if you are short on time We opted for the afternoon course as not that interested in the market tour. Our pick up was from our hotel in Ubud and was surprised when received a phone call to let us know they were held up in traffic on Monkey Forest Road and would be a few minutes late even Puspa apologised to us when we arrived at her home. After a warm welcome and cold drink from Puspa and Wayan we were taken into the kitchen area which was extremely clean and well set up to begin our journey into the smells and taste of Bali. Puspa very thoughtful asks if anyone has an allergy to any food or is vegetarian or how hot they like their chillies. All the ingredients are set out on display and we are told which dish the ingredients are for and given a full description of each, then it is onto chopping everything in preparation for cooking. Everyone is given to opportunity to work at the various workstations, we had 11 in our group and had 11 workstations so everyone had a task. When everything is chopped to Puspa and her staff’s satisfaction it is onto cooking the first dish Clear Mushroom and Vegetable Soup, 4 people are given this task while the rest of the group supervise. In a few minutes we all seem to be sitting down having a bowl of this delicious soup, then it is onto cooking the remaining courses all of which we thoroughly enjoy eating. Everyone agreed that it was entertaining and the best food we had eaten in Bali. Puspa, Wayan you are great hosts well done.
Culturally fascinating, amusing and great food. I loved visiting the market, the rice fields, and being involved in cooking.... Not to mention eating all the delicious food at the end!

One of my best travel experiences!. I highly recommend this cooking class...it's not just a cooking class with fresh, local ingredients, but a very intimate encounter with daily life in Bali. You are welcomed into Puspa's home and are treated like family. You learn about the typical family compound and generations of tradition in their daily life. The cooking is very hands on and you enjoy an absolute feast! Must do in Ubud.

Great all round experience!. First you meet at the old palace in the centre of Ubud,followed by a short food and general market visit,by car to a rice growing area for a briefing and then on to the operators private home in the hills for cooking and lunch.You start at 8:30am (which if coming from Seminyak is a big ask) and finish around 2pm.Our group of eight joined about another twelve from all over the world.The instruction is hands on - everyone is involved in defferent roles all the way from initial preparation to eating.We enjoyed the whole experience and I have a few observations.At USD 35/person its very cheaply priced for what it is; six hours was a bit long - four hours of cooking would have been better;the market at Ubud is poor and disappointing; water and beer is available - Coke would have been nice. Puspa who runs the school oozes personality and is delightful - her support staff equally as good.A visit to a private home was worth the money in itself.Transport provided was first rate.This is an experience I would recommend although its more mid level family food than top draw.A great way to learn some basic Asian cooking skills.In our case we spent a lot of time and money getting from Seminyak to Ubud which on reflection we would have been better to consider a more locally based cooking school in Seminyak.For us we wanted to see Ubud anyway so it all made sense.We had a great day!

More than just cooking...an insight to Balinese village life. Puspa and her husband are a great team! They share their knowledge, their home and their passions with comic entertainment. From the market tour to the rice field trip and back to their home to cook Puspa's delicious food the day flowed with enough pace to keep you engaged whilst not feeling like you are on a tourist carousel. Informative, delicious and fun! I would like to return and take my family.
Great value. Couldn't fault this cooking school. Great authentic cooking. Very clean and professional operation.

Cooking with Puspa. If you ever wanted to learn how to cook authentic Balinese food, this is the place to go. They pick you up and drop you off from the hotel. You learn about the rice paddies and how the family compound is build. Best of all you get to prepare, cook and most importantly eat great food. Puspa and Wayan are great hosts. The family compound is immaculate. They really treated me like family. This is a great experience.

Best part of our trip!. Everyone will enjoy this amazing cooking class! It is funny, informative, and a great time. I wasn't bored for one second, and the food was SPECTACULAR. We stayed in Indonesia for 3 weeks, and this was hands down my favourite part of the trip. After this, I am going to make a point to take a cooking class everywhere I travel - worth every penny! MUST DO IN BALI!

A real experience!. We have done many cooking courses throughout the world and this rates as one of the best. What made it special was learning about Balinese cuisine in a home setting. We were welcomed with warmth, humour and a cool drink and this was followed by patient explanations and opportunities for hands on learning. We hope this small business continues to thrive!

Great cooking class - excellent meal.. Well organised and presented, from the hotel pick-up, market visit, rice paddy talk to the cooking experience and delicious meal. Thanks! Great day for my my friends & I.

So good I went twice. Thank you Puspa and Wayan for two lovely days learning, cooking and eating in your beautiful home in Ubud! See you again when I go back to Bali!This is a wonderful cultural and culinary experience for all levels of and interest in cooking

Culinary and cultural delight. I write this review as tonight I cooked the clear mushroom and vegetable soup as I remissed the experience of the Paon Bali Cooking Class. I was picked up from Sanur and transported to Ubud to the start of a wonderful day. We were given a history or rice paddings and then experienced the abundance of fruit and vegetables at the local markets. The class was a mixture of all nations, honey mooners and people doing the trip of a life time. It was a fantastic day everyone was involved in everything including prepartion, cooking and eating. Wayan and Puspa were perfect hosts and I will remember this day everytime I cook from the recipes. I booked this class on line before arriving in Bali and everything was perfect.

From market to mouth magnificent!. I have travelled and lived in Indonesia off and on for over 40 years and I have to say this is one of the most inspiring husband and wife ventures available in the tourism product. It retains the authenticity that we are looking for as well as the attention to detail that time pressed tourists appreciate. It is more than a cooking school and includes an insight into the sociology of one Balinese family's village and cultural life. It helps you appreciate the connection between garden the cycle of growth and selling and how the food gets to our plate.The energy an clarity of the instruction in English must be exhausting but both Wayan and his wife work incredibly hard to be thorough and informative at the same time as ensuring you have a little bit of fun. We came with a group of friends and all really enjoyed it! I wish I had brought my teenage sons and husband on our last visit as well.1

Superb indoor/outdoor cooking class in Ubud. The day started at Ubud food market where various foods were explained. I experienced my first mangosteen. We stopped at a rice field where the process of rice growing was explained. We were greeted at Puspa and Wayan's house with a cool drink and an explanation of a traditional village layout and traditions. I had imagined a cooking class might be an indoor demonstration. This was so much better! Held inside the traditional village complex with open style pavilions and lots of open to the outdoors areas, we could still look out into the Ubud valley next to us. The class was 'hands on'. There were multiple chopping stations and 3 or 4 of us at a time chopped the gulangal, garlic, chilli, and other ingredients ourselves. We could participate or observe, however we liked. Around six dishes were prepared - Sup Jamur (mushroom and vege soup), Bumbu Kuning (yellow sauce), Kare Ayam (chicken in coconut curry), Sate Lilit Ayam (chicken on sticks), Gado Gado (veges in peanut sauce), Jukut Urab (coconut and snake bean salad), Pepes Ikan (fish in banana leaves), Tempe Kering (tempe in sweet soy sauce), then dessert - Kolak Pisang (banana in palm sugar syrup). It was a feast!Puspa with her big smile and caring nature, and friendly husband Wayan, make this an authentic cultural experience to remember. Well exceeded my expectations.

Yummy Fun!. For tourists wanting to sample authentic, well prepared Balinese food in Bali, it is not as easy or straightforward as one would expect. Unlike a pizza or the ubiquitous nasi goreng, genuine Balinese food is not widely available at the usual visitor haunts. The best Balinese food we had was at Villa Semana in Ubud where we stayed and by taking matters into our hands and signing up for a Balinese cooking class with Paon which we found out about on Tripadvisor. Gosh! When I called Paon, the classes were fully booked and we could only get on a class 3 days later. To avoid disappointment, I suggest booking in advance. So off we went to visit the local market and rice paddy fields to get to know the ingredients we would be using later on. It was quite a large group (14 of us from all parts of the world) but by the end of the class, we were all having fun and exchanging contact details. The star of the show is, of course, Puspa, the gregarious and engaging chef herself. She cajoled, teased and bullied the group (especially the lazy men like myself) into trying their hands at making what turned out to be a wide variety of surprisingly tasty Balinese dishes. Puspa has a nice dedicated kitchen set up for the cooking classes at the back of their family home overlooking lush green hills. I particularly admired her traditional wood fire cooking area and the fact she makes her own organic cooking oil! With the help of her friendly staff, everything proceeded smoothly under her watchful eye. For me, a day well fed is a day well spent. Definitely recommended.

Fabulous. I would highly recommend this if you are visiting or staying in the Ubud area - So much more then just a cooking experience it was a really nice touch visiting the Ubud markets to better understand Balinese ingredients and also the rice field tour was fantastic !! The hosts were so accommodating and friebdly and the food and atmosphere was truly incredible -10/10

A great day, Thankyou Puspa and Wayan. I have always wanted to do a cooking class and I finally did. After all the great reviews on TA i booked with Paon.Hubby wasnt keen but I dragged him along. Our 6 year old daughter was very keen.Hubby has returned home and been telling everyone how much he thoroughly enjoyed the day and how good it was. I knew he would!! hahaThe whole day was brilliant. We all took turns at chopping, preparing ingredients and cooking. My daughter loved that she could "do" stuff as well.The meal at the end was brilliant and we were so full. Puspa and Wayan are so lovely and friendly and made the whole day fun.Would highly recommend

Great Balinese culinary experience!. This cooking class was a delight from beginning to end. Puspa and her husband Wayan were very welcoming and friendly, providing a number of insights into Balinese family and village life. There were numerous opportunities to tackle the cooking hands on, with plenty of yummy traditional dishes to eat at the end! Great humour provided by husband and wife team and friendly helpful support staff! Highly recommend!
Can't fault. Been on 4 cooking classes now around SEA. Can't find fault with this. Ubud food market is not amazing but the course is. All the people running the course are amazing. Excellent.

The most wonderful way to experience the life, culture and food preparation of the Balinese people.. Wyan and Puspa welcomed us into their beautiful home (and Village) to experience, from the raw ingredients found at the market, the preparation of delicious Balinese food. We were collected from our hotel and started the day at the Ubud markets where we were provided with a very detailed descriptive of the raw ingredients that would form the basis of the 7 dishes that we would prepare for the day. We were then transported to the rice fields of the Laplapan Village to understand the process of growing white rice. Pupsa, a former cooking teacher, then taught (and helped us) prepare the most wonderful dishes for our lunch. The cooking process was an easy hands-on participation which made the learning process easy to understand and enjoy. The group of 10 that participated at the Paon Bali cooking school come to the class from varied sources (Trip Advisor, word of mouth & brouchures). Four of the participants said over lunch that they had attended other cooking classes in Bali but they rated this one as the best they had attended. Do yourself a favour and enjoy the experience.

Recommend Paon Cooking School over all others. We have been to 4 different cooking classes over the last 5 years and enjoyed them all. Saw Paon on Google and decided to try a different one. Well what can we say! The greeting was very welcoming when we met at the Ubud Palace. From there it only improved! Wayan was funny and informative giving us a wonderful overview of village life and the rice paddies.When we arrived at Paon the setting took our breath away! So traditionally Balinese, the setting was beautiful and first class. Puspa, Wayan's wife was there to teach us and she had the 10 of us in the class hanging on to her every word. The food chosen was wonderful and we all enjoyed the finished preparation!What makes it # 1 you ask?The friendly people running the showThe cultural informationThe beautiful settingAnd the quality of the food, instruction and flavoursA magic experience we would recommend to anyone

Amazing experiance 100% loved it!. After reading a lot of review 's about this particular cooking class, We had very high expectations. Those expectation were more than exceeded. Starting off in the market, then to the rice fields and then to the family home to start the cooking. It was an amazing experiance and a definat must do when in Bali. This class is for any one and every one, out of the small group of 10 I was the only vegetarian and I had my own none meat menu. It was fantastic. I can't speak highly enough about this experiance.

Best Travel Experiance Yet !!. Being my fourth trip to Bali and my partners third I thought it was time we did a cooking class so we could take home with us some tips on how to cook the fabulous food we enjoy in Bali. I've done rafting, snorkeling, mountain biking, elephant rides and been to 3 very chic weddings and eaten and some of the best restaurants in Bali but this experiance would be hands down without a doubt the most enriching, exciting and fun Experiance we have had in Bali.Meeting Wyan in the village fields to explain how rice is grown and harvested and how the village works was exciting enough for me but when we were welcomed into his home by his wife Puspa with a welcome drink, I knew we had picked the right Experiance for us. Wyan explained the traditional Balinese house and howmit worked and symbols of their religion, this really showed how beautiful and welcoming the Balinese people really are. We then moved out to the cooking class area where Puspa's 2 assisatants were busy preparing for the class, more drinks and into the class we dived. Luckily enough on this day it was just us and another couple which made the whole Experiance even more personal and we got more attention.Another highlight of the day was the storm that came in and caused the power to black out for quite some time this didn't bother Puspa and her team one bit as we were now cooking like "Bali Before" it really added to the experiance with the torches and candles coming out. The ingredients are fresh and tasty, coconut oil hand made that day, techniques traditional and all very hands on, with absolute guidance by Puspa and her assitants all the way.Sitting down to eat all our handy work in the outside dining room in the storm was just amazing and the food so tasty.We look forward to our next trip and this time taking our friends and family to meet Aunty & Uncle for another fantastic class.We can't recommend this Experiance enough a must do ubud Experiance.

Awesome experience! A must do.. My girlfriend and I had a fantastic day in the home of Wyan and Puspa in beautiful Ubud, surrounded by lush paddy fields. Easy hands-on participation made the experience practical and memorable. Enjoying the many yummy Balinese dishes we prepared topped it off! Be careful of being persuaded to take a class in Kuta. Many operators, taxis and concierges try to convince one to consider the cooking schools in Kuta, but I am delighted that we stuck to our guns and enjoyed the day at Paon Bali cooking school.Authentic, humorous, clean, fantastic!Book in advance, they are quite booked up in season.

A Must do while in Bali. My girlfriend booked the class for both of us & our hubbies.All of us really enjoyed the total experience, from the guided market tour to the rice paddy tour and then the cooking class itself & finally feasting on our own creations!Both hubbies found the experience far better than they thought it would be & have said they would do it again and also recommend it as well. You can be as involved with the cooking as you like or just stand back & watch, it's up to you. Pusbe & her husband and staff were Brilliant & there were plenty of laughs during our time together.

Great Cooking Experience. My girlfriend had to convince me to do this, but I'm glad she did as it was great fun.We started by going to the UBUD locals market to see the vegetables and spices we would be cooking with then got take to the home of Puspa (wife) and Wayan (husband) in a village set near the rice paddies of UBUD. Surprisingly, there were 4 or 5 other guys there who all enjoyed it. We got taught 9 different recipes including how to grind the spices from scratch and everyone was heavily involved in the cooking. They are very conscious of food safety and refrigerate all of the meat and fish so the tourists do not get sick.The best bit was the eating - we all enjoyed a 9 course meal - fantastic meal - one of the best we had in Bali (compliments to the chefs). All the staff were very friendly and helpful. Puspa was very entertaining also.A great experience.

A wonderful experience in beautiful, traditional Balinese surroundings.. Big Thanks to Wayan and Pusps for a wonderful day, absolutely worth taking the time to enjoy this experience. We were told about this cooking class by relatives who know Wayan and Puspa and we were keen to learn some new cooking skills. We thouroughly enjoyed learning about the different ingredients, the rice fields, techiques for traditional Balinese style cooking and to be so welcomed so warmly into Wayan and Puspa's home compound was just unforgettable. We were told to make ourself at home, to be relaxed and to enjoy our day, for this we feel priviledged.The lovely chef who helped us with cooking we remember him as 'Mr one for luck' made our day funny as well as imformative. We made some unbelievable dishes which we were able to have for lunch and they tasted fantastic.Wayan and Pupsa have a beautiful home and fantastic cooking skills, all their staff are also very helpful. Nothing is too much problem. We learnt so much and have used our new knowledge quite a bit since we have been home. Please please please just go and see for yourself, you will not be dissapointed.

Just fantastic - do it!. A truly authentic experience. Puspa and Wayan (husband and wife team) are the best. i can not fault this experience. I loved it. I am a travel agent and now have had many clients also enjoy the same cooking class. Everyone says the same thing 'a highlight' 'don't miss it', 'wonderful hosts'.. I am full of praise for this cooking class. it's more than just a cooking class; it's a true introduction to Bali, the people, culture, family life and food.It's easy to book in via email also!

Eat, Play, with Love and Passion. My experience at Paon Bali was the ABSOLUTE highlight of my visit to Ubud. I only had 1.5 days in Ubud and was really looking forward to my cooking class...it did not dissappoint!Very well organised and professionally executed programme with a generous touch of warm hospitality from the funny and knowledgeable Wayan and his very lovely and culinary Goddess of a wife - Puspa. We started our day with a visit to the local market learning about local spices and ingredients used typically in Balinese cooking. Followed by a visit to the Padi fields in the village where Wayan and Puspa lives. The expanse of the padi fields against the clear blue skies was a sight to behold.Wayan and Puspa warmly welcomed us into their home where our cooking class was to be conducted. I was greatly humbled by their generosity in sharing their home and culture and wanting to keep it alive for all to experience. Their passion and love for what they do emanates through every little task that they perform.Puspa clearly very comfortable conducting the class and deftly experienced around the kitchen made everything seem so easy and everyone in the group gets a go at preparing each dish from scratch to finish. Her wonderful kitchen helpers moved around effortlessly preparing the ingredients and getting them ready for us to literally make a mess of, and helping to clean up after. The luscious greenery and foliage makes a beautiful setting as we cooked and learnt the art of Balinese cuisine in the wonderful open kitchen within their backyard. 99% of the ingredients were prepared from scratch and i loved that there were no modern kitchen equipment and everything had to be made by hand...and indeed with love and passion that Puspa imparts her knowledge to us.The food was absolutely divine! Definitely an experience not to be missed and i would go back again for another class in a heartbeat!

Excellent insight into Balinese cooking + culture. As a solo traveller I took the Paon Bali cooking class in April 2012 and it was amazing. Picked up from my hotel by a lovely driver and returned after the class had finished. Lovely hosts and staff, great food and a beautiful premises to spend the day. I felt very "at home"... relaxed and able to ask questions when needed/wanted to, no pressure to do anything I didn't feel comfortable with. Learnt about the dishes (including the Balinese way of grinding, mixing and cooking) and also a lot about the local way of life. The visit to the markets and the rice paddy also added to the experience. Group of about twelve so a great place to meet other travelers and plenty of time throughout the class and whilst downing the delicious and tasty dishes to get to know each other/have a good laugh. Do not miss this experience - highly recommended!

Much more than a cooking class, a very good time!. Two friends and I just spent 4 days in Ubud, and this was the highlight of our time there. We chose Puspa and Wayans' class by chance, and boy was it a great decision to join. We were first picked up at our hotel, and taken to a rice terrace in the village to learn about rice production there. (only briefly, not enough to make you yawn!), then taken to the teacher's own home in a village in Ubud, where we were greeted with refreshing drinks and the lovely Puspa. She and her husband Wayan are comics as well as chefs, and introduced us to their Balinese home and lifestyle in a very entertaining way. We were then treated to coffee and tea, and mingled with the other people in our class, who were wonderful. We then learned about the core ingredients of our meal, and proceeded to prepare and cook together, each person getting a different communal task. I had taken other tourist cooking classes in Asia, but the communal and relaxed feel of this one really stood out; we cooked everything together as a group, most of us with beers in our hands! There was non-stop laughter, and when all of our food had been prepared (time flew during the process), we had an excellent dinner together. The food itself was delicious, and I am very happy to now hold the recipes for everything, especially the delicious Gado-Gado. Puspa is an excellent and spirited teacher, never missing a chance to make us laugh and feel at home in her home. I would recommend this class to anyone of any age or cooking ability!

Informative fun & delicious. We were a family of five including our 11yo grandaughter and we all thoroughly enjoyed this cooking class. We were met at the Ubud Palace and walked across the road for an interesting market tour followed by a short drive to a rice field to learn the rice growing process. Then on to Puspa and Wayan's home for a fantastic, fun cooking class where everyone gained hands on experience preparing and cooking the ingredients. There were about 10 in our class and we all enjoyed a delicious lunch of our own cooking. For all the fellow obsessive hygiene nuts in Bali, I have to say I was a little hesitant that the class was not being held in a stainless steel hotel kitchen but I should not have worried. Hygiene was a top priority with hand washing, hand sanitiser, plastic gloves, aprons etc. Every aspect of the class and facilities were professional and spotlessly clean. Puspa is a delight and her staff fantastic. A great experience we would all thoroughly recommend.

Exceptional fun, entertaining & delicious!. Four of us went to cooking school this morning and when they first told us they were taking us to the market, but not buying any food, we were disappointed. We have been to Asia many times and were familiar with most everything in the market. But the woman had a way about her that was fun and by the time we got in the van to head to the home of the owners of the cooking school, we were anticipating a good class. First, we went out in the rice fields for an explanation of the village, the rice and the area. Then to the home, which was a beautiful compound but not over the top. Puspa & Wayan each had a little talk with us, offered us welcome drinks and then we headed to the kitchen. We were a fairly big group of people from all over the world and soon Puspa had us chopping frying and grinding by hand. It is impossible to describe how good the eight dishes we made were, but let's just say, if you have the opportunity to go to their school, don't miss it. We left with printing clear english recipes for the dishes, an offer of extra bottles of water, and transportation both ways was included. So much fun & delicious, what more can you ask for?

Excellent experience in Cooking. Thank you for an excellent morning. Best cooking class I have ever done. We went as a family my daughter who is nine and loves cooking and my son who is twelve. I was so amazed at how my son got right into the whole experience. He really enjoyed the day. The hosts were so happy friendly and explained every step in detail. You actually got really involved in the whole thing from cutting up the ingredients to cooking everything. Finally you get to sit down to an amazing banquet with everyone else to eat all the dishes. The day starts with a trip to the markets then a stop at the rice fields to find all about how the farmers pick the rice and get it ready for eating. The kids had a chance to bash the rice stalks and then sift the rice to get rid of the husks.You are then taken to their home and are made to feel like part of the family. The whole tour takes about five hours. The price is very good for what you get.I would recommend this cooking class for anyone who loves food and wants to learn about how to cook Indonesian food. The hosts are great dealing with children so the tour is a must for families. There are a lot of cooking classes in Ubud at the hotels which do not give you a real introduction to how people live and cook in their own homes. The hosts really cared about cleanliness in preparing the food.Do not think about do it. You will love it like we did.

Wonderful afternoon. This is a great way to spend several hours in Ubud. Puspa and Wayan open their home for us ( our group consisted of 18 including a 11 year old boy.) touring the market, rice fields and cooking as a group. It was an enjoyable day. Meeting people from around the world,and great dining as well. Thank you for a trip to remember.

High Quality Cooking Class in a beautiful Bali setting. The cooking class begins at the market, where some of the ingredients to be used later on are tasted and purchased. The next stop is the rice fields where we learn about its cultivation and gathering. Finally we are invited to the home of Puspa and Wayan where, in an outdoor Bali kitchen, 20 or more people work together to create delicious Balinese food. We made about 9 dishes and their accompanying sauces, and after a few interesting hours, sit down to a feast. The atmosphere is quite convivial and fun. This is a not to be missed experience.

I can't remember what was better - cooking or eating?. What a nice experience! The hosts will have you laughing and felling right at home. They love cracking jokes and will even reveal how they got married (you must go to find out!).The tour of the market was the least appealing part of the experience. However, one you are wicked away into the countryside you will feel as if you are in a different world. You will learn about how the rice is harvested and how each family shares in the farming duties.Once you are at the family "compound", you will be cutting, tasting, grinding, mixing all the wonderful ingredients which beautifully transform in your lunch. The chicken satay is like no other. I'm talking uber-delicious. The tempeh is the best I have tried anywhere. This is a great experience. You will learn to cook Indonesian dished but you will also do so smiling the whole day.

Just go. You'll love it!. We found this place on Tripadvisor, and just felt we had to add our own ringing endorsement of everything everyone else has said. True, the market experience was "in yer face", but the cultural talks are fascinating and Ubud is a brilliant town. The real fun began when we got to Puspa and Wayan's house. It's a wonderful setting - an open air kitchen in a beautiful garden with a backdrop of jungle. The welcome is genuinely warm - somehow Puspa and Wayan manage to make you feel like this is a family occasion they've planned all year, rather than something they do all the time. The cooking is great fun, the smells are amazing, and the food at the end was incredible (I was stuffed and I've got a reputation as a human hoover!). They were also really kind to our kids, which meant we could really indulge ourselves in the grown-up cooking. All in all one of our best memories of Bali.

Great experience of the real Bali. Fantastic cultural experience and great food. Starting with a trip to Ubud markets to learn about fruit, vege and spices. The market itself is pretty full-on, it's a bit noisy, dirty and busy - but not so bad that the first time asian traveller couldn't handle. Next a quick trip to the rice field to learn a little about rice growing, and then onto the family compound. This is the best bit, as you see how the Balinese live, and come to understand a little about Balinese family life, told in a very amusing style. Your hosts are a real family, so you get a genuine experience, without some of the polish of other tourist cooking classes. The cooking is done in the backyard of the compound which is lovely, clean and open. The food is fantastic, with a selection of simple dishes that give you a great foundation for Indonesian cooking back at home. Thank you Puspan, Wayan and the whole team for a great day!

The REAL Bali cooking experience - a day to remember. Book it !. I booked this cooking class based on the great reviews on Tripadvisor, and I am very glad that I did. From the first moment, I loved it. Puspa is the perfect host, and a beautiful and sweet lady. She takes you to the market first where ingredients for the days' class are explained and you can try them on the spot. Afterwards, her husband Wayan will show you the rice harvest close to their home. And it is at their beautful home where you will do the cooking - the organization is absolutely perfect, and yes, you do chop and prepare all the dishes yourself, of course with assistance from the lovely personell otherwise you would need a week cooking all those dishes. Coffee , tea and water is included and beer can be bought at a low price. At the end , you will get a copy of all the recepies you made. It was a wonderfull experience and i was so happy there, I actually did not want to leave. Please do yourself a favour, and book this class and feel at home with this loving and wonderful Balinese couple. If I return to Bali, I will do it again. Enjoy - and thank you Puspa & Wayan for this unforgettable experience. Lots of Love, Pim

An Ubud Must!!!. Just finished my day with Wayan and Puspa. Fantastic experience. Learned a lot about Balanese cuisine and culture. The cooking classes are a lot of fun, and the food is absolutely delicious. Would do the tour again for the food alone!!! Can't recommend strongly enough.

Good class, great people. To me this isn't a cooking class as such, you really don't get to do a lot of cooking- everything is shared out, so there's more watching than cooking.In terms of a day out its great value, with the tour round the markets, trip to rice paddys and we were made to feel very welcome all day.It was great to have an insight into Bali family life, and ways the villages work, but personally I would have liked to have done more cooking and less watching.

Puspa and Wayan, will you adopt me?!. Fantastic experience, Puspa and Wayan have a beautiful home and they really know how to make you feel relaxed and welcome. And the food was so good, I couldn't believe I'd made some of it myself!

The "BEST" experience in Bali !. We have been travelling to Bali since the 70's and the Paon Cooking Class is, without doubt - the best experience you can have in 6 hours in Bali! I know that is a big call but Puspa and hubby, Wayan have hit the nail absolutely on the head with their interpretation of what visitors to their world would like to share. They have put together a package that gives you a detailed insight to villiage / communal farming and administration as well as family home life in the traditional compound. Wayan is a proud man of stature in his own right, with a wicked sense of humour and Puspa is also fun to be with as she imparts with her very extensive culunary secrets. Oh, and then there is the cooking class with all of its "hands on" eight courses - just fantastic!The really good part is that you get to enjoy your own cooking - at home with Puspa, Wayan and the excellent staff. This is one experience in Bali - that tops all others and at a price that is great value. We'll be back to visit Paon Bali Cooking Class on our next visit.

best cooking class in Ubud. From the tour of Ubud market, to the rice fields and finally to Wayan and Puspa's home to cook, the whole experience was an absolute joy. Not only was it a culinary experience it was also a cultural experience which gave us a small glimpse into the lives of ordinary Balinese people. The hands-on practice of actually preparing and cooking the food was excellent and this practice has already made cooking the recipes at home much easier. All the staff were lovely and the facilities are clearly well-maintained. Of the two cooking classes I had in Ubud on this trip, the Paon Bali Cooking Class was the superior experience and I would quite happily recommend it.

Entertaining and motivating. This cooking class met all our expectations, even after reading all the comments on trip advisor (some great comments on this class). I didn't expect how organized and motivating the class was, and how funny Puspa and her husband were. I have not seen team work (there were 7 staff on top of the host for a 15 participant class, plus Puspa herself) like this anywhere in Bali (by a long shot). They also went the extra mile to make sure everyone enjoy their time in ubud and then take them back to the hotel at a time that suited us.

wonderful wonderful day , couldnt ask for a nicer Bali experience. Do you want to try Balinese cooking, experience the Ubad markets learn about the rice paddy's and cook and dine on the sensational dishes you helped to create, in the most amazing settings of a family compound, learn the layout of the homes and the reasons behind them. Btw for cleanliness I would give 100% very highly rated in every aspect Paon cooking was fabulous the first time in Dec 2011, so much so that on my return with 5 girlfriends we revisited, for another exciting day everyone enjoyed the antics of Puspa as she involved us all in the experience.Males Female and families enjoy this tour please try it I can promise you that you will enjoy . I have been to Bali 12 times and to Poan cooking twice will I go there again yes every time I go back.....

Friendly, welcoming, flexible, refreshingly entertaining enjoyable day. I love cooking, especially finding new ways of cooking to get new flavours and dishes so took the chance to take this course while I was recently in Bali. In a nutshell the day involves a trip to Ubud Market, a trip to the local village and rice paddy with explanation about how the village operates including the family units, dispute resolution and so on, which was fascinating. Then you're taken to the home of the hosts - or the family compound, this is explained over a welcome drink and then you start with the food!Overall it's several dishes - a few mains, sate, soup, some salads and dessert. You get a copy of all recipes at the end.To me, it was the perfect amount of cooking versus not cooking. Everyone was assigned some preparation tasks, then the dishes were cooked sequentially with 3 or 4 people from the group cooking each meal under instruction and others helping with the additional ingredients such as soy sauce, palm sugar or seasoning. We stopped briefly for the soup starter then continued with the main courses which we sat down to eat as a group, which was pleasant. Meanwhile the class helpers were preparing other foods or tidying up. Ginger and Lemongrass tea and Bali coffee were offered before and after the cooking and all through bottled water was available free.The food was delicious and somehow even more enjoyable based on the fact that as a group we had prepared it all. I'm excited to see how I get on with the recipes on home turf.I'd happily recommend to other Bali visitors.Another aside, I had to arrange transport from my hotel to Ubud, and the Paon Bali people organised this for me. The driver was flexible enough to allow me the extra time to stop in Ubud and take a look around before heading back to my hotel. Great on the flexibility and much appreciated.

Unforgettable Experienc. My husband and I thought what the heck lets give this a go. Boy are we glad we did. It was absolutely brilliant and so much fun. We got picked up from our hotel in Ubud and taken to the markets and a lady explained about the different veges etc and we tasted a few fruits then we were driven to the rice fields and this lovely gentlemen met us there with more explanations on the village and rice fields etc then we were taken down the road to his beautiful home. His lovely wife and her wonderful helpers are there helping us all the way. We cooked 8 dishes all up including soup and dessert with lots of help and then sat down and was served our food we just cooked. The scenery is beautiful the people are so welcoming and I just loved it. You also get copies of your recipies of the meals you just cooked and they were so delicious. It was worth every cent + more.

Inspiring. The BEST day in Bali. Wayan picked us up from our villa in Ubud and drove us to an amazing experience at the Ubud market. The rice padi education was expertly presented in the village of Laplapan. We felt extremely privileged to be visitors in this village and especially, visitors to Wayan and Puspa's family compound. Puspa taught us to cook Balanese food. She is an awesome lady and an awesome teacher.

Second Time to visit and just as amazing !!!!. My husband and I visited Paon Bali Cooking Class for the second time in March 2012. Our first visit was in May 2011. Certainly not disappointed. The visit to the market still fantastic and our welcome by Puspa and Wayan made us feel like long lost friends. Their hospitality is really amazing. We also enjoyed visiting the rice fields again and always different people on the trips so lots of time for making new friends and having lunch together. Absolutely a MUST DO IN Bali.

Excellent Plus. On our recent trip to Bali we pre booked this course and what a wonderful day it was. The owners Puspar and Wayan are really wonderful people. We were collected from our hotel by a very nice young driver and taken to Ubud where we met Puspar. Her wonderful warm smile instantly made us feel very welcome. We walked the market and were then taken to the rice paddy and learnt a little about all the commodities offered at both places. We were then taken to their private residence and boy did we cook! When we were told exactly what we going to do I wondered how we were ever going to pull it off but there was a very nice group of local people to assist us and we managed to put together a very lovely meal with their help. Our group are vegetarian and we were guaranteed 100% vegetarian and it certainly was. Unfortunately as we were about to eat an terrible storm broke and Wayan was quite worried about us getting wet but we were fine he put down the bamboo sides and fussed around making sure we were all kept dry, in fact it added to the whole experience. Everywhere was beautifully clean and well ordered it was just lovely to be in their own home cooking!Thank you so much Puspar, Wayan and all of your staff and driver.For anyone out there wondering whether or not to do it, I would say, take the plunge, it is just a lovely day.

Paon Bali Cooking Class - Wildly exceeded expectations. Our hostess, Puspa, started the day by giving us a tour of the Ubud markets. She introduced us to the local spices and produce. On the way to her house, we had an unexpected stop in the rice fields, where her husband (Wayan?) provided a great introduction to Bali rice farming. Upon arriving at Puspa's house, we were warmly greeted as if we were old friends. Wayan explained the how and why of a traditional Balinese home orientation. Once we entered the kitchen area, Puspa explained the menu, showed us all the ingredients, equipped us with aprons, and put us to work. Most of the work was done by her excellent support staff, and we were allowed to do as much or as little of the food preparation as we wanted. Every sense was sated. Paon Bali Cooking Class is one of those rare offerings where expectations were greatly exceeded. We now consider Puspa a friend, and look forward to a 2nd visit for the "2nd visit" menu.

True Cooking plus cultural class. Attending class poking class was a great experience - certainly well worth it. It proved to go beyond the expectations of 'just' a cooking class. The group was larger than I expected but it worked really well, everyone was able to chop, grind, stir etc some people didn't want to do the hands on which was good as they didn't have to. I greatly enjoyed the hospitality of the owners having the class in their own home, it felt so much more personal because of that. I'm sure I'll do the class again next time when I'm in Ubud.

Great fun and great food!!!. It was a really nice experience! Auntie Puspa is so welcoming and funny.. She slowly introduced the ingredients and how to prepare each dish and me and my family were rotated to perform most of the task. And the food was excellent... It was actually more than we can finish but we did our best! Overall fun and interesting experience! And needless to say good food and reciepes to bring back!!

Tasty, well organized and conducted with warmth. We were picked up on time from our hotel and taken for a tour of the market, on the way to Puspas house we stopped and learnt about rice growing. At the house it was explained to us the culture and lifestyle of families in their village. Then the cooking began! I've cooked many dishes and shared with our group different roles in preparing them and ate together. It was a nice way to meet other travelers and the hospitality of Puspa and all those helping to make it run smoothly was welcoming. I would recommend this to anyone with an interest in cooking, enjoys Indonesian food or is looking for a nice relaxing way to spend a day in Ubud.

Excellent authentic balinese experience with great value for money. If you are looking for a Balinese cooking experience where you can learn where to source and how to use the ingredients, then prepare an array of delicious dishes in a clean, comfortable welcoming environment this cooking class is it. The value and experience for the money is outstanding.Husband and wife Wayan and Puspa, who run this class have all the elements for an authentic balinese experience. Our group was met to begin the day with Made who walked us through the local Ubud market and explained the ingredients we would be using, she answered all our questions and expertly guided us. After a short van ride we met with Wayan at the village temple where he explained some local customs and then talked us through the rice growing process. An extremely entertaining and charming man. We then were driven to Wayan and Puspa's house and were made to feel at home immediately. Wayan and Puspa introduced us to some of their family customs again with entertaining charm. Together with their competent staff we all chopped, stirred, ground, mixed, sliced, tossed, fried, boiled and prepared 8 wonderful dishes. The information imparted included the substitutes and alternatives in order to adapt the process which was very helpful.The results were truly amazing, every single dish was delicious and we all felt as though we had produced them.The facilities at their beautiful home met our needs well, undercover areas for cooking and dining within their lovely garden and access to a clean comfortable bathroom added to the overall experience. In addition, nothing was too much trouble, unlimited access to bottled water was encouraged and demonstration and explanation of additional recipes and techniques were no problem.I had only been back from holidays 1 day and have already made 2 of the 8 dishes which my family (with a 14 and a 16 year old) have enjoyed.All of our group felt strongly about recommending this cooking class.

Memorable Experience. For our honeymoon, my wife planned for us to participate in a cooking class. I had no idea what I was in for, and, frankly, I was a bit skeptical of how much I'd enjoy this activity. However, I was proven wrong by Pupsa and her husband (what a charming couple, by the way)! Our day included a visit to a local market, where we got to try local fruits and meet some of the local vendors. Although the rain was pouring rather hard that day, the trip to the market was great, as we got a taste of what life might be like for some of the locals.After going to the market with Pupsa, we met her husband, who showed us the rice fields. He even provided us with the communal aspects of rice growing, which was really interesting. Finally, we were taken to Pupsa and her husband's home, which is a traditional Balinese home (meaning, multiple generations live on the property, in addition to the presence of a temple). Although we did get to participate in much of the cooking, Pupsa really simplifies the process so that you have a chance to really enjoy yourself (and you don't spend the entire time cooking) - you get to talk to the other parties participating in the class, you are offered drinks, and you get to taste your creation.For those of you looking for a hardcore cooking class, you may be disappointed. However, for those of you looking for a fun experience and a taste of local life, I would highly recommend Pupsa and the Paon Bali Cooking Class!

Great Day Out. We thoroughly recommend Paon Cooking School. I had done a lot of research into which school to go to, as my partner was not jumping at the thought of going to a cooking class whilst in Bali instead of surfing! But after our visit to the local market (which is an eye opener and you must go with an open mind as it can be quite off putting seeing the meat out in the open, but its the authentic! :) My partner was enjoying himself, as were our whole group of 7.We then went to the rice fields which was interesting.Then we were taken to Wayan & Puspas beautiful home. Where we started off with amazing welcome drinks which were so refreshing. Then after some laughs we headed into the backyard to cook & learn.
