The view is mind blowing, and wow what a place to sit & have lunch with new friends. The boys LOVED it, so if your worried about your partner like I was - dont be!!! It was a fabulous experience & there was not a thing we would ask Wayan & Puspa to change about their cooking class. It is a memory that will last forever and the meal was FANTASTIC!!!If you want to know what you will be cooking you can email them prior to attending & ask what the menu will be.Thankyou Wayan and Puspa for such an experience and I miss you and your beautiful Bali already!!! We will be recommending your class to all.TIRAMI KASI Tam & Sam
Fabulous. we were picked up from our villa for what turned out to be an amazing day of food and new friendships. the best part of our holiday and will be returning for more

Fabulous experience – do not miss this. An absolute must-do experience in Ubud. Wayan & Puspa are so warm and welcoming, and absolutely hilarious! They will welcome you into their village and their home and share their way of life, and their way of cooking with you. This was one of the highlights of an incredible trip to Bali. Just do it!

Amazing experience. My wife and I did the night class in a group that included 4 others. My wife is vegetarian and paon were amazingly accommodating to her. The value here is exceptional, paon pick you up from the hotel and take you to their amazing outdoor kitchen at their family home amongst the hills of ubud 600m above sea level. We had an 8 piece menu with amazing curries, satay and tempe and tofu. The class is very well designed and the group cooks as a group, taking turns at different things such as prep, cooking etc instead of everyone cooking their own meals. Once done, you sit down for a magnificent feast overlooking the hills. The family who run this are so nice, I had a bad headache when I got there and they were very caring, offering me tea with ginger and honey and water, which made me feel right at home.All in all a magic experience and one we would do again and again. Just terrific. And they give you all the recipes to try at home. Can't recommend highly enough.

Absolutely Fantastic - Caters for all everyone, Allergies and Vegetarian. WOW is what i can say, some might after reading this wonder why i would even contemplate doing a cooking class in Bali.I have been coming to Bali the last 13 years and finally decided to do a cooking class, and i sit back now and wonder why i did not do it sooner.I would have to be the one of fussiest eater around being, allergic to garlic and the onion family, and nuts, as well as being vegetarian... the challenge at times in Bali eating can be quite difficult. BUT the experience we had in our cooking class was awesome. We have 10 people in our session, all with different needs, some vegetarian, some nut allergies, and then there was me, the team of staff ensured that my food did not come in contact with the items i was allergic to, they had alternatives to everything. As all of the duties of chopping and cooking of the food was shared amongst everyone, they still ensured i was made part of this experience. The food was awesome, everyone at the table tried my dishes, and were quite surprised to the amount of flavour it had especially given the main ingredients are from the onion family.I would recommend this cooking class to anyone, it does not matter if you have allergies or are just plain fussy, the food was fantastic, the atmosphere was awesome and it was an experience that i would recommend to anyone.Give it a go, you will not be disappointed... :)

Enchanting, informative, entertaining hosts who are skilled at running this course.. Collected from our hotels, given a lively and interesting short talk about rice alongside the paddy fields, taken to the market to see and learn about the produce and then welcomed into our hosts own home - a spacious traditional house in their village. Beautifully presented, clear explanations and then we all set to with our allotted tasks, one of the staff played provided live music gently in the backgournd. We cooked fabulous food, and then ate it! Delicious. What good cooks we were. Thank you Pusba for a delightful experience.

A great experience for Balinese culture and culinary...... We have decided on Paon Bali based on the reviews in Tripadvisor. We booked via email with prompt replies. We were picked up from our hotel and were taken to the market to meet up with the rest of the group. It was a good size group as there were 7 of us. Being the low season for the tourist in the area, we thought that was a good size, not over crowded. We went through the market, learning the Balinese fruits, vegetables, herbs etc. Then we were taken to the rice paddies to meet up with the boss, Wayan, who then proceeded to explain the process of their rice harvest and ceremonies. After a few 'Balinese' 20 minutes, we were taken to the house for the cooking lesson. The 'house' comprises of few 'houses' on a plot of land which has at least a couple of generations living there. The kitchen was well structured for the class. Everyone of us has participation in preparation for the menu. Puspa was informative and good in giving instructions to guide us in every step of cooking each dish. The entree was well timed before we proceeded to the main and then the dessert. We have ample time to interact with each other and generally we all have a great time. At the end of the cooking class, we were given the recipes of what we have learned to cook. We have thoroughly enjoyed our time at Paon Bali and would recommend it for any person with or without cooking skill. Note to self: do not bite into raw nutmeg.

Cooking at Home. My wife and I really loved our experience at the cooking class. Despite there being quite a few people, every single one of us helped prep, cut, and cook one fabulous meal. They opened their homes to the class so we really got to understand about Bali culture. It was found out that my wife and I were on our honeymoon and so they sat us in the Honeymoon chairs which was really fun to us.I highly recommend this if you want to learn about Bali life and culture and have fun cooking!

awesome do it again. I had a great time at the cooking class. Meet some really nice people, the hostess was wonderful and friendly, so welcoming. It was my highlight of my visit to Ubud and I intent on taking my friend there next time we go in May. By the way the cost is much cheaper than any of the hotels cooking classes.

My fave day in Bali..... ... was the day Ibu Puspa and Pak Wayan Introduced me to the Balinese lifestyle! We first went on a trip to the Ubud markets to learn the origins and the culture surrounding the foods we would be cooking with later that day. Pak Wayan then took us to the rice fields where our group was taught about the culture and politics of rice. We were then welcomed into Ibu Puspa and Pak Wayan's family home and were taught about how the typical Balinese family lives. Then the cooking started. Set in perhaps the most beautiful part of Bali - the kitchen overlooked a gouge thick with rain forest and monkeys jumping away in the distance. The food was as delightful as our hosts. I have since recommended this class to several of my friends of all ages and all kinds of interests and backgrounds - this is not something one should miss!

Time and Belly-space well-spent. After a few days in Ubud, we decided to put TripAdvisor to the test of revealing a worthwhile pursuit. After discovering Paon as #5 on the To-Do List of activities we'd either done already or gave the "meh" treatment. Pak Wayan and his wife were exceptionally friendly and welcoming from the phone call to our formal introduction the next day, and remained so throughout our time together. Our experience in the market and at their lovely home felt more like spending time with friends. We have accompanied and sent friends, and plan to return whenever we're Ubud.

Fantastic Food and Friendly, Welcoming People. I booked this cooking school because it sounded more intimate and "Balinese" than some of the others. I didn't expect to cook a lot so I didn't leave disappointed but I got to do more than I was expecting. I'm a chef by trade so I didn't care if I did a lot, I just wanted to watch and learn more about their basic techniques. I enjoyed the early morning guided tour of the local Ubud market, it was very interesting. I was the only one who tried any of the sweets being offered in the stalls - I think the others were wary of Bali belly or something but I was glad I did. Then onto a rice paddy where Puspa's husband Wayan explained the rice growing and then we were welcomed into their home with a beautifully chilled drink! We were shown how to make coconut oil, given a small tour of what some of the ingredients look like while it's still a plant and then we got chopping and cooking. Our group were not as keen to cook so it gave me the opportunity to jump in more which was fine. It was hot and I totally understand. There is a clean bathroom and they offer unlimited free cold bottled water. You can purchase a beer for only 15,000IDR ($1.50!) too. Our meal included soup, curry, salads, satay and much more and even a dessert. It was the best Balinese meal that we had on our trip and someone else said so too. What impressed me the most was how well they treated my 2 yr old toddler. They watched and played with him (he played with their kids) for hours and even fed him, all without charging me which is why I gave a large tip because they were so warm and welcoming. I really felt that it was one of our best days in Bali.

Excellent experience. This was definitely one of the highlights of Bali! We were brought to the market, then to the family town to learn about the community and finally to the family compound where we were treated to a hands-on cooking class. Excellent organization from beginning to end. I would highly recommend this activity - even if you don't like cooking or you think you can cook anything. I must do!
Great Food Great Family. The family who host the cooking class are so kind and energetic. The food was delicious and we all learned a lot about Balinese cooking. Overall, it was a great experience :)

Unforgettable experience. This was the best introduction to Balinese food, hospitality & culture. Any first time traveller to Bali should take this class. Thank you Puspa & Wayan for unforgettable experience!

A highly recomended experience of the real Bali. Being our second trip to Bali I was looking to experience different aspects of Bali to the tourist trips we had done before.I booked this class whilst in Bali on holidays but I had read the TripAdvisor reviews and thought they were nothing but positive.And I couldn't have been anymore right. From the pick up they arrange from our hotel to the friendly and warm welcome we received, I really couldn't have been any happier with my choice.The price comparison to other cooking classes doesn't compare to the service and value for money you receive along with the real Balinese experience you are given.The hosts were hilarious and engaging and definitely added to the already fun atmosphere.My husband wasn't very happy with my choice of activities when I had told him I had booked him into doing a cooking class, but he was pleasantly surprised and thoroughly enjoyed cooking and eating the delicious array of dishes we created along with the exposure to a real Balinese house, rice fields and market.I definitely endorse this Balinese experience as a must do when your in Bali!

Unforgettable. One of the best decisions I ever made during this trip was to take up a cooking class with Puspa. I managed to escape the tourist route (although this cooking class is a popular tourist activity) to spend some time in a quiet village just a few minutes outside of Ubud’s commercial area. The tour appropriately began at the market where Puspa met us and introduced us to local produce and ingredients. Nyoman, Puspa’s husband, met our group at the farm where he gave us an introduction into village life in Bali. In Bali, every villager is given a patch of land to farm but farming, as an activity, is communal. It was harvest season and some of the rice stalks were just reaped. Ducks roamed freely, pecking at stray grains. The highlight of the course, of course, is the cooking class with Puspa. She introduced us to local ingredients and showed us the proper way to prepare them for cooking. I had my first taste of tempe, which I now love! To read more about my Bali experience, go tohttp://travelswithgusto.tumblr.com/post/16113514307/bali-with-gusto-paon-cooking-school

Wonderful day learning to cook delicious Balinese food. A wonderful morning spent with Wayan and Puspa. I would recommend this cooking class to anyone visiting Ubud in Bali.After a merket tour and an introduction to Balinese rice harvesting and culture, our hosts made us feel very welcome in their home! The cooking was structured and although there wasnt a cooking station for each person as some other cooking classes do, it was easy to follow and everyone got a chance to get stuck in and have a go.The dishes we cooked were delicious and we all got a chance to sample our wares. I have already recreated all but one of the dishes back home for a dinner party - which high praise from my guests!Cannot recommend this enough! Thank you for a lovely day!

Wonderful food, great instructions. This is a must if you are interested in tasting real Balinese food. We have had a truly wonderful time! Pupsa and her husband Wayan are great hosts and will make every effort to make you feel welcome. As I had not tasted a Durian yet, Pupsa went ahead and graciously purchased one for me, so that I could try it, right there at the market. She gave a truthful explanation of the different qualities of sarongs (printed sarong material, low and high quality ikat), and showed us around Ubud market. The kitchen in her house is just beautiful, very airy, very clean with strict observance to food hygiene. Puspa loves what she does and it shows in how she prepares the food how she teaches and how she arranges the food for her guests. This is a hands-on cooking class and everybody gets to do something in the process. Highly recommended if you love to taste and prepare true Balinese food!

Totally worth it!. My husband and I booked this class because of the fabulous reviews on Tripadvisor and it lived up to all the hype! Puspa recommended a driver who picked us up from our resort in Kuta and took us straight to Ubud markets- it ended up being cheaper than the hotel could offer... The market tour was informative and interesting, as was Wayan at the rice fields! The whole day was great and the food was fantastic! I love that we were given copies of the recipes to take home- totally intend on having ago at some of the dishes! Couldn't recommend this experience more highly! It was awesome! Thanks to Puspa and Wayan and all the helpers!

Fab night. Only 8 in our class and despite the rain we has a great night - they are such a fun and sincere couple who looked after us so well - learnt much about Balinese food as well as their culture. We ate like kings in a warmhearted home. I highly recommend this cooking school.

Amazing hosts, excellent food and a great cultural experience.. I have done cooking classes in Australia, Thailand, Vietnam and now Bali and this was definitely one of the best. The class has a great balance which provides a background of Balinese history and culture whilst remaining focused on the cuisine. The cooking is also well balanced. You do some of the preparation and the majority of the cooking without having to spend hours de-seeding chillies etc. The hosts are very friendly and knowledgable. The food is amazing. The facilities and hygene are also very good. Overall a great day spent in Ubud with our hosts Wayan and Puspa in their home cooking traditional Balinese food. Highly recommended.

Delicious food in a beautiful setting. I won't write much, as I can see many other positive reviews for this cooking class. Basically, my friends and I had an amazing time cooking with Paon Bali. We were stunned by the beautiful and clean kitchen and yard overlooking a lush, green valley. All of the ingredients were fresh and fragrant. The instructors are fun and give lots of interesting information on tradition cooking methods. We felt comfortable and relaxed, and enjoyed interacting with the other guests. At the end of the night, we enjoyed a huge meal at a big communal table with the other participants. It was a fun and enjoyable experience, and I would highly recommend this to anyone, regardless of cooking ability. The food itself is worth it!

Great cultural and cooking experience. The Paon Cooking school is a great experience, both culturally and gastronomically. The day starts off with a tour of Ubud markets and rice fields, with explanation of local customs by owner Wayan Then you are taking to the private residence and given an explanation about how the Balinese live by Wayan and his wife, Puspa (who is the instructor). At the back of the private residences is a nice open air (but weather proof) set up where you learn about Balinese cooking. You help prepare some of the dishes, with half of the work done by the participants and most of the cooking is finished off by the Paon staff. You get enough of an idea of the cooking processes, but no minute is wasted, so when you are eating your food, the Paon staff get ready for the next course. Given the time constraints I think this is a good solution as you get enough hands-on experience to have an understanding of how the cooking process works. I just left the table and had a look from time to time to see how the cooking was progressing and asked lots of questions. This course is different to the Casa Luna cooking course as it focuses a bit more on general Balinese cultural aspects and has slightly more hands-on action. Casa Luna focuses more on theory. You are also cooking in a beautiful environment, overlooking a beautiful valley and rice fields, so in that respect it can be more classified as a 'tour', not just a cooking class. Recipes and cooking style and experience are different enough not to feel as if you are doubling up if you were to visit both cooking schools. If you can, attend both!

Best cooking class - a must do when in Bali. We started the day with a tour around the Ubud markets. We sampled a Bali type Muffin some sweet rice and some amazing local fruit. I like that we were able to try these different foods as part of the tour as it is not something I would normally do. We then head up to the rice fields and Wayan gave us a quick 5 min (15 min Bali time) explanation on how the locals live and how the grow their rice. Very interesting and Wayan has a wicked sense of humour. Then its to Wayan and Puspa's family home. Wayan and Puspa gave a brief rundown on their homes and family history. We move out the back into a lovely outdoor kitchen, magnificent views and the tables are setup up with an array of wonderful vegetables and fruit. In total we cooked 9 dishes. Awesome. At the end of the class they give you a copy of all the dishes you had created. Hopefully I can recreate at home. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone who enjoys cooking.

Really fun Day. This may have been one of the most fun days I spent in Indonesia. I signed up for this class as a single several months in advance. There were 5 other attendees which made for a very nice small group. Puspa and Wayan are contagiously enthisiastic about their home and their cooking. I enjoyed the visit to the market, the visit to the rice paddies, and the cooking. All six of us had the opportunity to pitch in and help with the chopping, mixing, and cooking. It was just enough participation to be fun and not to be work, The end result was delicious. I recommend this activity for a fun day in Bali.

Outstanding Balinese Experience - Do not miss this. Amidst pelting rain and muddy conditions, we were delivered to the markets. The conditions did not deter Puspa our host and she even managed to get the driver to find umbrellas for those in our group (around 15) who did not bring one.We huddled around listening to descriptions of spices and condiments at stalls, what they are used for, how much to use and how to use them. Some of us purchased some fruit and bakery items from the markets and Puspa helped us to speak with the owners of the stalls for this. It was a great experience.Off to Puspa's village and a tour of the rice paddies which have been in the family for 100 generations. Puspa's husband Wyan told us about species, growing, stages and harvesting. Then what is done with the rice after that. He even spoke about village life and the way issues are dealt with, discussions are had, decisions are made in the village.We were then taken to Puspa and Wyan's own home - an immaculate series of pavilions and temple. We were advised about the family living structure, family housing compound and how families make decisions / sort out problems etc. In other words, the social fabric of Balinese life. It was absolutely evident to me that this is something a non-Balinese person could never do anything but talk about. This was real true life experience being shared.Drinks abounded - from the hand made ginger tea from the garden to the beer and bottled water - it just kept flowing. The recipes were plentiful and we even made our own cold pressed coconut oil on the open fire stove to use in the cooking of dishes. We tended the mortar and pestle to pound the spices for the paste, chopped copious amounts of vegetables, spices and condiments, stirred, tasted, enjoyed the stories and each others company. Through it all, we inhaled the amazing aroma of what we were creating for our lunch. There were 9 dishes in total.Puspa has a few helpers for the group including a chef to enable a large number of people to be catered for. These people are all willing to answer questions and contribute to the learning experience. They blend into the group and are part of the tour.I cannot recommend the Paon Cooking School highly enough. It was by far the best activity I did whilst in Bali - I also did an Eco-Cycling tour which was up there too but this was amongst Balinese people willing to share their culture with others.It is a pleasure to write a glowing review for Puspa as I believe she has made a good business out of something that she absolutely loves to do - cook and socialise!!

Beyond all expectations!. From start to end, it was just so amazing. The owners and staff are just so accommodating and although we were a group of 17, we all had fun and had our things to do. An open-air kitchen and an excellent view just add to the ambience. And Puspa is just full of energy! If you have not done it yet, go now! And the food is great!

Wonderful cooking experience in family home overlooking rice terraces. Did the cooking class today and thoroughly enjoyed it. Had a market and rice paddy tour in the morning (a little long for my liking but good to see where all the product comes from).Loved every bit of the cooking class, about 25 ppl in our group but everyone got a turn to chop, cook and stir - sometimes all at once. Staff did a great job ensuring everyone got a go. The only vegetarian in the group was shown special attention and fully catered for.Huge range of dishes (8) were cooked and consumed. Wonderful experience not to be missed.

Too long but enjoyable.. The tour begins at 8am and finishes at around 3pm. Initially you are shown through some small markets and educated on some interesting produce. You are then taken on an educated tour of rice fields and finally taken to the hosts' house for an involved cooking class.The tour operators are friendly and extremely well informed, they are open to questions but as mentioned in the title the tour goes for far too long. We ate at 7am pre tour and did not eat our lunch until around 2pm. As long as you are prepared for the length of the tour you should thoroughly enjoy the day.

True Balinese experience. We visited Pupsa & Wayan yesterday for their cooking class (understatement).The total experience is 10 out of 10 - market tour, visit to the rice fields and then the cooking class and then a feast to remember.It gives you an insight into Balinese life away from the hustle and bustle of the Kuta area.They are a very warm and funny couple, who work very hard and genuinely aim to provide the best experience for everyone. We took our teenage children, one sick with bali belly. They fussed around her, trying to make her comfortable. In a country where wages are very low, I feel that people that work hard with an honest, friendly & caring disposition, should be rewarded for their efforts. Do not hesitate, if you are considering a cooking class, book with Paon, you will not be disapointed. Best day in Bali so far.

A superb cultural experience not to be missed. Puspa and Wayan show true Balinese hospitality to all their guests. This is an experience that not only takes in cookery, but every other aspect of true Balinese life, from the market place, to the rice paddies, learning about the village and the Balinese Culture. Spotless facilities in luscious surroundings make this an incredible experience. I take small tour groups to Bali and this has become a highlight of the tour and eagerly awaited with anticipation. All this .....as well as delicious food prepared by the group and helped by Puspa's staff, so at no stage does it become a bore. A wonderful experience for couples too..... the men LUV it! Thank you Puspa for a wonderful day and to Wayan who has such a sense of humour too!

Great day, nice people, wonderful food. I booked this on the recommendation of my cousin. Didnt tell the family until the day before because I knew that they would greet this with cries of dismay, having zero interest in cooking. However they all got into it after a few minutes of sulking and enjoyed the opening tour of the markets as well. Our hosts were charming and amusing and made such an effort to make everyone comfortable that they were won over. They chopped, pounded spices and cooked admirably and ate with great enthusiasm despite the heat of the day. I would recommend these guys, they try very hard to make sure its a good day and I felt they earned every cent plus saved us having to buy dinner (we were FULL). A lovey day. One of my kids has even made the Yellow Sauce since we got back.

A magnificent cultural experience, a highlight to our trip.. This class was entertaining and culturally educational from the very beginning of the class. I went with my 19 year old son, he enjoyed this experience as much as me. Puspa took us through the markets, her husband then took us to the rice fields, ending up at their family home. This was absolutely beautiful. A very interactive class finishing with the most delicious balinese meal that we had helped make. No need for evening meal!. I would recommend this to any age. Puspa and her husband were very warm and lovely hosts.

Excellent cultural experience and delicious food!. This is the 2nd cooking course I have taken in Ubud (the other was from a favorite restaurant). Both classes were wonderful, however Paon Bali's course was a more complete cultural experience (includes a guided walk through the market, visit to the rice fields, introduction to Balinese family life, and a visit to a Balinese home) AND the food was much better! Worth it for the food alone. Puspa, Wayan, and their wonderful family of helpers were so welcoming, educated, and friendly. If you only have a short time in Ubud, this course is perfect!

A terrific experience!. Warm and welcoming hosts, a superb location in the owner's home, friendly and informative staff, educational, beautiful food, and enormous fun made this a 'must do' whilst in Ubud. From whoah to go it was a delighful operation and a credit to Wayan and Puspa, who arrange pick up and return to your hotel as part of the service. You'd be mad not to do it!

Fantastic. Don't miss this experience.. We had a great experience attending this class. The evening class was attended by only 5 of us. The beautiful surrounds, Puspa and her staff, humour from her husband and beautiful food made this a great experience. Preparing the food, understanding the way the ingredients interact and sharing this meal was the highlight of our trip. If you want this same experience, don't miss out sharing your time with Puspa and her family and staff in her home. We would do this again.

Much better than the others. This is both a great cooking class and a wonderful experience. So much nicer being in a beautiful family home than a restaurant. The food is delicious and the teaching is very good, and Puspa is very happy to go into greater depth if you want.

OUTSTANDING! A real balinese experience. Wayan and Puspa are by far the most hospitable hosts we met in Bali.We were picked up from our hotel and taken to the Ubud market where we met with the other guests and then taken on a very informative tour of the markets and the produce... it was fanatstic and our guide was just delightful and funny!! We were then driven through some of the most beautiful parts of Bali and stopped by a rice field where Wayan talked to us about the rice padi fields, water irrigation and how it affects the community - he knows a lot about rice and is absolutely delightful - I could listen to him all day!Upon arrival at Laplapan village we met Wayan's wife, Puspa. These two are absolutely amazing and share such beautiful passion for each other and their family. They apologised for being a little sad as their 'King' (Wayan's father) had passed away only the day before. They talked about their family life and how they met and were married... My partner and I learned a lot from these two wonderful people.We had a lot of fun with the cooking and learned so much!! I highly recommend anyone to go on this tour - it's GREAT value for money and was by in my top 2 favourite things we did in Bali!

Make sure you go to this cooking class-not to be missed. I was fortunate enough to have attended Puspa & Wayan's "PAON" cooking class. I have to say this was the highlight of this trip for me. From the visit to the Ubud market, rice paddies, and meeting the beautiful Puspa to finally eating the magnificent feast we chopped and prepared was to say the least - unreal. To be invited into their home and enjoy the experience of learning not only about traditional Balinese cooking and their way of life and culture was an honour. This beautiful family have a wonderful product with this cooking class and I thoroughly recommend that if you are traveling to the Ubud area THAT YOU DO NOT MISS OUT ATTENDING THIS CLASS.

Amazing meal and fun cooking it too.. I attended the afternoon cooking class. There is no market tour in the afternoon, but that wasn't a problem for me. I preferred eating the amazing meal we prepared in the evening...so much wonderfully delicious food!!!There were 12 participants in the class and Puspa and Wayan made everyone feel welcome in their home and both have a great sense of humor.The cooking area is open air and amazingly clean. The whole preparation and cooking process was very well organized with high standards of hygiene.Absolutely wonderful meal, good fun, and all the recipes to take home and try.

Best meal in Bali!!. Everything was just great - tour of the market, drive to their village just outside of Ubud, stop at community rice paddies with explanation, welcome drink, tour and explanation of typical Balinese home, cooking class, the delicious food!!!! In addition it happened that there were special ceremonies going on in their home due to a recent death in the family. We were welcomed into the family temple and were able to experience a unique Balinese cultural event (42 days after the death of a family member).Our 10 year old daughter really enjoyed it and has asked that we do another cooking class as we travel - don't know if we'll find one as good as this!!

A must do while you are in Bali!. My husband I did the cooking tour in December. Although it rained, it did not stop us from visiting the market, visiting the rice paddy field, and experiencing the fun and "fullness" of the cooking class. Pupsa and her husband are very sweet and very funny! Learning to cook is really just a small part of the overall experience. We enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere of being welcomed into a home, partaking in some of the cooking, and ultimately, devouring the final product. If you're looking for a "hard-core" cooking class, this might disappointment you. But if you're looking for an overall awesome experience, give it a try! We really enjoyed our time here and highly recommend it to anyone visiting the area.

A wholesome experience!. While looking for a list of things do during our stay in Bali, the Paon cooking experience came up. Being strict vegetarians, I was skeptical of Puspa being able to cater to our requests. But she did! It began with several emails to her explaining our requirements and also my apprehensions/ reservations. Pushpa was very prompt and patient with her replies, and assured me that we would cook only veg dishes. She accommodated us in the afternoon session. And were we in for a surprise!We'd agreed to be picked up at our villa, but our plans changed, and she had arranged for us to be picked up at the Ubud market. The ride was pleasant, with her nephew giving us a short guided tour of the market, as we drove to the family's paddy field, where Puspa's husband Wayan received us. He gave us a history of his village, about growing paddy, the irrigation systems. This introduction over, we drove to Wayan and Puspa's beautiful home, where they have their cooking school. A welcome drink greeted us as we got off our car, and while sipping that cool refresher, Wayan took us through the family 'temple' and explained the architecture and belief behind building Balinese houses a particular style! It was VERY interesting getting to understand their culture from a local! About 15 minutes later, we were introduced to Puspa, who greeted us with another refresher - lemongrass tea and ginger with honey! She took us to her cooking pad, which was quite something else! Set cozily in the open, with a separate area for cooking and dining. This is where the surprise came in - my sister in law and I were the only ones at the afternoon session!! This was not something we expected, and it came as a wonderful surprise. A private class, it was!We set to work immediately, and when Puspa said 'hands-on' cooking, she meant every word of it - from chopping every tiny bit of ingredient, to pounding it over in the traditional mortar-pestle, to the actual cooking! She had her Sous-Chef help us though. We began cooking by around 4:00pm; by 9:00pm, our husbands and my nephew joined us for a delicious Balinese dinner! My personal favourites were the vegetable soup, and the boiled banana and jackfruit dessert!It is an experience that I cannot recommend enough. Puspa was a teacher at a cooking school prior to setting up her cooking school. She is an AMAZING teacher - taking us through the nuances of each ingredient, and techniques - and an even better cook!! If you are as serious and as keen on cooking as my sister in law and I were, Paon Cooking Class is the place for you. If you are there to enjoy a relaxed evening out in the open, and feast your senses on a wonderful cuisine while enjoying the sunset, well, Paon has it all for you!Thank you Puspa and Wayan, for a very memorable experience!Cost: Very reasonable. Includes pick up and drop at your villa/ hotel Experience: One for a lifetimeDishes/ Cooking class: Delicious. And definitely picked up a few techniques

Fantastic Experience in Bali Living and Cooking. We signed up for this class based on previous Tripadvisor reviews. We enjoyed the whole experience from the market, to the rice field visit to be welcomed in to their home to cook a meal. I was a bit disappointed that there were helpers on hand who did most of the prep work and the preparation. There was one other family with us (a father and two teenagers) so there were lots of opportunities for chopping but most of the work was done by the helpers. The food was excellent and we were given copies of the recipes to take with us. We did not follow the recipes while preparing the dishes though so I do think it might be hard to replicate the food at home as the owner kept adding a little bit more of this or that etc.

A great day out. Started with w trip to the market - which I think was more to show us the market and to buy a few bits and pieces rather than to buy stuff for our cooking, Was very vary well organised, food was delicious and we had so much fun cooking and then eating. Pick up from the hotel was well organised and on time - highly recommend this as an activity!

Wonderful experience in heart of Bali. Just the best day ever, from being picked up and being driven from South Kuta to Ubud an amazing eye opening experience to stopping at rice paddies and being explained how the farming system operates within the community. The market tour was very thorough and great to see the real Bali. Puspa was amazing, a natural teacher, food was delicious especially the mushroom soup and gado gado. Thank you to such a wonderful family, for letting us into your home and to our driver, dewy. Oh and such a sweet dog!

Great introduction to Balinese cooking.. Our day started off in the market where we learned about the basic ingredients for Balinese cooking, from there we went on to visit the rice patties where a brief discussion and explanation of Balinese village structure was explained; after that war were take to the family home to prepare our meals. Everyone participated in chopping and grinding ingredients as well as watching things on the stove. Very good English was spoken and excellent direction was provided. Recipes were also provided following our sit down lunch (which was certainly worth the 35000Rp investment). I'd recommend this to anyone.

Excellent. We really enjoyed the warm welcome from Wayan and the proffesional cooking class from Puspa. They are both great hosts. The afternoon class itself was great fun and everyone participated in preparing a wonderful meal. We can truly recommend this for somethingh different to do in Bali.

Paon - The Number 1 Balinese Cooking School. Our day with Wayan and Puspa was excellent. We started at 8:00am with a visit to Ubud markets to learn all the different foods and spices. We then travelled to Wayan and Puspa's village where Wayan gave a great talk on how the village operates - I usually find this sort of thing boring but Wayan explained their way of life in an interesting and humourous manner. We then moved to Wayan and Puspa's home and started preparing all the food for lunch - there were 12 of us and everyone got stuck in to the various tasks. We ended up with a fantastic, varied lunch. Had a wonderful day and worth every penny (we paid 350,000 indonesian rupiah per person). Thanks again to Wayan and Puspa - the number 1 balinese cooking school in Bali!!
Great experience!. Delicious food and a great experience. Meet other folks from around the world and learn to cook in a fun, clean environment. This is first class all the way.

Great Experience. Definitely worth it! Loved walking through the market in the morning - got to taste all sorts of strange items I would never had if I went on my own. The 7 course meal was delicious and overall a great day out.

Fantastic experience and wonderful hosts. We visited the Paon Bali Cooking Class in November and had a fantastic experience. The hosts were amazing and welcomed us into their home. The opportunity to learn about the produce and make the dishes was brilliant.

So much fun!!. Had such a fantastic time with Wayan and Puspa. This is SO incredibly worth it. Definitely one of the things I will remember from my stay in Bali. I love the way Wayan creates a collaborative environment. By the end, we were all a group of friends in good company. As a tip: Due to a mix-up in lodging arrangements, we agreed to meet for pickup at the Ubud Palace. This place is insanely crowded and we quickly realized it was highly unlikely we were going to be able to find our driver. There is a tourist information center across the street from the pickup center. They are familiar with the Paon Cooking Class and will let you use their phone. This was a huge help. Wayan sent a driver for us right away. Enjoy!!!

Fantastic way to spend the day. My husband and I participated in a morning class and both absolutely loved it. Plenty of hands on food preparation; lots of tips and information about ingredients and recipes passed on while cooking and at the end, we enjoyed probably the best Balinese food of our entire trip. Best thing is that we got recipes of this wonderful food to take home with us!Wayan and Puspa are wonderful hosts, very warm and entertaining. Wayan gave us an insight into the family life and of working the rice paddies and Puspa ran the cooking class with the help of other staff. We had a group of 14 and we all had things to do, but you could also step aside and just watch if you wanted (until called upon by Puspa to help - 'honey bunnie'!)We would highly recommend doing the class - wonderful people, amazing food and great value for money.

The single best thing we did in Bali. My girlfriend and I had a fantastic time on this course. It takes place in the couples home and you hence learn about Balinese life and the importance of home and family. The pick up and drop off was most welcome as was the Bintang! The course itself is highly entertaining and we laughed as well as learned. Also helped that everyone else on the course was very friendly and good company. I can't recommend it highly enough.

Awesome Cooking Class. This is the best cooking class I have ever been to and believe me I have done a few. Firstly it is actually at Puspa's & Wayan's home,so you actually get to see and understand more about the Balinese way of life. The food you cook and eat is the best meal we ate in Ubud it was a true Balinese experience. We had many laughs together and my 17yr old daughter and I will go again next year. You truly should take the opportunity I promise you will not be disappointed.

A must do cultural experience. My Husband and myself did the morning cooking class with Paon and I must say how much we enjoyed it. Wayan and puspa are excellent hosts. We were picked up from our hotel on the exact time we were told, we were then taken to the local market and were given a full description of every herb and spice which is used in balinese cooking tasted local produce.We were then taken to Wayan and Puspas home and were made very very welcome they are beautifull people. Puspa is very professional and is very strict with hygiene. Our cooking experience was out of this world. Their staff are all wonderfull. Do yourself a favour and do this tour you will not regret it.

A chance to visit a Balanese home. Really enjoyed my visit to Wayan & Pusspa's home, they made us so welcome. It was so interesting hearing about their family and village life. Participating in the preparation of the food was great fun and entertaining. Definitely one of the highlights of my visit to Bali. It was such a differnent food experience. Highly recommend it.

Skipping the beach for a day has never been more rewarding.... Skip the beach and the shopping for a day - this class will show you more about beautiful Bali than almost anything else you can do on the island. Puspa and Wayan have created a truly unique cultural and culinary experience that shouldn't be missed. They warmly welcome you into their home, their kitchen and their world - and what a special place to receive an invite! It's a terrific learning experience and so much fun to be a part of. And, of course, the feast is rewarding and delicious!It's a delightful way to spend the day and now officially my #1 recommendation to friends and family traveling to Bali.
The best of Bali in one cooking class. Take this class, you won't be disappointed even if you don't like cooking!

More than a cooking class...a cultural experience.. My husband and had a most enjoyable time learning about the Balinese way of life with our lovely hosts.The food was great and everything was extremely hygienic.There were only seven people in our group so we were able to be very hands on with the cooking as well as meeting and making new friends. We went to an evening class.Other reviews mention class sizes were too big so it may be wize to check how many people will be in your group when booking.

Great experience & learn about the Balinese culture. We did the morning cooking class on a recent trip to Ubud. We were picked up from our hotel & dropped off to the Ubud markets, meeting up with the rest of our cooking group. One of the guides showed us through the food markets, then we were taken to the family's rice field to learn about how they produce their rice. We then returned to the family's compound to get into the cooking. We learnt how to cook several meals, after which we sat down to have a wonderful lunch. The family who run the school were lovely, very entertaining & we had a fantastic experience. We would consider going again next time we visit Bali, chosing another menu option for variety.
I took away warm memories. Lovely hosts, excellent day with new friends and full bellys.. Recommended

Above and beyond all expectation more than we could have asked for!!. Our experience with Paon Bali Cooking was phenomenal. Wayan, his beautiful wife Puspa, family and staff were remarkably genuine. Through this class we were enabled to consume more than a meal; but to be filled too with culture, genuine generosity and love. I would highly recommend this to anyone. And look forward to visiting this unique place once again. To Wayan, Puspa, your family and staff thank you so sincerely for this experience. I now know what it means to be 'full'. : ) best of luck-Farrah and familyCanada
Pusspa and Wayan are wonderful hosts. We went to their home in their village and cooked a delicious meal with people from all over the world.fun stuff

Excellent from start to Finish. Such a pleasant and warm welcome was just the start of what turned out to be a fantastic and knowledgable class which was led by a lovely husband and wife combination who ensured our stay was comfortable and interesting from the outset. All preperation and cooking was carried out in full traditional Balinese fashion which as a European made the experience that much better. All transport was provided to and from the class which was much appreciated. If i could offer one piece of advice it would be not to eat for atleast 2 hours before the class as the amount of food that you will prepare is outstanding.

Fabulous. The Paon cooking class was not only highly enjoyable but it was also surprising. I, a 50+ american male told my girl, no you go to the class and have fun and learn something and well then back in the states you cook it for me. But she pled and talked me into going. One of the most enjoyable evenings out in Bali. Pupsa was a great host, making the food was fun and light hearted, Seeing a Balinese compound from the inside was a great learning experience. So I am a convert, this class was top notch and I highly recommend it to any couple not just the women. Hey there's BBQing and a cold beer going on there also so put on your apron wash your hands and have a great time.

Our favorite Ubud activity. This class was well organized, informative and fun and the food was tasty. We are taking home a few new recipes that are sure to become a part of our standard repertoire. Puspa and Wayan were attentive and gracious hosts and the other couples attending the workshop were interesting to get to know. Of all that we did in our five days in Ubud, this was our favorite.

Really fun experience and great food!. We had a blast at the cooking course. The tour of the market was very informative, as well as the info on the rice fields. You are welcomed into the families compound and told about its lay out.The only thing I really wish was that the class was a smaller size, and more hands on. The food was deleicious and I am very excited to try to make it at home.And I must point out, the instructor speaks very loud so everyone can hear!!! I was very happy about this!

A day in a Balinese home cooking class. The day started with being picked up from my hotel. After all students accounted we met the Chef at the market. A tour of the various fruits, spices, and veggies we would be using was a learning experience. We then went to a school and to a rice paddy to see how it was hand harvested and rice removal from the stalks. We also saw ducks cleaning up the rice fields and leaving droppings to add to the fertilizer. They are trying to go green as much as possible. Progress is being made as many locals exress the need is now. Arrival at the school in their home was being greeted by a very excited dog. We spent the day learning several dishes and knowing the spices used. We were able to taste along the way and had a lunch like nothing I have tasted in Bali the past week. The husband was the instructor in balinese home and family life. The culture side of our day added to the experience. I had so much fun, meeting all of the other students. There five countries represented amoung the students.

Good day of cooking and learning. We had a great day learning about the markets, rice fields, Balinese culture and of course food. The dishes we cooked were very nice and the recipies were provided at the end of the day. The day was well structured and good fun as well as educational.
Best value. Great day. Informative welcoming fantastic easy to follow recipes and great interacting with my husband. Both really enjoyed the experience and inspired us to cook indonesian at home.

Like to Eat & Learn? Look No Further!. There's no need to re-write the great experience that all the other posters has written. The reviews explain very well the events of the day and Puspa and Wayan are gracious, wonderful hosts, and the food is, well, even better than you expected because YOU have played a part into bringing it to the table . Puspa and Wayan understand well that there's more to tourism than museums, hotel pools, and the beach. They combine Indonesian culture with Indonesian cooking and make the "event" one well worth your tourist dollar. Besides, you've come this far, most likely because you have a bit of curiosity of this island you've landed on, and while you're here, you have to eat so why not enjoy the local cuisine. Combine the two and voila, Paon Bali Cooking Class. The added bonus is you get to enjoy the company of many other folks from around the world who are also here to enjoy the same experience. Being around a big table sharing a wonderful meal together, one you have helped prepare, is priceless. Note that is a hands-on experience though you are not required to help; you're free to watch and enjoy. In essence, you make of it what you want. In 2010 I took cooking class offered by Casa Luna and it was mostly a demonstration; there were way too many people in attendance to keep you focused on the demonstration and we all couldn't fit around where the demonstration was taking place. The food was just as good but the cooking experience was of no comparison. Bon Apetit!

great experience. We prebooked our class before we left for Bali, and we were picked up on time and taken to the markets to join the rest of the group. On this day there were about 20 of us which had me worried at first but Wayan and Puspa were so organised that it did not matter at all. After the market and rice field we went to their home and we all had a go at hands on cooking. Needless to say it was all very tasty and all in all a great day .We were 4 friends doing the class and one of us got sick before the cooking class started ,she was treated with care given a drink and then driven back to our accommodation . Very kind of our hosts. We will be back to do it all again.

Very entertaining!. A group of 5 of us did the night session @ Paon, and what a great night it was!Puspa and Wayan are a very welcoming, friendly and very entertaining couple. They Invite you into their home for the cooking school.The afternoon started with Wayan taking us to his village rice field and explains all about rice and the water chanels etc, was very interesting, then you get taken into their home and an icey cold welcoming drink is offered and Wayan and Puspa explain the significance of a family compound.We then were shown the ingredients and how they are grown, then everyone is asked to choose a station and we all got "hands on" with the preparations.Everyone had turns taken with cooking process, adding ingredients and serving up the dishes finished. When we sat down to eat Puspa served our dishes to the table on her head! And we sat and drank and enjoyed the works of our labors to traditional live musicians!Puspa was very thoughtful with taking care for those that have certain food allergies and those that are vegetarian.Copies of all the recipes are given at the end of the night.Surprising how simple alot of the recipes are, even for those that dont cook!What a great way to end another fabulous day in Ubud!Great day- try it, I would do it again, but will try the morning session next time.

Best Cooking class anywhere. Found this class on Trip Advisor, easily signed up before I left for Bali. Driver picked me up at my hotel in Ubud, dropped me at marketplace to meet up with Puspa and other students. Had wonderful tour of market, then went to rice fields with here husband, Wayan, as guide. Great description of how rice grows and is processed. Wonderful hands on class, perfectly understood English, they have great sense of humor, which is difficult when English is not your first language. We made wonderful, flavorful food, then ate it! They then took me back to my hotel. Will definitely go again next time I go to Bali. A "ten plus"

A great expeRience. Paon Bali Cooking Class was full value. Wayan and his wife Puspa are both very entertaining and extremely gracious hosts. The day started with a tour through the Ubud market where we were introduced to a variety of Balinese fruits, veggies and spices, led by Pupsa. We were then driven up the hills to the rice fields where Wayan gave a very thorough presentation on the organic methods used to grow rice. Then it was back to their family compound for cooking and eating. Wayan once again gave us a good explanation of the Balinese family organization in his family's compound. Then Puspa took over with the cooking session, first of all setting out all of the ingredients for each of the eight dishes we would be making. We helped with the chopping and stirring through each of the dishes - lots of hands on opportunities as they keep the group to a maximum of eight. Then we sat down to eat one of our best meals while on Bali. It was full value - a great learning experience, entertaining and fun, and a fabulous food experience.

Enjoyable Experience. Our day started with the tour of the local market with an explanation of local fruits and spices by Puspa. Then a drive through paddy fields of the village of Laplapan where the cooking class is held with a description by Wayan of the culture, farming methods and rice variaties grown. There were 11 in the class which was a comfortable size. Everyone got turns at chopping and cooking. After arriving at Wayan and Puspa family compound, Wayan gave a talk of the layout and meaning of the various buildings in the compound. Just after we started preparing the first dishes we had more than we bargained for with a magnitude 6.8 earthquake. The earth really moved! We had a lovely luncheon of our cooking efforts before being returned to our resorts. Wayan and Puspa are excellent hosts. This class this recommended for anyone who wants to enjoy an authentic Balinese cooking class.

An Experience to Remember!!! Best cooking class in Bali!. My fiance and I had the most amazing day with Puspa and Wayan. We were picked up at our hotel in the morning and taken on a tour through the market with a really thorough explanation of the different foods we would be cooking. Then Wayan took us to the rice fields of his village and explained the rice harvest process. From there we went to Puspa and Wayan's compound were they live with their two children and their great uncle. Puspa led us through a full day of cooking AMAZING Balinese dishes. It was a pleasure to learn how to prepare the local foods with her and her family. A truly intimate experience filled with tons of laughter. I was glad we found this beautiful family to learn from. It was an experience we'll never forget. - and the food was fantastic (all grown in their organic garden).

Quite the experience. They are incredible hosts. They gave just a little cultural explanation of their house and as we went along with the food.The food was great.They're also very organized. Everything went smoothly. They accommodated for a girl who was allergic to spicy food and you could hardly tell.I highly recommend it.

AMAZING - Don't go anywhere else!. We spent along time searching for cooking classes and were recommended a couple of them. We werent overly sure what to expect but when we were told that Paon Bali Cooking Class were run by a traditional indonesian family we knew it was the one to do and we were not disappointed.Wayan and his gorgeous wife Puspa were so inviting and informative with the traditional way of indonesian life and cooking. I recommend the morning class as you are taken to a market and showned all aspects (meat, spices, fruit, vegetables and batik) and rice field. The cooking was amazing and the food was even better. My girlfriend and I came away with at least 6 recipes and we intend to try everyone of them as they tasted amazing when we had the feast at the end of the class. I promise you you wont be disappointed and if you are I'll pay the 350,000 rp cost for the class.Terimah Kasih Wayan and Puspa you were both amazing and we will be back, when we are next in Ubud.

great class great food. Great food, great hosts very funny!!!!!we had a blast of a time and we were so full when we left from luch we didnt even eat diner!!first off we were picked up right on time by a very friendly driver, we were then taken to the local market and shown and taught about local spices, fruits, veggies, clothing,flowers for the offerings and even sampled some fresh fruit. after we all had taken our pictures and made our way back to the cars we went out to some rice paddies nd learny about the local village and rice production.were then taken to the family compund and greated with a lemon shake and tea and coffee. we then help in preparing as soup for appetizer and after eating our soup we learnt to make many indonesian main courses and sauces. The friend tempe is awesome!!!!!! after eaing more then i posbly thought i could it was time to prepare desert and enjoy it!!!! before a short ride back to the hotel.a great daylong activity as we were picked up at 8:30 and cme back at 3:00pmthey supply al you can drink water and beer for purchasegreat time great food highly recomend

Even better second time around!. We went to Puspa & Wayan's Paon Bali Cooking Class last year when we visited Ubud and enjoyed it very much - so we decided we'd like to go back this year and learn more. I contacted them by email when we arrived in Ubud and asked if we could learn some different dishes second time around! No problem - we did a very different menu and again enjoyed every minute of our time with these special people.We went to an afternoon class this time - so no market trip - which if you haven't been before is not to be missed! Puspa and Wayan have done some enlarging of their kitchen since we last visited them and the improvements have given them much more room, both for cooking and enjoying the meal you prepare afterwards. The whole session is very professionally run and is definitely very "hands on" - the food you prepare is delicious and you get a recipe book to take home so you can cook the dishes at home.We would most definitely recommend Paon Bali as a great place to spend half a day while you are in Ubud (or elsewhere in Bali, as pick up can be negotiated from other towns). Keep up the great work Puspa and Wayan - you are fantastic people and we hope to see you next time we are in Ubud!!

Highlight of our visit to Ubud. If you love food and love cooking, then this is a must! We had a private class (4 of us) and what a wonderful experience. From a tour of the rice paddies and of their home and garden, we went straight to the kitchen and learned so much about the ingredients, blending of spices and flavours, etc. My wife is vegetarian and the kids don't eat fish but the menu was adjusted accordingly and we all had what we wanted. We took part in every part of the preparation and cooking and then enjoyed what was arguably our best meal in Bali. The hosts made us feel so welcome and comfortable, and the kids had a ball. Highly recommended.

Informative, funny, hospitable and catered to my vegetarian request!. What a wonderful experience!! From the on time pick up and cultural/history information to the vegetarian option (asked us upon arrival). This husband & wife team really opened up their home and taught us about farming, spices and home life. The walk through the market was a great way to get introduced to the culture. It was followed by a trip to the rice paddy where Wayun taught us so much about Balinese farming. Cooking class was hands on and mouth watering. A great experience for solos, couples and groups!

A great cooking and cultural experience. Our wonderful hotel - Desa Sanctuary - booked my 4 friends and I into this fantastic course. We were collected from our hotel and spent some time touring Ubud market - looking at fresh vegetables, fruits and spices and tasting quite a few too! Then a trip to the rice paddys near Wayan and Puspa's village with a great explanation of the growing process. Then off to their house where we were met with a delicious ice cold lime juice and a discussion of the structure of the family compound in Bali. For the following 3-4 hours we were all busy helping with the preparation of around 8 dishes which we then shared for lunch. It was a great course - lots of interaction and hands on. Also a great multicultural group with us from Australia, a group of Japanese women, a couple from Amsterdam and some French Canadians. The discussions over lunch were great too. this is a must do course if you have an interest in food or culture or both!

Excellent class, excellent food. I really enjoyed the afternoon cooking class. It was a lovely setting cooking outdoors in the family compound. The class was small and lots of information was given. We all got to be involved with the preparation and cooking but if we didn't get it all done there were others to help.The actual meal was delicious and huge!The recipes were distributed and I have already collected the ingredients in Melbourne to make the "basic yellow sauce" which goes in most dishes. I definitely feel that I will be able to reproduce the dishes we made.The price was also very reasonable.

Food for the Soul. The Paon Cooking School was fantastic. It is well run, very informative and just a great day out. It gave a wonderful insight into Balinese culture and the wonderful sense of community that is shared by the families that live in Wayan and Puspa’s village. For a more thorough review with pictures please read my blog post. http://christielou22.blogspot.com/2011/09/bali-paon-cooking-school-food-for-soul.html

Good fun day out in Ubud. My fiance and I thoroughly enjoyed the cooking school with Puspa and Wayan. It was great being able to see behind the walls into a Balinese house and experience how they make all the wonderful food. The class was very hands on and lots of fun. My fiance was even given a new nickname by Wayan which has stuck to this day! What is most interesting is the food you make and eat is not the usual food you find in most restaurants in Bali.

Great experience. My husband wasn't overly keen on a 'cooking class', but at the end of the day he had to admit he loved it just as much as me.Going to the markets is an eye opener, and learning about the traditional Balinese family and way of life is very interesting.The food was beautiful, so much flavour and can't wait to try it at home. Definitely recommend for everyone!

A true understanding of Bali mixed with great home cooked meals. Didn't think I would enjoy a cooking class on when on holidays but Wayan and Puspa were delightful, giving us an understanding of Balinese life and how to cook great Balinese dishes. They were very welcoming to there home and would recommend this to anyone. Word of advice though, if you are based in the south part of the island (Kuta, Seminyak etc) give at least 1 1/2 hours to travel to Ubud as the traffic in Bali is horrendous!

One of the best things I did in Bali. I did the morning cooking class because I wanted to check out the morning market with someone who knew where everything was. Puspa is so great and energetic. I loved every minute of this class. After the market we went up to the rice patties near their house. Wayan gave us a lot of great information about the village and the land before taking us back to their house for the class. Every item we made was so good and full of flavor. We made soup, sauces, tempeh, tofu, tuna, chicken satay, peanut saunce, gado gado and a banana dessert that wasn't over the top but a nice finish to the meal. The pace of the class is perfect and broken up just enough. We were all involved start to finish in their lovely outdoor kitchen. If you are thinking at all about taking a cooking class while in Ubud.....this is the one to take! This was honestly the best meal I had while in Bali. Thank you Puspa for a wonderful day.

Wonderful Day Out. I had to write this review as the couple running this day were so wonderful. I visited with my boyfriend but unfortunatly had to leave half way through as we were not feeling well. But we were so impressed with how lovely the couple were that I wanted to say thank you and to compliment them. We only were able to attend the morning which involved the market trip. So fascinating and the lady who showed us round was very knowledable and clearly knew lots of people there so we could try all the fruit and veg. We then went just north of Ubud to the paddy fields and her husband taught us about the fields and harvest. Really interesting and he was very friendly and engaging. Then back to their charming house where you learn about how families and homes work plus get to sip on some lovely refreshing drinks. all wonderful. We had to leave before the cooking begun but it looked great and we were most disappointed to miss out. I would recommend.

An amazing day in secluded Bali. Please do not miss the opportunity to see the real BaliFrom the market visit, to the rice fields to cooking some of the best food I've ever tasted this trip was one of our highlights in an amazing trip to Bali. For me, the best thing is the course is held at the home of the hosts, who couldn't have done more to make it such a fantastic experience.Don't think that if you don't like cooking you won't like this - I don't and I loved it.

Something that will stay with me.. I would highly recommend Puspa's cooking class. This was my 5th trip to Bali and this was one of the best things I have done on this beautiful island. Not only do you take part in learning several Balinese dishes but you will also have the benefit of learning more about Balinese culture and family life (which I found to be a very special part of the day). The recipes are easy to reproduce once you get home, and you will just have a great day with these funny and beautiful people. I am vegetarian and was easily catered for and the veggie food was always cooked before the meat dishes.

highlight of my holiday. Pick up at the hotel :-)
Ubud marked with all the explanations and stories :-)
Rice padi information :-)
Puspa and wayan, great couple with a lot of humor :-)
cooking class :-) just perfect
Price :-)

Life-changing experience. We spent a day with Puspa and Wayan at their cooking school outside Ubud recently, and it was one of those rare days one knows will change the way you view things forever. Having been fans of Balinese and Indonesian cooking for ages, but never able to figure out how those tastes and textures are brought into being, our visit did one crucial thing: it made it clear that it can indeed be done. You see it getting done, you help to do it, and there it is. The magic is not reduced, but made accessible.Even if this is not your aim. the lunch you end up eating is worth more than the price of the class.

Best thing I've done in Ubud!. Well I can't say enough great things about the morning we just had!We were picked up at 8:30am and brought to the Ubud Market where we met the rest of our classmates along with a few of the staff from the PMCC. We spent roughly 45 minutes walking through the Ubud Market, where a woman explained and pointed out the various cooking ingredients we would be using throughout our class. Although they do not buy from the market themselves and organically grow their produce, it was neat to see the break down of Vanilla, tempe, tofu, peppers, chillies, and even the fruits they use.Following the Ubud Market experience, Wayon, the owner of the school brought us to his villages rice paddies where he explained how they grew and harvested the rice. Wayon did an amazing job of not only speaking about where and how rice came about, but gave us an incredible insight to Balinese families, village traditions, and a cultural perspective unlike I had gotten before. Wayon brought us into his home, where we also met his wife, and co-operater of the school. They shared their home with us and explained the layout of traditional homes there.Next the cooking class. It was very interactive and hands on. We chopped up our ingredients, mixed them together, boiled them, sauted, and brought together an incredible meal of various flavours and textures.Our menu consisted of Clear mushroom and Veggie Soup, Basic yellow sauce, minced chicken grilled on bamboo stick, chicken in coconut curry, veggies in peanut sauce, coconut and snake bean salad, steamed tuna in banana leaf, deep fried tempe in sweet soya sauce, and boiled banana in palm sugar syrup.It was amazing! We were proud of what we could create from scratch. The veggies were from their personal organic garden, the meat bought from a producer. The kitchen was spacious, clean and the equipment in excellent shape. The staff friendly, knowledgeable and helpful with answering questions. Their home was the perfect place to experience a Balinese Cooking Experience!

Highlight of my trip - fantastic. The day started with a trip to the market and then an explanation on rice farming in Bali. We then went to their family compound (in a little village outside Ubud) and spent an enjoyable day preparing, cooking and eating. Puspa and Wayan were excellent hosts. I turned up sunburnt and they plied me with fresh aloe vera and a refreshing welcoming drink. We prepared 8 dishes, all of which were delicious (easily as good if not better than the best I have eaten in Bali) Everyone had a different favorite dish so there is something there for everyone. There were 8 of us in the class which was a good number of people and meant we were able to get involved in all the stages of preparation. This was a highlight of my trip. It was so much fun that I went back to do a second class the next day. If you are thinking about doing a cooking class I can highly recommend this one.

Best cooking class I have done. What a great way to spend half a day. We went to the afternoon class (4-8pm) as the morning class was full. It was great doing the afternoon class. I have done classes before with market tours but I think i prefer an afternoon class now! Wayan and Puspa are the hosts with the most and are very welcoming. We ate so much food. The food was really good and lots of information was not crammed in all at once, which made the class more enjoyable. There was a young family also doing the class and the kids had a blast. This is a must do.

Best day out ever fantastic cooking class. The day started with them picking us up at the hotel with a short drive to the markets. There our guide took us through the various spices, herbs, food and then pointed out that they do not buy their meat from the market. This is to make sure that no one gets Bali Belly from the class. It was then on to the rice paddies where it was explained how the village looks after the rice crop etc.Once we got to their house they took us through the compound and explained the different rooms which you never get to see from the road.Then on to the cooking. As there were only four of us it was hands on for every course, the explainations were very good and clear and it was lots of fun. I do like cooking asian food at home and this class gave me so many good tips to help me and the receipe book is easy to read and understand. We got to eat what we prepared, they did the cooking, which was good on an open fire, and there was so much food we could not get through it all. They had no probelm in letting us take photos as we went. Do take sun screen as some of the prep is in the sun, and a hat would be good to. Good walking shoes for the market as there are some steep steps. I managed with the help of my husband as I do have a minor mobility problem.

Loved every minute of it. This was such a good day. The day started with a produce tour of the Ubud Market and then a scenic drive up to the village where our cooking class was held. Our hosts were very informative and eager to please. At the end of the session they were desperate for feedback and were wanting to know how they could improve but I couldn't think of anything! We got to keep the recipes and we were hands on in what was demonstrated. We sat down together at the end and enjoyed a scrumptious Balinese lunch. Very enjoyable!

Fantastic day in Bali!. The cooking class is a must do in Bali. It is really outstanding value for all your learn, eat and do. The food is amazing and the hosts were so kind and friendly and informative.I did get sick after the class but it was more to do with my stomach not been used to all the spices. The food was very fresh and the kitchen and house was immaculate.I chose this course over the number 1 course as they were going to charge me 200,000rp ($20) for pick up from my villa which is a lot of money in Bali - for that price you should get a half days tour!!Go with Paon and you will not be dissapointed!!!Enjoy!!

Fantastic Day. I would endorse all of the positive reviews. We went on the morning course and had a great time. Our 2 teenage daughters really enjoyed it. Puspa and Wayan were wonderful hosts and a great double act. We were warmly welcomed into their home. We learnt about Balinese culture and were shown around their home including the family compound. We also enjoyed learning about the paddy fields. The tour around the Ubud market was also fascinating.I would highly recommend this tour as you learn so much and have such fun.It was the highlight of my holiday.
Forget about Eat, Pray,Love come for Cook, Eat, Laugh. Everything the other reviewers said about Wayan and Puspa is true. We had a blast with them and I highly recommend this cooking class for all.

Great Food, Information, and Company. We echo the lavishly positive comments. My wife and I attended a morning/afternoon session. Wayan picked us up at our villa around 8:30 and took us to the market where we met others from the group. We quickly moved past the tourist areas of the market to the fruit, vegetable, spice, and meat areas. We stopped at various stalls for a short talk about local ingredients, complete with tastings.After the market, we departed for a short drive to the rice paddies. We received a fascinating overview of the cultivation process, the tiered canal system, and the village division of labor. Wayan was a very informative and warm guide.From the rice paddy, it was another short drive to Wayan's home. We received a welcome drink along with an introduction to Balinese family life. We spent the heart of the day enjoying cooking and eating a half-dozen recipes. We chopped, stirred, pounded, and prepared everything from the basic sauces to the final dishes, all at Puspa's expert direction and a steady supply of bottled water and Bintang beer.After we completed all the preparations, the 15 of us sat at two large outdoor tables and feasted on our creations. Although the class was billed to last from 8:30 to 2:00, the great conversation and delicious food pushed our departure time closer to 3:00. There was no rush by our gracious hosts.If you have any interest in learning about Balinese culture, playing a bit in the kitchen, and eating some amazing food, this one is a no-brainer and, at about US$40 per person, an amazing bargain.

A fabulous experience for young and old!. We took our parents (in their mid to late 70's) who had a few mobility issues and could not eat spicey food. Wayan, Pasma and their fabulous staff could not have been more accommodating. As my mum couldn't do the stairs at the markets - one of the girls stayed with her and showed her around downstairs. The markets were sooo colourful and amazing and we learnt a lot. Our tour of the rice fields was very educational and informative and provided some interesting insights into more eco-friendly approaches to growing rice around Ubud. The venue for our cooking school was just perfect - a traditional Balinese house compound. We learnt a lot about Balinese families as well as the ingredients we used in our cooking experience. Wayan and Pasma are quite the duo - very entertaining but also incredibly kind and gorgeous. To top it off - the food was just ... amazing! Absolutely recommend this experience - a highlight for us all!

Fabulous evening of edutainment!. Five of us did the afternoon cooking class, which began with a morning trip to a side of the markets we hadn't ventured into, then a break (which we predictably spent shopping) before being picked up to learn to cook. The class takes place in the home compound of Wayan and Puspa, who are welcoming, charming and very funny - none of which changes over the whole evening. Puspa and her helpers introduced us to the ingredients, set us chopping, mixing, stirring and eating, all the while maintaing a stream of informative patter and showing traditional cooking methods - including options for vegetarians. The whole group sat down to eat together which felt very festive. We ate our 3 course meal, breaking in between to prepare the next - and to digest a little to make room for more. Eating food we'd helped to prepare (noone could make that many dishes in that time on their own!) as the sun was setting and welcome to stay late (after which they dropped us back at our villa), we had a wonderful time and would recommend this class to everyone. It is head and shoulders above the cooking classes we saw in action at various restaurants and hotels. 6 stars if it was possible.
