Outstanding experience. We were looking forward to our cooking class and we weren't disappointed. This is an excellent day and must-do for anyone spending time in or around Ubud. Our hosts were funny, kind and went out of their way to make the day a great and hassle-free experience. Starting early (but not too early!) we enjoyed a tour of the Ubud markets, a trip out to the rice paddies to learn how rice is cultivated, then to the family home where we were treated to an insight into the way local families live. After that, of course, was the cooking class itself.What was particularly impressive about the class was the ease with which every taste and ability was catered for. In our class there was a vegetarian, someone who couldn't eat onions, and someone who couldn't eat spicy food. These potential difficulties were dealt with brilliantly - alternative dishes were prepared seamlessly and no-one was made to feel like they were causing a hassle or any trouble at all.The food itself is delicious and at the end of the day you receive a copy of the recipes needed to cook it at home. You'll also learn about the Balinese garden and many of the ingredients to make it easier to replicate this style of cooking yourself. The class includes transfers to and from your hotel (or anywhere else nearby you want to go) and beer, coffee and other drinks are available during the class.
So much more than a cooking class.. I write about found and been to many many cooking classes. Paon Bali is by far the best! So much more than a cooking class. Lots of fun, laughter and great food!

Best thing we did in Bali!. As soon we were picked up, we knew the day was going to be great. Wayan and Pasma are wonderful, lovely hosts, funny, warm and so knowledgeable about all things food and culture. The day starts off at Ubud markets, where Pasma shows you local treats and where to get the best produce. Wayan then showed us rice paddies and explained harvesting rice and importance of rice in the Balinese culture. We were then taken to the family home, where we were treated to so much more than how to cook and enjoy wonderful dishes. This is an experience where you have the opportunity to learn about the beautiful Balinese culture, family and the role food plays in this. You are also treated to wonderful hospitability and the most amazing food. This was easily our highlight of our trip. Cannot recommend Peon Cooking class enough!

Excellent tour and cooking class!. The day started off with us 4 being picked up from our hotel in Kuta. We then had a Market tour and met other guests. We got to try local fruit and other food - really interesting and a real surprise! Next we went to the Rice fields where we met Wayan our host... So informative and scenery was amazing. We then walked down the local village street...We met Puspa at their traditional Balinese home where we got welcome drinks... Then the cooking began!Excellent and very funny hosts :) one of the most memorable days of my first trip to Bali. Definitely recommending to friends and family...The food was amazing - I can't wait to cook it at home!!!

More than just a cooking class..... We decided to book Paon (Balinese for ‘kitchen’) after the glowing reviews here and we were so glad we did! All the reviews are pretty much spot on so I won’t repeat it all again… Sure, the food is great and the day is fun but meeting Wayan & Puspa and being so warmly welcomed into their home was the highlight of the day. From the first minute of meeting this dynamic and entertaining couple, you instantly feel both welcomed and humbled. As Wayan explains on entering their home, you are honorary family for the day and both he and his wife along with their support staff, make sure that you feel part of the family experience for the duration of the course.From the tour of the Ubud market, you are then taken to Laplapan and to the local school for a quick tour before then being invited into the family home for welcome drinks, a brief background into Balinese tradition and culture and then a day of cooking. I note some negative reviews on here about the length of the course – yes, it does take a while as all of the dishes are prepared from scratch (including the coconut oil) in the traditional manner, so pack some snacks just in case you get peckish. We also felt a little unsure about the school tour – we were unaware this was part of the proceedings and weren’t quite sure what to do so do note that this is part of the package, albeit for only a few minutes. All in all, I learnt more about Balinese culture and tradition in this morning session than on four trips to Bali combined so for me, it was worth every penny.The food was tasty and Puspa was happy to advise on less authentic substitutes to use back home; a full copy of the recipes are provided at the end to take home which was great. If you want a really hands-on, highbrow cooking class, this may not be for you but if you want to be part of a family home whilst learning some of Bali’s most well-known dishes (chicken satay, chicken curry, peanut sauce, steamed fish, sambal etc) then you’ll enjoy the day - you’ll also make two new wonderful Balinese friends in the process.

Brilliant hosts, fantastic food, great experience.. We'd booked ourselves on late and got a call to see if we were ok to be within a large group of 20. As we were leaving the next day we accepted and wondered what this might mean. In the morning your taken round the market in Ubud. Maybe an idea to do this early on in the trip as we'd been to the market but hadn't seen all of it and all it has to offer till after this tour. They split the group in two to at no point did we feel we were losing out due to being part of a big group. Afterwards they take you closer to the village outside Ubud and Wayan explained how they grow rice and why they are trying to go organic. Wayan and his wife Puspa who leads class are characters themselves and it is worth going on this course just to meet them. How they do this day in day out with the energy they showed I have no idea. Afterwards they take you back to their home and explain the layout of Balinese homes and families. This is done in a very relaxed environment and both are full wit and smiles. After you begin to cook and learn the basics of Balinese cooking. To be honest you don't do so much cooking, but you do get a good overview. You get fed and watered well before the main courses are served and I can say all the food was the best we experience on Bali. If you think Balinese food is not that good get yourself on this course as it is as it should be, if not better.

Great hosts and wonderful food. We signed up for the cooking class during our visit and it was brilliant. Puspa and Wayan are amazing hosts and did a good job trying to entertain everyone in the group.The only drawback was the size of the class - I think the experience would have been much better if they try to keep the classes to a small group. Our class had 20+ guests and even though we generally enjoyed the hospitality, I think we would have had more of a chance to learn some techniques and be part of the cooking experience if the class size was smaller.

much more than a cooking class. Wayan and Puspa provide a wonderful insight into Balinese life as well as very thorough instruction in cooking a range of fabulous Balinese food. After being picked up at our hotel we were taken to the markets and where Puspa showed us the different food including spices, fruit and vegetables and gave us a chance to taste many of them. Wayan then took us to the family rice paddies and explained the way the rice is cultivated and the village operates. Then to their family compound and the most amazing cooking experience - small group, plenty of opportunity to cook and taste and a variety of dishes.HIghly recommended - a delightful day.

We had a great day with Puspa and Wayan. Wonderful day, you will start by the Ubud market visit, then you arrive at Puspa and Wayan house. Warm welcome, they are very kind and friendly.It is very well organized so that everybody can contribute. You will feel at home with friends !It is also very clean.You can book directly on their website.

delicious day out. My husband ,myself and our 2 teenage boys booked a cooking class with Paon bali while on holiday in ubud.We had a fantastic ,informative and tasty day .Visiting the markets meeting the family and cooking a wonderul meal .I would thoroughly recommend making the time to do this trip and see and taste a very authentic side of bali.

a special day with puspa. what a day . a great chance to spend time in a village learning about the people of bali then cooking adn eating their food . if yoiu visit bali do not miss this . it is more than just a cooking class.

Fantastic day, great company and amazing food. My partner and I did this class yesterday and it was a fantastic day. It was a great opportunity to learn a little about the Balinese culture, see a traditional family home, the rice fields and then cook some fantastic food. Wayan and his wife and warm and welcoming and make every effort to ensure you have a wonderful time. If you have dietary requirements they are all taken into account which is a massive plus. Highly recommended experience, even if you have next to no cooking skills.

Authentic cooking class in wonderful surroundings. If you are interested in experiencing local culture and an intimate cooking class in a traditional Balinese home, this is it!Wayan picked me up from Ubud and off we went to the market for a tour of the fresh produce and dry goods areas. Next, we visited the village school and padi fields. Finally, we arrived at his family home and met Puspa, Wayan's wonderful wife and also our cooking instructor. I was lucky, on the day I went to the class, there were only four students, so there was plenty of opportunity to be hands on. We cooked all the traditional balinese dishes one usually sees at the restaurants such as gado gado. We cooked ourselves a hearty lunch and Puspa even packed up the leftovers for me to bring back to my sister at the only. The only minor quibble I have is that the events of the day went by rather slowly, but I guess I'm just too much of city dweller. Overall, a wonderful experience. Highly recommended!!

Wonderful experience ... fantastic food and warm, welcoming family. Puspa (aka Honey-Bunnee) and Wayan are wonderful hosts together with their staff of assistants.Wayan provided exceelent insights into Balinese familty culture whilst Puspa provided "hands-on" authentic Balinese cooking recipes and techniques. My wife and 4 other ladies participated in the cooking classes whilst I kicked back, Bintang at the ready chewing the fat with Wayan.It turned out to be a great day finishing with an extremely tasty meal prepared by the cooking "students"I would can sincerely recommend the visit to UBUD as being well worth the ride from (in our case) Legian.

What a fantastic experience!. Our family of four adults were lucky enough to join this course with just one other couple. This group size of 6 seems considerably smaller than the average sizes I have read about on here, and as a result, we had a very personal experience.Wayan and Puspa gave us a fantastic welcome to their home, a great introduction to Balinese life and some fantastic menus to take away and try at home.It is true that you don't do a great deal beyond chopping, pounding, stirring and tasting but the menu is so extensive that I think it would be difficult to do anything more in the time.For me the value of this course was to see some of the techniques and be able to take them away to recreate at home.A wonderful experience to be recommended to any foodies.

Cooking, Culture, Heritage- and damn good food!!!!!!!!!!!. I have been to Bali many times now, and been to several Cooking Classes in the many locations- PAON Bali was the next one to try while we were in Ubud. This was the most informative and pleasant day I think I have spent in Bali. Wayan and Puspa are a real joy to be near. The local and cultural information, the passion about their village (Laplapan) and the farming practices were all a highlight to a fantastic occasion in June. I loved the chance to learn more of the information on family ,communities, the house and compound- and then the cooking WOW I loved every bit of this day. Puspa is a delight as a cooking teacher, Wayan is funny and passionate about heritage and culture. I can only hope that this venture in tourism just keeps getting better and better as more people discover PAON. Please stay as you are, and dont get as commercial as other courses in Bali. For an informative chat- ask Wayan about the charity work he supports also. Very moving. I will be going back with a group next time- as I want everyone to know that there is more to Bali than Bintang and beach! By the way; a great lunch is included too.

Best First Day in Bali - and I've lived here five years!!. I decided to go on this "cooking class" because I met a group of international tourists who had been on the course on their very first day in Bali. I have lived in Ubud for 5 years and it seemed to me that they had understood the essence of Bali in a very short time. I was NOT disappointed. With Puspa we were in the hands of someone with a love and passion for Balinese cooking; we chopped vegetables and blended spices, helped cook several dishes, at EVERYTHING and came home with easy to understand recipes.Her husband Wayan gave us background on the most precious, vital things to know about Balinese culture - why the rice cultivation system still works, despite inroads from tourism, how every Hindu home and village is constructed, how they are ensuring the future of their children's education and the return of their farm land to organic methods.Honestly, I discovered so many things that I had not quite understood, although I have lived here for five years. And the food was amazing!!
Wonderful. The hostess was very funny, we spent the entire time laughing and eating. What's not to like!

Fantastic experience!. Would highly recommend this wonderful husband/wife run cooking experience. Wayan and Puspa make you feel incredibly welcome in their home along with explaining how the Balinese village, rice growing and family heirachy functions. A lot of fun and laughs. Be prepared for some of eye opening sights at the Ubud markets, especially the meats, but don't worry the Paon Bali doesn't use these meats in their cooking. Sign up now for a wonderful day!

the best thing to do in bali!!. This was honestly the best thing I did when I visited Bali. I went with my boyfriend and both of us are really into cooking (me more so than him...) The food we cooked was delicious, and really easy to copy at home (some of the ingredients may be a little difficult to find, but substitutes are recommended.) We also went into the markets and rice paddies, which was really interesting. The hosts, Puspa and Wayan are absolutely lovely and make you feel as part of the family as soon as you walk into their home... which is beautiful by the way. Wayan also gave us information on their home and their culture. I have recommended this to all my friends... it really is such a great experience for such a good price!

Fantastic (and delicious) intro to Balinese culture.. Wayan and Puspa have got it down. They are engaging teachers and generous hosts. Our day with them was the highlight of our week in Bali and exposed us what life is like among the Balinese today--not simply the tourist cliches. The food was fantastic, probably the best Balinese food we ate during our week, and everyone who attended the class (about 10 people) played an integral role in preparing it: from chopping garlic and shallots, to stir frying tempeh. The day begins at Ubud's bustling and aromatic market. Then a visit to the rice paddies outside Wayan and Puspa's village (Laplapan) and then a tour of the town school. Afterwards, we gathered at their beautiful home for lime juice and a brief lecture on Balinese family customs and religious traditions. Most of the day, though, was spent cooking and learning to prepare the essential dishes in Balinese cuisine. I found the instructions in preparing Balinese peanut sauce and the basic yellow curry sauce particularly helpful. I simply cannot understand those reviewers who accused our hosts of focusing too much on Balinese culture and not enough on cooking. For shame! Cooking and culture go hand in hand and it is impossible to appreciate one without the other. Needless to say, the majority of the day was spent around the cutting boards, stoves and hearth. By the time we returned to our hotel, the four of us were dead tired from all of the time on our feet. Tired yes, but also very full and inspired to continue exploring Balinese food and culture at home. Three cheers for Wayan and Puspa!

great experience. Myself and friend wanted to do something a bit different so on recommendations booked the Paon Cooking Class. We booked all by email, Wayan was very prompt in replying. Cost was 350,000 rupiah plus 300,000 rp (per car) for pick up and drop off from our hotel in Kuta.The day started with a trip to the Ubud markets, yukkkkk. Thankfully Wayan assured us they did not buy their produce from there. We then took a trip up to the villages rice paddies and Wayan told us all about the importance of the rice paddies to the families and villages. It was really interesting to hear about.We were then taken to Wayan and Puspas house, there a nice welcome drink and some more chatting about their house and how the locals live. We then went into their outdoor kitchen (spotless) and after a tea or coffee we started on the prep for our lunch. There were about 12 of us and all were given chopping peeling slicing of the various ingredients. Then a demo of how to make coconut oil on the wood fire, how to use the giant mortar and pestle, then we finished off making the mushroom soup. Delicious!!!Then we all chipped in for a bit of stirring to finish off our other dishes - we made 8 in total. You dont make your own dishes in this class its kind of like shared cooking, with Puspa instructing and helping. The food was gorgeous, fresh, tasty and different, we loved itFinshed at 2pm and were taken back to Kuta. the class was suitable for anyone, young or old. You dont have to be a good cook to participate.Wayan and Puspa were lovely and its nice to know that they are both very generous donators within their village

An excellent way to spend an evening in Bali. We really enjoyed our time at Paon Bali. The husband and wife duo literally let you into their home and provide a friendly and warm environment for all. we found the evening to be both educational and entertaining and would highly recommend trying the cooking class out. the food was great, everyone took part in the cooking, and the atmosphere felt like family. Ask questions and enjoy....

So hospitable and incredibly friendly. Best part was being in Balinese home.. What a pleasant experience. I think the best part about Bali is the Balinese people. This class truly exemplifies the Balinese's kindness and hospitality - and that is what makes it such a great cooking class experience (yes, the food is great, too). Wayan picked us up at our hotel and brought us to their home where were learned about the traditions of Balinese houses and home living. We had a hands on cooking class which was simple enough to recreate at home yet complex enough to be unique and deliciously satisfying. I highly recommend this class to anyone who wants to learn how to cook Balinese cuisine and get a peek into the lives of these amazing people.

Absolutely amazing!!. I have traveled to over 25 countries around the world in hopes of experiencing different cultures. This cooking class was 100% the most extraordinary experience abroad I've ever had!! I loved being taken through their home and temple and learning about their beliefs and culture! Then the cooking... WOW!! The kitchen is so clean and large, and the whole area overlooks the beautiful rice fields, it is so peaceful there! I learned so much about cooking and the many, many Baliense dishes we cooked were absolutely to die for! The woman who runs the class is so kind, caring, and fun! We were laughing together the whole time!! I went with my mom to the 4:00 PM class, and plan to go back with my husband to the morning class next time I can make it to Bali! I've already made one of the dishes at home and received so many compliments!! I am a picky eater too, and they let me leave an ingredient out to make sure I was happy! This is hands down a MUST DO when in Bali!! I learned so much about culture and cooking, and being in their village home in such a beautiful, clean place was so special!! I want to go back to Bali with my family and friends just to do this class again!!

Cooking up an adventure. What an experience! Hands down this was the highlight of my trip in Bali this time ‘round. The wife and husband duo are wonderful hosts, great cooks and damn entertaining – and deserve their own cooking show. I tested out the recipes with friends back home in Sydney last night and they were a hit - now planning an Indonesian dinner party with a bigger group soon. Wish me luck.

More than a cooking class-a look at the Balinese lifestyle. Way an and Puspa are fantastic hosts! The class/tour started with a tour of the market ( great experience) to see how every Balinese picks up food for the day, etc. Then a quick stop at their village school and rice paddy fields. We had a short lecture on how the different families maintain their rice patty fields, the process, etc.; then we went to their personal residence for the cooking class. It was very interesting to learn about and see first hand their lifestyle! We had a group of about 20..but it was run so smoothly, we all had something to do in the kitchen! We made a 3 course meal, which was delicious!! Learning about the local foods and how to prepare them was priceless!! Plan to spend most of your day...

A definite highlight - not to be missed!. Wayan and Puspa are simply amazing and their love for what they do shines right through. We were a group of about 15-20 which was fine. The day started with a market tour in the morning followed by a visit of the local school and Wayan's explanation about how the rice harvesting works, the division of land in his village and also so of the issues encountered and the benefits of going organic which are life changing for the people from the village. We made a staggering 8 dishes or so which tasted absolutely marvellous! The day is incredibly well organised and they make you feel really welcome in their beautiful home. Excellent experience and value for money - you won't be disappointed. Highly recommended, even if for "good luck!" :)

not a cooking class.. this paon bali course is not really a course or class at all. it is basically a tour of a market, village and balinese compound with very little cooking done. i called wayan the night before to see if there was any room left. he said, YES and that he will pick us up from out hotel. nice. however, when we got to the market and more and moooore people kept joining us until the group was well over 20 large.after the market we went to a rice padi where wayan talked for a long time about the rice. then we went to the local school which was awkward because i don't like to disrupt kids whilst they are supposed to be studying. when we finally got to the house at around 10.30am to start the cooking class we still did not start the class. yet more talking was to come.we didn't really do any cooking, we mostly watched other people cook for the whole day. boring!lunch was finally served at around 2.30 which was much too late... and you know what the say about too many chef's ruining the food.they should decide if they want to offer a village/house tour or run a cooking class but not do both in one day.there needs to be less answering of questions which have already been asked 2 - 3 times by someone else.more cooking, less talking, less people.

First class cooking cass!. We wereicked promptly from our hotel in Ubud and were first taken to the local markets....an eye opener for some, but a great place to pick up spices, oh and I bought vanilla beans to take home at a very good price. Then we were taken to rice paddies and here was explained the local customs. Then on to the cook school, which is in their home and is very nicely set up. Not only do you get a cook school, but also a cultural tour of their home, beliefs and views. We not only got to taste and cook amazing food, but also how to make coconut oil. I can highly recommend this wonderful experience.

Informative, interactive and really delicious food!. It was more than a cooking class. Puspa and Wayan are a lovely couple, very humorous and hospitable. We also had a very informative tour of the market and the rice fields. The cooking class was conducted in Wayan's and Puspa's home, which was very beautiful too. We made a total of 8 dishes, including a soup and a dessert. Knowing how difficult it would be for us to find local ingredients back home, Puspa also taught us what substitute ingredients we could use. Everyone was involved in the preparation/ cooking at some point in time, be it cutting, pounding, stirring or frying (no need for washing though). It's definitely a great experience for all, the foodie, the kids, even for the dad without culinary interest!The only downside was that the class was conducted for a group of 20 pax, which is pretty big. Also, we didn't get to prepare and cook our own dish from the start to end, only helping out in parts of the cooking.

Definitely a place you need to visit. Cooking Class with Puspa and her husband Wayan was a great experience. I did not only find out how to prepare delicious balinese food, but also I could learn some more about the culture and the way of living of Balinese people. Puspa and Wayan are doing great job and they are lovely people. That is definitely a cooking class that cannot be missed!

An authentic and tasty Balinese experience. My husband and I enrolled in this cooking class after reading all of the excellent reviews. The class did not disappoint and it was actually one of the highlights of our trip to Bali.The class began at an open air market in central Ubud. Our guide introduced us to local spices, produce, flowers and baskets for offerings and clothing. Then we were transported to some beautiful rice paddies. Wayan explained the differences in the sizes of the different patties, the canal system, etc.After our trip to the rice patties, we were transported to Wayan and Puspa's home. We were greeted with a refreshing lemon welcome drink. They spent 10 minutes explaining the structure of a typical Balinese compound and their family history. The discussion ended with your choice of tea or coffee.Finally, we made our way into the kitchen. Puspa explained what we were going to cook and immediately put us to work. Our group of 18, simultaneously worked on different dishes. Puspa and her staff were extremely organized and made sure everyone had enough to do. After we completed the prep work, Puspa explained the ins and outs of a Balinese kitchen. We were even given a demonstration of how to make coconut oil.The meal we made was delicious and we had a lot of leftover food. Trust me-you will not need dinner. All in all we made 1 soup, 6 entrees/salads and 1 dessert. For 35 USD, this cooking class is an unbelievable deal. Not only did I enjoy great Indonesian food, but I also learned a great deal about Indonesian culture, customs and history.

Big class, but worth it. Very enjoyable. Committed people who explain everything very well in a nice setting. Worthwhile doing. Maybe only downside was the rather large size of the group, so the hands-on experience is limited (Above 12 people it gets quite impersonal in my view).

Great culinary & cultural experience. A traditional Balinese cooking class, including a trip to the markets being introduced to all the ingrediance, and to rice fields. Cooking was alot of fun, very interactive and involved everyone. Overall a wonderful day out.

Everything Everyone said it would be. Thanks to all the travelers who recommended this class. It was authentic - best thing we did in our trip to Bali. Our boys - ages 9 & 12 really enjoyed it. I can't say enough about the couple that runs the class -- their energy level is amazing.

Fantastic experience in outdoor kitchen in Puspa's lovely home in local village.. Starting with a tour of the food at Ubud market Wayan then showed us and explained his vilage's rice growing followed by his wife's cooking class in their home. Cooking 8 dishes that I will try at home it was a fantastic experience and my 11 and 14 year olds also loved it with Puspa getting everyone involved.

This was the highlight of my holiday. Fantastic hosts, very friendly and homey. It's great to get out of the main ubud strip and up into a nearby village area. Good value for money. Yummy food and I've managed to even make some of it back home. The rice fields tour was very interesting. We made about 7 different dishes, all very authentic. This family is VERY hard working and were holding down a few jobs each plus hosting 2 classes a day. So it was a little rushed at times, but I would do it again in an instant. The market tour was interesting for the food explanations.

A must for anyone travelling to Bali.. We did this on our recent trip to Bali and can't recommend it highly enough. Even my 8 year old son enjoyed it. Not just a lesson in Balinese cuisine but a lesson in village lifestyle and generational history. Food was divine and our hosts where amazing. Highlight of our second trip to Bali.

It was a day about the whole experience. Sharing it with others and in a family home was truly wonderful.. From the start to being dropped off we were totally looked after. The hands on of preparing and cooking was fantastic. The smells, the colours and the simplicity was an experience to be had. The generosity of Wayan and Puspa was warm and open, all of which was my Bali experience. Highly recommend it to anyone wanting to do a Bali Cooking Class. Will do it again next visit!!!cheersKim

Had a fanstatic day learning about the food and culture of bali. My husband and l spent the day at this cooking course with 8 others it was one of our highlights of our tripWe visited the market their village and ended up at their home to cook with food which had been grown by them, they where very entertaining and the food was fabulousIf any one wants to do a cooking course then this is the one to do its small and personal

Wonderful!. I can only agree with all the reviews. My 16 year old daughter and I loved the whole experience - visiting the market, the rice paddies, the family compound, preparing the delicious food and then the fun of eating it with the friendly group who made up the class. Wayan and Puspa and their staff are so warm and welcoming - you really do feel at home. This is a wonderful way to gain an insight into Balinese families and culture and easily one of the highlights of our trip. Highly recommended!

Delicously Fun, Informative & Friendly. Upon entering this true modern Balinese compound we were greeted with love, a cool towel, and a tasty beverage. We were constantly encouraged to make ourselves at home as if we were with family. The friendly and knowledgeable cooking team is lead by the delightful lady of the house Puspa. They taught us some of the basics in Balinese cooking, had us pick fresh herbs and vegetables from their garden, explained the different ingredients, and let us get hands on in all the steps of the preparation. Overall we cooked about 7 dishes that were all unique and very yummy. The entire experience was very pleasurable and I hope to do it again!

If you only do one cultural thing in Bali, make this it!. We have just come back from an absolutely amazing cooking class, cultural experience and a day with the most wonderful family in Bali. We begun with a tour of the markets, then a tour and explanation of the rice paddies, a look around a traditional Balinese home and then a few hours of excellent and delicious cooking.All of the ingredients are grown in their garden or sourced from organic growers. Everything is explained and recipes are given so you can repeat the recipes back home.Thank you Puspa and Wayan we had a fantastic day and will be back!

Awesome Experience. we did the afternoon class and it was absolutely amazing. Wayan picked us up from our Hotel and we drove to the village rice paddies and he told us about those for a while. Then we drove to the family home where Puspa was waiting for us. After welcome drinks we got told about traditions and religion. We went onto the cooking part. Puspa told us all about ingredients, which most of them they grow themselves. We started cooking the entree and then sat down and ate it. Then we got up and cooked a few different mains and sat down to eat that and got up for cooking the dessert again and sat down and ate it. It was an amazing meal! So many yummy things!! Fresh ginger tea and cold Bintang to finish off the evening. Well worth the money! Thanks Wayan & Puspa

The most fun you can have with a wok. Doing this course not only helps one learn about Balinese cooking: a trip to the paddy fields shows where/how the rice grows, visiting a food market introduces the ingredients and even the culture of family and community are explained by the delightful hosts - Wayan and Puspa - before any cooking happens! Enjoy a fabulous (and cheap) experience that will stay with you forever.

fantastic experience. had intended to attend another ubud cooking school however our resort recommended Paon and so glad they did. Once picked up by Wayan we were driven to village rice paddies and given informative talk on the workings of the village and irrigation by Wayan we were then driven to & welcomed into the beautiful home of Wayan & Puspa with a refreshing drink for one informative fun filled arvo/evening. Puspa and staff were excellent hosts and teachers and made sure everyone participated in the preparation of a scrumptious bali feast which we all sat down at the completion of cooking and enjoyed after our fun filled night we were given copies of the recipes This was a definate highlite of our trip and would return to do it all again a big thankyou to all at Paon Bali Cooking Class

Don't miss it.... If you don't know what to do in Bali , don't miss this- Paon Cooking Class in Ubud. A place that you get to know people from different countries, get to learn the culture of Balinese Family and d cooking of course. Puspa and Wayang were a good host, made us feel like we know them for so long or rather like a family. The cooking session itself was great, the dishes were great, enjoying our lunch with nice panorama surrounding, it was awesome...miss them now...So much laughter and Joy , really highly recommended place to visit in Ubud!

Surprising to say the least. I thought I had signed up for a cooking class but it was so much more than that. The chef Wayan picked me up from the hotel, the drove to the local markets to see how its done. Luckily they have already purchased their food as it is pretty amazing what they sell and the conditions the food is often in. More of an eye opener more than anything else. Then we go up to Wayans village and he shows us around and how the village operates, how each family has a rice patty plot and how they cultivate it. They you actually go to Wayan and his wife Puspa's home to cook! You are taught all about the culture and cooking, it is really quite amazing. they are both very funny and accommodating and make sure you get involved in the preparation of the meals. A very well though out day and it does go all day so if you were thinking of a quick half day it is not. You also get a lift back to the hotel. All of this for half the cost of a nice meal out back at home. I could not recommend anything higher in ubud if looking for something to do.

Cooking was only one ingredient to a great experience.. Puspa and Waylan take you on a wonderful journey that includes Balinese Cooking in their home (where you are a 'participant' not just an "onlooker") but the day begins with a trip through the Farmers Market to learn more about the food and spices that you will be working with; a stop at a rice field to see and hear about how complex something so small as a grain of rice is to plant and harvest; then finally being a guest in their home.I learned so much about Balinese culture in these few hours, not to mention meeting wonderful people.This makes a trip to Bali a unique and memorable experience. I will return and urge everyone that really wants to learn about the culture to do the same.

Great experience - a MUST do in Bali!. The Paon Bali Cooking Class was the highlight of our trip to Bali. It's a definite MUST do in Bali! The day started off with a tour in a local market by Puspa and then we were shown their village's rice paddies by Wayan. After that we brought to their house and it such an amazing experience. It was a great way to learn about Balinese tradition and culture. Wayan and Puspa were both very friendly and were fantastic hosts! On top of all of that, cooking was really fun! The dishes we made were so delicious and everyone participated. It was really rewarding experience and I would definitely recommend it to anyone going to Bali.

Best thing we did in ubud...cultural experience with superb food and fun. This was a cultural experience. Well paced. Well designed. Superb tasting.Ten of us in the class began at the market, then learned about rice in the fields near wayan's home compound, then learned about family, religion marriage, and the family temple and family life in the gorgeous village and inside the lovely compound of wayan's that includes his great uncle who is nearly a hundred years old.He and his wife were welcoming and the set up in the back for the cooking is great. You each have jobs of mostly chopping, then several demos, then you get a chance to help prepare which ever dish you like....all were yummy.Steamed tuna, gaddo gaddo with divine peanut sauce, chicken curry with this miraculous yellow sauce you grind up and put in every dish almost, long bean salad, satay in the Balinese style cooked ogre coconut husks, fried bananas, rice and tea. It is very well paced and extremely tasty and if you do not eat it all, can even take some home...it is very very reasonably priced too and they pick you up.I made back the fee by going back to the market to the vendor they recommended and buying some things the next day.Loved the staff who helped, the food, the magical setting, meeting the family..loved it all.

Just a magical day enriched with Balinese culture.. We started the day by been taken to the morning market.We then took a drive through there village and stop and help some local villagers harvest the rice. If you are looking for an awesome cooking experience in a local balinese home (that has been set up for cooking classes) then i can't recommend this enough. They catered for all our taste. The food we cook was absolutely delicous, at the end of each course I just looked -wondering how I managed to create something so wonderful.Even if you not into cooking then I would say just go for the food. Its worth every penny. Also we found out that the husband teaches english to the village children (60+) every weekend. If I had known that before I left for Bali I would have taken some of my son's first books with me to help him. So if you haven't left for Bali yet maybe you could take some first language books with you for him.

Charming, lovely hosts and a great way to see real Bali.. We attended yesterday's class with our kids, age 10 and 11. It was as good as everything you read on trip advisor! We all loved it, and will likely count it as the highlight of our trip. I mostly loved the information on the villages and the homes of Bali.

All the other reviews are spot on. I won't bother repeating what every other review has said, as they're all spot on.I will, however, mention that if you aren't real keen on spicey food (like us), metion it at the start and they can pull out some of the ingredients before they put in the spices for everyone else.We didn't even think about that, so couldn't eat many of the dishes that we'd helped cook. It wasn't until afterwards that Wayan said he could have done this - next time!

Excellent home cooking experience. I joined the Paon Cooking class this morning, being collected from my hotel by the delightful Wayan, husband to Puspa, whom we met at the market. The shopping experience was wonderful - seeing herbs & spices difficult to find or afford back home in plentiful supply, the whole chickens being cut up by a cleaver, fresh fish in baskets, temple offerings being put together & the fresh fruit & veg was amazing.The class itself takes place in their home, after a visit to their rice field which was being cultivated by nine hard working women. The meals our group cooked were a culinary delight & easy to prepare with each person being given a task from chopping temeph & tofu to slicing shallots, garlic & other vegetables.All in all, the most fantastic cooking class I have done to date & I would thoroughly recommend to all. As a vegetarian, there were plenty of choices & the hosts were nothing short of hospitable. I wish them both every success with their venture.

It is all that it is cooked up to be.... Loved it. My wife and I had a great day. The cooking was great, although without the recipes we would be lost...but the real bonus was the cultural insight into how this enlightened Bali family live. Their village politics, hinduism, family life, and general economy. Overall a very generous expression of Bali hospitality.

Not to be missed!. A full cultural experience...Puspa and her husband provide insights to the Balinese family, as well as a wonderful cooking experience. They choreograph the chopping, preparing, and cooking well, and it was one of the best meals I've had in Bali!

Such a blast!. I try to take a cooking course each place I visit, and this was great fun! Puspa started us on a tour of the Ubud market, trying various fruits and buying items for our cooking. Then we rode to their village, where Wayan explained agriculture in Bali, out in a rice field. We next traveled to their house, where we were given a welcome drink and an explanation of a Balinese house (fascinating!). Then we began with a tour/explanation and then started cooking. The class was large and different people were charged with different tasks. I enjoyed this because we were able to mingle with various groups but it may not be ideal for some - I did not see all parts of any dish, so if that's your goal you may be disappointed.Then we sat down to eat - wow! The food was just terrific and the table was full of interesting people; I really enjoyed the conversation of a very varied group.Wayan and Puspa were lovely hosts - one of the people in the class had been injured in a motorcycle accident, and Wayan administered first aid so graciously! Wayan drove me back and welcomed me to visit again to his house! I had hoped for a great cultural experience but got so much more due to Wayan and Puspa's incredible graciousness - they made it a day to remember.

Much more than anticipated. The cooking class was excellent. Very hands on and a wonderful way to learn about the ingredients and cooking styele for Bali. Every person on the tour was asked to help with the prep work and e actual cooking.But what made this an OUTSTANDING trip was e visit to the local food market with a ful explanation of the ingredients, customs and history of the market. As well, the tour spent a bit of time getting to know the village in which the family runs it's program! We stopped at a rice field and saw everything from harvest and separation of the grain through replanting.The host fmily was very open to explaining EVERYTHING abut their life and their home. If you desire tp get to know the real Ubud area of Bali, and not just the more obvious tourist sections, do not hesitate in the least to book this tour. We also recommend booking in advance, as our Sunday excursion was fully booked

Wow we loved it. This was such a great tour. We loved it. The group was not too big. We learnt loads of things about food and Bali. This husband and wife team were great. The food was so yummy. I cant wait to make it when I get home.

Top Balinese cultural experience!. Wayan and Puspa are the most welcoming hosts ever! The day began with a lesson on typical Balinese ingredients at the markets, then a stroll through the family rice paddy and finally a feast on our own creations at the family home. Having the class at their home was the highlight! Thanks for a fantastic day in Ubud!

Depends what you are after. I like to cook and I cook a lot so I was expecting a proper cooking class. Unfortunately I don't feel the experience was set up that way. It was more of a get to know Bali culture and cook traditional food with a big group of people. Don't get me wrong, it was lovely. The family was very welcoming and kind, they taught us a lot about the culture, rice and some of the basic ingredients included in the cooking. But, all the cooking I did was chop garlic, chillies and stir a pot. I was not a big fan of this, particularly because I can't help compare it to other classes I've taken where I learned about the ingredients, cooking style and was required to make all of my own dishes... If you are looking for a casual view into Bali culture and have a fun large meal with lots of people, than this is great. If you are looking for a proper cooking class which will increase your cooking skills and awareness of Bali ingredients then.. maybe try elsewhere.

A Must Do!. Paon Bali was a highlight of our honeymoon and a must-do that we are still talking about. The owners make you feel right at home, and teach you about family life, the market, rice and cooking all in one glorious day at their beautiful home. The market tour gave us a peek into real life in Ubud and was really fun. Onto the rice fields, where we learned about the family system and cultivation, and then to their home to start the lessons. We enjoyed the cooking and sampling very much- and eventually our delicious lunch. A must do for your trip- great fun and learning in a hands on way you won't forget.

Fantastic!- The BEST thing we did in Ubud!. We had such a wonderful time during our Paon Bali Cooking Class. The owners were wonderful and the chef was very knowledgeable, attentive and great to learn from. When we got picked up from our hotel we were first taken to the rice fields- where we got to learn about how the rice is harvested and then got to interact with the farmers and actually work in the rice fields for a bit! That was a great experience! We then went to the house where the cooking class would take place. The owners of the class (and house) were extremely welcoming and made you feel right at home. Since we did the afternoon class (started at 4pm) we (my husband and I) were the only ones, which made it even better because we got to do all of the cooking! All of the ingredients that we used were fresh and some were even organic! I loved that the kitchen was kept very clean all of the time. We made about 7 different dishes that were all very good and manageable to make once I came back to the States. My husband is not a big fan of cooking but he even had a great time! I am so glad we got to do this class as it was not only a cooking class but a true Balinese cultural experience. I truly recommend it.

Must do experience. The Paon Bali cooking class was a great experience, the food, the people and the location was fantastic. I would highly recommend this to everyone, Puspa and Wayan made the day so much fun, it’s 9 out of 10.

Wonderful hosts - a fun experience. We were lucky to enjoy a special evening class with only 2 other participants. This made the experience far more enjoyable as we really felt we were part of Wayan and Puspa's family. They both have such a wonderful sense of humour and are so passionate about what they do, it was a real highlight of our trip to Ubud. The food we helped prepare was excellent and to try out authentic methods of preparation (mortar and pestle as opposed to a food processor) made the experience quite special. Their home is located overlooking a beautiful valley, and just to see that was wonderful.Thank you Wayan and Pupsa, you and the cooking course were a highlight of our holiday!

Don't miss it. I was also on a very large group to the cooking school but I found it an awesome group and a thoroughly well organised experience. Puspa and Wayan organise an excellent day incorporating village life, the rice fields and cooking and was by far the most interesting day I spent in Bali. Though the group was large that day I found there was exactly as much actual cooking available as you wanted to do. I learnt several new techniques I have not yet put into practice but I certainly shall do. As for the eating.... fantastic!

the most amazing day in Bali , do not miss this opportunity to learn.... From the moment we were greeted by this dynamic duo of husband and wife , we were well taken care of .An interresting visit to the market where tourist would not realy go, we learn about vegetables and fruits, spices and culture .A short trip to the country side to get the real story about rice patty and living on this land .Then we were off to the host house , clean , traditionea and fill with stories of today living .After we got explantion of produce and recepies the guests all participated in cutting and chopping, grinding, cooking of at least 7 dishes. At two large tables we ate our realy delicious food and chat about our differents contries .The day is full of good stories ,food and our great host!!!

Not really a cooking class. although it was a great day, dont expect to do much cooking. We had a very large group of 24. and the most cooking i did was chop two carrots. I would not recommend to anyone wanting to actually cook a full meal then eat it (which is what i assumed a cooking class was)I would not return.

Simply the Best!. First of all a huge thank you to the owners Puspa & Wayan! This was by far one of the best activities I have done throughout my travels in Bali. On all of my future travels I now plan on incorporating a cooking class and they will be hard pressed to beat our experiences with you. I cannot urge all future travelers to Ubud enough to register for a cooking class with Puspa and Wayan. We loved every aspect of this tour: shopping at the local ubud market for our cooking ingredients in the early am, learning about and exploring the rice paddies in their local village, cooking a delicious Indonesian meal from scratch in Puspa and Wayan's personal home/kitchen and, I cannot forget the best part, eating our delicious meal! Thank you for such a great experience and all the great memories. I will make sure to book a second class when we return to Bali!

A Must Do!. A fabulous and informative cooking class. I travelled up from Legian in the morning and it was well worth the trip.Puspa & Wayan are great hosts and Puspa is very patient with all the questions and queries.I only hope I can replicate all the flavours now I am home!

Paon Bali Cooking Class - highly recommend!. It is clear that Puspa and Wayan have built their business on a base of love of Bali and cooking, and they and their whole family made us feel right at home immediately. The highlight of the day was certainly the cooking, where we prepared nine dishes. This was the best food we had in Bali during our stay!!We had a group of ten, and there was lots of hand-on cooking to be done! "Aunty Puspa" and her staff were very good at explaining all the steps and ensured that everyone got a turn at cooking (and taste testing!) all of the dishes. We received a printed copy of the recipes, and tonight on our first night home from Bali, we tried to re-create Puspa's clear mushroom soup - not quite right without the fresh kaffir lime leaves (we plan to create our own Balinese vegetable garden just like Puspa's!). We loved Puspa's tour of the market and being able to ask all those silly questions you've always wanted to ask (what is that spiky fruit?!), and also loved being entertained by Wayan with his explanation of rice harvesting.I would highly recommend this class to anyone visiting Bali.

The Best Cooking Class and Cultural Experience in Bali. We enjoyed the hospitality of Wayan and Puspa in their intimate cooking class. It was the highlight of our visit to Ubud. They both exude personality, spark and ensure that everyone understands a bit about the markets, rice growing, family living conditions and especially how to prepare, cook and eat delicious, fresh and ultra Balinese foods. We highly recommend this not only for the food, but for the wonderful delight of being entertained in a real Balinese home with real and enthusiastic hosts. Thanks for a fabulous experience!!

It was great!. Really enjoyed it! A wounderful couple , Wayan and Puspa, who were hosting us there in their own house, were full of energy and sense of humour and let us know a bit more of their own way of living! It was not a cooking class only, but a sort of combination of cultural experience, great fun and great lunch! Would recommend it to everybody!

Real Balinese food, authentic surroundings, the loveliest hosts.... This course is absolutely excellent. The hosts, Wayan and Puspa, are a genuinely delightful couple who welcome you into their beautiful home and share with you a fascinating insight into Balinese life. The market visit is so interesting and fun, the descriptions of life in the village and how this is mirrored across Bali is one of the best memories from our trip to Bali - it gives a real understanding of Balinese life that adds to the enjoyment of being on such a wonderful island. The variety of dishes cooked is excellent. We had a little production line going in the gaden kitchen and Puspa explained excellently how the dishes were coming together. Everything was delicious and it was a truly wonderful experience and day out. I would have one small criticism - there were 18in our group, and I feel that was slightly too many - a few people didn't get a chance to do much more than a bit of veg chopping - and eating of course. I think a limit of around 12 would be better, but that's being really picky! Highly recommended, and you get to take all the receipes away too in a beautifully presented folder.

highly recommend. what a wonderful day and experiece this was. been to Bali many times and at the end of this (26 day) trip, decided to attend this cooking class with my sister and our 16yo daughters. We all thoroughly enjoyed it. Our hosts, Puspa and Wayan, both such beautiful, humble people with a lovely sense of humour, take you into their home and their hearts. at the end of the class you get to eat all that was mad, what a feast. I might also add that the cost of this was a lot less than most of the other cooking classes.Since returning to Australia I have cooked a few dishes I learnt and they turned out beautifully.

An experience not to be missed!. I had read the reviews from TripAdvisor before going to Bali and was inspired to do the class even though I am not the worlds biggest foodie. I am so glad that I did. Visiting the market was not just about identifying spices, vegetables and fruit, but also to share an insight into offerings and even how to get into the fruit without getting it all over yourself! There was a little bit of discussion about the rice paddies but I found that other tours gave a more detailed explanation, particularly the Bali Nature Herbal Walk, but the information was complimentary. We also talked about traditional compounds, their layout and composition. Again, other tours covered this, such as the Eco Bali Cycling Tour but it was good to see it from another perspective.But the real experience was the cooking! This was no cooking demonstration, everyone had a part to play - chopping, grinding, mixing, cooking and tasting. I'm no expert but they do get you to work to your skill and interest level. We even had two children on the course and they were given tasks such as stirring and grinding. It really is a class for everyone.The culmination of our endeavours was a feast - and it was worth it! I couldn't agree more that this was the best Balinese food I had tasted and to know that I was a part of it made it taste even better!One word of warning though, they do run on Bali time. A few of us were a bit worried when the pick up was late and even asked our hotels to call to confirm. We needn't have feared though as they did arrive. Of course, by running on Bali time they were patient to take us through everything and didn't rush us out the door to get us back to our hotel by 1:30pm. We got back around 3pm. So if you book the morning trip, expect to be out most of the day.Wayan, Puspa and the other members of the team all made us feel extremely welcome. It was a fantastic experience and I thoroughly recommend it!

gracious hosts, lush setting, fabulous food. We joined this class on the recommendation of a friend who has been on two separate occasions and were not disappointed. Puspa and Wayan are welcoming hosts, I felt as if I was "helping out" in a friend's kitchen and the meal we prepared was fresh, delicious and simple - definitely a couple of dishes I will cook at home (ingredients used in the recipes are readily available in Australian supermarkets).Also enjoyable was the friendly banter with the others in our group of 19 as we moved between various preparation stations, shared our meal and exchanged hints and tips for travel/tours in Bali. Bintang is available for purchase, will be taking a bottle of Two Islands chardy on my next visit.

Delightful way to relax and learn. Starting with a trip to the market, visit to the village rice fields and then the 9 course cooking and eating experience, this was a day to remember. Having heard about other cookery experiences form travellers then I would suggest that this is the one to go for. There is lots of information to take in right through the day and if you are not in the mood to listen and take in the culture and traditions of the hosts then stay on the beach; but if you are ready to immerse yourself in the day then this will feature high in your memories of Bali. Our tip is to arrange a one way transfer from the organisers at the start oif the day then take the opportunity to go into Ubud after the school ends in the afternoon; spend 4 or 5 hours cruising the shops and stalls, grab some dinner and arrange a taxi back to your base.

Hilight of our trip!. We had a wonderful day ! From the time the driver picked us up in Kuta till the moment he dropped us back.Visits to all food markets,rice paddies and information about the family compounds all very interesting>Puspa and Wayan went out of their way to include everybody and offered as much hands on as people wanted to experience.It was a very hot day and they were continually looking out for everyone and made a point of speaking to everyone individually and finding out a little about them as well as sharing alot of themselves.I would liken it to visiting a family you already knew ,the friendly banter amongst the staff and shared anecdotes made for a very enjoyable day for everyone ,even those who arent that into cooking.I have noted that other reviewers have thought the class size too large,however ours was 20 people and that added to the fun mix I thought. I wonder if people would be happy to pay alot more for a guaranteed small class size .We also gained alot of interesting travel info from our fellow classmates whom we wold not have otherwise met.Thankyou Puspa and Wayan and all your great staff for a wonderful day and we will think of you when we try and recreate your dishes!

PAON BALI COOKING CLASS - BEST THING WE DID IN BALI. Our family did the Paon Cooking Class. This was the best thing we did in Bali without getting ripped off. The Hosts were very interesting and funny and passionate. Making sure that everyone was happy. Went out of there way to ensure we had enough food, especially cooking a soup for my husband and son because they didn'tlike the mushrooms.Apparently someone wrote on there site that they talked to much, I feel people should stop and think before they make these comments, as they talked enough for us to understand the culture etc. Best day out and hands on as well.

Wonderful cultural experience. We thoroughly enjoyed our day with Puspa and Wayan. They are truly professional at what they do. The food we prepared was the best we had eaten in Bali all week. We really appreciated the opportunity to experience the market and the rice paddies where Wayan explained the intricacies of the culture. I would recommend this to those wanting a cultural and food experience within a Balinese home, and perhaps not for those wishing a one on one master class. I came away with a good appreciation of the local food.

Forget Bumbu Bali restaurant, this is the real Balinese food. Fantastic!. What can I say... We have been a little disappointed with the true Balinese food until last night. What a wonderful setting, accompanied by two funny and truly entertaining hosts with amazing food. Even got a tour of the rice paddies!

To Many cooks spoil the day. Having just returned from this cooking class (not much cooking) with my wife' we found the class to be over booked ( were told the maximum was 14 but on the day there was 24 of us) even though the host's were fantastic and very welcoming it failed to teach us any real cooking.We have done other cooking class's in Bali that offered a greater learning experience and was much more enjoyable .

Can highly recommend it!. We loved this cooking class. The hosts Wayan and Pupsa really go out of their way to make you feel welcome and give you a great experience. It is brilliantly organised. I agree, this was not just a cooking class this was a cultural experience. Well worth the money. Great meal!My only criticism would be that they need to be careful about numbers. There were 20 people in our class and I would have enjoyed it even more if there had of been a max of 10-12 people. So my advise would be to ask how many bookings they have for the day you want to go. It was also a slightly long winded experience. But I still can't fault it for the food, hospitiality, organisation and experience.

Pleasant day but class too big and too long. I was really looking forward to this class after excellent reviews. The hosts were lovely and it was nice to be set in the family compound. I am a vegetarian and they went out of the way to make sure I was catered for.Unfortunately, on they day of our class there was an issue with the booking system and the class was overbooked. This meant that it wax not as hands on as expected and a lot of people missed out on doing some things. It also meant the day dragged on two hours later than expected, and I had to cancel later plans.Having said that, the food and experience was lovely and I will assume the 'overbooking' was a one-off. As long as the classes are small and run on time, then I would recommend this for a cultural experience.

We had a fantastic day, thoroughly recommend you try!. Read our thoughts and check out the photos of our fantastic day here :
http://fabulous-destinations.blogspot.com/2011/04/bali-day-2-paon-bali-cooking-class.html

for anyone who eats - highly recommended. Nothing was too much trouble. There was plenty of opportunity to cook - but fine for those who were happier to talk and observe. The trip to the market was great and visting the rice paddy was very informative - increased our appreciation of the Balinese lifestyle. The food was truly unbelievable - flavours and textures were magnificent, big variety of dishes, and they catered without batting an eyelid for three different food allergies / avoidances / intolerances. We would recommend this experience for anyone who eats!

A wonderful cultural and culinary experience!. We were a group of 8 (with two kids) with a mixture of meat eaters, vegetarians and three with fish and garlic allergies- but nothing was too much trouble for Wayan and Aunty Puspa! Such an interesting and varied experience. There was plenty of hands on preparation and lots of chances to contribute to the cooking. The food was scrumptious +++. The visit to the market and rice field made so interesting due to Wayan's knowledge and his willingness to share his culture. Highly, highly recommended.

A Waste of My Time In Bali. After reading such amazing reviews, we were really looking forward to our cooking class and taking our new knowledge back to our friends at home.We were picked up at 7am from Legian and taken to the markets in Ubud where we were shown around and given the opportunity to try different fruits and look at the various stalls. This was interesting to see. After that we hopped in a van and headed to the hosts family rice paddy. There we got to see how many people were actually in our group, around 20 not including some young children. We stood out the front looking at the rice paddy for around 45 minutes which was nice, but a little over done. The host was incredibly friendly and welcoming, and continued to reassure us that the size of our group wouldn't impact on the interactiveness of the day. We then went onto his family home where we were shown around and given a cool drink. By this stage we were getting peckish and were more than ready to get our hands working in the kitchen! More waiting, more showing around and more talking. Finally we head into the kitchen. But with over 20 of us there was little to do, we were all put at a chopping station. The group prepared each meal together. Well by prepared I mean, we got to chop or grate an item each. Then they were cooked by one or two willing volunteers and the hosts wife while we all stood around and watched. Given the size of the class we were given little opportunity to be interactive. Standing around watching other people cook grew more and more tedious so most people sat and waited around chatting with each other while our hunger grew more and more. The first opportunity were were given to eat was at 2.30, and we were all ravenous!!!!It truly was a waste of time, as it was not a hands on experience. I would have learned more watching Ready Steady Cook. The class has obviously become so popular that they have increased the class size. I think that perhaps if the class was small it would have been much better. Also, having young children running around and crying did not help!

Pa(o)inful! Couldn't pay me to do it again!. We found this cooking school on Trip advisor, booked months in advance and were very much looking forward to the experience promised by its reviews. We could not have been more disappointed.There were 20 people in our group, 10 more people than they should have had. The hosts were friendly and welcoming that was where our enjoyment ended.We were taken to the markets & introduced to some Balinese ingredients, after which were taken to shops and asked if we wanted to buy anything from the guides friend. We were shown the family rice paddies, the host explained how these are run, which was interesting but unnecessary long. It was not at all interactive, the only thing I actually did all day was grate some coconut (which I had already mastered as a child). We went with another couple and met a couple on the day , we as well as all the others in the very large school spent most of the day with nothing to do and gradually becoming more and more hungry.We left Legian@ 7am and did not eat until 2:30pm. I expected to come home & have the knowledge & skills to prepare a beautiful Indonesian meal for my friends and family...but they would be bored with grated coconut.Re-reading the reviews again I cant believe it was the same place, maybe they have become too greedy and increased the class sized beyond their capacity, but it certainly was not something I would recommend to anyone. This was not a cooking school, we learned nothing and wasted a day on our beautiful holiday in beautiful Bali.

Great hospitality but not really a hands on cooking class.. I can't really complain about the day. They were great hosts and made sure everyone was catered for. The price very reasonable. It could have been much better. However, the group was far too big (24 people) so we really didn't get much hands on cooking time. Only two cooking stations. One suggestion - check the numbers before going on this trip.

Informative and interesting menu.......great fun too on 16th April. We had a fantastic experience from booking to transfers from our Villa property to Ubud market, paddi field explanations and warm hospitality in the home or Wayan and Puspa. We have already just last night entertained guests back in Sydney with some of the delicious recipes....which were well received. Have recommended to more friends who are in Bali now for Easter.

Wonderful!. It was raining that day, but the hospitality and excellent customer service made it the rain disappear. This wonderful couple let us into their home and showed us the essence of Bali and Balinese cuisine. Loved the food! They were careful if anyone had allergies or foods they couldn't eat. This was really a great experience.

My most memorable experience in Bali. Thanks to Puspa and Wayan, I felt I was celebrating a great family feast and everyone present was family, cooking together. Starting with the market experience with Puspa, the rice fields with Wayan, and then back to the family compound to experience a home-cooked Balinese meal at its best, it is difficult to find words to express my joy and delight. I thoroughly enjoyed the preparations, especially because everything was so fresh and hands-on experience was encouraged. I was the only vegetarian that day and Puspa made sure I was not left out; in fact, I helped prepare and ate the most delicious vegetarian meai I've ever eaten. Paon Bali Cooking Class is a must for anyone visiting Bali.

A Must See. It was more than a cooking class it was a cultural experience. Puspa and Wyan were wonderful and make you feel at home. The market tour was 'golden' and Puspa took the time to explain everything even what prices to pay for certain items and we were able to taste fresh produce. Puspa was a great teacher and was support by amazing staff. The food was fantastic and the company was great. Their house was beautiful and their kitchen garden was inspirational. This was the highlight of my trip.

Best Food EVER!!. This was a great way to spend a day in Ubud. We were picked up at our hotel and taken to the markets, which was an experience in itself. The food we cooked was hands down the best tasting food I had my entire trip in Bali. We were also given the recipes for everything we made on the day to try at home. My only complaint would be the size of the cooking class - there were 17 people on the day I did it. Their kitchen is quite large and they were able to handle the size, but I would have preferred a more intimate class.

Extremely authentic and an experience that won't be forgotten!. Paon cooking class was more than a cooking class. It was a wonderful insight into Balinese culture and the life that they lead. Puspa and wyan were great hosts and made us feel like we were at home. Cooking class with Puspa and her lovely staff was fab and can't wait to get home and start cooking some of the wonderful dishes that we learned. My husband that has a "don't cook / won't cook attitude" loved it also and is inspired to try some dishes at home in our kitchen! If you are visiting Ubud I would highly recommend Paon Bali cooking class!

Awesome Day out. Our day out with Puspa and Wayun was educational and fun. Our group of 6 thoroughly enjoyed all aspects of this. It was more than just a cooking class. We got to visit the markets and rice paddies and to top it off we got to enjoy cooking at their home. Puspa was so kind and patient with all us amatuer indonesian cooks, and Wayun talk was educational and he also made the perfect host. We learnt so much, had a laugh and had the best lunch ever. WE would highly recommend this day out to all that love good food and good company.

Just a great day. Not being a cook, I had some reservations when my wife suggested we attend a cooking class, but this was much more!It turned out to be as much a cultural experience as a cooking class. The family running the school are delightful and obviously take a great deal of pride in their culture. The food was amazing and everyone gets to sample the results with a lunch to end the day. We were very impressed with the level of hygiene and the care taken to accommodate everyone in the process. Very, very good value and very worthwhile.

Wonderful day spent with lovely people. Very enjoyable experience. Puspa and Wayan are fantastic people who welcomed us into the home. Their home is beautiful and we thoroughly enjoyed all the stories we were told. The food we cooked was delicious, i hope we will be able to replicate the yummy food. Would reccomend to anyone who enjoys excellent company and great food.

Fantastic. I think mist if the other reviews have covered what this course involves, so I will just add that it is fantastic. A cooking course and more, you walk away feeling that you have really learnt about how the Balinese people live, their family life and beliefs. The couple are so sweet and kind and they truly wNt you to have a wonderful day. This course is one not to be missed. The food after everones hard work is still the best I have tasted after 10 days in Bali!

One for good luck. Great day five stars from us. The market and rice paddy tour starts off the day well then you learn a little about their culture beliefs and such like. Then the cooking it is so much fun Puspa, Wayan and the rest of the staff, as well as all the other people you meet from so many different areas and back grounds make it so much fun and the food is just wonderful. Can't wait to try a few reciepes when we get back to Perth, even had a vegetarian dish that I never thought could taste so good. If your only a little bit into food this is a must do it is brilliant. Thanks Honey Bunny

A Fantastic Expirience in Bali!!!!. Paon Bali Cooking Class was one of the best activities we did in Bali.  Don't be mistaken by the title. It is more than a cooking class.  Wayan provides free pickup at your hotel in Ubud. From there you stop at his family's personal rice paddy where he explains the process of making rice from growing the plants to maintaining them all the way to harvesting and cooking the rice.  The paddies themselves are a beautiful green-yellow during March and this was a perfect time to take pictures.After touring the paddies Wayan's wife Puspa was our personal guide through the local food markets where she explained the differences between strainers and hats, spices and herbs, and fruits and vegatables.  The cooking class itself was bomb!  Puspa, an expert chef, was very detailed in every step with documentation to accompany every recipe. There was about nine of us in the group and everyone had a chance to participate. I am slightly incompetent when it comes to food preparation and especially onion chopping but luckily there were other staff members to help out. The end dishes were, seriously, the most delicious Balinese dishes you've ever had in your life. There was chicken, rice, curry sauce, peanut sauce, vegetables and dessert beyond this world. One of the most valuable parts of the class though is just being taken inside their home. It was really fascinating to learn about the architecture of their house and the traditions of Balinese families. We would highly recommend Paon Bali Cooking Class to anyone visiting Bali!!

Great Experience, Great Food..Highly Recommended. The Paon Cooking Class was one of our best experiences in Bali. The hosts/teachers, Puspa and Wayan were very kind, and personable. We not only got a lesson in Balinese cooking but were given some history and background about the Balinese people and their culture. After an informative visit to the local market, there was plenty of hands-on experience with prepping items for the various food items that were on the menu. Myself and my girlfriend had a great time and thoroughly enjoyed every single food item which we ate for lunch once done. We are so glad that we were able to fit the class into our vacation and will definitely be using the recipes to try our hand at making the items on the menu at home. Again, the class was one of the most memorable things we did in Bali and I highly recommend it. We had a ball!

Exceeded my expectations, and I'm a foodie critic!. Puspa and Wayan host a state-of-the-art cooking class with a morning tour of Ubud market, a real rice paddy, and a hands-on 8-course meal and cooking class. You cook in a traditional Balinese house, and the food was probably the best we tasted in Bali. It's true when they say a homecooked meal tastes better. You see what effort and intricacy and love goes into the food, and Puspa and Wayan teach you in a way so it's easily manageable and you can cook it at home. We didn't even eat dinner that evening because the lunch was so full and satisfying. A true highlight to our Bali trip!

fantastic day. If you want a cooking class in Ubud you MUST do this. Everything on the day was fantastic. From the markets to the rice paddies and the time we spent at their house Puspa and Wayan were so happy to be sharing their knowledge with us.We learnt so much more than just food and cooking. A complete package.Will definitely be doing this again on our next visit.

Fabulous Balinese experience!!!!. From start to finish hosts Puspa and Wayan made us all feel welcome and part of their community. It was a great way to learn about Balinese culture and traditional foods with such a welcoming and friendly family. Would highly recommend this tour for anyone looking for a fun, hands on cooking experience in Bali. 5 stars all round!

Fantastic - Not to be missed. This was a great day, not just for the cooking, but also the trip to the markets in the morning, and the rice fields. Wayan and Puspa were so interesting to listen to about the culture of their village, and their families. They are a lovely family, and thoroughly enjoy having you there in their home and it shows. They have a great sense of humour as well.The actual cooking class was in their home, and with only a small group, it was very good. The food was amazing, and excellent value for money. If you ever want to do a cooking class, this one is a must.The only thing that I would like to add is, that they offer you beer and water, but there was no mention of paying for the beer until the end, so I would think a sign on the fridge saying that the beer is 15,000 rph but water free of charge, would of saved any people embarrassment if they didnt have the cash with them. I am sure everybody would be quite willing to pay for it, as it was cold and very reasonably priced, but just to know that it wasnt included in the lunch would of been nice to know. Apart from that it was an excellent day!
