Paon-Bali (Puspa and her funny and charming husband) are the hosts of hosts. This cooking class is more than just cooking - it is the market (morning classes only), the rice-field trip and discussion of village life and, of course, the class itself. But it is more than that - you are warmly welcomed into the family and genuinely so. You feel like a true guest - not a paying customer.The class, it is hands-on all the way - no 'watching here'! Puspa is reassuring all the way, but is always asking how you want the food to taste - taste-testing is a common theme throughout the class. Once you have finished making the food and you make your way to the table with fabulous views over the gully, Puspa weaves her magic and 'your' food is presented back to you in a beautifully decorative style - it looks too good to eat! But wait til you try some - you won't be able to stop!! I loved it, can not recommend it enough, and will definitely be back to visit my new friends Puspa and Weyan

must do!. I could not agree more with the other reviews! We had a wonderful day with our hosts and their lovely home! We had the morning class, so we visited the market where we could see all the ingredients the Indonesians use in their kitchen, (and also buy some), then we had a small walk in the rice fields where we had the chance to hear about the every day life in the village. When we arrived in our hosts house, our welcome drinks were expecting for us and the cooking started! We used chili, made peanut sauce, grained coco, and wrapped tuna in banana leaf! All delicious, with the help of hour hosts of course!

Enjoyed this from start to finish. My two daughters and I enjoyed our day with Puspa and Wayan. They were charming and warm and taught us more about village life in Bali than I had ever learned in my prior three trips to the island. The visit to the open market in Ubud was fun, colorful, full of local smells and offered a glimpse of where locals shop. From there, Wayan drove our group to their village in Laplanan and helped us understand farming and village governance. We then joined Puspa in her kitchen and learned the basics of spices, local foods, and technique. After a few hours of preparing and cooking several dishes from soup to dessert, we enjoyed our work by eating and savoring every delicious bite. I would highly recommend trying Paon Bali.

A Lovely Relaxing Day. Sept.2010 - Spent the day learning to cook traditional Bali cuisine. Paon Cooking School was wonderful. We were picked up from our hotel and taken to the Ubud markets, this was a start of a special day, the smells of all the spices etc were certainly enticing. We were then taken on a tour of the rice fields and then finally to the village of Laplapan to start our cooking course. Four beautiful courses later, all hands on, with the hosts that were truly wonderful. I cannot speak too highly of this amazing day. We were taught the traditional way to cook and then were able to eat what we had made.This is a must do when visiting Bali

A Fantastic Experience - A Must in Ubud. I chose to join Pupsa & Wayan's cooking course due to the great reviews on the website and definitely want to echo people's sentiments about the fantastic experience. Pupsa & Wayan are two of the warmest and friendliest Balinese I met in my 2.5 week trip. There was laughter every few seconds among the people that I took the course with, a lovely couple from Australia and another from Belgium, and our gracious hosts.The food was very delicious and it was super easy to make. It's hard to source the ingredients back home, but I'm glad to know that I now make a simile of Balinese food.

A highlight of Ubud. I'm not really much of a cook to be honest, but myself and a friend thought we would try this class out as it was recommended by the home-stay I was in. It was a morning class in Aug 2010, Wayan picks you up early and takes you to a local market and explain the different foods for sale and how the market is ran which is really interesting. We were then taken to his village and given a bit of a tour of Laplapan.The cooking class itself takes place inside the home of Wayan and Puspa. Unfortunately we never got to meet Puspa as she was away at family ceremony. The cooking itself was extremely well run and we made around 7-8 different dishes which tasted great. Wayan made us feel very welcome throughout the day and explained to us a lot about the Balinese culture that you wouldn't always find out. The guy is a legend. The whole session was a real experience and Paon Bali Cooking Class have an excellent set up and a genuine passion for what they do. A must for when you are in Bali.

The best indonesian experience. This was one of the best experiences in Bali. The cooking lesson is only for small groups AND it happens at the owner´s house. That way you get to know the real indonesian life style. She teaches on fancy hotels sometimes but has started her own business about a year ago (2009 or so).I went early in the morning, so they first take you to the market to show around and learn about spices. Then they take everyone back and while Puspa is preparing welcome drinks, her husband shows the rice fields and explain how is the day-by-day life on the village. When we were back at their house, Puspa was making the daily offerings and they explained how it is for us, and how the family compound works. After a really nice coconut water drink, the class begins. It´s very hands on, everyone helps a bit. Puspa showed also her plants, where she gets most of the ingridients. Feel free to ask many questions, especially about their culture, she´ll be more than happy to answer them. As time goes by, the class makes delicious dishes and at the end we had a feast. I felt like being a guest at a local´s house, wt made the lesson so special. Oh, sing Imagine by John Lennon to Puspa. It´s her favorite song and she sings it whenever she´s cooking!

GREAT. I really enjoyed the cooking class especiall because we were able to do some of the cooking by ourselves (not just chopping vegetables) The ambiente it took place in was wonderful and the cooks very kind. I also really liked the food (sooo delicious). Recommendation to anyone who wants to learn about indonesian food and lifestyle

A Balinese Cookin Class with a Richness and Roundness. Puspa and Wayan’s Balinese Cooking Class in their home in the gorgeous lush lolly green rice paddy fields of Laplapan is an experience not to be missed. Wayan met me in Ubud in the morning then Puspa took us on a tour of the colourful local market where we had the opportunity to smell, sniff, taste and feel, the glorious abundance of fresh topical fruit, herbs and spices. What I liked the most about this class was that I had an inside view of the way the Balinese people live. Wayan took us on a tour of his family temple and explained a little a about his culture and customs which added a richness and roundness to the cooking that was to come later. Puspa took us on a tour of her organic kitchen garden, coming from a colder climate I found it so interesting to see vanilla, ginger, tumeric and many other spices growing. Under Puspa’s guidance in her beautiful ‘backyard kitchen’ with the most stunning views, we cooked, chopped, sliced, talked, laughed, tasted and looked. We sat down to 6 traditional Balinese dishes followed by dessert and tea; Puspa supplied written recipes at the finish of the course. When we had finished lunch Wayan took us on a tour of his village showing us the rice paddy fields and talked about farming techniques including organic rice growing, village life, water, customs and ceremonies. Puspa and Wayan are delightful, their generosity, hospitality and warmth will be something that I will treasure and especially so now that I can cook their dishes in my home. I stayed in Kuta and organised a driver to take me to Ubud (which is around 1 hour from Kuta), it was not expensive, cheaper than a taxi. Wayan picked me up at Ubud. If you are thinking of doing a cooking class in Bali I would thoroughly recommend Paon Bali Cooking Class with Puspa and Wayan. www.paon-bali.com.

Not just great cooking - fascinating cultural tour included!. Although I enjoy Indonesian food I was not sure that I wanted to spend half a day in a cooking class - but I'm SO glad I did! This was so much more than a cooking class. First we toured the Ubud central market with Puspa learning about ingredients (and bartering - a real art!) and buying mangosteens, soursop and jackfruit just to try. Then, with Wayan driving, we dropped Puspa at home while Wayan took us up the road to his village's rice paddies and explained all sorts of things about their management, village governance, irrigation, local feeling about the bombings... he invited us to ask anything about Bali and we did!Next Wayan took us to his and Puspa's home and first took us into their family temple area and explained something about each structure and its purpose, as well as a quick look at Balinese spiritual beliefs. After all that we got down to the actual cooking, with preparation already completed by Puspa and Nyoman. A highlight for us was that Puspa was happy to teach us to cook her dishes completely without chilli, which while no doubt less than authentic, was a definite help to our inflamed internal systems! But I have no doubt that if you love chilli, she would love this inclusion. Wayan and Puspa were so relaxed yet informative, I found this to be one of my highlight experiences of my first trip to Bali, and I've been recommending it to everyone I know who's thinking of going to Bali.

A truly original and delicious experience!. The attraction of going into someone's home to cook and really experiencing life in a village seemed very attractive to us. We have done many other cooking classes whilst in Ubud years before, but this one was outstanding. Meticulously clean kitchen and preparation. Puspa and Wayan both have great English. The warmth, hospitality, information, and delicious food made was brilliant. Puspa used just a little chilli in response to our request and we sat down for a fragrant, fresh and delicious meal we'll never forget. Before lunch Wayan showed us the workings of local rice paddies and explained so many interesting stories about Balinese culture and way of life. Sensational!

A unique opportunity to experience the heart and home of a Balinese family. Meeting Puspa and Wayan is like meeting a friend. Their warmth and hospitability is so generous and it was wonderful to experience the market with the knowledge of an insider; tobe taken into a typical Balinese home and taught about their values and culture and to learn something about the sumptous Indesian cuisine. This is before I talk about the great meal you get to eat in the comfort of their beautiful garden kitchen.This is a special opportunity and you will leave knowing that you have a friend you can visit in Bali.All cooking is done to Western hygiene standards and vegetarian or other dietary needs can be accommodated.Wayan is also available to transport you wherever you want to go and will pick up from all over the Island.

A cultural hands on cooking class.... I had the most fabulous day with Puspa and Wayan doing the cooking class in August 2010, it was hands on which none of the others offered seemed to be and well worth the money. Wayan and Puspa were both knowledgeable and welcoming. The morning started with a visit to the markets and a walk through with Puspa and an introduction to the produce available. We then visited their village where Wayan talked to us about Bali and the way the village works and the process of rice farming. Following this we headed to their home where we were welcomed and introduced to Balinese life. They welcomed us to the temple area in their home and Puspa completed the ceremonies before we headed off to get on with the cooking! We made a series of traditional balinese dishes with organic ingrediants fresh from their garden which was fun and tasted great! Puspa was well aware of the sensitivities of our stomachs and had made sure she bought all meat from a reputable butcher, the hygiene standards were well on par with that expected. We got the recipes to keep at the end of the day. Overall it was a fabulous day, filled with laughter and a warmth that is often hard to find Puspa and Wayan were fabulous and i now feel that i have friends in Ubud should i return... Would highly recommend this to anyone interested in a culutral experience in Ubud.

more than just a cooking class. Just ahead: It's absolutely worth the money and you will enjoy the whole balinese cooking trip.My girlfriend and I were the only 2 guests of Puspa and Wayan this morning in July 2010. We were picked up on time by Wayan and he led us through the morning market, as there were no other tourists. We learned a lot about the local people and their food.After that stop we went to Puspas and Wayans family compound in the village of Laplapan. We were very friendly welcomed by Puspa. Afterwards Wayan explained everything about their family compound, the family temple and rituals and their honeymoon suite.Now Puspa led us to the cooking facility. They have a wonderful garden with a great view down a valley with plenty of rain forest and rice paddies. The kitchen was clean and well organized. After having a refreshing water coconut we were introduced by Puspa to the different ingredients and the procedure of making fresh coconut oil. Then self-cooking started with making all the tasty food like chicken curry, Gado Gado with peanut butter sauce, etc. Puspa explained all in english, we had a lot of fun and she also cared a lot about us during our final lunch. On our way back Wayan even drove us to some local villages nearby Ubud, that are famous for crafts like kite building, silver-forging, cause we liked to. Fabulous!It was a absolutely satisfying day with lot of fun and learning much of the local balinese lifestyle. Food was tasty, the kitchen clean, Puspa and Wayan wonderful.

A fantastic organic lunch and a great insight into Balinese family life.. Wayan and Puspa came to meet us at the Ubud market where they showed us all the indonesian ingredients. After a small tour to the rice paddies we went to their house, a typical Indonesian family compounds. This was great because you can never enter one since they are private houses. Wayan showed us the family temple and gave us some precious cultural explanations. Then we went to their beautiful open air kitchen where the master chef processed some coconut oil in front of us. In a very warm and friendly atmosphere we cooked a feast that of course we ate. My husband and I went with our two daughters (4 and 6), and they did enjoy the cooking too. If you want to learn about cooking but also about the Indonesian culture in a relax and authentic way, I will definitely recommend this cooking class.

More than just a cooking class the "Real Bali". When I signed up for this cooking class I got a lot more that I expected. First let me say that it was wonderful and everyone should run, not walk and sign up for the class. Even if you are not interested in cooking! Puspa and Wayan the owners are so warm and inviting you will never want to leave!I signed up for the afternoon class and Wayan one of the owners/chauffeur/helper picked me up on time. He drove me and the other class attendees to their village Laplapan in Ubud, Bali. He toured us around the village and showed us the rice fields where they are trying to turn the fields organic. We were able to stop and take pictures as well as just enjoy the magnificent view from the fields. On the tour of the village he explained a lot of things about Bali and the villages that you don't get on most tours.After the rice fields we arrived at Wayan and Puspas home. Wayan gave us a tour of their home and explained about the temples, and the traditions of the Balinese people inside their homes. We also saw their organic garden. It was wonderful to be able to go into someone's home and see how they really live. I really enjoyed the explanation about the Balinese culture. We cooked about 5 or 6 different things and it was fun and very friendly atmosphere. Puspa the chef/wife/boss is so nice and she gives great instruction about the ingredients you are using. I loved the fact that almost 99% of the food used comes from their organic garden. Many of the ingredients used, such as turmeric, I had never seen before in its natural state. During the cooking process we all took turns chopping and stirring and tasting. You can cook as much as you or just sit and chit chat if you want. Puspa is very laid back and your wish is her command. She was even able to accommodate my request for a vegetarian option.When the meal was done we sat down and ate the best meal I have ever had in Bali! We made traditional Balinese and Indonesian dishes. I am excited to know that I will be able to go home and re-create these dishes in my kitchen.If you take the morning tour you are able to tour the market with Puspa to see how and what she buys as well how to bargain with the shopkeepers. That's worth the price alone. Also the morning tour includes the process of how she makes the coconut oil which is used in a lot of the dishes. At the conclusion of the meal they give you all of the recipes to take home. They even had a vegetarian recipe for me which I thought was very nice. The price of this tour is much less than you would pay for most of the cooking classes held in many of the hotels. Plus you don't get to see a real village and go into someone's home to view a real Balinese kitchen. I stayed two weeks in Bali and this class was the highlight of my trip. If I ever come back I would take this class again just for the delicious food and to be in the company of Puspa and Wayan. When I took the class I was staying in Ubud but I am sure that they can do pick ups from other parts of the island also just call and ask.

Fun and relaxed way to learn!. We took a class in May and had a wonderful experience. Wayan and Puspa welcome you into their village and home. We started the day with a tour of the market, taking as much time as we wanted or needed, asking questions and picking items for the class. After a short drive, we arrived in the village where we stopped to look at temples and rice fields. Wayan telling us about the life n the community. Arriving at the house, we got a small tour before starting to cook. The set up is beautifl with a small orgnic garden right next to the kitchen. Puspa showed us how to make coconut oil before starting with out meals. Once the cooking was done, we ate and took our time, so much that we almost forgot to leave! During the class, Puspa gives us instructions and we all do little parts of te meal. We had just taken a cooking class in thailand where we each had our section, it was not the case here, but still very nice!

Amazing experience!. The experience was great and went beyond a simple cooking class.It started with a visit to the market with Wayan, where he told us about the ingredients we were going to use (only if you take the morning class).Then he took us to his family's rice field. It doesn't replace a visit to Tegalalang's rice field but it was nice to see the countryside of Ubud and see more typical rice fields.Then Wayan welcomed us to his family home to show us how Balinese people live and for the cooking class. Of course, his residence also had a big modern kitchen for the cooking class :)Wayan is really nice and he is keen to tell you about the balinese way of life, balinese cooking and to answer all your questions. We cooked 9 dishes and were involved in every step. The food was really tasty and varied. At the end of the class Wayan gave us his recipe book so we can try to reproduce the meals at home.I think it was a really great experience, especially for that price. I definitely recommend it!Oh and hotel pick-up and transportation to the different places were all included in the price.

Best cooking class we've had in SE ASIA!. Definitely recommend Jeding Bali cooking class to anyone who visits Ubud! My friend and I did the afternoon class and we were the only ones so there was tons of food and it was very personal. We Started off learning about how rice was made in one of his rice fields, then we're taught how to make offerings which was really cool. Nyoman was a great teacher and his English is awesome! His family was very sweet, and they also provide you with a cooking book to take home. Overall great experience!

Loved it, a must do!!. This was so worth it while in Bali, a highlight!! A tour of the ubud Market before the tourists. Saw Wayans rice field, very interesting and then, got to cook amazing food as well as learning how to make a offering. We met the family as this is done in their home, which is just out of central ubud, we were staying in ubud so we had a free pick up from our hotel and drop off. It was such a friendly and fun thing to do, we were given the recipes to bring home with us so we can cook for our family and friends. Absolutely loved it, a must do.

An afternoon of delicious food with a wonderful family. This class is a lesson into the wonderful world of balinese food and culture. Wayan picked us up outside our hotel and took us to a beautiful rice field to explain how rice is produced. Afterwards, Wayan gave a tour of his compound explaining Balinese family traditions and taught us how to make offerings for the gods. The cooking was great fun and Wayan and his wife taught us how to make 9 dishes in total! The food was the best food we had eaten during our whole 3 week stay in Bali and was served to us in a buffet style. We were left feeling so warmed by this experience and grateful for the opportunity to spend the afternoon with such a kind and welcoming family. If you are in Ubud, this is a must! Wayan even gave us his 'secret' recipe book, full of his family recipes for us to take home.

Perfect. Excellent cooking course. We got shown around the Ubud markets, rice fields and shown how to cook Balinese food, which was delicious to eat. The house you cook at is 5 minutes from Ubud centre, the house is very clean and tidy, very spacious. The course takes 20 people max on each course, however on our day we were only 2, which at first seemed daunting, but the family made us very welcome and valued. Would highly recommend this cooking course.
Unique experience - must do. Great night at jeding bali. Being able to see how the food was cooked let alone cook it ourselves was amazing. Definitely go to this cooking class, you'd be crazy not to.

Nice experience. Good cooking class!! We made several dishes and eat it after, the ambiance was good and the teacher was nice! First the master chef brought us to the market and explain a lot of thing, then brought us to his rice field and described all the process of rice farming. You can ask him a lot of questions, he will answer!Then we went to his house where he told us a lot about family culture and indonesian way of life. After that we get to the kitchen and have a really nice moment! I recommend this adress!

Excellent Cooking Class. Picked up at the hotel we visited the market and rice fields. Then we came to a fantastic private home area in a small village where IWayan and two of his brothers introduced us to Balinese kitchen. We prepared a delicious lunch in an open kitchen. Luckily our group was quite small with just 10 people. We enjoyed the hospitality and kindness of the whole family.

More than just a cooking class. Family run business that offers a peek into understanding Balinese culture and food. The owner Wayan picked us up at our hotel, gave us a tour of the market and his family's rice paddies. We learned about his family, village and Balinese traditions while we were cooking. Wayan was very welcoming and is a great teacher and host.The class is hosted at his family's compound, so you get a feel for how Balinese people live. Great professional setup with a shaded open air kitchen surrounded by a pretty backyard.We learned about ingredients, and got to participate in prep and cooking. At the end enjoyed a family style meal and got to take home recipes.I highly recommend!

Excellent Class. Excellent family run business set at his home, the class was organised, clear and informative guidance throughout the various courses. Market visit and family rice paddy visit was also fascinating. In additional insight into the bali family home and way of life was very interesting. Recipe guide given to take home Definitely recommend this cooking class

Complete cooking experience. This cooking experience goes way beyond just learning some recipes. Nyoman (the owner) walk you through a real Balinese market, brings you to his own rice fields, gives you a small lesson on the Balinese culture and helps you create a multitude of recipes which are all delicious. I also have to give a hands up for Nyoman who is very welcoming and friendly.
Awsome. Great place to go, really enjoyable, learned and enjoyed alot (ask also my belly hahaha). Our host were truly kind and friendly. You wont regret it ;)

Authentic, truthfull hospitality and sooooo delicious!!! A must to do in Bali -> Our highlight!. We took the morning class and so were able to visit the traditional food market with our nice hosts Wayan and Nyoman, who welcomed us like good friends to their beautifull house in Ubud! We were introduced in the various freh vegetables anbd spices on the market, how they grow and what they are used for. Afterwards we had a absolutely amazing cooking class and couldn't stop eating it afterwards. Everything was just perfectly organized and it gave us a perfect, autentic insight into the balinese daily live! Thanks to Wayan and Nyoman and all the helpers for making our trip so special with your cooking class! A absolutely must for every visitor who is interested in the balinese culture!

Jeding Bali Cooking Class. Wayan picked my up from my Ubud homestay and toured me through the markets. He then took me to a plantation where I tasted a variety of teas and coffees. His family compound was beautiful and Wayan was able to explain its history. Wayan and his wife's set up is lovely, all in the fresh air. They demonstrated and then had me doing all the cooking tasks, with lots of support! The array of dishes was perfect. A great experience. I'm cooking some of these dishes this evening for my family. Wish me luck! .Thanks, Wayan and family.

Wonderful experience . The day started with I Wayan picking us up from our hotel and taking us on a very insightful tour of the local Balinese food market in Ubud.We then visited the family rice fields and from there proceeded to the family home where the cooking class is hosted.We met the wonderful family members and were given an explanation of a typical Balinese home and the family temple.We then prepared and cooked the food and sat down to a lovely meal at the end and were also given a recipe book to take home with us.The whole experience was wonderfully informative and was great to be welcomed into someone's home. I would definitely recommend this class to anyone visiting Ubud.

Traditional Balinese Cuisine and Culture. We really enjoyed this experience. Very good insight into food, spiritual life and culture. We went to the afternoon session which does not include the market visit or rice paddy trek. Husband and I were only participants (12 in morning). Plenty of opportunity to ask as many question as you need.

Super cooking class!. I experienced a very good organized and professional cooking class. I saw that everything was ordered and prepared for a whole group.Although I was the only one,(because other people cancelled) Inyoman tried his best to let me feel comfortable. His wife assisted and together we made an complete dinner. Before we went to his house in the village, we visited the family's rice fields. He showed and explained me about the water system for the rice to grow. At his house I met the family and then we first started with creating offerings with beautiful flowers and the basket made from coconut leaves. Following up we made the whole dinner. Everything is explained in the meanwhile and I also could take some food home. The recipes are already on paper and you will receive them after the class. They bring you back to hotel.I really enjoyed the whole afternoon.

What a wonderful experience. We booked this through an agent in the main street and how lucky we were. Collected from our hotel, we met Imade our chef / guide and some other participants for a tour of the market before being taken to his family rice field and finally welcomed into their traditional Balinese family home where we had the class, with the help of their extended family. Before the cooking we were taught to make Hindu offerings while they explained the significance of these to their culture. As a group we then prepared a number of different meals under the family's tuition - including one we had specifically asked for that they do not normally do. Although there were 15 of us in the group a whole they made sure everyone was involved in preparing the many dishes. When it was all done - we ate it all a a buffet for lunch!A wonderful experience that was so much more than just a cookery class as we were made to feel very welcome by the whole extended family in their home.

Great cooking experience. had a great day doing cooking class, starting with a trip to the market, you are copllected from your hotel and dropped back to your hotelthe family were really friendly and helpful, with some great tips and at the end of the class we had a really nice buffet meal of all the stuff we made.The class came with a recipe book so you can try the recipe at home

Amazing, great food, great fun! . This was a wonderful cooking class. My driver dropped me at the market and we met the chef. He took us around the local market and explained what foods we'd be cooking with and went through some spices, veggies etc. Following this is took us to see his families rice crops before going to the families quarter where we did the amazing cooking class. Everything was explained really well. We all ate together after and it was delicious. We also got a recipe book with everything we'd cooked. Highly recommend!

More than just a cooking class. We actually booked another cooking class at our hostel but ended up in this one. We were not disappointed though. They picked us up and then we visited the market, which was very interesting. He told us a lot about hindu religion and balinese ingredients. Later on we looked at a rice field near his house. Then we went to his house where we met his family. Before preparing the food, everybody made a hindu offering. We then prepared several balinese dishes. I especially loved tuna sate. Also the basic sauce we used in every dish is super delicious. The two brothers were very nice and friendly. The whole experience gave us an excellent insight into balinese culture. We loved it!

Family fun. We booked 24 hours by e mail and we where collected on time from an agreed place in town ( we are staying in the rice fields where cars cannot get to)IWayan took us to the rice terraces and told us all about the rice, its production and answered all our questions.We then went to cook. We where with one other family from Holland who were very nice and the 8 of us cooked bits together and bits separately. IWayan adapted the menu for us as we are vegetarian and even changed the soup to noodle soup which was fantastic as the kids don't like mushrooms.You get to do lots of chopping and mixing and grinding and all of the cooking between you.Each person has a chopping station and there are 4 rings for cooking which were shared and was enough for 8 people - 4 cooking and 4 mixing etc.You never got to cook a whole meal only bits and then it was passed on. I don't thing in 1/2 a day there was any other way and we really enjoyed this experience but I wanted to explain it as I think some people may think that you cook every dish yourself.You are given a recipe book at the end and ours was changed for the noodle soup too.After you have cooked they show you how to make a blessing for the gods and then you eat together as a group.There is lots of food and it all tasted good - not sure Ill be able to repeat but will try.They offer beer and water is provided free. beer is 40,000IDR each bottle.All in all an excellent day that I would recommend - but only if the class size stays at 8 or below.One last thing - everything is very clean and all the food is covered from foods while you are preparing or while it is waiting to be eaten.Clean toilets and hand washing available and encouraged also plastic gloves provided when you need to use your hands for shared bits with hand mixing.

Highly recommend. My boyfriend and I booked this cooking class at short notice through Whatsapp. We were staying in a villa 400m along the road and had walked by and seen their sign. On the day of the class we had to check out of our villa so they very kindly let us store our luggage in their compound.Because our villa was so close we walked along at 8.15. We were super lucky being the only 2 people in the class that morning. We were taken to a local market to explore the produce before being driven back to the cooking school for a delicious breakfast and welcome drink. We were shown how to make an offering which was really interesting and added an extra element to the day, before we started cooking.I'm vegetarian and my boyfriend eats meat and they were able to accommodate my dietary requirements. We spent the rest of the morning cooking many delicious meals under the watchful eye and guidance of the staff. Water was provided throughout the day.The best part of the day was lunch time when we were able to enjoy all of the delicious food we'd cooked. We were amazed by the flavours of everything and can't wait to recreate the dishes at home after being given both a vegetarian and meat recipe book.We were finished by around 1pm but we hadn't arranged our driver to pick us up until 2pm so we were able to stay at the compound and get to meet the whole family. This really added something special to the day as were were able to learn a lot about the Balinese culture, compounds, work, daily life etc which we would never have learnt any other way. It was so nice getting to know everyone in such a chilled and welcoming environment. It's a day we will never forget and it was an absolutely amazing experience. I recommend this class to everyone, as theres much more to it than just cooking.

Awesome Authentic Balinese Cooking!. Highly recommended! Day started with a visit to the morning market, our fabulous guide took us through the produce, spices intro. Cooking class very interactive, we prepared loads of different delicious dishes! Food was fresh, great variety and delicious. You are also introduced to the guides home where he explains how the traditional Balinese home is run. Great value for money HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!

We loved it.... We decided on short notice to take a cooking class and it was a great choice. My friend and I were picked up on time and together with another couple we went to the cooking school,which was their private home at the same time. On the way we stopped at rice fields and got told about the process. We were welcomed with some drinks and learned how to make those typical Bali offerings, then we started cooking. Everything was fresh and delicious. Everything was explained well. The final feast was amazing, especially with those nice cold beers going along with it. I would come back any time...

Excellent!!!!. If you are after a cooking class then this is the one for you! It's family run and done at a Balinese home. The brothers and his family were so welcoming and friendly. We learnt plenty of dishes and ate the food at the end. A must do in Ubud!

Amazing experience!!!. This was an amazing experience well worth doing! It was a very personal cooking class done at a family compound. Definitely a must a do in bali with a rewarding lunch at the end. Highly recommended!

A delicious experience . As someone who doesn't know how to cook properly I was quite sceptical about doing a cooking course. Fortunately, this cooking course would appear to be a totally different type of cooking course. After getting picked up from our various hotels, we ventured into the bustling morning market of Ubud where we were shown around by our guide. He introduced us to the different spices, vegetables and other ingredients that we would be using to cook with. We arrived at the Balinese family home where the course would take place after visiting a rice paddy field. Over the next hour or so we were shown how to use ingredients and made many different meals which we then sat down to enjoy our delicious creations.I would recommend this experience to anyone, regardless of their cooking ability. The way the family welcomed us into their home would add a cultural knowledge to those who would participate in the course.

Amazing, unforgettable cooking experience. We really couldn't fault this cooking class and would recommend it to anyone wishing to try cooking true Balinese cuisine. We were welcomed into their home and learnt all about offerings before being shown the kitchen and ingredients. The range of skills and dishes we learnt made this an unforgettable afternoon and IWayan's previous restaurant experience really added to our enjoyment. The food tasted incredible, we learnt a lot in a friendly and relaxed environment. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Ubud.

Cooking class. Very good cooking glass in their friendly family home . This was more than just cooking glass, we went to market, rice fields and they showed us their beutiful home and garden. Food was really great and very traditional indonesian/balinese food! We also learned how to make an offering, which was interesting! :) Really nice people :)

Book it now! . What a great experience this was. From start to finish it was very enjoyable and informative. Although previous reviews have praised this cooking class, I was a little concerned about the lack of reviews. However, there was no need to be. All previous reviews reflect the high standards of this class. The family (mainly the brothers) take very good care of you throughout always going to that extra effort to help you, answer your questions and generally make you feel at home. We attended the afternoon session. So I can't comment on the market tour, but if it was anything like the rest of the day, I'm sure it would have been great fun and very informative. After finding the class through tripadvisor, we booked over whatsapp using the number on the website. We were picked up by one of the brothers and first taken to a tour of the rice fields, before returning to their compound home to start the cooking class. All ingredients supplied, with great instruction throughout. You will learn not just the cooking methods, but about the individual ingredients and their culture. At the end of cooking class, you will have prepared several meals which you can then enjoy. As this was an afternoon class, this effectively became our dinner and lovely it was. Overall I really can't find out any faults. You will have a great day, learn and laugh and enjoy some great food for the price of an average meal. Don't look anywhere else and book it now!

Unforgettable foodie experience . There are many cooking classes in Ubud but this one stands out from the rest. The main reasons are that you pick your food from the local market before you cook, and the staff is beyond nice making every moment a pure joy. I would highly recommend going with Jeding Bali if you are looking for an authentic and tasty cooking experience

Friendly and delicious! . This was so much more than a cooking class! We began by going to the market where our guide taught us about different spices, rices, and fruits! Then we went to his uncle's rice fields where he told us how how the rice is grown and harvested. We had juice and sat out by the fields for a bit. We then went back to his family's beautiful compound. Multiple family members helped us learn to make an offering and make around 7 dishes. We then at the meal we made and were able to take home the leftovers. They were EXTREMELY accommodating when we requested to have a vegetarian meal. The meal, guides, and day was perfect! I highly recommend this cooking class!

Amazing experience. With My friend Erika We tried this experience during our holiday in Bali.I really recomend to choose this cooking class: the owner of the business is so friendly and polite!!!We first went to the market which was closed unfortunately because tooLate. Then we went to the house: an huge compound was waiting for us as well as the family. We cooked together delicious meals in typical Balinese style.5 stars!!!!
delcious recipes and great experience. Great afternoon. Superfriendly guys. Recipes very intersting/ creative ad work for all levels of expertise. I would and will recommend to go there!

Not just cooking, its culture!. My friend and I took the afternoon class, which was lovely. The market was closed already, so we went to a coffee plantage first. There we could try various kinds of coffee and tea, including the famous kopi luwak. After a quick stop at the rice fields, we arrived at the village where the class took place. We received a welcoming drink and a flower in our haar. Then, we were taught how to make a Hindu offering with flowers and leaves. After that, the real cooking started. You learn about spices, flavours and ingredients. It was a great class! Definately choose this one when you are in Ubud. You het picked up at your ho(s)tel, and they bring you back after the class.

Awesome experience!!. We booked the cooking class with our chef/manager at the villa we stayed at (Villa Olivia) and got a discount. This is a fairly new establishment but we were really impressed throughout the experience. Pros: -Great service!! Our host and chef picked us up, showed us to the traditional market, rice field, daily offering rituals, and taught us cooking all by himself (with the help of his wife, lovely family!). Throughout the day, he was extremely courteous and always answer our questions, made sure we are comfortable. -Home style cooking; all the dishes he taught us at the class were (mostly) made from scratch by us, including the sauce, so other than he fact that it might be difficult to find the ingredients in the states, it felt very doable and easy to follow. -Great food! Not only that he made sure we all had hands on experience with the cooking, he made sure the flavors are good and suitable for everyone. The food we made was some the best and most authentic we had during our stay. -Clean facilities; even though it was a very family oriented set up (the class takes place at his home/compound house) the kitchen, bathroom, and dining areas were all very clean and well maintained. Cons:I thoroughly enjoyed the whole experience and can honestly find nothing serious as a con. Overall highly recommended! Even though it is not as popular or renowned as other older cooking schools, but the sincerity and the quality of Jeding cooking school will definitely give you a memorable experience.

A great experience!! Highly recommendable!!!. I had a wonderful time, I learnt a lot about Balinese cuisine I met the best people and I enjoyed a wonderful meal, all for a very good price. There are many cooking schools in Ubud area but I think this one is the best, not only because they are really nice and helpful people, but also because you get in touch with the real culture of the place. I'd love to repeat!!

Amazing experience, fabulous food, lovely family:-). This has been my favourite experience during this trip to Bali and so much more than just a cooking class. I was picked up at my villa by Nyoman who was welcoming, professional and very informative; we proceeded to the local market where Nyoman explained the produce, much of which was to be used in the meal we were to prepare later. We then drove to a stunning location where I was educated on how many of the herbs, spices, coffee and cocoa grow. It was most informative and the tasting plater of teas and coffees was a refreshing touch after a stroll through the lush gardens.We then drove to Nyomans family home which is in the traditional style with a little temple and a beautiful courtyard. The space where the cooking class is held is wonderful, clean, open and really nice to be in. I was shown how to make the daily offerings and enjoyed a tasty iced tea and fruit before we got started on the cooking.I had a great time preparing all the dishes; Nyoman and his lovely wife were excellent teachers, the ingredients were fresh, colourful and smelled amazing. The end result was seriously the best food I have had in Bali hands down and one of the tastiest meals I have had in a long time, my mouth is watering just thinking about it:-)This is a small family business run by a beautiful couple in their beautiful home and you feel the warm heart of the Balinese people not some tourist trap.I will be back again and can't wait to learn more traditional cooking. No matter your skill, you will take away some great receipes to show off to your freinds and family and will leave with a full, happy belly!
PYSZNIE (delicious) !!!. It was a very great time with friendly people ! A lot of new recipes of yummily Balinese meals. I sincerely recommend it !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Great experience! Even if you're not that into cooking it's still well worth it.. The friendly guide picked us up from the hotel, took us to the market and also to a rice field before the cooking lesson. We got to learn a bit about Balinese food and prepare a really good meal which we ate afterwards. My wife loved how everything was set up. You could pay as much just for the food. The guide was friendly and everything was included in the tour price, there was no push to buy extra stuff, which you sometimes get with other tours in Bali.

Awesome cooking class experience. I thoroughly enjoyed the cooking class with Canting - Starting with a visit to the market was great to see local produce. The cooking class was not too long and the best part is sitting down and enjoying the meal prepared. Class was small and everyone is busy all of the time doing various elements of the menu preparation and/or cooking. Learnt a lot about the local ingredients and basis of Balinese food. The setting was stunning in the rice fields! Friendly and knowledgeable instructors and assistants.

MUST DO: Great value for money and scrumptious!. From start to finish we were blown away by the professional service and delightful staff. We were picked up from our hotel, taken to the markets to learn about all the ingredients we would be using and then bustled off to a quaint building nestled among the rice paddies. We were taught how to make a traditional offering before the cooking class began. The staff didn't miss a beat, everyone attending the class had multiple opportunities to make various dishes and the food was beyond amazing. A full recipe booklet was handed out to each attendee at the end. I cannot recommend this experience enough, a definite must do when visiting Bali.

Awesome value for money and delicious!. Tour to market, Padi fields and cooking in the rice fields makes this a very memorable experience! Pickup and drop off to and fron accommodation is also included. Very friendly staff and beautiful setting. Class is well organised!

What an experience . As chef myself i was interested to know and learn the way of indonesian food. Wow.. what can i say. This was an aesome experience.. Friendly staff and teachers.. so calm and patient. Pick up was 8am on the dot from hotel. Then a trip to the ubud market to see produce.. dont be alarmed.. the fish and meats and purchased from larger suppliers.. From there we were taken up and through the rice fields with an explanation of how the rice grown and cut and processed.. Then a sit down and taught how to make the offerings. To me this was very special... Then the class started.. With a meal of banquet at the end... Amazing.. flavours... yumm... If you love cooking and different flavours.. its a must to do this.. if there were 10 stars. Id click it.. thank u to all the staff and the wonderful people we met today.

Beautiful and tasty experience. Pick up from hotel and went to the market were Made showed and explained the spices and ingredients balinese food uses. Then arrived at the place in the middle of rice paddies. We were received with a drink and were taught how to make balinese offerings. The cooking class was hands on very interactive. Very organised and professional. Greatly explained and relaxed. Then we had all the delicious lunch we prepared including dessert. Recipes provided. The plus was that we went with our two little daughters and the staff was very accommodating and kind, relaxed about the girls being around. Thanks very much for the excellent morning we had.

Great lunch!. Such a fantastic class!Picked up in the morning early enough to visit the market the locals attend for food. (That same market switches to tourist knick-knacks at 10am.)Spices and ingredients were explained to us.Then drove to a beautiful rice field. Walked through it to outdoor cooking building.Made many many Balinese dishes for our lunch. It was awesome to make it ourselves step by step.I am definitely recommending this company.Thank you!!!

Not to be missed. We were collected from our hotel by a friendly driver and taken to a local market. We were given a tour and information on local fruit, vegetables and spices. We then went to the cookery school which is beautifully set within rice fields. All of the staff spoke English and the whole class was informative and fun. The best part of the day is eating the feast you have prepared and taking home a recipe book to at least try and recreate the food at home.

Take your own Hand Wash. Great fun, supremely well organized tour. Excellent value for money. Tip : TAKE YOUR OWN HANDWASH as theirs was watered down water ! Came down with Diarrhoea the next day so pretty sure I ate something a bit dodgey, although hubby was ok. Everyone prepares the food & it then gets mixed together so even if your higene is perfect other peoples might not be !

Incredible experience!. Wow wow wow! Such an amazing experience all the way in every way. Beautiful food, gorgeous variety of flavours, elegantly taught. Highly organised, all set on a beautiful rice field with stunning views! An experience for the bucket list for sure !

Must do! . Amazing day! I was picked up in the morning at my hotel and was taken to the fruit market to see all the fruits, vegetables and spices we would be using in class. It was a short drive to the location and a nice short walk through the rice field. There were only 3 people in the class in the morning which was wonderful! We cooked a buffet of food and even made our own offerings to start the day. It was very delicious and our cooks were great English speakers and explained everything well. We also went home with recipe books to recreate the dishes back home. I highly reccommend this class! Great for all levels.

working hand in hand – GREAT EXPERIENCE. we´ve been picked up from a driver at our hotel. The place is a bit outside and nicely surrounded by rice fields. The whole experience was just amazing! The place, the ingredients, the people and of course our dinner in the end! I would highly recommend taking this class :)

Don't leave Ubud unless you've done this. Ketut and the team were accommodating, on time for our transfer, friendly and lovely to spend half our day with. We spent an hour at the market, after which we walked through a rice paddy to our course venue. Every in the class has ample opportunity to be involved and the whole experience was a pleasure! We have met some lifetime friends here.

A MUST. Everyone from the driver who picked us up to the cooks and helpers were all wonderful - very friendly, had great senses of humour, and we're very informative. The tour through the market was interesting, the cooking was fun, and the lunch (which we made) was fabulous. Best. Day. Ever.

Delicious cooking class 😋. The morning cooking class is really worth getting up for. You will be picked up at your hotel and visit the Ubud market. There you will learn more about the ingredients you are using later on. The cooking class itself takes place in the middle of a wonderful rice field. It's really a beautiful panorama. At the end of the class you will be able to eat the prepared food which was heavenly. Furthermore you will get the recipes of the meals so you can try cooking Balinese style at home. Thank you very much for this wonderful experience!

Fantastic experience . My boyfriend and I did this cooking class on a recommendation from our hotel, and it did not disappoint! We were picked up from our hotel (in an air conditioned van) and from there the adventure began.The class started with a tour of the local Ubud market to see (not purchase) the types of ingredients used in traditional Balinese cooking. From there we jumped back in the van and headed to the cooking class location set in a beautiful rice paddy. The classes were small groups (6 people in ours) so everyone had a chance to ask questions and be involved. Our guide/teacher Ketut was fantastic - he answered all our questions and explained everything in detail in great English, he even made lots of jokes, which made the day very entertaining. We made 8 dishes in total and got to sit down at the end and enjoy the lunch we had made as a group.I would recommend this cooking class for anyone wanting a fun and enjoyable morning with delicious food! We were picked up at 8:30 and dropped back to our hotel around 1:45pm.

Awesome morning well spent!. This cooking class was the best!We got picked up in the morning exactly on time and taken to the ubud market where we got taken around and had the different fruit and veges and spices explained to us. We then went to the rice fields and were taught aboht rice and then we walked to the cooking class which was in the middle of the rice fields. I am vegetarian and the meat was substituted with tempeh or tofu but same flavours were used to that the dishes were similar. We cooked soup, curry and other dishes as well as dessert. They cater for all food allergies and preferences and everything was delicious! We met some really awesome people too which made the experience even better! Loved our drivers and the cooking guides and everyone else who helped out. Really glad we took this class and even got to take home a recipe book with everything we made! And we made offerings before the cooking started which was my favourite! :)

Great morning at the cooking class. The mini van came in the morning to pick us (free of charge), and take us to the market. We visited the food / flower market, which was very different from the market in the afternoon (where you can find gifts). This was very nice. Then we went to the lovely location in the Rice field, where is situated canting cooking class. We had a great time discovering the cooking of balinese meal and testing them. Great expérience to live in Ubud !

Great Morning. . This is a well run course that moves at a good pace and is inclusive of everyone. My partner is vegetarian and was made to feel welcome with different variations of the same dish being taught at the same time as the rest of us. The food was lovely and the buffet to feast on all that we had cooked was a good way to end the day. Teachers are fab and helpful and create a great atmosphere. Our group was lovely too and we met some fab people. The only drawback and reason I haven't given five stars is the market experience was a bit of a let down. We weren't given much of an explanation about foods at all and this stretched to the rice fields. It clearly depends on the guide however, having read other reviews. Would recommend.

Learning about secret of Balinese Cusine. The guide was great. The sightseeing was also great and the Balinese family compound was so nice. We did enjoy the making of an offer to the gods. Later we learned à lot of spices and vergatables how to cut and process in the recipes from the Cusine . And the group was small and the teatcher was good in explaining. If you can book it.. DO it!!

"Balinese chef for one day". We took part to a cooking class with canting bali. The day was perfect! We started with a visit to the food market and our guide introduced us to typical products from here. Then we went to visit the rice field, the place was amazing and really chilly. Before start cooking, they taught us how to make an offering basket, it was a really pleasant moment.Then we started to cook and discover the balinese cuisine, the lesson was great, the chef explained us the recipes very well and it was a wonderful sensation cooking with our hands local plates. We had so much fun and we enjoyed the lunch all together, everything was really tasty. Absolutely suggested to go deep into balinese culture in a funny way!

Amazing cooking course. Booked the day before through our hotel, they came and picked us up and even waited for us to finish our breakfast. We first headed to the market in ubud where they explained about how it worked, then upto the rice fields and finally to the cooking school which was in a beautiful setting. The chefs were great, they explained to food choices really well and catered for all different diets, there was hands on activity with chopping and cooking creating a banquet which we had for lunch. Would throughly recommend for any foodies.

The perfect birthday gift!. I turned 30 while I was in Bali and my girlfriend treated me to this cooking experience in Bali which I thoroughly enjoyed! It's a different set-up to cooking classes I've been to before. Rather than choosing a course for yourself, you prepare a buffet together with about 10 other people, so you're all working together rather than separately. Although this may take away a little bit of the "personal" aspect of making your own food, it does mean you can prepare a greater variety of dishes in the same time. Plus the food was great, so I can't complain! We also did a tour of the local market, and got to see the best places to buy particular ingredients.
Great activity . Very friendly staff, delicious food and you make it all your self with little help. Reasonable price too. Would definitely recommend !
SO DELICIOUS AND FUN. Great thing to do with a group of friends! Food was great. People were fun. Learnt a lot about Balinese food and culture too :)

Fantastic . I have done lots of these types of cooking courses on my travels but this one rates among the best, mainly because of how smooth and well organised it was, with no moment when you were waiting for something to happen.I was picked up from my homestay in the morning and we went to Ubud market. Anyone can easily go here but it was nice to have the different produce explained to us. We then drove out to the location for the course, for which we took a short walk through the rice fields. We were greeted with a welcome drink and taught how to make offerings (a nice touch - especially as there are some courses just for this which charge $50 for the day!). Once we were onto the cooking, everyone got a chance to be involved in every dish and everything was arranged so smoothly that you turned round and the next section had already been set up ready to go. Staff spoke good English and were helpful. We finished by sitting down to eat our delicious banquet together before being dropped back to our hotel along with a recipe book. Highly recommended.

A wonderful day!. I had an excellent time at cookery school! The staff were wonderfully helpful and we made some really delicious dishes! I am a vegetarian and the staff were very helpful at adapting the recipes for me. I would thoroughly recommend!

Amazing experience. I love cooking, i like indonesian food, so it was a good choice to do a cooking class at Canting Bali.First you visit the market in Ubud, then you go to the farm and make some food.Ketut explained some things about the ingredients we were using, and we each were able to participate in every single dish (we were with 8 people).At the end you can eat all the dishes and chat with the other people.

Best food we've had in Bali. We went to the afternoon class and got to make 8 delicious dishes which we then had for dinner after cooking had finished. We all got involved in making each part of each dish so were involved the whole time.The people there were lovely and made it a really fun experience, we'd highly recommend going.

Great experience! . My partner and I recently completed the cooking course with Canting Bali and loved it. We were picked up from our hotel and then went to Ubud market to have a look around. When we arrived at the place it was in a beautiful setting in the middle of rice paddies. We were given a welcome drink at the start and we were taught how to make our own offerings. We then got down to the cooking; everyone always had a job to do, sometimes you were the 'chef' others the 'assistant' but you were involved in every dish that was made which was great as I know on some courses you only get to make 1 dish per couple. The staff were excellent and very entertaining throughout. At the end we got to eat all the food we had prepared and were given recipe books to take home. We were heading on to Kuta after the course and they even arranged a taxi for us from their place to our hotel in Kuta. I would highly recommend this company to anyone looking to complete a cooking course in Bali.

Wonderful Experience - a real highlight!!. We had such a great time on this cooking course. A trip to the markets where we got to try some of the local fresh food for breakfast followed by a trip to the rice fields and then on to the cooking class. The staff were so friendly and helpful and spoke a good standard on English so it was easy to follow the instructions. The course was really hands on and we got to cook about six different courses! At the end we got to sit together and eat all the delicious food we had cooked!! This was a fantastic experience and I highly recommend it to anyone visiting Ubud!

Great fun, beautiful location, friendly people and fab food. Picked up at our hotel & shown the foodmarket before heading up to this beautiful rice field location. Fun class, we were hands on and did chooping and cooking under guidance and got to eat a superb buffet lunch of all the things we'd made after

Delicious food and very, very friendly people. Just came back from a marvellous cooking experience. Amidst the beautiful rice paddies we've cooked a delicious meal with our three kids. Supported by friendly members of the family we've "amazed" ourselves with our Indonesian Cooking skills. We took the afternoon class from 15.00 (pick up at hotel) untill 20.00 (return at hotel). We've prepared 8 different dishes and enjoyed each one of them. Price/quality is tripple A.

Fantastic cooking classes in Ubud. My partner and I found these cooking classes on TripAdvisor and emailed to make enquiries and got an answer back immediately. We booked into a morning class which started with pickup from our hotel and together with others a visit to the Ubud produce market. Here our host/guide explained the different ingredients we would be cooking with today. Then back in the van and to our cooking class venue in amongst the rice paddies. We all got our own station to cut, dice, slice and chop the veggies and herbs for our dishes. Also worked with Mortar and passel to grind herbs etc. as well as actually shallow frying our dishes. These included chicken and mushroom soup, tofu and veggie curry, tuna and other chicken dishes, Balinese salad and coconut pancakes. Ingredients were explained and how much to use. At the end we all got to sit down together and enjoy what we had cooked, which was a feast by anyone's standards. They also catered to vegetarians and those with food intolerances. All the staff were very friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend this cooking class for any foodies visiting Ubud. Big bonus was copy of all recipes given to everyone to take home.

A Highlight of the trip to Bali. I saw a brochure in my villa and asked them to sign me up. There is a shuttle bus that picks you and other participants up. First stop was the market place. It was pouring rain the day we arrived but our guide took us through the narrow passage ways and explained the different kinds of fruits, vegetables and eggs. I purchased spices and different kinds of incense. The class had around 20 participants from all over the world. We broke into 2 groups. We used traditional methods to create a variety of delicious dishes. The are at a large community table. It was fun being next to the peaceful rice fields and preparing our food. The cooking guides were friendly and helpful. Very fun experience!

A Delcious Cooking Experience. I have taken many many cooking classes in Bali and the world! This one was WELL ORGANIZED....FUN...LEARNED quite a bit and GREAT GREAT HOSTS! We did not do the morning market as I have been to them many many times. I liked doing the class in the afternoon and I LOVED LOVED LOVED the location.There are man cooking classes to choose from and this one was very well-rounded, fun and great value!

Great class . Had a wonderful time at this cooking class and the food was wonderful.Wasn't feeling to well so they made me ginger tea to calm my stomach.Had lots of options and they cater for all allergies. nut, gluten Vegetarian to meat, fish eaters.They walk through the market at the beginning was great and than we went through the family rice fieldsHad a wonderful day

It can't get better than this, 5 star plus.. Excel well informed cooking class. Nothing was too much trouble for Made and the team. Even our group special dietary requirements were catered for. A wonderful fun experience. Thank you to the team at Cantling Cooking Class. Sue, Ros & Elaine

LOVED IT. People at my Villa organised this cooking class and I loved it. Driver picked me up from Villa and with 5 others we went to the morning Ubud markets where tour guide explained the food choices He then drove us to his family home where they had a magnificent set up. They showed us how to make and cook genuine Balinese food. It was fantastic and everyone was friendly and helpful. Made and ate delicious food and got a instruction booklet to take home.

Great experience - also for vegetarians (and vegans). We first went to the market, where our driver explained us a lot of things. Afterwards we went to the house, where the cooking class took place.The staff was so nice and helpfull and they explain everything very well. The menu was so good, totaly loved it. They also have great alternitivs for vegetarians and most of it is even vegan! (Only the desserts contained egg, rest was vegan) I would definitly recommend it, I learned so many things, not only how to prepare the dishes but also a lot about the balinese culture.

Fantastic Experience! . I'm not one for group activities or tours generally while traveling, but Canting Bali was exceptional. The class is so well organized, it was easy to prepare a substantial multi course lunch in a couple hours and learn plenty throughout the process. The setting is gorgeous and the staff were so nice and quick to answer any questions about Balinese cooking. The food was spectacular! Eating at a communal table sharing the fruits of our labor was really nice. We even got the recipes at the end. I will definitely try some of these at home!

Friendly staff in a lovely setting. Very friendly staff, got to learn how to make an offering then make a fantastic Balinese spread! Lovely setting very calm and peaceful. Tasty food and get to take the recipes home after. Maybe better going in the afternoon as it is less busy although means you miss out on the market trip.

excellent introduction to balanese food. This class is perfect to discover balanese food : a driver can pick you up, then visit the market and go to a house in the middle of the rice fields where they teach you how to cook with fresh ingredients. The cooks and owner were very very nice funny and helpfull. they even drive you back to your hotel!A must do!

Cooking class. We had a great time this morning during our cooking class. First we have visited the market and then we had a look at the rice field. Then we have prepared different dishes and then we had a lovely lunch. Definitely something you should consider when you are in Ubud!!!!

Great cooking class in Ubud. Had a great morning at the Canting cooking class. First thing we went to the local market where we had a short lesson on balinese spices and other ingredients usedin local cooking. The classes took place in local village. The group of us cooked 8 dishes menu !!! Very professional teachers,all well explained. At the end we ate all the dishes. There was so much food we couldn't finish the lot. Highly recommend to anyone visiting Ubud or Bali as you can get it organised from anywhere on the island.

Very fun and worthwhile - would definitely recommend! . This cooking class was both fun and informative! We started by hearing some background on the rice fields from the lovely staff that work there and then went on to learning and creating our own offerings! Something we had been interested in from before we came and were keen to hear about. We did the afternoon session which meant we didn't get to go to the market but in the end we felt lucky to have this session with fewer people making it more intimate and meaning you really get to know the staff and be involved in every step of the cooking! The food was delicious and well presented and the staff made every bit of the session more enjoyable! Hygienic and beautiful setting, eating amongst the rice fields. Potentially the favourite thing we did in Ubud! Would highly recommend!

Wonderful time, fun and food. It was a pleasure to spend almost whole day with the team. Very nice, kind and helpful people. They ask if you have allergy for some ingredient and adjust the content.And finally - The food was fantastic.THANK YOU :-)We 200% recommend

Very nice cooking class!. I enjoyed taking this cooking class today. We made several Balinese dishes and one dessert, and everything tasted delicious. They made adjustments for vegetarians and for allergies. Everything was well-planned and moved like clockwork. Recipes were given in the end. It was fun!

Amazing food experience!. Had such a fantastic time on this cooking excursion! We got collected from our homestay and went to the morning market to see how the local people trade their fresh produce and other goodies, so nice to experience the "real people" in their everyday living. We then went off to our stunning outdoor kitchen in the middle of rice paddies ( you cannot ask for a more beautiful view!) our hosts, Made and Wayan were so lovely and welcoming! Everything was nice and clean and well organized, we even made our own offering before we started cooking. The food was delicious, the atmosphere and the help from the hosts great! We also had a real good time meeting new people in the group and we had lots of fun. This is something I would recommend doing, it is worth every memory! Thank you Canting Bali Cooking!

Best experience ever!. The experience was so perfect. The driver was on time to pick me up from the hotel, and then we went to the local market. After that, we went to a nice place in the middle of rice field to cook there. Everything was well organized. I would like to recommend it for anyone who will visit Ubud!

Great way to spend a morning. This class not only taught really cool essentials of Balinese cooking but also provided a tour of the morning food market and nearby rice patties. I learned a lot about rice, Balinese culture, and cooking! The instructors were clear about instructions and spoke pretty good English. The food was delicious. The rides to and from my hotel made everything easy. They also took photos for me while I was cooking so I have some great pictures of myself cooking. They accept solo travelers and made me feel welcome even though most people had partners. I highly recommend it.

Fantastic, Clean, Cleansing and fun!. Amongst the rice fields in Gianyar is the most beautiful setting to learn to cook. This is about a 10 min drive up into the hills above Ubud. iMade owns the land and the cooking school and he runs a great school. We learnt to cook 10 dishes from scratch and we were given the recipes and online support for when we cook it at home.. We first went to the market in Ubud to identify foods that we would be likely to use during the class. I must say that the famous peanut satay sauce - that is amazing in Bali - is taught at this school. I have never tasted Satay as good as how they cook it in Bali anywhere else in the world. I have since come home and made chicken sticks with the peanut satay sauce and they have tasted EXACTLY LIKE BALI. So great to know how to make this. My family love it! Anyway this was a highlight of my whole holiday and great to be able to nip up into the hills and cook in a beautiful setting. The class took about 4 hours and I met some beautiful people who were also learning with me. We all sat down to a grand lunch and totally enjoyed ourselves. This cooking school is very clean and safe. I hope you go and experience it for yourself when you travel to Ubud.
Amazing, Amazing, Amazing!. Loved this cooking class, which was arranged last minute by my hotel. The instructors spoke near perfect English and the food was amazing!

Perfect cooking lessons with a delightful host. For everyone that wants to get in touch with the Bali cuisine and also get some tips into the local culture, this is the spot to visit. Friendly people, good advice, eat what you cook and custom tailor your 6-7 course dinner is what you will find. In one word, awesome.
Perfect cooking session. In the middle of ricefields. Perfect package with market, ricefields, cookingand eating! We canrecommand it!!!

Best activity ever. This was the most perfect Bali experience. The class is in an balinese home in the middle of rice fields. The "cooks" are well organized and you really prepare everything yourself. The produce is fresh and full of flavour. There is always a veggie variant for every meal. ... Just delicious.

Amazing! Great food, fabulous staff!. Impressive right from the start. Pick up from our hotel was early, such friendly staff, eager for you to learn and to teach you. We had to do the night class due to our schedule so we didn't get to go to the market but absolutely still 100 % worth it. We got to see their rice fields, and make a ceremonial offering box to take home, and learn more about their culture and traditions. The ingredients were all fresh, and meat kept cool until cooking. The food we ended up making was delicious and there was more then enough of it to fill everyone plus some. Highly recommend this to anyone. Great price, great experience, and amazing people.

Great class, great teach but got food poising from the chicken resting in the sun for 3 hours. We had a great cooking class at Paon Bali while in Ubud. We were picked up on time, the staff is kind, polite and friendly.Unfortunately, the chicken spent most of the morning in the sun and we are fairly certain that we got food poising from the cooking experience.We contacted the owner when were back at the hotel (and sick) to inform him of the situation and received apologies for the unfortunate event.If we didn't get poising, we would have rated this activity a big 5 star but considering this cant go over 3.Safe option is to go vegetarian

Just perfect. In our humble opinion, everything about this cooking class was perfect. Not only the delicious food and the great recipes (which you get to take home) but also the beautiful setting amongst the rice fields and the super friendly staff. A must do during your stay in Ubud!

You gotta do it!. Such an awesome experience! From pick up to drop off, the day was so well organized, interesting and fun. The class was very hands on and the teachers were super kind and patient. Their staff works so well together and keeps the class clipping along at a great pace. And the food...beyond delicious! We are already excited to try the recipes from the take home cook book! Awesome recipes for vegetarians as well.

Brilliant cooking class, definite recommend!. Fantastic view, great people and brilliant food.We went to the evening class so you don't go to the market but I'd definitely still go. You get to cook about 8 different dishes and everyone was delicious. Highly recommend!

Absolutely amazing! . We did an evening class here and it was incredible. We're not the most confident cooks in the world but the staff helped us all the way through and taught us how to make 9 different dishes! I would recommend this to anyone who visits Ubud! Amazing location in a little village to the East of Ubud set amongst rice fields. What an excellent evening! Thank you so much - Ruby and Catriona :)

Balinese cooking . Fantastic experience amazing Balinese cooking, fresh ingredients, amazing 9 dishes cooked in a friendly, authentic setting, would recommend this cooking class to anyone wanting to learn and take a taste of Balinese cooking home - very friendly chefs who were more than happy to share their wonderful culture with you.

Great location and delicious dishes. Open kitchen in the middle of a rice field, it is the perfect location to learn how to cook Balinese. I was skeptical about the cuisine, but ended up loving the dishes they taught us. You just need to realise that you don't do every step of the process yourself, because you cook as a group. Therefore you might need to try the recipes again at home before you get it. Great value for money and fun experience though. Would really recommend. The staff is very helpful and nice.

Beautiful!. Beautiful people, beautiful place and beautiful (& tasty) food! If you are looking for a cooking class in Ubud, this is the perfect place for it. One of my highlights of getting to know amazing people and eating delicious food in Bali!!!

Stunning location, delicious food. I worked for a cooking school in Sydney for three years, so my expectations were high. I was not disappointed. The cooking school is set amongst an idyllic landscape of lush green rice paddies, with an outdoor kitchen and eating area. We had a small group, just 5 people. Our teacher, quietly spoken but very knowledgeable about Balinese cuisine and cooking methods, was very welcoming. The class included a good amount of hands on preparation and cooking and the food we made was phenomenal! A very lovely afternoon and highly recommended

Must do!!. My husband and I attended this cooking class on our honeymoon. It was such a fun afternoon. The food we made was the best meal we had in Bali. The ingredients were super fresh and we made everything from scratch. We made 8 different dishes with varied ingredients including fish, chicken, tofu, tempe and a lot of vegetables. Our teacher was great and learning how to cook balinese food amongst the owners rice field is something I'll never forget. I would recommend this class to everyone and thought it was good value for money.
