had a very nice and relaxt cooking class. this morning, together with my girlfriend, we had a very nice cooking class with made and made. they are super friendly and nice guys. the food we made was amazing! i can really recommend canting cooking if you consider taking one. they give you all the recipes, so don't worry if you forget them.

Fantastic!. We started at the Ubud market to see the items we would use In the class, then drove to a beautiful spot in the rice fields to make 7 Balinese dishes and1 dessert as a team. Then we go to enjoy them in the open air. Highly recommend this class. Beautifully organized and great people.

Tasty Teaching. This was one of the best cooking classes we've done. They came and picked us up from our hotel in the morning then took us to the market where we were shown the different ingredients and utensils we would be using during the day. It was very interesting to see the market in the morning before all of the vendors' stock changed over. The kitchen is set in the middle of rice fields so offers lovely views while you cook. The guys that ran the course were very informative and entertaining. This is a very hands on cooking class and everyone is allowed an opportunity to have a go. The food was delicious and plentiful. We definitely appreciated the recipe book we received at the completion of the session and the offers for assistance via correspondence in the future. Would definitely recommend attending this class.

A Truly Authentic and Amazing Experience into Balinese Culture and Gastronomy. Suparta and Made, two nice, friendly adn professional staff from Canting Cooking totally made our day! A German girl, a Canadian girl, an Argentinean couple and I myself from Hong Kong 5 people joined the class on March 28, 2016 morning. It was such a delightful morning. We went to the Ubud market to learn how Balinese shop for food. If not for them who told us the market is closed after 10am, we would never know the area which is renowned for souvenirs sells fresh food in the morning. We love that they patiently explained to us in detail what food and ingredients we would use in the cooking. We gathered so much local knowledge because of them. It is so good that we are more than tourists. We love too location of the school. It is surrounded by trees and rice field. All we saw was greenery. It made us extra happy. Cooking equipment is adequate and professional. The area is well covered so we didn’t feel very hot. I like that it is open rather than air-conditioned. They gave us a cinnamon lemon grass drink to welcome us which is such a lovely gesture. We had offering learning class to start our class. I love this part very much. Offering is an integral part of Balinese culture. We honour this culture by making our own offering before preparing a meal. And we made our offering in a traditional way using bamboo sticks rather than staplers. We got to choose and arrange the flowers ourselves too. We made99% of the condiments and food from scratch by ourselves. We are so happy. It is always good to know where the food in our meal comes from. We together did the chop, cut, mix, grind and cook to make a collective meal. This arrangement works very well. They offer alternative to vegetarians like me, which is so thoughtful and very important. I really appreciate this. We cooked 8 authentic delicious Balinese dishes. We enjoyed the process as well as the end result. I highly recommend this cooking class to travellers. It offers an understanding of Balinese culture and gourmet. The two staff are so nice and have such local knowledge that you will want to befriend them.

Lots to learn, even more to eat!. This was the best cooking class I've done. We booked about 30mins before the class started and they came and picked us up from our hotel within 15 minutes and were easily able to accommodate vegetarian. We cooked 8 dishes throughout the afternoon and all of them were so delicious! Would definitely recommend.

Classic Balinese food amongst the rice fields. We took the afternoon class as we only wanted to cook without the fuss of the markets. After unsuccessfully booking with another cooking class last minute due to a ceremony, we booked Canting through our hotel just for the afternoon. The driver picked us up from our hotel in Ubud within 10 minutes and took us straight to the location which was an adorable small outdoor setting in amongst a local rice field. I am a vegan so they offered me a vegetarian option (only the desert used egg) and my friend the meat option. The food was superb, fresh ingredients and so much food this class of 5 couldn't finish it all! Would highly recommend.

Absolutely love this place!!!!!!. One of my best experiences in Ubud!! I really can't recommend this place enough! Food was amazing!!!!!!!! The guys were so friendly! Picked us up from our bungalow and brought us out to their location in the middle of a paddy field! Explained and showed us how to make Canang Sari (Balinese Hindi flower offerings that you will see everywhere in Bali!) and then we got to make so many different Balinese recipes! This is a must-do!

Fantastic Cooking Authentic Balinese Cooking. We visited Canting Bali last week and cannot recommend it highly enough. We were picked up from our hotel around 8.15am and taken to a food market where we were shown how the locals purchase items for different dishes and offerings, then we went to a coffee farm and given an insightful tour ending with a coffee tasting. When we arrived at the family home the hosts were already preparing food and we got straight to work chopping, frying and grinding. We were encouraged to taste as we went and each recipe was explained in detail. At the end or group of 5 had made around 13 dishes (meat and vegan) and all sat down to enjoy.Afterwards we were given envelopes containing all the recipes we had made.The kitchen was clean but traditional and the setting was lovely.A great morning spent with great people.

Lovely Cooking in Rice Fields . Delicious and fun! Very organized and well executed from start to finish. The location was beautiful, in the middle of rice fields. Great trip to the market first to learn about local produce and spices. Made a ton of food, more than our group could finish. They supplied cold water throughout the day, and gave us a cookbook with all the recipes at the end. I've done other cooking classes before and this one is one of the best. Highly recommended!!

Great cooking course, would recommend!. This cooking course was so good! We made a lot of different recipes, everyone participated in every dish, switching in pairs (so you really got to learn all of them) and we had a small group of seven people. I called the day before and then they had no one enlisted, they told me that the maximum amount of people in one group was six. Seven was fine though, and I think there was even equipment for eight. They said all the food we couldn't eat (it was that much, even with second helpings) would be for the family and we got all the recipes when the class was finished. I would recommend to get up early though (you get picked up around 8am) and do the morning course because the visit to the local market was also great! The market starts at four in the morning and terminates at 10am, so the afternoon class can't go. My boyfriend and I have been traveling in Asia for almost five months and been to numerous local markets but we still learned some things (and bought some real cheap Luwak coffee!). All in all a great day, and you probably won't need dinner!

Great experience . This is a beautiful location and a beautifully run little cooking school. Great dishes, lovely atmosphere, fab friendly staff who were wonderful with our kids. We had lots of fun and a delicious lunch!

Great class, beautiful area and super friendly people . We had the afternoon cooking class today and we had a great time. We booked it late (same day) and were happy we could still join. We got picked up from our hotel. We drove to a smaller village nearby. The cooking class is outside and surrounded by the most beautiful rice fields. We were received with a welcome drink and had a nice chat with the cook. He explains everything very calm and that is great while cooking. We cooked 7 dishes in total. And by cooking I mean we actually chopped, crushed, fried, steamed, mixed, baked etc the food. All my questions could be answered and we actually took something away here. Fully confident that we can recreate something alike at home (no of course not the same, never is at home). We actually were only the 2 of us which was awesome. The morning class was more busy with 19 total, they then split the group in two and have more assistance. We highly recommend this cooking class. Especially if you actually want to do something rather than just looking. Btw it all tasted excellent!

Fantastic experience. Can't rate this highly enough. Amazing location in a rice paddy only 15 mins from Ubud. Picked up from hotel on time by the cooking instructor with great English. All of the staff were attentive and gave excellent tuition. The food was incredibly delicious. Overall a very professional cooking class. Would highly recommend.

Great food and fantastic experience. Pick up was on time. The location of the cooking cook was superb; being surrounded by rice fields. All the staff were very attentive, friendly and professional. There was a good selection of Indonesian dishes to prepare. The end result was delicious and beautifully presented.

Learned how to make Balinese food. Ive never been to a cooking class before and this is really good.We paid 350k rupiah (some people paid around 300k) Got picked up at 8:00am, drove 20 min to the market, where the guide explained all the food we were going to use. Then we drove to the village, and went to the cooking station. Making the food was really fun. They showed us every single ingredient and we cut everything ourselves. We also stirfried everything and mixed the salad with our hands. We also used a pestele to grind up the basic balinese sauce.We were on a farm, where they grew their own rice. Everything was really clean and the instructions were very good. I wish they served more meat in the curry though, a lot of things were vegetarian, but overall the food was delicious I recommend doing this if you never had a cooking class before.

Now we know how to cook Balinese food!. The class was a pleasant surprise. The place where we did the cooking is located near the rice fields, so the view was very nice. The staff was very friendly, enthusiastic and humorous. We learned to cook a variety of dishes, each of which were easy to make. After the class we ate the food we cooked, which came out to be very tasty. I definitely recommend this class.

Delicious. The place is really beautiful, is in a rice field, and the environment and the music of the place is very enjoyable. They picked up each person from every hotel and took us to the market explaining about all the spices the use. Very friendly people, and the food was delicious, we all took part preparing every plate. There is no problem if you are vegetarian, they are able to change it without problem.

An inspiring Bali Cooking Class. This cooking class was very professionally presented with a relaxed atmosphere and friendly staff and guests. Learnt how to cook many dishes the traditional way in an undercover outdoor setting surrounded by gardens and rice fields after visiting the local markets to learn the names of local foods.

Fabulous cooking class in the middle of the rice paddies. Amazing view of Mt Batur in the middle of the rice paddies. The staff were great. Made picked us up in Penenstanan and took us to Canting Bali. We learnt to make offerings, soup, Tempe, tofu Curry, fish skewer, grilled fish in banana leaf, Mix Vegetable and dessert. Was a great place to meet people from around the world. The food we made was so good and we enjoyed a lovely lunch. So worth it!

Great Cooking Experience . My friend and I did the morning class at Canting Bali and loved every moment of it! The market visit in the morning was informative and enjoyable but the main fun comes when you arrive to the kitchen! Situated in the middle of a rice paddie field, the kitchen is outside and very well organised! And the food!!... The food was incredible! The staff, who are friendly and speak fantastic English, help you to create an array of colourful and very tasty dishes! All served buffet style at the end of trip! Overall the experience was fantastic and I would hugely recommend that you take the time to do this cooking class! Thank you everyone at Canting Bali!

Truly fantastic experience !. I cannot recommend this cooking class enough, if you're going to do a class in Bali, choose this one! We had a truly wonderful time, it was so enjoyable and worth every penny.After hotel pick up, we went to visit the market and see how locals buy all of their cooking ingredients and we learned about some of the ingredients we later used in the class. Then we were driven to the cooking class itself, about half an hour drive from Ubud centre but it was a very enjoyable (air conditioned) scenic journey. The class is located in an absolutely stunning area, out in the open amongst the rice paddies. It was beautiful and meant we had an amazing view to enjoy whilst cooking/eating. We were given a delicious welcome drink and introduction, and then we were taught briefly how to make simple offerings from coconut leaves, which was lovely.We made 8 different amazing dishes, in our case all vegetarian (they have a great selection). The teachers were incredibly friendly and very helpful, they showed us exactly what to do and were very patient with us. We were assisted with cooking but it was still hands on, it was a good balance of us cooking and being helped. We had so much fun and learnt so much. We were given all the recipes to take home too so that's very exciting!After we'd cooked we sat down to eat, everything was absolutely delicious - truly amazing food! Honestly just had the best time at this class, everyone was so nice, the food was incredible, and the whole experience was lovely. Really good value for money too - 350K IDR each - less then you'd pay for the meal itself in some places, not to mention the class too!Loved it!
The best cooking class. Take the morning class so you can go to the market. You will cook in the middle of the rise feel with a good teacher, all of us did made all the dishes

Really enjoyable cooking class . Really good experience. The food was very tasty and we were given excellent direction! We really liked the trip to the market and the fact that they give you all the recipes in a little booklet at the end so you can try to recreate the dishes at home!

The best cooking class I've taken so far. I've done quite a few (Thailand, India, Nepal) but this one really stood out. Take the morning class:8:30am to get a tour of the market where they will walk you through some of the ingredients and indeed some of the other items you'll stumble upon.They'll pick you up from your hotel but the part I liked most was where it took place. You're set in the middle of rice fields in open plan kitchens. You'll begin by making an offering basket of flowers and greeted by some of the friendliest people you can imagine.Great value for money. If you can book direct instead of the agents on Ubud main street, you can probably get the price down. 250000R-350000R, better value than some of the ones nearer to our Villa.We made 2 curries, a soup, desert, 4 other dishes and they gave us a booklet with all info to take home so if you're feeling a little tired from the early rise like I was and didn't remember every step, they had me covered. Unlike other classes, there was no waiting time between dishes. When we were finishing one, the next meal was being prepped on the table behind us. You'll get into every detail...I just loved it!

Great and very nice cookingclass!. If you take the morning class they will take you to the local market to sort out all the ingredients! If you take the afternoon class you'll skip that part.Before preparation of the multiple course meal the friendly staff will tell you everything about all the ingredients you are going to use if they haven't done that already on the market! After that you'll start cutting and slicing them. Then step by step they will let you make the recipes. Think about a really nice soup, a salade, some skewers with chicken or tuna and so on.... you'll will eat your fingers because of the fine taste of it all! If you asked me this is a real "must do" during your stay in Ubud!!! You won't be disappointed! And last but not least it's worth the money.

Excellent balinese cooking class. In the middle of the rice fields,locates the small cooking class of canting bali. And small is good. Because its means small groups. And a lot you can do yourself. First a little tour on the ubud fresh market. After that we continue. Our class began. Of making a offering which is ofcourse more difficult than it looks like. Chopping, frying cooking, pounding. By cooking one of you is the assistant and one does the cooking. Which ofcourse was fun, hells kitchen yell" yes chef" was often heard. There were also two lovely kids and they did enjoy too.Overall i was very happy and the food taste soooo good. Thanks to our master chef Koman who ofcourse really was the master brain. Overall a really nice day.Later i will place some photo's

Great experience. Very professional, hotel pick up, quick lesson about Balinese offering, fresh produce, great recipes. We not only learnt how to cook Indonesian dishes but we asked a lot of questions about the culture, religion, traditions while eating delicious lunch. Recommend!!!

Fantastic Canting bali. The whole overall experience was excellent. Picked up from hotel by friendly and knowledgable chefs who spoke perfect English. Taken to the market where produce and custom of making offerings were explained fully. The setting for the course is perfect and very peaceful in the middle of rice fields. Our hosts were fabulous very patient and willing to share stories of Balinese life with us. This course Is one of my best memories to take home with me and and would highly recommend to others, whatever your previous cooking experience. Oh and the food was beyond delicious.

A Fun Choice!. Loved this class. 350,000 IDR per person. We were collected from our accommodation and first stop was the markets to show us the ingredients we would be using. There were 8 in our group. Firstly they showed us how to make our own personal Hindu Offering which we could take back to put out the front of our motel unit.We were introduced to our authentic ingredients and shown how to chop up them up. We ground them up and then took turns cooking various parts of our great menu. Once it was all cooked we shared the banquet. Our hosts were fantastic- very patient, polite and helpful. The entire group had a wonderful time and our meal was delicious.
Canting course. Great course. Great fun. Very well put together and delicious. Market visit was interesting. Best do morning class for that.

Canting Bali was the best class yet!!. We have done a few cooking classes on previous trips to bali but this was the best one yet. Set among the rice paddies it is a relaxing way to spend a few hours learning balinese cooking!!Feasting at the end of your cooking class is the icing on the cake.

Amazing cooking class. My friends and I loved the cooking class and would highly recommend it to anyone who loves cooking (and eating). We started off with a visit to the market where the different ingredients were explained to us. The cooking class itself took place in a village nearby in the middle of rice fields (the rice you're going to cook comes from those fields). We cooked about 9 different Balinese dishes from soup to desert and everyone got to participate in everything unlike in other cooking classes. As some people were vegetarian we always cooked different versions, so don't worry if you don't eat fish or meat. The food was delicious and the guys were always happy to answer questions. Thank you for that!

Hands in, perfect organisation, tasty food. Starting from immediate response for booking mail, everything was perfect. From the first minute hands in, which is not a rule in all cooking classes. Made and his colleagues worked very well with 8 people group. Ingredients were prepared beforehand, our work was friendly supervised and no question remained without answer. Food was great and we have fun while preparing it. Highly recommended.

Canting Bali Cooking Class. Fantastic cooking class:@ very friendly hosts with a lot of knowledge about Balinrse cooking@ we learnt how to create a herb / spice base that can be used for Balenese soups, side dishes and main meals@ very relaxed enjoyable experience - my partner (initially a somewhat reluctant participant) really enjoyed @ classes are held amongst picturesque rice fields@ excellent value for moneyWe have enjoyed it very much and would recommend it to others without any hesitation.

Lovely time learning authentic Balinese cooking skills. My husband and I had a great time learning to cook a wide range of Balinese dishes as well as sharing experiences with the very friendly staff. The visit of the market was very nice with explanation and descriptions of what local do and buy. The place where we cooked is beautiful in the middle of a rice paddy with white herons, ducks, frangipani and sunshine away from the very busy and loud Ubud town. It was a very relaxing time meeting great people and enjoying eating a delicious meal cooked by ourself. We left with a recipe booklet, ready to try at home. I recommend it to anyone, a highlight of our holidays, thank you.

Excellent teachers, breath taking surroundings, delicious food!. The cooking class was wonderful! The two teachers Made and Made, gave excellent information and guidance, the food we made was authentic Balinese and the location was stunning. Outside of Ubud, overlooking rice fields where ducks waggle around. Highly recommendable!

Perfect cooking class!. The scenery was gorgeous as well as the food! The staff were so friendly, patient and knowledgeable! They picked us up from our hostel, showed us around the food markets to look at the ingredients we'd be using then introduced us to some seriously yummy, quick and healthy meals!

Very good!. My boyfriend had a great experience with this company. We were picked up at 8am and taken to the markets, this part of the day I found to be unnecessary as we weren't buying the ingredients because they had already done that. Maybe we felt this way because we have already seen the markets several times, also it was a lot of 'this is this and we will use that later' basically all that could be said for vegetables and spices. When we arrived at the cooking place we were given a welcome drink, some form of cold tea which was nice. The area itself is surrounded by beautiful rice fields! We got to cook around 8 dishes all using traditional Balinese methods. The cooking instructors were very good and explained everything. The best part of the day was sitting down and eating all the delicious food we had all prepared, luckily we were only in a group of 5 so there was so much food! I would definitely recommend this cooking experience we really enjoyed ourselves!

Fantastic Veg or non Veg Cooking Class. There were many choices for Bali cooking classes. We LOVED our experience with Canting. They pick you up in the morning and whisk you to the market, pointing out all the vendors specialties and local foods. I could have spent more time here in the market( great for photo ops) but there was cooking to be done. We were transported with a small group of others from various locations to a one level elevated building smack in the middle of a lovely rice field. With open sides to the buildings it gave a feeling of openness and serenity surrounded by the lush green. We started our day by drinking tea and learning to make one of the offerings that you see so frequently in Indonesia. We were given a quick rundown of various ingredients used in Indonesian cooking and their importance. Our head Chef was great! We then paired off and made 6 or 7 dishes. Soup, Spicy/Sweet Tempeh, Tofu Curry, Fish Satay(Skewer), Grilled Fish in Banana Leaf, Mixed Veggies and Coconut Cake with palm sugar for dessert. AMAZING!!! The feeling of sitting down to eat a meal we made with our fellow chefs was so fun and rewarding. As a parting gift you are given a printout of all the dishes you made and their recipes to take home. Wonderful experience and a great class!!! Indonesian cooking is so unique, taking a class like this helps connect you to their culture.

Beautiful surroundings Great food !. We really enjoyed our cooking class from the walk through the garden to tasting the delicious meals we created . Made was a patient and considerate host who was also very personable and friendly.You are cooking right amongst the rice fields that make for a serene experience.The value is incredible too ...... We can't recommend enough !!

Awesome experience!. Me and my friend booked the class through our hostel, the price includes the pickup and drop off to our accommodation. The place where we had the class is located in a small mountain town 15 minutes away from Ubud town, and it's in the middle of rice field, very very nice!Although we did the afternoon class without visiting the local market, but there were only me and my friend, the teacher gave us introduction to local herbs and other ingredients in details, and we made 8 different dishes which were amazingly delicious!Thank you again for the wonderful experience! Totally worthy!

Sexiest cooking class in Ubud. Mr. Sexy was an awesome teacher. Made us laugh the whole time. Learned to cook authentic balinese food right smack in the middle of the rice fields. Totally worth the time and money. Stay gold!✌

Great experience . Couldn't have asked for a better experience. We got everything we wanted to get out of the class. We firstly went to the market and the Balinese man explained all the different ingredients we were going to use in the cooking class and talked about all the different spices. He answered all questions and was very polite and helpful. Once we arrived at the rice paddy we made offerings and then begun the class. The class was amazing, we all got to help prepare the ingredients and then cook all the dishes. The teacher had great humour, answered all the questions asked, got everyone involved and of course was a great cook himself. Would definitely recommend to do this class even if you aren't a capable cook. The experience was great. We all got to take the recipes home and the teacher also gave his email so if we have any problems or questions when we are cooking these amazing dishes at home we could send him an email
Definitely recommend . The hosts are lovely and the food is beautiful! The cooking class is set amongst a rice field which makes it feel even more authentic!

Wonderful cooking class. We were very well looked after by Made and his brother-in-law Made from pick up to drop off at our hotel. The market was fascinating, especially with Made's explanations. The cooking school itself is in a beautiful location in the midst of rice fields. We first made floral offerings before cooking 8 delicious dishes. Everything was explained clearly and it was very well organised. The meal we prepared was delicious.We very much enjoyed our morning in a peaceful and relaxing setting. Highly recommended.

Incredible experience !!. The canting bali cooking was one of the most incredible classes that i made the the kitchen inside rice fields was so beautiful and the staff is so profesional and helpful im very happy i recommended to every body

Awsome Experience !. I took an evening cooking class while my friends went white water rafting. Although I was the only participant signed up of this class I was provided with an unforgettable experience. First I learned a little about the Hindu culture and made my own offering. I then learned about different balinese spices and food preparation. We cooked a mushroom chicken soup, 5 delightful dishes, and a fantastic dessert. In all of the dishes made the meat could be adapted to preference eg. cod instead of tuna and Tofu instead of meat. The location was beautiful, kitchen facility was great, clean and had proper washing facilities. The morning class also provides a trip to the local market which would have added to the experience however it didn't fit into my schedule.

Excellent hospitality & food. My wife and I did a morning class with canting. Everything from the hotel pickup to the tour of the food market and cooking course was excellent. Made is a great host and teacher who really takes the time to explain Balinese culture and cuisine. The setting is also really picturesque and peaceful in the middle of his family's rice paddies. Cannot recommend this enough. One suggestion is to go for a morning class as the afternoon class doesn't include a tour of the local food market where they source the ingredients.

One of most worthwhile things have done travelling so far. Awesome afternoon! Collected promptly from hotel by the two brothers that run the family business, quickly informed me that was the only person that had booked in for the afternoon but were happy to accommodate me one on one! Great variety of dishes in display that were to be cooked and the guys broke everything down so was very simple to understand and follow, before joining me for dinner! Would highly recommend, will definitely return when back in Bali with friends

Amazing class-not to be missed !. We were lucky to have a class just the two of us, like a private cooking lesson! The guys that run this are great we made our own offering and learnt so much about Balinese food can't wait to cook some of this when I get home ! Beautiful location, worth every penny and delicious food

Excellent!. Brilliant cooking class! Learnt so much! Showed us around the market first then took us to their beautiful location. Got to cook several dishes from scratch with very good instructor, 1 to 1 cooking. Then sat down and had lovely lunch!!! Gave us all recipes to take away. Highly recommend!

awesome cooking class! . Firstly I was little bit scared of another touristic trap. I am quite sceptic about the atractions in Bali! But this was totally worth it.I dont eat meat and it was not a problem. They gave me a favour. (I prepared tempeh or tofu instead of meat). Nice lectures, delicious food. Amazing, I like it very much.

Excellent and interesting cooking class . I really appreciated this cooking class as I have learnt a lot about balinese food. The chef gave a lot of explanations about spices, ingredients, ... and the food is really good ! the class takes place in a rice field wich is really nice ! I would recommend it ! In bonus you have also explanations about rice field and also the daily balinese offering (you will prepare your own offering). Thanks for this awesome experience

Amazing cooking in beautiful surroundings. We had an amazing morning and cooked a wide variety of food. We opted for the morning session as this involved a trip to the local market to see the ingredients that we would be cooking with later.Once we arrived in very impressive rice field surroundings we started off by making a local offering basket before the food preparation begun.It was just the 2 of us so we got lucky as it meant we had lots of time to ask questions and the staff were fantastic. They were all from the local village which gave it more authenticity. Would definitely recommend!

Learned a lot, ate a lot!. This is a great introduction to Ubud and to Balinese cuisine. Classes are small and very hands-on, and you get to try as much as you want of various dishes, made as mild or as spicy as you like. Great fun, learned a lot, and had a lovely meal in the bargain!

Small class sizes, with fun staff, and great food.. We started with a visit to the locl Market, and went through the ingredients we'd be using. They had already bought the ingredients fresh earlier, and the tour of the markets was informative and fun.Then back to the cooking school amongst the beautiful rice paddies of Laplapan, a yummie welcome drink, a friendly chat and a quick review of the food we'd be preparing. About 9 dishes in all. The it was down to the preparation. Not too arduous - really we did most of the fun bits. The staff did some of them ore tedious parts in the background.Once we had finished, the dishes were arranged in a beautiful buffet with attractive garnishes, and it was time to dig in. Enak dua-kali!There was a great range of traditional balinese food, all great tasting, with recipes provided.Great value for money, and a good morning out. I'd definitely go back, as well as recommend it to others.

Lovely local class in rice fields . Great cooking class being run by family in Laplapan just outside of Ubud. I have done a few classes on previous visits and this was probably the most enjoyable one for me - enthusiastic and friendly Made and Nyoman are happy to share and show you the balinese cooking style. it is hands on too which is good. Beautiful setting amongst rice fields and the array of dishes is superb! You won't leave hungry :) oh, they also show you how to make offerings and market tour in the morning.
Absolutely amazing!. The atmosphere was great. The instructor was really nice. The food tasted marvelous. All in all great experience. Would highly recommend!
Informative afternoon class. Began class with an informative introduction to all the Balinese ingredients. Had fun preparing and cooking all the courses. Delicious banquet to complete the lesson.

A fun day learning Balinese cooking. We had a really enjoyable day that started with a tour of the market which was very insightful. The cooking class itself is fun and in a really nice setting amounts rice fields. For the more adventurous cook it may be a little too structured but when they are catering for a group its understandable. All in all a fun day out.

Brilliant day. I would 100% recommend this cookery class. We had a great day with a lovely guy teaching. We made the best Balinese food we ate in our whole trip! If you are going to cook then cook here! Location was also amazing. A lot of other cookery classes were in restaurants in central ubud whereas as this one was in the middle of the countryside surrounded by rice fields

Great taste of Ubud! . We loved everything about this experience. Great price, nicest staff, clean cooking area, close and personal approach, local markets & hand picking ingredients! Our guide also offered lots of interesting information about the area. Couldn't recommend it more!
Sensational Cooking Class. This cooking class is located in the middle of an organic garden. Beautiful scenery, tasty food, friendly and helpful staff! You could not ask for better!

True Balinese experience, Hands-on. After much research I decided to book this cooking class among so many others due of the added market and the organic farm visit. It turns out to be a great choice choosing this cooking school. Disclaimer: if you are truly princess and do not like to get into the farm and country side maybe this is not for u. A lot of hands on and getting hands dirty. But it's worth it. We booked weeks in advanced and got some discount via booking it online. Pick up on the day was on time. The van was quite OLD and little uncomfortable, but it's very clean and the driver was very careful. After picking everybody from other hotels we were greeted by our guide in the local market. We get to see the local produce and tried some of fruits and local cake. After that we took quite a journey on the road before reaching the organic farm which is just at the back garden of our cooking class. Our guide took us through the garden and we get to pick the vegetables (ie: carrots, chilies, bok choy..etc) that we need for later. Cooking utensils and ingredients are all well prepared and washed for us. We get a booklet of recipes, a free balinese aprons and a welcome drink. We cooked many dishes and ate our own meals. It was fun by using the local grinder and the traditional way of cooking. Pros: easy to follow recipes, helpful and friendly staffs, meals are delicious, great and authentic balinese experience Cons: pick up van was quite old and uncomfortable, only 1 bottle of water is provided (you might want to bring your own water or else u can order extra drink there). Recommended if you like a true balinese experience

Great days cooking. Great experience, market visit intersesting, enjoyed trying different fruits. Organic farm is beautiful, nice and cool, tour of garden interesting, cooking instruction well done, excellent tutor. Food was delicious, learnt a lot. Only negative, needed more covers to cover prepared food while waiting to eat it. Otherwise great day out.

Beautiful organic farm, delicious food! . I found this cooking class on tripadvisor, out of hundreds of different classes in Ubud and I am glad I booked this one ! What an excellent experience from the online booking to the confirmation, the pick up at the hotel, the visit to the market and of course the ambiance at the class. We went to the market in the morning on the way to the farm, and tried local fruits with our guide. When we arrived at the farm, Made our Chef, welcomed us with a nice refreshing drink. We went to the farm to collect some vegetables and fresh herb to use them for the class. He introduced us to the staff and then we started to cook. We went over 6 Indonesian recipes including a banana pudding. The food was so fresh, the quality and the taste were just amazing. The staff was so helpful, always here to assist you during the cooking class. Also super friendly and funny! I would definitely recommend this place as it is ran by a community in a small village. The general feeling after 6 hours on site was simply relaxing, peaceful and yummy! Hope I will be able to cook the same dishes back home ! Terimakasi baniak

Fun with Food!. The class was amazing! Friendly chefs, you get to pick your ingredients, cook with them , eat the meal together with the group and get the recipes! They pick you up from your hotel early morning and drop you back! I am a vegetarian and I had separate dishes to cook on my station! they tell you all the substitutes as well, wherever you are living! Glad that I did this, A day well spent!

Love it! . We start from the market tour by a Balinese guide who speak very good English and he explain a lot about food, fruit and spices at the market. Then we continue driving to the farm where the cooking class held. We offered coffee and tea as the welcome drink then another guide took us to walk around their organic farm with lots of different kind vegetables, fruits and spices, also we got to cut our own vegetables for the cooking.... More excited story about this experience, only one way to know is to experience it, we love it and we recommend this place for cooking class.

Beautiful farm, great staff, wonderful food!. The day started with a short visit to the local market where we wandered around talking about some Balinese cooking ingredients; spices, roots, veggies and fruits. We had a chance to sample some of the fruits (jackfruit, snakeskin fruit) as well as a few prepared foods made in front of our eyes and presented on banana leaves. Our guide who would later be our cooking teacher was happy to answer questions and judging by the prices he paid for what we ate - the whole experience was pretty authentic! We then moved on to the farm where (after a welcome drink) we toured the gorgeous grounds first. More alike to gardens than a farm to my eyes with winding paths, pergolas and beautiful trees throughout. We ate passion fruit right from the vine and stopped to smell, look at and talk about the various spices, fruits, and veggies as well as some less obvious things such as cacao and coffee. Then we started cooking! The class was divided into two sessions with mealtime in between and was very comfortably paced. All of the washing and difficult prep (peeling etc) was done for us so our time was focused on preparing the six different dishes. We had been given a recipe book for the day and I happily made notes and snapped photos as I worked with my partner at our station. We were lucky with only 5 class members that day, the maximum here is 12.Sukuda (our guide) was an excellent cook who's infectious laugh and calm demeanour set us at ease quickly. The class was a perfect balance of us cooking and the staff making sure everything went smoothly, taking over when needed. He was happy to answer questions and correct mistakes usually before they happened. He is young and energetic but clearly has been doing this for some time. Thanks Sukuda!Lastly I should note that they are extremely accommodating of vegetarian and vegan diets with an entirely separate book and recipe changes where needed. As often happens, the non-veg folks were very curious to try the delicious things we were making.Overall this was an unforgettable day in a beautiful place with kind and talented staff. Treat yourself to a visit to this organic farm and cooking school!!
Great fun!. I can totally recommend this cooking class. Even my husband who wasnt very keen really enjoyed it! We went to a hidden farmers market and cooked with the ingredients.

Lovely experience. We really enjoyed the cooking classes at the farm. We started at local market, then we went to the farm, visited all farm, took part of ingredients directly from the garden and prepare 5 dishes plus dessert. We love the idea and we spent a great time. Highly recommend the farm to others!

Fantastic food, great instruction...all in a beautiful setting!. After reading reviews, I picked this class because it was on an organic farm. I am so glad I did! We were picked up at 7:30 am, toured the local market with the cooking instructor, drove to the farm, picked our produce fresh and started our lessons. The instructor explained all the spices, ingredients and cooking techniques. The food was far better than any of the dozens of restaurants I have tried in Bali. The portions were generous. There were several courses including dessert. We alternated between cooking and eating. It was paced nicely and allowed for conversations among the students. There are several staff members who assist with washing the produce and clearing pots/pans. It leaves you able to focus on chopping, cooking and eating. I highly recommend this cooking school!

Great experience. If you've been to the markets in Ubud, join the afternoon cooking class and enjoy a fantastic dinner that you cook yourself. We really liked walking the vegetable garden and collecting our own ingredients.The recipes selected are not overly difficult to cook and taste fantastic. Our group in the afternoon was much smaller than the one we saw finishing for the morning. This meant we had more attention from Made and the team.Overall we had a fantastic time and highly recommend this class.

Learn the secret to balinese cooking bumbu . Great tour. Do the morning one, get to go to the market and try all sorts of fruits and traditional sweets. Then got to go to farm and make heaps of food. Made Tempe, satay, salad, tuna and banana pudding. Makes cooking fun and easy. Was great experience.

Great way to spend time in Bali. We did the cooking course just yesterday and it was fabulous. Having done cooking classes all over Asia this is one of my favorites. The walk around the market is informative and you get to try some fruits you might never have heard of.The setting of the kitchen on the organic farm was so beautiful. The instructors bith were great and the dishes we cooked were delicious. So if you think about a cooking class choose this one instead of choosing one im Ubud directly. Highly recommend!!!!

HIGHLY RECOMMEND / fun / informative / great experience. We started the day out in a local market where our guide and teacher ,MADE, showed us around. He even bought a few local fruits and cakes for us to try. The place where we did the cooking is just amazing. It is picture perfect , they had their own farm where you go out to get vegetables for your cooking. The lesson was well planned and carried through. You get to cook all your dishes on your own , in a group of 2 in a beautiful setting. i would definitely recommend anyone to have a class there if you are in bali!

Best Cooking Class . This is the only one that you actually go to the organic farm, get educated on the food they grow, that's organic, and that you pick yourself to use for you cooking class that spans a good portion of your time. They split it into two parts so you get to enjoy a few dishes before returning to the cutting board. Warm and kind staff. I have had another Balinese cooking class a few days prior and because we were on the farm grounds, this was a experience quite unique and wonderful. The food were all tasty and clean.

Wonderful experience. My daughter and I have the opportunity to visit the Farm. What an experience! The drive to the location was beautiful. We stopped at a market along the way and had a fantastic time learning about the foods along with tasting some amazing foods.Continued the trip to the farm all the while admiring the scenery. The out door cooking and eating area made the experience even more enjoyable.The people at the farm are so nice. We walked around getting the tour and collecting ingredients for out cooking class. We learned about different trees, fruits, vegetables and spices. With the expert help of the people there we cooked about four dishes and thoroughly enjoyed each one.Give this school a try In the beautiful out doors of Bali.

Quite Possibly the Best Cooking Class in Bali!. My two kids and I were so happy we chose this class. It felt like so much more than a cooking class. Our group began our day at a local market learning about the different fruits and veggies that we'd be cooking with. Next we headed to the beautiful location of the class, a group owned organic farm. Once at the farm we were given little baskets to collect various herbs and vegetables that we were going to use in our cooking. This provided a great opportunity to learn more about Balinese agriculture and my kids loved seeing where their food came from. Once we went back to the classroom area we found each station was fully prepared with our ingredients for the first two of six dishes that we were to make. The instructors found the perfect balance of guiding us and letting us try things on our own. Upon finishing the first two dishes we sat down to eat, complete with rice from their own farm. We then set off to make the last four recipes, which included an amazing curry that served as base for two recipes. The process of the curry; from chopping to grinding in the mortar and pestle was so fun for my kids. Each and everyone of the dishes was delicious and the chicken curry was the best that I've had during all our time here in Bali. We left with full bellies and happy souls. The entire day felt well thought out and we were well taken care of. Every detail was considered in making it an excellent experience- from the recipes and the plan for cooking, to the hand washing stations and clean restrooms. It was truly a pleasure taking this class and I'd do it again in a heartbeat.
amazing class!. If you want an authentic experience you must come here.The farm and the staff who run it very passionate about cooking and having fresh produce.

Wonderful experience. I thoroughly enjoyed every bit of the organic farm cooking day. I was picked up and driven through lovely villages and past some beautiful rice teraces to a village market where I was shown the unique fruits, vegetables and snacks of the region. Then I was driven to the farm where I helped pick the vegetables for the cooking. I had a wonderful cooking instructor who explained the balinese cooking techniques as we cooked and I felt he had a great love of Bali and it's cuisine.I have never tasted beter food and was even able to take a doggy bag home for my evening Dinner. Thank you to the whole team for a very enjoyable and memorable experience I highly recommend this to anyone who wishes to learn more about Bali and its wonderful food.

Great experience, must do in Ubud. If you would like to learn more about the Balinese kitchen, then I could not recommend this course more. The course takes place on their organic farm, and you are shown around and receive an explanation of all their crops. The cooking course itself includes six dishes, all delicious. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable and speak good English. You are given a booklet with all the recipes you've prepared and then some to take home, can't wait to try them again at home.

a must do!!!. this was so much fun..i learnt so much..ate so much...going to the market was educational to say the least! the staff went out of their way to make it an incredable experience...the facilaties..garden/produce cleanleness transport etc was 100/100!! highly recommended xxx thankyou for such a great experience

A great experience. A wonderful day, starting with a pick up from our villa and travelling north up into the hills. We stopped at a local fresh food market and our guide explained many of the fruits and vegetables that were unfamiliar to us. When we arrived at the farm, we were welcomed with a cup of ginger tea and then we were led around to see the variety of fruit, vegetables, herbs and spices that flourished there and harvested what we would need for our culinary efforts later in the day. Teamed in pairs at each cooking station and wearing our complimentary aprons, we proceeded to chop, slice, grind and cook our way through the recipes that were planned for the day. What great fun! After all our hard work, we were able to eat the fruits of our labours - totally delicious. The farm and school is run by the local community and income goes straight back to the locals.A very rewarding day.
Amazing. Loved the farm!! The cooking class was so yum. And they were very accommodating to me as I don't eat meat!!

Outstanding local experience. The Balinese Farm Cooking School is a fabulous opportunity to see the high country north of Ubud. Combined with a visit to a local market, gathering vegetables for the cooking class from the farm's organic garden and cooking a range of home style Balinese dishes, the experience is one of the most enjoyable in the area. The Balinese Farm School is a fair trade venture that directly benefits the local community.

The perfect day trip. I booked this cooking class for my husband and I as he loves to cook. We started by wandering around a local market looking at various fresh foods and sampling many, including some delicious cooked foods. On arrival at the farm we collected our vegetables and each vegetable and it's different substitutes was explained. We cooked six dishes over the course of the day. I don't like cooking yet thoroughly enjoyed the day. All the food is brought to you and you chop and cook - and eat. The explanations are clear and detailed, with lots of additional tips. Between each dish the dirty dishes are taken away and cleaned for you. We learnt so much and can't wait to try cooking at home from the helpful recipe book they give you. The aprons are a great souvenir as well. Highly recommended!

Incredible cooking class. I decided to do this cooking class because they have grand farm! I liked soooo much i could see various type of veges and fruits!! Instructor was so cute i love the ambient. It was like in the heaven. And food was so good :) thanx for good experience!!!
Fantastic Farm. Great farm and amazing cooking class. I would recommend this to everyone. During my trip to Bali this was one of my favourite activities.

Wonderful Attention to Detail. Wonderful attention to detail was paid to virtually every aspect of this cooking experience - taking you to the market, explaining different spices, showing you around the quaint organic farm and letting you pick ingredients. Although it is a cooking class, everything is washed and basically prepared for you - you chop and dice and use the mortar and pestle and grate, then add the ingredients to the pots, but there's no peeling vegetables or any of the tiresome prep work. The atmosphere is also very welcoming: you cook two or three dishes out in the open with a partner, then eat, then cook again, with beautiful Balinese music playing in the backdrop. There are a few things that can be improved: during the transfer, I think more effort could be made to explain different aspects of Balinese life (it was only when I asked and prodded that I learnt about some cultural traditions), and photos (or hand-drawn pictures) could have been included in the cook books so you have a basic idea of what your meals are supposed to look like. But these are small recommendations given that the staff (who are all from the same family) go to the effort of catering for meat eaters, vegetarians and vegans, and really are doing something so positive for their community.

Amazing authentic experience. . This cooking class was so much fun. I loved how the class was kept quite small (12ppl max) with 2 people working on each cooking station. Everyone cooks the same dish and eats together. This course is done on an organic farm, so we luckily were able to have a look around and see all the amazing fruits, herbs and spices they're growing. The team is very friendly and do an excellent job of facilitating the day. I would go back and try the vegetarian menu, it looked amazing!!

Amazing way to spend a day learning about food and farming. This isn't just a cooking class - you learn about the whole food cycle. First, we visited a local market, where we got to try identifying many fruits and vegetables (and tasting them). Along with some Balinese desserts, of course!Then, we moved to the organic farm, where we got the full tour and learned how these fruits and vegetables are grown. We picked our own vegetables and herbs from the garden to cook our meal. We cooked a staggering total of 6 dishes, with a break to eat in between. The flavors were a wake-up call for me. I need to figure out how to integrate lemongrass, galangal, and limes into my cooking back home! The curry was especially amazing. There were two courses, for vegetarians and non-vegetarians, and they proceeded smoothly side-by-side. Only 3 groups were in the class (each from different continents), so we enjoyed the chance to get to know each other. We got to take home cookbooks at the end of the class.A very educational experience and an opportunity to enjoy food more authentic than what you'll find in any restaurant!

Superb day and must do in Bali. We give it a five star.Sukada was our teacher and he did such a great job. Smart kid with good humour.The organic farm it self was excellent, they have their own bio garden. After being picked up we started out by visiting the market. There we could taste different fruit and veggies and got info about how and when.After we drove about 40 min to the farm. Fantastic place. Beautiful way.The service was excellent, we did not have to think about nothing else than our self, learning and eating. We did make few courses meal witch we then ate and the rest in a doggy bag. They also have a little groceries shop where you can pick up few things if you want. Finally we also got a brochure with recipes and an internet access with more info.Great day and one of the top thing we did in Bali. We would say "A must 2 do".A great change to get too know Balinese culture better.Best, Loa and Torfi

Delicious food... if I do say so myself!. We were picked up on time from our villa in Nyuh Kuning. Luckily there was only one more pickup after us, a lovely couple from Poland, so there were only the 4 of us in total and it felt really quite private. We were about to pass through the Tegalalang rice terrace around 940am so the driver very kindly offered to stop to let us take photos. It was a good time to stop as it was very quiet there and not much was yet open. The market stop was at a very small market and while we got to sample some interesting things like snakeskin fruit and a glutinous rice/pumpkin sweet I've probably visited some more interesting markets as part of other cooking classes I've done. I did like visiting a market that locals attend though, and our instructor so very kindly helped me buy a small jackfruit to try later, and I really appreciated that! It took quite a while to arrive at the grounds itself and it is a bumpy ride in patches but well worth it. The gardens are just beautiful and it was great to pick our own veggies to cook with (though I think we didn't even use half of what was picked in the end) and to try some of the local fruits that were in season. It was a long, slow walk and I was impatient to get started with the cooking but once I let myself relax and be on 'Bali time' I really enjoyed it. The cooking was good fun but I'd say it's geared towards beginner/intermediate cooks so if you know your way around the kitchen, ask for the advanced course. I thought the dishes were delicious and paced well - it felt like a bit of a degustation in a way - 2 salad courses cooked then eaten, followed by a chicken curry and sate lilit (minced pork satay) cooked and eaten, followed by dessert of fried banana. All were very tasty meals but often the instructor would say "now taste it and make sure it is well balanced". I found this some times hard to do, as we don't know what these dishes are supposed to taste like - so I would ask him to taste ours (as other instructors have done in other courses we have done) to let us know if it was balanced, so maybe something they could add in the recipe book is words like "salty-sour-spicy" or words to describe the sorts of flavours we should be looking to accent. What I loved most is that it gave us an understanding of what traditional Balinese foods are like - so for the rest of our trip we could appreciate and recognise what fresh herbs were used and where the flavours come from - and why and how the vegetables are cooked that way. 2 thumbs up from us for a lovely day spent!

Highlight of my trip to Bali. The cooking school was very well organized. We stopped at a market on the way where we were able to look around, take some photos and get an explanation of some of the ingredients used in Balinese cooking. After that we were taken to the farm for the class. Our class was very small, just me and a couple from Australia. We were first given a drink and allowed to relax and talk with each other for a few minutes. We got our own aprons and cook books containing all the recipes we would make. The cook books and aprons were ours to keep. Then we got a tour of the farm and picked some of the vegetables we would use in cooking. We were set up at two person cooking stations although I had my own since there were only three of us. We first made two dishes, then had them served. After eating we made four more dishes! There was more than enough food and all of it was absolutely delicious. I was in Bali with my wife who was taking a two week pottery workshop so I had to come up with activities for myself. I had looked on Tripadvisor for the best cooking schools and contacted the top listed ones. The others were already full so I picked this one. I'm very glad I got this one because I can't imagine the others could have been any better. The people at the cooking school were all very friendly and helpful. We've used some of the recipes in the cook book since we got home. Just do this, you can't go wrong!

Delicious and a Great Chance to Learn About the Balinese Culture. My husband and I LOVED this experience! It was my favorite thing we did in Bali. They are very well organized and had all of the ingredients set up and ready ahead of time except the ones we picked fresh from the farm. They also had a detailed recipe book for you to keep and pen for you to write notes to yourself if you had things to add which made it much more likely I will repeat these recipes at home! We did the vegetarian option and the recipes we made were delicious and diverse! We would cook a few, take a break to eat and enjoy, and then cook a few more. They have a great system and were wonderful to talk with. They had very good English and so we learned a lot from them about cooking and their culture during our time there. They were also very friendly and fun!

Wonderful experience. We had a amazing time cooking Balinese food. The visit to the local market is great. You get to taste some local fruits as well as a good explanation of local herbs and spices. After the market we arrived at the beautiful farm. It is a really nice and quite place, where your instructor will guide you through the farm and will let you pick some needed veggies and spices for the cooking class. The cooking class is well guided and all the people are genuinely friendly. Overall a fantastic experience! If you are looking for a cooking class during your stay in Ubud: look no further. There pick- and drop off service is great and included in the price.

Looking forward to return... in near future!. My friend and I spent a wonderful 6 hours in this Cooking program starting from 8.30am hotel pick up and dropping us safely back at 2.30pm. It entails local market orientation - sampling of local produce - organic farm exploration, learning of various produce, sampling, picking ingredients (from veggies to roots like ginger & turmeric!), enjoying the fresh air in the farm (You MUST try the cocoa fruit and Passion fruit!) - Step by Step preparation and cooking (No SHORT CUT! which is nice... we cut & pound everything ourselves!) - Savoring our own Cooking - Enjoying the nice ambiance in the farm.... Our instructor was a very patient and experienced cook, very passionate in sharing his knowledge hence making the entire experience a very memorable one for us. Thank you, we will be back!

Amazing and authentic experience preparing Balinese Food. I recently took a cooking class with the Balinese Farm Cooking School and had an amazing experience. I was picked up bright and early from my hotel and visited the local market to explore how the locals shop for items to prepare for the day. The class was held at a beautiful organic farm where I picked the vegetables used in the dishes we made and I was the only student in the class. The instructor was very knowledgeable and communicated very well about how to prepare each dish. I appreciated that got to prepare 2 dishes and then ate them before preparing the next few dishes. They were able to accommodate my vegan lifestyle and everything came out beautifully. I was given a booklet with all recipes that we prepared and the apron I wore during class as keepsakes. I had so much food leftover that I took it back to eat later in the day. Not to mention eating your meal in such beautiful surroundings. It made for a wonderful experience.

Loved it. It was exactly what we were looking for. Proceeds went directly back to the community that was running it and benefitted the local village. Wayan was patient and knowledgeable. The class was affordable and we were the only 2 who participated. Could pick our own foods and everything was explained to us. Great experience and lovely company.

Interesting experience!. The cooking class surpassed our expectation! We enjoyed our session and learnt to appreciate the effort needed to prepare the ingredients for cooking our dishes. Our instructor was very patient and spoke excellent English. The walk around the garden was very informative and we had the opportunity to select our ingredients for our cooking. Passion fruits are in season so we were asked to pluck some and try them. It was the sweetest passion fruit i have tasted!

Amazing cooking experience. What a amazing experience being able to visit this place and learn Indonesian cooking at a very basic level.The visit to the market was not rushed and our guide took the time to explain everything about produce we saw in the market.The farm itself is a community based farm with produced grown and used in the school and also as a source of income.The cooking classes were well run and unlike other cooking classes we prepared all the ingredients under the guidance of experienced cooks in this crusine.The meals we learnt to cook were easy and explained so well, with a booklet also given with recipes to take home. This experience was a highlight of my time in Ubud and i recommend all visit this place and support the local community.Cost of $40 AUD was very good value and would happily return again.Our hosts were well presented, spoke good english and were very proud of their farm.

Pick your own organic veggies and fruits and make your own meal-fun and delicious. This was actually our second Balinese cooking class on the trip. And this one was just as wonderful but in a different way. The trip to the market was not amazing--besides showing us-"here's the market" we didn't get introduced to new vegetables or foods. We did on our own buy some donut like things and saw some interesting carts and lots of beautiful fruits and vegetables, but more of a tour by someone knowledgeable would have been better. When we arrived to the farm, we walked down all of the rows and saw the plants growing, were taught how to pick each fruit/vegetable/herb to get the delicious ones, and sampled a bit as we went. We all loved this. Really interesting to see the plants they come from. Then we made our meals. We had 2 omnivores, 1 pescetarian and 1 vegan and they accommodated us all. We needed some help here and there (particularly on the grinding of the garlic and onions for the paste) and I'm sure our meals turned out better b/c of their help. Really, really lovely day and one of our highlights.

splended. we had to extend our stay in this welcoming ,chilled and very hospital inviroment because we loved it so much.The place has a great pool gorgeous staff and great banana pancakes wich you can select on the breakfast list wich included in your commodation.we payed $40 /night for 3 of us (2adault 1 child)It also has a back entrance to the fabulous trafficless back streets wich give you great shortcuts to exciting places.

Was the highlight of our stay in Ubud. We enjoyed everything about the cooking school from pickup tour drop off after an amazing day. We were lucky we were on tour with 2 other couples who were lots of fun. We travelled up to the cooking school, stopping off at the markets on the way. Very friendly market people, we tried different unusual fruits and saw many interesting vegetables ,fruit etc. Then back on the mini-bus to the organic farm for our cooking lessons. what an amazing day, first we were given a little basket and taken to the organic garden to pick our fresh ingredients, what fun! Then we were given our aprons and recipe book ( which you keep) and the lessons started. Working as couples we each had a very good "helper". We cooked 4 dishes altogether and dessert. After 2 dishes you get to eat your masterpieces , then you cook 2 more and once again enjoy those meals. absolutely delicious, then dessert. Yum! The staff were wonderful, with good sense of humour. Would recommend this cooking school, was fun, meals cooked with organic ingredients, and a top day.

Small class sizes + organic ingredients. I chose this cooking class after comparing a dozen others because I liked the smaller class sizes and the fact that it takes place on an organic farm, with organic ingredients. (Plus we were staying in Ubud, so the location was convenient.) All of the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, and my boyfriend and I really got along with the other three people in our class. The farm is beautiful and we learned a bit about different plants and produce, and the food was delicious and so filling, we didn't even eat dinner that evening! The market tour at the beginning was also nice, it felt a lot more local (not just a place to take tourists through).

A truly wonderful experience. This was a wonderful day experiencing Balinese cuisine and culture.By the end of the day you will learn to cook local dishes - you really are able to take the recipes home and create them for your friends!We loved going to the local market, tasting Balinese treats & fresh produce while speaking with locals. We then were taken to the farm where you hear about the efforts these guys go to to help their community - Farming organic produce and supporting those around them in need. Such a relaxing space and a great day of food.Thank you - we will be back next time in Bali!

Nice day with friendly staff and great meal. Had a one day market and cooking experience. Great explanations on a local market, well prepared cooking sessions (veggies are pre-washed and prepp'ed, so only cooking has to be done). Great tour on farm with plenty of fruits and vegetables, well explained in english.
Best Cooking Class.. This was an awesome class. A full day adventure while making some awesome food. I highly recommend this to all visitors of Ubud.
Perfect.. Beautiful location, friendly and patient staff, very educational, and probably the best food we had in Bali!

A unique Bali experience. This was the highlight of our trip to Bali. It was a place we chose to visit, and our guide, Wayan, of Baliaritour was very helpful in finding it and joining us here. Our garden tour guide, another Wayan, was very knowledgeable and interesting. We got to pick, chop and cook our own lunch. Our chef and his assistants were attentive as they showed us what to do. The food was delicious!!. We received recipe books and bought spices to make these same dishes when we arrived back in the USA.

An absolute gem. Passionate and genuine staff. Wonderful setting. A very special day out.
Pemulan Bali is creating something special for its local community. If you want to do a cooking class on Bali and want to see a little slice of the real heart of Bali this is for you.
Great Day. A cooking school located on an organic farm up toward the mountains provides a fascinating and delicious experience.

Delicious & Nutritious Cooking Fun with the Wonderful Staff. This was a beautiful organic farm off the beaten path! We were greeted with such beautiful smiles then given a tour of the organic farm. We picked the veggies, spices and herbs for our recipes that day! The organic farm was plush and abundant! Our leader, Wayan, and his staff were so warm and friendly! He was a great cooking instructor! We made SO MANY delicious dishes! I loved the Tuna with Sambal Matah, poor Ayam - Balinese Chicken Curry and my favorite was the Bali Sate Lilit (Satay). I made the Lilit this pack week for a group of 16 people and they LOVED IT!! I loved the fresh cauliflower, carrots, garlic, lemon grass and other ingredients we pick straight from the organic garden. The black rice pudding was a nice ending to our meal! Thank you for such an education, delicious and amazing day! I will be back - with friends! :)
Natural beauty.. We chose to order our lunch at this place. The food was fantastic. Clean Resturant as was the rest room. Great to sit and overlook the fields/forest. No mozzies either. :-)

Wonderful organic, local cooking experience taught by local community garden volunteers.. Perfect half-day experience in a local community organic garden. We selected items out of the garden, and prepared several dishes that we all found to be the best tasting food of our trip!! Great, easy to follow step-by-step instructions, and will definitely be preparing these recipes once back home!! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!!!
Fun and interactive. Small group lesson and we sure had fun. Made some outstanding food, came home with recipes and ate more than we should.

Great day out. We have been on an number of cooking classes over a few trips to Bali and can say without reservation that this is the best experience we have had. Cost for our family of four was around the $140AUD mark which is in our mind very reasonable for pretty much a full day. This visit to the market was good and is included in other classes we had tried. The part that stood out was the walk around the garden picking the seasonal ingredients that we were to add to the meals we were to make. The instruction and information given throughout the day was first class. The staff working in the background were friendly efficient and more importantly seemed to want to be there and share what they knew. Great day out and in our view worth a visit I'd Indonesian food is your thing.

Fun Cooking Day in Ubud. Cooking school was lots of fun. The best part is the tour of the organic farm which is interesting and very well explained by the charming teacher. He was great and gave us lots of knowledge. This is a course for beginner to intermediate cooks or anyone who wants to immerse themselves in the beautiful farm and school day.
Amazing Cooking and farming. One word: AmazingThe Farm is small, but you can carry everything you need to cook your own MealThe Markt Visit in the morning was very interesting

A glorious, tasty and fun day!. We chose this class over others because of its location in the countryside outside of the bustle of Ubud, and because we are very committed to eating organic food. We also were very happy to support this community collective's effort to educate about the value of organic food and farming. My husband and I met Wayan and a small group of fellow adventurers at the outdoor market and proceeded to explore the tastes, smells and colors there. We then took a beautiful drive to the farm and were greeted with warm, welcoming smiles by the team of people supporting our cooking class. We strolled through the lovely organic garden and picked baskets of fresh ingredients for our meal. The cooking stations and open pavilion where the magic would happen were very clean and inviting (as were the restrooms!). We paired up and got busy making truly delicious dishes. There was lots of laughter and play as well as great instruction. The recipes were simple and when we sat to eat, there were many exclamations of appreciation. Yum! Our small group and the instructors bonded and spent time in conversation after the meal was over. It was hard to leave this beautiful environment and people when the day was over. We could easily make these recipes back home, especially with the little book of recipes and information they sent us home with. A really wonderful day that we can't recommend highly enough!

Excellent cooking class. I few days ago my sister and I attended this cooking class and absolutely loved it. It was a great introduction to Balinese food and cooking. The whole day was a discovery of new ingredients and flavours. The day started with a trip to the local market to source local ingredients as well as thw opportunity to try out new fruit and some local street food. Next we were taken upto the farm where a tour of the garden allowed us to see our ingredients in their natural state as well as pick what we would need for cooking. We cooked a range of traditional recipes and were guided through each step by the lovely staff at the cooking school. The best bit was getting to eat the food we had cooked! Everyone at the cooking school was so friendly and easy going and the relaxed environment made it a super day. I was particularly impressed with the efforts being made by the cooking school to involve the local community and encourage sustainable and organic growing methods. This really is a top Bali experience!

Outstanding cooking school in beautiful location. The Balinese Farm Cooking School is outstanding value. It's set on a rural farm near Ubud. After our visit to he traditional market it was up to the farm for a tour of the farm, then into the cooking of 6 courses of beautiful Indonesian food. Ketut was an excellent teacher that helped us to achieve great results. Loved our time at the farm.

Great experience, would do this again. We were picked up from Ubud and taken to a local market where we met up with a guide who showed us around, explained some items and offered tastings of fresh produce. From there we went on to the cooking school which is on a working farm well off the main roads, in a most peaceful location. We were greeted with a welcoming drink on arrival then were taken around the farm to pick and collect produce that we were going to use in our recipes. There were six dishes to be cooked, which were done so that we cooked two dishes and ate before continuing with the next two dishes.Every dish was delicious, including those that used ingredients we would not normally have considered cooking with. It was obvious that this has been well thought out and planned by the staff, they were most helpful and laughed along with us as the class went on. The class area was traditional in style, very clean and hygienic, undercover and well suited to the setting. Kitchen Facilities were of a high standard with hand washing basins to the side. There are good clean toilet facilities on site also. There are no steep paths or steps to traverse on the farm walk.This class was as well run as any that I have attended in Australia, with the bonus of being in a beautiful setting. Would recommend to everyone. It was excellent value for money and we would do this again.

Excellent day out. My sister and I thoroughly enjoyed our day here during our stay in Bali. The morning market visit was interesting and fun and we loved tasting and learning about new foods and fruit. Once back at the farm we walked around the beautiful garden picking, smelling and tasting while Wayan explained the plants to us. We chose the vegetarian menu and cooked a range of delicious dishes, with just the right amount of help from Wayan and his staff who very efficiently chopped, measured, cleaned and tidied up around us. Everyone was incredibly friendly and welcoming and made us feel comfortable. It was also a really nice touch that the dishes we didn't finish eating were neatly packed up in banana leaf and newspaper bags to take back to the hotel with us. Very impressed by their attitude towards sustainable organic farming and supporting the local community. The online booking process was very smooth and they accept credit cards. We loved this place and can not recommend it highly enough.

A fabulous experince. I was picked up from my hotel at the time advised and spent a memorable day with Wayan and other guests visiting a local freah food market, followed by and interesting drive through the countryside to the farm. The cooking experience was excellent, the kitchen was hygenic and food preparation was well presented. Cooking instructions were clear and each dish we prepared was very tasty. I was driven back to my hotel at the end of the day. A full days wonderful experience I would do again and well worth the money.

Would love to go again. I happened to be the only student that day, so one on one made me feel especially welcomed. Before we went to the farm, we went to a local market and had a bit fruit tasting, like snake fruit, mangostein etc. Then it was about thirty minute drive to the destination. First they showed me around the farm, there were various kinds of veggies, herbs and fruit. We picked some that'll be used later for cooking.
