There were six dishes divided into three sessions, after each session you can rest a bit and eat the food while it's still warm. All were pretty simple dished yet so delicious. My favorite two were mixed veg and curry. First time made the curry from scratch. Goes perfect with rice! The class comes with the recipes and a apron that u can bring homeThe place is very quite n beautiful. The trip got a bit bumpy after going off the main road and into the mountain. We passed by two small villages there, surprised to see them cuz it was far out from the road I'd say. Loved to see the Hindu temples as well.The staff were all very friendly and welcoming. The owner couldn't speak much English, but he was really nice and hospitable. After the class, he took me to Pura Gunung Kawi (a temple), there weren't many people there, so I got to take my time looking around, taking some photos. It was cool and sacred. Overall, I'd love to go back again and learn more tasty Balinese dishes :)
One of the best to do whilst in Ubud. Don't miss this beautiful experience. Nature, good cooikng, great food to eat and gorgeous hosts. A nice trip out of ubud for the day. Highly recommended.

Excellent cooking class near Ubud!. My friends and I did this cooking class while staying in Ubud and I highly recommend it. We go to a market and then pick herbs and vegetables from a garden and finally start cooking and eating in a great outdoor kitchen space. The staff is wonderful and all the food we cooked and ate was delicious. It was very relaxing and rewarding as we also learned a lot of Balinese cuisine and culture!

Amazing staff, food, and location. My wife and I attended this cooking class during our honeymoon in Bali in December 2015. From the moment we were picked up outside of Ubud, we knew this trip was going to be memorable. Riding through the back roads of Bali in a little van with only two other tourists and a driver, we were on our way to a village market where the rural life felt very much untouched from the western world we came from. From there, we continued to the cooking school where we were greeted with smiles from the wonderful staff. The tour of the farm, descriptions of the different plants, and guidance they provided for picking the fresh fruit and produce was wonderful. Then using the food that we just picked in new and interesting recipes resulted in some truly delicious dishes. Throughout the entire trip, the staff did everything in their power to ensure we were relaxed and enjoying ourselves. Bali is an amazing place and the Balinese Farm Cooking & Organic Farm is a pure representation of a unique culture that remains vibrant. And the food was amazing.

A fun and tasty experience!. My girlfriend and I went to take the regular cooking class and absolutely loved our time there! The market visit was fun and the drivers were very nice. Upon our arrival we were served a light snack and then were given a tour of their garden and got to pick the vegetables we were going to cook. Everything is streamlined to make the experience as easy as possible. I am a terrible cook and yet I never felt like I was going to make a mistake thanks to the helpful guidance of the chefs. Sign up for this place and enjoy!!!

Return visit. We decided to repeat last years visit and were not disappointed. We made a couple different dishes but we didn't mind repeating some of the ones we had already cooked as they are so delicious.All the staff are fantastic, with so much knowledge of all ingredients, helping us with prep and cooking and lots of joking and laughter all day.Such a great day out of main Ubud in cooler temperature. Nice to be on organic farm supporting the local community.Would we return again next year.... ABSOLUTELY.

Complete Package. We got pick up at our hotel, visited the local market, learned the variety of spices, went to a little farm and picked some fresh vegetables for our cooking ingredients. The instructor was very kind and patient, he provided a Balinese cooking book and an apron for each of us. The surrounding area was green and airy which gave a relaxing atmosphere. The instructor was also really communicative and gladly gave tips for the substitute spices/herb if we want to cook it in our country. Overall, we really enjoyed this cooking class and recommend it to those who love cooking and want to try cooking Balinese food.We have cooked again some of the recipes back in our home, and it still remind us about this wonderful cooking class in Bali.

Lovely morning out. Went on this trip as wanted to get a more authentic experience away from the hustle and bustle, and fake tourist spots, we where taken to a lovely little farm, where they grew all the ingredients and made everything fresh. Then we spent the rest of the day cooking what we had picked and best of all eating it. The hosts where very welcoming, and explained everything thoroughly, we also got a cook book and bib, All in all great day !! highly recommend.

Great Balinese Cooking adventure. We booked through Cookly a great app that allows you to discover different cooking classes. The whole experience was great, the people were very nice and helpful, the food was delicious, seeing the market and the garden was awesome! Great day :)
wow wow wow. Just top experience I had there. Really learn a lot about coking proper food in the most beautiful surroundings. Thanks Wayan you are amazing.

Excellent time for friends and families to get away from the buzz. The cooking lessons were fantastic, starting with a trip to the local market and a tour of the organic farm. I love it that we got to gather our own ingredients from the farm prior to the lesson. The dishes taught were very traditional balinese cuisine with super friendly and helpful staff! Highly Recommended :)

Amazing food, place and staff!. Wow, we really loved this. The food was excellent and loved the food tips we got from Wayan! The girls working there were so sweet and really enjoyed the place. Got to see the local market which we enjoyed because you get to see all the different foods and were it comes from. We then picked organic veggies from his garden and learned about the different plants. We had the vegan menu and it was really tasty. So full up so be careful eating too much rice! You are allowed to bring home the food for later and we also got a little recipe book and aprons. You will love it if you enjoy making food or want to learn, very easy.

Great organic cooking classes. One of my favorite activities in Bali. We looked for an organic farm, outside the city. They came to get us at our villa in Ubud. We made a pit stop by the market (why not?), just to show us what it looked like and to point out the different fruits and vegetables we would later see at the farm. Once at the farm, everything and everyone was enjoyable. Beautiful and well maintained gardens, beautiful and happy farmers, beautiful and delicious cooking. We loved it !
Daniel Michelle and Ryan. Highlight of our tripThis was an excellent day.Learned about traditional balinese food.Cooking was made simple and our chef was fantastic.Highly recommended.

Go nowhere else!!. We came as a group of 4 and had a completely private class! On time pick up, lovely exciting drive, beautiful interactive gardens where you pick all your own foods to cook with (organic!!) we were astounded by the authenticity and knowledge we were presented with. They perfectly accommodated to our vegan diet. So much food! It was Devine!! Absolutely great value! Such a day excursion for such a cheap price. Came away with recipes too! If I came back to bali I would go again and request new recipes !! Loved it. Perfect for everyone

Good would recommend for the experience . Interesting experience. It was just myself and 2 others on the day. Went to the market with Ketut on the way to the farm. Got some good insights from him on the way there and back. I'm vegetarian so it was perfect for me that there was the opportunity to cook just vegetarian. A lot of preparation is done for you and the girls are there to assist you with pounding and chopping. There was heaps of food and plenty to take away. Perfect as it was just before Nyepi so I had food for that day sorted. I would have liked to have heard how we could do this at home. Easier ways to prepare spices etc. Made was a good instructor. He had a cold and wasn't being careful enough with hygiene for me. Just a small criticism. As a community project it is excellent and great to see other areas of Bali. Keep up the good work with the eco/ green tourism.
fun. its fun to do this for a day, but dont expect to be cooking yourself . most is prepared and you just watch nonetheless its a fun day

Amazing. A wonderful walk through the organic farm, choosing ingredients to be used in the lesson. Fun, hands on, and maybe one of the best meals in Ubud. Small group this day. Cannot recommend this experience enough.

Fantastic! . My boyfriend and I went to this class. It was us and one more couple. The class started off with a tour of a local village market. Ketut, our instructor, wanted to show us different types of products and give us a chance to explore. After this we went to the farm. The farm was bigger and more beautiful than I expected. Ketut takes good care and pride of his organic produce. He walked us through the garden and showed us what vegetables to pick for our recipes. It was neat knowing that what you're cooking and eating is hand picked fresh by you in their garden. The recipes were flavorful and delicious. My boyfriend and I don't have much cooking experience and this class was great for us. You even get to take home a detailed cookbook and the apron you wear! The atmosphere was amazing and I definitely recommend this class!

Authentic, delicious, awesome!!!. Loved the food, it was very well chosen, timed and super delicious!Loved also that it's organized to help the community! Very lovely people in a peaceful place, very authentic!David

Great location but food a little regular. I joined my friend the other day and we felt that the location was really a great spot for a cooking class. Unfortunately, we were a little disapointed at the portions of ingredients and they used packet seasoning...MSG? Other locations used real spice from the garden in big quantities. I would shop around.

Fantastic. Have done 2 cooking classes before and this one really stands out, in a good way.After pickup from the hotel and a 30min drive you visit a market where you meet a guide to give you an intro to Balinese produce. Good time to ask questions and in our case the guide also paid for some fruits to sample.Then a short drive to the farm, you pass the Tegallalang Rice Paddies on the way.The same guide took us around the organic farm to explain about the different fruits and veg and we had to harvest it ourselves. Really liked this part and he was very knowledgeable. Also impressed by the fact that you use so many organic ingredients in the class.After that we cooked 2 dishes, ate them, cooked 3 dishes, ate them, cooked dessert and sat down to eat that as well. The cook (not the guide, although he also helped with cooking) was very easy to understand with good English and friendly as well. There is staff to do the dishes and help chopping/grinding stuff. If you prefer to do it yourself it's totally fine. They are there to speed it along and let you skip the 'stir on medium heat for 10mins' part. Option to buy some sodas or other drinks. Had some lovely ginger something something soda for about 30k.You get to keep the apron and the recipe book. Lesson was 360k after one discount and included pickup and one bottle of water.

As authentic as you can get. My visit was actually a year ago but I have refrained from writing a review until I have gathered more information and experiences from other cooking schools around. I am now ready to give my 2 cents worth!This is the furthest cooking school/farm from Ubud. For the moment, it is the least unadulterated from the typical tourist caterers. The market they take you to is the actual Tegallalang market where the locals shop. The farm has a nice, neat organic garden with a hint of manure in the air (not so pretty and clean as to warrant the question "How is this organic?"). It is owned and run by locals with local villagers as their staff so you know you're contributing to the area's economy instead of to some western expatriate. The cooking experience is very hands-on and retains its true Balinese flavours and style.A wonderful way to spend the day with family and coming away with memorable experiences!

Great day at the farm. I can highly highly recommend this cooking class!You will spend the day in a lush organic garden cooking delicious dishes from plants you have harvested yourself. The cooking instructor has a detailed knowledge about all ingredients and Balinese cuisine. Most importantly, he shared all the little hints which make Balinese food so special but you will never find in any book. I can strongly recommend to choose the vegetarian option, as the dishes are much more special. We made Tempe sweet sour, tempe curry, Gado gado with extra yummy peanut sauce, bumbum Bali sauce, steamed coconut tofu dumplings, sweet corn and tofu fritters and fried bananas. Yummy!Anyway, in both cases you will get a recipe book that also includes descriptions of the ingredients and how you can replace them by something available back home.You get picked up from your place and visit a local market on the way to the farm that is located in the highlands halfway to the volcano. On the way, we also stopped at the rice terraces and at a Luvak coffee tasting. Kind of nice of them to do that.If you want to learn to cook Balinese food, do it here!
Love Balinese food!. Very nice experience, clean, beautiful farm and people. I highly recommend it. They include transportation from Ubud.

Balinese cooking adventure. I was picked up promptly from my cottages to start the adventure. Traveled throughBeautiful country and arrived at a local market to sample tasty fruit and feast my eyesOn the beauty of the market filled with incense and flowers.The location is remote and the gardens where you pick or dig your vegetables is lovely.The cooking training was very complete and cooked so much food I could notPossibly finish. They also had spices and tools for sale making it easy to replicate recipes. Fun experience except for the huge amount of flies.
A brilliant experience.. Couples, groups families and kids would all have a great time. You pick the vegetables first from the farm and then you are ready to cook!

A Really Enjoyable Day out With A Great Company. The organic cooking farm is located in a village called Banjar Patas, Tegallalang which is a 40 minute drive from Ubud. It is an Organic farm with cooking class facilities that is run by the local villagers. All profits are returned to the village. The main Chef has great English as he previously worked on a cruise ship. So the details:- The company picks you and the other guests up in an air conditioned bus from your hotel around 8.30am in Ubud.- You then drive for about 30 minutes to a market near the farm.- The market is boring and I think it is just an attempt to support the locals in that village.- Then 5 mins later they stop at a nice view of the terraced paddy fields where you can get some nice photos.- Then 5 minutes later you arrive at the farm and are greeted by the chef.- You sit down at the already prepared table and are served tea and coffee while the chef explains how the day goes.- At the table is your cooking apron which is really nice and you get to keep it and there is the booklet of recipes that you refer to when cooking. It also lists alternative ingredients that you can get in Australia.- They then walk you round the organic garden and instruct you what veg and herbs you need to pick for your meal. The young man who walked us around was a very nice guy.- Once you get back, you can order drinks like soft drinks and beers at an extra cost if you are thirsty for something other than water, tea or coffee.- Then the cooking starts. I believe we cooked 6 different things. 3 things I absolutely loved and the other 3 things I didn’t like.- About half of the ingredients are already prepped, cut and ready to go and you have to cut and prep the other half, which I liked.- Each station had one or two people cooking and a girl was assigned to each station to take all the dirty pots and pans and wash them and bring them back so your work station was always pretty clear.- The cooking is split up into two parts. You cook a few dishes, then sit and eat. Then you cook a few more dishes and sit and eat again. I couldn’t eat all of mine and gave it to the young man who was helping me. He was delighted and grateful.- The course finishes at 3pm and you are dropped back to Ubud.I didn’t stay till 3 though because I had to be back in Ubud by 2.30pm, so they kindly organised for me to cook my meals in a different order and a bit quicker (they gave me my own private chef to help just me) and they arranged for a driver to bring me back to Ubud early charging an extra $10 which I was more than happy to pay. I was really grateful that they were so happy to make alternative arrangements for me and it was no trouble.All in all a really nice day out and would highly recommend to anyone.

Very enjoyable day. My husband and I really enjoyed the whole day (and it was a full day). The school is not in Ubud. It is actually out in the countryside about 40 minutes away. On the way to the farm we stopped at the Tegallalang rice terraces and at a local market. The walk around the farm collecting fresh vegetables for our meal was fun and informative. We cooked 5 or 6 dishes followed by a leisurely meal visiting with the other students from around the world. The staff was accommodating of various dietary requests and even wrapped up our leftovers for us. They also allowed us to bring our 2 young children along. They played with toys that we brought for them while we cooked. Definitely recommend!

the best way to see where your food comes from. Whilst researching cooking schools for our fitness retreat. We come across this as it showed us where the food grows the benefits of each herb/spice which we use and how to integrate it into our cooking. AMAZING..

Organic, fun and delicious. A little disorganised with the ppickup and the market (skip it if you can) but as soona s we arrived on the farm everything was amazing!We learned about he fruit, spices and veggies they grew on the farm and got to pick our own. The cooking was well instructed and the chef was very patient when we got caught up in conversation with the other couple and were distracted. The food tasted delicious and was very healthy. The staff took care of everything boring (dishes,tidy) so we could simply focus on cooking and enjoying the food. We requested dairy and gluten free per email before hand and all the dishes were suited for our allergies :-)Peaceful and beautiful place!Improvement: The pot/casserole should be upgraded to a steel one, aluminium pots are very damaging for our health. We made two dishes and ate, shortly after we made two more and was expected to eat again. We had not had time to digest the first meal. Would be better to cook all meals for so to eat.

Absolutely to be recommended 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻. I really had a awesome stay at the organic farm. After picking me up at my hostel in Ubud, we first visited the organic market. Then we went to their organic farm to start the cooking class. We first picked all the needed vegetables in the enormous garden. Then we started cooking, six main courses & one dessert. The cooking teacher was really friendly and helpful. He explained a lot of things an answered every question I had. & The food was AWESOME! There also exist vegetarian classes!Conclusion: I really enjoyed the cooking class and would choose this cooking class again.I'm looking forward to showing my balinese cooking skills to my friends at home ;) (you even get a small cookbook to take with you at home!)Thumps up!

Worthwhile Education and Fun. We both have a better understanding of Balinese cooking methods and ingredients as a result of this course. Beware most restaurants in Bali, as Monsanto Frankenfoods are endemic. We loved that this school uses all organic veggies, and loved being walked around their garden, picking the ingredients we would use in our cooking. Spray their mosquito repellent on before this tour, lest you be eaten.We appreciated how staff would take care of repetitive tasks once we had learned them, and would do things for us if we were too caught up in conversation.Our host remembered all 4 of our names, and our preferences and conversations through the day.Recommendations to the school:- read client emails sent prior to the course. We let you know that we're avoiding gluten, yet were both served gluten pancakes. Truly health conscious places in Ubud understand that most people have some level of sensitivity to gluten, whether they're aware of it or not. They therefore serve many gluten free options.- be even more health conscious. This includes using stainless steel or cast iron instead of aluminium pots. Using stainless steel strainers rather than plastic. Keeping the flies off using reed baskets rather than oestrogen boosting cling film. Most of your clients are health conscious, so being organic isn't enough.- give more time between the two courses. We all felt stuffed by having to eat our meals about an hour apart.- organise your staff better. The young market chap arrived late. The market trip wasn't worth including, especially since all ingredients are sourced from your excellent organic veggie garden.

A great cooking and cultural experience. I booked this class from Ubud for New Year's Day and was doubtful it would go ahead but we had a full class of 12. As the class is based on a farm it's bit of a drive out of Ubud but we stopped at the Tegalalang markets and wandered around the fruit and vege stalls. No other tourists here, just locals going about their business. We haggled for bananas with sign language and admired the old fashioned scales used to weigh the produce.The farm is set up in the mountains in lush green forest. We were given a basket and taken around the gardens to pick our own veges including bok choy, beans, carrots and lemongrass. These were then washed and used for our first dish. Wayan was our main instructor and he spoke great English, he was assisted by a group of staff who kept us all organised and on track. Unlike some cooking classes everyone had a board and knife and there was a double gas burner for every couple. We really cooked the food we then ate! The ingredients were all ready but we chopped and diced, and used a mortar and pestle to make the paste. We were all given a great recipe book with a glossary and other information about Balinese food. There were also specific books and menus for vegetarians. We made 2 vegetarian dishes, pork on lemongrass skewers, chicken curry and tuna with a raw sambal. All delicious. The staff showed us the ingredients for a banana black rice dessert but then made it for us. While there were 6 dishes overall the amount of food and the time available was beautifully organised so we didn't feel over full.Just a note about insects- do remember your mosquito repellent as they can be fierce. There are always a lot of flies where ever you eat in Bali, the farm used sticky fly paper to distract the flies from the food and there was a real focus on covering food and having hand washing facilities close by.I would highly recommend this cooking class for something a bit different to the Ubud based classes- the setting, the people and the food.

One of our best activities in Bali. 4 of us came here to do cooking class on day. It was from 4pm until 7pm and we had a lot of fun. We walked around the farm first picking ingredients and learning about their produce. Then we cooked several yummy dishes in 3 sessions in between eating them as they were finished. It was very well organized so that we got to cook hands on, but they also helped us chop some of the various ingredients as well.

One our best activities on Bali. A perfect day and they were very vegetarian friendly. Loved how they utilized local sustainable methods. The head chef had a great sense of humor. Highly recommend this activity.

Beautiful farm, unique experience. Very good cooking class in a beautiful setting! The only suggestion we have made to the Wayan Jon to skip the trip to the morning market! It is irrelevant to the school, and doesn't set the tone to the experience! Absolutely unnecessary! However, the rest of the day was fantastic!

Fantastic day. The cooking class was one of the highlights of our trip...A lovely drive up into the mountains...interesting local market visit then a fantastic cooking experience hosted by a wonderful chef & delightful hospitality students. We were well and truly full by the end of lunch and where impressed by what we produced. Definitely recommended...

Excellent Cooking Class in very nice surroundings!. My family (2 adults and 2 children) had a wonderful experience with this cooking class and company. The site was outside of Ubud, and in a very scenic jungle, garden setting. You walked around and picked your own veggi's. We went vegetarian and found that the company found the right balance between being actively involved in the cooking process, learning, and having fun. The food we prepared was excellent! There were 4 of us and about 6 helpers, so we got a lot of attention. Our family does cooking classes on just about any trip we take, and we found this to be one of our very favorites.

My favorite activity in Ubud!. This was a wonderful experience! I had a wonderful time gathering ingredients, learning to make 6 dishes, and eating all the wonderful food. The instructors were informative, the staff were incredibly helpful, and the entire feel of the place was welcoming and comfortable. The ambience is peaceful (outside of Ubud's center) and the whole experience really exceeded my expectations. This was a very fun and authentic experience and also a great way to interact with areas outside of the foreigner-heavy Ubud center.I signed up online and there is a section for notes, so you can let them know if you have any special dietary restrictions. I was a little worried that as a solo vegetarian it might be difficult for them to accommodate me, but it ended up being totally fine! There were 7 of us (a family of four, 2 women traveling together, and me) and we had a vegetarian, a pescatarian, and a vegan (and someone who didn't like lemongrass or ginger) and they were able to accommodate all of us.They picked me up at my hotel around 7:30 and we first went to the market. At the market someone explains to you what different spices and ingredients are just to show you around and let you get a feel for things. Then we headed off to the farm, which is tucked away in a small village outside of Ubud's hustle and bustle.At the farm you get some time to relax before things start and they treat you to ginger tea or Balinese coffee. Then we paired up (we were an odd number so I got paired with the instructor) and we were led around the garden armed with a basket and a knife to collect the ingredients for the day. Then the staff clean and prepare our ingredients on separate plates for each dish.You work in pairs or the staff help you (if you were alone like me). We learned to make 5 dishes (plus making spice paste and peanut sauce from scratch) and the meal is split into 2 sections. My dishes were: gado-gado, sweet and sour tempe, corn fritters, steamed corn dumplings, and a tofu and tempe curry. They also make a black rice pudding dessert for you.The instructions were clear, it was really nice to have all the ingredients laid out for you, and everyone was very friendly and helpful. I really enjoyed making the food with ingredients we had collected straight from the garden. They also include possible substitutions in the cookbook for various spices and plants that you might have trouble finding in your home country. I 100% recommend this experience and would probably do it again if I come back.

Authentic culinary experience in nature. Loved the ride to get to the farm. Once there the view and the organic garden are amazing. I had a great cooking class; Wayan and his team are super friendly. Loved my day with them.

Authentic. Fun for all the family. Great Value for money.. One of the best days I have spent in Ubud. This day went way beyond my expectations. I had such a great time, from discovering real traditional Balinese market where we had a lesson on Balinese local products to picking our own ingredients to use from the ground to the pot.Its not hard to find a cooking class in Ubud as most of the restaurants offer this, but I wanted an experience that I would remember spending with my young cousin.We picked, prepared and cooked six traditional Balinese dishes, which included, chicken, tuna, pork and vegetarian meals.Our host Wayan was a delight, knowledgeable, friendly and a great sense of humour he made us feel at home and is an excellent cook himself. We were very lucky to have a great group from different parts of the world who all shared the same love for good food and produce. To have the chance to eat vegetables and herbs and spices straight from the ground was a taste sensation.This is a great day out for all the family. The cost of roughly Aud$47.00, awesome value for money. A must do.

Great cooking school experience. We really enjoyed the day at this organic farm cooking some delicious food. Highlights:Communication the day before was great and easy as you can text with whatsappWayan the cooking instructor was awsome, fun and informative. His helpers were great and helped make sure you got personal supervision.The farm was beautiful and everyone enjoyed walking around and picking their vegetables for cooking Food and menu were great as was the atmosphere. You could also buy beers and local drinks using farm produceMinor improvements: the market we were taken too was awful and put you off food so recommend that they think where they take you. Also we didn't learn anything here as the guy not particularly informativeA water bottle was provided though this was very small and suggest that bigger bottles be provided as it is hot We also seemed to finish early and didn't ge to to make dessert and were home closer to 2pm than 3pmSmall things go a long way so i suggest to the operators to not cut corners or risk losing out in this highly competitive market. Overall however great experience!!

What a great place!. My partner and I had a memorable and enjoyable day cooking at the Balinese Farm. Everything about the day is run well and it's so pleasant interacting with the locals who volunteer for the farm. Profits go into the community. A great day out, highly recommended

Awesome. Went to the markets on the way there and saw all the Indonesian fruits and vegetables. When we arrived at the farm we were taken through by Made and he showed us all the vegetables and we picked our ingredients fresh. We cooked 5 dishes and they were very accommodating to my food intolerances substituting onion and garlic with coconut!Overall great experience and a nice drive past rice terraces to get there too!

Great lesson and lots of fun. This was well worth the money! We made Nadi goring, chicken sate and a few other dishes which we enjoyed eating after the class. Very informative and took some good tips home with me

Just magical !. I've been on quite a few cooking courses over the years but this one topped them all. From the beautiful flower put in my hair , to the delicious coffee taking in the surroundings , the stroll through the organic garden collecting my fresh Veges and learning about the things they grow , right through to tasting the final fruits of our labours - this truly was a day to remember . Ismadi was a great teacher and everyone who helped made me feel right at home . Luckily I was the only person on the course that morning so I worked slowly and carefully and ate my produce mindfully . It was such a gentle , calm and peaceful time - I thoroughly recommend it and hope these guys move up the Trip Advisor ranks quickly as they deserve it! Thank you again to you all- I had a fabulous time !

An amazing day at the Balinese cooking school.. This is a definite put it on your list. Extremely well organised, efficient communication, picked up on time, fabulous food and people. We went to the market on the way, then wandered around the organic garden. Picked our food and cooked it under the guidance of the cooks. It tasted fantastic! What a wonderful day. Highly recommend. More importantly it is a local initiative to help the local children learn organic gardening and English skills for their futures. I am going back.

Bali trip must do!. It was a great experience, my boyfriend and i are happy that we chose this cooking class. We were picked up early and then we visited Tegalalang Market for ingredients and fruits introduction before we headed to the farm. We picked our own veggies and spices and we prepared things ourselves, then we cooked 2 dishes for lunch. It was too tempting though Wayan remind us not to eat too much for there are more 3 dishes to cook later on. The best things is the land is own by locals and the farm was organized by local young and passionate organic enthusiasts and the whole thing is going to be a give back to the (local) community. Their missions are to let people to experience the real balinese cooking and to understand the true culture behind the dish, and thats how you taste the real Bali through your mouth. It's just wonderful!

The highlight of our Bali trip . There are a few cooking classes available however I specifically asked for the organic class due to reading positive reviews on trip adviser. We thou roughly enjoyed our day . The reviews lived up to our expectations. A wonderful way to meet fellow cooks from around the world . The chef gives you confidence ensuring you plate up outstanding dishes with a drive to keep on cooking at home .i could say so much more . You won't be disappointed

Excellent experience. We had a fantastic day, one of the highlights of our visit to Bali. Authentic experience, clear and helpful instructions which will enable us to go home and cook traditional Balinese meals. We also picked up tips on growing our own spices and vegetables.Lovely, friendly people with a positive outlook to life. Highly recommended.

Achievable for all cooking levels. In Bali, you can do pretty much anything including taking a cooking class which we did today. During research time, it was confusing as to which cooking class we were wanting to take but knowing that this class is held at the farm with natural atmosphere, it was an easy decision for us to go ahead with Balinese Farm cooking school. From the time we got picked up, we were so pleased with the friendliness of our driver, Dewa and then we were guided by Wayan at the local market where we were introduced to many different local fruits we don't normally get in Australia. They all speak good English which was helpful for non Indonesian speaker. During the cooking class itself, we made 2 entrées, 3 main dishes and 1 dessert. We also got some help from the guys working there so that helped us to make sure our dishes were made as they were supposed to taste like. Overall, a very enjoyable experience and we also got the recipe book to take home so we get to make them all again.

Lovely experience. We chose this cooking school because it said it could cater for vegans on the website, and 2 of our group required this. We also liked the fact that it was an organic farm. We were collected from our villa at 7.30 and taken to a local food market, where different spices were explained to us. Next we went to the farm, which was in a beautiful setting, very serene, and it was great to pick the vegetables that we would be using to cook with. The owner is passionate about his organic produce and took us on a tour of the gardens explaining the different plants that we saw. On to the cooking. We cooked 6 dishes in all, the first 2 which we then ate, followed by the next 4. A great selection of Tempe, vegetables, pork, fish, chicken and rice for the non vegans. Anything that we couldn't eat was given to us to take home. Both the vegan and the meat dishes that we prepared were delicious. The instructions were clear, and everyone was very helpful. The cooking school was a covered area in the gardens, and very well set out, with everything we needed at hand. I highly recommend this experience to anyone wishing for a days cooking with a difference, as it was a really enjoyable experience. We are confident we can recreate what we learnt at home with the recipe books we were given, and we bought some spices there at a very reasonable price to help us do this.

The Best. A thoroughly enjoyable experience. The presenters and cooking instructors were passionate, knowledgeable and friendly. The farm is a work in progress with a real community feel.All the vegetables, spices and herbs are picked by the participants, then shown how to prepare and cook them in a Traditional Balinese style.Highly recommended.

Wonderful experience!. I highly recommend this brilliant cooking school. The people are absolutely wonderful, the food is mouth watering and the garden is stunning in its varieties. I can not speak highly enough of this class, it was a highlight of my trip to Bali.

Amazing Class, best day in Bali!. This was an incredible experience. The team, the chef the farm, the food, the ingredients wowww! We hand-picked all the veggies from the farm ourselves, I would so highly recommend it. Make sure to fit it in your Ubud plan for sure:) ENJOY!
Wayne is just an amazing chef!!

One of the best things we did on Bali. Last October I was on Bali with a friend of mine. We decided to learn something about the Balinese cooking. Our day started on a nice market were we could stroll around and learned some things about some spices. It was a great experience. Than we were driven to the farm. There we got a very warm welcome and then started to harvest our own ingredients, all the time we git told important and interesting facts about the ingredients. Then we started cooking. My friend is vegetarian so we cooked the vegetarian menu. (That was no problem although the others cooked the meat menu) And what can I say... it was delicious. We got perfect explanations and cooked things we never cooked before... and i just can say it again... it was so delicious =) All in all it was one of our best days on Bali. We had a lot of fun, learned so many things and git awesome memories. Thank you for this perfect day.

The best place to learn Balinese cookery. We were recommended to go to Bali Farm by a local - he reckoned all the other cookery schools are not authentic and so we decided to go with this one. It was far better AND cheaper than the others we looked at.We were collected by a driver and the owner (who acted as a translator) who first took us to a local market (not central Ubud market as its too touristy) and then into the farm. I wanted to buy some coffee beans for a friend and he kindly let us stop off at a local coffee plantation on the way to the Bali Farm cookery class.When we got there, we were given a welcome drink and some delicious banana pancakes! We then proceeded to go to the garden and we picked various fresh herbs and vegetables that we would need for our cookery class.I believe the class can take 14 people at any one time, however as we were visiting in low season, there was only 4 of us which was great.We cooked some delicious dishes which we ate for lunch - and we actually cooked everything ourselves, with just some guidance from one of the trainers. We did everything except wash up !!! This place is run by a close family and the Owner is really passionate about what he is providing to tourists - he wants us to experience "real" Bali.They also sell lots of lovely spices (including vanilla pods) at a fraction of the price you would pay in the UK ! We had a great day out and would highly recommend to others - thank you!

Blown Away!. We were expecting a nice day but this place really exceeded our expectations! After our tour of the local market we went to the organic farm and found it to be absolutely beautiful. All of the staff spoke good English and worked hard to welcome us and make us feel special as we picked our ingredients from the garden. Then the cooking instruction was fantastic and we really enjoyed seeing the local high school girls helping out and learning English. They gave us a cook book and an apron to take home. Not to mention the food was great and we took home the left overs. I highly recommend this to anyone. Also, we took our 3 boys age 11,13 and 14 and they loved it too!

Amazing place. First off I was mesmerized by all the amazing foods that were grown on property. Our guy Whalen was amazing explaining every bit of the farm to us girls.. Allowing us to go and pick our own lemongrass and beans etc was amazing... I couldn't wait to get back to start cooking. Everything you cook is outside in the open... I loved that idea as well as sitting outside to eat the meal. The one thing I didn't however like is the flies but they put these special papers out and the flies immediately were attracted to them. We ended up doing the vegetarian option but they offer meat options as well. I did like the fact that the tour came and got us from our villa then took us to the market and explained all the spices to you first before taking you to the cooking class. Also after you are finished with the cooking class they have a little shop that you can basically get every kind of spice offered in the class. If you have the time to do this then it's def a must do attraction.

Best Cooking Class in Bali. Fantastic experience from beginning to end.Great communication and transport provided.Wayan was a brilliant teacher and knew so much about the farm, ingredients and recipes.He was very engaging, as were all of the staff.We had a brilliant time and I have since recreated all the dishes we were taught from the recipe book provided!Can't recommend highly enough!! The picture attached is what I recreated at home!

Delicious food, beautiful farm, wonderful experience!. We pre-booked our cooking class experience with Balinese Farm Cookin before arriving in Bali. They confirmed our lodging information ahead of time, and allowed us to pay via PayPal. On the day of our class, we were picked up in the farm's van and driven to a traditional market north of Ubud. It was a very authentic experience, no tourists to be found--expect for us! We learned about the traditional ingredients in Balinesecooking, and then it was off to the farm. The organic farm where the class is held is beautiful--filled with an abundance of fruits and veggies, and everything we could need to cook. Our instructor Wayan showed us around the property, where we selected and picked the ingredients we would later cook. Very fun to be involved in the process of selecting the food we would be eating! Wayan walked us through cooking 6 Balinese dishes, with the help of a friendly staff and local students who are studying tourism. We enjoyed helping them practice English while also learning some Indonesian, too! The space is peaceful and quiet, the food delicious. We would highly recommend the experience to anyone looking for a unique and authentic experience in Ubud!

Special Treatment - What a perfect day!. Although I was the only participant, they did not cancel and I was picked up by a cheerful Ketut, who showed me enthusiastically around the authentic Tegalalang markets. The farm is such a special place, that is lovingly cared for. John showed me how to cook the most divine food, which I will certainly try at home! I certainly recommend this experience.

Very delicioua day out with the cooking class. While booking the cooking class, I was skeptical about all the very positive remarks and ratings. Having had the cooking class experience at the organic cooking farm, I am convinced: this was value for money and a day in Unud very well spend!At 8 o'clock we were picked up by the driver, who would bring us to the cooking farm. Before arriving there, we went to a local market where we got explaination about products used to cook in Bali. Very interesting.Arriving at the farm, we started to harvest the products we would need for cooking. After some delicious tea, we started. To make a long stort very short: it was fun and delicious. A big part of this is due to the very kind, patient and relaxed people of the cooking farm. Also the fresh juices which van be choosen.I can recommend this cooking class to everybody!

Feed your soul with a day out on this beautiful farm with beautiful people. After being collected you're taken to a local market en-route and given 10-15 minutes to wander around yourself, then your guide joins you and explains the reasoning of the organic farm and describes and shows you the produce you'll be cooking with.Then onto the farm itself and after a tea or coffee refreshment when you arrive, you then get to wander around the beautiful farm and pick the vegetables that you cook with during the class. The farm setting is such a tranquil place, it's really interesting to see food growing that I can't grow in my own home country. The baby pineapple trees were very cute too.For the cooking, you start by making two cold dishes and then you can eat them, then it's back to the cooking area and three main courses. We started by making a 'base' paste and made a chicken curry, pork skewers and a tuna dish with a delicious raw salad accompaniment. There were only three of us in the class on the day I went and we had so much food we couldn't eat it all! You can take home any leftovers if you want to.Finally we made desert which was sliced fried banana which was simple but yummy. Served with fresh coconut and a syrup.I cannot recommend this day out enough - the people are incredibly warm and friendly throughout and funny too. The farm is just beautiful and is a very calming place and you get to learn how to cook some delicious Balinese food!A favourite day trip for me on my holiday in Bali - Fabulous!!!

Best day ever!!!!. I could not reccommend this Cooking Class enough!! First we met Katut at a local market in Ubud and guided us through all the spices that were being sold by local farmers. We then drove up to the farm where Wayan showed us around their organic garden. We got to taste cacao beans and various other herbs and spices, and got to harvest ourselves the ingredients we were going to use in the class. Wayan was a great cooking instructor, and with the help of him and the other staff we got to cook and eat six absolutely delicious balinese recipes. All of the staff were amazing and the ambiance was just beautiful. I would reccommend this to anyone, of all ages, even if you dont consider yourself the cooking type, you will be inspired after this!

Organic farming and Balinese hospitality at its BEST!. We were recommended by our friends to take on another cooking class but the Organic Farm component caught my eyes and I am very glad we took THIS cooking class and not the other.We were picked up from our hotel at 7.30am and there was a group of 10 of us cooking that day. After all the pickups, we were driven to a local market in Tegallalang. It was such a wonderful experience being in a local market where tourists were minimum and the locals were just getting on their days. We were met by someone from the farm and he gave us a tour around the market. He also spoke about why they chose to include this local market as part of their cooking class, introduction to spices and herbs used in local cuisine. We were given free time to explore the market. FYI, as this is not a tourist market, English is not widely spoken. Lots of pointing and fingers gestures to gather pricing of goods. Part of the cultural fun!After the market tour we were taken to the farm where we got to tour this massive organic farm, picked the vegetables and herbs we needed in the cooking and getting to fast FRESH vegetables off the vines! Never tasted a fresher cucumber my whole life where it just on the vines a few seconds before I took a bite!Wayan our host was so lovely and we learnt heaps of knowledge on fruits and vegetables and the Balinese dishes we learnt to cook. We made 2 entree dishes, a Balinese vegetable salad and Sweet and Sour Tempe. OMG, the sweet and sour tempe was to die for! Never expect 2 amateurs to cook up a storm and serving up delectable Balinese dishes!The organic farm and Balinese cooking are definitely winner's combo. It is also a great experience for children to learn where their food come from. There were 2 children in our group and they probably were the happiest in the whole group; so much to see and learn. Definitely an overall sensory experience!There are many cooking classes out there with good ratings but THIS is the BEST as you can't find another cooking class run by the farmers who will wow you with their warm hospitality and fresh produce. They are so willing to share that you get to bring home a recipe book of all the dishes cooked and a list of alternative ingredients you could use back home when local Balinese ingredients are hard to come by. Definitely worth every cents paid for the class!

Fantastic location, fun cooking experience, great food!. As a first-time solo traveller, I wanted to make sure I kept myself busy through my trip and experienced the true essence of Bali. I did a lot of research, trying to find the best cooking class in/around Ubud (believe me, there are many!). This is the only class I could find on an organic farm where you actually learn about how different veggies are grown. You even get to pick your own fresh veggies for cooking!Wayan and his whole family are so great. They are friendly, funny and always ready to answer questions. He responded immediately to my queries and was very accessible even before the class. Our trip to the traditional market was fun. We had time to learn about traditional Balinese spices as well as wander about on our own to take pictures, etc. The farm is about a 30 minute drive from the traditional market. The setting is absolutely beautiful - peaceful, green, cool. We cooked a salad, a starter, (you get to eat these before you start cooking the rest which is great as the food smells absolutely delicious), 2 mains and a side of satay - much much more than I would have imagined they would teach us in one class.The best part is that this is a family owned business. Everyone is involved; everyone goes out of their way to make sure we have a good time. And they never accept more than 10-12 students each class so you're sure to have an intimate, personalised session.There's nothing I can say to fault this cooking class. I honestly had the best day and would definitely recommend this class. I really got to immerse myself in the true Balinese culture, with the local people, ingredients and food. It's great value for money, too! I know I would definitely go back!

Great cooking class - nice location. First we went to a local market fora quick walk and after on the way to the farm stopped quickly (we asked the driver) to see the beautiful rice terraces of Tegallalang. We really liked the trip on the farm - seeing and harvesting some of the ingredients. Before cooking we were explained and tasted the main favours and spices in Balinese kitchen what was great. We had a small group of 6 people that day preparing 5 dishes each, cooked in couples and ate together (starters in the first round and mains in the second). All ingredients were well prepared in advance and help was provided to everyone who needed to finish approx. the same time (although cooking experience in our group was very different). I think this is a well organized daily program for a good price, with nice local people.

Best cooking class I've ever attended.. Granted, it was my first cooking class but it was still the best thing ever. We did the one day class and can not find a single fault. Another reviewer was definitely not exaggerating, this is the future for the world.At 27USD p.p, it is very reasonably priced. The setting is beautiful, the staff are great and the food you cook is delicious - you can even take the leftovers home. We learned how to cook 6 authentic Balinese dishes and they have a recipe book prepared for you to follow and take home. Another great thing is that the classes will never get too large (10-12 people max). Honestly, it's worth every penny.

Best value for money activity in Bali. Being shown local produce, meeting local growers, picking the ingredients fresh from the field and being taught the essential spices in cooking was fantastic. Wayan engage everyone in the preparation and cooking of 5 different dishes and although we all had different skill sets we were able to complete our meals to a restaurant standard. Importantly unlike other classes attended the staff at this cooking school gave us information about what to use as an alternative ingredient (local to our country of origin) which means we can now replicate these dishes and others at home. It was the best activity we done in Bali and value for money. I have already recommended Balinese Farm Cooking to our friends. Wayan keep it up your on a winner!
Great farm. We visit this place and we like very much. This is future for Bali and for world for clean food and good to earth

Ffffso much fun..such delicious food. Wayan and his staff are fantastic..learned so much about Balinese spices and tricks to making easy, delicious dishes,,,a lot of fun...open air in a warung(restaurant) ...a must do on your visit to Ubud, Bali
Just do it!. Awesome course! Hands on. Wonderful farm. Beautiful area. Learned how to make authentic Balinese food and harvest the fresh vegetables on their organic farm! Amazing!
Get your hands dirty. For foodies this is a must. An introduction to the basic construction of all Balinese cooking, from soil to plate.

Wonderful experience. I am so glad we took a cooking course when we were in Ubud and it was definitely the right decision to do it at this place. At the local market and also at the organic farm we learned a lot about the different spices and ingredients they use in Bali. The cooking school is in such a nice location outside of busy Ubud and the garden in which we picked our own beans, chilies and other vegetables is pretty big. Two people always share one stove and it was so much fun to cook the different dishes and of course eat them later on. Everything was sooooo delicious and we were so full after eating everything we cooked. Everybody who worked at the cooking school was so nice and helpful and we highly recommend this school. Thank you Wayan and your whole family for this wonderful day.

Amazing experience. This was my second visit to Ubud and my second cooking course. The Farm Cooking School in Ubud is a very well executed experience. This family run farm and kitchen is set in a beautiful area outside of the hustle and bustle of Ubud central. The brothers, Ketut and Wayan make you feel welcome from the get go. Unlike other cooking courses that take you to Ubud market, this course takes you to a small local market with no tourists (other than the group). Once at the farm, you are led through the garden where you pick your own ingredients and local plants are pointed out and explained. After that it's off to the open air kitchen for an incredibly informative and well presented cooking lesson. Before starting, you are instructed to taste all the individual spice ingredients to get a better understanding of their purpose in the recipe. You will make 6 recipes, all of them absolutely delicious. You also receive a small cooking book, with thorough recipes that also suggest alternative ingredients should you not be able to find some of them in your home country. This was truly one of the highlights of our trip. An amazing experience, highly recommended!

Wonderful day spent cooking in Bali. We spent a special day at Ketut's and Wayang's Balinese Cooking School in the hills outside Ubud. We were picked up from our accommodation in the morning, spent time at a local market then onto the school. The setting is wonderful - out in the country, very quiet and surrounded by organic produce and fruit trees. First we picked our own vegetables, etc then set about cooking. An easy experience with Wayang offering comments and help when needed. The food was truly delicious - 6 dishes and dessert. We were returned to our accommodation about 3.00pm after a wonderful day. A very unique experience compared to being enclosed by the usual four walls. It is also a community-type project benefiting the local people in the area. If you are thinking of doing this, please don't hesitate as it is a wonderful experience while in Bali.

Lovely day cooking on the farm. This was truly a special day. We were picked up at our hotel at 7am and driven out into the country, stopping at a local traditional market to explore and learn about the foods available. The Organic Farm was a peaceful place where we strolled around with our hosts, selecting fresh produce to be used in our cooking. I enjoyed hearing about new veggies and spices and the passion of Wayan and his extended family for organic farming was very evident. There were just 6 of us in the well equipped kitchen building which was open on all sides so we were surrounded by the farm atmosphere. None of us were expert cooks but our instructors were clear and patient and after slicing and dicing we turned out an array of wonderful Balinese dishes. I can honestly say this was the most authentic and tasty Balinese food I've had in the past week. I totally recommend this experience without hesitation.

Indonesian cooking experience. What a wonderful experience. We were picked up at out hotel and went first to the local market. Our host showed us the different spices on sale and how they were used in Indonesian cooking. We then went on to the farm and were shown all around the farm (which practices organic farming techniques) and picked many of the ingredients we would use in our cooking.We then made several dishes and enjoyed them all! Our instructor was clear, helpful and was fun to chat with. We loved the hands on experience.Afterwards we left with an apron, a cooking book and we purchased several spices (very reasonably) at the farm.An amazing day! This school was recommended to me and I will certainly recommend it to anyone visiting Bali.

A perfect day in a Balinese kitchen!!. We were 11 artists from Austra lia doing all things art. What a welcome change to be at the cooking school. From market to garden and then to the table, it was a day filled with new experiences and flavours. Ketut and Wayan have created the concept and run this venture very well. we were picked up on time, taken for a tour of the local market and then driven to the cooking school. Wayan too us ingredient picking and explained the uses of each herb and vegetable. We prepared and cooked 7 dishes and ate it all! What a fun way to be educated in Balinese cuisine. It was indeed one of the highlights of our trip. Thank you Wayan Jhon and Ketut! We will be back!
Great oooking school. This cooking school starts in the garden and ends at the dinning table. The recipes are very good and the staff very informative. Its a great introduction into Balinese cuisisne

Great experience. This was one of the highlights of our trip to Bali. Based on a beautiful organic farm, we were given a tour and allowed to pick the vegetables for cooking. The host was spoke great english and had a wonderful sense of humour, kept us laughing all morning! We made some really delicious food and were given the recipes to take home.Great value for money, definitely recommend!

Sustainable Eco Tourism in the Real Bali. Ketut and Wayan have created a wonderful concept that is not beholden to corporate control!This was without a doubt one of the best tourist experiences Bali has to offer. We were picked up where we were staying by Ketut and taken to a small local farmers market. The local market visit demonstrated the heart and mind of true Balinese, who do not hawk their goods to tourists as in lesser, larger markets. During the market visit, Ketut explained some of the differences between the local herbs and spices compared with those you might find at home and he offered us samples of some exotic fruits to try.Then on to the farm! The farm tour was both interactive and interesting to see. Guest get to pick the produce they will cook with later. The produce is being grown proudly in a sustainable fashion without resort to pesticides which will poison our eco system and our bodies!The cooking class itself was hands-on, entertaining and educational and it was great to interact with the staff and fellow travelers who enhanced the day. Wayan was our cooking instructor and was knowledgeable, friendly and witty. We cooked several dishes and can't wait to go home and recreate them! It was truly a wonderful experience to spend the day with this family. This is a hands-on experience in Bali that should not be missed!
amazing. This place has amazing food for cheap money. Its really something. Takes a little time until you get your food,but its worth it.

Culture and cooking in Ubud. This was my hands down favourite experience of our recent Bali adventure. If you are not staying in Ubud, Ketut and one of his drivers will come and collect you from your hotel for a small additional fee. My family (2 adults and 2 children, aged 13 and 12), were staying in Kerobokan, and the trip to Ubud took a long while, however we had the wonderful company of Ketut who was so friendly and genuinely interested in knowing more about us and sharing his own experiences around how he came to start up his business. Ketut is very passionate about organic farming and changing perceptions in the wider community around the reliance upon pesticides to produce acceptable looking fruit. Our first stop was at a local market in Ubud. Here we had a look through to see all of the locally grown produce and an explanation of the types of ingredients that we would be cooking with that day. We were able to try a few fruits including snake fruit (which interestingly has a taste not dissimilar to pineapple). We then had a quick stop at the beautiful rice terraces in Ubud. A little further on, we arrived at the farm, where an outdoor kitchen is set up and we were welcomed by Ketut's family and given a refreshing ginger and lemongrass tea and had an opportunity to meet the other participants of the cooking school as they arrived. We spent some time harvesting ingredients around the farm and were given clear explanations of the various fruits and vegetables in season and how they are typically used. Our boys were given a treat by being invited to climb a papaya tree and pick some fruit, which they took home with them at the end of the day. Once we were set with our ingredients, we were provided with cookbooks and aprons and set about cooking our 5 dishes (dessert was cooked for us). We cooked a couple of dishes at a time, and then ate, so we were eating right throughout the day. The dishes varied with a number of vegetarian dishes as well as some meat and fish, so there was something to suit all tastes. The great thing about this cooking school is that you do the cooking yourself, all hands on, even grinding the curry paste. Wyan, our instructor was always on hand to direct us and help if we needed it. He was very entertaining and always had a big smile on his face, so the whole experience was made to be incredibly fun.

Great food and a passionate team!. I cooked the vegetarian meals and everything was absolutely delicious!The owner as for the chief were really passionate about their work.I would definitely recommend this class located in "the real" and untouched Ubud.

Perfect Experience!!. This was a unique and fun experience, we loved it. They picked us up bright and early, took us to a market that was a bit off the beaten path, and let us pick the veggies right from the farm to use for cooking. The food was healthy, delicious, native, and very well advised. The team was all very kind and proficient with English, which we really appreciated. Try the specialty mixed-drinks they offer!
The food was incredible. The food was incredible, not only in taste but healthy, the flavors all new and exquisite, not your typical restaurant food, made with love and very professional an fusion

Great experience. The class will take place outside Ubud, in a small village. That makes it all the more authentic, including the morning visit at the market. The setting is great, the equipment is excellent and the staff is lovely. Not to mention that good results are basically guaranteed. Everyone knows that Balinese food is amazing but the one I have prepared... is probably the best :)
Good value. This tour was good. Very affordable and lots of fun. You get to go to the market and pick fresh produce from their garden. Then you will make and eat 5 or 6 dishes.

Full day: cooking and feast. This tour was the highlight of our trip to Bali. Our group of six women signed up to take this as part of our independent tour of Bali. it was a well run, comprehensive cooking experience from pick-up to drop-off, complete with market and farm tours, an apron and a cookbook. Very hands on. come prepared to cook and feast. Definitely recommend it to any one interested in Balinese food.

Cooking class and overnight stay. We were picked up in the afternoon for our overnight stay at the farm and the cooking class the next dayWhen we arrived at the farm we got a warm welcome from Wayan and the rest of the staff. We had an amazing home cooked meal and after we got directed to our room. The only remark i gave for the room is that there was no mosquito-net. The next morning we were woken up with a plate of fresh fruit from the farm. We then got taken to the market where we would meet the rest of the class. The market was not really special and we've seen better ones but we got told a lot of information about the roots and vegetables used in traditional balinese and Indonesian dishes. We already knew most of the information but for most people this was a nice add to the dayThen of to the farm. We got to pick al our ingredients for the dishes that we were going to make. This was very nice! After we were done the veggies got cleaned for us and we could start cookingThe cooking you mostly have to do by yourself. You work in pairs so the work is equally split. Our teacher walked by frequently and so did the ladies who also helped a lot! The dishes were very good and tasty! The whole experience was a real add for the vacation and we hope we can do the vegetarian course some day! What i liked the most of the day is that you can pick your veggies by yourself and because you work in pairs you get to eat your own dishes ( some people like very spicy some don't) Nice finishing touch: you get to keep your apron and a little cookbook with the dishes you made that day

Great location, facilities and staff. While i have done quite some cooking classes this was a relaxed one in a very nice, local and peaceful surrounding. While a bit off the beaten path and it took some time to arrive, it was time well spend. Like said location, staff and food were all very good. No hurries, very helpfull and sometime a good laugh while being there with also 4 other guests. Recommended.

Back to Nature! Very Inspirational. One of the best decisions we made during our trip to Bali was taking this cooking class. The day was so inspirational and relaxing. We started at the market, and got a chance to see how the items were sold. The market was so colorful, and full of life. From there, we went to the organic farm, where we were taught about all of the different plants. I truly felt at peace with myself, surrounded by beautiful fruits and vegetables. We picked items from the garden, and got to taste each of them. The price of the class is so reasonable and included pick up and drop off, an apron and cookbook, and all of the different dishes we made. It was wonderful to see a family run business with such good intentions. We loved every second of it and would highly recommend it.

A very authentic experience!. We were pleasantly surprised with this tour - it was a fantastic day and such an authentic experience. We decided to go with this company initially because of the positive reviews and because we were able to cook the dishes ourselves, as opposed to watching someone else. We were picked up by Ketut who had very good English - he is very passionate about Balinese culture and preserving Ubud for everyone to enjoy. A very interesting man to converse with! He is well travelled and extremely knowledgeable - mapping out substitute ingredients for the recipes where local ingredients may not be available. We were very happy with this because we plan to recreate some of the dishes to impress our friends! We opted for the Luwak coffee (coined cat poo cappuccino!) stop off instead of the markets (prior to the class) which was actually really nice all things considered - the views are absolutely breath taking. After the markets/coffee stop, we drove 20 minutes or so out of Ubud, to the farm. The farm has all organic produce which you pick yourselves - that was a nice experience in itself. The group is relatively small (8-10 people) so it was easy to listen to his family as we walked around the farm picking our ingredients. We cooked 5 dishes all up - it was a lot of food and all very yummy. They have vegetarian alternatives as well.Cooking is done in pairs at your own station, which is situated in an open air area in the middle of the farm - everyone is set up in a U shape. The setting is lovely. His family run the cooking school and are very pleasant to be around. Ketut also has a homestay offering (one room) which sounds very authentic in comparison to others. You can teach english to the local school kids and help the farmers in the morning collect vegetables in the rice paddies. Well worth getting in touch with him if this is something you are interested in - I would have loved to do it if I had more time in Ubud.

Amazing experience, organic, friendly/helpful staffs, great recipes. What else would you ask for?. Location and atmosphere is beautiful, organic ingredients in simple Balinese recipes which are easy to cook at home later. The staffs were so nice and helpful. Highly recommended! I will certainly go back for the vegetarian class

A fantastic, hands on cooking class. This is such a great experience. You start with a visit to the market to take a look at the local produce. Our guide avoided taking us to Ubud market as it is too touristy, instead opting for a more out of the way market. When we got to the farm we were offered a welcome drink before being given a tour around the farm. Our guide and chef for the day, Komang, was great. We were able to pick some of the greens that we needed from the farm. They took them away to wash and I'm not convinced that it as the same greens that came out. However, that didn't matter at all! The recipes were very authentic and easy to follow and the instruction and guidance from Komang and the other staff was fantastic.The reason I chose this class over the others featured on Tripadvisor was that it is very hands on. You cook in pairs so have plenty of opportunity to get involved. The others I read about seems to be more like a presentation.After all the hard work you sit down and enjoy the lovely dishes that you have cooked. They also have some delicious recipes for any vegetarians. I can't recommend this place enough!!
Fresh, Organic, Delicious & Fun. A great experience!. A fantastic day and a great experience. Well organised, loads of fun and yummy food. One of the best experiences we had in Ubud. Thank you!

Best Authentic Cooking Experience!. Had the best day enjoying this beautiful organic working farm and cooking school in Ubud. Starting with our pickup from our hotel in Seminyak to our farm tour and a fun & leisurely afternoon cooking delicious Balinese dishes - this was a memorable day. This is real Balinese food cooked with ingredients grown on the farm - staff are friendly and you can work as fast or as slowly as you like - I highly recommend this cooking experience!
Great cooking class. Great cooking class with lots of different meals and friendly hosts. Skip breakfast, there will be plenty of food.

Fantastic experience- Cooking class and Homestay. We chose to do the Cook and Stay option for $50US (child was half price) which is great value when compared to the cooking class for $35 which is average price for cooking classes in Ubud. For the extra few $ we were given a room for the night and breakfast and lunch as well as a market tour and cooking class. Great value. We arrived by our own transport at 5pm- i think they will pick you up if you come from Ubud. It would be best to arrive a bit earlier, maybe 4pm if you can. We planned to do the cooking class for lunch the next day but on arrival we decided to do it that night and we were glad we did. That way we had a class to ourselves rather than with the people who come for the class during the day.We were welcomed by Wayan, Wayan and Ketut and had a nice herbal tea welcome drink and set our bags in the room. We then went to the cooking school across the road and had a look around. Wayan explained about the place and the plants and we picked ingredients for our dinner from the garden. Most of the stuff we picked went into the Urab dish we made. We had our 3 year old daughter and Wayan brought his daughter of similar age along and they had a great time playing in the garden. He was great at including her in the class. We cooked 2 dishes, urab and sweet and sour tempe that were delicious, then ate those (rice and water provided) then cooked 3 more dishes and ate those! By this time it was late and we were full so we decided to leave the dessert for the next day and went to bed. The cooking class was great. I was planning to do another cooking class in Ubud on my own (without the family) but i didn't feel like I needed to after this class as it was broad and I felt like it covered some great dishes. Our room was in a house that seemed to not have anyone living in it but i'm not sure. It was clean and comfortable and had a decent ensuite with a good shower. The bathroom was better than some in the hotels we stayed in! We were happy with the room. The next morning we opted to get up early and take a trip to the markets where we met up with the group doing the lunch cooking class that day. We learned about some of the local fruits and ingredients and tried a few snacks sold there. Then we went back to the farm for breakfast. After breakfast we watched a special event going on at the house we stayed at- a local cooking competition showcasing the regions produce. There were govt officials there and we met the local elected member who was very friendly (also named Wayan), Then we went for a walk down the street and back to the farm for lunch (yum) and to cook our dessert. Our daughter made friends with another little girl there. We were driven to Ubud after lunch.We very much enjoyed the experience and we felt welcomed and comfortable the whole time. This is a really great enterprise. We were told a group of 13 people set up the organic farm and cooking school to bring tourism to the village. It is a very genuine experience.And very well set up and run. The food is fresh and clean and the kitchen staff and teachers were friendly and welcoming. I highly recommend it.

A must do experience. My friends and I were on a whirlwind trip to Bali and wanted to experience Bali culture at its best rather than the typical tourist spots. That is exactly what we got from Wayan and his family. We were picked up promptly by Katut and taken to the farm where we were greeted warmly and treated like VIP's.The whole experience was amazing. What is fresher than picking your own ingredients right off the farm and then cooking and enjoying the meals over a tranquil setting with the mountains as our backdrop.As an instructor Wayan was very personable, patient and well humoured. I very much enjoyed this tour and would recommend it to anyone wanting an authentic experience of "Bali" life.

Beautiful experience!. I really enjoyed this experience katut picked us up from our hotel he was on time, polite and friendly. Then he took us to a great little market and introduced us to some of the locals, and explained different ingredients to us.After the market we continued onto a coffee plantation which was very cool with the most astonishing views. Then we met our instructor Wayan who made us feel extremely welcome. And we picked our own veggies which was great, Wayan also showed and explained to us the different plants and what the Balinese people use them for. We cooked so many different things, all which are fantastic-I made my curry to spicy!!. I will definitely be back this was the highlight of my trip to Bali, it was a welcoming experience away from the hustle and bustle of the tourist areas.

Short market trip followed by interesting farm discovery and a lot of food. Although our pickup was a little bit delayed our overall experience was awesome.First we went to one of the local markets and our guide explained some of the vegetables and spices. Purchasing them was not part of the trip.Afterwards we drove to the farm were a very comprehensive collection of vegetables and fruits is grown. They tell you a lot about them and let you harvest some of it which is afterwards used for the cooking.The cooking course itself was easy to follow and well organised. The outcome was very delicious and by far to much to add rice to every dish ;)You can pick between veggie and standard recipes.The staff was friendly and their english was quite good.I totally recommend this tour!

Not to be missed!. Unforgettable experience and a great deep dive into Bali culinary culture. I would recommend this to anybody including family with children early on in your travel in bali. Journey started with a visit to local fruit and vegetable market, then we moved to the family farm where we picked and collected our ingredients, and finally we started the long and exciting process of cooking a five course meal. I have rarely done an activity where I cannot fault the organizers. This was the case here. Other than the choice of dessert (red rice sweet dish) that was not to our taste, everything else was memorable. This ranks as one of the best and most fun experience in our stay on the island. Also you feel you are doing a great action as you are supporting a local entrepreneurial family who gives back to its community. Of course everything you see and eat is organic and you even feel good on the inside after this day.
Great Experience!. Highly interesting and funny activity to learn and enjoy Balinese culture and food.Great people that will make you feel part of their family!

2 Sisters at Balinese Farm, Cooking and organic farm trip.
