I cant fault any of it.My sister and I had time to kill with 4 extra days after Denpasar airport was closed because of volcanic eruptions .We both have big gardens and both mad keen cooks who often attend sophisticated cooking demonstrations from famous chefs. The beginning of the tour we attended a local market which started us off on a high(lots of photo's)and seeing all the produce. The driver,"Commin" was delightful,(good English) and so were all the staff(especially our Cook (Wyan./ Commin) . As Gardeners we loved the garden and identifying plants we had only seen in books ie cumin, coffee beans and cacao plus picking our own vegetables for the class . "Cooking should be fun" Wyan kept saying and we laughed our way through 4 main dishes, cleaning, prepping , learning and cooking. Great clear instructions, excellent equipment and delicious recipes. A lovely fresh fruit drink was served with the food also. This also included a cook book plus an apron. Absolutely fabulousJulianne Lowe and Colleen Pye from NewZealandMy sister and I said it was the best thing we have done in Bali and we have been many times. I also think it is
Highlight of our tour. My sister & I have done numerous cooking classes but this was one of the most memorable & enjoyable.

Mindfull and interesting learning experience!. Our children, age 10 and 11(difficult eaters) enjoyed it so much. They were being helped by the staff very patiently and learned about the food preparing in Bali at the same time. The farm is a well kept beautiful place.

Fantastic learning experience at the farm. Last week we had the best cooking experience in Ubud with lots of other families from around the world. We were picked up from our hotel in Seminyak and driven to the market where we had the chance to taste and learn about foods and how they were used in Balinese dishes. Next, we arrived at the lovely farm where we were warmly greeted and given a tour of all the organic produce that is grown there. All the staff were very friendly and the instructions when cooking were clear. We made 4 dishes in all, which were all delicious, and were given a recipe book and the chance to purchase organic herbs and spices from the farm. Our instructor told us stories about how the farm began and how he is using it to change and help the surrounding community! It is growing from strength to strength. Well worth a visit! Tip - don't eat breakfast!

Amazing experience, couldn't have been better. I went to the cooking course with my family and we all had an amazing day. The farm is beautiful, the staff very welcoming and the instructor very passionate about his job. The food we cooked was delicious and easy to do it again at home. As some of us on the course chose to do vegetarian dishes and some not, we exchanged all our dishes so that everybody could taste everything. Everything about the course was great and we had a lot of fun!

Fun way to learn cooking. I'm not really good at cooking and joined this class has change my mind cos makes cooking look easy and fun. Wayan is good in explaining the spices and the cooking process. Easy to understand, friendly and also funny in the way he teach which make me enjoy every step of cooking. The environment is relaxing and fresh, even the farm still in growing process but all very nature and refreshing. Last July was my second visit and I saw they've made a lot of progress on farm, on the way they set up the stove and cooking class table which now more nice and more organize. And have the recipe book upgrade too. So i guess they really pay attention to uplift customer' satisfaction. and that's make the most of it. I would come again and learn to cook another dishes.

Perfect unique cooking school with lots of extras . My Dad and I booked the cooking school and it's hard to choose with so many options but we are so glad we picked this one.From booking, Wayan was very kind and helpful. We were picked up on time and personally, we both loved the smaller market we visited. It was far more local and the guide was fantastic. Next we moved on to the farm and had a great tour around the organic found where we learnt a lot about different vegetables and farming techniques and collected some veg for our cooking. We then got to have a tea wheel looking over the incredible gardens- it was such a good relaxing day. Then we cooked. First 2 dishes, then eating and then the final 3 dishes. Doing it this way was so much better as you could really appreciate all the dishes. We both cook a lot but found the school very informative and just the right pace so you had time to enjoy and learn more as you cooked. We then has desert cooked by the teachers. We also bought some of their locally produced spices. Overall it was a great day and we loved the atmosphere, staff and food we Had. I really hope I can come back again when I'm back in Bali. Perfect cooking school and garden. One tip, book online and make sure you bring your printed receipt as proof if you've paid online so you can give it to Wayan.

Amazing!. I loved the experience!! Perfectly orchestrated and great food. Good value. Highly recommended! We made several dishes and they were all great. We first went to a farmer market and then went back to pick some veggies at the organic farm. Then we made the stuff we picked! Loved it

Amazing! . We made at least 5:6 dishes and they were all amazing, all the staff were very friendly and the whole atmosphere lush! The farm that it's located on is still growing but.its very beautiful and peaceful. I would definantly recommend a visit there!

One of our favourite activities in Bali!. Our family visited Bali for 17 days in July 15. We chose this cooking school because of the organic farm. With 2 of us being vegetarian, we asked whether this could be catered for and the owners were friendly and accommodating. Ketut, the owner was very passionate about organic farming and cooking and spoke fondly of his village, family and travels. He is very passionate about helping his community and leaving a legacy. A word of advice, eat a small brekky as it's an early pick up and mid-morning before you eat your first meal. We visited a small local market on the way there and we also made a coffee stop on the way after requesting it as we had not had brekky and Ketut was happy to arrange this. Once there, we took a tour of the organic garden and picked some fresh ingredients for our cooking. We were also provided a refreshing beverage on arrival. The farm was beautifully laid out and the cooking area and seating were well presented. There was also clean toilet facilities on site. We were each given a cook book and there was a vegetarian and regular version available. The food we made was absolutely delicious. We had a lot of fun and also learnt a lot. This would have been one of our most memorable activities and I highly recommend it! Ketut and his family are delightful and Ketut I really enjoyed our chat near the new spice building during our break. A great day and great value! :)

Best cooking class by far. From the Market to the farm to the plate.Was picked up from my hotel, then traveled to the markets to be shown some fantastic ingredients. Once we arrived you could tell this school has been built with one thing in mind. Sustainability and keeping it like it should be/how it is in the local communities. The farm and the staff were amazing, the class was planned so well and organised with a vast amount of different recipes.Everything was explained clearly and the food was fantastic.Would highly recommend

wonderful experience you shouldn't miss. first you visit a local market, then take a tour in their organic farm. during the tour, you pick some ingredients for the cooking part. i think we cooked around 6 dishes, and they were all fantastic. easy to follow and very very hands on. i was a solo traveler and they helped me out a lot with the chopping and every thing! ketut's family was so sweet and helpful in every way. always quick to give a smile and some encouragement. one of the best things i've done in a while! don't miss this!

4th Time Visitor and Still Awesome!. I've been to Bali a lot on holiday and for various reasons keep going back to the Balinese Farm Cooking school. I was one of the first customers when they opened up and it's been amazing to see it go from strength to strength. This most recent time they had improved the recipe books and had upgraded their working tables to be even more friendly to Western Tourists. The food was amazing (better than I remember last time) and over all the day was perfect! Highly recommended as a unique cooking experience in a real Balinese village!
The best cooking class ever!!!. This was an amazing experience. The food is delicious and plentiful. Wayan is a great instructor and very patient and funny. We loved it here :-)

Great Cooking class. I adore my experience with the Balinese Farm Cooking and organic farm! Our guide was very funny and interesting! I really enjoy him talking to us about the balinese culture! The food was good and we were definitely stuffed after!

A wonderful cooking experience . My friend and I chose to take this cooking class over the many other options we had in the Ubud area because we liked the idea of it being on an organic farm. We were beyond impressed by the end of the day. It was such an amazing environment and the staff were so nice and very knowledgeable. Ketut, the instructor was also our driver. He told us many stories about Bali and the reasons behind why he started this cooking class. We made 6 delightful balaneise dishes and of course got to eat and enjoy them. I would absolutely recommend taking this class if you are interested. It's very quiet and peaceful and it is a nice break from the busy cities.
We helped cook the best meal. Excellent day with everything home made including the coconut milk/cream/oil. Wonderful outdoor setting with cover. Wood fire cooking.

Best day trip on Bali. This was one of the best choices we made for our trip to Bali. The owner is inspiring and passionate and we were thrilled with our entire experience. They will pick you up early morning and take you to a small local market for ingredients. After the market you drive up to the farm where you will walk through the gardens picking fresh veggies for your meal. Once everything is picked you get to spend a few hours cooking some of the most delicious Indonesian meals. I would highly recommend this to anyone going to bali. It's one of my favorite memories! My only suggestion would be that you eat a small breakfast before you go. We were picked up at 7:30am and I didn't eat before we left and it was tough waiting to eat until 11 when the first meal was done. Other than that bring a smile and enjoy an amazing day with inspiring people.

Go to this!!! . We just got back from our cooking class and it was one of the best travel experiences of my life. Our guide and chef Katut had a dream and a passion for Bali, with an emphasis on authentic experiences. He was friendly, entertaining and informative. The food was AMAZING! Can't wait to go home and impress my friends. This class is more than you could possibly hope for and incredible value, highly recommended for all!

Fantastic Day. A friend and I booked this the day before and it turned out to be one of the best days we spent in Bali. The place is in a beautiful setting and wandering about the expansive garden was an absolute joy. The staff were all fantastic and I couldn't recommend this highly enough. However, avoid breakfast - you will be eating a lot!

If you love food - take this tour!. What a great way to spend the day in Ubud! This is a perfect chance to get out of the centre of town and into an authentic village – seeing some countryside along the way. Spend the day harvesting and cooking food grown right there on the farm – learning about the Balinese way of life and enjoying delicious food. It’s amazing what this family run team is doing. Also doesn’t hurt that the food is delicious - easily one of the best meals we had in Ubud.

Very enjoyable relaxed cooking class. Not just a normal cooking lesson, but a complete one to experience Balinese style of cooking.My partner and I have done cooking classes in Malaysia and Vietnam and this was another good experience in a relaxed and informative atmosphere. Cost was 400K rupiah or 35USD and well worth it. Pickup from Ubud was around 7.45am and drop off 3.30pm and the time passed reasonably quickly.PROS:- Booking experience was simple. Called Wayan (lovely guy) who booked us in over the phone and confirmed everything via text.- Pickup was pretty much on time and drive to farm was fairly easy in airconditioned van (maybe 45min excl. the stop at the market)- At the farm you pick various vegetables and learn about the different foods (v. informative)- We are fish eating vegetarians and Wayan and the team easily adapted the menu to suit our needs - The foods, cooking and instructions are spot on. The prep and cooking are pretty relaxed (didnt feel too pressured) and the team are there to help out and answer questions or tell you about the dishes etc- You make a couple of dishes then eat, then make more then eat again. Really delicious (the meat eaters loved our food!). Not sure if we as group took too long but the team made the dessert for us - no matter as it was nice to be waited on - the team are very patient and happy to talkCONS:- the stop at local market was a little disappointing. Its reasonably small and not very diverse - mainly local mothers/grandmas selling a small selection of the same vegetables. Overall, we'd recommend the class (8.5/10) and had a great day with great people in Wayan and team.

Cooking class. My day out cooking at the Balinese Farm Cooking & Organic Farm was one of the highlights from a recent trip to Bali. I chose this class because it was in a village outside of Ubud, so we were treated to a nice scenic tour through the lovely rice terraces and countryside outside of town to and from the farm. Pick up and drop off from accommodation in Ubud was convenient with pleasant drivers. The first stop, at the market wasn't really necessary or informative. On arrival at the farm (large garden) Wayan gave us a tour of his farm which was a good ice breaker. Then we cooked for 3-4 hours which included a basic Balinese spice paste plus 5 savoury dishes, stopping to eat lunch during this time! It was a bit rushed trying to get all the dishes done, and unfortunately we didn't have time to make any desserts (the staff made them and we got to sample). However I had a great day and the take home recipe book will be used very shortly :)

Fantastic - one of the best things we have done, one of our best meals so far!. Highly recommend We also arranged to purchase some extra copies of the cookbooks - we were very keen to get the vegetarian version for ourselves, as well as extras for family.Was great that we actually did the cooking (it's not a cooking show, which several seem to be).Overall came away stuffed and looking forward to trying at home - and wowing our friends with great tasty food.

Excellent cooking class!. I thought the overall experience was very good. The day was fun and informative and the food was delicious. If I had one complaint it would be there were many flies, however, that being said it's expected in Bali...they could stick some fly tape up though. Wayan was very informative and polite and helped us the whole way.

cooking class. Just came back from Bali and the cooking school was one of our highlights. We were picked up from hotel and taken to a local market and then to the farm for class, it was well organised and the instruction was very clear and precise. The meal we were taught to cook were great.The event was excellent value for money if fact would have paid more for experience. The full staff were great.

Great Time Cooking. I had a great time learning Balinese food at the cooking class. I signed up with my hubby, therefore it's our very first time cooking in a lesson setting. The people were very nice and friendly. Being city-dewller throughout my live, I have not seen a farm that is filled with so many variety of vegetation. It was really an eye-opener for me. The staff was really nice to explain everything in great details for us and allowed us to try some of the fruits from the trees. The explanation for the cooking was really done step by step. The food was really delicious.

Delicious food, long day. My friend and I signed up for this class and really enjoyed it. We were picked up at our hotel (a bit late) and brought to a farmers market. We were there for about 15 minutes and then went to the farm. The guide led us through the farm talking about the produce and we got to pick the produce for our meal preparation.All of the recipes were very flavorful and delicious. The demonstrators spoke English really well. It was wonderful to get a hands on traditional Balinese experience. My only complaint was timing. The company said we would be back by 2pm and so we had made 3pm massage appointments. Unfortunately we didn't get back to our hotel until 3:30pm and that was after asking to be taken from the farm back to our hotel as others were still hanging around. It was a bit of a long day with the pick up scheduled for 8:30am and being dropped off at 3:30pm.
very good food. original food in a modern coat but still tastes good.I am an indonesian woman so i know how it has to taste.

Fabulous experience with Balinese Cooking. We visited Bali in end May 2015. Before the trip, we were planning the itinerary and wanted to have different kind of activities for our 5days there.We chanced upon this with excellent comments. So, decided to put that in.Not just a normal cooking lesson, but a complete one to experience Balinese style of cooking.First experience with the team already given me a very good impression. Wayan was the one I contacted for the booking. He was super patience with all my query. And provided the kind of assurance that we really looked forward to. We were met by one of the staff ( forgotten his name ) early in the morning who brought us to the local market. It was an eye opening for us especially the children who only know of modern supermarket back home.Touring round the organic farm was another hilight. We received so much information ( tour conducted by Putu ) while moving round the farm. Not a very big farm but we actually spend quite a bit of time there as there were so many things to explore. Different kind of veg, fruit trees, spices etc etc.the staff was so patience in explaining to us and never rush to finish it off.Then we were introduced to Kutuk, the handsome chef ! A very inspired guy. As we learn the various cooking technics from him, he patiently explain each ingredient to us and tell us story of how they start up with this school.We ate what we cooked ! Dish by dish. I can't described the feeling here but you really got to try this. You will not regret.The whole cooking class were so seamlessly conducted with the chef and the supporting staffs whom helped prepare and clearing.Thumbs up !Will recommend to friends whoever wants to visit Bali. This is one of the activities you should not missed.Once again, big thanks to Wayan, Kutuk, Putu and the guy who brought us to the market, as well as all the support staffs !
Best cooking class ever. This was by far the best thing we did when we were in Bali! Loved the farm experience and picking our own vegetables.

A Fabulous Relaxing Food Filled Day. We had such a fabulous day at this organic farm. We toured the farm, picked most of our ingredients, and made 4 dishes and a dessert. The kitchen is an outdoor pavilion in a beautiful setting. We had a lovely time. The staff was seamlessly pre prepping our dishes and cleaning up behind us. The food we made was very good. We have been making some of these dishes since we returned home, and the recipes we were provided with are easy to follow. Highly recommend this experience. The best thing we did on Bali.

One of the best experiences of my Bali visit. I am just so glad I decided to go for this experience during my Bali stay. I connected with the organiser before even reaching Bali and Wayan Jhon was very prompt to respond. I paid the fee for $35 at the farm only. I was picked up in morning from my home stay, we picked 3 more people on the way...we stopped at the Tegallalang local market to learn about ingredients and then continued our drive through the lush green countryside to reach pemulan Bali, the organic farm! It was breathtakingly beautiful, lush green all around. We got to pick our own ingredients from the farm that was used in cooking. We cooked some traditional Balinese and Indonesian food and ate them too. One of the best meals I had in Bali.. All in all I just loved being there and cooking with them. The staff are warm and friendly and Jhon is a fun instructor! For me this is a must have experience when in Bali..

Exceeded my expectations. My husband and I wanted to do something different for a change, so we started looking at cooking classes while celebrating our anniversary in Bali. After reading reviews on tripadvisor, I contacted Jhon prior to booking and he was very prompt regarding my inquiries. We even got a discount for booking early! ($5 off for booking early). Class is at $35usd, and they can pick you up at your hotel too. This class is cheaper than the one offered in Seminyak so it's value for money alright. Although it was a 2 hr drive from Seminyak, Ketut, our driver was very pleasant to talk with and he was very eager to explain Balinese culture. Once we got to the farm, we found ourselves loving the place! The cooking stations is in one open pavillion in the center of their very lovely farm. You get to pick your veggies and herbs that will be used for cooking. The menu was a very good mix of authentic Indonesian food, and it was one of the best meals we've had while on vacation! There were 2 vegetable dishes, 1 fish dish, 1 chicken and 1 pork dish and dessert. You get the recipe booklet and apron for free too. A lot of the crew at the farm seemed to be related too, so it's nice to see getting family involved in their business. Everybody was just very friendly. We had an awesome day, and Jhon is such a good cooking instructor, with a good sense of humor to boot. Thanks for making our holiday memorable. We really had fun! P.S. They also have a mini shop for spices and some handy cooking utensils.

Amazing experience surrounded by true Balinese style. This was by far an amazing day, we had a true experience in cooking delicious Balinese food in the surroundings of an exotic Balinese farm lands. The people were so kind & the head chef spoke good English. It was fun to experience the markets first then to come to the farm where we could cook our food. I would highly recommend this place to others.

Great food great vision. This cooking class/project is truly inspiring. The vision that was intended is beautiful and you will know this as soon as you get to the farm. We were picked up from our villa and transported to the organic farm which is located in the countryside on a beautiful property full of organic produce that is gathered and used in the cooking class! The instructor speaks good English and is clear with his instructions as well as his transcribing of recipes in the booklet you get to take with you which includes all recipes plus the website address with additional recipes. The food was amazing and the teacher was more than accomodating to my partner who could not eat the meat dishes and substituted meat for tofu and Tempe. If you are looking to do a cooking class in Bali, please support this one, it is done from the heart and helps members of the community by providing wholesome food made with love and also an exchange type deal for English speakers who volunteer to teach English to those who cannot afford schooling costs. After the day finished around 230 we asked if we could be taken to a shop in Ubud before being taken to villa to which he was very accomodating and did not charge any extra.....a very enjoyable experience that I woulda love to do again a++

A fantastic experience. I had a great time at this cooking class. I happened to be the only student that day, and I had an amazing individualized experience with friendly, knowledgeable staff who spoke great English. They even customized the menu for me as I am a pescatarian. The trip also included transportation and a trip to a local market. Highly recommended!

Beautiful day at the organic farm!. Delicious, typical Balinese food, cooked in a wonderful organic garden. The place is idyllic and the staff was very friendly and enthusiastic. We visited a local market, learned about Balinese herbs and vegetables that they grow organically in the garden and cooked 7 recipes (a whole lot of food!). What a great day we had! Super experience ! I definitely recommend!

Amazing organic farm with fantastic food!. We booked the class the last minute and so glad we got a spot! Everything was perfect, we were cooking outside in the middle of their organic farm! The stuff and the cook instructor were funny and very helpful!

Amazing cooking and homestay experience!. My boyfriend and I took the cooking class here and stayed at the homestay. Cooking was hands on (unlike a lot of other schools in Ubud), and really fun! Homestay was clean and felt very authentic. Staff were so amazing and welcoming - we really enjoyed our class with Ketut.

cooking class. Balinese staff was helpful and friendly.
Excellent cooking class in the middle of jungle !
Very good experience !!!
MG

Fabulous day. What a wonderful experience, we enjoyed every moment. The visit to the market was interesting & informative. The farm is so beautifully kept, it was a privilege to be able to spend the day in such a lovely place. The cooking instructors are helpful & delightful to be with. We cooked 6 dishes I all & they were all so delicious. It was a very hands on experience & we will be putting what we have learnt into practice at home.Don't hesitate to book this experience.

Best cooking class experience!. I loved our time at Pemulan Bali! All the staff were so friendly and eager to engage with us, and as it was just my sister and me that day, we got to cook and eat and explore the garden at our leisure. The quiet seclusion, beautifully landscaped garden, outdoor cooking pavilion, bamboo music -- everything was perfect. We got to cook a good variety of dishes (6 in total, plus the bumbu base sauce), and our instructor, Wayan Jhon, explained all the ingredients and cooking concepts in great detail. When he learned that I love chayote (coko), he told me how the Balinese use it in their food and so now I have even more ways to make it! In addition to cooking, the staff also introduced their organic farm concept to us, all the different fruits and vegetables that they grow, and even let us pick some of the vegetables we used in our meal. Everything was so fresh and the food we made was some of the best (if not the best) we had in Bali. For anyone going to Bali, I highly recommend making time to check out this farm and taking the cooking class -- you won't regret it!

The most incredible cooking class I've done!. I've done a lot of cooking class around the world and this one is by far the best one. Everything is just perfect. The farm is beautiful and you get to go around it picking your own vegetables and spices for the class. Ketut, the class instructor, is very professional and interesting, and super nice. You start with going to a local market, then Ketut will go around the farm explaining everything. Then you get to cook 5 dishes hands-on. The farm and the cooking class setting is just beautiful, tasteful and local. Just a warning: don't eat breakfast in the morning as you will eat 5 dishes that morning! The class is very well organized and fun. It was the highlight of our stay in Ubud. Cheers!

Superb experience. The cooking class, from A to Z, is a wonderful experience! The scenery is so nice! Picking your own ingredients, learn about them and complete the whole thing in some amazing dishes was one of our best trips around Ubud! We were the only two, so we had a private cooking glass, in between meals, we made some music with the people of the farm, very cool.Thank you!

A Memorable Experience in Ubud. We were picked up at 7:30am from our villa and started the day at a local Ubud market experiencing the culture of the people who sell fruits, vegetables, meat and fish. We were then taken to the organic farm where the staff were genuine and invested in teaching us about the fruits, vegetables, herbs and spices. We got to see and walk around the farm and learn about their organic farming techniques. We cooked 5 courses and it was one of the best meals I've had that I can remember. The day ended at 3:30pm and we were then given a surprise trip to the farmer's friend's cafe (Bali Pulina Agro-Tourism) overlooking the rice paddies where they make authentic Luwak coffee (which is apparently hard to come by as most are not the real thing). We took in beautiful views and were able to say we tried real Luwak coffee. Highly recommend this activity if you have the time.

A special Experience!. This was a more than just a cooking class, it was a wonderful experuence and a super value! Ketut is passionate about delivering a great and authentic experience. We visited a local market for a tour and then headed to the farm where we picked our own ingredients and learned about local produce. We prepared and ate 5 traditional Balinese dishes and enjoyed discussions with Ketut, his team and the others that were there for the class. We left with an apron and book of the recipes. Transportation was provided at no additional cost and we even made a couple of unexpected stops on the way back to see some sights.

fantastic cooking class. I have done many cooking classes across south east asia and this was one of my favorites. the farm setting is so great..nice to get a feel for what it is like to live there...the staff was fantastic throughout. ketut was our instructor and he is the best.(this is not a course for professional chefs to set your expections.)and if you have done ä "market" tour in the past, I would ask them to pick u up after that as it is very small and a little redundant.overall great experience!p.s. if u have a timetable for the day, make sure u set that expectation.
Recommended. Well maintained farm, great food and nice staff! Good plan to spend a day 😊 everything was clean. Only unnecessary point: the visit to the market.

Balinese cooking class. The tour to the market wasnt that intersting or necessary. But going around the farm and the cooking class was very good, it was easy but I still learned alot. The food was good, the staff was nice. I could do the class again just with different dishes. Ubud is so beautiful and the place where the cooking class was were no exception.

Great food, great staff and great company. From pick up to drop off we really enjoyed the day. All the staff were so friendly and helpful with great sense of humour. The market tour was a more pleasant smaller market than in Ubud and we did learn a few things. We found the farm interesting and were able to pick quite a few things to use in our cooking. i am vegetarian but not my husband so we were able to cook both options.The food was so delicious. We were lucky to have only 3 others with us on the day so it was really pleasant and we loved chatting to fellow travellers while eating our amazing lunch.Thank you to all the staff for a great day.We will return next year and bring that koala bear we promised.
great quality organic produce. Ubud is an area where many good cafes abound but the organic produce here is excellent and the service freindly

Balinese cooking class. This was an awesome experience. Best food I had in Bali. Picked us up at our hotel on time, drove us to the market for a tour, full day of cooking and learning, then dropped us back at our hotel in Legian. A great day with my wife. Also meet nice people from Australia!

Great staff! Friendly and helpful.. Wayan and his fellow staff had been exceptionally helpful from the day I signed up till the drop off at the hotel. There was a little mix up in the morning as the driver could not speak English but he more than made up for his friendliness and helpfulness in pointing out the good spots to take pictures of the rice terraces. The market tour, though a little short, was a good intorduction to what was to come later. It provided us with a good opportunity to have a glimpse of local life.The reception at the farm was fantastic. Wayan and his staff took us around the farm, we picked our vegetables and they proceeded to guide us on our cooking class. Helpful, yet non-intrusive. I must easily say the dishes we made and ate were easily the highlights of our Bali trip. The farm itself was also a pleasant environment. If there were to be an actual farm stay in the premises, I would not hesitate to sign up for it!

Great cooking and atnosphere!. We had a great time at our cooking class, first a short visit to the market and then to the farm where Putu showed us the different plants and fruits they grow organically there. Then we set out to cook several dishes, vegetarian and not and proceeded to eat everything!The place is beautiful, with a lovely open kitchen in the middle of the garden.We arranged the visit the day before via whatsapp, spoke to Wayan who was very patient and answered all our questions.They picked us up at our hotel at 7.30 and dropped us back there at around 3pm. Great day!

Excellent class and day out!. We chose to attend the Balinese Cooking School with only one days notice. our hotel arranged the class easily and without hassle. Yesterday we were picked up at the exact time arranged and drove a short distance to the market for a quick tour. Our guide was most knowledgable, easy to understand and able to answer our questions. We were then whisked away in our comfortable van to the cooking school and organic farm. I was delighted to see the working farm that supplies all the ingridence in the cooking class. we found the farm tour interesting as much of the spices we only see in a powered form from the supermarket at home. The tour included pest control methods which I will adopt in my own garden. The cooking catered well for me being a vegetarian, it was no issue at all. We cooked some amazing food. Too much to finish eating really. The staff were amazing help and very kind. It appears they do enjoy their jobs as they are very happy and love a laugh. In all we had an excellent day, Thank you.

Fabulous time!. The B&B I was staying at organized this for me so I didn't know what I was getting into -- it was much better than I expected!1) Excellent value. We cooked and ate six dishes that were better than most of the restaurant food I ate in Ubud.2) High quality and fun. The ingredients and instructions were top notch. Tons of attention, all of the fun of cooking without any of the hard work (like cleaning up!).3) Informative. Tons of information about plants, ingredients, and techniques that I didn't know.4) Friendly. The people were so nice!

Amazing experience . This is really good value for money. We got to see the beautiful farm of their's, cooking amazing food, see the local morning market and much more. Just being there is an experience it self. I highly recomment this. It's such a nice feeling to support this family and their organic farm. It makes so much sense and they are truly making an effort to make Bali organic place

Grate activities. One of the best things to do in Bali. Highly recommended! The farm is located in a heaven place, the people are very kind, the ingredients and the food are very good. Only one negative comment: to much food to eat 😊
But for sure, I highly recommend to visit the farm an to enjoy the cooking lessons!!

A Wonderful experience. This is by far the most interesting thing we have done in Bali. We learned so much about Balinese cooking and ignore the comment this cooking class was for amateurs. We were so fortunate to see an actual garden that was so well planted and learn what is grown in Bali. The surrounding farm is gorgeous and very serene. The people working this farm are very helpful and made you feel at home. We enjoyed seeing a local market at the beginning and then off to the farm for your class. Ketut (sorry if I spelt that wrong) was so informative and substituted ingredients that we can get in Canada for the recipes. He has a true passion for cooking and had fun preparing dishes. You will not regret booking this class, we are still talking about our experience!!

No dice, only for Amateurs. Sorry guys but the cooking class is only for amateurs. That being said, maybe it would have been different if Wayan himself was teaching the class and not his kind, but inexperienced brother/relative.I don't want to knock what they are doing but the market tour was a joke. It was pretty much, this is eggplant. This is garlic, this is ginger, this is tumeric. If you don't know what these items are, or if you have kids who might have fun wandering around the farm picking their own vegetables, this might be the class for you. For myself, I'm a professional chef and wanted to learn A LOT more about the local cuisine and methods. This was not the class for me. I asked what some of the vegetables/fruits I didn't recognize from the local markets were and they weren't able to tell me because they didn't know the names in English. That's ok, not big deal. But the class/day was super slow paced and the menu items were not varied enough. This is not to say I did not learn anything at all. It was good to see some of the way they prepare the basic gede spice mix. But all in all, I think I could have spent my time in another class which would have been more well suited for me.Pros: On the way from the market to the farm they were kind enough to stop at the rice terrace so everyone could take a photo. It was nice to walk around the farm and see the vegetable growing in their naturally. The staff was kind and tried their best. I met some nice people who were also taking the class. Cons: I felt like I was being taught how to cook by an assistant who was not passionate about cooking. Forget the market tour, total joke, not even a good market that you could wander off on your own. For the price, they charge for things like beers and sodas. Only take this class if you are a beginner in Asian flavors or you have small children who want to participate.

Very very slow day. Our day started off by being picked up in Ubud at 7.00 then making our way to the local market which we met our chef there. Probably no point going to the market as nothing is purchased because all ingredients are at the farm. As we left the market we were told that we were going to visit a coffee plantation on the way and enjoy the view as there was another group coming from seminyak. At 9am (two hours after pick up) we finally drove to the farm where we waited more time for the other group. Finally by 10.30 we started the boring tour around the garden as three hours after pick up we are just wanting to get things moving a little bit and get to the reason we were all there... Cooking! An hour went by discussing the produce on the farm in which we had already pretty much heard it all at the market anyway and we finally got to the cooking! The chef was knowledgable in the local ingredients but lacked any real cooking or teaching skills as he basically just came to our bench and chopped something and walked away expecting us to know what we wants us to do. Never explaining anything to the whole group. Food was okay nothing special, was put off my too much stuffing around In the beginning and got dropped off back at home around 4.30 as the driver was lazy and wouldn't take us home until he was ready. Wouldn't recommend at all

Great class and even better food!. This was my first cooking class and I really didn't know what to expect, but I was pleasantly surprised and would take the class again if I return to Ubud. At first, the price of the class put me off, but it was totally worth it! The chef was very patient and helpful. I learned a lot about different spices and vegetables used in Balinese cooking and the food was the best I had while in Bali. We had five dishes and I was stuffed at the end. This was probably my highlight of Ubud.

Best food I ate in Bali!. What sets this cooking class apart is that it takes place in a covered outdoor cooking area on an actual farm. After visiting the local market to learn about different vegetables and spices, you arrive at the farm where you carry a basket around and pick different vegetables and spices from the gardens as a guide explains to you what eat plant does. You get a chance to see the plants as they are grown and what different vegetables like various ginger roots look like. The ingredients we harvested from the farm composed about one-fifth of the food we ate, with the rest being already supplied either from the local market or picked earlier at the farm. I felt like we got a good education about the ingredients we were using.We cooked seven dishes in total. We ate our first dish around 10:30am and ate our last dish around 1:30pm. We were stuffed and were given leftovers to take home to eat for dinner. We didn't need to buy any other meals that day. Everything was super delicious. The chicken curry was maybe the best dish we ate in Bali. The bad part about this is that it made us critical of all of the other food we ate in Bali! The instructors were fantastic and very nice. They explained clearly what we were doing. There are a number of helpers at the cooking area and inside a prep area. Most of the vegetable cleaning, dish washing, and some of the prep work is done for you by the helpers. There were times when they maybe helped too much, such as preparing the batter for the fried bananas (pisang goreng) when we would have wanted to do that. But all of the dirty work is done for you so that you can focus on the fun of cooking. They give you a cookbook with recipes where you can take notes as you cook. My only complaint is that the cookbook was not very detailed, and we spent a good amount of time writing notes that should have already been in the cookbook.I cannot recommend this cooking class enough. What a fantastic day with wonderful people, great food, and great instruction.

Fun day of cooking and eating. I love taking cooking classes when I travel and the fact that this one is on a farm made me really excited about it. The atmosphere was great and the food was excellent (we really enjoyed 4/6 dishes. We thought 2 of them were 'just okay'.)The biggest downfall to this cooking class, in my opinion, is that he doesn't really teach you how to cook the food. Everyone gets a cookbook and then he runs around turning everyone's stoves on and off and saying 'add this! cut this!'My personal preference for a cooking class is one with more instruction and explanation upfront and then more independent cooking. That being said, if this is your first cooking class, you will probably love it! It was a lot of fun and great to meet the other participants.

Balinese Farm Cooking. We wanted to do a Balinese cooking course and found this place recommended. They were very helpful; they came to pick us up at our hotel in Ubud and gave us a short tour of the Ubud market. Then they gave us a little talk on rice farming. Finally we ended up with about a dozen people doing a cooking class. It was well-organized and very clean with helpful explanations. The setting is beautiful. I have no hesitations in recommending them.James Fentress

the best experience ever. It has been a wonderful experience, the food was very fresh and the staff lovely! the cheff is a very nice guy and was very helpful, he also gave good advice about where to go in bali and how to get to places. We cooked 6 dishes and ate them all!we were so full at the end of the day but very happy! the good thing is that you actually pick your ingridients up, plus you manage to get a recipies book for free at home!AMAZING!

Fun, Interesting & Delicious!. Had a great day from start to finish! Picked up at our hotel and taken to the Tegallalang Market. Learn't lots about the ingredients we were going to be using that day. Then back into the car and to the farm. Beautiful spot amongst the forrest.Picked our produce, while having the tour of the farm and then onto making a delicious 5 course menu. All of the staff at the School are helpful, friendly and just lovely. Ketut is a great instructor with the right amount of fun and passion for Balinese cooking! I admire his dream to set-up a form of tourism for Bali that looks after Bali as well as the tourists!Keep up the great work guys!A thoroughly good day!

Great cooking class, great day, but. The farm is gorgeous, the class was great, some hands on, all of the drudge work done by others so you actually get through 7 courses during the day. My two complaints: the spices sold at the end are overpriced, and everything is priced in US dollars. If you pay in IDR, they give an astonishingly bad rate of 1:10,000, instead of the 1:12,600 it should be. Its a cheap and stupid move, that i hope they will soon correct.

A must-do!. The best day of the entire trip. A must do! Ketut and his staff made the day both interesting and enjoyable. The market visit was a great start to the morning, and the day only got better!

cooking balinese. Good day shopping for food and preparing dishes which you also get to eat. Great. Made Balinese offerings for the gods and also observed the making of coconut oil for the body, hair or cooking.

Fun, Interesting, Beautiful and Delicious. This a cooking school. But what stands out to me most however wasn't the food. What stands out was the people. Wayan Jhon and his staff were incredible fun to be around. Clear and serious when touring the local market and the farm to let us pick our produce and when describing the recipes. Fun and full of personality when helping us cook them. These are clearly folks who enjoy what they do and they make the whole experience a joy.And the food? The food was great too. We didn't need any dinner after all the meals we cooked and ate by mid afternoon. It's a good thing that the food is prepared conscientiously to be healthy; it's far too tempting for self control.Any place can teach you the details of the cuisine. Balinese Farm Cooking lets you experience the land and the people from which the cuisine originates.

Leisure Outdoor Cooking. There're a whole bunch of cooking schools listed on Tripadvisor but the Balinese Farm Cooking School stood out for us for several reasons. Not only are the classes deliberately kept small (10 pax maximum), the class itself is set in a really nice organic farm and participants are taken around the farm to harvest their own herbs and vegetables which they cook during the class. Wayan, our chef explained that they're the only ones that have adopted this concept in Bali so far.Before the farm tour and harvesting, you're served a complimentary drink then led around the farm. Remember your mosquito repellent! Everyone in our group were bitten repeatedly because nobody thought to apply any.Then we broke away into groups of two. Each couple were assigned a cooking and prep station. First we made Bese Gede, a traditional Balinese paste that is used in practically every dish, followed by 4 savory dishes and a dessert. By the time it came to the dessert, we were all so tired we opted for the staff to make the pisang goreng on our behalf while we lazed around.The farm and kitchen itself is located about 30 minutes north of Ubud but return transportation is provided.The only gripe we had was the market tour. There were 8 participants and the guide seemed interested only in talking to and showing the front 4 participants around the market. We could not hear most of what she was saying. Also from the little we did hear, it seemed she was merely pointing out produce and going "this is an eggplant" and "that is an onion". The cooking class would be a 5-star experience if not for the market tour.

A must do in Bali. Bali has a mature tourist market and service standards are usually high everywhere. The Balinese Farm Cooking & Organic Farm stays a cut above that; it's that good an experience.Not only did we learn to cook a plethora of delicious Balinese cooking, but also get to eat them all. By the end of the day, we were thoroughly satisfied at the delicious meal we cooked. Before the cooking session, we were taken around the organic farm to harvest the raw ingredients, something which has inspired me to grow my own farm someday.The location of the farm is nestled within the Ubud greenery and once it started raining, cooking those delicious meal outdoors became an even more memorable experience.If you crave for some lesser food like a Coke, you can vend such stuff there as well but then again, why would you?

Mr Wayan Mundi and family are very welcoming :D. I stayed in Balinese Farm Cooking School from Sunday, 14 December 2014 until Wednesday morning, 17 December 2014. Mr Wayan Mundi, the house owner, is a very friendly person. The house is clean and cozy. It's like being in your own home :) About the cooking session:Yes, I am very eager in learning cooking Indonesian cuisines. And, Balinese foods are really strong in its taste. Chef Ketut is a very experienced and approachable chef teacher. He spoke English fluently. He will tell you inside out on how to cook DELICIOUS and AUTHENTIC Balinese cuisines. You MUST and Have To experience this cooking class when you Love Indonesian cuisines. Love it!!

Only cooking class on a farm and not just in a garden / restaurant. I found this cooking class here on Tripadvisor and I really have to say thank you. It was great. The pick up in Ubud was around 7-7:30, because the farm is a few km up the Mountain. On the way to the farm you will visit a local market, but you will just go over it with a guide. All the needed ingredients grow on their farm. As soon as you arrive at the farm you have a tour around and will pick some ingredients with the chef. Don't think this is a 'smelly' farm, it is really pretty! It was build by the local farmers to grow organic veggies. However, since the marked for organic food on Bali is fairly small they created the cooking class with some chefs from Ubud. Now most of their products are used for the cooking classes. Also the facilities are extremely good and modern.We cooked in total 5 dishes. However, since we just did the beginner class, the first dish was just a paste which was used later on for some other dishes and the last dish, fried banana, was done by the chef. Nevertheless, it was a very nice day and we were really full. At about 3pm we were back at our hotel.The the way, you can keep the very nice receipt book and the used apron!

Great cooking class, not expensive, lovely day. My partner and I were picked up from Ubud at 7am and headed off to pick up another couple. We went to an organic market however it was the day after a celebration so not many veggies were out... We arrived around 930am and had a welcome drink... We then walked through the gardens and picked our veggies for the cooking class... The teacher was very entertaining aswell as his assistant... I think her name was puspae... I wasn't feeling well and they made me a ginger tea and helped my partner while I sat down.. We made 5 dishes all together and got a recipe book and apron as a souvenir.... Definitely recommend this class... We got back to the hotel around 3 so is a big day.... Don't eat breakfast

Fantastic food (after a long wait). My boyfriend and I got picked up at 6:30am from seminyak to be taken to Ubud cookery school via the market. The market was semi interesting, and we then headed to the farm to start cooking... Or so we thought. We had to wait for the rest of our group to arrive which took almost an hour/two. They did provide us welcome drinks however which allowed us to have time to chat to the other people on the tour. We then picked our own veg from the garden which was good, however the chef kept on repeating himself and it started to get a bit annoying. After lengthy (repetitive) talks about the herbs and spices used in Indonesian cooking we finally started cooking at 11:30 (5 hours after we were picked up). Throughout the day the chef kept on repeating himself (in broken English) - which was very annoying but eventually my boyfriend and I just made a joke out of it to keep us sane and we ended up having a good laugh. The food that we cooked completely saved the day- everything we made was delicious and came out perfect - and was very easy to make. Everyone enjoyed it!! We also bought some Balinese saffron and they kindly gave us an extra recipe book to take home as presents for family. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. Great day to look back on and very glad we did it, however I would suggest they shorten the day considerably so there isn't so much waiting around and maybe changing up the chefs a bit too. Would recommend also eating a big breakfast before hand!

Amazing. My boyfriend and I took part in this cooking class whilst on a short trip to Bali and we absolutely loved it! We were the only people there which was really nice. We started off with a short trip to a small market to have a look at some local produce and then went on to farm for the rest of the day. We walked around the farm with Made, the host, and picked some vegetables and spices which we would be using in our recipes. We made a total of five recipes which were all absolutely amazing! Made was an fantastic teacher, he knows a lot about food and what flavours work well together, and the other staff were great too. Definitely recommend it, we had such a good time! :)

also fantastic if you are vegetarian!. We took part in this cooking course in August and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. There were only four people in the course in total, which allowed for plenty of discussions about food and food production in the gardens as well as Balinese culture in general. Our main host, Made, and the team made our experience very memorable, as we were given a guided tour through the organic gardens and were able to pick our own ingredients (Made’s knowledge of plants greatly enhanced this experience). In fact, we selected this particular cooking course over the others because of this unique selling point. Furthermore, as vegetarians their willingness to help prepare vegetarian or meat dishes according to the wishes of the participants was important for us. In total, we prepared four meals and were given our own recipe book and apron to take home. The food was tasty and portions were large so it was difficult to finish them all! At one point we even had some light musical entertainment on flutes and xylophone, played by the some of the other workers. The cool thing was that the music had not been planned as part of the tourist event that we took part in—we just happened to be lucky to listen to it.The entire experience from the punctual hotel pick up, through the market tour and later the garden tour, to the cooking itself was extremely professional. I would highly recommend this particular cooking course.

Learn to cook traditional Balinise food in an idyllic location. I can highly recommend the Bali Farm Cooking classes. I was picked up from my hotel in Ubud and enjoyed a scenic drive through the country before arriving at an organic farm that was a visual delight away from the hustle and bustle. The facilities were first rate and I enjoyed cooking with the locals learning how to make şix different dishes all made with organic produce I had chosen at the farm earlier in the day.

Thoroughly enjoyable experience - highly recommended!. As a couple on honeymoon, we were very lucky to be the only ones on this course the day we went, making it a very enjoyable experience for us both. First we were picked up from our hotel by a very friendly local named Nyoman and taken to the food market. The market was an eye opening experience for us; there were so many different things available and Nyoman was a very interesting guide. When we got to the farm, we were taken around the grounds and shown a large selection of the vast amounts of produce they grow on site. We picked a few vegetables which we were then to cook with. It was such a beautiful place; it felt like real Bali and it was nice to get away from the crowds and the heat in the busy streets of Ubud. The cooking class itself was in an open-sided bamboo structure. We were each given a recipe book which we were then shown how to make 5 different dishes from, including a dessert. The food was simple enough to create, as we are not keen cooks ourselves but we still found it quite easy to follow, especially with such a good instructor! The food was delicious; before the course, my husband didn’t like coconut and I didn’t like banana. By the end of the day, we had both decided otherwise! We bought a few spices from the farm so that we could recreate some of the dishes at home - these were very reasonably priced.On our way back to the hotel, Nyoman took us to see where Kopi Luwak (coffee) comes from. There were stunning views out over the valley of rice fields and we enjoyed trying their different types of coffee while looking out. A great way to end our trip! We left our hotel at around 07:30, returned at around 14:00 and had our fill of more food than we could have wanted – I would say that’s definite value for money!

An absolute treat!. Visiting this farm and cooking was one of the best activities my partner and I did during our stay in Bali. Staff were very responsive, from booking (which I did in Australia) to arrival to finish. We were super lucky that we were the only participants on the day we booked, so we had a special private experience. But even if we were in a larger group I believe the staff would have shown the same investment in its visitors as they showed to us. After coming back from the local market, with a short stop at the Rice Terrace Café for some amazing views of terraced rice fields Ubud is famous for, we were greeted by Made (who we enjoyed seeing again at our hotel where he also works). He had a chat with us while we relaxed with a refreshing glass of ginger and lemongrass tea. Made then took us around the farm, not only talking about the produce and growing products but also about farming life and general Balinese culture. It was interesting to learn what vegetables are also used for medicines by the locals given that visiting a doctor or hospital is very expensive for many of the locals. The tour around the farm probably took around an hour, and we cut some things for use during our cooking and even ate some things right from picking. We then spent the rest of the day with Ketut for the cooking. The cooking "hut" was beautiful and added to the local traditional feel of the place, as well as provided much needed shade from the sun. Ketut is clearly passionate about growing organically, cooking, and maintaining local culture in his life. He is a very peaceful man and a gentle soul. We enjoyed his company so much that we asked him to be our driver for the week (his main job is driving – I think he volunteers at the farm because he believes in it, loves the atmosphere, and is intrinsically motivated to help the farm grow). Ketut has worked in kitchens in Bali and overseas (London, Perth), and you should ask him why he chooses to stay now in Ubud.We cooked four or five things from the recipe book (you get to keep the recipe book and your apron, which is a nice touch). Everything was sooooo yummy. I was glad I did not eat breakfast that day, and we were so full from the day that we did not need dinner. Ketut explained what ingredients could be substituted for other things if we were having trouble finding the listed ingredients back home. I cannot wait to make these dishes again when I return home. The two women helping Ketut were also lovely. They could not speak English as well as Ketut but have the same interest in the farm and in cooking and in guest interaction, but Ketut encouraged them to explain to us the making of the dessert, which they did a fine job with. After the cooking, Ketut took us to another organic farm owned by a friend of his who produces luwak coffee among other coffees and vegetables. This farm has a fantastic view of and is one of Ketut’s favorite places to sit and stare at nature. The day was a big treat for us, not just in terms of the food! Great value as well!

Sublime. Truly amazing. I was the only booking but they did the whole day anyway. Starts with pickup and an authentic (not ubud) market visit with nyoman tarka. Very chatty and friendly like all the locals. Very good English. Very informative.The 20 minute drive to the farm and cooking school takes you away from tourist bali and into real bali. I was met by Mada Retu and began with a tour of the farm. I've been involved with permaculture for nearly 30 years and the organic farm is based on local knowledge and good design. I would call it permaculture but that word wasn't in their vocabulary. The farm is also very beautiful thanks to nyoman gardening skills and artistic flair. You get to graze on the plants which was great. Also gives you an idea of heat for the chillies you'll be using later. The birds eye chillies are exactly what you'd expect. Strong! Mada also told me about medicinal uses for plants such as guava leaf tea for bali belly. I haven't needed that so hygiene is good at the school. The only disappointment was that the durian was not in season. I shall just have to come back.The cooking class took 4 or 5 hours with a half hour break. I was surprised how well organised it was. you get a 40 page cookbook and all the prep work was done which i appreciated: I know how to cut shallots thanks. Yes they call a shallot a shallot. Not a spring onion in sight :)We made 5 courses including satay lilit using lemongrass stalks as skewers. I'm not going into detail. Do yourself a favour and book the course to get the secrets. You'll learn heaps. The locals will en trance you. And you'll get an amazing feed worth way more than the whole day out has costed.

A-MAZ-ING. An absolutely brilliant experience, went with a mate who was a little unsure at the idea of doing a cooking course, but by the end of it we were both raving about it.Picked from your hotel you are driven out to a rural food market, this thing is huge, we walked around for half an hour and probably didn't see a quarter of it, also we were the only tourists there and I'm fairly sure not many spoke english. Your guide takes you through and shows you the various foods, and where the food is a bit exotic gives you an idea of western equivalents, he also purchases a few treats for you to try.From here you travel out to the guides home, he introduces you to some of his family and then gives you a tour of the layout typical to Balinese ancestral homes.It's then a quick walk out into the farmland behind, each section is owned by an individual farmer but the area is maintained as a collective. You are given a run down of the various crops grown, and pick a few vegetables to be used in the cooking.The kitchen itself is an open air kitchen on the hill overlooking the farms, you are given a run down of the recipes and ingredients and then its a hands on experience for there onwards.The results are amazing, the food tastes fantastic and it almost spoils you from trying the same foods at restaurants because you could only expect disappointment.I would strongly recommend this experience to everyone, you have the options of Meat, Vegetarian or Vegan experiences so there is something for everyone. Side note, I'm a vegetarian and my mate is definitely not, despite this he came on the vegetarian experience with me and still found it amazing.

Personal touch. We were picked up by ketut and started our journey with 3 other people we first stopped at a local market about 10 mins out of Ubud and ketut had a huge knowledge of spices and herbs which was pretty cool for a driver little did we know ketut was also our teacher for the day so it really was a personal touch plus there was only 5 in out class so it was even better the cooking was all hands on and we were given aprons and recipe books as well we picked our own veggies for the meals and are as we cooked so as to enjoy the food as went and items the food was hot. Ketut is so passionate about Bali which is pleasant to see and in the drive home we even stopped for a spare of the moment tour at a coffee plantation with the cat (possum) poo coffee all in all well worth the fee paid.

Fun, relaxed, and yuuuummmmm. I came here with three friends a couple of weeks ago, and we had a great time! The farm itself is amazing, and it was really cool to learn about all the different types of ginger and pick the veggies we'd use in our class. And an added bonus - we happened to be there when a dude was climbing a palm tree to fetch coconuts (something I've always wanted to see in real life). The staff are so nice and friendly! We had two chefs/teachers helping us out, and they were funny, knowledgable, and super accommodating. We had two special diets among our group, and they easily modified the recipes for us (which were delicious!!). We also received a recipe booklet, which I definitely plan to use. This was a fabulous day, and we all thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. I highly recommend this activity!!

Highly recommend!. Three friends and I wanted to take a Balinese cooking class while in Ubud on Oct 2nd. We decided to go with the Balinese Farm Cooking School based on the great tripadvisor reviews. We LOVED it! The whole day was awesome. The male cooking instructor and the female assistant were super cool and fun and great teachers. I wish I remembered their names to give them kudos. The farm and cooking facility was well maintained, very clean and neat, and the decorations/grounds/furnishings/cooking area were beautiful! One of my friends was vegetarian and I am allergic to shellfish, and they happily accommodated all of our dietary restrictions. They also provide a recipe booklet with the dishes we made (and subsequently ate) and a bunch of other traditional Balinese dishes. The ingredients and spices we used were amazing. Most were things that one would likely have at home, and the others can likely be found at an Asian market (we live in the US). This was a fun, memorable day, and all four of us were very pleased! Shake the meat!... (inside joke)

Amazing cooking experience among the Balinese. I had an awesome overall experience with the team of Balinese farm and cooking school. Excellent communication; they responded very quickly via email to any inquiry I might have. The whole team is fantastic, from the driver, to the chef, to the ladies helping with food preparation; very sympathetic, knowledgeable and helpful. The visit to the market is interesting, as there are no tourists there, and you get a glimpse of the balinese everyday life.The farm is very peaceful, and the kitchen setup in an open air gazebo prevents you from getting too hot while cooking.The recipes are delicious, and you don't only receive the ones you cooked, you get a little book with maybe 20 recipes in it, as well as some insights on the Balinese cooking techniques, which is very interesting.Many cooking schools in Ubud are well renowned, but owned by foreigners. This business is all Balinese, providing work to people in the little village where the farm is located, and supporting local farmers.

Simply the BEST cooking school I could hope for. Organic farm with an introduction to your ingredients,complete with (if known)the equivalent in your country (which carries through the day!).best part...you Cook,hands on,you eat the first two dishes, then you cook again,eat,cook and eat. It wasn't the usual Nasi Goreng etc either.best day ever must for everyone! Huge thankyou to ketut and his helpers xo Keep in mind it includes return transport in the ubud area plus an apron and book to keep plus priceless knowledge!!! Oh and lunch!!!! :)

A perfect day at a perfect place. My wife and I spent a lovely day at Balinese farm cooking school. We had heard stories from others that had attended cooking classes around Ubud, and did honestly not know what to expect. We were in every aspect positively surprised. First of, the driver were on time for the pickup. As Balinese have a more relaxed relation to time than westerners, it is always with anticipation I face pickups like this. But this time the driver where on time, and ha already done another pickup before coming to our place. We had, in our initial booking, requested to be in a group of no more than 10 people. As it turned out it was just the three of us that day, and that gave us opportunity to do every task along the way. The farm is an hours drive from Ubud, but I would highly recommend to take the trip instead of doing a home cooking inside Ubud. The farm is organically run, and they use no pestilence on their produce. On the way there we stopped at a local market to view the different produce for sale there. It was nice and the driver gave us a good walk through the market and answered all our questions about different fruits and veggies. Up at the farm we got a tour of the farm with information about the plants and trees. We got to know about herb use of the spices as we picked our own greens from the garden. Instead of buying at the local market it was really cool to handpick the different ingredients for the cooking. We then did five dishes first two that we ate, then two more and finally we did a dessert. The place was clean, the instructor spoke good English, the knives were sharp and everyone smiled and had a good time. I have no hesitation to give them full score and will go back there for another visit.

Fresh and very interresting. I booked this day on thé internet, via email ans everything happenee as planned. The driver was right on time, then we stopped at the local market, and he even stopped at the rice terrasses so I could take pictures. Then we arrived at the farm, everyone was very nice, the set-up is amazing, we picked our own vegetables and then we cooked. The food was better than any food I've had since I got here. I would recommend this to anyone.

Great experience. We had a great cooking class. The driver picked us up at our hotel in Ubud and dropped us off at a small market before he took us to the farm. The farm itself is amazingly beautiful..all kinds of vegetables and fruits are grown there (cocoa, bananas, pineapples, vanilla, carrots,.....). Before class started our very nice and entertaining instructor gave us a tour through the garden and explained all the different plants to us, plus we could already try everything and collected some ingredients for the cooking. The guy is fluent in English, which helps a lot.Our group only consisted of 8 people, which was perfect as all of us could really cook themselves. Btw the class takes place in an open bungalow directly in the garden. The view is so beautiful!We made 5 different dishes in total, including a dessert ( banana fritters :). As we had a vegetarian in our group one of the staff members cooked a dish without meat extra for her!!All the dishes were provided to us in a small booklet that we could keep!!!We really enjoyed this class, it was an amazing experience and we would recommend it to everyone who wants to get an insight into the traditional Balinese kitchen in an organic setting!

Ubud cooking school with a big difference. We learnt a great deal and more importantly, we also acquired much insight into the village culture and traditions of farming and food. It was very inspiring to be hosted by such vibrant young people who live what they believe and stay true to their cultural values . They also demonstrated much insight into the use of traditional food and cooking not only to promote good health. But also how food can be a medicine to manage chronic health. Which in todays economic environment where governments and insurance companies struggle to fund basic healthcare is becoming a vital issue for every one

Best cooking day yet. We have attended a few cooking days but this was the best experience yet. We try to be organic and fresh at home and when we travel, so to actually pick the food in the beautiful vegetable gardens and then cook it was a highlight for us. The teaching of the recipes was easy to follow with plenty of hands on and the results were absolutely delicious. We made a total of 4 dishes with dessert being prepared for us. It is a family set up so to see the children playing in the garden was a delight. Hosts were great, good English and very good knowledge of local herbs and their uses over which I was able to quiz at some length. Thank you for a lovely day.

Fantastic morning, lots of amazing fresh food. Great value for money, picked up at 7 and taken to the traditional food markets, before heading to their farm for an extremely informative guided tour of the their organogenesis farm- including trying the food and spices in their fresh, raw form.We then cooked 4 great traditional dishes (and are them!) not finishing until 2:30. The cooking was well demonstrated and explained, all questions were answered.As a new enterprise I would fully encourage, recommend and support them.... As an added bonus you even get to keep your recipe book and apron!

A really lovely day. A truly excellent experience. We enjoyed the early morning market experience - it was great being with a guide and able to ask questions, as well as try the odd fruit from various stalls. Once on the farm, our small group (4 in total) enjoyed coffees before being shown around the farm - and in particular trying the different produce growing there - in a lot of detail. Really interesting. It was fascinating trying the different types of ginger, and even leaves, and noticing the small differences between them, and learning how each plant is used traditionally within both cooking, and often within medicine. Once cooking, we made 5 dishes in total - each were delicious. Really nice to be able to taste things along the way too, and see how small squeezes of lime (for example) can really transform a taste. We had a lovely time eating all the food of the course of a few hours. The tempe and dadar were my favourites (though tough to call!). Really recommended, and thank you once again!

Beautiful and real farm!. We had a great day at the cooking farm. First i would like to mention the negatives. We got picked up really early around 7. The driver took us to a market and we walked around a bit but the driver was passively stroling around. We already did great cooking classes in Thailand & Cambodia and the market tour was always a highlight. But it got wors when the driver lit his sigaret while showing us fruits. I did'nt like that and the tour started bad. But once we were at the farm another guide gave us a welcome drink and a tour around the farm. It was great, we chose our fruit and vegetables and got our hand dirty while picking them :-). It's a beautiful well maintained farm. We started cooking in an open kitchen. The cook was very kind and explaind everything. We made 4 dishes and 1 dessert. It was delicious... The best sate Ayam i've tasted in Bali. It's about 40 min from ubud. A great experience with great people.

Excellent experience and surroundings. We were picked up around 7am from our hotel, (a little early but well worth it). Our driver was friendly and knowledgeable with good English.My husband and I were very lucky as we were the only 2 on the course that day.We were taken to the local market to look around, very handy to have a guide. Despite the weather we found out a lot about the different produce available.Onto the farm, where we had a welcome drink of tea or coffee, followed by a guide of the farm to pick the ingredients for the dishes we were going to cook. Made explained the different produce, and you can get your hands dirty picking, tasting and smelling.We cooked 4 different dishes, 2 then eat, 2 more then eat and finally a desert.The cooking was well explained and clear to follow. You get to do plenty of cooking with excellent support and help. You are given a recipe book and pen so you can make your own notes as you go. Many chances for photos.Everything you need is provided as well as clean toilet and hand washing facilities.Just remember to take your camera and be careful when trying the ginger!

An amazing day!. We had a fantastic time on the organic farm cooking school! We booked a month or so in advance and Wayan was very helpful in moving our class when we couldn't attend the pre booked session. The whole day was a brilliant experience, from visiting the local market, to picking our vegetables in the organic farm to use later. The hosts couldn't have been more welcoming or helpful, answering all out questions and sharing very interesting information about the farm and food. We made 5 dishes, all delicious and more than enough food to go round. We were provided with recipe books to keep and given lots of extra detail as we cooked. The staff were keen for us to do as much cooking as possible, but always there to help and advise as needed. The only criticism is the amount of flys present, but as an out door cooking school we know there is not a lot that can be done. All the food is kept as hygienically as possible.Over all a fantastic day, highly recommended!

A great day of village life. Simply amazing, this trip is well worth the value, you get picked up 7am in the morning, going to the local market and get introduced to eat local food, the cooking class itself is marvellous you can eat a LOT that you don't need to have dinner that day! The staff is very informative. The best thing is everything is organic, they don't use any chemicals, and they use coconut oil for every dish, so yummy!

Great food and good value.. We had a great day learning about the food, the local vegetables and the way of life. A real insite into the local way of life. Great value as a whole day with loads of food and collection and drop off included.

Beautiful tasty cooking class. If you want to do some balinese cooking classes, do it here. The scenery and environment will outdo the indoor/restaurant cookings by far. The staff is very friendly and informative about the garden/farm where you are able to pick your ingredients freshly. Also included is a class in local ingredient of which not all you will be using for your actual dishes, so very informative. It is just a startup farm but definitely worth a visit as it keeps getting better and better, I know!

Just simply amazing. I recommend this to anyone staying in Ubud. The drive and the atmosphere is great! But the food you make is simply astonishing good. Be sure not too eat too mich breakfast. Its 3 courses ;) Of you are allergic or vegetarian you just have to say the word and you get a special menu! Well worth the money

The best experience in Ubud .
