This was a full and comprehensive introduction to Balinese cooking and a great activity for those who are looking for something interactive and different, we would definitely recommend.

Amazing cultural family experience. Rakesh and his family are really amazing in how they deliver the cooking class, share their culture and give you background knowledge and make you feel very comfortable in their home. We started by walking through a local market which is great and then drive to their home. On the way, rakesh explains things we are noticing on the way with detail, such as certain types of rice, which ones are better etc etc. information we had not received by anyone before. Its very interesting. We got to his home and its was just amazing there in. We got to share our cooking experience with a school of french children and it was great fun. We learnt alot. I would recommend rakesh and his family to everyone. In the 5 times i have been to bali, this experience tops anything iv done!

So much extra activities . Since this is not the cheapest cooking class around, we selected this class for its dishes. I'm glad we did. Besides the morning market with additional ingredient tasting, we visited the local coffee brewery with the cats. There was a coffee tasting and after that we went through the ricefields to the local family. It was obvious that they are used to the routine, two classes a day. Still, the fun parts you can do yourself, the dishes and boring preparations are being taken care of. It was really good food, a good atmosphere and in the end you get all the receipts in a bound booklet, kinda professional to me. They pick you up and drive you back so be prepared for fun and good food. I would definitely recommend.

Great fun. Went there with my girlfriend. We were picked up at our hotel and together with two other couples visited the market. After that we went to the house where we joined two other couples. We were warmly greeted and got a drink while the family was sorting ingredients.The class was great fun, every step is explained well and you can ask questions as much as you like. Everybody gets a task so that nobody is standing idly by.Because of this, you can not make many photos yourself but the hosts will ask if they can use your camera so you still get some nice action shots.The food was delicious and afterwards we received the recipes. After some more chatting we were brought back to our hotel. It was a great experience!Sidenote: On various websites there are people complaining about not visiting the market in the afternoon. In their brochure it clearly says this is only in the morning class and when asked at booking they also say this. The reason for this is that there simply is no market in the afternoon...

cook like a local. Learn to identify Indonesian spices at the local market, experience food shopping the Balinese way, meet and cook with the most delightful Balinese family who go out of their way to make you welcome in their home and culture. Very hands on with recipes given to take home. A great experience.

Rakesh and his family are the best!!. We had such an amazing time with Rakesh and his family. They picked us up from our hotel and brought us to the market. We walked around and they explained all the local spices, fruits and vegetables. They also explained about Balinese culture and facts about the buildings in their house. The cooking class itself was so much fun! Rakesh and his whole family was so sweet and welcoming and made jokes the whole time and volunteered to take our pictures. It's a real family run business and totally worth it! We loved Rakesh so much, that we asked him to take us on a day tour the next day (which was also amaaaaazing: temple, waterfall, lumak coffee, spring temple, art gallery, rice terraces, monkey forest all in one day!)

Afternoon cooking class . Attended with my wife as a group of eight. Rakesh gives a good introduction to life and culture in Bali. Everyone participates in the preparation. Plenty of vegetarian dishes which were prepared separately. Food was cooked by us under instruction from the family after which we all sat down together to enjoy the meal. Good experience!

Best cooking school!. I did a morning cooking class and it was an amazing experience. I've done cooking classes in other southeast Asian countries and this was the best one by far. It's a family run business and they bring you into their family compound. They take you to the local market to get the ingredients then they welcome you into their home with refreshing drinks. We started by walking around their home and their personal temple- they all made us feel at home right away. The cooking class was hands on and we learned a lot. They teach in a very fun and interactive way. We made 6 or 7 dishes using traditional tools and everything tasted amazing. It's perfect for kids, backpackers, families, anyone. Highly recommend this school! You won't be disappointed!

A highlight of our holiday - A must do in Ubud. My sister and I had a really enjoyable afternoon. We visited a coffee plantation before heading back to their house where we learnt about Balinese culture and traditions, made offerings, prepared and cooked the food as well as tasted it. The afternoon session was great as we were in a group of only 5 people (the smaller the group, the better). This was great value for money as we got to make 8 different recipes and try everything. The food was fresh and the family were so friendly and welcoming. They share a great passion for what they do and were always so helpful and enthusiastic. We definitely recommend this experience for anyone, of any cooking ability as we had a great time and would do it again.

Great cooking class. Today we did the cooking class at Jambangan. His funny cousin picked us up at the hotel and we had a nice visit at the market. Then we had a lovely drive passing rice fields and, of course, temples. We learned to make the offerings but they didn't turn out as nice as the Balinese make them ;) we made 6 nice dishes adapted on allergies etc. We got to do the whole process, from cutting to cooking and the best part... eating. We'd hardly recommend this cooking school. It's a family business and they make you feel like at home. Great day, lovely food and really nice people. Go for it :)

Great cooking class!. Such a fun cooking class with such a great family! The process of making the food was so much fun and you get to taste the food as you go. We made some incredible Indonesian dishes and had the yummiest dessert! I would recommend this to anyone in Bali who is looking for a cooking class to do!

A wonderful afternoon! . This cooking class offers exceptional value for money. We booked the afternoon class which began with a trip to a coffee plantation. This was so interesting as we were taken around by a guide who explained the process of coffee making and even provided us with a sample of around 24 different flavours of coffee and tea for free. We got to try lots of new and exciting flavours and as a tea lover I really enjoyed sampling new and traditional flavours. After this we went to a traditional Balinese house to begin the cooking class. Throughout the class the hosts were so so welcoming and very very kind. We learnt a lot about traditional cuisine and about traditional familylife in Bali. There was only three of us on the afternoon course and we made around nine dishes and the amount of food was very generous. All transport was included and we were given bottled water throughout.Having been to cooking classes before I must say this is one of the best I have been to! The staff could not have been more helpful and welcoming. If you want to visit the market make sure you book the morning class. The morning class does however tend to be busier so if you would prefer a smaller group go for the afternoon slot!Highly recommend!!!

Cooking class Bali style. Great people...very informative, hands on, worth more money. 👍👍👍👍👍
"Dragon fly" car driver and cooking assistant is very funny.

Balinese cooking class. This was a fantastic morning with a visit to the market first to see/source all our ingredients and then back to our hosts traditional Balinese house to prepare food, from the paste up, 6 different and delicious dishes. Could not recommend it more. Thanks for a great experience.

Brilliant day out. Fantastic value for money, we were picked up from our villa and taken to a traditional market to learn about the different foods. We were then taken into a lovely family home and taught a little about Balinese traditions and offerings. We made some fantastic meals and got to try lots of food! We got given a recipe book and plan to hold a Balinese dinner party for our friends in Scotland! All in all, a wonderful day with a lovely family, who really made us feel welcome!

A wonderful experience!. We are an older couple (in our 60's) and we were with a young couple (20's). We spent half a day in the cooking class, and it was very entertaining and a lot of fun, not to mention useful! The instructor was very friendly, knowledgeable and spoke very good English. An excellent adventure!

Fantastic day! . We were picked up from our hotel by a lovely gentleman who took us to a coffee store in the jungle which was amazing! We then met the rest of the group at the local market, where we were given a fab tour. When we arrived at the family home to do the class we were kindly welcomed, given drinks and everyone's needs were catered for. The family were delightful and made the day amazing! The food was all delicious and I couldn't complain about one thing! Would recommend this class to everyone visiting the Ubud area!

One of the best experiences ever!!!!. You start by visiting a local market. We got there late at 9 am (market opens at 3 am) lol We were shown all the different ingredients used in Balinese cooking. We were then taken to a private home compound and the family welcomed us with a fresh coconut to drink from! We were introduced to the family as well as each other and told a bit about the traditional Balinese family compound which was fascinating!! We then donned our aprons and got to cooking! It's very hands on and fun! We even learned to make coconut oil from scratch! The food turned out wonderful and we sat down to eat with the new friends we had made during the class! I even had dinner with one of my classmates later in the eve! We were given printed recipes of all the dishes we made, which were many! I would highly recommend this cooking class! They only take about 8 people at a time so it is very personal!
Great cooking!. Very nice people, real Balinese life and home, delicious food with cooking lessons! Really worth to join the session. It's good to try them Warung earlier - excellent as well.

Great cooking class. We attended the afternoon cooking class. It was fantastic. It took place in the family home and everyone was so friendly and kind, we really felt like part of the family. We were the only 2 there so was basically a private class. The dishes we were taught to make were delicious and we were really involved, every step was explained well enough for us to follow. Everything was delicious and we were given cold water bottles and coconut juice to cool down. We were even given printed recipes of everything we made which was very thoughtful. I can't recommend this class enough; if you want to do a cooking class in Bali, look no further!

delicious food and great atmosphere!. First of all, I wouldn't know how they could make their cooking class even better. I got picked up from my accommodation in the morning and we drove to a small market where our nice, funny driver explained a lot about local fruits/vegetables/food in general. When we've arrived at their home for the cooking class, we were welcomed really lovely and got a fresh coconut drink. I felt really comfortable during the entire cooking class. We were only 3 students. So it almost felt like one big family cooking together. It was greay fun and I learned a lot. The recipe book is also a great idea.

First ever cooking class, and I loved it!. It was my first ever cooking class and it was amazing. Starting from the trip to the local market and explanation about the ingredients, interesting stories about Balinese traditions and culture up to making delicious food in a great company of other travelers. Definitely would recommend to anyone who want to understand and get to know the real Bali. Well done to the whole team for this greatly spent morning !

Great experience from beginning to end!. Be sure to add this class to your Ubud itinerary! This was such a fabulous experience and most definitely a highlight of our Bali trip. The entire afternoon from beginning to end was great. We didn't do the market tour but had the most amazing time being taught about the Balinese culture and lifestyle and learning how to prepare and cook the traditional Indonesian cuisine. The whole family was lovely and made us feel very welcome. We had looked at other classes but this one came recommended and we were not disappointed. They truly involve you with the entire cooking experience, not just watching and chopping up food. All the food was AMAZING and I can't wait to try the recipes back home.

Amazing Experience. Trip to the traditional market, smelled and tasted local produce, experienced local culture and religion. Then to the coffee plantation and tried some teas and coffees, then bought some and I don't even like tea! So good. Then went to the cooking class learnt about the family home and traditions, the cooking class is at the family home and they make you feel at home. Then we learnt to cook, such an amazing experience. The food was so good. Definitely going to try cooking at home. They also give you athe recipes to take home. Definitely recommend loved every minute of it.

Amazing food, people and place! . We were picked up by the excellent driver / chef / jogger / linguist called Rakesh but otherwise known as the dragonfly! We were welcomed into their home and made to feel so welcome. We were especially lucky to be the only two in the afternoon class so we had full control over the cooking and could ask questions along the way. You cook and then eat your starter, main(s) and dessert and I couldn't recommend this place enough. If you're in Ubud then make it part of one of your days! Thanks again for the recipes and hospitality! David & Sophie

Very tasty!. We did a morning workshop, picked up at our hotel and headed to the small local markt in Ubud for some ingredients, not an extensive visit as the market is quite small but good to walk around. Our group (6) were the only foreigners at this time. From the market we went to the coffee plantation ( I guess this is a standard thing in all the tours or workshops you do in Ubud, it's nice to see it once, but at the end is more like a sales thing) Back to the workshop: We arrived at Rakesh's house, and were greeted by his sister Made, who's in charge of the workshop. After getting some refreshments and a "lecture" on the family tradition and house planning, we were taught how to weave the baskets used for the daily offers in front of the door. Loads of laughing as most of us did struggle trying to make a presentable one. The workshop was great, the way that was run was really good, everyone got the chance to do something, even my kids (13 & 16) were working hard to deliver a nice Balinese meal. The food was just great! I'll give the highest rate to Jambangan and want to thank Rakesh, Made and the whole family for allowing us to be part of them for a couple of hours.Do not look any further, just call them and book the workshop, I'm sure you would love it!

Really amazing experience. I did an afternoon class with a friend because we were limited on time, but it was absolutely amazing! We were picked up by a driver who was nicknamed "Dragonfly" and taken to the cooking class, which took place at a family home. It was a really great experience and a different way to be exposed to the culture.

Great experience, lovely family business. Had a great cooking class here, the family were welcoming and great fun. Everyone participated which was good to be all working in a team together and step by step guides which gives you the confidence to cook these delicious dishes at home!

Very yummie . We were picked up by their driver and went first to the market. After that the cooking class took place in a private home of the family organizing the whole thing. Before we started we all made our own ofeering from palm leave and flowers. Very attentive and friendly people. We cooked 1 soup and 5 different main dishes plus desert everything was delicious.

Go for a morning class rather than afternoon. I did an afternoon cooking class here as i didnt have any free mornings while in Ubud. I think a morning class would have been better as it includes a trip to a local market to buy ingredients. In my afternoon class, I was the only participant which i think took away from my experience a little bit. It would have been better with other people there. The staff were very very nice and i learned a lot about Indonesian ingredients and got to eat all the delicious dishes i cooked which was the best bit!! :)

Fantastic cooking class and nice family. . This cooking class was recommended by a booking agent in Ubud. We really loved the whole experience of shopping at a local food market and seeing the local produce. We then went to their home where we had a wonderful experience learning how to cook Balinese. Be prepared to eat lots of food that you make yourself! We highly recommend it!

Must do Balinese experience . Booked at 5pm the day before and so glad we did! Our host Rakesh was knowledgeable, friendly and inviting. He picked us up from our villa on time, guided us through a Balinese food market, stopped off at a luwak coffee plantation (known for the 'cat-poo-chino' a must try for a coffaholic like me!) then brought us to his beautiful home for a quick lesson about Balinese culture where we got to make one of the Balinese offerings that you see everywhere! All before the actual cooking class were we learnt to make a delicious Balinese 9 course cooking course - even teaching us how to make nasi goreng on our request - which was simply taught and easy enough to recreate at home with the recipes they provided.He was then kind enough to take us on an VERY reasonably priced tour the following day to a few sites of his and our choosing (temples, rice paddies, art market, funky bars and restaurants) whilst taking care of us (4 young women) and our bags.Two of my favourite days in Bali thanks to Jambangan Cooking course! Highly recommended and thank you again Rakesh for your hospitality.

Nice place for enjoy cooking class. So lovely poeple, nice home and good baliness food :-)
혼자 듣는거라 많이 걱정을 많이 했는데 다행히도 분위기를 재미있게 이끌어 주시고, 발리요리 체험도 신선했다 아쉽게도 나시고랭은 없지만 다른 요리를 맛볼 수 있어서 좋았다!!!

Unforgettably sweet and fun cooking class . Absolutely amazing Balinese cooking class to recommend!! We had the most fun time preparing yellow basic souce and peanut souce in traditional style :)
Also learned a lot about Balinese family traditions, house planning and much more. Thank you for opening your house for this unforgettably sweet event!

Cooking class. This is a must if you want to experience Balinese life and culture and learn to cook the food that Indonesians eat.Everything about this visit was well planned, executed and the final part was not only in the cooking but the eating.I won't spoil this experience by giving a complete run down...Simply put, wonderful home, great cooking, brilliant company and a never forgotten experience.EnjoyJohn & Tania, Brisbane

Family run, great experience. This is a family run cooking school so they really do take care of their own facilities and offerings. They provide pick up service free of charge and do not stuff it with people so it is very private. They prepare you MORE than enough food. The ladies do a diligent job to explain the food and cooking preparations. I've only done three different cooking classes in my life and this is highly recommended. The price point is cheaper than hotel based yet the service is excellent. The facilities are clean and very smoothly operated. We chose this over some of the other higher ranked ones because we wanted a more private class with dialogue, and preparation of food throughout the entire process, not just one part of the cooking process while other groups take care of the other parts. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Local Balinese cooking. A nice local cooking school. Reasonable priced with very friendly staff. Cooking class of up to 15-20 people. It was only two of us so we had full service and Attention from staff.

Excellent experience. We were four friends attending a cooking class with two others, a small class of 6 persons.We were participating in a very well organised program. We had hands on and learned a lot about many dishes. Made, the teacher, she made everything easy and funny.The lesson was well prepared and the managing of time and subjects showed a great knowledge and experience.I would gladly come back with more friends.

Cook the Bali way!. Excellent half day spent with this beautiful and kind family. We discovered the local market with local food we tasted. Then off to their beautiful home with the kindest people who taught us how to cook traditional Balinese meals. We had so much to eat in the end! Definitely something to do to experience the authentic Bali. Thank you again to this fantastic family for a great time and beautiful memories.Cal & Lili

Cooking fun ❤️🇩🇪. This was a lovely experience with a lot of food and fun. This family was so kind and helpful and very very very funny. It was a very nice day with delicious food. Thanks for all of them. I guess I'll come back.

Fabulous Cooking Class. I would highly recommend for anyone wishing to do a Balinese Cooking Class to do it with this lovely family. My friends and I had an amazing morning getting to know them and cooking up a storm. Amazing time had by all. Thanks

Was an amazing day. My husband and I did this class as we had never done one before. It was great. The people were so lovely and so helpful. We went to the markets to start off with and then to their home to cook. It was a small class which was great, everyone got a chance to cook. The food was amazing and they gave us the recipes to take home. Recommend!

Delectable experience!. My wife and I really enjoyed this class. The host family was very friendly, the food was incredible, and learning how to prepare each dish was very fun. We definitely recommend this class to everyone, no prior cooking experience necessary.

Such great fun. These are some of the friendliest, nicest people that I have ever met. I thought I was just killing time by booking this class but it ended up being an absolute great experience. If you are in Ubud, I recommend this with all my heart.

an extraordinary balinese cooking class. we ve enjoyed every minute with Jambangan Cooking class an excellent value for the price and plenty of Balinese dishes..friendly ppl included...we ve learned a lot

Small, intimate, & entertaining day out. Just like all the other reviews we could not fault our experience here. A small group (max 8ppl) meant that everyone gets to try different methods and learn about the ingredients first hand. Loved the additional background information on family compounds, the markets, seasonal produce, & traditions. Madi and her brother even whipped up a surprise birthday cake for one of the guests to serve after lunch. A wonderful time from the beginning to the end. Value for money and highly recommended.

Brilliant Cooking Class. Fantastic day of cooking authentic Balinese food. The hosts were awesome - friendly, knowledgeable and hospitable. The food was delicious and there was a fantastic balance between cooking and sampling. We learned a lot and thoroughly enjoyed the experience and the facility. We started with a visit to the markets to learn about the produce and how items are purchased - we even got to sample some products. Then it was off to the "cooking areas". Everything was explained as we went along and everyone was involved. Would highly recommend this to everyone.

A wonderful experience. Wow, what great cooking! There was a good variety of different foods to cook and they give you the recipes which is great. The people who run it were very friendly and accommodating. This is not the normal sort of thing I would do but I highly recommend it to everyone!
Suksma Jambamgan cooking school!!!!. Authentic Balinese cooking class. What an amazing experience it was!!!!! And by far the best food I've had in Bali! I cannot recommend it enough :) :) :)

Legitimate Balinese Cooking Experience. We have done cooking classes in Bali before but this one is by far the best. The family that runs the class were so lovely and hospitable inviting you in to be a part of their family for the day and encouraging you to feel at home. It was a lot of fun and there were a lot of laughs and the meals at the end were amazing. We can't wait to try out our new recipes with our friends and family

Delicious food and recipes. I attended this cooking class with friends in December. The cost was 350,000 IDR per person. The class includes the following:Pickup from your lodgingVisit to market to see ingredientsCooking lessons in a traditional Balinese family compoundEating the meal the cooking class preparedPrint outs of each recipeTransport back to your lodging While a visit to the market shows you the ingredients you’ll be cooking with, if you are familiar with ginger, turmeric and galangal, there really isn’t much more to learn. I’d be happy if this section of the class was cut out to shorten the day. We had a tour of the family compound which included information on the Balinese culture and offering customs. This was interesting and very informative. The class itself was very informative. I would have liked to make each meal myself. Instead we were put into groups to make different items. It would have taken forever to make all the meals by myself so I understand why we had to divide the labour in groups. Having recipes to take home made up for not making each menu item myself. Some of the meals we made were:· Snake bean and coconut salad· Chicken Satay sticks with peanut sauce· Vegetable soup· Chicken Curry· Yellow curry base· Gado-Gado· Fried tempeh· A banana desertThe instructors were friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. The facilities were nice and clean and there was ample space. The group was about 15 people. It was a long day. We were picked up at 9am and arrived back at 3pm. I feel like these lessons were good value for money.

Once in a lifetime experience . We went with a group of 5 friends of all different cooking levels. We started off the day at the local market which really contributed to our understanding of the ingredients and food culture of Bali. We had an incredible time with Made and her family in their beautiful traditional Balinese home. The day was relaxing, informative and above all delicious! We learned all about Balinese ingredients and types of cooking. Everyone contributed toward the meal and in the end we were amazed at what we had made and how tasty it all was. It was a real cultural experience which we will remember for years to come. I would highly recommend Jambangan Cooking School. Thank you for such a wonderful day!

Wonderful experience. Myaelf and two friends took part on the fantastic half day cookery class back in October.
A truly wonderful, fun, relaxed and informative class! Wonderful setting and delicious dishes with some great tips to take back home!
One of the best things we did on our amazing 2 week trip to Bali.
THANKYOU!

Delicious! . We were picked up from our guesthouse by Jambangan Cookery School and taken to the local food market where we had all the ingredients explained to us in detail, time to explore the stalls and have photos taken. On hearing that we hadn't yet visited a coffee plantation he took us to Las Harum coffee plantation where we had a guided tour, an incredible tasting of 18 different teas and coffees and the opportunity to buy from the shop. There was no additional charge and no pressure to buy. We were then welcomed at the family run Jambangan Cookery School with fresh coconuts before learning how to cook a delicious 3 course feast - the family were friendly, chatty, informative and the whole experience was well worth the 350,000 we paid (£18). I wouldn't hesitate to give a big recommendation.

Delicious and enlightening. Rakesh, Thank you and your family for the wonderful experience of joining you for the day at your beautiful home, for the insights into traditional Balinese home construction, for the trip to the market and the pickup/dropoff at our hotels, for the fresh young coconut greeting upon our arrival, for all your beautiful smiles, for the delicious and visually delightful dishes that we prepared, and for the recipes so we can make these dishes upon our return home. I had a great experience, learned a lot, and enjoyed the feast that we prepared!

Best way to spend half a day :). Rakesh and his sister are amazing hosts. They explained the layout of their beautiful Balinese house and welcomed us in. We made 8 different dishes that we're all incredible. Three courses that are all very different but all delicious.Warm, kind hearted people. We'll definitely be back Thank you all for a wonderful experience xx

Excellent delicious cooking experience!. My husband and I had a great time and helped make a very tasty feast! It was just the two of us, but we made 6-7 dishes. The family was very friendly and welcoming, and were very organized and helpful. And I got the recipes to try them at home! Highly recommended

Good food and good people!. It was a very nice expirience, we loved the market. They introduce you to their family and make us feel like home. We are far from being good cookers at home but we were interested in knowing how they make so good dishes! And with these two balinese cookin teachers it was easy and pleasent. After all the cooking we enjoyed the delicious meal so much! It was fun, we recomend it so much!

A HIGHLIGHT not to be missed in Ubud. From start to finish, we had a thoroughly enjoyable time with the family who offer the Jambangan Bali Cooking Class. They provided a personalized tour of the local food market and explained the various vegetables, fruits, and spices that we would be using in our cooking class. And after a short drive from the market, we arrived at their beautiful home. They took the time to explain how traditional Balinese homes are organized, from the location of each building to the purpose that each is used for.In terms of the cooking class, it was wonderful. Two master chefs took great care to explain what each dish was and were very patient with us as we helped prepare and cook each dish. There was ample food, and each plate was delicious. Thankfully, the provided us with the recipe for each course so we can try to re-create them when we return home.Overall, it was a 5-Star experience! Highly recommended.

Fun time with delicious food!. We started off at the market with a personal tour and then got a welcome drink of fresh young coconut. We got to see the ingredients every dish and participate in making each course. I loved that we were never rushed and had lots of time to savor each bite. Would 100% recommend to my friends.

Fantastic cooking experience. We had a wonderful time doing this cooking class. The location was awesome, real balinese home. Everybody was so nice, happy and willing to teach us. In the morning we drove to the local market where we got explanation about the spices ingredients. After that we went to the cooking location. Before starting with the cooking we got some information about the architecture and structure of the houses, temple and the culture, while enjoying a fresh coconut. The cooking itself was also awesome. We did many meals, tried everything and helped each other doing it. They took a lot of time for us, explaning, showing and making pictures. :) The food was fantastic! Best food I had in Bali so far! 5 stars for 5 star class! :) Thank you!

Good experience to kick off our Bali trip. Signed up for an afternoon class on the day of our arrival to Bali itself. Driver picked us at our hotel on time and it was a pleasant ride to the place of the class itself. We were lucky to have a relatively small group of 4, and we were struck immediately with the immense hospitality from our hosts. They gave us a quick tour of their house (yes, the cooking class is based in a traditional Balinese house which they stay in) before we started cooking. The lessons are suitable for people without much cooking experience like us and we were given a choice to customise the menu based on the group's dietary requirements. The lessons were very hands on and we were involved in every process. Food turned out to be tasty which is an added bonus.

Authentic food and cultural experience. A highlight of out trip to Ubud. Unlike other cooking classes where you watch the chef demonstrate their skills in commercial kitchens, our group of 13 toured a local market and Luwak coffee plantation before being welcomed to the family's compound to prepare our Indonesian feast. It was a fun morning as we learned about Indonesian everyday family life and some of their family history. We were taught how to weave banana leaves into mats and we were guided to prepare much of the meal ourselves. We even learned how to carve decorations from vegetables. We were picked up and dropped back to our Ubud hotel, mid afternoon, happy and full, with recipes to try when we got home. A very hospitable and warm cultural experience.
Nice! . Nice and friendly staff en great food! We were picked up on time, went to a market, made a quick stop at a coffee farm and were put to work. Lovely food!

The best experience - guaranteed. There is absolutely no shortage of cooking classes in Ubud, and on a conceptual level there is only so much you can do differently. But what struck me with Jambangan Bali Cooking Class was its level of professionality. You feel in very safe hands; the staff is attentive, highly qualified and makes sure you have a fun and good experience.And you can be ensured that the food you end up with matches anything you'll have while in Bali.Highly recommended.

More than a Cooking Class. The school really does tailor your food or eating needs to suit the individual. I don't eat seafood and I wanted to try the Banana Curry so they very willingly indulged me (and everyone else in the group because we all enjoyed it).The tour takes you to a local market and then through beautiful rice fields and villages. It saves time on going on different tours. My husband has never been to a cooking school and this one appealed purely because of the journey there. However he loved it! Especially the feast at the end! Well worth it!

Really fun experience . We called the day before to book our cooking class, and it was no problem arranging it. We booked an afternoon class and we were the only two persons there, which was good cause all the focus were on us! It was really interesting to visit a Balinese home. The family we visited was so nice and welcoming. We cooked many courses and all of them were very good. The only thing that could be improved is that the different stages of the cooking could be explained a little bit more. It was quite hard to understand all the different cooking-stages. Overall a very good experience which we highly recommend!

Organised fun cooking class.. This is a family run cooking school. It is well set out, clean and organised. The three course buffet we cooked was delicious. The owners made it fun and we also learnt to make a thatched palm mat. We received copies of the recipes to take home. The only downside was the visit to the market beforehand. The rotting fruit and fly blown fish had most of us worried about the food quality at the school but it was excellent and the owners were very careful with food safety. Well worth a visit.

An intimate and amazing cooking experience. Rakesh picked my partner and us and along with another couple to attend the traditional bali market in the morning, then later took us to his home where it was a small group (6 of us) to start the cooking session- we were all given jobs to do; the girls do the chopping and the boys were busy with the mortar and pestle; grinding all the spices to make the yellow sauce. We made at least 5-6 different dishes, starting off with soup, chicken satays, steamed fish, gado gado and many more dishes- she also gave us the recipes to take home and showed us how coconut oil was made. I had so much fun and was so full from eating all the food we cooked- i particularly enjoyed this as this was a small group and you get much more out of it!! Highly recommend the cooking class

Serene beautiful casual dining.. A small restaurant seating eight out the back and a further dozen or so out the front. The dining area is set in a beautiful and simple garden and the restaurant is located just north of Ubud near the rice paddies. We had a delightful meal - Gado Gado with a 'to die for' peanut sauce. Quite impressed by the food. Perfect for a casual time with good friends. Not high class dining, more in keeping with the local culture but still a strong candidate for the romantic dinner for two. If we'd discovered the place earlier we would've become regulars.

An experience not to be missed!. Me and one other friend were staying around the corner, we went there one night to have dinner Warung JB (amazing food). It was there we found out they do cooking classes and straight away booked for the next day! They have 2 classes a day, make sure you book the morning, as you get to go to the local food market. An experience if you've not been to one yet. You then arrive at there home! Yes home!!! They talk you through some traditions, something we have not experienced, so was great! Then you crack on with weaving. Then the exciting bit cooking. There were 8 of us in the class. And we all had lots of fun and the instructions were clear and even better, the food we cooked were delicious. This is definitely an experience not to miss out on!!!

Tasty Balinese food and a great afternoon. When you are tired of temples, markets and swimming this was an enjoyable way to spend an afternoon. We had a small group of fun people and learnt about Balinese food, spices and cooking. The family was friendly and helpful, the food fresh and delicious and the best part was we got to enjoy our creations at the end. The family also runs JB Warung next door where we had lunch twice, enjoying their cooking this time. I could highly recommend both.

A fun afternoon. We opted for the afternoon class and there were 6 people in our group. The family were very welcoming and made us laugh a lot. My vegan needs were easily accommodated and the food was delicious - you get to sample about 8 different dishes! I would definitely recommend.

Really must do! . We went with my husband, met some really great people and enjoyed the whole day. The family was really nice and welcoming, they taught us a lot. The atmosphere in their home was absolutely great. We recommend you to attend this cooking class very much!

Great time. We had a really good time at Jambangan cooking class. People are really lovely and the food we cooked was amazing. We went as a couple and strongly recommend it even if you don't have much interest in cooking its a great thing to do, very fun and you'll meet lots of nice people.

Excellent Cooking Class. I thoroughly enjoyed this day, from being picked up at my hotel, the great company of the other people in the class, the trip to the market, the reception given us by the Balinese family who own this small business. We were shown their family home and way of living. The class was very well organised and flowed well, everybody having jobs to do, and the food was amazing. Recipes as well. Then being dropped back to my hotel after a nice drive through the countryside through small villages. I highly recommend this Cooking class.
Great experience. Great place, really nice people, opportunity to be part of a process of really tasty meal making. Worth the price.

Recommended. My wife and I really enjoyed this cooking class. Small group with individual attention. Very tasty dishes prepared and eaten by yours truly: and I'm an awful cook :) great way to spend a morning!

Great last minute find. This was a great experience and I highly recommend it! I called up last minute (in the morning) to book the afternoon class. Mr Jambangan was very accommodating. The class was only 350,000 rupiah which is great value. My partner and I were only in Ubud for a day so he picked us up from the Starbucks. This is a family fun business so the class was run by his sister. She made the whole experience extremely enjoyable. She was jovial and walked us through all the techniques of the food prep. I would recommend coming with an empty stomach as there are quite a few dishes that are prepared and you eat them all. All in all 10/10.

Great class and half day. The class was really great, starting with an informative market tour a visit to a coffee plantation with opportunity to try different teas/coffees and then a warm welcome into their home. We made many dishes and they catered for us being vegetarian really well. We made a vegetable soup, tofu and Tempe kebabs, a tofu and Tempe curry with banana, Tempe in a sweet soy sauce, gado gado, a Balinese salad and a coconut milk and banana desert. It was all delicious. Really good value for money! A great morning (9-2), recommend.
Superbbb balinese cooking class . Super good teaching in a very traditional balinese house....natural and fresh ingredients... super delicious food....highly recommend!

Excellent food. We had a great morning at the cooking class. The class is in the family home so a great experience and opportunity to learn more about Balinese culture. We went to the morning markets however would have like to have seen them purchase the food there not just see the market. There was also a stop at the luwak coffee plantation which we would have preferred not to have done. However the food was amazing and it was really worth doing. Great value.

Delicious!. Well worth your time and money, so much food and it was delicious. I had the vegetarian menu and although the ingredients were mainly the same (tofu and tempeh) the tastes for each dish were different. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable, the class sizes small and intimate.

How many Balinese Restaurants are in Your Home Town?. This was a great way to spend a morning. The recipes are simple and delicious and makes the taste of Bali a reality in my home. Staff is very friendly and accommodating.

A real food highlight in Ubud!. After going to the market and learning a lot about the ingredients, we made a menu with many dishes. The cooking is done in the family house, and a lot of information is given on how a house of a Hindu family is made. The cooking class is given in a very professional way and the taste was fantastic!

Best cooking class in Ubud. In Jambangan Bali Cooking you can studied maked Balinese food and Indonesia food.they will teach you cook in Balinese compoun house.the family very wellcome and the chep realy frendly.when you are in ubud you must be tray to studied cook here.

Absolutly amazing. When you will be in Ubud, defenitevely have to come. For gourmet persons MUST see it for the great taste of Balianese cousine. We spare fantasticic day out and honestly have to say that it was one of our best days of our honeymoon.Well organized and i can recommend morning courses with market visit. Perfect.

Very well organised and delicious food!. I did the cooking class a couple of days ago and have to say how impressed I was how smooth everything went. From the pick up to the activities (as there is more than just cooking to be done) to the actual food. I really enjoyed myself, the only reason why give I 4 and not 5 points is because I would have enjoyed it even more if everyone would have prepared their own dish from start to finish (rather than have the group split to work on different parts of the process).I did a detailed write up of the entire day, which can be found here: https://nowornever2015.wordpress.com/2015/08/02/acquiring-balinese-cooking-skills/#more-1506

An amazing experience. This cooking class was a fantastic day out. There was so much attention to detail. We made some fantastic food and I honestly think it was the best food I've eaten on my trip to Bali!

Don't miss out. Cooking class very well organised and good variety of dishes (8) cooked and eaten as a group, meanwhile a lovely insight into a typically beautiful Balinese house.The food we cooked tasted better than any of the equivalent dishes we ate at restaurants in Ubud town. Most other classes advertised picking participants up early in the morning to go to the local market in full flow, drop back at their hotel for breakfast and then pick up again late morning for the cooking class. Jambangan instead collect in time to see the market still in operation so that you can experience the full cycle but not so early that it is so busy that you feel slightly in the way or interrupting the locals actually running their business and then straight back to their home for the class. The whole family involved in helping were great. I would even go again if I am lucky enough to go back to Ubud. (Also, see Warung JB which had just opened when we were there)

Fabulous class and unique window into Balinese Culture. We happened upon this class by chance as they would accommodated a vegetarian during their regular classes, absolutely no regrets, it was fantastic! We were picked up early the next morning, joined by three friendly Australian women (so a small group of only five) and off we drove to a nearby village where we started with a tour of an authentic local market. We tasted fresh fruit, ambled along the colorful stalls, sampled some fresh mini pancakes and picked up some last ingredients for our class. We were then taken back to a nearby village, entering a family compound. It was a great way to see traditional lifestyle, our class was indeed a family affair with different members assisting in various ways. They were extremely friendly, pedagogic and ensured we all got our hands dirty, chopping, stirring or grinding. The resulting feast of our labors was divine. Not only did we have this unique window into Balinese life and cuisine, we also learnt more than we would during some of the other classes in town that are more of a demonstration.

lovely house, great fun, nice food (!) and a ceremony extra. What a nice experience! I was picked up on time, or actually a bit early. Brought to a lovely village (from Ubud). Met a very nice family, got things explained about their house, and had a nice cooking course. Of course you don't do all the work yourself. It is being divived among the group members. I was traveling solo and that was fine too. The food tasted amazing, maybe because you help prepare it. And gthe best thing is: you don't do the dishes! We had a little event extra. The prince of the village had died and the ceremony started in fornt of the house where the cooking course was. Impressive! I might not add this to the review because it is rate, but then again it happened so why not.

Best cooking class in Bali!. Had a fantastic experience with Jambangan cooking class, got picked up from our villa by our very friendly driver and started with a market tour, and then a tour of the home belonging to the Balinese family teaching us. Very friendly, delicious food and got a recipe book to take home. All very clean and well run. Great fun!!

I can cook baliniese now!. I highly recommend this cooking class. Maybe it is the best on bali. The most lovely family and very carful and clean with the preparation. The driver picks you up at the hotel and take you to a not touristy market to explain all the spices. Than he takes you to a real baliniese house to explain how their lifestyle is. Afterwords they show you all the ingredients if all the meals on different plates that you understand what you'll cook. It is an awesome experience to prepare everything by yourself and learn about their cultures. I like balinese food a lot but the own made one was better than all i had in the restaurants. Maybe because the food quality was better or why i knew how it was prepared! Of course eating was the best part. the end their provide you a recipe too cook everything for your family at home.

Great adventure and an activity that the whole family can enjoy together. Our class was small, just the 5 of us. The family compound was interesting with explanations for how Balinese family units work and visits around the gardens to the different buildings. Cooking facilities were very impressive. Branded aprons and bottled water show how professional these guys are. We cooked mushroom soup, Checken Satay, a chicken/vegetable curry (including making the paste), tempe/tofu dish, Gado-Gado (at last I know hoe to cook this), and another salad dish with green beans and sprouts. The food was awesome, my kids normally wouldn't eat Indonesian but because they had cooked it there was no stopping them!!. The desert (banana/coconut cream) dish was extremely popular..(and easy). These guys work hard and I wish them all the success they deserve. We enjoyed ourselves, and we learnt more that I would have ever expected about Balinese cooking. Success!!

What a personal, authentic and local exprience!. Wow! This was such an amazing experience, we got a true taste of the real Balinese culture and people. Incredible cooking class, but also so much more than just a cooking class too - learn about the Balinese home, family and traditions!We were picked up from our hotel a driven to the class. The class is located a little ways outside of Ubud center, and driving out of town you get to see the "real" Bali.... Rice fields, local homes, neighborhoods and the people that live there. It was very refreshing to get outside the touristy area and actually see Bali. Upon arriving at the class, we were welcomed into the family home. They always keep classes small, however that particular day, we happened to be the only ones in the afternoon class! They do offer morning classes, which include a trip to the local market, which are generally more popular. They gave a us a tour of their home and explained the intracacies of Balinese family life and culture. They were happy to share and answer all of our questions about family temples, their rice house, and the traditional Balinese houses.Finally, we got to the cooking! We made 9 traditional Balinese dishes! The entire familiy was there to help out (we were only two people, SSO this was helpful, but would also be helpful witha larger group to assist). They walked us through, step by step, for every dish. Everything was really quite simple, but turned out so delicious! It was very clean, organized and well-executed. We even got to see how to make coconut oil!This was one of the most authentic experiences we had in Bali, and HIGHLY recommend it! They were so kind, welcoming, and happy to share. I brought my camera and they took lots of action shots while we were busy cooking! You also get a recipe book to take home. Overall, one of the most memorable experiences in Bali! This class is a bargain for the price!

Awesome experience. The dishes we made taste amazing and yet seemed so easy. The cooking class atmosphere was great, so much fun and friendly, and what I also love about the class is that they taught us how to make the very pretty Balinese decorations, I made a really really cute crab that I adored haha.

A real pleasure - despite my apprehension ! . This was my wife's idea and I was a little hesitant, but the team at the school were great at drawing us both into the class and both making the session informative and amusing. With their careful guidance we created a great meal and now have a range of techniques and a set of recipes to practice. It's unusual in that it is delivered in a home environment not a restaurant but as a result all the richer an experience - if you want to do one class - this is the one !

Learnt alot and enjoyed alot!. Due to a morning program my girlfriend and I took part in the afternoon class. We were the only participants yesterday. It's a family business with a male cousin doing the pickup and the sister giving the training. Everyone was kind and patient. Rakesh firstly gave us a brief rundown of his family and some Balinese cultural info. Next, the sister took over with the cooking. We learnt to make mushroom soup, a curry , mains and dessert- a total of 7 dishes. We didn't feel under pressure or overworked following the simple recipes and we ate everything we cooked. Overall, it was a fabulous experience which we fully recommend. Try it!B. TaoTip: If U book the morning class U get taken to the local market to buy the ingredients for the class

Cooking school. Fabulous authentic Balinese Cooking . Picked up & taken to market, coffee producers, & then onto the family home. Beautiful family & cooking demonstration included us cooking as well. Many courses that we ate & enjoyed immensely. Taken home after a fun & enjoyable day. Would highly recommend doing this cooking school.

Wonderful Local Food Experience. This place has amazing food and wonderful hospitality. If you are looking for real local Balanese food, healthy and safe, you should most definitely come here. Luxury plating style with a real local experience. Very quiet and romantic. I would also recommend for families. This placed is owned and operated by a beautiful family. Also it has free wifi

Great experience!. Cool and funny hosts, great atmosphere, delicious food and hands on cooking. You don't only learn how to cook but are a guest in a really beautiful Balinese house. All in all, it was a fantastically spent few hours.

Amazing food. Really impressed with this cooking class. Learnt how to make several amazing dishes and recieved the recipes at the end for us to try at home. We thought it was great value for money and would definitely recommend it.

Perfect!. Really enjoyable experience!We were picked up from our accomodation, visited the local market where we tried some small balinese pancakes.At the cooking school we were welcomed with young coconuts. The class itself was amazing (we got lucky and were the only two participants), we learned a lot about indonesian cuisine, prepared and cooked 8 dishes. Best of all, we got to eat all of them afterwards - so yummy!100% recommend

Great experience . This cookingclass is truly a great experience. The people are super friendly, and the food is delicious. They have small classes (my friend and I where only the two of us) so you really learn a lot. We can highly recommend this class if you are in ubud.

Delicious Fun. What a fun and delicious experience! My 7 girlfriends and I were on holiday in Bali and had a 3 day stay in Ubud. We all decided to do this so we could learn more about Balinese cooking. They picked us up from the hotel and took us to a very local market where they pointed out ingredients we would be using that day. From there, we went to the house which was amazing. They showed us around the house and explained about the different rooms and their family temple. The cooking instruction was fun, interactive, and easy. Everyone was able to take turns doing different things - chopping, grinding, mixing, etc. We made a delicious spicy mushroom soup which I will definitely try and recreate at home. We then made 7 more dishes and a dessert. Everything was tasted great. My one friend is gluten free and they were very accommodating and made dishes specific for her. Great experience. Recommend it to everyone!

Great cooking class with lovely hosts. This class was fun and informative. The hosts are friendly and welcoming. Picked up and dropped off. I did the morning class which begins with a trip to the local market. Then back to the hosts home where the cooking begins.

A must do!. Though me and my friend were staying in Kuta, Rakesh picked us up for an additional fee of 400 000 Rp (~$40 CDN) for pick up and drop off. We went to a local market (it was unfrequented by tourists) before heading to his house in Ubud. We were welcomed by his family with open arms as well as with fresh coconuts! It was only a class of 4 people, so it was very hands on and personal. The food we made was absolutely delicious, and Rakesh's family was funny, warm, and knowledgeable. I highly recommend taking this class!

Excellent match for those who seek for cultural explore. Had a great time at Jambangan Bali Cooking Class with very hospitable hosts and convenient pick-up service in Ubud area. HIGHLY recommend for those who are looking for Balinese food, culture and genuine smile :)

Great experience!. The cooking class was a great experience! We were only 4 people so it was really personal. The family is very welcoming, warm and friendly. The best thing is that it is not only the cooking but also learning much about family life on Bali.

Amazing!!. Wasn't just a cooking class, took us on a tour of the local market and coffee plantation then took us into their family home. Showed us step by step how to make a beautiful balinese meal, was so delicious. Highly recommend this cooking course!!

Not possile to do it better. More than cooking class. We were two couples who decided two take this cooking class. There was only four of us in the class wich made the experience even more personal. The family was so welcoming and warm. This was much more than a cooking class with the visit to the market, brief stop at the rice field and the tour around the home. Thank you!

Great cooking experience!. Just 3 people in the class, witch did it really personal! Loved it! Picked me up in Ubud an then we went to the market to look at all the ingredients. And then of to cooking!

Highlight of my holiday in Ubud!. Unlike most cooking classes in Ubud that are conducted in a hotel/restaurant, Jambangan Cooking Class takes place in the comfort of Rakesh's beautiful home. We felt extremely welcome and it was such a joy learning how to prepare the delicious Balinese dishes.The amount you pay (IDR 350,000 per person) includes pick up, drop off, the food (yes you get to eat them after), a visit to a local market (no, not the touristy Ubud market), a trip to Luwak Coffee plantation (optional) and beverages (bottled mineral water and fresh coconuts). The entire experience takes about 4 hours.We were the only ones in the class and received undivided attention from our patient teachers. They were very friendly and the class was so fun! I can't believe I almost forgot to pay for my class and I felt terrible. They reminded me gently and even apologized for reminding me when it was clearly my fault. Mrs Rakesh is remarkably hospitable - she was all smiles, constantly checked if we were thirsty and gave us multiple bottles of mineral water to keep us hydrated.I suggest you skip breakfast before the class or just have a snack, as you will soon be cooking up a feast - which you will definitely not be able to finish.I tried to film whatever I can during the cooking class and made a short 33 seconds video, you can view it here: http://thekeepersmap.com/2015/04/20/ubud-jambangan-bali-cooking-class-review/I highly recommend this class to anyone who is currently in Ubud / visiting there soon!

FAVOURITE !!!. My three girlfriends and I took part in the afternoon cooking class at Jambangan. This was the best thing we did during our one week trip to Bali. The food we made (from scratch !!!) was absolutely DELICIOUS. We wished we had more time to do the course over and over again. This is a MUST DO in Ubud :-)

Felt like apart of their family. A must do in Bali!!! They picked my brother and I up in the morning and we went to the local market where we were introduced to all the ingredients we would use for our recipes...even did a little taste testing of some new things to us...(snake skin fruit and balaniese pancakes), both very good! We then were welcomed into their home with great explanations about their traditions and culture. They gave us coconuts to sip on while they finished prepping and then we jumped right into it, all very hands on! You cook your own dishes, which is what we loved! They are such nice people and love what they are doing, and to top it off, everything was soooo delicious! We wished we would have done this at the beginning of our trip to Indonesia and not the end (so we knew more about the different foods we were eating and their ingredients). Would definitely do this again!!!

An amazing cooking experience. We have just returned from a fantastic morning. My family including two children (aged 11 and 14), booked for this experience. We were collected on time and taken to the food market and rice fields, both really interesting, before going to Rakesh's home. There were 8 in the class.Rakesh's and his family made us feel so welcome, we were shown the house, got involved in all aspects of the food preparation and cooking, before sitting down to feast on everything we made. We all had a fantastic morning and would highly recommend it.

A must do in Bali. We had so much fun doing this class, we had a walk ariund the local markets lookjng at all tje food they source for the local dishes.The class takes place in their lovely home which they will tell you all about their traditions.The couple running the class were heaps of fun and made us laugh all the way through, they also took videos and photos for us. Soooo much food and so easy to get involved in making.Would recommend to anyone

Really great. Must do.. My wife Jenni and I just finished the class and it was amazing. We were picked up from our hotel and brought to the wonderful family home where the class takes place. We were welcomed in by the most friendly, welcoming people. We worked together and cooked amazing dish after amazing dish. We have been traveling for 3 weeks in SE Asia doing so many different things and this has been one of our favorite things all trip so far. I really cannot recommend this enough. If you are in Ubud for a few days, do this. If we could give it 6 stars, we would.

Best Cooking Class Ever!!. My cousin and I took this cooking class this morning, hoping to learn some inside hints on Balinese cooking. I'm not very into cooking, so I didn't think I would enjoy it as much as I did. Our amazing tour guide suggested this class. Was even cheaper ($25 USD) then at our hotel. Their entire family is extremely kind and welcoming. They took us to the market, and then back to their beautiful home. Had a great time and enjoyed the amazing good we learnt how to make. Definitily would recommend!! Worth every penny. Thank you Jambangan :)

Best day ever!. My boyfriend, myself and our two friends decided to take this cooking class after great reviews on here already, and they were so justified. We were collected from our hotel my Made, who then took us to his cousins home where we would learn all about their traditional Balinese home and traditions. Rakesh and his family made us feel so welcome, and had us laughing the entire time. Very well organised,with everyone helping to make all dishes, trying as we cooked. We then sat down to eat all our food and oh my it was good! Best meal we have had in Bali so far. This deserves to be the #1 cookery class is Ubud, maybe even Bali!

Mind blowing . Went today with four friends and had the most amazing experience. We were picked up from our hotel in Ubud and taken directly to the families house where we were made to feel completely at ease. Greeted with a glass of coconut water we were then shown around the family home and taught about Balinese family tradition. We then proceeded to make traditional Balinese food and were even accommodated if we disliked or had any allergies to food. We made 7 different dishes and the experience was very hands on. After eating we were dropped back to the hotel after having some great conversations. The hosts also took lots of pictures of us during our time at their house without being asked. Such a fantastic experience and I would definitely recommend it to anyone in the area as a must do.

Must Have Experience in Ubud. This particular cooking class/ experience is a must do activity while in Ubud. Unlike all the generic cooking classes offered in the city centre in regular restaurants and kitchens, this one is held at a families home on the outskirts of town. They will arrange pick up & drop off and it's only a 10 minute drive to the families home. The morning flew by and I had some of the best Indonesian food I've ever tasted hands down. They also give you a cookbook with all the recipes to take home which is a huge bonus. The Jambangan family are wonderful hosts and really offer a unique and memorable Unud experience. They really helped make our holiday special.ABPHong Kong

A must do!. we can only reconfirm all past postive comments from fellow participants: a true hands-on unforgetable joyfull tastefull experiencethanks again to the whole Jambangan family for their hospitality and soft but professional supportyou made our day and stay in Ubud

Wonderful memories. A great morning with lots of laughters. It was the funnest moments for time we spent in Bali. Rakesh and his family did all they could to make us enjoy these few hours in their beautiful Balinese home. Everything is perfectly arranged. We had great company, a nice and friendly couple for Belgium, so that the whole morning was full of laughters. The food and spice of course was incredible. I would recommend this to anyone who are looking for some touch of real Bali life.

Loved it!. Walking around Ubud, you'll see a lot of restaurants advertising cooking classes. I would recommend you skip those and learn in someone's kitchen like Jambangan. They pick you up at your hotel and drive you out to their house about 15 minutes away (with no traffic). It's a pretty nice house (might describe it as a compound) with a dedicated kitchen for the classes, and they'll explain to you the symbolism and meaning behind all the buildings and statues etc. The food was delicious - better than most any restaurant we went to - and they staff there definitely have the class down to a science so everything went very smoothly. I highly recommend!

Amazing day with wonderful people learning to cook delicious meals.. Rakesh and his family made our day! We learned about all ingredients at the market, did a coffee& tea tasting and finally cooked and ate at their house. I could do my vegetarian meals and at the same time watch others preparing meat dishes (great in case I cook for some non~vegetarians as well). Besides we learned a lot about the culture. Now I can follow the recipe book and start practicing. Thank you for everything!!

Highlight of my Bali trip!. I booked this cooking class after another one cancelled at the last minute. Now i'm so glad they did because this was a fantatic way to end my stay in Bali! I read all the reviews and was not disappointed.  The cooking lessons take place at the family home and they teach you about their traditions first. Everyone was so lovely and made you feel like you were part of the family. A very hands on experience and delicious food! My favourite dish was the tuna wrapped in banana leaf and i don't even like tuna! I love that they give you the recipes at the end so i can recreate it home.You will not regret booking this trip. You learn so much, meet an amazing family and eat so much! Money well spent. :)

Fantastic experience. This cooking class was a wonderful surprise and lovely way to spend half a day. We were picked up from our hotel and taken to a private home where we were learnt about the Balinese home, beliefs and culture. This class definitely offers a value for money experience as we had more food than we could handle and used some balinese cooking techniques.The cooking class is extremely well organised as we were active at all times and were doing interesting things (making crabs out of cucumber) while picking up some good knowledge about their traditional flavouring. A nice touch is the recipes they give you to take home and make your own. Everyone was extremely friendly and are more than willing to take some nice action shots.

A complete package. A wonderful few hours - picked up at hotel, taken to markets where we learned about spices and the fresh fruit and vegetables we were to cook with. Out to rice paddies to learn more about this very important industry. Then into private home to learn about family culture, coconut oil processing and be put to work cooking a wonderful, tasty three course lunch. Lots of laughs and chatting between the hosts and the guests. Wonderful adventure.

Give it a go!. The Jambangan Bali Cooking Class is a must for any foodie. We were picked up from our Ubud accommodation and taken first for a tour of the local market and then onto their own home for a great experience. We have done cooking classes in other countries and found this one particularly good as it is more hands on than just watching someone prepare the dish and then leave you to copy it.The class started off with weaving using the local palm fronds which was a great laugh and certainly made us all feel more comfortable with each other. The class is informative and fun with a lot of laughter and way too much food for us to eat. We tried dishes we probably would not have otherwise and learnt some great tips.We were safely returned to our villa early in the afternoon armed with a recipe booklet to try at home.

Fantastic Day!. If you want to learn how to cook real Indonesian food then there is no better place than Jambangan's Cooking Class!My two friends and I visited whilst staying in Ubud. We were picked up for free and driven to a local market where we were shown and told about the local ingredients that we would be using in our dishes later that day. We asked about tea tasting and so on route back to the host's home we were taken to a coffee and tea plantation where we learnt about how the luwak coffee was produced and tasted 14 different flavours of tea/coffee - all included in the price!When we arrived at the host's beautiful home, we were warmly welcomed and made to feel at home straight away. The day consisted of preparing and cooking a range of delicious starters, mains and a dessert. The chefs were helpful, kind and good humoured throughout. The food tasted incredible and we were also supplied with plenty of water throughout the day. At the end of the day, we were warmly waved off and driven back to our villa. This is one of the best activities I have experienced in Bali and it is all down to the fantastic family at Jambangan Cookery Class! Thank you! Chantelle, Clare and Tess xxx

Great cultural experience. Top 5 reasons to check out Jamganan's Cooking Class1. The experience starts in the market, where they show you the types of food you will be cooking 2. It is in a typical Balinese home with the temple area, a beautiful home. 3. They cook a wide range of dishes, I think we cooked 7 different dishes. 4. The are an excellent price.5. The food was delicious All great reasons to check out the Jamgangan Cooking Class, we had an awesome time and I would highly recommend. We even did some food art with the veggies.

Great experience . Was a really good day and the hosts we're very welcoming . Food we cooked was delicious . We got rained out so they had to cut the final part a bit short but that wasn't their fault .would thoroughly recommend to do this .

Wonderful experience. I went with my mum and it was such a wonderful and joyful experience! They came in a car to direct our driver there and the home was lovely and we were welcomed so warmly! Menu ranged from appetisers and mains to dessert, of which we had the time to eat what we made im between the cooking:) Wonderful hands on experience and also they were very organised with starting with the preparations for some ingredients so we didn't have to waste too much time and got to maximise all the 2hours worth of the lesson Cheerful hosts who were very engaging and we definitely will go back again to learn more local dishes. Can't wait to try out the recipes back home!

Fantastic experience! . Highly recommended, it was an unique experience. They picked us up, brought us to the market and explained a lot about the different food, spices as well as Balinese culture and traditions. The course was in their beautiful family house. The dishes we prepared were yummy!!!

Had an amazing day!. Thank you so much for such a lovely morning! I was lucky enough to be the only one on my course and I loved it! Had such a good time and the food was amazing! Their house is beautiful! Thank you again! :-)

One of the highlights of our trip to Bali. This was easily one of the highlights of our Bali trip. We were picked up in the morning and shown both a local market and a rice field. We got to discover some new tropical fruits that we had never tasted before, and our guide was knowledgeable and welcoming. Back at the family home, we were walked through a fantastic menu from soup to dessert, making our own peanut sauce and pounding our own yellow curry sauce. Of course, the family helped with the prep and the proportions, but throughout we felt we were being guided on our own delightful culinary tour. We were in Bali for over a week and the meal we prepared in this class was one of the top two meals. We return to Hong Kong with a our "cookbook" of the recipes we prepared, and plan to give one to our sister and save one to make the meal for our friends. We would highly recommend this cooking class to anyone visiting Ubud, whether you are experienced cooks or just enjoy delicious food!

Perfect cooking course. This cooking course is really worth it.We were picked up from our hotel (and dropped again in the afternoon), went to the local market and then to enjoy the view of rice terraces and then to the house of the family, where we had a very warm welcome. The family was so sweet and told us about the traditional Balinese family house and afterwards we prepared a lot of very good Balinese food. After enjoying our dishes we had the recipes. Everything was very professional, but in a very relaxed, calm and nice atmosphere.Thank you so much for a nice cooking course!

The best food the all Indonesia :). They are a lovely family and a good cookers, your house is so beautiful. We love so much, tanks for all...And if you need someone for work whith you, I goo, lol...Super kiss

Fantastic Experience. Fantastic cooking class at a beautiful Balinese home. The class is a fantastic way to learn about Balinese cooking and culture. The class starts at the local market where you can explore and taste the local produce and you are then driven to the cooking school. The class is very interactive and a lot of fun. The hosts are very helpful and keep the class fun and memorable. The food is delicious and fantastic to share your food. Afterwards you get the recipes so you are able to make them on your return home. I had a fantastic time and would highly recommend the Jambangan cooking class.

Great experience!. On Oct 27th, our class started with Rakesh picking us up from the hotel in his air conditioned van. Our group of 6 was taken to the market to pick up a couple ingredients and learn a bit about their local foods and about the market itself. We were then taken to a coffee plantation and got to try a bunch of different coffees and learn about the process of making their special Luwak coffee.The cooking class itself was great, with great instruction and it was very hands-on. Everyone in the group had slightly different tasks and required teamwork between all the students. We were an intimate group of just 6 students, which was a good size. The food was delicious and we had cooked so much that we were stuffed and even had leftovers to spare. Rakesh and his family welcomed us into their home, and treated us like part of the family. They were such a happy and warm group, making the experience thoroughly enjoyable.We received recipes for all the dishes we had made, and can't wait to try them at home!At the end of the class, we were dropped back at the hotel. The experience is highly recommended.

Superb cooking class. superb cooking class at a Balinese home.
First you go to a local market. Next you go to a Balinese home, where the family will learn you how to cook.
They only take small classes. We, as a couple, where the only 2.
Afterwards you get the receipts / menu.
The food is delicious

Lovely experience. We had a private program and were picked up right on time to go to a local market. We could taste all the things we wanted and got an explination of the local food and tastes. After the market we went to an agroculture farm and tried the world known Luwak coffee and an explination of the process of making it with a wonderfull view over rice fields and we got a tour on the farm. Afterworths the driver brought us to his village and had a warm welcome from a Balinese family. There we started cooking and learned everything about traditional Balinese cooking and way of living. In every dish goes an extra spoon with flavour for good luck. For lunch we tried everything we made and it was great! We can recommend this to everyone!

Fantastic!. Amazing way to learn about the Balinese home compound, family values, and culture. The unity and trust between a familiy is deeply apparent in this cooking class as Rakesh invites you to his home to share traditional recipes and his entire family was teaching us. His sister, in particular, was warm, inviting, and incredibly positive. We had many laughs starting off at the traditional market, to slicing and dicing spices and eating together as a group in the early afternoon. We loved every moment and are looking forward to returning. I highly recommend doing the class at the start of your trip as it will provide a strong foundation of understanding the fundamentals of Balinese daily life.

Fantastic experience!. I highly recommend this cooking class! We stayed in Ubud for a few days but this was definitely our highlight. The family is very kind and they show you a local food market and their private paddy field, which is very interesting. Afterwards they invite you to their home and the cooking class begins. The food is extraordinary good and everthing is made under hygenic circumstances. And don't worry that you won't get enough, we skipped dinner because we were still full...The price (similar to other cooking classes) is totally reasonable, we got the receipts at the end, and simply had a great time!

Become part of the family at Jambangan cooking class. My husband and I attended a morning class atJambangan and thoroughly enjoyed it. We were picked up from our hotel in an air conditioned car, and after picking up other guests, we were taken to the local market. It was great to see this slice of local life,and we were given samples of foods we'd never tried before. We were welcomed at the house with a fresh coconut and taught how to weave leaves.
