And then the cooking began! Everyone was involved in making all of the meals, and everything was delicious. The family were all really friendly and helpful. At the end of the class we were given the recipes and taken back to the hotels, although we wantedto go to monkey forest so were kindly taken there instead. Overall can highly recommend.

Such a lovely experience!. I love to cook and really wanted to learn how to make the amazing food we were eating on our holiday. I booked this class based on a recommendation by a friend and if am so glad that I did! It was super easy to book the class via the email on their website and Ade came to pick me up from my hotel right on time. They do classes for 4 but the other 3 had cancelled at the last minute so I was lucky enough to have the day all to myself. We went to the local market and walked around and it was great to take photos of the fresh produce we were going to be using later. I love taking pictures of people and this was a great photo op. We then went to their home via the rice terrace (another great photo op) and I was welcomed with some fresh king coconut and made to feel right at home. I was then explained about the dishes I was going to be making with them and we got underway. The place was very clean and the food was yum! They allow you to take photos and eat after every course and make you feel right at home. We made over 6 or 7 dishes and each one was simple but flavorful and will be easy to replicate when I get home.I got typed pages of recipes to take with me and they even let me take some food to takeaway because we cooked so much. Their family is so lovely and I would definitely recommend this experience to food lovers visiting Bali. They promised to give me more recipes to cook the next time I go back. I hope I get to go back soon!

Jambangan Bali Cooking Class . My sister, her best friend and I went along to the Jambangan Cooking Class, it was a lovely experience, it was wonderful learning to cook a few of the yummy Indonesian meals. Rakesh and his family opened their doors to have all of us in their home, and he also took us to the local markets, to buy some of the ingredients required for the class. It's definitely worth doing when you visit Bali, and so much to learn about their sharing culture. Thank you Rakesh and all of your wonderful family for the experience of your cooking class.

Delicious Food and Great Company!. My wife and I traveled to Ubud in August while on our honeymoon. We decided to take a cooking class and signed up for Jambangan Bali after reading the positive reviews. We had a wonderful experience. Rakesh and his family were extremely kind and gracious and provided wonderful service. The food we prepared was truly delicious and we learned a great deal about Indonesian culture and family life. We highly recommend this cooking experience!

Outstanding. This was an outstanding experience. Well worth doing. Small classes very hands on and great fun. It was lovely to see a Balinese home and experience their warmth and hospitality. Thank you Rakesh and family.

Fun and delicious cooking experience. ** Please make sure that you get the right directions to the cooking class. At this time 15 Sept 2014 the directions on trip advisor are incorrect ** Me and 3 other friends wanted to do something nice and different in Ubud and as all of us are passionate about cooking and good food we decided to give this cooking class a try. We were a bit fooled by the location of the class on trip advisor and refused the hosts proposal to come pick us up. We ended up walking for half an hour and then asked a very nice lady to call the host for us. He arrived in 5 minutes and took all of us in his car to the class. From the first moment you can feel that the host and his family are really passionate about what they do and that they want for their guests to enjoy the experience. Btw: the host speaks excellent English. We were welcomed with fresh coconut juice and had an introduction to the typical Balinese house and then we started cooking. The experience was awesome: we made about 6 different types of food and all were exquisite. We were very much involved in the cooking process: from creating ornaments ( crabs made from cucumbers, flowers made from tomatoes) to actually preparing some ingredients and cooking the dishes. The final products tasted and looked awesome and the the whole evening was very enjoyable.

Authentic and fun cooking class in Ubud. We enjoyed a wonderful afternoon in the company of Rakesh and his family while learning to cook beautiful food in a relaxed, friendly and fun atmosphere. We were collected from our hotel and brought to a local coffee plantation which was very interesting. We tasted a wide variety of coffee including the famous Luwak coffee! We received a very warm welcome to Rakesh's home and we found the experience to be quite cultural as he told us about some Hindu beliefs and the layout of the home according to Balinese tradition. We actively participated in the preparation and cooking of the food and enjoyed a variety of tasty dishes for our meal. We felt the experience was very authentic and much preferable to a cooking class in a restaurant. This experience was one of the highlights of our holiday and we highly recommend it as an activity to do, good value too.

Excellent local experience in a traditional balinese house. Firstly I hadn't expected a lot because there were not much reviews in Tripadvisor and I contacted a couple of cooking classes but already fully booked, then I decided to contact to them but luckily it was the best moment in my bali visit.They picked us up at Ubud Terrace and went to a traditional local market which was REALLY LOCAL! We had tasted a couple of fruits - mangosteen, snake fruit, longan etc and Indonesian spices - galangal, gingers etc. After that, we visited to the world famous "Rice Terrace" for photos and "Bali Pulina" - agriculture tourism place. We walked a fruit and spice forrest there - there are cocoa tree, giant passion fruit tree, pineapple tree etc and tasted several kings of balinese drinks - ginger tea, balinese cofee..Then we visited to the cooking class venue - it was the traditional balinese house. We listened about the history and style of house with welcome coconut juice.We cooked 7 meals totally - vege soup, chicken sate, gadogado, bean salad, grilled tuna, chicken curry, pan fried tempei. We separated our role from chopping to frying. Also cooked dessert as well. then total recipe will be 8. Most important thing was they taught how to cook yellow sauce and peanut sauce. It was very tasty.The atmosphere and location is better than other cooking class in restaurant and understand about balinese food deeply.If I pointed out a bit negative point, probably staying at Bali Pulina and market needed to be shorter.Otherwise, It was the best activity to visit in Bali. Strongly recommend!!Cheers.

Great experience in UBUD!. We went there in a group of 4 friends. They wanted to pick us up from the hotel but we were stubborn and said no. We relied on the map on trip advisor, which is not correct. So after we walked a lot we decided to ask someone for help. As all people in Bali, the woman we asked for helped was kind enough to call them and ask them to pick us up from where we were. So The big boss :) came and took us to his home. I loved that he explained to us some things about the architecture of a balinese house. And about their customs and traditions. The other members of the family were so nice and they really made us feel like we were part of their home. We took turns to do different things for each dish and we cooked a very nice soup, 6 main dishes and desert. We all did it like a team so it was much fun! GREAT GREAT FOOD!I think it is a must to do this in Bali. I can not recommend it enough!

Nice family, excellent food !. Small group of 4, lots of different dishes to cook and try! Would have liked to be more hands on and do more of the cooking myself rather than in group all together. Liked to braid the coconut leaves into a carpet. :) very good experience overall! I recommend it!

Amazing!!. We loved attending to this cooking class. It takes place in a Balinese house and you get to know a lot about the culture and food! We loved cooking with the family and it was yummy!! Great experience :)

Best experience in Ubud!. This cooking class went beyond our expectations. The family took us into their beautiful home and were amazing hosts and made everyone feel comfortable and like family. This is definitely a must do when in Ubud!!! Thank you so much to our hosts we had an unbelievable experience and meal!

Great experience. After a pick up at the hotel, we were in a small market to see the different products that we will used later. The cooking class was in a traditional balinese house. Our hosts gave us information about the house, we learnt a lot. We prepare a lot of meals (around 8), even some specials for the vegetarian of our group. They are taking care of there guests all along the class, smiling and joking. The atmosphere is really friendly. They pick us up around 8h30 in Ubud and we were back around 15h. We paid 350 000 roupies per person. A really good experience, we recommand it!

Hands-on! Great! Treated us like family!. We did this on our honeymoon, great time. Picked us up at the hotel, did a tour of a local market looking at fruits, veggies and spices, a small tour of local rice paddies then on to the family home and we started cooking. 8 courses in 2 hours, they are fun, funny and GREAT chefs and hosts. They told us what to do, we did it - hands on the whole time, very interactive. A+. A must-do if in the Ubud area

Authentic and interesting cooking experience. We were picked up at our hotel as planned.A first stop at the market to point and show the difference ingredients that will be used later.Then the cooking happens in a traditional Balinese house.Cooking is really interesting, with tasting and understanding of different ingredients. Our hosts have always been careful that everybody is busy with nobody left aside. This is a real plus.In the end, the food cooked and eat during lunch was awesome, with a great atmosphere.The groups are small and you are really more than watching to prepare the lunch.Strongly recommended and worth the price!

Worthwhile doing. Authentic experience.. We were picked up and brought to the family home in a rural area and given a tour of the family compound outsideUbud. It was interesting and informative about the Balinese style of living. The cookery course we did lasted throughout the afternoon and evening. It was my first time doing something like this. They had all the ingredients ready and told us exactly what to do in a structured and organised way. It was fun and relaxed. The food was delicious. There were 4 of us altogether. There is nothing I would have changed about today. It was the perfect introduction to Balinese cooking. We even got the recipes to take away with us. I would highly recommend this experience and I would consider it a highlight from my trip to Bali.

Great experience, great people. This was a fantastic day, and really well organised, and great value for money. After being picked up from our villa, we were taken to a local market (no tourists in sight) to see where all the fresh produce comes from. Our guide pointed out all the ingredients we would be using, and a lot of the other interesting fruits and veges we don't get at home. We also stopped by some beautiful terraced rice paddies, and went to an eco park, where they were growing a lot of the plants that various spices are produced from - a really fascinating experience. The class itself was great fun, lots to do, plenty of explanation and plenty of time to taste everything. The feast we produced was amazing, and we got a print out of the recipes to take with us. Just fantastic, and made better by it being held in a real Balinese household. Highly recommended.
Absolutely fantastic!. This cookery class is the best! The food you is amazing and the family who carry out the class in their own home are the nicest! I would highly recommend!

"And one for luck!". I booked to have a morning lesson at the Jambangan cookery school. When Rakesh came to pick me up from my hotel he explained that the other people who were meant to join the class had rescheduled at the last minute, which meant I had a private cooking lesson.The whole experience from start to finish was fantastic. The cooking takes place in Rakesh' home and it felt like the whole family was involved in the lesson, which made for a really fun and funny time.The lesson started at a local market where the various ingredients were explained to me. This was really interesting, especially as the market was in a little town outside Ubud and there was not a tourist in sight. After that we drove thorough the rice fields to Rakesh' home which is a traditional Balinese family compound with several different buildings, a family temple and lots of ingredients growing on their land. It was interesting to hear about how the family lives and to get a bit of an insight into Balinese life.After a welcome drink it was time to get stuck in! We started by making the yellow curry paste which is a base for many of the dishes. I had a go on the huge pestle and mortar, chopped, mixed, formed and cooked....all the while under the watchful eye of Rakesh's sister who made the morning so much fun. There was always time for a photo and when weighing out the ingredients there was always one extra spoonful for luck!The food was absolutely delicious, one of the best meals I had on holiday! You learn how to make curry, satay empol, Tempe manis, lawar bali, among other things. Make sure you arrive feeling hungry as you will certainly leave feeling very full!You also get a copy of all the recipes to take home with you.I really cannot rate this cooking class highly enough. Rakesh and his sister both have a background in gastro and this shows. I had a great morning and really recommend it to others.

Cultural balinese cooking experience. This cooking class was well organized. It started with a short stop at the market, then we went to Puralina Bali (plantation with the best free coffee tasting of Bali) and the others that already went before to this plantation went to the rice paddies. Hereafter we went by passing Tegalalang's paddies to Rakesh his home. A beautiful typical Balinese family compound where we were welcomed by all family members with a smile and we got a fresh coconut. The cooking started with cutting and then we started preparing the yellow and peanut sauce. After a while we switched to learning some decoration and some were making minced chicken... later we cooked at turns the several dishes (as there were 4 heaters). All in all we had a wonderful meal that we made together with the whole group! Although there was no individual cooking place for everyone tasks were well divided and everyone saw how dishes were prepared as we were not doing several dishes at the same time. At the end you get a very lovely meal (enak sekali), a very full stomach and recipes to bring home:).

Fantastic class in cooking and local culture. This is an amazing cultural and cooking experience! The day started in the local market where Rakesh explained and showed us many different fruits and vegetables. Then we moved on to the rice padi where we learnt about the process of harvesting rice and much more. Next Rakesh took us to his home. It was absolutely beautiful setting and we learnt a lot about the local culture and Hindu traditions. We were greeted by his wife who was extremely kind and great fun throughout the class. After weaving some traditional floor mats, we got cracking with the cooking. There was a good amount of hands on cooking and supervision and the food created was delicious! All in all a fantastic experience, I would highly recommend it to anyone.I can't wait to make the dishes again when I get home!!

Fun experience. First we visited the market and they explained the ingredients to us. Then we went to a plantation where a local guide showed us all kind of plants and the process of coffee making. After that we went to their traditional house. The family was very friendly and helpful with the cooking. In total we prepared 8 dishes. We had a good time!

Yummy. I chose Jambangan over other cooking classes in Ubud as I liked the fact that the class would be in the family compound and would be hands on. I was a bit disappointed that the market visit wasnt available for my afternoon class and this is not mentioned in the brochure. However no big deal. The drive to the village is very picturesque and the family's compound is very pretty and very clean. Turns out I was the only guest so we got down to the cooking. We made. . Or should I say. .I helped make 8 dishes and learnt the basics of balinese cooking. ..lots garlic and wonderful spices which need working with a mortar and pestle. Good fun. I can't remember her name but the cook is wonderful. .. She speaks English well and has a fantastic sense of humour. . Everything was so many tablespoons and 'one for the road'. I thoroughly enjoyed the class and the final feast was huge! I can't believe I ate most of it.. But it was astoundingly good. It was a shame for the family I was the only guest..but hey. Who's complaining. I think they're a fairly new business and I wish them much good luck for future.Do yourself a favour. . Get cooking with Jambangan.

Great atmosphere and delicious food!. This cooking school is hosted by a lovely family and you immediately feel really welcome! Everything is good organised and because you're only with four people you have the possibility to make all the dishes together. Really nice dishes! Would definitely recommend everyone to go here, especially because they tell you a lot about the Balinese culture, religion and the family as well!

A real highlight on a truly memorable holiday on Bali. Amazing experience, great value for money and a highlight of our first visit to Bali. We agree with many other people who have already commented, and thoroughly endorse the recommendations. We were lucky to have shared the experience with another couple, and had a lot of fun. The whole experience was exceptionally well organised.

Amazing time with this welcoming family. I did the afternoon class and had a really great time. Actually I had a private class. The cooking class is outside in a real balinese home. They receive you with a big smile and make sure you feel comfortable. The menu was really good and a lots of choices and you really Cook and help making every meal...not just watching. You do learn a lot about hindu rituals and hindu house and their temple. Most of the food usée vomie directif from the garden behind the house! Absolutely delicious. One of my top activity in bali! And the best part, you go home with all the receipes! :D definitely not for the ones on diet!!!

Great Place. We had a great experience over here. The cookingplace is at the private house of the family and it is beautiful. The menu we cooked was very large and the taste was great. The explenation is good and thee gave us all the recipes. Thanks Rakesh and family. Kind regards David en Mireille

Unforgettable Experience. This was one of the highlights of our trip to bali. My wife and I are on our honeymoon and attended the cooking class yesterday. The experience was authentic, extremely welcoming, and the food/preparation was amazing. The hosts welcome you into their house and teach you not only about the food, but also how family life works for the Balinese. Just awesome.

Authentic one by one balinese cooking class. If you would like to experience home cooked balinese food in a small group,then this class is the place to be. The class is held by the owners who are super nice and funny. The food is freshly bought at the local market,prepared,cooked and eaten. There's heaps of food,so make sure you don't eat much before. Everything is clean and hygienic. Definitely worth trying.

Fantastic & Authentic Balinese Experience. Would highly recommend to anyone wanting to experience Balinese culture and cuisine. The fact it is in their own family home makes it a much more authentic and informative experience than other cooking classes in the area. The hosts were extremely friendly and good fun- I think it's a must for anyone coming to Bali for the first time. I learnt not only about their cooking techniques but about family life and their religion. Definitely great value not just for the experience but the amount of food you get to sample throughout the day!

Yummy!!!. We had an amazing time! It ended up being only my husband and I, but we were taken to the local market to see where they buy ingredients and then back to their Balinese home! It's was beautiful! We then cooked 7 dishes and a dessert and ate what we could. There was a ton of food and so yummy! Then you get all the recipes to take home! We are definitely going to attemptTo make the food!

Authentic Balinese hands on experience. I very much enjoyed this class. We were picked up on time & driven to pick up the other participants. Then straight to the markets. I found this a bit odd as we purchased nothing but we were shown which ingredients we would be using. It was an eye opening experience but I would have also liked to have seen the ingredients bought (but not the meats which were not refrigerated)!Then we got to see a real traditional Balinese family home and felt very welcomed with fresh coconuts to drink. We then made some carpet from weaving some vine leaves and then to the kitchen. The ingredients were fresh and we were all put to work to create maybe 10 different dishes. We worked, ate then worked some more. We even got to take recipes with us of all the meals. It was exactly what I hoped for, a hands on cooking class that was informative, delicious and great value.

A great way to spend a day :). Since the other reviews do a great job describing the whole experience, I'll just summarize some of my highlights and why I recommend this to anyone:- The food you make is the best food I've had in Bali, and you can definitely make any of the recipes back home.- Rakesh could double as a tour guide. On the drive, he explained to us all about Balinese culture, with lots of interesting insights on day to day Balinese life that we didn't get elsewhere (such as family life, traditions, religion, current events).- It was way more fun than I expected. I don't enjoy cooking at home, so I expected it to feel like work. That was totally wrong, it was a lot of fun.- You get to see a Balinese home! I was really curious about them so it was a highlight for me.

"One more spoon full for good luck" =). Our experience with Jambangan Bali cooking school started off positive when we received a prompt friendly email response to attend a cooking class that afternoon, with a free pick up and drop off to our hotel which was 15 mins north of Ubud. Cost is 350,000 rupiah per person via cash only payment and there is a morning and afternoon class available. I belive morning classes are usually busier and you visit the Ubud market which is closed by the afternoon classes, so you go to the coffee plantation instead (which was our preference as I wanted to sample the famous Kopi Luwak). Rakesh was friendly, talkative and answered our many questions and being just two of us we received a indervidualised and intimate experience. After the coffee plantation (no pressure to buy) and a stop off to the bank to exchange money we drove to Rakesh's village to cook at home with his sister and family, receiving lessons on Bali life, temples and rice farming on the way. Rakesh is an experienced Chef who spent 6 years cooking at a hotel and the standard of food, organisation and cleanliness were high. We were dressed in aprons and given coconut water on arrival before we got hard at work. Most of the ingredients are home grown and/or produced from scratch including the coconut oil, milk, chicken stock and spices. You make 8 dishes, including 2 pastes plus desert, with explanations along the way. Bottled water is included as it's thirsty work. Rakeah and his Sister are happy to take photos, laugh along with you and make it enjoyable. I am an experienced cook at home but think this class is enjoyable for all levels of cooks as you can always learn a lot cooking in another part of the world with ingredients and techniques not commonly found at home.Jambangan cooking school offers value for money and lessons you can take home as well as the added bonus of connections to a wonderful family if you choose to visit again. A highlight of our trip and highly recommended.

Cook, eat, laugh! :). It was last minute when I and my two friends decided to join a cooking class for our last few days in Bali. Little did we know that it will be one of the best memories of our trip!We took the morning class and we were picked up from the hotel by Chef Nyoman. We went to the market and he showed us fresh ingredients of a Balinese cuisine. We also drove around Ubud, passed by some beautiful sceneries, sipped coffee stand teas before we proceeded to the house of Chef Made, which is a typical Balinese compound.Cooking time was a very wonderful experience, we prepared the dishes while singing and laughing and taking pictures together with Chef Nyoman and Made. The food was extraordinarily delicious despite it being easy to prepare. With the great chefs, the food, and the experience - its definitely worth it! Enjoy!

Great family, class and food. Rakesh first took me to the local market and showed many of the spicies we would use later. Throughout the way he also explained me a lot about local culture. At his house, he showed the familiar compound and temple. I had a light and funny class with his sister and could taste real and delicious balinese food. They truly made me feel at home and it is an experience I'd tell anyone to have.

Best cooking class in Bali. This experience could not have been any better! We got picked up at our hotel on time. As we did the afternoon class, the marked was closed, but we got to start our class with a trip to a coffe plantation instead! What an experience!!! As we walked around the plantation we were told about different spices and the proses of making the best coffe in bali! We also got to sample various delicious coffe and tea flavors. A really good start to the class! After that, we were brought to Rakesh's beautiful home where we were greeted by his lovely sister and got a fresh coconut as a welcome drink! The class it self was incredible! Very much hands on and they were both very good teachers! We got to learn about traditional Balinese carpet breading and grinding of spices! We had so much fun making the food! We got to make a soup, six main dishes and a dessert! All of them tasted absolutely amazing! If you are looking for an authentic Balinese experience and great food as well as lovely people, this is perfect for you!

Best indonesian food I´ve had so far. This cooking class was really a nice experience. We`ve got the chance to see how a Balinese family lives and how they prepare their food. The food was delicious and we had a lot of fun during preparing the meal. Adiitionally we got a welcome drink and the recipe of the meals we cooked!

Awesome authetic adventure!. My friend and I did a night class with Rakesh and his family at his house near Ubud. We learned how to make 8 traditional balienese dishes and they pretty much had to roll us out of there. The food was amazing and the company was even better. They showed us are and their traditional balienese house is in between cooking.We felt right at home and had the best food we'd had our entire trip! They are just awesome!

Great day with Rakesh. We had a wonderful day cooking with Rakesh and his sister! We went to the market, checked out the rice fields, were greeted with delicious coconut juice (complete with coconut) and began cooking delicious balinese food. We made soup, ate soup, made 4 different main dishes, ate 4 different main dishes, made dessert and ate dessert, and then got to take some home!! Rakesh's home and family were so welcoming, and I would recommend anyone spend a day there learning (and eating) all they can!

Highlight of the trip!. I absolutely loved my day spent with Rakesh and his family. We started off with a market tour, it was amazing to see all the fresh produce and the ingredients we would use. We then moved on to a gorgeous coffee plantation with a spectacular view of some rice fields. We were greeted at Rakesh's house with some fresh juice and welcomed by his lovely sister. Then it was cooking time, there was only 3 of us there so we all got to be completely hands on. They showed us how to make everything, even down to the beautiful garnishes. Still thinking about the amazing food we cooked and I can't wait to try and cook it again! Thanks so much for a great day :)

absolutely amazing!!!. i had the most amazing day!we started by going to the markets which was full of beautiful ripe and exotic produce and ingredients which started to make me hungry already then some sightseeing of beautiful lush ,green rice paddies,locally grown coffee with a fantastic view and local villages!it was nice to see what is just out of ubud centre!then we went to rakesh and his families house which is just beautiful!with the help of his lovely sister madre i know i am spelling that wrong sorry i cooked up a storm!it was so delicious and all the aromas and ingredients were divine and so nice to eat food that was so full of flavour and tasted so fresh just so delicious and the setting so lovely with there beautiful family temple and gorgeous surroundings and sweet family was nice to get some culture and a glimpse of bali life!everyone was so welcoming and i just had a fabulous day and left very very full!it really was a highlight of my trip and i cant wait to cook all the delicious things i learnt to make!thank you so much very special xk

A Great Way to Spend the Day. I has a wonderful time. Everyone was extremely welcoming, patient and funny even. We laughed, we ate, we drank. It was completely hands on and I was lucky enough to get undivided attention. I learned traditional Balinese cooking in the true sense of the word. When it was all said and done I sat down to the most beautiful, delicious feast imaginable....and I even got to take a doggie bag home. If you're someone who likes to cook, this is a not to be missed tour.

Yummy!. I had a fantastic time here today. The food was delicious, it was very hands on and the hosts were very friendly. This was an awesome way to experience local culture and I learnt a lot more than a resturant class. Thank you for welcoming me into your family home!

Very satisfied. Excellent cooking class and sightseeing in wonderful environment. Visiting a local market with no tourists. Drinking luwak coffee and visit the luwak farm. The cooking class took place in his home so we also had the opportunity to see how some balinese people live. It was only two of us and we paid around 350 000 Rp per person. He picked us up at the hotel at 0800 and dropped us of at 1400. We had a wonderful experience and can strongly recommend this cooking class/tour!

Rakesh's wonderfull cooking class in Ubud, Bali. If you are looking to really learn how to cook balinese dishes, and not a turisticaly ordinary ubud cooking class where you just spend money on, then you should choose Rakesh's cooking class. You will be granted the honour of going to Rakesh's beauyifull house, getting to know his family, and how a balinese family really lives, and then he will put you to work. But first, he will take to a local market, explain you the diferent ingredients balinese food has, afterwards, to a rice field trip, to show you the procedure of planting, irrigating and harvesting the rice. Then, straight to work. You start with an workshop to learn how to make a "green matress" out of palm tree leaves, that you'll be using later on your cooking procedures. Concerning cooking, you will learn how to cook 9 different recipies, the basics to it, from a starting soup, several main dishes, and ending with a desert! Curious about the dishes? Sign in for the cooking class when you arrive in Ubud. This will be a 6 hour activity, lasting the whole morning, buy we can promise you, that the early wake and the hard work on making the yellow sauce will be largely compensated with a wonderfull meal, actually made by you, and that will satisfy your every sense. Thank you very much Rakesh!

Welcoming and delicious!. What a lovely morning spent - with a visit to the local market, a tour of the compound and a lively cooking class. Using fresh local ingredients, together we created the best tasting local dishes.The family members were warm, welcoming and generous in their hospitality. Highly recommended to those who would like to get out of Ubud and experience an insight into local family life centred around a cooking class - and of course, eating the delicious food made as well! Highly recommended.

Excellent!. One of the activities that we really wanted to do in Ubud was a cooking class, and after reading a whole load of reviews on TripAdvisor, Be Bali Day cooking class was the one that stood out for us. The tour around the market, which seems to be standard on all cooking classes, sounded interesting, but we also liked the idea of being in a small group, and getting to see their home and farm. The family home and commune is beautiful, and we had a lovely walk around their property, where we saw the children at play, as well as their chickens, pigs and cows, and we also collected some fresh items for the cooking class. We were shown their private pool villa, which is beautiful, and is available for rent. I would definitely look into staying there in the future.The class itself was fantastic, and we were involved in the preparation of each of the different dishes. The food that was cooked is definitely the best that we have eaten in Ubud - especially that peanut sauce (!), and we enjoyed a delicious lunch looking out into the jungle. We were very lucky that our group was so small, and that we had a personalised class with Made, which was very hands-on. We both thoroughly enjoyed ourselves, and highly recommend this class to others.We were collected from our villa at 8 am, and we were returned home just after midday with the leftovers from our cooking class. An excellent day!
Great cooking class. . It was a nice Day. With Friendly People. And see a lot. The food was great. You can do a lot by your self. But the help with everything.

Lovely cooking class in amazone environment . Such lovely people! Very beautiful surrounding. Cooking class was Gert Nice. Unfortunatally my huisbrand was not feeling Well so we had to stop early. We could get the food with is. I recommandeer this to everybody !

Great culinary experience in (very) small group!. Kadek first picked us up at our hotel at 8:30 am (we were just the two of us that day -more generally, it's a 6-person max tour), and took us to a local market near Ubud, where he showed us the traditional ingredients used in Balinese cuisine and explained the importance and the crafting process of the (multi-)daily offerings that Balinese people place at temples and at their homes. He then drove us to the family farm, where he first showed us the different buildings in the house, which are arranged according to a traditional layout. As we later walked through the forest to their (gorgeous) guesthouse facing terrace rice paddies (which he showed us briefly), he showed us the trees and plants used in the kitchen (and even a monkey jumping from tree to tree). We then met their cows and eventually arrived at the outdoor kitchen, nicely set in the wooded/jungle part of their domain, with a nice view on the Agung river valley.There, Made told us about the main principles and components of the Balinese cuisine. We then put theory into practice: we ground, cut, mixed, stirred, wrapped, modeled... One hour later (and with much of Made's help), everything was ready for degustation. On the menu: chicken soup, corn fritters with (homemade) sambal sauce, sweet potato rice, chicken satay with (homemade) peanut sauce, pork pepes (cooked in banana leaf), gado-gado, and banana fritters for dessert.Everything was delicious! And the setting was great, facing the lush valley.We cooked so much food that we couldn't finish it despite all our good will and appetite. Made packed a fraction of the leftovers into a big doggy bag (plus some fresh fruits that we could pick from a basket), and also gave us a booklet with all the recipes we made that day. Finally, Made showed us how to make offerings of various shapes, and we tried to imitate her. It appeared we didn't have half her dexterity but it was still fun and informative ;)It's hard to find room for improvement in that tour, but I think I would have loved spending even more time in the kitchen and do some of the work that was actually done by Made before our arrival to make things easier and faster for us (getting some herbs in the garden, cutting vegetables into small pieces, etc). Also note that there will be some advertising for the rafting occurring nearby (at times, we could actually hear the screams in the distance) and, obviously, for the guesthouse they take you to during the tour. But nothing too insistent, I thought.Overall : Made and Kadek (and all the people we met in the farm) were very nice and welcoming. One of our best moments in Bali, for a reasonable price (350 000 IDR per person in August 2016)! And the big plus is that contrary to most of other cooking classescaround Ubud, here you get the opportunity to cook in (very) small groups!

Part of the family. We had a wonderful time at the cooking class today. It was great spending time with a Balinese family. It was much more than a cooking class as you got to see a working farm and learn a little more about the Balinese culture. Well worth the money and would recommend if you are staying in the Ubud area
Amazing Day. This experience was very authentic and we really loved the market, the farm and the cooking lesson with nice food.

Authentic Balinese experience!!. We booked this cooking lesson with my boyfriend after reading all the excellent review about it. Were not disappointed! Unlike the other cooking class of the region, they only take very small groups. The journey started with a visit of a local market (not a single tourist in there!) We were explained the different spices, vegetables and fruit available in the region.Our guide then let us the time to buy whatever we needed and negotiated very good prices each time for us.Then on the way to the familly property, the guide told us about Balinese tradition.Once on the beautiful familly farm, we were given a tour of the property and the rice fields.After that we started the cooking lesson. All the product were from the familly garden. Even the coconut oil was homemade!! We cooked chicken saté, rice with sweet potatoe, Balinese chicken soup, corn fritters, steam pork and banana fritters for dessert: SO DELICIOUS !We then enjoyed the meal we cooked in the very nice surrounding. Portions were so generous we were able to take doggy bags.Overall an amazing experience, very authentic.I strongly recommend.

Wonderful day with delicious food. Kadek and Made helped us spend a wonderful day at their farm near Ubud and we learned to cook Balinese dishes which are very tasty. The best we had during our stay in Bali. The whole farm is really beautiful and if you do the tour, do step up the rice terraces as you have a great view from above. It is a bit tricky to get down though. We got all of the recipes from the cooking class and lateron prepared our own offerings. My husband turned out to be quite skilled. Their guesthouse looks gorgeous as well, so you should check that out too. All the dishes can be tailored to your special needs and preferences if you like.

What a fantastic day!. We just had the best day with Kadek and Made, truly an amazing experience! I would highly recommend you to avoid the top tripadvisor choices and go for this authentic experience instead. I picked this place as the reviews mentioned small groups, and we were not disappointed! It was only my boyfriend and me! Turns out the biggest group they take is 8 people and even that is really rare. The more popular options usually take up to 25 people so this really made a huge difference and it felt so special to be just the 2 of us.Kadek picked us up at our hotel and then we headed to one of the traditional Ubud markets. One the way there we talked a lot about Balinese culture and the planting of rice. At the markets he showed us lots of plants and vegetables that we had never seen before, really interesting.We then headed out to their house compound and farm and started a tour of their home where their large family (30 people) live. He explained a lot about Balinese religion and culture and how traditional families live. We then headed to their beautiful farm where we spotted lots of different plants. We walked up to their rice terraces, it was really magical! They also have a small eco-resort there, next time we want to stay there instead of crowded Ubud. There is a huge pool where you can relax among the terraces and the frog noises.The walk in their rice plantation was super cool, we learned lots about the irrigation system and how people plant rice.Then back to their farm where his wife Made waited for us. All the ingredients were nice and clean and ready for us to chop, wrap and grind. So much fun and she made it so easy! Made told us everything about the different spices we used. All the ingredients were super fresh straight from their farm, it was so special. Even the coconut oil is made fresh at their farm. We used so many different things like galanghal, ginger, kafir leaves, white tumeric, lemongrass, tofu, chicken etc... In the end we helped make tofu soup, white rice with sweet potatoes, fried eggplant, gado gado, tofu skewers satay, steamed tofu and chicken in bamboo leaves, sweet corn fritters...My god! There was enough food for 10 people even though it was just the 2 of us. We had so much fun preparing it but even more eating it, with the beautiful view on their farm. I got full so quickly so Made packed us enough food for the night's dinner, such a treat. The corn fritters where the best I've eaten in my life. My boyfriend loved the gado gado and me the tofu satay but truly everything was incredible (especially with a cold beer). While we were eating they even prepared us some dessert, some delicious battered bananas. Once we had a small rest, Made showed us how to make traditional Balinese offerings, such a special addition to the day's events. As we were leaving, she heard we had a small kitchenette at our place so she packed us a huge bag full of their spices and leaves, I couldn't believe it. We now have lots of tumeric, ginger, leaves and others to try and recreate some recipes. Lucky that they also supplied the recipes!In conclusion, everything was wonderful to the last very detail, I have rarely in my life been so satisfied with such an experience. It was the best thing we did in Ubud and we will cherish these memories for many years to come. Made, Kadek and family, thank you so much, we will miss you!Marie and Michal

Delicious food you won't find in the restaurants. It's a few days after our cookery course (and in spite of having helped cook the food on the course) we still compare every meal to the food we made with Made, Putu and Kadek. It gave us a real taste of Bali. We have had a number of delicious meals since but nothing has beaten it for taste. We are tempted to do the course all over again just to eat that food again. The family is so friendly and welcoming. The course is very relaxed and the small groups gives a really personal touch to a day which is much more than just a cookery course. We loved it and would recommend it to anyone going to Ubud.

Fantastic Day. Fantastic Balinese family business.. This deserves a higher rating. Been going 7 years but only a short time on TripAdvisor so not many reviews which stop it from being higher up the list. I have done a cooking class before and still really enjoyed this. They adapted the menu to suit that we had cooked things before. My young son was entertained by fishing while we cooked. The market and rice field visit were more extensive and inclusive than before. Being on a rural farm also made it special. Your money goes to the locals. All my family agreed it was a 5 star day.

Heaven !. We had a lovely time at Made and Kadek's. We visited the market, the rice fields, their home before learning how to cook lovely tasty Balinese dishes... Best lunch ever ! The place is truly amazing, we were only the two of us which made it even better. They do not take big groups, which I think is great compared to bigger cooking class where you can be 15. Bonus: we even got the recipe and a doggy bag! Great time, lovely food. Highly recommended !
Amazing experience !!!. Very nice familly who makes you discover the real Bali! Beautiful place in the rice fields and amazing food ! Probably our best memory in our Bali trip !

Great experience!. Both my wife and I highly recommend this wonderful cooking experience. We first visited a local market where we were able to purchase some of the local specialities and discover many new fruits and vegetables grown in Bali. A quick drive and we arrived at the family farm and had fun harvesting some rice using the traditional method. The cooking class was well organised and Made, our wonderful hostess, helped us cook some delicious cuisine; the corn fritters were unbelievable! Best of all group sizes are kept at a minimum as there was only another couple in our party. This local family are amazing hosts. Don't miss out on this great day!

The highlight of our trip. I strongly recommend this cooking class. We went to the food market and tasted different things. After that we visited their home and took a walk surrounding the most beautiful nature. The hosts were so welcoming and introduced us to the Balinese culture. The food and spices were so fresh, coming straight from the garden.

Wonderful day out. We've just come back from an amazing day with the Be Bali Day Cooking Class. We were so well looked after from the moment we were picked up from our hotel in Ubud. We were taken to the local markets, to see rice paddies and hear about the process, the family home and garden, to see their beautiful homestay, and that was all before we started cooking! We had delicious vegetarian meals with much of produce grown on their farm. There was only four of us and we had the best time, helping and learning at each stage of making the meal before sitting down to enjoy it. We even had some monkeys come to say hello! Highly recommend to anyone visiting Ubud!! An intimate and authentic experience. Thank you!!

Fourth time we've done it!. We visit Made, Kadek and the family everytime we visit Bali. We bring friends to experience it too and it never disappoints. The family are lovely and the area is purely breathtaking. The food you cook is so good but there's always so much of it that you can never finish it all. We will continue to do the cooking school when we visit Bali.

Best tradtional Balinese cooking class in Ubud. My daughter and I decided to take Made's cooking class and we both agreed it was one of the most interesting things we participated in. They offer more than cooking, the day starts with a trip to the local market with Kadek to pick up veggies for the class. Most of the herbs and vegetables come from their farm. After the market, Kadek took us back to the family compound where we picked other veggies and herbs, got a tour of a traditional Balinese compound and the temple and then toured their farm. The cooking class is fantastic for those who do and don't cook alike. You'll learn how the herbs are used, have the choice to participate and receive a list of recipes in the end. The classes are kept small so everyone can work together and the best part is the lunch at the end. Made was sure to include vegetarian options for me and it was an afternoon well spent. I would highly suggest taking this class!!!

Amazing Balinese Experience. Amazing Balinese experience. The tour was more than I could have expected. From the market, to the tour of the family property and the wonderful cooking class. All guides (family members) are wonderful, friendly and extremely personable. The food was amazing and the guide was great at explaining the ingredients, methods and involving us.A very intimate and personal experience with only 2 couples on the tour.Azimg experience from the first email enquiry to the return to our hotel.

Amazing experience!!. The family is very friendly. They took us on a journey with many traditional elements of the balinesian lifestyle. This experience was a real highlight for us in Bali! We definitely recommend it!

A wonderful day learning about life in Bali. Would recommend this class and tour if you are interested in learning what living in Bali is really like. The BeBaliDay family replied to our email quickly and we made a reservation (for two) for a cooking class. We were picked up in the morning for a trip to—and tour of—the local market. Then on to the family compound where we learned about life at their home and farm. We were lucky to have a quick tour of their new b&b/villa overlooking the rice terraces. On to our cooking class with Made and cousin where much was learned about Bali spices and cooking. A delicious lunch followed (with enough leftovers to take with us to have for dinner). The day was topped off with a lesson on making offerings. Thank you to the Be Bali Day (and Stay) family!

Fantastic cooking class!. This cooking class was recommended by our private driver, Wayan Juli, https://www.tripadvisor.com/Attraction_Review-g297701-d3683097-Reviews-Be_Balinese_Private_Tours-Ubud_Bali.html#review_361466821. Juli's family runs this cooking class, and it was a great experience. The day started with Kadek picking us up from our hotel, and taking us to a local market. There were only 4 people in our class, so it was a very personal experience. He showed us various vegetables and fruits in the market, and explained how they are used in Balinese cooking. Next, we went to his home and toured around the complex. He showed us in detail things like the yard, family temple, kitchen, and living areas. It was a great look into local Balinese culture. After that, we walked around the farm area, learned about many different local fruits and vegetables growing there, met some animals, and took a few pictures around their beautiful homestay available for rent. I would definitely consider staying there the next time I'm in Bali.Finally, we headed towards the cooking area, where we were greeted by Made, who lead us through the cooking class. Made was a great host and it was a very hands on experience. We went over all the ingredients in detail and worked together to create the spice mix and entrees. I helped make the corn fritters, steamed pork, chicken skewers, and peanut sauce. At the end, we probably had enough food for 10 people, but there were only 4 of us. 2 in our group were vegetarians, so we made both vegetarian and non-vegetarian options. Recipes for everything were provided for us at the end. Made was a great instructor and all of us had a great experience! The food was delicious and we even got to takeaway the leftovers along with some fresh fruits picked from their gardens. Thank you Kadek and Made!

Balinese for one day. Our pick up was at eight am, by one of the family members of Be Bali. We picked up another couple and then went to the local market. A market where no other tourists were to be found. Our guide told us a lot about the local products and let us taste several fruits. Despite the fact that we were on the market for quite long (two hours), it was nice to see this part of Bali society.After the market we drove to the family compound. Again, it took quite a long time in the burning sun to show us around. Interesting though to hear about traditional families and their habits.Then the real cooking started. A lovely woman told us everything we needed to know. First she showed us the garden with al the herbs and spices. Later we started chopping and stirring. The food was real good and nothing like you see in the standard warungs. While cooking, you are in the jungle, having a very nice view.Really nice to go here while in Ubud!

Great location, great food!. After we got picked up at our stay in Ubud we picked up another person and went to a local market, which is very different from the tourist markets and was a nice experience. Then we drove to the farm where we got a tour around the compound we're the family lives, which was very humbling. When it was time for our cooking class we picked some fresh ingredients from the garden and made some delicious Balinese dishes. We were with a small group of 5 young people which was nice! Very friendly guide & staff, lots of explanation. We had a lovely day. I'd also recommend staying at their bungalows which are very serene, beautiful, luxurious and have the best located pool and view!

Best Day in Bali so fad. We had the most amazing time!! My expectations were already high due to the amazing reviews in trip advisor but I was still so surprised and overwhelmed by the genuinely nice and friendly people we were with on the day. Food was amazing, atmosphere even better. Best location in Ubud, best experience we've had. I'll say if you book a cooking class anywhere else for the price of 350.000 Rr and it isn't here I can only say I feel sorry for you. Such an experience and the best food we've eaten in Bali. And!!! We got to bring home leftovers.. What more can you ask for? I recommend anyone and everyone to spend the day here.

If you're looking to avoid huge group lessons, and want a more personal humbling experience, book this class!. Picked this based on its 100% record of 5* reviews, and we weren't disappointed. As Ubud is a place where travelers rely religiously on trip advisor, I was desperate to escape cooking a dumbed down menu in an over crowded class, which is what I feared and read that the top listed places would offer. Managed to book 48 hours in advance, and we were the only 2 in the class, so a really personal touch! (Max group size is 8).We met Kadek in his air conditioned car at 8 at our hotel, headed to the locals market where we were introduced to a handful of produce we'd not seen before, and even haggled for some of the gorgeous locally woven baskets. We then went to Kadek's home, where he walked us through the rice fields explaining the irrigation system, took us to the house and farm where he and his family live, explained in detail the 'offerings', shrines and rituals, then went to the outdoor kitchen, set high in the most gorgeous forest /jungle setting, where his wife Made started our lesson. In total we did 6 dishes; cornfritters, chicken soup, fish steamed in banana leaf, minced pork in banana leaf parcels, chicken satay, veg salad with shredded coconut. All complex enough you'll learn something, but easy enough that you'll be able to make them again without the teachers. You get the recipes at the end, and I think you'd easily get all required ingredients back home at an Asian supermarket to reproduce the dishes.So if you're looking for a boutique operation, where you'll get more under the skin of Balinese culture and cooking, then book with this company. Equally they have a stunning 2 bed villa with infinity pool set in the forest which would be sensational for a short visit for a group of 4!! It's on airbnb at 150 USD per night, but well worth it!

Amazing Experience, Amazing Food!. The Be Bali Day was an amazing experience. Kadek picked us up from our hotel and took us to a local market to get fresh ingredients for our cooking class. He explained various items at the market and how the Balinese used them. We were told normally we would get the food from their garden but it was currently out of season. We then went back to the family's compound and he showed us their Balinese home where he and his extended family live along with their family temple. We saw the family farm and then had a cooking class with Kadek's wife. We made many traditional Balinese dishes and they were all delicious. All in all, it was a wonderful experience and it was awesome to be Bali for a day!

We loved it. We did the cooking class this morning and we loved it! Right on time the driver picked us up and showed us around in the local market and even is home! The cooking class took place in a beautiful area, surrounded by nature. They use as many vegetables and spices from their own garden as possible, so it can't be more fresh! The food you will prepare with them is so delicious! They were all so friendly and they spoke Englisch very well! Just go there.. And enjoy! ps. they've got a nice spot over there as well where you can stay for a couple of days. It looked realy beautiful, perfect if you want to spend a couple of days in the middle of nature (it is quiet).

Fabulous!. We (family of four - boys aged 11 and 14) all thoroughly enjoyed the Be Bali Cooking Class. We enjoyed chatting and getting to know out driver and guide as we headed to the market. The market was fabulous, a terrific opportunity to take some photos, learn more about the local produce and see the locals going about their day. The tour around the family compound was interesting and again gave us an insight into Balinese life. The kitchen we cooked in was ideal - clean, lovely views and ample room for us all to participate as much as we wanted to. The food was delicious, Made explained things well and was able to accommodate our son's dietary limitations. A definite highlight of our trip to Bali and certainly some of the best food we ate whilst away.

Excellent cooking class in the heart of the countryside in Ubud. We spent half a day cooking with husband and wife team Mate and Kadek in their home in the countryside in Ubud.We started with a trip to a local market and then to their village compound. Their large family all live here and they have many temples and large outdoor space which they took us round. The rice paddies was my favourite landscape and they have a villa with pool there for guests.The cooking class was incredible - we learnt to make sweetcorn fritters, veg salad with shredded coconut, chicken satay, steamed pork in banana leaves and banana fritters.They gave us the recipes at the end to take away with us which was handy. Definitely excellent value for money to discover Indonesian culture and also see the countryside.

Be a Balinese Cook for 1 Day . Today we did the cookingclass from be Bali and I really enjoyed it. We've seen a lot from the local life of Bali. First we went to the market and we saw where locals do their groceries. After that, we walked through the Village and iMade (m) showed us how the fruits and vegetables grow and hé showed us his house. We learned a lot about the Balinese family culture and the ceremonies. We walked a bit downhill because it is time to cook! I've never cooked with an amazing view like this! Ni Made (f) is our hostess for the Day and she learned us everything about the spices and how we can cool the tasty Balinese dishes. I cook a lot in Holland, but now we have to do some other techniques, so sometimes I felt a little bit clumsy :-). We made our own lunch and it tastes soooo good! The family is really hospitable and you could ask whatever you want. I'm not used to have such a big lunch in Holland. So they gave us a 'doggybag' to carry the food back to the hotel. I've had an amazing day and I recommend this cookingclass to everyone.

Its an experience not just a cooking class.. Fantastic. Lovely family.We went with our two young girls who didn't want to do a cooking class (my wife also wasn't so keen). Everyone left extremely happy.We had a tour of their family home (Balinese style with each sub-family having their own small compound), a walk around the beautiful farm picking things to put in the lunch and walk through their rice fields and finally cooked lunch together.Next to where you do the cooking class there are two ponds stocked with fish - our children each caught a fish (including a 1.5kg catfish) which also got cooked and served.The corn fritters were fantastic and probably the largest serving of veggies our kids had during our entire holiday (they almost polished off the entire platter themselves).One of the best family things we did in Bali.
Amazing experience!!!. Friendly people, extremely affordable 350000 IRD with hotel pick up. An experience like no other... we definitely recommend

Outstanding Authentic Experience . While Bali can be so full of touts, partying and Bintang T-shirts, this is one experience that floored us with its authenticity. Putu and his beautiful family welcomed us into their life for a day. It is so much more than a cooking class, it is an opportunity to see a Balinese family compound and farm, then learn how families cook and eat. And boy did we eat!!! It was beyond delicious and they adhered to our dietary restrictions no problem. Their tiny son even caught a fish and we cooked it up right there! We made at least 6 different things and all were amazing. We also walked through the local rice fields and learned about that industry and its importance. Finally we were able to sit by (didn't have bathing suits!) the most beautifully situated pool I have ever seen, and a herd of about a hundred monkeys passed by, right stinkin there!!! It was like a dream!!! They also have a beautiful Airbnb property which the pool was part of. This was top to bottom a glorious day! Book it!!!

The real deal. We went for a cooking class but we recieved more than we expected , we also discovered the local Balinees culture. Putu ( our guide) first showed us how he and his family ( 3 generations) live and then he showed us the family farm giving information about all the herbs and plants in a way it didn't get boring! During this tour we where collecting our ingredients for the cooking class. The cooking class took place in the middle of the jungle and the food we prepared under the supervision of putu's sister in law was delicous!!!! We highly recommend this cooking class

Overwhelmed with Hospitality, Culture, and Incredible Food!. We experienced Be Bali Day's Cooking Class and it was the best experience we have had in Bali (we have been here for a month now)! When traveling, we love to meet locals and learn about the culture. With Be Bali Day's Cooking Class we were overwhelmed with way more than just cooking. We learned a whole new way of life and living. We didn't realize what we had signed up for!:) Made welcomed us into her family's compound and toured us through their home, their rice terraces, their organic garden and then we learned to cook a huge meal! Made was lovely and answered all of the questions we had along the journey. We loved the local, culture experience and we actually want to do it again! We would highly recommend this experience to everyone traveling to Bali. We enjoyed it so much, we wrote four blog posts about it here. Check them out for more pictures and our experience!http://nuventuretravels.com/2015/06/22/drenched-in-balinese-culture-putu-part-1/http://nuventuretravels.com/2015/06/28/drenched-in-balinese-culture-made-part-2/http://nuventuretravels.com/2015/06/29/drenched-in-balinese-culture-nyoman-part-3/http://nuventuretravels.com/2015/06/22/drenched-in-balinese-culture-ketut-part-4/

Cook with local three generations family and farm. What a delight to meet a local Kedewatan family, see their farm that has been in the family for generations and have a cooking class experience with them. Made took us to the local market and we also picked organic ingredients from her husband's family farm, including fern tips, kaffir lime, pandan and salam leaves. We went for a walk through one of their rice fields and cooked in an open air kitchen with wood fired stoves and a lovely green view high above the Ayung river. We cooked together with Made and her cousin, making sate lilit ayam (minced spiced chicken on lemongrass skewers, tum babi (aromatic steamed port in Salam and banana leaf), coconut and bean salad to name just a few of the dishes! We're definitely inspired to cook Balinese when we get home!

Great Cooking Class, Balinese Cooking. Spent half a day (8 am - 1 pm) attending Ketut's Balinese cooking class. First hour on the local market in Ubud, being introduced to many Balinese spices and vegetables. Then to his cooking school. Instructions were very good - and funny. Lots of hand-on experience. We made several basic Balinese sauces (bumbu Bali, peanut sauce) from scratch. Then used these to prepare several dishes. We then had lunch eating what we cooked. Having done some Indonesian cooking at home already, this class really added good understanding about the spices and their flavors. And all was done with a lot of humor by Ketut and his staff. Highly recommend this activity. Whether you're into cooking or not.

Spicy SAUCE!. Absolutely hilarious day, never expected to laugh so much during a cook class but Ketut is so funny, as well as an excellent chef and teacher! The pace of the class was perfect and the food at the end was beautiful. Would just mention that it might not be suitable for a more experienced chef as it's definitely aimed at beginners! Also if you do the afternoon class instead of the morning class you don't take the trip to the market - just FYI.

So many laughs. You will not be unsatisfied with this trip to school. Set in a peaceful part of Ubud, amongst the rice fields you'll create a swagger of dishes, along with the help of your instructor Made, who is a bonafide pun machine. Good value, great quality and excellent hospitality and support. Look forward to coming back and doing an advanced course!

Fantastic cookery course. After being picked up at 8am we went to the market with one of Ketut's staff. There, we were introduced to all sorts of Balinese food ranging from cakes derived from rice or palm sugar to fruits vegetables and spices. The marketeers were happy as our Balinese host helped himself to food for us to try and they then discounted the price of our purchases. We were driven to Ketut's kitchen where we prepared nine traditional balinese dishes. Ketut's laughter made us smile as we worked as a group under his instruction. At the end of preparation the food was served like a banquet. It was delicious and the portions were huge, more than we could eat.

Great experience. So happy to have gone to this,such a great experience and really good price,we were taken round the market with a guide who spoke to us about all the different foods and traditions, they collected us from our hostel and then took us to the cooking class,as a class there were about 6/8 people which is a great size,for each dish the pairs made different things,it meant that we could all practice different dishes and also different methods of cooking/chopping ect,the food we made was SO good and the staff that work there were all lovely,nothing is too much for them and they were happy to help find alternatives for my friend who is vegan,she got some of her own food since the noodles had egg in they bought out some rice noodles for her!at the end we got to sit down all together to eat and you even get a little certificate to say you completed a days cooking course,the location is beautiful aswell just outside the forest and you can see it all!they even dropped us back at the end of the day,would recommend!!

Intimate and lots of fun!. This was a really awesome experience. The cooking instructors were super funny and really informative. The meal was excellent and we had such a great sense of accomplishment knowing that we made it (with help of course). The class attendants were just a Dutch couple, my husband and I so it was really intimate. I would definitely recommend this class for anyone visiting Ubud.

Great experience for the whole family. We went to Ketut's cooking class with our 7 and 5 year old daughters. Enjoyed visiting the markets first to see all the ingredients we would be using. They split our class in half with just our family in the one class and everyone else in the other. This was a nice touch as we didn't feel rushed with our young children. Our chef was fantastic with us and our girls. We all had a great time while learning to cook delicious Balinese foods. Couldn't recommend enough
Come and enjoy Ketut's laugh and cooking course ;-). You can come here to learn how to cook indonesian food. The course is nice. Ketut's laugh will seal the deal!

Grrat cooking class. Really enjoyed this cooking class. Went to ubud market before cooking delicious balinese food. Can totally recommend the cooking class, especially because ketsu is a lovely chef with his friendly, funny and warm personality :)
Great experience. A professional team and lots of laughter. Delicious meals and perfect scenery outside Ubud. Just do it!Suksema.

Most fun we had on our trip. Any trip to Ubud Bali should include a half day class at Ketut's facility. He is an amazing teacher and everyone who was with us declared our time there to be the most fun we had on our trip. Don't miss the chance to learn about all the ingredients that go into a great Indonesian meal

Lots of Laughter & Learning. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed this class. The whole schedule was well organized, we were picked up from our hotel on time and taken to a market to get an overview of some of the ingredients we would be using. We were then taken to the class which is nicely laid out. 2 classes were taking place at the same time each in their own area - we had a group of 7. Ketut was a great teacher who had us laughing throughout. The pastes and dishes we put together have certainly enhanced our cooking repertoire. The group sat down together to lunch on our creations which were all very delicious. The kitchen assistants and drivers were lovely and helpful throughout. I unfortunately left my phone in the car and Ketut arranged for a driver to return it promptly which was very helpful and a relief. Definitely recommend this class

Amazing Balinese experience-learning to cook most popular balinese dishes with the bet chef in Bali!. This was our second visit at Ketut's cooking class and we loved it just as much as we did the first time-Ketut is always smiling and is happy to help you with advices on how to cook delicious traditional food! His staff came to pick us up at Sayan rice firlds and we went to visit the market first. Ketutu nicely explained about the spices that are common in Balinese kitchen.  After that we went to his cooking station/house in the middle of a rice field. We cooked in pairs and were prepairingn the food from the begining to the end.The only thing I missed the second time is, that we didnt learn about the traditional balinese home, process of coconut oil making and we didnt make offerings as we did the first time when we visited him.In any case-this class was a lot of fun and i wish to Ketut a long-time success with his classes! Would recommend him to anyone who visits Bali!

Awesome Experience. My boyfriend and I are traveling alone and thought this would be a good chance to meet people and learn about Balinese cooking.When we arrived we found out we were the only two for the evening class, I would recommend trying the morning where you get to go to the market. Ketut was amazing! So funny and entertaining, made us smile so much! You cook quite a few dishes and at the end of it you get all the recipes to take with you. And of course eat the food you cook. Such an awesome place and experience! I highly recommend this!

Great fun and great food!. We had so much fun at Ketuts cooking class! We were picked up at our hotel by a friendly driver (who even stopped at the shop on the way to buy us breakfast!) and taken to Ubud market where we met our guide and 2 other couples for a tour of the market. Here our guide taught us about the various fruit, vegetables, herbs and spices they commonly use in Balinese cooking. We tried some green bananas and some snakeskin fruit! From here we all jumped in a car and headed to the cooking class where we were greeted by the big smile of Ketut! Ketut really did make the class memorable, with his phrases and infectious laugh! 2 weeks later and I'm still saying "Bumbo Bali!"in his way! As a group (12 people in total) we prepared 3 key sauces that we then used for the dishes. Then under the guidance of Ketut and his assistants, we made a chicken curry, satay, noodles, tuna, and soup in our pairs. He did offer a vegetarian menu but we were all non-veggies. Once all the dishes were cooked we moved to the open sided restaurant area to tuck into the amazing food. Ketut gave us all print outs of the recipes so we cook practise them at home. It was such a fun morning that we will remember for many years to come!

Learn a variety of dishes, have lots of fun and eat your heart out!. I joined this class with two friends of mine. We are amateur but aspiring cooks and thoroughly enjoyed this class. Taught by Ketut himself, he is very warm and has an infectious laugh that lifts the mood. All work is mainly based on cooking, all cleaning and sorting is sorted by helpers. You then sit down to eat and have a copious amount of food to get through, all very tasty stuff! At last, you leave with a certificate and recipes to try at home.

Good fun & delicious food! . Did Ketut's Bali Cooking Class whilst on a trip to Ubud with my friends, it was really fun and the dishes we made were delicious. The mie goreng and chicken satay with peanut sauce were my favourite! You also get a copy of the recipies to take home. Ketut is a very friendly guy who loves to laugh! I would recommend this class to anyone who is interested in cooking some authentic balinese food!

Keturts cooking school fantastic fun. it was a great day from start to finish They pick you up form your hotel and return you there .you meet people from around the world all learning to cook Indonesianwith foods and spices that some of us had never used it was a great fun day that went to fast .we all got to sit down to a lunch of what we all cooked

So much fun. Ketut's cooking class was awesome for the following reasons:1. It's well organized.Every step of his class was so well organized. From the moment you start cooking until you eat the meal you always have something interesting to do or learn. 2. Meeting other people.Ketut has you start cooking with your partner (if you came with a wife/husband/friend) but then he gets everyone to split up to pound different pastes or do different tasks. Our class had people attending from all over the world and it was interesting chatting with all of them about food and their experiences in Bali. We met a couple that had attended his class four years in a row because they enjoy the food and meeting other travelers so much. 3. The foodThe food we made was so delicious! We ground and pounded out pastes and sauces by hand and even got to help cook the sates over a charcoal grill. 4. KetutKetut was so warm and friendly. He laughs and jokes throughout the whole class and I couldn't help but laugh along. It really set the tone for a fun afternoon

Nice and funny cooking class. We spent a really nice afternoon during this cooking class which is 10-15min minutes away from the main road. The cook are very friendly and entertaining. They explain you everything in detail and were very well vetted in conveying their knowledge in an easy and understandable manner.

Where is the 6 Star Rating???. My fiancé and I went there after rafting as a last minute "to do list item", & ketut had such an amazing personality that he literally took everyone of us in the class and had us smiling, laughing and happy which in today's world and mixes of people in groups is nearly impossible but this guy will do it... Take the class and I guarantee you will be leaving the same review as I am. It's ok if you want to copy and paste mine lol... Enjoy

Just amazing!. My partner and I thoroughly enjoyed this class. My partner is an avid cook and I am a beginner to say the least. This experience was amazing. And the food was delicious. The food is not too crazy and is perfect for those from all over the world. Left feeling very satisfied and with a bunch load of recipes to take home! Highly recommend.

Awesome experience!. Ketut has the biggest smile, he is so friendly and welcoming, as are his staff. We loved learning how to prepare and cook Indonesian foods and the lunch was so tasty! We enjoyed the market tour in the morning also. Highly recommend this experience!
Funniest chef on earth. The cooking class was awesome!It's well arranged. The food was fantastic !!! The chef was super funny but really professional !

Brilliant!!. Simply a ton of fun from start to finish. I can't recommend Ketut and his team highly enough he is a truely lovely person with a big heart and even bigger personality. My husband left his sunglasses on the table and Ketut himself jumped on his scooter in the pouring rain and caught our driver part the way home just to return them. We were blown away. Loved the class, the food just everything. Thank you for a great experience :)
best cooking class ever!!! . It was awesome!! the food and the atmosphere was just perfect! and Ketut...the funniest and happiest chef i've ever met!!! :) thank you for the unique expereince!!

Excellent. The whole experience was excellent. We spent just over 4 hours with Ketut and his colleagues and everything was excellent. The tour of the market was informative and a marvellous look into the ingredients of Bali and, when we arrived at the outdoor kitchen, the views and set up were excellent. Ketut is incredible positive, friendly and has the best laugh I've ever heard. My partner felt ill during the session and they did everything to help and made our day. Great value for money, exceptionally friendly, delicious food and a great insight into Balinese cuisine. If there was an advanced session I'd return for sure! I now have a new satay recipe as it blows mine completely out the water. Thank you Ketut and friends!

Absolutely fantastic . I could not rate ketut highly enough. Both him and everyone involved were friendly, warm and welcoming and Ketut himself was absolutely hilarious with the most infectious laugh I have ever heard!I was unfortunate enough to feel faint half way through (always eat breakfast!) but I was so well looked after! I genuinely could not fault it.From start to finish it was a spectacular experience with wonderful food and great company and I will be recommending to anyone who visits Bali to go visit Ketut!

Super moment and great class. Great coking class in a very nice and quiet open house in BaliThe staff is amazing and very helpful!In one morning we managed to cook a lot and have fun!We also loved going to the market in the morning and seing the different fresh products used for the main dishes we cooked!Highly recommended
