Great!. The food was delicious and they assist you really well. I lovend this place. It is also set on a great location in the middle of the Rice fields! The staff is super friendly and the chauffeur even invited us to a Hindi ceremonie in his village. We were the only tourists.So super good food, great location and super friendly staff. What do you want more?The recipe? They give it to you at the end of the class and you can contact them by e-mail if you have Some troubles with recreating one of the dishes. So check it out!

Absolutely fantastic . I had wanted to do a cooking class in Ubud for my last 3 trips here, and I'm so glad I finally did one with Ketut's Bali cooking class. The guide was excellent, spoke great English and had us all laughing with his jokes and sense of humour. We started off with a visit to the local market where we saw the locals in action and the guide explained all the different veges and herbs and spices which are commonly used in Balinese cooking. The location of the class was gorgeous - overlooking rice fields in a very peaceful part of Ubud. All the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, and they took care of the cleaning up so we could concentrate on the cooking itself. The class was very enjoyable, with step by step instructions, and suited everyone from beginner cooks to those with more cooking experience. We made a total of 3 sauces, fried Balinese chicken, steamed fish in banana leaf, Mie Goreng, satay chicken with peanut sauce and soup, plus an unusual but delicious dessert of sweet potato in a palm sugar sauce with icecream... Yum! Absolutely loved it and would definitely recommend.

Very fun and informative class!. We started with a visit to the market where our teacher explained the different ingredients and its purpose. Then we went to our "classroom", which is a really quaint and spacious outdoor kitchen beside a farm. Our teacher was very funny and he always checked in on our progress to ensure we were doing fine. Despite being a small class of just 3 people, we were able to cook a wonderful 5 course meal with the help of our teacher and his assistants, who were all rather fluent in English. Food was great, and the best part was, mr Ketut personally handed us a certificate at the end with a copy of the recipe book so we could replicate them at home. Wonderful time spent in ubud learning about Balinese cuisine :)
Very good cooking class outside Ubud. Ketut is a very nice person and the class is easy-to-follow. The cooking is in an outdoors kitchen , looking at the rice fields. The kids loved it as well!

Actually Payuk Bali cooking class. The photos and website are actually a different class called Payuk Bali. They are amazing and informative, the food was delicious and we felt like amazing chefs by the end! Highly highly recommend it to any amateur chefs or anyone that likes good food.
Wonderful Balinese cooking class. Fantastic cooking class, hands on , lots of fun and delicious food.highly recommended. thanks to Ketut and staff.Kim and family. australia

Awesome and great fun cooking class. One of the best things we ve done in bali. The group size was brilliant, all well prepared, the tour through the ubud market everthing very well organized. Thank you once again. Totally recommend it.

Highly recommend this class. Great half day out - highly recommend! We had a great guide, he was knowledgeable, patient and lots of fun. Start with a tour of the markets where he explained the ingredients, spices, and how it worked. Then up to the cooking school. We had a great team of teachers helping the main guide, and we cooked an incredible menu - satay chicken skewers, mei goreng noodles, chicken curry, chicken soup, tuna parcels in banana leaf and to finish, caramelised sweet potato with ice cream. The pace was good. Everyone got to learn everything and we ate very well!! Highly recommend :)

A MUST DO....... This was the best thing we've done in Bali so far, I highly recommend you do this otherwise you would be missing out...It is such an amazing experience and you get so much for the price... It starts with a tour of the traditional market where all the food you are cooking with is explained - their English is perfect which makes it even better - you then go to the rice fields where again the process is explained and then spend a few hours cooking and then enjoying the meal... It is simply wonderful as a whole experience - I cannot praise these guys enough.... (And the food was AMAZING - and I can't cook at all)

Great experience. What a great morning we had, Ketut is quite the showman, he and all his efficient staff provided us with a very educational and interactive experience. I would highly recommend this class, the market experience was great and the lunch was lovely on completion.

Delicious Balinese Cuisine!. Great experience. Ketut is a convivial personality with a highly infectious laugh! He made it so much fun learning how to cook quite complex local dishes from scratch. If you join the morning session Ketut will take you on a tour of Ubud's farmers market. Well worth the experience. If you enjoy Balinese food, Ketut's cooking class is not to be missed!!

Alice. I went on the cookery course today based on the reviews I'd read on this page and am so glad I did. It was brilliant fun, Ketut creates a really good atmosphere and all the other staff were really friendly and helpful, highly recommend.

Best Cooking Class!. My friend and I went to Ketut's and loved the experience. Their main chef, Ketut, had a vibrant personality and a fantastic laugh! All of the staff was very professional! The food was wonderful and Ketut took us step by step through the cooking process. I can't wait to come back and do the class again! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

Amazing Balinese Cooking Class! . We had an amazing experience with Ketut's Bali Cooking Class! He and his staff are very professional and friendly. He offered a vegetarian option for my friend which was also amazing. You are a part of the experience from start to finish! I would come back in a heartbeat! Ketut has a great laugh and you can tell he loves his job as a chef! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!

Loved it.. Ketut was a perfect host. Very congenial with an infectious laugh. Loved the food, the class suitable for all level of cooks. When I found that I didn't have one of the recipes I emailed him, and he had emails it back to me within hours. Favourite activity of my trip to Bali, and the food was delicious.

Fantastic cooking class. It was our second cooking class visited in Ubud. We really enjoyed the time with Ketut and other staff, learnt new recipes and spend a really good time with indonesian cuisine. We started with pickup from our resort, then a tour at the Ubud market (very amazing place) and then we moved to the cooking class.

Highly recommended. Thoroughly enjoyed this cooking class with the highly entertaining Ketut. Lovely outdoor setting with friendly staff. Everything was very hygienic. We learnt to cook an array of dishes which were all amazing and we thoroughly enjoyed eating the fruits of our labour at the end of the class with an interesting group of travellers.

Fantastic!. Great experience, best cooking school in Ubud. We got a pickup from our villa, a tour of the local market, a visit to a rice field, and then taken to a lovely setting for the class. It was clean, pretty, and well set up. Staff were amazing with our young kids. Food was delicious. Highly recommend.

Excellent morning. I thoroughly enjoyed my cooking experience at Payuk Cooking class. The family were absolutely lovely. It was wonderful to learn about the Hindu offerings and the meaning behind them. The cooking itself was excellent, the food amazing.Pick up and drop off from the hotel was very convenient and I really loved the market tour, so many new and different foods!I definitely recommend this to anyone, you will not be disappointed.

Very authentic-delicious recipes! Fun morning. We loved the morning! Amazing food, great staff, super hygienic. They go the extra mile! We made little offering baskets after a trip to the local market-all food is brought at the supermarket though so is healthy and washed. Every meal that we made (made about 5) was great and learnt so much!

Miss L Luce . Three friends in early 20s. We had the afternoon class to ourselves. Picked up on time from our hostel. The chef had an amazing personality! Really friendly, made jokes and explained everything. Other staff members were friendly and helpful. Clean spacious kitchen area, open walls but shaded and sheltered. We created a wide selection of dishes! All aspects made from the sauces, meats to noodles of 6 Balinese dishes (1 starter, 4 mains as a buffet, 1 desert). Perfect amount of food for all of us. High level of involvement. Added extra, learnt how to make a offering, provided cold bottled water throughout the class, recipe book and received certificate of attendance. Would recommend to all group sizes and ages!!

Great place for kids and family . We first booked this place just for the wife, when we arrived there the kids and I decided to join in. It was an awesome experience , we all loved it , every step through the cooking process. The instructor was funny and kids just loved him. There was plenty of food served at the end of the class. Just be prepared for this. Highly recommend this place.

Funny and interesting experience. We passed by yesterday to book a cooking class and this morning at 8 o'clock sharp a mini van reached our villa for pick up. We went to local market for a quick briefing about local ingredients and some shopping. Then straight to the venue, a complex of local houses. First we learn how to do a offer basket to put to the family temple. We were 11 person, french, italian, Chinese and some germans. The mood was funny and light and instructor take us in his on kitchen by the river. We start to learn how to do balinese sauce, "bamboo bali" peanuts sauce, cutting and mixing together all the ingredients. The we proceed to follow the receipts and we cook several dishes. A soup. A chicken with coconut sauce. A noddles, a tuna steam into banana leaves and a dessert. We follow all together the teacher with his own family members. A thin rain start drop and we were safe and comfortable. Nobody get bored and we enjoy all together the meal around twelve o'clock. But 1.30 we payed "300k" each and i can easily say was really money worth experience, considering you eating a 5 course meal. More then this the driver drop you wherever you prefer. People kind, Humble, generous with good mood. Definitely one of the best experience we did in Bali during the whole month. Very useful and funny!

Great and fun experience!. Very well run and organised experience. The team is super friendly and is positive all the time. I loved going to the market and learn about the local produce. The course is well paced and everyone gets to be active. Then we got to eat what we prepared and the food was delicious and so fragrant. Definitely a great activity if you are interested in different cuisines.
Excellent experience. Wonderful way to spend a day. Professionally organised,very friendlyand an insight into into local culture - retirednomads.com

Cannot fault! Great experience!. A very well run and organised cooking class. All of the staff were great. I don't know how they maintain such a high tempo and positive approach since they are very popular but everything went smoothly. It's hygienic and you get to cook a variety of different dishes and learn about the different ingredients in Balinese cooking. If you do the morning class you get picked up around 8am, taken to the food market for a quick tour and then you are driven to the family home to make a temple offering and to cook. Everything is well executed and the sit down lunch is delicious. Very much worth the effort!

Loved! Would do it all over again. . I didn't realize I would get a tour of the food markets before heading to the cooking class, so that was a nice surprise. Our guide was so knowledgeable and was full of energy which made the market a fun and informative part. The cooking class was very well organized and they explained everything in details. They were accommodating to people with allergies and vegetarians. The food we prepared was delicious and we learned a lot about the Balinese food culture and their culture overall. Wonderful experience. It was worth every penny !

Fantastic morning. Thoroughly enjoyed our vist to Payuk Bali. Transfers to and from the hotel and mineral water included in your day. Started with a tour of the local market and being introduced to ingredients and spices we would use that day. Super insight into daily life in Bali. Great to have a guide in a market place which otherwise would have been overwhelming. Then transferred up to the village cooking school where we made offerings and learnt about coconut milk and oil. The cooking itself was fun and well organised. Clear English instruction. Ketut was hilarious and a great host. The feast we had for lunch was terrific. Highly recommended day out!

A fun day. We went on this cookery class as a couple and were part of a group of around 10 people. We started with an interesting visit to ubud's market, where we learnt about different ingredients that we were to use later that day. We then headed to the cookery school which was set in a family home in the hills. We learnt about the significance of Hindu offerings and even got to make one for ourselves. We then set to work, making around 7 different things in a calm and informative environment. It was great to be cooking so close to nature, we even saw some monkeys in the trees around us. After around 3 hours we sat down to eat everything we'd cooked before being transferred back to our hotel. A great experience and great value for money.

Fun and delicious!. From the moment they picked me up at my villa until sitting down to enjoy our meal, it was great conversation and a pleasure cooking in the well-equiped outdoor kitchen.The visit to the market was really interesting (and quite helful for the rest of my trip), delicious tea when we arrived and different recipees to try out. If you like cooking and want to experience Balinese cuisine, you will not be disappointed.

Well organised. My 7 and 12 year old children joined me on this great class. We cooked the vegetarian menu which was really yummy. We enjoyed the Ubud market tour, learned how to make an offering and coconut oil. The staff were so friendly and helpful. It was very well organised and clean. Highly recommended.
Amazing Cooking Time!!!!!. It's a wonderful experience to cook a traditional bali meal!! Nice teachers, nice classmates, great foods!! Its a must to join this cooking class!!!

A delicious experience. Sempurna!. I highly recommend this class. It is a complete food and culture experience in a delightful location. The Payuk Bali staff picked my 7-year-old son and I up from our hotel. We learned about local ingredients and sampled ripe, local fruits--snakefruit, mangosteen, and marquisa--at the market. We received a refreshing, cinnamon-y welcome drink before crafting offerings to give before the start of the class. Ketut demonstrated the process of making coconut oil, and my son got to try his hand at grating coconut. The location of the outdoor kitchen is beautiful. It is well equipped and breezy. We cooked for hours and I never once felt too hot. Everyone is provided with a big chopping block, an apron, towel, and chef's knife. Water is available throughout the class. Food safety procedures were followed, and everything was run very professionally. Eleven people were enrolled in the course for the day, and together we created just as many dishes. The class staff did all of the boring and messy prep work ahead of time (washing produce, cleaning and chopping meats, and sorting ingredients) while we students were able to focus on the fun parts. We were actively engaged chopping, stirring, smashing, crushing, and sauteing fresh local herbs and vegetables all morning. We moved quickly from one task to the next, so nothing became tedious; ingredients and processes were aptly explained. Some participants chose to prepare a vegetarian menu, and we were told that several menus are available if you'd like to take more than one course (I would do it again!).My seven-year-old son was able to fully engage in all of the cooking. The staff was patient and caring with him, and he was very proud of his chef skills. He says, "Take your kid to the class! It was blast-tastic!" I would highly recommend the course for kids who are good listeners, probably over the age of 6. I don't think I would have enjoyed it as much if I'd had to assist my 4-year-old.No cooking class is worth it if the food isn't delectable, of course! We were all very ready to dine by the time our handmade lunch was served. Everything was tasty, but I especially enjoyed the satay, the long-bean salad, and the sambal. The sweet potato dessert and the satay were my son's favorites.We were picked up from our hotel at 8 am and didn't get back until 1:45, so the class was a bit longer than I'd expected. It takes a while to get to the eating part, so I would suggest eating breakfast before you go.It was a delightful experience, very professionally run, and I highly recommend it to anyone visiting Bali.

One of the highlights of our trip! A must for foodies. We booked this online through their website. Everything went smooth from booking, to meeting in the market, through class. The market tour was so informative and colorful, the recipes were easy to follow and the cooking class was great fun. Ketut is very amusing and knowledgeable (he went to cooking school and has over 20 yrs of experience) and the class is well planned and flows extremely well. We used traditional methods for grinding and pounding, a lot of the ingredient prep (peeling garlic, shallot etc) was done ahead of time and saved us valuable time, and they are VERY accommodating for food allergies or dietary preferences. Our group was fun, Ketut helpers were great as well and did all the dirty work of washing dishes and cleaning. We even got two bonus activities: making the daily offering and learning how to make coconut oil and milk. This is and EXCELLENT way to get familiar with Balinese cuisine and learn about traditional life in Bali. Totally recommended!!!

Had fun and learned stuff too!. My wife and I had a great time taking the morning cooking class while in Bali. The tour of the market was great - Saw the marked when it was set up for Local shoppers vs. tourists.Learned to make some good Balinese staples as well as some great information about local products. I had no idea there were so many different types of Ginger - now I love ginger even more than I did before!Don't expect to leave the day as a 5 star chef - just be sure to pick up a few good ideas, a recipe book, and a great experience to add to the list of trip accomplishments.

Great afternoon cooking class. 15 minutes by courtesy van from central Ubud to Laplapan village for this afternoon cooking class. We chose this option instead of the morning option which visits the markets first.Our Chef/Instructor welcomed us to the Bali house and explained how the typical household operates. We then learned to make the flower and pandan offering before beginning our preparation of the meal.Our Instructor was engaging and humorous with great English and the rest of the kitchen support crew were helpful in demonstrating skills.Excellent price 350,000 per person (NZ$38)

What an amazing experience. Not being a 'cool' myself and not too keen on cooking classes, I was convinced by friends to do one.... And this was our choice after some researching and reading reviews.All I can say is that I was blown away by the whole experience. Everything from the pick up at our villa, thorough the markets visit and then the actual cooking class was wonderful. All staff were very friendly, ready to assist if needed, and best of all made the whole experience enjoyable for everyone. The food we cooked was delicious. Will definitely be trying out the recipes when we get back home.For anyone looking for a cooking class, look no further than then place. We will be back for a different class they provide next time we return to Bali.

Great couples activity. Recently celebrated 10 years of marriage and along with two other couples also celebrating same. The guys surprised the ladies by taking the half day cooking tour with Payuk School. Had an absolutely great time - the market was fascinating - I recommend closed shoes! Then onto the school which is in typical Balinese style beautiful, open and on the edge of a ravine/river. The class was made fun and presentation of all the ingredients was a sensory pleasure. Cooking with the teams support was simple and fun. When it's all done - time to eat - the food was delicious. I have 2 suggestions please to add another ceiling fan in dining area and offer your guests a Bintang with the meal!

Half the day well spent. On my second day in Ubud, I decided to enrol myself in Payuk's cooking class and I think it was one of the best decisions I made on this trip. The service provided for the guests is incredible! First they pick you up from your hotel, take you to the market for some ingredients shopping, then you're taughed to make the traditional offerings to the Gods accompanied by some delicious iced tea, afterwards, the cooking begins! Everyone in the class is each tasked to do different roles and therefore makes this a very hands on activity. As a vegetarian, I was also granted the privilege to have my own menu separate from everyone else's. Anyway, once the cooking is over, we get to indulge in the food that we made. Let me tell you----it was nothing short of delicious!!!! I loved every minute of this class and I hope you find time to treat yourself to an experience like this with Payuk! Thank you!

What a great experience. I was super surprised at what a great experience this was. Picked up from your villa, taken for a tour of the local markets then brought back for some traditional offering making and then on to the food. Mede & Katut were unreal. Fantastic hosts, hilarious and generally awesome. The food was a hands on experience. And eating it after was a banquet. Exceptional experience.

5 stars isn't enough!!. Had the absolute best time. Starting with a fun trip around the markets with Made who was so funny learning about the food we are going to use later. Then we made an offering before making the food. Ketut was one of the funniest people I've ever met and a great guide for the cooking. The food was amazing and as an average cook this was definitely not too difficult and all abilities should try it. It's a very enjoyable time and you make lots of different things before getting to enjoy it all at the end. The highlight dish being the chicken satay in peanut sauce. Thank you so much for one of the best times the whole time I've been away travelling. Do it with these guys they're great!

So much fun and learnt so much!. Can't believe what a good time I had! You don't have to be a professional chef or anything, it's so fun for everyone. We were picked up from our hotel then went to the market which was very educational and cultural. Then we went to the house, where we learnt about life in bali and how to do an offering which was great. The food we made was so yummy, restaurent standard and so great to try! It was easy but still fun! However the best part was the two guys who ran it - Ketut and Made! Such funny and friendly people- some of the best we've met in Bali. They had us laughing all the way through - I'd do it again just to see them!Do this class - you won't regret it!!

Cooking fun!. Looking for something to do in Ubud, we came across the Payuk Bali cooking course. We didn't anticipate how much fun the chef and guide Katut would be to cook with. He makes trivial chopping and frying a joy with his humorous quips and unique laughter. He gives you specific steps toward making dishes like Sambal sauce, chicken satay, and steamed tuna. Best of all we got to eat the dishes we'd made at the end. This isn't a professional cooking course but more than worthwhile for half a day's fun.

So so fun!!. We got picked p 40minutes late because of the Ubud market fire and the car was stuck in a jam but none the less we got picked up at the end and visited another market.It was fun that he taught us how to make the Balinese offering, to make coconut oil from scratch and make a 7 course meal. We chopped, cooked, mashed and just learned so much in a span of 3 hours. Of course we get to enjoy the meal after which was amazing.There're only 4 of us so it was really intimate so it was nice. Made was really friendly and funny and explained to us in details about the basic of Balinese cooking. The best part is that we get to take home the recipe with us so we can make the same at home now! Thank you everyone, it was a really great learning experience for us!

Nice experience . We were there 2 kids. The staff was very friendly. The tour group was nice as well. We were happy to be there. My only suggestion is to add some (maybe just 1) kid friendly dish. So the kids could have fun too. This place is great, but however feels like a place for foodies- a bit more serious for kids.

Lots of fun. I had lots of fun visiting the colourful market, learning to make the pretty offerings that you see everywhere in Bali, helping to make some delicious food from scratch, and of course eating the food with my lovely classmates.Will I ever make sauce by pounding stuff in a giant mortar and pestle as we learned to do in this class? Of course not, but I think that I really will use the ideas I learned in this class to add to my repertoire.The village where this class is held is very pretty but there are a lot of mosquitoes - they will offer you some bug repellent, don't just casually spray it on, rub it everywhere that could vaguely be described as exposed!

Fun & what a gourmet. Went with my mate to the afternoon class and on that day we were the only ones in a class. Our Chef & kitchen staff were so friendly and fun people to cook together. Real experience even tho Im not that big fan of cooking. But we both enjoyed and had great afternoon & of course ended up in a proper food coma if I can say that way. Haha! Thank you! Definitely recommend!

Bali Cooking Class . I've always wanted to do a cooking class here in Bali, glad I did. We went to the market first and we were explained a lot of cooking spices and a lot of different types of fruits and vegetables that can be used in cooking that we are unable to get at home.The cooking class was excellent, also with a sense of humour. We also had a great group of people from all over the world, every one got on well and worked together as we were all there for one thing, a fantastic lunch that we all cooked.The cooking class is very organised and if your thinking of having a go don't hesitate.

Great experience, must try!. We had an amazing time with my boyfriend during this cooking class. We were taken to the market and explained about local spices, fruits and vegetables. Then we were making "offerings" for good and bad spirits, the guide told us a bit about their religion. And of course then we made 7 dishes! The staff were amazing, super helpful and made a lot of funny jokes. Highly recommend this in order to know more about real Bali.

Great fun. Spent the morning here and had a great time.Looked around the market first then off to class to learn how to make offerings, and then cook some beautiful Balinese food.All the staff were fabulous, we had a couple of young children do the class, and chef Ketut had them chopping, pounding and joining in with everything, explaining everything as we went along. we all thoroughly enjoyed the experience and I'd recommend it to all ages

Lot of fun, perfect for couples . Yesterday we did the cooking classes. Started around 8.30am in real Ubud Market with a good lesson about Balinese spices, veggies and fruits. Beaatvl. Great value tourAwesome. people awesome cook amd great dvay the best way to spend a day totally worth t the money

Even better than expected. enjoyed this day a lot more than expected, make 3 different types of good and dessert, they have some of the stuff ready but there is still a lot of work to be done, definitely hands on, ended up being one of the funnest days of trip and also one of the most delicious meals!do note it is outdoors but in the shade, we did the morning shift but still got a little warn, they do give you all the bottled water you can drink while there, book it!!!!

Amazing. I was with a private group for the cooking class. Ketut was so much fun. Very entertaining. Wonderful introduction to Balinese food and life. The cooking class began with a visit to the Ubud food market to have the different fruits,vegetables and spices explained. Our guide was a very knowledgeable young man,Madi, who explained the Balinese use of the foods in a very entertaining way.We then went to the compound where Madi showed us how to make the traditional offerings with beautiful fresh flowers.After that we met Ketut the chef- what a delightfully funny man! He explained the menu we would be cooking and explained and showed us the difference between the different types of ginger, chillies etc.The morning ran very smoothly with the kitchen team handing out ingredients and taking away dirty dishes like magic! The food was delicious and we really enjoyed interacting with staff who without exception were friendly and very professional.I would highly recommend this cooking class for anybody who is interested in food or the Bali way of life. Real Balinese experience. Our friends recommended this cooking class to us and we were not disappointed. It runs like a well-oiled machine with dirty pans and plates removed by almost invisible worker bees. The chef Ketut takes you to the market to give you an idea of a typical Ubud food market where locals get supplies. You get to taste the local (exotic to us) fruit and get some great pics. Next you go to their living compound where he teaches you to make an offering and you are allowed to say a little prayer and place your offering at their family temple. I would have liked this to be a more formal affair but I suppose it was difficult us being a big group. Our group was 13 which although sounds like a lot was easily managed by the staff. You all get a turn chopping/ crushing/ frying etc parts of the meal and at the end get to eat it! The meal consists of a 3 course and free water - beer is on offer at a price. The recipes are given to each participant after the class. This is a good way to spend a half day in Bali!
Thank you for making me feel 'more Balinese' . Thank you for a great exprience . It's not my first time come to Bali but it's a new thing to do in Bali when you came to Payuk Bali cooking class

When we realize that time is our most prized possession Payuk is sooo worth the time. A great experience with a lovely family. Laughter, lessons and good eating ! We had the best time! Easily planned through email, we were transported both ways in a safe vehicle...

Cooking, laughing and good food. We had a glorious morning lunch in Ubud! Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Everything is organised perfectly. If you are interested in balinese culture and tastes it is definitly one of the best things to do in Ubud, you will not be disappointed! Thank you Ketut!

Fun way to spend a day in paradise. My spouse and I actually signed up with Paon Bali for a cooking class, and I was taken aback when we discovered that Payuk Bali picked us up instead. Luckily, I had a SIM card and could look this place up, along with reviews. This company appears to be located quite near to Paon Bali, so I suppose they have some kind of co-marketing agreement to take each other's overflow. That said, it is a pretty serious service flaw to not at the very least inform clients that a substitution will take place. Imagine my shock and confusion when we arrived at the actual cooking school and it wasn't where I expected to be. This all said, I can't hold Payuk Bali responsible for any of the above issues, and in the end, the class and experience was nothing short of fantastic. If there is any blame to be held, it should lie squarely with Paon Bali, who took my reservation only to slough it off to Payuk. Now, on to the review of the class itself. We were picked up and driven to Ubud market, where our driver/guide Wayan provided our group of four with detailed information about the produce and spices used in traditional Balinese cooking. It was quite a detailed tour, and included not just culinary information, but cultural commentary as well. We were able to smell and taste the unique ingredients and get a flavor for the bustle of the local market, although most of the market action is over by 9 am. Then it was off to the school, where we were joined by four other students and our primary instructor, Made. Made provided insight into Balinese life on the family compound, and taught us how to construct our own basic temple offerings made from coconut leaves, bamboo picks, and flowers. We later had the opportunity to place our offerings and "make a wish". Next, we learned how to make coconut oil, which is the primary cooking oil in Bali. The cooking class then commenced. It is set up for 10 students paired in twos. We were each assigned various tasks - starting off with chopping, pounding, and grinding ingredients. You will not have the opportunity to do all the dishes from start to finish, but you will be able to try your hand at most of the aspects of preparing each dish. More importantly, you will learn a number of preparation methods, such as grinding and pounding ingredients by hand with a couple of different mortars, and steaming rice in a basket - things you would likely be using a food processor and rice cooker to do at home. From my view, this was less of a cooking class, and more of an opportunity to experience how food is prepared the traditional Balinese way. For me, this was a good thing. In all, our group prepared 6 dishes: a chicken soup, chicken sate', steamed and grilled tuna, a balinese style salad, a chicken dish, a dessert, and rice as an accompaniment. We also prepared three sauces: a bumbu sauce, sambal, and peanut sauce for the sate'. The food we prepared was combined and plated buffet style for lunch. I'm guessing that in the process the seasoning was refined by more skilled hands than ours. It was delicious and everyone left completely stuffed. You are also provided with printed recipes so that you can attempt to replicate what you learned at home. A hint - Some ingredients may be hard to get at home, and will require substitutions, so take some notes on what possible substitutions can be made while it is still fresh on your mind and you can ask questions of your instructor. Also, some steps on the printed recipes may not have a lot of detail, so writing down exactly what you actually did to prepare a dish will minimize confusion later.I would sum up this activity in one word: Fun! You will definitely gain enough skill and confidence from this class to attempt to make authentic Balinese food at home. More than that, you will gain some fascinating insight into Balinese life and culture. This is a very worthwhile experience, even if cooking is not necessarily your thing.

Nice experience . I love food , and i cook a lot. Live spicy too so i found this experience like something i must try, and now that i ve done it, I recommend you do it too.A driver come and pick us up from our hotel in Ubud at 8 am, we were with2 more persons too. Then we stoped in the market and we met Made , our guide in cooking. Made its a 24 years old boy, very funny and he told us about ingredients, he made a tour through the market and then we went to a place where we were welcomed with a delicious drink and then we made our first iOffering for Gods. Then we were taught about spices, and how to cook 3 courses of Indonesian food. We finished eating what we cooked. Atmosphere was relaxing and nice , they are very friendly, and its an interesting experience even if u like to cook or not.

Best experience in Bali!. We had a fantastic time learning from Wayan and the team at Payuk. They were informative and made the entire experience so much fun. They helped us get great prices in the market and told us about all the fruits we were unfamiliar with. Every single detail is thought out and prepared for the day. The meal prep was a great experience, and of course, the best part was enjoying the meal itself. We would highly recommend this experience to anyone who enjoys a good meal!

Brilliant, fun and insightful. From the moment Ketut picked me up to the moment he left us he was informative and engaging. The market tour was insightful and a great way to understand the culture. The cooking was a great experience and the end result superb. I would highly recommend this tour for its authenticity, both in food and the wonderful staff who hosted it. Thank you so much.
AMAZING EXPERIECE. We learned a lot and had so much fun. Really funny and good teacher. The market tour was very good and tried lots of things. 100% recommend

An engaging, full day of fun with a delightful family. The Payuk Bali Cooking Class is, hands down, the best we've ever experienced. The family running it is kind, welcoming, and more than anything - incredibly fun. They'll keep you engaged and entertained throughout, even if you're doing something as trivial as chopping vegetables.Often with day long tours, there can be lulls or sections where you're bored. Things can be dragged out and by hour 4-5, this is the last thing you want. I don't recall a single time this thought came to mind; time just flew by.The market tour is interesting, mostly to have some local fruits and spices specifically explained to you. We adore meandering through markets on our own, but in a foreign country, you don't always know what's what. Making our own offering was really fun too; after seeing thousands of them, it's nice to get a more intimate experience with them.We didn't make anything TOO exotic, but then again, for a fun cooking class, you don't want to be. We had a huge array of dishes though, and the best part was that we did EVERYTHING. Many cooking classes will streamline things by prepping certain ingredients for you, or even being the ones to throw them in the pan/pot. Payuk utilized a buddy system which meant you were always doing something, and the patrons were always the ones cooking. Making everything from scratch, yourself, makes it a genuine experience. The food we ended up with resulted in an enormous feast, and every dish was truly delicious.The class was suitable for all ages, as our group had children and seniors. The instruction was clear, simple yet fun and challenging, and, again - highly entertaining. Transfers were prompt and safe.

Absolutely fantastic authentic cooking class & great value for money . My friend & I attended the morning class on 6 Nov, after trying to get into a class the week prior but there was no availability day after day proving the popularity and need to book in advance. The whole experience was great fun, informative & value for money. The host family are a delight and strive to make you feel comfortable & fully engaged in the whole activity. Everyone gets to learn about local Balinese traditions & then it's time to learn about and taste the array of ingredients, and begin chopping, pounding, grinding, sautéing, steam, and assembling the food. Loads of photo opportunities, tasting along the way and asking questions etc... The main host I think he's Ketut is a trained chef with a background in hospitality and overseas hotels, is such a hoot! Full of character, a wicked sense of humour and joy to meet. At the end of the 4 hours you sit down to savour yours and your fellow class mates wide selection of Balinese dishes & take home copies of the recipes. Don't look elsewhere this is A MUST DO whilst visiting Ubud.

A great experience. My partner and I attended this cooking class based on the reviews. They picked us up at our hotel in Kuta (extra 400.000) then took us to a local market in Ubud where we joined the rest of our group. We were taken around the market and were taught the basics on how they pick the produce.When we got to the class we were shown how to make an offering, how coconut oil is made and how a family compound works. Once the cooking began it was very hands on, which everyone really enjoyed. The photos you see on TripAdvisor are correct to what you learn. My partner was sick for the entire day and didn't really participate and didn't eat so they only charged her half the price. We didn't expect that but it was appreciated! Would advise for anyone to attend this class.

No 1 cooking class. Fun cooking class,no 1 in ubud,not just presentation,we have chance to involve in making the dishes,not like other cooking class i attended before,limited chnce to invlove in cooking,the staffs here all were helpful,some were humorous,the class starts from visiting ubud market,it was interesting though not my first time,maybe the charming staff make it interesting,we had chance to make a canang(Bali offering basket made by palm leaf), nice experince.after the class we ate what we cooked,yummy!recommended to those who really want to learn something!

Great teacher Amazing food. Wow is all I can say easy to follow directions. Very fun cooking class easy to make at home.Take home recipes provided. Highly recommend this to any one who likes to cook or eat.will pick up at your hotel and drop off.
Recommend it to everyone! Yummy!. What a delightful experience, plus you get to eat the finished dishes in a beautiful setting. Staff so helpful and recipes can be easily recreated at home!

Great experience. We really enjoyed the cooking school set up by our hotel. It was held at a Balinese home; I enjoyed learning how to make an offering that I saw so many places in Bali. An absolute must do- our best activity in Bali yet!. A flawless afternoon spent cooking traditional, delicious Balinese food at Payuk Bali. As we booked last minute we were on an afternoon class so while there was no market visit, we still felt this was an incredibly worth while Bali activity. We were picked up from our hotel, and greeted warmly on arrival to the family home. We were first taught about and how to make a traditional Balinese offering, followed by a lesson in the traditional production of coconut oil. We were then lead to an amazing cooking area in a beautiful garden overlooking the river. It really was bliss! The staff were incredible, we couldn't fault, and our chef kept us entertained throughout the entire lesson! One thing that made this place stand out is that it is completely hands on- you prep and cook everything yourself from start to finish, and the food was delicious. Enjoyed at the end of the lesson overlooking the river! A great way to experience a slice of Balinese life. We would do again in a heartbeat! Thank you so much much Payuk for a great afternoon :)

Very informative and fun . I loved visiting the local markets, then learning how to make the offering baskets. We learnt lots about the Balinese culture, and the food we cooked from scratch was beautiful. Very professional. Payuk organised a driver to pick us up from Legian. Our chef was very funny and made the day lots of fun!

best Bali experience! great morning and amazing staff and food. couldn't recommend this experience more. the staff are so so friendly. the entire morning was thoroughly enjoyable. the food you get to cook is really tasty and definitely worth the money!

Such an amazing experience!. We spent the morning doing this cooking class a few weeks ago and it was such an awesome experience. Chef Ketut And his staff were so delightful and funny. The market was a great experience and we learned a lot. The food that we cooked was absolutely delicious!!! Definitely a highlight of our time in Ubud. Highly recommend!
Bali highlight . This cooking class was the biggest highlight of my trip to Bali. The tour guide/chef Ketir was amazing!! Very knowlegaable and funny. I would definitely do this class again!

Balinese culture and cooking, a wonderful experience. The four of us decided that a cooking class was the easy way to gain some insight to Balinese Culture and food. We signed up for the Payuk Bali cooking class athe the recommendation of our hotel and we were absolutely delighted by the experience. They picked us up at 7:45 am and we drove to the Ubud food market where we received an introduction to the Indonesian spices: 4 kinds of ginger, many different chilies, water and regular spinach, and the colors and smells of an open air market. Our driver than took us to a Balinese home which had been outfitted for the cooking school. We learned how to make the flower offerings that were distributed throughout the household everyday to ward off evil spirits and welcome the positive ones. The making of coconut palm oil was very interesting as well.Then, the cooking and the explanations were very informative, enjoyably presented and the food was delectable: satay and homemade peanut sauce (I had no idea how complex that delicious sauce was to make). A salad with snake beans and bean sprouts (yumm); steamed and grilled tuna in banana leaves; Balinese rice (perfect); chicken soup with all the complexities of the spices in sauces we had made; Balinese fried chicken in tumeric; and the end with candied sweet potato with palm sugar. Our lunch started at12:15 pm. Our head chef and teacher was charming and I am sure that you will enjoy this experience. I recommend that you arrange for this at the start of your stay in Ubud.

Balinese cooking at its best!. Very good cooking class! We learned a lot about Balinese cooking and spices - i LOVE the peanut sauce!!! - and ahd a reat time with our wonderful and very enthusiastic teacher and his helpful and attentive family.A great - and educational AND first and foremost delicious! - way to spend a half-day in Ubud!
Highlight of Bali Trip. Ketut is an absolute master of teaching! Knowledgeable and entertaining! If there is one thing u must do, its this class

Payuk cooking school Ubud Bali. This morning we attended a 5 hour cooking class which was wonderful. Picked up from our hotel and taken to the local market. Here we were given advise on the herbs and spices we were going to use in the class. We were then taken to a home with wonderful views and a lovely clean kitchen.Katut the master chef and his team were extremely professional, their English was good and the whole morning was very entertaining. 10 of us set about chopping, cooking and eating 7 dishes. Everything was absolutely delicious.Highly recommended and good value at $35.

Wonderful Culinary Experience . Such a great experience! We signed up for the morning class, which included a trip to the Ubud market. There we learned about all the ingredients, the spices, the culture and much more. After that, they showed us how coconut oil is made and also taught how to make offering baskets and were given the opportunity to make our own offerings. Then it was cooking time! The class was very insightful and fun. The chef had a wonderful sense of humor and taught us many recipes and cooking techniques. After all the chopping and cooking, we all sat and had our meal and were given recipes to take home. Such a great, memorable experience and worth the price. They are absolutely wonderful people and there is a lot to learn and a lot to cook.

One of the best things we did in Bali . This is definitely worth every penny! Learnt so much about Balinese culture through this experience. The food market was very thorough and we got to try some of the local produce which I have never had before. Then after it was onto the cooking lesson where we made traditional food and the best part was eating it. Generous portions too!

guaranteed its more than just cooking class. ive been to bali many times, but this is new unforgettable experience.i suggest you to take the morning class, the market tour trip was one of my highlight. i understood more about ingredients and most important is the locals life. Bli Budi, Bli Wayan and also the whole team at the house guided the group with laughter and fun. it was so much more than just cooking class for me.i guarantee, the food you cooked tastes so good you could die, but please dont.thank you payuk bali.

Best cooking facilitation I've experienced!. When I travel I always enjoy not only eating the local dishes, but learning how they are made. My experience at Payuk Bali Cooking Class absolutely stands out as one of my favorite experiences of all my travels and local cooking classes. We signed up for the first class of the day as you go to the market to learn, see, smell, and taste everything around you. We were picked up at our villa and met the other 'chefs for the day'. Ketut provided us with loads of information as well as being exceptionally entertaining. We made offerings, met his family, learned the history of Balinese cooking and familial culture.As a former classroom teacher, I'm fully aware of classroom management. I can't say enough great things about how the cooking process and instructions were delivered. Everyone had a chance to cook, to cut, to be sous chef, master chef as well as meet and work with the other people in the class. As soon as we finished one dish we would turn around and start another and our pans would be clean and ready to cook again. It was exceptionally well timed and executed. It's something you wont even notice as it's so well done.The food, of course, was delicious. And the people with whom we shared and cooked made it even more tasty. You will love Ketut and his team!

Delicious Balinese. This was an awesome experience and the food we cooked in this class was one of the best Balinese dishes we had.  Our instructor was very entertaining and explained everything from the Balinese culture, to all the spices we used and what flavors they give the food we prepared.  The outdoor kitchen we used was very clean too. I can't wait to try the recipes we made in class. They give you a pamphlet explaining how to make the food and the recipes.

Amazing one. We really enjoyed visiting the Ubud Market and attending the Cooking Class! All ingredients were fresh and delicious and chef Ketut was smiling all the time. Besides cooking we learned how to make a coconut oil and traditional offerings. Would recommend to everyone!

Great Experience. My husband and I really enjoyed our time at this cooking class. It was recommended by the staff at our villa and we couldn't have been happier. They picked us up at our villa (well nearby since it was inaccessible by car) and took us to the market to see what they purchased for us. They explained everything then took us to the compound to begin. The first thing we did was learn about the offerings that you see all over Ubud, including how to make them. Then the cooking began. We made a bunch of food and did it all piecemeal (the only downside to the experience because if we had made less food we could have done our own dish from start to finish). It ended up wonderful, and was a great experience.

First Indonesian cooking class . We got picked up by the driver and he explained to us how the class would be conducted. Once we got to the house , we were welcome with a homemade tea and we made each a Balinese offering ( as you would see them around Bali ) .Our Chef was professional and friendly , showed us some of the herbs we will be using in the garden prior our class ...... And then we proceeded to our kitchen area .The set up is great , you are in a middle of the jungle. What more do you want to learn some Indonesian cuisine ?The class went from 5 hours , we made everything from scratch and we finished sitting at a large communal table to eat our cooking : incredible!The cost is not exorbitant and it's so much fun and worth it .I would recommend to everyone coming to Ubud and I would certainly do it again next time

Best ever cooking class!. This is a great experience! You are picked up at your hotel and taken to the market for an explanation about Balinese food and spices. The cooking is great fun. The owners and cooks are super friendly, the athnosphere is very relaxed. We had a great time!

Fun Cooking Experience!. We loved the cooking class! Very hands on and easy to learn!The final product was served as lunch and it was delicious!Thanks to everyone at Payuk Bali, especially our instructor, Ketut.

The most fun we've had in a long time. Of course the hosts were polite and friendly. They after all Balinese. And of course the ingredients were fresh colourful and tasty. What was unexpected was how delightful everything and everyone was whilst running a highly slick operation. While you cook in one area yr prep area is cleaned. Move benches and you come back to a spic and span kitchen again. All the while you are learning new hints and techniques and we cook and eat Asian a lot. But wot really made it was the sense of fun. I defy anyone not to smile and feel happy at chefs exuberance and sing song infectious giggle. A big s'smoor (sic) to everyone at payuk bali
You must do this!. Wow! Loved this cooking class! Some great cooking was done and fabulous (and plentiful!) food eaten at the end! A lot of laughs had thanks to Ketut!
Awesome food, very nice chefkok. . Everybody is very friendly and they will teach and tell you a lot. The food is really delicious and it is a great experience. I really recommend this class.

Cooking class. This was a fantastic half day starting with a guided tour of the ubud market with an information about all the fresh fruit, vegetables & spices. Katut was a great personality & made the experience very enjoyable. We then moved onto the cooking where it was a hands on experience making about 7 dishes. The day then finished with a smorgasbord of all the food we had created.

Staff and food both excellent. Can't speak highly enough about the whole experience we had today. Done a few cooking classes before and was a little worried as it doesn't state if everyone will have a stove and be properly cooking, just says that everyone participates. As it turns out you have a stove per couple and it's really hands on. We had 11 in the group which I also thought might be too much but they split us into two and both guides were entertaining, informative and involving of everyone. Got to cook a three main dishes, three sauces (all from scratch, including the grinding of spices in huge manual pestle and mortars), rice, pudding and sides. Plenty to do, done at a great pace, laughed along the way and the food, like the experience, was wonderful. A big thank you to all the staff, would highly recommend.

Great class in the middle of the jungle!. My husband and I loved the class! It was very informative and a lot of fun, the staff was really friendly and helpful (maybe a bit too helpful ;) ) and the result was great! We are trying to cook for friends this weekend and hope to deliver some traditional Balinese dishes as we learned them at Payuk's. 100% recommendation for any skill level.

Fantastic!. Booked it at the last minute and so glad we did. I told them I was a vegetarian when I got there and they made it seamless for me to cook a vegetarian meal while everyone else cooked meat. Informative, fun, and one of our favorite memories of Ubud!

Highly recommend. Went with husband and two children, chef took us to the local market which was great to learn about new foods. We were taught how to do a Balinese offering to the gods again really interesting. We then got to do lots of cooking and preparing, the chef was so funny and really got the kids involved, the food was amazing the whole experienced as a family was awesome.

A must for any holiday maker. I think the thing which stands out to me is that they somehow manage to give an authentic feeling experience while delivering a highly professional and slick operation. it was an early start with a nice educational walk around the morning market. we were a group of about 10 for the class which made it more fun in many ways. between us we cooked up a feast and enjoyed it greatly. our hosts made the whole experience great fun. our 2 young children enjoyed it also, although it was quite a long morning for them. learned a lot, had good fun and ate great food.

Such fun!. The hosts at Payuk Bali cooking class were just the best: riendly, funny, informative. Information was presented step by step as everyone cut, chopped, pounded, cooked, skewered etc our delicious lunch. Very organized. Delicious! Loved it!

Fun for all!. We went with my two young daughters and their young at heart grandmother. We all had an amazing time. All of the people, from the head chef to all of the assistants, were extremely kind and helpful. Some of us were vegetarian, others pescatarian and we were all well fed and looked after. My girls gobbled down tempeh sate. I was very impressed. I hope I can do justice to the recipes I'm eager to try at home.

Amazing experience. This was one of the best experience that we had in Ubud. The teacher was friendly, we could learned how to do few really Balinese dishes. The dishes that we made that day was much better that any restaurant in Bali. Go for it, you will not be disapointed.

Not to be missed. A really fun and informative way to spend a morning. The class was enjoyable and very well organised. Ketut was very funny, as well as professional. Learnt a lot, great value for money. Highly recommended.

Ketut is the best guide! . This class was awesome! Not just for the techniques learnt but for our guide Ketut who was probably the happiest bloke I've met! We went to the traditional markets in the morning to see the local produce we would be using in the class. Then we were taught how to make Hindu offerings which was fun. The class it self was informative and great for cooks of any levels. Being a chef I wanted to gain some new recipes which was great as we were handed a book after our class of the dishes we produced. Delicious and the price was right!

Great experience. Can't miss it. Had a great half a day, started from market with explanation how to choose products and spices , than went to Balinese house to be cooked how to prepare local food. Good experience , good mood, good cultural injection

Very interesting cultural experience. Great day. Would recommend.. This is definitely an all round package. Start with a stroll around the market with your guide pointing out the various ingredients and giving you an interesting commentary. The class is then based in a local village in a family compound. Learn about and make an offering and place it in the temple. Then step through making about 6 different dishes, including making the pastes and sauces from scratch. Then finish off by eating your work. A great way to meet locals and experience a real flavour of local life. I would definitely recommend. The price - very cheap!

Fun with cooking. Drive picked us up early to take us to meet the chef. Visited the market and and had many of the spices and wares explained. Visited a rice paddy and had a great explanation of growing and harvesting rice.The cooking class is in the chefs home. She has her kitchen set up to have to handle about 25 people. She explains what we will cook and then she assigns task to each. What a fun day to learn so much and then get to eat the great food you prepared. Boy it was really good. Class lasted from about 8:30am to 2:00pm. Full meal from start to finish.

Cooking Balinese. Our driver drove us from seminyak to ubud very early in the morning to meet the chef at the ubud markets. Our driver and the chef exchanged phone numbers to organise times etc. Ketut the chef was a very funny man and very helpful with teaching all. It starts with a tour of the food markets and Ketut explains all the different fruit and veges and you get to try some too. Then back to the cooking school by car. You are given a welcome drink and start by making the offering basket, then down to see how coconut oil is made, a bit of interaction then to the kitchen. The ingredients are given to you and there are other chefs to assist you and also chop up the rest of ingredients needed. I liked that you got to taste the food along the way also. About 15 people in a class and they make sure that you are partnered with your own group. Fantastic experience and at the end the food you just helped prepared and cook is served smorgasbord style and you help yourself. You are given the recipes at the end. Then they take you by car back to a local hotel in ubud or a meeting point. For us our driver came and picked us up from the cooking class. A great experience and Ketut was very helpful. There was myself, husband and 16 y.o daughter. Other couples and families with younger children also. Highly recommended

Fabulous food. We were a family of 6 and had the best time. Wyan picked us up from our hotel and took us to the Ubud markets were we met kudek and he showed us all the spices and veg that they use in their cooking. The class was a lot of fun and very informative. The most I like was it was done in a local house not a commerical kitchen.

Lovely local experience . This class will last a good three hours. And so a really good activity to take up an afternoon. The afternoon class doesn't include the market trip but we made the little basket blessings for the gods which was fun.The class is in a local community which was really nice! And the chef was hilarious and good fun. So rewarding eating the delicious food you cooked!They also pick you up and drop you off so no money needed for taxis.Loved it!!

Cooking has never been more fun. What a surprisingly great day! I was worried that the cooking class would be a lot of hard work...it was hard work but totally fun and totally worth it because we got to eat food we created at the end and it sure was tasty!!I loved that upon pick up they took us to the morning market to illustrate how the Balinese people select their produce, food, flowers and spices . It was fun to see especially in a small group. Next we headed to a traditional Balinese home and were educated on the different buildings and happenings.We got to make traditional Balinese offerings and place them in the appropriate area.We next got to see and try making coconut oil from real coconuts!!! It was amazing night.After that we learned about all the ingredients of the food we were about to prepare and then set to making 8 lovely dishes. We made Balinese chicken soup, three sauces including bumbu, peanut and chili sauce, BfC, sate, tuna in nana leaf, long bean salad, twice steamed rice, etc. at the end we were given the recipes and ketuk's email in case we wanted to ask for different recipes! I did, I asked for the fried tempeh and was Emailed the recipe 24 hours later!!We started the day at 830 and finished around 2 with free transport both ways in ubud. Great day! My boyfriend had a blast too!

Fun and delicious. A cooking class is s worth doing when in Bali. You get hands-on experience of how to make Balinese dishes with real flavours. I wanted to do the morning class, but it was fully booked as with some other cooking schools as well, so be sure to make a booking well in advance. So the afternoon class didn't include the market tour, but we got make our own offerings for the gods instead which was interesting. Cooking itself was very informative, our instructor Ketut was great! Always smiling and making jokes. Everything went smoothly step by step because of a few assistants that were finishing our cookings, doing dishes etc. Won't be so neat and easy when I try these recipes at home haha. Eating was the best part of course, there was so much yummy food and there's no way our group of 5 could've finished it all. Sate chicken and peanut sauce were to die for.

Something a little different. If you have more time in Ubud and are looking for something a little different, try Katut's cooking classes. Great location by the river and very professionally run. We took our 3 kids along and they enjoyed it. For us adults however, used to Asian cooking it was perhaps not that enlightening. We learnt a few tricks and tips, but certainly I would suggest this is more geared for the Asian cooking novice. Nice, but not one of the best in comparison to some we have tried around the world.

great activity. Even if you don't like cooking this is well worth the time- everyone likes eating and it may inspire you - I came home and planted galangal and a kaffir lime tree in my garden- great family activity too- the whole exercise is well organised and like many things in Bali- runs like clockwork!

Great course with tasty food. A really nice way of learning about Balinese cuisine. The course leader was super enthusiastic and a good teacher. All of the utensils were top notch and all the dishes were done immediately by the mentors. We took the afternoon class, and got the feeling that the morning class had more to offer and a calmer approach. Somehow the course felt rushed even though we were only three pupils. When everything was done the food was served and it was lots of it. The things learned will definitely be used at home!

Great Cooking Class. I enjoyed this Cooking Class very much. Great teacher and lovely staff, nice athmosphere for cooking and great food. I would definitely recommend this class to my friends. It's worth the money.

Great to see where flavors come from. After eating Balinese food all week, it was great to get a hands-on, beginner's understanding of where these flavours come from. A visit to the local food markets (which are packed away by 10 am) followed by chopping, grating and pounding the original ingredients gave me a better appreciation of local food culture. And then a tasty lunch to reward our efforts. Friendly teachers and staff. Great setting. Worth doing.

The best thing that I've done in Bali. How lucky I am to meet our chef, Ketut! He was fun, energetic, very experienced and has such a great personality. We started our taste journey from visiting Ubud market and then headed to a family compound where our cooking class was held. Everything was well prepared ahead neatly, nicely by Ketut and many other skilled assistant chefs. The class was very organized and easy. The ingredients are fresh and clean. Every staffs are kind. We had so much fun and it is definitely worth of money. Highly recommended!!
Exceptional cooking class. Our cooking class with Chef Ketut Budi was an exceptional experience. We loved it so much, from the tea they served us.

Taste of Bali. We attended this class with about 11 other people but at times we worked in either pairs or in two groups with a main chef - either Ketut or Made. We were picked up from our hotel after 8am and after collecting another couple, parked at the market place and all set off through the food sector. Although this was after the busiest time for the locals, it is still a vibrant and colourful place. Ketut highlighted a lot of the unique Balinese fruits and spices to us. We then drove to a family compound where we were given a very refreshing cinnamon flavoured herbal tea and then we were all given the opportunity to make an offering from scratch. We then walked to see coconut oil being made and thence to our table and cooking area. Ketut then showed us each spice or ingredient needed for the sauces, and we then set to cutting up, chopping, slicing, grinding or pounding items for the sauces. Ketut then demonstrated the skills and steps needed to make the dishes. All the staff were warm, friendly and informative. The class was fun, relaxed and non threatening for inexperienced cooks. We all then enjoyed the lunch we had prepared.

A beginner's demonstration class with some hands-on. The instructor is a traditional Balinese man who has an infectious positive personality. He brought us to tour around the Ubud market which we otherwise wouldn't venture so deeply on our own, so it's awesome to get a feel of the local market scene. Cooking wise, many things were prepared in advance for us, and we merely had to do some basic chopping, grinding and stir frying. The instructor and assistants were overly interested in helping all the participants take pictures. Honestly I would hope for more hands-on cooking rather than demonstrations and photo taking.Don't expect to be preparing and cooking for just you and your partner. All food items are prepared as a whole team!Overall it was a pleasant experience to interact with the Balinese in their own house. We also brought back a printed recipe booklet at the end of the day.

Tasty and fun. We thoroughly loved this activity. We were picked up at 8 am to go to the local market. We got to taste some of the local fruits. Then we went to a family compound, where we learnt how to make an offering. The cooking afterwards took about 2 hours and was great. Our chef / guide genuinely enjoyed himself and his happiness was contagious. We cooked a soup, 3 sauces, 3 mains and a dessert. Before we head back to the hotel, we stopped at a rice field. Overall a great day, which we highly recommend.

Great day out. My wife and I attended a morning cooking class with Ketuk and co and an awesome time was had. The market tour was informative and detailed, the cooking school was clean and very well set out. A detailed explanation of the herbs and spices was great and the cooking was easy to follow which resulted in a great meal at the end.Ketuk and his teachers were very funny and made u at ease which resulted in us having a great day.Louise and Brett Burns

Fun, must do, YUM!. After a start in the Ubud markets and all the local food and spices explained, a 5 min drive to Ketut's house. Balinese life explained and the cooking began. Ketut was very funny and his staff entertained us the whole time there! Food was amazing and a copy of the recipes provided to us at the end after we had eaten plenty!
Great food and amazing cooking teacher.. This cooking class was amazing. Ketut was very funny and the food was very good. Would recommend it to anyone who loves to try good food in a great setting.

Fantastic fun. Awesome experience - fabulous detailed market tour including fruit tastings and much info on local customs and ways of life, clean cooking school which was superbly well organised. Very friendly staff, highly recommend this

Payuk Bali is fantastic! . My husband and I were really keen to take part in a authentic cooking course on our honeymoon and Payuk Bali was the best choice to make. It was the best day out! Ketut was our guide and teacher and he was just brilliant. He is so positive and happy all the time and added humour to the day theoughout. Ketut met us at the ubud market at 8am in the morning and we ventured through the market looking at all the fruit, vegetables and flowers on offer. It was so interesting. We headed back to the class and were met with a drink, information on how to make an offering and coconut oil. We then set about cooking our variety of dishes, we were put into pairs and took it in turns to chop and dice all the spices ans ingredients. They were all so fresh and delicious. We all took it in turns to cook, chop or grind. The smells were in incredible. All of the dishes were typical balinese and it was great to learn what goes into each dish. We have tge recipes to take away and attempt to make at home All of the staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. Once all made we sat and ate our lunch and it was definitely worth it! It was all delicious and we all wanted to eat it all again. A fantastic day out and one not to be forgotten! X

Great class!. This class was so fun! I was picked up by the driver for a 5-hour excursion. The first thing we did was go to the public market, where we got a tour of all the vegetables and spice stands. Stall upon stalls of flowers and fruits and vegetables. There was tons of street food from chicken to sweets and art stalls selling trinkets to clothing.After the market, we went to the family compound where we would learn to cook the following:Soup Ayam – Balinese chicken soupNasi Putih – Steamed riceSata Tusuk Ayam – Chicken satay with peanut saucePepes Ikan – Steamed tuna in banana leafAyam Bumbu Bali – Balinese fried chickenKolak Pisand – Braised banana in palm sugar gravySambal Ulek – Balinese spicy sauceBumbu Bali – Balinese multipurpose sauceThere were 6 of us in the class and after we finished cooking we sat down to eat our feast together. Out of the dishes we made, my favorite was the Balinese fried chicken and the Sambal Ulek.The guys who taught the class were fun and entertaining. They would take your camera during the course and say selfie time and take pictures of you cooking.Overall great experience and I can't wait to try the dishes at home.

3 basic Balinese sauces. The day started out a little out of kilter - I overslept after a grueling trek from Ijen crater. But after that, the hotel pick up, to market and to the class, it was no further worries. After establishing that there were no dietary allergies, we were shown how to make offering, just how much work goes into making coconut oil, and we were making so many dishes, we were not able to finish them for lunch. Both kutuk and mady were very entertaining, and our group of about 14? Were orchestrated to put up a culinary feast to enjoy. it was also most helpful to hear how we could replace some of the ingredients, that may not be easy to find in our respective countries.

Ketut will make you smile! Just ask him to say peanut sauce!. We attended this Payuk Bali cooking class as the one we had hoped to attend was booked out. We are glad we chose to attend this class regardless... as it was really enjoyable!There were four of us and we were added to a group of 8 for a total of 12 participants. 14 can be catered to in each class apparently. It was a really interesting morning and Ketut is a charming host. We enjoyed seeing how the coconut oil is prepared in addition to our own participation. We were a little surprised that the whole class was to cook the same 4 dishes. Previous classes in Thailand etc have allowed individuals to select from multiple choices by simply varying the the basic sauce and trading a couple of herbs or vegetables for others, or swapping seafood for chicken etc. The dishes that we were able to assist in making here, (chopping and grinding mostly) were good. Although we did not know it we were all helping to create dishes that would after cooking be combined by kitchen staff which was a little frustrating.Balinese cuisine calls for the considerable use of palm sugar and sweet soy - we'd have preferred to cook and consume our own meals prepared by our own selves (or at least in each group of 2) It was explained as we were cooking that we might choose to add more salt or chilli etc and use less of the sweet ingredients to suit our own individual palates so thinking that we were indeed cooking for ourselves, we did... but the finished dishes were then all combined and served as a large dish buffet style! Therefore inevitably we found the tuna a little bland for our individual palates. The peanut satay sauce too sweet etc. There may be a little more work involved in allowing & assisting us to cook individual dishes for our own consumption- but we would have definitely awarded a five star rating had this been the case. Simply because we'd have enjoyed the flavour more. Please consider this option for your clients and we would be happy to come back and learn how to make some more dishes on a subsequent visit to Bali.

Fantastic Balinese cooking experience!. Very friendly helpful staff, who went out of their way to make sure we had a great experience. The kitchen and all of the preparations looked clean and hygienic, will all food covered when not in use. The day was very well organised, and thought the offering making was a nice extra touch. Overall had a great day out and made some delicious food, would definitely recommend!

Original Activity. We started at the market at 08:00 in the morning with our guide and explaining what we will be using for ingridients for the recipe, we tour the whole market for spices, fish fruits and explanation about eh offerings as well. we then arrived at the cooking facility, and made our own offerings form scratch and offer them to the God for cooking our meals. And that is when the wonderful experience started, the staff was awesome and funny and knowledgeable I did not want to leave this place, everything is taken care of, the food and the spices are delicious and all is made from nothing, peanut sauce, sambal ulek etc.. they even give you all your recipes at the end to take home. You do everything, cut, grind, shred, cook, steam, using all tools in the kitchen and all is done with no electric tools but manually. It was an amazing experience and one I would have done over and over. it takes almost 5 hours to do it all and then you eat what you made.. unbelievable. I would never think of taking a cooking class while on vacation but you cannot miss this activity and this was the best highly recommended and in a little village not a a fancy restaurant in town, but in a temple setting where people lived and grew their own vegetables with chickens and all.. a perfect delight

Cooking made entertaining. The chef could do a comedy routine. The staff clearly enjoys their jobs and the enthusiasm reads down. The class was very well orchestrated. Everyone participated with preparation and cooking. Then we ate!! The food was delicious and plentiful. It was a great introduction to the spices and preparation of Balinese food.

Wonderful hosts, great food, unique experience. The staff and hosts were amazing, made the cooking class informative and entertaining for everyone, kids and adults alike. My husband likes to cook, I do not, and even I had a great time!! We started at the Ubud market and were taught about produce, herbs, traditions, and negotiating price. Then we went the the hosts family home. We made some offerings and learned about their traditions/religion, and how to make items such as coconut oil. The cooking class was well organized, very clean, and fun. At the end you get to enjoy the food you made, and there is A LOT of food, so go hungry!! They took care of picking us up and dropping us off at our hotel. Highly recommend.

Payuk Bali Cooking Class was a great introduction to Balinese food for us. Payuk Bali Cooking Class was recommended to us by our hotel. My husband and I travelled to Ubud with our 19 month old baby and a cooking class was the only thing I was keen to do as an organised tour. Payuk Bali was a professional tour but it had a relaxed feel to it. We were picked up from our hotel pretty much on time (around 8am) and went straight to the markets in Ubud. Katut met us there and walked us around the market explaining a lot about the Balinese ingredients and offerings. One of the most helpful things Katut did was to compare ingredients to western flavours and uses which helped to provide context.After the visit to the market we were driven about ten minutes out of town to Laplapan Village.
