There was a funeral planned for the next day and our group was interested in the ceremony so Katut took us over to look at the beautiful offerings that the village had made in the temple to send the important villager (I think it was the Priest's wife) on her journey. Katut explained how the funeral would happen and invited us all to come along.The actual cooking class was extremely organised. There was about 10 people (tourists) doing the class and about 7 staff helping to do all of the preparation of ingredients. As soon as we started one of the staff tried to take my baby to let me concentrate but she is quite shy so stayed in the backpack. My daughter eventually went to look at the chickens with one of the staff and I had a break to cook and grind spices without her for awhile...We made 8 dishes and they were all different and delicious. Soto Ayam (chicken soup) was my babies favourite, the satays were delicious too. It was helpful to know what dishes are usually eaten so that when we went to restaurants we were more familiar with the food. I absolutely love the flavours of Indonesian cooking and they keep the sambal (or chilli) separate so that you can have it as spicy as you prefer.I guarantee that you will have a great time at this class no matter if you are single or travelling with others. Everyone is lovely and very helpful. It was nice to hang out at a house in a village and see a bit of the "real" Bali too.

Fantastic cooking class. We did the morning cooking class which started with a walk through the local Ubud market. This market looked quite different to how it looked int the afternoon as a tourist market. Tasted a few local fruits then off to the family compound to start cooking. First we were shown how to make coconut oil. Quite a timely process. Then before cooking actually started Ketut went through all the spices and other ingredients with explanations, other names for the spices and tasting. There we're 11 in our class and we all cooked every dish. Dishes were cooked from the. start ie. cutting, crushing spices. Using the mortal and pestle to combine. The bean salad was probably my favourite dish

A great day cooking with a fabulous end result. Just traveled to Bali with my sister, who wanted to do a Balinese cooking class. From pickup at the hotel, a walk-through of the local market, the quick run though on making an 'offering', the explanation on all the spices being used and finally the cooking it was an excellent day. The result being a number of dishes to eat for lunch.Could not fault it.

Simply amazing . I went to this cooking class together with my girlfriend. It was by far the best cooking class experience I had so far. The visit to the traditional markt in the morning is great. The staff is very enthousiastic and full of passion. Especially Ketut was a blast to be around. The class is very well organized. The pace is good. The cooks explain all ingredients used and everyone is put to work to create the most delicious food. I highly recommend this course!

Best fun with great food. Our family group of five did the cooking class at Payuk in Ubud during our holiday to Bali in May 2015. It was an awesome experience. Ketut the head chef and his excellent team were brilliant. It was numerous light hearted fun while you cooked some excellent Balianese dishes which we all sat down to eat as a group. A true dining experience in a very enjoyable setting. I highly recommend this cooking school for any one who enjoys this type of thing. Thank you Ketut and your friendly team for making the day a total dining experience.

Best cooking class ever!. Amazing cooking class staff where super friendly and so organised. Time flew by as we prepared the meals and the staff finished them off and fixed our mistakes. Had so much fun everyone in my group raved about how great of tine they had. If your looking for a fun way to learn a bit more about Balinese ways of life look no further these guys are excellent!!! Highly recommended for anyone visiting Ubud

Fun and delicious day, an absolute highlight! . Thank you Ketut and team for a wonderful day! Highly recommended tour. Interesting tour of the food markets in the morning - we were lucky enough to sample a few goodies. Then on to the family compound for a morning of preparation for the most delicious Indonesian food we have had all trip. All the staff were fabulous, very entertaining and helpful. Everything was so well organised and ran so smoothly. I'll be recommending to anyone in Ubud. Thanks again!

A must do experience in Ubud. We picked this this cooking class above others on offers as it came highly recommended by family and friends that had been before ANDY they give a percentage of the fee to local children. The day is well structured with a trip to the local market in the morning which is an educational experience in itself as our guide explained about all the ingredients we would be using later on in the day. After that it was back to housing where we were shown how to make our own offerings to the gods and had a herbal tea which was also heavenly! A quick example of how to make your own coconut oil was then followed by a morning of making sauces and cooking traditional Balinese dishes. Our chef, Ketut was an amazing, entertaining and genuinely enthusiastic guy and he made the day very special. I would recommend this to everyone and anyone staying in Ubud.

Wonderful Experience!!. This is an absolute " must do" in Ubud! Our teacher, Chef Ketut, was amazing- funny, kind and talented. The rest of the staff was amazing as well. You will NOT be disappointed!

Incredible experience!. Our hotel recommended this class and it was incredible. Transportation was included, we explored the market and saw all the ingredients, learned to make the traditional offering, saw how to make coconut milk and oil and so many different parts of a traditional Balinese meal. I was wowed! I am not a comfortable kitchen person, I eat out a lot, and it was so comprehensive and fun-yet the staff, who were lovely, did all the hard behind the scenes work so it was purely fun! I can't wait to try and recreate the things we made-we were given all the recipes! The outdoor kitchen was fabulous-just wear bug spray or they will loan you theirs! A must!

Educational and fun experience. Booked in for the morning cooking class as we wanted to do the market tour and we weren't disappointed. The young guy who took us through the markets was incredibly knowledgable as he identified and explained the use of different fruits, vegetables and spices as we wandered through the markets - he even grabbed us a few different things to try as we went through. Then we were off to the compound/cooking school. We started with a quick lesson in preparing the traditional balinese offerings as our guide gave us a lesson in Balinese culture and spirituality. Then the main man Ketut joined us and showed us through the process of making Coconut Oil from scratch. Then it was off to the main kitchen where we were taken through the menu for the day with everything explained in great detail. Then the chopping began! Everyone rotated through the many preparation tasks as the day went on so you got a chance to try your hand at all the different stages of the different dishes. Whilst not a traditional "lesson" in that we weren't guided step by step through all of the dishes, it was nonetheless enjoyable as we got to try a lot more things than we would have done if it was all step by step individually. The preparation really was all by hand which was great - down to the grinding of many different spices in large mortar and pestles to create the sambal and the peanut sauce. The result was an array of truly delicious balinese food for everyone to enjoy. We were grouped with a great bunch of people from around the world which was fantastic, and everyone seemed to really enjoy themselves. We were also provided with a detailed recipe and instruction handout to take home meaning I was left feeling like I might actually try to recreate some, if not all, of the dishes we made today. The staff were absolutely amazing and they really made the experience special for us. They were patient, educational and helpful with everyone and made sure everyone was as hands on as possible. They constantly offered to take our cameras/phones and take photos for us as the day went on so we could document the experience which was a great touch. Spending the morning with them is worth the experience alone - the amazing food is just a bonus. I think everyone felt the same as students and teaches shared hugs and high fives on the way out - and a lot of laughs and smiles. Big thanks to Ketut and his amazing team for a truly amazing and educational experience!

Such a nice experience!. We had a morning cooking lesson and we really enjoyed the experience! The morning walk to the Ubud food market was really interesting as we could actually see the products we were about to cook!The chef is such a nice guy, always smiling and joking with his guests! It makes the cooking lesson a really pleasant experience!!The food was really good. We certainly had the best Chicken Satay among our stay in Ubud, not pretending we are cooking well, but still...;-)!The extras (The offering craft and the coconut oil process introduction) was really good as well.A cooking lesson with Payuk Bali is highly recommended to put the balinese culture into practice!!!

Awesome food. Our original plan was for me to take my daughter and my mates daughter but in the end all 5 of us did the cooking class and although my 2 friends are not big on cooking they absolutely enjoyed it. The food was awesome and the class was fantastic. Only downside was that we had to wait an hour for the rest of the class to arrive but it was definitely worth the weight. I would recommend this to anyone.

Amazing time and a unique learning experience. What can I say about this class that the other reviewers have not already said. This was an amazing experience that we will take with us for the rest of our lives! Ketut was fun, welcoming, and very patient with the group of various people at that morning's class. His assistants were also all very helpful and friendly. I loved going down to the market in the morning and trying some of the various fruits that the vendor's had to offer. Learning how to make the offering for the kitchen shrine, and how coconut oil was made was fun and informative. After having spent the past few days loving the food in Bali, we were very interested in learning how to make the food for ourselves (I have made some of the dishes since returning back to the States, and have come to a pretty close approximation to the tastes of Bali considering the limited ingredients I can get in Reno, NV). We appreciated the cook book that was given at the end of the class too. My wife and I were in Bali on our honeymoon, and I couldn't think of a better way to spend our morning with some of the most welcoming, friendly, and fun people we have ever had the pleasure of meeting!

Hilarious, Family-Friendly, Hands-On Morning!. We had originally tried to sign up for the Casa Luna Cooking School because we enjoy eating dinners there, but they were full, so I looked online for other options. I can't believe almost missed out on this amazing day!! I highly recommend Ketut and his team, as they will keep you laughing, will teach you a lot about local ingredients at foods, and will provide lots of hands-on experience. We began the day at the local market, checking out local ingredients, and then headed to a lovely family compound where we spent a wonderful few hours with the Made-for-TV Ketut and his staff. Highly Recommended!!! Our daughters ages 10 and 7 were welcomed and put right to work as well, so it truly was a family experience.

Ketut will leave you laughing. A lovely experience. We started with Made in the Ubud market, tasting mangosteen and snakeskin fruit. We made an offering to the gods and then created a feast with Ketut and his team. A very slick and energetic operation and a delicious meal.

Great fun and amazing food. My girlfriend and I spend and incredible morning with kartut and his family. He is super funny and patient. His presence made everything very light and enjoyable. First we went to the market to check some fresh produce, we had been there the previous day but things just came to life when Kartut talked about the the different ingredients. After that we went to his venue. We weaved and prepared an offering basket while he explained the meaning of it. Then our cooking class began, everything is very hands on and you get to try the different steps of the cooking process for several recipes. Staff is super attentive and everything is clean and organised. The actual lunch was a banquet, I could hardly believe how good it tasted!In summary, it was a highlight in our trip to bali.

Enjoyable but forgettable. Was an enjoyable , but I expected more. A lot of bugs and was very hot. ( I know that's to be expected :) ) Would prefer a more hands on approach as can get boring when you are not doing very much. People who run it are extremely nice and entertaining.

Fantastic - must do on your trip to Ubud - hint - DONT EAT BREAKFAST. What a wonderful experience. We were picked up from our hotel in Ubud and driven to the markets where we met our wonderful guide and cooking instructor Made. First of all we were taken around the Ubud market and shown all the produce and what it was used for and where it came from - having Made with us meant that we could get up close and personal without being harangued to buy anything. We then drove to the family compound where we were first shown how to "sew" the ceremonial offerings with Banana leaves and bits of bamboo (this was to get us ready for later sewing the leaves around the food). We then went down to the cooking area where the menu was explained and we then set to chopping and grinding and getting all the spices ready for making the sauces. This ran like clockwork. Everything had been laid out in advance and everybody got to chop, mash, pummel and grind a bit of everything. We then moved on to cooking the various dishes - again all the meat had been measrued out in advance and there were plenty of people on hand to show us what to do. The lesson also showed us how cocnut oil was made. Once this was all finished the staff took over and finished the cooking and we then all sat down to an amazing three course lunch that we had (well mostly) cooked. I would recommend this for foodies and non foodies alike -

Enjoyed our Morning Cooking!. It was so nice that they picked us up from our homestay and then took us to the morning market. I loved the tour and explanation of ingredients. We then went to the school and created an offering to the gods and then began our cooking adventure which I thouroughly enjoyed. The people and the food were amazing! Would definitely do again!

Balinese cooking - definitely a Must Do in Ubud, Bali! I love Ketut & his team, they're very fun, friendly & helpful. I highly recommend this activity for everyone. it's fun and an amazing way to learn Balinese cooking & culture. if you love food, spices & rice, then you will have the best time!

Good intro to Balinese cooking. Enjoyable morning. After being collected at our villa by Ketut we set off for the Ubud market where he explained the various foods that we would be cooking with. Then back to his compound where we were greeted with a drink and a lesson in how to make an offering. This was followed by preparation of various dishes including soup, salad, satay ayam, tuna in banana leaf, balinese chicken and a desert. All meals were delicious. Recipies were provided also to keep.

home cooking in Bali. Excellent cooking class as an introduction to balinese cuisine. We went to the market first to learn about different fruits, spices and components of the offerings.The class was very professional but also a lot of fun . We are motivated to try cooking some of the dishes when we get home.

Must do. Something you must do when you visit Ubud. They picked us up at the hotel early in the morning like around 8 am, took us to the market to teach us about their food, ingredients and what we should and not should buy. Then we arrived the place and the first thing we did was some offerings and a tea that was amazing, they thaught us how to make coconut oil and after that cooking time. They are very organized and had everything ready by the time we arrived. Kitchen was super clean. They are very patient and make your class funny and entertained. Excellent activity to do. We are from Mexico and so far we have cooked some of the things we learnt and it just reminds us of the lovely time we spend there. Highly recommended,

Absolutely wonderful . We learned a lot. The food was the best we had in a week in Bali. Well organized and a very entertaining and friendly staff. a memory to treasure. An absolute must do if your interested in cooking and Bali food

Awesome experience in Payuk Bali. We started at Ubud Market with Wayan, recognizing all the spices and tasting some fresh fruits. He's so nice, explaining all my questions. Then we headed to Payuk. Made introduced flower offering, coconut oil making and our main dishes. These guys were so great, and they helped us behind. And the lunch time... That was the best meal I've ever had in Bali. 5 stars!!!

Authentic and Fun. From beginning to end we were warmly welcomed, laughed and enjoyed learning of the daily rituals, culture and how to cook...delicious, fresh Balinese taste sensations. The day stared amongst the bustling market were we were taught about the different produce, as well as processes to prepare spices and coffee. Transfers were included in the day and the drive up to the to the compound, set amongst the rice fields and tropical vegetation, itself amazing. We were welcomed into the compound and taught how to each make a traditional Balinese offering, and the extensive rituals undertaken to turn a coconut into rich oil were demonstrated and explained. The cooking class itself included 7 dishes, recipes, practical tips for preparation and preserving the fresh produce, had each of us helping with the preparation and cooking for the whole morning, and highlighted the joys sharing a meal brings. The privilege of being with the hosts in the compound and sharing in a superbly organised day, which was both interactive and beautifully accommodating was delightful. A truly enjoyable experience, which was amazing value for money and still one of our favourite meals.

Laughed the whole time. We booked this cooking class through our hotel, and we are so glad we did! We were picked up in an air conditioned car and taken to the market, where we were taught about local food and customs and visited areas we never would have ventured into.The actual cooking class takes place in a beautiful setting at the back of a traditional compound, with a huge kitchen and dining area. The chefs/hosts/comedians Ketut and Made kept us entertained and busy the entire time. We especially enjoyed the "bali blender" and getting to help prepare all the different parts of the meal. After a busy few hours of cooking we sat down to enjoy a delicious feast with the rest of the group.Definitely suitable for kids, families, couples or solo travellers. They also cater really well for allergies if this is a concern for you.

Professionally organized. We chopped, cooked, pounded and mixed. Staff were right at hand to bring ingredients, take away dirty pans and to do the hard work. Our chef was well organized, instructive and fun.

A fantastic fun filled day.. I contacted a few cooking schools and was initially booked in at another cooking school however they cancelled last minute. I sent a message and immediately got a response from Payuk Bali.They came and picked us up, took us to the market and talked to us about Balinese religion and cooking and then we had one of the most fantastic, entertaining and hands on experiences imaginable.I cannot speak more highly of Ketut, Wayan, Made and the entire Payuk team, and if you are looking for a cooking class with a little extra I strongly recommend you book here!

Don't even think about going anywhere else.... I'll begin by saying that this was my third Payuk Cooking adventure. The first time was with with my 9 year old daughter, followed by a group of girlfriends and this time with my husband and daughter (now 10)I keep coming back with family and friends because it is truly the best fun you can have while learning about Balinese cuisine and culture.Ketut (the chef) and Made are the most wonderful hosts, so much wonderful information and so entertaining!!!We started with a visit to the markets - so many different sights and smells!! The colourful flowers, fruits and vegetables will never cease to amaze me. We returned to the traditional Balinese home to begin our cooking experience. We began by making a flower offering and learnt how coconut oil is made. Then we made our way to the 'kitchen' and 'dining' area - the most beautiful setting. Surrounded by lush garden, high on a cliff edge - we could hear the river running below.After a quick drink, we began to chop, sauté, steam, pound, fry, mix, grill etc. Our group of 14 were kept very busy!! Once all dishes were completed came the best part...time to feast!! The food was delicious, company was wonderful and the setting was second to none. Payuk Cooking Class is highly recommended. There is something very special about being invited into a private home to experience the Balinese way as opposed to cooking in a restaurant kitchen.Plus the 'entertainment ' is too good!!Thank you Ketut, Made, Wayan and all of the Payuk team for another wonderful adventure!Toni, Rippa and Charli SalmonJanuary 2015

Holiday. We've visit this cooking class, because we've got recommended it from a friend. This friend told us, the teacher has a Funboard Voice. In fact, ketut knows, how to entertain :-). We have so much fun there and since then, the running gag in our holiday was "....and now: FISH! ". Try it, when you searching for a class with a verY kompetent teacher who let you know much about cooking and the balinese People. Ketut is full of good energy!!! Go there! 5 honour points!

So much fun. We took the morning class which meant we got to visit the market. We didn't buy our food there as the tour guide had already bought it at 4am that morning, explaining that it's more hygienic to buy it early. We ventured into areas that we probably wouldn't have found alone and he gave us a lot of interesting information. We were then taught how to make offerings to the gods. It was good to learn more about these because you see them everywhere in Bali. Then the cooking class.. So much fun! The instructor was so so enthusiastic you could tell he loved his job and is passionate about food. You are all completely involved. Everyone always has a job to do then you all eat together at the end and we all thought it was delicious. Definitely worth a go!

Don't miss this!. All of the reviews below perfectly outline our cooking class - personal driver, traditional markets, and learning to cook in a family compound. Cooking involved learning how to make coconut oil, several sauces, twice steamed rice, and several other dishes. Our group was 12 large and we all had an equal part in preparing the food. I've heard other workshops only allow you to prepare food and not cook, but this was not the case for us! The chefs and staff were funny and had great interpersonal skills. They were patient to explain all ingredients and offer alternatives for those not available at home. This was definitely a highlight over several visits to Bali - don't miss it!

Awesome cooking class with much more!. I organised this class for myself, my partner and 4 teenagers on my sister's recommendation and couldn't be happier! The market tour was a really interesting way to start the day, and Ketut was wonderful! The food was delicious and everyone had a go at everything. The price is so reasonable for what you get! Highly recommended!

Great experience. First class operation. Easy pick up. Interesting market tour and then rice paddies. Very welcoming couple. Cooking not too hard but you learn a lot. Delicious end result. Highly recommended.

Such a unique experience! . My husband and I stopped in Ubud on our honeymoon trip in Bali and just took Payuk Bali's cooking class today! We are SO glad we did. It is definitely one the most culturally unique experiences you can do here in Ubud! You get to visit the traditional market, learn about Balineese offerings, taste some of the most unique fruits and veggies on the island, meet new people, and eat a delicious 7 course meal at the end of the day. They could easily charge more for this as it is such an amazing and fun experience! ($35.00 USD) is so cheap for the experience you will get! Our guide and head chef was the highlight of the trip. His enthusiasm and encouragement makes you feel like you might actually even know what you're doing! The crew even took our phones to capture some cool photos of us as we cooked! We prepared a pretty extensive meal that would have taken forever had we not had a group contribution. The cooking team is very friendly and helpful so that helped to speed things up also. Book with Payuk Bali! You will not be disappointed. Also, it doesn't take your entire day, so you still have time to explore something else amazing in Ubud!

Very enjoyable day. My friend and I opted for the afternoon class so the market trip wasn't included (the markets are only open in the morning) however this did not spoil our day as we had a very enjoyable class. Ketut and his staff were very patient and explained everything thoroughly even advising of alternative ingredients we could use back in the UK. The food was very nice (which says a lot for me being a picky eater) and overall we thoroughly enjoyed our day, would definitely recommend!

A Feast. This cooking course was very enjoyable! They covered vegetarian options too. The chefs explained each ingredient and then gave us possible replacements that we could use from our home countries. They were patient, funny and very helpful. I'm looking forward to practising my new skills!

Highlight of Bali. My husband and I love to experience different cultures and foods. We went to this cooking class and it was the highlight of our holiday. It was so interesting to learn of the Bali culture, their family life, and then to cook and eat their amazing food!! We used only the best and freshest home grown ingredients. They catered for everyone - we even had a vegan in our group.The class was presented in English with a passion and love for food and people - on an extremely hot and humid day in the most beautiful tropical environment. We loved every minute of it and experienced truly amazing Balinese cuisine and hospitality.

Perfect day.. What an amazing experience - this was one of the best days of my life. The driver picked us up early in the morning from our hotel in Nusa Dua and took us up to Ubud. We went to the food market while our guide showed us tons of different and unique fruits and vegetables. It was a small group so it was easy to navigate around the crowded market. Then we stopped by a rice paddy where we learned more about how the rice grows and is irrigated. Finally we arrived in the family compound where the kitchen was located. While we drank very refreshing tea, we learned how to make the traditional Balinese flower offerings. Then it was time to cook! Chef Ketut explained everything clearly and we laughed our way through the preparation for the meal. It was absolutely spectacular - the food, the views, the instructors. What an amazing day - would strongly recommend!!

Great Experience. We loved our time cooking and laughing with the friendly people at Payuk Bali home cooking class. We had a small class of only 4 people and it amazing. When they picked us up from our resort they were friendly and spoke very good English we went straight to the Ubud food markets and they explained all the food to us that we will be using. We didn't buy any as they already brought it fresh that day at 4 am. I would highly recommend this activity to groups, individuals or/and family's.

Lightning struck twice. We took this class in 2013, from Ketut Budi, and it was exceptional. We decided before coming back to Ubud that we'd happily do the class again, partly because we needed a refresher on what we'd learned, partly because we found the food (that we'd collectively made) so terrific, and hopefully to catch Ketut Budi's marvelous act again.Well this year, we had a different instructor, a young guy named Made, who was every bit as charming and helpful as Ketut Budi. The formula for the class was the same, and is notable for being superior to other cooking classes we've heard about. First, the class goes to the market and sees how to shop for ingredients. Then you go out to the family compound where the cooking takes place, and you learn to make offerings. And then learn how to make coconut oil from scratch. Then prepare the entire meal from scratch, many courses, including the critical three sauces, the-more-involved-than-you-think steamed rice, satay, soup, vegetable and fish dishes, and dessert. Rather than watching someone demonstrate, you actually do it, all of it. Super well-planned, and delightfully delivered by Made and his sweet staff. The meal was one of the best we've eaten in Bali, which is saying a great deal. Plus, like last year, we met other people in the class who were really fun to meet and talk with. There you go.

One of the highlights of our travel. We got picked up at 8 in the morning and were shown the local market with great explanations of everything. It was only 4 of us. Then we went to a nice home, where we made offerings and prepared our food. Soo interesting, our guide was so much fun and all in all it was just a really great experience. Highly recommend this place!

Great fun, one of the high lights of our trip. We realy enjoyed the cooking class. It is fun, easy and you learn something new. As everybody mentions Ketut and his helpers are great and entertaining. It was also nice meeting the other participants and sitting down for the dinner in the end.We did the afternoon class as the morning one was full. First I was a little bit dissapointed not makeing the morning class. Once we were actually there I didnt think about it for one moment and didnt feel that we were missing out on anything.We contacted them via e-mail and the correspondens was quick and accurat.I highly recomend this activity!!

Great experience.. We had a great experience, the entire morning was great value for money. Our teacher Ketut was so enthusiastic and really enjoyed immersing us in Balinese culture and cuisine. The class itself was very hands on, we took part in cooking all aspects of the meal. It was a delicious feast at the end. A big plus was taking home a copy of the receipes so we can replicate our creations when we get home. We would highly recommend the class to anyone considering a cooking course whilst in Ubud.

Fabulous Way to Immerse Yourself in the Flavors of Bali. We learned a lot about the local spices, cooking methods and culture of Bali. The class includes door to door pick up and drop off at your hotel. We also went to the local market and our chef/teacher, Katut, introduced us to a wealth of local color and flavor. The class itself is in a serene setting on a hill overlooking the Balinese forest and river. There were 10 people in our class and we all had the opportunity to contribute to the creation of about 6 different dishes and the sauces that go into them. This cooking class experience Katut and his friends and family provide was amazing. Katut is also a great teacher and very funny. If you are in Ubud, you should really sign up for this great experience!

Burst of Cultural Flavors. You learn more than just Balinese cooking! How to shop at the markets, and how to make a Hindu offering basket are beautiful also, A good blend of people coming together to learn the flavors of Bali, how to use the spices and the foods to bring forth the right tastes. This is a must do while in Ubud.Heres more info: http://www.6elementsconsulting.com/burst-of-cultural-flavors-in-bali/
Part of my Eat Love Pray. Learning some of the Balinese dishes was well put together by a great teacher. My new friends recommended it and I'm so glad I did... Two thumbs up!!!!

Great cooking class!. I had a wonderful time with Payul Bali Cooking Class.
All staffs are very kind and friendly and the class was very funny. I learned a lot, not only about cooking, but about Bali culture when we stopped in the rice fields or when we learnt how to make offerings.
Of course, the food was delicious! I'd recommend this activity!

Awesome food. We took this cooking class today and found it not only informative but was also extremely entertaining. Ketut and his family of assistants were exceptionally well organised and kept the day rolling to precision timing. The food and recipes will be well used when I return home.

Learnt heaps. This cooking class was fantastic, Ketut was really entertaining, informative, knowledgeable and of course talented. The group worked together to slice, dice and grind herbs and spices together that went into creating the tastiest feast that I have had for a long time. I think if I go back to Ubud, and the chances are quite good that I will, another trip to this cooking class is on the cards. A large group of strangers came together and left as friends, a truly excellent day.
Perfect!. Don't miss this activity! It's fun, original and entertaining. The chef is very funny and you learn a lot on different parts of Balinese people.

Excellent, excellent, excellent.. We attended this class after reading about it on TripAdvisor. After an initial mix up with transport, we ended up being found by Ketut himself at Ubud Palace and taken to find the rest of the group. Ketut was extremely knowledgeable about nearly everything at the market and gave us a great tour including tastes of Balinese fruits and a trip to the spice section of the market. After arriving at his family home, we were treated to tea and a Balinese offering lesson. He then set up a photo opportunity for everyone with their own offering and flowers in our hair. Next we were given step by step instructions of how to make coconut oil, which was really interesting. The final step before beginning to cook was a nice morning coffee while our ingredients were set up.Ketut had this class down to a science, perfecting the timing of everything to have our lunch served by 12:15. We started by seeing, smelling, and tasting every ingredient we were cooking with that morning. We then began cooking by preparing the ingredients for each sauce. After this, we ground, sauteed, and finished the sauces, adding each to a dish we were making. After beginning each dish, Ketut's team finished the dishes and served the buffet. If you are looking for a lovely Balinese group to teach you how to cook Balinese food and teach you more about their culture, Payuk is the clear choice for a class in Ubud. They are definitely worth a trip from Canggu, Seminyak or Kuta.

Best experience in Ubud. The cooking class was simply amazing. Starting from the quick response when you email them, getting picked up in the morning, visiting a market and rice terraces, and of course the class itself. The food tasted spectacular and time went by quickly. The people were so nice and especially our chef (Ketut? sorry, forgot the name) cracked me up and had me laughing all day. Coolest person ever.

Great experience and delicious food. Such a fun experience! We cooked a wide range of food and it was so much fun. Everyone got to have a go and be involved in preparing a wonderful buffet of traditional indonesian foods. The staff are o friendly and the host was so passionate and funny. The visit to the market to see all the foods we were using was a really unique experience and we really enjoyed it. I went with 2 friends and we took our daughters (13 and 9) and they both had a ball as well. There was so much to do and it covered so many different levels of traditional indonesian culture - even making traditional offerings! We learnt so much and cant wait to cook these meals again!

fun cooking experience. The chef team is very organized and supportive. The cooking class is very fun and the final product is quite tasty! It is not that everyone completes his/her lunch/dinner, but all the participants to complete the buffet together. So if you really want to learn how to cook from head to toe, you will get recipe to practice at your home.

Stop looking, this is the one to do. Chef Katut is a wonderful chef and even better person. A very happy man who made our day. Great food, lots of laughter and the best experience of our trip. Can't recommend it enough, and it was extremely good value for money. Just do it, you won't regret it.

Fantastic. Really enjoyed the cooking class I did with Payuk Bali Cooking Class. Besides learning a lot about how to cook yummy Balinese food, we were in fits of laughter from start to finish I can highly recommend this visit to the market and cooking class.

Funny, informative, and great food knowledge. What a class! Best thing to do in Ubud. The chefs were hilarious, cracking jokes with us the whole time. All spoke great English, food was super fresh, and the knowledge of the staff was great. It was a fun, interactive experience which took an entire 4 hours. We got recipes to take home and I can't wait to try it for myself!

What is Cooking in Ubud. My wife and I started taking cooking classes when we travel. We found it is a great way to me local residents see their homes and often meet their families. Good conversation while cooking and eating are natural companions. It is also a great way to meet fellow travelers from around the world. We enjoyed Chef Ketuk Budi's wonderful sense of humor and enthusiasm. The dishes were varied and tasty and he accommodated our daughter's vegetarian diet easily.His staff was friendly and helpful.I highly recommend this as a great add on to your vacation.

Wonderful experience & caters for vegetarians. My 9 year old daughter and I participated in this cooking class and we both loved it. It was excellent value for money, and easily one of the best things I did in Indonesia, as you come away from the class with a new skill. We did the afternoon class, as the morning classes for the next few days were fully booked. (Class sizes are capped to I think 12 participants.) The only difference between the classes is that the afternoon class does not include a visit to the Ubud market. We were picked up from our hotel around 2pm and dropped back round 8pm. We paid Rp 350,000 per person. The food we prepared was delicious! Our group of seven spent a lot of time chopping, grinding and blending spices. It was all done the traditional way, using mortar and pestles rather than electrical blenders. We learnt how to cook 3 spice mixes/sauces which form the basis for much Indonesian cuisine. We were then shown how to prepare 5 dishes (4 savoury plus 1 dessert). I was the only vegetarian in the group and made similar dishes to the others (eg satay tofu and tempeh skewers whilst the others made satay chicken skewers, and steamed mushrooms in banana leaves whilst the others did steamed fish). We didn't cook everything from start to finish, but would tend to start dishes which were then finished by the handful of assistants there. This struck me as a good use of our time. The main chef, Ketut, is described in most of these reviews as one of the happiest people alive, and he did not disappoint! (In fact, it was on the basis of Trip Adviser reviews that I picked this particular cooking school.) I particularly appreciated how he involved my daughter in activities, giving her little jobs to do that involved less chopping but which helped her to feel included. Ketut and the other chef (whose name I forget) in whose family compound the classes are held were consistently helpful and encouraging. After around 3 hours of cooking, our group sat down to feast on what we'd cooked. There was far more food than we could have possibly eaten. The food was simply divine, and the surroundings, which overlooked a valley, were most pleasant. All participants were given a recipe handbook at the end of the class. Since my holiday ended last week, I have cooked nothing but Indonesian food. I do not feel at all daunted by the longish list of ingredients as I feel that this class was really helpful at demystifying Indonesian cooking, and showing how easy it is to prepare. I would highly recommend Payuk cooking school. In my case it was definitely money well spent as I have been using the skills I learnt in this class every time I cook dinner. I also found the class itself really enjoyable as well as informative.

Fun activity to spend time with your loved ones. My sister and her boyfriend found this activity.Another way to enjoy Bali.The chef was very friendly and very helpful. Our class was in a group of 6 adults, it was 4 of us and the other 2 is an American couple.We do really enjoy our time in the cooking class..And I have to say, Indonesian cuisine is really hard to prepare. Had fun though...

Fun, cultural, value for money. I have always wanted to do a class, went by myself and had a blast. I wanted the morning class which was full but was happily surprised by the friendly staff, night transfers were great and I met some interesting tourists for a good chat over our finished dinner. They accommodated two vegos well and it was fun making the offerings and learning - finally - what they were for and their significance in the culture. Only suggestion is it would have been good to have the recipes at the start to make notes on (aussie equivalents for ingredients for example). Location was beautiful and very clean.

Great Experience. A great day outing. Start at the markets, then to the cooking school. Make an offering first off, then do some chop chopping and pounding of spices. Next, in pairs, do the cooking. Then, as a group, sit to lunch and enjoy your culniary work. We followed up the cooking school with a Balinese massage then retreated to our accommodation for a very refreshing Bintang. An outstanding day anchored but eh wonderful cooking school experience.

A must do in Ubud. Our day started with a trip to the market - great to learn some more about the local produce. The cooking class itself was fantastic - the staff are all so happy and the boss is possibly the happiest man in the world! You get a real chance to get stuck in and make the many dishes yourself. The food was absolutely amazing and can't wait to recreate it back home! A must do while in ubud.

BEST cooking class in Bali!!. My husband and I are foodies and love to attend cooking classes wherever we travel. Payuk is honestly the best class we have been to abroad- due to the fabulous Ketut, the beautiful setting, the extraordinary food and the special touches including a lesson on making Balinese offerings. Ketut runs his classes like a well-oiled machine with enthusiasm, humour and excellent food knowledge and instruction. They were extremely flexible and adjusted our meals to food preferences with graciousness. We just loved this class:)

Great and caters to vegetarians too!. I only have good things to say about this course ! I went in solo. They picked me up from my hotel on time and took me to the village . I went for the afternoon course and we learned to male offerings. Afterwards we were given the menu and since I was the only vegetarian I had a customized menu and ready to use ingredients for my dishes . The staff is positive attentive caring and the food was really amazing! I want all my friends and family to try it at least once !

Authentic & Fun!. I was highly impressed at how organised, well thought out and informative this cookery class was. I got way more than I thought, from visiting the food market to making my own offering and being shown how coconut oil is made. The class itself was in a beautiful setting, Ketut made it really good fun (I'm convinced this guy will be on TV one day). The food we prepared as a group, cooked together as a group was then eaten together as a group. Everyone got to do something and Ketut explained the ingredients, the cooking process and quietly in the background there was a team of really friendly assistants making it a slick operation. Really first class.

Amazing class!. The afternoon class was an amazing experience. Although we were hesitant to pay full price without taking the trip to the market, we were not disappointed in the least. The staff are extremely friendly and professional. Ketut is hilarious - you will not stop smiling. One of my best experiences in Ubud!

Cooking class. Picked this class for the high review on tripadvisor. Great fun and ketut was very funny. Very professional set up and we learnt how to cook 7 dishes. Our group was lovely and it's a good way to meet people and to hear their travelling stories. Food was delicious!

Great experience, lots of laughs!. Got picked up at our home stay and headed to the market to see a slice of daily life. Ketut explained the different exotic fruits and vegetables to us. We then learned to make offerings which was really interesting, and saw how coconut oil is made. The class was really fun - we made an array of Indonesian dishes, with the harder parts done for us - it was all very efficient, thanks to the team! Also our instructor was definitely the happiest man in the world - his laughter was contagious!

Great activity with tasty outcome. It was a really nice afternoon that ended with a delicious dinner. We were picked up on time from a nice driver. At the beginning of the cooking class we learned how to make the traditional offering for the gods and got some background information on this tradition while enjoying a refreshing welcome drink. Then we prepared 6 different dishes and 3 different balinese sauces. Every ingredient and step of the preparation process was explained. While we were concentrating on one thing, helping hands in the back already set up all we needed for the next step. The cooking class was very well organized and the chef answered all our questions. He also entertained the whole group. I liked that we got enough time at the end for enjoying our dinner in a very relaxed setting. I am very grateful, that we got the recipies to take with us, I will definitely cook some Indonesian food at home :)

Loved this!. I was with my 9 year old daughter, and was a little nervous about keeping her interest in a cooking class, but this was great! We met Ketut at the markets at 8:00, and that was a thorough but brief enough visit to learn what we wanted. We went back to his family compound for the class, where he first taught us how to make the daily offerings...which we loved! When he showed us the menu we'd be preparing, I thought it would take days. But they are so organized and efficient - we were back to our hotel by 1:00. It's all hands-on, which keeps you engaged and interested. And I think Ketut may be the happiest person on the planet - he was an absolute joy. This is a MUST!

Fantastic - Highly Recommended! . Dont be talked into going to any other cooking class - this was an absolutely fantastic day out with lovely and entertaining staff, immaculate organisation, fantastic food and an all round brilliant experience! Thank you :)

Hilariously fun day with Chef Katut. Our morning trip to the market was followed by a quick class in making an offering to the Gods, and then some lessons in how to make some of the best food we've had in Bali. All of this in a wonderful setting and full of laughs. So much fun!

Do it. A really Must to do in Bali!! Go for a Cooking class!! Especially Payuk is a really good place because you cook at a families house, not in a restaurant!! Food was excellent and we had a good teamwork!I really enjoyed this day!!

Funny, delicious and valuable. We got picked up at our hotel in the morning. After that we went to the morning market which was a great experience. Our guide told us a lot about the spices and different fruits, he took us to places we wouldn't have come on our own. It was really unique. After that we went to the kitchen, it was placed in a beautiful scenery just about 10 minutes out of the center of Ubud. The cook was very funny and friendly, he really took the time to explain all the ingredients and why they are used. Then we got to cook for ourselves, it turned out very delicious! If you want to book a cooking class, you definetly should go here. I stayed in Ubud for a week and this was definetly my best day!

Loads of fun. A visit to the market followed by a 3 hrs or so preparing a number of dishes and sitting down to dine. You're not going to win master chef after this instruction however you will be given some pointers to practice in your own time.

A must if you are in Ubud. My family of three teenage daughters, my wife and myself booked on this cooking course. We had found it on the Internet without further introduction. It was a brilliant experience.We were collected from our hotel and started with a tour of the food markets. We were in a team of only six in sharp contrast to other cooking tours which seemed to be nearer 20.We were then driven a couple of kilometres outside Ubud where we had a brilliant couple of hours of both laughs and instruction followed by a delicious, self cooked lunch. Our lead teacher and his assistants were amusing and informative. We spent much of our time laughing and yet now would not be fazed about trying to cook a Balinese dinner! I cannot claim to be a keen cook but this was truly great fun. I would recommend it to anybody.

Delicious food, great fun. Myself and 3 friends loved our experience cooking with Ketut and his crew! The staff is warm, enthusiastic and hilarious! They really make an effort to get you involved. The food was authentic and delicious, and we were provided with easy to follow recipes to use at home.

Great, great fun!!. What a fantastic afternoon. Ketut & Made were fantastic hosts. The setting is the family compound with other family members helping out. It is truly a worthwhile experience. We loved Ketut & Ketut loves a hug. Great stuff

Legitimate Bali Fun. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a fun cultural experience. Staff consists of hospitable, patient and funny Balinese families. They really go the extra mile to make sure everyone participates and understands what takes place in the Indonesian kitchen. Interactive experience without the hard work, and a huge, delicious meal at the end. They should raise the price because this a valuable service they provide! Really good value for money and a unforgettable experience! Not to be missed for pescatarians and vegetarians...they are very accommodating to food allergies as well! Please note they do also serve bintang :)

Ketut is the star. My 2 young adult daughters and I chose this cooking class, because it's run by a Balinese family and promises small numbers. We enjoyed every minute - the market visit, making offerings, chopping, grinding, mixing, cooking, the location, laughing and of course ... eating. We had a lovely group, but our host and ex chef, Ketut was the star. You do a great job, making sure everyone is involved and enjoying themselves.

Super cooking class!. We had a very nice experience with payuk cooking class! Very friendly people, really learning by do it yourself and delicious food. Very nice ambiance and the rest of the people made it an experience we will not forget!

Balinese Experience. Do this course if you want to share an experience with people from around the world, visit a Balinese house, learn about Balinese cooking and spend some time with Ketut, Made, Agus and Wayung. What a great team.
Best outing in Ubud. Loved everything about this balinese cooking class, from the family who run it to the wonderful food we cooked and ate. A great way to wile away five hours!!

Fun and interesting!. We had a chance to learn a little bit about Balinese culture, not only cooking! Food was amazing and the general experience was really funny. You get to know the main ingredients of Balinese food, touch, smell, chop, taste them and try to prepare nice dishes. We really enjoyed our time there!

Enjoyable day. Quite enjoyed the morning cooking class. Started out with a tour of the market where we were introduced to some of the fruits and veggies most commonly used in Balinese cooking. After that we continued on to a rice field and finally to the cooking school. Once at the school we were taught how to make Balinese offerings and were offered coffee/tea/hot cocoa and taught about many of the spices. Then onto cooking. In this school everybody collectively helps to make the dishes as opposed to everybody making their own dishes. While you will not learn in depth how to make a specific dish, you will get to try all of the wonderful dishes instead of being limited to just the ones you chose. All in all a terrific morning!

Already using what we learned. This was a fantastic cooking class. I had no idea that we would learn so much about growing rice, making Hindu offerings, or making coconut oil before we even began cooking. The recipes were delicious (though our Balinese driver said, "It was good, but not very spicy.") and were adapted to Western tastes in one key way (only five hot chilis instead of 20!). Although it rained the morning we were there, we had enough cover to avoid getting soaked before we settled down into the outdoor kitchen. My husband has already used the recipes to make some basic sauce at home, and we've been back less than a week! Of all the cooking classes I've taken in a variety of countries, this one was the best value for the money. I highly recommend it.

Great way to spend an afternoon!!. I absolutely enjoyed our afternoon cooking class with Ketut and his family! We diced, chopped, and pounded our way through some of the most delicious ingredients you can find. The atmosphere was fun and we learned some excellent cooking tips to take home with us. Although all of that was great the highlight was definitely tucking in to our finished products...from the soup to the dessert we were very impressed with ourselves!!A valuable and rewarding experience that I would encourage you to try!
Brilliant experience . Ketut made us feel very welcome & coached us so we felt like master chefs. The food was plentiful & delicious, some ingredients even grown in the kitchen garden

Hands on and good food. Payuk Bali cooking class only allows a maximum of 12 people, for our class there was 11.There was 3 instructors and plenty of elements and the like. The cooking is done as a group with everyone having a go at everything.The teachers were all exceptionally helpful and patient, the cooking is done on a family compound which is a little out of ubud, making the whole experience better.The food that we made was excellent and out chief provided the complete recipes.This was a great experience and included a good lunch ( that we cooked with help :) ).Can fully recommend payuk cooking if you are looking for a hands on genuine experience.

An outstanding way to learn about Bali. This is an outstanding way to learn about Bali as well as about Bali's traditional food. The chef and an assistant picked me up at my hotel and we went to the market to buy fresh ingredients. That was fascinating. Then they told me about the area's agriculture, particularly the rice farming, on the drive out to the school. Those two parts alone were worth the cost even if we had done no cooking afterwards.The kitchen is built behind the chef's family compound. We did the prep together, so many spices. The cooking was very "hands on" and well managed. Then the fabulous meal that resulted was an additional treat. They gave us recipes to take home. This was one of the two best activities I did on my recent Bali trip. Highly recommended.

A delicious experience. I would recommend the morning session, which included a really interesting trip around the food market (it turns into an art market later on). The class itself was well-structured, organised and loads of fun. They even asked about food allergies, which I thought was very considerate. All the dishes were delicious but the stand-out was definitely the sate! I can quite honestly say that it is the sauce of my dreams.
Worth the trip. My wife and I really enjoyed our time here. Each part of the tour was very informative and we will definately use what we learned when we get back home.

Fantastic. My daughter went to the cooking class , it was a fantastic one !She learnt how to make Balinese sate , steam fish , rice , desert and vege dishes. The teacher Ketut spoke good English and explained everything very well so that everyone understood and could do what was required. There were also many assistants who helped the participants and made the whole experience enjoyable. The feast at the end was yummy and memorable.They also provide pick-up from your hotel and transport back to the hotel. The evening class does not have a visit to the market.The package also included making the Balinese offering and coconut oil.A point to mention here is their warmth and hospitality which is simply amazing!

A fun & memorable cooking class. I organized a group of us to come to Bali for my birthday. 18 of us did this cooking class & it was one of our highlights. Such fun with this warm & humorous family. We laughed, pounded, chopped, cooked and then all sat down together in gorgeous tropical surroundings to eat the delicious food we'd just prepared.Thoroughly recommend this class.

great class, professional staff, a fun way to spend a few hours in Ubud. If you are vaguely interested in food, a bit of local culture or want a lovely view to accompany your three course dinner then I'd highly recommend this class. The team were absolute professionls from start to finish. We were picked up and taken to some rice fields where we were taught a bit about the growing process. After this we were taken to the family home, greeted with drinks and taught how to make a traditional Hindu offering and then coconut oil, before embarking on our lesson. There were six of us in our class and we all got a chance to get involved in every stage of the cooking process. There were lots of staff on hand to make sure everything went smoothly, dishes were cleaned and all the food prepared on time. They were also really friendly answering questions, taking pictures and happy to share their culture with us. At the end of it we got to eat the fruits of our labour in a beautiful outdoor dining area and were given the recipes to take away. Great way to spend a few hours in Bali. We did the afternoon class so didn't get to go to the local market to buy the ingredients which was a bit of a shame (they only run until 10am) so would perhaps recommend a morning class so you get to see these too. Highly recommend.

Highlight of my trip. This was the cheapest and best cooking class I have ever done in all my travelling. Fantastic value. Ketut and his assistants will turn your cooking class into a cooking Paaarteeeeee! Sooo much fun. Learnt some great recipes and excellent secret tips. No wonder I couldn't get my sate sauce to taste that authentic! Everyone was looked after. I did the afternoon but I believe the morning is even better. As the only vegetarian I was catered for with no problems. Lots of laughs. Big thanks to Made who helped with our group. This is a must do while visiting Ubud. Jungle kitchen cooking - fun and yum!

Great fun, great food. Definitely worth your money. It's a very well planned cooking workshop indeed! I would recommend you to pick the morning class as you get to go to the Ubud morning market and experience the daily buzz. What's more, you get to see the beautiful rice terraces in Laplapan village as the instructors would explain the lives of farmers at the padi fields. Of course, the stars of the class are Ketut and his friendly assistants. These wonderful people are entertaining teachers with substance. If you are serious about picking up some Balinese cooking skills and recipes, I must say that Payuk Cooking School will not disappoint. The food prepared by you and your classmates will impress you.

Fantastic cooking class with friendly helpful chefs. We thoroughly enjoyed cooking at Payuk Bali. The staff where friendly and more than willing to help answer our every question. The price is expensive as cooking classes go but well worth the money. We learnt how to make our own traditional blessings and coconut oil along with numerous dishes. A truly unforgettable experience. Our only regret is that we only had time to do the afternoon class so we did not get to visit the local market. But we have come home with our own menus and ready to cook up some treats for our friends!

Entertaining and educational. We spent a thoroughly enjoyable morning with Ketut and his team. Everything was well organised and the food preparation was efficient and clean. All up it was interesting and educational, but also very entertaining ... and the food we cooked was delicious.

It's class cooking course!. We were given the leaflet for Payuk cookery course by our hotel so thought we'd give it a try. It's was fantastic! We were picked up at our hotel in a mini bus and taken to the kitchen just out of central Ubud. It's high up in the hills so the view we had was quite something. We were shown how to make an offering which is more difficult than it looks! The staff were very good and the meals we cooked were fantastic (if I do say so myself!). I'd definitely recommend this to anyone visiting Bali.

Great day, wonderful cooking class with friendly Chefs. If you want to have a view of what looks like Balinese food, the cooking experience, have a try on it.Chef Ketut and his colleagues will turn your day into a party, full of flavours, smiles and a unforgettable experience.Our day Started with a visit to a local school, what a amazing visit, kids having their snacks, smiling and enjoying our presence, simple, not fancy school but, happy kids and happy visitors. I guess we were the ones who got the lesson!!Back to city, street market, a must if you want see how it is and taste some fruits. Relax, keep it cool and enjoy the moment.When arriving at Ketut place, be prepared to a revolution of colours, flavours, smiles. I doubt any one won't enjoy such a simple, great, happy day!The cooking? Uuuaaauuuu, I ate with the eyes.... Smell fantastic.... Taste better than any 5* hotel. That's is the Balinese food!! Simple, taste, good, unforgettable experience!Will be back for sure!!! That people are a smile factory, made our day worth. Missing that moment, food, smell, the smile faces!Will be back!!Keep it as simple as it is Chef Ketut. Suksmar mauali

Great fun. This was wonderful and educational and good value for money. Our chef Ketut was very interesting informative and hilarious. The cooking class fantastic and the good wonderful. Terrific set up for kitchen and lovely venue in family compound. Interesting tour of Ubud market ( very hot and smelly) to start and lovely welcome drink and morning tea. Fun experience to share with other tourists there too. Love Ketut and his team.

A fantastic day!!!. Highly recommend this cooking class for anyone visiting Ubud.We were taken on a tour of the markets to see where a lot of people by the fruit and vegetables and were able to sample a few native fruits which was great. Having the local knowledge of what to eat was fantastic.Then heading out to the beautiful setting for the cooking class it was just magic. All the staff were very friendly and great instructors. They checked if there were any allergies and were happy to accommodate.We cooked a banquet style lunch which included a soup entree, three dishes and a rice for mains and a dessert. You are given printed handouts with all recipes and conversions for some of the more traditional Indonesian ingredients.

Awesome experience. Friendly and helpful staff. Start the day with a morning market tour and then on to the family compound for cooking lessons. Beautiful setting and the right amount of hands on work and instruction.

One of the highlights of our trip to Bali. This was one of the highlights of our trip and great value for about $35 per person. On booking, Chef Katut enquired as to any allergies, to determine which menu he would use.The next day Chef picked us up from our out-of-the-way villa at precisely 8 AM, and his driver returned us sometime after 2 in the afternoon. We joined the rest of the day’s participants (we were 10 in all – the most is 12 for this class) at the market for a tour. Chef explained that we were seeing only the tail end of the produce market, which opens around 4 AM and that this was not a good time to buy the best ingredients. The class was held at the back of a traditional Balinese compound in Laplalan village with a very scenic outlook into a deep ravine. There were shaded cooking and dining areas to accommodate up to 12 participants and clean western style toilets. On arrival we said selamat pagi in passing to a traditional old lady with exposed breasts doing some chores on her porch (my wife was taken aback a bit). We started by making those little banana leaf trays with flowers and pandan for temple offerings.On moving to the cooking area, we sat down and a choice of excellent hot chocolate or coffee was served, and we could introduce ourselves and organize into teams of 2 who would share a gas burner. We were invited repeatedly to take complementary cold bottled water from the fridge. We met another chef as well as 5 or 6 other assistants including Chef’s wife. The menu comprised:- Soup Ayam (chicken)- Steamed Rice, Bali style- Balinese Sautéed Chicken- Chicken Saté- Tuna cooked in banana leaf- Sayur Urab – a spicy cold vegetable dish with grated coconut- Sambal Ulek – hot chili condiment- Base Gede – a complex general purpose spice paste prepared with traditional mortars and pestles.- Peanut sauce- Caramelized sweet potato – a dessertTo begin, all the ingredients were explained and discussed with authority by Chef. He made sure we washed our hands and provided little plastic gloves when we needed to mix by hand. He then orchestrated the class, breaking the preparation and cooking down into very small steps which he demonstrated individually, and then let each student perform them. We each had a sharp knife, chopping block, sarong apron, and kitchen towel. He and the other chef walked up and down the 10 work stations, coaching, joking, photographing with our cameras, answering questions, and seasoning. The assistants pre-measured and staged the ingredients, finished the cooking steps we started, fixed up any poor work by inexperienced cooks (husbands), and combined the individually-prepared portions, so that we could move on through the menu. It reminded me of a cooking show on TV, with no time wasted looking for things or cleaning up and the assistants were diligent in wiping spills and removing trimmings and kept everything clean.Sometime before 1 PM, the finished dishes were displayed as a nice buffet for our pictures and we ate a very tasty lunch. We lingered with our congenial fellow students – Swiss, Swedish and Ozzies, until nearly 2 PM. This enjoyable day went by very quickly!

fabulous day, great food and lots of fun!. We had a great day at the payuk Bali Cooking class. Our day started with a trip to the markets where we learnt about the different ingredients - all very interesting. Then on to the cooking school in Laplapan village - a beautiful location. It was interesting to learn about the balinese family compound and to learn to make a simple offering. We then saw how coconut oil was prepared before starting on our hands-on cooking experience. Ketut was a great teacher and lots of fun. The food we prepared was absolutely delicious. All in all, a fabulous day - highly recommended!!

Great day. 11 ladies who went for the cooking class, a great day and quite intimate in Ketuts home. He was very entertaining as was all his helpers. We made everything from scratch and then sat down for lunch. Food was delicious, the dessert sauce was beautiful but the dish would have been better if the sweet potato was replaced with banana.

Very informative and fun. As the previous comments have stated, this is an excellent class. What was great was how long we spent doing each individual part of the class. The market tour was long enough, but not over the top and by the time we had finished cooking we were ready to sit down and eat. They threw in a couple of other informative things such as the making of the flower offerings and making Cocunut oil and it was a perfect morning. Very authentic

Gourmet Balinese Lunch. This was a most enjoyable day in Ubud. Our day started at 7:30 am when our driver and guide collected us from our accommodation. A visit to the market prior to our class introduced us to the range of spices used in Balinese cooking. This was followed by an introductory lesson in making the lovely floral offerings that are seen everywhere in Bali. After a demonstration of how coconut oil is extracted, we set to work preparing a wonderful range of food under the guidance of the chef. Our duties included chopping, grinding, sauteeing, threading sates, and wrapping parcels in banana leaves. The same recipes were adapted for a vegetarian version. The staff completed the cooking, and the food was presented beautifully for our gourmet lunch, which included soup, multiple main course dishes, and dessert. We were given the recipes to take away, so I'm looking forward to trying some again at home. I would strongly recommend this cooking class to anyone who is interested in learning some of the secrets of Balinese cuisine.

A lovely experience, learnt lots and laughed lots. My boyfriend and I booked into the afternoon class, which was a lot quieter (it was just us), but we had a fantastic time. They picked us up from our hotel and the guys that picked us up were really good fun and chatty. After this, we learnt how to make the offerings, how to make the coconut oil and everyone we met in the compound was really good fun and friendly. The chef (budi) was absolutely hilarious, it was really hands on and we learnt lots but was really good fun. We laughed the whole time. We were treated so nicely and felt really welcome. The food wasw absolutely delicious and we learnt how to make loads of dishes!! We had soooo much food to eat at the end which was all beautifully presented to us at the dinner table with lovely views. Really do recommend this!! we were super impressed with the course and the whole team. Thanks!!

A perfect exploration of Balinese Cusine. This cookery class was a joy. The staff were wonderful, so friendly and helpful and made the whole experience incredibly fun. The activities were wonderful- visiting the market and the rice fields was great and the range of food we made was brillaint. Soup, vegetables, chicken satay, tuna in a banana leaf and 3 different kinds of Balinese sauces. I really enjoyed the fact that it was a collaborative effort as we all workes together to make food for the group. Highly recommended.

A Balinese experience leaving you full of food and learning. A great way to spend a few hours doing something really quite different in the lovely environs of Ubud. Situated at the chef's home 10 minutes or so in the hills outside Ubud, this was more that a cookery class, with an opportunity to learn about Hindu customs as well as understanding about the wide variety of local ingredients used in the class. A class of 10 prepared, chopped and mashed ingredients to make three very different sauces which were the constituent parts of a seven course feast which we tucked into at the end. Ketut is a master of humorous teaching involving not only his class but his 5 assistants which made this a must do part of your balanced itinerary when visiting the area. Great fun and reflecting afterwards we learnt so much.

Whole family enjoyed and learnt lots. Reviews all correct. Very hands on. All had our own chopping board and got to do lots of prep, cooking and then eating. Started with market tour, quick stop at rice field and then to home where first thing we did was each make an offering learning lots at the same time. My 15 year old son wasn't really looking forward to it, but had a great time. Good recipie book. 7 in class and think we were out numbered by chefs and cleaners helping teach us. Highly recommended. Free water, with bintang, coke, lemonade available for sale to have with your lunch.

One of the best days of our trip. Originally we had tried booking woth someone else as hadn't found Payuk, but we were so pleased when they were full and it meant we discovered Ketut and Made at Payuk! An absolutely cracking morning doing so much more than just the cooking; traditional market, rice paddy, making a baliness offering, watching coconut oil being made.... Ketut and Made were such jolly hosts and full of information. Team effort to prepare the food then at the end all sat down for our delicious feast! Would not hesitate to recommend even if you haven't done much cooking before!

Cooking with Ketut!. What a gem of an attraction! Discovered this cooking class on Trip Advisor and assumed 210+ reviewers couldn't be wrong! They weren't! Fab morning out, took 16 year old twin sons and 11 year old daughter along with Hubby and I and thumbs up from each of us! Day started early with a tour of local market and Ketut pointing out various ingredients and interesting produce (kids had to hold their noses through some areas admittedly). Then we visited a little local school that Ketut helps support ( usually a visit to the rice fields is included instead but wrong time of year). Once at the cooking school we were taught about making offerings for the Hindu gods and then onto kitchen to make 7 separate dishes. All delicious. Ketut laughs infectiously all day... So much fun... Definitely recommend!

Absolutley brilliant. What a great experience. Our head chef was entertaining from start to finish. You arrive and immediately made to feel welcomed. The view was spectacular overlooking a jungle.Each person is given an apron and takes part in the seven course meal you eventually eat,We all took turns is preparing chillies, ginger, garlic and the many spices needed to make the sauces. We then cooked and eventually all sat down to a beautiful meal.There was a small group of approximately 10 people from all over the world, who were great company.I would highly recommend this tour and would definitely return for not only the food but the entertainment and PR skills of the chef.

Fab cooking class!!. We tried Payuk cooking class during our visit to Ubud.We really enjoyed the experience.They pick you up from your hotel, then you can visit the market where you can see many spices and fruits.The lesson is very interesting and chef Ketut is super!!After lesson we had lunch all together...we really recommend this experience in Bali!

Good experience. Having done cooking classes in other Asian countries (China and Thailand) this one differed a little. We each did not have our own work station where we prepared and cooked our meals. We all prepared together and cooked together on two stoves. I felt like I missed what some other participants were doing when I was grinding mixture or visa versa. I totally missed the method for cooking on if the sauces as that was done by three other ladies. In saying that this class was very enjoyable, Katuk the chef was very pleasant and explained things well while at the market. Anything I did miss is now in my take home 'Cooking Class Menu'. It was very reasonable also only €35 AUS each.

Best Traditional Balinese cooking class. We booked the cooking class through our villa at Ubud Padi Villas at Payuk Bali it was a very enjoyable afternoon. We were picked up from our villa at 3pm and taken to a traditional Balinese village that had a well equiped kitchen and an amazing open dinning room! Head chef Ketut is a very funny man that is a skilled chef and teacher. My family of 7 joined a Swiss group of 4 to an educational 7 hours of learning about Balinese spices and how to cook a 7 course banquet.We first learnt how to make our own Balinese flower offering and how to make coconut oil the traditional way. An entertaining afternoon of hands on choping, mixing, frying, steaming, and then eating our way through this 7 course menu was the best family activity!!Web address: www.payukbali.com Email: info@payukbali.com

Fantastic Experience!. I would like by saying a big Thank you and apology to Made our chef/instructor. We were meant to meet at Ubud Palace at 8:30am in the morning but the traffic into Ubud from Legian made us 30 minutes late (we had left at 7:30am already). Not only was Made very welcoming he sat there for 30 minutes assuming we were probably a no show. We then went into the local market which was already starting to pack up (they open at 3-4am) to give us a few of what it was like; I would recommend arriving at 8 or 8:15am as Made was already waiting for us at that time. After trying the snake fruit we headed to the kitchen. A short 10 minute car ride away at someones home. We were taught about the local customs, housing, inheritance, how to make the offering and also coconut oil. Made explained everything that I had to ask and wanted to know. We were giving a refreshing herbal drink which you can ask the recipe for. Then we went right to the back and got down to the cooking class. The location of the cooking class is open air and looks into a river forested area, it was beautiful. Made quizzed us about the herbs and spices to get a few of what we knew. Everything was hands on from chopping all the herbs and making the paste. The only thing we didn't cut was the meat. We made a total of 7 dishes and was holding our bellies out the door. The food was nice, I found the favours milder then what we ate at the restaurants but it was delicious =)Once again Thank you Made for your patience and being a wonderful teacher =) Hope to see you again sometime soon.

Such an enojoyable day. My husband and I were booked into Payuk Bali Cooking Class by our hotel, as we said we wanted to do a cooking class, so we knew nothing about it. This was such an enjoyable day, made all the more so, by the head chef, Ketut, who was very funny and very entertaining. We were picked up from our hotel and taken to Ubud Markets where the various Balinese ingredients were pointed out and explained. Then we were driving to a rice paddy field, and the rice growing process was also explained.We were then driven to the location where we were going to be cooking, and along with 4 other participants we learnt to make the Balinese offerings. After viewing how to make coconut oil, and a morning tea of fried jackfruit, and drinks, we were ready to begin cooking.We all took turns in cutting, dicing, slicing, chopping, grinding, steaming, frying and grilling.
