Ketut and his team made things look and feel easy (I have since tried to cook some of these dishes at home, and it took me all day), and we ended up with a delicious feast of several courses and were filled to the brim with food, even though we had barely made a dent in the quantity.I thoroughly recommend this cooking school for a really fun day.

mmhh so good. We had a wonderful cooking class yesterday in the afternoon, it was only the two of us with Made and 2 other chefs. They were all very friendly and made our cooking class a great experience. They gave us an insight into the Balinese culture of rice growing, coconut oil making, offering and cooking some of their traditional dishes. We cooked some vegeterian and some meat dishes. The quality and the taste of the food was great.

Excellent Experience @ Payuk Bali Cooking School. Thanks to the 6 participants who had cancelled the class last minute, I have a session with 3 chefs (Ketut, Wayan, and Kedak) all by myself. They were a hilarious and awesome team. I had a great time learning the Balinese ingredients, food, and beyond. The dishes we made definitely surpassed those in the top voted Balinese Restaurant in Bali. I highly recommend to all who like cooking and enjoy Balinese food to attend Ketut's schooling class.
Awesome. Ketut was hilarious the whole team are a fabulous lot. Had a really good time one of the most genuine Bali experiences I had the whole trip. Do it!!!

A highlight of our trip to Ubud :). I would highly recommend this wonderful experience :) we had a fantastic time with Ketut and his family. We learned so much, in a fun and relaxing way. Ketut is such a lovely, funny man, who definitely knows how to cook! I'd do it again in a heartbeat :) loved the food . Loved the company :) Excellent day :)

Great experience, highly recommended!. We had a great day! They took us to the traditional food markets and educated us on different vegetables, spices and fruits. We then went to the school, which the company supports. The cooking class was fantastic, it was hands on and we were able to experience how to cook delicious traditional meals. The food was very tasty and the staff were very friendly and entertaining. I would definitely recommend this cooking class! :)

We had a blast. Great day - out of Ubud a bit in a home with a nice view of the river valley. We made Balinese offerings in the morning and then cooked 7 dishes. Everyone was super friendly and helpful. We had a small class - 4 people - and the cooks felt challenged and the eaters felt comfortable. \I would recommend this course for sure!

A fun time with a great lunch. This was a fun day! Firstly we met at the markets to have a look at the type of foods and spices used in Bali, then we went to a rice field and a visit to the local school, very interesting! Upon arrival at the cooking school (which is a Balinese family home) we made offerings had a cool drink and then viewed a demonstration of how coconut oil is obtained. Then we started chopping, chopping and grinding with some fantastic explanations from Ketut and Mardi our teachers. Ketut was very animated - should have his own tv show! after working with others in the group ( there were 8 in the class , 2 groups of four) to prepare the food we were able to sit back and relax and chat to the other participants while the staff finished and served the food. It was very, very yummy! Best meal I had in Bali! This as my husband's second visit to the school and it was my first, but i would definitely visit again! This experience presents great value for money!

Faultless - its true. Excellent afternoon, starting with on time pick from my Hotel- warm welcoming for all- well organized and FUN! – the team created an environment and atmosphere of learning with friends - (whoops I’m home now and forgotten everyone’s name – sorry  ) A unique Balinese experience , offering a great balance - from basics of making coconut oil –to a delicious complete meal ( several dishes- I was the only vego- and well catered to- we four participants shared open air dining – overlooking a lush gully - we all loved this cooking course- I’m a cook- some not-– main thing is it was informative and fun for allWho knew how special – Special Sauce was- the care of producing simple things with local harvested ingredientsI have a great time, thanks guys Strongly Recommended
Will return. Great day. Thanks Trip advisor.Great people .Lots of fun for a non cook and my wife. Would recommend to all ages as not to heavy !

Amazing Cooking school. If you're looking for entertainment,authenticity and a great time, look no further than Payuk Bali Cooking School!I was collected from my Hotel, taken to the markets with a group of other people and the fun began!Chef Ketut's enthusiasm is so contagious! The ingredients were explained to us, we even got to taste some local fruits.After a tour of the market, we were then taken to the school with a stopover by the Rice fields where some ducks happened to be present.Before cooking, we were shown how to make an offering and each person made one,while sipping a cool drink.We were then explained and shown how Coconut oil is made before being taken to an open-air outdoor kitchen.We had to chop all the ingredients and took turns stirring and mixing ingredients.I really enjoyed the hands on experience of this school as other schools I had been on mostly involved watching the chef and eating.After we made several sauces, we had to mince chicken the Balinese way and place them on skewers.The whole time we were entertained by the two chefs who made us laugh from start to finish!Lunch was absolutely delicious.This was one of the highlights of my trip!Thank you so much for an amazing experience!Joelle B

Culture,comedy & cooking. We were collected from our hotel in a comfortable vehicle by the teacher and his assistant and from the start he had us laughing at his jokes. We went on a tour of the local wet markets and saw areas we hadn't noticed when we'd gone ourselves on the previous day. As we went from vendor to vendor he explained the various fruits, vegetables and ingredients and how they are used but cautioned against buying anything at 8am as 'there were too many flies and fingers so late in the morning. He shops at 4am to get the best and freshest ingredients. We then headed out of Ubud into the rice fields entertained by his wit and repartee en route. We were certainly a happy bunch by the time we'd learned about rice farming and made our way to the family compound where the class is taught. Before the cooking began we learned to prepare offerings from banana leaves and flowers and had the chance to see how locals lived.There were lots of opportunities to participate in the preparation of the meal - and lots of help to prepare a very labour intensive repast with a variety of family and friends helping with the cutting and dicing and cooking. The lesson finished with the nine students sitting down to what we had prepared - about 10 courses in all. We left feeling very confident that we'd learned to cook authentic Balinese food, with lots more knowledge about Balinese family life and having had many good belly laughs.

Such a cool chef. Not even torrential rain could dampen his enthusiasm and energy - it was infectious ! Had a wonderful day in Ubud - starting with visiting the market and then back to make some delicious food. Very hands on and entertaining - well worth it!

Just great if you like food from Bali. We booked this place at a agent in the streets of Ubud (incl. pickup from the place we stayed). It was a real and great experience to cook ourself the Balinese food. If you are in Ubud. You should book it. If you take morning classes you will have a great lunch (so don't have a big breakfast).

awesome, fun & delicious balinese cooking experience. We went today to Payuk Bali for a cooking class and I can just say we had an awesome time! the team is so nice and funny that it really brings up a great atmosphere! We were 4 people at our cooking station which is a small enough group so everyone can do something. If you expect to cook the full menue on your own, this is not going to happen there, but if you just want to have fun and get the idea of the recipes and ingredients used in the Balinese kitchen, this is a perfect class! plus the food was delicious!!:)

Great cooking experience.. I had a wonderful time during the cooking experience today. The chef Ketut was really friendly and bubbly, and made everything very fun. His English was also very good - much better than many of the the Balinese drivers/tour operators, so very easy to understand him and he was confident with all the food vocab in English. Experience started with a visit to the food market where we tried some different fruits and had a quick look around. On arrival at the cookery school we then got to make an offering that you see around the temples with fresh flowers which was interesting. During this we were served a delicious ginger tea. Then for the cooking we were all given various jobs preparing parts of the sauces, meats and vegetables for several dishes on an indonesian menu including starter, mains and dessert. Whenever you finished a job you were given something else to do and we got to do a range of cooking activities like chopping, frying, pestle and mortar, using banana leaves etc. The satay sauce was particularly good! During the cooking Ketut explained more about the meals and cooking techniques. Afterwards lunch was served to you with a drink where you got to try all the meals prepared. Also, on arrival we got a hot drink and fried banana as a snack and the surroundings of the cooking school are beautiful - very green and you can hear the river running. Overall would definitely recommend this if you like cooking!!

So much fun!. Took this class earlier today and had so much fun I couldn't wait to write a review. Chef Ketut's enthusiasm is contagious! His kitchen staff were very helpful, and we learned how to make what might seem complicated sauces very easily. He de-mystified the basics of Balinese cooking, and everyone in the class couldn't get enough of the end product when we were done. Although my husband and I are experienced cooks (including asian cooking), the chef made the entire process completely approachable regardless of experience level. One of the high points of this year's trip to Bali!

Awesome cooking class!. My partner and I went to the cooking class at Payuk Bali and had an excellent time. We were the only ones signed up for that day and so we got a private session. We enjoyed learning how to make a Hindu offering using palm leaves and various flowers. We then had a great time preparing the meal with the kitchen staff. We got to learn how to make everything we ate for dinner. We didn't just watch but we were involved in the cooking at every stage. The flavours were incredible and everything was fresh and delicious. Made, Nimade and Wayan were very friendly and helpful in teaching us. They also took time to serve the meal we had made in a very artistic fashion. I would definitely recommend this cooking class to anyone.

Fun but not a real cooking experience. I did enjoy myself mainly because the chef, Ketut, made everything fun and the rest of the staff were friendly. I did learn how the dishes were created and after watching (most of the time, you actually just watch), I'm confident I can re-create all the dishes.However if like me, your expectation is a complete cooking experience, you will be quite disappointed. I've taken half-day cooking classes for tourists in Laos and Thailand. Usual routine was: the chef's would cook and demonstrate then we would go to our own work stations (2 people/station) where we were left on our own to do everything from scratch with the aid of the recipe book while the chefs checked on us. We peeled, sliced, chopped, and cooked. We each made all the dishes step by step and when we sat down to eat, we were able to compare each other's work. At Payuk Bali, everything had been prepped already. We just did additional chopping and grinding. We did different tasks for 1 dish so we didn't get to experience actually completing a single dish on our own. The only cooking I ever did was to simmer the peanut paste someone else had made. Most of the time we were huddled around the stove watching while someone stirred something and another put a teaspoon of something on the instructions of the chef. It was over all too soon and I felt I didn't really create something. I didn't even stand long enough on the stove to feel its heat.If you just want to have fun and have a really easy experience of "cooking" then I guess it would work for you. I really wanted to cook the way I had it in my previous cooking classes, but I didn't get it here that's why I guess, I left the experience not really feeling I accomplished something. This was the only cooking class i did where my recipe book remained clean and crisp as we never used it.

Great time, great food and Awesome teacher. We had the chance to meet Ketuh and his team for a jump in Bali's culture. The organisation was perfect and we can really see that Ketuh loves what he does. We are looking forward to try the many recipes at home.

Great half day of cooking. Today we enjoyed a very nice and informative cooking class at Payuk Bali. Great to combine market, ricefield, lesson in making offerings, cooking lesson and finally enjoying the very tasty food. We especially liked the happy cooks, we had a delightful third X-mas day! And we had to do most of the cooking ourselves, contrary to some other cooking classes, which made it extra enjoyable. Thanks for this great day!

payukbali: a cooking school in paradise. My wife and I joined 7 other visitors , some of us well versed in asian kitchen techniques, for a truly pleasurable day of food selection and preparation. For a very reasonable $ 35aus we were collected from our accommodation promptly at 8am by two of the most hospitable and informative team members. Communication was in English at a high standard.We were taken to the main Ubud market ( not the cleanest place here) and introduced to many of the local varieties of foods and spices available. In particular we were taken with pink ginger flower which were used later in a fresh sambal together with chili, shallots, garlic, affirmative lime juice and salt, mixed with coconut oil.We then proceeded to the villa set on the edge of one of the river ravines. Almost every plant in the beautiful compound garden was able to be used in the kitchen. We were greeted with a cold tea and a brief class in offering making.The class was preceded by morning tea, actually banana fritters. We were provided with clearly written notes for both the meat and non-meat menus as requested.We were taught about the methods and ingredients of 7 dishes and their accompanying saucesmaking these as we went along. There was ample opportunity to both observe and participate in each process and each step was expertly guided by our chef Ketut and his team.Each component and process was explained and demonstrated. The school uses traditional cutting, pounding ( for the tuna dishes) and Balinese mortar and pestle technique. Steaming, shallow and deep frying and barbecue techniques were demonstrated. Dessert was made using a caramelizing technique for sweet plantain bananas leaving the flesh intact with a citrussy flavour despite the use of palm sugar. Western kitchen equivalents for preparation were discussed where required.The class moved rapidly and deliciously to lunch which was served in feast style.A very satisfying and rewarding activity which my wife and I have no hesitation in recommending to others , both nivice and experienced, in the confidence that the time required will be well rewarded.

Very enjoyable and informative.. We went as a family and enjoyed every minute. Ketut and his team were very well organised, and the whole experience was delightful and well worth the very reasonable price of about $35 per person. The day included a trip to the local market, the rice paddies, a lesson in making offerings, then a varied menu of dishes, which the whole class prepared and then consumed. It was all clean and comfortable, very clear explanations, and very friendly and enthusiastically presented. Well worth doing.

A must do in Ubud. We had a great time attending Chef Ketut's class today, which began with an interesting visit to Ubud market to see the local vegetables, fruits and spices. On arrival at the cooking class, we were taught how to make traditional flower offerings, and then it was on to the class proper. You are involved in preparing and cooking the necessary ingredients, sauces and dishes, with Pak Ketut and his team stepping in to advise and help when needed. He and his team really helped to make the class fun and interesting. Participants are limited to a maximum of 14 and this allows everyone to play an active part.The 350000 rp price includes hotel pick-up and return, as well as a buffet style lunch consisting of the dishes you helped to prepare and cook. The class also allows you to meet and share experiences with fellow travelers.

Great way to get a taste of Bali and to meet new friends. The cooking class conducted by Chef Ketut and his team was a wonderful and easy introduction to Balinese cuisine and culture, and was a great way to spend a morning and to meet fellow foodies or kitchen enthusiasts from around the world.After being picked up by Made at our hotel, we were brought to Ubud market for a look at the local produce and spices. He also helped us to pick up vanilla pods and nutmegs at very reasonable prices.On arrival at the cooking class, we learnt how to make traditional Balinese flower offerings, as well as coconut oil. The class of nine participants were then taught to make several Balinese sauces and dishes, including gado gado (a vegetable salad with peanut sauce), fish and chicken satay, nasi kuning and ikan pepes, or minced and spiced tuna wrapped in banana leaves that are first steamed and then grilled. Participants were encouraged to take an active part (with a helping hand as and when necessary by Chef Ketut and his team) including cutting/preparing and frying the various ingredients, as well as mincing the tuna in a traditional pounder made out of a 20kg lava rock.Chef Ketut also readily agreed to requests to teach how to make mee goreng and lemongrass sauce, after which we enjoyed the fruits of our labor. My wife and I are from Singapore and are used to cooking with spices, but we enjoyed the fun, friendly and interactive class tremendously. Priced comparatively with other outfits at 350000 rp per person, this is definitely one of the must-dos in Ubud.

Entertaining and informative. The teacher Ketut was very friendly and picked 5 of us up from our hotel. As it was an afternoon class, there was no market visit, but he provided us with a palm basket making session followed by afternoon tea. He, with three other helpers, guided all of us unostentatiously and we got a lot of hands-on experience with the food prep - slicing, chopping, pounding, mixing and wrapping - and we ended up with a good sense of what Balinese food was like. The location was also very beautiful and the kitchen was big enough to accommodate all of us without it feeling cramped. And best of all we got a good meal at the end of it!

Feast and fun. One of Ubud's things to do, must be a cooking class at Payuk Bali. It is excellent in value for time, cookery instruction, unobtrusive help to complete a satisfyig hands on expereince, quality and quantity of food (7 dishes presented buffet style, compared with other establishments of comparable price currently around 350,000 IDR, presentation of finished menu and entertainment from the personable Chef Ketut. A pick up and drop off service is included to the location which takes one on a route through spectacularly windy hilly roads with lush jungle scenery, stoppng in front of a modest gate that opens up into a large compound of little houses with real people living real lives around us. The dining area is spacious and comfortable and overlooks a lush and exotic backyard of secondary jungle with a rushing river at the bottom, one is entertained by squirrels flirting with each other along the trunks of coconut trees and seranaded by birds and cicadas at dinner time. All this generousity would be already ace value but with great warmth and generousity, Chef Ketut and team offered us a welcome drink of lemongrass and ginger, a little lesson in making Hindu floral offering baskets, and how to make our own coconut oil for cooking. These extras show this school's generousity and warmth in kind, the really generous spirit is personifed by Chef Ketut himself. We wish him every sucess and hope that you enjoy yourself as much as we did, and considering we are a family of five with two surley and easily bored teenagers and a twenty year old who explodes eggs in microwaves, and all had fun, that's saying a lot.

Best cooking class. We did the morning class and they picked us up at our hotel and took us to the market. It was very enjoyable and we even got to sample some interesting fruit. Such a great experience and a must do for food lovers. Ketut and the staff were superb, funny and knowledgeable. They were very attentive and were happy to answer all our questions. The food we cooked was delicious!

Very interesting, entertaining and all round great experience!. 3 of us signed up for the afternoon course. We were picked up from our resort but Ketuk and one of his assistants. Very friendly and also funny from the start. 2 other guest were picked up and we were driven up to their village. Here we stopped at some paddy field and Ketuk explained how rice is harvested. Following this we hoped back in the car and up to see the tradition Balinese house. We learnt about Balinese offerings and how to make the offerings. We sampled a Balinese snack before beginning cooking. We spent the next couple of hours learning about tradition food, we were encouraged to smell, taste and ask about all the ingredients. There was plenty of opportunity for questions and if you wanted anything else explained Ketuk and his team were more than happy to explain. Following the cooking we were all able to enjoy the food we cooked. Ketuk and his team were extremely friendly, welcoming and funny. It was a fantastic afternoon and I would highly recommend for anyone. Thank you to everyone at Payuk!!

A dinner, class and a show. It took no more then 30 sec. To warm to our chef, guide and all round amazing person Ketut. We were picked up for the afternoon from our Ubud resort taken to the market where we had a quick lesson all that's important to ingredients for Balinese cooking, then off to the families village a quick lesson on Balinese family life and offerings you'll then start an ambitious list of bases, dishes, techniques while being guided and entertained. The bonus is you'll get to eat it all. Highly recommend and wouldn't change a thing.

Very humouristic and a great morning. We did the morning class on 20 october 2013. Ketut took us on the market and showed us what food is available there! Especially the Balinese Fried Eel (BFE).In the cooking class itself, we were (after preparing offerings) involved in cooking the most delicious Balinese specialties with a small group. It was great fun and the result passed all tests!!Thanks to the staff for giving us suck a nice and warm welcome and a perfect morning!

So much fun and so delicious!. What a great experience this was! My girlfriend and I loved this class. We're both complete amateurs and somehow we were taught to make this huge amazing meal. I've even been able to replicate some of the dishes back home which is a great reminder of our trip. Thanks!

Ketut Budi rocks!. My wife and I are both good cooks, and we've long enjoyed Indonesian food, but this class completely demystified the cuisine in a most delightful way. Extremely well organized and extremely entertaining as well, you get worked hard but the results are a superb feast you've actually made. We also enjoyed meeting the other people who took the class. Ketut could have a future as a TV celebrity chef, he is hilarious.Do the morning class if you can, the market trip is better at that time of day.

Excellent cooking class. We went tot the excellent cooking class by payuk today. Had a wonderful time! Contrary to most cooking classes where one watches the staff prepare food , we basically did everything ourselves. From cutting bali spices to grinding chicken in a pot. The food was delicious. Thanks tot the payuk team and especially to masterchef Ketut!!

Masterchef without the pressure - Bali Style. We did this cooking class on our last day in Ubud. This was excellent fun. The day started with Chef Ketut giving us a tour of the markets where all the food would normally be purchased, although the ingredients were all pre purchased for us to start the class when we arrived at the kitchen. Chef Ketut also helped me buy a Durian (the stinky asian fruit) at the market as I had really wanted to try one for a long time - it tastes better than it smells). We were in a group of 8 people and we had a great time. Chef Ketut and his asisstants were very friendly and helpful, and we all got to experience each stage of the process to make several starter and main dishes, and a dessert. The whole atmosphere was fun and friendly too. The reward of out labour was a delicious buffet of the food we had prepared. Hygine standards were good too. Highly recommend to any lover of cooking or eating Indonesian cuisine
Highlight of our stay in Ubud!. We went for a cooking class at Payuk Bali and the experience was great - so much fun and the food we cooked was amazing thanks to super-chef Ketut. Highly recommended!
Brilliant. Brilliant. Food was fabulous! Laughed all morning. They packed up all the left over food for me to take home. Absolutely Brilliant!

Brilliant cooking class - a must-do!. This cooking class was the best thing we did on our honeymoon. We'd done a lot of research into the activities we were planning to do, and there are a lot of similar cooking classes on offer - we're so glad we chose this one! It is a special privelege to visit someone's home to learn how to cook traditional Balinese food! The house is set in lovely surroundings, overlooking a river, with lots of vividly coloured flowers. Before we started cooking, we used some of these flowers to learn how to make small offerings. We also visited an afternoon food market beforehand, and tried some snake fruit, which was interesting!Ketut, Kadek and all the staff make sure you get really involved, and a hands-on experience is exactly what we were looking for! There was also plenty of time for photos, and Ketut himself was happy to take photos of us chopping/frying away. You also get a recipe book to take home, so that you can recreate (or at least, try to!) all of the dishes at home. There were 4 of us, which I think is a perfectly sized group, and we all got along really well. This made the experience even better! There was lots of laughter, especially from Ketut, who is brimming with genuine warmth, friendliness and all-round cheerfulness. Kadek, who showed us around the markets and taught us how to make our offerings, was lovely and a great guide, and made us feel so welcome!At the end of the day while the sun was setting, we got to sit down and eat what we'd made. The food was delicious, varied, and plentiful, and the atmosphere was beautiful, and very relaxed. It was the perfect ending to a fun-filled day in the kitchen.I'd recommend this course to anyone who is visiting Ubud. It's superb value for money, and you get a fantastic experience that you'll never forget! Another thing I'd recommend when visiting Ubud is to use mosquito repellent wherever you go!

Surpassed my expectations. We got to cook in a beautiful Balinese villa overlooking a valley with monkeys jumping from tree to tree! There was little waiting time and a lot of eating time, and the food was great!The cooking was great fun. Everyone got to participate and chop, grill, or fry things. I particularly appreciated the fact that we didn't need to know the recipe itself (what a relief, the basic sauce is NOT basic at all!) The staff was there to give us directions every now and then, and we all worked together to move every quickly through recipes. Indonesian food involves many herbs and ingredients, so it was better to rely on the staff and study the recipe on your own later. I have taken cooking classes before that I thought was so-so, but this one is great because the food smells so good and you wouldn't make indonesian at home. I also liked the other participants and even made friends after the class! I would definitely recommend this class to anyone who has any interest in cooking or would like to see explore a traditional Balinese home.

Brilliantly Authentic. For my girlfriend and I this was the highlight of our trip to Ubud. Ketut was full of fun and knowledge, the food was simple to prepare and wonderful to eat. The best part was that it was in a family compound amongst real Balinese locals, far from the tourist traps of Ubud central. And now the recipe book has pride of place in our kitchen.

A must for anyone going to Ubud!. We were picked up in the morning when the beautiful Kardek took us to the market and showed us around. He was extremely knowledgeable with a wonderful sense of humor that was infectious. The cooking school was excellent, where a team of local balinese made you feel welcome in their compound and worked hard to ensure everyone was happy and safe. There were young children in our group and they were given individual help. The food was delicious and we were able to sit at the table and talk to other guests for over an hour. Loved the experience and would recommend it to anyone and everyone.

"Memorable Balinese experience - highly recommended". My nine year old daughter and I had the most wonderful day with the Payuk team. We started with a visit to a rice field followed by the markets - so many different sights and smells!! My daughter was amazed at the colourful flowers, fruits and vegetables. We returned to a traditional Balinese home to begin our cooking experience. We began by making a flower offering and then made our way to the 'kitchen' and 'dining' area - the most beautiful setting. Surrounded by lush garden, high on a cliff edge - we could hear the river running below.After a cuppa and fried banana we began to chop, sauté, steam, pound (chicken mince), fry, mix, grill etc. Our group of four was kept very busy!! Once all dishes were completed came the best part...time to feast!! The food was delicious, company was wonderful and the setting was second to none. Payuk Cooking Class is highly recommended. There is something very special about being invited into a private home to experience the Balinese way as opposed to cooking in a restaurant kitchen.Thank you Payuk!

Wonderful experience - highly recommend. We spent half a day learning about traditional balinese cooking, from where the spices etc are sourced (a visit to the market) followed by preparing and finally eating all of the delicious food that we made. Our host, Ketut, was very welcoming and had a fantastic sense of humour which only added to the experience. Was great to make Nasi Campur from scratch using traditional methods! What a fab day - would do again for sure!

Great experience!. I had so much fun doing this class. I did the morning one, so we first visited the produce market and got explanations by owner Ketut. Then we drove to his house. First, we made offerings. Then we had some tea/coffee, and then the class started. Ketut explained everyting very well, and would answer any questions in detail. It was very informative to see how sauces are made from scratch. Moreover, everything we made tasted great as well!The staff were all very nice. Ketut is quite a character, it will be hard for you not to laugh along with him! ;-)You will get the recipes at the end of your class. This class is highly recommended!!

Tailor made!. People we met recommended this cooking class to us. It was an amazing experience. The cooks and their families were very friendly and welcoming. One of us is allergic to ginger, but even though the Balinese kitchen depends a lot on ginger it was no problem for them to alter the dishes (but please inform them beforehand). So half of the group cooked the prepared recipes, and we had our own 'side dishes' - ginger free! And they provided us with the recipes - can't wait to try it at home. Getting to know other travelers from different cultures and having fun while coocking was also a big plus - the setting is lovely and welcoming.

A Fun Class with Good Food & Awesome People. My friends and I had came to Bali for a 5 days trip and it was a must for us to learn Balinese cooking. As such we went to the cooking class and we enjoyed ourselves so much. The staffs were very welcoming and they were always cracking jokes and smiling, to make the cooking lesson more entertaining and fun. It was a very good experience for me as I was able to have first hand view of how the Balinese dishes are prepared in a traditional method. It's a must-to-do activity in Bali if you love cooking. The day ended off with us enjoying the good feast that we had whipped up. A very good experience indeed!

Top Activity to do in Ubud. This cooking class was my highlight in Ubud. My husband & I were picked up from the hotel by their friendly staff. We then headed down to the wet market and explored the local culture. Within 5 min drive, we arrived at a family style home in a village and greet with more friendly staff/family members. We learnt a lot about the Balinese culture and practice. The whole operation was very well run. There was no time to stop. We were busy chopping, cooking, laughing, tasting and enjoying our time with the company. My husband sure enjoy his time interacting with the staff. He wants me to mention that the satay that they've taught us to make was EXCELLENT!

A must do. I had the best time at the cooking class. Besides learning to make the traditonal food you get to know a lot about Balinese people and their religion. I have learned more about Balinese lifestyle at the class than I did in the entire two weeks of staying here afterwards. The staff is happy to answer all the questions and are also interested to get to know your culture and trafitional food. They are truly commited to what they do and are trying to improve by getting your feedback.The thing I was happy with the most is the fact that the hygiene in the class was on a very high level. I was really worried about it before going to the class because I was shocked by some of the Balinese kitchen. The payuk cookng school was a really plesant surprise.It is definetely worth 350 000 rupiah.

Great Food Experience. I went to the afternoon cooking class in Ubud. A pickup at the Campuhan steps near where I was staying in Penestanan took us to have a walk around a local market to check out the commonly used foods for Balinese cooking. The class is held at a family compound within a really well set up kitchen and eating area. First, learn to make offerings, extract coconut oil and then on to do lots of food preparation. Lots of cooking and then on to enjoy all the delicious dishes made during the afternoon. There were six or seven Balinese men and women all assisting with preparation, cooking and just generally making it all possible. Sadly these guys did not join us to eat all the delicious food. It would have been nice to all sit down and share the meal and conversation together. Maybe this would be a good thing to do, a good opportunity for a cultural exchange whilst sharing the meal. Overall a great day and also a drop off back home...Highly recommended.

Must Do if you like cooking. We did recently stay in Ubud and decided to participate in this cooking class. What a perfect half day! We were picked up at the hotel and went first to a local market, to see all the different fruits, vegetables and other things. Everything was explained in detail. The day continued with the short drive to the cooking class location, where we were first greeted with a cold local drink. Then the way of living in a Balinese house was explained and we started to prepare some offerings. Followed by the preparation of a 8 course menu. As we have only been two participants, we have been involved in the preparation of everything. The kitchen, restroom and eating place have been extremely clean, the staff was supportive and funny and the food very good. The cooking class was a great experience. Highly recommended

Great school, lovely day cooking with friends. We had a wonderful day, educated on some interesting facts about herbs and spices. I enjoy the food and now can try myself some time. Our group were lovely and it was like cooking in our own home and nice as a community. The whole journey was great and we all had a nice tour and then experience.

Fun. What a fun time we had, a real cultural experience.....making the offerings, learning the coconut oil process and chopping, crushing ,stirring, mixing for about 10 different dishes. A wonderful size group of 4 people and lots of chatter whilst we enjoyed the smorgasbord we had created.

MUST JOIN!. My husband and I had a blast with Ketut and friends. From the pick up and till the end, everything was superb! Ketut and the rest of the staffs were very professional and warm which make us fell so comfortable. The market experience, making offering, cooking preparation, cooking and last but not least eating. The place itself was very clean and in a high location with nice view and fresh air. My husband have never ever even do any cutting and frying but thanks to Ketut.... I can witness all this :) Thank you Payuk Bali.

Versatile sauce/ base recipe taught. Very fun experience for us with hands on prep work and cooking involved. Ketut had us chuckling and having fun whilst putting together various parts of a dish. Although you may not be involved in learning everything listed in the recipe book from start to finish, given it's only a half day course, you can take the recipe book home with you so nothing is really lost.We put together a sauce/base which was used in various ways throughout the session. This was very helpful and put weight behind that specific recipe as it was shown to be quite versatile. Apart from the cooking, part of the experience was a market tour, making our own Balinese offerings, a brief overview of how coconut milk and cream is produced, complimentary water, pick-up and drop-off.

Fantastic activity - loads of fun !. It was a great experience. a small group of only 4 people. the food was very clean and the staff were lovely. Would highly recommend it. Also got to see the rice fields, how the local people live, how they make coconut milk, coconut oil and got to take home clear recipes for everything that we cooked. The setting was also lovely, overlooking the river in Ubud - sounded lovely !

Extraordinary !!!!!. We went there with my family and some friend.It was an activity proposed by our guide, and we loved it !!!! Why ? First of all, they were in time to dropped us at our hotel (that's very unusual in Bali).They dropped us at 8:30, then, we went to the local market in Ubud and they explained us every little thing you can find inside the market. Then, we arrived in their house (a traditional balinease house) and they showed us how to make the traditional offreing basket, and we had a cup of home made cold tea. It was very nice, and the result was nice.They showed us how to make the coconut oil ( long long work !!! ).before starting the ccooking lesson, we were offered some banana donut with palm sugar and some tea&coffee. They gave us some cooking recepies, to do it at home.Then we started to cook, we leart how to make the tradionnal sauce, we made a soup, a chicken curry, tuna in banana leaves, yellow rice, chicken lollipop barbecue, and a desert with banana, coco milk and palm sugar.We eat every dishes and they were all nice. The Bali family who made this lesson is very nice, hearty, they pay attention to any of your needs, in one word : perfect.Everything was perfect, it was the first good meal we eat.I really advise this cooking lesson, they are extraordinary people, and I will have this as memory forever.
Fabulous!. What a fabulous class. The people are so friendly and involves a mixture of culture, going through the markets and cooking. Highly recommend.

Love the food.. This is a great cooking class! You get a holistic experience including market know-how, food prep, cooking, and eating! And since Ketut is a trained chef he also makes you feel like you're in a commercial kitchen!Ketut is a nice and funny guy who makes everyone feel welcome, the other staff are also very friendly.You work in two groups to collaboratively prepare and cook 7 Balinese dishes - all delicious - and subsequently gain a good understanding of Balinese food. My favourite was the sambal tomat lalah.Because this is a half-day class and not a course, don't expect to learn every meal inside-out or to be taught how to cook.Also, because you work in groups it helps if you work well with the other participants.Picked up and dropped off at accommodation. Excellent.

Entertaining, friendly and helpful people, delicious food set in a beautiful location!. I really enjoyed my cooking class, we started with a walk around the local markets and our guide answered all of our questions. Then set off to the home where we were shown how to make god offerings and taught some Balinese traditions. The staff were amazing, so much fun and so helpful. Great group sizes, they are always keeping you busy and helping you with anything you need. The genuinely enjoyed teaching and that made it even more fun to learn. We got to eat all the food we made which was awesome too, whilst chatting with the other students and enjoying the beautiful surroundings. Pick up and drop off to my hotel. I'm so glad I did it and would recommend these guys to everyone, there was a family there, couples and singles, all were warming welcomed and had a great time. Thank you :)

Great staff, great experience -- I loved it!. You can not imagine having such a nice cooking place... Everything is perfect, from the pick up to the time you eat. There's not a little thing that I can say wasn't perfect (and I'm a real perfectionist!). What I liked most was the atmosphere, those people were so happy to do what they where doing and everything was so genuine... On the cooking side, I'm a french chef and I've got to say that I learnt a lot! Everything was going really fast but at the same time it was so easy to follow...I Can only recommend!

Not a cooking class. The experience was OK overall, but this was not really a cooking class. You get to partake in the making of 6 dishes as an assembly line worker. You do not learn how to make the dishes. A lot of stuff is already prepared, and you don't get any overview of how most of the dishes are really made. Payuk was really friendly and funny, so it's great if you want some entertainment (hence the good rating on TripAdvisor). Not so much if you actually want to learn cooking.

Must do if you like food. My family of five took part in the morning cooking course and everybody loved it! The Chef has a great personality, the class is informative and you actually do all the cooking yourself. Also, the group size is small, which just makes the whole experience more intimate and hands-on. Highly recommended.

Great class in Balinese cuisine. What a delight, great half day in Ubud, starting with visit to local market, rice field and talk on local community, class was entertaining, hands on, and wonderful eating what we had cooked, coming away with written recipes . Highly recommend, what lovely people, thank you for adding that special spice to our holiday. Yummmmmmmy!

Great Time - Fun, Easy Cooking & Intro to Balinese Culture. First of all, Chef Ketut is an amazing spirit and personality. He was very lively and fun and really made for a great host/entertainer/teacher. My girlfriend and I signed up for the class and were joined by one other person making for a class of 3. We cooked all of the dishes simultaneously so at times it was hard to keep the exact directions of a dish straight but it was still easy to follow. We made great food and I am happy to have a recipe booklet. We also made our own Balinese offerings, stopped in the market and got a tour of the rice fields. This was a very fun day!

Engaging introduction to Balinese culture, ingredients and cooking for whole family.. My family of five went to this place and had a great time. We were little bit skeptical driving through the countryside but when we got there we were reassured. We learned about the market, the offering, ingredients, how to make coconut milk and oil, and then also how to prepare everything from scratch. The chefs that were helping us were very good, I would highly recommend this is a great introduction to Bali food and culture

Cooking class- awesome experience!. I took this cooking with my sister while staying in Ubud and it was fantastic. We made over 7 courses and the teacher was hilarious! They let everyone participate in all aspects and prior to the class they showed us how to make offerings. Not expensive and they pick you up from your hotel and drop you off. Fantastic experience and the class takes place deep in the rainforest. Delicious food, not to be missed!

Great cultural experience. Great view, beautiful place and we learned a lot of things about food and balis culture. Guide was great fun and they found a good mix between letting us do the fun/interesting things and take over for the rest

Not To Be Missed. My husband and I spent a most enjoyable day at Payuk Cooking School in Ubud. After being picked up promptly at our hotel we had a guided tour of the market. It was relaxed and informative. It was a chance to get lots of our questions answered by Chef Ketut Budi in his jocular manner. Afterwards we traveled to a rice field where we learned even more. As it turns out Budi is also a rice farmer. Then we drove a short distance to his family compound. There we proceeded to create a sumptuous Balinese feast in the most relaxing, friendly atmosphere imaginable. The teaching was superb and included lots of cultural information. Like all great teachers Budi created an atmosphere that was so fun we forgot we were learning. The facilities were clean and the setting was remarkably beautiful. Budi and his helpers were efficient and so attentive. I joked that someday I would see them on the Food Network, but really "Budi in Bali" would be quite a hit. Even if you aren't that into cooking you will enjoy this.

Best cooking class ever. My husband and I had the privilege of doing this cooking class with Ketut and his wonderful staff last week. From being picked up at our hotel to visiting the local market, the beautiful rice fields to making blessings, learning about Balinese culture preparing and cooking a sumptuous meal we had so much fun and learnt such a lot. There were eight of us in the group and everyone got involved in the prep and cooking process encouraged by Ketut's humorous and expert tuition. I would highly recommend this cooking class.

Amazing day with Ketut and crew!. We took the cooking class with our friends and it was the best experience ever in Bali. Ketut was wonderful, funny, accommodating, and easy to get along with. The way they teach you was very hand-on and they really helped make us feel comfortable, as well as have a great time. The itinerary included shopping in the market for the food that we will be making, making Balinese offerings and understanding the meaning of it, and cooking at this amazing home. We had so much fun and would definitely come back to visit. Thank you!

Amazing day for kids and adults. Ketut made us feel like family from the first moments. We had a happy and knowledgeable guide in the markets. The staff have a good relationship with the sellers there and we could try a few things.The visit to the school was a great cultural experience for our kids, one of whom is a similar age to this in the class we visited. All our questions (and the kids had many!) were answered by Ketut, our driver and the teacher.When we reached the family compound we were welcomed again and enjoyed a delicious drink before beginning with the cooking preparation. Ingredients were introduced and much laughter enjoyed by all the participants as we prepared the food. Kids were welcome and assisted to chop. And stir and grind with tools they had never seen before.By the time we were done we were all friends and sat down to a fabulous meal as the rain poured down over the incredible view of the gully. We relaxed and ate our divine creations and were sorry to leave.I would recommend this to anyone who likes to cook and have fun in a relaxed friendly home atmosphere!

Chef Ketut and his team make all the difference!. My husband and I go to cooking classes in every country we visit. This was amongst the top ones we have been to. Two reasons; the people esp. teacher and chef Ketut and the itinerary which included visiting the markets, making Balinese offering and cooking at a local home. Also, this was really a cooking class and not just a demonstration; with Ketut helpfully pointing out substitutes in our home countries.

Nice cooking class in the jungle. On the 2nd of july we did the cookingclass with payuk in the afternoon. They came on time to our hotel and before starting cooking, we stopped at the rice fields and got some explenation. After that we arrived at the Balinese house and learned how to make an offer. Another lady explained us something about making coconut oil and milk. Then got coffee/tea and a banana snack. Cooking was really great! We were just with 2 people so it was a private class. We were not really good in cooking but the 3 chefs helped us so good. You will make 2 starters, around 4/5 mains and 1 dessert. When we finished, we tried to eat all, but it was so much:)! The view is also beautiful, because it is in the jungle and above a river. The chefs can all speak english!

Great fun with Ketut. If you want to learn more about Balinese life and cooking, this is the place to go. You visit the market in Ubud, then drive to the village of Laplapan where you see some beautifull rice fields. The cooking class is held at a family compound where you witness how balinese families live together. You learn how to make balinese offerings and they show you the herbs and fruits in their garden. Then a coffee break with fried bananas and the cooking lesson starts. They explain everything clearly and let everyone participate in the cooking process. You get a booklet to take home with all the recipes. And after cooking is finished you can enjoy the dishes prepared during lunch. I cook a lot and have followed many cooking classes in Asia, but this was definately one which I would recommend to everyone. Thanks Ketut and staff for this lovely morning!

Even as an experienced cook, I learned something new. The whole tour lasted for nearly 6 hours, starting with a quick visit to the local fresh food market, then off to the beautiful rice field to learn about their irrigation system and marvel at the lovely scenery. Then we were off to his lovely and stately home. Then came the run down like this:Making temple offeringsWelcome herbal drinkRefreshment (tea/coffee and banana dessert)Get to know the ingredientsChop-dice-grind-fry-boil.....busy work timeEnd results: Splendid lunch!During the class, 5 of us each was assigned a task, and we were all busy with our hands, it's really a hand-on exercise rather than a demonstration, this is how I like it. The master chef Ketut Budi himself is a very friendly and warm fatherly man, with a nice sense of humor and charm. Even as an experienced cook myself, I felt I had learned something new. I got a bit of a sore back from grinding those spice paste, talked about working for your lunch! There was a lot to eat, too much actually, and it was very delicious and satisfying. This, in my opinion, had got to be one of those best Bali experience one comes for. I highly recommended this one over all the others, for the class is kept to a small number, which means everyone GETS a chance to have a go.If I return to Ubud, I will do it again, hopefully with different dishes.

Sensational - best tour in Bali. This was a fantastic experience, starting with a trip to a local market, then off to marvel at the rice fields & beautiful scenery. Next up is off to the cooking class with small groups which make the experience more personalised, overall a fun, interesting & tasty adventure into Indonesian cuisine. Kutut is a great teacher, with a warm & friendly persona allowing us into his home & dream with kitchens set to western standards - a must do for all great food lovers while in Bali.

Great fun, great food!. If you want to try cooking Bali-style Payuk is what you're looking for. After a visit to the local market Ketut and his team will show how to make traditional Balinese offerings and then will take you through the preparation of a whole delicious meal. As groups are small (max 8 persons) you actually get to do some cooking. In a jolly and relaxed atmosphere Ketut gives you plenty of tips you can take home along with the recipes to impress family and friends with new flavours.Keep up the good work, guys!

Fantastic experience. I spent almost a month in Bali (2 weeks in Ubud) and had many wonderful experiences, of which this was one of the best. I was picked up at my hotel and then taken to the traditional market, the rice fields and a local school before going to the beautiful location where the cooking classes take place. The teaching was excellent, the food superb and the whole was a wonderful way to end my Balinese experience. Highly recommend to anybody with an interest in Balinese culture, or food. Wonderful.

Totally exceeded expectations!. There are a bunch if cooking classes in Bali, but some friends of ours recommend this one - we were not disappointed! They pick you up at the hotel, take you on a little tour of the rice fields, teach you about Indonesian ingredients, then show you hands on how to make a delicious meal. The chef/teacher Keetut is great - this dude could have his own TV cooking show he has so much personality. And the cost? All I will say is its a bargain...

Keetut's secret sauce. Very good cooking class. Ketut, the chef, took us to the market and explained to us what all the ingredients were. He told us about Balinese culture and taught us how to make Balinese offerings. The kitchen is in a beautiful location and his helpers and himself are very friendly. At the end of the day we had prepared a delicious meal and now we know how to make his secret basic sauce, which he puts in everything he makes. I recommend the course to everyone. Ketut himself is very enthusiastic, funny, and helpful.

A must do when visiting bali!. We did this class on the last day of our holiday in Bali. It was a great experience. Lots of fun, laughter & a wonderful way to learn more abut the balinese culture! Definitely recommend!

Really nice experience. We did a cooking class in Laos and so we decided to go for one more on Bali. Out hotel had a flyer of the "Payuk Bali Cooking Class". So we checked it up on the internet and decided, that it was ok. The next day the Pick-Up came in time and we first went to the Ubud food market. One really nice told us everything about spices, meat, vegetables, etc.. On our way to the cocking class the driver decided to stop in front of a school. He gave us colouring books and said, that we should give them to the children. In the beginning we felt bad for interrupting the normal classes, but actually it wasn't bad at all. The kids were having a break of their dancing classes anyway and so it was ok for both parties.Now to the cooking class: In the beginning we got taught in Balinese traditions and had to make a Balinese offering ourselves. After that we started to cook. Everybody was busy. In the end we cooked 8 meals and had a nice lunch after class.We were 5 persons, the kitchen was outside, but in the shadow and it is also possible to just cook vegetarian or vegan style, if you like to. In the end the whole trip took more than 4h and we can say, that we really had a good time. We can really recommend the Payuk Bali Cooking Class. I think we had to pay 380.000IDR per person, which was ok, I think.

Hands on and enjoyable, great for kids too. I chose this cooking school based on the reviews here and I wasn't disappointed. I was looking for something that was hands on for my kids so they wouldn't get bored and that's exactly what it was.We were picked up by Kadek right on time from our accommodation and taken to the local market. As we had booked the afternoon group, some of the market was already closed but it didn't really matter. We were then taken back to a family compound in a beautiful location. We received a welcome iced tea and were then taught how to make our own offerings which the kids enjoyed.Next we were given a welcome snack and tea which was delicious. The table organised for us is in beautiful location looking out onto the valley below.After this we began our cooking session. We put on our aprons and started chopping, slicing, pounding, boiling and frying. My kids had fun chopping up some of the ingredients and then grinding them into a curry paste. They really enjoyed making the chicken skewers and pounding the chicken into mince.When the cooking was over we sat down and were served all our food buffet style which was delicious. I can't say enough how patient, friendly and helpful the staff were with us and our kids. I would highly recommend this experience to anyone visiting Ubud.

A deliciously fun experience!. This was a wonderful experience. We were picked up in the morning and taken to the market in Ubud. Ketut gave us a thorough tour allowing us to smell and touch various items. After a scenic drive to the village of Laplapan, he showed us how the irrigation system works in the rice fields. From there went to his house where we were served tea and got to make two types of offerings. We created seven heavenly dishes during the course in a very hands on setting. Ketut has a wonderful sense of humour and he and his staff were all very helpful throughout the day. The very clean outdoor kitchen and dining area were set amongst beautiful scenery overlooking a river valley. We enjoyed our class with our five other classmates and would highly recommend learning to cook with Ketut!

You're in for a treat!. I took the afternoon class and it was a great experience.
You'll get a loads hands on excercise! It's a great opportunity to learn how the create truly Balinese dishes from a really great team of instructors.
And before I forget, indulding in the meals when you're finished is just a pleasure! :)

Great fun and food!. I took the morning class and it was great. I was picked up at 8:15 and met the three other participants. We went to the market, where we were shown different kinds of food and spices which was very interesting. After that we went to the place where the cooking class took place. It was outside the centre and on our way we even stopped at great rice fields. We were greeted with an absolutely tasty welcome drink and learned how to prepare an traditional offering. After that we started our hands on cooking class with a lot of information and fun. The food we prepared was just great and we had a very good time with the lovely and competent staff. I totally recommend it! Thank you very much for the great experience!

a MUST on your visit to Ubud. I signed up for a cooking class in the afternoon with Ketut. The pick up was right on time, the class was small(there were only 3 of us). We did go to the Balinese traditional market but they were almost closing due to the time, then went to Ketut's house. I loved making offerings. The kitchen was well organized, clean and impeccable. We made 7 dishes and they were all delicious. Ketut and his staff were beyond awesome and I had so much fun cooking. If you have about 5-6 hrs to spare in Ubud, I recommend you take this class. it's more than just cooking.

Extremely fun and highly recommended!. This was a cooking course, a learning experience and a half a day of sheer laughter. Set atop a hill outside Ubud, in serene and beautiful surroundings Chef Ketut Budi runs this charming cooking school. Ketut was intelligent, informative, experienced and utterly hilarious; he's a student of laughter yoga! His love for what he does and his passion for his country's cuisine was infectious.We were also taught how to make the ubiquitous offerings that can be seen across Bali. We also visited a local primary school that the cooking school supports, which was hilarious as I witnessed my mate singing and doing the actions to 'I'm a little teapot' (under duress but hilarious nonetheless.If you've got half a day in Ubud, definitely do this - you'll be glad you did. My mates and I really enjoyed this and were laughing for a long time afterwards.You also get a print out of all the recipes! Thanks Payuk Bali!!!

Payuk Bali Cooking School Magic. My family went to Bali in April and stayed in Ubud for 2 nights (not long enough). On day 2 The Champlung Sari Hotel organised a cooking school for my hubby and daughter. They were picked up at 3pm, went to local markets to learn about the types of veges available, got to the village and learnt about offerings and made one then it was on to meal preparation. They were hands on and loved every minute of pounding cutting and prepping. The smell was amazing and the end result was a feast for the eyes and the stomach. They sat amongst the serenity and enjoyed every morsal. At the end they were dropped back to the hotel about 8.20pm. They both want to go back and do it again. In 6 trips to Bali this is the single BEST THING THEY HAVE EVER DONE and still can't stop raving about it. When we go back we are all going to go. They will change the menu for you so you don't repeat anything. YUMM

Fantastic experience .......well worth every penny. Today's cooking class was an absolute delight. Not only was it a great learning oportunity it was fun and sociable.Ketut and his staff were all wonderful: they were professional, patient, courteous and constantly smiling. The kitchen is well organised and the equipment used was a great balance between traditional and modern. Everything was impeccably clean and hygiene standards thru out were outstanding.Overall the attention to detail meant that everyone alike ( professionals and amateur cooks present) learnt a great deal to take back to their own kitchens to play with and experiment.Highest recommendations are in order for Ketut and his crew of hard working and diligent staff.But they say the proof is in the pudding (eating) and beleive me the eating was sensational ....loved every mouthful.Also have to say thank you to convivial and fun Dutch contingent....the good company added to my experience Ps do not eat breakfast before you go !!! On arrival you are served banana fritters and choice of hot drink,then you get to sample as you go THEN you eat lunch........ENJOY

Bali community experience wrapped up in a cooking class. I'm really glad my friend talked me into this, learning about Balinese living was a bigger highlight than any possibility of improving my meagre culinary skills. Awesome food too! Now I'm actually excited to cook this for my friends back home (though I'll be using a blender).

So Much More Than Just a Cooking Class! Not To Be Missed!. On my recent trip to Ubud, Bali friends and I decided to take a cooking class. Much to our surprise Ketut, his family and co-workers welcomed us into their family and it was the most enjoyable day we spent in Ubud. The tour begins in the open market immersing us into the local culture of bartering for ingredients and a complete explanation the myriad indigenous spices and fruits and vegetables used in Indonesian cuisine. This followed by a beautiful ride into the rice paddies of Ubud to explain how rice is cultivated and harvested before arriving at his home and open air kitchen with a view of the lush Balinese jungle that is awe inspiring. Before cooking however, you are welcomed and invited to create an offering of flowers in their family temple to thank the gods for the blessings that will abound that day. Then it was off to the kitchen for a light breakfast of banana fritters and coffee before a four hour cooking class with superlative hands on instruction. It was non-stop laughing as Ketut is quite the showman, yet his expertise and very specific instruction was welcomed by the most novice cook to the expert. After all is cooked, the class enjoys the fruits of it's labors al fresco. The staff could not be more friendly and the food was outstanding. A recipe book of everything that was learned is also included along with suggestions for alternate ingredients that may not be available wherever home is. This is not just a cooking class, but an invitation to experience the Balinese culture and one that should not be missed. This class is appropriate for the novice cook, the foodie and an experienced cook like myself, Ketut gave me the nickname "the chef!" A most enjoyable day!

Laugh the whole time. Ketut is hilarious, polite, informative and personable. This is a definite to do in Ubud! After he picked us up from the hotel, He took us around the markets explaining Indonesian foods, what they are used in, and sampled the fruits. Then we arrived to a traditional compound where we made "offerings" with the women who live there. The cooking class was in this amazing backyard and he took us through step by step how to make everything from scratch! There was two other helpers who were so lovely and made our experience very enjoyable! The food was unbelievable. It's an amazing experience that I would recommend to everyone! It was slightly cheaper as well. Ketut was a great host and made it a wonderful and hilarious evening!

Sharing a fabulous lunch with family friends. This is exactly what spending the morning was like at the Payuk Cooking class. I will be adding some amazing,tasty and delicious food to my repertoire. The staff where very friendly, patience and informative. I would highly recommend a Payuk Cooking class to anyone who loves Indonesian food.

So much fun (and yummy). We were picked up at our house in Ubud and taken on a great local market tour to see what we'd be cooking with .. then we went to a beautiful rice paddy to learn all about the rice we'd be eating and the cultural traditions with growing the rice ... then a gorgeous flower ceremony in a beautiful home temple ... then ... cooking! What a treat. The class is held at a perfect outdoor location, within a compound that has an outdoor kitchen, dining area with a pretty view across the jungle (and breeze!) and a temple. We basically received four experiences with one event - the market, rice paddies, flower offering making plus cooking. Our lunch was wonderful. I will do this again and again. Loved it.

Excellent course with many recipes. Even if you are a good cook at home you will learn new things here. We had a visit to the market followed by a short stop in the rice paddies. The cooking class was with 12 people in total divided in 2 groups of 6. We got excellent explanation and we all had our own working station with a cutting board and knive. The kitchen is at the back of a stunning jungle garden and there is a seperate area with a table for 12 people. There are at least 4 people helping out with the cooking and they do all the washing up ;-). We were pleasantly surprised aboutnthe food hygiene. The good thing was that we prepared a total of 7 dishes (including peanut sauce, amazing sateh with kaffir lime leaves, tuna parcels). At home i love the Ottolenghi stylemof cooking with many flavours and fresh herbs and that is what we got at this course as well. A must do in Bali if you love food!

A fabulous cultural and cooking experience to delight the senses.. Wean and Carrick are the most generous of hosts opening their home and hearts for the most wonderful insight into Balinese cooking, culture and daily living. From the bustle if the morning markets to the tranquility of making a Balinese offering and wonderful traditional cuisine .... Every detail is taken care of!!! Thanks for the most amazing experience.

Fantastic Afternoon. We had a fantastic afternoon at Payuk Bali Cooking Class. On the day we were the only two which meant we got all the attention, however classes are limited to 8. Very hands on class with great instruction from the chefs. We cooked about 5 dishes which all tasted fantastic and there was no washing up at the end!! Interesting and informative I cant wait to try my receipes at home.
well organised. thanks Katut for a great afternoon. I learnt heaps, made some new friends, and ate some yummy stuff. Annie

Great Leaning experience. What a great experience.. A very informative and interesting guided tour through the markets by Ikadet 2 so much organic food meeting the locals and sharing their produce. Then arriving at the cooking school to be greeted by a smiling chef Kutet...The great thing with this school its all hands on ... you make the sauces grinding and pounding you learn about the spices and how they make coconut oil..Then best of all you eat what you cook .... just yum ... Great environment and I thoroughly recommend the Payuk Bali Cooking class.Thank you

Chez Ketut. One of the typical things to do in Asia is to take part in a cooking class. Through brochures we found in our hotel, we came across this specific one. I guess the program of each course is more or less similar, but nevertheless Payuk Bali offered an engaging afternoon and evening. We were three, this afternoon in November, the two of us and sparkling Joy from Taiwan. We got the regular market tour and a trip through the countryside to reach the facility. In a leisurely way Ketut, bright and cheerful and energetic, made us prepare (well, at least partly) a nice sequence of typical dishes, like tuna sateh, fried chicken, syrupy bananas etc. Alas no wine, but this was understandable given the price of the arrangement. After a big hug we were driven back to our hotel. We thought it to be worth our while.

Great experience. Thank you Ketut for having us. The eight young children in our two families had a great day visiting the market, local school, making the offerings and especially the cooking. The three course lunch we created with your help was delicious.

Best cooking class so far. As soon as I saw Ketuts smiling face I knew that I was in for a great day. We started off around the market, and Ketut explained everything very well. Then we went to a school, which was fascinating. It was so primitive I couldnt believe it. Clean and well maintained, but I have travelled a lot and was still shocked. Ketut gave us books to hand out to the kids and they loved it. I would recommend bringing something from home to give to them if you can.The cooking location is beautiful, and firstly we sat with the family in the temple and made some blessings with fresh flowers, then we ate fried banana with honey and had a coffee before the serious work began.Then we cooked some super delicious food, but I will leave it a suprise for you. This class was definitely the highlight of my holiday, especially learning from smiley Ketut and his crew.Not too long, not too short, great value for money. I would do it if i were you!

Personal favourite of our holiday. My husband and I attended Ketut's cooking class. It truly was an enriching experience that my husband and I will never forget. We were first brought to the Ubud market where we got to see the daily livelihood of stall holders. We were amazed by the freshness in the fruits and vegetables. We then headed to the kindergarten which was an eye opener for us. Even with limited facilities, the children had so much light in their eyes, happiness and contentment. They were so quiet and well-behaved. Loved it! Then off we went to the cooking class. We learnt to make the offerings and I loved the details that went with each offering. Being a Hindu myself, I was not aware that we had colours representing each deity. I love the respect the Balinese have for God. Mind blowing!The cooking class needless to say was a delightful experience. Outdoor kitchen surrounded by a picturesque view of Ubud, its lush greenery and a meandering river...so peaceful. Loved each of the dish we prepared. They tasted delicious. The basa gede gede (the main sauce) is so versatile. It can be used to make satay, chicken soup and many other dishes. Ketut and his group of friends and family were of such great assistance. They made us laugh and enjoy our cooking. My husband who never comes near the kitchen actually prepared two great dishes! Love Payuk Cooking Class!!If you are looking for an authentic Balinese experience, please visit Payuk Bali!100% satisfaction guaranteed!

Payuk Bali explores the essence of Bali through its cooking class. First of all, I would like to say a BIG thanks to Ketut Budi and his wonderful staff for making our trip in Ubud a memorable one! From the time he brought us to the Ubud marketplace to introducing us to a lovely kitchenplace surrounded by lush garden and nature, it was absolutely a joy to behold! He taught us how to make balinese offering using coconut leaves and flowers. He patiently explained to us all the basic spices and ingredients used in most Balinese food. His friendly mannerism, humourous personality and in-depth knowledge of Balinese food made sure we had a fun and enjoyable experience with his staff. Me and my wife can now make delicious chicken satay, chicken soup, three types of balinese sauce, yellow rice, gado gado and many others! His friendly staff also made sure we understood the recipes and instructions. The cooking class ended with an amazing spread of authentic Balinese buffet with sumptuous taste and flavour! Highly recommended to anyone who want a taste of Bali through delicious food in a beautiful countryside environment!

A feast for two.... We had a lovely very personal experience in a beautiful setting. The staff were incredibly friendly and as well as the cooking we enjoyed making the offerings before dinner. Highly recommended

Fun cooking class for all ages. This was a very enjoyable experience. We learnt how to make offerings and then cooked a delicious lunch and then we ate it. Ketut our teacher was funny and entertaining, with a lovely smile. He taught us to make the sacred sauce. This is the basis of most Balinese cuisine, and very tasty it is. His class sizes are small, seven people being the maximum. The day I went there were only three. This made for a very hands on experience. A great day out for anybody.Ketut cannot kill a bunny so there is no Rabbit on the menu.

Fabulous people, fabulous fun. I chose Payuk Bali Cooking Class on the strength of the reviews on this site. We too were blown away by the absolute joy in which Ketut and his team take in inviting you into their kitchen and involving you in every aspect of preparing a typical Balinese meal. I was the lone adult in my party with 5 kids aged 13, 11, 11, 9 and 8. And it was absolutely clear that the people at Payuk enjoy having children in their midst. From the first activity of creating our own offerings too the last we were smiling or laughing. The kids LOVED it all and I would rate it as a must, must do with kids in Bali.

Best Balinese Food - Cooked By Us!. An absolute treat! We were picked up and taken to a rice field to learn about rice cultivation and enjoy some beautiful breeze.Then invited into a family home to learn how to make offerings for prayer that evening.Watched how coconut oil is extracted. Then spent time learning from Ketut how to produce traditional, fresh and delicious Balinese food, we were a small group of 3. We made 7 dishes in total and were completely full by the time we left. We were lucky enough to meet Ketut and his wife's children who had come along that night. Outstanding night with wonderful people and a lot of fun!

Excellent morning of fresh food and a bit of culture. My two daughters and is attended this amazing cooking class today . The staff were friendly and the food we ate was of very good quality. Everything was fresh and flavoursome.Ketut is a great chef as well as very humorous and likable.The food was wonderful with all fresh ingredients , the spices were aromatic and flavoursome.I would recommend this company to anyone that wants a truly authentic bali experience.We were welcomed into,the family compound just like we were part of their family.My favourite part of the days was making the offerings and learning about their meanings. The lunch we cooked was very special as well.Highlight of our trip

The ultimate Balinese cultural experience!. This you have to do when in Ubud!We were picked up at 8 a.m. by Ketut and Wayan with a van at our guesthouse, to go to the produce market in Ubud. There Ketut explained with great enthusiasm al about many different ingredients as we walked across the market, such as vegetables, herbs, spices, fish and meat. Also letting us smell al the fantastic aromas! The ingredients for the cooking class are already bought on forehand, because the market starts at 4 o'clock in the morning. So only the freshest and best ingredients are used! Afterwards we drove to his family's house where the actual cooking is done. But first we made a quick stop at a local school, to bring some books to a kindergarten class. This is so much fun! Al the happy and cheerful kids really lift your spirit! At the family house you are welcomed with a refreshing drink and learn how to make Balinese offerings. Then it's of to the cooking area in the back of the beautiful garden. After a cup of coffee and a delicious fried banana, it's time to start cooking! Everyone gets a recipe book on how to make base gede,gado gado, nasi kuning, sate lilit, pesan be pasih, ayam bumbu Bali, sup timun and kolak pisang! You get to do everything yourself, under the skillfull and watching eye of Ketut. He explaines everything with great patience and enthusiasm! Also telling a lot about Balinese culture! After the cooking is done (about 2 hours), you get a taste of your own made Balinese food. This is served at the dining area with a great view overlooking the palm trees and the valley.All and all a fantastic experience that I will recommend to anyone visiting Ubud! Besides the cooking a unique chance to get an up close Balinese cultural experience!!!

Our best Balinese food so far!. If you ever want to learn more about Balinese culture and their way of preparing the food, attend Payuk Bali Cooking Class. You will like Ketut the chef from the first moment. They pick you up in your hotel and bring you to the market in Ubud. There you learn about fruits, vegetables and spices used later. After that went to an elementary school in his town to bring them some gifts and see their daily business.
