When we reached his home, we prepared the offerings, had some coffee and started with the cooking. We made several dishes and sauces in a small group of 4 people. After 3 hours of cooking, everyone was hungry for the good food, which as expected was fabulous. So go bestir Ketut and have your own Balinese food.

Fantastic - glad we chose Payuk Bali!. There are several cooking schools in Ubud, but I'm so glad we chose this one. My main reason for going with them was the vegetarian menu and the fact that it was more hands on. The food turned out great, we learned a lot, and the staff was so wonderful. Very friendly, very helpful. An excellent way to spend a few hours and get a great cultural experience.

cooking delicious meals in stunning garden setting. The class is held out of Ubud in a stunning garden setting. I took the afternoon class and watched the sun set over a delicious dinner, a truly special experience! Ketut is a magnificent cook and a patient cooking teacher, he did not mind us "helping" him. I loved the variety of Bali dishes that we learnt to cook.

An inspirational cooking class. Ketut's class was thoroughly enjoyable from the local market tour, through to the gourmet feast we cooked and ate at the end. We leaned a lot about Balinese custom, different foods & spices from Ketut who has a great sense of humour and made the class a lot of fun. Would definitely recommend. Mel & Tony

Smile, laugh and cook up a storm. I think you can tell a lot about a person by their smile and judging from Ketut’s, I knew we were in for a good time. His cooking class, like his spirit, was generously infused with laughter and warmth, and of course, lots of delicious food. Payuk Bali Cooking Class currently ranks #15 on Trip Advisor’s list of things to do, but as far as I’m concerned, it’s a must if you’re in Ubud.Since we opted to sleep in, we didn’t get a chance to visit the local market, but we did get a delicious nutritious three hours of extra sleep. Our cooking class took place at Ketut’s Balinese family compound (i.e. his home), set in the lush jungle, a short distance from Ubud. As is customary before meals, we began by preparing an offering of fresh flowers, betel leaves and panda to the Hindu gods.Whether this is applicable to all Indonesian food or just an example of a efficiently utilized menu, I have no idea, but the most important thing I learned was that Indonesian cooking is rooted in the preparation of three sauces: peanut sauce, samba olek and gede (basic) sauce. After smelling our raw ingredients (which included three kinds of garlic!), we began the laborious process of chopping, grinding and sauteeing each into a paste that would later be used as a base for our proteins. Let’s just say I’m happy that modern-day food processors have replaced the mortar and pestle :)Preparing the many ingredients that go into homemade peanut, gede and sambal sauces.The large, open-air kitchen served as a peaceful backdrop for the preparation of our 6-course meal, which under my direction, would have been chaos. But with the help of Ketut and his family, we swiftly moved through the menu, frying chicken for one dish and grilling tuna for the next, and always adding in a dash of our basic, samba or peanut sauces. While the cooking techniques are simple (grill, fry, stir fry, steam), the meal took a fair bit of time to prepare, since we were making everything from scratch. The chefs made sure we snacked at regular intervals, so between the fried bananas, tempeh, satay and soup, we kept our hunger at bay. All of our dishes were cooked in freshly pressed coconut oil, which Ketut’s family produces as part of their village farm collective.Our hosts were constantly smiling, laughing and joking and before we knew it, it was time to sit down and enjoy the spoils of our labor: tuna satay, gado gado, steamed pepe, fried chicken and yellow rice. It was a feast large enough for a family of eight (not that I know anything about feeding a family) although we were just five people. We had a great time and I’d definitely come back to do it all over again.

Cooking with Ketut. We were picked up from our hotel and driven to Payuk Bali Cooking class. There was four of us and we were joined for 3 others - a great class size. We made everything from scratch, expertly taught by Ketut and his assistants. Ketut has a fantastic personality and tells of tales of working in various professional kitchens learning his trade.By the end we dined on our feast - a buffet of various dishes including dessert. We did the afternoon session so did not get to go to the markets and instead made offerings.Great value for money and we enjoyed the whole experience.

A wonderful cultural and culinary experience!. The whole program today was really fun. It was run by a Balinese family and headed by Pak Ketut. Pak Ketut is very friendly, insightful, and helpful. Most importantly, he is a very happy person and has infectious laughter. All in all, it was really enjoyable day and I truly recommend this to anyone looking for a great cultural and culinary experience.

A great day spent to get a taste of real Bali. We spent a wonderful day yesterday with Agung and Wayan who gave us a peep inside the real Bali. Agung is a very cheerful and enthusiastic guide, who has an easy smile and a very spiritual centre. We visited the Ubud market to do a tour of the food area. It's below the ground level. A kaleidoscope of colour, smells and a fantastic array of spices. The huge bags of saffron and vanilla were a sight to behold. We were then taken to a family compound a short distance from Ubud. Two families live here and the cooking classes are held at the bottom of their garden overlooking the river. The class was well run and recipes given out. Chef Wayan whipped around the kitchen making sure that everyone got a turn. My favourites were the Satay Lillit, making the bumbu and dessert of palm sugar bananas with fresh mango was to die for. We made offerings to the gods with the matriarch of the village who promised to pray for us and our good health when she offered our handmade baskets of flowers at the temple later that day. The day finished with a visit to the local rice paddies to understand how rice is cultivated and how it grows. Delivered back to our villa, we were very happy that we had this unique opportunity. Highly recommended.

An truly wonderful morning spent with Ketut and his family!. An amazing day!You do not need to be a chef at all.... We went as a couple and although the other half wasn't that excited about an entire morning of cooking - he absolutely loved it!!Neither of us are excellent cooks, we both LOVE to eat, so that definitely helps, but we had the most wonderful day!Ketut picked us up bright and early and took us to Ubud markets where he showed us around, talked to us about the fruit and vegetables - letting us hold and smell them and just gave us an authentic market visit! He then took us up to the rice fields and explained about how the rice is grown... We then went to his family home.Such a great experience, first we made offerings and drank herbal teas while he talked to us about family life in bali... showed us the process to make coconut oil..... then we got started on the cooking!In no way was he patronising, he just talked us through everything so clearly and was so patient with all our questions!It's a completely practical class and everyone gets fully involved and we both had such a good time!!And the dinner at the end - amazing!The food was fabulous, we had a brilliant time making it, Ketut and his family are so warm and welcoming.... we couldn't have had a better experience! I would recommend it to anyone!

Fantastic activity in Ubud. We had a ball doing this class. Ketut is very friendly and an excellent teacher. The food we cooked was delicious, some of the best we had in Indonesia. I can highly recommend this class
Great cooking class in Ubud. Had a wonderful afternoon cooking Indonesian food with Ketut. He is such good fun and funny too. We all made some delicious food here!
Fantastic cooking class, Ubud. Excellent pick up and tour of local markets. Expert advice and fun as well. Recommended to all who cook and those who like to eat

Fun day for the whole family. We had a fantastic day with Ketut and his team. We started the day with a tour of the local market, a local elementary school and a rice field, it was very educational. We learned to make traditional offerings.The cooking school is in a beautiful location next to river. Very peaceful surroundings. The class was hands-on and the we all enjoyed making the delicous food.We really enjoyed our lunch and were stuffed when we left. It was a great day for the whole family. We can't wait to try these recipes at home.

An excellent insight into Balinese Culture. We were recommended this class by our homestay in Ubud and didn't know much about it before attending, but we are so happy that we chose to cook with Ketut! They picked us up and dropped us off. We started the day at the market learning about not only all of the wondering foods that we would be cooking with that day, but also the other foods that Balinese people use on an everyday basis. Next we headed to what is usually a time for the class to visit the rice fields, but was changed for the day to visiting a local school. We were given notebooks to hand out to the teachers and spent some time seeing what the children learn. It was a truly wonderful thing to see! We finally headed to the kitchen which is in a typical Balinese home setting. We were given a welcome drink and cold towels while being shown how to create the brightly coloured offerings we have seen on the streets since we arrived. As if this hadn't been enough, we then sat down to coffee and tea and fried bananas. The whole morning experience was almost worth the full price of the class! The cooking lesson was phenomenal. We received recipe books to take with us, ate incredible food and had a good laugh with Ketut, Wayan and Wayan! Ketut speaks very good English and provides a very hands on experience. Definitely recommend this to anyone thinking about a cooking class or looking for an overall Balinese experience.

Wonderful Family Experience. After spending a few days researching the best cooking school for myself, a keen home cook and foodie, I came across this course by stroke of luck as the other more renowned classes were either booked out, not running or under renovation. I'm so glad I did, after checking the course schedule, with its market tour, rice paddy tour & tradition palm leaf offering workshop PLUS the hands-on Balinese cooking lesson I had been searching for, I suggested the four of us (ages ranging from 4 - 40) do the class together. After much persuasion the family joined me, and we were lucky to be the only students for the day. We were picked up at our hotel by our chef Ketut & his able assistant, Wayan and taken on a brief market tour, where they were ready to answer all our questions. Ketut is a gregarious warm guide who quickly had the children at ease. Instead of the rice paddy tour, we chose to visit the village school. Our kids really loved the interaction with the smiley happy school kids, (and the school children also had a giggle at us!) The cooking class itself was definitly hands on - to extent that I looked across to see our 4 & 8 year old girls wielding cleavers to chop cloves of garlic! I was unable to help as I was too busy with my own tasks for the preparation of the delicious Base Gede, the base sauce and flavour for many of the savoury dishes. (I wasn't at all concerned, since our children were well supervised by the very talented staff at all times.)A bonus for us was that Ketut tailored the menu to add the kids favourite "Lumpia" (Spring rolls) and the delicious "Dadar Gulung" (Green Coconut & palm syrup pancakes). The setting, at the back of a traditional Balinese family compound was surprising picturesque, with views down a lush green river gorge. The outdoor kitchen was well setup and the fresh ingredients would make any foodie salivate.We were treated to an amazing banquet of the 5 dishes we learnt to cook, but it would have been nice to sit and share the sumptious food with our lovely kitchen staff and their family.I highly recommend this cooking and cultural class to anyone with a love of Bali and its food.

Payuk Bali Ubud cooking class par excellence!. I found this class on Trip Advisor. I'd always wanted to do the Casa Luna class but took the advice of some not so flash reviews about it and booked the Payuk Bali class instead. I'm so glad I did! Ketut and his team were just fantastic. I loved the market tour especially and I felt really comfortable and safe with my 16 year old daughter also enjoying the visit. The actual class was very hands on and Ketut was entertaining, thorough and dedicated. I seriously can't rave enough about what a wonderful day we had. As for the feast at the end...amazing! My daughter and I are vegan and Ketut accommodated us really easily. The other three people in the class made chicken and fish dishes as well, so when it came to sitting down to eat, there were many plates on offer.I would suggest though that the early session may be better at this time of year, November, simply because the late afternoons can be rather wet. Ketut picked us up from our hotel and we were dropped home afterwards. So convenient. This was a great experience and at $35AUD per person an absolute steal. I really hope you also choose to make this part of your Bali trip. You'll love Ketut and be swept up in his passion for cooking and his beautiful energy,

So much more than just a cooking class. Had a fantastic day at the cooking school with Ketut and the team. First trip was to the local food market in Ubud. It is definitely a different experience and we were taken through all of the ingredients and produce in their raw form. Market opens very early (before 5am) so they had already been down to market to purchase ingredients while at their freshest.Next stop was a local elementary school because part of proceeds of classes goes towards books for the children. Had a tour of the school and some of the group joined in in an impromptu one on one game with ice lock sticks that looked easy but the local champion won every time (9 year old boy with a pocket full of sticks).We then went to the cooking school in the local village. Beautiful setting overlooking the valley and rainforest. We were given a demo on how to make the offerings boxes full of flowers. Once we made our own it was time to cook.We made beautiful food using authentic ingredients and tools. We broke into 2 groups of 4 and it is definitely hands on so we got to pound, mix, stir and cook everything (under the watchful eye of the chefs, and they made sure they did the sate tests....). Great selection; soup, sate, curry, fish wrapped in banana leaf, rice, vegetable dish and a heavenly dessert that is so simple but delicious..... We then had the pleasure of eating all the good in the lovely setting and getting the recipes to take home. Definitely things you could make again, they made it seem simple. Highlight is making the pastes from scratch which is then used in almost every dish, so versatile.Well with the trip to ubud and would definitely recommend.

Best cooking class in Ubud!. My wife and our 2 friends attended the cooking class a few weeks ago and it was even better than we could have expected. Ketut picked us up and took us to the main market in Ubud and showed us around (he already bought the freshest ingredients earlier that morning to be used in our class), he then brought us to an elementary school in his village to donate some books and say hi to the kids. After that, we had a quick rundown on how to make offerings, which was neat. The cooking itself was a lot of fun, Ketut's wife and another guy helped out, but we were able to do a good amount of the hands on prep and cooking work. The setting of the class is unbeatable and the finished product was really tasty! We had an afternoon feast that ended up being one of the better meals we had in Bali.

Perfect cooking class. My girlfriend and I wanted to do a cooking course in which you actually get to use your hands and be a little active. That was definitely the case in Ketut's cooking class! Everything from chopping op chillies and garlic to stomping tuna in giant mortars! We also visited an elementary school which is supported by Payuk Bali and learned about balinese offerings and how to prepare them. All in all, excellent course!

Great food, great fun, great location. Visting Bali early October, we booked this class at the very last minute on the recommnedation of our booking agent - we were very pleased they could accomodate our family of 4 at such late notice for that evening's class. We were picked up from our accommodation and toured the markets (which were quiet at that time), visited the rice fields and watched harvesting with our very informative guide. Once we arrived at the compound we were given welcome drinks, made our own offerings (with guidance), saw how to make coconut oil and process coffee. The compound backed on to the river - beautiful and very relaxing atmosphere to enjoy our welcome dish and later our meal. Ketut and friendly staff then put us to work chopping, mixing, cooking, etc but made sure we were having fun. We learned so much and really appreciated the fresh ingredients used. The outdoor kitchen was clean, hygenic & attention given to good food-handling practices. The meal was probably the best we had during our Bali stay - definately the best cooked rice we have ever had. The whole family enjoyed this experience!

The Host with the Most!. I went with two other friends on this trip. We are all from Australia, and my husband Dan is the chef. The thing that would make me recommend this cooking class above others was the host and chef - Ketut Budi. He is extremely entertaining, funny and explains things very clearly.We used incredibly fresh and aromatic ingredients (uploaded), and I love the Balinese offering demonstration we did as well. A recipe book is provided to all attendees so you can try the recipes again at home :-)I adore Gado Gado so it was great to learn how to make this. I would definitely recommend. A friendly family run business in an absolutely beautiful Balinese home. 10/10 - thank you for an amazing time Ketut and the cute little grandma!! I have uploaded some photos as well. Love Chef Dan, his wife Elizabeth and our friend David xxx

Cook it as good as a Cafe!. We did this cooking class for 'something different' to do - turned out the 5-6 hours goes quickly and the tour through a typical village market is an interesting experience. You learn a bit about rice fields and the local religion too. A bit of help from Agung, Wayan and others was provided in putting together the Balinese cooking base from scratch that is used throughout - but at the end we sat down to a meal that we helped prepare and was as good as - better - a meal from a local Street Cafe - and its all included in the price. It is all very easy and cant wait to have a go at home !! Recommended - give it a go!

A great way to spend the day!. Ketut and his family and staff were wonderful. Our experience included a stop at the market, a visit at a local school, a drive through the countryside to his home, learning about and making offerings, as well as preparing a variety of dishes. Ketut's infectious laugh kept the group smiling through the day, and we left with full bellies. He and his staff were very organized and we were amazed at the amount of dishes that were prepared for the buffet lunch at the end. I would highly recommend this class.

Fantastic morning class -definately recommended. Very friendly staff, nice location with stunning view.
Well organised, lots of information. Also stroll on the market was nice and informative.
Because we were very interested in the volcanic stone pestle and mortar, they even took us to a local shop afterwards to buy one for a fair price.
Recommended!

A wonderful day out. We book via a web search and then checked with tripadvisor. All the review were excellent. What a wonderful day we had, picked up by Kutot (Head Chef) and taken to the market where all the ingredience were explained. then on to the family home to cook. the setting was just bueatful. What a wonderful family and environment, it was a side that you don't usually get to see. Highly recommend! Many thanks Kutut! Jo, Dani & Nicole

Highlight of our UBUD trip. We had such a great day with Ketut and his family. The day started off when we went to the local market. We had walked past this area for days and not even noticed it there so it was a lovely surprise to be taken in to have a look. We didn't buy any of the produce as it was later in the morning and Ketut had taken the time to go earlier in the day to ensure that the produce was fresh for us. We then went onto the rice fields where we learnt about the production and then to Ketuts house where we met his lovely family and were introduced to the truly stunning kitchen and restaurant. The cooking class was very thorough and Ketut and his team were friendly and hospitable. We really did have a fantastic time and I would suggest it to anyone.. We got to sit down with our new friends and enjoy our hard-work in a gorgeous setting. A great day.

Highlight of my trip to Bali. I love to cook and experience new cuisine so booked a Bali cooking class thru my hotel in Ubud. The experience surpassed my expectations!Ketut [chef] picked us up at hotel and took us thru the food market, explaining various ingredients; and then off thru the countryside, stopping to explain the growing of rice.We were a nice sized group at a family kitchen.Everything was well organized, clean, easily understood, and fun!! ... a good mix of hands-on and chef demos. We left with very full stomachs, and all the recipes.

A full day with hands on learning cooking and culture - Fantastic !. Best day in Bali.Wonderful experience with lots of laughter,hands on learning and great chef with a smile to light up the day.We not only learnt a lot about the balinese cuisine but also about the culture,family and religious ceremonies.The food was delicious - don't eat a big breakfastas we ate such a huge amount at the end of the day we didn't need dinner! Kutut was so informative about all aspects of Balinese life and we went away with a greater understanding and a very full belly.
Great cooking class !. We spent a really good time with Ketut and his family. We learned a lot about balinese culture and food. The food was so good ! One our best experience in Bali !

Do not miss!. Fun, unique experience. Ketut and wayan spoke perfect English, were knowledgeable, and very accommodating. The program was itself was fascinating, food was delish, and the compound was gorgeous!! Ketut even said that he (with advanced notice) could even customize a menu. Will definitely return.

A must do for anyone in Ubud. Ketut Budi was a fantastic teacher. He had a passion for cooking and for his local Bali. He laughed and smiled the entire class. This really one of the best experiences we had in Bali so far. He showed us his home and his family, I feel as if we experienced the real Bali family life, as well as learning some fantastic dishes that we will definitely try at home.

Cookery with fantastic Balinese character!. We spent a morning with Ketut and his team and no question that it was one of the best things that we did during our fortnight in Bali. Ketut hinself was a wonderfully positive, charming, funny and knowledgable host and head chef. The whole experience was hands on, we learnt a ton of stuff about Balinese life as well as the cookery itself and the dishes themselves were delicious. Most of all though, all of the staff made us feel hugely welcome so that we left wtih a big smile on our faces and very happy memories of a great day. Hugely recommend it!

Personalised and unique. A truly unforgettable experience that provided us both with so much more than other cookery schools we have been to. It provided additional cultural activities including the trip to the food market and rice paddy field, along with the creation of flower temple offerings which immersed us in to the Balinese world for a day. A magical experience with Ketut and his wife and Waynin who showed us patiently how to cook their mouth-watering recipies in their traditional ways. There were no electrial appliances in sight, it was wonderful to do things naturally. Steaming rice through a hand woven basket for example. Having studied and worked in the catering industry both in the UK and Switzerland many years ago, I am quite fussy about food and hygeine in the kitchen. Ketut runs an extremely professional and hygeine conscious kitchen. The Payuk Bali Cooking Class was the best day of our holiday.Wonderful, thank you so much for your personal attention and sense of humour.

Excellent day, awesome recipes!. The four of us had a wonderful day! Ketut was very knowledgeable, helpful, and it was wonderful to get out into the countryside into a typical Balinese house. This is more than a cooking school, its an education in how the Balinese live and how they cook. We were catered to as three of us had allergies, and given 6 different recipes. Ketut also taught us how to make sambal as one of the ladies had wanted to learn. A true test of any cooking school -Can you bring the recipes home and make them? The answer is yes! 2 months later in Canada, I just prepared a delicious meal from Ketut's recipes and wowed my parents. Also great, Ketut answers email questions! If you are going to do a cooking class in Bali, this is the one to do.

Amazing experience!. Was a fantastic day including a tour through a local market, explaining the produce and uses, visit to a rice field, learning to make an offering, and the cooking. The class was held in an amazing location with professional attentive staff looking after your needs. Our chef, Ketut, spoke english beautifully and made the day fun and entertaining. The experience of learning traditional Balinese recipes from locals, sharing their stories and culture is one that i will never forget. I can highly recommend that you give yourself the time to enjoy this amazing opportunity. They will pick you up and return you to your hotel and the day goes from around 8am-2pm. I will certainly do this class again and take any friends and family with me.

A delicious, authentic experience. Agree with prev positive reviews - we did the afternoon class ~3-7pm. Ketut and his family are wonderful hosts, full of warmth and laughter. We enjoyed the market visit, rice fields, a visit to the beautiful family compound, and a delicious meal. Only 2 of us in the class, so very personalized experience which may be lacking at other larger companies. Highly recommended.

Dont miss this incredible and authentic Balinese Food experience. I can not say enough about Ketut and his cooking school...everything was wonderful from beginning to end and we learned so much! The food, the preparation, the care taken all added up to one of the highlights of our trip. Ketut and his staff are so gracious and knowledgable. My 7 year old could not stop eating the Tuna satay....her favorite thing! The food was soectacular and I felt so accomplished at the end as we sat down to feast on our creations! I will definitely visit Ketut again my next time in Ubud!

Great balinese activity. A great half day activity to join in for balinese lifestyle.We decided on a morning class and got picked up at 8 am. Than off to the local market where our guide showed us all kinds of vegetables and ingredients. After the market we drove to the rice paddies where our guide explained us the rice growing techniques.The cooking school is located in a balinese house in the countryside with a wonderful view over the valley.After arrival and a warm welcome we made some offerings for the goods ( folding palm tree leafs into little baskets and filling it with flowers), than off to cooking.The chef and the staffs are very helpful and explain every step.It is an open kitchen with all kind of equipment. We were 9 people diveded into two groups.First we prepared the base for cooking, lots of chopping work. Then we made some fish sates which we grilled on a barbecue. So we prepared all kinds of food, starters, main course and desert:Vegetables with peanut sauceFish sateFish in Banana leafsBean soupSpicy chickenCooked bananas in sugar sauce with fresh fruitsThe food is also great for vegetarians.After cooking we had our lunch! It was great to taste everything we cooked.We also reveived a handout with the recipes.The cooking class finshed at 2 o'clock.Great activity for 30 euros per person! Join in, it is lots of fun!

Frida och Mathilda. Yeeeees! This is so good! Lovely people that become friends so quikly. We had so much fun and was lurning alot of how a typical day with shoping market, rise fealt, offering and cooking means to the Balines people, and it will mean so much to me in the future.To lern so much for so short time, thats a good teacher and a great team. I was laufing so much during this day and eat amazing recepie from the funniest chef Ketut and his beautiful wife Kade they have really make suksses at this place and i wish them all luck in life. I will se them agian in december as a friend! Try this everyone, its so worth it. "and I said yeaaaaahiiiyeaaaah"

Payuk Bali Cooking class. A cooking class that includes a visit to rice paddies and the local Ubud markets looking at cooking produce. Followed by a quick lesson in making offerings and some lovely iced tea and then the rest of the day with some hands on experience cooking Indonesian food and then sitting down to enjoy the efforts. My two young kids (Aged 8 & 5 yo) enjoyed the experience of learning to make offerings and trying the different dishes we were making and were well looked after. A recipe book is included to take home.
A great experience which should not be missed. An excellent introduction to Indonesian cooking in an unrealistic setting. Ketut the instructor is extreme with one of the best laughs I have heard.

fun,fun,fun. my friends and i took part in this cooking class. we loved every minute of it. we learned how to cook, about local ingredients, all about balinese culture and even sang with kutut. he was so much fun and an absolute inspiration. we also made offering baskets and learnt about this ritual. It was a full hands on day. we got to eat all we prepared in a magnificent feast at the end of the day. Kutut in his care free relaxed way ran a full day to perfection. we even visited a local food market and a rice field. I loved this day. whilst set up for tourists it felt authentic.

A good way to spend a day. Overall this cooking class is good. Our “chef / host / instructor” was really friendly, engaging and entertaining. This is a semi-hand’s on cooking class, which was perfect. You got to do just enough to get the full idea, but not too much that you felt overwhelmed. We really enjoyed the pace and relaxed atmosphere of the cooking class, not too intense. We also really enjoyed learning about the Balinese offering ceremony, this was a nice cultural touch.

A Decadent Experience!. If you're in the Ubud area, don't miss out in this tasty experience. We were picked up at our hotel and brought to a local market where our guide showed us all the special herbs and spices we were going to use in our class. The market was an interesting glimpse into local life, certainly a world apart from what we'd see in the States. Next our guide brought us to a rice field where he explained the harvest cycle of rice (3 times per annum). After a quick drive back to their lovely home/restaurant, we were greated by an old women who was all smiles and instructed us on how to make a Balinese offering dish to the Gods. Next, we saw saw how to roast coffee over an open fire (which they later prepared for us and was definitely some of the best coffee I've had). To accompany our delicious coffee was a stricking view of country from their outside seating area - a welcomed moment of peace and quiet from the busy streets of Ubud. Cooking class was well planned, with an organized staff and clean kitchen. We were involved in every step and learned a great deal. Oh, and of course, the food was delicious. I would highly recommend the Payuk Cooking Class: it's a nice small operation that provides an intimate environment with great instruction, freshly roasted coffee, an offering tutorial, how coconut oil is made, and got to taste the fruits of our labor with some of the best food I've had in Bali.

Payuk Bali Cooking Class. Wonderful day spent cooking the most fabulous Balinese recipes. Met some really lovely people and enjoyed the feast afterwards.Chef Ketut Budi made this day very enjoyable. Recommended

If there is only one thing you do in Ubud, it should be this!. I felt luke I was learning about the real Bali in this cooking class. The ataff was genuine and extremely pleasant. One of the veat vacation experiences Ive ever had!

Great experience. After looking around for a good cooking class in Ubud we settled on Payuk Bali and we were not disappointed!! Our experience was amazing, our guide was friendly and talkative from the moment he picked us up till the very end. We only got to meet the chef for a moment because it was a special ceremony in Ubud on that day. The cooking instructions were simple and easy to follow, the food was delicious and the general vibe of the cooking class was amazing! I like the fact that everything was done at their Balinese compund, it gave us a feel for how Balinese families live on a daily basis.

Great fun and learnt how to cook delicious Balinese food!. This was such a great day - educational and great fun. Our host/chef was delightful, entertaining, patient and a great teacher. I cannot recommend this highly enough. I have cooked most of the dishes we learnt back at home and was amazed with how good they tasted. This means the instructions were spot on and delivered in a memorable way. The location of the cooking school was also perfect in a village about 15 minutes drive from Ubud. I had 10 days in Ubud and this was one of the highlights of my trip.

Delicious!. Had such a wonderful and educational day! Full of laughs and were taught by some incredible people that had you smiling the whole morning. Was fantastic to be able to shown how to cook a true Balinese meal and we all sat together to eat at the end of the day.. There was so much food! Days like this make me never want to leave this awesome country.

Best part of our stay in Ubud. We loved our cooking class with Payuk Bali. After picking us up at our hotel, we had a brief walk through the main market to learn about different types of Balinese food. We then got a quick tour and overview of rice farming, and were driven to the picturesque home where the cooking class takes place. After learning about and making our own Balinese offerings, we got to cooking. The class was very hands on and the small group setting was wonderful. The chefs are great - happy to help but very willing to let the students do the majority of the work. We cooked about 6-7 dishes as well as an amazing dessert, and were given a recipe book to take home. Also included was drop off back at the hotel. The class (with driving and all the extras) took about 6 hours and was an amazing value.Highly recommended for everyone - kids included. Provided wonderful insight of day to day Balinese life, away from all the mass tourism.

Must Do in Bali. I spent a month with my 12-yr-old son in Bali this summer. We were on a low budget, but did a few things that cost a little extra. This was the best thing we did in Bali, and one of my son's favorites also (even competing with elephants and rafting and fire dances!) The instructor is not only a skillful and patient teacher, but a warm and wonderful human being that it was a pleasure to meet. The food we learned to cook was the best we had the whole month, the setting was beautiful, we received recipes and an ongoing relationship (new Facebook friend!) as take-aways. There are several cooking classes to choose from - but I feel blessed that we chose the best! The teacher picked us up and even the drive to the family compound where the classes happen was great. Our class also included a tour of an elementary school which I was interested in. When we arrived they let us each make an offering basket and the guide showed us the compound and explained the traditional lay-out according to the four directions. The grounds, gardens and surrounding jungle vistas are beautiful. Then we made a huge variety of dishes and learned so much! They offer the course with or without meat dishes and it is good for a variety of ages. The only draw-back is the huge amount of food that is so good I over-ate. It's like there was a party in my mouth and my stomach had to clean up afterwards! This is so much more than just a cooking class and all the people we met were really special.

A must do. Wonderful way to spend 4 hours in Ubud. You get a little of everything. History while you see some local sights and hands on experience trying out local activities. I enjoyed making the traditional offering you see everywhere. By the time you finsh preparing the food, everyone has relaxed, gotten to know each other and the meal is a shared experience. Wonderful way to meet other travelers. One of the best meals I had on the trip

wanna make remarkable memories in bali?. they are fabulous!! If you are looking for something new in Bali, you have to try cooking class with them.this is not only cooking class, it's learning their culture! (they organize this program in the best way!!) we went a rice field to see where's all the rice come. we went a small local traditional market to lean which ingredients Indonesian use the most.after we arrived at the place (that was traditional Balinese house) we learned how to make Offering.and they gave us some snack(home made banana pancake) and BALI KOPIafter those all we started our own cooking class. we were so lucky because we were the only customer for that class. (afternoon class)so I went vegetarian menu and two of my friend went non-vegetarian menu. (check the menu on their website)I will skip the cooking part because if I start describe how goof it was then I need to write a lot so I just say "just try" BUT! I have to talk about the people there. I've hear that they have few other cook but that day I met KETUT BUDI.he was the best guide and instructor ever! actually he's major in university was F&B. he was super professional!! I'm not telling only about cooking part, the whole experience with him was amazing he really tried so hard to make his customers happyhe told some funny stories, and made us feel free to ask anything curious, tried his best to make sure we feel comfortable~ it was just amazing~ he kept his smiling face whole time. and! he's English was so~~ good!!! If I go Bali again I will absolutely do this again!!! I miss them~

Wonderful friendly "hands-on" experience. Chef Ketut Budi provided a wonderful time, and such a "hands-on" experience from buying ingredients at the market to the cooking. And of course, the best bits were the fantastic setting, the friendly advice and guidance, and the eating of the results :-). It was definitely the highlight of my trip to Bali.

Fantastic! Great Fun and More Than Just a Cooking Class. My girlfriend and I stayed in Ubud and wanted to try our hand at some traditional Balinese cooking. We signed up for this class and it was brilliant fun.The chef Ketuck (apologies if I have spelt this wrong!) really made us feel comfortable and was so polite and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble for him. He very kindly changed the menu for us as I don't eat sea food and my girlfriend doesn’t like banana or nuts. He was a real character with lots of jokes, happy smiles and enthusiasm.The trip to the market was really interesting, then off to the rice fields. We made some offering baskets before starting to cook. Again, this class is all about having fun and not taking it too seriously. It's perfectly aimed at tourists.Superb and would highly recommend it!

Best experience in Bali. I chose this cooking school of tripadvisor for myself, my two sisters and my mom and I was worried they wouldn't enjoy it. Boy was I wrong. From the moment we were picked up we were made to feel like a member of the family. The market tour was interesting and I learnt a lot as was the trip to the rice paddies. Making offerings was fun and it was good to learn about Bali culture. The tea served was delicious and refreshing. I saw coconut oil being made, so much effort. The banana fritters and coffee were served in the lovely open air dining area and were delicious. We then started cooking and made 8 different dishes which was very hands on and lots of fun. We then got to eat our feast. Delicious. Thanks to Ketut and the team for a great experience. I thoroughly recommend this course to anyone.

More Than Just A Cooking Class. I recently took my daughter from Australia to Indonesia to visit the family of her Indonesian father for the first time in 15 years - she is 19 - and thought it would be good if she could learn to cook something to contribute to one of the many family meals I knew we would be having whilst in Kupang.From the time we were picked up by the ever smiling Ketut I knew that this was going to be a great experience for both of us. We visited the local market in Ubud learning to identify ingredients -in both English and Indonesian. A real bonus, as so often we can learn the Asian name but not the English one which is a real drawback when one returns home. We were then taken to the rice fields in Ketut's village and given explanations on the planting, growing and irrigation methods (cultural and agricultural) of the different types of rice. After this we were taken to Ketut's family compound - stunning area - served a delicious iced tea with flavours I have never tasted before and a cooling face washer.We learned to make offerings for the Gods and their meanings - these are seen outside homes and businesses throughout Bali. We then walked through the amazing organic gardens which have everything growing labelled (again in both English and Indonesian) to the outdoor kitchen to begin our cooking class.The food that we prepared was absolutely delicious, about 7 dishes in all. I am over 60 and consider myself a pretty good cook - even of Asian food - but I learnt so much during this class. My daughter - a little reluctant at first considered this to be up there with one of her best Indonesian experiences. One advantage is that the class is small - only 5 on the day that we attended - but I think it goes up to 10. We were given a comprehensive recipe booklet to take home with alternatives for ingredients and cooking implements if they were not available in our respective countries.The setting of the kitchen and the small open air restuarant (just for members of the cooking class) is exquisite! Ketut is assisted by his lovely wife and and another man whose name, I'm embarressed to say I can't remember. All in all I can't recommend this experience highly enough.

Excellent experience, awesome food!. My partner and I decided on a whim that we wanted to do a cooking class during our trip to bail in June of this year (2012) and it was one of the best decisions we made. We had such an excellent day starting with pick up at 8:30 sharp and straight to the Ubud Markets where Chef Ketut Budi took us around the stalls showing us a plethora of ingredients and taking the time to explain each one to us. After our trip to the markets we were taken on a drive through some breath-taking scenery to some rice paddies where the Ketut Budi explained the complex irrigation system used by the local rice farmers.Following our little adventure through the markets and the paddies we arrived at the home where the kitchen / restaurant is located. We were welcomed with a lovely refreshing drink and some soaped towels to freshen up. Ketut Budi explained the traditional Balinese house layout and functionality. We were then invited to learn how to make a traditional offering out of banana leaves and flowers and after that shown how to roast coffee, Balinese style.After a delicious morning tea of fried banana and awesome views (the outdoor kitchen is set on the edge of a cliff that drops down to a flowing river) we were invited into the kitchen to learn how to make a traditional Balinese feast! The class was excellent, all of the ingredients were explained and everyone got involved with the preparation of the meals. We chopped and mashed and stirred and laughed our way to a feast of rice, soup, chicken, gado gado fish and syrupy boiled banana. All of the ingredients were fresh and delicious and at the end of it all we got to pig out and eat it all. It was without a doubt one of the best experiences of our holiday and definitely up there with some of the best food that we ate.Aside from the excellent experience of cooking, one of the biggest highlights was Ketut Budi himself, what a character! He was so funny and cheerful that we would have been happy to sit and hang out with him all day! I would really thoroughly recommend this class, we had a great time and learned so much.

Best Bali Attraction. We've enjoyed cooking schools in other parts of Asia but this one topped the lot. Chef Ketut and his team went above and beyond to make this a memorable cultural experience. First we learned about the ingredients as we toured the local market out of Ubud. Exploring the rice padis nearby was fun and informative. Then we spent the most wonderful evening on a family farm where the well-equipped kitchen and dining areas are sited high on the rim of a ravine. Tropical rainforest covers the slopes and the river sounds magnificent. Here we learned how to make the colourful offerings, grind coffee and cook delivious food. We shared this with a young couple from the Netherlands and another from the UK. Great company for the fun of preparing and cooking, then consuming. We thoroughly recommend this experience.

Awesome food, awesome vibes (great for vegetarians too) :). My Mum is very into cooking, so she really wanted to do a cooking class while we were in Bali. I don't mind cooking, but it isn't something that I particularly enjoy, and my vegetarianism can be somewhat limiting in these kinds of situations. I'm nineteen and I was a little reluctant at first. As soon as we were picked up from our hotel, however, I knew that the day was going to be enjoyable. Ketut was extremely friendly, funny and warm. He did his best to make us feel welcome, and my mother and I (as well as the other three people that were in the group) warmed up to him and each other right away. After the informative market and rice fields trip, we all went back to his amazingly beautiful house to make offerings and cook the food. The place is absolutely stunning. There are lots of fruit and vegies growing in his garden as well as lots of different types of flowers and beautiful trees. the place where you actually eat (next to the open kitchen has a beautiful view, and you can hear the river somewhere below. The cooking itself was enjoyable and the food was amaaazzzziinnng (even though I am a vegetarian). I can't recommend this place more highly. Anyone who enjoys cooking at all should do it!

Cooking/Culture experience with Flair. Excellent choice of cooking class. Fun from the moment we got in the van, informative and passionate about their culture and beliefs and passing this on to tourists. Great market visit, beautiful rice paddi visit and the venue for cooking was amazing. Making the offerings for the Gods was fun and the pride in the tutors was written all over their faces. The cooking was lots of fun with patient helpful tutors and we all had hands on experience at doing some part of the preparation of this amazing food from the chopping of garlic and onions to making banana leaf parcels to fanning the coals on the open fire for the fish kebabs. Then sampling the feast we had created was devine. An awesome day with great people and passionate tutors. Would most definitely reccommend to anyone without hesitation, great value for money.

Best cooking Class I've done in Asia, beautiful and authentic!. Excellent cooking class, with great menu and beautiful surrounds. Both men were extremely helpful, informative, fun and excellent teachers. We learn't how to cook numerous authentic balinese dishes and had a great time doing so. Really enjoyed eating our delicious creations as well. In addition, we had a brief tour of the local market, a local rice farmer and learn't how to make offerings and produce coffee. I've done numerous cooking classes throughout SE Asia and this is the best I've done, throughly enjoyed, thoroughly recommend, looking forward to coming back and cooking a different menu in the future.

Superbe Experience. My family had a really great time with Payuk Bali. The kids got a chance to cook, having fun cutting stuff, mum and dad got a chance to learn new recipes and making flower baskets for the gods, the wife and myself got a chance to do something together as a family. Ketut is a great guy, very friendly and have a beautiful compound and scenery for the cooking course. I cannot thank him and his crew enough for giving us such great experience. So thank you again Payuk Bali.

Fantastic experience from beginning to end!. Our morning with Payuk Bali was unforgettable! They are very welcoming and we felt like part of the family by the end of the day. We learned so many things and not just about food! It was hands on and fun. When we left we were filled with happiness and knowledge. Now, we want to make sure that we encourage everyone to try Payuk Bali Cooking Class, even if you don't know anything about cooking!!

Great Day - Especially for the kids. We have 4 kids, aged 8,9,10,12. We decided to do a cooking class while scanning TripAdvisor for things to do in Ubud. We chose Payuk, for three reasons. First was price obviously, because there was six of us. Second was the fact that it was at a family compound, but only a short distance from Ubud, and third was the recommendation from the shop where we booked it. Another thing was that Ketut was I think the only one that did an afternoon/evening course, which suited our schedule.We certainly were not disappointed. Enough has been written about what goes on. Free hotel transfers; Market; Rice paddy and temple; then to family compound. During our holiday, Our kids were constantly dodging and asking about the offerings that are everywhere throughout Bali. Despite it being our 5th trip and the kids' 2nd, we really didn't know much about them. So, while sitting down with Ketut's mum and grandmother, and making both offerings, the reasons were explained and translated to us by Ketut's little sister and nieces, who also live in the compound. We moved onto the coffee making/grinding, which was demonstrated by another family member. By this time, all the nieces and nephews were intrigued by our kids, and ours by them. They were kept at a polite distance, but it was notable that not a lot of kids took this tour. We began our cooking lessons and nothing was substituted for our kids who, prior to this, had peeled the odd potato or carrot, but very little knife work. They revelled in being handed razor sharp meat cleavers and the like. They were chopping, slicing, dicing, boiling, stirring and most importantly, grinning like Cheshire cats. All the while, they had one-on-one assistance and we were never concerned at all.At the end of the evening, we had a massive feed, in a beautiful setting. A truly unforgettable experience. Our kids still talk about it, months later. They now want to do cooking classes here in Australia, which we simply cannot afford.While in Ubud we did Payuk, a cycle tour, white water rafting and an art/craft/painting class at one of the local museums. Our kids, apart from the rafting, didn't want to do any of it. They now rate them as highly as the Marine Safari Park and Waterbom Park. Don't miss this. It has free pick-up from everywhere. Kuta, Nusa Dua etc. just an earlier start that's all. A great cultural experience. Unforgettable.

Great course! Nice location, superb chef: wonderful evening!. Not knowing what to expect, we were picked up by Ketut and his driver. Already we noticed that Ketut, who introduced himself as the chef, was kind and very correct.After meeting the other people, visiting a small local market, a stop at the rice field, we went to his house: in the backyard (nice.., very nice) the course is given. Not only he explained a lot, he also asked a lot of questions and is doing the best he can to make everybody feel comfortable, like writing down your name on a small note so he won't forget it! First we made small traditional offerings, than coffee, thea and fried banana snacks is served and than the cooking course started. The menu is very nice, kitchen and location is neat and beautiful, ingredients smell great and the interaction between Ketut and his guests is great! I loved it! Off course, some parts of the different dishes are prepared but he (and also his assistent and his wife) explains why and how. At the end, the different parts are combined into a very nice meal, with starter, main course and dessert. Yumyum! That the course itself was very good, is important...,that the food was nice too, but what I liked most was the way that Ketut interacted with the people and also kept smiling. I really think that he loves what he is doing and that affected us al! I can't think of any negative point at all. If I would come back to Bali another time, I would take the course again definitely!

An amazing Balinese culinary/cultural experience. Taking this class with Ketut was arguably the highlight of my recent trip to Ubud. As a previous reviewer has pointed out, it is a much broader Balinese cultural experience rather than simply learning to cook some tasty dishes. The class started with trip to the Market in central Ubud (they pick you up), where Ketut taught me the Bahasa Indonesia names for the ingredients we would be cooking with that day. He was very flexible with the menu (accommodating my fish allergy). On the way to Ketut's home, we stopped by an elementary school in his village and talked to a few kids and teachers, which was quite fun. After learning how to make offerings using bambo leaves and flowers with an elderly woman of the house, and surveying the process of roasting coffee and making coconut oil, we got down to work in the kitchen. I was lucky enough to be the only person who had signed up for that day's morning class: the student to chef ratio was 1 to 3! Ketut and his fellow chefs were incredibly funny and warm, as well as knowledgeable and encouraging. Yes, very hands on. Grinding up chicken for making sate - in a massive mortar and pestle - proved to be a real workout. The kitchen and dining room are beautifully situated on a kind of terrace overlooking a river, and bird calls provided a constant soundtrack. The feast at the end was absolutely delicious, and dare I say well earned. Strongly recommended!!

An amazing day in Bali at Cooking School!. If you want to have a most excellent experience, call Ketut at Payuk Bali cooking school! He picked my little family of three up with his driver in the morning and gave us a day to remember, teaching us every step of the process. We visited little stalls in the vibrant market, see where all the luscious fruit and vegetables are purchased. We visited the real rice fields and tried our hand at threshing rice, my 7 year old had a big smile on her face. We got to his little authentic family compound and what followed was pure magic. We met his family, learned to make offerings, had lunch and then got to work. This didn't seem like work, we learned about ingredients, created dishes and then ate them all in the end. Great day!

Cooking on Bali. Without knowing what I was into, I found myself in a cooking class on Bali.Our Chef, Ketut, had a good way of familiarizing us with the ingredients for he took us to the market where we bought them.Further on he showed us the village and the locality of the kitchen school.After that we started the lessons and everything went in a way as if it was quite normal to do like this, apart from chopping and crushing.I enjoyed it from the beginning until the end.This is what everyone can do with lots of fun.I have to say that it was because of Ketut, who made this in his special way attractive.It' s definitely recommended.Ketut thanks for the moments we've had together.I only hope that my wife doesn´t think that I can cook.Berry

Experience that reaches far beyond a cooking class - must do while on Bali!!!. While on Bali, you SHOULD book one morning or afternoon at Payuk Bali Cooking Class near Ubud! You'll have a great time, great company & the chef you can only dream of - Ketut Budi! ♥ And with their itinerary, you'll have no hard time to persuade your "precious other half" to join you! None of you will regret it, from the firs moment on - guaranteed! ♥ Within a half of day, you'll discover & check a local market, have fun & few lessons at the road to the cooking class site, learn how to make offerings, check the roasting of coffee, have a glimpse on the procedure of getting a coconut butter. ♥ After a delicious break, Ketut and his assistants will present you some basics of Balinese cuisine (in an open air kitchen), and help you to master a delicious selection of dishes (7 in our case) that you'll most probably class into "the best ever meal on Bali"; as we did. ♥ My hubby was more than glad to be at my side & he hasn't regretted joining me for a sec. We were both thrilled about the experience & the food we helped to prepare! Thank you, guys!! ♥ ♥

Forget the hotel cooking courses. This is the way to go.. I haven't stopped talking about this class since I got home and have been recommending it to everyone. The whole family were involved in making us feel welcome and made the experience a truly traditional one. You certainly won't be disappointed.

Cooking Balinese style. Spending time In Ubud is a joy but the crowning experience of my week in this wonderful place was the morning I spent at this cooking school. After spending time at the local market, we were taken to Ketut's home where we watched the process of making coconut oil and roasting coffee before making the food.The process is hands on and done with humour. The group was small (5 people) and everyone was completely involved. A variety of dishes were prepared (7 dishes) and we tasted as we went. To finish we sat down and enjoyed a splendid feast.Perhaps the highlight of the time we spent together was the opportunity to make some offerings with the women of the house before we began. In a small way we felt like members of the family. It felt genuine and as I said a highlight of my time in Bali.

Excellent experience through cooking. Chef Ketut was an excellent teacher!Not only he gave us awesome guided tour through the traditional market, he also explained the importance or taste of each ingredients. Food we made was very fresh and gooooooood goood!Never had i dreamt i'd cook great food like that. Highly recommended.

Fantastic Experience. We enjoyed the balinese cooking very much. The stuff is very friendly and funny and our cooked dinner was delicous. It starts with a market tour and also includes a visit on a rice field and the making of sacrifical flower offerings. Also the kitchen is beautiful and open air. We highly recommend it.
Dominik & Luisa

Exclusive, nice location, lovely kitchen, marvelous cook!. We very much enjoyed this cooking class. We learned a lot about all the different spices and how to prepare all the food. We also laughed a lot during the cooking class. For us it was an unforgetable experience. And here at home in Holland we have made a lot of balinese rise tables. And our friends love it!

great experience with payuk bali. thanks for ketut .you give me oportunity to learn balinese cuisine this is fantastic course , experience chef and good view the people who help in the kitchen are very helpfull and very friendly we had real good time , enjoyed the wonderful view , laughed and cooked if you like cooking or you want to taste the real Balinese cookingplease visit this cooking class "Payuk Bali"

The Best Balinese Cooking Class. We had a great day and we learned so much. It started with a trip to the market to learn about typical Balinese food and spices. Then off to the rice fields for a little knowledge about how this basic staple is grown and and harvested...very interesting. We then went to the cooking compound and learned how to make a simple offering, how coffee is roasted and how coconut oil is made. There were only the two of us in the class and we made nine separate items with the chef, Ketut, and his assistant. We started by making the basic Balinese spice paste and then used that spice in several of the recipes. From spice paste to soup, vegetables, fish, sate, peanut sauce, ceremonial rice, sambol to spice it up more, and dessert, we participated in cooking all the items. After, just the two of us were treated like royalty as we ate all the food that was beautifully arranged and served to us as we looked out on a vista of lush tropical green. It was a magnificient day and the food and company were superb!

Wonderful experience!. My cousin and I really enjoyed our culinary experience with Lobong. Everything was well planned, perfectly organized and given careful thought to detail. They are very professional but the whole experience was also very comfortable and homey. The school is in their beautiful family compound. They took time to explain not just food but culture and tradition of Bali too. The food we made was all fresh, slow cooked, healthy and yummy! Definitely recommend this to people not just interested in food and cooking but also anyone interested in learning more about Balinese life. Thank u Lobong. :)

A truly wonderful experience. This cooking class was the highlight of our trip to Ubud. It was very informative and very hands on. The Lobong family are wonderful and we took away a lasting memory (oh and a little gift). Thank you all.

Compulsory!. This should be promoted as a Balinese cultural experience! This experience with Lobong should be compulsory when visiting Bali for the first time. You'll learn so much about the Balinese way of life, which will hold you in good stead whilst wandering the streets of Bali. You get to create & eat some fantastic food which can be downed with ice cold Bintangs all for a very reasonable price.

Outstanding culinary and cultural experience!. What a wonderful way to learn about Balinese culture and food, hosted in a family compound outside Ubud. The morning started with a trip to a local, non-touristic food market where we learned about Balinese fruits, vegetables, herbs and spices with Sang Made, the family host. Sang speaks English quite well and is very personable. Then we went back to the compound for refreshments and a lesson in family life within the compound. Chef Dewa then took over for the cooking instruction. We prepared a three course meal with 7 dishes. Preparation was fun and the food delicious. Prior to our sitting down to eat, we were taught about, then watched the ceremony for the food in the temple within the compound. My wife and I do cooking classes everywhere we travel as it is a wonderful way to learn the culture. We would rate Lobong among the top schools we have attended. Highly recommended as it is not just a cooking school but an education.

Fabulous experience !. Fabulous day - the market experience was a once in a life time ! Great fun cooking. Fabulous insight into traditional Balinese life ! Highly recommended. Caters for vegetarians and allergies very well !

Fantastic Experience and a Brilliant Lesson. This class is an amazing lesson into the wondeful world of balinese food and culture. Wayan the host invites you into his home and to meet his family who are all very welcoming and so kind. Even if you are just in Ubud for a few days, this is definitely something you should do. You even get a free recipe book so you can cook the tasty dishes at home!

Wish we had done this when we arrived in Bali instead of the end of the trip. We learned a lot about the culture of Bali not just how to cook Balinese food. The experience was fantastic, the food was sensational (and we cooked it!) I would recommend this cooking experience to anyone. Cannot recommend highly enough!! Thanks for the day, one we will remember a long, long time.

Great Experience . Such an amazing experience, our guide taking us through the local market trying some of the local fruits. Then to the family complex where the class takes place. The chef is amazing and the food is delicious!Thank you so much for the amazing day. Throughly enjoyed it.

Great Balinese cooking experience. If you want to experience traditional Balinese cooking book this class. They offer everything you need to learn and they are very organised. Very easy to book via telephone or email. The host Sang and the chef Dewa are professional and will make you feel at home. The cooking class begins with a morning tour to the local market where you will get familiarised with the local produce. A must visit. Then you are taken to their house for cooking. The house itself is a typical Balinese house and the host will tell you lot of their style of living. The cooking class is a big fun and chef Dewa is helping everybody. Special thanks to the chef Dewa. Strictly recommend this cooking class, and the food is delicious.

Amazing!. Fantastic cooking class with a trip to the local market in Ubud before hand if you choose the morning session. Fairly hands on, with everyone getting an opportunity to have a go. Food was incredible, can't wait to try the recipes at home!

Vegetarians Won't Be Disappointed!. Wow! What a fun day we had cooking true Balinese food in a family home. There's a reason this company had hundreds and hundreds of five star reviews. From the early morning pickup to the information local market tour to the actual techniques explained during the class, this is a truly well-oiled professional experience. Everything about this class flowed so well. The spices we touched and smelled in the market were exactly what our recipes consisted of, which seems simple, but is a really great tie in when you are new to an entire cuisine. This is quite a long day, but when I found myself getting thirsty, tea or a iced drink would appear. The family was more than happy to answer all of the hundred or so questions our group offered up over the course of the day. We learned a ton and left happy and full, thanks to the delicious luncheon you get to enjoy as the fruits of your labor. Vegetarians, definitely book this class. I did a lot of research before I booked and this class was seamlessly accommodating. I worked with tofu and tempeh whilst everyone else worked with chicken and it didn't impact things at all. The market didn't really have meat for sale at the late time of day (9:30am) that we visited with the class, I think that's a first thing in the morning product. Without a doubt, this was one of the best things we did during our two week honeymoon in Bali!Small tip - where close-toed shoes to the market. It had rained the night before and I was really glad I had shoes on as the market you visit (especially after a rainy night) has some puddles.

Cooking Like a Bali Boss. This culinary experience was out of this world, so much so that I can not eat western food anymore. I felt so accomplished as a chef cooking real food from Bali. The smells to this day are still dancing in my head, I have bought cook books and I am watching videos on you tube to refresh my memory and doing a good job- except for the rice, its a work in progress. I recommend that everyone who visit Bali take this class because there is nothing better than cooking an authentic meal for yourself that tastes as good as it does from a restaurant. The trip through the market was the best experience for me because i was swimming in the spices and ingredients the scream Bali. And I got to shop like a local. I have looked at my food as a religious act after this experience because the people of Bali pay respect for all of the life that was given so that I can live. I made it a point to return to Bali next year with my family and the first thing we will all do is the Lobong Culinary Experience.

Amazing experience. I booked the session after reading the reviews and no dissappointment there: confirmation email soon after with the details. They picked me up at the hotel and then we went for a tour of a local market (no tourists there). Got introduced to the main ingredients for balinese cooking, learnt a lot of interesting things about local products/produce. After that, we head out to the family compound where we were greeted with coffee/tea and banana fritters (delicious). We were introduced to the life of a balinese family with great detail before beginning our cooking class. The "teacher" is a restaurant trained chef and he shared lots of details about what balinese food is all about. We got to get our hands dirty and managed to produce a lovely meal (starters, main & dessert).Before serving the meal we had a small presentation on the offerings you can see everywhere in Bali and even got to see the whole ceremonial process.Upon leaving we received the book with all the recipees and a bottle of home made coconut oil.This is much, much more than a culinary experience. Not to miss!When coming back to Bali, for sure I will book it again ;)Thank you for a lovely day!Adina

Learned a lot. This was a great experience. Wished we had done something like this on a prior visit as it teaches you a great deal of the local culture and culinary practices. The market tour was great because it was not a tourist dominated market, the tour and explanation of the family compound along with explaining and setting out the offerings was enlightening, and learning about all the ingredients and cooking techniques was very interesting. It was pretty hands on and we got a delicious meal out of it too. A nice way to spend a day.

Excellent, one of our top days in Bali!. We absolutely loved our day with the super friendly family who run Lobong. We went today and I don't normally jump straight on to leave reviews, but this deserves a top rating. Easy to organise, speedy responses via email to make arrangements and we were picked up on time from our hotel. We loved the market visit, there were no other tourists and our guide shared so many insights and traditions - it was the first time we really came to understand the Bali way of life. Then it was back to the family compound for more insights into the family, the community and culture before 2 hours of hands on cooking and eating together. The food was delicious and we got the recipes to take away to try at home. I will be recommending Lobong to all of our friends heading to Bali.

Excellent staff, location, food!. Other cooking schools might be good as well - but Lobong was just perfect. Pickup was exactly on time, took us to a village market with no other tourists, welcomed us to their beautiful family compound and served us delicious fried bananas and coffee/tea. The cooking class was obviously the highlight - our instructor made sure to explain lots of details to us and get everyone involved in the cooking. After two hours of chopping and stirring, we followed the family matriarch into the compound's temple to make an offering before sitting down to eat. The food was amazing, and on top of that, an extra treat was a little recipe book and bottle of coconut oil presented to us at the end. Lovely addition to any Ubud trip!

Excellent Food. What a well organized, professional and fun day!The people at Lobong pick you at your hotel, take you to a local market, explain in depth about the ingredients you will be cooking with and then take you back to their family compound for a fun day of cooking.The hands on instruction is great, and as someone who cooks for a living, it was instructive and informative.This was one of the best things I did in Bali and I would recommend it to anyone with an interest in Balinese cooking and culture.

Wow! What a perfect day!. Wow - what a fantastic day.We were picked up at the hotel (on the minute) by the Lobong staff in the morning.We had a friendly driver who got us safe to the market a couple of minutes away from our hotel (Puri Sebali).The day started with a trip to the local marked, guided by "Sunday" (who spoke excellent english and was super-friendly). Our group were the only tourists there, since this was a marked used by balinese, which made it even more special.He guided us through the marked and explained the different spices used in balinese cuisine, along with fruits and vegetables. After a very interesting morning we were taken to their home, were also the cooking class was arranged.This was really something special and we didn't just learn how to cook a delicious balinese meal, but also a lot about balinese culture, religion and family traditions.This is really worth it and I would recommend it to everyone who travels to Ubud!

Not just a cooking class. I expected this to only be a cooking class. We were picked up at our hotel in the morning and driven to the traditional food market where the locals go. Had a try of some local fruits and learnt about different spices and other unfamiliar things. Then onto the family compound where we had an overview of the family structure in Bali and about all those temples. After a coffee and morning tea, we got stuck into the cooking class. In total, we prepared 7 dishes which were served up as three meals. Just prior to eating, the grandmother of the family made offerings to the shrines and her son explained to us how, why and when the offerings were made. After our extremely delicious meal, we received a recipe booklet and homemade coconut oil and rolled back to our hotel. So much fun, really interesting and delicious!

Highlight of our trip . We enjoyed every minute of the Lobong culinary experience . We were shown around the market where all the produce was explained to us . When we arrived at the home we were welcomed with a coffee and snack . The host gave us a very interesting insight into the family and cultural traditions . The cooking was amazing and we enjoyed the lovely meal we had all prepared . We were given a gift bag with a recipe book and a bottle of coconut oil . I would highly recommend this trip you won't be disappointed .

A great thing to do in Ubud. A brilliant time spent at Lobong. We were collected from our hotel and taken to a local market which was so interesting - we learned an awful lot about cooking traditions and ingredients and our guide was so knowledgeable and full on insight. Going back to the family compound to cook our food was so interesting. The cooking part was a really fun thing to do and we were very well guided by the host who was clearly a great chef. The best thing though was just immersing ourselves in Balinese culture - learning about how families live, traditions with offerings - we just learned so much and it really added to the rest of our holiday as we understood so much more about the country. Thank you so much. We had such a great time.

Holy crap! Awesome experience . To hold 5 star reviews over 6 years you have to be amazing. Visit to the market taught us about the different produce, costs, local market customs, etc. We cooked food inside their home compound (which is beautiful). The cook is a professional restaurant chef. Hands on. Friendly. Customer service oriented. Damn good food. Sooo grateful for this experience.

Fantastic Experience . Had an amazing day 8am-2pm with Lobong Culinary Experience. We started the day in the market (real market where the locals shop) and learned about some of the spices and vegetables we were going to cook with. They were extremely well organized, everything was perfection. This was far more than a cooking class, this was history, culture and cooking with an amazing family in their home. Highly recommend!

Just amazing. They pick you up at the hotel and bring you first to a local market to show you all the ingredients. After that they bring you to their home. There you get a tea/coffee and they tell you about their culture and their life. Then the cooking starts, step by step. Before the meal is served, they show you about the tradition of doing the offerings. Then the whole meal cooked is served as in a restaurant. Will come back if I come back to Bali.

One of our best days in Ubud. All of the other great reviews are so true. Our day with Lobong was super informing, interesting and fun! The guide for the market tour was great, he made it fun and his English was spot on. The guide for the cooking portion was also great. There was 14 in the group but we all got a go and worked as a team. The meals were absolutely delicious!!I really liked the fact that it wasn't just about the cooking, although most of it was. Before cooking we learnt heaps about the traditions within the family compounds.

An Amazing Cooking & Culture Experience!. I have visited Bali many times, and as I do on most vacations, I like to take a cooking class to learn about the local ingredients and methods of preparation. Usually I arrange a half day through a hotel. On this particular visit, I decided that it would be a nice change to experience a local business approach to cuisine. I booked Lobong after reading many excellent reviews. I was surprised and delighted at every turn. The group of 12 was a mix from all over the world - such great observations and comments based on varied backgrounds. Sunday, our guide, was an incredible storyteller. His knowledge of history, the culture, ingredients... all outstanding. After the market, we went to his family home, a compound that was beautiful. The entire family is involved in the business and how fantastic it was to spend the morning immersed in Balinese culture. If I could recommend one activity in Ubud, it would be Lobong. Regardless of your cooking sophistication or understanding of Balinese culture, you will learn more during these 4 hours than you can imagine. Truly a great experience - thank you!

A wonderful day!. It was great to spend time in the family's compound learning about their culture and traditions. The market tour was well put together and the food was delicious. Definitely recommend.

So much more than a cooking class. We were excited to learn the secrets of spicy Indonesian cooking. Everything that has been said by others is absolutely true. The whole family is involved in this business which is fantastic, it works. I have come home and can't stop myself putting an spicy Indonesian edge to anything I cook. No more boring fried fish or chicken. Sourcing some ingredients in Australia is a little challenging, however I will succeed cause it's so worth it to do it right.

Great Value half day activity. This cooking class was amazing!
