Our guide picked us up from our hotel and took us to the markets where he showed us how the ingredients were sourced and taught us about Balinese life. He was interesting, friendly and funny. We were then welcomed warmly into the beautiful Lobong home and provided with tasty morning tea before beginning our cooking lesson. The chef was very helpful and told us how we could recreate the recipes at home. Once all the food was ready we did a traditional offering to the gods, before settling down to the 3 course meal we had made. The Lobong family then gave us all a recipe booklet and a vial of their home made coconut oil and drove us back to our hotel. All that for only $40 (Aus)! It was also a great way to meet other young people. Thanks Lobong, we had an awesome time!!

Great cooking lesson with added market tour. Excellent cooking lesson with a real emphasis on understanding cooking technique, rather than simply compiling ingredients. The end result was delicious and well worth the effort! The morning market tour was also great and well organised, would thoroughly recommend getting up early for this as I don't think the afternoon lessons include this.

Great! Exactly what we were hoping for.. We try to do a cooking class everywhere we travel, and this was a wise decision on our part. The market tour was very informative, and made us a bit hungry. Being welcomed into the traditional family home for our cooking course was incredibly generous, as was being invited to participate in the prayers before eating our meal. The instruction was great, the ingredients were perfect and fresh, and the food was wonderful. My wife asked for seafood instead of meat, which was easily substituted with no issues. Highly recommended to anyone looking to learn classic Balinese cooking.

Best thing we did in Bali. Thank you for an amazing experience and for welcoming us into your home. Loved every single moment - from the market visit to the lunch. Even my partner, who doesn't cook, enjoyed the experience. We wish you all the best.

lovely half-day activity, must do!. We enjoyed this cooking class experience very much! The morning visit to the market was an eye-opener, and Sang Made was an eloquent guide who had so much interesting knowledge to share. Other than listening to him, we got to smell the different spices we would be using for cooking and that was really helpful. It was a privilege to visit Sang Made's home, a Balinese family compound, and have the cooking class conducted there. The class was very well-run, and much effort was put in to ensure that participants of different culinary skill levels were able to be fully engaged. Cooking was fun and we were amazed by how absolutely delicious the food that we had prepared turned out! We're so glad we didn't miss out on this. Sang Made was very prompt with email responses and that really helped to put our minds at ease that we could squeeze this activity in before heading for the airport on the same day. Very appreciative and would highly recommend this experience.

Welcoming family home. Not only was this a cooking class with a wide variety of dishes, techniques and methods but this was a whole round cultural learning experience. I would of never have learnt as much as I did about the traditions and spiritual beliefs of Bali if it wasn't for Sunday and his family. The trips begins with a insightful tour around a locals food market, experiencing new fruits, spices and vegetables, learning what they are called,how they are grown and what they are used for. Ask as many questions as possible to get the most out of this opportunity to learn. After the market you are taken to their family compound where the true teachings begin. The day finished with a blessing to the Gods before eating the delicious food. This is also the best meal I have eaten since arriving in Bali. I would recommend this to everyone- couples, lone travellers, families.

Engaging and delicious!. Visiting Lobong cooking school was one of the highlights of our trip to Bali. Sang and his brother Dewa are extremely engaging and have created an experience that far exceeded our expectations. Everything was so polished and professional that it was hard to believe that we were really visiting the family residence. We learned a huge amount about Balinese cooking and the many spices and ingredients that are used but we also learned a great deal about Balinese culture, from the layout of the family compound to the mechanics of making an offering to the spirits before food can be consumed. I highly recommend this experience to anyone who wants a little deeper perspective on the Ubud area.

A family affair. This is a a real Balinese family enterprise, where you get to visit a local food market, cook in a family compound, with the matriarch getting involved to make the blessings before the meal, to the kids playing in the back courtyard. Sang Made, our guide and Dewa, his brother-in-law and chef speak great English and are generous in answering any question you have. The cooking instruction is good, and the food divine. I really liked that we were able to get ideas about how to adapt the recipes to what is available in our home country. This is a highly professional, local enterprise that should be on your list of 'must do's' when in Bali.

Worth doing!. Sang Made kindly liaised with me via email. We got picked up from Ubud Palace at 8am. Went to the markets with Sunday and had a really informative morning. We then went back to the family home where we were given more interesting facts from Sunday before we started the cooking. Our chef had great English and was patient and thorough with his teachings. It was a most enjoyable morning and the food was very tasty too, we finished up around 2pm. I would recommend to anyone; no matter what level of cooking skills they may have.

GREAT COOKING SCHOOL. We had the best time. Not only a cooking class but a cultural experience starting with a trip to the market to experience the locals bartering, and view the array of colourful product, all explained by a very well spoken guide who then took us to his compound where the cooking began. It was hands on and well communicated with a yummy feast at the end. I would recommend this to anyone.

real food experience. Was a great experience picked up from our accommodation driven to the markets meet up with other travellers where we got a tour of the markets and taught about all the foods spices etc. which we were going to be using. From there went to a family compound where the kitchen and dining experience was held started with a coffee and banana pancakes and then we all got to start cutting up everything and started cooking. After everything was cooked we were served the three course dinner. Yum Yum and Yum

Fantastic Bali cooking experience. Was a great day from start to finish. Market was very interesting and the compound was lovely very welcoming staff and great experience highly recommend to anybody looking for a real Balinese cooking class and the food was fantastic as well

Culinary cooking experience. What a fantastic day and experience we had today.First we were picked up by Sang at our hotel and driven to a market in Ubud.There we were met by Sangs brother Sunday who showed us around the market to show us ingredients we were using to cook. He was extremely knowledgable about all aspects of market and culture.From there we were driven to family compound and where we were shown around and learnt about how the family lived. We then met Dewa who was our chef. Dewa then explained what we were cooking and from then on everything was hands on.We cooked a 3 course Balinese meal and was very interesting an enjoyable to eat .I would thoroughly recommend any anyone travelling to Bali to go and experience this cooking class as very professionally run very informative and they make u feel very much part of family

Fantastic family & compound where cooking class held. Was not sure what to expect from this day, however I was pleasantly surprised, this day was filled with knowledge of the local customs and cooking techniques. Extremely well run & very hands on experience. Fantastic experience, would not hesitate to recommend this class. Dewar our instructor was excellent and the warmth from the family made you feel welcome

Best Balinese Cooking Experience. I reviewed several cooking courses, until I found one that had a menu I knew I would be able to find the ingredients for at home, and also a menu I was confident I could tackle at home.I wasn't disappointed, our teacher gave us alternatives for ingredients that are not easily found at home. The recipes were typical Balinese fare and "do able".The experience rfrom being picked up from my hotel was warm, comfortable and friendly, right until our drop off at the day's end. The market tour was informative and interesting. The chance to ask questions and view a family compound was also extremely interesting. The whole family seemed involved and everyone spoke perfect English. Our teacher involved everyone in the menu, and everything was made by the students. The end result was served to us in a beautiful dining area in the middle of the garden compound.You don't have to be a "Master Chef". If you can chop, grind and stir, you can do this course. The cook book given to you at the courses finish is also easy to follow. We had couples, small group of friends, and me (solo). The group was supportive, interesting and fun.I would highly recommend this tour.

A real experience . My wife and I did the class and loved every second of it. The Lobong family welcomed us with open arms and showed the true side of indonesian cuisine. The whole tour was fantastic and so professionally run, I would recommend everyone to do this tour and experience.

Delicious!. My partner and I recently attended Lobong cooking class: we were not dissapointed!We were picked up at our hotel and had a short scenic drive to meet our tour guide who took us around the local market place. The guide was clear spoken, funny, helpful and full of interesting information about Balinese culture and food. We loved walking around the marketplace and seeing new things. The cooking class was held at the family's beautiful home. It was a humbling experience learning about the Balinese traditions and culture here. The chef was clear and made sure that everybody was following his instructions, this made the class easy to follow and a lot of fun. The food at the end was delicious! Make sure you have plenty of room in your tummy to fit it all in!This class was one of the highlights of our trip and we would definitely reccomend it to any food lovers.

Brilliant experience, delicious food. We really enjoyed this experience. From start to finish, the people were very friendly, welcoming and ensured we had a smooth enjoyable experience. The chef and also the guide who took us round the market were very helpful in explaining what each ingredient was and also what you could use at home if you couldn't find the same Balinese ingredient. We were also very impressed by how well they catered for my partner who is vegetarian. The vegetarian was by no means second best to the chicken but equally thought out and delicious. Overall, a really great experience!

A must-do in Ubud. Wow. My husband and I loved this cookery school. The day was excellent and the food we prepared was delicious. Definitely a highlight of our trip and I'm looking forward to making the dishes again at home. It was great to see the market and be educated about Balinese food. While we were at the market I did get really upset about the welfare of the chickens (it was pretty poor) and so I was really relieved and grateful when our chef explained that they source their chickens from a higher welfare place. The cooking was really fun and a good balance of doing lots of the cooking ourselves but with some shortcuts and help from the staff so that we were not cooking all day. A great day and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone visiting Ubud.

Excellent if you lave cooking and want to learn more about Bilanese culture. This is a very authenic experience in the familyhome of a lovely Balinese family. It was better as my best expectations. It is not only about lovely cooking but also learning about the culture, traditions and passions of the Balinese people. The host and cook speak good English and very generous in sharing there knowlegde.

Interested in Food?- Do This!. I have spent a day in cooking schools before, but I was blown away by the scope of the Lobong Culinary Experience. A comprehensive tour of a small, local market, allowing us to see truly how the locals go about their day. Back to the guide's family compound to cook our bounty. The structure of the family and compound was well explained, I felt priviledged to be welcomed into the compound. The trained chef took us through all elements of preparation and cooking our delicious , authentic food. After an offering( once again, all parts explained fully) by the Guides mother on our behalf, we were served our food that we had cooked, restaurant style. An amazing day, it is a true experience in not only cooking, but Balinese culture. I would highly recommend taking time out to do this.

An absolute MUST. So so friendly and welcoming and just can't praise this cookery class enough - great value for money when you think about what you get for it - even get a three course meal once it's cooked! Truly great!

One of the best things we did in Bali. The was the first thing we did on our first full day in Bali. We are so glad we did as it gave us an not only an amazing insight into Balinese food, but also culture, the structure of the family unit and the Balinese belief's and riituals.I don't want to say too much about the experience itself as I don't want to ruin the surprise for you. the cooking class is extremely well executed. The food we learnt to make was all delicious and we have already recreated some since we returned to Australia. it was without exaggeration some of the best we ate in Bali. Can't recommend the Lobong cooking school enough.

Very professional!. A very comprehensive cooking class ran by a professional chef. It was fun, interesting and very informative. We learned so much about the Balinese culture! Very accommodating with special dietary requirements. A must for "foodies".

Exceeded our expectations. What a fantastic insight in to real Balinese life. From my initial phone contact the day before to the drop off back to our accommodation after our Lobong Culinary Experience all we can say is wow. Highlights for us were:Visit to traditional village market including detailed explanation about ingredients we would be using later.The warm welcome we received into the family compound and insight into daily Balinese life.Our hands on involvement in the preparation and cooking of the food.Professional and personal conduct from the whole team / family members.

Best part of our trip. This experience was perfect. Sang Made and his family were so welcoming, and very informative. They provided a huge amount of information about Balinese culture and history, as well as a very professional cooking class. Highlights included tasting local fruits at the market, watching a traditional offering of the food we had prepared in the family temple, talking to Sang Made about his home and family, learning about new ingredients, and obviously eating the meal that we put together.This is a very hands on experience, and the menu that has been out together is fantastic. This is an absolute must!

You must do this!. This was one of the best things I've done anywhere, from start to finish. The market tour, the cooking, being graciously welcomed into the family compound, the wonderful hospitality - all was perfection. Very interesting to learn how the traditional dishes are made. The day was very well organized. The food at the end was amazing. We were also invited into the family temple to observe offerings, which was a real treat. Seriously a must do. You will love the hosts.

Amazing experience - highly recommended. Great experience. I didn't only learn how to cook some fantastic Balinese dishes but also a lot about Balinese tradition family life and much more. We were only 3 participants which was great to ask a lot of questions. Everyone was extremely friendly, open and patient.
Incredible!. This is a fantastic local experience where you really get to see into Balinese culture in so many ways.

A highlight of our trip. what an amazing day we spent with all the folk at Lobong Culinary Class. Sande was an incredible host, relaxed, informative and extremely professional in his explanations of every step through this great day. We first went through their local market and Sande explaining all the wonderful spices and fruits to us all, along with some history and cultural significance of many of the Balinese customs.The class was held back at their stunning family compound, where chef Dewa took us through the preparation of many of the basic marinades, salads etc including how the Balinese manage to produce light fluffy rice every time they cook it!We prepared a number of wonderful dishes including vegetarian, and between the 10 of us in the group, we took turns preparing and cooking all of the food under the close guidance of Dewa.Before lunch, we were included in the family offering ceremony which takes place in their family shrine before food is eaten, and Sande went to great detail to explain the history and meanings of all their ceremonies, and we were made to feel as part of the family for a day which was incredibly special.Following the offering, we were seated under a gorgeous pavilion and served our 3 course meal as if we were in a top al a carte restaurant, so not only did we learn how to cook it all, we were also shown beautiful ways to present the food in an authentic way.Such a special day that is one of our top memories from our recent trip, and if we get to travel to Bali again in the not too distant future, we will do another class with them.

Lovely cooking experience. 每次旅行的最後一日我都會參加當地既cooking class這是確保自己離開之前能了解身處地方的另一面今日黎到Lobong Culinary Experience首先由SangDe(超似Tony Jaa)帶我地去市場認識下不同的Balinese spices然後我地去到佢屋企坐定定聽SangDe講解峇里文化當然cooking class才是重點導師講解清晰又有好多機會比我地落手去整菜色完成左仲會以fine dining形式出餐飲住啤酒享受自己的成果番到黎香港又多左幾味煮喇

Amazing experience!. Amazing course!!!! So interesting!Firstly we went to market and guide showed us spices used in balinese food. Then we went to his house and that was really amazing to hear about their traditions, their life. Cooking class was very friendly organised. We learned how to cook balinese food, which spices to use, how to make delicious desert from rice. That was very interesting, knowledgeable and I will recommend this course to all my friends!

A perfect day - An amazing experience. There is no way I can say enough good things about the Lobong Culinary class. Right from the start you see that you are treated as a friend of the family. The team is so knowledgeable and justifiably proud of their culture and heritage. You start out with a top knotch tour of a market outside of Ubud and they provide so much information about the ingredients and foods that make up Balinese cuisine. After the market to you are taken to their home and then the real fun begins.The cooking space is imbeciably clean and so very well organized. The chef that teaches the class is internationally trained and an expert in Balinese food. The instructions are so helpful and they provide small tips and offer substitutions if we can't find a certain ingredient at home.At the end of it all you get to sit down with the rest of your class and enjoy the meal you have just prepared. The take away booklet with the recipes is clear and I've been able to make many of these items at home with no problem. They also have some of the Balinese mortar and pestles available for sale and I picked up one of these which has proven to be one of my favourite kitchen tools.This is one of many cooking classes available in Ubud but I really think this is the best one. You can't go wrong in booking this class and you won't regret it.

Amazing day!. This class was absolutely amazing. So professionally run and well thought out. I cannot recommend it highly enough, it was not only the best day of my Bali trip but by far the best food. Made, chef Dewa and all the team were so friendly and knowledgable, the whole experience was fantastic, and I can't wait to try to make some Balinese food at home!

Amazing experience!!. The Lobong cooking class was definitely one of my highlights of Bali! I was picked up punctually from my hotel (7.45 a.m.) and, together with a few other guests, taken to the local market where Made, the organiser of the school, was waiting for us with the rest of the people I'd be learning to cook with that day (there was 10 of us that day and Made told us the max. of people they take per day is 12 which is a good number). Made took us around the local market which was a brilliant experience in itself. We were the only Westerners there and were told lots about various spices and fruits and could even try some. An hour later we were taken to the Lobong family compound where Made told us about traditional Balinese family life (fascinating, as it was all completely new to me!) and answered any questions we had. We were then given either some coffee or ginger tea and banana fritters before Made introduced us to Dewa (spelling?), the very experienced chef who taught us various dishes. We learned how to cook rice the traditional way and cooked 8 dishes that morning. Dewa explained everything step by step, got us to chop the spices and always used 1-2 people from our group to follow his instructions, so that everybody got involved in things. Once we'd finished all the dishes, Made's mother did the traditional food offerings to the gods - a ritual that was so interesting to witness!After that we were served all the dishes we'd cooked - oh, it all tasted divine!!Afterwards we were presented with a little bag which contained a booklet with the recipes we'd cooked that day and a small bottle of coconut oil. Then we were driven back to our accommodation. I was back in my hotel at 2.30 p.m.All in all, it was a fantastic experience! Made speaks excellent English, as does Dewa. The compound is beautiful, and they take hygiene extremely serious, which I was so glad about. I cannot wait to try the dishes at home :)I highly recommend this cooking class to anybody visiting Bali!!!

Extraordinary. We took the class in January which is supposed to be low season. From the beginning they delivered great service. We booked in last minute (evening before) however they replied to the e-mail immediately, picked us up from the hotel on time. We were 6 people in our group which was fantastic. We started with local market (completely different from those Ubud tourist markets). Mr. Sunny explained us so much about all the spices, herbs. If you need anything for really cheap price take from there (Sunny helped us to bargain the price - tobacco, vanilla...). Later they welcomed us to their family compound with a cup of local tea/coffee and fried bananas, explained about family live, traditions. Then the cooking class started, everything was so carefully prepared with so many helpers so you can concentrate on the chef´s explanations and cooking. You will 6 course menu which you will be later served to the table. You will learn so many things, make new friends a have a lot of fun while chopping all the ingredients. In the end they will give a lovely bag with a recipes book and a bottle of coconut oil so even after your return home you feel Bali in your kitchen. Must try! Cheap for what you get!

The Best Experience in Bali!. Lobong Culinary Experience was one of my best and memorable moments in Bali!- The friendly driver picked us on time and on the way driving, he introduced us the Balinese culture.- Made, the big brother of the family host, brought us to a local market, unlike Ubud market which is full of tourists, the market he toured us to is more authentic and filled with locals, you may check out how the locals' daily life are. Made speaks fluent English and shared with us a lot of Balinese food culture, it was fun!- Banana Fritter and ginger tea will be served as refreshment upon your arrival to their home, it was tasty!- The cook is knowledgeable, we made everything from scratch and I had the best peanut sauce ever for my satay!- Everyone was given at least a chance to demonstrate.- The food presentations were so nice that can compare to those from fine-dining restaurant.- a bottle of coconut oil was given as souvenir, thank you so much!Love the family (and the food) a lot! Will definitely return to the Lobong if I re-visit Bali in the future! :)

Amazing experience!. I went there on October 2015 and my husband and I really enjoyed this culinary experience. I love the fact that all the guys are family and share with you more than just a cooking class. They bring you to their home, show you lots of traditions and the food is just amazing! For me, it was the best thing I did in Bali!

First-class Culinary Experience in Bali. This was one of those unforgettable experiences that occurs only once or twice on any trip. The day started with a guided tour of a local village market. Our host/guide Sanday took us through the market, explaining the characteristics and qualities of the various ingredients we would be dealing with later in our cooking class. Following this tour, we were taken to Sanday's beautiful family compound where we were given a brief tour and explanation of the layout and served coffee and tea. Then the excellent cooking class began,taught by Sanday's brother-in-law. This was a hands-on experience accompanied by lots of valuable culinary tips. At the end we sat down to a beautifully presented meal of the food we had prepared. Before the lunch was eaten, however, we observed Sanday's mother offer at the family temple some of the food we had cooked. Highly recommended.

Wonderful experince. From the moment we were picked up at our hotel we were so impressed with everything They were both very professional and very welcoming the market tour was a true Balinese experince. They welcomed us into their beautiful family compound and we felt privileged to learn so much about Balinese family life. The cooking course was excellent and lots of fun, very well organized and presented. A truly memorable day

More than just a cooking class. So glad we chose Lobong for our Balinese cooking class.We were picked up in the morning from our resort in Ubud and taken to the local food market for a tour. Following that we went back to the family compound where we undertook the cooking class.It was such a fantastic day and we learnt so much about the Balinese culture. We were lucky to have a young group of people in our class. It was extremely informative and very special when we took part in the food offering and then all sat down to enjoy our cooked meal together.

Balinese cooking class at its finest!!. Absolutely loved this experience! If you are looking for super friendly experienced professional cooking class this is it!! From the very start being picked up from your hotel (thank you Nata) and then taken to your traditional fresh produce market to be shown how the Balinese do it by our very knowledgeable guide Sunday (sorry if the spelling is incorrect) who not only showed us all the different types of spices, fruits, and food but explained and showed the traditional way of life. We learnt a lot about Balinese compound life.... So interesting!!! And beautiful!! Taken back to the family compound we were met by Dewa!!! And boy this chef can turn anyone into a Chef in a matter of hours!!! Our menu included entre, mains and dessert!! All made by YOURSELF!! Fresh aromatic ingredients!!! Not only do you get to eat what you cook (loved all of it couldn't choose a favourite!) but you also get to experience offering to the ancestors and gods (they were very thoughtful to ask if you were ok with it NEVER forced, totally up to you!) If you have any allergies just let them know (bookings are essential and super easy.. Just email them!) and they will cater to your needs! Such an awesome experience! Well done Lobong!!

More than just a cooking class!. We first went to a local market outside of Ubud which catered mainly for the local neighbourhood, not tourists. Having said that, our colourful guide who spoek excellent English explained the difference between hot (small, red & very strong) and what they call "tourist" (big, sweet and not hot at all) peppers! He was an excellent communicator and knew the market and stallholders. I bought a kilo of the best local red rice for just 20,000 to take home, and learnt alot about herbs & spices. Then we went to the family compound where the cooking class was held. A really informative talk about Hindu culture ensued (why the house for the eldest family member is in the north and why the family temple on site was in the north-east corner) The art, architecture and fmaily practices were fascinating. The class instructor was great - he knew so much about all kinds of cooking, having worked in a big hotel before (His favourite snack was pasta he made for himself!) and he had a good sense of humour and engaging manner. We were lucky to be in a class of just 6 people, so alot of hands on work, followed by a most enjoyable lunch. The steamed rice & sweet potatoe and the chicken satay were delicious. We departed with a cute little recipe book, a gift of 100ml of pure coconut oil, a satisfied palette and lovely memories.

learned more than just about Balinese cooking. from the start of the day at the loacl market right through the end this was a delectable, enjoyable learning experience.Sumde and his family were so infornative, welcoming and enjoyable to be with. Teaching us about the Balinese culture and welcoming us into his own family compound to cok and eat.I am so glad i did this is. It was a great day.Food was fabulous.A tip, aside from the excellent fries bananas mid morn, you don't eat until 1pm so have a good breakfastworth doing

Such good value!. The Lobong Culinary Experience is fantastic value for money - it includes a market tour with your guide Sunday who can explain all of the ingredients and also how the market works. Following the tour, and some delicious tea and sweet snacks, the cooking class takes place at his family compound, where his brother-in-law (who is a chef) is your instructor for the class. Before lunch, there is the opportunity to watch Sunday's mum making offerings at the family temple with the food you've cooked (she'll wrao you up in a sarong so you can enter the temple with her). So a real insight into Balinese family life as well as Balinese food. The lunch you cook is delicious, and there's plenty of it. They even give you some coconut oil and a little recipe book so you can replicate the dishes when you get home (I'll give it a try!).Thanks everyone at Lobong!

Exceptional in every way. You can't go past this experience. The staff go out of their way to be friendly, courteous and helpful. It is not just a cooking class it is an education and an insight into family life. Terrific value and the tour of the markets first was a great way to start. Would do it again, in a heartbeat. Thanks you guys, we all loved it and the food was delicious at the end of the whole experience. Wonderful people and well worthwhile.

More than just a cooking class, an unforgettable experience!. This cooking class experience was one of the best memory that I will keep from my trip to Indonesia. I am so thankful to Sang Made's family for this wonderful moment. We arrived in the evening the day before to Ubud and I called to book cooking class, even tough it was already late, we were positively attended and Made was waiting for us the next day to pick us up at the hotel.The tour of the local market was an unique experience, back to their home, we were offered tea, coffee and fried bananas while Made was enlighting us with balinese culture, traditions, way of life...Then, we started the cooking, it was so entertaining that it went so fast. All together we were a group of 12 person from all over the globe, so cheerful to share together this experience. All the techniques given by the chief and the kindness of the staff really made this moment special.Once everything was finalized, we were able to share with the mother of Made the offering to the temple house before eating all the dishes we had prepared. It was so delicious!!! Best food ever in Ubud.Thanks to the whole family and staff for this wonderful experience which I more than strongly recommend! Suitable for vegans offering, toffu/fish alternatives.

Cooking and culture mix. We learnt so much not just about Balinese food but everyday life. Our guide was passionate about educating us about the market and gave us many cultural insights. Our chef was equally enthusiastic about his subject. We ate and cooked in their family compound and the whole experience was nothing short of fantastic.

THIS IS IT!! You have found what you're looking for. I would just like to firstly thank Sang and the whole Lobong family for a memory and beautiful experience that Jack and I will treasure forever. <3If your are reading this review, and are searching for not only the ultimate Balinese cooking experience, but an insight into the beautiful culture and way of life of the people, this is where you want to go.No more than 12 in a group. Beautiful set up, prepping outside in lovely cool elevated area. You have so many opportunities to ask questions and are made to feel very relaxed and comfortable. Our group was great, we all bounced off of each other. We learned, we prepped, we cooked and ate. There's so so much more I could say but I'll let my pictures do the talking.We look forward to seeing our Lobong family again soon :)

Way more than just a cooking class!! . What an amazing day!!! From the market tour, to the food the whole day was an great experience!! The whole team was so enthusiastic and clearly passionate about what they are doing. Clean well maintained vehicles, very informative well spoken, English speaking staff, incredible cultural experience as well as amazing food!!! Highly recommend this tour. Family run you can taste the love!!

Brilliant Culinary Experience. Just back from a brilliant time at Lobong, the family home of Sang Made. We were collected from outside the Ubud Palace at 8:00 a.m. this morning, driven to Lobong and then to the market, where we were taken round by Sang who explained all the fruit and vegetables and what they are used for. We were then driven back to Lobong, a truly beautiful family compound, given coffee, tea and fried bananas. Sang explained his culture to us and we really appreciated his time and friendliness.We then met Dewa, the chef, and his helpers. Dewa made it so interesting and it really was 'hands on'. We cooked numerous dishes and I loved every minute of it!When the lunch was prepared, we were taken to the family temple where Sang's mother made the offerings. We were then seated at a beautifully set table, where we ate what we'd cooked, finishing with black rice porridge, which I thoroughly recommend.I would recommend the Lobong Culinary Experience, without reservation, to anyone who has an interest in food and/or the Hindu culture.

The best experience I've had in Bali. This was a fantastic experience! The family was warm, welcoming and knowledgeable and made us feel comfortable. We were able to experience an authentic traditional market, learned a lot about Balinese ingredients and cooking and had a wonderful meal. We are still cooking these recipes at home.

Amazing. Fantastic experience. These people know how to run a business. You feel very welcome in their compound where the cooking takes place. The food is delicious. The group in no to big with max 12.

So much more than cooking!. This was our favourite activity in Ubud! It isn't easy as a tourist to experience so much culture without expert guidance and that's what we got from the Lobong Cooking Class. Sangde (Sunday to us) gave a great tour of the traditional market with impeccable English and a jovial attitude. He was also the expert at Balinese culture and taught us so much about the lifestyle, culture and religion of Bali and in his own home compound. Then his brother the magnificent chef took over. Cooking is very much a part of the family experience, but this was not average home cooking. Our creations tasted like they'd been made at a 5 star resort. What a feast! Can we recreate this at home??? The souvenir cookbook will get us close, at least! Thanks, Lobong Culinary Experience!

Excellent experience. I was recommended this particular cooking school by a friend and we were not disappointed. I was on honeymoon with my wife, spending 5-6nights in Ubud. This was one of the activities that we did. It has filled our minds with lovely memories. We were picked up from our hotel. As part of the experience we were taken through a traditional market which was an experience in itself. We were also shown a traditional balinese family compound. The cooking school is located on the grounds of the owners family compound. It is very clean and shaded, with fans to keep you cool. We made some lovely dishes there, preparing and cooking them. Once all the food was made we sat down for our feast to try everything we had just made. It took about 5-6hours in total from memory (it was back in May that we went). Lovely little touches like giving us cold water and towels. All in all a great experience that I would recommend to anyone that is visiting Ubud.

Amazing experience about the Balinese culture!!. The course consists of three parts: visiting the market (I really loved it!), actually cooking and then eating together with other participants. We also asked a lot of questions about Balinese traditions and their live style during cooking. It was really interesting and one of the best things I did on Bali!

Not to be missed!. A really excellent experience conducted by very friendly guide, chef and staff. The whole day was spent getting a real sense of Balinese culture. Every aspect of the experience is choreographed, thought out, timed and executed. The best food I tasted in Bali - and we prepared and cooked it ourselves!

good experience. this is agood place to learn and experience the way of cooking on Bali and traditional again, normally you go to market first then they bring you to Bali house compound and learn the cooking from Balinese, and luch what you cooked yummmy

Highly recommended!. On our first trip to Bali, a friend recommended this experience and we were not disappointed. We enjoyed the market trip and explanation of Balinese culture and insight into family life. Staff were friendly, fluent in English and exceedingly welcoming.The cooking class was fun, inclusive and gave a great introduction to traditional Balinese cuisine. We noticed they took hygiene seriously (ie.) gloves, sanitiser available and hand washing stations. We thoroughly enjoyed our lunch and company, our class size of 10 seemed perfect. Also worth mentioning that the pick up and return service was seamless and our driver was great fun.This family run business seems well managed and highly professional. We would highly recommend!

Amazing authentic experience - A MUST!. The combined parts of the overall experience make it so interesting! The local food market tour was great - fantastic to see all the traditional balinese foods prior to cutting/cooking etc. We loved listening to the explanation of the family compound and how things are all set up. The cooking was lovely, the staff are all very competent with English and eager to answer all your questions. I asked about alternative methods of cooking chicken instead of barbecuing as England doesn't really permit the weather for that (haha!) and they were very keen and quick to give me other methods (use cast iron in the oven). All in all, the meal was lovely to eat after all our hard work and the little book of information was a great touch at the end. Everyone definitely needs to do this! It was so lovely; my friend and I found this to be our favourite part of a two week holiday travelling around Bali!

Great experience!. We loved this experience, more than just a cooking course - also learning about the Bali culture and people which was fascinating. We were picked up promptly at 8am from our hotel in Ubud. We went to the local market for about 45 minutes which was a great experience, Sunday was our guide - he was fantastic, great English speaker, great explanations on ingredients and traditions - pausing regularly to ask if we had any questions. Cold towels and water provided after the market before we travelled a short distance to the family compound. There were 12 people on the cooking course and everybody was involved equally in the cooking. The end result was delicious, lots of tasty dishes served up at the end for a tasty feast. We were given a booklet of recipes to take away and some homemade coconut oil. We liked that through out the day, the family often paused to ask if we had any questions on culture, family life or cooking. We got back to the hotel about 3pm. A great day - thanks to the family for this experience!

If you can only do one thing in Bali, DO THIS. I won't recap the whole experience as others have done a good job of it in reviews already, but all that I will say is the following- - We learned more about true Balinese culture and food and cooking and family and religion during this experience than in all our others combined- your guide, "Sunday" has the BEST English of anyone we met in Bali. We were able to ask dozens of questions and discuss all the finer points of Balinese food and culture, and he was an INCREDIBLE teacher and friend - the cooking was extremely informative and fun, and the food was fantastic- book it now!!

Wonderful Cooking - Wonderful cultural experience. If you want to cook and eat the most wonderful food and learn so much about Bali, its people and its culture, this experience is for you. From the tour of the markets to the sharing of their compound, every aspect of this tour is professional, personal and great fun. The family is wonderful, the chef amazing and the food afterwards is divine. We loved every minute of this tour. A wonderful memory of Bali.

Flawless!. This was a highlight of our trip to Bali. This event was flawless. From the moment of pick up in an amazing vehicle, to the patient reply to any and all questions in flawless English, to the ice-cold towels from the esky after the market, to the self posessed and poised demeanor of our host, everything had been considered and perfected over the 5 years of running the cooking school.Read the other reviews, don't hesitate. Excellent value for money and well worth it.
Amazing culinary experience. Highly recommend this lovely cooking class. The food was excellent, the explanations were great, the hosts were so warm and friendly - a true Balinese experience!

Yummmm...!:). That was a great great cooking class! The family who runs this place was very lovely, welcoming and taught us a lot about food and the way to cook Balinese food. Their English is really good, the food was just yummmm and the time spent so worth it!

Great class. This is a great class to take to learn something about food and family life in Bali.Many detailed reviews have already been posted that accurately describe the course (petedriver35 being a very recent one) - I don't feel I need to repeat these.I would thoroughly recommend this course as the numbers are limited to 12 and the family compound is a lovely place to spend the day (well, most of the day) - and the food is delicious.

Great experience. The best cooking class we have been on. The food we made was of a high quality and our hosts were fantastic and was also a great learning experience in to Balinese culture. Would highly recommend this cooking class to anyone.

Exceptional... . I had been debating between the top few cooking classes offered for Ubud on TA... To be honest the top three have good reviews on the whole, however, I ended up choosing Lobong, and although they are (or were at the time of choosing) #3, they definitely offer a #1 service!My wife and I were collected promptly at around 7.50am on the chosen morning, and along with another guest driven around 25 minutes to a local market. NOT I will add, to Ubud market, which is just full of tourist junk, but an actual, local market. We were the only non Balinese there. We were a group of 9, so not too big, and were shown around by one of the brothers who runs the class.His English was brilliant, and he explained everything very well and showed us all the spices and root ingredients that are such an integral part of Balinese cooking. It was very insightful and at no point felt like we were just following someone around, it was informative and interactive. A great start to the day. From here we were driven to the family compound in which they live, and given a tour of where, and more importantly, how they live. We were told about the family history and the cultural side of how Balinese families live. Again, it was very informative and educational. The class itself was very good. Run by another brother, he too was very good, good English, and very helpful throughout. We learnt all about how to use the spices and the methods of cooking the multiple dishes that we made. Everyone played a part in the class and everyone had vital input to the finished product. It was well run and everyone clearly had a great time and enjoyed it thoroughly. Before sitting down to eat, we all experienced a big part of Balinese culture, and that is the offerings. It was a very nice touch, and gave the whole experience a very Balinese feel. We sat down to eat around 1pm, and by this time were all starving and looking forward to eating everything we had just prepared, and that we did. A nice cold beer to accompany the multiple dishes we had created. The food was lovely, the family were lovely and the experience as a whole was exceptional. They even give you a parting gift, a small book of the recipes and ingredients for the menu we had made, and also a bottle of coconut oil. Just another nice touch, from a very nice and well run family business. I'd be surprised if Lobong don't make it to #1 on trip advisor, they provide an excellent service from start to finish and we couldn't recommend highly enough.

This is truly an "experience" and not just a class! Amazing!. This was the highlight of my trip to Ubud! Not only did we learn how to cook delicious, fresh and locally sourced Indonesian dishes, but we got a true cultural experience thanks to our hosts. I would highly recommend - no matter your level of culinary experience - if you have any interest in learning more about Balinese culture and cuisine. I will definitely be back!

The Best!!!!!. What a great day my wife and I had. We learned more about Balinese culture, family and way of life in our 5 hour tour then we had in the previous week here. Maday was awesome as our host taking us to an authentic food and vegetable market explaining to us about different spices and ingredients that we would be using that day. We were then driven to the their amazing family compound where we prepared and cooked a 5 course meal plus desert under the direction of Chef which we enjoyed with the other 10 particants. Best meal I've had since we arrived. You have to do this, is not to be missed!!!!!!!!

Fantastic Tour. Do not hesitate to book Lobong experience if u are looking for a cooking class in Bali!The family are lovely and give u so much information about balinese family life and cooking traditions. The market tour is really authentic and the whole day is run very professionally. Cooking with the home grown/made coconut oil is super tasty.

Yes Yes and YES!. I have absolutely nothing to fault with the Lobong Culinary Experience. One of the best days we had in Ubud. Don't get me started on the deliciousness of the food, wish I was eating it now rather than my vegemite toast. Loved it! Thank-you so much for such a fun day exposing us to the exciting flavours and traditions Indonesian food has to offer.

Excellent experience! . My sister and I loved this culinary experience! It starts with a visit to the market which was really authentic and insightful. You learn about all the vegetables and spices most of which were new to us. The family are lovely people and they speak excellent English and the whole day is run extremely professionally. The compound where the session takes place is also a great place to visit in itself! The blessing of the food at the temple was also very interesting.You have your own cooking station and you work together as a group of maximum12 to cook 5 courses. It was a lot of fun preparing and cooking the food and very rewarding eating it for lunch at the end! It was delicious! A really nice touch was they give you a bottle of coconut oil and a recipe book at the end so you can re-create the food once you are back home. Thank you to the Lobong family for a lovely day!

Fantastic experience. The class was brilliant, probably one of the best things we did in Ubud! The tour guides and chefs are very experienced, passionate and charismatic. The market tour takes place at a local market and the cooking takes place in their family compound - it was a great way to see Ubud away from other tourists and understand locals' way of life. Class size is kept small, they keep it very interactive and the food at the end is great. Recommend having a small breakfast before the class, you don't eat until about 130pm.

10/10 experience!. The day start with one hour at the local to explain the type of typical foods and spices of Balinese food, and to give us an insight into a local market atmosphere.After the market, several private cars were waiting to pick us up and take us to the family compound. Nice cook with a great chef who have us all the explanations on each part of every dish. Before eating we watched the host's mother perform a traditional Balinese offering to the gods. The experience was not just a cooking lesson but also a cultural insight into the life of a Balinese family. To summarize - one word AWESOME!

Delicious, beautiful experience.. This was one of the highlights of my trip, starting at the market where we learned about the flavours, spices and herbs that we were going to cook with. We went to the beautiful Mang Family Compound, called Lobong, and learned about the Balinese family culture and how to prepare and cook many delicious dishes. BBQ chicken in coconut spice sauce, Chicken satay with peanut sauce, a traditional salad, rice and several sambal sauces. Then experienced the tradition of the offering before sitting down to a fantastic lunch. It was the best meal of the trip.The setting was so beautiful and the family and cook were wonderful, helpful and informative. We learned a lot, and got a gift with the recipes. I would definitely do it again.

BEST COOKING CLASS - wouldn't do it anywhere else. I can't say enough great things about this experience but here's a few:Market tour: EPIC, I even bought some vanilla there and we tried a few fruits and got to see all the spices Balinese people use to cook with The Mang family compound: Stunning! We got a run down of the history of their home and how Balinese people live and their customsThe cooking class: Led by a skilled chef and very experienced! It's very interactive and for people of all walks of life. The food we made was amazing and true to Balinese cusineThe family temple: you get to learn about the offerings and the meaning behind this ritual and also be apart of it! It's very beautiful!Eating: after the ritual we ate what we prepared! It was the BEST meal I had in Ubud and we were given a lovely parting gift afterwards with the recipe book! I LOVED this and would recommend it to All!

Best cooking class!. I did this cooking class while staying in Ubud and it was fantastic! They started the class out at a local market, explaining all of the main ingredients used in traditional Balinese cooking. Then we headed to a family compound and started cooking. We made several dishes and they all turned out absolutely delicious, some of the best food we had while in Bali. Everyone was very helpful and explained everything. I would definitely recommend this for anyone staying in Ubud; it was a great experience.

good and fun. I came here by myself and joined a group of 5 ladies from around the world. We were first taken down to the fields to learn about the ingredients which we would be using. Walking down the slope we visited some small hamlets and met friendly ladies intent on preparing food for their families. Great photo ops.After the walk in the fields we started the cooking, which took several hours. The instructor followed every step of the way and he made it fun and interesting.At the end, aftr the senior lady in the family gave offerings to the divinities, we ate what we had prepared.Lots of fun and great food!http://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/ShowUserReviews-g297701-d1972441-r300656750-Lobong_Culinary_Experience-Ubud_Bali.html#

Great fun! . Together with hubby we done this cooking experience on 25th of August and definitely can recommend. Is an early start with pick up from your hotel at 7.45. After pick up they take you to local market, usually you are only tourist there so is pretty cool. Guide explains all about local spices and prices etc. After your market you go to their house, you have opportunity to meet family and understand more about Balinese family compound. Everyone is very friendly and answer all your questions. You are welcomed with tea/coffee and fried banana. After introduction cooking start. Groups are around 10people, there is space for everyone to chop etc. an experience usually finish around 2 pm, after lunch where we all eat what we prepared. We both really enjoy this experience.

Fantastic course. My husband and I have done various cookery course at home and abroad and this one was particularly good .The visit to the market was really informative and authentic. It was great seeing the family compound. The explanation was very clear throughout and the size of the group meant we were all very involved.The food was delicious and we will definitely be giving it a try at home.

Great fun for the entire family. I had to send a few messages to get a response confirming that they had availability. That made me a bit concerned about their professionalism, but those fears were unfounded. This was a great experience for everyone in the family from our 12yo boy to my 84yo mother. The class was impeccably run and a completely smooth operation (no small feat given the breadth of experience in the class and the number of dishes we prepared). The food was delicious, and there were enough dishes that there is sure to be one that will be pleasing to your whole group. The dishes will take some effort to recreate in the US, but doable. The best thing about the class was the fact that it is done in their family compound. This, combined with the trip to their local (and non-touristy) market made this more of a cultural experience than just a simple cooking class. The day started with a hotel pickup at 7:50 AM. We were back to the hotel by about 3PM. Well worth every penny and every minute.

Wonderful - not to be missed. Every minute was wonderful- i have seen local markets all over the world and thought i'd be bored- the contrary ! It was fantastic and i learned a lot- we were welcomed into their home- the Chef had been a chef at 5 star Aman resorts for iver 20 years and he was fantastic- the beat meal i had in my one month Indonesia visit. Not to be missed -

Excellent!. Never reviewed anything but feel like I should here since we just used TA to find this place yesterday. We had a GREAT experience with Lobong; it had everything we were looking for: started with a super detailed and interesting tour of an authentic market that had ZERO tourists, moved to a real family compound (of the owners, not staged for tourists) where we learned about the family and religious traditions, then spent hours cooking a Balinese meal with and learning all about the process from a chef who was at the Amandari for TWENTY TWO YEARS, and finished by eating the goodness we cooked! Class size limited to 12 (we had 10) and lasted 8:30am to 2:30pm. All cooking was interactive with the expert chef, who was very focused on enabling us to bring the Balinese cooking tradition back to our home in the U.S. -- this is not just a demonstration of something you'll never be able to replicate, but rather a true course of a dish that we're excited to try for our next dinner party. Gifts of coconut oil and a recipe book followed the class. For less than $30 USD (475k IDR) per person (including all taxes/fees), this was a steal. Highly recommended!

excellent experience, fun and interesting. I came here by myself and joined a group of 5 ladies from around the world. We were first taken down to the fields to learn about the ingredients which we would be using. Walking down the slope we visited some small hamlets and met friendly ladies intent on preparing food for their families. Great photo ops.After the walk in the fields we started the cooking, which took several hours. The instructor followed every step of the way and he made it fun and interesting.At the end, aftr the senior lady in the family gave offerings to the divinities, we ate what we had prepared.Lots of fun and great food!

What a Fantastic day for so Cheap!. After recently getting stuck in Bali for an extra 5 days we had a budget to stick to but still wanted a great day trip. The Lobong Culinary Experience did not disappoint & blew away our expectations. Starting the morning with a guided tour around a local market introducing you to local products was a warm up for what we would be cooking with. A quick van ride took us to the family compound where we were welcomed. We were shown the basic layout of the compound & the meaning behind the set up. A coffee & tea break before starting our 2 hour prep & cooking session. The three course traditional Balinese menu was explained in detail, as was every step through out the day. A fantastic set up to ensure everyone had space to chop, cook & take photos. It was very interactive with lots of time for questions to be answered at every step. After completing the cooking we were shown the Temple offering rituals by their mother with Sunday giving us details on the meanings behind the offerings. Then it's time to eat your three course lunch which you helped prepare. It was delicious!! It was a 6 hour tour, class & lunch for under $40. The class was all couples but it would be just as fun with friends. It is just outside Ubud & if you're staying in Ubud they will pick you up for free. We had our driver take us from Kuta but would book a pick up through Lobong next time as it cost the same but you start & finish at different spots making it a little confusing for our driver.

Amazing Balinese Cooking/Cultural Expierience. Due to the great reviews we have decided to have a cooking class with Sang Made (family host and market guide) and Dewa Jana (chef). It was an excellent experience indeed.Lot's of hands on, good information about ingriedents and cooking process.Besides the actual cooking and lunch, the visits to the market and the insights to Sang Made's family life and their home were really great. You can read the next reviews for more information on that.I like to add to the other reviews that the Pisang Goreng (breakfast with banana) and the Tamarind juice (healthy drink) prior to the cooking were really tasty.We are looking forward to try cooking your recipes back home in Germany.Best, Dennis and Corina

Unreliable booking system-very disappointing. Sadly we didn't get to experience this cooking class despite booking it. Having confirmed our booking, we were later informed that a family group had requested an exclusive class and so the owners cancelled our booking. I contacted the owners to let them know how disappointed I was that they put the prospect of more bookings over customer loyalty and courtesy and was informed that the family had already made a prior booking, but when they didn't confirm immediately Lobong gave away their place to us. Subsequently to cancel on us when the family did later confirm. Warning to anyone who books this class that your confirmation may not be final, and if they request confirmation of your booking, respond immediately so they don't give away your place. Very disappointing process and the booking was cancelled the day before so very difficult to find an alternative class. I would go to one of the many slightly cheaper, but still fantastic classes such as Jambangan who put their customers before their takings.

Great experience. We had a fantastic day with the Lobong Cooking School.Early start but well worth it, started with a very intersting visit around the market.Then we went to family compound, which was very beautiful.We learnt all about how their live and the balinese culture.The food prep was great fun, learnt so much and am looking forward to trying to cooksome of the dishes now we are home.Everyone was so friendly, and made us feel so welcome in their home.Would recommend to anyone who wants a great Balinese experience.

An excellent day, highly recommended. My husband, daughter and I had a fantastic day on 28 July doing the Lobong Culinary Experience. We had great fun, it was really interesting, particularly the visit to the market which we loved, as it was a side of Bali tourists don't get to see. Most of all we learnt how to make great food and enjoyed the whole experience. All of the family were brilliant, and made us truly welcome in their beautiful home. Very happy to have learned so much more about Balinese culture and relishing the challenge of recreating a beautiful Balinese meal at home. Great value, if you enjoy making good food and learning so much more about the country you are this comes highly recommended.

Cookery Course. My partner and I had an amazing day with the Lobong Cooking school. Not only was the cooking and food fantastic, we learnt so much about the markets, the family compound, how the families live and it was the best class I have been to. Excellent value for money, a lovely family- we will be back!

Truely the best experience. This is the most amazing experience I had. Picked up from our accommodation taken to Ubud traditional market where the locals go.Madė explained all the herbs, spices and ingredients we will be using. After this we went to their compound and explained how it is payed out. We all participated in cutting,and cooking. After all 6 recipes were cooked, we sat down to lunch and eat what we cooked. So delicious!!!

Fab Balinese experience. We learnt so much about the Balinese culture as well as the culinary, in a very enjoyable and fun way. I'm looking forward to trying out the recipes myself... I'd do it again with other friends.

MUST DO!! The best way to spend a day in Bali!!. This is much more than just a cooking class. Not only do you get an insight into how to cook some traditional Balinese cuisine, you also get an insight into the Balinese culture and way of life. The day starts with a visit to a local market, accompanied by Made Sunday who was an excellent guide. It was super interesting to see how the Balinese people buy their produce and how their markets work. We were the only non-Balinese people there which was awesome. They provide you with complimentary water and cold towels at the exact moment that you need - the whole day has all been incredibly well thought out. The class itself takes place in their family compound as opposed to a restaurant or cafe which is very personal and interesting. The class is taken by Made Sunday's brother-in-law. The food we made was delicious! The actual cooking time is around two hours. Our class only had seven people which was great, this meant we all got a chance to be hands-on with everything. The price includes pick up (around 8-9am) and drop off from/to your hotel (around 2-3pm). We were also able to observe offerings being made in the compound temple. This was without doubt one of my favourite days from my Bali trip! The tiniest thing that I thought could be changed was that it wasn't made clear that the additional drinks (e.g. Coke etc) that were offered while we sat down to eat were additional. However, the prices of these drinks was very reasonable so it wasn't a problem. Make sure you eat plenty before you go, you get a small snack on arrival at the comound but don't eat properly until around 12-1pm. Overall, it was a day well spent! Do this, you will not regret it!

One word: Excellent!!. - Pickup service from Hotel is included (Ubud)- Visit on a real local marktet. The gentlemen from Lobong Culinary explained serveral food and traditional things in detail. You can buy food as well, I paid 50.000 IND for a whole bunch vanilla!!!- The cooking class is located in their family compound- 12 participants- 70% Hands-on cooking, 30% presentation- friendly staff- perfect English skills (as far I can notice as a not native speaker)
Great day out at Lobong.. Loved that it is family run and got to see how they live. Very informative and market tour was great. Food delicious and learnt heaps. Would recommend.

The best of the best. Lobong is more than a cooking class, it's a window into the lives and culture of the remarkable Balinese. Starting at a local market, seeing, touching, smelling the spices, fruits and veggies set the tone for a brilliant day ahead. Next a visit to the family compound and being emerged into their family and spiritual lives is humbling. Onto the food preparation, cooking lessons by the talented Dewa, the blessing in the compound temple and finally the eating of a delicious meal we had just prepared with a great group of new friends. Just a wonderful day, one we hope to repeat when we next visit Ubud. In the meantime we plan on putting our new skills to work when we return home.

Culture & Cooking. Really enjoyed the trip to the market, being in a traditional home, the interesting cultural information and cooking real Indonesian food. Small classes with everyone participating so I would highly recommend .

Excellent day out. As people have already said, this is a great tour combining a trip to a genuine local food market, teaching on the history and culture of the Balinese people and then the opportunity to take part in some cooking. The whole day is run very well and there is nothing to fault.

A cultural experience along with a cooking class!. Amazing experience!!! Our driver picked us up at 8:00am and drove to the street market where we met other guests. The market was an incredible experience as we were the only tourist and non locals there. It was awesome to see the people from this village buying and selling their goods. Our hosts took us through the market educating us on many of the local ingredients used for Balinese cooking. After the market we were driven to our host home where we received so much more than just a cooking class. We were treated as friends in their home and given coffee/tea and a tour of their compound while learning about their culture and family dynamic. We also witnessed an offering in their temple and they explained how and why this offering takes place everyday all over Bali. So impressed with their kindness and hospitality. Learning how to use and prepare different spices and ingredients together was really interesting. The food tasted amazing and at the end they gave us a small goody bag with the menu and instructions of how to make our dishes along with their handmade coconut oil! Very nice touch!! This was one of my favorite things we did in Bali!

Authentic Balinese experience like no other!. I have done cooking classes all over Asia and I did this one in April and I loved it. Our morning market tour was in a village and very "local" and our guide was very informative about the culture and produce giving us a fabulous insight into the Balinese way of life. The cooking course was based in the family compound and was seamlessly run like a tight ship with lots of stimulating techniques to try and tips to make the food delicious. Everything was prepped ready to go and the grounds are stunning and peaceful. In April I am bringing a group of girls here and I think it will be a highlight for them too! Thank you for your wonderful hospitality! I will be back

So much more than just cooking!. I would highly recommend a day with the Lobong Cooking Class. It is appropriate for adults of all ages. I was really impressed with how much time and effort the family takes to teach you about Balinese culture, religion and their private residence where you spend the day. From the beginning to the end it was enjoyable. They've figured out how to give a cooking class a personal touch and create a lasting impression in only 5 years. I hope it stays this way! My dad is a vegetarian and they seamlessly helped him create his dishes within a whole group of meat eaters. Thank you to Sunday for driving us around and providing us with a wealth of information. And to your family for welcoming us into your home.

exceeded all expectations !. Absolutely fantastic day that exceeded all expectations! The family home where the cooking took place is stunning and the food incredible. Learnt a lot about the Balinese lifestyle, beliefs and people that we never would have known if we hadn't taken the class. The entire day was planned very well and the timing perfect. Would recommend for anyone, and suited for families. Definitely would recommend !

A must do in Bali. This is not just a cooking class. You will learn a lot about Balinese culture and how the Balinese live (as well as learn how to prepare some really yummy Balinese food!). You start your day in a local market (not the tourist one in Ubud). Here Sang Made (your host) shows you the types of ingredients you you will be using and explains how the markets work. Afterwards you will go to the family compound where you will learn about how Balinese families live. We learned more about Balinese culture that morning than we had during the rest of our trip in Bali. Then chef Dewi takes over and spends the next few hours guiding you through the preparation of a number of Balinese dishes. Lots of fun for both beginners and experienced cooks. Our group had 11 people and we all had turns at trying the various techniques and preparation. At the end we had a beautiful sit down lunch where we were served the fruits of our labours. Finish time is about 2.30pm. Thank you Sang Made and Dewi for a fantastic day!

Great experience, cooking great food. What a wonderful experience from the time Sang Made(Sunday) picked us up from the hotel until we were dropped back some 6 hours later. The market experience was unique and informative. The visit to the family compound was humbling and learning about the Balinese way of life was priceless. Preparing and cooking beautiful food in a great setting with some very nice people was a wonderful way to end our Bali experience. The lunch that we all shared together was probably the best meal of the whole trip to Bali and we ate in some very good restaurants !! We cannot recommend this experience highly enough.

Loved this cooking class!. So pleased to have booked this cooking class. It started with an interesting & informative tour of the markets, and then a tour of the Lobong compound home where we were told of Balinese home traditions. The cooking was hands on, and we were told so much about the ingredients and methods of cooking. Finally, the delicious food we had cooked was served a-la-carte. Recipes were certainly a bonus to receive at the end of the class so that we can cook the dishes at home!

Not just a cooking class. This experience was the highlight of a fabulous 2 weeks in Bali. I booked this particular course after reading the excellent reviews on here and it definitely exceeded my expectations. The whole day was amazing and I learnt so much not only about Balinese cooking but also Balinese culture. The family hosts are welcoming, the market tour informative and the actual cooking part of the day was very hands on. The day finished with an absolute feast that was delicious. A truly memorable day, can't recommend highly enough.

Awesome experience! . Cannot recommend this highly enough! Not only was it great to learn traditional Balinese cooking techniques but also learnt a huge amount about the Balinese culture, family and religious beliefs. Visiting the market was a fabulous experience. A must do! If you can hold a knife you can do it.

A reals insight into the Balinese life. What an experience, so much more than just a cooking class. From the friendly pick up and drop off to the markets, where we we're meet by Made/Sunday our wonderful guide through a local market, he was so friendly and informative and we got to see how the locals buy their produce and explained many things about the town and markets that you would not get if you just walked around on your own. Then we were watered and driven to the family compound, which was amazing. Made explanation and description of the family life for a Balinese was so informative and interesting. I felt like I got a great insight. Then the cooking class was sensational, very hands on and I really learnt a lot and feel confident in being able to reproduce this in my own kitchen. It was also great that local produce that we will not be able to find in Australia, we were advised of alternatives that we could use. The food that we had helped in making was then served to us and it was delicious. Don't bother looking at other classes, this one has it all and was a real highlight of our trip

Awesome Experience. Words fall short to capture the essence of this wonderful experience, from the Traditional Market to their beautiful compound to the amazing mouth watering food that we cooked and to the Beautiful Balinese Family that took me on this culinary and cultural experience. Lobong Culinary Experience is a must do when visiting Ubud

So fun!. Informative, fun, structured to not waste your time, and DELICIOUS! A must do. One of our favorite meals in all of Bali ( We stayed for 2 weeks!) Interesting tour of the Market during the morning and then Sunday (the tour guide) took us to his home where we cooked the meal. Learned a lot about the culture, ate great food & made some friends.

Not only a cooking experience.. What a wonderful experience! Not only did we cook some amazing meals, we also got a cultural lesson. From being picked up at our hotel, to travelling to a village market where we were taken around all over the market even behind the scenes. We then travelled to the family compound (5 mins) where we were greeted with coffee and banana fritters whilst being told how the compound is set up. Then onto the cooking where it was hands on. We it was explained what ingredients were what and how they are used to create such wonderful flavours. We were told how and why offering were done, then we had the opportunity to eat what we had all made that day. Classes are small (12) people and they also offer transport back. Don't miss this chance to experience not only just a cooking class. They also gave us a little gift of the recipies we made that day to re-create at home. A must do !

EXCELLENT Experience, a must do in Ubud!. An excellent experience! You will learn how to cook an amazing traditional Balinese meal but also learn about the culture and family systems of Bali. The family is amazing and their compound and facility was gorgeous. Highly recommend the Lobong Culinary Experience for anyone visiting Ubud!

Cooking and Cultural Experience. We went for a cooking class and got much more out of it! The Lobong team covered the market (Bali local), shared the cultural aspects of a typical family in Bali and on top of it we cooked the best meal I ever had in South Asia! In one word... "Unforgettable"'! Love it!

More than just a cooking class . Sang Made, the family host was very informative and he spoke fluent English. He brought us to the payangan traditional market in the early morning and explain to us the different types of ingredients used in Balinese cooking.We even got an insight to the traditional balinese family compound and we learnt alot about Balinese culture through him! Once home, we were greeted by chef Dewa. He was very knowledgeable and he go through with us the steps and techniques involved in cooking all the different type of dishes. Everybody in the class partipated in the cooking process. We cooked a total of 8 dishes, including appetizer, main and desserts! The food we cooked was delicious! We enjoyed the food and class very much and would highly recommended this to everyone who is interested in Balinese food and culture!

Excellent from start to finish. Excellent from start to finish says it all really. Informative food market tour, beautiful compound, not just a culinary experience but also a cultural experience. We learnt more about traditional balinese culture in these couple of hours then we have in our whole trip. The staff were incredibly helpful and informative. But most importantly on a culinary experience the produce was top class and the final product (the meals we made) was beautiful. Highly recommended!!!!!!!!

balinese masterchef. after being picked up from our hotel doorstep we were taken to the local marketplace where our tour guide, Made Sunday, was very informative of the local cuisines, ingredients and traditions. he was easy to understand as he spoke good english and was very funny. we got an insight to traditional balinese family and offering culture at the lobong family compound which was very interesting and lovely to know their traditions are still being practiced today. then it was to the cooking with chef dewa which involved a lot of processes and each was explained in detail to us so that we understood how true balinese cook. the food we cooked was absolutely incredible and filling! the best food ive had in bali so far! dewa was very knowledgable of not only balinese cuisine but also western cuisine as well and you can see and feel his passion for cooking. a great day and amazing food with a lovely gift at the end. highly reccommend.
Beautiful Bali experience . Couldn't fault this place with such attention to detail. Fabulous way to spend the day and experience the real Bali. Would highly recommend

Great experience market and hands on cooking!. Worth the early start to see a local market in action (minus the tourist stuff in Ubud!). Friendly and informative guides drive you to a market first and explain some of the ingredients you will be using later. Then you get taken to their lovely house for refreshments before the cooking begins! You make your own three course meal between the group and get to eat it after. Clear instructions and very fun to do even if no cooking experience! Highly recommended.

Such a great highlight of our holiday. My husband and I signed up to this course primarily to learn about Balinese food and do some cooking, but we did not realise it would be such an insightful crash course in Balinese culture too.
