A member of the Lobong family picked us up from our hotel and drove us straight to the local market to meet the others and our guide. We learnt loads about the food and it was totally tourist free - apart from us of course!Then to the beautiful and peaceful Lobong compound. From here I don't want to go into too much detail and spoil the surprise... but if you are interested in food, cooking and the Balinese culture then book here! Juat do it because it was the highlight of our trip
Amazing!. Everything was most informative and not rushed at all. Professional from start to finish. Authentic and informative Balinese experience!! I wouldn't chance a thing

Amazing. Honeymoon highlight. Sundae (so sorry about the spelling bud!) was an amazing guide around the actual local market (only tourists there) and I've never learnt so much about ingredients. To top that we were invited into this home and given some great insight into how the Balinese community works. All the questions that had been building up over the week or so before were answered!The cooking class was also great, again learning so much more. I can wait to take this new found knowledge home. Can not recommend this enough. Incredible value.

More than a cooking class . This experience of Bali culture cannot be surpassed. After a comprehensive and informative walk around an authentic Balinese market, Sunni allows you to enter into his family compound where you'll learn about the Balinese family and religious values. Thanks to Sunni's fluent English and eagerness to answer any questions I can now understand and appreciate the Bali way of life. Oh and there was an amazing cooking class included. Professionally handled in every way by the chef (sorry mate, forgot your name!) and he makes sure everyone gets involved. The meals that are produced could be sold for more than the price of this class. They're THAT good.This should the number one attraction on TripAdvisor.

Professional Cooking class. This is what you will be signing up for: - Knowing the ingredient used during market tour (nothing beats to have the knowledge like what your mum will guide you)- Understanding how balinese food are being prepared and hands on doing it. (Its the effort and pride in Balinese cuisine that made it delicious. Hands on is always better than theories. I bet you will remember how to do the dishes after 1 course) - Understanding Balinese culture (this is not just a cooking class. In fact the place is a home for Sunday and his family. Sunday is the guide who brings us around the market) - Fun and delicious balinese lunch (I enjoyed the session and had my own cooked Balinese lunch) This is NOT just a cooking class. It is a culture exchange with nice cuisine sharing. It is definately value for money activity. I have to say they have upkeep the home very well and beautifully decorated.Recommended for those who loves cooking or love food! Even for those who cannot cook, join them. It is easy and you might fall in love with cooking afterwards.

WOW!. Incredible experience and lost for words! Starting your day in the fresh market, your host engages your sensory system by exploring raw spices, foods and teaches you about the corner stones of Balinese cooking. Not only was this a cooking class but a complete lesson in the Balinese customs of family, respect and food. These guys do it right, there is no cutting corners with these guys. I couldn't believe my two hands helped shape the lunch we had that day! Absolutely amazing and would recommend for all.

Cant imagine anyone doing it better. Have been to Bali heaps, but this is up there with one of the best things i have ever done there. Book a couple of days in advance. We did the morning session and can not more highly recommended it. Learnt a lot about cooking and how to recreate balinese cooking techniques at home, the market and culture tour was outstanding, as was the food.

Great fun. This is a belated review from our honeymoon in Bali in September. We love cooking and were keen to learn more about local recipes and produce. The day was really well organised, pick up from hotel and driven to a local market. The market is somewhere we would never have went alone but was so interesting.Our guide was so friendly and knowledgable. We then went to the beautiful family compound where we had fresh coffee/ tea & little warm banana fritters.The actual cooking part was clean, fun & interesting. Before eating our beautiful feast we learnt more about offerings to the Gods which was humbling and insightful.All in all this was a great day, one of the best things we did in Ubud!
Great experience . Staff was very nice and the food and the cooking workshop were splendid. You will also learn a lot about the Balinese culture and the family compound.

Cooking class and cultural experience. The best thing we did in Bali! We loved walking through the local market and learning about daily Balinese life and traditions. Our guide was very knowledgeable and charismatic. We were welcomed into the family compound which was lovely.We lined up at the bench to start cooking, the kitchen and equipment was immaculately clean. Our chef explained everything thoroughly and everyone participated.We sat down with the group to enjoy the meal and I couldn't believe we'd cooked it! the food was fantastic! Highly recommended, we had a great day

Very nice (for the most part). We're beginners in the world of culinary and reading the reviews and browsing their website was a little misleading, as this was very clearly for those with advanced cooking skills. There is no way I could replicate these recipes at home. With that said, the family is extremely friendly and you're made to feel right at home when you step in the door. The parting gift is also a really nice touch. The meal was pretty good, and the chicken satay was AMAZING. The peanut sauce was out of this world. That is the one thing I am really hoping to take away from this and bring back home. :)

Cultural Experience, More than just Cooking!. We had such a great day! The trip to the Local market was great, our tour guide spoke exceptional english and was a very humble informative man. You then go back to the family's compound and he gave us an incredible insight into how they live (the house was beautiful!). We then cooked delicious food, all having a go! All the staff were fantastic, will definitely recommend this place to our friends back home!

Culture plus cooking lesson- unbeatable if you want an authentic experience. My wife and I did this course today and as the cook in our family I truly enjoyed it. I cook a lot of Asian dishes so gaining an insight into Balinese cooking through this day was rewarding. We had a group of 8 which was an ideal group size. Lots of cultural background is given and they are able to answer our questions about current practices and customs within the family and the larger local community. Others have written in detail about the flow of the day's activities so I won't repeat here. Highly recommend this if I had only a few days and wanted an authentic Balinese experience that focuses on food and culture. Thanks to Made and all the family/staff.

Amazing Balinese experience. This was the best experience yet in bali. It was nice to see a local market and shown what each spice and ingredient was. The family compound was very beautiful and it was very interesting to learn about the calture and see it in practice. The class was fun, informative, and the food was amazing. At the end you are given a recipe book with instructions and a list of substitutions so you can share with friends at home. Thanks lobong family

Fantastic Cultural and Culinary Experience. We just took this tour and class today, and absolutely loved it! It was my favourite moment on our trip so far. It starts out with a pick up from your hotel in the Ubud area, then you go to a local market (not the touristy places you'd see on your own). The guide (who speaks very fluent English) walks you through the market showing you spices and foods you wouldn't see at home. He talks about things like how to tell if a banana is tree ripened, and what kinds of things we can substitute at home. They have everything carefully thought out down to the cold wet towels and water bottles after the market. You then go to a family compound to learn about home and family life, and how each compound is laid out and why. They make coffee or tea, and a special treat of fried bananas. Then you learn how to make an entire Balinese feast. Come hungry, because you get to eat the food you cook, and it is A LOT! Everything is so delicious, and they make every effort to keep the work stations clean and sanitized. Everyone we worked with was so helpful and lovely. We felt very welcome, even by the children in the compound. You can't beat this experience!! Highly recommended! Thank you Lobong Culinary Experience!

Wonderful experience - but we got really sick!. Its taken me a while to write this as felt conflicted - in January we had the most wonderful experience at Lobong cooking school. The trip to the market, the family compound, the cooking instruction was all excellent and so friendly and genuine. Unfortunately the three of us who did the cooking course were incredibly sick afterwards with salmonella (suspect the chicken wasn't cooked or was handled in a way we are not used to which the Balinese chef did talk about). What was so scary was that I was in the early stages of pregnancy and feared we may lose the baby. The fourth member of our group didn't visit Lobong with us and was totally fine. Having 5 days of not being able to do anything on our 10 day holiday was not a great result!

Great culinary and cultural experience!. Really enjoyable and professionally run class. I chose Lobong for its small class size (max 12 pax) so everyone gets involved. Sunday also explained the traditional balinese compound and their lifestyle. A must-do activity if you are a foodie!

Our best day out in Bali. From the pickup at our hotel , the market tour by Made , the hands on cooking and lunch this was our favourite day of all.We had 11 persons on our tour, including 2 Koreans on their honeymoon and 7 young american kids ( mid 20's), 2 Aussies (us). We, all 11 of us, got on so well, we were so lucky to have such a nice group of people.The family compound was amazing and we all learnt a lot. I highly recommend this class to anyone, you wont be disappointed.

Just Awesome. If you want to experience authentic Balinese cooking and hospitality, this cooking class is a must. With a maximum of 12 people, EVERYONE is hands on. Sang Made (aka Sunday) your host is amazing as he narrates you through their local market and back to their family compound where the coking and eating take lace.I've been to Bali a few times and I learnt more from Sunday about local family culture in this cooking class. The Chef, Dewar is fantastic, very skilled, passionate, and a good sense of humour. Very professional and classy operation. You guys should be very proud of the business and wonderful tourist experience you have built.

Amazing food and family.. My husband and myself took this cooking class April 3rd, along with 7 other people, small class which is good. The whole day was wonderful, I'm very impressed and can fully say it was tone of the best days spent near Ubud. Our host Sunday was the name of the gentlemen that looked after us, he was very knowledgable, and also one of the Lobong sons. They promptly picked us up from our location and took us to a local market for food, spices etc, this is a local market not tourist, he took us around and explained all the different foods, then we were taken to the Lobong compound cooking class, the compound is very beautiful and everyone in the family is very helpful and friendly, great amenities and very clean, the cooking class was excellent with Dewa, he is very good at what he does and speaks good English so you can understand him well, the preparation and cooking was great, and then we had a break to give offerings to the gods in the temple, and it was time to sit down relax and be served the food that we had helped create, the food is so delicious, one of the best Indonesian feeds I had while visiting Bali. The gave us plenty of cold bottled water and a snack when we first arrived. This is an outstanding way to find out how they live also. I would throughly recommend this cooking class. Everything was great and well organised, we finished around 2.30pm and started around 8.00am when they picked us up.
bali cooking class. Enjoyed the class; used all fresh ingredients except the all purpose flour for the crepes. We did all the prep work to make the meal.

Fantastic complete cooking experience, more than just a cooking class!. This is superbly organised. Swift market tour with opportunity to buy local ingredients for yourself. An insight into Bali culture, seeing a proper compound. Clean and Hygienic cooking area (actually entire compound), great equipment and a super presenter (chef). Everyone gets to participate but the hard and less pleasant mundane stuff is taken care of for you. I was previously a chef and loved this course and will highly recommend it. I did another class and seperate market tour with another company. But This is the all in one experience to do.

First class culinary tuition in a delightful Balinese family compound. This is a cooking class worthy of the name, everything was done to make sure everyoneparticipated in the preparation of the dishes. The dishes for the day included chicken curry, sambal ulek (chilly and tomato mild accompaniment to other dishes), chicken satay lilit and more. It would seem a lot to get through, but it all went efficiently under the guidance of the trained chef. It was well organised with a spacious area for cooking.All the family members were going about their occupations and before we sat down to eat, one of the ladies dressed us in sarongs and invited us into their family temple whilstshe made offerings. The dishes we had cooked together were beautifully presented and we all enjoyed the good taste of home-cooked Balinese food.

You must take this class if in Bali!!. We booked this cooking class having done one in India and I have to say this was much better!The Lobong family are amazing - so friendly and welcoming and extremely willing to share all they know not only about Balinese food but also about Balinese culture and customs. You get picked up and taken to a village market where there are no tourists at all. Sunday took us around and explained in detail about the spices we would be using later on. When we arrived to the compound, we were shown around, given the chance to ask lots of questions about Balinese life, and were then given coffee and banana frites - so good. We were introduced to the chef who was extremely lovely and showed us all the ingredients we'd be using and took us through the menu. We then had our own cooking station to prepare ingredients, and took it in turns cooking various parts of the dishes. Finally, we each made a Balinese green pancake - so much fun! You're offered drinks throughout and the cooking school itself is extremely clean and sterile. You are served the food you've made at a beautiful table and have the chance to buy soft drinks. It's been my favourite thing I've done so far in Bali; definitely book a class if you have a free day!

Highly recommended experience!. Very happy with the Lobong Culinary Experience! There were 10 people in our group, and we thoroughly enjoying learning about the local ingredients as well as Balinese culture and the details of life in their family compound – which was absolutely gorgeous! Made is an excellent host who speaks great English, is very organized, and happy to answer our many questions. We were picked up promptly before 8am and ate lunch together with our group a little after 1pm, so I'd recommend eating a hearty breakfast before the class, or bringing a few snacks along in case you get hungry. Bring along a few bottles of purified drinking water too, as the day gets warmer the later it gets. Overall high quality experience and will definitely recommend!

The best cooking class in Bali!. Lobbing cooking class is a fantastic cultural and cooking experience. We were picked up by Sunday (Made) from our hotel and on our drive to the market he explained a lot of Balinese tradition and ceremonies which were unbelievably interesting! Upon our arrival to the markets, Sunday took us on a tour explaining the various vegetables, herbs and spices that are used in Balinese cooking. We were then taken back to his family compound and explained the tradition and meaning of his compound. This is fascinating and you are taken back by their culture and tradition of staying as a family. Chef Dewa is then introduced and takes us through a step by step process of preparing and cooking traditional Balinese food. The cooking part of our day was fantastic and the organisation and preparation is great. It is extremely hands on with the end product being the most amazing spread of traditional Balinese food. The chicken curry is to die for!Sunday's Mum showed us their traditional offerings ceremony prior to eating which makes this day not just about the cooking, but also about respecting their culture and traditions. This is a definite must do while in Bali, not just in Ubud, with Lobong Cooking Class by far being the best cultural/cooking experience we have ever done in Bali!Thank you for welcoming us into your home Sunday!

Extremely Enjoyable!. Lobong should be commended for their wonderful cooking school. The class includes a market tour and explanation of bali family compounds. They will also arrange transport from your hotel. Most importantly the food is excellent and the techniques taught are simple and effective. Thank you Lobong!

Great cooking class along with the Best Chicken Satay. What a wonderful experience!. The cooking school is located in a family compound and when you enter you totally forget about all the commotion that is going on outside. Our host could not have been any more gracious! We were treated to coffee or tea along with a trip before began our cooking lessons. My husband could not get over the beautiful birds. This was a wonderful way to spend 6 hours on our short trip to Bali. We came away from there feeling enlightened and stuffed.

Very good experience. A MUST do activity for food lovers. We had a great day with Sunday (Made), Chef Dewa and the staff, visiting the local food market and preparing the food. The 8 course meal we've cooked was excellent. The best urap and sate ayam lilit we've had in Bali. And we liked that you get a booklet with all the recipes to take home.

The best cooking class we have ever been too :). We really can't say enough about the wonderful time we has at the Lobong Cooking Class in Ubud Bali. Sandae is the perfect host and his command of the English language is impeccable, his great knowledge of the Bali traditions plus an in-depth tour of the early morning markets as he explained about the different produce we would be using today. Sandae has a great sense of humour and is perfect man for the job. The classes are held in their beautiful traditional family home. I must explain that we have been to so many other places that look great on the net but turn out to be run down hovels But not this time we are glad to say. There was 9 in our class and Chef Dewa had us all working not only by showing us but by making us preparing and cooking the lunch we would be eating today, he also asked us questions to make us think so we weren't just letting him do all the work. I can say that warmth given from all the members of this family run business was most welcoming We really really recommend this cooking class to any other as it is truly amazing value compared to the others. Many thanks Sandae and Dewa

Fantastic cultural experience. We arranged transport from Legian to Ubud and the driver was lovely. He took us to the local market in Ubud first for a lesson on how the restaurants and locals purchase there fresh produce. We met up with the rest of the class there.. there was only 6 people in total - PERFECT number for us. Our host was Made and he was a very charming young man who spoken excellent English. He showed us around the market explaining the different fruit and veggies. He then took us to his home compound and it was beautiful. His Brother was the Chef and he was very hands on showing us the best techniques for achieving the best flavours. We also met his wonderful mother who showed us how we must make an offering to the gods for our food... this too was a great cultural experience. The menu was 7 courses and it was shown step by step how to do it. The end result was delicious. I do not like peanuts and one of the sauces was a peanut sauce, so he made a different sauce for me - very yummy! We had a wonderful bunch of travellers with us who complemented the whole experience. I would definitely recommend this to everyone who would like to try their hand at a cooking class in Bali. Thank you again Made (Sunday :) Kind regards,Karina and Julie

Great hands-on experience. We visited the produce market, learnt about all the ingredients, then traveled to the beautiful Lobong community home for our cooking adventure. We really got hands-on in the preparation of all aspects of our lengthy menu, then had the pleasure of eating it all in style at the end. Such a fun thing to do as a group.

Best value experience. We had the absolute best day at the Lobong Cooking Class. It was, by far, the most interesting and rewarding activity I have done in Bali. From the early markets, to being warmly welcomed to the family compound - I cannot recommend this experience enough. Small class sizes and warm service makes this business a cut above its competitors - and amazing value! Thank you for a great day.

Still the best day out in Bali. This is the second time we have visited the Sang family's compound for their cooking class. Lobong Cooking Class is the best day out in all of Bali in my book, the day begins with a pickup from your accommodation to make the journey to a local market place in Ubud. Here you get to see where the ingredients we will cook with, come from. Then it is on to the family home for the cooking class in what is a fantastic outdoor kitchen, kitted out to accommodate 12 pupils through the tuition by qualified chef Dewa. All ingredients have been prepared before you arrive so it is straight into the cooking, including the slicing, dicing and grinding of the ingredients. Everyone pitches in to cook the meal which you will finally sit and enjoy with your fellow students. Todays table seated people from France, England, Chile and various parts of Australia. The food we ate, just like our last visit was amazing. Sang De the family host has a great personality, is very knowledgeable in many cultures and visibly enjoys sharing his culture with his guests, of which he is very informative and delivers in such a way he keeps you captivated so much so, you don't want him to stop talking. A wonderful day out, hope to return again soon.

Brilliant Master Chef experience. Absolutely loved this experience. From the pick up and market visit and explanation behind Balinese cooking and food, through to visiting the family residence for our amazing cooking lesson, no detail was overlooked.The group we were with were super friendly and everyone got on well as we got to work carefully crafting an entire menu of delicious, traditional Balinese food with fresh ingredients.Throughout we were treated to coffee and juice and breaks to enjoy the beautiful temple and family home.And of course feasting on everything we created was the best way to end this.The cooking instructions and set up was awesome and I felt like we were in a Master Chef class

Fun Day. This is a very fun day. The day will start with the company picking you up from your hotel. After everyone has been picked up you will then proceed to the market where they will educate you about the local produce. After the informative stop they will take you over to their property.The class takes place in their compound or house. You will partake in the daily rituals and prayers to the elders and then go on to the actual class. They will teach you how to prepare each ingredient and the proper steps to prepare each dish. During our specific experience they also taught us how to make coconut oil. After all the cooking you will then be rewarded with the spoils of your work. Gathered together in a big communal table you will drink and dine.After every one is done it is time to pay up and you will be escorted back to your hotel.

A really enriching experience. Just been on the cooking class at Lobong today. What a fantastic experience. From the moment we were picked up from our hotel to the time we were dropped back we were treated like very special guests.This is not just like any other cooking class. It encompasses the cultural side, local customs, spiritual importance of Balinese religion and everyday family life, truly inspirational and not to mention the way the teaching was carried out, in such a professional manner. I have learned so many new thing that I thought I already knew about cooking, like cooking rice the proper way! After walking through the food market and learning about the main ingredients in Balinese cooking we went back to the school, which is also a family compound set in beautiful surrounding. We make five or six different dishes, they all turned out to be delicious.I would highly recommend this experience to anyone wanted to learn about Balinese cooking and traditions. This course is very comprehensive and fantastic value for money.If I return to Bali I have no doubt I will go back for another course. Thank you Lobong. I had a unforgettable day.Kim

Great day. We spent the day at the Lobong Cooking School and throughly enjoyed our day. We were taken to the local market which was extremely interesting and then back to the cooking school.The chef helped us create an amazing lunch for the group, it all looked amazing and was absolutely delicious. Great value for money do it if you can.

Awesome experience. Amazing day. Visit to the local village markets amazing, we were the only tourists(group of 12), very interesting fresh produce. Cooking class great in family compound,giving us insight into the way the Balinese family lives. Good participation in food preparation and once cooked we all sat and had a beautiful meal. Very interesting, relaxing and enjoyable

Wonderful!. It is easy to see how the Lobong Culinary Experience has such great reviews! We attended the class yesterday & were lucky enough to have an intimate group of just 10. From start to finish it is so clear to see the passion that this family has for Balinese food & cooking. The market visit is one of a kind, the locals are such beautiful people who were happy to let us sample fruit & take many photos of them! Going back to the compound was amazing, the home of this family is so beautiful & finding out all about the structure & rituals of the family was very interesting. Then onto the cooking - our mentor chef was fantastic, had a great sense of humour & encouraged everyone to have a go. By the end of the class you can't help but feel a sense of pride that you have contributed to the sensational feast you are about to consume! We were so pleased we gave the Lobong Culinary Experience a go & would highly recommend it to anyone of any skill level! thanks again Lobong :)

Best Bali experience. I'd recommend this to anyone, whether you like cooking or not. The Lobong family are the most welcoming, beautiful people and more than happy to show you around their local market and invite you into their family home. If you're interested in learning about the way traditional balinese families live this tour is a must. This was an excellent experience finished with amazing meal at the end of the day.

Great mix of history, food and Balinese lifestyle . The tour was amazing! From traditional markets where you are the only tourists to the cooking course in a Balinese home, it was just a great experience. If you are in Ubud and you don't do this you have honestly missed out. And you don't have to be a good cook to enjoy yourself!

Exceeded expectations. The entire day was faultless. I've been coming to Bali for years and I wished I'd done this years ago. The cultural info was equally as fabulous as the cooking experience. Top notch from beginning to end - thank you Made and Dewa (sp?) and all of your fabulous team.

A MUST!. What an amazing day!...markets...cooking...eating and learning so much!....Beautiful family welcoming you into there gorgeous home...they make this experience world class!...you will luv it!....nothing but the best!

Not Just A Cooking Class. This was such an amazing experience. First I would like to say one in our group fell ill while at the market and they were very quick to identify that and made sure she got to the hotel where she received fantastic care by the staff at Four Seasons Sayan. This experience gave us a look into the Balinese life and culture...that was invaluable. The cooking was fun and use of local ingredients made the food fresh and most delicious. Two in our group are vegetarians and they knew exactly what we would substitute for the meat products. Highly recommend.

Culinary feast. The moment Sang De (Sundae, like the ice cream) picked us up at out hotel, we knew we were in for an unforgettable experience! We first went to the market to see all the roots and spices, where Sund De taught us about the local food and culinary practices at the market. After our visit to the market, we were taken to our host's house, a traditional Balinese compound, for the actual cooking class. At the compound we learnt all about balinese culture and heritige - it really made Bali come alive for us! The class followed, and we found it well presented and interesting. The culinary feast ensued!! Thanks Lobong!!!

Highlight of Bali. Highlight of our Bali trip!! You would be silly not to book with these guys.We stayed in Semyniak but they picked us up for a small fee and were right on time. We arrived at the local market in Ubud and were the only tourist to be found. It was great to see all the different ingredients that Bali has to offer and you get to try the fruit in the market which we would have never done if it wasnt for the cooking class.Our guide had excellent english and if you want to not only learn about food but the culture than this is a must. We learnt about family, housing, education and even had the honour of going into the family temple to see how a offering is done before we eat. Cooking class was great!! Very hands on and by far the best meal we had on our whole trip. Dont waste your time with any other cooking company book with these guys. Also our 5 year old came with us and the staff were great with him. There home has so much to explore for little ones.

So much fun! throughly enjoyed the experience!. I'm not going to spill the beans on what we did during the morning.But I must conclude that it was a very fun and eye opening experience. Both my boyfriend and myself throughly enjoyed visiting the local market and the Balinese cooking experience! I will highly recommend this to all my friends who will be visiting Bali.

Brilliant class, fantastic food and lovely people. As the title says! Had an brilliant day being taking round a traditional market and shown all the food we were to cook with. Got back to the family compound where everyone wee very welcoming, before cooking some great Balinese food.

Highly Informative, Authentic Cooking Experience. We saw some offers for cooking classes on the streets, being held in Warungs and cafes, and we are so glad we decided to book online after reading reviews.Lobong Cooking Class does not disappoint. In fact, it's better than we expected.We were picked up from our hotel at 8am, but an talkative and friendly driver, taken to a local market to join the rest of the group. There were 7 other tourists that joined our group, and we met our guide, Sang De. Sang De, guided us through a local market, only used by locals to purchase food. We could tell that this was an authentic local market, because not once, were we approached by a seller trying to convince us to buy something. We were a bit of an attraction to the locals as the only foreigners in the market. Sang De was funny, informative as he directed us around the market, explaining the various customs, spices, and vegetables.After exploring the local market, we were taken to the Snag De's family compound, where we were shown around the compound, receiving a full explanation followed by banana fritters and ginger tea/balinese coffee.Soon afterwards, our teacher, Sang De's brother-in-law took us through the cooking class.The entire experience was amazing, starting at 8am and finishing at 2:30pm. It included seeing how to cook and actually chopping, grinding and cooking traditional dishes consisting of soup, curry, rice, and sweet green crepes.Everyone involved in the Lobong Cooking Class is polite, professional, speaks english and is entertaining and informative. There are plenty of opportunities to ask questions and they ensure that everyone gets involved.It concludes with being served the meals we prepared, including free beer or softdrink and being given a recipe book & home-made coconut oil to take home. The whole experience cost my wife and I approx 850K, and we also purchased a Volcanic Rock Pestle & Mortar for only 80K.I highly recommend this experience to anyone including kids, as it's a hands on authentic experience full of great flavour and food.

Best experience in Ubud!. This was hands down my favourite experience in Ubud. The family is incredibly friendly and we learnt so much from them about cooking and the Balinese way of life. The market tour was fantastic, where we were taught about all the local ingredients. Then back to the family compound for our cooking experience. It was so much fun and the huge meal we made was the best food I had in Bali! Thank you so much to the Lobong family for such great hospitality and a wonderful day we'll never forget.

A Lovely Experience!. We got back from our day with the Lobong family just a few hours ago and we haven't stopped talking about what a great time we had! Made and his family took us to a local market in the morning (not one filled with tourists) and toured us around, explaining in great detail all of the different ingredients we would be using in the cooking class (as well as some other common ingredients found in Balinese cooking). He then drove us to his family's compound where he explained about Baliense family life, how and why the compound is set up in the way that it is and other interesting facts about Hinduism in Bali --we were given coffee, tea and a welcome treat and then it was off to the kitchen.The cooking itself was tons of fun! Everyone got their own stations and was involved in prepping the ingredients, cooking the dishes, stirring and sautéing (I've heard in other schools this is not the case). We all got to be a part of the class which made the day super fun and rewarding when we feasted on our delicious creations. A full experience that is so much more than just a cooking class - I highly recommend to anyone traveling in Ubud. You won't regret it!
Wonderful. . An amazing experience. Every detail has been thought through carefully from the market experience to the cooking amd eating. Very warm and professional.

Awesome . From the time they collected us from the hotel until we were dropped back we had an awesome experience. It was much more than a cooking course. It was an education in Balinese culture, lifestyle and cooking.
The family looked after us like royalty. It was thoroughly enjoyable.

Best food in Bali!. We were pick up on time and taken to the local market. Our guide spoke excellent English and had so much knowledge. We than travelled back to their compound and learnt over 6 dishes, all traditional, all delicious! The tour went from 8-3pm, perfect time for a feast with great company. Highly recommended!!

Incredible, more than just a cooking class. We spent our day with the Lobong family today. After reading the reviews we were expecting a great experience, but this blew us away. They picked us up from our hotel right on time, and took us to a local market so we could see where locals bought their food. Sang De (our guide) explained a lot of the food to us and let us try a local fruit which was interesting. We then went back to their family 'compound' which is where all Balinese people live. It was really great to see inside their home to understand the Balinese culture. De Wa then guided us through making a full 3 course traditional Balinese meal. Everyone was involved in making every step, with all 8 of us making the meal together. We then got taken to their family shrine and Sang De explained all about the offering process while his mother did the offering for the meal we had created. Very, very interesting. The meal itself was absolutely amazing, and Sang De's information about Balinese tradition and De Wa's knowledge of traditional food was so amazing. This is the best thing we have done in Bali so far, can not recommend it highly enough. Thank you to the Lobong family for making it so special!

Great experience. This is more than just a cooking class. After pick-up from the hotel we went to a local market were we were introduced to the main ingredients for the menu we were about to cook. We got to smell and taste a lot and hear more about the Balinese cooking traditions. After this we got taken to the family compound where we learned more about Bali family life and how these compounds are set up. And then it was time to cook. Although we did a lot of the chopping and cooking ourselves, there were always 2-3 staff members around to help out and make sure we got it right. as mentioned by another reviewer, it was all very well organized. While the staff finished and plates our dishes, we got to join in a ceremony at the family temple. Again, everything was explained to us and then the ritual was performed. After that it was finally time to fig in and taste the sate, nasi, soup and salad we helped prepare. It was absolutely delicious! I'm very glad we took the time to participate, it was definitely one of the highlights of our trip.Also, if you can't handle spicy food, please don't feel discouraged and do take part in the class. They will take it into account and ensure the food is not too spicy. They also cater for those who have food allergies.

Great value for money and a great meal at the end of it!. I was picked up by the tour lead and we were taken to the market where Balinese spices and the offerings you see everywhere were explained to us which was just fascinating. After this we were taken to the compound where Balinese family life was explained and they gave us a hot drink and banana fritter. Then the cooking began! This was so much fun! Once again a lot of explanations as to why things were done and that timing was very important in Balinese cooking. There was the rice, the chicken soup, the chicken satay, the pancakes filled with coconut and palm sugar and the most important bit – the peanut sauce! After a few hours we were given 10 mins to ourselves and when we returned they had set out the food in huge plates and we witnessed offerings being made in the temple. After this we were sat down, offered Bintang or soft drinks and the food was brought out to us all plated up and oh my! It was lovely! At the end of the meal they brought out a small gift for us all and also a recipe booklet so we could recreate the dish which includes alternatives in case we couldn’t find ingredients.It was great day and I found I got a lot out of it from the cultural aspects to the traditional Balinese cooking spices used and great value for money.

Amazing experience. This cooking course was definitely the highlight of our trip to Bali. We learnt so much from Sang De, our Tour Leader. Not only about the food but also about the culture and Balinese family life. We cooked so may different dishes and got to eat an absolute feast. It is definitely worth the money and was a most enjoyable experience.

Great cooking class and day's outing. We booked the day before and received email confirmation 10 minutes after we booked. The staff were very prompt picking us up from our hotel. We have done cooking courses in other Asian countries and found this one to be well run, very worthwhile, good value for money and enjoyable. We had 10 people in our class which seemed like a good number. You didn't get a chance to prepare every step of each meal however lots of opportunity to observe. I think we would easily be able to replicate most of the dishes at home with the menus given. Chef Dewa has worked in 5 star Balinese resorts for many years as well as in Australia so has a good gage of how to translate this into Western home cooking. The food was delicious! The market tour was not too extreme- suitable for families. People with mobility impairments should be aware of stairs in the market and steep stairs to access the family compound. The information on Indonesian cultural background provided by Sang De was very interesting, I learnt many new things on my 4th trip to Indonesia. 5 stars to staff for friendly, welcoming and informative service.

Great value and experience. Made and his family were fabulous hosts. We leant a lot about Balinese spices and the trip to the market was wonderful although very challenging for my young nieces who weren't used to Bali smells. The cooking itself was fun and very ' hands on'. The cultural aspects of this cooking class provided an informative insight into Balinese family life. We had a great morning of cooking and eating. Charming people aground.

Fun and delicious. My daughter and I had a great time at this class. It was clearly well thought out judging from the little details- prompt pickup, cold towels after our market tour, cold drinks halfway through the class, nicely printed recipe books. The family compound is really lovely, as is the class space. There is plenty of kitchen help whisking dishes away and helping with the cooking, so it's light on the actual prep work and cooking time- you don't do all the steps of every recipe yourself, but you see most of the steps and everything is explained well. The lunch we made was delicious, so fresh and full of flavor. I thought it was a great value, too.

Fantastic for Foodies. When you want to taste the real Bali and its food try this unique experience. We where with a group of 7 and payed a little more to keep it private which I would recommend highly. Sang De picked us up from the villa and guided us through a local market just outside Ubud, no tourist and handicraft stalls!! After all the explanations we went to his family compound and where welcomed by Dewa the Chef and his brother in law. With good instructions and constant supervision we made a wonderful meal together. Before eating Sang De explained the way of Balinese offerings, carried out by his mother at the family Temple, to please the Gods and bless the food. Thereafter we had our enjoyable meal and received a cooking booklet for the next time. A great experience!!

Fabulous experience. Our group of 3 adults and 3 17/18 year teenagers all really enjoyed this experience. The morning market tour was good, we were the only tourists in sight.......Sunday gave a terrific explanation of Balinese culture and traditions and showed us around his family compound, and the cooking with his brother in law was fun and delicious! An excellent way to have fun and learn more about Bali.

Amazing day!. Right from being picked up in the morning we were right looked after, our driver that grabbed us from our villa was so friendly and informative about the area, our guide (Sunday) who took us through the local market was great, explained all of the ingredients and the Balinese culture In great detail and great English. The chef at the beautiful family compound explained each dish in great detail from technique to presentation. For a beginner cook like myself, it was easy to follow along, and the end result, our lunch meal was amazing and quite rewarding. Me and my girlfriend had an amazing time I highly recommend this class to anyone visiting ubud. Thanks to everyone involved!!

Thank you Sang De and Dewa!. this morning we had a great time at the market and in the family compound with our guide, Sang De. He took us to a local market, where we were the only tourists. This made the experience feel very authentic. He showed us his family compound when we got back from the market, which is very beautiful and well kept. We did not realize this was such a major part of the package, but were pleasantly surprised! Sang De does well to transfer his love for his culture and customs to his clients. Our chef for the day was Dewa. He is a very passionate teacher and we had a lot of fun preparing the food. He was very thorough in his explanation yet very encouraging too!(I am a beginner cook hehe). And a bonus - we got a parting gift as well. A recipe book of the dishes we did included! All in all, a cooking class with a real Balinese experience to it! Can't recommend enough :)

Lives up to its 5 stars reviews!! Service and product exceed expectations. Had lots of expectations from this class after I read the good reviews. It is really what it is. Despite the many classes the family had conducted, the guide Sang De and chef Dewa had consistently shown passion in doing what they loved. The culture of bali, the persistence in using organic ingredients and their incredible service mindset. Little details we looked into, cold towel after our traditional market tour. Will not write up on the details of the class as many had already given many detailed accounts.Definitely a must go if you are at bali.Thank you Sang de, Dewa and family for an unforgettable and enriching experience at lobong culinary experience.

The only way to learn!. Sure, anyone can buy a book about Balinese cooking, but why not learn from the masters!? I personally learn by doing much more than by reading--so I really absorbed and understand and appreciate what is involved in preparing Balinese cuisine. It really is a whole cultural experience and was with every minute and every penny. I have already returned home and bought ingredients to try flying solo, wish me luck!

Not only a cooking class but a cultural experience. I took a cooking class here after reading both the reviews and an article on Ubud cooking classes. An amazing day. This is a very slick, professional operation that still makes you feel part of the family. From pickup to dropoff, the market tour and the cooking class itself, you were immersed in the wonderful Balinese culture. The dishes were fairly simple but they concentrate on traditional family Balinese dishes. The key differential here is how they explain not only the cultural significance of the food, but also how traditional Balinese family compounds operate, which includes the giving of offerings to the family shrine of portions of the food cooked, before you partake. The whole family are involved and it is this involvement that makes this more than just a cooking class.

Definitely the best cooking class in Bali. My husband and I had the most wonderful time at Lobong Cooking Class. Truly an exceptional experience. I've been to three other cooking classes in the Ubud area over the last 10 years and this is the best by far. The local market visit is amazing. You get to truly experience the life of a local Balinese who shops at the market from buying produce, poultry, pigs, spices, tobacco and even clothing and kitchen tools. Definitely out of the norm than going to the touristy Ubud market.The compound of Sange De's family is so inviting and beautiful. We felt at home and relaxed. They do a great job with the setup of cooking instruction as well as the traditions and understanding of the family compound.The food was so delicious, the best we've eaten on our trip. I love Balinese food and learn something new each time I take a class. Dewa is a trained chef and explains everything and answers any question you have. The staff is very accommodating as well. Offering water, coffee, jamu. A must do in Bali!!! So worth it.

The best thing you can do in Ubud.. The family who run this school are so very lovely. They take you to their local market and guide you through the different stalls telling you about all the different vegetables and fruit. Then, when they take you back to their family compound, you are greeted with coffee and traditional morning tea.They love telling you about how their family and the way the compound works. Then you start cooking. You are guided every step of the way. You don't have to go above your comfort level. Watching how they cook will make you appreciate your next meal from the local asian take away. I can't recommend this experience highly enough. Would definitely do this again.

Fantastic day out. Our day started with a friendly driver collecting us from our hotel, he took the scenic route to our destination and the scenery is just beautiful. We then had a very informative tour of a local Ubud market, and this is where the locals buy their produce, straight from the grower. After a refreshing cool drink we were than taken to the Lobong family compound which was extremely well set up and accommodated the cooking school. We met some more family members, and got down to business, this is a very hands on cooking class which enhanced the experience. Once we had cooked everything we then observed a blessing in the family temple. Everything we cooked was then served to us for lunch and it was delicious. What a great day, excellent value for money, highly recommend it!

Much more than cooking!. This is a very slick operation. From being picked up at your hotel, you are given a friendly, professional and informative experience. Ok, the cooking isn't gourmet, but that is not the issue here. You get insight into the spicing of Balinese dishes and the chance to make and eat them. Alongside this, the charming hosts give you information on Balinese culture, family life and traditions, in a relaxed and informative way. This is a great way of spending some of your time in Ubud and I cannot recommend it highly enough. A great experience!

Small group, big fun!. This day of cooking is absolutely fabulous! We started early in the morning with a visit to a real indonesion market (no tourists, but us) with a lot of explanations about the ingredients and life in indonesia. Then we went to the family compound and were welcomed with a balinesiab coffee of tea with banana fritters. The cooking was so much fun, especially with the three sisters from Australia. In total we were with seven, which was actually just good. Lots of fun and personal attention by the chef and family.The taste was absolutely fabulicious!We can absolutely recommend this cooking school!!!Thanks once again Sunday and other members of the team!

Great day! ..but should be more spicy!!. I recommend to every food lover who comes to Ubud to do a cooking class! And the Lobong cooking class was just excellent! - they are very efficient and accomodating to make the reservation via mails- you won't just learn about food: throughout the whole day they'll explain to you all about their culture and traditions. Bali is extremely rich culturally speaking, and it's fascinating to be in a familial house and receive explanations from Sang Made, who manages to make it accessible to all (great orator!).- but you still learn a lot about food!! The day begins with a visit to the market, where Sang Made explains all the basic ingredients, how to chose them, etc. Great!!The only two comments I have are: - the food we prepared was not very spicy - which is the way you eat it in the streets and markets of Ubud. I don't mean that everything should be very spicy, but everything was mild, even the dishes that are supposed to be spicy... When I asked why, I was told that as it's a class for foreigners, who usually don't like when it's spicy, they make it mild. To me it was a pitty: you come to learn how to make the food as it is made in Bali, and if it's too spicy, either you ask beforehand to make it less strong or you decide to spice it less once you do it back home. But they shouldn't decide for you.- when we were preparing the food, the person that was showing us the techniques was not always keen to answer our questions. Too bad, because we had tons of questions to be able to cook well back home, and everytime we had the feeling to annoy him.But in general, the day is perfectly planned. With a lot of little attentions that are very pleasant. I highly recommend the Lobong cooking class!

Amazing cooking class. My husband and I attended the Lobong cooking class today. It was a wonderful experience.You not only learn how to cook beautiful food you also learn about the culture.We would highly recommend to everyone.

So educational and so tasty. The Lobong cooking class wasn't just a cooking class, it was a complete cultural experience. Our amazing guide, a member of the family who's home we were invited to cook at, was so educational in his explaining his family culture and living style. 22 people live in the home we visited. The chef who guided us thru our cooking experience had great English as did our guide, and also explained the cooking process with great detail. It was an insight going to a local market and learning all about the food and spices. An experience I will never forget. I got to learn so much more about the people of Bali, an Island I love to visit.

Excellent experience. This is the second cooking class we have done in Bali this trip, this one was the best by far. Sang De and his brother in law, Dewa are outstanding hosts, providing more than just cooking information. The trip to the market with Sang De was very informative and his explanation of life in the family compound when we arrived was really enlightening.The compound is beautiful, the kitchen and dining areas well laid out, clean and a fantastic experience to cook outside (different to our bbq's). Dewa's experience as a chef really enhances the cooking experience and the food we cooked was delicious. It is a fun day for cooks and non cooks alike. My husband doesn't do much cooking like this but he really enjoyed it and was motivated to come home and try cooking the recipes himself. I would highly recommend this experience.

Cooking school & eating the rewards. My husband does NOT cook...he donned apron, chopped, stirred, with a visit to a local market our host was amazing, informative, welcome drink and snack at the hosts home followed by cooking soup, chicken curry, salads 'real' satay & sauce it was a day I will treasure, with my menus from there I can recreate at home

Absolutely amazing!. I went and did this class today and it was the best thing I have done on my bali trip so far. Wonderful insight into the balinese traditions. The cooking class is all done using fresh ingredients from scratch and you do all the cooking. A very hands on experience. Really enjoyed the whole day! Thankyou to my amazing hosts☺

excellent day out!. This is a great way to learn not only about balinese cooking techniques and their different foods but also to understand balinese culture. We thoroughly enjoyed our day and would definitely recommend it to others. The food at the end tasted amazing and we now have a recipe book to practice the dishes at home!

Not to be missed. After reviewing cooking classes on Trip Advisor, we elected to go with Lobong. It was everything and more than expected. Prompt pick up, fascinating trip to the local market learning, smelling and tasting so many different things. (Snake fruit was something I'd never knew about: how to peel or taste.) Our guide Sang De was well-spoken, gregarious, knowledgeable and engaged all with questions seeking how much the group knew about the culture, spices, fruits and all that we saw. Next up was to visit and experience their very lovely family compound with coffee/tea, fried bananas along with information about Balinese Hindu family homes that include a temple and fascinating architectural aspects. On to the cooking class where our chef, Dewa helped us learn and create the many courses of our meal. We chopped, ground peanuts, cooked and stirred. So many good memories of cooking, eating and enjoying the company of cooking classmates and our hosts; gift of recipes and coconut oil were a nice touch. This is a great experience and not to be missed!

Amazing cultural and food experience. My girlfriend and I came to ubud, bali to relax and primarily do yoga however, we also wanted to immerse ourselves In the Balinese culture and wanted to take a cooking class. Googled a few places and saw lobong cooking. Decided to go with them as they pick you up at your hotel and drop you back off.We got picked up promptly at 7:45a (make sure to eat a snack if you skip breakfast) and got to experience a local Balinese market, Payangang Market (not frequented by tourists). Our guide Sang De was great - very knowledgable about the history, food and culture. After the market Sang De invited us into his home where we got to experience cooking in a Balinese family compound. His brother was our chef (Dewa), and brought over 20 years of hotel chef experience. He was very funny and great teacher. All the food including the sauces we cooked were fresh, no MSG or pre-made ingredients and they also had options for vegetarians (I'm not a vegetarian, but there were a few in our group). We got to help prepare all the dishes we were going to eat, and the meal was delicious. We also received a parting gift (recipes from class + homemade coconut oil). Returned to our hotel around 3pm. This was definitely an unforgettable day, not only because of the amazing culinary experience, but also being immersed into authentic Balinese culture and family life.

A highlight of our trip to Bali. Very well organised, great communication which helped us organise transfers etc from our Kuta Hotel. Food was delicious - I enjoyed the market trip beforehand (my daughter not so much so as she found the 'live' animals a little distressing). An awesome way to take home and continue to enjoy a little bit of Bali with our newly found Balinese cooking skills.

Amazing Day. We were very impressed with the day, from beginning to end! Picked up promptly in the morning and taken to a market where the locals shop. Our guide explained many Balinese foods and how they are used in cooking. After the market we went to a beautiful compound and were served tea / coffee and yummy fried banana. I don't like banana at home but the banana the Balinese use in dessert is like custard, so make sure you try it!Then we started cooking. Everything is made from scratch - from roasting the peanuts to the curry paste. We cooked multiple courses and then sat down at a beautiful table to eat together. At the end we were given a recipe book and some coconut oil as a gift and driven back home.Definitely one of our favourite days in Bali..

Pray, Cook, Eat. My friend's pick for an event while in Bali, this was an unexpected delight. Not just a cooking class; a complete experience starting with a tour of a non-tourist Bali market where produce is bought with an informative explanaton of the choice of herbs etc through to a cultural discussion of family life in Bali to preparing the dishes on the menu - cooking - and finally dining in sumptuous surroundings on the meal we had prepared.Sang de was the family host extraordinaire preparing us with the whole cultural experience before handing us over to Chef Dewa whose culinary expertise lead us through the food preparation and cooking.As I said above, not just a cooking class but a complete Balinese culinary and cultural experience which is a must-do on any Bali holiday itinerary.

Best Activity in Bali. My wife and I wanted to try a cooking school even when we were in the uk so when we got to Ubud we researched this on TAand saw that LaBong seemed the best one.We were picked up on time by a driver from the company who took us to the market where we met the rest of the group.The tour of the market was amazing. Sang De the host taught us so much about fresh ingredients used in Balinese cooking and taught us how the local people shop and the delicacies on offer.We then drive to their family compound where we were offered tea or coffee with banana fritters and he explained family life, culture and traditions which were extremely fascinating. My wife and I both agreed we could listen to him speak all day because the knowledge he shared with us was incredible.We then began the cooking which was so much fun. We cooked six dishes in total and everything was taught and explained in full detail.After the cooking, we watched the family take part in their religious pre meal ceremony and make offerings to God before sitting down to eat the foods we helped prepare earlier.This is the perfect activity to do when in Ubud. By far the highlight of our trip and simply not to be missed.

Cooking and a whole lot more. My wife and I had a fantastic experience with Lobong. Not just a cookery class, but an insight into the sights and sounds of an Ubud family and their culture. From the tour of the market, to coffee at the family compound and of course the expert cookery class and delicious lunch that followed, this experience delivered on all accounts.Our group consisted of novice cooks (such as us) to restaurant owners and chefs; it appeared everyone learnt something and took new skills and knowledge away with them.I would say a must for any trip to Ubud and the area and great value for money.

Great day at Lobong. Highly recommend signing up.. This goes far beyond a cookery class. It's really an introduction to Balinese family life and culture done over an excellent cooking demonstration and finished off with a delicious meal. I highly recommend doing it while in Ubud. Learnt so much about the food at the markets, family life in a Balinese compound, the 1.5 hours it takes to cook rice! and so much else besides. Just do it!

Fantastic experience, highly recommended.. We booked into this course after reading its reviews and it lived up to expectation in every way. We were picked up from our homestay in ubud, for no additional cost, and taken to the local market. Here we were shown around by our guide who explained every detail of the market keeping it both interesting and fun. We then went back to his amazing family home where we were treated like royalty by the whole family who were so kind. The cooking course consisted of 4 dishes with lots of different elements and skills to learn and ended with a lovely meal in the beautiful gardens. My girlfriend and I have loved Bali and this was definitely one of the absolute highlights.

Wonderful introduction to Indonesian culture. Thoroughly reccomend this course as an insight into the real Balinese way of life.It is not just a cooking class but also an education into the customs/religion of the locals.Even our 15 & 11 year old i-Pod/Smartphone daughters found it interesting-high praise indeed!The trip to the market is a real eye opener into the non-tourist Bali,with lots of interesting facts revealed by our host "Sunday"(Definitely the wrong spelling) in his near perfect English.You then go back to the family compound where he explains the reasons behind the layout of the buildings/temples(each compound has its own temple)and you learn about the family way of life in Bali.Later you are honoured to enter the temple whilst the family Matriarch carries out a blessing,which is fascinating to witness first handYou are then handed over to sunday's brother Made who is the ChefThe cooking class itself is very enjoyable.All the ingredients are explained to you and you each take part in various stages of the food preperation/cooking.All in an amazing courtyard setting.There are several staff constantly bringing/removing ingredients/utensils,everything is extremely hygenic. Then the best bitYou get to feast on the fruits of your labour-DELICIOUS!If this is what we will be eating for the rest of the holiday i am in food heaven!Thank you Sunday(sorry about the spelling)Made and the rest of your family for a truly unforgettable experience

Awesome! Best activity we did in Ubud.. Through the class we gained a greater understanding of the labour required to place these dishes on the table, as well as the cultural place of food in the Balinese way of life. Our Lobong Culinary Experience was an excellent, enlightening day. Very highly recommended. Full review and photos at foodgoldcoast(dot)com(dot)au(slash)lobong

Wonderful activity!. This was so fun and the family that runs the school is extremely nice. You get to enter their home, have the daily worship at their home temple explained and see how they live as well as cook (chop, chop, chop) and eat the result. The trip to the market was wonderful and the explanation of the spices very clear.
Loved It. Really laid back day that is both informative on Balinese culture and cuisine. The food was great as well!

A true highlight. We (two couples) all considered this class one of the highlights of our Bali vacation. The market tour and information about Balinese families and home life was fascinating and enriching. The cooking was very hands on and the chef was obviously well-versed in various types of cuisines. We also oved the sweet mom demonstrating Balinese offerings before lunch and enjoyed eating a fabulous lunch and chatting with other travelers from Europe and Asia. Don't hesitate, just book this!

Very good day out. This was a great experience and we learnt a lot about the balinese culture. We visited a local market before going to a family compound where we were treated very well by the family. The cooking was fun, the food was excellent and we thoroughly enjoyed our day. My one small gripe would be that there are quite a few people (12 in our case) on the class. Although this isn't a lot, it does mean that you essentially cook a meal between all of you and a lot goes on behind the scenes to get things ready. I have to say that I didn't really do an awful lot of cooking which was what we really paid for. It was still a lot experience and I would recommend it although I think the class size is a lite big for the people who go there to cook.

Fabulous day on many levels.. My sister, Pip and I booked for the Lobong Cooking School and we both enjoyed every minute from the tour of the local markets where we learnt about the ingredients used in Balinese cooking to the sit down meal at the end of the session. Lobong Cooking School staff were exceptional and the ten persons in the group participated in the making of 5 dishes learning lots of techniques along the way. We were welcomed into the family compound and told of the history and religious ceremonies which are so important for the Balinese people. At the end we were each presented with a gift bag containing a recipe book of the dishes prepared and a bottle of pure coconut oil. Many thanks to all the members of the Lobong compound for welcoming us and making our visit so special. Jane Thomas

Delicious. Anybody who is searching for some old fashion Balinese culture should be participating in this cooking school! It was a marvelous day spent in a family compound cooking and eating. The entire activity ran seamlessly and the kitchen facilities were spotless. With a maximum of 12 students we all experienced a very hands on morning. If your time in Ubud is limited then put this class on top of your list you will be very well fed and learn a great deal about the traditional Bali which is thankfully a world away from Kuta, bars and nightclubs.

Great afternoon of cooking!. Felt welcome from the moment we walked in. Great people, warm staff and run very professionally. Interactive setting with other participants made a really interesting class even more fun! Highly recommended...

Highlight of my stay in Ubud . The family who run Lobong are very passionate not only about their food but about sharing all the cultural heritage of Bali. The visit to the market in the morning was enlightening and it was really nice to go somewhere outside of Ubud where locals come to shop rather than tourists. The cooking experience was really great fun and we learned all about the different technics used for steaming rice (80mins!!) and preparing the sambal olek and the peanut sauce etc... The menu is very extensive so make sure you don't have a big breakfast in the morning. It's worth it. Thanks a lot for this great authentic balinese experience.

A cooking and cultural experience I'll always remember.. This was a fantastic experience I will recommend to everybody that visit Ubud! The classes are no more than 10 -12 people and everybody get a chance to cook. A true Balinese culture and cooking experience. Thank you to Sang Made and his family. I cant say anything more that already have been said in all the other reviews!

5 star experience!. From the moment we were picked up, this proved to be a fantastic experience. We were lucky enough to get a place with only a days notice, and thank goodness we did! From the local market tour (a genuine local market!) to the introduction to the family compound - this cooking class taught us so much about the Balinese lifestyle and values - it was much more than just cooking! However, the cooking was the highlight - as someone who is a confident cook, I still learnt a lot of different things and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. But don't worry, less confident cooks were equally accommodated, and everyone was given a number of opportunities to be hands on throughout the lesson. Cannot wait to try out the chicken satay (sate) and peanut sauce at home! Thank you Sang de and family for welcoming us into your home and providing an experience we will never forget!

A true taste of Balinese cuisine and culture. Absolutely fantastic!!Began with a hotel transfer to a food market full of locals and no other westerners. Sang, our guide, was great and very informative. From here our group of around 12 were driven to the family compound (home) with cold water and towels in the cars. Here you are welcomed into the beautiful family home and given information about Balinese culture which is totally unique.For the cooking class you are handed over to other family members and you make a full meal completely from scratch. It is informative and fun and everyone gets really stuck in. And the results are absolutely delicious!! At the end of the experience you are given a recipe book so you can make the meals at home too.Overall the day is from around 8am to 3pm including hotel transfer. Honestly it was unforgettable, the family couldn't have done anything more to improve the day, make sure you book for a fantastic day in Bali.

Fantastic Culinary Experience. I booked the Lobong Cooking Class via the internet prior to arriving in Bali, Sande's communication via e-mail was first class with very quick confirmation of the class.Sande's picked us up at our hotel in Ubud and took us to the market on the other side of Ubud picking up other people on the way. The market visit was very informative with Sande explaining all the local produce that we would be using to make our lunch.On arrival at his family home we were given an explanation of the typical Balinese home and their culture. Following this we were introduced to Sande's brother in-law who hosted the cooking class. The class was fantastic and we thoroughly enjoyed the fantastic lunch that we had all prepared, the highlight was the chicken satay, the peanut sauce is to die for!!!!!! Once we were finished lunch, we were all given a recipe booklet with alternative ingredient suggestions, coconut oil and the contact e-mail details should we wish to contact if we have any further queries when we try the cooking at home.If you are going I to try a Balinese Cooking Class whilst you are in Bali I would definitely recommend you give this one a try, trust me you won't be disappointed.

The highlight of my Bali trip. Every disappointment is for a good,we tried getting accomodation to 2 other cooking class to no avail,but on our third attempt Lobong was availbale,and the Gods were on our side.Sang de(Sunday) picked up my daughters and I, and the moment we entered the vehicle he started to impart facts on balinese culture,we visited the market outside of Ubud no hasslingencountered and he gave us an isight into the diffrent ingredients we would be using in our cooking class along with other traditional balinese products,quite informative,we wer then taken to the family compound after a cold towel to cleanse our hand and a btl of water,beautifulfamily home,the restrooms were spotless,were given an insight into the Hindu cultures and customs prior to being turn over to his brother in law for our cooking adventure,and a wonderful experience it was,hands on and all our questions were answered in the event there were any,since he did explain everything we did in details.Once done we were all experinece'Sang de Mom dressing us in order to give blessing in the temple prior to digging in the deliciousmeal our hands made,along with complinmetary drinks.We were then given a gift of cocnut oil which I've been using since I returned home along with a recipe book of all the dishes we made.We were also accomodated with a ride back to where we staying..I for sure will definitely do this again with lobong on my next trip to Ubud,and would highly recommend anyone visitng this area to do themselve a favour and give yourself a extraordinary experinece with the Lobong family...A cultural experince of a lifetime..

Cultural experience with cooking included. Thank you Sande and your family for hosting us for a cooking class at your kompong. We booked our cooking class via the internet and they were very responsive and happy to accommodate our timetable. The day started with pickup and we went to a market outside of Ubud. No tourists around and Sande explained how the market worked. We met many of the people selling their products and it was very informative. We then went to Sande's beautiful family home for the cooking class. Everything was explained in detail and every question answered. We were shown around the kompong and the layout and family structure was explained to us. After our cooking class, which was very enjoyable and hands on, we participated in an offering with Sande's mother, with the whole process explained to us. After that we enjoyed the beatiful food we helped prepare. The chicken satay was a standout - delicious! We were offered complimentary drinks and could also have a beer (charged) if that was wanted. We were all given a gift of coconut oil and a recipe book, and dropped off at our accommodation afterwards. All the ingredients were of high quality and very clean, including the bathroom facilities. Wear comfortable shoes as you will be walking and standing a bit. Highly recommended!

Highlight of our time in Bali. This cooking class was superb from start to finish. It started with pick up from our hotel, taking us to the market where we met up with the rest of our tour group (there were 12 of us altogether which was a good number). We did a 30-40min tour of the market which was a local market so not touristy the back to the family compound for the rest of the experience. We spent the next few hours learning about Balinese culture and traditions, cooking and then eating a beautiful meal. The hygiene standards were high throughout - from the preparation of the food through to the toilets. Before we left we were given a small gift and a booklet with ingredients and instructions for each of the items we had cooked that day. Our car was waiting for us and took us back to the hotel. It was fantastic value for money.We would highly recommend this experience and would like to thank the family for welcoming us into their home. We have nothing negative to say about the day - It was the highlight of our stay in Bali.

Much more than cooking!. From the fantastic and hands on tour of the market, to the great explanation of key elements of Balinese cooking, they've seriously gone above and beyond to deliver this experience. I slashed my finger pretty good right in the beginning and they were so kind and helpful about it (sorry again for that, will be sure to work on my knife skills!) Honestly though I have absolutely no negatives to add. Fantastic experience, and I wish your family all the best!

Fantastic cooking experience. This was my second cooking class experience over the years I have been coming to Bali and Lobong Cooking Class was the best. The day started with pick up from hotel and then the drive through to Ubud. We met up with the rest of the class at the market and ventured through with explanations of different foods and spices etc. From the market we drove to the family compound and there began our cooking experience. A menu had been prepared of delicious foods all of which was to be consumed a la carte at the end of the "hands on" preparation of the food. The food was so delicious and something I have promised myself to tackle on my return home. Upon asking for a few extra recipes, these were emailed as requested. A great day and something I would recommend to travellers for something a little bit different to try on their holidays

Best Cooking Class and All Around Ubud Culture Experience. My husband and I took this cooking class on our honeymoon in November 2013. This was definitely one of the highlights. First we went to a local market where we saw where the locals actually purchased their ingredients and learned of all the different ingredients that go into balinese cooking. Then we were taken to the family compound where we were welcomed into their home, learned about family culture in ubud and then began the cooking class. We also learned more about the offerings in balinese culture and experienced it first hand in the temple in their compound. It was by far the best cooking school experience I have encountered and the food was absolutely delicious - we hope to actually be able to recreate it at home one day. I highly recommend this.

Highlight of my Ubud trip. Partaking in a cooking class during my Bali trip was on the top of my list. Found this one through trip advisor and it was amazing! I didn't really have any expectations leading up to the class other than walking through the market and cooking some tasty food. The class ended up being so much more than that with in-depth explanations throughout the local's market and learning about Balinese culture at the family's compound. The hosts are friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. And the food is so delicious!

Great experience and delicious food. Bali cooking school reviewI've been to Bali a few times and never done a cooking class. I now wish I'd done this on my first trip. The experience is an enlightening and warm introduction to Balinese cooking and culture. I feel privileged to have gained a small insight into some local traditions.Sang De was friendly, helpful and informative.
