Although I have been to Bali many times this is the first time I have undertaken this activity and I was certainly not disappointed by the level of service, the attention to detail and the final outcome of the class which was a delicious Balinese meal that was prepared by the seven participants in the class and consumed in the traditional bungalow of this delightful family. The thought that has gone into every aspect of the experience is a credit to Sang De and his family. The setting was intimate, spotlessly clean and we were all treated so respectfully by our hosts that you felt it was an honour to be invited into their home. Once again I am overwhelmed by the humility and the humanity of the Balinese people.

I am now an amazing cook!. Our day started with a nice tour of the market place with Sangde. He's quite the celebrity among the local market vendors. He was full of interesting Indonesian and Balinesian culture and history. Then we met up with Dewa, the chef. He's high spirited and just down right fun to be around. We got pretty of hands on personal time and I'm quite confident that I can cook many of the dishes he showed us. We then got to enjoy the fruits of our labor....and it was delicious.All I can say is..."this is a must do." It was definitely one of my most enjoyable experiences in Bali.

Not to be missed!!!!. Absolutely fantastic experience, Sang De met us at hotel, trip to market absolut eye-opener and a lot of fun, learning about local customs and the various spices and their uses. The cooking facilities were very professional and extremely clean. Great to see hygiene is a priority.Cooking instructions were clear and easy to follow. Chef Dewa great fun and enthusiastic. Seeing and learning about local cooking methods was amazing! The added bonus of the cooking class is seeing and hearing first hand how Balinese people live, thanks to Sang De's generous hospitality. Thank you so much guys!!! (PS we cooked the peanut sauce already here back home!!!)

Absolutely fantastic. From the time we first contacted lobong the experience was nothing but friendly and professional. Our group of six and 5 others including 2 children. The family made it very easy to all work together. Picked up at hotel and dropped back. The visit to the local market was a real experience and set up the day very well. The highlight of our 9 days in bali

More than just a cooking class!. What a fantastic day!! The market tour was excellent and a bit of an eye opener being that it was a local market for local people. After the market we were taken to the family compound and had explained to us how the family all lived together in the one compound. The cooking experience was very hands on - we were involved in every step of the process and were given lots of explanation. The menu was fabulous and the hosts very welcoming of us. They were eager to answer our questions about how they lived and shared with us their culture as well their home. The food we cooked was pretty amazing (even if we say so ourselves). Our favourite dishes were the peanut satay sauce and the tuna salad but pretty much everything was deliscious! Very informative and learned more about the culture of Balinese people in this one morning than I have the last 15 times I have been to Bali. We left with a recipe book with receipes for everything we cooked and also they welcome questions via their website. Definitely worth a visit! We will be back!!

Our best meal in Bali. This was a terrific experience. Lots of fun, educational, and great food, too!Lobong was the only cooking class we took in Bali, and it was great. Would recommend to anyone. Fun for couples! Truly memorable and one of the best days we had in a month of travel throughout India and south Asia.

Awesome people! Best cooking class I've done in Bali!!!!. Amazing day with the Lobong family. Toured a traditional market with Sag De, our guide who speaks perfect English. Cooked up a feast with the best set up in the family compound of the Lobong family. Traditional feasts and ceremonies, all explained beautifully by guide. Best activity of my trip. Thank you again!

Best Bali experience. This was the highlight of my trip to Bali. The staff was incredibly friendly and hospitable. I was given a wonderful market tour followed by a good explanation of Balinese family life and customs. Next came the cooking class where we made 9 wonderful dishes. My husband said it was the best satay sauce he ever had and he has eaten a lot of satay! I would recommend this class to anybody visiting Bali. I did a cooking class in Guatemala last year and this was so much better!!! Plus after the class we had do much delicious food to eat! I can't wait to make some of the dishes at home!!!

Best thing we did in Bali. The market tour was wonderful. Their home is beautiful. The discussion about customs of Bali was spot on on depth and breadth. The family is incredibly friendly. Most importantly the food was the best we had in Bali. Even my non-cooking/non-foodie partner loved it. Can't recommend them enough.

Wonderful morning spent with these guys. Really nice staff, even took care of our baby so we could fully participate. Amazing food, fun tour of a local market, good explanation of traditions and background, highly recommended.

A must do for anyone who loves shopping, cooking, culture and GREAT food. Starting at the markets, it was so wonderful to see it from the perspective of a local. Then we returned to the compound for amazing coffee and to learn about the customs of the traditional Balinese household. We cooked everything from scratch and somehow us novices created the best tasting food of my trip so far. We left with the goodie bag of recipes and a little treat, not to mention very full tummies!! If you want to try a cooking class while in Bali, this is the one to try!!

An authentic & delightful Balinese experience. This is a Bali must do for anyone of all ages. The energy & passion the team at Lobong provided was superb. We cooked under the instructions of a 5 star chef, and made dishes from scratch & did not use a drop of commercially produced sauce. The food delivered a perfect balance of so many flavours. It wasn't only a cooking class, it was a culturally educational & enlightening experience.

Great experience and great people. Very fun time getting to learn about Balinese cooking with this family. They take you to the market in the morning, where you can see where the locals come for their ingredients. Seng De gives an explanation of each ingredient before taking you to his house to learn to cook from his brother. The tour includes step by step instructions for the food prep and even an explanation of balinese customs for food offerings to the Gods. Getting to go inside the family temple and watch their mother perform the offerings was very special. I also really thought the food tasted azmazing, but then again, I did help cook it! I highly recommend this to anyone visiting the area!

Excellent cooking experience in Bali. The Lobong cooking class was a wonderful experience for me and my husband. From the very start of the day: at pick up time from our accommodation; to the local market; learning about the family compound; their way of life; the garden where herbs and ingredients are grown; and the giving of an offering before lunch was extraordinary. My husband, who does not cook, commented at the end of the course that he was surprised by the flavours that he could create when shown how to put different foods together. This response is a reflection of Wyan’s patience and guidance that he demonstrates throughout the class. We also found the class was well organised and as we were the only two participants this gave us a greater hands on experience. The menu for the day consisted of a large range of dishes which, with the take home book of recipes and coconut oil, we will replicate at home. We would like to sincerely thank Sang De and Wyan and all the other people helping on the day for providing us a very enjoyable experience; one that we would be happy to repeat and to recommend to others.

Learn about Bali culture whilst having great fun. Highly recommended.. This is the second time we have done this (previously sept 2011) And will not be the last. This time, together with friends, we did the afternoon tour. This is different from the morning in that instead of a visit to the market , Sang Made takes you on a short trek into the Ayung valley. This requires walking to /from the valley floor via steep steps but the effort is well worth it. The views are spectacular and the walk through the paddy fields interesting particularly enhanced by the insights provided. After the walk there is a chance to cool down whilst being provided with a full explanation of the compound and its workings. Then the cooking which is great fun even for non chefs (which were a majority in our group!). The menu is fantastic and the end result one of the best meals we had in Bali with the added satisfaction of our contribution to it. The whole experience is fantastic and Sang Made and his team (including his mother who makes the compound offerings) ensure it is an unforgettable few hours that gives you a great insight into Balinese life. We will definitely be returning!

Top Quality and Continuity. This is the second time that I attend the Lobong Cooking Class.I was there a couple of months ago on my own and now again together with my wife.Everything was organzed in a highly professional way and one feels the strongdedication and commitment of Sang Made and his crew. My wife was very muchimpressed and so was I . I know that it is not easy to deliver top quality and service over a long period of time. You are not only learning about the Balinese way ofcooking, here you are also learning what Bali is all about.Horst , Switzerland

First class activity!!!. The Lobong Cooking Class was the activity we liked most during our stay on Bali. Very friendly welcome by the family. First we went to a local market, where no other tourists come. After that, the cooking class started in the beautiful outdoor kitchen in the garden of the family. Since we were only 3, we were given very good explanations. And the result? ... definitely the best indonesian food we've had; although we've made it by ourselves!Just BOOK this activity.

Great food and cultural experience. What a lovely family business. We really enjoyed our experience. Unfortunately on the day of our experience the class was full (12 people) and with only one cooking stove, therefore, the amount of actual cooking we got to do was minimal. It was more like a cooking demonstration. Nevertheless the day was very well organised and we would recommend the experience.

Cooking traditional Balinese cuisine right there in a Balinese home!. A must do on your visit to Bali. Learn how to cook some delicious traditional dishes and then enjoy the feast you have just cooked amongst new friends made. Absolutely delightful experience.

Best authentic experience!!!. If you come to Bali and need 1 activity, this is it! This cooking class is how you will best experience the real Bali!You will start your day with a tour of a local market to look at all the spices and veggies that you will use in your cooking. You can even use that market trip to buy some fruits for yourself! Sang De is the person who tours you around and explains things to you. After the market, you will relax over a morning tea and snacks at the owner's home. That's where you realize that the Lobong Cooking Class is a family affair every every part of your experience is handled by the same family! You will get the most hands on experience with this class with a small teacher to student ratio. The day we took the class, it was 4 students to 1 teacher. Our class was taught by Dewa, who was very good at going at a good speed and making sure everyone got a chance to practice making the dishes. He focuses on the technique to make the food authentic balinese. He says that you can measure and read recipe book later so focus on the technique first. He taught us how to make 9 items and customized 2 items for me since i didn't eat red meat. He helped me make 2 fish dishes and sent me the recipes for it a few days later. On a side note, I brought my 6 months old baby on this excursion and thought that my husband and I would trade off during the class. Their family members ended up babysitting him the entire time so that we could enjoy ourselves. THey even offered to make him baby food too! We brought our own so they fed him what we had on us.

Wonderful experience. From the time we made our booking the day was perfect. Unlike other cooking class sites I looked at ours only had 5 people cooking and we got to-do lots of preparation and and learnt lots about the different ttechniques use in Balinese cooking. My husband who is in his own words isqa very basis cook was chopping and dicing with the best. He joined in and thoroughly enjoyed the day. The market visit is great to learn about the ingredients and also the way of life in a local market. Sang De was wonderful as was our chef, Dewa. No question was seen to be stupid and we came away with a new appreciation of fresh Balinese food and the time it takes to prepare. It may be little dearer but is well worth the money.

Just goes to prove!!. Yep, I took the advice of the 200 or so Tripadvisor reviewers and decided that 'my' Bali cooking school was going to be the Lobong Cooking Class. Just as the other reviewers have, I could add yet another five star review for this great day out, as it is indeed a great day, fantastic value for money and an attraction not to be missed. However, this time I'm going to say that with the honest opinions of the millions of Tripadvisor reviewers, you can find a great experience, whether it be an attraction or accommodation anywhere, anywhere in the world. So, today it's 'Go Lobong Cooking Class and Go Tripadvisor reviewers' and a great time was had by all!!

Highlight of the whole vacation!. I found this place via trip advisor. And there are no regrets for having gone through this. We started the day at a local market that does not get many tourists. The locals are very welcoming and we had a great time getting to know the various types of spices. Sang De, our host was knowledgeable and articulate, which made the whole experience all the more enjoyable. This was the whole package, where we not only get to learn how to cook, we got to learn about the Balinese culture. Dewa was our instructor and we thoroughly enjoyed the cooking. Dewa loves cooking and this passion is what is most memorable! The food which we prepared was heavenly and the class size is small, which gave us plenty of hands on experience. Highly recommended and my friends are going to hear about this for months!

Was fantastic!. We did the afternoon class and absolutely loved it. The people were so lovely, and the walk before dinner is a great way to build up an appetitie and see what's around the near by area. The class was small, and the family was so warm and welcoming and got everyone involved with the preparation and cooking within our group. My six year old was worried she wouldn't like the elephant tour organised for the next day (which she had been really loking foward to) because she thought that the cooking class wouldn't be fun but ended up having a fantastic time. She now doubted her ability to gague what would be fun or not!Definitely reccomend the class to people of all ages, you won't be disappointed.

Most fantastic experience. I signed my husband and I up for the cooking class at Lobong after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. One of the best decisions of my life! Lobong was chosen because of the hands on cooking that was mentioned by other reviewers. Before confirmation with Lobong, I made sure to double check that the class size would be small and there would be significant hands on practice. I was assured that class size would be kept to a maximum of 12 participants and lots of hands on cooking.On the day of our class, the driver picked us up punctually but we were about 10 mins late. So my apologies to other participants of the class. There was eight participants that day, including my husband and I. After we were picked up, we proceeded to the next pick up and with 4 participants in the car, we headed to Panyangan market, a market where only locals visit. We met up with the remaining participants and the market tour was headed by Sang de, who was fluent in English. In the market tour, we learnt quite a bit about the roots (eg ginger and turmeric) used in Balinese cooking and the local vegetables. The market tour was informative and I liked it a lot.Thereafter, we were brought to the site of the cooking class, which is the house of Sang de. The little details were very much appreciated. Eg, we were given cold towels and drinks after the market tour. When we reached the compound of Sang de's house, that's when the real interesting part kicks in. While seated with ginger tea, we were briefed on the Balinese culture, in terms of their accommodation and daily lifestyle. It was amazing to hear Sang de talk about the different parts of the compound and their uses and functions. The Balinese way of life is so very distinctive from most cultures and very very family-centric. Sang de mentioned about Balinese trying to strike a balance in everything they do, including their cooking. Then we were introduced to how coconut oil is made. Not a difficult process, but a lengthy one. Fresh coconut oil smells heavenly and I'm sure it made all the difference in the cooking.We were then handed over to the chef, Dewa, who taught us the correct way to hold a knife. I also learnt the right way of chopping (thought I already knew but turned out my technique was wrong). So we shared the chopping amongst the eight of us and that took about 25 mins or so to complete. We also cooked rice the Balinese way, which took 1 hour and 15 mins to do so. The rice that we ate was very fluffy.Our menu for lunch included chicken sate with peanut sauce, tuna salad, green papaya soup. All the food tasted fabulous and my favourite has to be the peanut sauce! Maybe it was because I was the one who fried the peanuts and my husband who cooked it, I thought the peanut sauce was one of the best I ever had, and I have had quite a bit of peanut sauce in my life. The peanut sauce was addictive!!! We are going to make that this weekend!The tuna salad was super yummy too. The tuna was very fresh and thick and I didn't know tuna could taste like that. Throughout the cooking, Dewa was keen to ensure that we remember the techniques more than the recipes since we were provided with the recipes at the end of the class. He said remembering the techniques is most important. Wise words indeed!The lunch we had was one of the best meal we had in Bali! It was so good I wanted to come back for another class. Sang de said their menu changes every 6 months but because the Balinese food does not have a wide variety, there is no extensive changes to the menu. And at the end of the session, we were given 100ml coconut oil and the recipe book. Both my husband and I enjoyed this class tremendously. It was the highlight of our trip! Not only did we pick up some cooking tips, we also gained an insight into the Balinese culture. I strongly recommend this cooking class. Not to be missed!

I loved it. The day starts with a trip to the market. The market we went to was truly out of any tourist area, so you really get to see a normal everyday market. It was noisy, busy, and full of colour and smells. A very interesting and unforgettable way to start, with a wonderful guide who explains the produce and where it is from. Then you go to his home 'compound' where you walk to the back part of it to a very clean commercial style but basic kitchen, there is a room off it with a great wood stove where rice is traditionally prepared and cooked. The teacher has had twenty years as a chef at a five star resort in bali and really knows how to teach. There was only 7 in total in the class which was a perfect size for learning, and one of the best things was the commitment and passion of the teacher. The setting is idyllic, and it was a pleasure to spend a few hours chopping up ingredients and learning how to prepare ultra fresh meals. Then you sit down and eat it. We had nine dishes and they were all delicious. You receive a small book of the recipes and some coconut oil to take home. I have already made one of the dishes back at home and really fell like I got a lot out of just one class.

Truely outstanding. Wow. We were the only people during the day of this outstanding day. The whole crew was ours. The market was amazing and we got to have a outstanding experience all to our selfs with our wonderful host. My camera didn't stop at the market. When we sat down to eat what we had help to cook it was the most amazing food and the best we had had in Bali. Once again the answered all my questions and I had a few about culture, local bush food and customs. Lobong Cooking Class Crew where brilliant. Highly recommended.

Great experience. From start to end it was a wonderful experience. Starting with the open market, the culture sharing, the visit of the community and then the cooking and the lunch. Everything was very well organized, the Chef was great, very patient and his family and friends were also very supporting and friendly. We had a blast ! A must do if you like cooking !

Fantastic experience. I had the most wonderful experience at the cooking class. They were very welcoming of my 2 year old daughter, who was with my nanny and I for the market visit. The local market was a great start to the day and seeing the fresh, local ingredients helped us appreciate what we were about to prepare.One nice touch was when at the start of the day they asked of any dietary requirements I informed them of my dislike of bananas so when we got to the compound and the others enjoyed a banana fritter they had made me a pancake that was delicious, it was much appreciated. The family compound was a pleasure to visit with the family welcoming us all. Learning about their way of life and giving an offering before lunch was a great experience. The cooking was a great mixture of hands on and observing and with only 4 people in the class you never felt lost in the crowd.The food was wonderful to enjoy for lunch and I have already made a couple of dishes back in Australia as they give you a book of recipes and coconut oil.

Brilliant. From the very start of the day when we were collected from our villa it was excellent. The program included a visit to the local market which was interesting and I learned so much more than I would have if I had been to the market on my own. The family compound where the cooking school was held was lovely and very well set up. The teachers were excellent and the class was well organised which gave us all a combination of hands on and shared learning. The menu for the day was excellent with a large range of dishes that we would be able to replicate at home. We had an experience of the ceremony of food preparation, temple offerings and the garden where herbs and ingredients are grown. The class size (12) was good. We enjoyed the meal that we had prepared for lunch and were given some coconut oil and a book of recipes to take home.

Excellent experience. This was a great experience for my wife and I. We were lucky the day we went in the evening there were no other people doing the class so we had a private experience. The host did an excellent job. We enjoyed a tour of the rice field. He even picked up this gigantic spider and let it crawl to his face while we watched (from a distance-hehe). We felt like we were close family friends when we were in their family compound. I highly recommend this cooking class and it was well worth every rupiah we spent! The food came put delicious. The instructing chef was very patient and descriptive. Highly recommend this!!!

A full day of info and activity finishing with a great meal!. An early start in a local food market where all the various ingredients of basic balinese recipes are purchased. On to a beautiful family compound for some tea and basic cultural background, then into the spacious outdoor kitchen for hands-on chopping, mixing and cooking. Fabulous history and culture primer, host Made posesses exceptional communication skills. Day ends with the meal prepared and all participants receive a little cookbook and bottle of coconut oil. Fantastic value for a wonderful day.

Small Groups. We decided to book with Lobong after reading some of the negative reviews from the other cooking classes that have up to 24 people and I am glad we did.It was just us and 2 others, almost like a personal lesson with you own chef.. I learned a lot of new techniques and was able to ask lots of questions about the Balinese dishes we were cooking and also other dishes that I cook at home. It starts with a visit to a market outside of Ubud where we were the only westerners. Then you return to the beautiful family compound where you visit the family temple, learn about Balinese Hindu culture followed cooking lesson and a delicious lunch. It was a very enjoyable, informative day with lovely hosts. It may cost a couple of dollars dearer than the competition but its worth every cent.

Add it to your itinerary. You won't regret your decision to do the Lobong Cooking School. This is a hands on, fun cooking school, even for those who think they can't cook. You will not only learn about balinese cooking but also about their culture and beliefs. Be ready to experience the most delicious meal in a beautiful setting.

Don't miss this experience!. I took a group to Ubud and we saw Lobong on-line, the reviews were great so we went. What a fabulous experience, it is just not a cooking class, you learn a lot about the Balinese culture. We started with a trip to the local market which was interesting to see all the native ingredients. We enjoyed learning about the cooking process and chopping away in the kitchen. The staff were all so kind, knowledgable and genuinely happy we were able to join them.The meal we made was fantastic! I could go on and on, this is my fourth trip to Bali and I have to say this is one of my best memories. Don't miss this experience!

Wonderful culinary, cultural,spiritual, scenic experience. Just do it!. Lobong cooking school is a must for those wishing for the one of the best scenery and cultural culinary experiences. Sang Made and his family welcome you into their home which is one of the cleanest and prettiest compounds Ive seen. You are fed wonderful food in a perfect atmosphere.

The best $40 I've spent. What a fantastic experience away from the hustle and bustle of Ubud. We were picked up from our Hotel and driven to the families local Market. Song Made was a superb guide explaining the local herbs and spices, joking with local market traders and answering all of our questions.At the family compound Dewa our chef and all the the family were so welcoming. This is not a watch the chef experience but a practical hands on class. I have cooked Balinese food many times but this will enhance my skills and knowledge beyond any expectation.I cannot recommend this experience enough. if you are only in Bali for a few days make the effort to go and experience the people, food and the customs at Lobong.

Incredible experience. This was like running into a friendly local, with excellent English, and having him say "I have a chef coming over tomorrow to teach some friends local cooking techniques. Why don't I pick you up at your hotel and we can go to the market and shop for ingredients, then go back to my house for the class and have lunch?". Of course we actually "ran into" him online and booked the class, but our whole experience was so warm. The trip to the market was wonderful, and Sang Made expained ingredients we would be using. Then he welcomed us into his home compound - a beautiful place - and explained how the family compound is laid out and how things work there. What a fantastic experience to be welcomed into a home, and get a glimpse of real Bali life! Then the cooking started. Everyone watched everything being made, with someone doing each step under the expert guidance of the accomplished chef. There were 6 in our class, so it was a great size for questions and sharing. Everything (including the rest room) was perfectly spotless and everything was done with excellent hygine standards. The offering ceremony was special to witness and another precious glimpse into the real Bali. Then the food we had prepared was served. It was absolutely fantastic and beautifully presented, and set a very high standard for the rest of our trip (which many restaurants didn't meet). I wish there was a rating of 6 for the experiences that go beyond excellent for learing about the place you are visiting and enjoying every second of it.

Cook Like a Local. Instead of eating poor imitations of Indonesian Food in restuarants, cook your own and bring home the recipes. Great fun, do it with a group of friends or family if possible, and eat your results at the end. Great way to spend a fun day

Every second was amazing. Wow. Where to start... Sang Made picked us up and took us to a local market to show us how Balinese people shop and also educated us on the ingredients... This was amazing. So colourful and I learned so much about culture from this trip.After is we were taken to Sang Made's family compound- which was beautiful and were shown around and treated to Pisano goring (banana fritters) and ginger tea while Sang Made explained how the Balinese live and the function of each section of the compound.We were then introduced to Sang Made's mother who showed us how she made the coconut oil, which smelled amazing- then the cooking began.Dewa and his team took us through all of the ingredients and the stages and gave us tips on how to improve technique- Dewa was right when he said the key to Balinese cooking is in the preparation, we have just made our first base Gede at home and it took an hour of prep but then the actual cooking is easy! His guidance was so valuable and my husband and I were lucky that we were the only members of the party that day so we could get his expert opinion on every aspect. There were a lot of dishes to prepare and we learned so much as we cooked... I am an avid cook at home so was really excited to get Dewa's expertise as I learned these new dishes.After we had finished the prep we were invited to make an offering the family compound's temple. This was really interesting as we had seen the offerings but had never had the meaning explained to us, it felt very apt that we could take part in this in a Balinese family home.Lastly we got to eat. The food was delicious and Dewa had presented our cooking beautifully. The recipes were delicious and I honestly think that the food was among the best we had in Bali and that is down to Dewa and Sang Made.I honestly could not recommend this enough, it was lovely to come into a family, learn how they live and cook food- they were so welcoming and warm. It was a real honour to be involved in the class. Sang Made's English is exceptionally good and we were always made to feel that no question was too trivial. If you could do one thing in Bali, do this. It was amazing.

Highlight of our Bali trip. Simple: this is a must do when you're visiting Bali! Starts with visiting a typical Balinese market which is really interesting to see. The cooking instructions where very clear and fun. All the facilities are very clean and recent. Very friendly and helpful staff!

Fun, enjoyable day learning about their culture and lots of cooking :-). Fantastic Memorable Day! Highlight of my entire holiday!Myself and my bf and our friends decided to do this as we're big foodies and going on the reviews on tripadvisor.It really lived up to expectations. We were collected from our resort and brought on tour of the markets and the rice fields then back to the couples home where we were met with a lovely welcome drink. The couple are very funny which make the day so enjoyable! Best part is you get to eat all the yummy food at the end.Definitely a must-thing-to-do when in Ubud! :-)

Fantastic Experience. Thank you to Sang De and Dewa for a wonderful experience. Not just a cooking class, the day was an introduction to the Balinese culture. Starting with a visit to the local market to learn all about the different foods and their uses, we then went to the family home to learn the art of Balinese cooking. Preparing 9 dishes in all, watching coconut oil being made, participating in a temple offering, and then getting to enjoy the fruits of our labours for lunch, completed the experience. The little gift at the end of the day was just the icing on the cake! Fantastic experience - I loved every minute.

A cooking experience to remember!. From start to finish our day with Sang De and his family was one to remember, every aspect was carried out in a friendly and professional manner. Beginning with a tour of the local market and then on to the family compound for our foray into Balinese cooking and culture, the dishes we prepared were simple and very tasty - Chef Dewar's passion for food made the day interesting and very enjoyable. I would recommend their class to all from beginner to experienced cook. Once we had cooked and eaten a delightful meal we were sent on our way with a gift and cookbook so that we can recreate our experience at home. Something that my family really enjoyed.

Much more than good cooking. Curious to learn about the Balinese way of life? Want to know where those big bold Balinese flavors come from? This cooking school experience is For you. Our day started with a trip to a local market, where I got the opportunity to try local snacks with help for translation from my host Sang Made. The market itself was not interesting at first glance, but our host was able to show many aspects of local life as he strolled us through the market.The class is hosted in the family compound which really enriched the experience. As we were explained the various parts of the beautiful compound, we gained perspective on the Balinese philosophy of life. In the midst of our hectic lives, it is refreshing to be reminded of the importance of family and being in harmony with nature. If what I'm writing is too vague, just go to this class and you'll know what I mean.Of course there's the cooking experience. Our chef instructor was a long time chef at a 5 star resort. Needless to say, our creations had those bold tastes that made you say Wow. There is considerable amount of cutting, chopping, and grinding. If you learn nothing else from the c

What an experience. Fantastic. Not only the trip to the local market, the cooking class and the delicious food, but the introduction to Balinese culture and a welcome to a real Balinese home. Sang De, Dewar and the whole crew make this a not to be missed experience! Thank you

Excellent. All I can say is excellent as well as the cookery class we learnt about the culture and customs of Bali, would recommend trying to book on a Wednesday as this is when the big market is on rather than the usual local market.

A highlight day!!!! Not to be missed. Our experience with the Lebong Cooking Class and the experience of interacting with the family who runs it was beyond wonderful. The communication from the very beginning was excellent. Propt service and fabulous information. From the moment we arrived at the market we were made to feel so welcome and the experience was absolutely authentic. The family compound was beautiful and again the experience throughout the day was super authentic. The cooking class was fabulous and the food outstanding. Again, presented in a professional but caring manner. We loved our time and would recommend it as a not to be missed day in Bali. A special thank you to the entire family for taking such wondeful care of us.

"A trip to foodies heaven". Our recent trip to Bali was made extra special by adding the Lobong Cooking School to our itinerary. My sister and 14 year old son joined me and we had an amazing time on our Balinese culinary journey. Our host Sang Made escorted us through a traditional Balinese market that was a kaleidoscope of colour with an array of exotic herbs, spices, fruits and vegetables. The outside market was a buzz of activity with merchants selling live ducks, chickens, pigs and clothing etc. On arrival at the family home (known as a family compound) we were greeted by our Master Chef, Dewa and commenced our class with great anticipation. The whole experience was fantastic and exceeded our expectations. It was a joint effort as we all shared in much of the time consuming preparation of chopping and grinding before the cooking began. What a gastronomique delight it was to prepare some truly tantalising authentic Balinese dishes. The chicken sate with sate sauce made lovingly and patiently from scratch was outstanding as was the tuna and fern tipped salad with chilli dressing and the broiled chicken in spicy coconut sauce. After a traditional blessing in the family temple we were seated to a sumptuous table filled with all the dishes we had prepared during the class. Our taste buds were alive and dancing to the contrasting flavours that were captured in each dish. During our stay we also learnt a great deal about the Balinese culture and way of life which helped to gain a better insight into the beautiful, kind and gentle people who live on this magical island. On our departure we were given a recipe book and a 100ml bottle of coconut cooking oil made by Sang Made's mum. We plan to use it when we treat our family to a Balinese buffet using our new found skills. Thank You Lobong Cooking School for a holiday highlight. No true "foodie" should miss this.

Great cooking class but dreadful recipe book. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed this cooking class experience, the best one we have done in Bali. HOWEVER, the recipe book we are all given to "cook at home" is extremely disappointing. The Base Gede doubles the amount of ginger required resulting in a bitter tasting paste, the Base Sate is obviously missing an ingredient (we added Kepas Manis), the Sate is listed as chicken in the index but pork in the recipe (a minor matter), the Fern Tips Salad omits to advise to cook the red beans and the Fish dish cooking method is impossible to understand.......there are a lot of mistakes both in ingredients and cooking method. After several disasters, we checked all the recipes on the internet and made many changes. So, a lovely day at the compound but a very disappointing recipe book. Sorry, but we were so excited to be cooking these dishes again and presenting them to our friends.....the result was a waste of time and money.

Great Cooking Class in Ubud. MY wife and I just returned from a 3 week trip to Bali and one of the highlights was the cooking class hosted by Sang Made and Dewa. The tour through the market prior to the class was an event in itself and most interesting. The class itself one of the best we have ever taken. The variety of dishes, preparation skills demonstrated and finally the wonderful lunch were all most outstanding. In additon to all this our tour of their compound, blessing ceremony and their warm hospitality surely made for a most wonderful experience. We are very much looking forward to preparing a similiar meal for our friends...to include letting them do some of the work.

A must for any food enthusiast. Did the cooking class today and was a pretty full on (7 hours!) but rewarding experience, as you got to enjoy the fruits of your labour (well, it wasn't actually too laborious as you shared the load/chopping). The day began with a market tour. Be prepared for a bit of an assault on the nostrils, but also an informative session from our guide. We were then brought to the family compound where the cooking class was held - very clean, tidy and great for photos. Provided a refreshing hot drink with snacks, and then made 9 dishes in total - loved the tuna salad and the sambal. The day was very hands on, the chefs were very helpful, and the food was restaurant-quality. The main message I got - Balinese food is all about patience and care. We also had a great group of people (10 of us) partaking who were full of questions and stories, so if you love food and cooking, you should definitely try this. Thanks to the team and will recommend to friends!

Culinary delights from the heart of the family. Sang Made and Dewa are the most wonderful hosts for what was a brilliant experience of Balinese culture. They put on a tour/cooking experience yesterday just for my wife and I as they were fully booked for the other two days we were able to do (very popular) and looked after us royally. Sang's huge depth of knowledge of culture, tradition and ingredients made a fascinating tour to the food and spice market out of town, followed by a warm welcome to his family's compound made us feel very special. Dewa's wonderful knowledge of all things culinary allowed even me to have a hand in some wonderful food. We will be trying all the recipes at home (much practice may be needed!)Thank you gentlemen for a wonderful day and if you ever come to the UK you are welcome to experience my cooking!!!

A memorable Experience. Despite the weather - pouring rain- our trip to the market and cooking class was a memorable and enjoyable day. We were picked up promptly in a comfortable bus, and welcomed warmly upon our arrival at the market. The visit to the local food market was informative and interesting. Once we arrived in Sang Made's home, the location of our cooking class, we were once again welcomed generously and warmly.Our teacher Dewar explained clearly what we were to expect from the class, the ingredients we were using and the meals we would be preparing, and we donned our aprons and began.The class was very hands on and questions were welcomed and encouraged. With only 12 participants, everyone got a chance to chop, crush, stir and taste! with 9 dishes to prepare the morning passed very quickly.After our food was prepared and cooked we were privileged to enter the family temple to witness part of the blessing ceremony before we sat down and enjoyed our delicious meal.A thank you to Sang Made and his family for sharing their home and traditions with us, and to Dewar and his team for teaching and helping us to prepare such a wonderful meal. We are looking forward to sharing what we have learned with friends - using our gift of home made coconut oil!Advise to all booking this class - don't plan to eat dinner!

lobong cooking class. Having done a number of other cooking classes in Bali we found this to be a wonderful experience. Highly efficient and friendly company to deal with and they gave us a fascinating insight into intimate Bali culture and day to day routine. Small group sizes made it all the better ensuring everyone had a chance to do everything. The meal at the end was divine......and we had cooked it!! 5 stars and many thanks from us for an amazing day. ....Sarah and Ted

This is not only a cooking class it is an eye-opener about Food & Culture. Yesterday , attending the Lobong Cooking Class I expierenced a day of highlights . I hv been in Bali many times but this event is something exceptionally.I am not much into cooking but the class was done in such a way that time flow by and at the end we had cooked together a wonderful and super tasting meal. However , before we could eat it, we had to follow the Balinese tradition and gave respect to the gods in the local house tempel. This brings me to the extraordnary part of this trip. Not did we learn all about the typical Bali food , fruits , spices , etc. but also a lot about the Balinese culture and customs. This is possible because the whole team belongs to one family and your class takes place at their compound which by the way is in top conditions. One last comment , the sanitary installations are excellent . I like to wish Sang Made and his family all the very best for the future and I am convinced that this will not be the last idea they have. Kind Regards Horst Kleinwechter , Basel , Switzerland (presently staying in Ubud)

Fantastic day at Lobong Cooking. My husband and I, along with 3 other friends, had a wonderful day at Lobong Cooking. The whole experience was so carefully and thoughtfully put together. As well as learning so much about aspects of preparing Balinese food, our "chef" was highly knowledgeable about general aspects of cooking and was able to answer any number of questions put to him. Our visit to an authentic village market was great, then onto their lovely compound for the course followed by a delicious banquet - which we had apparently made - unbelievable!! The friendly, kind and sincere care given to each participant was outstanding. As well we were given a little "show bag" with recipes and more! Don't want to spoil the surprise. Can't recommend this highly enough - just hope it doesn't change as it becomes more popular.

Do this course!. This was the highlight of my trip to Ubud. The course is incredibly professional, everyone from the drivers, to the teachers, to the serving staff was warm, friendly and couldn't do enough to make sure we enjoyed the lessons. The attention to detail was fantastic (eg cold flannels after the market tour) and the skills/recipes we learnt were marvellous.I was travelling alone so this was a wonderful chance to meet other people and learn a whole host of recipes (and then enjoy them afterwards). It was fabulous value for money and I'd recommend it in a heartbeat.

Fabulous authentic Balinese cooking class. My Husband and I have just returned from Bali, and thoroughly enjoyed the Lobong cooking class. We visited the local markets and saw an amazing variety of local produce and it was a vibrant and busy market with locals cooking lots of interesting cuisines. Then we went back to the family compound to start our class, we learnt all about the balinese family traditions and culture which was fabulous and the cooking class itself was terrific. I highly recommend this cooking school which was extremely well run and professional. My husband and I have done quite a few cooking classes including classes in Vietnam and Thailand and found Lobong cooking class to be one of the best.

#1 experience in Bali. Thank you Sang Made. We had such an amazing time at our class today. You were a stellar tour guide and we especially loved the market tour and seeing and smelling the ingredients before cooking. Dewa is such a calm and knowledgeable teacher. He clearly knows and loves his cooking. No doubt your new restaurant will be a success. Everyone thought it was the best food we ate all week, and even better because we cooked it! Definitely because of the fresh ingredients and 'technique'.Also many thanks to your mother and family for welcoming us into their home and the helpers who finished off all the grinding and washing up!! Many thanks and we will spread the word :) hope to see you and your family again soon.

A fantastic cultural experience. This was so much more than just a cooking class. We were collected from our hotel and taken to a local market where Sang Made introduced us to local Balinese produce. We were then welcomed into their family home and learnt a lot about Balinese culture and traditions. The cooking class was detailed and everybody was very helpful. We all had a chance to have a go. The menu was well thought out and the food fantastic. We got a little take home bag with the recipes and some coconut oil, which was such a sweet touch. The whole experience was awesome and I would highly recommend it and I will most definitely do again!!!

Great cooking and cultural experience. We Were picked up from our hotel and taken to their local market just out of ubud which was very interesting and most enjoyableWe then went to their family home( compound) a d learnt about their culture which was also very interestingNext came the cooking where we all participated and cooked the most amazing foodI highly recommend this experience and I will definitely go back

A fun and informative introduction to Balinese cooking. This was a great experience. We were picked up from our hotel at around 8.30- (our first morning in Ubud, in fact our first morning in Bali) and driven to an early morning local market away from the usual tourist area. Our host, Sang Made, showed, explained, let us sniff and touch the produce we were going to be using to cook our lunch. It was a very good introduction to the differences (and in some cases, similiarities) in our foods.After the market we were driven to Sang Made's family compound (a beautiful, serene space), welcomed by others in the family including Sang Made's mother and presented with ginger tea and fried banana snack. While imbibing, Sang Made explained some of his country's traditions and customs.From there, we moved to the kitchen area and proceeded to watch and take our turns at creating a delicious lunch menu under the guidance of Dewi. I loved the way Dewi helped us understand the processes and checked that we were following his instructions. Lots of fun - and wonderful aromas as the food changed from ingredients to delicious courses.We watched the offering made in the home shrine before sitting down to a convivial and enjoyable lunch with two other holidaying couples who were also in the class. We were presented with our own 100ml bottle of fresh coconut oil to take home to use - and help get that truly authentic Balinese flavour. Loved every minute of this experience. I'd go back again in a flash!

Wonderful Bali experience, fantastic cooking class. Our first stop was a local market where we were introduced to exotic and unusual produce by the wonderful Sang Made. He explained the ingredients we'd be using, showed us the difference between the produce we knew and what was grown in Bali and let us smell, touch and taste the unfamiliar items. It was a great way to start the day. We had tea and a snack at the family compound and Sang Made explained the Balinese family structure and customs - absolutely fascinating and he is a great speaker, who answered all our questions with wit and intelligence. Our chef, Dewi, was funny and engaging and we all got to try our hand at various processes including knife work, Balinese mortar and pestle, marinating, skewering and sauce making. The menu was exciting and varied and catered very well to the two vegetarians in the group. We made the offerings first then all sat down together for a wonderful meal and delicious dessert. This was one of the best cooking classes I've experienced in Asia and we had a really enjoyable day. Highly recommended!

A must do when in Bali. Much more than a cooking class! It really is an experience. The cooking experience is wonderful but what really impressed my husband and I was the way that Sang Made and the family really made us feel like we were guests in their lovely home. We felt like we got to see what Bali life is really like. We had a wonderful day and can easily say that we will definitely do it again when back in Bali.

Lobong is a culinary and cultural delite. Lobong cooking class has to be one of our favorite experiences in Bali. Returning for the second time , we found the chef had a totally new cooking menu to last year which was absolutely fantastic . From start to finish we cannot fault this brilliantly thought out and well executed cooking class.All the staff are super friendly and make you feel more than welcome .We can not wait to return on our next trip to Bali and look forward to trying there new restaurant when it opens.A serious must do when traveling to Bali .

Overall Balinese experience. What a truly amazing experience. I would do this trip over and over and over again. Not only do you have the hands on experience of making all the spice mixes, marinades and pastes before cooking the food. The family is incredibly welcoming from the moment you step into their compound and you are served with coffee or tea and banana fritters. You are looked after all day, from cold towels to refresh you to refreshing turmeric drinks while cooking as well as cold bottled water. The glimpse into traditional Balinese family life was interesting and educational. I can't wait to come back and do it again! My mum and I loved the ikan bakar sambal matah (pan seared fresh yellow fin tuna, lemongrass, chilli & kaffir lime). Money very well spent and for the cost of a meal in an Australian restaurant for a nine course feast.

This has been a highlight of my Bali holiday.. I'd never done a cooking class as part of a holiday before, however I was really impressed by Lobong. It wasn't just the professionalism of the team and the amazing food we cooked, it was the way our host invited us into his beautiful home to share his story. A real insight into domestic Balinese life. Thank you, Lobong.

More than a cooking class. I had booked a morning class a month before arriving in Ubud and was pleasantly surprised to learn that only my friend and I were signed up for that day. The driver suggested that we try the Trekking-Cooking course which is usually set in the afternoon but being only two in the class, he said it was possible to do it in the morning. I was a little concerned about the mid-day heat but went ahead with the trekking course anyway for a minimal additional fee.Actually, I'm glad to have done the trekking trip in the morning when the air was much cooler and with the clouds intermittently blocking the sun, it made for a rather special morning trek in the area where part of the Eat Pray Love movie was set. Our guide was quite knowledgeable of the local flora and fauna and we even happily found common words between Balinese-Bahasa and Filipino. It must be our shared Austronesian ancestry. My friend did not bring sneakers on this trip and thus wore his Havaianas which snapped on negotiating through mud. He thoroughly enjoyed the rest of the trek barefoot though and his opinion, was much better than wearing flipflops. The trek lasted about an hour.The cooking class immediately followed. What I appreciate about the class is that although Balinese cooking and Filipino cooking have many similarities, I learned new techniques from the able chef, especially their traditional way of cooking rice. In the Philippines, cooking rice for 1.5 hours is unheard of but I learned that such was the Balinese way. I surmise that the chef may have had some Western culinary training which he applied in class. Again, we found so many common words between Filipino and Balinese-Bahasa and even exchanged some cooking ideas.What probably set this cooking class apart was all the cultural stuff infused into it. They demonstrated their daily rituals, explained their beliefs, and shared bits and pieces about their way of life. This was much more than a cooking class.

We felt like special guests of a charming Balinese family. Priceless!. Our afternoon culinary Trek and cooking class with Lobong Cooking School leaves me struggling to describe in a few words what a privilege it was to do the river valley walk and then be welcomed into the family compound for a cooking class and wonderful meal.Sang Made led us down a path to the top of a deep river valley to begin our foodies trek. Immediately we were stunned by the beauty of the view. We would have been happy to have paid just to do this short trek down to the rice paddies and white water river.In fact our charming guide provided a wealth of information about both cultural activities happening nearby and the often edible plants and fruits that were always within easy reach. The climb back to the top via a very safe stairway was considerable but worth every sometimes gasping step.We were then welcomed into the lovely family compound for our cooking experience. The several hours we spent with this family were so much more than the excellent cooking instructions we were given by Dewa Jana (clearly a highly experienced chef with knowledge of both Asian and western food). Wisely his instructions and demonstrations focused on technique rather than ingredients. Recipe booklet provided later.Highlights of the evening were numerous and included donning sarongs to accompany the family matriarch as she laid offerings; explanations of family life; meeting other smiling dignified family members; natural fresh ingredients and "touring" the family compound.Finally once the 8 or 10 dishes and accompaniments were cooked Chef Jana beautifully plated our dinner which was than served to us by a delightful young "waitress".I suspect this will be the best meal we eat in Bali. Even a 5 star restaurant would be pressed to better the quality of our dinner. Overall a priceless experience which demanded respect and delighted our senses.

One of our best memories in Bali.... ... This cooking course was very well put together. We started in a very traditional, local market to see various ingredients. Then, went to a beautiful family compound (garden) for the cooking course. We learned how to make absolutely everything from scratch. The course ended with a multi-course meal of all the yummy things we had made that morning. Would do it again in a heartbeat!

Beyond expectation in every way. We were a group of 6 girls that went with the view of having a bit of fun while picking up a few cooking tips. We got so much more from it. Sang Made met us at the markets and we got to learn about all the produce we were going to cook and meet all the wonderful market vendors.We arrived at the compound where Sang Made's family live and the cooking classes were held and we were amazed at the beauty of it.We met Chef Dewi, who has been a chef in one of Bali's best 5 star restaurants. He was fantastic with his fluent English and easy explanations. The day was full of laughs. We learnt all about the Bali family traditions.A beautiful dining table was set up for us to eat our cooking, and to our amazement our cooking tasted fantastic. We were sent away with cooking books and a little gift.I had checked out trip advisor looking for a cooking class experience before we left, I know now we could not have picked a better class. It was a five star experience from the moment we arrived until the moment we left.

Will do this again, and again. Just what we wanted. Collected promptly in nice van with working a/c. Taken to seriously locals only market to look how they really shop and plenty of knowledge imparted and questions eagerly answered. This is a hands-on cooking course in a traditional compound. Many staff on hand and chef was experienced and very patient. My 11yo daughter cooks at home regularly so she was included and felt sufficiently useful. Be aware that when they offer you a beer with lunch that it will be added to your bill and is not included in the price. They charged fairly for the beer; this is just a note to remind you to bring extra funds. We bought vanilla, palm sugar and some spices for unbelievable prices, but be aware that if going onto Australia or NZ these will not be let in by customs. Happy to answer any questions anyone has, just message me.

Is it really 5 star??. In a word.....absolutely.Everything about the experience works - the booking was simple & flexible, the pick up was perfectly on time in a car with seatbelts (and a good driver) & then the course itself is great.Sang De our host took time to explain about the Balinese culture, tradition and lifestyle in a way that was both informative and easy to follow. We have been to Bali a few times now, and this was the best 'introduction' that we have ever had - we felt really welcome in their home.The cooking got us all involved & the dishes were all excellent, as was sitting down to eat at the end of the evening - with the team nearby if you needed anything, but not overbearing or intrusive.Thoroughly enjoyable evening, would recommend to anyone - you wont be disappointed,
Best experience in Bali!. What a fantastic evening! Very welcoming and culturally interesting. It was the best food experience we had in Bali.

Great food, great fun, learnt so much, and not just about food.. Fantastic cooking class conducted in the home of our hosts. My husband and I did an afternoon class, just the two of us. Was the best experience we had in Bali. By far the best food that we ate there.
Awesome!. Awesome experience. Very professional and informative. All the great reviews in this forum cover everything; therefore, all I can say is to make sure you take advantage of this experience.

If you choose this cooking tour you will no regret it!. Lobing cooking course was exceptional. I know that there are numerous other cooking classes but if you choose this one I assure you you will no regret it. It is not just a cooking class it is a cultural experience. We were lucky enough to do one of Lobong's new tours which was the Culinary walking tour (this was as a substitute to doing the market tour). The culinary walking tour was a huge highlight for me and my partner. Sang de (Our guide) knew this area like the back of us hand as this was his playground when he was growing up. He had a world of knowledge. This is now my fourth cooking class and this was definitely the  best. Mata (I hope this is his correct name) was our chef and he was fantastic. A great teacher who loves his job. The food was DELICIOUS! Some of the best food we have had in all of Asia. They did not skimp on ingredients either, we ate like Kings and Queens. The whole experience was very special, you are welcomed into their family compound and taught about Balinese traditions, lifestyle and culture. I would also not hesitate to bring along any male companions as my partner who is not a cook loved it, you couldn't not. Every details was well thought out, even down to the special gift and book of recipes that you get to take home with you. This  is the best way to experience a place and a culture.

Great Balinese cooking experience!. My friends and I loved spending time with Sang Made, his family and the rest of the Lobong Cooking team. We learned so much from our time at the market to touring the family compound and cooking many great Balinese dishes. They make sure that everyone plays a part in preparing the meal, so the entire experience is very hands-on. Highly recommended for those who want a mix of culture, cooking, and a good time with friends/family!

Best meal in Bali, great hosts, perfect presentation. We had the best time at Lobong cooking class. After looking at numerous reviews for various cooking classes, we realized that several factors are important: size of the class, location (home vs. cafe), and cost. Lobong limits its class size to 10, and we had a class of 6. There were plenty of things for each of us to do (though we weren't each making an individual meal- if that's what you expect). The chef was amazing and gave us instructions that were easy to understand- and more importantly- remember. The location also couldn't have been beat. The host family has a wonderful house, and the explanations of Balinese culture, the housing complex, etc. really contributed to our appreciation of the culture. Other cooking classes, many for a cheaper price, are located in warungs, or small restaurants, which I think would detract from the experience.The cost is roughly $40 USD, which we were hesitant about at first (other classes run as low as $20) but we think is more than worth it for what you get out of it. What it comes down to is- most anyone can run a cooking class. All you need is a kitchen and a recipe. Lobong manages to surpass all expectations with the presentation, the explanations, and the food. (the cook used to be a su chef and cooked for many celebrities.) If you are going to do a cooking class, you may as well do it right. Couldnt think of higher praises. Would highly recommend to any of my friends, and am going to send my parents when they come visit Bali.

Top-class cooking course. Sang De made us very welcome, took us thru the markets, then we went to his home compound to meet family, talk about his family unit and the reasons for the layout of the buildings and temple, had a lovely morning tea, then on to preparing the food. Dewa was a great teacher, but I would like to see more control over the participants. We had one person who kept butting in with suggestions, tips. Very annoying. But overall, a terrific course. Even our 25 yr old non-cooking son enjoyed it. Thank you from Bapa Cooch and family, Sang De.

Highly recommended!. We can't rate this experience highly enough. From the fascinating tour of the local market, to the wonderful hospitality of the Lobong family (especially Sang De), to the fun hands-on cooking, finishing with the amazing food for lunch. And great value for money. Book it now. You won't be disappointed.

Best cooking class in Bali!. Wonderful way to experience Balinese culture:Educational market tourWelcome into family compoundAmazing English speaking guide: 'Sunday'Hands on preparation of Balinese feast with 'Dewa' the world class chefComplementary recipe book and a special surpriseWould highly recommend to young and old!

What an Amazing Opportunity. There are numerous places in Ubud offering traditional Indonesian cooking classes. This is one of the top-rated options and now I see why. There is an opportunity to see real Balinese life as its being lived. The information at the market and then at the family compound was amazing. I appreciated the chance to slow down and learn about a different culture and how they live their lives. Everything about this experience was authentic, from the market with all it's interesting foods to the smells (not always pleasant but real) to the family compound and daily life. Nothing is glossed over or hidden, this is the way the Balinese have lived for many years. Yes the table is beautiful and the modern toilet is appreciated but you still see the simple kitchen, the delicious, fresh foods used for cooking, the pigs in the pen and the chickens walking through the yard. As a chef I was impressed by the quality of the meal from a simple stove, including the wood stove used to cook the rice and the matron of the house making fresh coconut milk and oil for cooking. I received a great education on the food, the lifestyle, the spirituality and the home of a Balinese family. What a great bargain for the price and a fabulous meal and parting gifts as well.

Not only had the best insight into Bali life, but cooked and ate the best food of our stay!. From start to finish the family puts on a welcoming, interesting, interactive and hugely insightful morning. Foodies and cooking beginners can both get a LOT out of this, there were no kids on our course but I am sure it would be good for them too. 100% recommended, the highlight of our stay in ubud.

Professional, fun, informative and hands on. We haven't done any other cooking classes here but here are the reasons we would recommend this one:1/ Morning market visit. This was a real clincher for us choosing this one in the first place, we love markets and seeing what people are selling and getting more information about the products than we could just walking around gawking.2/ not just a cooking class but a cultural class as well. Lots of information on lots of aspects of Balinese culture. Being in the family compound you are embedded in it from the offerings made after cooking to watching a priest conduct a ceremony 'cleansing" one of the family members who recently became a mother. This is the real clincher for why we don't think this class could be beaten.3/ Good facilities, good food, small groups (we only had 6 in total).4/ A professional chef who is a good communicator and helpful about things from knife skills to different techniques of cooking.5/ Professional handling all the way from booking to arriving back at our accommodation.6/ Friendly and knowledgeable hosts at all points of the tour.Thoroughly enjoyed it - thanks!

The best experience I had in Bali. Our host and the rest of the family were so kind and friendly, they made their best to make it a fantastic morning for us. I was staying in Ubud, and they picked me up from my hotel just on time. Then, we meet with the rest of our group (5 people in total) and our host Sang Made took us to the local market. It was a very nice tour explaining the different plants, vegetables, fruits used in the Balinese cooking. After we got home, we started cooking. It was an all-in-all class that we learned a lot about food, Balinese culture and family life, and of course the food we prepared at the end was amazing. I'd definitely recommend this cooking class to everyone.

Much more than just a cooking class. I honestly could not recommend this cooking class highly enough, not only was this an amazing cooking class but also a fantastic cultural insight. After promptly being picked up from my hotel, we were all taken to the local fresh produce markets and guided through the stalls and the produce that was for sale. After this Sang Made welcomed us into his family compound and explained the structure of his home. We then met our chef and it was full steam ahead from there!! Everyone was included in the process of cooking, with praise and encouragement being offered the whole way through. After all the cooking was complete we were taken into the family temple and Sang Made's mother made an offering for everyone in the class, Finally our creations were plated up for us in a three course meal and it was without a doubt the BEST food I have eaten in Bali!!

Ubud FAVOURITE!. So much more then a cooking class. Picked up at 8am from our villa, collected another couple and off we went to the local market. What an eye opener, im not going to go into too much detail as words cant really describe it! We were so welcomed and enjoyed every minute of our experience with Lobong Cooking, We cant wait to try their new class next time we are in Ubud! Thank you for welcoming us into your home. We have already made the peanut sauce at home :) YUM!!

Family fun. Efficient pick up and delivery from our villa was followed by a visit to the local markets, eye opening, before we were invited into the family compound for a n education on not only Balinese cuisine but also Balinese life. We took the kids and they too enjoyed the half day experience. The food is great and the friendly family atmosphere is a great taste of Bali life

Experience of a lifetime. My partner and I (avid food lovers and home chef's) went to the morning class. The markets were an assault on the senses. Amazing produce and an experience of the friendly locals of Ubud.The cooking class itself was informative on the traditional ways in preparing delicious Balinese food. I loved sitting down with the class to feast on the banquet we had all contributed to making. We both would highly recommend this experience. For about $35 AUD its amazing value for money.  J + T Qld, AUS

Best food in Bali!. My husband and I were lucky to get a private cooking class experience with them. So we had a lot of hands on experience and cooked all dishes ourselves.The food tasted amazing! Everything was so fresh (they killed the chicken the same morning) and tasted delicious. We stayed at the Four Seasons but the food at Lobong Cooking Class tasted much better than at the 5* hotel!

Fantastic Experience. An absolute "Must Do" - this family run cooking school held in their own compound is just fantastic. The tour of the market was really interesting particularly as it was not a tourist market so it showed real-life activity. Being part of the family and being able to ask questions about their life and customs was very rewarding and the actual cooking class was easy to understand and extremely well presented. The food was so delicious and we came away feeling we could replicate the meal at home. We learnt so much and were made to feel so welcome. It was a highlight of our time in Bali.

A sure thing!. This was recommended to us by the person who rented the villa we stayed at in Ubud, all of her recommendations as a local were excellent, but the Lobong Cooking Class was by far the best.It is a family business, and each member a different role. The friendly host picked us up at our accommodation. He was a very well educated man with excellent communication skills. He ensures you understand everything about local food, religion and traditions. We felt this was more than a cooking class, it was also about learning their way of life.The class was excellent. After the market, the host took us to his family compound where the class was held. Everything is done fresh, so before we arrived they have been preparing all the ingredients since 5AM. The Chef has 20 years of experience, cooking locally and overseas. He is focus in teaching techniques and open to give you tips on all type of cooking. We enjoy the 5 set menu we prepared and learned a lot.The experience was excellent, it was a morning very well spent. I highly recommend it.

Amazing!. As all the reviews illustrate, Lobong Culinary is a great way to spend a morning in Ubud whether you are an aspiring chef or just enjoy learning more about Balinese life and culture. Highly recommended, I'll be back, especially when they open a restaurant on the family compound!

A must do for everyone visiting Bali. I cannot recommend this enough. I was looking forward to this class before leaving Australia but it exceeded my expectations. We were surprised they still ran the class for just my friend and I on the day and the one on one attention was fantastic. Sang Made our host was very informative and pleased to answer any of our questions from the minute we were picked up from the hotel. All the staff were so welcoming and friendly and to visit the family compound was an amazing experience. The food was divine and awesome to see it made from scratch. There was so much quantity we could not eat it all and would of been good if Chef or Host got to sit down and share with us. Was THE highlight of my trip to Bali and Ubud is an amazing place to visit.

Ubud Highlight. A morning spent at the Lobong cooking class is an amazing authentic Balinese experience, highly recommended to anyone who can spend a day in Ubud. Starting with a trip to the Ubud food markets to see how the local ingredients are bought, the small class is then welcomed into the Lobong family home; a typical Balinese compound, where family life and spiritual tradition are explained. Under Chef Dewa's clear instruction the class then prepares and cooks 9 dishes, each one more delicious than the last. The family at Lobong are so friendly, speak fantastic english and offer an educational Balinese experience not to be missed.

Best experience I have had on Bali.. My 12 year old son, my mother inlay spent a fabulous day with the staff of Lobong Cooking (also see Facebook page). We had a great tour of a local market and then went to the family compound for a cooking experience of a life time. We were treated like honoured guests and felt honoured to be welcomed into their home. We were treated to a thorough explanation of family life in the compound before beginning our cooking experience. The 9 course meal was carefully explained and we really enjoyed the hands on approach to the cooking. My son was treated as a mini "Masterchef" and really enjoyed the attention from the staff. It was great to learn all about the traditional way to prepare an authentic Balinese meal and actually make a lot of the meal ourselves. While the meal was being plated up we were invited to the family temple, wearing sarong and learning how and why offerings are made. We the sat to eat our meal which was glorious and were were so proud of ourselves for making such great food. We were farewelled with a gift (will keep this a surprise for you). We had a really wonderful day and can not say enough of how professional and extremely well set up and hygienic the Labong Cooking is. I would highly recommend this to everyone. A bonus for us was that we were the only three at the class that day. I would also recommend doing the morning class so that you get to go to the market.

This is much more than a cooking class!!!. I went with my 24 yr old daughter and her guy friend. We loved it. It has been the highlight of our Bali trip. The trip to the market was so interesting and authentic. Wow. Sang, our amazing host showed us all the things that are commonly used in authentic Balinese cooking. We touched and smelled so many ingredients.Then we were off to the family compound which was beautiful. Sang told us all about how the extended family lives. It is really like a living museum experience with a warm and inviting host. We learned so much and we were comfortable to ask questions. The cooking portion was so fun and informative. It is very interactive and we had a good group which made it fun.A very special part of the day was when we all put on sarongs and watched as Sang's beautiful mother made the offering at the family temple. It was very beautiful and moving. Then we got to eat the meal that we had prepared. Yum. We really loved that we got to have a cold Bintang with it.When we left there were many hugs and pictures. Sang told us that we were now part of the family and we really felt that way. I would return in a second the next time I came to Bali. It would be a great experience even for someone who doesn't really cook. Just to attend the whole thing would be so enjoyable and informative. When we left we were given all the recipes we made and a bottle of coconut oil that Sang's mother makes daily. It was presented in a very nice presentation. I can't say enough good things about this day.

The best thing you'll do in Ubud. I always send my houseguests over to Lobong Cooking Class and they always come back raving about it. Today I went with them, and was reminded why. Made picked us up at 8 this morning and we headed to the traditional market -- a real one, just outside of Ubud -- where we had a wonderful tour of all the ingredients and regular market life (it's where things happen!). Back at the family compound over coffee and fresh-made snacks, you learn about how an extended family compound is designed and operates. Mother shows you how to make fresh coconut oil, and then Chef Dewa gets down to business. I was surprised the menu was so extensive, but it covers all of the basic types of preparation and sauces & sambals, and we did them all without trouble -- including cooking rice over a traditional wood stove! They have added a clean, spacious facility that lets everyone particiate and dine in comfort, and with a maximum of 12 participants you still feel like part of the family. We had two kids in our group aged 10 and 13, and they were easily included in all the activities. While the capable assistants finished up the last bits, we learned about making offerings, tied on our sarongs, and helped mother place the daily offerings around the family temple. Then we all sat down to a 5-star meal, the best Balinese food I've had in 20 years of living here. Even the picky kids cleaned their plates! Made delivered us home between 2:30 and 3:00 with our recipe booklet, a little bottle of fresh coconut oil, and an invitation to come say hi anytime we're back in town. A memorable day.
