I rang once in Bali, and spoke to the very charming Sunday, who is the son who organises this cooking class at his family home. Sunday speaks impeccable english; he organised for driver to pick us up in Seminyak, drive to Ubud to see the produce market and then take us to his family home, to prepare and then eat a lovely lunch that we all had a hand in preparing. Even my grand-daughters, aged 5, 7 & 9 years were cutting, tossing, pounding herbs and were intrigued to see the making of offerings by Sundays' mother, and prior to eating we wnt to the family temple to place these offerings to the Gods.The combination of cooking, learning Balinese customs & understanding local produce made it a wonderful day. Lunch was superb. The cost of this day was very reasonable, considering the quality of information & experiences.
Awesome experience!. We had a great day doing this cooking class. All staff were So friendly and more than accommodating . Great cultural and culinary experience. Would highly recommend !

Best tour we have ever done. From the moment we were picked up and taken to the markets to the moment we left after a scrumptious meal, we were treated liked favored family. As others have said, this is not just a cooking class, but a comprehensive introduction to Balinese culture and family life. To top things off, we were invited back to a ceremony at the local temple the next night and were again treated like welcome family by Sang Made. Cannot recommend highly enough!!!

A must do Ubud experience. This was a highlight of our recent holiday in Ubud. What set it apart was the combining of the food/cooking experience with understanding of the culture. The cooking included visiting a market so we could see the range of foods and how local people shop and then seeing the varus food being grown in the family compound: a paddy to plate experience. The cooking class was very hands on and Dewar is a great teacher. He respected the varying levels in the group and adapted the class to take account of everyone's taste buds. Sang Made was a welcoming and informative host who made us feel at home. Nothing was too much trouble and he filled in many of the gaps we had about Balinese life and culture. All five of our group highly recommend this class even if you are not that interested in cooking because its such an opportunity to join a local Balinese family for the day and eat great Balinese food that you've prepared. For foodies like us it was a great way to cook some authentic Balinese dishes.

Ceade mile failte!. We were welcomed into this families home with a hundred thousand welcomes!This is more than just a cooking class! The family give you a complete cultural and educational lesson on all things sacred to the Balinese. We thoroughly enjoyed the passion with which this was communicated, in perfect English. Absolutely fantastic.Initially we had reservations doing the course, as we had done a cooking course in Chiang Mai Thailand at a much cheaper price (and Thai food favours our palate more). However, we thoroughly enjoyed our evening - in fact we had an awesome time!!! Highly recommended!!! Lobong cutely mixes up the main host and the chef, which keeps the interaction fresh. The host principally teaches you about the Bali culture (a former Bali tour guide) while the chef teaches you cooking skill sets (a former hotel chef who also worked in Perth). The food was fantastic - the peanut sauce, marinated chicken and pork skewers were standouts! The desert was slightly disappointing - I have tasted better black rice pudding in Bali.The only advice I would give Lobong is that we were asked if we would like a Bintang with our dinner. Everyone in the group assumed it was complimentary, as it seemed to be in the nature of the offer. It wasn't. We were all given large Bintangs, which most of the females didn't finish. It's a small matter which can be easily rectified with better communication. I would have been embarrassed if I had only the correct money with me for the course. Rectify this guys, give a small Bintang complimentary. The class is priced sufficiently.Overall, keep up the enthusiasm, keep educating us simple souls, and enjoy the rewards. Your tour has been the highlight of our trip to Bali so far (even better than the many massages, and that says it all).

A cultural and culinary delight!. This is one of the newest cooking schools in Bali and as a result, staff are very eager to please and make your experience as enjoyable as possible. I was incredibly impressed from start to finish. An educational trip to one of the village markets is followed by a trip to the family compound where the cooking takes place in the open air. Our menu consisted of a mix of 9 authentic local dishes with the most sumptuous of spices and flavours all chopped and ground by your own fair hands. It all ends with a banquet lunch or dinner (you can do an 8am or 3pm start) laid out in style in the family compound. They don't Market the fact that a % of profits goes back into the local community making this something of a social enterprise! Lobong deserves all the great reviews and is bound to go from strength to strength. Treat yourself. You won't regret it

An exceptional and wonderful experience!!!. We were welcomed at the family compound as it was our own home. The family host told us everything about living in the family compound and the Balinese way of living.Aftter this warm welcome we started cooking and the chef explained all the ingredients and techniques to use. We did a lot of chopping and frying and had a lot of fun. We now know more about the reason why Indonesian food is so good! Before dinner we also learned more about offering, a great experience as well. The dinner was delicious. Before saying goodbye we received the recipe book and a bottle of coconut oil made by the familiy. The cooking class in the familiy compound was more than only cooking for us. It was a very special and fantastic experience!

Simply a must if you're travelling to Bali!. As the title suggests..my friends and I had an absolutely fantastic time. We were fortunate enough to be the only ones in the class and thoroughly enjoyed the hands on cooking experience in Balinese cuisine! Sang Made was the friendliest most informative host, teaching us about not only the diiferent ingredients we were using but also about the Balinese culture. He also allowed us to buy and bring back some durian in the car (for those that don't know what it is..it is a spiky fruit that smells a tad pungent to some but tastes heavenly!) Chef Dewa was a very patient and friendly teacher, especially with my slow cutting skills! The dishes we made were delicious and easy enough to recreate in the home. We were also given a goody bag with coconut oil freshly made by Sang Made's mum and a booklet containing the recipes. The whole experience was brilliant and I recommend everyone to give it a go. You'll feel like a masterchef by the end of it!!

A fantastic culinary and cultural experience!. We chose this cooking class because it was locally based and involved visiting a Balinese family compound. We (five) were picked up early by our charming host and first visited a local produce market to learn about the ingredients we would be using. We were then welcomed at the family compound with a drink and a snack before meeting the chef. He then supported us as we cooked nine different courses of authentic Balinese food! It was very 'hands on' and we chopped, ground, stirred and fried all of the dishes. This was fantastic as we learnt the techniques not just the recipes which gave us confidence that we can reproduce them at home. We finally sat down and enjoyed the fabulous lunch we had produced - after participating in the family's blessings and thanks for the food. Seriously the best peanut sauce and tomato sambal ever!While the food and cooking experience was great, what really made this a memorable day was the extensive understanding we gained about Balinese cultural life from our generous host as we were shown around the compound, family temples and gardens. We did this class early in our 10 day holiday in Ubud and it meant we had a better understanding and appreciation of the culture and people for the rest of our stay. A very rich cultural and culinary experience - do it!

Best cooking class in Ubud!. We have attended the Lobong Cooking Class on June 10th 2011. We took the morning class - starting at 08:00 - and went to the local market where we got introduced to a variety of fruits and vegetables. I thought that I'd seen all, but as it turned out, Bali has many culinary secrets that lie hidden in the local market! After the visit to the local market we went to the family compound. I was afraid that it would be another day of endless cultural introductions to temples and Balinese customs, but to my pleasant surprise, we were all expected to take part in the cooking class and stir, cut and bake the ingredients ourselves! The menu was finger lickin' good, and the explanations of our cheff could not have been better. It took us 3 hours to complete the menus. Then, we sat down to enjoy our lunches. Since Lobong only works with small groups, there is a lot of individual attention. Oh, and BTW: they pick you up from the hotel and drop you off after the work's done! I really recommend this experience!

Highlight of Ubud. The Lobong cooking class has been the highlight of our time in Ubud. We feel so privileged to be allowed to integrate into a Balinese community for a few hours, to learn something of the culture PLUS learn to cook this delicious food in such a fabulous setting. From the moment we were picked up at our accommodation til we were dropped off hours later, full and happy; we felt welcomed and comfortable. Loved everything about this experience,and don't need a 64 GB memory to be able to reproduce some of our favorites when we get back home.

Fantastic day- so glad we did this!. Travelling to Ubud with family to celebrate my 50th birthday, one of my gifts was a cooking class of my choosing. After careful consideration, I opted for the Lobong culinary experience, and the five of us who went all agree it was an awesome choice. We were collected on time from our accommodation by Sang Made, our host, who was a fount of information about Balinese customs and culture and cheerfully answered all our questions as we drove from one side of Ubud to the other to get to the wet market where we would be seeing all the foods we would be cooking with later in the day. Sang Made was a most solicitous host and quick to assist as I had injured my foot before arriving in Ubud and was having some trouble with steps. He also helped us to purchase fruit to take back to our accommodation later. Back in the car, we quickly drove to the Lobong family compound where we left the bustle and noise of the main street behind for a quiet, peaceful family home.Here Sang Made explained how Balinese families plan their living spaces and share with the extended family as we enjoyed a moring coffee and snack in a ceremonial pavilion. Then he passed us into the capable hands of Chef Dewa to start preparing our luncheon feast. One of the things we liked best was that, as we were a small group, we all got to have hands on experience preparing each dish rather than standing about watching one or two people cook. Sang Made later explained that his family's plan is to always keep group sizes small, to provide just such and experience. We learned how to make a base paste which was then used to flavour our other dishes, which were all surprisingly different. There included two kinds of satay (which we had made the peanut sauce for from scratch), a salad, a special rice, a Balinese chicken "curry" and a tomato sambal. The only dish we did not make ourselves was a black rice pudding for dessert. All the ingredients used were fresh and healthy with no commercial products used and as Chef Dewa has worked in Australia he is very knowledgeable about ingredients which can be substituted if the original is not available.Our lunch feast was served in the ceremonial pavilion after Sang Made's mother kindly showed us the Balinese custom of making an offering to the family gods of the food one is about to eat, and Sang Made explained the significance of the offering and the family shrines.After we were full to bursting with a delicious lunch, we were surprised and delighted to see Sang Made, Chef Dewi and other family members appear singing "Happy Birthday", complete with a gorgeous cake! On our departure we were each presented with a going away gift of the family's home-produced coconut oil and a recipe book containing the recipes of all the foods we had cooked.On the way back to our accommodation, again Sang Made was happy to answer questions and point out places and sights of interest and it was a most pelasant trip. The whole experience was a fantastic way to spend some time in Ubud and I would thoroughly recommend it most heartily to anyone who wishes to enjoy good food, good friends and sterling hospitality.

What a wonderful cultural experience it was!. Attended a cookery class at Sang Made and chef Dewa's family compound yesterday and had a truly lovely experience. Made speaks perfect English and he doesn't get tired of telling you all about Bali, Balinese culture and religious and spiritual beliefs. If you think this is just an ordinary cookery class you are soooo wrong! We've been in Ubud for 5 days and I've learnt much more about Balinese culture from Made in a few hours than in the last 5 days!! Dewa is a great chef, he showed us everything carefully and explained in detail the technique, told us all the alternative ingredients in case we couldn't find them at home and kept asking if we've had any questions.. He's a very passionate and genuine cook:) Made's mum made offerings and we were given sarongs to go to their family temple in the compound where we cooked the meals in the "clean kitchen". we were treated so well and got sit down and were served the food we had cooked. It was Enak(delicious)!! All in all this has been a truly Wonderful experience both culinary and culturally, the class of 6 people also meant that we all had the chance to participate in the prep and cooking of all the dishes..I couldn't recommend it enough!

Memories forever.. Cannot recommend this experience highly enough. Sang Made and Dewa Jana with their family have given my wife and I, a memory to remember for ever. Sang Made is the perfect host, with his knowledge and expertise he took us for a journey through local markets and sites in the Ubud area that were beautiful. He then introduced us into his family compound, were we met Dewa Jana and his Mum along with other family members. We were made so welcome. It was a great experience to learn Bali style cooking from these lovely people. If you want to do a Bali cooking class As I said at the start, I cannot recommend the Lobong cooking class highly enough.

Outstanding Cultural Experience. One of my favorite experiences during my week stay in Ubud. Sang and his family welcomed us into their home, walked us through the local market and shared their cultural, religious and family lives.

Lobong cooking class. The Lobong cooking class is a must do in Bali, my husband and I love to cook and we wanted a real Balinese experience. This cooking class did not disappoint. From the moment we were picked up from our accommodation Sang Made (our host) was so friendly and informative, we made a stop at the markets where Sang explained the history of the local markets, and the unusual vegetables, fruits and spices native to Bali.. We were then taken to Sang's home, where we were welcomed with coffee and beautiful banana fritters. Dwar the Chef (Sang's brother-in-law) was instantly welcoming and explained what we would be cooking and how the morning would progress. The compound was extremely professional, great facilities with an authentic twist. We chopped, fried, diced and made 8 unbelievable courses. Cool home made juice and bottled water were supplied as we cooked, there was absolutely nothing forgotten.We were shown how the family prepare traditional offerings, and then witnessed Sang's Mother give the offering to bless the food we had just cooked. We then sat like "Kings" in a lovely outdoor area, the food is incredible ( and we cooked it, with help of course ), Dwar explained what we could use in Australia if we couldn't get the exact ingredients , which willbe really helpful when we return home. Sang had prepared a small bottle of home made coconut oil and a great recipe booklet for us to take home. The whole experience was extremely reasonably priced and the highlight of our trip.One thing I would like to suggest to anyone who is thinking booking for this class .....Do Not have a big breakfast.....!..... Thanks to Sang, Dwar and their family for making the day special.....

Best experience in Ubud!. My husband and I were on our honeymoon and wanted to experience first hand some local cooking and traditions! Sang Made, his family and the Master Chef at the Lobong cooking class made this experience the highlight of our trip to Ubud.Sang Made picked us up on time from our hotel and the first stop - visit to the local market - was informative and interesting! Upon arriving to his home and family compound we marvelled at this amazing sanctuary. So peaceful and beautiful. The cooking class itself exceeded our expectations. However the atmosphere and Sang Made's staff and family made it all the more special. The food was absoloutely delicious (we could not believe we had cooked all the dishes 'ourselves')... and what we ate was better than any other meal we had in Ubud during our entire stay.The recipes we cooked meant we learnt some basics to Balinese cooking and it was interesting to learn the customs, traditions and beliefs also. This whole experience was wonderful and also extremely reasonably priced.... I would recommend this cooking class to anyone visiting Bali looking for a unique and delicious culinary experience and I wish Sang Made and his family all the very best. (I would even do this class again if I ever returned to Bali and will certainly be telling all my friends!)

Top notch! One of the best activities I have EVER done overseas!. This cooking class is truly amazing... I believe the groups are limited to 5 so the experience is very personal. The hosts teach you so many great things about Balinese culture and the food we learnt to cook was the best food we had during our 11 days in Bali, by far. Thanks Sang Made! - We wish you and your family the very best! : )

Experience authentic Balinese culture and cuisine. Hosts, Sang Made and chef Dewa provided us with an outstanding opportunity to personally create a beautiful Balinese meal of 6 dishes, entirely composed of fresh local ingredients. The experience was intensified by being conducted in Sang Made's family compound, ouside of Ubud. Sang Made provided full explanation of the compound structure and the daily traditions that have helped the Balinese culture remain so successfull. After helping at each stage of the cooking we were served the meal as guests to enjoy. A thoroughly enjoyable and satisfying experience that would be recommended to anyone wishing to discover the culture and cuisine of Bali.

A wonderful introduction to Balinese cuisine and tradition!. Sang Made, Dewa Jana and their family are very gracious hosts. This was a wonderful experience and we felt it was an honour to be invited into their family home. Not only did we learn about Balinese cuisine and had the chance to prepare dishes under the guidance of Chef Dewa, we learnt about Balinese traditions, culture and the importance of their religion. After the cooking was done, we enjoyed the food and the chance to sit, relax and talk to our hosts about our different countries and ways of life. We left with good wishes, an invitation to contact them if we wanted any further advice and a recipe book.This is a complete experience, from being collected at our villa, to going to the markets to buy some ingredients, to the preparation, cooking and eating of some lovely dishes. Well recommended.

a highlight of our time in Bali. this was truly an unexpected highlight of out trip to bali. Sang Made picked us up from our villa, took us to the local markets to learn about and select the produce and then we were taken to his family compaound to learn about balinese life and balinese food cooked in a very authentic environment. we particularly liked the fact that the course took place in a traditional balinese compound, and that we got to learn about not just the food but also the cultural and religious aspects of balinese family life.the course lasted from 9am till 1pm.

The highlight of my vacation!. Sang Made and his family were the highlight of my Bali vacation! The cooking class was more than I could have hoped for. The atmosphere was beautiful and welcoming. The food was better than any restaurant in Ubud. The recipes were easy to follow but complexed in flavor. The price was extremely reasonable.... The whole experience was perfect! I would recommend this cooking class to any level of cook.

Delicious, great class, and beautiful place.... ... Host Sang Made, Chef Dewa, and the rest of their Cooking Team put out quite the spread in a gorgeous family compound. Fantastic learning experience with easy to follow recipes, tips, awesome Satay, vegetable salad, and Pisang Goreng (banana fritters). Basically everything was delicious!The added bonus is learning how the real Balinese Family Compounds functions, explanation of Deities, Shrines, the coolest "rice storing barns" (in my opinion, easily converted to great hotel rooms!), and even learning how to make doilies out of banana leaves, not to mention a bowl and ladle/spoon to serve your dessert in. Very cool!The plus of the setting is that you are not stuck in a hotel kitchen or a restaurant. The home feeling is great and conducive to making you want to duplicate the experience at home for your friends. Easy, delicious, and you'll give them a real taste of Balinese Cuisine.HIGHLY recommended! One of the best experiences in Ubud.
